hebrew_text: בְּתוּלָה נִשֵּׂאת לַיּוֹם הָרְבִיעִי וְאַלְמָנָה לַיּוֹם הַחֲמִישִׁי. שֶׁפַּעֲמַיִם בְּשַׁבָּת בָּתֵּי דִינִין יוֹשְׁבִין בָּעֲיָירוֹת: בַּיּוֹם הַשֵּׁנִי וּבַיּוֹם הַחֲמִישִׁי, שֶׁאִם הָיָה לוֹ טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים, הָיָה מַשְׁכִּים לְבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: A virgin is married on Wednesday and a widow on Thursday. that twice a week courts convene in the towns, on Monday and Thursday, that if had a claim concerning virginity he would go early to court
llm_translation: Virgin is married on the fourth day and widow on the fifth day. For twice on Shabbat the courts sit in the cities: on the second day and on the fifth day, for if he had a claim of virginity, he would go early to the court.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ בְּתוּלָה נִשֵּׂאת לַיּוֹם הָרְבִיעִי? לְפִי שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ: הִגִּיעַ זְמַן וְלֹא נִישְּׂאוּ — אוֹכְלוֹת מִשֶּׁלּוֹ, וְאוֹכְלוֹת בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Due to what did they say that a virgin is married on Wednesday? because we learned If the time arrived, and they were not married, eat from his and, eat teruma .
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yosef said, Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: Why did they say that a virgin is married on the fourth day? Because we learned: If the time arrived and they were not married - she eats from his, and she eats from the terumah.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל הִגִּיעַ זְמַן בְּאֶחָד בְּשַׁבָּת יְהֵא מַעֲלֶה לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת? לְכָךְ שָׁנִינוּ: בְּתוּלָה נִשֵּׂאת לַיּוֹם הָרְבִיעִי.
human_translation: One might think time arrived on Sunday, he would provide her sustenance Therefore, we learned: A virgin is married on Wednesday.
llm_translation: One might have thought that if the time arrives on one of the Sabbaths, should he provide her sustenance? Therefore we learned: A virgin is married on the fourth day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מָרֵיהּ דְּאַבְרָהָם! תָּלֵי תַּנְיָא בִּדְלָא תַּנְיָא?! הֵי תַּנְיָא וְהֵי לָא תַּנְיָא? הָא תַּנְיָא וְהָא תַּנְיָא! אֶלָּא: תָּלֵי תַּנְיָא דִּמְפָרֵשׁ טַעְמָא בִּדְתַנְיָא דְּלָא מְפָרֵשׁ טַעְמָא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said Lord of Abraham, makes is taught dependent on is not taught, Which is taught and which is not taught? this is taught that is taught. Rather, makes is taught whose reason is explicit, dependent on is taught whose reason is not explicit.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "The master of Avraham! Hang a teaching where it is not taught? Should it be taught and should it not be taught? This teaching here and this teaching here! Rather, hang a teaching that explains the reason where a teaching that does not explain the reason is not taught."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר הָכִי אִיתְּמַר. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ בְּתוּלָה נִשֵּׂאת לַיּוֹם הָרְבִיעִי? שֶׁאִם הָיָה לוֹ טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים — הָיָה מַשְׁכִּים לְבֵית דִּין. וְתִינָּשֵׂא בְּאֶחָד בְּשַׁבָּת, שֶׁאִם הָיָה לוֹ טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים הָיָה מַשְׁכִּים לְבֵית דִּין? שָׁקְדוּ חֲכָמִים עַל תַּקָּנַת בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁיְּהֵא טוֹרֵחַ בִּסְעוּדָה שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים, אֶחָד בְּשַׁבָּת וְשֵׁנִי בַּשַּׁבָּת וּשְׁלִישִׁי בַּשַּׁבָּת, וּבָרְבִיעִי כּוֹנְסָהּ.
human_translation: Rather, if it was stated, this it was stated: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Due to what did say a virgin is married on Wednesday? that if had a claim concerning virginity, he would go early to court But let her marry on Sunday, as if had a claim concerning virginity, he would go early to court Sages were assiduous in seeing to the well-being of Jewish women so that would exert in the feast for three days: Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday, and on Wednesday, he marries her.
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Why did they say that a virgin is married on the fourth day? Because if he had a claim of virginity, he would rise early to go to the court. And she is married on the first day of the week, because if he had a claim of virginity, he would rise early to go to the court? The Sages were diligent in the enactment for the daughters of Israel, that he should exert effort in preparing a meal for three days, one on Shabbat, the second on Shabbat, and the third on Shabbat, and on the fourth day he marries her.

hebrew_text: וְעַכְשָׁו שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ ״שָׁקְדוּ״, אוֹתָהּ שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ ״הִגִּיעַ זְמַן וְלֹא נִישְּׂאוּ, אוֹכְלוֹת מִשֶּׁלּוֹ וְאוֹכְלוֹת בִּתְרוּמָה״, הִגִּיעַ זְמַן בְּאֶחָד בְּשַׁבָּת, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִכְנוֹס — אֵינוֹ מַעֲלֶה לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: And now that we learned were assiduous that which we learned If the time arrived and they were not married, eat from his and eat teruma , If time arrived on Sunday, since unable to marry he is not obligated to provide her sustenance
llm_translation: And now that we have learned "they have checked," that which we have learned "the time has arrived and they have not been taken," eating from his and eating from terumah, the time arrived on one on Shabbat, because he cannot enter - he does not bring up sustenance for her.

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ: חָלָה הוּא אוֹ שֶׁחָלְתָה הִיא אוֹ שֶׁפֵּירְסָה נִדָּה — אֵינוֹ מַעֲלֶה לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Therefore, fell ill, or if fell ill, or where she began to menstruate [ peirsa nidda ] not provide her sustenance
llm_translation: Therefore: whether he is sick or she is sick or she has menstruated — he does not have to provide her with sustenance.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּבָעֵי לַהּ מִיבַּעְיָא: חָלָה הוּא, מַהוּ? הָתָם טַעְמָא מַאי — מִשּׁוּם דַּאֲנִיס, וְהָכָא נָמֵי הָא אֲנִיס. אוֹ דִּלְמָא: הָתָם אֲנִיס בְּתַקַּנְתָּא דְּתַקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן, הָכָא לָא.
human_translation: And there are who raised it as a dilemma: If fell ill, what is There, what is the reason due to that he was forced And here too, isn’t he forced Or, perhaps There, he was forced by an ordinance that was instituted by the Sages However, here, not
llm_translation: There is one who asks a question: He is sick, what is the law? There, what is the reason? — Because he was forced, and here too he was forced. Or perhaps there, he was forced due to the enactment of the Rabbis, but not here.

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר חָלָה הוּא מַעֲלֶה לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת: חָלְתָה הִיא, מַהוּ? מָצֵי אָמַר לַהּ: אֲנָא הָא קָאֵימְנָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא מָצְיָא אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: ״נִסְתַּחֲפָה שָׂדֵהוּ״.
human_translation: And if you say that if he fell ill, he provides her sustenance if she fell ill, what is Can he say to her: I am standing here Or perhaps she can say to him that his field was inundated,
llm_translation: "And if you might say that it is a sickness, he should provide her sustenance. Is it a sickness? What is it? He might say to her: 'I am standing here,' or perhaps she might say to him: 'His field has been ravaged.'"

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר אָמְרָה לֵיהּ ״נִסְתַּחֲפָה שָׂדֵהוּ״ — פֵּירְסָה נִדָּה, מַהוּ?
human_translation: And if you say that she say to him that his field was inundated, she became a menstruating woman what is
llm_translation: And if you were to say to him, "She said to him, 'His field has been plowed,'" - she has spread a rumor, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁעַת וִוסְתָּהּ, לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ
human_translation: at the time of her set period [ vista ], do not raise the dilemma,
llm_translation: At the time of Vistah, do not inquire for yourself.

hebrew_text: דְּלָא מָצְיָא אָמְרָה לֵיהּ ״נִסְתַּחֲפָה שָׂדֵהוּ״. כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת וִוסְתָּהּ, מַאי? כֵּיוָן דְּלָא בִּשְׁעַת וִוסְתָּהּ הָוְיָא, מָצְיָא אָמְרָה לֵיהּ ״נִסְתַּחֲפָה שָׂדֵהוּ״, אוֹ דִלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא נְשֵׁי דְּקָא מְשַׁנְּיָיא וִוסְתַּיְיהוּ — כִּשְׁעַת וִוסְתָּהּ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: as she cannot say to him his field was inundated. When you raise a dilemma not at the time of her set period. What Since it is not the time of her set period, she can say to him that his field was inundated. Or, perhaps since there are some women whose set period changes, is like the time of her set period,
llm_translation: He did not find, she said to him, "his field has been plowed." When you want to claim that it was not at the time of his plowing, what is the law? Since it was not at the time of his plowing, she said to him, "his field has been plowed," or perhaps since there are women who are weaving and spinning - it is considered as the time of his plowing.

hebrew_text: פָּשֵׁיט רַב אַחַאי: הִגִּיעַ זְמַן וְלֹא נִישְּׂאוּ — אוֹכְלוֹת מִשֶּׁלּוֹ וְאוֹכְלוֹת בִּתְרוּמָה. ״לֹא נָשְׂאוּ״ לָא קָתָנֵי, אֶלָּא ״לֹא נִישְּׂאוּ״.
human_translation: Rav Aḥai resolved If the time arrived and they were not married, eat from his and eat teruma . It doesn’t teach: And didn’t marry, Rather, And were not married,
llm_translation: Rav Ahai expounded: The time arrived and they did not marry - they eat from his and eat from terumah. It does not teach "they did not marry," rather "they were not married."

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי: אִי דְּקָא מְעַכְּבָן אִינְהִי — אַמַּאי אוֹכְלוֹת מִשֶּׁלּוֹ וְאוֹכְלוֹת בִּתְרוּמָה? אֶלָּא לָאו, דְּאִיתְּנִיס כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא, וְקָתָנֵי: אוֹכְלוֹת מִשֶּׁלּוֹ וְאוֹכְלוֹת בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: What are the circumstances If the postpone why do they eat from his and eat teruma ? Rather, is it not where they were compelled in that manner, and it teaches: eat from his and eat teruma ,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "How so? If they are delaying, why are they eating from his and eating from the terumah? Rather, it is not so, for he is testing her in this matter, and it teaches: eating from his and eating from the terumah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ כׇּל אוּנְסָא, לָא אָכְלָה, וּדְקָא מְעַכְּבִי אִינְהוּ. וּבְדִין הוּא דְּאִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמִיתְנֵי ״לֹא נָשְׂאוּ״, וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא בְּדִידְהִי, תְּנָא נָמֵי סֵיפָא בְּדִידְהִי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Actually, I will say to you: In any of unavoidable circumstances, she doesn’t eat and where postpone the wedding. And by right, should have taught: They didn’t marry, And since the first clause in it taught the latter clause in
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Always say to yourself, "All coercion, she did not eat," and they are indeed delaying. And it is in accordance with the one who requires them to teach "they did not accept," and since the first part is in their favor, the latter part is also in their favor.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּלְעִנְיַן גִּיטִּין אֵינוֹ כֵּן. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר רָבָא אֵין אוֹנֶס בְּגִיטִּין.
human_translation: Rava said: And to bills of divorce that is not so. Apparently, Rava maintains that unavoidable circumstances no to bills of divorce.
llm_translation: Rava said: And for the matter of divorce it is not so. This implies that Rava holds that there is no compulsion in divorce.

hebrew_text: מְנָא לֵיהּ לְרָבָא הָא? אִילֵּימָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ״, וּמֵת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ — אֵינוֹ גֵּט. מֵת הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ גֵּט הָא, חָלָה — הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט.
human_translation: From where does Rava this If we say it is from that which we learned This is your bill of divorce, if I do not return from now until twelve months, and he died within twelve months, is not a bill of divorce. he died, is when it is not a bill of divorce, he fell ill, it is a bill of divorce
llm_translation: He said to Rava: This? Perhaps from that which we learned: "Here is your bill of divorce, if I do not come from now until twelve months," and he dies within twelve months - it is not a bill of divorce. He who dies, that it is not a bill of divorce, if he becomes ill - here is a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ חָלָה נָמֵי אֵינוֹ גֵּט, וְהִיא גּוּפָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּאֵין גֵּט לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: And perhaps, actually I will say to you he falls ill it is also not a bill of divorce, And that itself to teach us that there is no bill of divorce posthumously.
llm_translation: And perhaps forever I will say to you, "This illness is not a divorce document," and the very essence itself teaches us that a divorce document is not effective after death.

hebrew_text: אֵין גֵּט לְאַחַר מִיתָה — הָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ רֵישָׁא: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ אִם מַתִּי״, ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ מֵחוֹלִי זֶה״, ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ לְאַחַר מִיתָה״ — לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: there is no bill of divorce posthumously? Wasn’t it taught in the first clause This is your bill of divorce if I die, This is your bill of divorce from this illness, This is your bill of divorce after I die, he said nothing.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: There is no divorce after death - here, a Tanna teaches him at the beginning: "Here is your divorce if I die," "Here is your divorce from this sickness," "Here is your divorce after death" - he did not say anything.

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבּוֹתֵינוּ. דְּתַנְיָא: וְרַבּוֹתֵינוּ הִתִּירוּהָ לְהִנָּשֵׂא, וְאָמְרִינַן: מַאן רַבּוֹתֵינוּ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בֵּי דִינָא דִּשְׁרוֹ מִשְׁחָא. סָבְרִי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: זְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל שְׁטָר מוֹכִיחַ עָלָיו.
human_translation: Perhaps to exclude that which our Rabbis as it is taught And our Rabbis permitted her to remarry, And we said: Who are our Rabbis Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: the court that permitted oil they hold in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who said: The time in a document proves it
llm_translation: Perhaps to go out from our teachers' teachings. As it was taught: "And our teachers permitted her to marry, and we say: Who are our teachers? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The court that permits her from the wine. They hold for her like Rabbi Yosei, who said: The time of a document proves against him."

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מִסֵּיפָא: ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ״, וּמֵת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ — הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט. מֵת, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְחָלָה.
human_translation: And rather, latter clause from now if I do not return from now until twelve months, and he died within twelve months, this is a bill of divorce. he dies, the same is true he fell ill.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather from the latter part: "From now if I do not come from here until twelve months," and he dies within twelve months - this is a divorce document. He dies, and the same applies to illness.

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא מֵת דַּוְקָא, דְּלָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּתִפּוֹל קַמֵּי יָבָם!
human_translation: Perhaps specifically he died, he is not amenable happen before yavam ,
llm_translation: Perhaps he died specifically, as it would not be pleasing to him for his yavam to fall before him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָא: דְּהָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ ״אִי לָא אָתֵינָא מִיכָּן וְעַד תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין לֶיהֱוֵי גִּיטָּא״, אֲתָא בְּסוֹף תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין וּפַסְקֵיהּ מַבָּרָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: חֲזוֹ דַּאֲתַאי, חֲזוֹ דַּאֲתַאי. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לָאו שְׁמֵיהּ מַתְיָא.
human_translation: Rather, from this where a certain who said to If I do not return from now until after thirty days let this be a bill of divorce. He came at the end of thirty days, but was prevented by the ferry He said to the See that I have come, see that I have come. Shmuel said: is not considered a return.
llm_translation: Rather from this: that he who said to them, "If I do not come from here until thirty days, let it be a divorce," he came at the end of thirty days and he retracted. He said to them: "See, he has come, see, he has come." Shmuel said: His name is not Matya.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא אוּנְסָא דִּשְׁכִיחַ שָׁאנֵי. דְּכֵיוָן דְּאִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְאַתְנוֹיֵי וְלָא אַתְנִי — אִיהוּ דְּאַפְסֵיד אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: And perhaps unavoidable circumstances that are common are different, since he should have stipulated and he did not stipulate he brought the failure upon himself.
llm_translation: And perhaps it is a case of ones, that it is common that they are different. For since he demanded to give him and he did not give - he is the one who caused himself to lose.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רָבָא סְבָרָא דְנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָאָמַר: מִשּׁוּם צְנוּעוֹת וּמִשּׁוּם פְּרוּצוֹת. מִשּׁוּם צְנוּעוֹת — דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ לָא לֶהֱוֵי גֵּט,
human_translation: Rather, Rava is stating his own reasoning. due to virtuous women and due to licentious women. due to virtuous women as, if you said: Let it not be a bill of divorce,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava holds his own opinion: Due to modesty and immodesty. Due to modesty - for if you say it is not a valid bill of divorce,

hebrew_text: זִימְנִין דְּלָא אֲנִיס וְסָבְרָה דַּאֲנִיס, וּמִיעַגְּנָא וְיָתְבָה. וּמִשּׁוּם פְּרוּצוֹת — דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ לָא לֶיהֱוֵי גִּיטָּא, זִימְנִין דַּאֲנִיס וְאָמְרָה לָא אֲנִיס, וְאָזְלָא וּמִינַּסְבָא, וְנִמְצָא גֵּט בָּטֵל וּבָנֶיהָ מַמְזֵרִים.
human_translation: sometimes, where he was not unavoidably and thinks unavoidably, she will sit deserted, And due to licentious women as, if you said: Let it not be a bill of divorce, sometimes, when he was unavoidably and she thinks not unavoidably, and remarries. And that the bill of divorce is void, and her children mamzerim ,
llm_translation: Times when he did not coerce and she thought that he coerced, and she rebelled and sat. And because of breaches - for if you say it is not a valid divorce, times when she coerced and he said she did not coerce, and he went and married, and it was found that the divorce was nullified and her children are mamzerim.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא לֶהֱוֵי גֵּט, וּמִשּׁוּם צְנוּעוֹת וּמִשּׁוּם פְּרוּצוֹת שָׁרִינַן אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ לְעָלְמָא?!
human_translation: And is there a matter where by Torah it is not a bill of divorce, but due to virtuous women and due to licentious women we permit a married woman to others?
llm_translation: "And is there anyone who, due to the stringency of the Torah, a divorce document is not valid, and because of modesty and immodesty, we permit a man's wife to the world?!"

hebrew_text: אִין, כׇּל דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ אַדַּעְתָּא דְּרַבָּנַן מְקַדֵּשׁ, וְאַפְקְעִינְהוּ רַבָּנַן לְקִידּוּשֵׁי מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Yes, anyone who betroths betroths upon the agreement of the Sages, the Sages invalidated his betrothal
llm_translation: "אִין, כׇּל דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ אַדַּעְתָּא דְּרַבָּנַן מְקַדֵּשׁ, וְאַפְקְעִינְהוּ רַבָּנַן לְקִידּוּשֵׁי מִינֵּיהּ." "No, all who sanctify the mind of the Rabbis sanctify, and the Rabbis annul their sanctifications."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: תִּינַח קַדֵּישׁ בְּכַסְפָּא. קַדֵּישׁ בְּבִיאָה מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? שַׁוְּיוּהּ רַבָּנַן לִבְעִילָתוֹ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: works out well he betrothed with money, he betrothed with intercourse, what can be said? The Sages rendered his intercourse licentious intercourse.
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "Let the holy one be placed in silver." What is there to say about placing it in intercourse? The Rabbis have compared his intercourse to the intercourse of harlotry.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אָמַר רָבָא, וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן גִּיטִּין. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר רָבָא יֵשׁ אוֹנֶס בְּגִיטִּין.
human_translation: Some say, Rava said: the same is true with regard to the matter of bills of divorce. apparently Rava maintains: Unavoidable circumstances with regard to bills of divorce.
llm_translation: There are those who say: Rava said, and so too regarding matters of divorce. This implies that Rava holds that there is a case of coercion in matters of divorce.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ״, וּמֵת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ — אֵינוֹ גֵּט. מֵת הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ גֵּט, הָא חָלָה — הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט!
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection This is your bill of divorce if I do not return from now until twelve months, and he died within twelve months, is not a bill of divorce. he died, is when it is not a bill of divorce, he fell ill it is a bill of divorce
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Challenger: "Here is your bill of divorce, if I do not return from here until twelve months," and he dies within twelve months - it is not a bill of divorce. Since he is dead, it is not a bill of divorce, but if he is sick - here is a bill of divorce!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ חָלָה נָמֵי אֵינוֹ גֵּט, וְהִיא גּוּפַהּ קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דְּאֵין גֵּט לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: Actually, I will say to you one falls ill it is also not a bill of divorce, And that itself teaches us that there is no bill of divorce posthumously.
llm_translation: Forever say to you, "illness indeed is not a divorce document," and she herself the body is indicating to us: that there is no divorce document after death.

hebrew_text: אֵין גֵּט לְאַחַר מִיתָה הָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ רֵישָׁא! דִּלְמָא לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבּוֹתֵינוּ.
human_translation: there is no bill of divorce posthumously? Wasn’t it already taught in the first clause Perhaps to exclude of our Rabbis.
llm_translation: There is no get after death. But didn't the Tanna teach him at the beginning! Perhaps to fulfill the words of our Rabbis.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ״, וּמֵת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ — הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט. מַאי לָאו, הוּא הַדִּין לְחָלָה! לָא, מֵת דַּוְקָא, דְּלָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּתִפּוֹל קַמֵּי יָבָם.
human_translation: Come and hear from now if I have not returned from now until twelve months, and he died within twelve months, this is a bill of divorce. What, is it not that the same is true he fell ill? specifically he died, he was not amenable happen before yavam ,
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'From now on, if I do not come from here until twelve months,' and he dies within twelve months — this is a bill of divorce. What, is it not the same as an illness? No, specifically if he dies, because it is not desirable for him to fall before the levir."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע מֵהָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ ״אִי לָא אָתֵינָא מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם לֶיהֱוֵי גִּיטָּא״, אֲתָא בְּסוֹף תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין וּפַסְקֵיהּ מַבָּרָא, וַאֲמַר לְהוּ: ״חֲזוֹ דַּאֲתַאי! חֲזוֹ דַּאֲתַאי!״ וַאֲמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לָא שְׁמֵיהּ מַתְיָא!
human_translation: Come and hear from a certain who said to If I do not return from now until thirty days let this be a bill of divorce. He came at the end of thirty days, but was prevented by the ferry He said to the See that I have come, see that I have come. Shmuel said: is not considered a return.
llm_translation: Come and hear from that one who said to them, "If I do not come from here until thirty days, let it be a divorce." He came at the end of thirty days and he was creating a separation, and he said to them, "See that he has come! See that he has come!" And Shmuel said: His name is Matya.

hebrew_text: אוּנְסָא דִּשְׁכִיחַ — שָׁאנֵי, דְּכֵיוָן דְּאִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְאַתְנוֹיֵי וְלָא אַתְנִי, אִיהוּ הוּא דְּאַפְסֵיד אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Perhaps unavoidable circumstances that are common are different, since he should have stipulated And stipulate he brought the failure upon himself.
llm_translation: The coerced one who is found - it is different, for since he desires to give and does not give, he is the one who causes himself to lose.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מִתַּקָּנַת עֶזְרָא וְאֵילָךְ, שֶׁאֵין בָּתֵּי דִינִין קְבוּעִין אֶלָּא בְּשֵׁנִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי. אֲבָל קוֹדֶם תַּקָּנַת עֶזְרָא, שֶׁבָּתֵּי דִינִין קְבוּעִין בְּכׇל יוֹם — אִשָּׁה נִשֵּׂאת בְּכׇל יוֹם.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said: teach only from the ordinance of Ezra that courts are in regular session only on Monday and Thursday. However, prior to the ordinance of Ezra, when courts regular every day, a woman was married on any day
llm_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Yitzchak said: They only instituted the reading of the Torah from the time of the enactment of Ezra and onwards, for the courts are only established on Mondays and Thursdays. But before the enactment of Ezra, the courts were established every day - a woman could be married every day.

hebrew_text: קוֹדֶם תַּקָּנַת עֶזְרָא? מַאי דַהֲוָה הֲוָה! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִי אִיכָּא בָּתֵּי דִינִין דִּקְבוּעִין הָאִידָּנָא כְּקוֹדֶם תַּקָּנַת עֶזְרָא — אִשָּׁה נִשֵּׂאת בְּכׇל יוֹם.
human_translation: Prior to the ordinance of Ezra? What was was This is what is saying: If there are courts regular today, as prior to the ordinance of Ezra, a woman is married on any day
llm_translation: Before the enactment of Ezra? What was, was! This is what he is saying: If there are established courts like today before the enactment of Ezra - a woman may be married every day.

hebrew_text: הָא בָּעִינַן שָׁקְדוּ! דִּטְרִיחַ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Don’t we require were assiduous where he exerted himself
llm_translation: This one we require to check! For it is difficult for him.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״שָׁקְדוּ״? דְּתַנְיָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ בְּתוּלָה נִשֵּׂאת לַיּוֹם הָרְבִיעִי? שֶׁאִם הָיָה לוֹ טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים, הָיָה מַשְׁכִּים לְבֵית דִּין. וְתִנָּשֵׂא בְּאֶחָד בְּשַׁבָּת, וְאִם הָיָה לוֹ טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים הָיָה מַשְׁכִּים לְבֵית דִּין! שָׁקְדוּ חֲכָמִים עַל תַּקָּנַת בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁיְּהֵא אָדָם טוֹרֵחַ בַּסְּעוּדָה שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים: אֶחָד בַּשַּׁבָּת וְשֵׁנִי בְּשַׁבָּת וּשְׁלִישִׁי בַּשַּׁבָּת, וּבָרְבִיעִי כּוֹנְסָהּ.
human_translation: What is were assiduous? as it is taught Due to what did say a virgin is married on Wednesday? that if had a claim concerning virginity, he would go early to court But let her marry on Sunday, as if had a claim concerning virginity, he would go early to court were assiduous in seeing to the well-being of Jewish women so that would exert in the feast for three days, Sunday, Monday and Tuesday, and on Wednesday, he marries her.
llm_translation: What is "shakdu"? For it was taught: For what reason did they say that a virgin is married off on the fourth day? Because if he had a claim of virginity, he would rise early to go to the court. And she is married off on the first day of the week, and if he had a claim of virginity, he would rise early to go to the court! The Sages were diligent in the enactment for the daughters of Israel, that a man should exert effort in preparing the feast for three days: one on Shabbat, the second on Shabbat, and the third on Shabbat, and on the fourth day he brings her in.

hebrew_text: וּמִסַּכָּנָה וְאֵילָךְ נָהֲגוּ הָעָם לִכְנוֹס בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי, וְלֹא מִיחוּ בְּיָדָם חֲכָמִים. וּבַשֵּׁנִי לֹא יִכְנוֹס. וְאִם מֵחֲמַת הָאוֹנֶס — מוּתָּר. וּמַפְרִישִׁין אֶת הֶחָתָן מִן הַכַּלָּה לֵילֵי שַׁבָּת תְּחִלָּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא עוֹשֶׂה חַבּוּרָה.
human_translation: And from danger and onward, the people adopted the custom to marry on Tuesday and the Sages did not reprimand them. And on Monday one may not marry However, if it is due to the coercion, permitted. One isolates the groom from the bride, first on Shabbat evening, because he inflicts a wound,
llm_translation: The people used to gather in the marketplace and from there they would go in on the third day, and the sages did not protest. And on the second day they should not enter. And if due to a pressing need - it is permitted. And they would separate the groom from the bride on the eve of Shabbat first, because he is creating a bond.

hebrew_text: מַאי סַכָּנָה? אִילֵּימָא דְּאָמְרִי בְּתוּלָה הַנִּשֵּׂאת לַיּוֹם הָרְבִיעִי תֵּיהָרֵג — נָהֲגוּ?! לִגְמָרֵי נִיעְקְרֵיהּ!
human_translation: What is danger If we say said that a virgin who is married on Wednesday will be executed, that they adopted the custom Let them abolish
llm_translation: What is the danger? If you say that a betrothed virgin who commits adultery on the fourth day should be killed - is it practiced?! It is completely uprooted!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה, דְּאָמְרִי: בְּתוּלָה הַנִּשֵּׂאת בְּיוֹם הָרְבִיעִי תִּיבָּעֵל לַהֶגְמוֹן תְּחִלָּה. הַאי סַכָּנָה? אוֹנֶס הוּא! מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא צְנוּעוֹת דְּמָסְרָן נַפְשַׁיְיהוּ לִקְטָלָא, וְאָתְיָין לִידֵי סַכָּנָה.
human_translation: Rabba said: said that a virgin who is married on Wednesday will intercourse with the prefect [ hegmon ] first. Is that danger? It is coercion. as there are virtuous women who give their lives and they will come to danger.
llm_translation: Rabba said, as they say: A virgin who is married on the fourth day will first be examined by the Gemone. Is this a danger? It is coercion! Because there is modesty that they have entrusted themselves to be killed, and they come to danger.

hebrew_text: וְלִידְרוֹשׁ לְהוּ דְּאוֹנֶס שְׁרֵי? אִיכָּא פְּרוּצוֹת, וְאִיכָּא נָמֵי כֹּהֲנוֹת.
human_translation: And let instruct that coercion permitted there are licentious women And there are also priests,
llm_translation: And to inquire, is it permitted to compel? There are breaches, and there are also priestly matters.

hebrew_text: וְלִיעְקְרֵיהּ! שְׁמָדָא עֲבִידָא דְּבָטְלָא, וְתַקַּנְתָּא דְרַבָּנַן מִקַּמֵּי שְׁמָדָא לָא עָקְרִינַן. אִי הָכִי, בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי נָמֵי אָתֵי וּבָעֵיל! מִסְּפֵיקָא לָא עָקַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: And let abolish A decree of religious persecution [ shemada ] is likely to be abrogated, and we do not abolish a rabbinic ordinance in the face of a decree of religious persecution. If so, will come on Tuesday too, for uncertainty uproot himself
llm_translation: And to its root! Destruction of a matter of nullification, and the enactment of the Sages from before the destruction, we do not uproot. If so, on the third day he will come and inquire! From doubt he did not uproot himself.

hebrew_text: וּבַשֵּׁנִי לֹא יִכְנוֹס, וְאִם מֵחֲמַת הָאוֹנֶס — מוּתָּר. מַאי אוֹנֶס? אִילֵּימָא הָא דַּאֲמַרַן, הָתָם קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״סַכָּנָה״, וְהָכָא קָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״אוֹנֶס״?! וְתוּ: הָתָם נָהֲגוּ, הָכָא מוּתָּר?
human_translation: And on Monday one may not marry However, if it is due to the coercion, it is permitted. What is coercion If we say it is referring to that which we mentioned there calls it danger, and here he calls it coercion. Furthermore, there adopted the custom here permitted.
llm_translation: In the second year, he should not enter, and if due to circumstances beyond his control — it is permitted. What is considered beyond one's control? If you say, like what we said there, there it is called "danger," and here it is called "circumstances beyond one's control"?! And furthermore: there they are accustomed, here it is permitted?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, דְּאָמְרִי: שַׂר צָבָא בָּא לָעִיר. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאָתֵי וְחָלֵיף — לִיעַכַּב! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאָתֵי וְקָבַע. בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי מִיהָא לִכְנוֹס? אִסְפַּרְווֹא דִידֵיהּ בִּשְׁלִישִׁי קָאָתוּ.
human_translation: Rava said: where they said: A general are coming to the city What are the circumstances? If where comes and passes let postpone Rather, it is necessary where he comes and establishes In any case, let one marry on Tuesday. his entourage [ asperava ] arrives on Tuesday.
llm_translation: Rava said, as they say: the officer of the army came to the city. What is the comparison? If he comes and goes back - he is delayed! It is not necessary, for he comes and establishes. On the third day, should he enter? His own account on the third day they came.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מַאי ״מֵחֲמַת הָאוֹנֶס״ — כִּדְתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה פִּתּוֹ אָפוּי, וְטִבְחוֹ טָבוּחַ, וְיֵינוֹ מָזוּג, וּמֵת אָבִיו שֶׁל חָתָן אוֹ אִמָּהּ שֶׁל כַּלָּה — מַכְנִיסִין אֶת הַמֵּת לַחֶדֶר, וְאֶת הֶחָתָן וְאֶת הַכַּלָּה לַחוּפָּה,
human_translation: And if you wish, say What is Due to the coercion? as it is taught If one’s bread was baked, and his animal slaughtered, and his wine diluted, and the father of the groom or the mother of the bride died one moves the corpse into a room, and the bride and groom to the wedding canopy
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: What is "due to circumstances beyond one's control"? — As it was taught: If his bread was baked, his meat cooked, his wine mixed, and the father of the groom or the mother of the bride died — they bring the deceased into the room, and the groom and the bride to the wedding canopy.

hebrew_text: וּבוֹעֵל בְּעִילַת מִצְוָה וּפוֹרֵשׁ, וְנוֹהֵג שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי הַמִּשְׁתֶּה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹהֵג שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי אֲבֵילוּת. וְכׇל אוֹתָן הַיָּמִים, הוּא יָשֵׁן בֵּין הָאֲנָשִׁים וְהִיא יְשֵׁנָה בֵּין הַנָּשִׁים. וְאֵין מוֹנְעִין תַּכְשִׁיטִין מִן הַכַּלָּה כׇּל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: And engages in intercourse mitzva, and withdraws And observes the seven days of feast, and thereafter he observes the seven days of mourning. And throughout those days sleeps among the men, and sleeps among the women, And one does not withhold jewels from the bride entire thirty-day
llm_translation: He who has relations with a woman for the sake of fulfilling a commandment and then separates, and observes seven days of feasting, and afterwards observes seven days of mourning. And all those days, he sleeps among the men and she sleeps among the women. And we do not withhold adornments from the bride for thirty days.

hebrew_text: וְדַוְקָא, אָבִיו שֶׁל חָתָן אוֹ אִמָּהּ שֶׁל כַּלָּה, דְּלֵיכָּא אִינִישׁ דְּטָרַח לְהוּ. אֲבָל אִיפְּכָא — לָא.
human_translation: And specifically the father of groom or the mother of bride as there is no person who exert for them. However, the opposite no,
llm_translation: And specifically, the father of the groom or the mother of the bride, there is no one who is obligated to support them. But the opposite is not true.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַפְרָם בַּר פָּפָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנָּתַן מַיִם עַל גַּבֵּי בָּשָׂר, אֲבָל לֹא נָתַן מַיִם עַל גַּבֵּי בָּשָׂר — מִזְדַּבַּן.
human_translation: Rafram bar Pappa said Rav Ḥisda said: taught only if one placed water on the meat. However, if he did not place water on the meat, it sold.
llm_translation: Rafhram son of Papa said, Rav Hisda said: They only taught this law when one placed water on top of the meat, but if one did not place water on top of the meat - it is considered mingling.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּבִכְרַךְ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנָּתַן מַיִם עַל גַּבֵּי בָּשָׂר — מִזְדַּבַּן. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וּבִכְפָר, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נָתַן מַיִם עַל גַּבֵּי בָּשָׂר — לָא מִזְדַּבַּן. וְאֶלָּא דְּרַב חִסְדָּא הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כְּגוֹן מָתָא מַחְסֵיָא, דְּמַפְּקָא מִכְּרַךְ, וּמַפְּקָא מִכְּפַר.
human_translation: Rava said: And in a city, even if he placed water on the meat it sold, Rav Pappa said: And in a village, even if he did not place water on the meat, it cannot sold, Where do you find of Rav Ḥisda Rav Ashi says: like Mata Meḥasya, which is removed from a city, and removed from a village,
llm_translation: Rava said: And in a dish, even though water was placed on top of the meat - it spoils. Rav Papa said: And in a spoon, even though water was not placed on top of the meat - it does not spoil. But how does Rav Ḥisdah forget it? Rav Ashe said: Like Matya Maḥseya, who removes from the dish, and removes from the spoon.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה פִּתּוֹ אֲפוּיָה וְטִבְחוֹ טָבוּחַ וְיֵינוֹ מָזוּג, וְנָתַן מַיִם עַל גַּבֵּי בָּשָׂר, וּמֵת אָבִיו שֶׁל חָתָן אוֹ אִמָּהּ שֶׁל כַּלָּה — מַכְנִיסִין אֶת הַמֵּת לַחֶדֶר, וְאֶת הֶחָתָן וְאֶת הַכַּלָּה לַחוּפָּה, וּבוֹעֵל בְּעִילַת מִצְוָה וּפוֹרֵשׁ, וְנוֹהֵג שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי הַמִּשְׁתֶּה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹהֵג שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי אֲבֵילוּת. וְכׇל אוֹתָן הַיָּמִים, הוּא יָשֵׁן בֵּין הָאֲנָשִׁים וְאִשְׁתּוֹ יְשֵׁנָה בֵּין הַנָּשִׁים.
human_translation: taught in accordance Rav Ḥisda: If one’s bread was baked, and his animal slaughtered, and his wine diluted, and he placed water on the meat, and the father of the groom or the mother of the bride died, one moves the corpse into a room, and the bride and groom to the wedding canopy, engages in intercourse mitzva, withdraws And observes the seven days of feast, and thereafter observes the seven days of mourning. And throughout those days sleeps among the men, and his wife sleeps among the women,
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Ḥisda: If his bread was baked, his meat was cooked, and his wine was mixed, and he placed water on top of meat, and the father of the groom or the mother of the bride died - they bring the deceased into the room, and the groom and the bride to the wedding canopy, and he engages in the mitzvah act and separates, and observes seven days of feasting, and afterwards observes seven days of mourning. And all those days, he sleeps among the men and his wife sleeps among the women.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן מִי שֶׁפֵּירְסָה אִשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה — הוּא יָשֵׁן בֵּין הָאֲנָשִׁים וְהִיא יְשֵׁנָה בֵּין הַנָּשִׁים. וְאֵין מוֹנְעִין תַּכְשִׁיטִין מִן הַכַּלָּה כָּל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ לֹא יִבְעוֹל, לֹא בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת וְלֹא בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: And likewise, whose wife began to menstruate he sleeps among the men and she sleeps among the women, However, do not withhold jewels from the bride entire thirty-day In any event, the may not engage in intercourse neither on Shabbat evening, nor conclusion of Shabbat.
llm_translation: And so too, one whose wife becomes a menstruant - he shall sleep among men and she shall sleep among women. And they do not withhold adornments from the bride for thirty days. In between this and that they shall not engage in marital relations, not on Friday evening and not on Saturday night.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: הוּא יָשֵׁן בֵּין הָאֲנָשִׁים וְהִיא יְשֵׁנָה בֵּין הַנָּשִׁים, מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ אֵין אֲבֵילוּת בַּמּוֹעֵד, אֲבָל דְּבָרִים שֶׁל צִינְעָא — נוֹהֵג.
human_translation: The Master said: He sleeps among the men and she sleeps among the women. supports of Rabbi Yoḥanan, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Although they stated that there is no mourning on a Festival, yet one observes matters of privacy,
llm_translation: Master said: He sleeps among men and she sleeps among women, assisting Rabbi Yochanan. For Rabbi Yochanan said: Even though they said there is no mourning during the festival, but matters of modesty - are customary.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא בָּעַל, אֲבָל בָּעַל — אִשְׁתּוֹ יְשֵׁנָה עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rava, taught in the name of Rava: They taught only if he did not engage in intercourse However, if he engaged in intercourse his wife sleeps with him,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rava, expounded in the name of Rava: They only taught this law in a case where he is not a ba'al, but if he is a ba'al, his wife may sleep with him.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא, דִּבְבָעַל עָסְקִינַן, וְקָתָנֵי: הוּא יָשֵׁן בֵּין הָאֲנָשִׁים וְהִיא יְשֵׁנָה בֵּין הַנָּשִׁים! כִּי קָאָמַר, אַפֵּירְסָה אִשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה.
human_translation: But here, we are dealing where he engaged in intercourse and teaches: He sleeps among the men and she sleeps among the women. When he states concerning his wife began menstruating,
llm_translation: And here, in the case of Bevai, we are dealing with, and it teaches: "He sleeps among men, and she sleeps among women!" For it is saying, "His wife is a menstruant."

hebrew_text: הָא ״וְכֵן״ קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: doesn’t it state: And likewise,
llm_translation: This is what is taught: "And so."

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְכֵן מִי שֶׁפֵּירְסָה אִשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה וְלֹא בָּעַל — הוּא יָשֵׁן בֵּין הָאֲנָשִׁים, וְאִשְׁתּוֹ יְשֵׁנָה בֵּין הַנָּשִׁים.
human_translation: This is what is saying: And likewise, whose wife began to menstruate, and he had not engaged in intercourse he sleeps among the men, and his wife sleeps among the women.
llm_translation: So it was stated: And similarly, one who separates from his wife while she is in a state of menstrual impurity and does not have relations with her— he shall sleep among men, and his wife shall sleep among women.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דַּאֲבֵילוּת קָיְלָא לֵיהּ מִנִּדָּה?
human_translation: Is that to say that mourning is more lenient in his than a menstruating woman?
llm_translation: Regarding the statement of Availut, is a basket effective for her from Niddah?

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כׇּל מְלָאכוֹת שֶׁאִשָּׁה עוֹשָׂה לְבַעְלָהּ — נִדָּה עוֹשָׂה לְבַעְלָהּ, חוּץ מִמְּזִיגַת הַכּוֹס וְהַצָּעַת הַמִּטָּה, וְהַרְחָצַת פָּנָיו יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו. וְאִלּוּ גַּבֵּי אֲבֵילוּת תַּנְיָא: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ אֵין אָדָם רַשַּׁאי לָכוֹף אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ לִהְיוֹת כּוֹחֶלֶת וְלִהְיוֹת פּוֹקֶסֶת, בֶּאֱמֶת אָמְרוּ: מוֹזֶגֶת לוֹ הַכּוֹס, וּמַצַּעַת לוֹ הַמִּטָּה, וּמַרְחֶצֶת לוֹ פָּנָיו יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו.
human_translation: But didn’t Rav Yitzḥak bar Ḥanina say Rav Huna said: All tasks that a woman performs for her husband, a menstruating woman performs for her husband, except for pouring cup; arranging bed; and washing his face, hands, and feet, Whereas with regard to mourning, it is taught Although they said that a man may not compel his wife, to paint blue or to rouge [ pokeset ] in truth they said that she may pour the cup; arrange his bed; and wash his face, hands, and feet.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And Rabbi Yitzchak bar Chanina said in the name of Rav Huna: All tasks that a woman does for her husband - she makes herself impure for her husband, except for pouring the cup and making the bed, and washing his face, hands, and feet. And regarding mourning practices it was taught: Even though they said a person is not allowed to force his wife to be like a warrior and to be brazen, in truth they said: She should pour him the cup, make the bed for him, and wash his face, hands, and feet."

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בַּאֲבֵילוּת דִּידֵיהּ, כָּאן — בַּאֲבֵילוּת דִּידַהּ.
human_translation: not difficult. Here, in mourning; there, in mourning.
llm_translation: Not difficult: here - in its mourning, here - in her mourning.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָבִיו שֶׁל חָתָן אוֹ אִמָּהּ שֶׁל כַּלָּה קָתָנֵי! כִּי קָתָנֵי, אַשְּׁאָרָא.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught The father of the groom and the mother of the bride? When teaches concerning the rest
llm_translation: And this, the father of the groom or her mother of the bride is taught! For it is taught, I will explain.

hebrew_text: וּמִי שָׁאנֵי בֵּין אֲבֵילוּת דִּידֵיהּ לַאֲבֵילוּת דִּידַהּ? וְהָתַנְיָא: מִי שֶׁמֵּת חָמִיו אוֹ חֲמוֹתוֹ — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לָכוֹף אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ לִהְיוֹת כּוֹחֶלֶת וְלִהְיוֹת פּוֹקֶסֶת, אֶלָּא כּוֹפֶה מִטָּתוֹ, וְנוֹהֵג עִמָּהּ אֲבֵילוּת. וְכֵן הִיא שֶׁמֵּת חָמִיהָ אוֹ חֲמוֹתָהּ — אֵינָהּ רַשָּׁאָה לִהְיוֹת כּוֹחֶלֶת וְלִהְיוֹת פּוֹקֶסֶת, אֶלָּא כּוֹפָה מִטָּתָהּ וְנוֹהֶגֶת עִמּוֹ אֲבֵילוּת.
human_translation: And do distinguish between his mourning and her mourning? But isn’t it taught one whose father-in-law or mother-in-law died, he may not compel his wife to paint blue or to rouge Rather, he overturns his bed, and observes mourning with her. And likewise, if father-in-law or mother-in-law dies, she is not allowed to paint blue or to rouge Rather, she overturns her bed and observes mourning with him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who is considered the mourner in regard to her mourning and his mourning? And it was taught: If his father-in-law or mother-in-law dies — he cannot compel his wife to be unbraided and to be unkempt, but he compels her from her bed, and he behaves with her in mourning. And similarly, if her father-in-law or mother-in-law dies — she is not permitted to be unbraided and to be unkempt, but she compels herself from her bed and behaves with him in mourning.

hebrew_text: תְּנִי בַּאֲבֵילוּת דִּידֵיהּ: הוּא יָשֵׁן בֵּין הָאֲנָשִׁים וְאִשְׁתּוֹ יְשֵׁנָה בֵּין הַנָּשִׁים. הָא ״וְכֵן״ קָתָנֵי! כִּי קָתָנֵי, אַכִּיחוּל וְאַפִּירְכּוּס. וְהָא ״עִמּוֹ״ קָתָנֵי, מַאי לָאו עִמּוֹ בַּמִּטָּה! לֹא, עִמּוֹ בַּבַּיִת. וּכְדַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְחִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ: בְּאַפַּהּ נְהוֹג אֲבִילוּתָא, דְּלָא בְּאַפַּהּ לָא תִּנְהוֹג אֲבִילוּתָא.
human_translation: Teach with regard to his mourning: He sleeps among the men and his wife sleeps among the women. doesn’t teach: And likewise? When teaches painting and rouge. doesn’t teach: With him? What, it not with him in bed, No, with him at home, and as that which Rav said to Ḥiyya, his son, Before her, observe mourning not before her, do not observe mourning
llm_translation: It was taught in the mourning practices of his household: He sleeps among the men, and his wife sleeps among the women. But isn't this what was taught: "And so"? When it was taught as such, it is a correction and an explanation. And when it was taught "with him," what does it mean that she is not with him in the bed? No, she is with him in the house. And as Rav said to Chiya his son: Mourning practices are observed in the oven, for mourning practices are not observed in the oven.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מִי קָמְדַמֵּית אֲבִילוּתָא דְהָכָא לַאֲבִילוּתָא דְעָלְמָא? אֲבִילוּתָא דְעָלְמָא חֲמִיר, וְלָא אָתֵי לְזַלְזוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ. אֲבֵילוּת דְהָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּאַקִּילוּ רַבָּנַן, אָתֵי לְזַלְזוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said Can you compare the mourning here with mourning in general? Mourning in general is stringent, and one will not come to take it lightly. mourning here, since the Sages were lenient, one will come to take it lightly.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Who established the mourning here compared to the mourning of the world? The mourning of the world is severe, and one should not treat it lightly. The mourning here, since the Rabbis lightened it, one may treat it lightly.

hebrew_text: מַאי קוּלָּא? אִילֵּימָא דְּקָתָנֵי בּוֹעֵל בְּעִילַת מִצְוָה וּפוֹרֵשׁ — הָתָם מִשּׁוּם דְּלֹא חָל עָלָיו אֲבִילוּתָא, אִי לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא מִפֶּתַח הַבַּיִת, אִי לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ עַד שֶׁיִּסָּתֵם הַגּוֹלֵל.
human_translation: What leniency If we say which teaches: engages in intercourse mitzva withdraws there, due to that mourning has not yet taken effect upon him. If Rabbi Eliezer, until the emerges from the entrance of the house If Rabbi Yehoshua, until the covering of the grave is sealed.
llm_translation: What is the law? If it is taught that one engages in the mitzvah act and then separates—there, because the mourning does not take effect upon him, whether according to Rabbi Eliezer until he exits from the doorway of the house, or according to Rabbi Yehoshua until the skullcap is removed.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּקָתָנֵי: נוֹהֵג שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי הַמִּשְׁתֶּה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹהֵג שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי אֲבֵילוּת.
human_translation: Rather, which teaches: observes the seven days of feast and thereafter he observes the seven days of mourning.
llm_translation: Rather, for it was taught: One observes seven days of feasting, and afterwards one observes seven days of mourning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ לֹא יִבְעוֹל, לֹא בָּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת וְלֹא בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת. בִּשְׁלָמָא בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — מִשּׁוּם חַבּוּרָה. אֶלָּא בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת, אַמַּאי לָא?
human_translation: The Master said In any event, the may not engage in intercourse neither on Shabbat evening, nor conclusion of Shabbat. Granted, on Shabbat evening due to the a wound However, at the conclusion of Shabbat, why not
llm_translation: Master said: Between this and that, one should not engage in marital relations, neither on Friday evening nor on Saturday night. It is understandable regarding Friday evening - due to the need for connection. But why not on Saturday night?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא:
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said:
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said:

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם חֶשְׁבּוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: due to calculations
llm_translation: On account of calculations.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְחֶשְׁבּוֹנוֹת שֶׁל מִצְוָה מִי אֲסִירִי? וְהָא רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַב הַמְנוּנָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: חֶשְׁבּוֹנוֹת שֶׁל מִצְוָה מוּתָּר לְחַשְּׁבָן בְּשַׁבָּת! וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: פּוֹסְקִין צְדָקָה לַעֲנִיִּים בְּשַׁבָּת! וְאָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הוֹלְכִין לְבָתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּלְבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת לְפַקֵּחַ עַל עִסְקֵי רַבִּים בְּשַׁבָּת. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מְפַקְּחִין פִּיקּוּחַ נֶפֶשׁ בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: And are calculations for a mitzva prohibited But wasn’t it Rav Ḥisda and Rav Hamnuna who both said: calculations for a mitzva, permitted to reckon them on Shabbat? And Rabbi Elazar said: One may allocate charity to the poor on Shabbat. And Rabbi Ya’akov said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One goes to synagogues and study halls to supervise matters multitudes on Shabbat. And Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One supervises matters of saving a life on Shabbat.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And calculations of a commandment who prohibits? And this Rav Ḥisdah and Rav Hamnuna both said: Calculations of a commandment are permitted to be calculated on Shabbat! And Rabbi Elazar said: We distribute charity to the poor on Shabbat! And Rabbi Ya'akov said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: We go to synagogues and study halls to oversee communal affairs on Shabbat. And Rabbi Ya'akov bar Idi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: We perform life-saving activities on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: הוֹלְכִין לְטֵרַטְיָיאוֹת וּלְקִרְקְיָיאוֹת לְפַקֵּחַ עַל עִסְקֵי רַבִּים בְּשַׁבָּת. וְתָנָא דְּבֵי מְנַשְּׁיָא: מְשַׁדְּכִין עַל הַתִּינוֹקֶת לֵיאָרֵס בְּשַׁבָּת, וְעַל הַתִּינוֹק לְלַמְּדוֹ סֵפֶר וּלְלַמְּדוֹ אוּמָּנוּת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: One goes to theaters [ tartiyyaot ] and circuses [ karkiyyaot ] to supervise matters multitudes on Shabbat, And of the school of Menashya taught: makes matches [ meshadkhin ] for a young girl to be betrothed on Shabbat, and for a young boy to teach him Torah and to teach him a craft.
llm_translation: And said Rav Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan: They go to Tartiyot and to Kirkayot to oversee the affairs of the public on Shabbat. And it was taught in the school of Menashya: They spread a cloth over the infant to play on Shabbat, and over the child to teach him a book and to teach him a trade.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִשְׁחוֹט בֶּן עוֹף. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשֵׁנִי בְּשַׁבָּת יִדָּחֶה, גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִשְׁחוֹט בֶּן עוֹף! הָתָם דִּלְנַפְשֵׁיהּ — לָא טְרִיד, הָכָא דְּלַאֲחֵרִים — טְרִיד. אִי נָמֵי: הָתָם אִית לֵיהּ רַוְוחָא, הָכָא לֵית לֵיהּ רַוְוחָא.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Zeira said: It is a decree lest one slaughter a young fowl on Abaye said to him: If so, Yom Kippur that occurs on Monday should be postponed a decree lest one slaughter a young fowl There, for himself, he is not preoccupied, Here, for others preoccupied. Alternatively, there, he has an interval Here, he does not have an interval
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Zeira said: It is a decree lest one slaughter a young bird. Abaye said to him: Rather, from now on, if Yom Kippur falls on Monday or on Shabbat, it shall be postponed, it is a decree lest one slaughter a young bird! There, where it is for his own benefit — it is not postponed, but here, where it is for others — it is postponed. Alternatively: There, it has a benefit, but here, it has no benefit.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי, עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת נָמֵי — גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִשְׁחוֹט בֶּן עוֹף.
human_translation: Now that we have come to this Shabbat evening, too, a decree lest one slaughter a young fowl
llm_translation: The instance where you came to say, "on Friday eve only" — a decree lest one slaughter a young bird.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בְּתוּלָה נִשֵּׂאת בָּרְבִיעִי וְנִבְעֶלֶת בָּרְבִיעִי, וְלָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְאִיקָּרוֹרֵי דַעְתָּא, אוֹ דִלְמָא: בְּתוּלָה נִשֵּׂאת בָּרְבִיעִי וְנִבְעֶלֶת בַּחֲמִישִׁי, דְּחָיְישִׁינַן לְאִיקָּרוֹרֵי דַעְתָּא.
human_translation: raises a dilemma: Is a virgin married on Wednesday and engage in intercourse on Wednesday, and we are not concerned his resolve cool Or perhaps, a virgin is married on Wednesday but engages in intercourse on Thursday, as we are concerned that his resolve will cool.
llm_translation: He asked them: A virgin is betrothed on the fourth day and consummated on the fourth day, and we are not concerned about the entanglements of the mind, or perhaps: a virgin is betrothed on the fourth day and consummated on the fifth day, for we are concerned about the entanglements of the mind.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי בַּר קַפָּרָא: בְּתוּלָה נִשֵּׂאת בָּרְבִיעִי וְנִבְעֶלֶת בַּחֲמִישִׁי, הוֹאִיל וְנֶאֶמְרָה בּוֹ בְּרָכָה לַדָּגִים. אַלְמָנָה נִשֵּׂאת בַּחֲמִישִׁי וְנִבְעֶלֶת בַּשִּׁשִּׁי — הוֹאִיל וְנֶאֶמְרָה בּוֹ בְּרָכָה לָאָדָם. טַעְמָא מִשּׁוּם בְּרָכָה, אֲבָל מִשּׁוּם אִיקָּרוֹרֵי דַעְתָּא — לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: Come and hear as bar Kappara taught: A virgin is married on Wednesday and engages in intercourse on Thursday, since the blessing to the fish: was stated A widow is married on Thursday and engages in intercourse on Friday, since the blessing was stated to man the reason is due to the blessing, but with regard to his resolve cool, we are not concerned.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught by Bar Kappara: A virgin is married on the fourth day and consummated on the fifth, since a blessing was stated in it for the fish. A widow is married on the fifth day and consummated on the sixth, since a blessing was stated in it for man. The reason is because of the blessing, but due to the enticements of the mind, we are not concerned.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אַלְמָנָה נָמֵי תִּיבָּעֵל בַּחֲמִישִׁי, הוֹאִיל וְנֶאֶמְרָה בּוֹ בְּרָכָה לַדָּגִים! בְּרָכָה דְאָדָם עֲדִיפָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: If so, a widow should also engage in intercourse on Thursday, since the blessing to the fish was stated then. the blessing of man is preferable for him.
llm_translation: If so, a widow should also be married on the fifth day, since a blessing was said over it for fish! The blessing for a person is preferable for it.

hebrew_text: וְאִי נָמֵי: מִשּׁוּם שָׁקְדוּ. דְּתַנְיָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ אַלְמָנָה נִשֵּׂאת בַּחֲמִישִׁי וְנִבְעֶלֶת בַּשִּׁשִּׁי? שֶׁאִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר תִּיבָּעֵל בַּחֲמִישִׁי, לְמָחָר מַשְׁכִּים לְאוּמָּנֻתוֹ וְהוֹלֵךְ לוֹ. שָׁקְדוּ חֲכָמִים עַל תַּקָּנַת בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁיְּהֵא שָׂמֵחַ עִמָּהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים: חֲמִישִׁי בְּשַׁבָּת, וְעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, וְשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Alternatively, due to were assiduous as it is taught Why did say that a widow is married on Thursday and engages in intercourse on Friday? because if you say that she should engage in intercourse on Thursday, on the next day go to his craft early the Sages were assiduous in seeing to the well-being of Jewish women that rejoice with her three days: Thursday, and Shabbat eve, and Shabbat.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if you will say: because they are diligent. For it was taught: For what reason did they say that a widow may be married on the fifth day and consummated on the sixth? Because if you were to say she may be consummated on the fifth, he would rise early the next day to his craft and go. The sages were diligent in establishing the ordinance for the daughters of Israel, that he should make her happy for three days: the fifth day, Friday, and the eve of Shabbat, and Shabbat.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין ״בְּרָכָה״ לְ״שָׁקְדוּ״? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ אָדָם בָּטֵל. אִי נָמֵי: יוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: What is there between blessing and were assiduous? There is between them an idle person, Alternatively, a Festival that occurs on Shabbat eve.
llm_translation: What is the difference between "berakhah" and "shakdu"? The difference between them is that a person is exempt. Alternatively: a festival that falls on Erev Shabbat.

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ בַּר קַפָּרָא: גְּדוֹלִים מַעֲשֵׂה צַדִּיקִים יוֹתֵר מִמַּעֲשֵׂה שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ, דְּאִילּוּ בְּמַעֲשֵׂה שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ כְּתִיב: ״אַף יָדִי יָסְדָה אֶרֶץ וִימִינִי טִפְּחָה שָׁמָיִם״, וְאִלּוּ בְּמַעֲשֵׂה יְדֵיהֶם שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים כְּתִיב: ״מָכוֹן לְשִׁבְתְּךָ פָּעַלְתָּ ה׳ מִקְּדָשׁ אֲדֹנָי כּוֹנְנוּ יָדֶיךָ״.
human_translation: Bar Kappara taught: The handiwork of the righteous is greater than the creation of heaven and earth, as with regard to the creation of heaven and earth it is written: “My hand also has laid the foundation of the earth, and My right hand has spanned the heavens” Whereas with regard to the handiwork of the righteous it is written: “The place which You have made for Yourself to dwell in, Lord, the Sanctuary, Lord, which your hands have established” (Exodus 15:17).
llm_translation: Bar Kappara expounded: The deeds of the righteous are greater than the creation of heaven and earth, for regarding the creation of heaven and earth it is written: "My hand has founded the earth, and My right hand has spread out the heavens." But regarding the deeds of the hands of the righteous, it is written: "The place for Your dwelling that Hashem, Your hands have established."

hebrew_text: הֵשִׁיב בַּבְלִי אֶחָד, וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא שְׁמוֹ: ״וְיַבֶּשֶׁת יָדָיו יָצָרוּ״! ״יָדוֹ״ כְּתִיב. וְהָכְתִיב ״יָצָרוּ״! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: יָצְרוּ אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״כִּי אֶרְאֶה שָׁמֶיךָ מַעֲשֵׂה אֶצְבְּעוֹתֶיךָ יָרֵחַ וְכוֹכָבִים אֲשֶׁר כּוֹנָנְתָּ״.
human_translation: A certain Babylonian, and his name is Rabbi Ḥiyya, responded “And His hands formed the dry land” “His hand” is written. But isn’t it written: “Formed,” His fingers, as it is written: “When I see Your heavens, the work of Your fingers, the moon and stars, which You have established”
llm_translation: He returned Bavel one, and Rabbi Chiya his name: "And his hands will dry up"! "His hand" is written. And it is written "will dry up"! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: His fingers will dry up, as it is written: "When I see Your heavens, the work of Your fingers, the moon and the stars that You set in place."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״הַשָּׁמַיִם מְסַפְּרִים כְּבוֹד אֵל וּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדָיו מַגִּיד הָרָקִיעַ״! הָכִי קָאָמַר: מַעֲשֵׂה יְדֵיהֶם שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים מִי מַגִּיד — הָרָקִיעַ, וּמַאי נִיהוּ — מָטָר.
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: “The heavens declare the glory of God, and the firmament proclaims the work of His hands” this is saying: Who attests to the handiwork of the righteous, the heavens. And what is rain
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "A contradiction was raised: 'The heavens declare the glory of God, and the firmament proclaims His handiwork!' (Psalms 19:2). This is what it means: Whose handiwork of the righteous do the heavens declare? — The firmament. And what is the benefit? — Rain."

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ בַּר קַפָּרָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְיָתֵד תִּהְיֶה לְךָ עַל אֲזֵנֶךָ״. אַל תִּקְרֵי ״אֲזֵנֶךָ״, אֶלָּא ״עַל אׇזְנֶךָ״ — שֶׁאִם יִשְׁמַע אָדָם דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ הָגוּן,
human_translation: Bar Kappara taught: What is is written: And you shall have a peg among your weapons [ azenekha ]” Do not read Your weapons [ azenekha ]. Rather, On your ear [ oznekha ], that if a person hears an inappropriate matter,
llm_translation: Bar Kappara expounded, what is the meaning of the verse: "And a peg shall be for you on your ear." Do not read "your ear," rather "over your ear" - so that if a person hears something unseemly,

hebrew_text: יַנִּיחַ אֶצְבָּעוֹ בְּאׇזְנָיו. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִפְּנֵי מָה אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם דּוֹמוֹת לִיתֵידוֹת? מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּמְחַלְּקָן, כׇּל חֲדָא וַחֲדָא לְמִילְּתַיהּ עֲבִידָא. דְּאָמַר מָר: זוֹ זֶרֶת. זוֹ קְמִיצָה. זוֹ אַמָּה. זוֹ אֶצְבַּע. זֶה גּוּדָל.
human_translation: he should place his finger, into his ears. And that is what Rabbi Elazar said: Why are the fingers of a person similar to pegs? What is the reason If we say due to that they are discrete each and every was designated for its matter, as the Master said: This a span, this a fistful this a cubit, this finger this thumb,
llm_translation: He shall place his finger in his ears. And this is what Rabbi Elazar said: Why are the fingers of a person similar to worms? What is the reason? If you say it is because they divide, each and every one does its own work. As Mar said: This is a span. This is a handful. This is a cubit. This is a finger. This is a forearm.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מַה טַּעַם מְשׁוּפּוֹת כִּיתֵידוֹת — שֶׁאִם יִשְׁמַע אָדָם דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ הָגוּן, יַנִּיחַ אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו בְּאׇזְנָיו. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: מִפְּנֵי מָה אוֹזֶן כּוּלָּהּ קָשָׁה וְהָאַלְיָה רַכָּה? שֶׁאִם יִשְׁמַע אָדָם דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ הָגוּן, יָכוֹף אַלְיָה לְתוֹכָהּ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַל יַשְׁמִיעַ אָדָם לְאׇזְנָיו דְּבָרִים בְּטֵלִים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן נִכְווֹת תְּחִלָּה לְאֵיבָרִים.
human_translation: Rather, What is the reason that they are pointed like pegs? that if a person hears an inappropriate matter, he will place his fingers in his ears. of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Why is the entire ear hard and the earlobe soft? that if a person hears an inappropriate matter, he will bend his earlobe into The Sages taught: A person should not allow his ears to hear idle matters. Because that are first of the limbs burned,
llm_translation: Rather: what is the reason for the earlobes being like a kettle handle? Because if a person hears something inappropriate, he will place his fingers in his ears. It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Why is the entire ear hard and the lobe soft? Because if a person hears something inappropriate, he will press the lobe into its interior. The Sages taught: A person should not let his ears hear idle words, as they are the first to affect the limbs.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ לִבְעוֹל בַּתְּחִלָּה בְּשַׁבָּת. דָּם מִיפְקָד פְּקִיד, אוֹ חַבּוֹרֵי מִיחַבַּר?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised What is to engaging in intercourse for the first time on Shabbat? blood is pooled, Or, attached
llm_translation: He asked them: What is the law regarding having marital relations at the beginning of Shabbat? Is the blood separated, separated, or the joining joined?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר דָּם מִיפְקָד פְּקִיד: לַדָּם הוּא צָרִיךְ, וּשְׁרֵי. אוֹ דִּלְמָא לַפֶּתַח הוּא צָרִיךְ, וַאֲסִיר.
human_translation: And if you say it is pooled Does require the blood permitted? Or, perhaps he requires the opening and prohibited
llm_translation: And if you might say that blood is required to be collected: for blood it is necessary, and permitted. Or perhaps it is necessary at the entrance, and forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר לַדָּם הוּא צָרִיךְ, וּפֶתַח מִמֵּילָא קָאָתֵי — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמַר דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין מוּתָּר, אוֹ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין אָסוּר?
human_translation: And if you say he requires the blood, and the opening comes incidentally is the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who said: An unintentional act, is permitted? Or, is the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who said: An unintentional act is forbidden?
llm_translation: And if you might say that it is necessary for the blood, and the opening is coming from the outset - is the halakha like Rabbi Shimon who says that an unintended consequence is permitted, or is the halakha like Rabbi Yehuda who says that an unintended consequence is forbidden?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — מְקַלְקֵל הוּא אֵצֶל הַפֶּתַח, אוֹ מְתַקֵּן הוּא אֵצֶל הַפֶּתַח?
human_translation: And even if you say that the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda a destructive vis-à-vis the opening, Or, perhaps a constructive vis-à-vis the opening.
llm_translation: And if you might say, "Is the halakha like Rabbi Yehudah?" — Is he causing damage at the entrance, or is he fixing at the entrance?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: וְאִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר דָּם חַבּוֹרֵי מִיחַבַּר — לַדָּם הוּא צָרִיךְ, וְאָסוּר, אוֹ דִּלְמָא לַהֲנָאַת עַצְמוֹ הוּא צָרִיךְ, וְשָׁרֵי?
human_translation: Some say And if you say the blood is attached does require the blood, prohibited, Or, perhaps he requires for his own pleasure, and permitted.
llm_translation: There are those who say: And if you might suggest that the blood of the fetus is considered connected to the blood — it is necessary for the blood, and prohibited, or perhaps it is necessary for his own benefit, and permitted?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר לַהֲנָאַת עַצְמוֹ הוּא צָרִיךְ, וְדָם מִמֵּילָא קָאָתֵי — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן?
human_translation: And if you say that he requires for his own pleasure, and the blood comes incidentally, is the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda or in accordance with Rabbi Shimon?
llm_translation: And if you might say for his own benefit he needs, and blood from the foreskin comes — is the halakha like Rabbi Yehuda or is the halakha like Rabbi Shimon?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — מְקַלְקֵל בְּחַבּוּרָה אוֹ מְתַקֵּן בְּחַבּוּרָה הוּא?
human_translation: And if you say halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda destructive in wound constructive in wound?
llm_translation: "And if you might suggest that the halakha is according to Rabbi Yehudah - is he causing damage in the group or fixing in the group?"

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר מְקַלְקֵל בְּחַבּוּרָה הוּא — בִּמְקַלְקֵל הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה,
human_translation: And if you say destructive in wound, in destructive is the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: "And if you might suggest that he is causing damage within a partnership - in causing damage, is it according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda,"

hebrew_text: אוֹ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Or, is the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: Or the halakha is like Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: (אִיתְּמַר:) בְּבֵי רַב אָמְרִי: רַב שָׁרֵי וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָסַר. בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא אָמְרִי: רַב אָסַר וּשְׁמוּאֵל שָׁרֵי. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, וְסִימָנָיךְ: אֵלּוּ מְקִילִּין לְעַצְמָן וְאֵלּוּ מְקִילִּין לְעַצְמָן.
human_translation: it was stated in the school of Rav they say: Rav permitted and Shmuel prohibited In Neharde’a, they say: Rav prohibited and Shmuel permitted Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: And your mnemonic These are lenient to themselves, and those are lenient to themselves.
llm_translation: It was stated: In the study hall of Rav they said: Rav permits and Shmuel prohibits. In Nehardea they said: Rav prohibits and Shmuel permits. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, and the mnemonic is: These are lenient for themselves and these are lenient for themselves.

hebrew_text: וְרַב שָׁרֵי? וְהָאָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר חִזְקִיָּה מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: הַאי מְסוֹכַרְיָא דְּנַזְיָיתָא — אָסוּר לְהַדּוֹקַהּ בְּיוֹמָא טָבָא!
human_translation: And did Rav permit But didn’t Rav Shimi bar Ḥizkiyya say in the name of Rav: this stopper of a barrel [ nazyata ], prohibited to it tightly on a Festival,
llm_translation: And Rav Sharay? And Rav Shimi bar Chizkiyah said in the name of Rav: This butcher in Nazya - it is forbidden to inspect it on a good day!

hebrew_text: בְּהָהוּא אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מוֹדֶה, דְּאַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בִּ״פְסִיק רֵישֵׁיהּ וְלָא יְמוּת״.
human_translation: In the case even Rabbi Shimon concedes, as Abaye and Rava who both say: Rabbi Shimon concedes in Cut off its head and will it not die,
llm_translation: In that case, even Rabbi Shimon agrees, as Abbaye and Rava both say: Rabbi Shimon agrees in a case of "pesik reishei v'lo yamus."

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְרַב חָנָן בַּר אַמֵּי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. וְרַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין מַתְנֵי לַהּ בְּלָא גַּבְרֵי, רַב אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: But didn’t Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi say Rav said The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, and Rav Ḥanan bar Ami said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. And Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin taught without men Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, and Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And Rav Chiya bar Ashe said in the name of Rav: The halacha follows Rabbi Yehuda. And Rav Chanin bar Ami said in the name of Shmuel: The halacha follows Rabbi Shimon. And Rav Chiya bar Avin taught it without mentioning the men, Rav said: The halacha follows Rabbi Yehuda, and Shmuel said: The halacha follows Rabbi Shimon."

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַב כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, לְהַךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמַר דָּם מִיפְקָד פְּקִיד — מְקַלְקֵל הוּא אֵצֶל הַפֶּתַח. לְהָךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמַר דָּם חַבּוֹרֵי מִיחַבַּר — מְקַלְקֵל בְּחַבּוּרָה הוּא.
human_translation: Actually, Rav holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. to that version that said the blood is pooled, he is destructive vis-à-vis the opening. to that version that said attached he is destructive in wound,
llm_translation: Always Rav like Rabbi Yehuda holds, to this to sleep of saying blood is appointed appointed — he is damaging near the opening. To this to sleep of saying blood of bundles is bundled — he is damaging in a bundle.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב חִסְדָּא: תִּינוֹקֶת שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ זְמַנָּהּ לִרְאוֹת וְנִשֵּׂאת, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נוֹתְנִין לָהּ אַרְבָּעָה לֵילוֹת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: עַד שֶׁתִּחְיֶה הַמַּכָּה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raised an objection a young girl whose time to see has not arrived, and she married, Beit Shammai say: One gives her four nights Beit Hillel say: until the wound heals.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Ḥisda raised a dilemma: With regard to a minor who has not reached the age to understand and speak, Beit Shammai say: One should wait for her for four nights, and Beit Hillel say: Until the wound heals.

hebrew_text: הִגִּיעַ זְמַנָּהּ לִרְאוֹת וְנִשֵּׂאת, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נוֹתְנִין לָהּ לַיְלָה הָרִאשׁוֹן. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: עַד מוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת, אַרְבָּעָה לֵילוֹת.
human_translation: her time to see has arrived, and she married, Beit Shammai say: One gives her the first night, Beit Hillel say: One gives her until the conclusion of Shabbat, four nights.
llm_translation: The time has arrived for her to see and be married, Beit Shammai says: They give her the first night. And Beit Hillel says: Until the end of the Sabbath, four nights.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו: דְּאִי לֹא בָּעַל, מָצֵי בָּעֵיל אֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת. אָמַר רָבָא: לָא, לְבַר מִשַּׁבָּת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא ״עַד מוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת אַרְבָּעָה לֵילוֹת״ קָתָנֵי? אֶלָּא, אָמַר רָבָא: כְּשֶׁבָּעַל.
human_translation: What, is it not where if he did not engage in intercourse, he may engage in intercourse even on Shabbat? Rava said: No, except for Shabbat. Abaye said to him: But isn’t it taught: Until the conclusion of Shabbat, four nights? Rather, Rava said: where he engaged in intercourse
llm_translation: What is the reason that if one is not married, he may have marital relations even on Shabbat? Rava said: No, it is in reference to one who is married. Abaye said to him: But doesn't it teach "until the end of Shabbat four nights"? Rather, Rava said: When one is married.

hebrew_text: אִי כְּשֶׁבָּעַל, מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דִּשְׁרֵי לְמִיבְעַל בְּשַׁבָּת, כְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: פִּירְצָה דְּחוּקָה מוּתָּר לִיכָּנֵס בָּהּ בְּשַׁבָּת, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמַּשִּׁיר צְרוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: if he engaged in intercourse, what is teaching us He teaches us that it is permitted to engage in intercourse on Shabbat, in accordance with of Shmuel, as Shmuel said: permitted to enter into a narrow opening on Shabbat, although causes pebbles to fall
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If a man is a ba'al, what does it imply to us? It implies to us that it is permitted to enter it on Shabbat, as Shmuel said: Shmuel said: A broken barrel may be entered on Shabbat, even though it is filled with bundles.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב יוֹסֵף: חָתָן פָּטוּר מִקְּרִיַּת שְׁמַע לַיְלָה הָרִאשׁוֹן עַד מוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת אִם לֹא עָשָׂה מַעֲשֶׂה. מַאי לָאו, דִּטְרִיד דְּבָעֵי לְמִיבְעַל! אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: לָא, דִּטְרִיד דְּלָא בְּעֵיל.
human_translation: Rav Yosef raised an objection A groom is exempt from the of reciting Shema on the first night until Saturday night, if he has not taken action What, is it not that he is preoccupied because he wishes to engage in intercourse Abaye said to him: No. that he is preoccupied that not engage in intercourse
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Yosef raised an objection: A groom is exempt from reciting the Shema on the first night until the conclusion of Shabbat if he did not consummate the marriage. What is the reason? Because he is preoccupied with the mitzvah that he needs to fulfill! Abaye said to him: No, it is because he is preoccupied with something that does not involve a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וּמִשּׁוּם טִירְדָּא פָּטוּר? אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, טָבְעָה סְפִינָתוֹ בַּיָּם, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּפָטוּר?! וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי — וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא אָמַר רַב: אָבֵל חַיָּיב בְּכׇל הַמִּצְוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בְּתוֹרָהּ חוּץ מִן הַתְּפִילִּין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בָּהֶן ״פְּאֵר״!
human_translation: Rava said to And exempt due to preoccupation? If that is so, one whose ship sunk at sea also And if you would say: that is so, didn’t Rabbi Abba bar Zavda say Rav said: A mourner is obligated in all the mitzvot in the Torah except for phylacteries, as splendor is stated with regard to
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: And because of Tir'da he is exempt? Rather, from now on, if his ship sank in the sea, is he exempt like this?! And if you will say he is exempt like this — but didn't Rabbi Abba bar Zavda say in the name of Rav: A mourner is obligated in all the commandments stated in the Torah except for Tefillin, as it says about them "beauty"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתָנָא חֲדָא: אִם לֹא עָשָׂה מַעֲשֶׂה בָּרִאשׁוֹן — פָּטוּר אַף בַּשֵּׁנִי, בַּשֵּׁנִי — פָּטוּר אַף בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: is tanna’im , as one taught: If he did not take action on the first he is exempt even on the second. second he is exempt even on the third
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: It is a teaching. As it was taught in one teaching: If one did not perform an action in the first instance - he is exempt even in the second, in the second - he is exempt even in the third.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: רִאשׁוֹן וְשֵׁנִי — פָּטוּר, שְׁלִישִׁי — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And another is taught: first and second he is exempt; third he is obligated
llm_translation: And it was taught in another Baraita: The first and second offenses - exempt; the third - liable.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי? הָתָם נָמֵי בְּטִירְדָּא פְּלִיגִי.
human_translation: And Abaye there too, is with regard to preoccupation disagree.
llm_translation: And Abbaye? There, in Tirda, they argue.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי כִּי הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי. דְּתַנְיָא: הַכּוֹנֵס אֶת הַבְּתוּלָה — לֹא יִבְעוֹל בַּתְּחִלָּה בְּשַׁבָּת, וַחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִין.
human_translation: And these tanna’im parallel these tanna’im , as it is taught one who marries a virgin, he may not engage in intercourse first Shabbat, and the Rabbis permit
llm_translation: The text reads: "And these Tannaim, for these Tannaim. As it was taught: One who marries a virgin - may not consummate the marriage initially on Shabbat, and the sages permit."

hebrew_text: מַאן חֲכָמִים? אָמַר רַבָּה: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Who are Rabbis Rabba said: It is Rabbi Shimon, who said: An unintentional act is permitted
llm_translation: Who is wise? Rabah said: Rabbi Shimon is, as he said: A matter that is not intended is permitted.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא מוֹדֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בִּ״פְסִיק רֵישֵׁיהּ וְלָא יְמוּת״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֹא כְּהַלָּלוּ בַּבְלִיִּים שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין בְּהַטָּיָיה, אֶלָּא יֵשׁ בְּקִיאִין בְּהַטָּיָיה.
human_translation: Abaye said to But doesn’t Rabbi Shimon concede in Cut off its head and will it not die, said to him: Unlike these Babylonians, who are not experts in diverting there are experts in diverting.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: But doesn't Rabbi Shimon agree that "if one's head is cut off, he should not die"? He said to him: Not like the Babylonians who are not proficient in their craft, but rather there are those who are proficient in their craft.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, טוֹרֶד לָמָּה? לְשֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּקִי. יֹאמְרוּ: בָּקִי — מוּתָּר, שֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּקִי — אָסוּר! רוֹב בְּקִיאִין הֵן.
human_translation: If so, why preoccupation one who is not expert. should say expert is permitted who is not expert is prohibited majority are experts
llm_translation: If so, why is it torn? Because he is not proficient. They will say: If he is proficient - it is permitted, if he is not proficient - it is forbidden! Most are proficient.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא בַּר רַב חָנָן לְאַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה שׁוֹשְׁבִינִין, לָמָּה? מַפָּה לָמָּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם שֶׁמָּא יִרְאֶה וִיאַבֵּד.
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Ḥanan said to Abaye: If that is so, why are groomsmen why a sheet said to him: There, lest see and destroy
llm_translation: Rava son of Rav Hanan said to Abbaye: Rather, we sit, why? A table, why? He said to him: There, lest he see and be lost.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הַמֵּפִיס מוּרְסָא בְּשַׁבָּת, אִם לַעֲשׂוֹת לָהּ פֶּה — חַיָּיב. וְאִם לְהוֹצִיא מִמֶּנָּה לֵיחָה —
human_translation: Rav Ami raised an objection one who drains an abscess on Shabbat, if to create opening he is liable However, if to remove pus,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Rabbi Ammi raises an objection: One who squeezes murṣa on Shabbat, if it is to make a mouth for it - he is liable. But if it is to extract liquid from it -

hebrew_text: פָּטוּר. הָתָם, פְּקִיד וַעֲקִיר. הָכָא, פְּקִיד וְלָא עֲקִיר.
human_translation: he is exempt. There, is pooled and removed Here, is pooled, it is not removed
llm_translation: Exempt. There, appointed and uprooted. Here, appointed and not uprooted.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַמֵּי שְׁרָא לְמִיבְעַל בַּתְּחִלָּה בְּשַׁבָּת. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: וְהָא לָא כְּתִיבָא כְּתוּבָּתָהּ! אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַתְפְּסוּהָ מִטַּלְטְלִין.
human_translation: Rav Ami permitted to engage in intercourse first on Shabbat. The Sages said to him: But her marriage contract is not written. He said to them: Have her seize movable property
llm_translation: Rabbi Amei permitted to carry at the outset on Shabbat. The Rabbis said to him: But isn't it written, its writing is its writing! He said to them: You have grasped it from the carriers.

hebrew_text: רַב זְבִיד שְׁרָא לְמִיבְעַל בַּתְּחִלָּה בְּשַׁבָּת. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: רַב זְבִיד גּוּפֵיהּ בְּעַל בַּתְּחִלָּה בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rav Zevid permitted to engage in intercourse first on Shabbat. There are who say: Rav Zevid himself engaged in intercourse first on Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rav Zebid permitted carrying at the outset on Shabbat. Some say: Rav Zebid himself permitted carrying at the outset on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה שְׁרָא לְמִיבְעַל בַּתְּחִלָּה בְּיוֹם טוֹב. אָמַר רַב פַּפִּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: לָא תֵּימָא בְּיוֹם טוֹב דִּשְׁרֵי, הָא בְּשַׁבָּת אֲסִיר, דְּהוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת נָמֵי שְׁרֵי, וּמַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה כָּךְ הָיָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda permitted to engage in intercourse first on a Festival.
