Rav Pappi said in the name of Rava: Do not say: on a Festival that permitted, on Shabbat prohibited, as the same is true that even on Shabbat it is permitted. And the incident that took place, took place in this way.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah permitted carrying out initially on a festival. Rav Pappi said in the name of Rava: Do not say that on a festival it is permitted, for on Shabbat it is prohibited, as the same applies that even on Shabbat it is also permitted, and there was an incident that it was so, it was so.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אָמַר: בְּיוֹם טוֹב שְׁרֵי, בְּשַׁבָּת אֲסִיר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פַּפִּי לְרַב פָּפָּא: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ — מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהוּתְּרָה חַבּוּרָה לְצוֹרֶךְ, הוּתְּרָה נָמֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ? אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, מוּתָּר לַעֲשׂוֹת מוּגְמָר בְּיוֹם טוֹב, דְּמִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהוּתְּרָה הַבְעָרָה לְצוֹרֶךְ, הוּתְּרָה נָמֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said in the name of Rava: on a Festival permitted, on Shabbat prohibited. Rav Pappi said to Rav Pappa: What is your thinking? Since a wound was permitted for purpose was also permitted not for purpose If that is so, permitted to prepare incense [ mugmar ] on a Festival Since kindling was permitted for purpose was also permitted not for purpose
llm_translation: Rav Papa from the name of Rava said: On a festival it is permitted, on Shabbat it is prohibited. Rav Pappi said to Rav Papa: What is your opinion - since it is permitted for a necessary purpose, is it also permitted for a non-necessary purpose? Rather, from now on, it is permitted to prepare a cooked dish on a festival, for since it is permitted for a necessary purpose, it is also permitted for a non-necessary purpose!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, עָלֶיךָ אָמַר קְרָא: ״אַךְ אֲשֶׁר יֵאָכֵל לְכׇל נֶפֶשׁ״ — דָּבָר הַשָּׁוֶה לְכׇל נֶפֶשׁ.
human_translation: said to him: about your the verse states “Save that which every person must eat, a matter that is equal for every person.
llm_translation: He said to him, upon you it says the verse: "Only what may be eaten by every soul" — a matter that is equal for every soul.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, נִזְדַּמֵּן לוֹ צְבִי בְּיוֹם טוֹב, הוֹאִיל וְאֵינוֹ שָׁוֶה לְכׇל נֶפֶשׁ, הָכִי נָמֵי דַּאֲסִיר לְמִשְׁחֲטֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא דְּבַר (הַ)צוֹרֶךְ לְכׇל נֶפֶשׁ קָאָמֵינָא, צְבִי צָרִיךְ לְכׇל נֶפֶשׁ הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: If that is so, if a deer happened to his on a Festival, since not equal for every person, also that prohibited to slaughter it? said to him: I said a matter that a need for every person, deer is a matter that a need for every person.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: Rather, from now on, if a deer is found by him on a festival day, since it is not suitable for everyone, is it thus prohibited for him to slaughter it? He said to him: I am speaking about something necessary for everyone, a deer is necessary for everyone.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי, הוֹרָה רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּצַיְידָן: אָסוּר לִבְעוֹל בַּתְּחִלָּה בַּשַּׁבָּת. וּמִי אִיכָּא הוֹרָאָה לְאִיסּוּר?
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi said: Rabbi Yoḥanan issued a ruling in Tzaidan: It is prohibited to engage in intercourse first on Shabbat. And is there a ruling issued to prohibit
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi, Rabbi Yochanan taught in Tzaydan: It is forbidden to have marital relations at the outset on Shabbat. And is there a teaching for prohibition?

hebrew_text: אִין, וְהָתְנַן: הוֹרוּהָ בֵּית הִלֵּל שֶׁתְּהֵא נְזִירָה עוֹד שֶׁבַע שָׁנִים אֲחֵרוֹת.
human_translation: Yes, didn’t we learn Beit Hillel issued a ruling that she shall be a nazirite for seven additional years.
llm_translation: There is, and we learned in a Mishnah: The House of Hillel instructed that a Nazirite should be for another seven years.

hebrew_text: וְאִי נָמֵי, כִּי הָא דְּתַנְיָא: חוּט הַשִּׁדְרָה שֶׁנִּפְסַק בְּרוּבּוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ נִיקַּב. הוֹרָה רַבִּי כְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב.
human_translation: And alternatively, similar that which is taught If a majority of the spinal cord is severed, this is the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Ya’akov says: Even perforated Rabbi issued a ruling in accordance with Rabbi Ya’akov. Rav Huna said: the halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Ya’akov,
llm_translation: And if you will say, for this that it was taught: a thread of the warp that was severed in its majority, the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Yaakov says: even if it was pierced. Rabbi ruled in accordance with Rabbi Yaakov. Rav Huna said: the halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Yaakov.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק מַתְנֵי הָכִי: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, שָׁאַל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן יַעֲקֹב דְּמִן צוּר אֶת רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּצַיְידָן, וַאֲנָא שְׁמַעִי: מַהוּ לִבְעוֹל בַּתְּחִלָּה בַּשַּׁבָּת, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָסוּר. וְהִלְכְתָא: מוּתָּר לִבְעוֹל בַּתְּחִלָּה בַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak taught this Rav Abbahu said: Rabbi Yishmael ben Ya’akov, who is from Tyre, asked Rabbi Yoḥanan in Tzaidan, and I heard What is to engaging in intercourse first on Shabbat? And he said to prohibited. And the halakha is permitted to engage in intercourse first on Shabbat,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak taught thus: Rabbi Avahu said, Rabbi Yishmael ben Yaakov asked Rabbi Yochanan from Tzur while they were hunting, and I heard: What is the law regarding marital relations at the beginning of Shabbat? And he said to him: It is prohibited. And the halacha is: It is permitted to engage in marital relations at the beginning of Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא אָמַר רַב: אַחַת בְּתוּלָה וְאַחַת אַלְמָנָה טְעוּנָה בְּרָכָה. וּמִי אָמַר רַב הוּנָא הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אַלְמָנָה אֵינָהּ טְעוּנָה בְּרָכָה! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּבָחוּר שֶׁנָּשָׂא אַלְמָנָה, כָּאן בְּאַלְמוֹן שֶׁנָּשָׂא אַלְמָנָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥelbo said Rav Huna said Rabbi Abba bar Rav Zavda said Rav said: Both a virgin and a widow require benediction Did Rav Huna say that? But didn’t Rav Huna say: A widow does not require a benediction not difficult. Here, with regard to a bachelor who married a widow. There, with regard to a widower who married a widow.
llm_translation: Rabbi Helbo said in the name of Rav Huna who said in the name of Rabbi Abba bar Zavda who said in the name of Rav: One virgin and one widow require a blessing. Did Rav Huna really say this? But didn't Rav Huna say: A widow does not require a blessing! There is no difficulty: here it refers to a bachelor who married a widow, and here it refers to a widower who married a widow.

hebrew_text: וְאַלְמוֹן שֶׁנָּשָׂא אַלְמָנָה לָא? וְהָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אָמַר לִי הוּנָא בַּר נָתָן, תָּנָא: מִנַּיִן לְבִרְכַּת חֲתָנִים בַּעֲשָׂרָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקַּח עֲשָׂרָה אֲנָשִׁים מִזִּקְנֵי הָעִיר וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁבוּ פֹה וַיֵּשֵׁבוּ״. וּבוֹעַז אַלְמוֹן שֶׁנָּשָׂא אַלְמָנָה הֲוָה.
human_translation: And does a widower who married a widow not But didn’t Rav Naḥman say: Huna bar Natan said to me taught: From where that the benediction of the grooms in ten is as it is stated “And he took ten men of the Elders of the city and said: Sit you here, and they sat” And Boaz he was a widower marrying a widow.
llm_translation: And Almon who married a widow not? And Rav Nachman said, Hunah bar Nathan said to me, it was taught: From where do we learn the blessing of the groom with ten? - As it is said: "And he took ten men of the elders of the city and said, 'Sit here,' and they sat." And Boaz, who married Ruth the widow, was.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אֵינָהּ טְעוּנָה בְּרָכָה״ דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא — אֵינָהּ טְעוּנָה בְּרָכָה כׇּל שִׁבְעָה, אֲבָל יוֹם אֶחָד טְעוּנָה בְּרָכָה.
human_translation: What is Does not require a benediction, that Rav Huna stated? she does not require a benediction all seven but one day, she requires a benediction
llm_translation: What is "it does not require a blessing"? As Rav Huna said - it does not require a blessing all seven days, but one day it does require a blessing.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: שָׁקְדוּ חֲכָמִים עַל תַּקָּנַת בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁיְּהֵא שָׂמֵחַ עִמָּהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים. בְּמַאי: אִי בְּבָחוּר, הָאָמְרַתְּ שִׁבְעָה! אִי בְּאַלְמוֹן, הָאָמְרַתְּ יוֹם אֶחָד?
human_translation: However, that which is taught the Sages were assiduous in seeing to the well-being of Jewish women, that will rejoice with her three days, with regard to what If with regard to a bachelor didn’t you say seven If with regard to a widower didn’t you say one
llm_translation: Rather, this that was taught: The sages were particular about the ordinance of the daughters of Israel that one should rejoice with her for three days. With what? If it is with a bachelor, didn't you say seven! If it is with a widower, didn't you say one day?

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: בְּאַלְמוֹן — יוֹם אֶחָד לִבְרָכָה, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה לְשִׂמְחָה. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: בְּבָחוּר — שִׁבְעָה לִבְרָכָה, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה לְשִׂמְחָה.
human_translation: If you wish, say: In a widower one day for benediction and three days for celebration. And if you wish, say In a bachelor seven days for benediction and three days for celebration,
llm_translation: If you wish, say: In Almon - one day for blessing, and three for joy. And if you wish, say: In Bachur - seven for blessing, and three for joy.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מְבָרְכִין לִבְתוּלָה שִׁבְעָה וּלְאַלְמָנָה יוֹם אֶחָד. מַאי לָאו, אֲפִילּוּ אַלְמָנָה שֶׁנִּשֵּׂאת לְבָחוּר! לֹא, לְאַלְמוֹן. אֲבָל לְבָחוּר מַאי, שִׁבְעָה? אִי הָכִי לִיתְנֵי: מְבָרְכִין לִבְתוּלָה שִׁבְעָה, וּלְאַלְמָנָה שֶׁנִּשֵּׂאת לְבָחוּר שִׁבְעָה, וּלְאַלְמָנָה יוֹם אֶחָד?
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection One recites a benediction for a virgin seven and for a widow one What, is it not even a widow who is married to a bachelor, No, to a widower However, to a bachelor, what seven If so, let teach One recites a benediction for a virgin seven and for a widow a bachelor seven and for a widow one day.
llm_translation: The question was raised: We bless a virgin for seven days and a widow for one day. What is the reason? Is it not even for a widow who marries a young man? No, it is for a widow who marries an older man. But for a young man, what is the reason for seven days? If so, let it be taught: We bless a virgin for seven days, and a widow who marries a young man for seven days, and a widow for one day.

hebrew_text: מִילְּתָא פְּסִיקְתָּא קָתָנֵי, דְּלֵיכָּא בְּתוּלָה דְּבָצְרָה מִשִּׁבְעָה, וְלֵיכָּא אַלְמָנָה דְּבָצְרָה מִיּוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: he taught categorical matters. as there is no virgin whom fewer than seven and there is no widow whom less than one day.
llm_translation: The matter is concluded, for there is no virgin in Bezerah from seven, and there is no widow in Bezerah from one day.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אָמַר לִי הוּנָא בַּר נָתָן, תָּנָא: מִנַּיִן לְבִרְכַּת חֲתָנִים בַּעֲשָׂרָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקַּח עֲשָׂרָה אֲנָשִׁים מִזִּקְנֵי הָעִיר וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁבוּ פֹה״. וְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״בְּמַקְהֵלוֹת בָּרְכוּ אֱלֹהִים ה׳ מִמְּקוֹר יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: the itself. Rav Naḥman said: Huna bar Natan said to me taught: From where that the benediction of the grooms in ten as it is stated: “And he took ten men of the Elders of the city and said: Sit you here, And Rabbi Abbahu said from here: “In assemblies [ mak’helot ], bless God, the Lord, from the source of Israel”
llm_translation: The body, Rav Nachman said: Huna son of Nathan said to me, a Tanna: From where do we derive the blessing for the groom with ten? - As it is stated: "And he took ten men of the elders of the city and said, 'Sit here.'" And Rabbi Abbahu said, from here: "In congregations bless God, the Lord, from the source of Israel."

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן, בְּהַאי קְרָא דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ מַאי דָּרֵישׁ בֵּיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ עוּבָּרִים שֶׁבִּמְעֵי אִמָּן אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה עַל הַיָּם — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּמַקְהֵלוֹת בָּרְכוּ אֱלֹהִים ה׳ מִמְּקוֹר יִשְׂרָאֵל״. וְאִידַּךְ? אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא ״מִבֶּטֶן״. מַאי ״מִמְּקוֹר״ — עַל עִסְקֵי מְקוֹר.
human_translation: And what does Rav Naḥman derive from this verse which Rabbi Abbahu He requires to that which is taught Rabbi Meir would say: From where that even fetuses in their mother’s womb recited song at the Sea? as it is stated “In assemblies, bless God, the Lord, from the source of Israel.” And the other If that let the verse say: From the belly of Israel. What is “source”? to matters the source
llm_translation: Rav Nachman, in this verse of Rabbi Avahu, what does he expound in it? He should learn it as it was taught, Rabbi Meir used to say: From where do we derive that even fetuses in their mother's wombs sang a song at the sea? As it is stated: "In congregations bless God, the Lord, from the source of Israel." And the other opinion? If so, let the verse say "from the womb." What is "from the source" - concerning the events at the source.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, בְּהַאי קְרָא דְּרַב נַחְמָן מַאי דָּרֵישׁ בֵּיהּ? הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְמִידְרַשׁ: עַמּוֹנִי וְלֹא עַמּוֹנִית, מוֹאָבִי וְלֹא מוֹאָבִית. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ לִבְרָכָה, לָא סַגִּיא דְּלָאו זְקֵנִים.
human_translation: And what does Rabbi Abbahu derive from this verse which Rav Naḥman He requires to teach Ammonite and not a female Ammonite, Moabite and not a female Moabite, as, if it would enter your mind to a benediction, not sufficient were not Elders?
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu, in this verse of Rav Nachman, what does he expound in it? That one should expound it in a Midrash: "Ammonite and not Ammonitess, Moabite and not Moabitess." For if it were to enter your mind to bless, it is not significant that they are not elders.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: אִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ לְמִידְרַשׁ, לָא סַגִּיא דְּלָאו עֲשָׂרָה! אִין — לְפַרְסוֹמֵי מִילְּתָא, וּכְדַאֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב חָנָא בַּגְדָּתָאָה: פּוֹק וְאַיְיתִי לִי בֵּי עַשְׂרָה, וְאֵימָא לָךְ בְּאַנְפַּיְיהוּ: הַמְזַכֶּה לְעוּבָּר קָנָה. וְהִלְכְתָא — הַמְזַכֶּה לְעוּבָּר לֹא קָנָה.
human_translation: And the other If it would enter your mind in order to teach not sufficient were not ten? Yes, to publicize the matter, as Shmuel said to Rav Ḥana of Baghdad: Go and bring me an assembly of ten and I will say to you before them one who transfers ownership to a fetus, acquires And the halakha one who transfers ownership to a fetus, does not acquire
llm_translation: And the other opinion: If your intention is for Midrash, it is not necessary to have ten! No — for the publicity of the matter, as Shmuel said to Rav Ḥana in the garden: Go and bring me ten, and I will say to you with anger: One who benefits for a fetus acquires. And the halakha is: One who benefits for a fetus does not acquire.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מְבָרְכִין בִּרְכַּת חֲתָנִים בְּבֵית חֲתָנִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף בְּבֵית הָאֵרוּסִין מְבָרְכִין אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught One recites the benediction of the grooms in the house of the grooms, Rabbi Yehuda said: One recites it even in the house of the betrothal,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One recites the blessing of the groom in the house of the groom. Rabbi Yehuda says: One also recites it in the house of the betrothed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וּבִיהוּדָה שָׁנוּ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמִּתְיַיחֵד עִמָּהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: And taught in Judea because that be secluded with
llm_translation: Abaye said: And in Judea they taught, because he secluded himself with her.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: מְבָרְכִין בִּרְכַּת חֲתָנִים בְּבֵית חֲתָנִים, וּבִרְכַּת אֵרוּסִין בְּבֵית הָאֵרוּסִין. בִּרְכַּת הָאֵרוּסִין מַאי מְבָרֵךְ? רָבִין בַּר רַב אַדָּא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב אַדָּא, תַּרְוַיְיהוּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמְרִי: ״בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ מֶלֶךְ הָעוֹלָם, אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו, וְצִוָּנוּ עַל הָעֲרָיוֹת, וְאָסַר לָנוּ אֶת הָאֲרוּסוֹת, וְהִתִּיר לָנוּ אֶת הַנְּשׂוּאוֹת עַל יְדֵי חוּפָּה וְקִדּוּשִׁין״. רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא מְסַיֵּים בַּהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: ״בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳, מְקַדֵּשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל יְדֵי חוּפָּה וְקִדּוּשִׁין״.
human_translation: It is taught another One recites the benediction of the grooms in the house of the grooms, and the benediction of the betrothal in the house of the betrothal. the benediction of the betrothal, what does one recite? Ravin bar Rav Adda and Rabba bar Rav Adda both said in the name of Rav Yehuda: Blessed are You, Lord our God, King of the universe, Who sanctified us through His mitzvot, and commanded us concerning the forbidden relatives, and prohibited to us those women who are betrothed, and permitted to us who are married by means of the wedding canopy and betrothal. Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, concludes in the name of Rav Yehuda: Blessed are You, Lord, Who sanctifies Israel by means of the wedding canopy and betrothal.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Another opinion teaches: One recites the blessing of the groom in the house of the groom, and the blessing of the bride in the house of the bride. What does one recite for the blessing of the bride? Ravin bar Rav Adda and Rabba bar Rav Adda, both of them from the name of Rav Yehudah, say: "Blessed are You, Hashem our God, King of the universe, who has sanctified us with His commandments, and commanded us concerning forbidden relationships, and prohibited for us betrothals, and permitted for us marriages through the canopy and sanctification." Rav Acha, son of Rava, concludes with it in the name of Rav Yehudah: "Blessed are You, Hashem, who sanctifies Israel through the canopy and sanctification."

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּלָא חָתֵים, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַבִּרְכַּת פֵּרוֹת וְאַבִּרְכַּת מִצְוֹת. וּמַאן דְּחָתֵים, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַקִּידּוּשָׁא.
human_translation: One who does not conclude just as is in the blessing fruits and the blessing mitzvot, And one who concludes just as is of kiddush ,
llm_translation: One who does not seal, from him will come a blessing of fruits and a blessing of commandments. And one who seals, from him will come a curse.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מְבָרְכִין בִּרְכַּת חֲתָנִים בַּעֲשָׂרָה כׇּל שִׁבְעָה. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: וְהוּא שֶׁבָּאוּ פָּנִים חֲדָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One recites the benediction of the grooms in ten all seven Rav Yehuda said: And that is when new faces came
llm_translation: The sages taught: One recites the blessing for the groom with a quorum of ten, all seven days. Rav Yehudah said: And this is when they have new faces.

hebrew_text: מַאי מְבָרֵךְ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: ״בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ מֶלֶךְ הָעוֹלָם,
human_translation: What blessings does one recite? Rav Yehuda said Blessed are You, Lord our God, King of the universe,
llm_translation: What does one bless? Rav Yehudah said: "Blessed are You, Hashem our God, King of the universe,

hebrew_text: שֶׁהַכֹּל בָּרָא לִכְבוֹדוֹ״.
human_translation: Who has created all for His glory.
llm_translation: "That everything created for His glory."

hebrew_text: וְ״יוֹצֵר הָאָדָם״.
human_translation: And Creator of mankind.
llm_translation: "And 'Yotzer Ha'adam'."

hebrew_text: וַ״אֲשֶׁר יָצַר אֶת הָאָדָם בְּצַלְמוֹ, בְּצֶלֶם דְּמוּת תַּבְנִיתוֹ, וְהִתְקִין לוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ בִּנְיַן עֲדֵי עַד. בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳, יוֹצֵר הָאָדָם״.
human_translation: And Who made humanity in His image, in the image of the likeness of His form, and out of His very self formed a building for eternity. Blessed are You, Lord, Creator of mankind.
llm_translation: "And 'who formed man in His image, in the image of His likeness,' and established for him from Himself a building for eternity. Blessed are You, Hashem, Creator of man."

hebrew_text: ״שׂוֹשׂ תָּשִׂישׂ וְתָגֵל הָעֲקָרָה, בְּקִבּוּץ בָּנֶיהָ לְתוֹכָהּ בְּשִׂמְחָה. בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳, מְשַׂמֵּחַ צִיּוֹן בְּבָנֶיהָ״.
human_translation: May the barren greatly rejoice and delight with the ingathering of her children within her in joy. Blessed are You, Lord, Who gladdens Zion through her children.
llm_translation: "Rejoice greatly, O barren one, who did not bear; break forth into singing and cry aloud, you who have not been in labor! For the children of the desolate one will be more than the children of her who is married," says the Lord. "Blessed are You, O Lord, who rejoices Zion with her children."

hebrew_text: ״שַׂמֵּחַ תְּשַׂמַּח רֵיעִים הָאֲהוּבִים, כְּשַׂמֵּחֲךָ יְצִירְךָ בְּגַן עֵדֶן מִקֶּדֶם, בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳, מְשַׂמֵּחַ חָתָן וְכַלָּה״.
human_translation: Bring great joy to these loving friends, as You gave joy to Your creations in Eden in ancient times. Blessed are You, Lord, Who brings joy to the groom and bride.
llm_translation: "Rejoice, rejoice, friends, the beloved, as You rejoiced Your creations in the Garden of Eden of old, blessed are You, Hashem, who rejoices groom and bride."

hebrew_text: ״בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳, אֱלֹהֵינוּ מֶלֶךְ הָעוֹלָם, אֲשֶׁר בָּרָא שָׂשׂוֹן וְשִׂמְחָה, חָתָן וְכַלָּה, גִּילָה, רִינָּה, דִּיצָה, חֶדְוָה, אַהֲבָה וְאַחְוָה וְשָׁלוֹם וְרֵיעוּת. מְהֵרָה ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ יִשָּׁמַע בְּעָרֵי יְהוּדָה וּבְחוּצוֹת יְרוּשָׁלַיִם קוֹל שָׂשׂוֹן וְקוֹל שִׂמְחָה, קוֹל חָתָן וְקוֹל כַּלָּה, קוֹל מִצְהֲלוֹת חֲתָנִים מֵחוּפָּתָם וּנְעָרִים מִמִּשְׁתֵּה נְגִינָתָם, בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳, מְשַׂמֵּחַ חָתָן עִם הַכַּלָּה״.
human_translation: Blessed are You, Lord our God, King of the universe, Who has created joy and gladness, groom and bride, delight, exultation, happiness, jubilation, love and brotherhood, and peace and friendship. Soon, Lord our God, may there be heard in the cities of Judea and in the streets of Jerusalem the sound of joy and the sound of gladness, the sound of the groom and the sound of the bride, the joyous sound of grooms from their wedding canopy and of young people from their feast of song Blessed are You, Lord, Who makes the groom rejoice with the bride.
llm_translation: "Blessed are You, Hashem, our God, King of the universe, who created joy and happiness, bridegroom and bride, rejoicing, song, delight, pleasure, love, brotherhood, peace, and companionship. May Hashem, our God, soon be heard in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, the voice of joy and the voice of happiness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the voice of the joyous shouts of bridegrooms from their canopies and of youths from their feasts with their musical instruments. Blessed are You, Hashem, who brings joy to the bridegroom with the bride."

hebrew_text: לֵוִי אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רַבִּי בְּהִלּוּלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרֵיהּ, בָּרֵיךְ חֲמֵשׁ. רַב אַסִּי אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רַב אָשֵׁי בְּהִלּוּלֵיהּ דְּמָר בְּרֵיהּ, בָּרֵיךְ שֵׁית.
human_translation: Levi happened to the house of Rabbi during the wedding celebration of Rabbi Shimon, his son, and recited five blessings. Rav Asi happened to the house of Rav Ashi during the wedding celebration of Mar, his son, and recited six blessings.
llm_translation: Levi entered the house of Rabbi during the celebration of Rabbi Shimon, his son, and he blessed with five. Rav Asi entered the house of Rav Ashi during the celebration of Mar, his son, and he blessed with six.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמָר סָבַר חֲדָא יְצִירָה הֲוַאי, וּמָר סָבַר שְׁתֵּי יְצִירוֹת הֲוַאי.
human_translation: Let us say that they disagree about this: Sage holds: It was one creation And Sage holds: It was two creation
llm_translation: Let us say in this case where they disagree: One Master holds it is one formation, and the other Master holds it is two formations.

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא חֲדָא יְצִירָה הֲוַאי. מָר סָבַר בָּתַר מַחְשָׁבָה אָזְלִינַן, וּמָר סָבַר בָּתַר מַעֲשֶׂה אָזְלִינַן. כִּי הָא דְּרַב יְהוּדָה רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״וַיִּבְרָא אֱלֹהִים אֶת הָאָדָם בְּצַלְמוֹ״, וּכְתִיב: ״זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה בְּרָאָם״, הָא כֵּיצַד? בַּתְּחִלָּה עָלָה בְּמַחְשָׁבָה לִבְראוֹת שְׁנַיִם, וּלְבַסּוֹף נִבְרָא אֶחָד.
human_translation: No, everyone agrees it was one act of creation. Sage holds: according to thought we proceed. And Sage holds: according to action we proceed. like the following. Rav Yehuda raises a contradiction. it is written: “And God created man in His own image” and it is written: “Male and female He created them” How this Initially, the thought entered to create two, but ultimately only one was created.
llm_translation: Not, all of the world one creation is. Master thinks after thought we go, and master thinks after action we go. Like this that Rav Yehuda raises, it is written: "And God created man in His image," and it is written: "Male and female He created them." How so? Initially, it arose in thought to create two, and in the end, one was created.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רַב כָּהֲנָא. יוֹמָא קַמָּא בָּרֵיךְ כּוּלְּהוּ, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ אִי אִיכָּא פָּנִים חֲדָשׁוֹת — בָּרֵיךְ כּוּלְּהוּ, וְאִי לָא — אַפּוֹשֵׁי שִׂמְחָה בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, מְבָרֵךְ ״שֶׁהַשִּׂמְחָה בִּמְעוֹנוֹ״ וַ״אֲשֶׁר בָּרָא״.
human_translation: Rav Ashi happened to the house of Rav Kahana The first day he recited all blessings. From that forward, if there were new faces he recited all the blessings, and if not, It is merely an extension of the celebration, and he would recite the blessing: In Whose dwelling is joy, and Who has created.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei arrived at the house of Rav Kahana. On the first day, he blessed them all. From then on, if there were new faces - he blessed them all. And if not - it is a sign of joy in the world, he blesses "who places joy in His abode" and "who created."

hebrew_text: מִשִּׁבְעָה וְעַד שְׁלֹשִׁים, בֵּין אָמַר לְהוּ מֵחֲמַת הִלּוּלָא, וּבֵין לָא אָמַר לְהוּ מֵחֲמַת הִלּוּלָא — מְבָרֵךְ ״שֶׁהַשִּׂמְחָה בִּמְעוֹנוֹ״. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, אִי אָמַר לְהוּ מֵחֲמַת הִלּוּלָא — מְבָרֵךְ ״שֶׁהַשִּׂמְחָה בִּמְעוֹנוֹ״, וְאִי לָא — לָא.
human_translation: From seven until thirtieth whether said due to the wedding celebration or whether he did not say to them due to the wedding celebration, he recites the blessing: In Whose dwelling is joy. From this forward, if he said to them due to the wedding celebration [ hillula ], he recites the blessing: In Whose dwelling is joy, and if not, he doesn’t.
llm_translation: From seven until thirty, whether he said it due to the festival or not due to the festival - he blesses "Who has joy in His abode." From here and onwards, if he said it due to the festival - he blesses "Who has joy in His abode," and if not - not.

hebrew_text: וְכִי אָמַר לְהוּ מֵחֲמַת הִלּוּלָא, עַד אֵימַת? אָמַר רַב פַּפִּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: עַד תְּרֵיסַר יַרְחֵי שַׁתָּא. וּמֵעִיקָּרָא מֵאֵימַת? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מִכִּי רְמוּ שְׂעָרֵי בַּאֲסִינְתָּא. אִינִי? וְהָא רַב פָּפָּא אִיעֲסַק לְאַבָּא מָר בְּרֵיהּ, וּבָרֵיךְ מִשְּׁעַת אֵירוּסִין! שָׁאנֵי רַב פָּפָּא, דַּהֲוָה טְרִיחַ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And when said to them due to the wedding celebration, until when Rav Pappi said in the name of Rava: Until twelve months of the year And initially, from when Rav Pappa said: From when they cast barley into the mortar Is that so? But didn’t Rav Pappa involve for his son, Abba Mar, and reciting the blessing from the time of betrothal? Rav Pappa is different, because prepared for him,
llm_translation: And if he said to them, "Because of the hilulah, until when?" Rav Pappi said in the name of Rava: Until thirteen months. And from the outset, from when? Rav Papa said: From when the hairs are plucked out of the horse's tail. Is it not so? But Rav Papa was engaged to Abba Mar's daughter, and he blessed him from the time of the betrothal! The case of Rav Papa is different, as he was troubled by it.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אִיעֲסַק לֵיהּ לִבְרֵיהּ בֵּי רַב חֲבִיבָא, וּבָרֵיךְ מִשְּׁעַת אֵירוּסִין. אָמַר: קִים לִי בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ דְּלָא הָדְרִי בְּהוּ. לָא אִסְתַּיַּיע מִילְּתָא וְהָדְרִי בְּהוּ. רַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר מַעְרְבָא אִיקְּלַע לְבָבֶל, בָּרֵיךְ שֵׁית אֲרִיכָתָא. וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Ravina arranged for his son the house of Rav Ḥaviva and recited the blessing from the time of betrothal. He said: I am certain with regard to them, that they will not retract the matter was not to be, and they retracted Rav Taḥlifa, from the West, happened to Babylonia, and recited six long blessings. And the halakha is not in accordance with his
llm_translation: Ravinah was engaged to his son, the household of Rav Ḥaviva, and he blessed them from the time of the betrothal. He said: May it be established for me in their midst that I not return from them. The matter did not succeed, and he returned from them. Rav Taḥlifa, son of Ma'arva, arrived in Babylonia, and he blessed with a lengthy life. And there is no halakha like his.

hebrew_text: רַב חֲבִיבָא אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי מָהוֹלָא, בָּרֵיךְ ״שֶׁהַשִּׂמְחָה בִּמְעוֹנוֹ״. וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ — מִשּׁוּם דִּטְרִידִי דְּאִית לֵיהּ צַעֲרָא לְיָנוֹקָא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥaviva happened to the house a circumcision recited the blessing: In Whose dwelling is joy. And the halakha is not in accordance with his Since are anxious, as the baby is pain,
llm_translation: Rav Chaviva entered the house of Maholai, he blessed "that joy is in his dwelling." And the halacha is not like his words - because he troubled the baby with pain.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: חֲתָנִים מִן הַמִּנְיָן, וְאֵין אֲבֵלִים מִן הַמִּנְיָן. מֵיתִיבִי: חֲתָנִים וַאֲבֵלִים מִן הַמִּנְיָן! מַתְנִיתָא קָא רָמֵית עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַב? רַב תַּנָּא הוּא, וּפְלִיג. אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חֲתָנִים מִן הַמִּנְיָן, וְאֵין אֲבֵלִים מִן הַמִּנְיָן. מֵיתִיבִי: חֲתָנִים וַאֲבֵלִים מִן הַמִּנְיָן!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Rav said: grooms are included in the tally. And mourners are not included in the tally raises an objection Grooms and mourners are included in the tally. Are you raising a contradiction from a baraita against Rav? Rav himself tanna and disagree It was stated: Rabbi Yitzḥak said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Grooms are included in the tally, but mourners are not included in the tally. The Gemara raises an objection Grooms and mourners are included in the tally.
llm_translation: Rav Nahman said in the name of Rav: Grooms are included in the count, but mourners are not included in the count. It was raised as an objection: Grooms and mourners are included in the count! You have raised a contradiction against Rav? He is a Tanna, and he disputes. It was stated, Rabbi Yitzchak said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Grooms are included in the count, but mourners are not included in the count. It was raised as an objection: Grooms and mourners are included in the count!

hebrew_text: כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא — בְּבִרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן, כִּי קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן — בְּשׁוּרָה.
human_translation: When that is taught, with regard to Grace after Meals, when Rabbi Yoḥanan says with regard to a line
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita — in the Grace after Meals, as Rabbi Yochanan said — in a clear manner.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מְבָרְכִים בִּרְכַּת חֲתָנִים בַּעֲשָׂרָה, וַחֲתָנִים מִן הַמִּנְיָן. וּבִרְכַּת אֲבֵלִים בַּעֲשָׂרָה, וְאֵין אֲבֵלִים מִן הַמִּנְיָן. בְּרָכָה בְּשׁוּרָה מִי אִיכָּא? אֶלָּא כִּי קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בִּרְחָבָה.
human_translation: And However, that which Rabbi Yitzḥak said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One recites the blessing of the grooms in ten, and the grooms are included in the tally, and one recites the blessing of the mourners in ten, and the mourners are not included in the tally. Is there a blessing in the line Rather, when Rabbi Yoḥanan said with regard to in the square
llm_translation: And rather this that said Rabbi Yitzchak said Rabbi Yochanan: Blessing of groomsmen with ten, and groomsmen are not included in the count. And blessing of mourners with ten, and mourners are not included in the count. Is there a blessing in a straight line? Rather, when Rabbi Yochanan said in a broad manner.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מְבָרְכִין בִּרְכַּת חֲתָנִים בַּעֲשָׂרָה כׇּל שִׁבְעָה, וַחֲתָנִים מִן הַמִּנְיָן. וּבִרְכַּת אֲבֵלִים בַּעֲשָׂרָה כׇּל שִׁבְעָה, וְאֵין אֲבֵלִים מִן הַמִּנְיָן. בִּרְכַּת רְחָבָה כׇּל שִׁבְעָה מִי אִיכָּא? מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּפָנִים חֲדָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: However, that which Rabbi Yitzḥak said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One recites the blessing of the grooms in ten all seven and the grooms are included in the tally; and one recites the blessing of the mourners all seven in ten, and the mourners are not included in the tally, is there a blessing in the square all seven You find in new faces
llm_translation: And rather this that said Rabbi Yitzchak said Rabbi Yochanan: Blessing of groomsmen in ten all seven, and groomsmen from the count. And blessing of mourners in ten all seven, and mourners not from the count. Blessing of a wide space in ten who is there? You find it in new faces.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּרַב חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא מַקְרֵי בְּנֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ הֲוָה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ מַתְנִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ הֲוָה. שְׁכֵיב לֵיהּ יָנוֹקָא. יוֹמָא קַמָּא לָא אֲזַל לְגַבֵּיהּ. לִמְחַר דַּבְרֵיהּ לִיהוּדָה בַּר נַחְמָנִי מְתוּרְגְּמָנֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קוּם אֵימָא מִלְּתָא כׇּל קֳבֵיל יָנוֹקָא. פְּתַח וַאֲמַר: ״וַיַּרְא ה׳ וַיִּנְאָץ מִכַּעַס בָּנָיו וּבְנוֹתָיו״, דּוֹר שֶׁאָבוֹת מְנָאֲצִים לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא — כּוֹעֵס עַל בְּנֵיהֶם וְעַל בְּנוֹתֵיהֶם, וּמֵתִים כְּשֶׁהֵם קְטַנִּים.
human_translation: similar that involving Rav Ḥiyya bar Abba, who was the Bible teacher of the sons of Reish Lakish, and some say the Mishna teacher of the son of Reish Lakish. His child died. On the first day, did not go to him. The next day, he took Yehuda bar Naḥmani, his disseminator, said to Stand and say a matter with regard to the child. He began and said: “And the Lord saw it and He abhorred them, due to the provocation of His sons and His daughters” A generation in which the fathers abhor the Holy One, Blessed be He, He is angered at their sons and their daughters, and they die when they are small.
llm_translation: The matter of Rav Chiya bar Abba, his sons were calling Reish Lakish, and they said to him, his son Reish Lakish was. He lay a child. One day, he did not go to him. The next day, his words to Yehuda bar Nachmani, his interpreter. He said to him: Get up, I will say a word to every child. He opened and said: "And Hashem saw and was disgusted with the anger of His sons and daughters," a generation that their fathers despise the Holy One, blessed be He - He is angry with their sons and daughters, and they die when they are young.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי בָּחוּר הֲוָה. וְהָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״עַל כֵּן עַל בַּחוּרָיו לֹא יִשְׂמַח ה׳ וְאֶת יְתוֹמָיו וְאֶת אַלְמְנוֹתָיו לֹא יְרַחֵם כִּי כֻלּוֹ חָנֵף וּמֵרַע וְכׇל פֶּה דֹּבֵר נְבָלָה בְּכׇל זֹאת לֹא שָׁב אַפּוֹ וְעוֹד יָדוֹ נְטוּיָה״. מַאי ״וְעוֹד יָדוֹ נְטוּיָה״? אָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר רַב: הַכֹּל יוֹדְעִין כַּלָּה לָמָּה נִכְנְסָה לַחוּפָּה. אֶלָּא, כׇּל הַמְנַבֵּל פִּיו, וּמוֹצִיא דְּבַר נְבָלָה מִפִּיו, אֲפִלּוּ נֶחְתַּם לוֹ גְּזַר דִּינוֹ שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה לְטוֹבָה — נֶהְפָּךְ עָלָיו לְרָעָה.
human_translation: And there are say was a youth, and this is what said to him: “Therefore the Lord shall have no joy in their young men, nor shall He have compassion on their orphans and widows, for everyone is a flatterer and an evildoer, and every mouth speaks obscenity. For all this His anger is not turned away, and His hand is still outstretched” What “And His hand is still outstretched”? Rav Ḥanan bar Rav said: Everyone knows why a bride enters the wedding canopy. However, anyone who profanes his mouth and issues a matter of profanity from his mouth, even if a positive decree of seventy years was sealed for him, it is transformed for him into an evil
llm_translation: There is one who says he was a young man. And thus he said to him: "Therefore the Lord will not rejoice over his young men, and will have no compassion on his fatherless and widows, for all of them are impious and evil, and every mouth speaks folly. Yet His anger is not turned away, and His hand is still outstretched." What is "and His hand is still outstretched"? Rav Hanan son of Rav said: Everyone knows why the bride entered the wedding canopy. Rather, anyone who makes his mouth disgusting, and utters foolish speech from his mouth, even if a decree of seventy years of goodness has been sealed for him, it will be turned to evil upon him.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְנַחוֹמֵי — צַעוֹרֵי קָמְצַעַר לֵיהּ! הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: חֲשִׁיב אַתְּ לְאִתְּפוֹסֵי אַדָּרָא.
human_translation: He came to comfort and he upset him this is what he is saying to him: You are significant to be seized, for the generation,
llm_translation: He came to Nachum - the Tsorei was causing him distress! Thus he said to him: "You are considered to be the capturer of glory."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קוּם אֵימָא מִלְּתָא כְּנֶגֶד שְׁבָחוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא. פָּתַח וְאָמַר: ״הָאֵל הַגָּדוֹל בְּרוֹב גׇּדְלוֹ, אַדִּיר וְחָזָק בְּרוֹב נוֹרָאוֹת, מְחַיֵּה מֵתִים בְּמַאֲמָרוֹ, עוֹשֶׂה גְדוֹלוֹת עַד אֵין חֵקֶר וְנִפְלָאוֹת עַד אֵין מִסְפָּר. בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ מְחַיֵּה הַמֵּתִים״.
human_translation: said to his Stand and say a statement with regard to the praiseworthiness of the Holy One, Blessed be He. He began and said: God, Who is great in the abundance of His greatness, mighty and strong in the abundance of His awesome Who revives the dead in His statement, Who does great deeds beyond comprehension, wondrous deeds without number. Blessed are You, Lord, Who revives the dead.
llm_translation: He said to him: Arise, I will say a word corresponding to the praise of the Holy One, blessed be He. He began and said: "The great God, mighty in His greatness, awesome and strong in His many wonders, who revives the dead with His word, who performs great deeds beyond comprehension and wonders beyond count. Blessed are You, Lord, who revives the dead."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קוּם אֵימָא מִלְּתָא כְּנֶגֶד אֲבֵלִים, פָּתַח וְאָמַר: ״אַחֵינוּ הַמְיוּגָּעִים, הַמְדוּכָּאִין בָּאֵבֶל הַזֶּה, תְּנוּ לְבַבְכֶם לַחְקוֹר אֶת זֹאת. זֹאת הִיא עוֹמֶדֶת לָעַד, נָתִיב הוּא מִשֵּׁשֶׁת יְמֵי בְרֵאשִׁית. רַבִּים שָׁתוּ, רַבִּים יִשְׁתּוּ. כְּמִשְׁתֵּה רִאשׁוֹנִים כָּךְ מִשְׁתֵּה אַחֲרוֹנִים. אַחֵינוּ, בַּעַל נֶחָמוֹת יְנַחֵם אֶתְכֶם. בָּרוּךְ מְנַחֵם אֲבֵלִים״.
human_translation: said to him: Stand and say a statement with regard to the mourners. He began and said: Our brothers, who are exhausted, who are overwhelmed by this mourning, set your heart to examine this: This is what stands forever. It is a path from the six days of Creation, Many have drunk and many will drink. As drink of the first so too drink of the last Our brothers, may the Master of solace comfort you. Blessed Who comforts the mourners.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Arise, I will say a word corresponding to mourners." He began and said: "Our brothers, the afflicted, the crushed in this mourning, let your hearts investigate this. This is standing forever, the path is from the six days of creation. Many have drunk, many will drink. Just as the feast of the first ones, so is the feast of the latter ones. Our brothers, the Comforter of mourners will comfort you. Blessed is the Comforter of mourners."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״רַבִּים שָׁתוּ״ — לֵימָא. ״רַבִּים יִשְׁתּוּ״ — לָא לֵימָא. ״מִשְׁתֵּה רִאשׁוֹנִים״ — לֵימָא. ״מִשְׁתֵּה אַחֲרוֹנִים״ — לָא לֵימָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, וְכֵן תָּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לְעוֹלָם אַל יִפְתַּח אָדָם פִּיו לַשָּׂטָן. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, מַאי קְרָא: ״כִּסְדוֹם הָיִינוּ לַעֲמוֹרָה דָּמִינוּ״. מַאי אַהְדַּר לֵיהּ — ״שִׁמְעוּ דְבַר ה׳ קְצִינֵי סְדוֹם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Abaye said Let him say: Many have drunk; let him not say: Many will drink. Let him say: The drink of the first; let him not say: The drink of the last. as Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, and likewise it was taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: A person should never open his mouth to Satan Rav Yosef said: What is the verse “We should have almost been as Sodom, we should have been like unto Gomorrah” what did reply to them? “Hear the word of the Lord, rulers of Sodom;
llm_translation: Abaye said: "Many drank" — let us say, "Many should drink." "The feast of the first ones" — let us say. "The feast of the last ones" — do not say. For Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, and similarly a Tanna taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: A person should never open his mouth to the Satan. Rav Yosef said, what is the verse: "We were like Sodom to Amorah." How is it interpreted? "Hear the word of the Lord, rulers of Sodom, etc."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קוּם אֵימָא מִלְּתָא כְּנֶגֶד מְנַחֲמֵי אֲבֵלִים. פָּתַח וְאָמַר: ״אַחֵינוּ גּוֹמְלֵי חֲסָדִים בְּנֵי גּוֹמְלֵי חֲסָדִים, הַמַּחְזִיקִים בִּבְרִיתוֹ שֶׁל אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ (שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ׳כִּי יְדַעְתִּיו לְמַעַן אֲשֶׁר יְצַוֶּה אֶת בָּנָיו וְגוֹ׳׳). אַחֵינוּ, בַּעַל הַגְּמוּל יְשַׁלֵּם לָכֶם גְּמוּלְכֶם. בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה, מְשַׁלֵּם הַגְּמוּל״.
human_translation: said to Stand and say a statement with regard to those who comfort the mourners. He began and said: Our brothers, bestowers of loving-kindness, sons of bestowers of loving-kindness, who embrace the covenant of Abraham our Patriarch, as it is stated: “For I know him, that he will command his children… Our brothers, may the Master of reward pay you your just deserts. Blessed are You, Who pays the just deserts.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Get up, I will say a word corresponding to the comforters of mourners." He began and said: "Our brothers, doers of kindness, sons of doers of kindness, who uphold the covenant of our father Abraham (as it is said: 'For I have known him, to the end that he may command his children and his household after him, that they may keep the way of the Lord, to do righteousness and justice'). Our brothers, the one who repays the act of kindness will repay you for your kindness. Blessed are You, the One who repays the act of kindness."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קוּם אֵימָא מִלְּתָא כְּנֶגֶד כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל. פָּתַח וְאָמַר: ״רִבּוֹן הָעוֹלָמִים, פְּדֵה וְהַצֵּל, מַלֵּט, הוֹשַׁע עַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הַדֶּבֶר וּמִן הַחֶרֶב וּמִן הַבִּיזָּה וּמִן הַשִּׁדָּפוֹן וּמִן הַיֵּרָקוֹן וּמִכׇּל מִינֵי פּוּרְעָנִיּוֹת הַמִּתְרַגְּשׁוֹת וּבָאוֹת לָעוֹלָם, טֶרֶם נִקְרָא וְאַתָּה תַּעֲנֶה. בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה, עוֹצֵר הַמַּגֵּפָה״.
human_translation: said to Stand and say a statement with regard to the entire Jewish people. He began and said: Master of the worlds, redeem and save, rescue and deliver Your people, Israel, from the pestilence and from the sword, and from spoil, and from the blight, and from the mildew, and from all types of afflictions that suddenly erupt and come to the world. Before we call and You will respond. Blessed are You, Who halts the plague.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Arise, say a matter before all of Israel." He began and said: "Master of the Universe, redeem and save, deliver, rescue Your people Israel from the plague, and from the sword, and from famine, and from pestilence, and from the wild beasts, and from all kinds of calamities that stir and come into the world, before it is called, and You will answer. Blessed are You, who restrains the plague."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר עוּלָּא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: עֲשָׂרָה כּוֹסוֹת תִּקְּנוּ חֲכָמִים בְּבֵית הָאֵבֶל: שְׁלֹשָׁה קוֹדֶם אֲכִילָה, כְּדֵי לִפְתּוֹחַ אֶת בְּנֵי מֵעָיו. שְׁלֹשָׁה בְּתוֹךְ אֲכִילָה, כְּדֵי לִשְׁרוֹת אֲכִילָה שֶׁבְּמֵעָיו. וְאַרְבָּעָה לְאַחַר אֲכִילָה, אֶחָד כְּנֶגֶד ״הַזָּן״, וְאֶחָד כְּנֶגֶד בִּרְכַּת הָאָרֶץ, וְאֶחָד כְּנֶגֶד ״בּוֹנֵה יְרוּשָׁלָיִם״, וְאֶחָד כְּנֶגֶד ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״.
human_translation: Ulla said, and some say that it was taught in a baraita : The Sages instituted ten cups in the house of the mourner: Three prior to meal, in order to open his intestines, three during meal, to soak the food in his intestines and four after meal, One corresponds to Who feeds one corresponds to the blessing of the land; one corresponding to the third blessing: Who builds Jerusalem; and one corresponding to Who is good and does good.
llm_translation: Ulla said, and some say it was taught in a baraita: The Sages instituted ten cups in the house of mourning: Three before the meal, in order to stimulate his intestines. Three during the meal, in order to aid the digestion of the food in his intestines. And four after the meal, one corresponding to "the Provider," one corresponding to the Grace after Meals, one corresponding to "the Builder of Jerusalem," and one corresponding to "He who is good and does good."

hebrew_text: הוֹסִיפוּ עֲלֵיהֶם אַרְבָּעָה: אֶחָד כְּנֶגֶד חַזָּנֵי הָעִיר, וְאֶחָד כְּנֶגֶד פַּרְנָסֵי הָעִיר, וְאֶחָד כְּנֶגֶד בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וְאֶחָד כְּנֶגֶד רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. הִתְחִילוּ (הָיוּ) שׁוֹתִין וּמִשְׁתַּכְּרִין, הֶחְזִירוּ הַדָּבָר לְיוֹשְׁנָהּ.
human_translation: added to those four One, noting the attendants of the city [ ḥazzanei ha’ir ], one, noting the leaders of the city, one, noting the Temple, and one, noting Rabban Gamliel. began and they would drink and become intoxicated. restored the matter to its previous
llm_translation: Add four: one opposite the synagogue officials, and one opposite the city treasurers, and one opposite the Temple, and one opposite Rabban Gamliel. They began to drink and become intoxicated, the matter returned to its former state.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל? דְּתַנְיָא: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיְתָה הוֹצָאַת הַמֵּת קָשָׁה לִקְרוֹבָיו יוֹתֵר מִמִּיתָתוֹ, עַד שֶׁהָיוּ מַנִּיחִים אוֹתוֹ וּבוֹרְחִין. עַד שֶׁבָּא רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְנָהַג קַלּוּת בְּעַצְמוֹ, וְהוֹצִיאוּהוּ בִּכְלֵי פִשְׁתָּן. וְנָהֲגוּ כׇּל הָעָם אַחֲרָיו לְהוֹצִיא בִּכְלֵי פִשְׁתָּן. אֲמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וְהָאִידָּנָא נְהוּג עָלְמָא אֲפִילּוּ בְּצַרְדָּא בַּר זוּזָא.
human_translation: What Rabban Gamliel as it is taught Initially, the funeral for the deceased were more taxing for his relatives than his death, until would abandon the deceased and flee. until Rabbi Gamliel came and conducted himself in a self-deprecatory to take him in linen garments. And all the people conducted themselves following his to take in linen garments. Rav Pappa said: And today, everyone is accustomed even in rough cloth [ tzerada ] worth one zuz .
llm_translation: What is Rabban Gamliel? For it was taught: Initially, the removal of the deceased was more difficult for his relatives than his death, until they would place him and flee. Until Rabban Gamliel came and acted with leniency himself, and they would remove him in linen garments. And the entire people followed him in removing in linen garments. Rav Papa said: And nowadays, it is customary for everyone, even in a purse of a zuz.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר:
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said:
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Elazar:

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר ״פֶּתַח פָּתוּחַ מָצָאתִי״ — נֶאֱמָן לְאוֹסְרָהּ עָלָיו.
human_translation: who says: I encountered an unobstructed orifice, is credible to render her forbidden to himself.
llm_translation: One who says, "I found an open entrance" - is believed to forbid it upon himself.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? סְפֵק סְפֵיקָא הוּא: סָפֵק תַּחְתָּיו, סָפֵק אֵין תַּחְתָּיו. וְאִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר תַּחְתָּיו: סָפֵק בְּאוֹנֶס, סָפֵק בְּרָצוֹן!
human_translation: But why is compound uncertainty. uncertain under his uncertain not under his And if you say under his uncertain by coercion, uncertain willingly,
llm_translation: And why? It is a doubt of a doubt: a doubt below it, a doubt not below it. And if you find to say below it: a doubt of compulsion, a doubt of willingness!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, בְּאֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: בְּאֵשֶׁת יִשְׂרָאֵל, וּכְגוֹן דְּקַבֵּיל בַּהּ אֲבוּהּ קִידּוּשִׁין פְּחוּתָה מִבַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: No, it is necessary in the wife of a priest, And if you wish, say even to the wife of an Israelite, and where her father accepted betrothal less than three years and one day old.
llm_translation: Not necessary, with the wife of a Kohen. And if you wish, say: with the wife of an Israelite, and for example, if he accepted betrothal with her when she is less than three years old and one day.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה ״קִדַּשְׁתִּיךְ״, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת ״לֹא קִדַּשְׁתַּנִי״ — הִיא מוּתֶּרֶת בִּקְרוֹבָיו, וְהוּא אָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: what is it teaching us? We learned a man who says to a woman: I betrothed you, and she says: You did not betroth me, she is permitted to his relatives, And prohibited him to her relatives,
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? We learned: One who says to a woman, "I have sanctified you," and she says, "You have not sanctified me" - she is permitted to his relatives, and he is forbidden to her relatives.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָתָם דְּוַדַּאי קִים לֵיהּ, אֲבָל הָכָא מֵיקָם הוּא דְּלָא קִים לֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say: There, where certainly clear to him However, here, not clear to him teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning: There, where it is certain, but here, where it is not certain, it is inferred for us.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵין הָאִשָּׁה נֶאֱסֶרֶת עַל בַּעְלָהּ אֶלָּא עַל עִסְקֵי קִינּוּי וּסְתִירָה, וּכְמַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה!
human_translation: And did Rabbi Elazar say that? But didn’t Rabbi Elazar say: A woman is forbidden to her husband only over matters of jealous warning and seclusion, and as the incident that transpired
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who said it, Rabbi Elazar the same? And did Rabbi Elazar say: A woman is not prohibited to her husband except for matters of jealousy and seclusion, and as the incident that occurred!

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה, בְּקִינּוּי וּסְתִירָה הֲוָה? וְעוֹד, מִי אַסְרוּהָ?
human_translation: And you understand Was the incident that transpired with jealous warning and seclusion? Furthermore, did render forbidden
llm_translation: And was there a case that occurred, in a designation and contradiction was it? And furthermore, who prohibited it?

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵין הָאִשָּׁה נֶאֱסֶרֶת עַל בַּעְלָהּ אֶלָּא עַל עִסְקֵי קִינּוּי וּסְתִירָה, מִמַּעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה, דְּלָא הֲוָה קִינּוּי וּסְתִירָה וְלָא אִיתַּסְרָא. מִכׇּל מָקוֹם קַשְׁיָא: קִינּוּי וּסְתִירָה — אִין, ״פֶּתַח פָּתוּחַ״ — לָא!
human_translation: That not difficult, this is is saying: a woman is forbidden to her husband only over matters of jealous warning and seclusion from the incident that transpired as there was no jealous warning and seclusion, she was not forbidden In any case, difficult, jealous warning and seclusion, yes, an unobstructed orifice, no,
llm_translation: The matter is not difficult, thus he said: A woman is not prohibited to her husband except for matters of suspicion and concealment, from an incident that occurred, where there was neither suspicion nor concealment and she was not prohibited. In any case, the difficulty is as follows: Suspicion and concealment - no, "an open door" - yes!

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ: קִינּוּי וּסְתִירָה — אִין, עֵדִים — לָא?!
human_translation: And to your reasoning, jealous warning and seclusion, yes, witnesses no,
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning: Kinui and Setira - no, witnesses - yes?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵין הָאִשָּׁה נֶאֱסֶרֶת עַל בַּעְלָהּ בְּעֵד אֶחָד, אֶלָּא בִּשְׁנֵי עֵדִים. וְקִינּוּי וּסְתִירָה — אֲפִילּוּ בְּעֵד אֶחָד נָמֵי. וּפֶתַח פָּתוּחַ — כִּשְׁנֵי עֵדִים דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rather, this is is saying: A woman is not rendered forbidden to her husband through one witness. Rather, only by means of two witnesses And jealous warning and seclusion, even by means of one witness as well, And an unobstructed orifice, like two witnesses,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rather, this is what he is saying: A woman is not prohibited to her husband based on one witness, but rather based on two witnesses. And regarding warning and denial - even based on one witness it is effective. And an open admission - it is equivalent to the testimony of two witnesses.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה, מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא אֲסָרוּהָ? הָתָם אוֹנֶס הֲוָה. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן:
human_translation: And if you would say the incident that transpired For what not deem her forbidden, There it was rape, And if you wish, say as that which Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said:
llm_translation: And if you say it was a case that occurred, why was it not prohibited? There, it was due to coercion. And if you wish, say: as Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan:

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַיּוֹצֵא לְמִלְחֶמֶת בֵּית דָּוִד, גֵּט כְּרִיתוּת כּוֹתֵב לְאִשְׁתּוֹ. דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת אַחֶיךָ תִּפְקֹד לְשָׁלוֹם וְאֶת עֲרֻבָּתָם תִּקָּח״, מַאי ״וְאֶת עֲרֻבָּתָם תִּקָּח״? תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: דְּבָרִים הַמְעוֹרָבִין בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ.
human_translation: Anyone who goes to a war house of David writes a bill of divorce to his wife. as it is written: “And to your brothers bring greetings and take their pledge [ arubatam ]” What is And take arubatam ? Rav Yosef taught: matters that are shared [ hame’oravin ] between and
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Anyone who goes out to war in the army of the house of David writes a bill of divorce for his wife. As it is written: "And you shall appoint over you judges and officers in all your gates." What is meant by "and you shall take their pledge"? Rav Yosef taught: Matters that are mixed between him and her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: בְּתוּלָה נִשֵּׂאת לַיּוֹם הָרְבִיעִי. לְיוֹם רְבִיעִי — אִין, לְיוֹם חֲמִישִׁי — לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם אִיקָּרוֹרֵי דַעְתָּא.
human_translation: Abaye said: We, too, learn A virgin is married on Wednesday. On Wednesday, yes, on Thursday, no, What is the reason due to that his resolve will cool
llm_translation: Abaye said, "We also learned: A virgin is married on the fourth day. On the fourth day - yes, on the fifth day - no. What is the reason? Because of the clarity of mind."

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאי? אִי לְמִיתַּב לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה, נִיתֵּיב לַהּ! אֶלָּא לְאוֹסְרָהּ עָלָיו, וּדְקָא טָעֵין טַעֲנָה.
human_translation: And for what If to giving her marriage contract, let him give to her Rather, it is to rendering her forbidden to him, and where he makes a claim.
llm_translation: And for what purpose? If it is to sit her down and have a written document, let him present it to her! Rather, it is to prohibit her upon him, and he is mistaken in his claim.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, דְּקָטָעֵין טַעֲנַת ״פֶּתַח פָּתוּחַ״! לָא, דְּקָטָעֵין טַעֲנַת דָּמִים.
human_translation: What, is it not where he makes the claim: an unobstructed orifice, No, where he makes the claim blood,
llm_translation: What is the reason that we do not cut the claim of "an open door"? Not because we cut the claim of "an open door," but because we cut the claim of blood.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָאוֹמֵר ״פֶּתַח פָּתוּחַ מָצָאתִי״, נֶאֱמָן לְהַפְסִידָהּ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: הָאוֹכֵל אֵצֶל חָמִיו בִּיהוּדָה שֶׁלֹּא בְּעֵדִים — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִטְעוֹן טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמִּתְיַיחֵד עִמָּהּ. בִּיהוּדָה הוּא דְּלָא מָצֵי טָעֵין, הָא בַּגָּלִיל מָצֵי טָעֵין.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said who says: I encountered an unobstructed orifice, is deemed credible to causing her to lose her marriage contract. Rav Yosef said: What is he teaching us? We learned who eats at his father-in-law in Judea without witnesses cannot make a claim about virginity because that he secluded himself with her in Judea that he cannot claim but in the Galilee, he can claim
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One who says, "I found an open door," is believed regarding its loss as its inscription. Rav Yosef said: What does he teach us? We learned: One who eats at his friend's in Judea without witnesses cannot claim a virginity plea, because he is familiar with her. In Judea where they do not find fine flour, in the Galilee they find fine flour.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאי, אִי לְאוֹסְרָהּ עָלָיו, בִּיהוּדָה אַמַּאי לָא? אֶלָּא לָאו, לְהַפְסִידָהּ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, וּדְקָא טָעֵין טַעֲנָה. מַאי לָאו, דְּקָא טָעֵין טַעֲנַת ״פֶּתַח פָּתוּחַ״! לָא, דְּקָא טָעֵין טַעֲנַת דָּמִים.
human_translation: And for what If it is to render her forbidden to him, in Judea why not Rather, is it not to cause her to lose her marriage contract where he makes a claim? what, is it not where he makes the claim: an unobstructed orifice, No, where he makes the claim blood.
llm_translation: And for what purpose? If it is not to forbid it upon him, in Judea, why not? Rather, no, to nullify its writing, and he is making a claim. What is the reason why not, that he is making a claim of "an open door"! No, that he is making a claim of blood.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: חֲכָמִים תִּקְּנוּ לָהֶם לִבְנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל, לִבְתוּלָה מָאתַיִם, וּלְאַלְמָנָה מָנֶה. וְהֵם הֶאֱמִינוּהוּ, שֶׁאִם אָמַר ״פֶּתַח פָּתוּחַ מָצָאתִי״ — נֶאֱמָן. אִם כֵּן — מָה הוֹעִילוּ חֲכָמִים בְּתַקָּנָתָם?
human_translation: It was stated: Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar: The Sages instituted for Jewish women: For a virgin two hundred and for a widow one hundred dinars. deemed credible that if says I encountered an unobstructed orifice he is deemed credible, If so, what did the Sages accomplish in their ordinance
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar: The Sages instituted for the daughters of Israel, for a virgin - two hundred, and for a widow - one hundred. And they believed him, that if he said, "I found the door open," he is believed. If so, what benefit did the Sages derive from their institution?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: חֲזָקָה, אֵין אָדָם טוֹרֵחַ בַּסְּעוּדָה וּמַפְסִידָהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: presumption a person does not exert feast and cause it to be lost.
llm_translation: Rava said: Strong, a person does not exert in the meal and loses it.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: הוֹאִיל וּקְנַס חֲכָמִים הוּא — לֹא תִּגְבֶּה אֶלָּא מִן הַזִּיבּוּרִית. קְנָסָא? מַאי קְנָסָא?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְתַקָּנַת חֲכָמִים הוּא — לֹא תִּגְבֶּה אֶלָּא מִן הַזִּיבּוּרִית. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה מִן הַתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: taught Since is a penalty Sages, she may collect only from the land of the most inferior quality. A penalty? What penalty Rather, say: Since it is a rabbinic ordinance she may collect only from the land of the most inferior quality. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The marriage contract of a woman is by Torah
llm_translation: Mishna: Since it is a penalty of the sages — one should not elevate except from the Zibburit. Penalty? What is a penalty?! Rather say: Since it is a decree of the sages — one should not elevate except from the Zibburit. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The writing of a woman is from the Torah.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הָכִי? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״כֶּסֶף יִשְׁקֹל כְּמֹהַר הַבְּתוּלוֹת״: שֶׁיְּהֵא זֶה, כְּמוֹהַר הַבְּתוּלוֹת, וּמוֹהַר הַבְּתוּלוֹת כָּזֶה. מִכָּאן סָמְכוּ חֲכָמִים לִכְתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה מִן הַתּוֹרָה. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה אֵינָהּ מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, אֶלָּא מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים!
human_translation: And did Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel say that? But isn’t it taught “He shall pay money according to the dowry of virgins” this will be like the dowry of a virgin, the dowry of a virgin like this From here the Sages based that a woman’s marriage contract is by Torah Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The marriage contract of a woman is not by Torah law, but by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said it? Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said it? And it was taught: 'Silver is weighed like the speed of virgins': that this should be, like the speed of virgins, and the speed of virgins like this. From here the sages relied on the writing of a marriage contract from the Torah. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The writing of a marriage contract is not from the words of the Torah, but from the words of the scribes!"

hebrew_text: אֵיפוֹךְ. וּמַאי חָזֵית דְּאָפְכַתְּ בָּתְרָיְיתָא, אֵיפוֹךְ קַמַּיְיתָא?
human_translation: Reverse And what did you see that you reverse in the latter Reverse the former,
llm_translation: Opposite. And what do you see that you turned over at the end, opposite you stood?

hebrew_text: הָא שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל דְּאָמַר כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. דִּתְנַן, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר — נוֹתֵן לָהּ מִמְּעוֹת קַפּוֹטְקְיָא.
human_translation: that we learned that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel who said that the marriage contract of a woman is by Torah as we learned Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says he gives her from the money of Cappadocia.
llm_translation: We have heard regarding Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel who said: "The writing of a woman is from the Torah." As we learned: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says - one gives her from the pockets of the Kapotkeia.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: כּוּלָּהּ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הִיא, וְחַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: מִכָּאן סָמְכוּ חֲכָמִים לִכְתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה מִן הַתּוֹרָה. כְּתוּבַּת אַלְמָנָה אֵינָהּ מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, אֶלָּא מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים, שֶׁרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כְּתוּבַּת אַלְמָנָה אֵינָהּ מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, אֶלָּא מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים.
human_translation: And if you wish, say entire is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, but is incomplete and it is teaching the following: From here, the Sages based that a woman’s marriage contract is by Torah marriage contract of a widow is not by Torah law but by rabbinic law, as Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The marriage contract of a widow is not by Torah law but by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if you wish, say: It is all Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and the lacking is from the lacking, and thus it was taught: From here the sages relied on the writing of a woman from the Torah. The writing of a widow is not from the words of the Torah, but from the words of the scribes, as Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The writing of a widow is not from the words of the Torah, but from the words of the scribes.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פֶּתַח פָּתוּחַ מָצָאתִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: אַסְּבוּהוּ כּוּפְרֵי, מְבָרַכְתָּא חֲבִיטָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: A certain who came before Rav Naḥman said to him: I encountered an unobstructed orifice said in his Flog him palm branches [ kufrei ]; prostitutes [ mevarakhta ] are common him.
llm_translation: That one who came before Rav Nachman, said to him: "An open opening I have found." Rav Nachman said to him: "Did you cover it with pitch, did you bless a handful of grain for it?"

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַב נַחְמָן הוּא דְּאָמַר מְהֵימַן! מְהֵימַן, וּמַסְּבִינַן לֵיהּ כּוּפְרֵי. רַב אַחַאי מְשַׁנֵּי: כָּאן בְּבָחוּר, כָּאן בְּנָשׂוּי.
human_translation: But isn’t Rav Naḥman he who said that he is deemed credible he is deemed credible, and we flog him palm branches. Rav Aḥai answered: Here, with regard to a bachelor, There, with regard to married.
llm_translation: The text: "And behold, Rav Nachman, he said 'mehiman! mehiman,' and we surround him with pitchers." Rav Ahai explains: "Here with a bachelor, here with a married man."

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פֶּתַח פָּתוּחַ מָצָאתִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שֶׁמָּא הִטֵּיתָהּ? אֶמְשׁוֹל לְךָ מָשָׁל: לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? לְאָדָם שֶׁהָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ בְּאִישׁוֹן לַיְלָה וַאֲפֵילָה, הִיטָּה — מְצָאוֹ פָּתוּחַ, לֹא הִיטָּה — מְצָאוֹ נָעוּל.
human_translation: A certain who came before Rabban Gamliel said to him: I encountered an unobstructed orifice. said to him: Perhaps you diverted I will tell you a parable to which this is similar. to a man who was walking in the blackness of night and darkness he diverts he finds it open; he does not divert he finds it locked.
llm_translation: The one who came before Rabban Gamliel said to him: "An open opening I have found." He said to him: "Perhaps you have turned it?" I will give you a parable: To what is this matter similar? To a person who was walking in darkness at night, if he turned - he found it open, if he did not turn - he found it locked.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, הָכִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שֶׁמָּא בְּמֵזִיד הִטֵּיתָהּ, וַעֲקַרְתְּ לְדַשָּׁא וְעָבְרָא? אֶמְשׁוֹל לְךָ מָשָׁל: לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? לְאָדָם שֶׁהוּא מְהַלֵּךְ בְּאִישׁוֹן לַיְלָה וַאֲפֵילָה, הִיטָּה בְּמֵזִיד — מְצָאוֹ פָּתוּחַ, לֹא הִיטָּה בְּמֵזִיד — מְצָאוֹ נָעוּל.
human_translation: Some say this is what said to him: Maybe you diverted intentionally and you displaced the door and the bolt. I will tell you a parable to which this is similar. to a man who is walking in the blackness of night and darkness If he diverts intentionally, he finds it open; if he does not divert intentionally, he finds it locked.
llm_translation: There are those who say, thus he said to him: Perhaps you intentionally uprooted it, and caused it to be trampled and destroyed? I will give you a parable: To what can this matter be compared? To a person who walks in darkness at night, if he intentionally veers off course — he finds it open, if he did not intentionally veer off course — he finds it locked.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בַּר רַבִּי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבִּי, בָּעַלְתִּי וְלֹא מָצָאתִי דָּם. אָמְרָה לוֹ: רַבִּי, בְּתוּלָה הָיִיתִי. אָמַר לָהֶם: הָבִיאוּ לִי אוֹתוֹ סוּדָר. הֵבִיאוּ לוֹ הַסּוּדָר, וּשְׁרָאוֹ בְּמַיִם וְכִבְּסוֹ, וּמָצָא עָלָיו כַּמָּה טִיפֵּי דָמִים. אָמַר לוֹ: לֵךְ זְכֵה בְּמִקָּחֶךָ.
human_translation: A certain who came before Rabban Gamliel bar Rabbi said to him: My teacher, I engaged in intercourse and did not find blood. said to him: My teacher, I was a virgin. said to them: Bring me that cloth [ sudar ] They brought him the cloth, and he soaked it in water and laundered it and found upon it several drops of blood said to Go take possession of your acquisition,
llm_translation: That one who came before Rabban Gamliel the son of Rabbi, said to him: Rabbi, I had relations and did not find blood. She said to him: Rabbi, I was a virgin. He said to them: Bring me that sheet. They brought him the sheet, and they soaked it in water and washed it, and they found on it several drops of blood. He said to him: Go, be diligent in your acquisition.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הוּנָא מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא מִפַּרְזִקְיָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אֲנַן נָמֵי נַעֲבֵיד הָכִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: Huna Mar, son of Rava, from Parzakya, said to Rav Ashi: Let us do so as well said to him:
llm_translation: He said to him, Huna, son of Rava, from Pumbedita to Rav Ashi: We also do so. He said to him:

hebrew_text: גִּיהוּץ שֶׁלָּנוּ, כְּכִבּוּס שֶׁלָּהֶם. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ נֶיעְבַּד גִּיהוּץ — מְעַבְּרָא לֵיהּ חוּמַרְתָּא.
human_translation: Our calendering is like their laundering And if you say: Let us perform calendering the stone removes
llm_translation: Our laundry, like their laundry. And if you say that laundering is prohibited - you are imposing a stringency upon it.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בַּר רַבִּי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבִּי, בָּעַלְתִּי וְלֹא מָצָאתִי דָּם. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: רַבִּי, עֲדַיִין בְּתוּלָה אֲנִי. אָמַר לָהֶן: הָבִיאוּ לִי שְׁתֵּי שְׁפָחוֹת, אַחַת בְּתוּלָה וְאַחַת בְּעוּלָה. הֵבִיאוּ לוֹ, וְהוֹשִׁיבָן עַל פִּי חָבִית שֶׁל יַיִן, בְּעוּלָה — רֵיחָהּ נוֹדֵף, בְּתוּלָה — אֵין רֵיחָהּ נוֹדֵף. אַף זוֹ הוֹשִׁיבָה וְלֹא הָיָה רֵיחָהּ נוֹדֵף. אָמַר לוֹ: לֵךְ זְכֵה בְּמִקָּחֶךָ.
human_translation: A certain who came before Rabban Gamliel bar Rabbi said to him: My teacher, I engaged in intercourse and did not find blood. said to him: My teacher, I am still a virgin. said to them: Bring me two maidservants, one a virgin and one a non-virgin, They brought him and he seated them on the opening of a barrel of wine. the non-virgin, scent diffuses the virgin scent does not diffuse he also seated that and did not diffuse said to Go take possession of your acquisition,
llm_translation: That one who came before Rabban Gamliel the son of Rabbi, said to him: Rabbi, I had intercourse and did not find blood. She said to him: Rabbi, I am still a virgin. He said to them: Bring me two maidservants, one a virgin and one married. They brought them to him, and he made them sit on the edge of a barrel of wine, the married one - her scent diffused, the virgin - her scent did not diffuse. This one also sat and her scent did not diffuse. He said to him: Go, acquire your purchase.

hebrew_text: וְנִבְדּוֹק מֵעִיקָּרָא בְּגַוַּוהּ? גְּמָרָא הֲוָה שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ, מַעֲשֶׂה לָא הֲוָה חָזֵי, וְסָבַר דִּלְמָא לָא קִים לֵיהּ בְּגַוַּוהּ דְּמִלְּתָא שַׁפִּיר, וְלָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְזַלְזוֹלֵי בִּבְנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: let him examine her initially. He learned tradition; he had never seen it in action, and he thought perhaps he was not sufficiently expert in manner and improper conduct to demean Jewish women
llm_translation: And we shall examine from the outset in his statement? The Gemara heard it, the deed was not seen, and he thought perhaps it was not established in his statement because the matter is plausible, and it is not the way of the land to degrade the daughters of Israel.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן, אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, בָּעַלְתִּי וְלֹא מָצָאתִי דָּם, אָמְרָה לוֹ: רַבִּי, מִמִּשְׁפַּחַת דּוֹרְקְטִי אֲנִי, שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן לֹא דַּם נִדָּה וְלֹא דַּם בְּתוּלִים. בָּדַק רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וּמָצָא כִּדְבָרֶיהָ. אָמַר לוֹ: לֵךְ זְכֵה בְּמִקָּחֶךָ, אַשְׁרֶיךָ שֶׁזָּכִיתָ לְמִשְׁפַּחַת דּוֹרְקְטִי.
human_translation: A certain who came before Rabban Gamliel the Elder said to him: My teacher, I engaged in intercourse and did not find blood. said to him: My teacher, I am from the family of Dorketi, who have neither menstrual blood nor blood the hymen. Rabban Gamliel investigated among her relatives and discovered in accordance with her statement. He said to him: Go take possession of your acquisition. Happy are you that you were privileged the Dorketi family,
llm_translation: That one who came before Rabban Gamliel the Elder, he said to him: "Rabbi, I married and did not find blood." She said to him: "Rabbi, I am from the family of Dorkeiti, who do not have either menstrual blood or virgin blood." Rabban Gamliel examined her relatives, and found that her words were true. He said to him: "Go, be fortunate in your acquisition, blessed are you for marrying into the family of Dorkeiti."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״דּוֹרְקְטִי״ — דּוֹר קָטוּעַ. אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: תַּנְחוּמִים שֶׁל הֶבֶל נִיחֲמוֹ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְאוֹתוֹ הָאִישׁ. דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהַשְּׂאוֹר יָפֶה לְעִיסָּה, כָּךְ דָּמִים יָפִים לָאִשָּׁה. וְתָנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: כׇּל אִשָּׁה שֶׁדָּמֶיהָ מְרוּבִּין — בָּנֶיהָ מְרוּבִּים.
human_translation: What is Dorketi? truncated generation [ dor katua ]. Rabbi Ḥanina said: Rabban Gamliel consoled that man with vain consolation, As Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: Just as leaven is fortuitous for dough, so blood is fortuitous for a woman. And taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: Any woman whose blood is plentiful, her children are plentiful.
llm_translation: "What is 'Dorkeeti' - a generation cut off. Rabbi Chanina said: The consolations of vanity consoled that man. For Rabbi Chiya taught: Just as leaven is good for dough, so too are beautiful blood for a woman. And it was taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: Every woman whose blood is abundant, her children are abundant."

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר. רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר: ״זְכֵה בְּמִקָּחֶךָ״ אֲמַר לֵיהּ, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין אָמַר: ״נִתְחַיַּיבְ[תָּ] בְּמִקָּחֶךָ״ אֲמַר לֵיהּ. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״נִתְחַיַּיבְ[תָּ]״ — הַיְינוּ דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״זְכֵה״, מַאי זְכוּתָא? דְּלָא אָתֵי לִידֵי סְפֵק נִדָּה.
human_translation: It was stated Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said said to Exercise your privilege of your acquisition. And Rabbi Yosei bar Avin said said to him: misfortune of your acquisition. Granted, according to the one who says: misfortune, that is of Rabbi Ḥanina, However, according to the one who says: Exercise your privilege, what is the privilege that he will not come to a situation of uncertainty menstruating woman.
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: "Acquire merit with your purchase." He said to him, and Rabbi Yosei bar Avin said: "You are obligated in your purchase." He said to him. According to the one who said "you are obligated" - that is Rabbi Chanina. But according to the one who said "acquire," what is the merit? That it does not come into contact with a doubtful case of impurity.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבִּי בָּעַלְתִּי וְלֹא מָצָאתִי דָּם, אָמְרָה לוֹ: רַבִּי עֲדַיִין בְּתוּלָה אֲנִי. וּשְׁנֵי בַצּוֹרֶת הֲוָה, רָאָה רַבִּי שֶׁפְּנֵיהֶם שְׁחוֹרִים. צִוָּה עֲלֵיהֶן וְהִכְנִיסוּם לַמֶּרְחָץ, וְהֶאֱכִילוּם וְהִשְׁקוּם, וְהִכְנִיסוּם לַחֶדֶר. בָּעַל, וּמָצָא דָּם. אָמַר לוֹ: לֵךְ זְכֵה בְּמִקָּחֶךָ. קָרֵי רַבִּי עֲלֵיהֶם: ״צָפַד עוֹרָם עַל עַצְמָם יָבֵשׁ הָיָה כָעֵץ״.
human_translation: A certain who came before Rabbi said to him: My teacher, I engaged in intercourse and did not find blood. said to him: My teacher, I was still a virgin. And was years of drought. Rabbi saw that their faces were black He instructed to them and they took them into the bathhouse and they fed them and gave them drink. they took them into a room, engaged in intercourse and found blood, said to him: Go take possession of your acquisition. Rabbi read in their regard: “Their skin is shriveled upon their bones, it is withered, it has become like a stick”
llm_translation: The one who came before Rabbi said to him: "Rabbi, I had relations and did not find blood." She said to him: "Rabbi, I am still a virgin." And there were two in the form of ducks, Rabbi saw that their faces were black. He commanded concerning them, they were brought into the bathhouse, they were fed and given to drink, and they were brought into the room. He had relations, and found blood. He said to him: "Go, acquire with your purchase." Rabbi recited regarding them: "He has stripped their skin from them and made it dry like wood."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בְּתוּלָה — כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מָאתַיִם, וְאַלְמָנָה — מָנֶה. בְּתוּלָה, אַלְמָנָה, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין — כְּתוּבָּתָן מָאתַיִם, וְיֵשׁ לָהֶן טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים.
human_translation: a virgin, her marriage contract is two hundred dinars, and a widow, is one hundred a virgin a widow, a divorcée, or a ḥalutza from betrothal, their marriage contract is two hundred and they are subject a claim concerning virginity,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A virgin - her marriage contract is worth two hundred, and a widow - a hundred. A virgin, widow, divorcee, and a woman who has been released from betrothal - their marriage contracts are worth two hundred, and they have a claim for virginity.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״אַלְמָנָה״? אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּגְדָּתָאָה: ״אַלְמָנָה״ — עַל שֵׁם מָנֶה. אַלְמָנָה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר! אַיְּידֵי דְּהָא קָרֵי לַהּ אַלְמָנָה, הָא נָמֵי קָרֵי לַהּ אַלְמָנָה.
human_translation: What is almana Rav Ḥana of Baghdad said: an almana after maneh , a widow from betrothal, what is there to say? Since they called this almana , this they also called almana .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the meaning of "almanah" (widow)? Rav Ḥana bar Gadda said: "Almanah" - named after a portion. A widow from the betrothed, what can one say about her? Because she is called almanah, this one is also called almanah.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָנָה דִּכְתִיבָא בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? דַּעֲתִידִין רַבָּנַן דִּמְתַקְּנִי לַהּ מָנֶה. וּמִי כָּתֵב קְרָא לְעָתִיד? אִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשֵׁם הַנָּהָר הַשְּׁלִישִׁי חִדֶּקֶל הוּא הַהוֹלֵךְ קִדְמַת אַשּׁוּר״, וְתָנָא רַב יוֹסֵף: אַשּׁוּר זוֹ סְלֵיקָא. וּמִי הֲוַאי? אֶלָּא דַּעֲתִידָה. הָכָא נָמֵי דַּעֲתִידָה.
human_translation: almana that is written in the Torah, what is there to say? because the Sages are destined to institute maneh for her And is a verse written for the future? Yes, as it is written: “And the name of the third river is Tigris; that is it which goes toward the east of Asshur” And Rav Yosef taught: Asshur, that is Seleucia. And did exist Rather, because destined Here too, because destined
llm_translation: Widow that it is written in the Torah, what is there to say? The sages will establish for her a portion. And who wrote in the future? No, as it is written: "And the name of the third river is Hiddekel; that is the one which flows east of Assyria." And Rav Yosef taught: Assyria is Tigris. And who is it? Rather, it is the future. Here too, it is the future.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּגְדָּתָאָה: ״מָטָר״ — מַשְׁקֶה, מַרְוֶה, וּמְזַבֵּל, וּמְעַדֵּן, וּמַמְשִׁיךְ. אָמַר רָבָא בַּר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב יֵימַר בַּר שֶׁלֶמְיָא, מַאי קְרָא: ״תְּלָמֶיהָ רַוֵּה נַחֵת גְּדוּדֶיהָ בִּרְבִיבִים תְּמֹגְגֶנָּה צִמְחָהּ תְּבָרֵךְ״.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥana of Baghdad said: Rain irrigates, saturates, and fertilizes and refines and proliferate. Rava bar Rabbi Yishmael, and some say Rav Yeimar bar Shelamya said: What is the verse “Watering its ridges abundantly, settling its furrows, You make it soft with showers, You bless its growth”
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥanah said in the name of the academy: "Rain" — it waters, saturates, fertilizes, adorns, and prolongs. Rava son of Rabbi Yishmael said, and some say it was Rav Yeimar son of Shelemya, what is the verse: "Her furrows she saturates, settles the ridges, You soften it with showers, You bless its growth."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: ״מִזְבֵּחַ״ — מֵזִיחַ, וּמֵזִין, מְחַבֵּב, מְכַפֵּר. הַיְינוּ מְכַפֵּר, הַיְינוּ מֵזִיחַ! מֵזִיחַ גְּזֵירוֹת, וּמְכַפֵּר עֲוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: mizbe’aḥ , It moves [ meziaḥ ] and sustains [ mezin ], endears [ meḥabev ], atones [ mekhapper ]. This atones, is that moves moves decrees, and atones sins.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: "Mizbeach" - sprinkles, and purifies, loves, atones. This is atoning, this is sprinkling! Sprinkling decrees, and atoning sins.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּגְדָּתָאָה: תַּמְרֵי מְשַׁחֲנָן, מַשְׂבְּעָן, מְשַׁלְשְׁלָן, מְאַשְּׁרָן וְלָא מְפַנְּקָן. אָמַר רַב: אָכַל תְּמָרִים אַל יוֹרֶה. מֵיתִיבִי: תְּמָרִים, שַׁחֲרִית וְעַרְבִית — יָפוֹת, בְּמִנְחָה — רָעוֹת. בַּצׇּהֳרַיִם — אֵין כְּמוֹתָן, וּמְבַטְּלוֹת שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים: מַחְשָׁבָה רָעָה, וְחוֹלִי מֵעַיִם, וְתַחְתּוֹנִיּוֹת!
human_translation: And Rav Ḥana of Baghdad said: Dates warm and satiate, loosen the bowels, strengthen, but do not pamper. Rav said: one ate dates he should not issue rulings, raises an objection: dates, morning and evening positive in the afternoon, negative At noon, their unparalleled, and they negate three matters: A troubling thought, intestinal illness, and hemorrhoids.
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥanina said in the garden: Dates, they nourish, satisfy, loosen, enrich, but do not pamper. Rav said: One who eats dates should not teach.
