It was raised: Dates in the morning and evening are good, in the afternoon are bad. At midday, they are unmatched, and nullify three things: evil thoughts, intestinal illness, and hemorrhoids!

hebrew_text: מִי אָמְרִינַן דְּלָא מְעַלּוּ? עַלּוֹיֵי מְעַלּוּ, וּלְפִי שַׁעְתָּא טָרְדָא. מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַחַמְרָא. דְּאָמַר מָר הַשּׁוֹתֶה רְבִיעִית יַיִן — אַל יוֹרֶה. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא — מִקַּמֵּי נַהֲמָא. הָא — לְבָתַר נַהֲמָא. דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אֲמַרָה לִי אֵם: תַּמְרֵי מִקַּמֵּי נַהֲמָא — כִּי נַרְגָּא לְדִיקּוּלָא. בָּתַר נַהֲמָא — כִּי עָבְרָא לְדַשָּׁא.
human_translation: Did we say that they are not exemplary? They are exemplary, and cause temporary distraction intoxication, just as it is of wine, as the Master said: One who drinks a quarter of wine should not issue rulings. And if you wish, say not difficult. This before bread, That to after bread. As Abaye said: My mother told me dates before bread like an ax to a palm tree; after bread like a bolt to a door,
llm_translation: We say that they did not ascend? They ascended, and due to a pressing need. Because it was a matter of urgency. For Mar said, "One who drinks a quarter of wine should not render a legal decision." And if you wish, say: It is not difficult, this one - before he dozed off, this one - after he dozed off. For Abaye said, his mother told him: Dates before he dozed off - for digestion, after he dozed off - for laxative purposes.

hebrew_text: ״דַּשָּׁא״, אָמַר רָבָא: דֶּרֶךְ שָׁם. ״דַּרְגָּא״ — אָמַר רָבָא: דֶּרֶךְ גַּג. ״פּוּרְיָא״ — אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: שֶׁפָּרִין וְרָבִין עָלֶיהָ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק:
human_translation: dasha , Rava said: derekh sham , darga , Rava said: derekh gag , purya , Rav Pappa said: parin veravin aleha , Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said:
llm_translation: "Dasha," said Rava: the way of there. "Darga" - said Rava: the way of a roof. "Purya" - said Rav Papa: that it bears fruit and multiplies on it. Said Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak:

hebrew_text: אַף אָנוּ נֹאמַר: ״אַיְילוֹנִית״ — דּוּכְרָנִית, דְּלָא יָלְדָה.
human_translation: We too will say: Ailonit , ram [ dukhranit ], because she does not bear children.
llm_translation: We also say: "Aylonit" - a barren woman who has not given birth.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַגִּיּוֹרֶת וְהַשְּׁבוּיָה וְהַשִּׁפְחָה שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ וְשֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירוּ וְשֶׁנִּשְׁתַּחְרְרוּ, פְּחוּתוֹת מִבְּנוֹת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד — כְּתוּבָּתָן מָאתַיִם. וְיֵשׁ לָהֶן טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִין.
human_translation: a female convert, or a captive woman, or a maidservant, who were ransomed who converted or who was freed less than three years and one day old, their marriage contract is two hundred And they are a claim virginity.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A convert, a freed slave, and a maidservant who were redeemed, converted, and freed, if they are less than three years and one day old - their value is two hundred. And they have a claim for their virginity.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: גֵּר קָטָן — מַטְבִּילִין אוֹתוֹ עַל דַּעַת בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: a convert a minor, one immerses him with the consent of the court.
llm_translation: Gemara, Rav Huna said: A minor convert - they immerse him with the consent of the court.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן — דִּזְכוּת הוּא לוֹ, וְזָכִין לָאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו? תְּנֵינָא: זָכִין לְאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו, וְאֵין חָבִין לָאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו!
human_translation: What is coming to teach us? that it is a privilege for and one may act in a person’s interests in his absence? We learned may act in a person’s interests in his absence, but one may not act against a person’s interests in his absence.
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? — That merit is his, and we acquire for a person not in his presence? We learned: We acquire for a person not in his presence, but we do not obligate a person not in his presence!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: גּוֹי בְּהֶפְקֵירָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ, דְּהָא קַיְימָא לַן דְּעֶבֶד וַדַּאי בְּהֶפְקֵירָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ,
human_translation: lest you say: a gentile, licentiousness is preferable for him, as we maintain that a slave, licentiousness is certainly preferable.
llm_translation: What is the reasoning: A non-Jew is pleased with hefker, for he holds that a slave is certainly pleased with hefker,

hebrew_text: קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דְּהָנֵי מִילֵּי גָּדוֹל, דִּטְעַם טַעַם דְּאִיסּוּרָא, אֲבָל קָטָן — זְכוּת הוּא לוֹ.
human_translation: teaches us: That applies an adult, who has experienced a taste of prohibition. However, minor, it is a privilege for him
llm_translation: We hear: that those matters of great importance, where there is a reason for prohibition, but for minor matters — it is a merit for him.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: הַגִּיּוֹרֶת וְהַשְּׁבוּיָה וְהַשִּׁפְחָה שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ וְשֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירוּ וְשֶׁנִּשְׁתַּחְרְרוּ, פְּחוּתוֹת מִבְּנוֹת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד. מַאי לָאו, דְּאַטְבְּלִינְהוּ עַל דַּעַת בֵּית דִּין?
human_translation: Let us say supports a female convert, or a captive woman, or a maidservant, who were ransomed who converted or who were freed less than three years and one day old; what, is it not they immersed with the consent of the court?
llm_translation: Let us say it assists him: the convert, the captive, and the maidservant who were redeemed, converted, and freed, their immersion is less than that of the daughters of three years and one day. What is the reason? That they immerse with the consent of the court.

hebrew_text: לָא, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן: בְּגֵר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירוּ בָּנָיו וּבְנוֹתָיו עִמּוֹ, דְּנִיחָא לְהוּ בְּמַאי דְּעָבֵיד אֲבוּהוֹן.
human_translation: No, with what are we dealing here? with a convert whose sons and daughters converted with him, as they are content with whatever their father does
llm_translation: Not here, what are we dealing with? With a convert whose sons and daughters converted with him, it is preferable for them to be involved in his property.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הִגְדִּילוּ — יְכוֹלִין לְמַחוֹת. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הַגִּיּוֹרֶת וְהַשְּׁבוּיָה וְהַשִּׁפְחָה שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ וְשֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירוּ וְשֶׁנִּשְׁתַּחְרְרוּ, פְּחוּתוֹת מִבְּנוֹת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד — כְּתוּבָּתָן מָאתַיִם. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ הִגְדִּילוּ יְכוֹלִין לְמַחוֹת — יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ כְּתוּבָה דְּאָזְלָה וְאָכְלָה בְּגֵיוּתַהּ?
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: they reach majority they can protest Abaye raised an objection to his a female convert, or a captive woman, or a maidservant who were ransomed, who converted, or who were freed less than three years and one day old, their marriage contract is two hundred And if it enters your mind they reach majority they can protest do we give her marriage contract that she go and consume in her gentile
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: They enlarged - can they erase. Abaye raised an objection to him: A convert, a freed captive, and a freed maidservant who were redeemed, converted, and freed, less than three years and one day - their written value is two hundred. And if you think, "They enlarged - can they erase," should we give her the written document that she went and consumed in her folly?

hebrew_text: לְכִי גָדְלָה. לְכִי גָדְלָה נָמֵי מְמַחֲיָיא וְנָפְקָא! כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגְדִּילָה שָׁעָה אַחַת וְלֹא מִיחֲתָה — שׁוּב אֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לְמַחוֹת.
human_translation: once she has reached majority When she reaches majority too, she will protest and abandon Once she reached majority one moment and did not protest, she may no longer protest.
llm_translation: "Go and grow." Go and grow, as taught by Memachaya, and it was fulfilled! Once she grew for one hour and did not shrink - she can no longer shrink.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא, אֵלּוּ נְעָרוֹת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן קְנָס: הַבָּא עַל הַמַּמְזֶרֶת וְעַל הַנְּתִינָה וְעַל הַכּוּתִית וְעַל הַגִּיּוֹרֶת וְעַל הַשְּׁבוּיָה וְעַל הַשִּׁפְחָה שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ וְשֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירוּ וְשֶׁנִּשְׁתַּחְרְרוּ, פְּחוּתוֹת מִבְּנוֹת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד, יֵשׁ לָהֶן קְנָס. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ הִגְדִּילוּ יְכוֹלִין לְמַחוֹת — יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ קְנָס דְּאָזְלָה וְאָכְלָה בְּגֵיוּתַהּ?
human_translation: Rava raised an objection These young women for whom there is a fine One who engages in intercourse with a mamzeret ; or with a Gibeonite woman [ netina ], or with a Samaritan woman [ kutit ]. with a female convert, or with a captive woman, or with a maidservant, that were ransomed or that converted, or that were freed less than three years and one day old, there is a fine to their And if you say when they reach majority they can protest do we give her fine that she go and consume in her gentile
llm_translation: Rava raises an objection: These are the maidens who have a penalty: one who has relations with a mamzeret, a Netinah, a Kutit, a Giryoret, a Shvu'yah, and a Shifchah who were redeemed, converted, or freed, less than three years and one day old, they have a penalty. And if you say they have grown, they are able to push away - should we give her the penalty so she goes and eats with her disgrace?

hebrew_text: לְכִי גָדְלָה. לְכִי גָדְלָה נָמֵי מְמַחֲיָיא וְנָפְקָא! כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגְדִּילָה שָׁעָה אַחַת וְלֹא מִיחֲתָה — שׁוּב אֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לְמַחוֹת.
human_translation: once she has reached majority When she reaches majority too, she will protest and abandon Once she reached majority one moment and did not protest, she may no longer protest.
llm_translation: "Go and grow." Go and grow, as taught by Memachaya, and it emerged! Once it has grown for one hour and has not shrunk - it cannot shrink again.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי לָא אָמַר כְּרָבָא: הָתָם קְנָסָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא — שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא חוֹטֵא נִשְׂכָּר.
human_translation: Abaye did not state as Rava, there, a fine, this is the reason: So that the sinner will not profit.
llm_translation: Abbaye did not say like Rava: There, the penalty, that is the reason - so that the sinner should not be rewarded.

hebrew_text: רָבָא לָא אָמַר כְּאַבַּיֵּי: כְּתוּבָּה הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא — שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא קַלָּה בְּעֵינָיו לְהוֹצִיאָהּ.
human_translation: Rava did not state as Abaye, as a marriage contract, this is the reason So that will not be inconsequential in his eyes, to divorce her.
llm_translation: Rava did not say like Abbaye: Written that is the reason — that it should not be light in his eyes to take it out.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבָּא עַל הַקְּטַנָּה וְקָטָן שֶׁבָּא עַל הַגְּדוֹלָה וּמוּכַּת עֵץ — כְּתוּבָּתָן מָאתַיִם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מוּכַּת עֵץ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מָנֶה.
human_translation: an adult man who engaged in intercourse with a minor girl or a minor boy who engaged in intercourse with an adult woman; or a ruptured by wood their marriage contract is two hundred the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: The marriage contract ruptured by wood is one hundred dinars,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The elder who marries a minor girl, and the minor who marries an elder woman, and a wooden peg — their writing is two hundred, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: The writing of a wooden peg is a hundred.

hebrew_text: בְּתוּלָה, אַלְמָנָה, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין — כְּתוּבָּתָן מָנֶה.
human_translation: a virgin widow, divorcée, or a ḥalutza from marriage, their marriage contract is one hundred dinars,
llm_translation: Virgin, widow, divorcee, and halutzah from those who are married - their marriage contract counts.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לָהֶן טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים.
human_translation: and they are not a claim virginity.
llm_translation: And they have no claim in regards to virgins.

hebrew_text: הַגִּיּוֹרֶת וְהַשְּׁבוּיָה וְהַשִּׁפְחָה שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ וְשֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירוּ וְשֶׁנִּשְׁתַּחְרְרוּ, יְתֵירוֹת עַל בְּנוֹת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד — כְּתוּבָּתָן מָנֶה, וְאֵין לָהֶן טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִין.
human_translation: a female convert, or a captive woman, or a maidservant, who were ransomed who converted or who were freed more than three years and one day old, their marriage contract is one hundred dinars and they are not a claim virginity.
llm_translation: The convert, the freed slave, and the maidservant who were redeemed, converted, and freed, their daughters are permitted after three years and one day - their document is a maneh, and they have no claim of virginity.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: קָטָן הַבָּא עַל הַגְּדוֹלָה — עֲשָׂאָהּ מוּכַּת עֵץ. כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אָמַר: אֵין מוּכַּת עֵץ בְּבָשָׂר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: A minor boy who engaged in intercourse with an adult woman renders her ruptured by wood, When I said before Shmuel, said not ruptured by wood flesh,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: If a minor engages in relations with an adult woman, he has thereby made her as a piece of wood. For when she said it before Shmuel, he said: "There is no piece of wood in flesh."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא בְּאַפֵּי נַפְשַׁהּ: קָטָן הַבָּא עַל הַגְּדוֹלָה, רַב אָמַר: עֲשָׂאָהּ מוּכַּת עֵץ, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין מוּכַּת עֵץ בְּבָשָׂר.
human_translation: Some teach this halakha independent a minor boy who engaged in intercourse with an adult woman, Rav said: He renders her ruptured by wood. And Shmuel said: not ruptured by wood flesh.
llm_translation: There is one who teaches her this teaching with a heavy soul: A minor who engages in relations with an adult. Rav said: He has made her like a wooden peg. And Shmuel said: A wooden peg does not exist in flesh.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: גָּדוֹל שֶׁבָּא עַל הַקְּטַנָּה, וְקָטָן הַבָּא עַל הַגְּדוֹלָה, וּמוּכַּת עֵץ — כְּתוּבָּתָן מָאתַיִם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מוּכַּת עֵץ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מָנֶה.
human_translation: Rav Oshaya raised an objection an adult man who engaged in intercourse with a minor girl or a minor boy who engaged in intercourse with an adult woman, or a ruptured by wood the marriage contract is two hundred the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: The marriage contract ruptured by wood is one hundred dinars.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Oshaya asked: If a large vessel comes into contact with a smaller one, and a small vessel comes into contact with a larger one, and a wooden vessel is struck — their scriptural status is two hundred, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: The scriptural status of a wooden vessel is a hundred.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: גָּדוֹל הַבָּא עַל הַקְּטַנָּה — וְלֹא כְּלוּם, דְּפָחוֹת מִכָּאן כְּנוֹתֵן אֶצְבַּע בָּעַיִן דָּמֵי. וְקָטָן הַבָּא עַל הַגְּדוֹלָה — עֲשָׂאָהּ מוּכַּת עֵץ. וּמוּכַּת עֵץ גּוּפָא פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rava said this is what is saying: An adult man who engaged in intercourse with a minor girl nothing, as less than is tantamount to poking a finger into the eye. And a young boy who engaged in intercourse with an adult woman renders her was ruptured by wood. And ruptured by wood itself, dispute between Rabbi Meir and the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Rava said, thus he said: Great is the one who comes upon the small - and not nothing, for less than this, it is like putting a finger in the eye. And small is the one who comes upon the great - he made it a wooden peg. And a wooden peg is the body of the dispute of Rabbi Meir and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: מַחֲלוֹקֶת כְּשֶׁהִכִּיר בָּהּ, דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר מְדַמֵּי לַהּ לְבוֹגֶרֶת. וְרַבָּנַן מְדַמּוּ לַהּ לִבְעוּלָה, אֲבָל לֹא הִכִּיר בָּהּ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל וְלֹא כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said: This dispute where was aware that her as Rabbi Meir likens her to a grown woman, And the Rabbis liken her to a non-virgin However, if he was not aware that her everyone agrees no at all
llm_translation: Ramai bar Ḥama said: A dispute, when one recognizes it, Rabbi Meir likens it to a cake. And the Rabbis liken it to a pregnant woman. But if one does not recognize it - everyone agrees it is nothing.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, אַמַּאי מְדַמֵּי לַהּ לְבוֹגֶרֶת? נְדַמְּיַיהּ לִבְעוּלָה! בְּעוּלָה — אִיתְעֲבִיד בַּהּ מַעֲשֶׂה בִּידֵי אָדָם, הָא — לָא אִיתְעֲבִיד בַּהּ מַעֲשֶׂה בִּידֵי אָדָם. וְרַבָּנַן, אַדִּמְדַמּוּ לַהּ לִבְעוּלָה, נְדַמְּיוּהָ לְבוֹגֶרֶת? בּוֹגֶרֶת — לָא אִיתְעֲבִיד בַּהּ מַעֲשֶׂה כְּלָל, הָא — אִיתְעֲבִיד בַּהּ מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: And why does Rabbi Meir liken her to a grown woman? Let him liken her to a non-virgin, a non-virgin, an action was performed on her by a person; this an action was not performed on her by a person. And the Rabbis, rather than likening her to a non-virgin, let them liken her to a grown woman. a grown woman, no action was performed on her; this an action was performed on her.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir, why is a bogeret compared to her? She is compared to a married woman! A married woman - an act is done with her by the hands of man, but here - an act is not done with her by the hands of man. And the Rabbis, since they compare her to a married woman, are they compared to a bogeret? A bogeret - an act is not done with her at all, but here - an act is done with her.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לֹא הִכִּיר בָּהּ — לְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל וְלֹא כְּלוּם. מֵתִיב רַב נַחְמָן, הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: מוּכַּת עֵץ אֲנִי, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: לֹא כִּי, אֶלָּא דְּרוּסַת אִישׁ אַתְּ — רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמְרִים: נֶאֱמֶנֶת.
human_translation: However, if he was not aware that her everyone agrees no at all. Rav Naḥman raised an objection she says: I ruptured by wood, and says: No; rather, you are was violated by a man Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is deemed credible
llm_translation: But he did not recognize her - according to everyone and not nothing. Rab Nahman raises an objection: She says, "I am a wooden staff," and he says, "No, rather you are a man's droosah." Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is believed.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: בֵּין הִכִּיר בָּהּ וּבֵין לֹא הִכִּיר בָּהּ — לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מָאתַיִם. לְרַבָּנַן, הִכִּיר בָּהּ — מָנֶה, לֹא הִכִּיר בָּהּ — וְלֹא כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: Whether was aware that her and whether he was not aware of her to Rabbi Meir two hundred to the Rabbis, he was aware of her one hundred dinars he was not aware of her no at all,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Whether one recognized it or did not recognize it - according to Rabbi Meir, two hundred zuz. According to the Rabbis, if one recognized it - it is appraised, if one did not recognize it - it is nothing.

hebrew_text: וַהֲדַר בֵּיהּ רָבָא, דְּתַנְיָא: כֵּיצַד הוֹצָאַת שֵׁם רַע? בָּא לְבֵית דִּין וְאָמַר: פְּלוֹנִי, לֹא מָצָאתִי לְבִתְּךָ בְּתוּלִים. אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁזִּינְּתָה תַּחְתָּיו — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה מָנֶה. אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁזִּינְּתָה תַּחְתָּיו — בַּת סְקִילָה הִיא! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁזִּינְּתָה תַּחְתָּיו — בִּסְקִילָה. זִינְּתָה מֵעִיקָּרָא — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה מָנֶה.
human_translation: And Rava retracted as it is taught How slander comes to court and says: So-and-so, I did not find in your daughter hymen. If there are witnesses that she committed adultery under she a marriage contract of one hundred dinars. If there are witnesses that she committed adultery under his she is subject to stoning. this is what is saying: If there are witnesses that she committed adultery under his to stoning. if she engaged in intercourse initially, she receives a marriage contract of one hundred dinars,
llm_translation: And further in it, Rava expounded, as it was taught: How does one bring forth a bad name? He comes to the court and says: "So-and-so, I did not find virginity for your daughter." If there are witnesses that she engaged in relations beneath him - she has a written marriage contract. If there are witnesses that she engaged in relations beneath him - she is a daughter of stoning! This is what he is saying: If there are witnesses that she engaged in relations beneath him - by stoning. If she engaged in relations from the outset - she has a written marriage contract.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, כְּנָסָהּ בְּחֶזְקַת בְּתוּלָה וְנִמְצֵאת בְּעוּלָה — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה מָנֶה. וּמֵתִיב רַב נַחְמָן: הַנּוֹשֵׂא אֶת הָאִשָּׁה וְלֹא מָצָא לָהּ בְּתוּלִים, הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: מִשֶּׁאֵרַסְתַּנִי נֶאֱנַסְתִּי וְנִסְתַּחֲפָה שָׂדֵהוּ. וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: לֹא כִי, אֶלָּא עַד שֶׁלֹּא אֵירַסְתִּיךְ, וְהָיָה מִקָּחִי מִקָּח טָעוּת. וְלֵית לַהּ כְּלָל?
human_translation: And Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said Rav Sheshet said: That is to say, married with the presumptive status of a virgin and she is found to be a non-virgin, marriage contract of one hundred dinars. Rav Naḥman raised an objection who marries a woman and did not find her hymen she says: After you betrothed me I was raped, and his, field was inundated, And he says: No; rather, before I betrothed you, and my transaction was a mistaken transaction. she does not any at all.
llm_translation: And Rav Chiya bar Avin said in the name of Rav Sheshet: This is what it means, if she entered into the marriage presuming to be a virgin and was found to be a non-virgin - she has a marriage contract. And Rav Nachman raises an objection: If a man marries a woman and does not find signs of virginity in her, she says, "I was violated before you betrothed me, and my field was plowed." And he says: No, rather, until I betrothed you, and my acquisition was a mistaken acquisition. And does she have no claim at all?

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לְהוּ רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין: אֶפְשָׁר רַב עַמְרָם וְכׇל גְּדוֹלֵי הַדּוֹר יָתְבִי כִּי אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא וְקַשְׁיָא לְהוּ, וְשַׁנִּי: מַאי ״מִקָּח טָעוּת״ נָמֵי, מִמָּאתַיִם. אֲבָל מָנֶה אִית לַהּ, וְאַתּ אָמְרַתְּ לֵית לַהּ כְּלָל!
human_translation: And Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said to possible Rav Amram and all the prominent of the generation were sitting when Rav Sheshet said this halakha , and was difficult for them, and they answered: What is mistaken transaction too from two hundred However, she is one hundred dinars. And, you say that she does not any at all?
llm_translation: And he said to them, Rav Chiya bar Avin: It is possible that Rav Amram and all the great ones of the generation will sit, for Rav Sheshet said to them a matter to hear and it is difficult for them. And he repeated: What is "a mistaken acquisition" also, from two hundred. But it has a count, and you say it has none at all!

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: מַאן דְּקָא מוֹתֵיב — שַׁפִּיר קָא מוֹתֵיב: מִקָּח טָעוּת לִגְמָרֵי מַשְׁמַע. וְאֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא הָךְ? תָּרֵיץ וְאֵימָא הָכִי: אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁזִּינְּתָה תַּחְתָּיו — בִּסְקִילָה. זִינְּתָה מֵעִיקָּרָא — וְלֹא כְּלוּם. נִמְצֵאת מוּכַּת עֵץ יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה מָנֶה.
human_translation: And Rava said: The one who raised the objection, raises the objection well, Mistaken transaction, indicates totally. But that difficult, Resolve and say this If there are witnesses that she committed adultery under his to stoning. If she engaged in intercourse initially, nothing at all. she was discovered ruptured by wood, she is a marriage contract of one hundred
llm_translation: And Rava said: Whoever argues - he argues well: a mistaken acquisition is completely ineffective. But is this difficult? Resolve it and say thus: If there are witnesses that she committed adultery beneath him - she is to be stoned. If she committed adultery from the outset - she is not liable. If she is found to be a wood gatherer, she has a marriage contract.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רָבָא הוּא דְּאָמַר לְרַבָּנַן לֹא הִכִּיר בָּהּ — וְלֹא כְּלוּם! אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הֲדַר בֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵהַהִיא.
human_translation: But isn’t it Rava himself who said to the Rabbis, he was not aware of her no at all? Rather, conclude from it Rava retracted that
llm_translation: And this is Rava who said to the Rabbis, "He did not recognize her - and not nothing! Rather, learn from it that Rava reconsidered it from that."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כְּנָסָהּ רִאשׁוֹן לְשׁוּם נִישּׂוּאִין, וְיֵשׁ לָהּ עֵדִים שֶׁלֹּא נִסְתְּרָה, אִי נָמֵי נִסְתְּרָה, וְלֹא שָׁהֲתָה כְּדֵי בִיאָה — אֵין הַשֵּׁנִי יָכוֹל לִטְעוֹן טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים. שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּנָסָהּ רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: first brought her into for the purpose of marriage, and she has witnesses that she did not seclude herself alternatively, she secluded herself and did not stay equivalent intercourse, the second cannot make a claim concerning virginity, first husband brought her into
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If the first one entered for the sake of marriage, and there are witnesses that she did not hide herself, or in other words, she did hide herself but did not delay long enough for intercourse - the second one cannot claim the defense of virginity, for she was entered by the first.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, כְּנָסָהּ בְּחֶזְקַת בְּתוּלָה, וְנִמְצֵאת בְּעוּלָה — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה מָנֶה. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: בְּעָלְמָא לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ לֵית לַהּ כְּלָל, וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּנָסָהּ רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rabba said: That is to say, one married with the presumptive status of a virgin, and she was found a non-virgin, she is a marriage contract of one hundred dinars. Rav Ashi said: In general, actually, I say to you she does not at all, But here it is different, because the first brought her into
llm_translation: Rabba said: This means, if she entered with the presumption of virginity, and is found to be a non-virgin — she has a marriage contract. Rav Ashi said: In general, I would say to you that she has nothing at all, but here it is different, for she entered first.

hebrew_text: וְנֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא תַּחְתָּיו זִינְּתָה! אָמַר רַב שֵׁרֵבְיָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ וּבָעַל לְאַלְתַּר.
human_translation: And let us be concerned that perhaps she committed adultery while under Rav Sherevya said: where he betrothed and engaged in intercourse immediately.
llm_translation: And suspicion lest beneath him she committed adultery! Rav She'revya said: For example, when he betrothed her and immediately married her.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַמַּתְנִיתִין: בְּתוּלָה, אַלְמָנָה, גְּרוּשָׁה חֲלוּצָה מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין — כְּתוּבָּתָן מָנֶה, וְאֵין לָהֶן טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִין. בְּתוּלָה מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּכְנְסָה לְחוּפָּה וְלֹא נִבְעֲלָה.
human_translation: Others taught this with regard to the mishna: a virgin a widow, a divorcée, a ḥalutza from marriage, their marriage contract is one hundred dinars, and they are not subject a claim virginity. How can you find a virgin from marriage? where she entered the wedding canopy and did not engage in intercourse.
llm_translation: And there is one who teaches her a tradition: A virgin, a widow, a divorced woman who is exempt from marriage contracts - their marriage contract is a hundred, and they do not have a claim for virginity. How does a virgin who is exempt from marriage contracts find a husband? For example, if she entered the wedding canopy and did not consummate the marriage.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, כְּנָסָהּ בְּחֶזְקַת בְּתוּלָה וְנִמְצֵאת בְּעוּלָה — כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מָנֶה. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ בְּעָלְמָא לֵית לַהּ כְּלָל, וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא שֶׁהֲרֵי נִכְנְסָה לְחוּפָּה.
human_translation: Rabba said: That is to say, one married with the presumptive status of a virgin and she was found a non-virgin, her marriage contract is one hundred dinars. Rav Ashi said: In general, actually, I say to you in general, she does not at all, But here it is different, because she entered the wedding canopy.
llm_translation: Rabba said: This means, she entered with the presumption of virginity and was found to be married - her marriage contract is valid. Rav Ashe said: Always say to yourself that in the world there is no such thing at all, and here it is different because she entered the bridal chamber.

hebrew_text: וְנֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא תַּחְתָּיו זִינְּתָה! אָמַר רַב שֵׁרֵבְיָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ וּבָעַל לְאַלְתַּר.
human_translation: And let us be concerned that perhaps she committed adultery while under Rav Sherevya said: where he betrothed and engaged in intercourse immediately.
llm_translation: And suspicion lest underneath her there is a prostitute! Rav She'revya said: For example, he betrothed and immediately married her.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַבָּרַיְיתָא — כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אַמַּתְנִיתִין, וּמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַמַּתְנִיתִין — אֲבָל אַבָּרַיְיתָא לָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּמָצֵי אָמַר לַהּ: אֲנָא אַעֵדִים סְמַכִי.
human_translation: The one who taught with regard to the baraita , all the more so with regard to the mishna. the one who taught with regard to the mishna, however, not with regard to the baraita , due to that say to her: I relied on witnesses.
llm_translation: One who teaches in the vernacular — certainly in the vernacular, and one who teaches in the vernacular — but not in the vernacular, because he can say to him: "I am a witness, rely on me."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹכֵל אֵצֶל חָמִיו בִּיהוּדָה שֶׁלֹּא בְּעֵדִים — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִטְעוֹן טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמִּתְיַיחֵד עִמָּהּ.
human_translation: who eats at his father-in-law in Judea without witnesses is unable to make a claim concerning virginity because that he secluded himself with her,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who eats at his father-in-law's in Judea without witnesses - cannot claim the virginity of his wife, because he is intimate with her.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִדְּקָתָנֵי ״הָאוֹכֵל״, מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא דּוּכְתָּא בִּיהוּדָה נָמֵי דְּלָא אָכֵיל. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בִּיהוּדָה נָמֵי מְקוֹמוֹת מְקוֹמוֹת יֵשׁ. כִּדְתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: בִּיהוּדָה, בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מְיַיחֲדִין אֶת הֶחָתָן וְאֶת הַכַּלָּה שָׁעָה אַחַת קוֹדֶם כְּנִיסָתָן לַחוּפָּה, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא לִבּוֹ גַּס בָּהּ, וּבַגָּלִיל לֹא הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין כֵּן.
human_translation: From that teaches who eats, by inference that there is also a place in Judea where does not eat Abaye said: Conclude from it that in Judea too there are places as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda said: In Judea, at first they would seclude the groom and bride for a brief period before their entry into the wedding canopy, so that he would accustomed to her And in the Galilee they did not do so.
llm_translation: Gemara: From the fact that it is written "the one who eats," it implies that there is a place in Judea where they do not eat. Abaye said: Learn from this that in Judea there are places, there are places. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: In Judea, in the beginning, they used to unite the groom and the bride one hour before they entered the wedding canopy, so that his heart would be joyful with her, but in the Galilee they did not do so.

hebrew_text: בִּיהוּדָה, בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מַעֲמִידִין לָהֶם שְׁנֵי שׁוֹשְׁבִינִין, אֶחָד לוֹ וְאֶחָד לָהּ, כְּדֵי לְמַשְׁמֵשׁ אֶת הֶחָתָן וְאֶת הַכַּלָּה בִּשְׁעַת כְּנִיסָתָן לַחוּפָּה, וּבַגָּלִיל לֹא הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין כֵּן.
human_translation: In Judea, at first they would appoint for them two groomsmen [ shushvinin ], one for him and one for her, in order to examine the groom and the bride at the time of their entry into the wedding canopy And in the Galilee they would not do so.
llm_translation: In Judea, initially they would appoint for them two ushers, one for him and one for her, in order to serve the groom and the bride at the time of their entering the wedding canopy, but in the Galilee they would not do so.

hebrew_text: בִּיהוּדָה, בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ שׁוֹשְׁבִינִין יְשֵׁנִים בַּבַּיִת שֶׁחָתָן וְכַלָּה יְשֵׁנִים בָּהּ, וּבַגָּלִיל לֹא הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין כֵּן.
human_translation: In Judea, at first the groomsmen would sleep in the house in which the groom and bride sleep, And in the Galilee they would not do so.
llm_translation: In Judea, initially they would seat the groom and the bride who were asleep in the house, and in the Galilee they would not do so.

hebrew_text: וְכֹל שֶׁלֹּא נָהַג כַּמִּנְהָג הַזֶּה — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִטְעוֹן טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים. אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַרֵישָׁא, ״כֹּל שֶׁנָּהַג״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And anyone who did not conduct in accordance with this custom cannot make a claim concerning virginity Concerning which If we say concerning the first clause Anyone who conducted it needed to say,
llm_translation: "And all that did not follow this custom - cannot claim the argument of virgins. Ahaiya? If you say the first, 'all that he practiced' - it requires it!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַסֵּיפָא, ״כֹּל שֶׁלֹּא מוּשְׁמַשׁ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rather, concerning the latter clause Anyone who was not examined it needed
llm_translation: Rather, the latter clause, "anything that has not been used," is required!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְעוֹלָם אַרֵישָׁא, וּתְנִי: ״כֹּל שֶׁנָּהַג״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְהָא ״כֹּל שֶׁלֹּא נָהַג״ קָתָנֵי. אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל שֶׁלֹּא נָהַג מִנְהַג גָּלִיל בַּגָּלִיל, אֶלָּא מִנְהַג יְהוּדָה בַּגָּלִיל — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִטְעוֹן טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם אַסֵּיפָא, וּתְנִי: ״כֹּל שֶׁלֹּא מוּשְׁמַשׁ״.
human_translation: Abaye said: Actually, concerning the first clause; and and teach: Anyone who conducted Rava said to him: But isn’t it teaching Anyone who did not conduct Rather, Rava said this is what is saying: Anyone who did not practice the custom of the Galilee in the Galilee, but the custom of Judea in the Galilee, cannot make a claim concerning virginity Rav Ashi said: Actually, concerning the latter clause, and teach: Anyone who was not examined.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Always the first, and it teaches: "Anyone who is accustomed." Rava said to him: But doesn't it teach "Anyone who is not accustomed"? Rather, Rava said, this is what it means: Anyone who is not accustomed to the custom of the Galilee in the Galilee, but rather the custom of Judea in the Galilee — he cannot make a claim of virginity. Rav Ashi said: Always the last, and it teaches: "Anyone who is not engaged."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַחַת אַלְמְנַת יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאַחַת אַלְמְנַת כֹּהֲנִים — כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מָנֶה. בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל כֹּהֲנִים הָיוּ גּוֹבִין לִבְתוּלָה אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת זוּז, וְלֹא מִיחוּ בְּיָדָם חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: both a widow an Israelite woman and a widow of priests, her marriage contract is one hundred dinars. A court of priests would collect four hundred dinars for a virgin and the Sages did not reprimand them.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One widow of an Israelite and one widow of priests - her marriage contract is counted. The court of priests used to collect four hundred zuz for a virgin, and the Sages did not protest against them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: וְאַלְמְנַת כֹּהֲנִים — כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מָאתַיִם. וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן: אַחַת אַלְמְנַת יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאַחַת אַלְמְנַת כֹּהֲנִים כְּתוּבָּתָן מָנֶה!
human_translation: taught And a widow of priests, her marriage contract is two hundred But didn’t we learn both a widow an Israelite woman and a widow of priests, their marriage contract is one hundred dinars?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: And the widow of a Kohen - her Kesuvah is two hundred. And we learned: One widow of Yisrael and one widow of Kohanim, their Kesuvah is counted!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: שְׁתֵּי תַּקָּנוֹת הֲווֹ, מֵעִיקָּרָא תַּקִּינוּ לִבְתוּלָה אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת זוּז, וּלְאַלְמָנָה מָנֶה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: There were two ordinances Initially, the instituted for a virgin four hundred dinars, and for a widow, one hundred dinars.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Two enactments there were, initially they enacted for a virgin four hundred zuz, and for a widow a maneh.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דִּמְזַלְזְלִי בְּהוּ, תַּקִּינוּ לְהוּ מָאתַן. כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דְּקָא פָּרְשִׁין מִינַּיְיהוּ, דְּאָמְרִי: עַד דְּנָסְבִינַן אַלְמְנַת כֹּהֲנִים — נֵיזִיל נִיסֵּיב בְּתוּלָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל, אַהְדְּרִינְהוּ לְמִלְּתַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Once saw that were demeaning they instituted for them two hundred Once they saw that were distancing from them, as they said: Instead of marrying a widow priests let us go marry a virgin Israelite woman they restored to their status.
llm_translation: As soon as they saw that he was treating them with contempt, they imposed a fine upon him. As soon as they saw that he was separating from them, saying, "Until we marry a daughter of priests," they went and married a virgin daughter of Israel, and then they returned to their original matters.

hebrew_text: בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל כֹּהֲנִים כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל כֹּהֲנִים בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ מִשְׁפָּחוֹת הַמְיוּחָסוֹת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, אִם רָצוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהַכֹּהֲנִים עוֹשִׂין — עוֹשִׂין.
human_translation: a court of priests Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Not only with regard to a court of priests did say but even families of distinguished lineage in Israel. If they wanted to act as the priests do, they may act
llm_translation: The court of the priests said: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Not only the court of the priests alone said this, but even the families that are genealogically connected in Israel, if they wish to act as the priests do, they may do so.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הָרוֹצֶה לַעֲשׂוֹת כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהַכֹּהֲנִים עוֹשִׂין, כְּגוֹן בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן, וּבַת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — עוֹשִׂין. בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן וּבַת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא דְּאִיכָּא צַד כְּהוּנָּה. אֲבָל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — לָא!
human_translation: raises an objection One who sought to act as the priests do, where an Israelite woman to a priest, or the daughter of a priest to an Israelite, may act an Israelite woman to a priest, or the daughter of a priest to an Israelite, where there is an aspect of priesthood However, the daughter of an Israelite to an Israelite, no,
llm_translation: Challenger: One who wishes to act in the manner of the priests, such as a daughter of Israel to a priest, and a daughter of a priest to an Israelite — they may do so. A daughter of Israel to a priest and a daughter of a priest to an Israelite, that is where there is an aspect of priesthood. But a daughter of Israel to an Israelite — no!

hebrew_text: לָא מִבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִבַּעְיָא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, דְּלָא מָצֵי אָמַר לַהּ עַלּוֹיֵי קָא מְעַלֵּינָא לִיךְ, אֲבָל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן, דְּמָצֵי אָמַר לַהּ עַלּוֹיֵי קָא מְעַלֵּינָא לִיךְ — אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: is stated It is not necessary. It is not necessary the daughter of an Israelite to an Israelite, as cannot say to her: I am raising your However, an Israelite woman to a priest, where he can say to her: I am raising your say no, teaches us
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "He did not mean this: A daughter of Israel to an Israelite, for he cannot say to her, 'I am better than you.' But a daughter of Israel to a Kohen, for he can say to her, 'I am better than you' — say no, he is implying this to us."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹשֵׂא אֶת הָאִשָּׁה וְלֹא מָצָא לָהּ בְּתוּלִים. הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: מִשֶּׁאֵרַסְתַּנִי נֶאֱנַסְתִּי, וְנִסְתַּחֲפָה שָׂדֵהוּ. וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: לֹא כִּי, אֶלָּא עַד שֶׁלֹּא אֵרַסְתִּיךָ, וְהָיָה מִקָּחִי מִקָּח טָעוּת — רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמְרִים: נֶאֱמֶנֶת. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִפִּיהָ אָנוּ חַיִּין, אֶלָּא הֲרֵי זוֹ בְּחֶזְקַת בְּעוּלָה עַד שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְאָרֵס, וְהִטְעַתּוּ, עַד שֶׁתָּבִיא רְאָיָה לִדְבָרֶיהָ.
human_translation: who marries a woman and did not find her hymen she says: After you betrothed me I was raped, and his, field was inundated, And he says: No; rather, before I betrothed you, and my transaction was a mistaken transaction. Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is deemed credible. Rabbi Yehoshua says: not from her mouth we conduct our lives; rather, this the presumptive status of one who engaged in intercourse when she was not yet betrothed and she misled him, until she brings proof her statement.
llm_translation: It was taught: One who marries a woman and does not find virginity in her. She says: "Since you betrothed me, I have been subjected to coercion, and his field was uncovered." And he says: "No, rather, until I betrothed you, and my acquisition was an erroneous acquisition." Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is believed. Rabbi Yehoshua says: We do not rely on her words alone, rather, she remains in the status of a married woman until she gets married, and you have misled him until she brings evidence to support her words.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִתְּמַר: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ — רַב יְהוּדָה וְרַב הוּנָא אָמְרִי: חַיָּיב, וְרַב נַחְמָן וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמְרִי: פָּטוּר. רַב הוּנָא וְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמְרִי חַיָּיב — בָּרִי וְשֶׁמָּא בָּרִי עָדִיף. רַב נַחְמָן וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמְרִי פָּטוּר — אוֹקִי מָמוֹנָא בְּחֶזְקַת מָרֵיהּ.
human_translation: It was stated: I have one hundred dinars in your possession, and the other says: I don’t know, Rav Yehuda and Rav Huna say: obligated and Rav Naḥman and Rabbi Yoḥanan say: exempt Rav Huna and Rav Yehuda say obligated certain and an uncertain certain prevails. Rav Naḥman and Rabbi Yoḥanan say: exempt Establish the money in the possession of its owner,
llm_translation: Gemara: "He appointed to me in your hand," and the other one says: "I do not know" - Rav Yehudah and Rav Huna said: liable, and Rav Nachman and Rabbi Yochanan said: exempt. Rav Huna and Rav Yehudah said liable - a clear case is preferable. Rav Nachman and Rabbi Yochanan said exempt - the money is established in the possession of its owner.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: הָא דְּרַב הוּנָא וְרַב יְהוּדָה — דִּשְׁמוּאֵל הִיא. דִּתְנַן: הָיְתָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת, וְאָמְרוּ לָהּ: מָה טִיבוֹ שֶׁל עוּבָּר זֶה? מֵאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי, וְכֹהֵן הוּא — רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמְרִים: נֶאֱמֶנֶת. וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: This of Rav Huna and Rav Yehuda is of Shmuel, as we learned who was pregnant, and said to her: What is the nature of this fetus, from a man so-and-so and he is a priest Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is deemed credible, Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: This of Rav Huna and Rav Yehuda - it is Shmuel. As we learned: She was pregnant, and they said to her: What is the nature of this fetus? From a certain man, and he is a kohen - Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: It is trustworthy. And Rav Yehuda said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is according to Rabban Gamliel.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה לְרַב יְהוּדָה: שִׁינָּנָא, אֲמַרְתְּ לַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אַף בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה. מַאי אַף בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה? אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר אוֹקֵי מָמוֹנָא בְּחֶזְקַת מָרֵיהּ — אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בָּרִי עָדִיף.
human_translation: And Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda said to Rav Yehuda: Big-toothed one [ shinnana ], you said to us in the name of Shmuel halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel even in the first What even the first? despite the fact that there is to say: Establish the money in the possession of its owner, Rabban Gamliel said certain prevails
llm_translation: And Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah said to Rav Yehudah: Shinana, you told us in the name of Shmuel: The halakha follows Rabban Gamliel even in the first case. What is "even in the first case"? Even though there is reason to say that he is grasping his money with the presumption of his master - Rabban Gamliel said: clarity is preferable.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַב יְהוּדָה וְרַב הוּנָא דְּאָמְרִי כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְרַב נַחְמָן וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמְרִי כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ?
human_translation: Let us say Rav Yehuda and Rav Huna who say in accordance with Rabban Gamliel, And Rav Naḥman and Rabbi Yoḥanan who say in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua,
llm_translation: Let us say, Rav Yehudah and Rav Huna who say like Rabban Gamliel, and Rav Nachman and Rabbi Yochanan who say like Rabbi Yehoshua?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב נַחְמָן: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי, אֲפִילּוּ כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל — עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הָתָם, אֶלָּא דְּאִיכָּא מִגּוֹ. אֲבָל הָכָא, מַאי מִגּוֹ אִיכָּא?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to you: which I said, is even in accordance with Rabban Gamliel. Rabban Gamliel says his ruling only there, where there is a miggo , However here, what miggo is there
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav Nachman: I, who said, even like Rabban Gamliel - until here did not say Rabban Gamliel there, but that there is a difference. But here, what difference is there?

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הָתָם אֶלָּא דְּאָמְרִינַן אוֹקְמַהּ אַחֲזָקָה, אֲבָל הָכָא, מַאי חֲזָקָה אִית לֵיהּ לְהַאי?
human_translation: Alternatively, Rabban Gamliel says his ruling only there, where we say: Establish her presumptive status However here, what presumptive status does this have
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Iy namei: ad kan lo ka'amar Rabban Gamliel hatam ellah de'amrinan okmah achazakah, aval hacha, mai chazakah it lei lehai?" English translation: "If you say 'namei,' until here Rabban Gamliel did not say, there rather that we say 'established possession,' but here, what established possession does he have for this?"

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא כִּדְקָא מְשַׁנֵּינַן, דְּרַב נַחְמָן הוּא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל,
human_translation: Indeed, also reasonable as we are teaching, that it is Rav Naḥman who said in accordance Rabban Gamliel.
llm_translation: Thus it was explained as it is taught, for Rav Nachman is the one who said like Rabban Gamliel,

hebrew_text: דְּאִם כֵּן, קַשְׁיָא הִלְכְתָא אַהִלְכְתָא. דְּקַיְימָא לַן הִלְכְתָא כְּרַב נַחְמָן בְּדִינֵי, וּבְהָא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כִּדְמִשְּׁנֵינַן. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Because if so, difficult, halakha halakha . Since, we maintain the halakha in accordance with Rav Naḥman in civil law; and, in that Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha in accordance with Rabban Gamliel. Rather, not conclude from as we are teaching, conclude from it
llm_translation: If so, the question is a question of halakha. For we have established the halakha like Rav Nachman in matters of law, and in this matter Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is like Rabban Gamliel. But do not infer from this as we have learned. Infer from this.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: מוּכַּת עֵץ אֲנִי. וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: לֹא כִי, אֶלָּא דְּרוּסַת אִישׁ אַתְּ. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמְרִים: נֶאֱמֶנֶת. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִפִּיהָ אָנוּ חַיִּין, אֶלָּא הֲרֵי זוֹ בְּחֶזְקַת דְּרוּסַת אִישׁ, עַד שֶׁתָּבִיא רְאָיָה לִדְבָרֶיהָ.
human_translation: she says: I ruptured by wood, and says: No; rather, you are trampled by a man, Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is deemed credible Rabbi Yehoshua says: not from her mouth we conduct our lives; rather, she the presumptive status of was trampled by a man, until she brings proof her statement
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: She says, "I am a wooden vessel." And he says, "No, rather, you are a crushed vessel." Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is believed. But Rabbi Yehoshua says: We are not dependent on her words alone, rather, this is in the presumption of a crushed vessel, until evidence is brought to support her words.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טַעֲנָתַיְיהוּ בְּמַאי? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: בְּמָאתַיִם וּמָנֶה. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: בְּמָנֶה וְלֹא כְּלוּם.
human_translation: What are their claims? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: two hundred and one hundred dinars. Rabbi Elazar said: one hundred dinars; and nothing at all.
llm_translation: The Gemara: With what did they load it? Rabbi Yochanan said: With two hundred and fifty. Rabbi Elazar said: With fifty and not more.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: בְּמָאתַיִם וּמָנֶה, סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: בֵּין הִכִּיר בָּהּ, וּבֵין לֹא הִכִּיר בָּהּ — מָאתַיִם. וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: בְּמָנֶה וְלֹא כְּלוּם — סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבָּנַן, דְּאָמְרִי: בֵּין הִכִּיר בָּהּ, בֵּין לֹא הִכִּיר בָּהּ — מָנֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: is two hundred or one hundred dinars, holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who said: Whether was aware that her or whether he was not aware of her two hundred And Rabbi Elazar says: The dispute is one hundred dinars or nothing at all, holds in accordance with the Rabbis, who said: Whether was aware that her whether he was not aware of her one hundred dinars.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: With two hundred and fifty, he holds like Rabbi Meir, who said: Whether he recognized her or did not recognize her - two hundred. And Rabbi Elazar said: With a hundred and not a thing, he holds like the Rabbis, who said: Whether he recognized her or did not recognize her - a hundred.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לֹא קָאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן — דְּקָא מוֹקֵי לַהּ כְּרַבָּנַן. אֶלָּא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר?
human_translation: Granted, Rabbi Elazar did not state in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan because he establish in accordance with the Rabbis, However, what is the reason that Rabbi Yoḥanan did not state in accordance with Rabbi Elazar?
llm_translation: In truth, Rabbi Elazar did not say like Rabbi Yochanan - for he supports her like the Sages. Rather, what is the reason that Rabbi Yochanan did not say like Rabbi Elazar?

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר: כְּנָסָהּ בְּחֶזְקַת בְּתוּלָה וְנִמְצֵאת בְּעוּלָה — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה מָנֶה. הָכָא, הוּא קָאָמַר מָנֶה, וְהִיא קָאָמְרָה מָנֶה, מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין טַעֲנָה דִידֵיהּ לְטַעֲנָה דִידַהּ?
human_translation: he holds: married with the presumptive status of a virgin, and she is found to be a non-virgin, she marriage contract of one hundred here, he is saying one hundred dinars; and she is saying one hundred dinars. What is there between his claim and her claim?
llm_translation: He holds: if she entered with the presumption of virginity and was found to be married - she has a marriage document. Here, he is saying "marriage document," and she is saying "marriage document," what is the difference between her claim and his claim?

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר — הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי: חֲדָא לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרָמֵי בַּר חָמָא,
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Elazar, that is teaches two One to exclude of Rami bar Ḥama,
llm_translation: In truth, to Rabbi Elazar - that is what is taught in two: one to go out from the south of the sun,

hebrew_text: וַחֲדָא לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן תַּרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: And one to exclude which Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin Rav Sheshet said: However, to Rabbi Yoḥanan, why do I two
llm_translation: And one time, when they went out from the lecture hall of Rav Chiya bar Avin, Rav Sheshet said: Rather, according to Rabbi Yochanan, why do I need two?

hebrew_text: חֲדָא לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וַחֲדָא לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. קַמַּיְיתָא — לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר מִיגּוֹ — לָא מְהֵימְנָא. בָּתְרָיְיתָא — לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּלֵיכָּא לְמֵימַר מִיגּוֹ, מְהֵימְנָא.
human_translation: One to convey to you the far-reaching nature of Rabban Gamliel and one to convey to you the far-reaching nature of Rabbi Yehoshua The first conveys to you the far-reaching nature of Rabbi Yehoshua: That even though there is to say miggo , she is not deemed credible. The second conveys to you the far-reaching nature of Rabban Gamliel: That even though there is no to say miggo , she is deemed credible.
llm_translation: One to inform you of the strength of Rabban Gamliel, and one to inform you of the strength of Rabbi Yehoshua. The first case - to inform you of the strength of Rabbi Yehoshua, that even though there is no water to say from, we do not believe. The latter case - to inform you of the strength of Rabban Gamliel, that even though there is no water to say from, we believe.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רָאוּהָ מְדַבֶּרֶת עִם אֶחָד, וְאָמְרוּ לָהּ: מָה טִיבוֹ שֶׁל אִישׁ זֶה? אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי, וְכֹהֵן הוּא. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמְרִים: נֶאֱמֶנֶת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִפִּיהָ אָנוּ חַיִּין, אֶלָּא הֲרֵי זוֹ בְּחֶזְקַת בְּעוּלָה לְנָתִין וּלְמַמְזֵר, עַד שֶׁתָּבִיא רְאָיָה לִדְבָרֶיהָ.
human_translation: saw speaking to one and they said to her: What is the nature [ tivo ] of this man? He is a man so-and-so and he is a priest; Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is deemed credible, and Rabbi Yehoshua says: not from her mouth we conduct our lives. Rather, she the presumptive status of engaged in intercourse with a Gibeonite or with a mamzer , until she brings proof her statement.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a woman was seen speaking with a certain man, and they asked her, "What is the character of this man?" She replied, "He is so-and-so, and he is a priest." Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is believed. But Rabbi Yehoshua says: We do not rely on her testimony alone, for she is presumed to be with a non-Jew or a mamzer, until she brings proof to support her words.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת, וְאָמְרוּ לָהּ: מָה טִיבוֹ שֶׁל עוּבָּר זֶה? מֵאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי, וְכֹהֵן הוּא. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמְרִים: נֶאֱמֶנֶת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִפִּיהָ אָנוּ חַיִּין, אֶלָּא הֲרֵי זוֹ בְּחֶזְקַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת לְנָתִין וּלְמַמְזֵר, עַד שֶׁתָּבִיא רְאָיָה לִדְבָרֶיהָ.
human_translation: if was pregnant, and said to her: What is the nature of this fetus? It is from a man so-and-so and he is a priest; Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is deemed credible, and Rabbi Yehoshua says: not from her mouth we conduct our lives. Rather, she the presumptive status of conceived from a Gibeonite or a mamzer , until she brings proof her statement.
llm_translation: She was pregnant, and they said to her: What is the lineage of this fetus? From a certain man, and he is a priest. Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is believed, and Rabbi Yehoshua says: We do not rely on her testimony, but rather she is presumed to be pregnant for a bastard or a Natin until she brings proof to her words.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי מְדַבֶּרֶת? זְעֵירִי אָמַר: נִסְתְּרָה, רַב אַסִּי אָמַר: נִבְעֲלָה. בִּשְׁלָמָא לִזְעֵירִי, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי מְדַבֶּרֶת. אֶלָּא לְרַב אַסִּי, מַאי מְדַבֶּרֶת? לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״אָכְלָה וּמָחֲתָה פִיהָ וְאָמְרָה לֹא פָעַלְתִּי אָוֶן״.
human_translation: What is speaking Ze’eiri said: she secluded herself Rav Asi said: she engaged in intercourse. Granted, according to Ze’eiri, that is teaches speaking, However, according to Rav Asi, what is speaking a euphemism, as it is written “She eats and wipes her mouth and says: I have done no wickedness”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, what is she speaking? Zeiri said: she is hidden, Rav Assi said: she is married. According to Zeiri, it is well, that is what the Mishnah teaches about speaking. But according to Rav Assi, what is she speaking? For a higher level of sleep, as it is written: "She ate and wiped her mouth and said, 'I have done no wrong.'"

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לִזְעֵירִי — הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי: ״מְדַבֶּרֶת״, וּ״מְעוּבֶּרֶת״. אֶלָּא לְרַב אַסִּי — תַּרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Granted, according to Ze’eiri, that is that teaches two speaking and pregnant. However, according to Rav Asi, why do I two
llm_translation: In truth, for a small amount - that is what is taught in two: "speaking" and "crossing over." Rather, for Rav Assi - why do I need two?

hebrew_text: חֲדָא, לְהַכְשִׁיר בָּהּ. וַחֲדָא, לְהַכְשִׁיר בְּבִתָּהּ.
human_translation: one to deem her fit And one to deem her daughter fit
llm_translation: One, to make it fit for use. And one, to make it fit for its daughter.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: לְדִבְרֵי הַמַּכְשִׁיר בָּהּ — מַכְשִׁיר בְּבִתָּהּ. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: לְדִבְרֵי הַמַּכְשִׁיר בָּהּ — פּוֹסֵל בְּבִתָּהּ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? רַב אַסִּי סָבַר כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר לְדִבְרֵי הַמַּכְשִׁיר בָּהּ — מַכְשִׁיר בְּבִתָּהּ.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says: to the statement of the one who deems her fit he deems her daughter fit However, according to the one who says: to the statement of the one who deems her fit he deems her daughter unfit, what is there to say? Rav Asi holds in accordance with the one who said: to the statement of the one who deems her fit he deems her daughter fit
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says: in matters that render it fit - it renders her fit. Rather, for the one who says: in matters that render it fit - it renders her unfit, what can be said? Rav Assi holds like the one who says: in matters that render it fit - it renders her fit.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: לִזְעֵירִי דְּאָמַר מַאי ״מְדַבֶּרֶת״ — נִסְתְּרָה, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לָא מְהֵימְנָא, הָאָמַר רַב: מַלְקִין עַל הַיִּחוּד — וְאֵין אוֹסְרִין עַל הַיִּחוּד!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: to Ze’eiri, who said: What is speaking? she secluded herself, and Rabbi Yehoshua said not deemed credible Didn’t Rav say: One flogs for seclusion, but one does not render forbidden for seclusion?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: According to the opinion of the one who says, "What is 'speaking'?" - it is hidden. And Rabbi Yehoshua said, "I do not agree." For Rav said: One is liable for yichud (seclusion) - but one does not prohibit yichud!

hebrew_text: לֵימָא דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ? אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ — מַעֲלָה עָשׂוּ בְּיוּחֲסִין.
human_translation: Let us say that not in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, Even say in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, established a higher standard with regard to lineage.
llm_translation: Let us say that it is not like Rabbi Yehoshua? Even if you say it is like Rabbi Yehoshua - they acted with genealogical matters.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: רָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּכְנְסָה עִם אֶחָד לְסֵתֶר,
human_translation: raises an objection: If saw that entered with one into seclusion,
llm_translation: Challenger: They raised an objection: If she was seen entering with one to a secluded place,

hebrew_text: אוֹ לְחוּרְבָּה — וְאָמְרוּ לָהּ: מָה טִיבוֹ שֶׁל אִישׁ זֶה? כֹּהֵן הוּא, וּבֶן אֲחִי אַבָּא הוּא. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמְרִים: נֶאֱמֶנֶת, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִפִּיהָ אָנוּ חַיִּין, אֶלָּא הֲרֵי זוֹ בְּחֶזְקַת בְּעוּלָה לְנָתִין וּלְמַמְזֵר, עַד שֶׁתָּבִיא רְאָיָה לִדְבָרֶיהָ.
human_translation: or into a ruin, and said to her: What is the nature of this man He is a priest, and he is the son of my father’s brother, Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is deemed credible. Rabbi Yehoshua says: not from her mouth we conduct our lives; rather, she the presumptive status of engaged in intercourse with a Gibeonite or with a mamzer , until she brings proof her statement.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Or to Churbah — and they said to her: What is the status of this man? He is a Kohen, and he is the son of the brother of the father. Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is believed. Rabbi Yehoshua says: We do not rely on her statement alone, rather, she is presumed to be a menstruant or a mamzer, until she brings proof to support her words."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לִזְעֵירִי — הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי: לְסֵתֶר אוֹ לְחוּרְבָּה. אֶלָּא לְרַב אַסִּי דְּאָמַר נִבְעֲלָה, תַּרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי? חֲדָא קָתָנֵי: לְסֵתֶר דְּחוּרְבָּה.
human_translation: Granted, according to Ze’eiri, that is that teaches two Into seclusion, and Into a ruin, However, according to Rav Asi, who said she had intercourse, why do I two is teaching one into the seclusion of a ruin,
llm_translation: In truth, for a small amount — that is what is taught: for concealment or for destruction. Rather, according to Rav Assi who said it was consumed, why do I need two? One is taught: for concealment of destruction.

hebrew_text: וְהָא לְסֵתֶר אוֹ לְחוּרְבָּה קָתָנֵי! חֲדָא לְחוּרְבָּה דְמָתָא, וַחֲדָא לְחוּרְבָּה דְּדַבְרָא. וּצְרִיכִי, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן חוּרְבָּה דְמָתָא — בְּהָא קָמַכְשַׁר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, מִשּׁוּם דְּרוֹב כְּשֵׁרִים אֶצְלָהּ. אֲבָל לְחוּרְבָּה דְּדַבְרָא, דְּרוֹב פְּסוּלִין אֶצְלָהּ — אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: But isn’t teaching Into seclusion or into a ruin? one to a ruin in the city and one to a ruin in the field, And are necessary, because if taught us a ruin in the city, in that Rabban Gamliel deems her fit due to that the majority in its proximity are honorable However, to a ruin in the field, where the majority in its proximity are unfit say concedes to Rabbi Yehoshua
llm_translation: And this regarding a hidden or exposed vessel is taught! One is referring to an exposed vessel of clay, and one is referring to an exposed vessel of metal. And it is necessary, for if we were to hear it referring to an exposed vessel of clay — in that case, Rabban Gamliel would validate it, because most vessels are valid with it. But for an exposed vessel of metal, because most vessels are invalid with it — say that Rabbi Yehoshua concedes to him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּהָהִיא — בְּהָהִיא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, אֲבָל בְּהָא — אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if taught us that in that Rabbi Yehoshua said However here, say concedes to Rabban Gamliel necessary.
llm_translation: "And if we were to hear in that case - in that case is speaking Rabbi Yehoshua, but in this case - I would say he agrees with Rabban Gamliel, it is necessary."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: זוֹ עֵדוּת שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה כְּשֵׁרָה לָהּ, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת. אָמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: אִי אַתֶּם מוֹדִים בִּשְׁבוּיָה שֶׁנִּשְׁבֵּית וְיֵשׁ לָהּ עֵדִים שֶׁנִּשְׁבֵּית, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת טְהוֹרָה אֲנִי, שֶׁאֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת?
human_translation: raises an objection This, is testimony that a woman is fit And Rabbi Yehoshua says: She is not deemed credible. Rabbi Yehoshua said to Do you not agree in the case of a woman who was taken captive, and she has witnesses that she was taken captive, and she says: I am pure, that she is not deemed credible?
llm_translation: Challenger: This is testimony that the woman is valid, and Rabbi Yehoshua says: She is not believed. Rabbi Yehoshua said to them: If you admit regarding captivity that she can be taken captive and there are witnesses that she was taken captive, and she says, "I am pure," is she not believed?

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֲבָל. וּמָה הֶפְרֵשׁ יֵשׁ בֵּין זוֹ לָזוֹ? לָזוֹ — יֵשׁ עֵדִים, ולָזוֹ — אֵין לָהּ עֵדִים.
human_translation: said to him: But And what difference is there between this and that For this there are witnesses But for this she does not have witnesses
llm_translation: They said to him: But. And what is the difference between this and that? This - has witnesses, and that - does not have witnesses.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: אַף לָזוֹ יֵשׁ עֵדִים, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּרֵיסָהּ בֵּין שִׁינֶּיהָ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: רוֹב גּוֹיִם פְּרוּצִים בַּעֲרָיוֹת הֵם. אָמַר לָהֶן: אֵין אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס לַעֲרָיוֹת.
human_translation: said to them: Even for that there are witnesses, because her belly is between her teeth, said to him: most gentiles are steeped in sexual immorality. said to them: There is no steward for sexual immorality,
llm_translation: He said to them: "Even for this one there are witnesses, for her comb is between her teeth." They said to him: "Most of the nations are licentious in their sexual behavior." He said to them: "Aphroditophos does not exempt them from licentiousness."

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּעֵדוּת אִשָּׁה בְּגוּפָהּ, אֲבָל עֵדוּת אִשָּׁה בְּבִתָּהּ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל הַוָּלָד שְׁתוּקִי.
human_translation: In what are these statements said? in the case of the testimony of a woman with regard to herself, However, testimony of a woman with regard to her daughter everyone agrees the child a shetuki ,
llm_translation: In what case are these words spoken? — In the testimony of a woman regarding herself, but the testimony of a woman regarding her daughter — everyone agrees that it is disregarded.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר לְהוּ וּמַאי קָמַהְדְּרִי לֵיהּ? הָכִי קָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: הֲשַׁבְתָּנוּ עַל הַמְעוּבֶּרֶת. מָה תְּשִׁיבֵנוּ עַל הַמְדַבֶּרֶת? אָמַר לָהֶם: מְדַבֶּרֶת הַיְינוּ שְׁבוּיָה. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: שָׁאנֵי שְׁבוּיָה, דְּרוֹב גּוֹיִם פְּרוּצִים בַּעֲרָיוֹת הֵם. אָמַר לָהֶם: הָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיסְתַּתַּר, אֵין אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס לַעֲרָיוֹת.
human_translation: What did he say to them and what did they reply to him? This is what are saying to him: You answered us concerning the pregnant woman, what will you answer us concerning the speaking said to them: speaking is the same as captive, said to him: a captive is different, as most gentiles are steeped in sexual immorality, said to them: this too, since she secluded herself There is no steward for sexual immorality,
llm_translation: What is he saying to him and what is he responding to him? This is what he is saying to him: "You have returned us to the past. What will you place upon us regarding the future?" He said to them: "The future is captivity." They said to him: "It is different with captivity, for most of the nations are licentious in their cities." He said to them: "Indeed, once it is permitted, there is no stopping the licentiousness in the cities."

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת תַּרְתֵּי — מְדַבֶּרֶת וּמְעוּבֶּרֶת. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב אַסִּי תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: In any event, is teaching two speaking, and pregnant, a conclusive refutation of Rav Asi, a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: The text states: "It teaches from here two — speaking and crossing over. The dispute of Rav Assi is a dispute."

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּהָתָם רוֹב פְּסוּלִין אֶצְלָהּ, וְהָכָא רוֹב כְּשֵׁרִין אֶצְלָהּ. מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: לְדִבְרֵי הַמַּכְשִׁיר — מַכְשִׁיר אֲפִילּוּ בְּרוֹב פְּסוּלִין, לְדִבְרֵי הַפּוֹסֵל — פּוֹסֵל אֲפִילּוּ בְּרוֹב כְּשֵׁרִים.
human_translation: And let derive that there, the majority in her proximity are unfit but here, the majority of the men in her proximity are honorable supports of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: to the statement of the one who deems her fit he deems her fit even in where the majority of the men are unfit. to the statement of the one who deems her unfit he deems her unfit even in the majority are fit.
llm_translation: And it should be derived from there that there, the majority are invalid near it, and here, the majority are valid near it. He assists Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. For Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: According to the words of the one who renders it fit - he renders it fit even with the majority of invalid ones; according to the words of the one who disqualifies - he disqualifies it even with the majority of valid ones.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְדִבְרֵי הַמַּכְשִׁיר בָּהּ — מַכְשִׁיר בְּבִתָּהּ. לְדִבְרֵי הַפּוֹסֵל בָּהּ — פּוֹסֵל בְּבִתָּהּ. וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: לְדִבְרֵי הַמַּכְשִׁיר בָּהּ — פּוֹסֵל בְּבִתָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: to the statement of the one who deems her fit he deems her daughter fit to the statement of the one who deems her unfit, he deems her daughter unfit But Rabbi Elazar says: to the statement of the one who deems her fit, he deems her daughter unfit.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: According to the words of one who validates it - he validates her with her daughter. According to the words of one who disqualifies it - he disqualifies her with her daughter. And Rabbi Elazar says: According to the words of one who validates it - he disqualifies her with her daughter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בִּשְׁלָמָא אִיהִי אִית לַהּ חֲזָקָה דְכַשְׁרוּת. בִּתָּהּ, לֵית לַהּ חֲזָקָה דְכַשְׁרוּת.
human_translation: Rabba said: What is the reason of Rabbi Elazar, granted, she has the presumptive status of fitness. Her daughter, does not have the presumptive status of fitness.
llm_translation: Rabba said, "What is the reason for Rabbi Elazar's statement: 'In a shulma, it has a strong presumption of validity. In a bata, it does not have a strong presumption of validity.'"

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּעֵדוּת אִשָּׁה בְּגוּפָהּ, אֲבָל עֵדוּת אִשָּׁה בְּבִתָּהּ —דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל הַוָּלָד שְׁתוּקִי. מַאי לָאו שְׁתוּקִי, וּפָסוּל. לָא: שְׁתוּקִי, וְכָשֵׁר.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan In what are these statements said? in the case of a woman’s testimony with regard to herself. However, testimony of a woman with regard to her daughter, everyone agrees the child is a shetuki . What, is it not a shetuki and unfit No, a shetuki , fit.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Rabbi Elazar to Rabbi Yochanan: In what case are these words said? — In the testimony of a woman in her own person, but the testimony of a woman regarding her daughter — everyone agrees that it is inadmissible. What is the reason that it is not inadmissible, and it is invalid? No, it is admissible, and it is valid.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא שְׁתוּקִי כָּשֵׁר? אִין, כְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עֲשָׂרָה כֹּהֲנִים עוֹמְדִים, וּפֵירַשׁ אֶחָד מֵהֶם וּבָעַל — הַוָּלָד שְׁתוּקִי.
human_translation: And is there a shetuki fit? Yes, as of Shmuel. As Shmuel said: ten priests standing and one of them left and engaged in intercourse, the child is a shetuki ,
llm_translation: "And is there a silent one who is valid? No, as Samuel said: For Samuel said: Ten priests are standing, and one of them separated and married - the offspring is silent."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״שְׁתוּקִי״? אִילֵימָא שֶׁמַּשְׁתִּיקִין אוֹתוֹ מִנִּכְסֵי אָבִיו — פְּשִׁיטָא, וּמִי יָדְעִינַן אֲבוּהּ מַנּוּ? אֶלָּא שֶׁמַּשְׁתִּיקִין אוֹתוֹ מִדִּין כְּהוּנָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיְתָה לּוֹ וּלְזַרְעוֹ אַחֲרָיו בְּרִית כְּהֻנַּת עוֹלָם״, מִי שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ מְיוּחָס אַחֲרָיו, יָצָא זֶה שֶׁאֵין זַרְעוֹ מְיוּחָס אַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: what is a shetuki ? If we say that one silences him from his father’s assets obvious. Do we know who his father is? Rather, that one silences him from the status of priesthood. as it is written: “And it shall be for him and for his offspring after him an everlasting covenant of priesthood” whose offspring are attributed to him, exclusion of this whose offspring are not attributed to him,
llm_translation: What is "Shetuki"? If you say that they silence him from his father's properties - it is obvious, but who knows his father's properties? Rather, they silence him from the status of priesthood, as it is written: "And it shall be for him and for his descendants after him an eternal covenant of priesthood." If his descendants are attributed after him, this one who has no descendants attributed after him is exempt.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא אָרוּס וַאֲרוּסָתוֹ דַּאֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, הִיא אָמְרָה: מִינֵּיהּ, וְהוּא אָמַר:
human_translation: a certain betrothed man and his betrothed, who came before Rav Yosef. She said from him, and he said:
llm_translation: That engaged man and his fiancée who came before Rav Yosef, she said: "From him," and he said:

hebrew_text: אִין, מִינַּאי. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לְמַאי נֵיחוּשׁ לַהּ? חֲדָא, דְּהָא קָא מוֹדֵה. וְעוֹד, הָא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Yes, from me. Rav Yosef said: with regard to what be concerned? First, he concedes And furthermore, didn’t Rav Yehuda say Shmuel said: The halakha in accordance with Rabban Gamliel,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ein, minnai. Amar Rav Yosef: Lemai neichush lah? Chadah, deha ka modeh. Ve'od, ha amar Rav Yehudah amar Shmuel: Halacha keRabban Gamliel." English translation: "No, from where? Rav Yosef said: For what should she be concerned? One, for he is admitting. And furthermore, for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halacha is like Rabban Gamliel."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וּבְהָא, כִּי לָא מוֹדֵה מַכְשַׁר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל? וְהָאָמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה: שִׁינָּנָא, הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְאַתְּ לָא תַּעֲבֵיד עוֹבָדָא עַד דְּאִיכָּא רוֹב כְּשֵׁרִין אֶצְלָהּ. וְהָכָא — רוֹב פְּסוּלִין אֶצְלָהּ!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: And in this when he does not admit Rabban Gamliel deems fit? But didn’t Shmuel say to Rav Yehuda: Big-toothed the halakha in accordance with Rabban Gamliel, but you should not perform an action unless the majority of the men in her proximity are honorable And here, the majority of the men in her proximity are unfit,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And in this case, does Rabban Gamliel not concede? And Shmuel said to Rav Yehudah: A sharp tooth, the halakha is like Rabban Gamliel, and you should not act until there are mostly valid ones with her. And here - mostly invalid ones with her!

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ תִּקְשֵׁי לָךְ הִיא גּוּפַהּ: הֲלָכָה, וְאַתְּ לָא תַּעֲבֵיד עוֹבָדָא?! אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר: הָא — לְכַתְּחִלָּה, הָא — דִּיעֲבַד. וְהָא נָמֵי, כְּדִיעֲבַד דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, itself should pose a difficulty for you, halakha and But you should not perform an action Rather, what have you to say This ab initio . That after the fact. And this too, is like after the fact,
llm_translation: "And to taste it is difficult for you, it is its essence: Halakha, and you do not perform the deed?! Rather, what do you have to say: This — initially, this — after the fact. And this too, is considered as after the fact."

hebrew_text: רָמֵי לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרָבָא: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת? וּרְמִינְהוּ: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא עַל אַלְמְנַת עִיסָּה, שֶׁהִיא כְּשֵׁרָה לַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Abaye raised a contradiction before Rava Did Rabbi Yehoshua say that is not deemed credible And raises a contradiction: Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira testified concerning the widow of a family of questionable lineage [ issa ], that she is fit to priesthood.
llm_translation: Abbaye raised an objection to Rava: Did Rabbi Yehoshua really say that she is not believed? But ask: Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Yehudah ben Beteira testified concerning a widow's dough that it is valid for the priesthood.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם: אִשָּׁה נִישֵּׂאת, בּוֹדֶקֶת וְנִישֵּׂאת. הָכָא, אִשָּׁה מְזַנָּה בּוֹדֶקֶת וּמְזַנָּה?!
human_translation: said to him: How can be compared? There, woman marries investigates and marries. Here, a woman engages in licentious intercourse investigates engages in licentious intercourse?
llm_translation: He said to him: Is this so?! There: a woman who is married, she examines and is married. Here: a woman who is promiscuous, she examines and is promiscuous?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ קַשְׁיָא, דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אַדְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לָא קַשְׁיָא? וְהָא קָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אָמַר לָהֶן רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: קִבַּלְנוּ עֵדוּתְכֶם, אֲבָל מָה נַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהֲרֵי גָּזַר רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי שֶׁלֹּא לְהוֹשִׁיב בֵּית דִּין עַל כָּךְ, שֶׁהַכֹּהֲנִים שׁוֹמְעִין לָכֶם לְרַחֵק אֲבָל לֹא לְקָרֵב.
human_translation: Rava said of Rabbi Yehoshua and of Rabbi Yehoshua difficult, of Rabban Gamliel and of Rabban Gamliel not difficult? But isn’t it taught in the latter clause Rabban Gamliel said to them: We accept your testimony but what we do, as Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai decreed not to convene a court for this because the priests obey you to distance but not to bring her near
llm_translation: Rava said: Regarding Rabbi Yehoshua, is Rabbi Yehoshua strict, but regarding Rabban Gamliel, is Rabban Gamliel not strict? And it teaches in the latter part: Rabban Gamliel said to them: We have accepted your testimony, but what shall we do, for Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai decreed not to establish a court for this purpose, so that the priests may listen to you from afar but not draw near.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אַדְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָתָם — בָּרִי, הָכָא — שֶׁמָּא.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: of Rabban Gamliel and of Rabban Gamliel is not difficult. There, a certain Here, an uncertain
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Due to Rabban Gamliel, it is not difficult. There — it is clear, here — perhaps.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָתָם — חַד סְפֵיקָא, הָכָא — תְּרֵי סְפֵיקֵי.
human_translation: of Rabbi Yehoshua and of Rabbi Yehoshua is not difficult. There, one uncertainty: Here, two uncertainties
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: It is not difficult. There — one doubt, here — two doubts.

hebrew_text: הִלְכָּךְ, לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: אַלִּים לֵיהּ בָּרִי, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּחַד סְפֵיקָא נָמֵי מַכְשִׁיר. וְקִיל לֵיהּ שֶׁמָּא, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בִּסְפֵק סְפֵיקָא נָמֵי פָּסֵיל. לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: אַלִּים לֵיהּ חַד סְפֵיקָא, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּבָרִי נָמֵי פָּסֵיל, וְקִיל לֵיהּ סְפֵק סְפֵיקָא, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁמָא נָמֵי מַכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: Therefore, to Rabban Gamliel, a certain powerful for him that even in one uncertainty, he also deems her fit And an uncertain insignificant for him that even in a compound uncertainty, he also deems her unfit to Rabbi Yehoshua, one uncertainty powerful for him that even in a certain he also deems her unfit. And a compound uncertainty is insignificant for him that even if she makes an uncertain he also deems her fit.
llm_translation: Therefore, according to Rabban Gamliel: One witness is effective for him, for even in a case of doubt, he is deemed valid. And he is lenient regarding him, lest one say that even in a case of double doubt, he is deemed invalid. According to Rabbi Yehoshua: One witness is effective for him in a case of doubt, for even in a clear case, he is deemed invalid. And he is stringent regarding him in a case of double doubt, for even in a case of uncertainty, he is deemed valid.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזוֹהִי אַלְמְנַת עִיסָּה? כֹּל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ לֹא מִשּׁוּם מַמְזֵרוּת, וְלֹא מִשּׁוּם נְתִינוּת, וְלֹא מִשּׁוּם עַבְדֵי מְלָכִים. אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר:
human_translation: the Rabbis taught: Who is the widow of a family of questionable lineage any that does not have neither due to mamzer status, nor due to Gibeonite status, nor due to slaves of kings, Rabbi Meir said:
llm_translation: The Sages taught: What is a widow of dough? Any woman who does not have in her either the status of a mamzeret, or the status of a natinut, or the status of the servants of kings. Rabbi Meir said:

hebrew_text: שָׁמַעְתִּי, כֹּל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ אֶחָד מִכׇּל אֵלּוּ — מַשִּׂיאִין לַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: I heard any that has none of these one her to marry the priesthood.
llm_translation: I have heard, anything that does not have one of all these - they elevate to the priesthood.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא אוֹמֵר כִּדְבָרָיו: אֵיזוֹהִי אַלְמְנַת עִיסָּה — כֹּל שֶׁנִּטְמַע בָּהּ סְפֵק חָלָל.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Meir, and likewise Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya would say in accordance with his statement: Who is the widow of a family of questionable lineage? any which uncertainty ḥalal was assimilated
