llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Meir, and so too Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya used to say in accordance with his words: What is a dough widow? - Any dough in which a doubt has been absorbed is considered as if it had been hollowed out.

hebrew_text: מַכִּירִין יִשְׂרָאֵל מַמְזֵרִים שֶׁבֵּינֵיהֶם, וְאֵין מַכִּירִין חֲלָלִין שֶׁבֵּינֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Jews identify the mamzerim that are among them, But they do not identify the ḥalalin among them.
llm_translation: Recognize Israelites mamzerim between them, and do not recognize chalalim between them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אֵיזוֹהִי אַלְמְנַת עִיסָּה — כֹּל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ לֹא מִשּׁוּם מַמְזֵרוּת, וְלֹא מִשּׁוּם נְתִינוּת, וְלֹא מִשּׁוּם עַבְדֵי מְלָכִים. הָא חָלָל — כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: The Master said Who is the widow of a family of questionable lineage? any that does not have neither due to mamzer status, nor due to Gibeonite status, nor due to slaves of kings. However, ḥalal fit.
llm_translation: Master said: What is a widow of dough? — Anything that does not have prohibition neither due to mamzerut, nor due to natinut, nor due to the offspring of kings. If it is hollow — it is valid.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא הָנָךְ — דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, חָלָל נָמֵי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא! וְתוּ, אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: שָׁמַעְתִּי, כֹּל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ אֶחָד מִכׇּל אֵלּוּ מַשִּׂיאִין לַכְּהוּנָּה, הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא?!
human_translation: What is different these by Torah A ḥalal by Torah And furthermore, Rabbi Meir said: I heard any that has none of these one marries her to the priesthood. That is first tanna .
llm_translation: What is different about these? — That they are from the Torah, the most severe of the Torah! And furthermore, Rabbi Meir said: I have heard, anyone who does not have one of all of these disqualifies for the priesthood, is that the first Tanna?!

hebrew_text: וְתוּ: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא אוֹמֵר כִּדְבָרָיו: אֵיזוֹהִי אַלְמְנַת עִיסָּה — כֹּל שֶׁנִּטְמַע בָּהּ סְפֵק חָלָל, מַכִּירִין יִשְׂרָאֵל מַמְזֵרִים שֶׁבֵּינֵיהֶן וְאֵין מַכִּירִין חֲלָלִין שֶׁבֵּינֵיהֶן. וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ רֵישָׁא, חָלָל כָּשֵׁר!
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Meir, and likewise, Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya would say in accordance with his statement: Who is the widow of a family of questionable lineage? any which uncertainty ḥalal was assimilated. Jews identify the mamzerim that are among them but do not identify the ḥalalin among them. But didn’t you say the first clause ḥalal fit?
llm_translation: And come: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Meir, and so too Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says in accordance with his words: What is a widow of dough - anything that is mixed in it is a doubtful hollow. Israelites recognize mamzerim among themselves but do not recognize hollow ones among themselves. But didn't you say at the beginning, a hollow is valid!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַמְזֵר צוֹוֵחַ וְחָלָל שׁוֹתֵק אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ: תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: כֹּל פְּסוּל דְּקָרוּ לֵיהּ וְשָׁתֵיק — פָּסוּל. וְהָכִי קָאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא: אֵיזוֹהִי אַלְמְנַת עִיסָּה — כֹּל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ לֹא שְׁתוּק מַמְזֵרוּת, וְלֹא שְׁתוּק נְתִינוּת, וְלֹא שְׁתוּק עַבְדֵי מְלָכִים, וְלֹא שְׁתוּק חָלָל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: mamzer screams and ḥalal is silent, is between The first tanna holds: Anyone who call him unfit and he is silent, is unfit, And this is what the first tanna is saying: Who is the widow of a family of questionable lineage, any that has neither silence mamzer status, nor silence Gibeonite status, nor silence slaves of kings, nor silence ḥalal
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: A mamzer shouts and a chalal remains silent, there is a difference between them. The first Tanna holds: any disqualifying factor that is called out and remains silent - is disqualified. And thus the first Tanna said: What is a widow of dough? - Any woman who does not have in her neither the silence of mamzerut, nor the silence of natinut, nor the silence of royal slaves, nor the silence of a chalal.

hebrew_text: וְקָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר: הָנָךְ הוּא דְּקָא פָּסֵיל לֵיהּ בְּקָהָל, אֲבָל שְׁתוּק חָלָל — כָּשֵׁר. וְהָא דְּשָׁתֵיק — מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אִיכְפַּת לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir is saying to him: those because these render him unfit into the congregation However, silence ḥalal fit. And that he is silent is due to his indifference,
llm_translation: And he said to him, Rabbi Meir: This is the one who disqualifies it in the congregation, but if it is silent, it is valid. And the reason it is silent is because it does not care.

hebrew_text: וְקָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר לְתַנָּא קַמָּא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִי שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ דְּמַכְשַׁר רַבִּי מֵאִיר בִּשְׁתִיקָה — לָא דְּקָרוּ לֵיהּ ״חָלָל״ וְשָׁתֵיק, אֶלָּא דְּקָרוּ לֵיהּ ״מַמְזֵר״ וְשָׁתֵיק. וְהַאי דְּשָׁתֵיק, סָבַר מַמְזֵר קָלָא אִית לֵיהּ. אֲבָל מַמְזֵר וְצוֹוֵחַ, חָלָל וְשׁוֹתֵק — פָּסוּל. וְהַאי דְּאִשְׁתִּיק, סָבַר מִיסָּתְיֵיהּ דְּלָא מַפְּקִי לֵיהּ מִקָּהָל.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar is saying to the first tanna Rabbi Meir If you heard that Rabbi Meir deems fit, in silence not where they called him ḥalal and he is silent; rather, where they call him mamzer and he is silent. he is silent that he holds: a mamzer publicity, However, mamzer and he screams ḥalal and he is silent, he is unfit. And that he is silent is he holds: sufficient for him that they do not expel him from the congregation
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said to the first Tanna of Rabbi Meir: If you hear that Rabbi Meir deems something permissible through silence - it is not because they called it "chalal" and he remained silent, but rather because they called it "mamzer" and he remained silent. And the reason he remained silent is because he thought that "mamzer" is a lighter term. But if one is a mamzer and shouts, or a chalal and remains silent - they are disqualified. And the reason he remained silent is because he thought that his removal from the community would not be effective.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: שְׁתוּק מַמְזֵר — כָּשֵׁר, שְׁתוּק חָלָל — פָּסוּל. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: שְׁתוּק חָלָל — כָּשֵׁר, שְׁתוּק מַמְזֵר — פָּסוּל.
human_translation: It is taught one Rabbi Yosei says: silence mamzer fit; silence ḥalal unfit. It is taught another silence ḥalal fit; silence mamzer unfit.
llm_translation: It was taught in one Baraita, Rabbi Yosei says: Silent Mumzer is valid, silent Halal is invalid. And it was taught in another Baraita: Silent Halal is valid, silent Mumzer is invalid.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא תַּנָּא קַמָּא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: not difficult. This the first tanna in accordance with Rabbi Meir, this of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar in accordance with Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: Not difficult: This was taught first in the study hall of Rabbi Meir, this in the study hall of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּתִינוֹקֶת שֶׁיָּרְדָה לְמַלּאוֹת מַיִם מִן הָעַיִן, וְנֶאֱנָסָה. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי: אִם רוֹב אַנְשֵׁי הָעִיר מַשִּׂיאִין לִכְהוּנָּה, הֲרֵי זוֹ תִּינָּשֵׂא לִכְהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: an incident involving a young girl who descended to fill water from the spring, and she was raped, Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said: If the majority of the people of the city marry to priesthood, this young girl may be married to
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Yosei said: There was an incident with a young girl who went down to fill water from the spring, and she was coerced. Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri said: If the majority of the people of the city appoint someone to the priesthood, she shall be married to the priesthood.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי דְּאָמַר כְּמַאן? אִי כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל — אֲפִילּוּ בְּרוֹב פְּסוּלִין נָמֵי מַכְשַׁר. אִי כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ — אֲפִילּוּ בְּרוֹב כְּשֵׁרִים נָמֵי פָּסֵיל! אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב:
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: In accordance with whose that Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri stated If in accordance with Rabban Gamliel, even in the majority are flawed lineage as well, he deems fit If in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, even in the majority are unflawed lineage, he deems unfit said to this Rav Yehuda said Rav said:
llm_translation: Gemara said to him Rava to Rav Nachman: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri who said like whom? If like Rabban Gamliel - even with the majority of disqualified ones, they are still valid. If like Rabbi Yehoshua - even with the majority of valid ones, they are still disqualified! He said to him, so said Rav Yehudah said Rav:

hebrew_text: בִּקְרוֹנוֹת שֶׁל צִיפּוֹרִי הָיָה מַעֲשֶׂה, וְכִדְרַבִּי אַמֵּי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: וְהוּא שֶׁהָיְתָה סִיעָה שֶׁל בְּנֵי אָדָם כְּשֵׁרִין עוֹבֶרֶת לְשָׁם, וְכִדְרַבִּי יַנַּאי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: נִבְעֶלֶת בִּקְרוֹנוֹת כְּשֵׁרָה לַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: incident among the wagons [ keronot ] of Tzippori in accordance with Rabbi Ami, as Rabbi Ami said: And this is where there was a contingent of men of unflawed lineage passing there. And in accordance with Rabbi Yannai, as Rabbi Yannai said: If she engaged in intercourse in the wagons, she is fit to priesthood.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In the horns of birds there was an incident, as with Rabbi Ammi. For Rabbi Ammi said: And this was a group of people who were fit to go there, as with Rabbi Yannai. For Rabbi Yannai said: A woman who was pierced in her horns is fit for the priesthood.

hebrew_text: בִּקְרוֹנוֹת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא נִבְעֶלֶת בִּשְׁעַת קְרוֹנוֹת, כְּשֵׁרָה לַכְּהוּנָּה. אֲבָל פֵּירַשׁ אֶחָד מִצִּיפּוֹרִי וּבָעַל — הַוָּלָד שְׁתוּקִי.
human_translation: enter your mind in the wagons, Rather, she engage in intercourse at the time of the wagons, she is fit to priesthood. However, one left Tzippori and engaged in intercourse the child is a shetuki
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Bikronot sal'ka da'atach? Ella niv'eleit bish'at kronot, k'sherah lakehunah. Aval peirash echad mitzipori u'ba'al — havalad shutuki." English translation: "Have you lost your mind about the Bikronot? Rather, you were betrothed at the time of the Bikronot, fitting for the priesthood. But if one separates from his wife and marries another — the child is legitimate."

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר זְעֵירִי, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר זְעֵירִי אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הוֹלְכִין אַחַר רוֹב הָעִיר, וְאֵין הוֹלְכִין אַחַר רוֹב סִיעָה.
human_translation: similar this that when Rav Dimi came Ze’eiri said Rabbi Ḥanina said, and some say Ze’eiri said Rabbi Ḥanina said: One follows the majority of the city and one does not follow the majority of the contingent,
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Zeiri said, Rabbi Chanina said, and some say, Zeiri said Rabbi Chanina said: We follow the majority of the city, but we do not follow the majority of the group.

hebrew_text: כְּלַפֵּי לְיָיא?! הָנֵי נָיְידִי, וְהָנֵי קְבִיעִי וְקָיְימִי!
human_translation: On the contrary [ kelapei layya ], These are moving, And these are fixed and standing
llm_translation: Like the face of the lion?! These are moving, and those are fixed and established!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הוֹלְכִין אַחַר רוֹב הָעִיר, וְהוּא דְּאִיכָּא רוֹב סִיעָה בַּהֲדַהּ, וְאֵין הוֹלְכִין אַחַר רוֹב הָעִיר גְּרֵידְתָּא, וְלֹא אַחַר רוֹב סִיעָה גְּרֵידְתָּא. מַאי טַעְמָא? גְּזֵרָה רוֹב סִיעָה אַטּוּ רוֹב הָעִיר.
human_translation: Rather, One follows the majority of the city, and that is where there is a majority contingent with However, neither does one follow the majority of the city alone, nor follow the majority of the contingent alone. What is the reason a decree the majority of the contingent due to the majority of the city,
llm_translation: Rather: we follow after the majority of the city, and this is when there is a majority of the group in it, and we do not follow after the majority of a small area, nor after the majority of the group of a small area. What is the reason? Because the majority of the group is a decree, but not the majority of the city.

hebrew_text: וְרוֹב הָעִיר נָמֵי, אִי דְּקָא אָזְלִי אִינְהוּ לְגַבַּהּ: כֹּל דְּפָרֵישׁ — מֵרוּבָּא פָּרֵישׁ! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּקָא אָזְלָא אִיהִי לְגַבַּיְיהוּ, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ קָבוּעַ, וְאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כׇּל קָבוּעַ כְּמֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: But the majority of the city as well, if goes to her any that is separated separated from the majority? necessary only where she went to them, is fixed and Rabbi Zeira said: any fixed equally balanced,
llm_translation: And the majority of the city is silent, if they are going to the top: anyone who separates — separates from the majority! It is not necessary, for they are going to their tops, for it is established for him, and Rabbi Zeira said: Any established thing is like half and half.

hebrew_text: וּמִי בָּעֵינַן תְּרֵי רוּבֵּי? וְהָתַנְיָא: תֵּשַׁע חֲנוּיוֹת כּוּלָּן מוֹכְרוֹת בְּשַׂר שְׁחוּטָה, וְאַחַת מוֹכֶרֶת בְּשַׂר נְבֵלָה, וְלָקַח מֵאַחַת מֵהֶן וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ מֵאֵי זֶה מֵהֶן לָקַח — סְפֵיקוֹ אָסוּר. וּבַנִּמְצָא — הַלֵּךְ אַחַר הָרוֹב.
human_translation: And do we require two majorities Isn’t it taught nine stores all of which sell meat a slaughtered and one sells meat animal carcasses, and bought from one of and he does not know from which he bought uncertainty, is prohibited. And in found follow the majority
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And do we require two majorities? And it was taught: Nine butcher shops, all selling kosher meat, and one selling non-kosher meat, and one buys from one of them and does not know from which of them he bought — his doubt is forbidden. And in a case of something found — we follow the majority." English translation:

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא בְּשֶׁאֵין דַּלְתוֹת מְדִינָה נְעוּלוֹת, דְּקָא אָתֵי לַהּ רוּבָּא מֵעָלְמָא — וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁדַּלְתוֹת מְדִינָה נְעוּלוֹת! מַעֲלָה עָשׂוּ בְּיוּחֲסִין.
human_translation: And if you would say where the gates of the city are unlocked, where come from the majority outside but didn’t Rabbi Zeira say: Even if the city gates are locked, established a higher standard with regard to lineage.
llm_translation: And if you say that when the gates of the city are locked, he comes from the majority of the world - but didn't Rabbi Zeira say: Even though the gates of the city are locked! They made an exception in cases of lineage.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כׇּל קָבוּעַ — כְּמֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה דָּמֵי, בֵּין לְקוּלָּא בֵּין לְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: itself, Rabbi Zeira said: any fixed equally balanced, both leniency, stringency,
llm_translation: The body, Rabbi Zeira said: Any fixed — like half on half blood, whether for leniency or for stringency.

hebrew_text: מְנָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי זֵירָא הָא? אִילֵּימָא מִתֵּשַׁע חֲנוּיוֹת, כּוּלָּן מוֹכְרוֹת בְּשַׂר שְׁחוּטָה, וְאַחַת בְּשַׂר נְבֵלָה, וְלָקַח מֵאַחַת מֵהֶן וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ מֵאֵיזֶה מֵהֶן לָקַח — סְפֵיקוֹ אָסוּר, וּבַנִּמְצָא — הַלֵּךְ אַחַר הָרוֹב; הָתָם לְחוּמְרָא!
human_translation: From where does Rabbi Zeira If we say from nine stores all of which sell meat a slaughtered and one meat animal carcasses, and bought from one of and he does not know from which he bought uncertainty is prohibited. And in the found follow the majority There, a stringency,
llm_translation: He posed to Rabbi Zeira: What about this? If we say there are nine storehouses, all selling kosher meat, and one selling non-kosher meat, and one buys from one of them without knowing from which one he bought - his doubt is forbidden. And in a case of finding the meat, we follow the majority; there, it is for stringency!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִתִּשְׁעָה צְפַרְדְּעִים וְשֶׁרֶץ אֶחָד בֵּינֵיהֶם, וְנָגַע בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזֶה מֵהֶן נָגַע — סְפֵיקוֹ טָמֵא. הָתָם נָמֵי לְחוּמְרָא!
human_translation: Rather, from nine frogs, and one creeping animal, among them, and touched one of the and he does not know which of them he touched, uncertainty ritually impure. There too, a stringency,
llm_translation: Rather, from nine frogs and one creeping creature among them, and it touched one of them, and he does not know which one it touched - his doubt is impure. There, it is said for stringency!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִתִּשְׁעָה שְׁרָצִים וּצְפַרְדֵּעַ אֶחָד בֵּינֵיהֶם, וְנָגַע בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזֶה מֵהֶן נָגַע. בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד — סְפֵיקוֹ טָמֵא. בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — סְפֵיקוֹ טָהוֹר.
human_translation: Rather, from nine creeping animals, and one frog among them, and touched one of them, and he does not know which of them he touched, in the private domain, uncertainty ritually impure, in the public domain, uncertainty ritually pure.
llm_translation: Rather, from nine creeping creatures and one frog among them, and it touched one of them, and he does not know which of them it touched. In a private domain - his doubt is impure. In a public domain - his doubt is pure.

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מְנָא לַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאָרַב לוֹ וְקָם עָלָיו״, עַד שֶׁיִּתְכַּוֵּין לוֹ. וְרַבָּנַן? אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: פְּרָט לְזוֹרֵק אֶבֶן לְגָו.
human_translation: And from where in the Torah do we the verse states “And lie in wait for him, and rise up against him” only where he intends to him. And the Rabbis, of the school of Rabbi Yannai say: excludes of throws a stone into a crowd
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And from the Torah, how do we derive it? The verse says: 'And lie in wait for him and rise up against him,' until he intends for him. And the Sages? The school of Rabbi Yannai said: This excludes one who throws a stone to the roof." English translation: "And from the Torah, how do we derive it? The verse says: 'And lie in wait for him and rise up against him,' until he intends for him. And the Sages? The school of Rabbi Yannai said: This excludes one who throws a stone to the roof."

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּאִיכָּא תִּשְׁעָה גּוֹיִם וְאֶחָד יִשְׂרָאֵל בֵּינֵיהֶם — תִּיפּוֹק לִיה דְּרוּבָּא גּוֹיִם נִינְהוּ. אִי נָמֵי, פַּלְגָא וּפַלְגָא — סְפֵק נְפָשׁוֹת לְהָקֵל.
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say that there are nine gentiles and one Jew among them, let him derive that they are a majority of gentiles. Alternatively, half and half uncertainty life-threatening is lenient.
llm_translation: How are they similar? If you say that there are nine non-Jews and one Jew among them — it should be considered as the majority being non-Jews. If so, half and half — in a case of doubt, we lean towards leniency.

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא: דְּאִיכָּא תִּשְׁעָה יִשְׂרְאֵלִים וְגוֹי אֶחָד בֵּינֵיהֶם, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ גּוֹי קָבוּעַ, וְכׇל קָבוּעַ — כְּמֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: No, necessary there are nine Jews and one gentile among them. because the gentile is fixed and any fixed like equally balanced,
llm_translation: Not needed: for there are nine Israelites and one gentile among them, for he is considered a fixed gentile, and any fixed individual — his status is like half Jewish and half gentile in terms of blood.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וְרַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא אָמַר רַב: הוֹרָאַת שָׁעָה הָיְתָה.
human_translation: was stated Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi Rav said: The halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei And Rav Ḥanan bar Rava Rav said: was a provisional edict
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Chiya bar Ashe said in the name of Rav: The halacha is like Rabbi Yosei. And Rav Chanin bar Rava said in the name of Rav: It was a temporary teaching.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: וּלְיוּחֲסִין לָא בָּעֵינַן תְּרֵי רוּבֵּי? וְהָתְנַן:
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya raised an objection And in matters of lineage, do we not require two majorities, But didn’t we learn
llm_translation: Rebbe Yirmeya raises an objection: Do we not require two majority opinions for lineage? But we learned in a Mishnah:

hebrew_text: מָצָא בָּהּ תִּינוֹק מוּשְׁלָךְ, אִם רוֹב גּוֹיִם — גּוֹי. אִם רוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל — יִשְׂרָאֵל. מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה — יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: one found abandoned baby in if majority of gentiles a gentile; if majority of Jews a Jew. half half a Jew.
llm_translation: Found in her infant thrown, if majority of gentiles - gentile. If majority of Israel - Israel. Half and half - Israel.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְהַחְיוֹתוֹ, אֲבָל לְיוּחֲסִין — לֹא. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: לְפַקֵּחַ עָלָיו אֶת הַגַּל.
human_translation: And Rav said taught only to sustaining him; however, to lineage, no, And Shmuel said: to create an opening a heap on his
llm_translation: And Rav said: They only taught this law for his revival, but for genealogical purposes - no. And Shmuel said: To remove the stone from him.

hebrew_text: אִשְׁתְּמִיטְתֵּיהּ הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בִּקְרוֹנוֹת שֶׁל צִפּוֹרִי הֲוָה מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: overlooked that which Rav Yehuda said Rav said incident among the wagons of Tzippori,
llm_translation: His wife, this that Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: In the horns of the birds was the deed.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא, דְּאָמַר: הוֹרָאַת שָׁעָה הָיְתָה, קַשְׁיָא הָא? מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי הָא, לָא מַתְנֵי הָא.
human_translation: And to Rav Ḥanan bar Rava who said That was a provisional edict difficult. That The one who teaches this, does not teach that
llm_translation: To Rav Hanan bar Rava, who said: There was a teaching of a specific time, is this difficult? Whoever teaches this, does not teach that.

hebrew_text: גּוּפַהּ: מָצָא בָּהּ תִּינוֹק מוּשְׁלָךְ, אִם רוֹב גּוֹיִם — גּוֹי, אִם רוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל — יִשְׂרָאֵל, מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה — יִשְׂרָאֵל. אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְהַחְיוֹתוֹ, אֲבָל לְיוּחֲסִין — לֹא. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: לְפַקֵּחַ עָלָיו אֶת הַגַּל.
human_translation: itself: one found abandoned baby in if majority of gentiles a gentile. If majority of Jews a Jew. half half a Jew. Rav said: taught only to sustaining him; however, to lineage, no. And Shmuel said: to create an opening a heap on his
llm_translation: The body: If a baby is found in it, if the majority are non-Jews - non-Jew, if the majority are Israelites - Israelite, half and half - Israelite. Rav said: They only specified to keep him alive, but for lineage - no. And Shmuel said: To open the barrel for him.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין הוֹלְכִין בְּפִיקּוּחַ נֶפֶשׁ אַחַר הָרוֹב! אֶלָּא כִּי אִיתְּמַר דִּשְׁמוּאֵל — אַרֵישָׁא אִתְּמַר: אִם רוֹב גּוֹיִם — גּוֹי, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וּלְפַקֵּחַ עָלָיו אֶת הַגַּל אֵינוֹ כֵּן.
human_translation: And did Shmuel say that? But didn’t Rav Yosef say Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: One does not follow the majority in matters saving a life? Rather, when the statement of Shmuel was stated it was stated concerning the first clause If majority of gentiles a gentile. Shmuel said: And to creating an opening a heap on his [ lefake’aḥ alav et hagal ] that is not so.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said thus, Samuel? But didn't Rav Yosef say that Rav Yehudah said in the name of Samuel: 'We do not delay the saving of a life after the majority!' Rather, when it was stated in the name of Samuel — initially it was stated: 'If the majority are non-Jews — he is considered a non-Jew,' Samuel said: 'And to remove the stone from on top of him is not so.'"

hebrew_text: אִם רוֹב גּוֹיִם — גּוֹי, לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לְהַאֲכִילוֹ נְבֵילוֹת.
human_translation: If majority of gentiles a gentile. to what halakha Rav Pappa said: to feed animal carcasses,
llm_translation: If most of the nations are non-Jews, for what halakha? Rav Papa said: To feed them carrion.

hebrew_text: אִם רוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל — יִשְׂרָאֵל, לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לְהַחְזִיר לוֹ אֲבֵידָה.
human_translation: If majority of Jews a Jew. to what halakha Rav Pappa said: to return lost property to him,
llm_translation: If the majority of Israelites - Israelites, for what halakha? Rav Papa said: to return a lost item to him.

hebrew_text: מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה — יִשְׂרָאֵל, לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לִנְזָקִין. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי נֵימָא דְּנַגְחֵיהּ תּוֹרָא דִידַן לְתוֹרָא דִידֵיהּ — לֵימָא לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִי רְאָיָה דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל אַתְּ וּשְׁקוֹל!
human_translation: half half a Jew. to what halakha Reish Lakish said: to damages. What are the circumstances? If we say that our ox, gored his ox, let the say to him: Bring proof that you are a Jew, and take
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Half on half - Israel, for what is the halakha? Reish Lakish said: for damages. How so? If it is said that our ox gores his ox - let him say to him: bring proof that you are Israel and pay!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא: דְּנַגְחֵיהּ תּוֹרָא דִידֵיהּ לְתוֹרָא דִידַן, פַּלְגָא מְשַׁלֵּם. וְאִידַּךְ פַּלְגָא — אָמַר לְהוּ: אַיְיתֵי רְאָיָה דְּלָאו יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲנָא, וְאֶתֵּן לְכוֹן.
human_translation: necessary only where his ox gored our ox, he pays half And the other half, say to Bring proof that I am not a Jew and I will give you
llm_translation: The matter is not necessary: if one pushes his ox against our ox, he pays half. And the other half - he says to them: bring proof that I am not Jewish, and I will pay you.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ בְּתוּלָה נִשֵּׂאת
llm_translation: We will return to you with the matter of the virginity being taken.

hebrew_text: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁנִּתְאַרְמְלָה אוֹ שֶׁנִּתְגָּרְשָׁה. הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: בְּתוּלָה נְשָׂאתַנִי, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: לֹא כִּי, אֶלָּא אַלְמָנָה נְשָׂאתִיךְ. אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁיָּצָאת בְּהִינוּמָא וְרֹאשָׁהּ פָּרוּעַ — כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מָאתַיִם. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: אַף חִילּוּק קְלָיוֹת רְאָיָה.
human_translation: a woman who was widowed or divorced, she says: You married me a virgin, and he says: No; rather, I married you a widow, if there are witnesses that she went out with a hinnuma or her hair uncovered, her marriage contract is two hundred Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says: Even distribution of roasted grain, proof
llm_translation: The woman who was suspected of committing adultery or who was divorced. She says: "I was married as a virgin," and he says: "No, rather, I married you as a widow." If there are witnesses that she went out in a state of negligence and her hair was uncovered - her marriage contract is worth two hundred. Rabbi Yochanan ben Broka says: Even the splitting of figs is visible.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: שָׂדֶה זוֹ שֶׁל אָבִיךָ הָיְתָה וּלְקַחְתִּיהָ הֵימֶנּוּ, שֶׁהוּא נֶאֱמָן,
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua concedes in one says to another: This field, belonged to your father and I purchased it from him, that he is deemed credible,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua concedes by saying to his colleague: "This field belonged to your father, and I acquired it from him, for he is trustworthy."

hebrew_text: שֶׁהַפֶּה שֶׁאָסַר — הוּא הַפֶּה שֶׁהִתִּיר. וְאִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁהִיא שֶׁל אָבִיו, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לְקַחְתִּיהָ הֵימֶנּוּ״ — אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: as the mouth that prohibited, is the mouth that permitted, However, if there are witnesses that the field belonged to his father, and says: I purchased it from him, he is not deemed credible
llm_translation: The mouth that prohibited - it is the mouth that permitted. And if there are witnesses that it belongs to his father, and he says, "I acquired it from him" - he is not believed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טַעְמָא דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים, הָא לֵיכָּא עֵדִים — בַּעַל מְהֵימַן, לֵימָא תְּנַן סְתָמָא דְּלָא כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל? דְּאִי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, הָא אָמַר אִיהִי מְהֵימְנָא!
human_translation: The reason is that there are witnesses However, if there are no witnesses, husband is deemed credible. Let us say that unattributed we learned is not in accordance with Rabban Gamliel, as, if Rabban Gamliel, didn’t he say she is deemed credible?
llm_translation: The taste of there are witnesses, here there are no witnesses - a trustworthy person, let us say we learned a tradition that is not like Rabbi Gamliel? For if it were Rabbi Gamliel, he would say, "I am trustworthy!"

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הָתָם אֶלָּא בְּבָרִי וְשֶׁמָּא. אֲבָל הָכָא בְּבָרִי וּבָרִי — לָא אָמַר.
human_translation: Even you will say Rabban Gamliel, Rabban Gamliel stated only there, in certain and uncertain, However, here, in certain and certain, did not say
llm_translation: Even if you say it was Rabban Gamliel, until here Rabban Gamliel did not say there, rather in a created being and perhaps. But here in a created being and a created being - he did not say.

hebrew_text: וּדְקָאָרֵי לַהּ, מַאי קָאָרֵי לַהּ? הָא בָּרִי וּבָרִי הוּא! כֵּיוָן דְּרוֹב נָשִׁים בְּתוּלוֹת נִישָּׂאוֹת, כִּי בָרִי וְשֶׁמָּא דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And he who asked why did he ask it? this is a certain and a certain Since most women are married virgins, is like case of a certain and an uncertain
llm_translation: And they call to her, what do they call to her? This is a bar and a bar! Since most women marry as virgins, it is clear and perhaps it is similar.

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי, ״וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ״: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא אַיְירִי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּמוֹדֶה — שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לָא אַיְירִי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּמוֹדֶה — רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְמַאן מוֹדֵה?
human_translation: And it also stands to reason as teaches: And Rabbi Yehoshua concedes. Granted, if you say that Rabban Gamliel is speaking in he concedes well. However, if you say that Rabban Gamliel is not speaking in he concede, to whom does Rabbi Yehoshua concede
llm_translation: And thus it was stated: "And Rabbi Yehoshua agrees." If you say that when you say "moda" it refers to Rabban Gamliel, it is well. But if you say that when you say "moda" it does not refer to Rabban Gamliel, then Rabbi Yehoshua agrees with whom?

hebrew_text: מִי סָבְרַתְּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אַהַאי פִּירְקִין קָאֵי? אַמִּגּוֹ קָאֵי, וְאַפִּירְקִין קַמָּא קָאֵי.
human_translation: Do you think that Rabbi Yehoshua is to this chapter? it is to miggo , and it is to the first chapter.
llm_translation: Who holds the opinion? Rabbi Yehoshua holds this interpretation? No, he holds this interpretation, and the interpretation stands before him.

hebrew_text: אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַהָא: הָיְתָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת, וְאָמְרוּ לָהּ ״מָה טִיבוֹ שֶׁל עוּבָּר זֶה״. ״מֵאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי וְכֹהֵן הוּא״, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמְרִים: נֶאֱמֶנֶת, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִפִּיהָ אָנוּ חַיִּין — הָתָם מַאי מִגּוֹ אִיכָּא? הֲרֵי כְּרֵיסָהּ בֵּין שִׁינֶּיהָ.
human_translation: to which If you say to this If was pregnant, and said to her: What is the nature of that fetus, and she says to them: It is from a man so-and-so and he is a priest, Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is deemed credible, and Rabbi Yehoshua says: not from her mouth we conduct our lives. There, what miggo is there her belly is between her teeth,
llm_translation: Ahayya? Ileima aha: haytah me'ubberet, ve'amru lah "mah tivo shel ubar zeh." "Me'ish ploni ve'kohen hu," Rabban Gamliel ve'Rabbi Eliezer omrim: ne'emanet, Rabbi Yehoshua omer: lo mifihah anu chayin — hatam mai migo ikka? Harei k'reisah bein shineha.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַהָא: רָאוּהָ מְדַבֶּרֶת עִם אֶחָד, וְאָמְרוּ לָהּ: ״מָה טִיבוֹ שֶׁל אִישׁ זֶה״. ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי וְכֹהֵן הוּא״, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמְרִים: נֶאֱמֶנֶת, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִפִּיהָ אָנוּ חַיִּין. הָתָם מַאי מִגּוֹ אִיכָּא? הָנִיחָא לִזְעֵירִי דְּאָמַר: מַאי ״מְדַבֶּרֶת״ — נִסְתְּרָה, מִגּוֹ דְּאִי בָּעֲיָא אָמְרָה לֹא נִבְעַלְתִּי, וְקָאָמְרָה נִבְעַלְתִּי — מְהֵימְנָא. אֶלָּא לְרַב אַסִּי, דְּאָמַר מַאי ״מְדַבֶּרֶת״ — נִבְעֶלֶת, מַאי מִגּוֹ אִיכָּא?
human_translation: Rather, to this If saw speaking to one and they said to her: What is the nature of this man? He is a man so-and-so and he is a priest, Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is deemed credible, and Rabbi Yehoshua says: not from her mouth we conduct our lives. There, what miggo is there? This well according to Ze’eiri, who said: What speaking she secluded herself a miggo . Since, if she wished she could have said: I did not engage in intercourse and she said: I engaged in intercourse she is deemed credible However, according to Rav Asi, who said: What is speaking? she engaged in intercourse, what miggo is there?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, Aha: They saw her speaking with someone, and they said to her: "What is the character of this man." "He is a certain man and a priest," Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is believed, Rabbi Yehoshua says: We do not rely on her testimony. What is the difference between them? It is reasonable according to the one who said: What is "speaking" - it is hidden, for if she wanted to say "I have not been defiled" and she said "I have been defiled" - she is believed. Rather, according to Rav Assi, who said: What is "speaking" - she has been defiled, what is the difference?

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא אַהָא: הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת מוּכַּת עֵץ אֲנִי, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: לֹא כִי, אֶלָּא דְּרוּסַת אִישׁ אַתְּ. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמְרִים: נֶאֱמֶנֶת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִפִּיהָ אָנוּ חַיִּין — הָתָם מַאי מִגּוֹ אִיכָּא?
human_translation: Rather, to this she says: I was ruptured by wood, and says: No; rather, you are was trampled by a man. Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is deemed credible, Rabbi Yehoshua says: not from her mouth we conduct our lives. There, what miggo is there?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather, Aha says: "I am a wooden staff," and he says: "No, rather, you are a man's doorpost." Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: "She is believed," and Rabbi Yehoshua says: "We do not live by her words." What is the difference between them?

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר: בְּמָנֶה וְלֹא כְּלוּם — מִגּוֹ דְּאִי בָּעֲיָא אָמְרָה: ״מוּכַּת עֵץ אֲנִי תַּחְתֶּיךָ״, וְאִית לַהּ מָאתַיִם, וְקָאָמְרָה: מֵעִיקָּרָא, דְּלֵית לַהּ אֶלָּא מָנֶה, מְהֵימְנָא. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר: בְּמָאתַיִם וּמָנֶה. מַאי מִגּוֹ אִיכָּא?
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Elazar, who said one hundred dinars, and nothing at all, miggo . Since, if she wished she could have said: I was ruptured by wood under your and she would have two hundred And she says initially, when she is only one hundred dinars, she is deemed credible. However, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said: two hundred and one hundred dinars, what miggo is there?
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Elazar, who said: "With a hundred and not less — from where? If she wants, she can say, 'I am worth a wooden staff beneath you,' and she has two hundred, and she says: From the outset, since she only has a hundred, she is believed." But according to Rabbi Yochanan, who said: "With two hundred and a hundred." What is the difference between them?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַהָא: הַנּוֹשֵׂא אֶת הָאִשָּׁה וְלֹא מָצָא לָהּ בְּתוּלִים, הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: ״מִשֶּׁאֵרַסְתַּנִי נֶאֱנַסְתִּי, וְנִסְתַּחֲפָה שָׂדֵהוּ״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא כִי, אֶלָּא עַד שֶׁלֹּא אֵירַסְתִּיךְ״.
human_translation: Rather, to this who marries a woman and did not find her hymen she says: After you betrothed me, I was raped and his field was inundated, And he says: No; rather, before I betrothed you,
llm_translation: Rather, Aha: One who marries a woman and does not find her to be a virgin, she says, "Since you have betrothed me, I have been tested, and his field has been plowed." And he says, "No, rather, until I have not betrothed you."

hebrew_text: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמְרִים: נֶאֱמֶנֶת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִפִּיהָ אָנוּ חַיִּין. דְּמִגּוֹ דְּאִי בָּעֲיָא אָמְרָה ״מוּכַּת עֵץ אֲנִי תַּחְתֶּיךָ״, דְּלָא קָא פָסְלָה נַפְשָׁהּ מִכְּהוּנָּה. וְקָאָמְרָה: ״נֶאֱנַסְתִּי״, דְּקָא פָּסְלָה נַפְשָׁהּ מִכְּהוּנָּה, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי קָאָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל דִּמְהֵימְנָא. וְקָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בְּהַאי מִגּוֹ דְּהָכָא — מוֹדֵינָא לָךְ, בְּהָהוּא מִגּוֹ דְּהָתָם — פְּלִיגְנָא עִילָּווֹךְ.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: She is deemed credible, Rabbi Yehoshua says: not from her mouth we conduct our lives, as, a miggo . Since, if she wished she could have said: I was ruptured by wood under your because she does not disqualify herself from the priesthood. But she said: I was raped because she disqualified herself from the priesthood. Therefore, Rabban Gamliel says that she is deemed credible. And Rabbi Yehoshua says to Rabban Gamliel: With regard to this miggo here, I concede to you With regard to that miggo there I disagree with you.
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: "She is believed," and Rabbi Yehoshua says: "We do not rely on her words." For if she wanted, she could have said, "I am beneath you, a wooden beam," which would not disqualify her from the priesthood. And she said, "I was coerced," which disqualified her from the priesthood. Therefore Rabban Gamliel said, "I believe her." And Rabbi Yehoshua said to Rabban Gamliel: "In this case - we agree with you, but in that case - we disagree with you."

hebrew_text: מִכְּדִי הַאי מִגּוֹ וְהַאי מִגּוֹ, מַאי שְׁנָא הַאי מִגּוֹ מֵהַאי מִגּוֹ? הָכָא — אֵין שׁוֹר שָׁחוּט לְפָנֶיךָ. הָתָם — הֲרֵי שׁוֹר שָׁחוּט לְפָנֶיךָ.
human_translation: after all, this is miggo and that is miggo . what is this miggo different from that miggo ? Here, there is no slaughtered ox before you, there, there is a slaughtered ox before you,
llm_translation: From this case and from this case, what is the difference between this case and this case? Here - a slaughtered ox is before you. There - behold, a slaughtered ox is before you.

hebrew_text: וְכֵיוָן דְּרוֹב נָשִׁים בְּתוּלוֹת נִישָּׂאוֹת, כִּי לָא אָתוּ עֵדִים מַאי הָוֵי! אָמַר רָבִינָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר רוֹב נָשִׁים בְּתוּלוֹת נִישָּׂאוֹת, וּמִיעוּט אַלְמָנוֹת, וְכׇל הַנִּשֵּׂאת בְּתוּלָה — יֵשׁ לָהּ קוֹל,
human_translation: And since that most women are married virgins, if witnesses did not come, what of it? Ravina said: because there is to say most women are married virgins and a minority widows anyone who is married a virgin generates publicity,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And since most women are married as virgins, if witnesses did not come, what is the ruling? Ravina said: Because it can be said that most women are married as virgins, and there are few widows, and every woman who marries a virgin has a voice. English translation:

hebrew_text: וְזוֹ, הוֹאִיל וְאֵין לָהּ קוֹל — אִיתְּרַע לֵהּ רוּבָּא.
human_translation: and this because her did not generate publicity, the majority is undermined.
llm_translation: And this, since it does not have a voice - it causes her great distress.

hebrew_text: אִי כׇּל הַנִּשֵּׂאת בְּתוּלָה יֵשׁ לָהּ קוֹל — כִּי אֲתוֹ עֵדִים, מַאי הָוֵי? הָנָךְ סָהֲדֵי שַׁקָּרֵי נִינְהוּ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבִינָא: רוֹב הַנִּשֵּׂאת בְּתוּלָה יֵשׁ לָהּ קוֹל, וְזוֹ הוֹאִיל וְאֵין לָהּ קוֹל — אִיתְּרַע לֵהּ רוּבָּא.
human_translation: If anyone who is married a virgin generates publicity, when witnesses come, what of it? These are false witnesses, Rather, Ravina said most who are married virgins generates publicity, but this since her did not generate publicity, the majority is undermined.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If all the one who marries a virgin she has a voice - for you are witnesses, what is the case? There, they are false witnesses! Rather, Ravina said: Most of the one who marries a virgin she has a voice, and if she does not have a voice - she will be harmed by the majority.

hebrew_text: אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁיָּצְתָה בְּהִינוּמָא וְכוּ׳. וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא מַפְּקָא עֵדִים בְּהַאי בֵּי דִינָא, וְגָבְיָא, וַהֲדַר מַפְּקָא לַהּ לִכְתוּבָה בְּהַאי בֵּית דִּין, וְגָבְיָא בַּהּ? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת כּוֹתְבִין שׁוֹבָר. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין כּוֹתְבִין כְּתוּבָּה עָסְקִינַן.
human_translation: If there are witnesses that she went out with a hinnuma , And let us be concerned she might produce witnesses in this court and collect and then produce marriage contract in that court and collect with it Rabbi Abbahu said: This indicates one writes a receipt Rav Pappa said: We are dealing with a place where one does not write a marriage contract.
llm_translation: If there are witnesses that she was found in a state of stupor, etc. And we are not concerned that perhaps witnesses will come out in this court, and the man, and then come out to write for her in this court, and the man will be there? Rabbi Avahu said: This means writing a divorce document. Rav Papa said: In a place where they do not write a document, we are dealing with a matter of a document.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַבָּרַיְיתָא: אִיבְּדָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, הִטְמִינָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, נִשְׂרְפָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, רָקְדוּ לְפָנֶיהָ, שָׂחֲקוּ לְפָנֶיהָ, הֶעֱבִירוּ לְפָנֶיהָ כּוֹס שֶׁל בְּשׂוֹרָה, אוֹ מַפָּה שֶׁל בְּתוּלִים. אִם יֵשׁ לָהּ עֵדִים בְּאֶחָד מִכׇּל אֵלּוּ — כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מָאתַיִם.
human_translation: And there are who teach to the baraita lost her marriage contract concealed her marriage contract her marriage contract was burned, danced before her, played before her, passed before her a cup of tidings or a cloth of virginity; if she has witnesses with regard to any one of these her marriage contract is two hundred
llm_translation: And there is one who teaches it in the academy of Abaye: If its writing was inspected, its writing was hidden, its writing was burned, they danced before it, they laughed before it, they passed before it a cup of sorcery, or a cloth of virgins. If it has witnesses from any of these - its writing is invalid.

hebrew_text: וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא מַפְּקָא עֵדִים בְּהַאי בֵּית דִּין וְגָבְיָא, וַהֲדַר מַפְּקָא לִכְתוּבָּתָהּ בְּהַאי בֵּית דִּין וְגָבְיָא בַּהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת כּוֹתְבִין שׁוֹבָר. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין כּוֹתְבִין כְּתוּבָּה עָסְקִינַן.
human_translation: And let us be concerned she might produce witnesses in this court and collect and then produce marriage contract in that court and collect with it Rabbi Abbahu said: This indicates one writes a receipt Rav Pappa said: We are dealing with a place where one does not write a marriage contract.
llm_translation: And perhaps lest witnesses depart from this court and lie, and then come to write their testimony in this court and lie in it! Rabbi Abahu said: This means writing a break. Rav Papa said: In a place where they do not write, we are dealing with a document.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״אִיבְּדָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ״ קָתָנֵי! דִּכְתַב לַהּ אִיהוּ. סוֹף סוֹף מַפְּקָא לַהּ וְגָבְיָא בַּהּ! מַאי ״אִיבְּדָה״ — אִיבְּדָה בָּאוּר.
human_translation: But Isn’t it taught lost her marriage contract? where wrote her ultimately she produce and collect with it What lost? lost in the fire.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: "But didn't it say, 'its writing was lost'?" This teaches that He wrote it for her. Ultimately, it was found for her, and it was inside her! What does 'it was lost' mean? It was lost in the light.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי הַיְינוּ ״נִשְׂרְפָה״? וְעוֹד: הִטְמִינָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? וְתוּ: אִיבְּדָה לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא: כֹּל אִיבְּדָה — כִּי הִטְמִינָה בְּפָנֵינוּ דָּמֵי, וְלָא יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ עַד דְּאָמְרִי עֵדִים נִשְׂרְפָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: If so, that is was burned, And furthermore, what is there to say concealed, And furthermore, why do I lost Rather, any she lost is like where she concealed before us, and we give her only when the witnesses say that her marriage contract was burned.
llm_translation: So is this the same as "burned"? And furthermore: she hid, what is there to say? And again: why do I need it? Rather, all of it is needed - for she hid in our presence the blood, and we do not give it to her until witnesses say she was burned as her writing.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַבָּרַיְיתָא — כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אַמַּתְנִיתִין. וּמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַמַּתְנִיתִין — אֲבָל אַבָּרַיְיתָא לָא, כִּי קוּשְׁיָא.
human_translation: The one who teaches this to the baraita , all the more so to the mishna. However, the one who teaches this to the mishna not to the baraita , in accordance with the difficulty
llm_translation: He who teaches in the Hebrew language — certainly can also teach in the Aramaic language. And he who teaches in the Aramaic language — but not in Hebrew, for it is difficult.

hebrew_text: אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים כּוּ׳. וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא מַפְּקָא עֵדֵי הִינּוּמָא בְּהַאי בֵּית דִּין וְגָבְיָא, וַהֲדַר מַפְּקָא עֵדֵי הִינּוּמָא בְּבֵי דִינָא אַחֲרִינָא וְגָבְיָא! בְּמָקוֹם דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר וַדַּאי כָּתְבִינַן שׁוֹבָר.
human_translation: If there are witnesses But let us be concerned lest she produce witnesses a hinnuma , in this court, and collect and then produce witnesses a hinnuma , in that court, and collect In a place where it is not possible certainly we write a receipt,
llm_translation: If there are witnesses, etc. And we should not be concerned that perhaps the witnesses were established in this court and then established in another court! In a situation where it is not possible, and certainly we write a break.

hebrew_text: הֶעֱבִירוּ לְפָנֶיהָ כּוֹס שֶׁל בְּשׂוֹרָה. מַאי ״כּוֹס שֶׁל בְּשׂוֹרָה״? אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: כּוֹס יַיִן שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה מַעֲבִירִין לְפָנֶיהָ. כְּלוֹמַר: רְאוּיָה הָיְתָה זוֹ לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: אַטּוּ אַלְמָנָה מִי לָא אָכְלָה בִּתְרוּמָה? אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: זוֹ רֵאשִׁית, כִּתְרוּמָה רֵאשִׁית.
human_translation: passed before her a cup of tidings. What is a cup of good tidings? Rav Adda bar Ahava says: A cup of teruma wine is passed before meaning this would have been eligible to eat teruma Rav Pappa objects to Is that to say a widow does not eat teruma Rather, Rav Pappa says: this bride is first, like teruma is first
llm_translation: They brought before her a cup of fine linen. What is "a cup of fine linen"? Rav Adda bar Ahava said: A cup of wine of terumah they bring before her. Meaning to say, this was fitting for her to eat with terumah. Rav Papa objected to him: Did a widow ever eat terumah? Rather, Rav Papa said: This is the beginning, like terumah is the beginning.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חָבִית שֶׁל יַיִן מַעֲבִירִין לְפָנֶיהָ. אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: בְּתוּלָה — מַעֲבִירִין לְפָנֶיהָ סְתוּמָה, בְּעוּלָה — מַעֲבִירִין לְפָנֶיהָ פְּתוּחָה. אַמַּאי? נִיעַבַּר קַמֵּי בְּתוּלָה וְקַמֵּי בְּעוּלָה לָא נִיעַבַּר כְּלָל! זִימְנִין דְּתָפְסָה מָאתַיִם, וְאָמְרָה: אֲנָא בְּתוּלָה הֲוַאי, וְהַאי דְּלָא עַבַּרוּ קַמַּאי — אִתְּנוֹסֵי הוּא דְּאִתְּנִיסוּ.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: one passes a barrel of wine before her. Rav Adda bar Ahava said: One passes a sealed before a virgin, and one passes an open before a non-virgin. Why Let us pass before the virgin, and before the non-virgin let us not pass at all. at times seized two hundred and said: I was a virgin, and that they did not pass before me was due to circumstances beyond their control.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: A barrel of wine, we pass before it. Rav Adda bar Ahava said: With a virgin - we pass before her closed, with a married woman - we pass before her open. Why? When it is in front of a virgin and in front of a married woman, it is not passed at all! Sometimes she may have been seized by two hundred men, and she says: I am a virgin, and this one who did not pass before me - he is the one who should be ashamed.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד מְרַקְּדִין לִפְנֵי הַכַּלָּה? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים:
human_translation: The Sages taught: How does one dance before the bride, Beit Shammai say:
llm_translation: The Sages taught: How do they dance before the bride? Beit Shammai say:

hebrew_text: כַּלָּה כְּמוֹת שֶׁהִיא. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: ״כַּלָּה נָאָה וַחֲסוּדָה״. אָמְרוּ לָהֶן בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְבֵית הִלֵּל: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיְתָה חִיגֶּרֶת אוֹ סוֹמָא, אוֹמְרִים לָהּ: ״כַּלָּה נָאָה וַחֲסוּדָה״? וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: ״מִדְּבַר שֶׁקֶר תִּרְחָק״! אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: לְדִבְרֵיכֶם, מִי שֶׁלָּקַח מִקָּח רַע מִן הַשּׁוּק, יְשַׁבְּחֶנּוּ בְּעֵינָיו, אוֹ יְגַנֶּנּוּ בְּעֵינָיו? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: יְשַׁבְּחֶנּוּ בְּעֵינָיו. מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: לְעוֹלָם תְּהֵא דַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם מְעוֹרֶבֶת עִם הַבְּרִיּוֹת.
human_translation: the bride as she is, And Beit Hillel say: A fair and attractive bride. Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel: where was lame or blind, one say to her: A fair and attractive bride? But the Torah states: “Keep you from a false matter” Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: to your statement, one who acquired an inferior acquisition from the market, praise it in his eyes or condemn it in his eyes? You must say he should praise it in his eyes From here the Sages said: A person’s disposition should always be empathetic with mankind,
llm_translation: The bride as she is. And Beit Hillel say: "A beautiful and gracious bride." Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel: If she was hunchbacked or lame, would you say to her, "A beautiful and gracious bride"? But the Torah says: "Keep far from a false matter." Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: According to your words, if one buys a bad purchase from the market, should he praise it in his eyes or criticize it in his eyes? He should say: Praise it in his eyes. From here the sages said: A person's knowledge should always be mingled with creatures.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: הָכִי מְשָׁרוּ קַמֵּי כַּלְּתָא בְּמַעְרְבָא: ״לֹא כָּחָל וְלֹא שָׂרָק וְלֹא פִּירְכּוּס וְיַעֲלַת חֵן״. כִּי סָמְכוּ רַבָּנַן לְרַבִּי זֵירָא, שָׁרוּ לֵיהּ הָכִי: ״לָא כָּחָל וְלֹא שָׂרָק וְלֹא פִּירְכּוּס וְיַעֲלַת חֵן״.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: This is what they sing before brides in the West, No eye shadow, and no rouge, and no braiding and a graceful ibex. When the Sages ordained Rabbi Zeira, this they sang to him No eye shadow, and no rouge, and no braiding and a graceful ibex.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: So they sang before the bride in the west: "No baldness, nor shorn hair, nor baldness of the forehead, nor gracefulness." The Rabbis relied on Rabbi Zeira, and they sang to him thus: "No baldness, nor shorn hair, nor baldness of the forehead, nor gracefulness."

hebrew_text: כִּי סְמַכוּ רַבָּנַן לְרַבִּי אַמֵּי וּלְרַבִּי אַסִּי שָׁרוּ לְהוּ הָכִי: ״כֹּל מִן דֵּין וְכֹל מִן דֵּין סְמוּכוּ לַנָא, לָא תִּסְמֻכוּ לַנָא לָא מִן סַרְמִיסִין וְלָא מִן סַרְמִיטִין״, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: ״לָא מִן חֲמִיסִין וְלָא מִן טוּרְמִיסִין״.
human_translation: When the Sages ordained Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi, this they sang to them: Anyone from this and anyone from that ordain for us. Do not ordain for us neither from corrupt [ sarmisin ] nor from worthless [ sarmitin ]. And some say: Not from one-fifth [ ḥamisin ] and not from incomplete [ turmisin ].
llm_translation: The sages relied on Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi and permitted them thus: "All from the law and all from the law rely on us, do not rely on us neither from the Samaritans nor from the Samaritans," and some say: "neither from the Hittites nor from the Turmites."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ כִּי הֲוָה אָתֵי מִמְּתִיבְתָּא לְבֵי קֵיסָר, נָפְקָן אַמְהָתָא דְּבֵי קֵיסָר לְאַפֵּיהּ וּמְשָׁרְיָן לֵיהּ הָכִי: ״רַבָּא דְעַמֵּיהּ וּמְדַבְּרָנָא דְאוּמְּתֵיהּ, בּוּצִינָא דִנְהוֹרָא, בְּרִיךְ מֵתְיָיךְ לִשְׁלָם״.
human_translation: When Rabbi Abbahu would come from the academy to the house of the emperor, the maidservants of the emperor’s house would go out to greet him, and this they sang to him: Master of his people and leader of his nation, candle of illumination, blessed is your arrival in peace.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu, when he would come from the study hall to the house of Caesar, the servants of the house of Caesar would go out to meet him and would greet him as follows: "Rava of his city and speaker of his nation, the splendor of his light, may you come in peace."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר אִילְעַאי שֶׁהָיָה נוֹטֵל בַּד שֶׁל הֲדַס, וּמְרַקֵּד לִפְנֵי הַכַּלָּה, וְאוֹמֵר: ״כַּלָּה נָאָה וַחֲסוּדָה״. רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק מְרַקֵּד אַתְּלָת. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: קָא מַכְסֵיף לַן סָבָא: כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ, אִיפְּסִיק עַמּוּדָא דְנוּרָא בֵּין דִּידֵיהּ לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא, וּגְמִירִי דְּלָא אִפְּסִיק עַמּוּדָא דְנוּרָא אֶלָּא אִי לְחַד בְּדָרָא, אִי לִתְרֵי בְּדָרָא.
human_translation: said about Rabbi Yehuda bar Elai that he would take a myrtle branch and dance before the bride, and say: A fair and attractive bride. Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak would dance on three Rabbi Zeira said: The old man is humiliating us, When died, a pillar of fire demarcated between him everyone and we learn that a pillar of fire demarcates only for either one in a generation or for two in a generation.
llm_translation: They said about Rabbi Yehuda bar Ilai that he would take a myrtle branch, and dance before the bride, saying: "A beautiful and graceful bride." Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak would dance with a scarf. Rabbi Zeira said: He is causing us embarrassment, for he is endangering the pillar of fire that stands between us and all the nations, and we have learned that the pillar of fire does not endanger except for one person or two at a time.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: אַהַנְיָיה לֵיהּ שׁוֹטִיתֵיהּ לְסָבָא. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: שְׁטוּתֵיהּ לְסָבָא. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: שִׁיטְתֵיהּ לְסָבָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: His branch [ shotitei ] was effective for the old man, And some say His nonsense [ shetutei ] for the old man. And some say His method [ shittatei ] for the old man.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: His madness is to his grandfather. And some say: His foolishness is to his grandfather. And some say: His folly is to his grandfather.

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא מַרְכֵּיב לַהּ אַכַּתְפֵּיהּ וּמְרַקֵּד. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: אֲנַן מַהוּ לְמִיעְבַּד הָכִי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי דָּמְיָין עֲלַיְיכוּ כִּכְשׁוּרָא — לְחַיֵּי, וְאִי לָא — לָא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa would place on his shoulders The Sages said to him: What us to do so as well? He said to them: If comparable for you to a beam, fine, but if not, no,
llm_translation: Rav Acha mounts her on his shoulder and dances. The Rabbis said to him: Are we to act in this manner? He said to them: If you are like angels, then yes, but if not, then no.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: מוּתָּר לְהִסְתַּכֵּל בִּפְנֵי כַלָּה כׇּל שִׁבְעָה, כְּדֵי לְחַבְּבָהּ עַל בַּעְלָהּ. וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: is permitted to look at the face of a bride all seven in order to endear her to her husband, And the halakha is not in accordance with his
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: It is permitted to gaze upon the bride for seven days in order to endear her to her husband. And there is no halacha like his opinion.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲבִירִין אֶת הַמֵּת מִלִּפְנֵי כַלָּה. וְזֶה וָזֶה מִלִּפְנֵי מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל. אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל אַגְרִיפַּס הַמֶּלֶךְ שֶׁעָבַר מִלִּפְנֵי כַּלָּה, וְשִׁבְּחוּהוּ חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One reroutes a corpse before a bride. And both this, and that, before a king of Israel. They said about King Agrippa [ Agrippas ] that he rerouted before a bride, and the Sages praised him
llm_translation: The Sages taught: They remove the deceased from before the bride. And this applies both before a king of Israel. They said about King Agrippas who passed before a bride, and the sages praised him.

hebrew_text: שִׁבְּחוּהוּ — מִכְּלָל דְּשַׁפִּיר עֲבַד? וְהָא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר נָשִׂיא שֶׁמָּחַל עַל כְּבוֹדוֹ — כְּבוֹדוֹ מָחוּל, מֶלֶךְ שֶׁמָּחַל עַל כְּבוֹדוֹ — אֵין כְּבוֹדוֹ מָחוּל. דְּאָמַר מָר: ״שׂוֹם תָּשִׂים עָלֶיךָ מֶלֶךְ״, שֶׁתְּהֵא אֵימָתוֹ עָלֶיךָ! פָּרָשַׁת דְּרָכִים הֲוַאי.
human_translation: praised him; by inference that he did well But didn’t Rav Ashi say: Even to the one who said a Nasi who relinquishes honor him his honor is relinquished, a king who relinquishes honor him, his honor is not relinquished. As the Master said “You shall place a king over you” that his awe shall be upon you. It was a crossroads
llm_translation: Praise Him - from the principle that He did well? But didn't Rav Ashe say: Even according to the one who says a prince forgives his honor - his honor is indeed forgiven, but a king who forgives his honor - his honor is not forgiven. As Mar said: "You shall surely set a king over you," so that his awe shall be upon you! This is the matter of Derech Eretz.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מְבַטְּלִין תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה לְהוֹצָאַת הַמֵּת וּלְהַכְנָסַת כַּלָּה. אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרַבִּי אִלְעַאי שֶׁהָיָה מְבַטֵּל תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה לְהוֹצָאַת הַמֵּת וּלְהַכְנָסַת כַּלָּה. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — כְּשֶׁאֵין עִמּוֹ כׇּל צָרְכּוֹ. אֲבָל יֵשׁ עִמּוֹ כׇּל צָרְכּוֹ — אֵין מְבַטְּלִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One suspends the study of Torah to the removal of a corpse and to the entry of a bride into said about Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Elai, that he would suspend the study of Torah to the removal of a corpse and to the entry of a bride into In what is this statement said? where not with him, all his needs, However, if with him all his needs, one does not suspend
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may suspend the study of Torah for escorting the deceased and for accompanying a bride. They said about Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ilai, that he would suspend the study of Torah for escorting the deceased and for accompanying a bride. In what case are these matters said? When he has no one else to attend to his needs. But if he has someone to attend to his needs, one may not suspend the study.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה כׇּל צָרְכּוֹ? אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אִינִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: תְּרֵיסַר אַלְפֵי גַּבְרֵי, וְשִׁיתָּא אַלְפֵי שִׁיפּוּרֵי. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: תְּלֵיסַר אַלְפֵי גַּבְרֵי, וּמִינַּיְיהוּ שִׁיתָּא אַלְפֵי שִׁיפּוּרֵי. עוּלָּא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן דְּחָיְיצִי גַּבְרֵי מֵאֲבוּלָּא וְעַד סִיכְרָא. רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: נְטִילָתָהּ — כִּנְתִינָתָהּ, מָה נְתִינָתָהּ בְּשִׁשִּׁים רִבּוֹא, אַף נְטִילָתָהּ בְּשִׁשִּׁים רִבּוֹא. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי לְמַאן דְּקָרֵי וְתָנֵי,
human_translation: And how many all his needs? Rav Shmuel bar Eini said in the name of Rav: Twelve thousand men and six thousand a shofar And some say: Thirteen thousand men and, among them, six thousand a shofar. Ulla said: so that the men form a partition from the gate of the city [ abbula ] until the cemetery. Rav Sheshet, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan, said: The taking is equivalent to its giving Just as its giving with six hundred thousand so too, taking is with six hundred thousand This applies only to one who read and studied
llm_translation: And how much is all his need? Rav Shmuel bar Ini said in the name of Rav: Twelve thousand men, and six thousand scribes. And some say: Thirteen thousand men, and from them six thousand scribes. Ulla said: For example, from Chayitzi to Avula and until Sikra. Rav Sheshet, and some say Rabbi Yochanan said: Its removal is like its giving, just as its giving is in sixty myriads, so too its removal is in sixty myriads. And these matters are for the one who reads and teaches.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לְמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי, לֵית לֵיהּ שִׁיעוּרָא.
human_translation: However, for one who taught no measure for
llm_translation: But according to the one who teaches, it does not have a measurement.

hebrew_text: וְאִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁיָּצְתָה בְּהִינוּמָא וְכוּ׳. מַאי הִינּוּמָא? סוּרְחַב בַּר פָּפָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּזְעֵירִי אָמַר: תַּנּוּרָא דְאַסָּא. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: קָרִיתָא דִּמְנַמְנְמָא בָּהּ כַּלְּתָא.
human_translation: And if there are witnesses that she went out with a hinnuma What is hinnuma ? Surḥav bar Pappa said in the name of Ze’eiri: a canopy of myrtle Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a veil [ kerita ] under which the bride dozes [ menamna ].
llm_translation: "And if there are witnesses that she became pregnant through 'hinuma' etc. What is 'hinuma'? Surkhab bar Papa from the name of Zeiri said: a stove of Asa. Rabbi Yohanan said: a city in which a bride is prepared."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳. תָּנָא בִּיהוּדָה רְאָיָה, בְּבָבֶל מַאי? אָמַר רַב: דַּרְדּוֹגֵי דְמִשְׁחָא אַרֵישָׁא דְרַבָּנַן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: מִשְׁחָא דַחֲפִיפוּתָא קָאָמַר מָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יַתְמָא, לָא עֲבַדָא לָךְ אִמָּךְ דַּרְדּוֹגֵי מִשְׁחָא אַרֵישָׁא דְּרַבָּנַן בִּשְׁעַת מַעֲשֶׂה? כִּי הָא דְּהָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן דְּאִיעֲסַק לֵיהּ לִבְרֵיהּ בֵּי רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא אִיעֲסַק לֵיהּ לִבְרֵיהּ בֵּי הָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן, וְדַרְדֵּיג מִשְׁחָא אַרֵישָׁא דְרַבָּנַן בִּשְׁעַת מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says: Even proof taught In Judea, proof; what are in Babylonia? Rav said: Smearing oil on the heads of the Sages Rav Pappa, said to Abaye: Is the Master saying oil for shampooing he said to him: Orphan, didn’t your mother perform for you smearing of oil on the heads of the Sages at the time of the performance As when one of the Sages who arranged for his son the family of Rabba bar Ulla and some say that Rabba bar Ulla arranged for his son the family of one of the Sages; and he smeared oil on the heads of the Sages at the time of the performance
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka says, etc. It was taught in Judea, what about in Babylon? Rav said: The fish market at the head of the rabbis. Rav Papa said to Abbaye: Is the head of the fish market saying to you, "Your mother's fish market at the head of the rabbis at the time of the incident?" For this one from the rabbis was occupied with his son, the son of Rabba bar Ulla, and they said to him, "Rabba bar Ulla is occupied with his son, the son of that one from the rabbis, and the fish market at the head of the rabbis at the time of the incident."

hebrew_text: אַרְמַלְתָּא מַאי? תָּאנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: אַרְמַלְתָּא לֵית לַהּ כִּיסָנֵי.
human_translation: What is the a widow? Rav Yosef taught: A widow does not have roasted grain [ kisanei ]
llm_translation: Armalta, what is it? The students of Rav Yosef said: Armalta does not have pockets.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ כּוּ׳. וְלִיתְנֵי: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ שָׂדֶה זוֹ שֶׁלְּךָ הָיְתָה, וּלְקַחְתִּיהָ מִמְּךָ?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua concedes in one says to another: And let teach: Rabbi Yehoshua concedes in one says to another: This field belonged to you, and I purchased it from you.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yehoshua concedes by saying to his fellow, "You are right." And it should teach: Rabbi Yehoshua concedes by saying to his fellow, "This field was yours, and I took it from you?"

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי סֵיפָא: אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁהִיא שֶׁלּוֹ, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לְקַחְתִּיהָ מִמֶּנּוּ״ — אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי?
human_translation: due to that wanted to teach the latter clause that if there are witnesses that it was and he says: I purchased it from him, he is not deemed credible. what are the circumstances?
llm_translation: From the fact that he wants to teach the latter part: if there are witnesses that it belongs to him, and he says, "I took it from him" — he is not believed. How so?

hebrew_text: אִי דְּאַכְלַהּ שְׁנֵי חֲזָקָה — אַמַּאי לָא מְהֵימַן?! וְאִי דְּלָא אַכְלַהּ שְׁנֵי חֲזָקָה — פְּשִׁיטָא דְּלָא מְהֵימַן!
human_translation: If where consumed years presumptive ownership, why is his not deemed credible? And if he did not consume years presumptive ownership, obvious that his is not deemed credible.
llm_translation: If she ate two k'zayit - why is she not trusted?! And if she did not eat two k'zayit - it is obvious that she is not trusted!

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, גַּבֵּי אָבִיו נָמֵי: אִי דְּאַכְלַהּ שְׁנֵי חֲזָקָה — אַמַּאי לָא מְהֵימַן?! וְאִי דְּלָא אַכְלַהּ שְׁנֵי חֲזָקָה — פְּשִׁיטָא דְּלָא מְהֵימַן!
human_translation: If so, with regard to father as well: If consumed years presumptive ownership, why is his not deemed credible? And if he did not consume years presumptive ownership, obvious that his is not deemed credible.
llm_translation: Thus, regarding his father, indeed: if she consumed two strong witnesses - why did he not trust her testimony?! And if she did not consume two strong witnesses - it is obvious that he did not trust her testimony!

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא גַּבֵּי אָבִיו מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, כְּגוֹן שֶׁאֲכָלָהּ שְׁתַּיִם בְּחַיֵּי הָאָב, וְאַחַת בְּחַיֵּי בְנוֹ, וְכִדְרַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אֵין מַחֲזִיקִין בְּנִכְסֵי קָטָן, אֲפִילּוּ הִגְדִּיל.
human_translation: Granted, with regard to his father, be found where consumed two during the lifetime of the father one during the lifetime of the son And in accordance with Rav Huna, as Rav Huna said: One cannot establish presumptive ownership of the property of a minor, even he reached majority.
llm_translation: In truth, regarding his father's wife, she is forgotten, for example, if he married her twice during his father's lifetime, and once during his son's lifetime, as Rav Huna said: We do not hold onto the property of a minor, even if he has grown up.

hebrew_text: וְרַב הוּנָא מַתְנִיתִין אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן? אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: רַב הוּנָא דִּיּוּקָא דְמַתְנִיתִין קָאָמַר. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: אֲפִילּוּ הִגְדִּיל קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And did Rav Huna come to teach us a mishna? If you wish, say Rav Huna is stating the inference from the mishna, And if you wish, say that he is teaching us even he reached majority.
llm_translation: Rav Huna came to teach us a Mishnah? If you wish, say: Rav Huna specifically meant the Mishnah. And if you wish, say: Even if he expounded, he is informing us.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנְיַיהּ בְּדִידֵיהּ, וְלוֹקְמַהּ כְּגוֹן שֶׁאֲכָלָהּ שְׁתַּיִם בְּפָנָיו וְאַחַת שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו, וּכְגוֹן שֶׁבָּרַח.
human_translation: And let teach in himself. And let him establish where consumed in the presence two and in his presence one And where fled
llm_translation: And let him divorce her, and she will be like one who ate two loaves in his presence and one loaf not in his presence, and like one who fled.

hebrew_text: בָּרַח מֵחֲמַת מַאי? אִי דְּבָרַח מֵחֲמַת נְפָשׁוֹת — פְּשִׁיטָא דְּלָא מְהֵימַן, דְּלָא מָצֵי [מְ]מַחֵי. וְאִי דְּבָרַח מֵחֲמַת מָמוֹן, אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמַחוֹיֵי. דְּקַיְימָא לַן: מֶחָאָה שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו — הָוְיָא מֶחָאָה.
human_translation: fled due to what If that he fled due to life obvious that is not deemed credible, since is unable to protest, And if he fled due to money he ought to protest as we maintain that a protest not in the presence of is a protest.
llm_translation: He fled due to what? If he fled due to his own life - it is obvious that he is not believed, as he could have saved himself. And if he fled due to money, let him bring witnesses. For we have a principle: a protest made not in the presence of the accused - is considered a protest.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן, שָׁלֹשׁ אֲרָצוֹת לַחֲזָקָה: יְהוּדָה, וְעֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן, וְהַגָּלִיל. הָיָה בִּיהוּדָה וְהֶחֱזִיק בַּגָּלִיל, בַּגָּלִיל וְהֶחֱזִיק בִּיהוּדָה — אֵינָהּ חֲזָקָה, עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא עִמּוֹ בִּמְדִינָה.
human_translation: as we learned three lands presumptive ownership: Judea, Transjordan, and the Galilee. was in Judea occupied in the Galilee, in the Galilee occupied in Judea, not presumptive ownership, until will be with in the same country.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Three lands are considered as one in terms of establishing ownership: Judea, Transjordan, and Galilee. If one was in Judea and established ownership in Galilee, or in Galilee and established ownership in Judea, it is not considered established ownership until he is present in the same province.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: מַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר מֶחָאָה שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו הָוְיָא מֶחָאָה — אֲפִילּוּ בִּיהוּדָה וְגָלִיל נָמֵי. וְאִי קָסָבַר מֶחָאָה שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו לָא הָוְיָא מֶחָאָה — אֲפִילּוּ יְהוּדָה וִיהוּדָה נָמֵי לָא!
human_translation: And we discussed What does hold? If he holds that a protest not in the presence of is protest, even in Judea and Galilee also And if he holds that a protest not in the presence of is not protest, even Judea and Judea also not
llm_translation: We were in it: What does he hold? If he holds that a wound that is not in his presence is considered a wound - even in Judea and Galilee also. And if he holds that a wound that is not in his presence is not considered a wound - even in Judea and Judea also not!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל: לְעוֹלָם קָסָבַר מֶחָאָה שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו הָוְיָא מֶחָאָה, וּמַתְנִיתִין בִּשְׁעַת חֵירוּם שָׁנוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Memel said: Actually holds that a protest not in the presence of is protest, and taught this mishna with regard to a crisis period,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abba bar Memel: Always he holds that Mecha'ah not in his presence it should be Mecha'ah, and the Mishnah in the time of dispute they taught.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא יְהוּדָה וְגָלִיל דְּנָקֵט?
human_translation: And what is different Judea and Galilee that cited
llm_translation: And what is the difference between Yehudah and Galil that is mentioned?

hebrew_text: דִּסְתַם יְהוּדָה וּגְלִיל כִּשְׁעַת חֵירוּם דָּמוּ.
human_translation: that standard Judea and Galilee is tantamount to a crisis period,
llm_translation: The hidden places of Judea and the Galilee are like the time of the destruction of their blood.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״מָנֶה לָוִיתִי מִמְּךָ וּפְרַעְתִּיו לָךְ״, שֶׁהוּא נֶאֱמָן! מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי סֵיפָא: אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁהוּא לָוָה מִמֶּנּוּ, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: פְּרַעְתִּיו — אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן, וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ בְּעֵדִים — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְפׇרְעוֹ בְּעֵדִים.
human_translation: And let teach And Rabbi Yehoshua concedes in one says to another: I borrowed one hundred from you and repaid to you, that he is deemed credible. due to that wanted to teach the latter clause: If there are witnesses that he borrowed from and he says: I repaid he is not deemed credible. as don’t we hold one who lends another in witnesses, need not repay in witnesses?
llm_translation: And it was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua concedes when one says to his fellow, "I borrowed money from you and I will repay you," that he is trustworthy! Because he seeks to teach the latter clause: If there are witnesses that he borrowed from him, and he says, "I will repay him," he is not trustworthy, and we establish that one who lends to his fellow with witnesses does not need to repay him with witnesses.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: מָנֶה לְאָבִיךְ בְּיָדִי, וְהֶאֱכַלְתִּיו פְּרָס — שֶׁהוּא נֶאֱמָן!
human_translation: And let teach And Rabbi Yehoshua concedes in one says to another: Your father has one hundred dinars in my possession but I provided him half his deemed credible.
llm_translation: And it was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua agrees by saying to his fellow: "I have counted out to your father into my hand, and I have eaten it in Persia" — for he is trustworthy!

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דְמַאן? אִי אַלִּיבָּא דְרַבָּנַן — הָא אָמְרִי מֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה הָוֵי. אִי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב — הָא אָמַר שְׁבוּעָה בָּעֵי.
human_translation: In accordance with whose If in accordance with of the Rabbis, didn’t they say he is one returning a lost article? And if in accordance with of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, didn’t he say required an oath,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Alibba d'man? Iy alibba d'rabanan — ha amri meshiv avaida havei. Iy alibba d'rebi Eliezer ben Yaakov — ha amar shevuah ba'ei." English translation: "In whose jurisdiction? If in the jurisdiction of the Rabbis — they said it is considered returning a lost object. If in the jurisdiction of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov — he said an oath is required."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: פְּעָמִים שֶׁאָדָם נִשְׁבָּע עַל טַעֲנַת עַצְמוֹ. כֵּיצַד? ״מָנֶה לְאָבִיךְ בְּיָדִי וְהֶאֱכַלְתִּיו פְּרָס״ — הֲרֵי זֶה נִשְׁבָּע, וְזֶהוּ שֶׁנִּשְׁבָּע עַל טַעֲנַת עַצְמוֹ. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא כְּמֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה, וּפָטוּר.
human_translation: as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: times when a person takes an oath on his own claim. How Your father has one hundred dinars in my possession, but I provided him half he take an oath and that is who takes an oath on his own claim. And the Rabbis say: he is merely equivalent of one returning a lost article, and is exempt
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Sometimes a person swears on his own claim. How so? "I will take your father's money into my hand and eat it in Persia" — this is a valid oath, and this is when one swears on his own claim. And the Sages say: It is only like returning a lost object, and he is exempt.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב לֵית לֵיהּ מֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה פָּטוּר? אָמַר רַב: בְּטוֹעֲנוֹ קָטָן. וְהָאָמַר מָר: אֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין עַל טַעֲנַת חֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן!
human_translation: And is Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov not of one who returns a lost article is exempt from taking an oath Rav says: where a minor makes a claim him. But didn’t the Master say: One does not take an oath on the claim of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor?
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov does not have the law that one who returns a lost item is exempt? Rav said: This is when he is a minor. But didn't Mar say: We do not administer oaths regarding the claim of a deaf-mute, imbecile, or minor!

hebrew_text: מַאי קָטָן — גָּדוֹל. וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ קָטָן — דִּלְגַבֵּי מִילֵּי דְאָבִיו, קָטָן הוּא. אִי הָכִי: טַעֲנַת עַצְמוֹ? טַעֲנַת אֲחֵרִים הִיא! טַעֲנַת אֲחֵרִים, וְהוֹדָאַת עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: what minor? majority, And why does call him a minor? that with regard to his father’s matters, he is a minor, If so, his own claim? is the claim of others. is the claim of others, but his own admission.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "small"? — It is great. And why is it called "small"? Because in comparison to the matters of his father, he is small. If so, is he self-asserting? It is the assertion of others! The assertion of others, and the acknowledgment of himself.

hebrew_text: כּוּלְּהִי טַעֲנָתָא, טַעֲנַת אֲחֵרִים וְהוֹדָאַת עַצְמוֹ נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: All claims are a claim of others and his own admission.
llm_translation: The entire claim, the claim of others and self-admission are they!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכָא בִּדְרַבָּה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה מוֹדֶה מִקְצָת הַטַּעֲנָה יִשָּׁבַע — חֲזָקָה אֵין אָדָם מֵעִיז פָּנָיו בִּפְנֵי בַּעַל חוֹבוֹ. וְהַאי בְּכוּלַּהּ בָּעֵי דְּלִכְפְּרֵיהּ, וְהַאי דְּלָא כְּפַר לֵיהּ — מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין אָדָם מֵעִיז פָּנָיו הוּא.
human_translation: Rather, Here, disagree with regard to Rabba, as Rabba said: Why did the Torah say that makes a partial admission the claim take an oath? presumption a person not be insolent in the presence of his creditor this would have liked to deny the entire and that he did not deny is due to that a person not be insolent
llm_translation: Rather, here Rabah argues. For Rabah said: Why did the Torah state that one who admits to part of the claim must take an oath? It is a strong presumption that a person does not confront his creditor face to face. The one who wants to be absolved seeks to atone, and the one who does not seek atonement does not seek it, because a person does not confront his creditor face to face.

hebrew_text: וּבְכוּלַּהּ בָּעֵי דְּלוֹדֵי לֵיהּ. וְהַאי דְּלָא אוֹדִי לֵיהּ — כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִישְׁתְּמִיט לֵיהּ, וְסָבַר: עַד דְּהָוֵה לִי זוּזֵי וּפָרַעְנָא לֵיהּ. וְרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: רְמִי שְׁבוּעָה עֲלֵיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלוֹדֵי לֵיהּ בְּכוּלֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And, he would have liked to admit to him that entire And that he did not admit to him so that he may avoid him. And he rationalizes until that I have money, and I will repay him. the Merciful One says: Impose an oath upon him so that he will admit that entire
llm_translation: And in all of it, he needs to lodge with him. And this one who does not lodge with him - how will he be able to support him, and he thinks: until I have money and I will support him. And the Merciful One said: impose an oath upon him, so that he will support him in all his needs.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב סָבַר: לָא שְׁנָא בּוֹ וְלָא שְׁנָא בִּבְנוֹ, אֵינוֹ מֵעִיז, וְהִלְכָּךְ לָאו מֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה הָוֵי. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: בּוֹ הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ מֵעִיז, אֲבָל בִּבְנוֹ — מֵעִיז. וּמִדְּלֹא הֵעִיז — מֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה הָוֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov maintains: no different with regard to no different with regard to his son. not be insolent And therefore, he is not one returning a lost article However, the Rabbis maintain: In not be insolent, but in his son, he insolent he is one returning a lost article
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov holds: Not different in him and not different in his son, he does not permit, and therefore, he does not return a lost item. And the Rabbis hold: In him, he does not permit, but in his son - he permits. And since he did not permit - he returns a lost item.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָעֵדִים שֶׁאָמְרוּ: כְּתַב יָדֵינוּ הוּא זֶה, אֲבָל אֲנוּסִים הָיִינוּ, קְטַנִּים הָיִינוּ, פְּסוּלֵי עֵדוּת הָיִינוּ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנִים. וְאִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁהוּא כְּתַב יָדָם, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה כְּתַב יָדָם יוֹצֵא מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר — אֵינָן נֶאֱמָנִין.
human_translation: the witnesses who said this is our handwriting; however, we were compelled we were minors we were disqualified witnesses, they are deemed credible. However, if there are witnesses that it is their handwriting, or if their handwriting emerges from another place, are not deemed credible.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If the witnesses said, "It is our handwriting," but we were coerced, or we were minors, or we were disqualified as witnesses — these are deemed credible. However, if there are witnesses whose handwriting it is, or if their handwriting was copied from another place — they are not deemed credible.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאָמְרוּ ״אֲנוּסִים הָיִינוּ מֵחֲמַת מָמוֹן״. אֲבָל ״אֲנוּסִים הָיִינוּ מֵחֲמַת נְפָשׁוֹת״ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנִין.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama says: taught only where they said: We were compelled due to a monetary However, if said: We were compelled due to lives, they are deemed credible,
llm_translation: Gemara said: Ramei bar Ḥama said: They only taught that "we were coerced due to money." But "we were coerced due to our lives" — these are believed.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: כֹּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ?! כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיד — שׁוּב אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר וּמַגִּיד. וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי עַל פֶּה, אֲבָל בִּשְׁטָר — לָא, וְהָא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: עֵדִים הַחֲתוּמִים עַל הַשְּׁטָר — נַעֲשָׂה כְּמִי שֶׁנֶּחְקְרָה עֵדוּתָן בְּבֵית דִּין!
