human_translation: Rava said to Is it within their power Once a stated he cannot again state And if you say oral testimony, but testimony in a document, no, didn’t Reish Lakish say: witnesses who are signatories on the document becomes like those whose testimony was examined in court.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: All like its kind?! Once he has revealed - he does not go back and reveal. And if you say: These matters are oral, but in a document - no, but Reish Lakish said: Sealed witnesses on a document - their testimony is considered as if it had been examined in court!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּי אִתְּמַר — אַרֵישָׁא אִתְּמַר: הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנִין, אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאָמְרוּ: אֲנוּסִין הָיִינוּ מֵחֲמַת נְפָשׁוֹת, אֲבָל אָמְרוּ: אֲנוּסִין הָיִינוּ מֵחֲמַת מָמוֹן — אֵין נֶאֱמָנִין. מַאי טַעְמָא: אֵין אָדָם מֵשִׂים עַצְמוֹ רָשָׁע.
human_translation: when is stated, it is stated with regard to the first clause they are deemed credible. Rami bar Ḥama said: taught only where said: We were compelled due to lives, However, if said: We were compelled due to a monetary they are not deemed credible. What is the reason One does not render himself wicked,
llm_translation: Rather, when it was stated — initially it was stated: "These are trustworthy." Ramei bar Hama said: They only did not differentiate except that they said: "We were coerced due to our lives," but if they said: "We were coerced due to money" — they are not trustworthy. What is the reason? A person does not consider himself wicked.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין נֶאֱמָנִים לְפוֹסְלוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: נֶאֱמָנִים. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבָּנַן כִּי טַעְמַיְיהוּ, שֶׁהַפֶּה שֶׁאָסַר הוּא הַפֶּה שֶׁהִתִּיר. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, מַאי טַעְמָא? בִּשְׁלָמָא פְּסוּלֵי עֵדוּת, מַלְוֶה גּוּפֵיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא מִידָּק דָּיֵיק וּמַחְתֵּם. קְטַנִּים נָמֵי, כִּדְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ. דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ:
human_translation: The Sages taught: are not deemed credible to invalidate the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: They are deemed credible. Granted, to the Rabbis, their reasoning The mouth that prohibited is the mouth that permitted However, to Rabbi Meir, what is the reason Granted, disqualified witnesses the lender himself initially ascertains and signs Similarly, minors also in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, as Reish Lakish said:
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: They are not trusted to disqualify it, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: They are trusted. Granted according to the Rabbis, for their reasoning is that the mouth that forbade is the mouth that permitted. But according to Rabbi Meir, what is the reason? Granted in the case of disqualifying witnesses, since they contradict themselves from the outset, it is sufficient to examine and seal. Minors also, as Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said. For Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said:

hebrew_text: חֲזָקָה אֵין הָעֵדִים חוֹתְמִין עַל הַשְּׁטָר אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נַעֲשָׂה בְּגָדוֹל. אֶלָּא אֲנוּסִין, מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: a presumption that witnesses sign on the document only if was made when adults. However, compelled what is the reason
llm_translation: Firmly, the witnesses do not sign on the document unless it is done with a gadol. Rather, we are coerced, what is the reason?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, קָסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: עֵדִים שֶׁאָמְרוּ לָהֶם ״חִתְמוּ שֶׁקֶר וְאַל תֵּהָרְגוּ״ — יֵהָרְגוּ וְאַל יַחְתְּמוּ שֶׁקֶר.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said Rabbi Meir maintains: Witnesses that said to them: Sign a falsehood and not be killed, should be killed and they should not sign a falsehood.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said, Rabbi Meir holds: Witnesses who were told, "Sign a false statement and do not be killed" — they should be killed and not sign a false statement.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: הַשְׁתָּא אִילּוּ אָתוּ לְקַמַּן לְאִמְּלוֹכֵי, אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ: זִילוּ חֲתוּמוּ וְלָא תִּתְקַטְּלוּן, דְּאָמַר מָר: אֵין לְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁעוֹמֵד בִּפְנֵי פִּיקּוּחַ נֶפֶשׁ אֶלָּא עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְגִלּוּי עֲרָיוֹת, וּשְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים בִּלְבָד. הַשְׁתָּא דַּחֲתַמוּ, אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ: אַמַּאי חָתְמִיתוּ?
human_translation: Rava said to him: Now, if came before us to consult we say to them: Go sign and you should not be killed, as the Master said: You have no matter that stands before saving a life, other idol worship, forbidden sexual relations, and murder. Now that they signed, we say to them: Why did you sign?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: "Now, if they come to attack us, we say to them: 'Go and sign, and do not be killed,' for the Master said: 'You have nothing that stands in the way of saving a life except idolatry, forbidden sexual relations, and murder alone.' Now that they have signed, we say to them: 'Why did you sign?'"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר כִּדְרַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מוֹדֶה בִּשְׁטָר שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְקַיְּימוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, the reason Rabbi Meir is in accordance with Rav Huna said Rav said, as Rav Huna said Rav said: admits with regard to a document that he wrote it, need not ratify
llm_translation: Rather: The reason of Rabbi Meir is like that of Rav Huna as Rav said. For Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: One who admits in a document that he wrote - there is no need to uphold it.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מוֹדֶה בִּשְׁטָר שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְקַיְּימוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: גַּנּוֹבָא גַּנּוֹבֵי לְמָה לָךְ. אִי סְבִירָא לָךְ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֵימָא הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: the matter itself, Rav Huna said Rav said: admits with regard to a document that he wrote it, need not ratify Rav Naḥman said to Why do you to conceal thief? If you hold in accordance with Rabbi Meir, say: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Body. Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: One who admits to a document that he wrote - there is no need to uphold it. Rav Nachman said to him: "Thieves, why do you steal?" If you do not agree with Rabbi Meir, say the halacha follows Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּמָר הֵיכִי סְבִירָא לֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי אָתוּ לְקַמַּן לְדִינָא, אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ: ״זִילוּ קַיִּימוּ שְׁטָרַיְיכוּ וְחוּתוּ לְדִינָא״.
human_translation: said to him: And what does the Master hold said to him: When come before us for judgment, we say to them: Go and ratify your documents and descend for judgment.
llm_translation: He said to him: And how does the master hold it? He said to him: When they come before the court, we say to them: "Go fulfill your documents and come to the court."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הָאוֹמֵר ״שְׁטַר אֲמָנָה הוּא זֶה״ — אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: One who says This is a document of trust, is not deemed credible.
llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah said Rav: One who says, "A document of trustworthiness, this is it" — he is not trustworthy.

hebrew_text: דְּקָאָמַר מַאן? אִילֵימָא דְּקָאָמַר לֹוֶה — פְּשִׁיטָא, כָּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ?! וְאֶלָּא דְּקָאָמַר מַלְוֶה — תָּבוֹא עָלָיו בְּרָכָה. אֶלָּא דְּקָאָמְרִי עֵדִים. אִי דִּכְתַב יָדָם יוֹצֵא מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר — פְּשִׁיטָא דְּלָא מְהֵימְנִי. וְאִי דְּאֵין כְּתַב יָדָם יוֹצֵא מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר — אַמַּאי לָא מְהֵימְנִי?
human_translation: which who is saying If you say borrower who is saying obvious Is it within power But rather, lender who is saying let a blessing come upon him Rather, witnesses who are saying If where their handwriting emerges from another place, obvious And if where their handwriting does not emerge from another place, why are they not deemed credible?
llm_translation: The text is as follows: Who is he saying? If he is saying "lender" - it is obvious, all of its kinds?! Rather, he is saying "borrower" - blessing shall come upon him. Rather, they are saying witnesses. If their handwriting is found in another place - it is obvious that I do not trust. And if their handwriting is not found in another place - why do I not trust?

hebrew_text: (סִימָן בָּאֵ״שׁ) אָמַר רָבָא: לְעוֹלָם דְּקָאָמַר לֹוֶה, וְכִדְרַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מוֹדֶה בִּשְׁטָר שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְקַיְּימוֹ.
human_translation: a mnemonic Beit , alef , shin , Rava said: Actually, the borrower who is saying it, and in accordance with Rav Huna, as Rav Huna said Rav said: admits with regard to a document that he wrote it, need not ratify
llm_translation: Tractate: (Siman Ba'esh) Rava said: Always when he says "borrow," it is like Rav Huna. For Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: One who admits in a document that he wrote - there is no need to fulfill it.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם דְּאָמַר מַלְוֶה, וּכְגוֹן שֶׁחָב לַאֲחֵרִים, וְכִדְרַבִּי נָתָן.
human_translation: Abaye said: Actually, the lender who said and where he causes loss to others in accordance with Rabbi Natan.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Always one should say "lend," and for example, when he owes to others, as Rabbi Natan.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לַנּוֹשֶׁה בַּחֲבֵירוֹ מָנֶה, וַחֲבֵירוֹ בַּחֲבֵירוֹ — מִנַּיִן שֶׁמּוֹצִיאִין מִזֶּה וְנוֹתְנִין לָזֶה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנָתַן לַאֲשֶׁר אָשַׁם לוֹ״.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Natan says: From where a creditor of one hundred dinars from another, and the other from another, from where that one takes from this and gives it to the the verse states: “And he shall give to the one to whom he is guilty”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Nathan says: From where do we learn that one can appoint a proxy for his friend, and the friend for another friend? From where do we learn that they can take from this one and give to that one? The Talmud teaches: "And he shall give it to the one who is guilty of the guilt offering."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם דְּקָאָמְרִי עֵדִים. וּדְאֵין כְּתַב יָדָם יוֹצֵא מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר. וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ אַמַּאי לָא מְהֵימְנִי — כִּדְרַב כָּהֲנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: אָסוּר לוֹ לָאָדָם שֶׁיְּשַׁהֶה שְׁטַר אֲמָנָה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַל תַּשְׁכֵּן בְּאֹהָלֶיךָ עַוְלָה״.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Actually, the witnesses who are saying and where their handwriting does not emerge from another place. And that which you are saying: Why are they not deemed credible, in accordance with Rav Kahana, as Rav Kahana said: It is prohibited for a person to keep a document of trust in his house, as it is stated: let not injustice dwell in your tents”
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Always they say witnesses. And their handwriting does not go out from another place. And you say, why do you not trust me? - Like Rav Kahana. For Rav Kahana said: It is forbidden for a person to leave a promissory note in his house, as it is stated: "Let no injustice dwell in your tents."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִדְּרַב כָּהֲנָא, עֵדִים שֶׁאָמְרוּ ״אֲמָנָה הָיוּ דְּבָרֵינוּ״ — אֵין נֶאֱמָנִין. מַאי טַעְמָא? כֵּיוָן דְּעַוְלָה הוּא — אַעַוְלָה לָא חָתְמִי.
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, says: Conclude from the statement of Rav Kahana witnesses who said: Our statement was trust, are not deemed credible. What is the reason? Since is an injustice, they not sign injustice.
llm_translation: And Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: Learn from it this principle from Rav Kahana, witnesses who said, "We were trustworthy in our words" - they are not believed. What is the reason? Since it is a deceitful act, a deceitful person does not sign a document.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: אָסוּר לוֹ לָאָדָם שֶׁיְּשַׁהֶה שְׁטָר פָּרוּעַ בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַל תַּשְׁכֵּן בְּאֹהָלֶיךָ עַוְלָה״. בְּמַעְרְבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אָמְרִי: ״אִם אָוֶן בְּיָדְךָ הַרְחִיקֵהוּ״ — זֶה שְׁטַר אֲמָנָה וּשְׁטַר פַּסִּים. ״וְאַל תַּשְׁכֵּן בְּאֹהָלֶיךָ עַוְלָה״ — זֶה שְׁטָר פָּרוּעַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: It is prohibited for a person to keep a repaid document within his house, due to that the verse states: let not injustice dwell in your tents” In the West, they say in the name of Rav: “If iniquity be in your hand, put it far away” this a document of trust and a document of security [ passim ]. “And let not injustice dwell in your tents,” this a repaid document.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: It is forbidden for a person to leave a promissory note lying exposed in his house, as it is stated: "Let no wickedness dwell in your tents." In the West, in the name of Rav, they say: "If iniquity be in your hand, put it far away" - this refers to a deed of trust and a deed of ownership. "Let no wickedness dwell in your tents" - this refers to a promissory note.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁטָר פָּרוּעַ, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן שְׁטַר אֲמָנָה. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁטַר אֲמָנָה — אֲבָל שְׁטָר פָּרוּעַ לָא, דְּזִמְנִין דִּמְשַׁהֵי לֵיהּ אַפְּשִׁיטֵי דְסָפְרָא.
human_translation: the one who said a repaid document all the more so a document of trust And the one who said document of trust however, a repaid document, as, at times keep it for the coins of the scribe,
llm_translation: The one who says a sealed document, all the more so a document of trust. And the one who says a document of trust - but a sealed document not, for sometimes it is lost and the document is clear.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: סֵפֶר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מוּגָּהּ, אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם מוּתָּר לְשַׁהוֹתוֹ, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ אָסוּר לְשַׁהוֹתוֹ, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַל תַּשְׁכֵּן בְּאֹהָלֶיךָ עַוְלָה״.
human_translation: it is stated, scroll that is not proofread Rabbi Ami says: It is permitted to keep it up to thirty days, from that time onward it is prohibited to keep it, as it is stated: let not injustice dwell in your tents”
llm_translation: It was stated: A scroll that is not defective, Rabbi Ammi said: Up to thirty days it is permitted to leave it, from here on it is forbidden to leave it, because it is stated: "Do not let wickedness dwell in your tents."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: עֵדִים שֶׁאָמְרוּ אֲמָנָה הָיוּ דְּבָרֵינוּ — אֵין נֶאֱמָנִין. מוֹדָעָא הָיוּ דְּבָרֵינוּ — אֵין נֶאֱמָנִין. מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲמָנָה הָיוּ דְּבָרֵינוּ — אֵין נֶאֱמָנִין, מוֹדָעָא הָיוּ דְּבָרֵינוּ — נֶאֱמָנִין. מַאי טַעְמָא? הַאי — נִיתַּן לִיכָּתֵב. וְהַאי — לֹא נִיתַּן לִיכָּתֵב.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said witnesses who say: Our statement was trust are not deemed credible. Our statement was a declaration are not deemed credible. Mar bar Rav Ashi said Our statement was trust, are not deemed credible, Our statement was a declaration, are deemed credible. What is the reason This may be written, And this may not be written,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Witnesses who said "we are trustworthy" are not believed. If they were known to be trustworthy, they are not believed. Mar bar Rav Ashi said: If they said "we are trustworthy," they are not believed; if they were known to be trustworthy, they are believed. What is the reason? This one - can be written down, and this one - cannot be written down.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: תְּנַאי הָיוּ דְּבָרֵינוּ, מַהוּ? מוֹדָעָא וַאֲמָנָה, הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא — דְּקָא עָקְרִי לֵיהּ לִשְׁטָרָא, וְהַאי נָמֵי קָא עָקַר לִשְׁטָרָא. אוֹ דִלְמָא: תְּנַאי מִילְּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי הִיא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי אָתוּ לְקַמַּן לְדִינָא, אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ: זִילוּ קַיִּימוּ תְּנָאַיְיכוּ וְחוּתוּ לְדִינָא.
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma before Rav Naḥman: Our statement was a conditional what is declaration and trust. this is the reason as they undermine the document, and this too, he undermines the document. Or perhaps a condition is a different matter, said to him: When come before us for judgment we say to them: Go and fulfill your conditions, and descend for judgment.
llm_translation: Rava asked a question from Rav Nachman: Our teachings were explicit, what is the ruling? Moda'a and amana, meaning the reason - that he uprooted it for the document, and this one uprooted it for the document. Or perhaps: Is it a different teaching altogether? He said to him: When you come before the court, say to them: Go fulfill your teachings and come to the judgment.

hebrew_text: עֵד אוֹמֵר ״תְּנַאי״, וְעֵד אוֹמֵר ״אֵינוֹ תְּנַאי״. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: תַּרְוַיְיהוּ בִּשְׁטָרָא מְעַלְּיָא קָא מַסְהֲדִי, וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר: ״תְּנַאי״ — הָוֵה לֵיהּ חַד, וְאֵין דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל אֶחָד בִּמְקוֹם שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: witness says: condition and witness says: There is no condition? Rav Pappa says: Both are testifying that it is a valid document, and that who says: condition is one And the statement of one has no in a place two
llm_translation: Witness one says "it is a dispute," and witness two says "it is not a dispute." Rav Papa said: Both of them are testifying favorably in the document, and what he is saying: "it is a dispute" — he should have one, and not the words of one in the place of two.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ תַּרְוַיְיהוּ נָמֵי? אֶלָּא אָמְרִינַן: הָנֵי לְמִיעְקַר סָהֲדוּתַיְיהוּ קָאָתוּ, הַאי נָמֵי לְמִיעְקַר סָהֲדוּתֵיהּ קָאָתֵי: וְהִלְכְתָא כְּרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, objects to this: If so even both also Rather, we say: These are coming to undermine their testimony this is coming to undermine his testimony as well. The halakha is in accordance with Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua,
llm_translation: The Gemara challenges him: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, objects to this: If so, even their testimony is also invalid? Rather, we say: These come to establish their testimony, while these come to invalidate their testimony. And the halakha is in accordance with Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁנַיִם חֲתוּמִין עַל הַשְּׁטָר וּמֵתוּ, וּבָאוּ שְׁנַיִם מִן הַשּׁוּק וְאָמְרוּ: יָדַעְנוּ שֶׁכְּתַב יָדָם הוּא, אֲבָל אֲנוּסִים הָיוּ, קְטַנִּים הָיוּ, פְּסוּלֵי עֵדוּת הָיוּ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנִים. וְאִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁכְּתַב יָדָם הוּא זֶה, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה כְּתַב יָדָם יוֹצֵא מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר מִשְּׁטָר שֶׁקָּרָא עָלָיו עַרְעָר וְהוּחְזַק בְּבֵית דִּין — אֵין אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught: two signatories on a document and they died, and two from the marketplace came and said: We know that this is their handwriting, but they were coerced or they were minors they were disqualified witnesses these are deemed credible, However, if there are witnesses that it is their handwriting, or if their handwriting emerges from another place, from a document that one challenged and was deemed valid in court, these not deemed credible
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If two witnesses signed on a document and then died, and two others came from the marketplace and said, "We know that their handwriting is genuine, but they were coerced, they were minors, or they were invalid witnesses," these are believed. But if there are witnesses that this is their handwriting, or that their handwriting came from a different place than the document upon which an objection was raised and was upheld in court, these are not believed.

hebrew_text: וּמַגְבֵּינַן בֵּיהּ כְּבִשְׁטָרָא מְעַלְּיָא? וְאַמַּאי? תְּרֵי וּתְרֵי נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: And that we collect as with a valid document? And why Aren’t two and two
llm_translation: We establish in it like a shtrara above? And why? Two and two they are!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת: הַכְחָשָׁה — תְּחִלַּת הֲזָמָה הִיא,
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: That is to say contradiction is the first rendering false, conspiring witnesses,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said, this means: "Deception - is the beginning of scheming."

hebrew_text: וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין מְזִימִּין אֶת הָעֵדִים אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵיהֶם, כָּךְ אֵין מַכְחִישִׁין אֶת הָעֵדִים אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: And just as render witnesses false, conspiring only in their presence, so too, contradict only in their presence.
llm_translation: And as they do not summon the witnesses except in their presence, so too they do not discredit the witnesses except in their presence.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: אִילּוּ הֲווֹ קַמַּן וּמַכְחִישִׁין לְהוּ, הֲוָה הַכְחָשָׁה, וְלָא הֲוָה מַשְׁגִּיחִין בְּהוּ. דְּהָוְיָ[א] לַהּ עֵדוּת מוּכְחֶשֶׁת. הַשְׁתָּא דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ, דְּאִילּוּ הֲווֹ לְקַמַּן דִּלְמָא הֲווֹ מוֹדוּ לְהוּ, מְהֵימְנִי?!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to If was before us and contradict that is contradiction, and we would not consider their as it is contradicted testimony. Now that they are not where if they were before us perhaps they would have admitted to are they deemed credible,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman: If they were standing and denying it to him, there would be denial, and they would not be paying attention to him. For it would have been a clear testimony for him. Now that they are not giving it to him, if they were to stand later, perhaps they would admit to him, would I believe them?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אוֹקֵי תְּרֵי לַהֲדֵי תְּרֵי, וְאוֹקֵי מָמוֹנָא בְּחֶזְקַת מָרֵיהּ, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַנִּכְסֵי דְּבַר שָׁטְיָא. דְּבַר שָׁטְיָא זַבֵּין נִכְסֵי. אֲתוֹ בֵּי תְרֵי, אָמְרִי: כְּשֶׁהוּא שׁוֹטֶה זַבֵּין, וַאֲתוֹ בֵּי תְרֵי וְאָמְרִי: כְּשֶׁהוּא חָלִים זַבֵּין.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Naḥman said Establish two against two and establish the money in the possession of its owner, just as it was of the property of bar Shatya. As bar Shatya, sold property, two came said: He sold when he was insane; and two came said: He sold when he was sane.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Nachman said: One establishes two through two, and one establishes money with the presumption of its owner, because it is likely to be a matter of a creditor. A creditor sells properties. The two came to the court, they said: When he is foolish, he sells properties, and the two came to the court and said: When he is ill, he sells properties.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אוֹקֵי תְּרֵי לַהֲדֵי תְּרֵי, וְאוֹקִי מָמוֹנָא בְּחֶזְקַת בַּר שָׁטְיָא. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּאִית לֵיהּ חֲזָקָה דַאֲבָהָתֵיהּ. אֲבָל לֵית לֵיהּ חֲזָקָה דַאֲבָהָתֵיהּ, אָמְרִינַן: כְּשֶׁהוּא שׁוֹטֶה זְבַן, וּכְשֶׁהוּא שׁוֹטֶה זַבֵּין.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said Establish two against two and establish the money in the possession of bar Shatya. We say only when he has the possession of his fathers. However, if he does not have the possession of his fathers, we say: He purchased when he was insane, and he sold them when he was insane.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: If there are two against two, and there is money in the possession of Bar Shatya, we establish the presumption in favor of the possessor. And we only said this when there is a presumption in favor of his father. But if there is no presumption in favor of his father, we say: When he is a buyer, he buys, and when he is a seller, he sells.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אֵין מְזִימִּין אֶת הָעֵדִים אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵיהֶן, וּמַכְחִישִׁין אֶת הָעֵדִים שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵיהֶן. וַהֲזָמָה שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵיהֶן, נְהִי דַּהֲזָמָה לָא הָוְיָא — הַכְחָשָׁה מִיהָא הָוְיָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: render witnesses false, conspiring only in their presence, but contradict not in their presence. And rendering witnesses false, conspiring not in their presence, although it is not rendering them false, conspiring in any case, it is a contradiction
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: We do not appoint witnesses except in their presence, and we discredit witnesses not in their presence. And a conspiracy that is not in their presence, even though a conspiracy is not valid - discrediting is valid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁכְּתַב יָדָם הוּא זֶה, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה כְּתַב יָדָם יוֹצֵא מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר, מִשְּׁטָר שֶׁקָּרָא עָלָיו עַרְעָר וְהוּחְזַק בְּבֵית דִּין — אֵין נֶאֱמָנִין. קָרָא עָלָיו עַרְעָר — אִין, לֹא קָרָא עָלָיו עַרְעָר — לָא, מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אַסִּי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: אֵין מְקַיְּימִין אֶת הַשְּׁטָר אֶלָּא מִשְּׁטָר שֶׁקָּרָא עָלָיו עַרְעָר וְהוּחְזַק בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: The Master said If there are witnesses that it is their handwriting, or if their handwriting emerges from another place, from a document that one challenged and was deemed valid in court, not deemed credible. that one challenged, yes, if one did not challenge no, supports Rabbi Asi, as Rabbi Asi said: One ratifies a document only from a document that challenged and was deemed valid in court.
llm_translation: Master said: If there are witnesses that their handwriting is this, or that their handwriting was from another place, a document that was read upon it a challenge and was established in court - they are not believed. If a challenge was read upon it - no, if a challenge was not read upon it - yes, he supports Rabbi Assi. For Rabbi Assi said: We only uphold a document from a challenge that was read upon it and was established in court.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי: אֵין מְקַיְּימִין אֶת הַשְּׁטָר אֶלָּא מִשְׁתֵּי כְּתוּבּוֹת, [אוֹ] מִשְּׁתֵּי שָׂדוֹת, וְהוּא שֶׁאֲכָלוּם בַּעֲלֵיהֶן שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים, וּבְשׁוֹפִי.
human_translation: of Neharde’a say: One ratifies a document only from two marriage contracts or from two fields And only where their owner ate their three years, and in peace,
llm_translation: The Nehardeans said: We do not establish a document except from two writings, or from two fields, and this is when their owners consumed them for three years, and with witnesses.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: וּבְיוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יַד אַחֵר. אֲבָל מִיַּד עַצְמוֹ — לָא. מַאי שְׁנָא תַּחַת יַד עַצְמוֹ דְּלָא, דִּלְמָא זַיּוֹפֵי מְזַיֵּיף. מִתַּחַת יְדֵי אַחֵר נָמֵי: דִּלְמָא אֲזַל וַחֲזָא, אֲתָא וְזַיֵּיף! כּוּלֵּי הַאי לָא מָצֵי מְכַוֵּין.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: when emerge from the possession of another. However, from the possession of himself, no, What is different from the possession of himself that not perhaps forged also from the possession of another, perhaps he went and saw came and forged he would not be able accurately to that extent
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashei said: "And from underneath the hand of another. But from one's own hand - no. What is the difference between 'underneath one's own hand' and 'from underneath the hand of another'? Perhaps one might switch." From underneath the hand of another is also possible: perhaps he goes and sees, comes back, and switches! In all these cases, it is not considered intentional.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כּוֹתֵב אָדָם עֵדוּתוֹ עַל הַשְּׁטָר, וּמֵעִיד עָלֶיהָ אֲפִילּוּ לְאַחַר כַּמָּה שָׁנִים. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: וְהוּא שֶׁזּוֹכְרָהּ מֵעַצְמוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין זוֹכְרָהּ מֵעַצְמוֹ. אָמַר רַבָּה: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִדְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָנֵי בֵּי תְרֵי דְּיָדְעִי סָהֲדוּתָא וּמִנְּשֵׁי חַד מִנַּיְיהוּ, מַדְכַּר חַד לְחַבְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: A person may write his testimony in a document and testify on its even after several years Rav Huna said: And is if he remembers on his own Rabbi Yoḥanan said: even if he does not remember by himself Rabba said: Conclude from Rabbi Yoḥanan: these two witnesses who know testimony and one of them forgot one may remind his fellow
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A person may write his testimony on a document and testify to it even after many years. Rav Huna said: This is when he remembers it himself. Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if he does not remember it himself. Rabbah said: Learn from this the ruling of Rabbi Yochanan: Two people who know the testimony and one of them dies, the other may remind his colleagues.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: עַצְמוֹ, מַאי? רַב חֲבִיבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ עַצְמוֹ. מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: עַצְמוֹ לֹא. וְהִלְכְתָא עַצְמוֹ לֹא.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before himself what is Rav Ḥaviva said: Even himself Mar, son of Rav Ashi, said: himself may not And the halakha is himself may not
llm_translation: He asked them: "Atzmo, what is it?" Rav Chaviva said: "Even Atzmo." Mar, son of Rav Ashi, said: "Not Atzmo." And the halacha is not Atzmo.

hebrew_text: וְאִי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן הוּא, אֲפִילּוּ עַצְמוֹ. כִּי הָא דְּרַב אָשֵׁי הֲוָה יְדִיעַ לֵיהּ בְּסָהֲדוּתָא לְרַב כָּהֲנָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי דְּכִיר מָר הַאי סָהֲדוּתָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא. וְלָאו הָכִי וְהָכִי הֲוָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא יָדַעְנָא, לְסוֹף אִידְּכַר רַב אָשֵׁי, אַסְהֵיד לֵיהּ. חַזְיֵיהּ לְרַב כָּהֲנָא דַּהֲוָה מְחַסֵּם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי סָבְרַתְּ עֲלָךְ קָא סְמִיכְנָא? אֲנָא הוּא דִּרְמַאי אַנַּפְשַׁאי וְאִדַּכְרִי.
human_translation: And if is a Torah scholar, even himself as that involving Rav Ashi, who knew testimony to Rav Kahana. said to Does the Master remember this testimony? said to him: No. Didn’t such and such said to him: I don’t know. Ultimately, Rav Ashi remembered testified for He saw that Rav Kahana was hesitant [ meḥassem ] said to him: Do you think I am relying on you? I made an effort, and I remembered
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If he is a Talmudic scholar, even himself. For this that Rav Ashe knew about him through testimony to Rav Kahana. He said to him: Who knows this testimony? He said to him: No. And was it not so and so? He said to him: We did not know, in the end Rav Ashe remembered, he testified about him. Rav Kahana saw that he was silent. He said to him: Do you think that we rely on you? I am the one who is a guarantor for myself and I remember. English translation:

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הַתְּלוּלִיּוֹת הַקְּרוֹבוֹת בֵּין לָעִיר וּבֵין לַדֶּרֶךְ, אֶחָד חֲדָשׁוֹת וְאֶחָד יְשָׁנוֹת — טְמֵאוֹת. הָרְחוֹקוֹת, חֲדָשׁוֹת — טְהוֹרוֹת, יְשָׁנוֹת — טְמֵאוֹת. אֵיזוֹהִי קְרוֹבָה — חֲמִשִּׁים אַמָּה, וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא יְשָׁנָה — שִׁשִּׁים שָׁנָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: קְרוֹבָה — שֶׁאֵין קְרוֹבָה הֵימֶנָּה, יְשָׁנָה — שֶׁאֵין אָדָם זוֹכְרָהּ.
human_translation: we learned there Mounds of dirt that are near either to a city or a path, whether are new or whether old, are ritually impure the that are distant new ritually pure, old impure. What is near? fifty cubits. And what is old? sixty years; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: near no closer than it. Old that no one remembers.
llm_translation: We learned there: Hanging clusters near a city or near a road, whether they are new or old - they are impure. Those that are far away, if they are new - they are pure, if they are old - they are impure. What is considered near? Fifty cubits. And what is considered old? Sixty years. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Near means that there is nothing closer, and old means that no one remembers it.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״עִיר״ וּמַאי ״דֶּרֶךְ״? אִילֵימָא ״עִיר״ — עִיר מַמָּשׁ, ״דֶּרֶךְ״ — דֶּרֶךְ מַמָּשׁ, מִסְּפֵיקָא מִי מַחְזְקִינַן טוּמְאָה? וְהָאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: עִילָּה מָצְאוּ וְטִהֲרוּ אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: ״עִיר״ — עִיר הַסְּמוּכָה לְבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת, וְ״דֶרֶךְ״ — דֶּרֶךְ בֵּית הַקְּבָרוֹת.
human_translation: What is a city and what is a path If you say city means an actual city and a path is an actual path Do we presume ritual impurity But didn’t Reish Lakish say They found a pretext and deemed Eretz Yisrael ritually pure. Rabbi Zeira said: city a city adjacent to the cemetery, and path is path to the cemetery.
llm_translation: What is "city" and what is "way"? If you say "city" - an actual city, "way" - an actual way, from where do we establish impurity? And Reish Lakish said: They found an upper room and purified the land of Israel. Rabbi Zeira said: "City" - a city adjacent to a cemetery, and "way" - a way to the cemetery.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא דֶּרֶךְ בֵּית הַקְּבָרוֹת, דְּזִמְנִין דְּמִתְרְמֵי בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת וּמִקְּרוּ קָבְרוּ בְּתֵל. אֶלָּא עִיר הַסְּמוּכָה לְבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת, כּוּלְּהִי לְבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת אָזְלִי?
human_translation: Granted, the path to the cemetery, as sometimes one happens at twilight, it happened that they buried in a mound However, a city adjacent to the cemetery, everyone goes to the cemetery
llm_translation: In peace, the way of the cemetery, sometimes they would go out between the suns and they would dig a grave in a hill. Rather, a city adjacent to the cemetery, all of them would go to the cemetery then?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהַנָּשִׁים קוֹבְרוֹת שָׁם נִפְלֵיהֶן, וּמוּכֵּי שְׁחִין זְרוֹעוֹתֵיהֶם — עַד חֲמִשִּׁים אַמָּה אָזְלָא אִיהִי לְחוּדַּהּ. טְפֵי — דָּבְרָא אִינִישׁ בַּהֲדַהּ, וּלְבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת אָזְלָא. הִלְכָּךְ, טוּמְאָה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לָא מַחְזְקִינַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: since women bury their stillborn and afflicted with boils their arms Until fifty cubits goes alone More she takes a person with her, and she goes to the cemetery. Therefore, we are not presuming ritual impurity in Eretz Yisrael.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: Because women bury their miscarriages there, and those afflicted with skin diseases, their arms are extended up to fifty cubits, then it is considered a separate domain. The reason is that a person's speech is with him, and he goes to the cemetery. Therefore, we do not establish impurity in the land of Israel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מֵרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הַאי סָהֲדוּתָא עַד שִׁיתִּין שְׁנִין — מִידְּכַר, טְפֵי — לָא מִידְּכַר. וְלָא הִיא, הָתָם הוּא דְּלָא רַמְיָא עֲלֵיהּ. אֲבָל הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּרָמֵי עֲלֵיהּ, אֲפִילּוּ טוּבָא נָמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Conclude from Rabbi Meir, testimony, until sixty years remembered, more not remembered. And That is not There, it is where was not imposed upon him, However, here, since was imposed upon him, even a greater
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Learn a lesson from Rabbi Meir, this testimony, until sixty years — immediately, it is remembered; after sixty years — it is not remembered. And it is not so, there it is because he did not hint at it. But here, since he hinted at it, even a good thing is forgotten.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ זֶה אוֹמֵר: כְּתַב יָדִי, וְזֶה כְּתַב יָדוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירִי. וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: זֶה כְּתַב יָדִי, וְזֶה כְּתַב יָדוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירִי — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנִין. זֶה אוֹמֵר: זֶה כְּתַב יָדִי, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: זֶה כְּתַב יָדִי — צְרִיכִין לְצָרֵף עִמָּהֶם אַחֵר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינָם צְרִיכִין לְצָרֵף עִמָּהֶן אַחֵר, אֶלָּא נֶאֱמָן אָדָם לוֹמַר זֶה כְּתַב יָדִי.
human_translation: this says: my handwriting and this is the handwriting of my fellow and that says: This is my handwriting and that is the handwriting of my fellow these are deemed credible this says: This is my handwriting, and that says: This is my handwriting, they must add another with them the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: They need not add another with them. Rather, a person is deemed credible to say: This is my handwriting.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: This one says, "This is my handwriting," and this one says, "This is the handwriting of my fellow." And this one says, "This is my handwriting," and this one says, "This is the handwriting of my fellow" - these are deemed trustworthy. This one says, "This is my handwriting," and this one says, "This is my handwriting" - they need to be joined with others, the words of Rabbi. And the sages say: They do not need to be joined with others, rather a person is deemed trustworthy to say, "This is my handwriting."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כְּשֶׁתִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר, לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי
human_translation: When you analyze say to statement of Rabbi
llm_translation: Gemara: When you find to say, according to the words of Rabbi...

hebrew_text: עַל כְּתַב יָדָן הֵם מְעִידִים. לְדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים, עַל מָנֶה שֶׁבַּשְּׁטָר הֵם מְעִידִים.
human_translation: are testifying about their handwriting to the Rabbis, are testifying about one hundred dinars that is in the document
llm_translation: On their handwriting they testify. According to the words of the sages, they testify on a loan that is in the document.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא לְרַבִּי סַפּוֹקֵי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ אִי עַל כְּתַב יָדָם הֵם מְעִידִים, אוֹ עַל מָנֶה שֶׁבַּשְּׁטָר הֵם מְעִידִים.
human_translation: obvious. lest you say Rabbi uncertainty whether they are testifying about their handwriting or are testifying about one hundred dinars that is in the document,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Peshita? Mahu d'teima l'Rabbi Safuqei mesapkei leih, i al k'tav yadam hem me'idim, o al mane sheb'shtar hem me'idim. English translation: Is it obvious? What is the reasoning for Rabbi Safuqei who is in doubt, whether they testify based on their handwriting, or on the count in the document they testify.

hebrew_text: וְנָפְקָא מִינַּהּ, הֵיכָא דְּמִית חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, לִבְעֵי שְׁנַיִם מִן הַשּׁוּק לְהָעִיד עָלָיו.
human_translation: And the practical difference where one of died. let them require two from the street to testify about
llm_translation: And it was derived from it, where if one of them dies, he requires two from the market to testify about him.

hebrew_text: דְּאִם כֵּן, קָנָפֵיק נְכֵי רִיבְעָא דְמָמוֹנָא אַפּוּמָּא דְּחַד סָהֲדָא.
human_translation: That if so of money, less one-quarter, is collected on the testimony of a single witness.
llm_translation: If so, the corner of the cloth of money, the value of one witness.

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא לְחוּמְרָא וְהָכָא לְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: And stringently here: and stringently here:
llm_translation: And here it is for stringency, and here it is for stringency.

hebrew_text: קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּרַבִּי מִיפְשָׁט פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ, בֵּין לְקוּלָּא בֵּין לְחוּמְרָא. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שְׁנַיִם הַחֲתוּמִין עַל הַשְּׁטָר וּמֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן — צְרִיכִין שְׁנַיִם מִן הַשּׁוּק לְהָעִיד עָלָיו, בְּזוֹ רַבִּי לְקוּלָּא. וְרַבָּנַן לְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: teaches us that was clear to Rabbi both leniently, and stringently, As Rav Yehuda said Rav said: two who were signatories to a document and one of them died, they require two from the street testify about in this Rabbi leniently and the Rabbis stringently
llm_translation: We have learned that Rabbi Mipshat is lenient with him, whether for leniency or for stringency. For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: If two witnesses are signed on a document and one of them dies, two others from the marketplace are needed to testify about him, this is the opinion of Rabbi for leniency. And the Rabbis for stringency.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לֵיכָּא תְּרֵי אֶלָּא חַד, מַאי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לִכְתּוֹב חֲתִימַת יְדֵיהּ אַחַסְפָּא, וְשָׁדֵי לֵיהּ בְּבֵי דִינָא, וּמַחְזְקִי לֵיהּ בֵּי דִינָא (וְחָזוּ לֵיהּ), וְלָא צָרִיךְ אִיהוּ לְאַסְהוֹדֵי אַחֲתִימַת יְדֵיהּ, וְאָזֵיל אִיהוּ וְהַאי, וּמַסְהֲדִי אַאִידַּךְ.
human_translation: And if there are not two but only one, what Abaye said: Let write his signature on an earthenware and cast it into the court. And the court ratifies by seeing his And he does not need to testify his signature. But he and this go and testify the other
llm_translation: If there is not two but one, what is it? Abaye said: To write the signature of his hand on a document, and place it in the court, and strengthen it in the court (and they see it), and he does not need to bring witnesses to testify to the signature of his hand, and he goes and the other party brings witnesses.

hebrew_text: וְדַוְקָא אַחַסְפָּא, אֲבָל אַמְּגִלְּתָא לָא, דִּלְמָא מַשְׁכַּח לַהּ אִינִישׁ דְּלָא מְעַלֵּי וְכָתֵב עִילָּוֵיהּ מַאי דְּבָעֵי. וּתְנַן: הוֹצִיא עָלָיו כְּתַב יָדוֹ שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב לוֹ — גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין.
human_translation: And specifically on an earthenware but not on parchment, perhaps an unscrupulous person will find it and write on it whatever he wants, And we learned produced about handwriting, that owes him may collect from unsold property.
llm_translation: And specifically Achaspa, but not Amgilta, perhaps one forgets that he did not transgress, and writes above it what he wants. And we learned: If one produces a document against himself that he is obligated to, he collects from free property.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים. פְּשִׁיטָא! יָחִיד וְרַבִּים — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּים! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵחֲבֵירוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ מֵחֲבֵירָיו, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis obvious, an individual and multiple the halakha in accordance with multiple Lest you say The halakha in accordance with Rabbi with his colleague, even with his colleagues; teaches us
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha follows the words of the Sages. It is obvious! Between an individual and the majority - the halakha follows the majority! Lest you say the halakha follows Rabbi against his colleague, and even against his colleagues, he teaches us.

hebrew_text: סִימָן: נָח נָד חַד. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִנָּנָא בַּר חִיָּיא לְרַב יְהוּדָה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב הוּנָא בַּר יְהוּדָה לְרַב יְהוּדָה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב חִיָּיא בַּר יְהוּדָה לְרַב יְהוּדָה: וּמִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הָכִי?
human_translation: a mnemonic Nun ḥet nun dalet ḥet dalet Rav Ḥinnana bar Ḥiyya said to Rav Yehuda, and some say Rav Huna bar Yehuda said to Rav Yehuda, and some say Rav Ḥiyya bar Yehuda said to Rav Yehuda: And did Shmuel say that
llm_translation: Topic: Nach Nad Chad. Rav Chananah son of Chiya said to Rav Yehudah, and some say Rav Huna son of Yehudah said to Rav Yehudah, and some say Rav Chiya son of Yehudah said to Rav Yehudah: Did Samuel really say so?

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָהוּא שְׁטָרָא דִּנְפַק מִבֵּי דִינָא דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל, וַהֲוָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ: מִדַּאֲתָא רַב עָנָן בַּר חִיָּיא וְאַסְהֵיד אַחֲתִימוּת יְדֵיהּ וְאַדְּחַד דְּעִמֵּיהּ, וּמַנּוּ — רַב חָנָן בַּר רַבָּה, וּמִדַּאֲתָא רַב חָנָן בַּר רַבָּה וְאַסְהֵיד אַחֲתִימוּת יְדֵיהּ וְאַדְּחַד דְּעִמֵּיהּ, וּמַנּוּ — רַב עָנָן בַּר חִיָּיא, אַשַּׁרְנוֹהִי וְקַיֵּמְנוֹהִי כְּדַחֲזֵי?
human_translation: But wasn’t that document that emerged from the court of Master Shmuel, and it was written with regard to From that Rav Anan bar Ḥiyya came and testified about his signature and about of the one who with him, and who was that Rav Ḥanan bar Rabba; and from that Rav Ḥanan bar Rabba came and testified about his signature and about of the one who with him, and who was that Rav Anan bar Ḥiyya; we certified and ratified as appropriate.
llm_translation: And this is the document that came out from the court of Mar Samuel, and it was written in it: "From the time that Rav Anan son of Chiya came and testified with the finality of his hands and united with him, and they counted - Rav Chanin son of Rabba. And from the time that Rav Chanin son of Rabba came and testified with the finality of his hands and united with him, and they counted - Rav Anan son of Chiya, who was there and established it as it appears?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָהוּא שְׁטָרָא דְיַתְמֵי הֲוָה, וְחַשׁ שְׁמוּאֵל לְבֵית דִּין טוֹעִין. וּסְבַר שְׁמוּאֵל דִּלְמָא אִיכָּא דִּסְבִירָא לֵיהּ: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְלֹא מֵחֲבֵירָיו, וּבְהָא אֲפִילּוּ מֵחֲבֵירָיו, סְבַר: אֶעֱבֵיד רַוְוחָא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא מַפְסְדִי יַתְמֵי.
human_translation: said to him: That was a document for orphans, and Shmuel was concerned for an error of the court. And Shmuel thought: Perhaps there is that holds the halakha in accordance with Rabbi with his colleague but not with his colleagues, and in this even with his colleagues, he thought: I will perform expansive that the orphans will not lose
llm_translation: He said to him: That document of Yatmei was, and Hash Samuel for the court err. And Samuel thought perhaps there is one who thinks: the halacha is like Rabbi from his colleague and not from his colleagues, and with this even from his colleagues, he thinks: I will do profit so that I do not cause loss to Yatmei.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עֵד וְדַיָּין מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: witness and a judge join
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A witness and a judge combine.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: כַּמָּה מְעַלְּיָא הָא שְׁמַעְתָּא! אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי מְעַלְּיוּתָא? מַאי דְּקָא מַסְהֵיד סָהֲדָא לָא קָא מַסְהֵיד דַּיָּינָא, וּמַאי דְּקָא מַסְהֵיד דַּיָּינָא לָא קָא מַסְהֵיד סָהֲדָא!
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said: How excellent is this halakha . Rava said: what excellence That which the witness testifies, the judge does not testify, And that which the judge testifies, the witness does not testify.
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: How exalted is this teaching! Rava said: What is the exaltedness? What he reveals to the witness, he does not reveal to the judge, and what he reveals to the judge, he does not reveal to the witness!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי אֲתָא רָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל, אָמַר: לָא תְּצִיתִינְהוּ לְהָנֵי כְּלָלֵי דְּכָיֵיל יְהוּדָה אֲחִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: Rather, when Rami bar Yeḥezkel came, he said: Do not listen to those principles that my brother Yehuda established in the name of Shmuel
llm_translation: Instead, when Ramei, son of Yechzekel, came, he said: "Do not extinguish them for the sake of the community of the school of Yehuda, the brother of Mishmei, whose name is Shmuel."

hebrew_text: אִיקְּלַע רַבְנַאי אֲחוּהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא לְמִזְבַּן שׁוּמְשְׁמֵי וַאֲמַר: הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עֵד וְדַיָּין מִצְטָרְפִין. אֲמַר אַמֵּימָר: כַּמָּה מְעַלְּיָא הָא שְׁמַעְתָּא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר: מִשּׁוּם דְּקַלְּסַהּ אֲבוּהּ דְּאִמָּךְ, אַתְּ נָמֵי מְקַלְּסַתְּ לַהּ?! כְּבָר פַּרְכַהּ רָבָא.
human_translation: Ravnai, brother of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, happened to sell sesame, and he said this Shmuel said: A witness and a judge join Ameimar said: How excellent is this halakha . Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: Due to that father of your mother, praised it, you also praise mekallesat it? Rava already refuted
llm_translation: Ravna'i encountered the brother of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba in the marketplace and said: Thus said Shmuel: A witness and a judge combine. Amemar said: How excellent is this teaching that you have heard! Rav Ashe said to Amemar: Because the father of your mother-in-law has mocked her, are you also mocking her?! Rava already explained it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר מָרְתָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, וְאָמְרִי לֵיהּ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁיָּשְׁבוּ לְקַיֵּים אֶת הַשְּׁטָר, שְׁנַיִם מַכִּירִין חֲתִימוּת יְדֵי עֵדִים, וְאֶחָד אֵינוֹ מַכִּיר. עַד שֶׁלֹּא חָתְמוּ — מְעִידִין בְּפָנָיו וְחוֹתֵם. מִשֶּׁחָתְמוּ — אֵין מְעִידִין בְּפָנָיו וְחוֹתֵם.
human_translation: Rav Safra said Rabbi Abba said Rav Yitzhak bar Shmuel bar Marta said Rav Huna said; Rav Huna said Rav said: three who convened to ratify a document, two recognize the signatures of the witnesses and one does not recognize as long as did not sign testify before signs once signed they may not testify before him and sign
llm_translation: Rav Safra said, Rabbi Abba said, Rav Yitzchak bar Shmuel bar Marta said in the name of Rav Huna, and some say Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: Three who sat to validate a document, two recognize the signatures of the witnesses, and one does not recognize. Until they have not signed - they testify in his presence and sign. Once they have signed - they do not testify in his presence and sign.

hebrew_text: וּמִי כָּתְבִינַן? וְהָאָמַר רַב פַּפִּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: הַאי אַשַּׁרְתָּא דְּדַיָּינֵי דְּנִיכְתַּב מִקַּמֵּיהּ דְּנַיחְווֹ סָהֲדִי אַחֲתִימַת יְדַיְיהוּ — פְּסוּלָה, דְּמִתְחֲזֵי כְּשִׁקְרָא, הָכָא נָמֵי מִתְחֲזֵי כְּשִׁקְרָא!
human_translation: And do we write But didn’t Rav Pappi say in the name of Rava: This ratification of judges that was written before the witnesses related about their signatures is invalid, it seems like a lie, Here too, it seems like a lie.
llm_translation: And who wrote them? And Rav Pappi said in the name of Rava: This document of the judges that is written from their presence, and they sign with one of their hands — it is invalid, as it appears like a lie. Here too, it appears like a lie!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: עַד שֶׁלֹּא כָּתְבוּ — מְעִידִין בְּפָנָיו וְחוֹתֵם, מִשֶּׁכָּתְבוּ — אֵין מְעִידִין בְּפָנָיו וְחוֹתֵם.
human_translation: Rather, say: As long as did not write testify before signs once have written they may not testify before him and sign
llm_translation: Rather say: Until they did not write - they testify in his presence and sign; once they wrote - they do not testify in his presence and sign.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּלָת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: עֵד נַעֲשֶׂה דַּיָּין, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: דַּיָּינִין הַמַּכִּירִין חֲתִימוּת יְדֵי עֵדִים — אֵינָן צְרִיכִין לְהָעִיד בִּפְנֵיהֶם, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: דַּיָּינִין שֶׁאֵין מַכִּירִין חֲתִימוּת יְדֵי עֵדִים — צְרִיכִין לְהָעִיד בִּפְנֵי כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: Conclude from three Conclude from it that a witness become a judge, And conclude from it judges who recognize the signatures of witnesses do not require to testify before them. And conclude from it judges who do not recognize the signatures of the witnesses, are required to testify before each and every one of them,
llm_translation: Listen, infer three. Listen, infer: A witness who becomes a judge, and listen, infer: Judges who recognize the signatures of witnesses - they do not need to testify in their presence, and listen, infer: Judges who do not recognize the signatures of witnesses - they need to testify in the presence of each and every one.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: בִּשְׁלָמָא עֵד נַעֲשֶׂה דַּיָּין, שָׁמְעִינַן מִינַּהּ, אֶלָּא דַּיָּינִין הַמַּכִּירִין חֲתִימוּת יְדֵי עֵדִים אֵין צְרִיכִין לְהָעִיד בִּפְנֵיהֶם — דִּלְמָא לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ: צְרִיכִין, וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא דְּקָא מִקַּיְימָא הַגָּדָה בְּחַד.
human_translation: Rav Ashi objects Granted, a witness become a judge we conclude from However, judges who recognize the signatures of witnesses do not require to testify before them Perhaps, I will say to you actually require and here, it is different, as statement is fulfilled with one
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rav Ashe objects to her: Granted, with regard to a witness, we require his knowledge, but as for judges who recognize the handwriting of witnesses, they do not need to testify in their presence — perhaps I will say to you: they do need to testify, and it is different here because the tradition is being upheld in one place.

hebrew_text: וְדַיָּינִין שֶׁאֵין מַכִּירִין חֲתִימוּת יְדֵי עֵדִים צְרִיכִין לְהָעִיד בִּפְנֵי כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד, דִּלְמָא לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ: אֵין צְרִיכִין, וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא דְּלָא קָא מִקַּיְימָא הַגָּדָה כְּלָל.
human_translation: And judges who do not recognize the signatures of the witnesses, are required to testify before each and every one perhaps, I will say to you actually, are not required and here, it is different, as statement not be fulfilled
llm_translation: And judges that do not recognize the signing of witnesses are required to testify before each and every one, perhaps I will say to you: they are not required, but it is different here because the matter of establishing the general rule is not fulfilled.

hebrew_text: יְתֵיב רַבִּי אַבָּא וְקָאָמַר לַהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא דְּעֵד נַעֲשֶׂה דַּיָּין, אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב סָפְרָא לְרַבִּי אַבָּא: רָאוּהוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה, וְהֵן בֵּית דִּין — יַעַמְדוּ שְׁנַיִם וְיוֹשִׁיבוּ מֵחַבְרֵיהֶם אֵצֶל הַיָּחִיד, וְיָעִידוּ בִּפְנֵיהֶם, וְיֹאמְרוּ: ״מְקוּדָּשׁ הַחֹדֶשׁ, מְקוּדָּשׁ״. שֶׁאֵין הַיָּחִיד נֶאֱמָן עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּעֵד נַעֲשֶׂה דַּיָּין, לְמָה לִי כּוּלֵּי הַאי? לֵיתְבוּ בְּדוּכְתַּיְיהוּ וְלִיקַּדְּשׁוּ!
human_translation: Rabbi Abba sat and stated this halakha that a witness become a judge. Rav Safra raised an objection to Rabbi Abba three saw and they a court, two should stand and seat two of their colleagues near individual And should testify before and they should recite Sanctified is the month, sanctified. as an individual is not deemed credible by himself. And if it enters your mind that a witness become a judge, why do I all this? Let seated in their place and sanctify
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba was sitting and saying to her: "Regarding that testimony that was made, let a judge be appointed." Rav Safra objected to him: "If three saw him, and they are a court, two should stand and sit their colleagues next to the individual, and they should testify before them, saying: 'The new moon is sanctified, it is sanctified.' For an individual is not trusted by himself. And if it enters your mind that the testimony was made, why do I need all of this? Let them sit in their places and sanctify!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַף לְדִידִי קַשְׁיָא לִי, וּשְׁאֵילְתֵּיהּ לְרַב יִצְחָק בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר מָרְתָא, וְרַב יִצְחָק לְרַב הוּנָא, וְרַב הוּנָא לְחִיָּיא בַּר רַב, וְחִיָּיא בַּר רַב לְרַב, וַאֲמַר לְהוּ: הַנַּח לְעֵדוּת הַחֹדֶשׁ דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וְקִיּוּם שְׁטָרוֹת דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: said to was difficult for me as well, and I asked Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta it, and Rav Yitzḥak Rav Huna, and Rav Huna Ḥiyya bar Rav, and Ḥiyya bar Rav Rav, and said to them: Leave testimony the month, as by Torah and ratification of documents is by rabbinic
llm_translation: He said to him: "Even according to me it is difficult, and I asked it to Rav Yitzchak bar Shmuel bar Marta, and Rav Yitzchak to Rav Huna, and Rav Huna to Chiya bar Rav, and Chiya bar Rav to Rav, and he said to them: 'Leave the testimony of the new moon, which is from the Torah, and uphold the documents of the Rabbis.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁיָּשְׁבוּ לְקַיֵּים אֶת הַשְּׁטָר, וְקָרָא עַרְעָר עַל אֶחָד מֵהֶן. עַד שֶׁלֹּא חָתְמוּ — מְעִידִין עָלָיו וְחוֹתֵם. מִשֶּׁחָתְמוּ — אֵין מְעִידִין עָלָיו וְחוֹתֵם.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said Rav Huna said Rav said: three who convened to ratify a document, and raised a challenge of one of them as long as they did not sign may testify about he signs once they signed they may no testify about his and sign
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav Huna who said in the name of Rav: Three who sat to validate a document, and one of them raised an objection. Until they have not signed - they testify against him and sign. Once they have signed - they do not testify against him and sign.

hebrew_text: עַרְעָר דְּמַאי? אִי עַרְעָר דְּגַזְלָנוּתָא —
human_translation: a challenge of what If a challenge of theft,
llm_translation: The city of Maai? If it is the city of Gazlanuta—

hebrew_text: תְּרֵי וּתְרֵי נִינְהוּ. אִי עַרְעָר דִּפְגַם מִשְׁפָּחָה, גִּלּוּי מִלְּתָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא. לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ עַרְעָר דְּגַזְלָנוּתָא, וְקָאָמְרִי הָנֵי: יָדְעִינַן בֵּיהּ דַּעֲבַד תְּשׁוּבָה.
human_translation: are two and two If a challenge flawed lineage, is a mere revealing of a matter Actually, I will say to you a challenge of theft, and these say: We know about him that he repented
llm_translation: Two and two are they. If a blemish of genealogy, revealed matter in the world it is. Always say to you a blemish of theft, and they say: We know in it that he did repentance.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: הָא מִלְּתָא מֵרַבִּי אַבָּא שְׁמִיעַ לִי, וְאִי לָאו רַבִּי אַבָּא דְּמִן עַכּוֹ, שְׁכַחְתַּהּ: שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁיָּשְׁבוּ לְקַיֵּים אֶת הַשְּׁטָר וּמֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶם — צְרִיכִין לְמִיכְתַּב: ״בְּמוֹתַב תְּלָתָא הֲוֵינָא, וְחַד לֵיתוֹהִי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: This matter, I heard from Rabbi Abba, and if it was not for Rabbi Abba of Akko, I would have forgotten it. three who convened to ratify a document, and one of them died must write: We were in a session of three and one is no longer
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: This matter I heard from Rabbi Abba, and if not for Rabbi Abba from Akko, I would have forgotten it: Three who sat to fulfill the document and one of them died — it is necessary to write: "With three who were present, and one is no longer here."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: וְאִי כְּתַב בֵּיהּ: שְׁטָרָא דְּנַן נְפַק לִקְדָמַנָא בֵּי דִינָא — תּוּ לָא צְרִיךְ. וְדִלְמָא בֵּית דִּין חָצוּף הוּא, וּכְדִשְׁמוּאֵל. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁדָּנוּ, דִּינֵיהֶם דִּין, אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּקְרָא בֵּית דִּין חָצוּף.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: And if wrote in This document was produced before us, the court; no longer need And perhaps it was an impudent court, and in accordance with Shmuel, as Shmuel said: Two who judged, their verdict is a verdict; however, they are called an impudent court.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: And if he wrote in it: "A document that we took out before the court," it is unnecessary. Perhaps the court is presumptuous, as Samuel said: "Two who judged, their judgment is a judgment, only that it is called a presumptuous court."

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״בֵּי דִינָא דְּרַבַּנָא אָשֵׁי״. וְדִלְמָא רַבָּנַן דְּבֵי רַב אָשֵׁי כְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל סְבִירָא לְהוּ! דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״וְאָמַר לַנָא רַבַּנָא אָשֵׁי״.
human_translation: as it is written in the court of our Rav Ashi, And perhaps the Rabbis of the court of Rav Ashi hold in accordance with Shmuel as it is written in and our Rav Ashi said to us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It is written in it: "In the court of Rabbanah Ashi." And perhaps the sages of the house of Rav Ashi hold like Shmuel! For it is written in it: "And Rabbanah Ashi said to us."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה: ״אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ הָיִיתִי וּגְרוּשָׁה אֲנִי״ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת. שֶׁהַפֶּה שֶׁאָסַר, הוּא הַפֶּה שֶׁהִתִּיר. וְאִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁהָיְתָה אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: ״גְּרוּשָׁה אֲנִי״, אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת. אָמְרָה: ״נִשְׁבֵּיתִי, וּטְהוֹרָה אֲנִי״ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת. שֶׁהַפֶּה שֶׁאָסַר, הוּא הַפֶּה שֶׁהִתִּיר. וְאִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁנִּשְׁבֵּית, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: ״טְהוֹרָה אֲנִי״ — אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת. וְאִם מִשֶּׁנִּשֵּׂאת בָּאוּ עֵדִים — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תֵּצֵא.
human_translation: a woman who said: I was a married woman and I am a divorcée, she is deemed credible as the mouth that prohibited is the mouth that permitted, However, if there are witnesses that she was a married woman, and she says: I am a divorcée, she is not deemed credible. said: I was taken captive but I am pure, she is deemed credible as the mouth that prohibited is the mouth that permitted But if there are witnesses that she was taken captive, and she says: I am pure, she is not deemed credible. And if witnesses came after she married, this not leave
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "If a woman says, 'I was married and now I am divorced,' she is believed. The mouth that forbade is the same mouth that permitted. However, if there are witnesses that she was married, and she says, 'I am divorced,' she is not believed. If she says, 'I am a captive woman, but I am pure,' she is believed. The mouth that forbade is the same mouth that permitted. However, if there are witnesses that she was a captive woman, and she says, 'I am pure,' she is not believed. And if she remarries and then witnesses come, she shall not leave her second marriage."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: מִנַּיִן לְהַפֶּה שֶׁאָסַר הוּא הַפֶּה שֶׁהִתִּיר מִן הַתּוֹרָה? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶת בִּתִּי נָתַתִּי לָאִישׁ הַזֶּה לְאִשָּׁה״. ״לָאִישׁ״ — אָסְרָה, ״הַזֶּה״ — הִתִּירָה.
human_translation: Rav Asi said: From where in the Torah The mouth that prohibited is the mouth that permitted, as it is stated: “I gave my daughter to this man [ la’ish hazeh ] as a wife” “to the man [ la’ish ]” he rendered her forbidden “this [ hazeh ],” he renders her permitted
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rav Assi: From where do we know regarding the mouth that it is forbidden, the mouth that the Torah permitted? As it is said: "I have given my daughter to this man as a wife." "To this man" - she is forbidden, "this" - she is permitted.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי קְרָא? סְבָרָא הִיא: הוּא אַסְרַהּ, וְהוּא שָׁרֵי לַהּ! אֶלָּא כִּי אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא, לְכִדְרַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן לָאָב שֶׁנֶּאֱמָן לֶאֱסוֹר אֶת בִּתּוֹ מִן הַתּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶת בִּתִּי נָתַתִּי לָאִישׁ״. ״הַזֶּה״ לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Why do I the verse? It is logic: He rendered her forbidden and he rendered her permitted. Rather, where this verse is necessary, is to that Rav Huna said Rav said, as Rav Huna said Rav said: From where in the Torah a father is deemed credible to render his daughter forbidden? as it is stated: “I gave my daughter to the man [ la’ish ]” Why do I “this [ hazeh ]”?
llm_translation: "Why do I need a verse? It is a logical deduction: He forbade her, and he permitted her! Rather, the verse is necessary, in accordance with what Rav Huna said in the name of Rav. For Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: From where do we derive that a father is trusted to forbid his daughter to others from the Torah, as it says, 'I have given my daughter to this man'? Why do I need 'this'?"

hebrew_text: מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתָנֵי רַבִּי יוֹנָה. דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי יוֹנָה: ״אֶת בִּתִּי נָתַתִּי לָאִישׁ הַזֶּה״. ״הַזֶּה״ — וְלֹא לַיָּבָם.
human_translation: is necessary to Rabbi Yona taught; as Rabbi Yona taught “I gave my daughter to this man,” “this” not to the yavam ,
llm_translation: He wants to learn according to the teaching of Rabbi Yonah. For Rabbi Yonah taught: "I have given my daughter to this man." "This man" - and not to the levir.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה ״אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ אֲנִי״, וְחָזְרָה וְאָמְרָה ״פְּנוּיָה אֲנִי״ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת. וְהָא שַׁוְּויַהּ לְנַפְשַׁהּ חֲתִיכָה דְּאִיסּוּרָא? אָמַר רָבָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּתְנָה אַמַּתְלָא לִדְבָרֶיהָ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אָמְרָה אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ אֲנִי, וְחָזְרָה וְאָמְרָה: פְּנוּיָה אֲנִי — אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת. וְאִם נָתְנָה אַמַּתְלָא לִדְבָרֶיהָ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת.
human_translation: The Sages taught the woman who said: I am a married woman, and then said: I am unmarried, she is deemed credible. But didn’t she render herself an entity of prohibition? Rava bar Rav Huna said: where she provided a rationale [ amatla ] for her statement That was also taught the woman who said: I am a married woman, and then said: I am unmarried, she is not deemed credible. And if she provided a rationale for her statement, she is deemed credible.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A woman who said, "I am a married woman," and then later said, "I am single," is believed. But if she made herself suspect in a matter of prohibition, what is the case? Rava bar Rav Huna said: For example, if she gave a date to her words. It was also taught similarly: If she said, "I am a married woman," and then later said, "I am single," she is not believed. But if she gave a date to her words, she is believed.

hebrew_text: וּמַעֲשֶׂה נָמֵי בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁהָיְתָה גְּדוֹלָה בְּנוֹי, וְקָפְצוּ עָלֶיהָ בְּנֵי אָדָם לְקַדְּשָׁהּ. וְאָמְרָה לָהֶם: ״מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת אֲנִי״. לְיָמִים עָמְדָה וְקִידְּשָׁה אֶת עַצְמָהּ. אָמְרוּ לָהּ חֲכָמִים: מָה רָאִית לַעֲשׂוֹת כֵּן? אָמְרָה לָהֶם: בַּתְּחִלָּה שֶׁבָּאוּ עָלַי אֲנָשִׁים שֶׁאֵינָם מְהוּגָּנִים, אָמַרְתִּי: ״מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת אֲנִי״, עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁבָּאוּ עָלַי אֲנָשִׁים מְהוּגָּנִים, עָמַדְתִּי וְקִדַּשְׁתִּי אֶת עַצְמִי. וְזוֹ הֲלָכָה הֶעֱלָה רַב אַחָא שַׂר הַבִּירָה לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים בְּאוּשָׁא, וְאָמְרוּ: אִם נָתְנָה אַמַּתְלָא לִדְבָרֶיהָ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת.
human_translation: And there was also an incident involving an important woman who was outstanding in beauty, and men were clamoring to betroth her. And she said to them: I am betrothed. Sometime later she arose and betrothed herself The Sages said to her: What did you see to do so? She said to them: Initially, when unscrupulous people approached me I said: I am betrothed. Now that scrupulous people approached me, I arose and betrothed myself And This halakha was raised by Rav Aḥa Sar HaBira before the Sages in Usha, and said: If she provided a rationale for her statement, she is deemed credible.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And there was an incident with one great woman who was great in beauty, and men leaped upon her to sanctify her. And she said to them, "I am consecrated." After some days, she stood and sanctified herself. The sages said to her: What did you see to do so? She said to them: At first, when men who were not respectable came upon me, I said, "I am consecrated." Now that respectable men came upon me, I stood and sanctified myself. And this halakha Rab Ahah the head of the academy brought before the sages in Osha, and they said: If Amatla speaks according to her words, she is believed. English translation:

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל מֵרַב: אָמְרָה ״טְמֵאָה אֲנִי״, וְחָזְרָה וְאָמְרָה ״טְהוֹרָה אֲנִי״, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַף בְּזוֹ, אִם נָתְנָה
human_translation: Shmuel raised a dilemma before Rav: said I am ritually impure and then said: I am pure, what is said to him: Even in that if she provided a
llm_translation: Samuel asked Rav: She said, "I am impure," and then she reversed and said, "I am pure," what is the ruling? He said to her: The same applies here, if she has given a reason.

hebrew_text: אַמַּתְלָא לִדְבָרֶיהָ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת. תְּנָא מִינֵּיהּ אַרְבָּעִים זִימְנִין, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא עֲבַד שְׁמוּאֵל עוֹבָדָא בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: rationale for her statement, she is deemed credible. learned from him forty times and even so, Shmuel did not take action with regard to himself
llm_translation: אַמַּתְלָא לִדְבָרֶיהָ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת. תְּנָא מִינֵּיהּ אַרְבָּעִים זִימְנִין, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא עֲבַד שְׁמוּאֵל עוֹבָדָא בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ. A matla to her words — trustworthy. It was taught from her forty times, and even so, Shmuel did not perform the act himself.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״מֵת״, וּשְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״לֹא מֵת״. שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״נִתְגָּרְשָׁה״, וּשְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״לֹא נִתְגָּרְשָׁה״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא, וְאִם נִשֵּׂאת — לֹא תֵּצֵא. רַבִּי מְנַחֵם בַּר יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: תֵּצֵא. אָמַר רַבִּי מְנַחֵם בַּר יוֹסֵי: אֵימָתַי אֲנִי אוֹמֵר תֵּצֵא, בִּזְמַן שֶׁבָּאוּ עֵדִים, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִשֵּׂאת. אֲבָל נִשֵּׂאת וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּאוּ עֵדִים — לֹא תֵּצֵא.
human_translation: The Sages taught two say: died, and two say: He did not die; two say: was divorced, and two say: She was not divorced, this may not remarry And if she remarried, not leave Rabbi Menaḥem bar Yosei says: leave Rabbi Menaḥem bar Yosei said: When do I say she must leave where witnesses came and she remarried thereafter. However, if she remarried and the witnesses came thereafter, not leave
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Two say "she is dead," and two say "she is not dead." Two say "she was divorced," and two say "she was not divorced" — in this case she may not marry, and if she did marry — she must leave. Rabbi Menachem bar Yosei says: she must leave. Rabbi Menachem bar Yosei said: When do I say she must leave? When witnesses came and then she married. But if she married and then witnesses came — she may not leave.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי תְּרֵי וּתְרֵי נִינְהוּ, הַבָּא עָלֶיהָ בְּאָשָׁם תָּלוּי קָאֵי! אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּשֵּׂאת לְאֶחָד מֵעֵדֶיהָ. הִיא גּוּפַהּ בְּאָשָׁם תָּלוּי קָיְימָא! בְּאוֹמֶרֶת: ״בָּרִי לִי״.
human_translation: After all, they are two and two one who engages in intercourse with her stands liable a guilt-offering for uncertainty. Rav Sheshet said: where she married one of her witnesses She herself stands liable a guilt-offering for uncertainty, where she says: It is clear to me
llm_translation: From the value of two and two, they are, the one who comes upon it with guilt offering is standing! Rav Sheshet said: For example, when she bore a child from one of her witnesses. She herself is standing with guilt offering! As it says: "It is clear to me."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים: ״מֵת״, וּשְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים: ״לֹא מֵת״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא, וְאִם נִשֵּׂאת — לֹא תֵּצֵא. שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״נִתְגָּרְשָׁה״, וּשְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״לֹא נִתְגָּרְשָׁה״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא, וְאִם נִשֵּׂאת — תֵּצֵא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said two say: died, and two say: He did not die, this may not remarry. And if she remarried not leave two say: was divorced, and two say: She was not divorced, this may not remarry. And if she remarried leave
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, two say "dead," and two say "not dead" - this one shall not marry, and if she does marry - she shall not leave. Two say "divorced," and two say "not divorced" - this one shall not marry, and if she does marry - she shall leave.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תַּרְגְּמַהּ בְּעֵד אֶחָד. עֵד אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״מֵת״, הֵימְנוּהוּ רַבָּנַן כְּבֵי תְרֵי, וְכִדְעוּלָּא. דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁהֶאֱמִינָה תּוֹרָה עֵד אֶחָד — הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁנַיִם, וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר ״לֹא מֵת״ — הָוֵה לֵיהּ חַד, וְאֵין דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל אֶחָד בִּמְקוֹם שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: What is different the first clause and what is the different the second clause, Abaye said: Interpret in one witness. one witness says: died, the Sages accorded him credibility like two And in accordance with Ulla, as Ulla said: Wherever the Torah deemed one witness credible, there two And that who says: He did not die, is one and the statement of one no in a place two
llm_translation: What is different about the beginning and what is different about the end? Abaye said: Interpret it in one witness. One witness says "he is dead," the Rabbis count him as two, like two, and like D'Ula. For D'Ula said: Any place where the Torah believed one witness - here it is considered as two, and this one who says "he is not dead" - he is considered as one, and his words are not valid in the place of two.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ לְכַתְּחִלָּה נָמֵי! מִשּׁוּם דְּרַב אַסִּי. דְּאָמַר רַב אַסִּי: ״הָסֵר מִמְּךָ עִקְּשׁוּת פֶּה וּלְזוּת שְׂפָתַיִם הַרְחֵק מִמֶּךָּ״.
human_translation: If so, even ab initio . due to Rav Asi, as Rav Asi said “Remove from you a crooked mouth, and perverse lips put far from you”
llm_translation: So it is, even at the outset! Because Rav Assi said: "Remove from yourself crookedness of mouth and perversity of lips, distance it from you."

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא, עֵד אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״נִתְגָּרְשָׁה״, וְעֵד אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״לֹא נִתְגָּרְשָׁה״, תַּרְוַיְיהוּ בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ קָמַסְהֲדִי. וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר נִתְגָּרְשָׁה — הָוֵה לֵיהּ חַד, וְאֵין דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל אֶחָד בִּמְקוֹם שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: the latter clause one witness says: was divorced, and one witness says: She was not divorced, both of them are testifying a married woman, and that who says: She was divorced, is one and the statement of one no in a place two
llm_translation: The latter clause: one witness says "she was divorced," and one witness says "she was not divorced," both regarding a married woman. And what he says "she was divorced" - he has one witness, and the words of one witness are not valid in place of two.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם תְּרֵי וּתְרֵי נִינְהוּ. וְרָאָה רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי מְנַחֵם בַּר יוֹסֵי בְּגֵרוּשִׁין, וְלֹא רָאָה בְּמִיתָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? מִיתָה — אֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה מַכְחַשְׁתּוֹ, גֵּרוּשִׁין — יְכוֹלָה מַכְחַשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said: Actually they are two and two and Rabbi Yoḥanan saw the statement of Rabbi Menaḥem bar Yosei in divorce but did not see in death. What is the reason death, she is unable to deny he divorce, she is able to deny his
llm_translation: Rava said: Always two and two are they. And Rabbi Yochanan saw the words of Rabbi Menachem bar Yosei in regards to divorce, and did not see in regards to death. What is the reason? Death - it cannot deny, divorce - it can deny.

hebrew_text: וּמִי חֲצִיפָה כּוּלֵּי הַאי? וְהָאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה לְבַעְלָהּ ״גֵּרַשְׁתַּנִי״ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת. חֲזָקָה אֵין אִשָּׁה מְעִיזָּה פָּנֶיהָ בִּפְנֵי בַּעְלָהּ! הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא עֵדִים דְּקָא מְסַיְּיעִי לַהּ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים דְּקָא מְסַיְּיעִי לַהּ — מְעִיזָּה וּמְעִיזָּה.
human_translation: And is impudent that extent, But didn’t Rav Hamnuna say a woman who said to her husband: You divorced me, she is deemed credible, presumption that a woman is not insolent in the presence of her husband? This applies only where there are no witnesses who are supporting her; however, where there are witnesses who are supporting her, she would certainly be insolent.
llm_translation: And who is the one who is so brazen? And Rav Hamnuna said: A woman who says to her husband, "You have divorced me" — she is believed. It is a presumption that a woman does not dare to confront her husband! These words apply where there are no witnesses supporting her, but where there are witnesses supporting her — she is bold and bold.

hebrew_text: רַב אַסִּי אָמַר: כְּגוֹן דְּאָמְרִי עֵדִים ״עַכְשָׁיו מֵת״, ״עַכְשָׁיו גֵּירְשָׁהּ״. מִיתָה לֵיכָּא לְבָרוּרַהּ. גֵּירוּשִׁין אִיכָּא לְבָרוּרַהּ, דְּאָמְרִינַן לָהּ: אִם אִיתָא דְּהָכִי הֲוָה, אַחֲזִי לַן גִּיטִּיךְ.
human_translation: Rav Asi said where the witnesses say: He died now, He divorced her now. death, there is no to clarify divorce there is to clarify as we say to If it is so that this show us your bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: For example, when witnesses say, "Now he is dead," "Now she is divorced." Death does not require clarification. Divorce requires clarification, as we say to her: If it comes to light that this is the case, hold onto your divorce document.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״נִתְקַדְּשָׁה״, וּשְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״לֹא נִתְקַדְּשָׁה״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא, וְאִם נִשֵּׂאת לֹא תֵּצֵא. שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״נִתְגָּרְשָׁה״, וּשְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״לֹא נִתְגָּרְשָׁה״ — הֲרֵי זו לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא, וְאִם נִשֵּׂאת — תֵּצֵא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: two say: was betrothed, and two say: She was not betrothed, this may not marry and if she remarried, not leave two say: was divorced, and two say: She was not divorced, this may not remarry. And if she remarried, leave
llm_translation: The sages taught: Two say "she is sanctified," and two say "she is not sanctified" - this one shall not be married, and if she is married, she shall not leave. Two say "she is divorced," and two say "she is not divorced" - this one shall not be married, and if she is married, she shall leave.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא, וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא?
human_translation: What is different the first clause and what is different the second clause
llm_translation: What is different about the beginning, and what is different about the end?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, תַּרְגְּמַהּ בְּעֵד אֶחָד: עֵד אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״נִתְקַדְּשָׁה״, וְעֵד אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״לֹא נִתְקַדְּשָׁה״ — תַּרְוַיְיהוּ בִּפְנוּיָה קָמַסְהֲדִי, וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר ״נִתְקַדְּשָׁה״ — הֲוָה לֵיהּ חַד, וְאֵין דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל אֶחָד בִּמְקוֹם שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: Abaye said: Interpret in one witness. one witness says: She was betrothed, and one witness says: She was not betrothed, they are both testifying that she was unmarried. And that who says that she was betrothed is one and the statement of one no in a place two
llm_translation: Abaye said, translate it in the singular: One witness says, "She is betrothed," and one witness says, "She is not betrothed" — both are believed in a case of voluntary testimony, and when he says "she is betrothed" — he is one, and the words of one are not valid in the place of two.

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא, עֵד אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״נִתְגָּרְשָׁה״, וְעֵד אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״לֹא נִתְגָּרְשָׁה״ — תַּרְוַיְיהוּ בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ קָמַסְהֲדִי, וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר ״נִתְגָּרְשָׁה״ — הָוֵה לֵיהּ חַד, וְאֵין דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל אֶחָד בִּמְקוֹם שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: In the latter clause, one witness says: She was divorced, and one witness says: She was not divorced, they are both testifying that she was a married woman. And that who says that she was divorced is one and the statement of one no in a place two
llm_translation: The latter clause: one witness says, "she was divorced," and one witness says, "she was not divorced" - both are testifying about the wife of a commoner, and the one who says, "she was divorced" - he has one witness, and the words of one witness are not valid in the place of two.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם תְּרֵי וּתְרֵי, וְאֵיפוֹךְ: שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״רְאִינוּהָ שֶׁנִּתְקַדְּשָׁה״, וּשְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״לֹא רְאִינוּהָ שֶׁנִּתְקַדְּשָׁה״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא, וְאִם נִשֵּׂאת — תֵּצֵא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Actually two and two And reverse two say: We saw her that she was betrothed, and two say: We did not see her that she was betrothed, this may not marry, and if she marries leave
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Always two and two, and the opposite: two say "we have seen her that she has become consecrated," and two say "we have not seen her that she has become consecrated" — this one shall not marry, and if she does marry — she shall leave.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא: ״לֹא רְאִינוּהָ״ אֵינָהּ רְאָיָה! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּדָיְירִי בְּחָצֵר אֶחָד. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אִם אִיתָא דְּנִתְקַדְּשָׁה — קָלָא אִית לַהּ לְמִילְּתָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּעָבְדִי אִינָשֵׁי דִּמְקַדְּשִׁי בְּצִנְעָא.
human_translation: obvious we did not see her is not proof. No, necessary reside in one courtyard. Lest you say: If it is so betrothed, the matter generates publicity, teaches us that people are prone to betroth in private,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Peshita: 'Lo re'inuha' einah re'ayah! La tzricha, de'dayirei bechatzer echad. Mahu d'teima: Im ita d'nikdashah — kala it lah l'milta. Ka mashma lan d'avdei inashei d'mikadshi b'tzina." English translation: "It is obvious: 'We have not seen it' is not a proof! It is unnecessary, as they reside in one courtyard. What might you say: If it comes that she has been consecrated — a light she has for the matter. It implies to us that people who sanctify do so discreetly."

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא: שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״רְאִינוּהָ שֶׁנִּתְגָּרְשָׁה״, וּשְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״לֹא רְאִינוּהָ שֶׁנִּתְגָּרְשָׁה״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא, וְאִם נִשֵּׂאת — לֹא תֵּצֵא. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? אַף עַל גַּב דְּדָיְירִי בְּחָצֵר אֶחָד — הַיְינוּ הָךְ!
human_translation: latter clause two say: We saw her that she was divorced, and two say: We did not see her that she was divorced, this may not remarry, and if she remarries, not leave What teaching us? although live in one courtyard This is that
llm_translation: Conclusion: Two say "we have seen her that she was divorced," and two say "we have not seen her that she was divorced" — this one shall not marry her, and if he marries her — she shall not leave. What is it teaching us? Even though they reside in the same courtyard — that is the case!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: גַּבֵּי קִדּוּשִׁין הוּא דַּעֲבִידִי אִינָשֵׁי דִּמְקַדְּשִׁי בְּצִנְעָא, אֲבָל גַּבֵּי גֵירוּשִׁין, אִם אִיתָא דְּאִיגָּרְשָׁא — קָלָא אִית לַהּ לְמִילְּתָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דַּעֲבִידִי אִינָשֵׁי דִּמְקַדְּשִׁי וְדִמְגָרְשִׁי בְּצִנְעָא.
human_translation: Lest you say with regard to betrothal that people are prone to betroth in private; however, with regard to divorce, if it is so that she was divorced, it would generate publicity, teaches us that people are prone to betroth and divorce in private.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "What is the reasoning? Regarding betrothals, it is people who engage in sanctifying the marriage discreetly. But regarding divorces, if it is found that she is to be divorced — a voice of proclamation is needed for the matter, indicating to us that people engage in sanctifying and divorcing discreetly."

hebrew_text: וְאִם מִשֶּׁנִּשֵּׂאת בָּאוּ עֵדִים לֹא תֵּצֵא כּוּ׳. רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא מַתְנֵי לַהּ אַרֵישָׁא, רַבָּה בַּר אָבִין מַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא.
