human_translation: And if the witnesses came after she married, this not leave Rabbi Oshaya taught to the first clause Rabba bar Avin taught to the latter clause
llm_translation: "If she is married, witnesses came, she shall not go out." Rabbi Oshaya teaches the first clause to her, Rabba bar Avin teaches the last clause to her.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַרֵישָׁא — כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אַסֵּיפָא, דְּבִשְׁבוּיָה הֵקֵילּוּ. וּמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא, אֲבָל אַרֵישָׁא — לָא.
human_translation: The one who taught to the first clause all the more so to the latter clause as, a captive woman, were lenient, And the one who taught to the latter clause however, to the first clause no,
llm_translation: One who teaches the first part - all the more so the latter part, as they have been lenient in captivity. And one who teaches the latter part, but the first part - no.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בִּדְרַב הַמְנוּנָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי. דְּמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַרֵישָׁא, אִית לֵיהּ דְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא. וּמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא, לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא.
human_translation: Let us say with regard to Rav Hamnuna disagree. The one who taught to the first clause he holds Rav Hamnuna, And the one who taught to the latter clause he does not hold Rav Hamnuna.
llm_translation: Let us say in the opinion of Rav Hamnuna he disagrees. For whoever teaches the first part, he has the opinion of Rav Hamnuna. And whoever teaches the latter part, he does not have the opinion of Rav Hamnuna.

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא. וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: כִּי אִיתְּמַר דְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא בְּפָנָיו, אֲבָל שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו — מְעִיזָּה. וּמָר סָבַר: שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו נָמֵי אֵינָהּ מְעִיזָּה.
human_translation: No, everyone holds of Rav Hamnuna, and here with regard to this that they disagree, as one Sage, maintains that when Rav Hamnuna was stated, in his presence; however, not in his presence, she is insolent. And one Sage, maintains that not in his presence she is also not insolent.
llm_translation: Not, for all the world has a Rabbi Hamnuna. And here in this case, for Mar disputes, as he holds: when it was said that Rabbi Hamnuna is present, it is considered daring, but if he is not present, it is not daring. And Mar holds: even if he is not present, it is still considered daring.

hebrew_text: וְאִם מִשֶּׁנִּשֵּׂאת בָּאוּ עֵדִים וְכוּ׳. אָמַר אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא ״נִשֵּׂאת״ נִשֵּׂאת מַמָּשׁ, אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִתִּירוּהָ לִינָּשֵׂא — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נִשֵּׂאת. וְהָא ״לֹא תֵּצֵא״ קָתָנֵי! לֹא תֵּצֵא מֵהֶתֵּירָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: And if the witnesses came after she married, The father of Shmuel said: Married not actually married; rather, once permitted her to marry, although she has not married, But doesn’t teach: She need not leave, she does not emerge her initial permitted
llm_translation: "And if she is married, witnesses came and so forth." Abba, the son of Shmuel, said: Not "she is married" literally, but once they permitted her to marry - even though she is not actually married. But isn't it taught, "she shall not go out" first from her initial permission.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, אָמְרָה: ״נִשְׁבֵּיתִי וּטְהוֹרָה אֲנִי וְיֵשׁ לִי עֵדִים שֶׁטְּהוֹרָה אֲנִי״, אֵין אוֹמְרִים: נַמְתִּין עַד שֶׁיָּבֹאוּ עֵדִים, אֶלָּא מַתִּירִין אוֹתָהּ מִיָּד. הִתִּירוּהָ לִינָּשֵׂא וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּאוּ עֵדִים, וְאָמְרוּ: לֹא יָדַעְנוּ — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תֵּצֵא. וְאִם בָּאוּ עֵדֵי טוּמְאָה, אֲפִילּוּ יֵשׁ לָהּ כַּמָּה בָּנִים — תֵּצֵא.
human_translation: The Sages taught she said: I was taken captive but I am pure, and I have witnesses that I am pure, does not say: We will wait until witnesses come. Rather, permits her immediately. permitted her and witnesses came thereafter and said: We do not know this need not leave And if witnesses that she was violated came even if she has several children, leave
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: She said, "I am defiled and pure, and I have witnesses that I am pure." We do not say, "Let us wait until the witnesses come," but rather we immediately permit her. They permitted her to marry, and afterwards witnesses came and said, "We did not know," then she shall not leave. But if witnesses of impurity came, even if she has many children, she shall leave.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי שְׁבוּיָיתָא דְּאָתְיָין לִנְהַרְדְּעָא. אוֹתֵיב אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל נָטוֹרֵי בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל: וְעַד הָאִידָּנָא מַאן נַטְרִינְהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִילּוּ בְּנָתָךְ הָוְויָן, מִי הֲוֵית מְזַלְזֵל בְּהוּ כּוּלֵּי הַאי?
human_translation: these captive women who came to Neharde’a Shmuel’s father posted guards with them Shmuel said to him: Until now who guarded them? He said to If they were your daughters, would you treat them with contempt to that extent?
llm_translation: The case of the prisoners who came to Nahardea. The father of Shmuel the guardsman was sitting with them. Shmuel said to him: Until now, who has been guarding them? He said to him: If they were your daughters, would you have been so neglectful of them?

hebrew_text: הֲוַאי ״כִּשְׁגָגָה שֶׁיּוֹצָא מִלִּפְנֵי הַשַּׁלִּיט״, וְאִישְׁתַּבְיָין בְּנָתֵיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל, וְאַסְּקִינְהוּ לְאַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל. אוֹקְמָן לְשָׁבוֹיִינְהִי מֵאַבָּרַאי, וְעָיְילִי [אִינְהִי] לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. הָא אֲמַרָה: ״נִשְׁבֵּיתִי וּטְהוֹרָה אֲנִי״, וְהָא אֲמַרָה: ״נִשְׁבֵּיתִי וּטְהוֹרָה אֲנִי״ — שְׁרִינְהוּ.
human_translation: was “Like an error that emerges from before the ruler” and The daughters of Master Shmuel were taken captive, and took them up to Eretz Yisrael their captors standing outside, and entered the study hall of Rabbi Ḥanina. This said: I was taken captive, and I am pure, and that said: I was taken captive, and I am pure, and permitted them
llm_translation: The text: "This is like an unintentional sin that departs from before the ruler," and the daughters of Mar Samuel understood it, and they took him to the land of Israel. They established her from her forefathers, and they brought her to the study hall of Rabbi Hanina. This one said: "I am destroyed and pure," and this one said: "I am destroyed and pure" - they reconciled them.

hebrew_text: סוֹף עוּל אֲתוֹ שָׁבוֹיִינְהוּ. אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בְּנָן דְּמוֹרְיָין אִינּוּן. אִיגַּלַּאי מִילְּתָא דִּבְנָתֵיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל הַוְויָן.
human_translation: Ultimately, their captors came and entered, Rabbi Ḥanina said: daughters authorities, the matter became clear, that they were the daughters of Master Shmuel.
llm_translation: End of the matter, they returned. Rabbi Chanina said: They are like builders. The matter that Samuel's son built was established.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא לְרַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא: פּוֹק אִיטַּפַּל בְּקָרִיבָתָיךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: וְהָאִיכָּא עֵדִים בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם! הַשְׁתָּא מִיהַת לֵיתַנְהוּ קַמַּן. עֵדִים בְּצַד אִסְתָּן, וְתֵאָסֵר? טַעְמָא דְּלָא אֲתוֹ עֵדִים, הָא אֲתוֹ עֵדִים, מִיתַּסְרָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said to Rav Shemen bar Abba, Go out and tend to your relatives, said to Rabbi Ḥanina: But aren’t there witnesses in a country overseas said to him: Now, in any event, are not before us. witnesses in north [ astan ] side, and be forbidden? The reason is the witnesses did not come However, were the witnesses come would be forbidden
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Chanina to Rav Shemen Bar Abba: Go, involve yourself in your offering. He said to him, to Rabbi Chanina: But are there witnesses in the province of the sea! Now, if they do not come, it is forbidden? The reason is that if witnesses do not come, if they do come, will it be permitted?

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִתִּירוּהָ לִינָּשֵׂא, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נִשֵּׂאת! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: עֵדֵי טוּמְאָה אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: But didn’t Shmuel’s father say: Once permitted to marry, even if she has not married, Rav Ashi said: was stated witnesses violation.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And the father of Shmuel said: Once they permitted her to marry, even though she has not yet married! Rav Ashe said: Witnesses of impurity are believed."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים שֶׁנִּשְׁבּוּ, זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת ״נִשְׁבֵּיתִי וּטְהוֹרָה אֲנִי״, וְזֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת ״נִשְׁבֵּיתִי וּטְהוֹרָה אֲנִי״ — אֵינָן נֶאֱמָנוֹת. וּבִזְמַן שֶׁהֵן מְעִידוֹת זוֹ אֶת זוֹ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנוֹת.
human_translation: two women who were taken captive, this says: I was taken captive but I am pure, and that says: I was taken captive but I am pure, they are not deemed credible. And when this testifies about that they are deemed credible.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Two women who were captured, one saying, "I have been captured and I am pure," and the other saying, "I have been captured and I am pure," — they are not believed. But when they testify for each other — then they are believed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אֲנִי טְמֵאָה וַחֲבֶרְתִּי טְהוֹרָה״ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת. ״אֲנִי טְהוֹרָה וַחֲבֶרְתִּי טְמֵאָה״ — אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת. ״אֲנִי וַחֲבֶרְתִּי טְמֵאָה״ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת עַל עַצְמָהּ, וְאֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת עַל חֲבֶרְתָּהּ. ״אֲנִי וַחֲבֶרְתִּי טְהוֹרָה״ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת עַל חֲבֶרְתָּהּ, וְאֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת עַל עַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught I am tainted and my counterpart is pure, she is deemed credible I am pure and my counterpart is tainted, she is not deemed credible I and my counterpart are tainted, she is deemed credible with regard to herself but she is not deemed credible with regard to her counterpart. I and my counterpart are pure, she is deemed credible with regard to her counterpart but she is not deemed credible with regard to herself.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "I am impure and my friend is pure" — she is believed. "I am pure and my friend is impure" — she is not believed. "I am impure and my friend is impure" — she is believed regarding herself, but not believed regarding her friend. "I am pure and my friend is pure" — she is believed regarding her friend, but not believed regarding herself.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״אֲנִי טְהוֹרָה וַחֲבֶרְתִּי טְמֵאָה״ — אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּלֵיכָּא עֵדִים, עַל עַצְמָהּ אַמַּאי לָא מְהֵימְנָא? ״נִשְׁבֵּיתִי וּטְהוֹרָה אֲנִי״ קָאָמְרָה! אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים.
human_translation: The Master said I am pure and my counterpart is tainted, she is not deemed credible. What are the circumstances? If there are no witnesses why is she not deemed credible with regard to herself? I was taken captive and I am pure, obvious that there are witnesses
llm_translation: Master said: "I am pure and my friend is impure" - she is not believed. How so? If there are no witnesses, why is she not believed on her own account? "I have been violated, yet I am pure" - she is saying! Rather, it is obvious that there are witnesses.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא מְצִיעֲתָא: ״אֲנִי וַחֲבֶרְתִּי טְמֵאָה״ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת עַל עַצְמָהּ, וְאֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת עַל חֲבֶרְתָּהּ. וְאִי דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים — אַמַּאי לָא מְהֵימְנָא? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא דְּלֵיכָּא עֵדִים.
human_translation: say the middle clause I and my counterpart are tainted, she is deemed credible with regard to herself but she is not deemed credible with regard to her counterpart. And if there are witnesses, why is she not deemed credible obvious that there are no witnesses
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima metzichta: 'Ani vachaverti teme'ah' — ne'emanet al atzmah, ve'einah ne'emanet al chavertah. Ve'i de'ika eidim — amai lo meheimna? Ella peshita de'leika eidim." English translation: "A maidservant declares: 'I and my fellow are impure' — she is believed regarding herself, but not believed regarding her fellow. And if there are witnesses — why is she not believed? Rather, it is obvious that there are no witnesses."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: ״אֲנִי וַחֲבֶרְתִּי טְהוֹרָה״ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת עַל חֲבֶרְתָּהּ, וְאֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת עַל עַצְמָהּ. וְאִי דְּלֵיכָּא עֵדִים — אַעַצְמָהּ אַמַּאי לָא מְהֵימְנָא? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים.
human_translation: say the last clause I and my counterpart are pure, she is deemed credible with regard to her counterpart but she is not deemed credible with regard to herself. And if there are no witnesses why is she not deemed credible with regard to herself? obvious that there are witnesses.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: 'Ani vachaverti tehora' — ne'emanet al chavertah, ve'einah ne'emanet al atzmah. Ve'i dileika eidim — atzmah amai lo meheimna? Ella peshita de'ika eidim." English translation: "The final clause states: 'I and my friend are pure' — she is believed regarding her friend, but she is not believed regarding herself. And if there are no witnesses — why is she not believed regarding herself? Rather, it is obvious that if there are witnesses."

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים, מְצִיעֲתָא דְּלֵיכָּא עֵדִים! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִין. רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא — דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים, מְצִיעֲתָא — דְּלֵיכָּא עֵדִים.
human_translation: first clause and the last clause where there are witnesses, and the middle clause where there are no witnesses? Abaye said: Yes, first clause and the last clause where there are witnesses, and the middle clause where there are no witnesses.
llm_translation: Beginning and end where there are witnesses, the beginning where there are no witnesses! Abaye said: No. Beginning and end - where there are witnesses, the beginning where there are no witnesses.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כּוּלָּהּ דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים, וְאִיכָּא עֵד אֶחָד דְּקָא אָפֵיךְ. אָמְרָה: ״אֲנִי טְמֵאָה וַחֲבֶרְתִּי טְהוֹרָה״, וְאָמַר לַהּ עֵד אֶחָד: ״אַתְּ טְהוֹרָה וַחֲבֶרְתֵּךְ טְמֵאָה״. אִיהִי שַׁוִּיתַהּ לְנַפְשַׁהּ חֲתִיכָה דְּאִיסּוּרָא, חֲבֶרְתָּהּ מִשְׁתַּרְיָא אַפּוּמָּא דִידַהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: its entirety where there are witnesses, and there is one witness who is reverse said: I am tainted and my counterpart is pure, and one witness said to her: You are pure and your counterpart is tainted, she rendered herself an entity of prohibition. Her counterpart is permitted on the basis of her
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: The entire matter where there are witnesses, and there is one witness who contradicts. She said, "I am impure and my friend is pure," and one witness said to her: "You are pure and your friend is impure." She was left to herself a piece of prohibition, her friend was relieved from her own.

hebrew_text: ״אֲנִי טְהוֹרָה וַחֲבֶרְתִּי טְמֵאָה״, וְאָמַר לָהּ עֵד אֶחָד: ״אַתְּ טְמֵאָה וַחֲבֶרְתְּךָ טְהוֹרָה״. אִיהִי, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים — לָאו כָּל כְּמִינַהּ, חֲבֶרְתַּהּ — מִשְׁתַּרְיָא אַפּוּמָּא דְעֵד.
human_translation: I am pure and my counterpart is tainted, and one witness said to her: You are tainted and your counterpart is pure, her, since there are witnesses it is not in her power her counterpart is permitted on the basis of the witness.
llm_translation: "I am pure and my friend is impure," and one witness said to her: "You are impure and your friend is pure." Where there are witnesses - not all like her, her friend - the testimony of the witness is nullified.

hebrew_text: ״אֲנִי וַחֲבֶרְתִּי טְמֵאָה״, וְאָמַר לַהּ עֵד אֶחָד: ״אַתְּ וַחֲבֶרְתֵּךְ טְהוֹרָה״ — אִיהִי שַׁוִּיתַהּ לְנַפְשַׁהּ חֲתִיכָה דְּאִיסּוּרָא, חֲבֶרְתַּהּ מִשְׁתַּרְיָא אַפּוּמָּא דְעֵד. הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? הַיְינוּ רֵישָׁא!
human_translation: I and my counterpart are tainted, and one witness said to her: You and your friend are pure, she rendered herself an entity of prohibition. her counterpart is permitted on the basis of the witness. Why do I this additional This is to first clause.
llm_translation: "I and my friend are impure," and he said to her, one witness: "You and your friend are pure" - she had set aside for herself a piece of forbidden food, her friend had tasted from the edge of the witness. Why do I need it? That is the beginning!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָנֵי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ טְהוֹרוֹת נִינְהוּ, וְהַאי דְּקָאָמְרָה הָכִי, ״תָּמוֹת נַפְשִׁי עִם פְּלִשְׁתִּים״ הִיא דְּקָא עָבְדָה — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Lest you say both of them are untainted and that she said that was she was acting “Let me die with the Philistines” teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? Those two are pure, and this one that it says thus, "Let my soul die with the Philistines," she did it - it is inferred for us.

hebrew_text: ״אֲנִי וַחֲבֶרְתִּי טְהוֹרָה״, וְאָמַר לָהּ עֵד אֶחָד: ״אַתְּ וַחֲבֶרְתֵּךְ טְמֵאָה״, אִיהִי כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים — לָאו כָּל כְּמִינַּהּ. חֲבֶרְתַּהּ מִשְׁתַּרְיָא אַפּוּמָּא דִידַהּ. הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? הַיְינוּ רֵישָׁא דְרֵישָׁא!
human_translation: I and my counterpart are pure, and one witness said to her: You and your counterpart are tainted, her, since there are witnesses it is not in her power her counterpart is permitted on the basis of her Why do I this additional This is to first part of the first clause.
llm_translation: "I and my friend are pure," and he said to her, one witness: "You and your friend are impure," since there are witnesses - not all like her. Her friend's face turned pale. Why do I need this? That is the beginning of the beginning!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כִּי מְהֵימְנָא — בְּמָקוֹם דְּפָסְלָה נַפְשַׁהּ, אֲבָל בְּמָקוֹם דְּמַכְשְׁרָא נַפְשַׁהּ — אֵימָא לָא מְהֵימְנָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Lest you say when is she deemed credible where she rendered herself unfit but where she rendered herself fit, say that she is not deemed credible teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning: when we establish her – in a place where she disqualified herself, but in a place where she made herself fit – say she is not established, it implies to us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְכֵן שְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים, זֶה אוֹמֵר ״כֹּהֵן אֲנִי״, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר ״כֹּהֵן אֲנִי״ — אֵינָן נֶאֱמָנִין. וּבִזְמַן שֶׁהֵן מְעִידִין זֶה אֶת זֶה — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנִין. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַעֲלִין לִכְהוּנָּה עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵימָתַי — בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ עוֹרְרִין. אֲבָל בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין עוֹרְרִין — מַעֲלִין לִכְהוּנָּה עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן הַסְּגָן: מַעֲלִין לִכְהוּנָּה עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד.
human_translation: And likewise, two men this says: I am a priest, and that says: I am a priest, they are not deemed credible. And when this testifies about that they are deemed credible. Rabbi Yehuda says: One does not elevate to priesthood on the basis of one witness. Rabbi Elazar says: When where there are challengers However, where there are no challengers, one elevates to priesthood on the basis of one witness. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Shimon, son of the deputy One elevates to priesthood on the basis of one witness.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And similarly, if two men, one says, "I am a Kohen," and the other says, "I am a Kohen" — they are not believed. But when they testify for each other — then they are believed. Rabbi Yehuda says: We do not promote someone to the priesthood based on the testimony of one witness. Rabbi Elazar said: When? In a place where there are adversaries. But in a place where there are no adversaries — we promote someone to the priesthood based on the testimony of one witness. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben HaSagan: We promote someone to the priesthood based on the testimony of one witness.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כֹּל הָנֵי לְמָה לִי! צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי תְּנָא מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא דְּרָרָא דְמָמוֹנָא. אֲבָל עֵדִים, דְּלֵיכָּא דְּרָרָא דְמָמוֹנָא — אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: Why do I all these necessary, as, if taught Rabbi Yehoshua concedes, in due to that there is financial significance [ derara ] where there is no financial significance say no,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Why do I need all these? I need them, for if Rabbi Yehoshua admits, it is because there is a free gift of money. But witnesses, where there is no free gift of money — say no." English translation: "Why do I need all these? I need them, for if Rabbi Yehoshua admits, it is because there is a free gift of money. But witnesses, where there is no free gift of money — say no."

hebrew_text: וְאִי תְּנָא עֵדִים, מִשּׁוּם דִּלְעָלְמָא, אֲבָל אִיהוּ, דִּלְנַפְשֵׁיהּ,
human_translation: And if taugh witnesses, due to that to others. However, him, whose to himself,
llm_translation: "And if he appoints witnesses, it is for the sake of the world, but he himself, it is for his own benefit."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: say no,
llm_translation: Fear not.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי, מִשּׁוּם דְּמָמוֹנָא, אֲבָל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, דְּאִיסּוּרָא — אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: And if taught us these two due to that monetary however, a married woman which is a ritual say no, not
llm_translation: And if we were to hear those two, because of money, but a married woman, because of prohibition - say no.

hebrew_text: ״נִשְׁבֵּיתִי וּטְהוֹרָה אֲנִי״ לְמָה לִי? מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי: ״וְאִם מִשֶּׁנִּשֵּׂאת בָּאוּ עֵדִים — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תֵּצֵא״.
human_translation: I was taken captive and I am pure, why do I need due to that sought to teach And if the witnesses came after she married, this not leave
llm_translation: "I am defiled and pure, why do I need it? Because it wants to teach: 'And if witnesses rise up against her when she is impure, she shall not go out.'"

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַרֵישָׁא — מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי: ״שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים שֶׁנִּשְׁבּוּ״.
human_translation: This well according to the one who teaches to the latter clause However, according to the one who taught to the first clause what is there to say? due to that he sought to teach two women who were taken captive.
llm_translation: He left it for the one who teaches the latter part, but for the one who teaches the beginning - what can be said? Because he needs to teach: "two women who were sitting."

hebrew_text: וּ״שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים שֶׁנִּשְׁבּוּ״ לְמָה לִי? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא נֵיחוּשׁ לְגוֹמְלִין, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And why do I two women who were taken captive? Lest you say: Let us be concerned for collusion teaches us
llm_translation: "And 'two women who were captured,' why do I need it? What might you say, that it is necessary for the laws of g'milin (restitution)? It teaches us."

hebrew_text: ״וְכֵן שְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים״ לְמָה לִי? מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And why do I And likewise two men, due to that he sought to teach the dispute between Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis,
llm_translation: "And similarly, 'two men' - why do I need it? Because it is necessary to teach the dispute of Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אֲנִי כֹּהֵן וַחֲבֵרִי כֹּהֵן״ — נֶאֱמָן לְהַאֲכִילוֹ בִּתְרוּמָה, וְאֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן לְהַשִּׂיאוֹ אִשָּׁה עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה: שְׁנַיִם מְעִידִין עַל זֶה, וּשְׁנַיִם מְעִידִין עַל זֶה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן לְהַאֲכִילוֹ בִּתְרוּמָה עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה, שְׁנַיִם מְעִידִין עַל זֶה וּשְׁנַיִם מְעִידִין עַל זֶה.
human_translation: The Rabbis taught I am a priest and my counterpart is a priest, is deemed credible to enabling his to partake of teruma . But he is not deemed credible for his marrying a woman until there are three that two testifying to this and two testifying to that Rabbi Yehuda says: is not deemed credible even to enabling his to partake of teruma until there are three that two testifying to this and two testifying to that
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "I am a Kohen and my friend is a Kohen" — he is trusted to feed him with terumah, but he is not trusted to marry him off to a woman until there are three: two testify for this one, and two testify for that one. Rabbi Yehuda says: He is also not trusted to feed him with terumah until there are three, two testify for this one, and two testify for that one.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה חָיֵישׁ לְגוֹמְלִין, וְרַבָּנַן לָא חָיְישִׁי לְגוֹמְלִין? וְהָא אִיפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לְהוּ, דִּתְנַן: הַחַמָּרִין שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ לָעִיר, וְאָמַר אֶחָד מֵהֶן: שֶׁלִּי חָדָשׁ, וְשֶׁל חֲבֵרִי יָשָׁן: שֶׁלִּי אֵינוֹ מְתוּקָּן, וְשֶׁל חֲבֵרִי מְתוּקָּן — אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: Is that to say that Rabbi Yehuda is concerned for collusion and the Rabbis are not concerned for collusion? But didn’t we learn they opposite? As we learned donkey drivers who entered a city, and one of them said: My is new and the of my counterpart is old My is not tithed and the of my counterpart is tithed, he is not deemed credible. And Rabbi Yehuda says: He is deemed credible,
llm_translation: In the matter of Rabbi Yehuda, is he concerned for camels, and the Rabbis are not concerned for camels? But the opposite we have heard for them, as we learned: If the donkeys entered the city, and one of them said: "Mine is new," and the other's is old: "Mine is not reliable, and the other's is reliable" - Rabbi Yehuda says: It is reliable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר רַב: מוּחְלֶפֶת הַשִּׁיטָה. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ. בִּדְמַאי הֵקֵילּוּ, רוֹב עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ מְעַשְּׂרִין הֵן.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said Rav said: the opinions is reversed Abaye said: Actually, do not reverse with regard to doubtfully tithed produce [ demai ] were lenient, most amei ha’aretz tithe
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said in the name of Rav: Mucholephet the acacia tree. Abbaye said: Always do not overturn. They were lenient with regard to Demai, for most common people tithe.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה קַשְׁיָא, דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן לָא קַשְׁיָא? אֶלָּא: דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא קַשְׁיָא, כִּדְשַׁנֵּינַן. דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן לָא קַשְׁיָא, כִּדְאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר עוּקְבָא, בְּשֶׁכְּלֵי אוּמָּנוּתוֹ בְּיָדוֹ,
human_translation: Rava said: of Rabbi Yehuda of Rabbi Yehuda is difficult, of the Rabbis and of the Rabbis is not difficult? Rather, of Rabbi Yehuda of Rabbi Yehuda is not difficult, as we explained of the Rabbis and of the Rabbis is not difficult. as Rabbi Ḥama bar Ukva said where one has the tools of his trade in his hand.
llm_translation: Rava said: Regarding Rabbi Yehuda, is Rabbi Yehuda difficult, but the Sages are not difficult? Rather, Rabbi Yehuda is not difficult, as we have explained. The Sages are not difficult, as Rabbi Chama bar Ukva said, when his craft tools are in his hand.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי בְּשֶׁכְּלֵי אוּמָּנוּתוֹ בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: Here too, where with the tools of his trade in his hand,
llm_translation: Here we say: "In his vessels of craftsmanship in his hand."

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכָא אִתְּמַר דְּרַבִּי חָמָא בַּר עוּקְבָא — אַהָא, דִּתְנַן: הַקַּדָּר שֶׁהִנִּיחַ קְדֵירוֹתָיו וְיָרַד לִשְׁתּוֹת (מַיִם מִן הַיְאוֹר) — הַפְּנִימִיּוֹת טְהוֹרוֹת, וְהַחִיצוֹנוֹת טְמֵאוֹת.
human_translation: And where of Rabbi Ḥama bar Ukva stated? concerning that which we learned a potter who abandoned his pots, and descended to drink water from the river, The inner are pure, and the outer are impure.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "And where was it stated that Rabbi Ḥama son of Uqva said? Here, for it was taught: One who placed his pots on the fire and went down to drink (water from the river) - the inner ones are pure, and the outer ones are impure."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ טְמֵאוֹת! אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר עוּקְבָא: בְּשֶׁכְּלֵי אוּמָּנוּתוֹ בְּיָדוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיַּד הַכֹּל מְמַשְׁמֶשֶׁת בָּהֶן.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Both these and those are ritually impure? Rabbi Ḥama bar Ukva said: the tools of trade are in his hand, Since all touch
llm_translation: And it was taught: These and these are impure! Rabbi Ḥama son of Ukva said: When his utensils are in his hand, because everyone's hand touches them.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ טְהוֹרוֹת! אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר עוּקְבָא: בְּשֶׁאֵין כְּלֵי אוּמָּנוּתוֹ בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Both these and those are ritually pure? Rabbi Ḥama bar Ukva said: the tools of trade are not in his hand,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was taught: These and these are pure! Rabbi Ḥama son of Ukva said: When his utensils of craftsmanship are not in his hand." English translation:

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דִּתְנַן: הַפְּנִימִיּוֹת טְהוֹרוֹת וְהַחִיצוֹנוֹת טְמֵאוֹת, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: But The inner are pure and the outer are impure, under what can be found?
llm_translation: And rather, this that we learned: the inner ones pure and the outer ones impure, how do you find for it?

hebrew_text: דִּסְמִיכָא לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וּמִשּׁוּם חִיפּוּפֵי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: where adjacent to the public domain, and due to the stakes the public domain
llm_translation: Connection to the public domain, and because of the joining of the public domain.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבָּנַן בְּמַעֲלִין מִתְּרוּמָה לְיוּחֲסִין קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis with regard to one elevates teruma to for lineage they disagree.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis argue regarding ascending from terumah to yuchasin.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ לְהַעֲלוֹת מִשְּׁטָרוֹת לְיוּחֲסִין? הֵיכִי דָּמֵי: אִילֵּימָא דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״אֲנִי פְּלוֹנִי כֹּהֵן חָתַמְתִּי עֵד״ — מַאן קָא מַסְהֵיד עִילָּוֵיהּ?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is to elevating from documents to lineage? What are the circumstances? If you say that it is written in I, so-and-so, a priest, signed a witness, who is testifying about him
llm_translation: He asked them: What is the law regarding bringing documents for genealogy? How so? If you say because it is written in it, "I, so-and-so, a priest, have signed as a witness" - who is testifying for him?

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״אֲנִי פְּלוֹנִי כֹּהֵן לָוִיתִי מָנֶה מִפְּלוֹנִי״ וַחֲתִימוּ סָהֲדִי, מַאי? אַמָּנֶה שֶׁבַּשְּׁטָר קָא מַסְהֲדִי, אוֹ דִלְמָא אַכּוּלַּהּ מִילְּתָא קָא מַסְהֲדִי. רַב הוּנָא וְרַב חִסְדָּא, חַד אָמַר: מַעֲלִין, וְחַד אָמַר: אֵין מַעֲלִין.
human_translation: No, necessary where it is written in I, so-and-so, a priest, borrowed one hundred dinars from so-and-so, and witnesses signed what Do testify concerning the one hundred dinars in the document? Or, perhaps they testify concerning the entire matter Rav Huna and Rav Ḥisda. One said: One elevates and one said: One does not elevate.
llm_translation: The matter is not necessary, as it is written in it: "I, so-and-so, a Levite priest, have appointed so-and-so." And the witnesses signed, what is it? The appointment in the document is the testimony, or perhaps the matter itself is the testimony. Rav Huna and Rav Hisda, one said: we elevate, and one said: we do not elevate.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ לְהַעֲלוֹת מִנְּשִׂיאוּת כַּפַּיִם לְיוּחֲסִין? תִּיבְּעֵי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מַעֲלִין מִתְּרוּמָה לְיוּחֲסִין, וְתִיבְּעֵי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין מַעֲלִין.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is to elevating from the lifting of hands to lineage? Raise the dilemma to the one who said: One elevates from teruma to lineage; and raise the dilemma to the one who said: One does not elevate
llm_translation: He asked them: What is the law regarding raising the hands for the priestly blessing in relation to genealogy? He should ask according to the one who says they raise from the terumah to genealogy, and he should ask according to the one who says they do not raise.

hebrew_text: תִּיבְּעֵי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מַעֲלִין: הָנֵי מִילֵּי תְּרוּמָה, דַּעֲוֹן מִיתָה הִיא. אֲבָל נְשִׂיאוּת כַּפַּיִם, דְּאִיסּוּר עֲשֵׂה — לָא. אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: Raise the dilemma to the one who said: One elevates this applies only teruma , where a transgression is death However, the Priestly Benediction, a prohibition a positive mitzva, no, Or, perhaps no difference,
llm_translation: The question is according to the one who says "we elevate": These matters of terumah, it is a matter of death penalty. But the lifting of hands, which is a positive prohibition - no. Or perhaps it is not different.

hebrew_text: תִּיבְּעֵי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין מַעֲלִין: הָנֵי מִילֵּי תְּרוּמָה דְּמִיתְאַכְלָא בְּצִנְעָא, אֲבָל נְשִׂיאוּת כַּפַּיִם, דִּבְפַרְהֶסְיָא — אִי לָאו כֹּהֵן הוּא, כּוּלֵּי הַאי לָא מַחְצִיף אִינָשׁ נַפְשֵׁיהּ. אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: Raise the dilemma to the one who said: One does not elevate this applies only teruma that is eaten in private. However, the lifting of hands, which is in public [ parhesya ], if one is not a priest, he would not be insolent to extent that Or perhaps, no difference,
llm_translation: The question was raised according to the one who says we do not ascend: These matters of terumah that were consumed in secret, but the waving of the hands, which is done openly — if he is not a kohen, everyone would not be cautious with himself. Or perhaps it is not different.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַבִּי אֲבִינָא, חַד אָמַר: מַעֲלִין, וְחַד אָמַר: אֵין מַעֲלִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק לְרָבָא: מַהוּ לְהַעֲלוֹת מִנְּשִׂיאוּת כַּפַּיִם לְיוּחֲסִין? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַב חִסְדָּא וְרַבִּי אֲבִינָא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rabbi Avina. One said: One elevates and one said: One does not elevate. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to Rava: What is to elevating from the lifting of hands to lineage? Rava said to him: a dispute between Rav Ḥisda and Rabbi Avina.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rabbi Avina, one said: they ascend, and one said: they do not ascend. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to Rava: What about raising the cupped hands for the blessing after meals? He said to him: It is a dispute of Rav Ḥisda and Rabbi Avina.

hebrew_text: הִלְכְתָא מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא מַתְנִיתָא יָדַעְנָא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: גְּדוֹלָה חֲזָקָה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמִבְּנֵי הַכֹּהֲנִים בְּנֵי חֳבַיָּה בְּנֵי הַקּוֹץ בְּנֵי בַרְזִילַּי אֲשֶׁר לָקַח מִבְּנוֹת בַּרְזִילַּי הַגִּלְעָדִי אִשָּׁה וַיִּקָּרֵא עַל שְׁמָם. אֵלֶּה בִּקְשׁוּ כְתָבָם הַמִּתְיַחְשִׂים וְלֹא נִמְצָאוּ וַיְגֹאֲלוּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה. וַיֹּאמֶר הַתִּרְשָׁתָא לָהֶם אֲשֶׁר לֹא יֹאכְלוּ מִקֹּדֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁים עַד עֲמוֹד כֹּהֵן לְאוּרִים וְתוּמִּים״.
human_translation: What is the halakha ? said to him: I know a baraita , as it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: Great is presumptive status, as it is stated: “And of the children of the priests: The children of Habaiah, the children of Hakkoz, the children of Barzillai, who took a wife of the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite, and was called after their name. These sought their register of the genealogy, but it was not found; therefore were they deemed tainted and put from the priesthood. And the Tirshatha said unto them that they should not partake of the most sacred items, until there stood up a priest with Urim VeTummim”
llm_translation: The law, what is it? He said to him: I have a tradition. As it was taught, Rabbi Yosei says: Strong and powerful. As it says: "And of the sons of the priests: the sons of Habaiah, the sons of Koz, the sons of Barzillai, who took a wife from the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite and was called by their name. These sought their register among those enrolled in the genealogies, but it was not found there, so they were excluded from the priesthood as unclean. The governor told them that they were not to partake of the most holy food until a priest with Urim and Thummim should arise."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: הֲרֵי אַתֶּם בְּחֶזְקַתְכֶם. בַּמֶּה הֱיִיתֶם אוֹכְלִים בַּגּוֹלָה — בְּקׇדְשֵׁי הַגְּבוּל, אַף כָּאן בְּקׇדְשֵׁי הַגְּבוּל. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מַעֲלִין מִנְּשִׂיאוּת כַּפַּיִם לְיוּחֲסִין, הָנֵי כֵּיוָן דְּפָרְסִי יְדַיְיהוּ — אָתֵי לְאַסּוֹקִינְהוּ!
human_translation: said to You your presumptive status. Of what did you partake in the exile? the consecrated items the outlying areas, Here too, consecrated items the outlying areas, And if it enters your mind that one elevates from the lifting of hands to lineage, they will come to elevate those since they lifted their hands
llm_translation: He said to them: Behold, you are in your presumption. Just as you used to eat in impurity in exile - with the sanctity of the border, so too here with the sanctity of the border. And if it enters your mind to elevate from clapping hands to genealogy, those who spread out their hands - come and engage with them!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָכָא דְּרִיעַ חֶזְקַיְיהוּ. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מַעֲלִין מִתְּרוּמָה לְיוּחֲסִין: כֵּיוָן דְּאָכְלִי בִּתְרוּמָה אָתֵי לְאַסּוֹקִינְהוּ! אֶלָּא לָאו, מִשּׁוּם דְּרִיעַ חֶזְקַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Here it is different. because their presumptive status was undermined As, if you do not say that according to the one who said: One elevates from teruma to lineage, since they partake of teruma , they come to elevate them Rather, not due to their presumptive status was undermined,
llm_translation: The case is different here with regard to Hezekiah. For if you don't say so, according to whom does one say that we elevate from terumah to yuchsin: Since he ate from terumah, he comes to engage with them! Rather, no, because of Hezekiah.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, מַאי גְּדוֹלָה חֲזָקָה? מֵעִיקָּרָא אֲכוּל בִּתְרוּמָה דְּרַבָּנַן, הַשְׁתָּא אֲכוּל בִּתְרוּמָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: And what, then, Great is presumptive status? Initially, partake of teruma by rabbinic Now, they partake of teruma by Torah
llm_translation: And rather, what is the greatness of strength? Initially, eating from the tithes of the Rabbis, now eating from the tithes of the Torah.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי בִּתְרוּמָה דְּרַבָּנַן אֲכוּל, בִּתְרוּמָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא אֲכוּל. וְכִי מַסְּקִינַן מִתְּרוּמָה לְיוּחֲסִין — בִּתְרוּמָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, בִּתְרוּמָה דְּרַבָּנַן — לָא מַסְּקִינַן. וְאֶלָּא, מַאי גְּדוֹלָה חֲזָקָה? דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיגְזַר מִשּׁוּם תְּרוּמָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — לָא גָּזְרִינַן.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Now too, they partake of teruma by rabbinic of teruma by Torah they may not partake. And when we elevate from teruma to lineage, with regard to teruma by Torah teruma by rabbinic we do not elevate And what, Great is presumptive status? although there is to issue a decree due to teruma by Torah we do not issue that decree
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: The wine of the Rabbis' terumah is eaten, the terumah of the Torah is not eaten. And when do we establish terumah for genealogy? — In the terumah of the Torah, not in the terumah of the Rabbis. But rather, what is the strong greatness? Even though there is a possibility to decree due to the terumah of the Torah, we do not decree.

hebrew_text: וּבַתְּרוּמָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא אֲכוּל? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא יֹאכְלוּ מִקֹּדֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁים״. מִקֹּדֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁים הוּא דְּלָא אֲכוּל, הָא בִּתְרוּמָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא אֲכוּל!
human_translation: And did they not partake of teruma by Torah But isn’t it written: “That they should not partake of the most sacred items [ kodesh hakodashim ]” of the most sacred items, that they did not partake; of teruma by Torah they did partake.
llm_translation: In the terumah of the Torah, one may not eat? But it is written: "Which they shall not eat of the most holy things." It is the most holy things that one may not eat, but in the terumah of the Torah, one may eat!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: לָא בְּמִידֵּי דְּאִיקְּרִי ״קֹדֶשׁ״, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכׇל זָר לֹא יֹאכַל קֹדֶשׁ״, וְלָא בְּמִידֵּי דְּאִיקְּרִי ״קָדָשִׁים״, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבַת כֹּהֵן כִּי תִהְיֶה לְאִישׁ זָר הִיא בִּתְרוּמַת הַקֳּדָשִׁים לֹא תֹאכֵל״, וְאָמַר מָר: בְּמוּרָם מִן הַקֳּדָשִׁים — לֹא תֹאכֵל.
human_translation: this is is saying: Neither of items called kodesh , as it is written: “And no common man may eat of kodesh ” nor of items called kodashim , as it is written: “And if a priest’s daughter be married to a common man, she shall not eat of terumat hakodashim ” The Master said Of set aside from the offerings [ kodashim ] they may not partake.
llm_translation: Thus he said: Not in the case where it is called "kodesh," as it is written: "And any stranger shall not eat kodesh," and not in the case where it is called "kodashim," as it is written: "But if a kohen's daughter becomes a widow, or divorced, and has no child, and returns to her father's house as in her youth, she shall eat of her father's food; but no stranger shall eat of it." And Mar said: In their state of sanctity — you shall not eat.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: חֲזָקָה לִכְהוּנָּה — נְשִׂיאוּת כַּפַּיִם בְּבָבֶל, וַאֲכִילַת חַלָּה בְּסוּרְיָא, וְחִילּוּק מַתָּנוֹת בִּכְרַכִּין. קָתָנֵי מִיהַת נְשִׂיאוּת כַּפַּיִם, מַאי לָאו לְיוּחֲסִין? לָא, לִתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: Come hear Presumptive status for priesthood the lifting of hands in Babylonia; partaking of ḥalla in Syria; and distributing gifts, in the cities. In any event, teaches the lifting of hands What, it not for lineage? No, for teruma .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shma: chazaka lichhunah — nesiut kappayim beBavel, va'akilat challah beSurya, vechiluk matanot bichrakhin. Katanei mihaat nesiut kappayim, mai lav leyuchasin? La, litrumah." English translation: "Come and hear: A strong presumption for the priesthood — the raising of hands in Babylon, the eating of challah in Sura, and the division of gifts in the villages. It was taught from there regarding the raising of hands, what, is it not for genealogy? No, for terumah."

hebrew_text: וְהָא דּוּמְיָא דַּאֲכִילַת חַלָּה קָתָנֵי, מָה אֲכִילַת חַלָּה לְיוּחֲסִין — אַף נְשִׂיאוּת כַּפַּיִם לְיוּחֲסִין! לָא, אֲכִילַת חַלָּה גּוּפַהּ לִתְרוּמָה. קָסָבַר חַלָּה בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה דְּרַבָּנַן, וּתְרוּמָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. וּמַסְּקִינַן מֵחַלָּה דְּרַבָּנַן לִתְרוּמָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. וְכִדְאָפֵיךְ לְהוּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: But isn’t taught parallel to partaking of ḥalla ? Just as partaking of ḥalla for lineage, so too the lifting of hands for lineage. No, partaking of ḥalla itself for teruma holds today ḥalla is by rabbinic and teruma is by Torah we elevate from ḥalla , by rabbinic teruma , by Torah And in accordance with Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, who reversed the Rabbis
llm_translation: The one who compares the eating of challah is teaching: Just as the eating of challah is for lineage, so too the waving of hands is for lineage! No, the eating of challah itself is for terumah. He holds that challah in our time is Rabbinic, and terumah is Biblical. And we establish from the eating of Rabbinic challah to Biblical terumah. And when Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, presented this argument to the Rabbis, they rejected it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: חֲזָקָה לִכְהוּנָּה — נְשִׂיאוּת כַּפַּיִם וְחִילּוּק גֳּרָנוֹת בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. וּבְסוּרְיָא, וּבְכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁשְּׁלוּחֵי רֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ מַגִּיעִין — נְשִׂיאוּת כַּפַּיִם רְאָיָה, אֲבָל לֹא חִילּוּק גֳּרָנוֹת.
human_translation: Come and hear Presumptive status for priesthood in Eretz Yisrael the lifting of hands and distribution threshing floors. And in Syria and everyplace that emissaries the New Moon arrive, the lifting of hands proof But distribution threshing floors not
llm_translation: Come and hear: Strong for the priesthood - the waving of hands and the division of the necks in the land of Israel. And in Suria, and in every place where the messengers of the new moon arrive - the waving of hands is visible, but not the division of the necks.

hebrew_text: וּבָבֶל כְּסוּרְיָא. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁבֵּית דִּין קְבוּעִין שָׁם.
human_translation: And Babylonia like Syria, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even Alexandria of Egypt initially due to that there a permanent court there
llm_translation: Bavel is like Kusriya. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even the Alexandrian sandal of Egypt initially, because there are established courts there.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת נְשִׂיאוּת כַּפַּיִם, מַאי לָאו לְיוּחֲסִין? לָא, לְחַלָּה. הָא דּוּמְיָא דְּחִילּוּק גֳּרָנוֹת קָתָנֵי: מָה חִילּוּק גֳּרָנוֹת לְיוּחֲסִין, אַף נְשִׂיאוּת כַּפַּיִם לְיוּחֲסִין! לָא, חִילּוּק גֳּרָנוֹת גּוּפֵהּ לְחַלָּה. קָסָבַר תְּרוּמָה בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה דְּרַבָּנַן, וְחַלָּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. וּמַסְּקִינַן מִתְּרוּמָה דְּרַבָּנַן לְחַלָּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: In any event, teaches the lifting of hands What, it not for lineage? No, for ḥalla . But isn’t taught parallel to distribution threshing floors? Just as distribution threshing floors for lineage, so too, the lifting of hands for lineage. No, distribution threshing floors for ḥalla holds today teruma is by rabbinic and ḥalla is by Torah we elevate from teruma , by rabbinic ḥalla , by Torah
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: From where is the exemption of clapping hands derived? What, is it not for genealogy? No, it is for illness. This is similar to the case of the division of the windpipe: Just as the division of the windpipe is for genealogy, so too the exemption of clapping hands is for genealogy! No, the division of the windpipe is for its own sake, for illness. He holds that Terumah in our time is Rabbinic, and illness is Biblical. And we derive the exemption of Rabbinic Terumah to Biblical illness.

hebrew_text: וְכִדְאַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרַבָּנַן. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: אַשְׁכַּחְתִּינְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן בְּבֵי רַב, דְּיָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר תְּרוּמָה בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה דְּרַבָּנַן, חַלָּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. שֶׁהֲרֵי שֶׁבַע שֶׁכִּיבְּשׁוּ וְשֶׁבַע שֶׁחִילְּקוּ — נִתְחַיְּיבוּ בְּחַלָּה, וְלֹא נִתְחַיְּיבוּ בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: And as where Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, found the Rabbis, as Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: I found the Sages in the hall of Rav, who were sitting and saying: Even according to the one who said that teruma today is by rabbinic ḥalla is by Torah as seven that conquered and seven that they divided they were obligated in ḥalla but were not obligated in teruma .
llm_translation: And when Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, found them in the study hall, for Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: I found them in the study hall of the sages, sitting and saying: Even according to the one who says that Terumah nowadays is Rabbinic, Challah is from the Torah. For when seven dried and seven moistened, they are obligated in Challah, but not in Terumah.

hebrew_text: וְאָמֵינָא לְהוּ אֲנָא: אַדְּרַבָּה, אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר תְּרוּמָה בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — חַלָּה דְּרַבָּנַן. דְּתַנְיָא: ״בְּבוֹאֲכֶם אֶל הָאָרֶץ״. אִי ״בְּבוֹאֲכֶם״, יָכוֹל מִשֶּׁנִּכְנְסוּ לָהּ שְׁנַיִם וּשְׁלֹשָׁה מְרַגְּלִים — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּבוֹאֲכֶם״. בְּבִיאַת כּוּלְּכֶם אָמַרְתִּי, וְלֹא בְּבִיאַת מִקְצַתְכֶם. וְכִי אַסְּקִינְהוּ עֶזְרָא,
human_translation: And I said to them: On the contrary, even according to the one who said that teruma today is by Torah ḥalla is by rabbinic as it is taught “When you come into the land If when you come, might from that two or three spies entered the verse states: “When you come,” I said with the coming of all of you and not with the coming of some of you. and when Ezra took them up
llm_translation: I would say to them: On the contrary, even according to the one who says that Terumah nowadays is of biblical origin - Challah is Rabbinic. As it was taught: "When you come into the land." If it said "when you come," one might think that even if two or three of you entered to spy it out - the Torah teaches: "When you come." I have said with your entire coming, not with part of your coming. And shall we compare Ezra to them,

hebrew_text: לָאו כּוּלְּהוּ סְלוּק.
human_translation: not all of them ascended.
llm_translation: Not all of them have departed.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: חֲזָקָה לִכְהוּנָּה — נְשִׂיאוּת כַּפַּיִם וְחִילּוּק גֳּרָנוֹת וְעֵדוּת. עֵדוּת חֲזָקָה הִיא? אֶלָּא לָאו, הָכִי קָאָמַר: נְשִׂיאוּת כַּפַּיִם כִּי עֵדוּת: מָה עֵדוּת לְיוּחֲסִין, אַף נְשִׂיאוּת כַּפַּיִם לְיוּחֲסִין! לָא: עֵדוּת הַבָּאָה מִכֹּחַ חֲזָקָה — כַּחֲזָקָהּ.
human_translation: Come hear: presumptive status for priesthood Lifting of the Hands and distribution threshing floors, and testimony. Does testimony presumptive status? Rather is it not this is what is saying: Lifting of the Hands like testimony, just as testimony for lineage, so too Lifting of the Hands for lineage. No, testimony that is based on presumptive status is like presumptive status
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shma: chazakah likhunah - nesiut kappayim ve'hiluk goranot ve'edut. Edut chazakah hi? Ela l'av, hachi ka'amar: nesiut kappayim ki edut: mah edut leyuchasin, af nesiut kappayim leyuchasin! La: edut haba'ah mikoch chazakah - kachazakah." English translation: "Come and hear: Strength for the priesthood - the lifting of hands, the division of the necks, and testimony. Is testimony strong? Rather, no, this is what it means to say: the lifting of hands is like testimony: just as testimony is for lineage, so too the lifting of hands is for lineage! No: testimony that comes from a strong force - like its strength."

hebrew_text: כִּי הָהוּא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוּחְזְקַנִי בָּזֶה שֶׁהוּא כֹּהֵן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָה רָאִיתָ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שֶׁקָּרָא רִאשׁוֹן בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת. בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהוּא כֹּהֵן, אוֹ בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהוּא גָּדוֹל? שֶׁקָּרָא אַחֲרָיו לֵוִי. וְהֶעֱלָהוּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי לִכְהוּנָּה עַל פִּיו.
human_translation: As a certain who came before Rabbi Ami said to him: That presumptive status me that he is a priest. said to him: What did you see He said to that he read first in the synagogue. on the presumptive status that he is a priest, or on the presumptive status that he is a great as after him a Levite read And Rabbi Ami elevated him to the priesthood, on the basis of his
llm_translation: When that one came before Rabbi Ammi, he said to him: "I am established in this one who is a Kohen." He said to him: "What did you see?" He said to him: "He was the first to read in the synagogue." Is he established as a Kohen, or is he established as a Gadol? He then called after him Levi. And Rabbi Ammi elevated him to the priesthood according to his word.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוּחְזְקַנִי בָּזֶה שֶׁהוּא לֵוִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָה רָאִיתָ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שֶׁקָּרָא שֵׁנִי בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת. בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהוּא לֵוִי, אוֹ בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהוּא גָּדוֹל? שֶׁקָּרָא לְפָנָיו כֹּהֵן. וְהַעֲלֵהוּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי לִלְוִיָּה עַל פִּיו.
human_translation: a certain who came before Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said to That presumptive status me that he is a Levite. said to him: What did you see He said to that he read second in the synagogue. on the presumptive status that he is a Levite, or on the presumptive status that he is a great as a priest read before him. And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi elevated him to Levite status, based on his
llm_translation: That one who came before Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, said to him: "I am certain about this one that he is a Levi." He said to him: "What did you see?" He said to him: "That he read a second time in the synagogue." Is he established as a Levi, or is he established as a Kohen? Because he read before him as a Kohen. And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi brought him up to the platform according to his statement.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוּחְזְקַנִי בָּזֶה שֶׁהוּא כֹּהֵן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָה רָאִיתָ? [אֲמַר לֵיהּ] שֶׁקָּרָא רִאשׁוֹן בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רְאִיתִיו שֶׁחִילֵּק עַל הַגֳּרָנוֹת? אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: וְאִם אֵין שָׁם גּוֹרֶן, בָּטְלָה כְּהוּנָּה?
human_translation: a certain man who came before Reish Lakish said to That presumptive status me that he is a priest. said to him: What did you see He said to that he read first in the synagogue. said to him: Did you see that he received a share at the threshing floor? Rabbi Elazar said to And if there is no threshing floor there, the priesthood cease
llm_translation: That one who came before Reish Lakish, said to him: "Strengthen me with this, for he is a Kohen." He said to him: "What did you see?" He said to him "That he was the first to read in the synagogue." He said to him: "Did you see him divide the necks?" Rabbi Elazar said to him: "And if there is no threshing floor there, is his priesthood nullified?"

hebrew_text: זִימְנִין הָווּ יָתְבִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֲתָא כִּי הָא מַעֲשֶׂה לְקַמֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: רְאִיתִיו שֶׁחִילֵּק עַל הַגּוֹרֶן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְאִם אֵין שָׁם גּוֹרֶן, בָּטְלָה כְּהוּנָּה? הֲדַר חַזְיֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בִּישׁוּת, אֲמַר: שָׁמְעַתְּ מִילֵּי דְּבַר נַפָּחָא, וְלָא אֲמַרְתְּ לַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ?
human_translation: occasion sat before Rabbi Yoḥanan. similar that incident, came before Reish Lakish said to Did you see that he received a share at the threshing floor? Rabbi Yoḥanan said to And if there is no threshing floor there, the priesthood cease turned and looked at Rabbi Elazar harshly, said You heard a statement of bar Nappaḥa, and you did not say to us in his name?
llm_translation: Times were when sat before him of Rabbi Yochanan, came when this incident before him. Said to him Resh Lakish: Saw him that he divided on the threshing floor? Said to him Rabbi Yochanan: And if there is no threshing floor, is it nullified as an entity? Returned he saw to Rabbi Elazar in the marketplace, said: You heard words of a matter of importance, and did not say to us from his name?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא, חַד הֶעֱלָה בֵּן עַל פִּי אָבִיו לִכְהוּנָּה, וְחַד הֶעֱלָה אָח עַל פִּי אָחִיו לִלְוִיָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi and Rabbi Ḥiyya one elevated a son to priesthood on the basis of his father, and one elevated a brother to Levite status on the basis of his brother.
llm_translation: Rabbi and Rabbi Chiyya, one ascended son according to his father to the priesthood, and one ascended brother according to his brother to the Levites.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיֵּים דְּרַבִּי הֶעֱלָה בֵּן עַל פִּי אָבִיו לִכְהוּנָּה, דְּתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁבָּא וְאָמַר: בְּנִי זֶה, וְכֹהֵן הוּא — נֶאֱמָן לְהַאֲכִילוֹ בִּתְרוּמָה, וְאֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן לְהַשִּׂיאוֹ אִשָּׁה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אִם אַתָּה מַאֲמִינוֹ לְהַאֲכִילוֹ בִּתְרוּמָה — תַּאֲמִינוֹ לְהַשִּׂיאוֹ אִשָּׁה. וְאִם אִי אַתָּה מַאֲמִינוֹ לְהַשִּׂיאוֹ אִשָּׁה — לֹא תַּאֲמִינוֹ לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה!
human_translation: It may be concluded that Rabbi elevated a son to priesthood on the basis of his father, as it is taught came and said: This is my son and he is a priest, deemed credible to enable to partake of teruma , but is not deemed credible to marry a woman to him, the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Ḥiyya said to him: If you deem credible to enable to partake of teruma , deem him credible to marry a woman to And if you do not deem him credible to marry a woman to him, do not deem him credible to partake of teruma .
llm_translation: The matter was concluded according to the opinion of Rabbi Heala, son of Al, based on the teaching: If one came and said, "This is my son, and he is a Kohen," he is trusted to feed him Terumah, but he is not trusted to marry him off to a woman, the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Chiya said to him: If you believe him to feed him Terumah, then believe him to marry him off to a woman. But if you do not believe him to marry him off to a woman, then do not believe him to eat Terumah!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: אֲנִי מַאֲמִינוֹ לְהַאֲכִילוֹ בִּתְרוּמָה — שֶׁבְּיָדוֹ לְהַאֲכִילוֹ בִּתְרוּמָה, וְאֵינִי מַאֲמִינוֹ לְהַשִּׂיאוֹ אִשָּׁה — שֶׁאֵין בְּיָדוֹ לְהַשִּׂיאוֹ אִשָּׁה. תִּסְתַּיֵּים. וּמִדְּרַבִּי הֶעֱלָה בֵּן עַל פִּי אָבִיו לִכְהוּנָּה — רַבִּי חִיָּיא הֶעֱלָה אָח עַל פִּי אָחִיו לִלְוִיָּה.
human_translation: said to him: I deem him credible to enable to partake of teruma , as it is within his purview to feed teruma , But I do not deem him credible to marry a woman to as it is not within his purview to marry a woman to concluded And from that Rabbi elevated a son to priesthood on the basis of his father, Rabbi Ḥiyya elevated a brother to Levite status on the basis of his brother.
llm_translation: He said to him: "I believe him to feed him from the terumah - for it is in his power to feed him from the terumah, but I do not believe him to marry him off to a woman - for it is not in his power to marry him off to a woman. It is concluded. And from Rabbi Heila, son of his father's brother, to the priesthood - Rabbi Hiyya brought up his brother according to his brother to the Levite status."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא, מַאי שְׁנָא בֵּן דְּלָא, דְּקָרוֹב הוּא אֵצֶל אָבִיו — אָח נָמֵי קָרוֹב הוּא אֵצֶל אָחִיו?!
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya, what is different a son, where not because is a relative of his father, A brother is also a relative of his brother,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya, what is the difference between a son who is not close, for he is near his father — is he not close to his brother?!

hebrew_text: בְּמֵסִיחַ לְפִי תּוּמּוֹ. כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה מֵסִיחַ לְפִי תּוּמּוֹ, וְאָמַר: זְכוּרַנִי כְּשֶׁאֲנִי תִּינוֹק וּמוּרְכָּב עַל כְּתֵיפוֹ שֶׁל אַבָּא, וְהוֹצִיאוּנִי מִבֵּית הַסֵּפֶר, וְהִפְשִׁיטוּנִי אֶת כּוּתׇּנְתִּי, וְהַטְבִּילוּנִי לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה לָעֶרֶב.
human_translation: of speaks offhandedly similar to that which Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: an incident involving a person who was speaking offhandedly and said: I remember when I was a child and carried on my father’s shoulder, and they took me out of school, and removed my cloak, and immersed me to partake of teruma that evening.
llm_translation: In the case of one who is speaking according to his innocence. For this is what Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: There was an incident with a certain man who was speaking according to his innocence, and he said: Remember me as I was a child, riding on the shoulder of my father, and they took me out of the school, and they removed my tunic, and they immersed me to eat from the terumah at night.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא מְסַיֵּים בַּהּ: וַחֲבֵירַי בְּדֵילִין מִמֶּנִּי, וְהָיוּ קוֹרִין אוֹתִי ״יוֹחָנָן אוֹכֵל חַלּוֹת״. וְהֶעֱלָהוּ רַבִּי לִכְהוּנָּה עַל פִּיו.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya, concluded And my friends distanced from me, and would call me: Yoḥanan who partakes of ḥallot , And Rabbi elevated him to priesthood based on his
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya concludes in it: "And my colleagues would distinguish me, and they would call me 'Yochanan the bread-eater.'" And Rabbi elevated him to the priesthood on his account.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁתְּרוּמָה חֲזָקָה לִכְהוּנָּה — כָּךְ מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן חֲזָקָה לִכְהוּנָּה, וְהַחוֹלֵק בְּבֵית דִּין אֵינָהּ חֲזָקָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Just as teruma presumptive status for priesthood, so too first tithe presumptive status for priesthood. And one who receives a share in court not presumptive status
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Just as a strong terumah is for the priesthood, so too is the first tithe strong for the priesthood, and one who disputes in the court, it is not strong.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן דְּלֵוִי הוּא! כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה. דְּתַנְיָא: תְּרוּמָה לְכֹהֵן, מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן לְלֵוִי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר: מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן אַף לְכֹהֵן. אֵימוֹר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה ״אַף לְכֹהֵן״, לְכֹהֵן וְלֹא לְלֵוִי מִי אָמַר?
human_translation: First tithe is to a Levite. in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, as it is taught Teruma is to a priest, first tithe is to a Levite; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: First tithe to a priest as well. Say Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya said: To a priest as well. Did he say to a priest and not to a Levite?
llm_translation: First tithe of Levi it is! Like Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah. As it was taught: Terumah for the Kohen, first tithe for the Levi, the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says: First tithe also for the Kohen. Say, when Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah said "also for the Kohen," to the Kohen and not to the Levi, who did he say?

hebrew_text: אִין, בָּתַר דְּקַנְסִינְהוּ עֶזְרָא. וְדִלְמָא אִיקְּרוּ וְיָהֲבוּ לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן דְּמוּחְזָק לַן בַּאֲבוּהּ דְּהַאי דְּכֹהֵן הוּא, וּנְפַק עֲלֵיהּ קָלָא דְּבֶן גְּרוּשָׁה וּבֶן חֲלוּצָה הוּא, וַחֲלַקוּ לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ מַעֲשֵׂר בְּבֵית הַגֳּרָנוֹת.
human_translation: Yes, After Ezra penalized But perhaps by happenstance they gave him Rav Ḥisda said: With what are we dealing here? where the father of that presumptive status of priesthood before us, and a rumor emerged that he is the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza . And himself received a share of tithe at the threshing floor.
llm_translation: There is no, after they have imposed a penalty on him, Ezra. And perhaps they will read it and give it to him! Rav Hisda said: What are we dealing with here? For example, that we are certain about the father of this priest, and a voice of a son of a divorcee and a son of a halutzah came out against him, and they divided with him the tithe in the granary.

hebrew_text: לֵוִי, דְּלָאו לֵוִי הוּא, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר — בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה אוֹ בֶּן חֲלוּצָה הוּא. לָא מִיבַּעְיָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן אָסוּר לְזָרִים, דְּלָא הֲווֹ יָהֲבִי לֵיהּ. אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן מוּתָּר לְזָרִים, הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְמִיסְפָּא לְהוּ, אֲבָל בְּתוֹרַת חֲלוּקָּה לָא יָהֲבִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Levite that he is not a Levite, What is there to say? he is the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza ? It is not necessary to say that to the one who says first tithe is forbidden to non-priests, they would not have given However, even according to the one who says that first tithe is permitted for non-priests, that applies only to provide However, in the form of a share at the threshing floor, one does not give to
llm_translation: Levi, who is not Levi, what can be said? — He is the son of a divorcee or the son of a halutzah. It is not necessary according to the one who says that the first tithe is forbidden to non-priests, as it was not given to him. Rather, even according to the one who says that the first tithe is permitted to non-priests, these matters are additional for him, but in the case of a divided inheritance, it is not given to him.

hebrew_text: וְהַחוֹלֵק בְּבֵית דִּין אֵינָהּ חֲזָקָה. אִי בְּבֵית דִּין לָא הָוְיָא חֲזָקָה, הֵיכָא הָוְיָא חֲזָקָה?! אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, הָכִי קָאָמַר: הַחוֹלֵק תְּרוּמָה בְּנִכְסֵי אָבִיו עִם אֶחָיו בְּבֵית דִּין — אֵינָהּ חֲזָקָה.
human_translation: And one who receives a share in court not presumptive status If in court it not presumptive status, where does it presumptive status? Rav Sheshet said this is what is saying: One who receives a share of teruma from his father’s property with his brothers in court not presumptive status
llm_translation: The one who divides in the court, it is not established. If in the court it is not established, where is it established?! Rav Sheshet said, this is what he is saying: One who divides a contribution from his father's estate with his brothers in the court - it is not established.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מִדְּהָנָךְ לַאֲכִילָה, הַאי נָמֵי לַאֲכִילָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: הָנָךְ לַאֲכִילָה, הַאי לְזַבּוֹנֵי.
human_translation: is obvious Lest you say from that these to partake that also to partake teaches us these to partake that to sell it.
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say: from here for eating, this one also for eating, it is teaching us: this one for eating, this one for selling.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַעֲלִין לִכְהוּנָּה עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד וְכוּ׳. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַיְינוּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר! וְכִי תֵּימָא עַרְעָר חַד אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר עַרְעָר חַד, וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: עַרְעָר תְּרֵי. הָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל, אֵין עַרְעָר פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One does not elevate to priesthood on the basis of one witness. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel is Rabbi Eliezer, And if you would say that there is between them a challenge one as Rabbi Eliezer holds: A challenge one and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: challenge two didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: Everyone agrees there is no challenge fewer than two
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: We do not elevate to the priesthood based on the testimony of one witness, and so on. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, is that Rabbi Eliezer! And if you say there is a dispute between them, for Rabbi Eliezer holds one witness, and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: two witnesses. As Rabbi Yochanan said: In all matters, an "ar'ar" is not less than two!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — דְּמוּחְזָק לַן בַּאֲבוּהּ דְּהַאי דְּכֹהֵן הוּא, וּנְפַק עֲלֵיהּ קָלָא דְּבֶן גְּרוּשָׁה אוֹ בֶּן חֲלוּצָה הוּא, וְאַחֲתִינֵּיהּ. וַאֲתָא עֵד אֶחָד וְאָמַר: יָדַעְנָא בֵּיהּ דְּכֹהֵן הוּא,
human_translation: Rather, with what are we dealing here? where the father of that presumptive status of priesthood before us, and a rumor emerged about that he is the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza , and we downgraded him And one came and said: I know that he is a priest
llm_translation: Rather: Here, with what are we dealing? — That we are established in the father of this priest, and there comes upon him a voice of a son of a divorced woman or a halutzah, and his lineage. And one witness came and said: I know about him that he is a priest.

hebrew_text: וְאַסְּקִינֵּיהּ. וַאֲתוֹ בֵּי תְרֵי וְאָמְרִי: בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה וּבֶן חֲלוּצָה הוּא, וְאַחֲתִינֵּיהּ. וַאֲתָא עֵד אֶחָד וְאָמַר: יָדַעְנָא בֵּיהּ דְּכֹהֵן הוּא. וּדְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִצְטָרְפִין לְעֵדוּת.
human_translation: and we elevated And two came and said: He is the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza , and we downgraded him one came and said: I know that he is a priest And everyone agrees join for testimony
llm_translation: And they examined him. And the two came and said: He is a son of a divorced woman and a halutzah, and his sister. And one witness came and said: We know about him that he is a kohen. And all the world's witnesses join together for testimony.

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא בְּמֵיחַשׁ לְזִילוּתָא דְבֵי דִינָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי. תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּאַחֲתִינֵּיהּ, לָא מַסְּקִינַן לֵיהּ, חָיְישִׁינַן לְזִילוּתָא דְּבֵי דִינָא. וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: אֲנַן אַחֲתִינַן לֵיהּ וַאֲנַן מַסְּקִינַן לֵיהּ, וּלְזִילוּתָא דְּבֵי דִינָא לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: And here with regard to concern to contempt for the court they disagree. The first tanna , holds: Once we downgraded him we do not elevate him. We are concerned to contempt for the court, And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: We downgrade him and we elevate him, and to contempt for the court, we are not concerned
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "And here in the case of Meichas to go out of the court, they disagree. A Tanna taught: The first one holds: Since we have sharpened it, we do not remove it, we are concerned about the dignity of the court. And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: We sharpen it and we remove it, and we are not concerned about the dignity of the court."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ תְּרֵי וּתְרֵי נָמֵי!
human_translation: Rav Ashi objects: If so, If so, even two and two also
llm_translation: Rav Ashi objects to her: If so, even two and two are also considered!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: בְּמִצְטָרְפִין לְעֵדוּת קָמִיפַּלְגִי, וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְּהָנֵי תַנָּאֵי. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין עֵדוּתָן מִצְטָרֶפֶת עַד שֶׁיִּרְאוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם כְּאֶחָד. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ בָּזֶה אַחַר זֶה. וְאֵין עֵדוּתָן מִתְקַיֶּימֶת בְּבֵית דִּין עַד שֶׁיָּעִידוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם כְּאֶחָד.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: with regard to join for testimony they disagree, and in the dispute these tanna’im as it is taught The testimony merges only if the two of them saw as one. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: even in this after that however, the testimony is validated in court only the two of them testify as one.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashe said: In the case of joining together for testimony, Reish Lakish disagrees, and in the dispute of those Tannaim. As it was taught: Their testimony does not combine until they see each other as one. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: Even if one after the other. And their testimony is not established in court until they both testify as one.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: שׁוֹמְעִין דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל זֶה הַיּוֹם, וּכְשֶׁיָּבֹא חֲבֵירוֹ לְמָחָר שׁוֹמְעִין דְּבָרָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Natan says: hears the statement of this today, and when his fellow comes tomorrow hears his statement,
llm_translation: Rabbi Nathan says: We listen to the words of this one today, and when his friend comes tomorrow, we listen to his words.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁנֶּחְבְּשָׁה בִּידֵי גוֹיִם, עַל יְדֵי מָמוֹן — מוּתֶּרֶת לְבַעְלָהּ. עַל יְדֵי נְפָשׁוֹת — אֲסוּרָה לְבַעְלָהּ.
human_translation: a woman who was imprisoned by gentiles due to a monetary she is permitted to her husband, due to a capital she is forbidden to her husband
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A woman who was taken captive by gentiles, if it is for the sake of money — she is permitted to her husband. If it is for the sake of their lives — she is forbidden to her husband.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁיַּד יִשְׂרָאֵל תַּקִּיפָה עַל אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם, אֲבָל יַד אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם תַּקִּיפָה עַל עַצְמָן, אֲפִילּוּ עַל יְדֵי מָמוֹן — אֲסוּרָה לְבַעְלָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak said Rav said: They taught only where the authority of the Jewish people is dominant over the nations of the world, However, when the authority of the nations of the world is dominant over themselves, even due to a monetary is forbidden to her husband,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak said in the name of Rav: They only decreed that the hand of Israel should be strong upon the nations of the world, but the hand of the nations of the world should be strong upon themselves, even regarding matters of money - it is forbidden for her husband.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַכֹּהֵן וְרַבִּי זְכַרְיָה בֶּן הַקַּצָּב עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁהוּרְהֲנָה בְּאַשְׁקְלוֹן, וְרִיחֲקוּהָ בְּנֵי מִשְׁפַּחְתָּהּ, וְעֵדֶיהָ מְעִידִים אוֹתָהּ שֶׁלֹּא נִסְתְּרָה וְשֶׁלֹּא נִטְמָאָה. וְאָמְרוּ לָהֶם חֲכָמִים: אִם אַתֶּם מַאֲמִינִים שֶׁהוּרְהֲנָה — הַאֲמִינוּ שֶׁלֹּא נִסְתְּרָה וְשֶׁלֹּא נִטְמָאָה, וְאִם אִי אַתֶּם מַאֲמִינִים שֶׁלֹּא נִסְתְּרָה וְשֶׁלֹּא נִטְמָאָה — אַל תַּאֲמִינוּ שֶׁהוּרְהֲנָה.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection Rabbi Yosei the priest and Rabbi Zekharya ben HaKatzav testified about a Jewish woman whom she was taken as collateral in Ashkelon. And the members of her family, distanced themselves from her, but her witnesses testified about her that she neither entered into seclusion nor was violated. And the Sages said If you deem credible that she was taken as collateral, deem credible that she neither entered into seclusion nor was violated. And if you do not deem credible that she neither entered into seclusion nor was violated, do not deem credible that she was taken as collateral
llm_translation: Rava raises an objection: Rabbi Yosei the priest and Rabbi Zekharya ben Hakatzav testified concerning a daughter of Israel who was suspected in Ashkelon, and her relatives distanced her, and her witnesses testify about her that she did not hide and did not become impure. And the sages said to them: If you believe that she was suspected, then believe that she did not hide and did not become impure, but if you do not believe that she did not hide and did not become impure, do not believe that she was suspected.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אַשְׁקְלוֹן, דְּיַד אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם תַּקִּיפָה עַל עַצְמָן, וְקָתָנֵי:
human_translation: But Ashkelon, which where the authority of the nations of the world is dominant over themselves, and it is taught:
llm_translation: And the city of Ashkelon, whose hands are stretched out to the ends of the world, and it is small.

hebrew_text: הוּרְהֲנָה — אִין, נֶחְבְּשָׁה — לָא. הוּא הַדִּין אֲפִילּוּ נֶחְבְּשָׁה. וּמַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה, כָּךְ הָיָה.
human_translation: If she was taken as security, yes, imprisoned no, The same is true if she was imprisoned, and the incident that transpired, transpired that
llm_translation: Instructed - no, bound - no. The same applies even if bound. And there was an incident that occurred, so it was.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רָבָא: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַכֹּהֵן וְרַבִּי זְכַרְיָה בֶּן הַקַּצָּב עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁהוּרְהֲנָה בְּאַשְׁקְלוֹן, וְרִיחֲקוּהָ בְּנֵי מִשְׁפַּחְתָּהּ, וְעֵדֶיהָ מְעִידִים עָלֶיהָ שֶׁלֹּא נִסְתְּרָה וְשֶׁלֹּא נִטְמָאָה, וְאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אִם אַתֶּם מַאֲמִינִים שֶׁהוּרְהֲנָה — הַאֲמִינוּ שֶׁלֹּא נִסְתְּרָה וְשֶׁלֹּא נִטְמָאָה, וְאִם אֵין אַתֶּם מַאֲמִינִים שֶׁלֹּא נִסְתְּרָה וְשֶׁלֹּא נִטְמָאָה — אַל תַּאֲמִינוּ שֶׁהוּרְהֲנָה.
human_translation: Some say Rava said we too learn Rabbi Yosei the priest and Rabbi Zekharya ben HaKatzav testified about a Jewish woman whom she was taken as security in Ashkelon. And the members of her family, distanced themselves from her, and her witnesses testified about her that she neither entered into seclusion nor was violated. And the Sages said If you believe that she was taken as collateral, believe that she neither entered into seclusion nor was violated. And if you do not believe that she neither entered into seclusion nor was violated, do not believe that she was taken as collateral
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rava said: We also learned: Rabbi Yosei the Priest and Rabbi Zekharya ben HaKatzav testified concerning a daughter of Israel who was violated in Ashkelon, and her relatives distanced her, and her witnesses testify about her that she did not hide herself and did not become defiled, and the Sages said: If you believe that she was violated — believe that she did not hide herself and did not become defiled, and if you do not believe that she did not hide herself and did not become defiled — do not believe that she was violated.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אַשְׁקְלוֹן, דְּעַל יְדֵי מָמוֹן הֲוָה, וְטַעְמָא דְּעֵדִים מְעִידִין אוֹתָהּ, הָא אֵין עֵדִים מְעִידִין אוֹתָהּ — לָא. מַאי לָאו: לָא שְׁנָא הוּרְהֲנָה, וְלָא שְׁנָא נֶחְבְּשָׁה! לָא, הוּרְהֲנָה שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: But Ashkelon that was due to a monetary the reason that witnesses testified about her However, if witnesses did not testify about her, no, is it not is no different taken as collateral and is no different imprisoned? No, taken as collateral is different,
llm_translation: The Gemara: And what about Ashkelon, where the testimony was through monetary transactions, and the reason witnesses testify about it is because witnesses do not testify about it - no. What is the reason? It is not different from Hurhana, and it is not different from Nechbasha! No, Hurhana is different.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּרָמֵי לַהּ מִירְמָא, תְּנַן: עַל יְדֵי מָמוֹן מוּתֶּרֶת לְבַעְלָהּ, וּרְמִינְהוּ: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יוֹסֵי כּוּ׳. וְהָא אַשְׁקְלוֹן, דְּעַל יְדֵי מָמוֹן, וְקָתָנֵי: טַעְמָא דְּעֵדִים מְעִידִים אוֹתָהּ, הָא אֵין עֵדִים מְעִידִין אוֹתָהּ לָא!
human_translation: Some raise it as a contradiction We learned due to a monetary is permitted to her husband. And they raise a contradiction Rabbi Yosei ben HaKatzav testified But Ashkelon, which was due to a monetary and it is taught the reason that witnesses testified about her However, if witnesses did not testify about her, no,
llm_translation: There is one who throws her from a height, we learned: through the means of money she is permitted to her husband, and we raised a dilemma: Rabbi Yosei testified. And the case of Ashkelon, through the means of money, and it teaches: the reason witnesses testify about her, but witnesses do not testify about her!

hebrew_text: וּמְשַׁנֵּי, אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן שֶׁיַּד יִשְׂרָאֵל תַּקִּיפָה עַל אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם, כָּאן שֶׁיַּד אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם תַּקִּיפָה עַל עַצְמָן.
human_translation: And he answers Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak said: not difficult. Here, when the authority of the Jewish people is dominant over the nations of the world. There when the authority of the nations of the world is dominant over themselves
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from the Mishnah, Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak said, it is not difficult: here where the hand of Israel is strong upon the nations of the world, here where the hand of the nations of the world is strong upon themselves.

hebrew_text: עַל יְדֵי נְפָשׁוֹת אֲסוּרָה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב: כְּגוֹן נְשֵׁי גַנָּבֵי. וְלֵוִי אָמַר: כְּגוֹן אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל בֶּן דּוֹנַאי. אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: וְהוּא שֶׁנִּגְמַר דִּינָן לַהֲרִיגָה, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמַר דִּינָן לַהֲרִיגָה.
human_translation: because of a capital is forbidden to her husband. Rav said: where the wives of thieves And Levi said: where the wife of ben Donai, Ḥizkiyya said: And is where were sentenced to death. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Although were not sentenced to death,
llm_translation: By means of his own life, it is forbidden, etc. Rav said: Such as the wives of thieves. And Levi said: Such as the wife of Ben Dornai. Hezekiah said: And this is when our judgment has been concluded for execution, and Rabbi Yochanan said: Even though our judgment has not been concluded for execution.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עִיר שֶׁכְּבָשׁוּהָ כַּרְכּוֹם — כׇּל כֹּהֲנוֹת שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ בְּתוֹכָהּ פְּסוּלוֹת. וְאִם יֵשׁ לָהֶן עֵדִים, אֲפִילּוּ עֶבֶד, אֲפִילּוּ שִׁפְחָה — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנִין. וְאֵין נֶאֱמָן אָדָם עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: a city that was conquered by siege, all the women priests located in are unfit And if they have witnesses, even a slave, even a maidservant, they are deemed credible. And a person is not deemed credible by his own
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A city that the enemy surrounded with a wall - all the Kohanim found within it are disqualified. And if they have witnesses, even a slave, even a maidservant - these are believed. And a person is not believed on his own.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּרְמִינְהוּ: בַּלֶּשֶׁת שֶׁבָּאָה לָעִיר, בִּשְׁעַת שָׁלוֹם — חָבִיּוֹת פְּתוּחוֹת אֲסוּרוֹת, סְתוּמוֹת מוּתָּרוֹת. בִּשְׁעַת מִלְחָמָה — אֵלּוּ וְאֵלּוּ מוּתָּרוֹת, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין פְּנַאי לְנַסֵּךְ.
human_translation: raises a contradiction a military unit that entered a city, during peacetime, open barrels forbidden sealed are permitted. in wartime, both these and those are permitted because there is no respite to pour
llm_translation: Gemara: And they raised a dilemma: In the case of a woman who comes to the city, during a time of peace - open barrels are forbidden, closed barrels are permitted. During a time of war - both open and closed barrels are permitted, because there is no leisure to pour out the wine.
