hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מָרִי: לִבְעוֹל יֵשׁ פְּנַאי, לְנַסֵּךְ אֵין פְּנַאי. רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אֶלְעָזָר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּחִזְקִיָּה אָמַר: כָּאן בְּכַרְכּוֹם שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ מַלְכוּת, כָּאן בְּכַרְכּוֹם שֶׁל מַלְכוּת אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rav Mari said: To engage in intercourse there is respite; to pour there is no respite. Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Elazar said in the name of Ḥizkiyya: There, to the siege of the same monarchy. Here, to the siege of a different monarchy.
llm_translation: Rav Mari said: For cohabitation, there is privacy; for libation, there is no privacy. Rabbi Yitzchak bar Elazar, from the name of Chizkiyah, said: Here in the vineyard of that kingdom, and here in the vineyard of another kingdom.

hebrew_text: שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ מַלְכוּת נָמֵי, אִי אֶפְשָׁר דְּלָא עָרַק חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּשֶׁמִּשְׁמָרוֹת רוֹאוֹת זוֹ אֶת זוֹ. אִי אֶפְשָׁר דְּלָא נָיְימָא פּוּרְתָּא! אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: כְּגוֹן דִּמְהַדַּר לַהּ לְמָתָא שׁוּשִׁילְתָּא וְכַלְבָּא וּגְווֹזָא וַאֲווֹזָא.
human_translation: Even of the same monarchy, it is impossible that one of did not wander off Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: where sentries see each other It is impossible that not doze a bit, Rabbi Levi said: where they surround the city with chains, and dogs, and branches [ gavza ], and geese,
llm_translation: Of that kingdom of Nami, it is impossible that one of them did not argue. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: "When the watches see each other." It is impossible not to say 'Purta'! Rabbi Levi said: For example, when he adorned for her a mat, a pillow, a coverlet, and a cushion.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה וְרַבָּנַן. חַד אָמַר: כָּאן בְּכַרְכּוֹם שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ מַלְכוּת, כָּאן בְּכַרְכּוֹם שֶׁל מַלְכוּת אַחֶרֶת, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. וְחַד קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ כֹּל הָנֵי, וּמְשַׁנֵּי: כְּגוֹן דִּמְהַדַּר לֵיהּ לְמָתָא שׁוּשִׁילְתָּא וְכַלְבָּא וּגְווֹזָא וַאֲווֹזָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said: Rabbi Yehuda Nesia, and the Rabbis dispute One said: There, to the siege of the same monarchy. Here, to the siege of a different monarchy, and it not difficult for him at all, And for one, all these were difficult, and he answers: where they surround the city with chains, and dogs, and branches, and geese.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said: Rabbi Yehuda the Nasi and the Rabbis disagree about it. One said: Here in the vineyard of that kingdom, here in the vineyard of another kingdom, and it is not difficult for him nor for them. And one difficulty is for him all these, and he answered: For example, when he adorned for the city of Shushan and for the dog and for the goat and for the goose.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַשְׁיָאן: אִם יֵשׁ שָׁם מַחְבּוֹאָה אַחַת — מַצֶּלֶת עַל הַכֹּהֲנוֹת כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin said Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Ashyan said: If there is a single hideaway there it saves all the women priests.
llm_translation: Said Rav Idi son of Avin said Rabbi Yitzchak son of Ashyayan: If there is one hiding place there - it shelters all the priests.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: אֵינָהּ מַחְזֶקֶת אֶלָּא אַחַת מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן כֹּל חֲדָא וַחֲדָא הַיְינוּ הָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא אָמְרִינַן?
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: holds only one what is Do we say that each this is Or, perhaps we do not
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rabbi Yirmiyah: Does it establish only one what? Who said we say each and every one is the same, or perhaps we do not say so?

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מִשְּׁנֵי שְׁבִילִין, אֶחָד טָמֵא וְאֶחָד טָהוֹר. וְהָלַךְ בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן וְעָשָׂה טְהָרוֹת, וּבָא חֲבֵירוֹ וְהָלַךְ בַּשֵּׁנִי וְעָשָׂה טְהָרוֹת,
human_translation: And what is different from two paths? one ritually impure and one ritually pure. And walked on one of them, and engaged in ritual purity, And another came and walked on the second and he engaged in ritual purity.
llm_translation: And what is the difference between the two paths, one impure and one pure. And he walked on one of them and performed purifications, and his fellow came and walked on the other and performed purifications.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם נִשְׁאַל זֶה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וְזֶה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ — טְהוֹרוֹת. שְׁנֵיהֶם כְּאַחַת — טְמֵאוֹת. רַבִּי יוֹסִי אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ טְמֵאִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If this asked in and of himself, and that asked in and of himself, they are pure. both at the same time, they are ritually impure. Rabbi Yosei says: One way or another they are ritually impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If this one was asked by himself and this one by himself - pure. Both of them together - impure. Rabbi Yosi says: In either case, they are impure.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּבַת אַחַת — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל: טְמֵאִין. בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל: טְהוֹרִים. לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא בְּבָא לִישָּׁאֵל עָלָיו וְעַל חֲבֵירוֹ: מָר מְדַמֵּי לֵיהּ לִבְבַת אַחַת, וּמָר מְדַמֵּי לֵיהּ לְבָזֶה אַחַר זֶה. וְהָכָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּשָׁרֵי לְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ — כְּבַת אַחַת דָּמֵי!
human_translation: And Rava said, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan at the same time, everyone agrees they are ritually impure, this after that everyone agrees they are ritually pure. They disagree only with regard to comes to ask about himself and about the other. One Sage, likens it to at the same time, and Rabbi Yehuda likens it to this after that And here too, since they all permitted it is tantamount to at the same time,
llm_translation: And Rava said, and it was stated by Rabbi Yochanan: In one daughter - the words of all: they are impure. In this one after the other - the words of all: they are pure. They only disagreed in the case of a "Bava" to Israel and his fellow: one Master compares it to one daughter, and one Master compares it to one after the other. And here it is stated, since they are permitted for all - it is considered as one daughter!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם וַדַּאי אִיכָּא טוּמְאָה, הָכָא מִי יֵימַר דְּאִיטַּמַּי.
human_translation: How can be compared? There, there is certainly ritual impurity Here, who says was violated?
llm_translation: So now?! There, certainly there is impurity, here who will say that it is impure.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי, אָמְרָה: לֹא נֶחְבֵּאתִי וְלֹא נִטְמֵאתִי, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן:
human_translation: Rav Ashi raises a dilemma: Neither did I hide nor was I violated, what is Do we say
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rav Ashi, amra: Lo nechbe'ati ve'lo nitme'ati, mah? Mi amrinan:

hebrew_text: מָה לִי לְשַׁקֵּר. אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא אָמְרִינַן?
human_translation: Why would I lie Or perhaps we do not say
llm_translation: What to me to lie. Or perhaps we do not say?

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָהוּא מַעֲשֶׂה, דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאֹגַר לֵיהּ חֲמָרָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא תֵּיזִיל בְּאוֹרְחָא דִּנְהַר פְּקוֹד דְּאִיכָּא מַיָּא, זִיל בְּאוֹרְחָא דְּנַרֶשׁ דְּלֵיכָּא מַיָּא, וַאֲזַל אִיהוּ בְּאוֹרְחָא דִּנְהַר פְּקוֹד וּמִית חֲמָרָא.
human_translation: And what is different from that incident where a certain man who rented a donkey to his colleague said to Do not go on the path of the Pekod River, where there is water, Go on the path of Neresh, where there is no water. And he went on the path the Pekod River and the donkey died.
llm_translation: And what is the difference from that incident, where that man was carrying wine to his friends, he said to him: Do not go on the path of the river Pekod where there is water, go on the path of Nares where there is no water, and he went on the path of the river Pekod and the wine died.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, בְּאוֹרְחָא דִּנְהַר פְּקוֹד אֲזַלִי, מִיהוּ לָא הֲווֹ מַיָּא. אָמַר רַבָּא: ״מָה לִי לְשַׁקֵּר״. אִי בָּעֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּאוֹרְחָא דְנַרֶשׁ אֲזַלִי. וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: ״מָה לִי לְשַׁקֵּר״ בִּמְקוֹם עֵדִים לָא אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: came before Rava said to him: Yes, I went on the path the Pekod River; however, there was no water Rava said: Why would I lie. If he wanted said to him, I went on the path of Neresh. And Abaye said to We do not say Why would I lie, in a situation witnesses.
llm_translation: He came before Rava, he said to him: No, in the highway of the river he went, but there was no water. Rava said: "Why should I lie?" If he wants, he should say to him: In the highway of the lamp he went. And Abaye said to him: "Why should I lie?" We do not say in a place of witnesses.

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם וַדַּאי אִיכָּא עֵדִים דְּאִיכָּא מַיָּא. הָכָא, וַדַּאי אִיטַּמַּי? חֲשָׁשָׁא הוּא, וּבִמְקוֹם חֲשָׁשָׁא — אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: How can be compared? There, there are certainly witnesses that there is water Here, definitely defiled? It is a concern, and in a situation a concern we say
llm_translation: So now?! There, certainly there are witnesses that there is water. Here, so certainly when? It is a doubt, and in a place of doubt — we say.

hebrew_text: אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים, אֲפִילּוּ עֶבֶד וַאֲפִילּוּ שִׁפְחָה נֶאֱמָנִין. וַאֲפִילּוּ שִׁפְחָה דִּידַהּ מְהֵימְנָא? וּרְמִינְהִי: לֹא תִּתְיַיחֵד עִמּוֹ אֶלָּא עַל פִּי עֵדִים.
human_translation: If have witnesses, even a slave and even a maidservant, they are deemed credible. And even her maidservant deemed credible? raises a contradiction may enter into seclusion with him only on the basis of witnesses,
llm_translation: If there are witnesses, even a slave and even a maidservant are believed. And even a maidservant, is she believed? And raise a contradiction: Do not conspire with him except in the presence of witnesses.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ עַל פִּי עֶבֶד וְעַל פִּי שִׁפְחָה. חוּץ מִשִּׁפְחָתָהּ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלִּבָּהּ גַּס בְּשִׁפְחָתָהּ! אָמַר רַב פַּפֵּי: בִּשְׁבוּיָה הֵקֵילּוּ.
human_translation: even on the basis of a slave and on the basis of a maidservant, except for her maidservant, due to that she is accustomed to her maidservant, Rav Pappi said: With regard to a captive woman, ruled leniently.
llm_translation: "And even according to the mouth of a slave and according to the mouth of a maidservant, except for her maidservant, because her heart is arrogant towards her maidservant!" Rav Pappi said: They were lenient in captivity."

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: הָא בְּשִׁפְחָה דִּידַהּ, הָא בְּשִׁפְחָה דִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: This is with regard to her maidservant, That is with regard to his maidservant
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: This is regarding one's own maidservant, this is regarding another's maidservant.

hebrew_text: וְשִׁפְחָה דִּידַהּ לָא מְהֵימְנָא? הָא קָתָנֵי: אֵין אָדָם מֵעִיד עַל עַצְמוֹ, הָא שִׁפְחָה דִּידַהּ מְהֵימְנָא! שִׁפְחָתָהּ נָמֵי כְּעַצְמָהּ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And is her maidservant not deemed credible? But isn’t it taught A person is not deemed credible by his own testimony? but her maidservant is deemed credible. her maidservant is like her own
llm_translation: And a maidservant of her own, we do not trust her? But it teaches: A person cannot testify about himself, yet a maidservant of her own we trust! Her maidservant is also considered like herself.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הָא וְהָא בְּשִׁפְחָה דִּידַהּ, וְשִׁפְחָה מִיחְזָא חָזְיָא וְשָׁתְקָה. הָתָם דִּשְׁתִיקָתָהּ מַתִּירָתָהּ — לָא מְהֵימְנָא. הָכָא דִּשְׁתִיקָתָהּ אוֹסַרְתָּהּ — מְהֵימְנָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Both are with regard to her maidservant, A maidservant sees and is silent, there, where silence renders permitted, she is not deemed credible here, where silence would render forbidden, she is deemed credible.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: This and this regarding one's maidservant, and when a maidservant is seen, she should be silent. There, when she is silent, she permits herself - we do not trust her. Here, when she is silent, she forbids herself - we trust her.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי אָתְיָא וּמְשַׁקְּרָא! תַּרְתֵּי לָא עָבְדָה.
human_translation: Here too she will come and lie not perform two
llm_translation: At that time, Naḥum of Gimzo came and lied! Two things he did not do.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּמָרִי בַּר אִיסַק, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ חָנָא בַּר אִיסַק, אֲתָא לֵיהּ אַחָא מִבֵּי חוֹזָאָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּלוֹג לִי בְּנִכְסֵי דְּאַבָּא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא יָדַעְנָא לָךְ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר לָךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּכֵּר יוֹסֵף אֶת אֶחָיו וְהֵם לֹא הִכִּירֻהוּ״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיָּצָא בְּלֹא חֲתִימַת זָקָן וּבָא בַּחֲתִימַת זָקָן.
human_translation: as that of Mari bar Isak, and some say Ḥana bar Isak, brother came to him from Bei Ḥoza’a, said to him: Apportion me in my father’s property. said to him: I do not know you. came before Rav Ḥisda said to him: is speaking well as it is written: “And Joseph recognized his brothers but they recognized him not” teaches that left without the trace of a beard and came with the trace of a beard.
llm_translation: The one that said, "Mar bar Isak," and they said to him, "Hana bar Isak," Aha came from the house of Hozai to him. He said to him, "Split for me in the properties of Abba!" He said to him, "I do not know for you." He came before Rav Hisda. He said to him, "You are saying well, as it is written: 'And Joseph recognized his brothers, but they did not recognize him,' teaching that he went out without a beard and came in with a beard."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל אַיְיתִי סָהֲדֵי דַּאֲחוּהּ אַתְּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִית לִי סָהֲדֵי, וּמִסְתְּפוּ מִינֵּיהּ, דְּגַבְרָא אַלָּמָא הוּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ: זִיל אַיְיתִינְהוּ אַתְּ דְּלָאו אֲחוּךְ הוּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּינָא הָכִי? הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי דָּאֵינְנָא לָךְ וּלְכוּלְּהוּ אַלָּמֵי חַבְרָךְ. הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי אָתוּ וּמְשַׁקְּרִי! תַּרְתֵּי לָא עָבְדִי.
human_translation: said to him: Go bring witnesses that you are his brother. He said to I have witnesses, but they are afraid of who is a violent man, said to Go bring witnesses that he is not your brother. said to him: Is that the halakha ? The burden of proof upon the claimant? said to him: This is how I render judgment for you and for all your fellow violent Now too, will come and lie not performing two
llm_translation: He said to him: Go, bring the witnesses of your brother. He said to him: I have witnesses, but they have withdrawn from me, for he is a powerful man. He said to his friend: Go, bring them, for he is not your brother. He said to him: Is this the law? The one who brings out against his fellow, the burden of proof is upon him! He said to him: This is not for you and all your companions, O deceitful friend. Now two have come and lied! Two do not suffice.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: זוֹ עֵדוּת — אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה, תִּינוֹק וְתִינוֹקֶת, אָבִיהָ וְאִמָּהּ, וְאָחִיהָ וַאֲחוֹתָהּ. אֲבָל לֹא בְּנָהּ וּבִתָּהּ, לֹא עַבְדָּהּ וְשִׁפְחָתָהּ. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: הַכֹּל נֶאֱמָנִין לְהָעִיד, חוּץ מֵהֵימֶנָּה וּבַעְלָהּ.
human_translation: Let us say subject to tanna’im . This testimony a man and a woman, a male child or a female child, father, and her mother, and her brother, and her sister but not her son and her daughter, not her slave or maidservant. And it is taught another All are deemed credible to testify except for her and her husband.
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaim: This is testimony — a man and a woman, a boy and a girl, her father and her mother, and her brothers and her sisters. But not her son and her daughter, not her male slave and her female slave. And it was taught in another Baraita: All are fit to testify, except for her relative and her husband.

hebrew_text: דְּרַב פַּפֵּי וּדְרַב אָשֵׁי תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּרַב פָּפָּא [מִי] לֵימָא תַּנָּאֵי הִיא.
human_translation: of Rav Pappi and of Rav Ashi subject to tanna’im , of Rav Pappa, do we say it is tanna’im ?
llm_translation: Rav Pappai and Rav Ashe taught: It was taught. Rav Papa who should we say taught? It was taught.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב פָּפָּא: כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא, בִּמְסִיחָה לְפִי תּוּמָּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to you: When that is taught, in she is making an unconsidered, incidental remark
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to you: When it is taught that, in a case of "misicha" according to its proper measure.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: רַב חָנָן קַרְטִיגְנָאָה מִשְׁתַּעֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה בָּא לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי מִישְׁתַּעֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה בָּא לִפְנֵי רַבִּי בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה מֵסִיחַ לְפִי תּוּמּוֹ, וְאָמַר: אֲנִי וְאִמִּי נִשְׁבִּינוּ לְבֵין הַגּוֹיִם. יָצָאתִי לִשְׁאוֹב מַיִם — דַּעְתִּי עַל אִמִּי, לְלַקֵּט עֵצִים — דַּעְתִּי עַל אִמִּי. וְהִשִּׂיאָהּ רַבִּי לִכְהוּנָּה עַל פִּיו.
human_translation: As that when Rav Dimi came he said Rav Ḥanan of Carthage relates: An incident came before Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi and some say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi relates: An incident came before Rabbi with regard to a person who was making an unconsidered, incidental remark, and said: My mother and I were taken captive among the gentiles. I went out to draw water, my thoughts were about my mother; to gather wood, my thoughts were about my mother. And Rabbi deemed her marry into the priesthood on the basis
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: Rav Hanan the Cartwright related: There was an incident involving Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, and some say it was Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi himself who related it: There was an incident involving Rabbi with a certain man who was talking to himself, saying, "My mother and I have been taken captive among the nations. When I go out to draw water, I have my mother in mind; when I gather wood, I have my mother in mind." And Rabbi appointed him as a Kohen based on his statement.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר רַבִּי זְכַרְיָה בֶּן הַקַּצָּב: הַמָּעוֹן הַזֶּה! לֹא זָזָה יָדָהּ מִתּוֹךְ יָדִי מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ גּוֹיִם לִירוּשָׁלַיִם וְעַד שֶׁיָּצְאוּ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין אָדָם מֵעִיד עַל עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zekharya ben HaKatzav said: this abode hand did not move from my hand from the time that the gentiles entered Jerusalem until they left, said to him: A person cannot testify about himself.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Zechariah ben HaKatzav said: "This residence! Her hand did not move from my hand from the time the Gentiles entered Jerusalem until they left." They said to him: "A person cannot testify on his own behalf."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: וְאַף עַל פִּי כֵן, יִיחֵד לָהּ בַּיִת בַּחֲצֵרוֹ, וּכְשֶׁהִיא יוֹצְאָה — יוֹצְאָה בְּרֹאשׁ בָּנֶיהָ, וּכְשֶׁהִיא נִכְנֶסֶת — נִכְנֶסֶת בְּסוֹף בָּנֶיהָ.
human_translation: taught And even so, He designated a house in his courtyard for her, and when she go out she go out before her sons and when she enter she enter after her sons,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tanah: V'af al pi ken, yiched lah bayit bachatzero, u'kesh'hiya yotz'ah — yotz'ah b'rosh baneha, u'kesh'hiya nichneset — nichneset b'sof baneha." English translation: Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: And even so, he should unite a house for her in his courtyard, and when she goes out — she goes out first among her sons, and when she enters — she enters last among her sons.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי אַבָּיֵי: מַהוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת בִּגְרוּשָׁה כֵּן? הָתָם הוּא, דְּבִשְׁבוּיָה הֵקֵילּוּ, אֲבָל הָכָא — לָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא שְׁנָא?
human_translation: Abaye raises a dilemma: What is to do likewise with a divorcée? Is it there, because with regard to a captive woman ruled leniently, however here, no, Or perhaps, is no different.
llm_translation: Ba'ei Abaye: What to do with a divorcee thus? There, it is because they were lenient in a captive woman, but here - no, or perhaps it is not different?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: הַמְגָרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ — לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא בִּשְׁכוּנָתוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear as it is taught one who divorces his wife, she may not marry in his vicinity,
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: One who divorces his wife - he shall not marry in his neighborhood.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הָיָה כֹּהֵן — לֹא תָּדוּר עִמּוֹ בְּמָבוֹי. אִם הָיָה כְּפָר קָטָן — זֶה הָיָה מַעֲשֶׂה וְאָמְרוּ: כְּפָר קָטָן נִידּוֹן כִּשְׁכוּנָה.
human_translation: And if he was a priest she may not live with him in alleyway if it was a small village? this was an incident and said: A small village is judged as proximity.
llm_translation: If he was a Kohen - do not reside with him in a shared courtyard. If he was a small village - this was a case and they said: a small village is judged by its location.

hebrew_text: מִי נִדְחֶה מִפְּנֵי מִי? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: הִיא נִדְחֵית מִפָּנָיו, וְאֵין הוּא נִדְחֶה מִפָּנֶיהָ. וְאִם הָיְתָה חָצֵר שֶׁלָּהּ — הוּא נִדְחֶה מִפָּנֶיהָ.
human_translation: who is ousted in favor of whom? Come hear as it is taught She is ousted in favor of him, and he is not ousted in favor of her. But if it was her courtyard, he is ousted in favor of her.
llm_translation: Who is rejected because of whom? Come and hear, as it was taught: She is rejected because of him, but he is not rejected because of her. And if it was her courtyard - he is rejected because of her.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הָיְתָה חָצֵר שֶׁל שְׁנֵיהֶם, מַהוּ? תָּא שְׁמַע: הִיא נִדְחֵית מִפָּנָיו. בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּחָצֵר שֶׁלּוֹ, פְּשִׁיטָא! וְאֶלָּא בְּחָצֵר שֶׁלָּהּ, וְהָתַנְיָא: אִם הָיְתָה חָצֵר שֶׁלָּהּ — הוּא נִדְחֶה מִפָּנֶיהָ. אֶלָּא לָאו כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא, דִּלְמָא דַּאֲגִיר מֵיגָר.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised it was a courtyard to both of them, what is Come hear as it is taught She is ousted in favor of him. With what are we dealing? If we say with regard to his courtyard, obvious But rather, with regard to her courtyard? Isn’t it taught If it was her courtyard, he is ousted in favor of her? Rather, is it not a case like this, Perhaps where he rented
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: If there was a courtyard belonging to both of them, what is the law? Come and hear: It is pushed away from him. With what are we dealing? If you say we are dealing with his courtyard, it is obvious! Rather, we are dealing with her courtyard, and it was taught: If it was her courtyard - it is pushed away from her. But is it not because of this concern, that perhaps he will bring from his?

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? תָּא שְׁמַע: ״הִנֵּה ה׳ מְטַלְטֶלְךָ טַלְטֵלָה גָּבֶר״, וְאָמַר רַב: טִלְטוּלָא דְגַבְרָא קָשֵׁי מִדְּאִיתְּתָא.
human_translation: What was about Come hear “The Lord will dislocate you the dislocation of a man” and Rav said: the dislocation of a man is more difficult than a woman
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "עֲלַהּ"? Come and hear: "Behold, the Lord will carry you away as a man swings a sling." And Rav said: The swinging of a man is more difficult than that of a woman.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לָוָה הֵימֶנָּה בְּנִכְסֵי אָבִיהָ — אֵינָהּ נִפְרַעַת אֶלָּא עַל יְדֵי אַחֵר. אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: וְאִי אָתוּ לְקַמַּן לְדִינָא, לָא מִזְדַּקְקִינַן לְהוּ. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: שַׁמּוֹתֵי מְשַׁמְּתִינַן לְהוּ. רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר: נַגּוֹדֵי נָמֵי מְנַגְּדִינַן לְהוּ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: תָּנָא בְּאֵבֶל רַבָּתִי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁנִּתְגָּרְשָׁה מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין, אֲבָל כְּשֶׁנִּתְגָּרְשָׁה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין, נִפְרַעַת עַל יְדֵי עַצְמָהּ — שֶׁאֵין לִבּוֹ גַּס בָּהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: borrowed from from property her father she is repaid only by means of another Rav Sheshet said: And if came before us for judgment, we do not attend to them Rav Pappa said: We excommunicate them Rav Huna, the son of Rav Yehoshua, said: We also flog them Rav Naḥman said: taught in Evel Rabbati , In what is this statement said? where she was divorced from marriage. However, when she was divorced from betrothal, she is repaid by means of herself, because, he is not accustomed to her.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If she borrowed with her father's property, she is not repaid except by another. Rav Sheshet said: And if they come to judgment later, we do not take action against them. Rav Papa said: We impose my names upon them. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: We confront them face to face. Rav Nachman said: It was taught in a large assembly: In what case are these words said? When she was divorced from betrothal, but when she was divorced from marriage, she is repaid by herself - because her heart is not arrogant.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא אָרוּס וַאֲרוּסָתוֹ דַּאֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. יְתֵיב רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָא קַמֵּיהּ. אוֹקִי רָבָא שְׁלוּחָא בֵּינְתַיְיהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָא, וְהָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: תָּנָא בְּאֵבֶל רַבָּתִי כּוּ׳. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קָא חָזֵינָא דְּ(קָא) גָּיְיסִי בַּהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: this betrothed man and his betrothed who came before Rava Rav Adda bar Mattana was sitting before him Rava placed an intermediary between them. Rav Adda bar Mattana said to But didn’t Rav Naḥman say: taught in Evel Rabbati said to him: we see that they are accustomed to each other,
llm_translation: That engaged man and his fiancée who came before Rava. Rav Adda bar Matna sat before him. Rava placed a partition between them. Rav Adda bar Matna said to him, "But didn't Rav Nachman say: A great scholar is like a mourner?" He said to him, "I see that you are engaging in frivolity."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: לָא אוֹקִי רָבָא שָׁלִיחַ בֵּינְתַיְיהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָא: נֹיקֵום מָר שְׁלוּחָא בֵּינְתַיְיהוּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְהָא [אָמַר] רַב נַחְמָן תָּנָא בְּאֵבֶל רַבָּתִי כּוּ׳. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנֵי מִילֵּי, הֵיכָא דְּלָא גָּיְיסִי בַּהֲדָדֵי, אֲבָל הָנֵי — קָא חָזֵינָא לְהוּ דְּגָיְיסִי בַּהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: Some say Rava did not place an intermediary between them. Rav Adda bar Mattana said to Let the Master place an intermediary between them. said to But didn’t Rav Naḥman say: taught in Evel Rabbati said to This applies only where they are not accustomed to each other. However, these we see that they are accustomed to each other,
llm_translation: There are some who say: Rava did not agree that there should be a messenger between them. Rav Adda bar Matna said to him: "The Master should send a messenger between them." He said to him: "But didn't Rav Nachman teach in the mourning of a great man?" He said to him: "Those words apply where they did not come together in Hadadei, but these words - we see that they did come together in Hadadei."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנִין לְהָעִיד בְּגוֹדְלָן מַה שֶּׁרָאוּ בְּקוֹטְנָן. נֶאֱמָן אָדָם לוֹמַר: ״זֶה כְּתַב יָדוֹ שֶׁל אַבָּא״, וְ״זֶה כְּתַב יָדוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי״, וְ״זֶה כְּתַב יָדוֹ שֶׁל אָחִי״.
human_translation: And these are deemed credible to testify in their majority what they saw in their minority. A person is deemed credible to say: This is my father’s handwriting, and This is my teacher’s handwriting; and This is my brother’s handwriting,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are the trustworthy individuals to testify regarding their greatness, whatever they saw in their smallness. A person is trustworthy to say: "This is the handwriting of my father," and "This is the handwriting of my teacher," and "This is the handwriting of my brother."

hebrew_text: ״זָכוּר הָיִיתִי בִּפְלוֹנִית שֶׁיָּצְאָה בְּהִינוּמָא וְרֹאשָׁהּ פָּרוּעַ״, וְ״שֶׁהָיָה אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי יוֹצֵא מִבֵּית הַסֵּפֶר לִטְבּוֹל, לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה״. וְ״שֶׁהָיָה חוֹלֵק עִמָּנוּ עַל הַגּוֹרֶן״. וְ״הַמָּקוֹם הַזֶּה בֵּית הַפְּרָס״. וְ״עַד כָּאן הָיִינוּ בָּאִין בַּשַּׁבָּת״.
human_translation: I was reminded of so-and-so, who went out with a hinnuma , or her hair uncovered and that so-and-so would leave school to immerse to partake of teruma , and that he would share with us at the threshing floor This place is a beit haperas , and Until here we would come on Shabbat
llm_translation: "I was remembered in a certain place that she went out in a state of unconsciousness and her head uncovered," and "that a certain man would go out from the house of study to immerse, to eat of the heave-offering." And "that he would argue with us on the threshing floor." And "this place is the house of Persia." And "up to here we would come on Shabbat."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אֵין אָדָם נֶאֱמָן לוֹמַר ״דֶּרֶךְ הָיָה לִפְלוֹנִי בַּמָּקוֹם הַזֶּה״, ״מַעֲמָד וּמִסְפֵּד הָיָה לִפְלוֹנִי בַּמָּקוֹם הַזֶּה״.
human_translation: However, a person is neither deemed credible to say: So-and-so had a path in this place; So-and-so had standing and a eulogy in that place,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: However, a person is not trustworthy to say, "So-and-so was on this spot," "So-and-so was eulogized and mourned on this spot." English translation:

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: וְהוּא שֶׁיֵּשׁ גָּדוֹל עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: And when there is adult with him.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Huna said in the name of Rav Yehoshua's son: "And he is greater than him."

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא. דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן אָבִיו — מִשּׁוּם דִּשְׁכִיחַ גַּבֵּיהּ, אֲבָל רַבּוֹ — לָא. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן רַבּוֹ, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִית לֵיהּ אֵימְתֵיהּ דְּרַבֵּיהּ, אֲבָל אָבִיו — לָא.
human_translation: And necessary, As, if taught us his father’s due to that he is found with his but his teacher’s no, And if taught us his teacher’s due to that he has awe of his teacher but his father’s no,
llm_translation: And it is necessary. For if we were to hear his father - because it is common for him, but his teacher - no. And if we were to hear his teacher, because he has fear of his teacher, but his father - no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי: אָבִיו — דִּשְׁכִיחַ גַּבֵּיהּ, וְרַבּוֹ — דְּאִית לֵיהּ אֵימְתֵיהּ, אֲבָל אָחִיו דְּלֵית לֵיהּ לָא הָא וְלָא הָא — אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: כֵּיוָן דְּקִיּוּם שְׁטָרוֹת מִדְּרַבָּנַן, הֵימְנוּהוּ רַבָּנַן בִּדְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And if taught us these two his father’s that he is found with him, and his teacher’s that he has awe of him. But his brother’s which has neither this nor that say no, teaches us: Since ratification of documents is by rabbinic the Sages deemed him credible by rabbinic
llm_translation: And if we were to hear those two: his father - for he is recognized by his back, and his teacher - for he has fear of him, but his brother, for whom he has neither this nor that - we would say no, for we learn: once the scribes' documents are established by rabbinic law, the rabbis have authority over them with rabbinic law.

hebrew_text: ״זָכוּר הָיִיתִי בִּפְלוֹנִית שֶׁיָּצְאָה בְּהִינוּמָא וְרֹאשָׁהּ פָּרוּעַ״. מַאי טַעְמָא — כֵּיוָן דְּרוֹב נָשִׁים בְּתוּלוֹת נִישָּׂאוֹת, גִּלּוּי מִלְּתָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: And I was reminded of so-and-so, who went out with a hinnuma , or her hair uncovered. What is the reason Since most women are married as virgins, is merely revealing of a matter
llm_translation: "I was remembered in a certain place that she went out in a state of stupor and her head uncovered." What is the reason? - Since most women in that place are unmarried, it is a common thing in the world.

hebrew_text: וְ״שֶׁהָיָה אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי יוֹצֵא מִבֵּית הַסֵּפֶר לִטְבּוֹל, לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה״. וְדִלְמָא עֶבֶד כֹּהֵן הוּא? מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: אָסוּר לְאָדָם שֶׁיְּלַמֵּד אֶת עַבְדּוֹ תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: And that so-and-so would leave school to immerse to partake of teruma , And perhaps he is the slave of a priest, support for Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: It is prohibited for a person to teach his slave Torah.
llm_translation: "And 'if a certain man goes out from the house of study to immerse, to eat of the terumah.' And perhaps he is a kohen's slave? He assists Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. For Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: 'It is forbidden for a man to teach his slave Torah.'"

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: לָוָה הֵימֶנּוּ רַבּוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁעֲשָׂאוֹ רַבּוֹ
human_translation: And not But isn’t it taught whose master borrowed from him, or whose master made him
llm_translation: And no? And it was taught: If his master lent him to him, or if his master made him.

hebrew_text: אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס, אוֹ שֶׁהִנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין בִּפְנֵי רַבּוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁקָּרָא שְׁלֹשָׁה פְּסוּקִים בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יָצָא לְחֵירוּת. הָתָם דְּאִיקְּרִי עֶבֶד מִדַּעְתּוֹ. כִּי קָאָמְרִינַן — דְּקָא נָהֵיג בֵּיהּ מִנְהַג בָּנִים.
human_translation: steward or donned phylacteries in his master’s presence, or read three verses in the synagogue, did not emerge to freedom. there where the slave read at his own initiative, When we say where he treats him treatment children,
llm_translation: Apotropos, or if he placed tefillin before his master, or if he read three verses in the synagogue - he has not fulfilled his obligation for freedom. There, because he is called a slave willingly. As we say - he is following the custom of children.

hebrew_text: לִטְבּוֹל לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה. בִּתְרוּמָה דְּרַבָּנַן. וְשֶׁהָיָה חוֹלֵק עִמָּנוּ עַל הַגּוֹרֶן. וְדִלְמָא עֶבֶד כֹּהֵן הוּא? תְּנַן כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין חוֹלְקִין תְּרוּמָה לְעֶבֶד אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן רַבּוֹ עִמּוֹ. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין חוֹלְקִין תְּרוּמָה לְעֶבֶד אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן רַבּוֹ עִמּוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל הוּא שֶׁיֹּאמַר: אִם כֹּהֵן אֲנִי — תְּנוּ לִי בִּשְׁבִיל עַצְמִי, וְאִם עֶבֶד כֹּהֵן אֲנִי — תְּנוּ לִי בִּשְׁבִיל רַבִּי.
human_translation: to immerse to partake of teruma , of teruma by rabbinic And that would share with us at the threshing floor, And perhaps he is the slave of a priest? We learned according to the one who says: One distributes teruma to a slave only if his master is with him. as it is taught One distributes teruma to a slave only if his master is with him; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: possible that each will say: If I am a priest, give me for my own sake, and if I am the slave of a priest, give me for the sake of my master.
llm_translation: To immerse to eat in terumah. In the terumah of the Rabbis. And he used to divide with us on the threshing floor. And perhaps he is a Kohen's slave? We learned: Just as it was said that one does not divide terumah for a slave unless his master is with him. As it was taught: One does not divide terumah for a slave unless his master is with him, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: It is possible for him to say: "If I am a Kohen, give it to me for myself, and if I am a Kohen's slave, give it to me for my master."

hebrew_text: בִּמְקוֹמוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָיוּ מַעֲלִין מִתְּרוּמָה לְיוּחֲסִין. בִּמְקוֹמוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לֹא הָיוּ מַעֲלִין מִתְּרוּמָה לְיוּחֲסִין.
human_translation: in the place of Rabbi Yehuda, they would elevate teruma to for lineage. In the place of Rabbi Yosei, they would not elevate from teruma to lineage.
llm_translation: In the place of Rabbi Yehuda, they would bring up Terumah for genealogical purposes. In the place of Rabbi Yosei, they would not bring up Terumah for genealogical purposes.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מִיָּמַי לֹא הֵעַדְתִּי. פַּעַם אַחַת הֵעַדְתִּי וְהֶעֱלוּ עֶבֶד לַכְּהוּנָּה עַל פִּי. הֶעֱלוּ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה בְּהֶמְתָּן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מֵבִיא תַּקָּלָה עַל יָדָם, צַדִּיקִים עַצְמָם לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: In all my days, I never to testify One time I testified, and elevated a slave to priesthood on the basis of my Does it enter your mind that they elevated Now, just as the animals of the righteous the Holy One, Blessed be He, does not engender a pitfall on their account, all the more so the righteous themselves.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: "Throughout my days, I have not testified. Once I testified, and they brought a slave to the priesthood based on my testimony. Did you bring up your own opinion?! Now, when it comes to the livestock of the righteous, the Holy One, blessed be He, does not bring a calamity upon them, let alone the righteous themselves!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: בִּקְּשׁוּ לְהַעֲלוֹת עֶבֶד לַכְּהוּנָּה עַל פִּי. חֲזָא בְּאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וַאֲזַל וְאַסְהֵיד בְּאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rather, They sought to elevate a slave to priesthood on the basis of my saw in the place of Rabbi Yosei, and he went and testified in the place of Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Rather: sought to bring up a slave to the priesthood according to the ruling of. He saw in the place of Rabbi Yosei, and went and testified in the place of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁהַמָּקוֹם הַזֶּה בֵּית הַפְּרָס הוּא. מַאי טַעְמָא? בֵּית הַפְּרָס דְּרַבָּנַן. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מְנַפֵּחַ אָדָם בֵּית הַפְּרָס וְהוֹלֵךְ. וְרַב יְהוּדָה בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: בֵּית הַפְּרָס שֶׁנִּידַּשׁ — טָהוֹר. מַאי טַעְמָא — אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְעֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה שֶׁלֹּא נִידַּשׁ בָּרֶגֶל.
human_translation: And that this place is a beit haperas . What is the reason beit haperas by rabbinic as Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: A person a beit haperas may blow and proceed. And Rav Yehuda bar Ami, in the name of Rav Yehuda, said: A beit haperas that has been trodden is pure. What is the reason? it is impossible for a bone of barley, not to have been trodden underfoot
llm_translation: This place is Beit HaPeras. What is the reason? Beit HaPeras of the Rabbis. For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A person can blow into Beit HaPeras and walk. And Rav Yehudah bar Ammi in the name of Rav Yehudah said: Beit HaPeras that was trampled upon - is pure. What is the reason? It is impossible for a bone as smooth as a barley grain not to be trampled upon by foot.

hebrew_text: וְעַד כָּאן הָיִינוּ בָּאִין בַּשַּׁבָּת. קָסָבַר: תְּחוּמִין דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And Until here we would come on Shabbat. maintains boundaries, by rabbinic
llm_translation: Until here we have been discussing the laws of carrying on Shabbat. He holds: The Rabbinic boundaries.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין נֶאֱמָן לוֹמַר ״דֶּרֶךְ הָיָה לִפְלוֹנִי בַּמָּקוֹם הַזֶּה״, ״מַעֲמָד וּמִסְפֵּד הָיָה לִפְלוֹנִי בַּמָּקוֹם הַזֶּה״. מַאי טַעְמָא — אַפּוֹקֵי מָמוֹנָא לָא מַפְּקִינַן.
human_translation: And one is neither deemed credible to say: So-and-so had a path in this place; So-and-so had standing and a eulogy in that place. What is the reason we do not remove money
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And one is not believed to say, "So-and-so was on this spot," "So-and-so was standing and eulogizing on this spot." What is the reason? Because we do not extract money based on such claims. English translation:

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נֶאֱמָן הַתִּינוֹק לוֹמַר, כָּךְ אָמַר לִי אַבָּא: ״מִשְׁפָּחָה זוֹ טְהוֹרָה״, ״מִשְׁפָּחָה זוֹ טְמֵאָה״. טְהוֹרָה וּטְמֵאָה סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא ״מִשְׁפָּחָה זוֹ כְּשֵׁרָה״, וּ״מִשְׁפָּחָה זוֹ פְּסוּלָה״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: A child is deemed credible to say this is what my father told me This family is pure, that family is impure. Does it enter your mind pure and impure? Rather, This family is unflawed and this family is flawed
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A child is trustworthy to say, "So my father told me: 'This family is pure,' 'This family is impure.'" Pure and impure according to your opinion?! Rather, "This family is valid," and "This family is invalid."

hebrew_text: וְ״שֶׁאָכַלְנוּ בִּקְצָצָה שֶׁל בַּת פְּלוֹנִי לִפְלוֹנִי״, וְ״שֶׁהָיִינוּ מוֹלִיכִים חַלָּה וּמַתָּנוֹת לִפְלוֹנִי כֹּהֵן״. עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ, אֲבָל לֹא עַל יְדֵי אַחֵר. וְכוּלָּן, אִם הָיָה גּוֹי וְנִתְגַּיֵּיר, עֶבֶד וְנִשְׁתַּחְרֵר — אֵין נֶאֱמָנִים. וְאֵין נֶאֱמָן לוֹמַר ״דֶּרֶךְ הָיָה לִפְלוֹנִי בַּמָּקוֹם הַזֶּה״, ״מַעֲמָד וּמִסְפֵּד הָיָה לִפְלוֹנִי בַּמָּקוֹם הַזֶּה״. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמָנִים.
human_translation: And that we ate at the ketzatza of the daughter of so-and-so to so-and-so and that we would bring ḥalla and gifts to so-and-so, priest. by himself, but not by means of another, And all these if he was a gentile and he converted, a slave and he was liberated, they are not deemed credible And one is neither deemed credible to say so-and-so had a path in this place; so-and-so had standing and a eulogy in that place. Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says: deemed credible.
llm_translation: "And 'that we ate at the edge of the daughter of so-and-so to so-and-so,' and 'that we used to bring bread and gifts to so-and-so the priest.' On his own, but not through another. And all of them, if he was a gentile and converted, a slave and freed — they are not trusted. And one is not trusted to say, 'It was the way of so-and-so in this place,' 'There was standing and mourning for so-and-so in this place.' Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka says: They are trusted."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַסֵּיפָא: אַפּוֹקֵי מָמוֹנָא הוּא! אֶלָּא אַרֵישָׁא. וְכוּלָּם, אִם הָיָה גּוֹי וְנִתְגַּיֵּיר, עֶבֶד וְנִשְׁתַּחְרֵר — אֵין נֶאֱמָנִין. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמָנִין.
human_translation: to which Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka If we say last clause it is removing money Rather, former clause And all these if he was a gentile and he converted, a slave and he was liberated, they are not deemed credible. Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says: deemed credible.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka says: Is he a trustworthy person? If you wish, I can say the conclusion: He is trustworthy! Rather, the beginning. And all of them, if he was a gentile and converted, a slave and was freed — they are not trustworthy. Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka says: They are trustworthy.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּגוֹי הוּא, לָא הֲוָה דָּיֵיק. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּדַעְתֵּיהּ לְאִיגַּיּוֹרֵי, מֵידָק הֲוָה דָּיֵיק.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? the first tanna maintains: Since he was a gentile, he was not exacting And Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka maintains: Since it was his intention to convert, he was exacting
llm_translation: With what did he argue? It was taught: The first sage held: Since he is a non-Jew, it was not precise. And Rabbi Yochanan ben Baroka held: Since his intention was for conversion, it was immediately precise.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״קְצָצָה״? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד קְצָצָה? אֶחָד מִן הָאַחִין שֶׁנָּשָׂא אִשָּׁה שֶׁאֵינָהּ הוֹגֶנֶת לוֹ — בָּאִין בְּנֵי מִשְׁפָּחָה וּמְבִיאִין חָבִית מְלֵיאָה פֵּירוֹת וְשׁוֹבְרִין אוֹתָהּ בְּאֶמְצַע רְחָבָה, וְאוֹמְרִים: אַחֵינוּ בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל שִׁמְעוּ! אָחִינוּ פְּלוֹנִי נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה שֶׁאֵינָהּ הוֹגֶנֶת לוֹ, וּמִתְיָירְאִים אָנוּ שֶׁמָּא יִתְעָרֵב זַרְעוֹ בְּזַרְעֵינוּ. בּוֹאוּ וּקְחוּ לָכֶם דּוּגְמָא לְדוֹרוֹת, שֶׁלֹּא יִתְעָרֵב זַרְעוֹ בְּזַרְעֵינוּ. וְזוֹ הִיא קְצָצָה שֶׁהַתִּינוֹק נֶאֱמָן לְהָעִיד עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: What is ketzatza ? as the Sages taught: How is ketzatza one of the brothers who married a woman who is unsuited for him, the family members come and bring a barrel full of fruits, and break it in the middle of square and they say: Our brothers, the house of Israel, listen. Our brother so-and-so married a woman who is unsuited for him, and we fear lest his descendants become intermingled with our descendants. Come and take for yourselves a sample for generations, so that his descendants will not intermingle with our descendants. And this is the ketzatza that a child is deemed credible to testify about it
llm_translation: What is "cutting off"? For the Rabbis taught: How is cutting off done? One of the brothers who carried a woman who is not fitting for him - the members of the family come in and bring a basket full of fruits and break it in the middle of the street, and they say: Hear, O Israel, our brothers, so-and-so, carried a woman who is not fitting for him, and we are afraid lest his seed mix with ours. Come and take an example for generations, so that his seed will not mix with ours. And this is cutting off, that the infant is trusted to testify about her.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁנִּתְאַרְמְלָה
llm_translation: The woman who was negligent is upon you.

hebrew_text: אֵלּוּ נְעָרוֹת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן קְנָס: הַבָּא עַל הַמַּמְזֶרֶת וְעַל הַנְּתִינָה וְעַל הַכּוּתִית, הַבָּא עַל הַגִּיּוֹרֶת וְעַל הַשְּׁבוּיָה וְעַל הַשִּׁפְחָה שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ וְשֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירוּ וְשֶׁנִּשְׁתַּחְרְרוּ, פְּחוּתוֹת מִבְּנוֹת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: These young women for whom there is a fine to their One who engages in intercourse with a mamzeret , or with a Gibeonite woman [ netina ], or with a Samaritan woman [ kutit ]. one who engages in intercourse with a female convert, or with a captive woman, or with a maidservant, that were ransomed, that converted, or that were liberated less than three years and one day old,
llm_translation: These are the maidens who have a penalty: one who has relations with a mamzeret, a natinah, or a kutit; one who has relations with a convert, a captive, or a freed maidservant; minors under the age of three years and one day.

hebrew_text: הַבָּא עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ, וְעַל אֲחוֹת אָבִיו, וְעַל אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ, וְעַל אֲחוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְעַל אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו, וְעַל אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אָבִיו, וְעַל הַנִּדָּה — יֵשׁ לָהֶם קְנָס, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהֵן בְּהִכָּרֵת — אֵין בָּהֶן מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: one who engages in intercourse with his sister, or with his father’s sister, or with his mother’s sister, or with his wife’s sister, or with his brother’s wife, or with his father’s brother’s wife or with a menstruating woman, there is a fine Although there is karet for there is no court capital punishment.
llm_translation: One who engages in relations with his sister, his father's sister, his mother's sister, his wife's sister, his brother's wife, his father's brother's wife, or with a menstruating woman - they are subject to a penalty, even though they are liable to karet, they are not subject to the death penalty by the court.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָנֵי נְעָרוֹת, פְּסוּלוֹת אִית לְהוּ קְנָס, כְּשֵׁירוֹת לָא?! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵלּוּ נְעָרוֹת פְּסוּלוֹת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם קְנָס — הַבָּא עַל הַמַּמְזֶרֶת וְעַל הַנְּתִינָה וְעַל הַכּוּתִית.
human_translation: these young women flawed for whom there is a fine unflawed no, this is saying: These are young women flawed for whom there is a fine One who has relations with a mamzeret , or with a Gibeonite woman, or with a Samaritan woman.
llm_translation: The text says: "Are these maidens disqualified, yet they have a penalty, but if they are fit, they do not have a penalty? This is what he is saying: These are disqualified maidens who have a penalty - one who engages in relations with a mamzeret, a natinah, or a kutit."

hebrew_text: נַעֲרָה אִין, קְטַנָּה לָא. מַאן תַּנָּא?
human_translation: a young woman, yes, a minor, no, Who is tanna
llm_translation: Maiden no, minor yes. Who is the Tanna?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: קְטַנָּה מִבַּת יוֹם אֶחָד וְעַד שֶׁתָּבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת — יֵשׁ לָהּ מֶכֶר וְאֵין לָהּ קְנָס. וּמִשֶּׁתָּבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת וְעַד שֶׁתִּיבְגַּר — יֵשׁ לָהּ קְנָס וְאֵין לָהּ מֶכֶר. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ מֶכֶר — אֵין קְנָס, וְכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ קְנָס — אֵין מֶכֶר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: is Rabbi Meir, as it is taught With regard to a minor from one day old until she grows two hairs, there is sale for her, but there is no fine for her And once she grows two hairs, until she matures there is a fine for her, but there is no sale for her. the statement of Rabbi Meir, as Rabbi Meir would state Any place where there is a sale, there is no fine; and any place where there is a fine, there is no sale.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: It is the opinion of Rabbi Meir. As it was taught: A minor from the age of one day until she grows two pubic hairs - she has a monetary value but there is no penalty. And once she grows two pubic hairs until she reaches maturity - she has a penalty but there is no monetary value. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. For Rabbi Meir used to say: In any case where there is a monetary value, there is no penalty, and in any case where there is a penalty, there is no monetary value.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: קְטַנָּה מִבַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד וְעַד שֶׁתִּיבְגַּר — יֵשׁ לָהּ קְנָס. קְנָס אִין, מֶכֶר לָא?! אֵימָא:
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: With regard to a minor from three years and one day old until she matures there is a fine for her. fine, yes, sale, no, Say:
llm_translation: The sages say: A minor girl from the age of three years and one day until she reaches maturity - she has a penalty. A penalty? No sale then?! I say:

hebrew_text: אַף קְנָס בִּמְקוֹם מֶכֶר.
human_translation: fine even in a place sale.
llm_translation: Even Kinas in place of Mechir.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי בְּנֵי קְנָסָא נִינְהוּ? וְאַמַּאי? אִיקְּרִי כָּאן: ״וְלוֹ תִּהְיֶה לְאִשָּׁה״, אִשָּׁה הָרְאוּיָה לוֹ! אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: ״נַעֲרָה״, ״נַעֲרָה״, ״הַנַּעֲרָה״. חַד לְגוּפֵיהּ, וְחַד לְאֵתוֹיֵי חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, וְחַד לְאֵתוֹיֵי חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת.
human_translation: And are these entitled fine? But why? I read here “And to him she shall be as a wife” a wife who is suitable for him Reish Lakish said Young woman, young woman, the young woman, One to itself, and one to include liable for prohibitions; and one to include liable to karet .
llm_translation: These are the sons of K'nasah? And why? It is called here: "And if she shall be for a wife," a woman suitable for him! Reish Lakish said: "A maiden," "a maiden," "the maiden." One for itself, and one for the implications of prohibitions, and one for the implications of excisions.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: ״בְּתוּלָה״, ״בְּתוּלוֹת״, ״הַבְּתוּלוֹת״. חַד לְגוּפֵיהּ, וְחַד לְאֵתוֹיֵי חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, וְחַד לְאֵתוֹיֵי חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Virgin, virgins, the virgins. One to itself; and one to include liable for prohibitions; and one to include liable to karet .
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "Virgin," "Virgins," "the virgins." One for itself, and one for the liabilities of negative commandments, and one for the liabilities of karet.

hebrew_text: וְרַב פָּפָּא מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ? הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְאַבָּיֵי. דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בָּא עָלֶיהָ וּמֵתָה — פָּטוּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנָתַן לַאֲבִי הַנַּעֲרָה״. לַאֲבִי נַעֲרָה, וְלֹא לַאֲבִי מֵתָה.
human_translation: And Rav Pappa, what is the reason he did not cite as Reish Lakish That required by him to in accordance with that Abaye as Abaye said: engaged in intercourse with and she died exempt as it is stated: “And he shall give to the father of the young woman” To the father of the young woman and not to the father of a dead
llm_translation: Rav Papa: What is the reason that he did not say like Reish Lakish? That one asked him according to the words of Abbaye. For Abbaye said: If he had relations with her and she died - he is exempt, as it is stated: "And he shall give it to the father of the young woman." To the father of the young woman, and not to the father of the deceased.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַב פָּפָּא? הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה. דְּתַנְיָא: ״כֶּסֶף יִשְׁקוֹל כְּמוֹהַר הַבְּתוּלוֹת״, שֶׁיְּהֵא זֶה כְּמוֹהַר הַבְּתוּלוֹת, וּמוֹהַר הַבְּתוּלוֹת כָּזֶה. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ נָמֵי, מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְאַבָּיֵי. וְרַב פָּפָּא נָמֵי, מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה!
human_translation: And Reish Lakish, what is the reason he did not cite as Rav Pappa That required by him to a verbal analogy, as it is taught “He shall weigh [ yishkol ] money like the dowry of the virgins” that this should be like the dowry of the virgins and the dowry of the virgins must be like this And Reish Lakish too, required by him to in accordance with that Abaye And Rav Pappa, required by him to a verbal analogy?
llm_translation: Reish Lakish, what is the reason that he did not say like Rav Papa? That one requires it for a similar decree. As it was taught: "Silver shall be weighed like the weight of virgins," that this should be like the weight of virgins, and the weight of virgins like this. And Reish Lakish also requires it for a different matter. And Rav Papa also requires it for a similar decree!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: שִׁיתָּא קְרָאֵי כְּתִיבִי? ״נַעֲרָה״ ״נַעֲרָה״ ״הַנַּעֲרָה״. ״בְּתוּלָה״ ״בְּתוּלוֹת״ ״הַבְּתוּלוֹת״, תְּרֵי לְגוּפַיְיהוּ, חַד לְכִדְאַבָּיֵי, וְחַד לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה. אִיַּיתַּרוּ לֵיהּ תְּרֵי. חַד — לְאֵתוֹיֵי חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, וְחַד — לְאֵתוֹיֵי חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, six verses written, Young woman, young woman, the young woman; virgin, virgins, the virgins. Two to themselves, one to in accordance with that Abaye and one to a verbal analogy Two remain for him; one to include liable for prohibitions, and one to include liable to karet .
llm_translation: Rather: two verses are written? "Na'arah" "Na'arah" "HaNa'arah." "Betulah" "Betulot" "HaBetulot," two for themselves, one for the words, and one for the similar decree. They are needed two. One - for obligating for prohibitions, and one - for obligating for excisions.

hebrew_text: וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי מֵהַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְלוֹ תִּהְיֶה לְאִשָּׁה״, שִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּימְנִי אוֹמֵר: אִשָּׁה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ הֲוָיָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא אוֹמֵר: אִשָּׁה הָרְאוּיָה לְקַיְּימָהּ.
human_translation: And to exclude of this tanna , as it is taught “And to him she shall be [ tihye ] as a wife” Shimon HaTimni says: a woman for whom there is betrothal [ havaya ]. Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: a woman who is suitable for sustain,
llm_translation: And to refute from this Mishnah, as it was taught: "And if she shall not be for a wife," Shimon the Timnite says: A woman who has the potential. Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: A woman suitable to fulfill it.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: מַמְזֶרֶת וּנְתִינָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יֵשׁ בָּהּ הֲוָיָה, הָא נָמֵי יֵשׁ בָּהּ הֲוָיָה. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר רְאוּיָה לְקַיְּימָהּ, הָא אֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לְקַיְּימָהּ.
human_translation: What is between Rabbi Zeira said: between their a mamzeret or a Gibeonite woman, According to the one who said there is betrothal, this there is also betrothal. according to the one who said suitable for sustain, this is not suitable for sustain,
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Rabbi Zeira said: There is a difference between a mamzeret and a netinah. According to the one who says it has potential, well, indeed it has potential. According to the one who says it is fit to fulfill its purpose, well, it is not fit to fulfill its purpose.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר: אֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ! אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, כְּרַבִּי סִימַאי, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי סִימַאי אוֹמֵר: מִן הַכֹּל עוֹשֶׂה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מַמְזֵרִין, חוּץ מֵאַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל. שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: ״לֹא יִקַּח ... וְלֹא יְחַלֵּל״ — חִילּוּלִין הוּא עוֹשֶׂה, וְאֵין עוֹשֶׂה מַמְזֵרִין.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Akiva, who said: Betrothal does not take effect for liable for prohibitions, what is between them? between their a widow by a High Priest, in accordance with Rabbi Simai, as it is taught Rabbi Simai says: Rabbi Akiva deems from all mamzerim , except for a from a widow to a High Priest, as the Torah said: he shall not take…and he shall not profane [ yeḥallel ] he creates ḥillulin , but he does not create mamzerim .
llm_translation: To Rabbi Akiva who said: Kiddushin do not take effect on those who are obligated in negative commandments, what is the difference between them? The difference between them is a widow to a High Priest, like Rabbi Simai, as it was taught: Rabbi Simai says: Rabbi Akiva does everything with mamzerim, except for a widow to a High Priest. For the Torah said: "He shall not take... and he shall not profane" - he causes profanations, but does not cause mamzerim.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יְשֵׁבָב, דְּאָמַר: בּוֹאוּ וְנִצְוַח עַל עֲקִיבָא בֶּן יוֹסֵף, שֶׁהָיָה אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בִּיאָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל — הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yeshevav, who said: Come, let us scream at Akiva ben Yosef, as he would say: anyone who does not have relations in the Jewish people, the offspring is a mamzer , what is between their There is between them
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yeshivav, as he said: "Come, let us examine Akiva ben Yosef, who used to say: 'Anyone who does not have lineage in Israel is a mamzer.' What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them."

hebrew_text: חַיָּיבֵי עֲשֵׂה, מִצְרִי וַאֲדוֹמִי.
human_translation: liable for positive an Egyptian and an Edomite
llm_translation: Obligated ones of positive commandments, Egyptian and Edomite.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי יְשֵׁבָב, אִי לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִטַּעְמָא דְּרַבִּי סִימַאי קָאָתֵי — שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא אִי טַעְמָא דְנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָאָמַר, כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בִּיאָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר — וַאֲפִילּוּ חַיָּיבֵי עֲשֵׂה! מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ?
human_translation: This well according to Rabbi Yeshevav if he is coming to reject the opinion of Rabbi Simai. well However, if he is stating his own opinion, anyone who does not have relations among the Jewish people, the child is a mamzer , and even liable for positive what is between
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He left it for Rabbi Yeshivav. If he intended to refute the reasoning of Rabbi Simai - it is good. But if he intended to say on his own account, anyone who does not have lineage in Israel, the offspring of a mamzer - even those obligated in positive commandments! What is the difference between them?"

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ בְּעוּלָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל. וּמַאי שְׁנָא? דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ עֲשֵׂה שֶׁאֵינוֹ שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל.
human_translation: There is between them a non-virgin by a High Priest. And what is different because it is a positive whose is not equal for all.
llm_translation: There is a difference between them regarding a firstborn animal to the High Priest. And what is the difference? That it has a positive commandment that is not equal to all.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּבָא עַל הַנִּדָּה שֶׁמְּשַׁלֵּם קְנָס. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יֵשׁ בָּהּ הֲוָיָה — הָא נָמֵי יֵשׁ בָּהּ הֲוָיָה. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר רְאוּיָה לְקַיְּימָהּ — הָא נָמֵי רְאוּיָה לְקַיְּימָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Everyone agrees with regard to one who engaged in intercourse with a menstruating woman that he pays fine. According to the one who says there is betrothal, this too there is betrothal. According to the one who says suitable for sustain, this is suitable for sustain.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Everyone agrees that when it comes to a case of a man who had relations with a menstruating woman, he must pay a penalty. According to the one who says she was already pregnant, well, indeed she was already pregnant. According to the one who says she was fit to conceive, well, indeed she was fit to conceive.

hebrew_text: וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא בֶּן הַקָּנָה. דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא בֶּן הַקָּנָה הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה אֶת יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים כַּשַּׁבָּת לְתַשְׁלוּמִין. מָה שַׁבָּת — מִתְחַיֵּיב בְּנַפְשׁוֹ וּפָטוּר מִן הַתַּשְׁלוּמִין, אַף יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — מִתְחַיֵּיב בְּנַפְשׁוֹ וּפָטוּר מִן הַתַּשְׁלוּמִין.
human_translation: And to exclude of Rabbi Neḥunya ben HaKana, as it is taught Rabbi Neḥunya ben HaKana would render Yom Kippur like Shabbat with regard to payment Just as Shabbat is liable to death and exempt from payment so too, Yom Kippur is liable to death and exempt from payment
llm_translation: To go out from Rabbi Neḥunyā ben HaQanah. For it was taught: Rabbi Neḥunyā ben HaQanah used to treat the Day of Atonement like the Sabbath in terms of compensation. Just as the Sabbath—one is liable with his life and exempt from compensation, so too the Day of Atonement—one is liable with his life and exempt from compensation.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא בֶּן הַקָּנָה? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נֶאֱמַר ״אָסוֹן״ בִּידֵי אָדָם. וְנֶאֱמַר ״אָסוֹן״ בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם. מָה ״אָסוֹן״ הָאָמוּר בִּידֵי אָדָם — פָּטוּר מִן הַתַּשְׁלוּמִין, אַף ״אָסוֹן״ הָאָמוּר בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם — פָּטוּר מִן הַתַּשְׁלוּמִין.
human_translation: What is the rationale of Rabbi Neḥunya ben HaKana? Abaye said: It states harm at the hands of man, it states harm at the hand of Heaven, Just as harm that is stated at the hands of man, exempt from the payment, so too, harm that is stated at the hand of Heaven, exempt from the payment.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Neḥunia the son of HaQana? Abaye said: It is stated "damage" in the hands of man. And it is stated "damage" in the hands of Heaven. Just as the "damage" that is mentioned in the hands of man - one is exempt from payment, so too the "damage" that is mentioned in the hands of Heaven - one is exempt from payment.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: מִמַּאי דְּכִי קָא מַזְהַר לְהוּ יַעֲקֹב לִבְנֵיהּ, עַל צִינִּים וּפַחִים דְּבִידֵי שָׁמַיִם נִינְהוּ? דִּלְמָא עַל אַרְיָא וְגַנָּבֵי דְּבִידֵי אָדָם נִינְהוּ?! אַטּוּ יַעֲקֹב אַהָא אַזְהַר, אַהָא לָא אַזְהַר? יַעֲקֹב עַל כֹּל מִילֵּי אַזְהַר.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava objects to this: From where that when Jacob is warning his sons about cold and heat [ tzinim paḥim ], which are at the hand of Heaven? Perhaps about a lion and thieves, which are at the hands of man, Is that to say Jacob warned about this about that he did not warn Jacob warned about all matters
llm_translation: Challenges to him Rav Adda bar Ahava: From what does Jacob warn his sons, are they on thorns and snares of the heavens? Perhaps they are on lions and thieves of men?! If so, Jacob warned here, but did not warn there? Jacob warned about all warnings.

hebrew_text: וְצִינִּים פַּחִים בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם נִינְהוּ? וְהָתַנְיָא: הַכֹּל בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם חוּץ מִצִּינִּים פַּחִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״צִינִּים פַּחִים בְּדֶרֶךְ עִיקֵּשׁ שׁוֹמֵר נַפְשׁוֹ יִרְחַק מֵהֶם״! וְתוּ אַרְיָא וְגַנָּבֵי בִּידֵי אָדָם נִינְהוּ? וְהָאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף וְכֵן תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁבָּטְלוּ סַנְהֶדְרִין, אַרְבַּע מִיתוֹת לֹא בָּטְלוּ. לֹא בָּטְלוּ?! הָא בָּטְלוּ לְהוּ! אֶלָּא:
human_translation: And are cold heat at the hand of Heaven? Isn’t it taught All at the hand of Heaven except for cold heat, as it is stated: “Cold heat are on the path of the crooked, he who guards his soul shall keep far from them” And furthermore, are a lion and thieves at the hands of man? But didn’t Rav Yosef say, and similarly, Rabbi Ḥiyya teach From the day that the Temple was destroyed, although the Sanhedrin was abolished four death were not abolished? not abolished? that they were abolished, Rather,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Are thorns and traps in the hands of Heaven? And it was taught: Everything is in the hands of Heaven except for thorns and traps, as it is stated: "Thorns and traps are in the way of the crooked; he who guards his soul will keep far from them" (Proverbs 22:5)! And are lions and thieves in the hands of man? But Rav Yosef said, and similarly Rabbi Chiya taught: Since the Temple was destroyed, even though the Sanhedrin was abolished, four types of death penalties were not abolished. Were they not abolished?! They were abolished for them! Rather:

hebrew_text: דִּין אַרְבַּע מִיתוֹת לֹא בָּטְלוּ. מִי שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב סְקִילָה — אוֹ נוֹפֵל מִן הַגָּג, אוֹ חַיָּה דּוֹרַסְתּוֹ. וּמִי שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב שְׂרֵיפָה — אוֹ נוֹפֵל בִּדְלֵיקָה, אוֹ נָחָשׁ מַכִּישׁוֹ. וּמִי שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב הֲרִיגָה — אוֹ נִמְסָר לַמַּלְכוּת, אוֹ לִיסְטִים בָּאִין עָלָיו. וּמִי שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב חֶנֶק — אוֹ טוֹבֵעַ בַּנָּהָר, אוֹ מֵת בִּסְרוֹנְכֵי?! אֶלָּא, אֵיפוֹךְ: אַרְיָא וְגַנָּבֵי בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם, צִינִּים וּפַחִים בִּידֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: punishment four death was not abolished. One who was liable stoning either falls from the roof or a beast tramples him. And one who was liable burning either falls into a conflagration or a snake bites him, And one who was liable decapitation either handed over to the monarchy or bandits attack him. And one who was liable strangulation either drowns in a river, or dies of diphtheria [ serunki ]. Rather, reverse A lion and thieves at the hand of Heaven, cold and heat at the hands of man.
llm_translation: The judgment of the four death penalties has not been annulled. One who is liable to stoning — either falls from the roof, or a wild animal tramples him. And one who is liable to burning — either falls into a fire, or a snake bites him. And one who is liable to the sword — either is handed over to the kingdom, or bandits come upon him. And one who is liable to strangulation — either drowns in a river, or dies by choking?! Rather, the opposite: lions and thieves are in the hands of Heaven, while mosquitoes and flies are in the hands of man.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר, טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא בֶּן הַקָּנָה מֵהָכָא: ״וְאִם הַעְלֵם יַעְלִימוּ עַם הָאָרֶץ אֶת עֵינֵיהֶם מִן הָאִישׁ הַהוּא בְּתִתּוֹ מִזַּרְעוֹ לַמּוֹלֶךְ. וְשַׂמְתִּי אֲנִי אֶת פָּנַי בָּאִישׁ הַהוּא וּבְמִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ וְהִכְרַתִּי אוֹתוֹ״, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: כָּרֵת שֶׁלִּי כְּמִיתָה שֶׁלָּכֶם, מָה מִיתָה שֶׁלָּכֶם — פָּטוּר מִן הַתַּשְׁלוּמִין. אַף כָּרֵת שֶׁלִּי — פָּטוּר מִן הַתַּשְׁלוּמִין.
human_translation: Rava said The rationale of Rabbi Neḥunya ben HaKana is from here. “And if the people of the land do at all hide their eyes from that man, when he gives of his seed to Molech, then I will set My face against that man and against his family, and will cut him off [ vehikhrati ]” the Torah said: My karet like your death just as your death is exempt from the payments, so too, My karet is exempt from the payments.
llm_translation: Rava said, the reason of Rabbi Neḥunia the son of HaQana is derived from here: "And if the people of the land hide their eyes from that man when he gives of his seed to Molech, and I will set My face against that man and against his family, and will cut him off," the Torah said: "My excision is like your death penalty, just as your death penalty exempts from payments, so too my excision exempts from payments."

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין רָבָא לְאַבָּיֵי? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ זָר שֶׁאָכַל תְּרוּמָה — לְאַבָּיֵי פָּטוּר, וּלְרָבָא חַיָּיב.
human_translation: What is there between Rava and Abaye There is between them a non-priest who ate teruma . to Abaye exempt And to Rava, liable
llm_translation: What is the difference between Rava and Abbaye? The difference between them is a non-priest who ate terumah - Abbaye is exempt, and Rava is liable.

hebrew_text: וּלְאַבָּיֵי פָּטוּר?! וְהָאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא בֶּן הַקָּנָה בְּגוֹנֵב חֶלְבּוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ וַאֲכָלוֹ, שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב — שֶׁכְּבָר נִתְחַיֵּיב בִּגְנֵיבָה קוֹדֶם שֶׁבָּא לִידֵי אִיסּוּר חֵלֶב. אַלְמָא דְּמֵעִידָּנָא דְּאַגְבְּהֵיהּ קַנְיֵיהּ, מִתְחַיֵּיב בְּנַפְשׁוֹ לָא הֲוָה עַד דְּאָכֵיל לֵיהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי, בְּעִידָּנָא דְּאַגְבְּהֵיהּ — קַנְיֵיהּ, מִתְחַיֵּיב בְּנַפְשׁוֹ לָא הָוֵי עַד דְּאָכֵיל לֵיהּ! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן שֶׁתָּחַב לוֹ חֲבֵירוֹ לְתוֹךְ פִּיו.
human_translation: And according to Abaye, exempt But didn’t Rav Ḥisda say Rabbi Neḥunya ben HaKana concedes with regard to steals another’s fat and eats it that he is obligated as he was already liable for theft before he came the prohibition fat? Apparently, from the moment he lifts it he acquired it, he is liable to death only when he eats it. Here, too, at the moment he lifts he acquired it he is liable to death only when he eats it. With what are we dealing here? where another inserted into his mouth.
llm_translation: To Abaye is exempt?! But didn't Rav Ḥisda say: Rabbi Neḥunya ben HaKanah concedes regarding one who stole his fellow's fat and ate it, that he is liable — for he was already liable for theft before he became subject to the prohibition of fat. This proves that since he acquired it through theft, he is liable for his own life until he eats it. Here too, since he acquired it through theft, he is liable for his own life until he eats it! What are we dealing with here — for example, if his fellow forced it into his mouth.

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף כֵּיוָן דְּלַעֲסֵיהּ קַנְיֵיהּ, מִתְחַיֵּיב בְּנַפְשׁוֹ לָא הָוֵי עַד דְּבַלְעַהּ! כְּגוֹן שֶׁתָּחַב לוֹ לְתוֹךְ בֵּית הַבְּלִיעָה. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּמָצֵי לְאַהְדּוֹרַהּ — נֶיהְדַּר. אִי לָא מָצֵי לְאַהְדּוֹרַהּ — אַמַּאי חַיָּיב? לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּמָצֵי לְאַהְדּוֹרַהּ עַל יְדֵי הַדְּחָק.
human_translation: Ultimately, once he chewed he acquired it he is liable to death only when he swallows it. where inserted it into the pharynx, What are the circumstances? If possible to retrieve let him retrieve If not possible to retrieve why liable? necessary only where possible to retrieve under duress,
llm_translation: At the end, once he has acquired it, he is obligated with his own life, it will not be until he swallows it! For example, if he entered it into the esophagus. What is the comparison? If it is found to be suitable for its generation — it is adorned. If it is not found to be suitable for its generation — why is he liable? It is unnecessary, for if it is found to be suitable for its generation under duress.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁתָּחַב לוֹ חֲבֵירוֹ מַשְׁקִין שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה לְתוֹךְ פִּיו. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: בְּזָר שֶׁאָכַל תְּרוּמָה מִשֶּׁלּוֹ,
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: where another inserted liquids of teruma into his mouth. Rav Ashi said: to a non-priest who partook of his own teruma ,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: For example, if his friend poured Trumah liquids into his mouth. Rav Ashe said: With a zar who ate his own Trumah.

hebrew_text: וְקָרַע שִׁירָאִין שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: and he tore another’s silk [ shira’in ].
llm_translation: And he tore the garment of his fellow.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא בֶּן הַקָּנָה בְּגוֹנֵב חֶלְבּוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ וַאֲכָלוֹ שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב, שֶׁכְּבָר נִתְחַיֵּיב בִּגְנֵבָה קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא לִידֵי אִיסּוּר חֵלֶב. לֵימָא פְּלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי אָבִין. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין: הַזּוֹרֵק חֵץ מִתְּחִילַּת אַרְבַּע לְסוֹף אַרְבַּע, וְקָרַע שִׁירָאִין בַּהֲלִיכָתוֹ — פָּטוּר. שֶׁעֲקִירָה צוֹרֶךְ הַנָּחָה הִיא. הָכָא נָמֵי: הַגְבָּהָה צוֹרֶךְ אֲכִילָה הִיא!
human_translation: the itself. Rav Ḥisda said: Rabbi Neḥunya ben HaKana concedes in steals another’s fat and eats it that he is obligated as he is already liable for theft before he comes to the prohibition fat. Let us say disagrees Rabbi Avin, as Rabbi Avin said: One who shoots an arrow from the beginning of four to the end of four and ripped silk as it proceeds, is exempt as lifting is a prerequisite for placement. Here, too, lifting is a prerequisite for eating,
llm_translation: The body, Rav Ḥisda said: Rabbi Neḥunya ben HaKanah concedes in the case of one who steals the fat of his fellow and eats it, that he is liable, for he was already liable for theft before he became subject to the prohibition of eating fat. Let us say that this is in dispute with the opinion of Rabbi Avin. For Rabbi Avin said: One who shoots an arrow from the beginning of four cubits to the end of four cubits, and he tears the tendons while walking – he is exempt. For uprooting requires placement. Here too: elevation requires consumption!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם, אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְהַנָּחָה בְּלֹא עֲקִירָה. הָכָא, אֶפְשָׁר לַאֲכִילָה בְּלֹא הַגְבָּהָה, דְּאִי בָּעֵי, גָּחֵין וְאָכֵיל. אִי נָמֵי: הָתָם אִי בָּעֵי לְאַהְדּוֹרַהּ — לָא מָצֵי מַהְדַּר לַהּ. הָכָא — מָצֵי מַהְדַּר לַהּ.
human_translation: How can be compared? There, placement is impossible without lifting, here, eating is possible without lifting as, if one wishes, bend down and eat Alternatively, There, if he seeks to take back he cannot take it back; Here, he could replace
llm_translation: So now?! There, if impossible to leave without uprooting. Here, possible to eat without lifting, for if one wants, bends and eats. If you say: there, if one wants to adorn it — cannot adorn it. Here — can adorn it.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין הַאי לִישָּׁנָא לְהַאי לִישָּׁנָא? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ הַמַּעֲבִיר סַכִּין בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְקָרַע שִׁירָאִין בַּהֲלִיכָתוֹ. לְהָךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְהַנָּחָה בְּלֹא עֲקִירָה — הָכָא נָמֵי אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְהַנָּחָה בְּלֹא עֲקִירָה. לְהָךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ לָא מָצֵי מַהְדַּר לַהּ — הָכָא מָצֵי מַהְדַּר לַהּ.
human_translation: What is there between this formulation, and that formulation, There is between them one who carries a knife in the public domain and tears silk as he proceeds. According to that formulation, where you said: Lifting is a prerequisite for placement, here too, lifting is a prerequisite for placement. according to that formulation where you said: He cannot take back here, he can take back
llm_translation: What is the difference between this and that? The difference between them is one who carries a knife in a public domain and tears silk in his walking. To this one, who says it is impossible to leave it without uprooting - here too, it is impossible to leave it without uprooting. To that one, who says it cannot be restored - here it can be restored.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין: הַזּוֹרֵק חֵץ מִתְּחִלַּת אַרְבַּע לְסוֹף אַרְבַּע וְקָרַע שִׁירָאִין בַּהֲלִיכָתוֹ — פָּטוּר, שֶׁעֲקִירָה צוֹרֶךְ הַנָּחָה הִיא. מֵתִיב רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: הַגּוֹנֵב כִּיס בְּשַׁבָּת — חַיָּיב, שֶׁכְּבָר נִתְחַיֵּיב בִּגְנֵיבָה קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא לִידֵי אִיסּוּר סְקִילָה. הָיָה מְגָרֵר וְיוֹצֵא, מְגָרֵר וְיוֹצֵא — פָּטוּר, שֶׁהֲרֵי אִיסּוּר שַׁבָּת וּגְנֵיבָה בָּאִין כְּאֶחָד.
human_translation: the itself. Rabbi Avin said: one who shoots an arrow from the beginning of four to the end of four and rips silk as it proceeds, he is exempt, as lifting is a prerequisite for placement. Rav Beivai bar Abaye raised an objection One who steals a purse on Shabbat is liable because he was already liable for theft before he came to the prohibition stoning. was dragging and exiting dragging and exiting, he is exempt, as the prohibition theft and the prohibition of Shabbat simultaneously
llm_translation: The body, Rabbi Avin said: One who throws an arrow from the beginning of four cubits to the end of four cubits and tears garments in his walking - he is exempt, for uprooting requires placement. Rav Bibi bar Abbaye objects: One who steals a purse on Shabbat - is liable, for he has already incurred theft before coming to the prohibition of stoning. If he was dragging and going out, dragging and going out - he is exempt, for the prohibition of Shabbat and theft come together as one.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? הָכָא נָמֵי, לֵימָא: הַגְבָּהָה צוֹרֶךְ הוֹצָאָה הִיא! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִגְבִּיהוֹ עַל מְנָת לְהַצְנִיעוֹ, וְנִמְלַךְ עָלָיו וְהוֹצִיאוֹ.
human_translation: But why Here, too, let us say lifting is a prerequisite for carrying out, With what are we dealing here? where he lifted in order to conceal it and he reconsidered and carried it out.
llm_translation: And why? Here it is stated, let us say: "Height requires removal!" Here, what are we dealing with - for example, when he raised it in order to conceal it, and a king ruled over him and removed it.

hebrew_text: וְכִי הַאי גַּוְונָא מִי חַיָּיב? וְהָאָמַר רַב סִימוֹן אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמְפַנֶּה חֲפָצִים מִזָּוִית לְזָוִית, וְנִמְלַךְ עֲלֵיהֶם וְהוֹצִיאָן — פָּטוּר, שֶׁלֹּא הָיְתָה עֲקִירָה מִשָּׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה לְכָךְ!
human_translation: And in a case like that, is liable But didn’t Rav Simon say Rabbi Ami said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One who moves objects from corner corner and he reconsidered their and carried them out exempt, as the lifting was not initially for that
llm_translation: And when it comes to this case, who is liable? And Rav Simon said in the name of Rabbi Ammi who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who transfers objects from corner to corner, and they became established and he removed them - he is exempt, because there was no uprooting from the initial moment for this!

hebrew_text: לָא תֵּימָא עַל מְנָת לְהַצְנִיעוֹ, אֶלָּא אֵימָא עַל מְנָת לְהוֹצִיאוֹ, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּשֶׁעָמַד.
human_translation: Do not say in order to conceal it; rather, say in order to carry it out. with what are we dealing here? where he stopped
llm_translation: Do not say "with the intention of concealing it," rather say "with the intention of bringing it out." Here, what are we dealing with? — When he stood.

hebrew_text: עָמַד לְמַאי? אִי לְכַתֵּף — אוֹרְחֵיהּ הוּא! אֶלָּא בְּעוֹמֵד לָפוּשׁ. אֲבָל לְכַתֵּף מַאי?
human_translation: stopped. For what If to shoulder, is manner Rather, in stopped to rest, But to shoulder, what
llm_translation: He stood for what? If to the shoulder - it is his way! Rather, he stood to relieve himself. But for the shoulder, what is it?

hebrew_text: פָּטוּר. אַדְּתָנֵי: הָיָה מְגָרֵר וְיוֹצֵא מְגָרֵר וְיוֹצֵא פָּטוּר, נִפְלוֹג וְנִיתְנֵי בְּדִידַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּעוֹמֵד לָפוּשׁ, אֲבָל לְכַתֵּף — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: exempt. rather than teaching: he was dragging and exiting, dragging and exiting, he is exempt, let distinguish and teach within itself, In what are these matters stated? in he stopped to rest; however, he stopped to shoulder, exempt.
llm_translation: Exempt. It was taught: If one was dragging a bench and it broke, and he was dragging the broken pieces and they broke, he is exempt. If they split into separate pieces and were given to him to carry individually: in what case are these words said? — When he was standing to carry them on his shoulder, but if he was carrying them on his side, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הָא מַנִּי — בֶּן עַזַּאי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מְהַלֵּךְ כְּעוֹמֵד דָּמֵי. אֲבָל זוֹרֵק מַאי — פָּטוּר? נִיפְלוֹג [וְנִיתְנֵי] בְּדִידַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּמְהַלֵּךְ, אֲבָל זוֹרֵק — פָּטוּר!
human_translation: Rather, whose this It is ben Azzai, said: one who walks is like one who stops, But one throws what exempt let distinguish and teach within itself, In what are these matters stated? one who walks, However, one who throws exempt
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, this is the statement of Ben Azzai, who said: "Walking is like standing still." But if one throws something, is he exempt? They disagree in his own matter: in what case are these words said? In walking, but in throwing - he is exempt!

hebrew_text: מְגָרֵר וְיוֹצֵא אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא אֵין דֶּרֶךְ הוֹצָאָה בְּכָךְ. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: dragging and exiting was necessary for it might enter your mind to say this is not manner of carrying out, it teaches us
llm_translation: The one who drags and the one who goes out, it is necessary for him, as you think, I say, the way of going out is not like this. It is heard for us.

hebrew_text: וּבְמַאי? אִי בְּרַבְרְבֵי — אוֹרְחֵיהּ הוּא. אִי בְּזוּטְרֵי — לָאו אוֹרְחֵיהּ הוּא. אֶלָּא בְּמִיצְעֵי.
human_translation: And In what If in large is its manner, If in small is not its manner, Rather, to intermediate
llm_translation: And with what? If with Ravbrevei - it is his custom. If with Zutrei - it is not his custom. Rather, with Mitsaei.
