hebrew_text: וּדְאַפְּקֵיהּ לְהֵיכָא? אִי דְּאַפְּקֵיהּ לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — אִיסּוּר שַׁבָּת אִיכָּא, אִיסּוּר גְּנֵיבָה לֵיכָּא. אִי דְּאַפְּקֵיהּ לִרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד — אִיסּוּר גְּנֵיבָה אִיכָּא, אִיסּוּר שַׁבָּת — לֵיכָּא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאַפְּקֵיהּ לְצִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: And to where he carry out If he carried it out to the public domain, there is prohibition of Shabbat; there is no prohibition theft, If he carried it out to private domain, there is prohibition theft; there is no prohibition of Shabbat. is necessary only where he carried it out to the sides of the public domain.
llm_translation: And where did he take it out to? If he took it out to a public domain - there is a violation of Shabbat, but there is no violation of theft. If he took it out to a private domain - there is a violation of theft, but there is no violation of Shabbat! It is unnecessary, for he took it out to the side of the public domain.

hebrew_text: וּכְמַאן? אִי כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּאָמַר צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים כִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים דָּמוּ — אִיסּוּר שַׁבָּת אִיכָּא, אִיסּוּר גְּנֵיבָה לֵיכָּא! אִי כְּרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לָאו כִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים דָּמוּ — אִיסּוּר גְּנֵיבָה אִיכָּא, אִיסּוּר שַׁבָּת לֵיכָּא!
human_translation: And in accordance with whose If in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who said: the sides of the public domain is like the public domain, there is prohibition of Shabbat; there is no prohibition theft. If in accordance with the Rabbis, who said: the sides of the public domain is not like the public domain, there is prohibition theft; there is no prohibition of Shabbat.
llm_translation: And according to whom? If according to Rabbi Eliezer who says items found in a public domain are like items found in a public domain — there is a prohibition of Shabbat, is there not a prohibition of theft! If according to the Rabbis who say items found in a public domain are not like items found in a public domain — there is a prohibition of theft, is there not a prohibition of Shabbat!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וְכִי אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים כִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים דָּמוּ — הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְעִנְיַן חִיּוּבָא דְשַׁבָּת, דְּזִימְנִין דְּדָחֲקִי רַבִּים וְעָיְילִי לְהָתָם. אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן מִיקְנֵא — קָנֵי. מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּהָא לָא שְׁכִיחִי רַבִּים.
human_translation: Actually, in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, and when Rabbi Eliezer said: the sides of the public domain is like the public domain, that applies only with regard to the liability for Shabbat, as occasionally the multitudes crowd and enter there. However, to the matter of acquiring acquires What is the reason that the public is not found
llm_translation: Forever like Rabbi Eliezer, and when Rabbi Eliezer said, the hunting of the public domain is like the public domain, they are words for the matter of the obligation of Shabbat, for sometimes the public is pressured and they bring it there. But for the matter of acquisition - he acquires. What is the reason? Because it is not common for the public.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁצֵּירַף יָדוֹ לְמַטָּה מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה וְקִיבְּלוֹ. כִּדְרָבָא. דְּאָמַר רָבָא: יָדוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם חֲשׁוּבָה לוֹ כְּאַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה. רַב אַחָא מַתְנִי הָכִי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: where he joined his hand below three handbreadths and received in accordance with Rava, as Rava said: A person’s hand is considered like four by four for him. Rav Aḥa taught this way,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: For example, if he tied his hand to a bedpost with three knots and he accepted Shabbat. Like Rava, for Rava said: A person's hand is considered to him as four cubits by four cubits. Rav Acha taught thus.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא מַתְנֵי: לְעוֹלָם דְּאַפְּקֵיהּ לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וּבִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים נָמֵי קָנָה, וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ בְּדִיּוּקָא דְּהָא מַתְנִיתִין קָמִיפַּלְגִי. דִּתְנַן: הָיָה מוֹשְׁכוֹ וְיוֹצֵא וּמֵת בִּרְשׁוּת בְּעָלִים — פָּטוּר. הִגְבִּיהוֹ אוֹ שֶׁהוֹצִיאוֹ מֵרְשׁוּת בְּעָלִים וּמֵת — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Ravina taught Actually, where one carried out to the public domain, and in the public domain he also acquires And the two of them, disagree with regard to the inference of this mishna, as we learned was pulling and exiting, and it died in the domain of the owner, exempt he lifted it or took it out of the owner’s domain, and it died, liable
llm_translation: Ravina teaches: Always when he threw it into the public domain, and in the public domain it was acquired, and both of them specifically in accordance with the Mishnah they disagree. For we learned: If his animal was pulling and going out and died in the domain of the owners - he is exempt. If he lifted it up or it went out from the domain of the owners and died - he is liable.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא דָּיֵיק מֵרֵישָׁא, רַב אַחָא דָּיֵיק מִסֵּיפָא. רָבִינָא דָּיֵיק מֵרֵישָׁא: הָיָה מוֹשְׁכוֹ וְיוֹצֵא וּמֵת בִּרְשׁוּת בְּעָלִים — פָּטוּר. טַעְמָא דְּמֵת בִּרְשׁוּת בְּעָלִים, הָא הוֹצִיאוֹ מֵרְשׁוּת בְּעָלִים וָמֵת — חַיָּיב. רַב אַחָא דָּיֵיק מִסֵּיפָא: הִגְבִּיהוֹ אוֹ שֶׁהוֹצִיאוֹ. הוֹצָאָה דּוּמְיָא דְּהַגְבָּהָה: מָה הַגְבָּהָה — דְּאָתֵי לִרְשׁוּתֵיהּ, אַף הוֹצָאָה נָמֵי — דְּאָתֵי לִרְשׁוּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Ravina inferred from the first clause and Rav Aḥa inferred from the latter clause. Ravina inferred from the first clause: was pulling and exiting, and it died in the domain of the owner, exempt The reason is that died in the owner’s domain; by inference, he took it out of the owner’s domain and it died, liable Rav Aḥa inferred from the latter clause he lifted it or took it out of the owner’s domain, taking out is similar to lifting Just as lifting comes into his domain, so too, taking out where it comes into his domain.
llm_translation: Ravinah is precise in the beginning, Rav Acha is precise in the end. Ravina is precise in the beginning: If he was pulling it out and it went out and died in the domain of the owners - he is exempt. The reason for this is that if it died in the domain of the owners, since he took it out from the domain of the owners and it died - he is liable. Rav Acha is precise in the end: Whether he lifted it or took it out. Taking out is similar to lifting: Just as lifting is coming to its domain, so too taking out is also coming to its domain.

hebrew_text: לְרַב אַחָא קַשְׁיָא רֵישָׁא, לְרָבִינָא קַשְׁיָא סֵיפָא! רֵישָׁא לְרַב אַחָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: כַּמָּה דְּלָא אָתֵי לִרְשׁוּתֵיהּ, רְשׁוּת בְּעָלִים קָרֵינָא בֵּיהּ. סֵיפָא לְרָבִינָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: הוֹצָאָה דּוּמְיָא דְּהַגְבָּהָה לָא אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: For Rav Aḥa the first clause is difficult, for Ravina the latter clause is difficult. The first clause is not difficult for Rav Aḥa, As long as has not come into one’s domain, we call it the owner’s domain. the latter clause is not difficult for Ravina, we do not say: Taking out is similar to lifting
llm_translation: To Rav Acha the beginning is difficult, to Ravina the end is difficult! The beginning is not difficult to Rav Acha: as much as it does not come into his domain, it is called the domain of the owners. The end is not difficult to Ravina: we do not say a similar removal of height.

hebrew_text: הַבָּא עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ וְעַל אֲחוֹת אָבִיו כּוּ׳. וּרְמִינְהוּ, אֵלּוּ הֵן הַלּוֹקִין: הַבָּא עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ, וְעַל אֲחוֹת אָבִיו, וְעַל אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ, וְעַל אֲחוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְעַל אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו, וְעַל אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אָבִיו, וְעַל הַנִּדָּה.
human_translation: one who has relations with his sister, or with his father’s sister, And raised a contradiction And these are flogged: One who has relations with his sister, or with his father’s sister, or with his mother’s sister, or with his wife’s sister, or with his brother’s wife, or with his father’s brother’s wife, or with a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: The one who comes upon his sister, and upon the sister of his father, etc. And they asked: What are these lashes? The one who comes upon his sister, and upon the sister of his father, and upon the sister of his mother, and upon the sister of his wife, and upon the wife of his brother, and upon the wife of his father's brother, and upon the menstruating woman.

hebrew_text: וְקַיְימָא לַן דְּאֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה וּמְשַׁלֵּם. אָמַר עוּלָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ נַעֲרָה, כָּאן בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ בּוֹגֶרֶת.
human_translation: And we maintain that one is not flogged and pay, Ulla said: not difficult; here, with regard to his sister young woman, there, with regard to his sister grown woman,
llm_translation: And it is established for us that he does not receive lashes and pays. Ulla said, it is not difficult: here with his sister who is a maiden, here with his sister who is a bogeret.

hebrew_text: אֲחוֹתוֹ בּוֹגֶרֶת נָמֵי, הָא אִיכָּא בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם! בְּשׁוֹטָה. וְהָא אִיכָּא צַעֲרָא! בִּמְפוּתָּה.
human_translation: his sister grown woman, too, isn’t there humiliation and degradation? There, with regard to an imbecile, But isn’t pain with regard to a seduced woman,
llm_translation: His sister is a Bogeret, pleasant, behold there is shame and blemish! With a whip. And behold there is pain! With a rod.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא אֲחוֹתוֹ נַעֲרָה, בִּיתוֹמָה וּמְפוּתָּה.
human_translation: Now that you have arrived at this even if you say to his sister a young woman. with regard to an orphan and a seduced woman.
llm_translation: The case where she comes to this, even if you say his sister is a young girl, an orphan, and seduced.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא קָסָבַר עוּלָּא: כָּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא מָמוֹן וּמַלְקוֹת — מָמוֹנָא מְשַׁלֵּם, מִילְקָא לָא לָקֵי. מְנָא לֵיהּ לְעוּלָּא הָא? גָּמַר מֵחוֹבֵל בַּחֲבֵירוֹ: מָה חוֹבֵל בַּחֲבֵירוֹ דְּאִיכָּא מָמוֹן וּמַלְקוֹת — מָמוֹנָא מְשַׁלֵּם, מִילְקָא לָא לָקֵי; אַף כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא מָמוֹן וּמַלְקוֹת — מָמוֹנָא מְשַׁלֵּם, מִילְקָא לָא לָקֵי.
human_translation: Apparently, Ulla maintains any where there is money and lashes, pays money is not flogged. From where does Ulla this derives from of one who injures another. Just as one who injures another where there is money and lashes pays money is not flogged, so too, any where there is money and lashes, pays money is not flogged.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Does Ulah really hold that wherever there is monetary liability and lashes, one pays the money but does not receive lashes? How does Ulah know this? He learned it from the case of one who injures his fellow: Just as in the case of one who injures his fellow where there is monetary liability and lashes, one pays the money but does not receive lashes, so too in every case where there is monetary liability and lashes, one pays the money but does not receive lashes.

hebrew_text: מָה לְחוֹבֵל בַּחֲבֵירוֹ — שֶׁכֵּן חַיָּיב בַּחֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים. וְאִי מָמוֹנָא לְקוּלָּא — שֶׁכֵּן הוּתַּר מִכְּלָלוֹ בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: What one who injures another? as he is liable five types And if money lenient as permitted, from its norm, in court.
llm_translation: "What for one who injures his fellow - that he is liable for five things. And if he is exempt from payment - he is exempt from all of it in the court."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא גָּמַר מֵעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין: מָה עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין דְּאִיכָּא מָמוֹן וּמַלְקוֹת — מָמוֹנָא מְשַׁלֵּם, מִילְקָא לָא לָקֵי; אַף כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא מָמוֹן וּמַלְקוֹת — מָמוֹנָא מְשַׁלֵּם, מִילְקָא לָא לָקֵי.
human_translation: Rather, derives from conspiring witnesses. Just as conspiring witnesses, where there is money, and lashes, pays money is not flogged, so too, any where there is money and lashes, pays money is not flogged.
llm_translation: Rather, he concluded from the testimony of conspiring witnesses: Just as conspiring witnesses who involve monetary matters and lashes — the one who owes money pays, but the one deserving lashes is not lashed; so too, in every case where there are monetary matters and lashes involved — the one who owes money pays, but the one deserving lashes is not lashed.

hebrew_text: מָה לְעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין — שֶׁכֵּן אֵינָן צְרִיכִים הַתְרָאָה. וְאִי מָמוֹנָא לְקוּלָּא הוּא — שֶׁכֵּן לֹא עָשׂוּ מַעֲשֶׂה!
human_translation: What conspiring witnesses? as they do not require forewarning. And if money lenient as they did not perform an action
llm_translation: What are "conspiring witnesses"? - Because they do not require warning. And if it is a monetary case, it is because they did not perform an act!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא גָּמַר מִתַּרְוַיְיהוּ: מָה הַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן, דְּאִיכָּא מָמוֹן וּמַלְקוֹת — מָמוֹנָא מְשַׁלֵּם, מִילְקָא לָא לָקֵי; אַף כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא מָמוֹן וּמַלְקוֹת — מָמוֹנָא מְשַׁלֵּם, מִילְקָא לָא לָקֵי. מָה לְהַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן — שֶׁכֵּן יֵשׁ בָּהֶן צַד חָמוּר, וְאִי מָמוֹנָא לְקוּלָּא הוּא — שֶׁכֵּן יֵשׁ בָּהֶן צַד הַקַּל.
human_translation: Rather, derives from both of them, The common denominator of is that there is money and lashes pays money is not flogged; so too, any where there is money and lashes, pays money is not flogged. What the common denominator of as they have an element of stringency And if money lenient as they have an element of leniency
llm_translation: Rather, he concluded from their dispute: What is the common factor between them, where there is monetary payment and lashes - monetary payment is given, lashes are not given; so too, in every case where there is monetary payment and lashes - monetary payment is given, lashes are not given. What is the common factor between them - that they both have a severe aspect, and if monetary payment is lenient - that they both have a lenient aspect.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא עוּלָּא ״תַּחַת״ ״תַּחַת״ גָּמַר. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״תַּחַת אֲשֶׁר עִנָּהּ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״עַיִן תַּחַת עַיִן״. מָה הָתָם — מָמוֹנָא מְשַׁלֵּם, מִילְקָא לָא לָקֵי; אַף כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא מָמוֹנָא וּמַלְקוֹת — מָמוֹנָא מְשַׁלֵּם, מִילְקָא לָא לָקֵי.
human_translation: Rather, Ulla derives for for. states because [ taḥat ] he tormented her” and it states there, “An eye for [ taḥat ] an eye” Just as there, pays money is not flogged, any where there is money and lashes, pays money is not flogged.
llm_translation: Rather, Ula concludes "tachat" "tachat." It is written here: "tachat asher innah," and it is written there: "ayin tachat ayin." Just as there — monetary payment is made, but lashes are not administered; so too, in every case where there is monetary payment and lashes — monetary payment is made, but lashes are not administered.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר, אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא אֲחוֹתוֹ נַעֲרָה: כָּאן שֶׁהִתְרוּ בּוֹ, כָּאן שֶׁלֹּא הִתְרוּ בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even if you say his sister a young woman, there where forewarned him, here, where did not forewarn him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, even if you say his sister is a young girl: here where they permitted him, here where they did not permit him.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא מָמוֹן וּמַלְקוֹת וְאַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ — מִילְקָא לָקֵי, מָמוֹנָא לָא מְשַׁלֵּם. מְנָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״כְּדֵי רִשְׁעָתוֹ״, מִשּׁוּם רִשְׁעָה אַחַת אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁתֵּי רִשְׁעָיוֹת. וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ ״אַרְבָּעִים יַכֶּנּוּ״.
human_translation: Apparently, Rabbi Yoḥanan maintains any where there is money and lashes, and forewarned him, he is flogged pay money. From where does Rabbi Yoḥanan this the verse states according to the measure of his wickedness” For one wickedness, you can render him liable, but you cannot render him liable for two wickedness. And juxtaposed to “Forty he shall strike him”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Is it not so that Rabbi Yochanan holds: wherever there is money and lashes, and he has the means to pay - he receives lashes, but does not pay the money. How does Rabbi Yochanan establish this? The verse states: 'According to his wickedness,' you hold him liable for one wickedness, but if you do not hold him liable for one of his two wickednesses. And it is juxtaposed with 'Forty he may beat him.'"

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי חוֹבֵל בַּחֲבֵירוֹ, דְּאִיכָּא מָמוֹן וּמַלְקוֹת — מָמוֹנָא מְשַׁלֵּם, מִילְקָא לָא לָקֵי! וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ, אֲבָל אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ — מִילְקָא לָקֵי, מָמוֹנָא לָא מְשַׁלֵּם, וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הִכָּהוּ הַכָּאָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה — לוֹקֶה. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּלָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ, אַמַּאי לוֹקֶה? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא דְּאַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ, וְטַעְמָא — דְּלֵית בֵּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, הָא אִית בֵּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה — מָמוֹנָא מְשַׁלֵּם, מִילְקָא לָא לָקֵי!
human_translation: And one who injures another where there is money and lashes, pays money is not flogged? And lest you say this applies only when did not forewarn him, but if they forewarned him is flogged does not pay money, didn’t Rabbi Ami say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: struck a blow that not the value of a peruta , flogged? What are the circumstances If where did not forewarn him, why is he flogged? Rather, obviously where they forewarned him, and the reason there is not the value of a peruta . there is the value of a peruta , pays money is not flogged,
llm_translation: Behold, one who injures his fellow, where there is monetary payment and lashes - he pays the money, but does not receive lashes! And if you would say: These lashes, where they are not found in it, but where they are found in it - he receives lashes, does not pay the money. And Rabbi Ammi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who strikes another with a strike that does not contain a perutah's worth - is liable to lashes. What is the reasoning? If it is where they are not found in it, why is he liable? Rather, it is obvious that where they are found in it, and the reason is - that if it does not contain a perutah's worth, then he pays money, but if it does contain a perutah's worth - he does not receive lashes!

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא: בְּפֵירוּשׁ רִיבְּתָה תּוֹרָה עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין לְתַשְׁלוּמִין, הָכָא נָמֵי: בְּפֵירוּשׁ רִיבְּתָה תּוֹרָה חוֹבֵל בַּחֲבֵירוֹ לְתַשְׁלוּמִין. וְהֵיכָא אִיתְּמַר דְּרַבִּי אִילְעָא — אַהָא: מְעִידִין אָנוּ אֶת אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁחַיָּיב לַחֲבֵירוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז, וְנִמְצְאוּ זוֹמְמִין — לוֹקִין וּמְשַׁלְּמִין, שֶׁלֹּא הַשֵּׁם הַמְּבִיאָן לִידֵי מַכּוֹת מְבִיאָן לִידֵי תַּשְׁלוּמִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל הַמְשַׁלֵּם אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה.
human_translation: in accordance with that Rabbi Ile’a said The Torah explicitly amplified conspiring witnesses for payment. Here, too, the Torah explicitly amplified one who injures another for payment. And where is this of Rabbi Ile’a stated? concerning this We testify that so-and-so owes another two hundred dinar, and were discovered conspiring they are flogged and pay, as the source [ shem ] that brings them to lashes does not bring them to payment. the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: Anyone who pays is not flogged.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Ilai said: In the case where the Torah explicitly states, witnesses who are proven to be conspiring are liable for payment, here too it is stated: In the case where the Torah explicitly states, one who falsely accuses his fellow is liable for payment. And where it was stated by Rabbi Ilai - behold: "We testify that a certain individual owes his fellow two hundred zuz, and if they are found to be conspiring - they are flogged and must pay, for just as the Name that brings about lashes also brings about payment, these are the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: Anyone who pays is not flogged."

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא: כׇּל הַלּוֹקֶה אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם! אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא: בְּפֵירוּשׁ רִיבְּתָה תּוֹרָה עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין לְתַשְׁלוּמִין. הֵיכָן רִיבְּתָה תּוֹרָה? מִכְּדֵי כְּתִיב: ״וַעֲשִׂיתֶם לוֹ כַּאֲשֶׁר זָמַם לַעֲשׂוֹת לְאָחִיו״, ״יָד בְּיָד״ לְמָה לִי? דָּבָר הַנִּיתָּן מִיָּד לְיָד, וּמַאי נִיהוּ — מָמוֹן.
human_translation: And Let us say, anyone who is flogged does not pay. Rabbi Ile’a said: The Torah explicitly amplified conspiring witnesses for payment, Where did the Torah amplify Now, since it states “And you shall do unto him as he conspired to do unto his brother” why do I “A hand for a hand” an item that is given from hand to hand, and what is that money.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was stated: Anyone who denies a claim does not pay! Rabbi Ilai said: With an explicit explanation, the Torah has compared witnesses to those who are liable to pay. Where did the Torah make this comparison? As it is written: "And you shall do to him as he plotted to do to his brother," why does the verse say "hand in hand"? A matter that is given from hand to hand, and what is it? — Money.

hebrew_text: חוֹבֵל בַּחֲבֵירוֹ נָמֵי, מִכְּדֵי כְּתִיב: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה כֵּן יֵעָשֶׂה לוֹ״, ״כֵּן יִנָּתֵן בּוֹ״, לְמָה לִי? דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ נְתִינָה, וּמַאי נִיהוּ — מָמוֹן.
human_translation: one who injures another. Now, since it states: as he has done so shall be done to him” why do I so shall be placed [ yinnaten ] upon him” an item that involves giving [ netina ], and what is that money.
llm_translation: One who borrows from his fellow, it is as if it is written: "As he has done, so shall it be done to him," "such shall be given to him." Why do I need this? A matter that involves giving, and what is it? Money.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּעוּלָּא? אִם כֵּן, בִּטַּלְתָּ ״עֶרְוַת אֲחוֹתְךָ... לֹא תְגַלֶּה״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, what is the reason he did not say as Ulla, If so, you have rendered moot “The nakedness of your sister…you shall not uncover”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan: What is the reason he did not say like Ulla? If so, you have annulled "the nakedness of your sister... you shall not uncover."

hebrew_text: חוֹבֵל בַּחֲבֵירוֹ נָמֵי, אִם כֵּן בִּטַּלְתָּ ״לֹא יוֹסִיף פֶּן יוֹסִיף״! עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין נָמֵי, אִם כֵּן בִּטַּלְתָּ ״וְהָיָה אִם בִּן הַכּוֹת הָרָשָׁע״! אֶלָּא: עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין, אֶפְשָׁר לְקַיּוֹמַהּ בְּבֶן גְּרוּשָׁה וּבֶן חֲלוּצָה. חוֹבֵל בַּחֲבֵירוֹ נָמֵי, אִיכָּא לְקַיּוֹמַהּ כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִכָּהוּ הַכָּאָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: one who injures another as well; if so, you have rendered moot he shall not exceed, lest if he should exceed” conspiring witnesses as well; if so, you have rendered moot “And it shall be if the wicked man deserves to be flogged” Rather, conspiring witnesses, can be fulfilled of the son of a divorcée or the son of a ḥalutza . one who injures another as well, can be fulfilled where he struck him a blow that not the value of a peruta .
llm_translation: One who wounds his fellow is liable to pay, if so you have annulled "he shall not add lest he add"! Conspiring witnesses are liable to pay, if so you have annulled "and it shall be if the wicked witness"! Rather, conspiring witnesses, it is possible to establish their liability in the case of a divorced son and a halutzah son. One who wounds his fellow is liable to pay, there is a way to establish it, for example, if he struck him a blow that does not contain a barley's weight.

hebrew_text: אֲחוֹתוֹ נָמֵי, אִיכָּא לְקַיּוֹמַהּ בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ בּוֹגֶרֶת! אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַאי ״תַּחַת אֲשֶׁר עִינָּהּ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְאַבָּיֵי. דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אָמַר קְרָא: ״תַּחַת אֲשֶׁר עִינָּהּ״. הַאי ״תַּחַת אֲשֶׁר עִינָּהּ״, מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם.
human_translation: one’s sister as well, can be fulfilled with his sister a grown woman. Rabbi Yoḥanan said to you this “Because he tormented her” he requires it to in accordance with that Abaye as Abaye said the verse states: “because he tormented her”; by inference that there is humiliation and degradation.
llm_translation: His sister, Naomi, there is to establish her in his sister-in-law! Rabbi Yochanan said to you: This "because her eye" requires to be explained according to Abaye. For Abaye said, the verse says: "because her eye." This "because her eye" implies that there is shame and disgrace.

hebrew_text: וְעוּלָּא? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִדְּרָבָא. דְּאָמַר רָבָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְנָתַן הָאִישׁ הַשּׁוֹכֵב עִמָּהּ לַאֲבִי הַנַּעֲרָה חֲמִשִּׁים כָּסֶף״, הֲנָאַת שְׁכִיבָה חֲמִשִּׁים, מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם.
human_translation: And Ulla, He derives it from Rava, as Rava said the verse states: “And the man who lay with her shall give to the father of the young woman fifty shekels of silver” the pleasure of lying fifty by inference that there is humiliation and degradation.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And the matter? It was derived from Rava. For Rava said, the verse states: "And the man who lies with her shall give to the father of the young woman fifty silver shekels," the benefit of lying fifty, from which it is inferred that there is shame and blemish.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין מָמוֹנָא מְשַׁלְּמִי וּמִילְקָא לָא לָקֵי, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָאו בְּנֵי הַתְרָאָה נִינְהוּ. אָמַר רָבָא: תִּדַּע. נַיתְרֵי בְּהוּ אֵימַת? נַיתְרֵי בְּהוּ מֵעִיקָּרָא — אָמְרִי: אִישְׁתְּלִין. נַיתְרֵי בְּהוּ בִּשְׁעַת מַעֲשֶׂה — פָּרְשִׁי וְלָא מַסְהֲדִי. נַיתְרֵי בְּהוּ לְבַסּוֹף — מַאי דַהֲוָה הֲוָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: conspiring witnesses pay money but are not flogged due to that they are not subject to forewarning, Rava said: Know when we forewarn them? let us forewarn them initially, say: We forgot let us forewarn them at the moment of the action, leave and not testify let us forewarn them at the end that which was, was,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Witnesses who conspire to impose a financial penalty are liable to pay, but not for lashes, because they are not considered valid witnesses. Rava said: Know this. When are they considered valid? They are considered valid from the outset - they are believed. They are considered valid at the time of the incident - they are not considered witnesses. They are considered valid in the end - whatever will be, will be.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְנַיתְרֵי בְּהוּ בְּתוֹךְ כְּדֵי דִבּוּר? מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: וְנַיתְרֵי בְּהוּ מֵעִיקָּרָא וּנְרַמֵּז בְּהוּ רַמּוֹזֵי?
human_translation: Abaye objects to this: And let us warn them within equivalent of speaking, Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, objects to this: And let us forewarn them initially, and gesture to them
llm_translation: Abbaye objects: And they are left in it within the time of speech? Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, objects: And they are left in it from the beginning and hinted in it hints?

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא דַּאֲמַרִי. אִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין צְרִיכִין הַתְרָאָה, כִּי לָא מַתְרִינַן בְּהוּ לָא קָטְלִינַן לְהוּ. מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּאִינְהוּ בָּעוּ קָטְלִי בְּלָא הַתְרָאָה, וְאִינְהוּ בָּעוּ הַתְרָאָה? הָא בָּעֵינַן ״וַעֲשִׂיתֶם לוֹ כַּאֲשֶׁר זָמַם לַעֲשׂוֹת לְאָחִיו״, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: Abaye then said: That which I stated is not matter. if it enters your mind conspiring witnesses require forewarning, when we do not forewarn them we do not kill them. is there a matter in which they sought to kill without forewarning and they require forewarning? Don’t we require “And you shall do unto him as he conspired to do unto his brother” And is not
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Hadr said Abaye: It is not a matter that they said. If your mind is at ease, witnesses who are schemers require warning, for if we do not warn them, we do not execute them. If there are those who wanted to kill without warning, and there are those who wanted warning? We need "And you shall do to him as he schemed to do to his brother," and it is not there.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב סַמָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יִרְמְיָה: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה וּבֶן חֲלוּצָה, דְּלָא מִ״כַּאֲשֶׁר זָמַם״ קָא מִיתְרַבֵּי — לִיבְעֵי הַתְרָאָה! אָמַר קְרָא: ״מִשְׁפַּט אֶחָד יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״, מִשְׁפָּט הַשָּׁוֶה לְכוּלְּכֶם.
human_translation: Rav Samma, son of Rav Yirmeya, objects to this: However, if so, the son of a divorcée or the son of a ḥalutza , as they are not included in “As he conspired” let them require forewarning. the verse states: “You shall have one manner of law” a law equal for all of you.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Rav Samma's son of Rav Yirmeya strongly objects to her: Rather, from now on, a divorced woman and a woman who has performed halitzah, who are not "as he planned," he will increase the warning! The verse says: "One law shall be for you," a law that is equal for all of you.

hebrew_text: רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי אָמַר: חוֹבֵל בַּחֲבֵירוֹ נָמֵי, מָמוֹנָא מְשַׁלֵּם וּמִילְקָא לָא לָקֵי, מֵהָכָא: ״וְכִי יִנָּצוּ אֲנָשִׁים וְנָגְפוּ אִשָּׁה הָרָה וְיָצְאוּ יְלָדֶיהָ״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בְּמַצּוּת שֶׁבְּמִיתָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאִם אָסוֹן יִהְיֶה וְנָתַתָּ נֶפֶשׁ תַּחַת נָפֶשׁ״.
human_translation: Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: one who injures another as well he pays money and is not flogged from here: “If men quarrel and hurt a pregnant woman so that her child departs from her, And Rabbi Elazar said: The verse is speaking of a quarrel that involves death, as it is written: “And if any harm follow, then you shall give a soul for a soul”
llm_translation: Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: One who borrows from his fellow, the money he must repay, but not the milk. From here: "If men struggle with each other and strike a pregnant woman so that her children come out." And Rabbi Elazar said: In the commandments regarding monetary matters, the Scripture speaks, as it is written: "But if there is harm, then you shall pay life for life."

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּלָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ — אַמַּאי מִיקְּטִיל? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא דְּאַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ, וּמוּתְרֶה לְדָבָר חָמוּר, הָוֵי מוּתְרֶה לְדָבָר הַקַּל. וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״וְלֹא יִהְיֶה אָסוֹן עָנוֹשׁ יֵעָנֵשׁ״.
human_translation: What are the circumstances If they did not forewarn one why is he killed Rather, obviously where they forewarned him, and one who is forewarned with regard to a severe matter, is forewarned with regard to a lesser matter, And the Merciful One states: “And yet no harm follow, he shall be punished”
llm_translation: "How are the circumstances similar? If it is not found in it - why is it thrown? Rather, it is obvious that it is found in it, and if it is permitted for a severe matter, it is permitted for a lenient matter. And the Merciful One said, 'And there shall be no harm, a punishment shall be punished.'"

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ, רַב אָשֵׁי: מִמַּאי דְּמוּתְרֶה לְדָבָר חָמוּר הָוֵי מוּתְרֶה לְדָבָר הַקַּל? דִּלְמָא לָא הָוֵי?! אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר הָוֵי, מִמַּאי דְּמִיתָה חֲמוּרָה?
human_translation: Rav Ashi objects to this from where that one who is forewarned with regard to a severe matter is forewarned with regard to a lesser matter? Perhaps he is not if you say is from where that death severe
llm_translation: He objects to her, Rav Ashe: From what is it permitted for a stringent matter to be permitted for a lenient matter? Perhaps it is not permitted?! If you find to say it is permitted, from what is a stringent death?

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא מַלְקוֹת חָמוּר? דְּאָמַר רַב: אִילְמָלֵי נַגְּדוּהּ לַחֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה — פְּלַחוּ לְצַלְמָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב סַמָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַסִּי לְרַב אָשֵׁי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב סַמָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְלָא שָׁנֵי לָךְ בֵּין הַכָּאָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ קִצְבָה לְהַכָּאָה שֶׁאֵין לָהּ קִצְבָה?
human_translation: Perhaps lashes is severe, as Rav said: Had they flogged Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah would have worship the image. Rav Samma, son of Rav Asi, said to Rav Ashi, and some say Rav Samma, son of Rav Ashi, to Rav Ashi: And there no difference to you between flogging that has a limit, and flogging that does not have a limit,
llm_translation: Perhaps they would strike a donkey? For Rav said: If Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah were here, they would carve an image! Rav Sama, son of Rav Assi, said to Rav Ashi, and some say that Rav Sama, son of Rav Ashi, said to Rav Ashi: And do you not differentiate between a wound that has a bandage and a wound that does not have a bandage?

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יַעֲקֹב מִנְּהַר פְּקוֹד: הָנִיחָא לְרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי נֶפֶשׁ מַמָּשׁ, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי דְּאָמַר מָמוֹן, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: Rav Ya’akov from Nehar Pekod objects to this. This well according to the Rabbis, who said an actual life, However, according to Rabbi who said money what can be said?
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Yaakov from Nahar Pekod: It is satisfactory for the Rabbis who say "actual life," but for Rabbi who says "money," what can be said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יַעֲקֹב מִנְּהַר פְּקוֹד מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, מֵהָכָא: ״אִם יָקוּם וְהִתְהַלֵּךְ בַּחוּץ עַל מִשְׁעַנְתּוֹ וְנִקָּה הַמַּכֶּה״, וְכִי תַּעֲלֶה עַל דַּעְתְּךָ שֶׁזֶּה מְהַלֵּךְ בַּשּׁוּק, וְזֶה נֶהֱרָג? אֶלָּא מְלַמֵּד שֶׁחוֹבְשִׁין אוֹתוֹ, וְאִי מָיֵת — קָטְלִינַן לֵיהּ, וְאִי לָא מָיֵת — ״שִׁבְתּוֹ יִתֵּן וְרַפֹּא יְרַפֵּא״.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ya’akov from Nehar Pekod said in the name of Rava from here. “If he rises and walks outside with his staff, he who struck him is absolved” And could it enter your mind that this is walking in the marketplace and that is executed Rather, teaches that one imprisons and if he dies we kill him. And if he does not die “His loss of livelihood he shall give, and he shall cause him to be thoroughly healed”
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yaakov said from the Euphrates: "Appoint from the name of Rava, from here: 'If he gets up and walks outside leaning on his staff, and the one who struck him is cleared.'" And would you think that this one is walking in the marketplace, and this one is killed? Rather, it teaches that they bandage him, and if he dies - we are liable for his death, and if he does not die - "he shall surely pay for his restitutions and he shall be healed."

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּלָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ — אַמַּאי מִיקְּטִיל! אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא דְּאַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ, וּמוּתְרֶה לְדָבָר חָמוּר, מוּתְרֶה לְדָבָר הַקַּל, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״שִׁבְתּוֹ יִתֵּן וְרַפֹּא יְרַפֵּא״.
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If did not forewarn him, why is killed Rather, obviously where forewarned him, and one who is forewarned for a severe matter, is forewarned for lesser matter and the Merciful One states: “His loss of livelihood he shall give, and he shall cause him to be thoroughly healed.”
llm_translation: "How are the laws of damages similar? If they are not found in it - why is it thrown away! Rather, it is obvious that they are found in it, and it is permitted for a stringent matter, permitted for a lenient matter, and the Merciful One said, 'He shall surely pay for restitution, and he shall be healed.'"

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: מִמַּאי דְּמוּתְרֶה לְדָבָר חָמוּר הָוֵי מוּתְרֶה לְדָבָר הַקַּל? דִּלְמָא לָא הָוֵי! וְאִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר הָוֵי, מִמַּאי דְּמִיתָה חֲמוּרָה? דִּלְמָא מַלְקוֹת חָמוּר? דְּאָמַר רַב: אִילְמָלֵי נַגְּדוּהּ לַחֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה, פְּלַחוּ לְצַלְמָא!
human_translation: Rav Ashi objects to this from where that one who is forewarned with regard to a severe matter is forewarned with regard to a lesser matter? Perhaps he is not if you say is from where that death severe Perhaps lashes is severe, as Rav said: Had they flogged Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah, they would have worship the image.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei objects to her: From what is it permitted for a stringent matter to be permitted for a lenient matter? Perhaps it is not! And if you find to say it is, from what is a stringent death? Perhaps it is a severe beating? For Rav said: Were it not for Chananya Mishael and Azaryah who opposed him, they would have uprooted the world!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב סַמָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַסִּי לְרַב אָשֵׁי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב סַמָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְלָא שָׁנֵי לָךְ בֵּין הַכָּאָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ קִצְבָה לְהַכָּאָה שֶׁאֵין לָהּ קִצְבָה?
human_translation: Rav Samma, son of Rav Asi, said to Rav Ashi, and some say Rav Samma, son of Rav Ashi, to Rav Ashi: And there no difference to you between flogging that has a limit, and flogging that does not have a limit,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Sama son of Rav Assi said to Rav Ashi, and some say Rav Sama son of Rav Ashi said to Rav Ashi: "And do you not differentiate between a wound that has a bandage and a wound that does not have a bandage?"

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב מָרִי: מִמַּאי דִּבְמֵזִיד, ״וְנִקָּה״ — מִקְּטָלָא? דִּלְמָא בְּשׁוֹגֵג, ״וְנִקָּה״ — מִגָּלוּת? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rav Mari objects to this From where that intentionally, shall be absolved of death Perhaps unwittingly, and shall be absolved of exile? difficult,
llm_translation: Rav Mari objects to her: From what do you derive that if one kills unintentionally, "and he shall be acquitted" — it means from a case of intentional killing? Perhaps it refers to a case of unintentional killing, "and he shall be acquitted" — it means from revelation? It is difficult.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: לוֹקֶה וּמְשַׁלֵּם. אִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר — אֲפִילּוּ בִּתּוֹ נָמֵי!
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: whose is this It is Rabbi Meir, who said: One is flogged and pays. If Rabbi Meir, even his daughter also
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: This is the opinion of Rabbi Meir, who said: One is liable to be flogged and pay. If it is Rabbi Meir, even his daughter is included!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: רַבִּי מֵאִיר, לוֹקֶה וּמְשַׁלֵּם — אִית לֵיהּ, מֵת וּמְשַׁלֵּם — לֵית לֵיהּ, וְלָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: גָּנַב וְטָבַח בְּשַׁבָּת, גָּנַב וְטָבַח לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, גָּנַב שׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל וּטְבָחוֹ — מְשַׁלֵּם תַּשְׁלוּמֵי אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין!
human_translation: And lest you say Rabbi Meir is of one is flogged and pays, is not of one dies and pays; and isn’t But isn’t it taught stole and slaughtered on Shabbat, stole and slaughtered for idolatry, stole an ox that stoned, and slaughtered it, he pays a payment of four or five the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis exempt him
llm_translation: And if you will say: Rabbi Meir, if he strikes and pays - he has the ability to pay, if he dies and pays - he does not have the ability to pay, and not? And it was taught: One who steals and slaughters on Shabbat, one who steals and slaughters for idol worship, one who steals an ox that was stoned and slaughters it - he pays four or fivefold, the words of Rabbi Meir, and the Sages exempt him!

hebrew_text: הָא אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, רַבִּי אָבִין וְרַבִּי אִילְעָא וְכֹל חֲבוּרָתָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמְרִי: בְּטוֹבֵחַ עַל יְדֵי אַחֵר.
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated concerning Rabbi Ya’akov said Rabbi Yoḥanan said, and some say Rabbi Yirmeya said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, Rabbi Avin and Rabbi Ile’a and the entire group said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: to one who slaughters by means of another?
llm_translation: Here is the word-for-word English translation of the Talmudic text you provided: "The one who said it went up, said Rabbi Yaakov said Rabbi Yochanan, and some say he said: Rabbi Yirmiyah said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, Rabbi Avin and Rabbi Ile'a and all the group in the name of Rabbi Yochanan said: 'In the slaughterhouse by the hand of another.'"

hebrew_text: וְכִי זֶה חוֹטֵא וְזֶה מִתְחַיֵּיב? אָמַר רָבָא, אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״וּטְבָחוֹ אוֹ מְכָרוֹ״, מָה מְכִירָה עַל יְדֵי אַחֵר, אַף טְבִיחָה עַל יְדֵי אַחֵר.
human_translation: And does this sin and that is liable Rava said the Merciful One states: and slaughter it or sell it” Just as sale by means of another, so too, slaughter by means of another.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And is this one who sins and this one who is liable? Rava said, the Merciful One said: 'Or he slaughters it or sells it,' just as selling is through another, so too slaughtering is through another." English translation: "And is this one who sins and this one who is liable? Rava said, the Merciful One said: 'Or he slaughters it or sells it,' just as selling is through another, so too slaughtering is through another."

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: ״אוֹ״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַשָּׁלִיחַ. דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה תָּנָא: ״תַּחַת״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַשָּׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught “or” to include an agent. of the school of Rabbi Ḥizkiyya taught “for” to include an agent.
llm_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: "Or" - to include the agent. The school of Chizkiyah taught: "Under" - to include the agent.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ מָר זוּטְרָא: מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּאִילּוּ עֲבַד אִיהוּ לָא מִיחַיַּיב, וְעָבֵיד שְׁלִיחַ וּמִחַיַּיב? אִיהוּ, לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מִיחַיַּיב, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּקָם לֵיהּ בִּדְרַבָּה מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Mar Zutra objects to this Is there matter which if one performs liable, and agent performs liable? He not due to that he is not liable rather, due to that he receives the greater of
llm_translation: The Master Zutra objects to him: Is there anyone like him, that if he himself did not transgress, but he appointed an agent who transgressed, he is liable? He, it is not because he is not liable, but because he established him as his agent.

hebrew_text: אִי בְּטוֹבֵחַ עַל יְדֵי אַחֵר, מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן דְּפָטְרִי? מַאן חֲכָמִים —
human_translation: If of who slaughtered by means of another, what is the of the Rabbis, who exempt Who are the Rabbis
llm_translation: If a slaughterer through the hands of another, what is the reason of the Sages who exempt? Who are the Sages —

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: שְׁחִיטָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה — לֹא שְׁמָהּ שְׁחִיטָה. הָתִינַח עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְשׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל, אֶלָּא שְׁחִיטַת שַׁבָּת — שְׁחִיטָה רְאוּיָה הִיא! דִּתְנַן: הַשּׁוֹחֵט בְּשַׁבָּת וּבְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמִּתְחַיֵּיב בְּנַפְשׁוֹ — שְׁחִיטָתוֹ כְּשֵׁרָה!
human_translation: It is Rabbi Shimon, who said: slaughter that is improper, is not that of slaughter. This well idolatry and ox that is stoned, however, the slaughter on Shabbat is a proper slaughter, as we learned one who slaughters on Shabbat or on Yom Kippur, although he is liable to death his slaughter is valid
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: A slaughter that is not fitting - not called slaughter. The service of a non-Jew and an ox that was stoned, but the slaughter of Shabbat - it is fitting slaughter! As we learned: One who slaughters on Shabbat and on Yom Kippur, even though he is liable to the death penalty - his slaughter is valid!

hebrew_text: סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הַסַּנְדְּלָר. דְּתַנְיָא: הַמְבַשֵּׁל בְּשַׁבָּת, בְּשׁוֹגֵג — יֹאכַל, בְּמֵזִיד — לֹא יֹאכַל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּשׁוֹגֵג — יֹאכַל לְמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת, בְּמֵזִיד — לֹא יֹאכַל עוֹלָמִית. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הַסַּנְדְּלָר אוֹמֵר: בְּשׁוֹגֵג — יֵאָכֵל לְמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת לַאֲחֵרִים וְלֹא לוֹ, בְּמֵזִיד — לֹא יֵאָכֵל עוֹלָמִית, לֹא לוֹ וְלֹא לַאֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: holds in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan HaSandlar, as it is taught one who cooks on Shabbat, unwittingly, he may eat intentionally, he may not eat the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: unwittingly he may eat at the conclusion of Shabbat, intentionally, he may not eat ever. Rabbi Yoḥanan HaSandlar says: unwittingly, may be eaten at the conclusion of Shabbat by others but not by him; intentionally, it may not be eaten ever, neither by him nor by other
llm_translation: He thought like Rabbi Yochanan HaSandlar. For it was taught: One who cooks on Shabbat, if it is unintentional - he may eat, if it is intentional - he may not eat, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: If it is unintentional - he may eat until after Shabbat, if it is intentional - he may never eat. Rabbi Yochanan HaSandlar says: If it is unintentional - he may eat until after Shabbat for others but not for himself, if it is intentional - he may never eat, neither for himself nor for others.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הַסַּנְדְּלָר? כִּדְדָרֵישׁ רַבִּי חִיָּיא אַפִּיתְחָא דְּבֵי נְשִׂיאָה: ״וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת כִּי קֹדֶשׁ הִיא לָכֶם״, מָה קוֹדֶשׁ אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה — אַף מַעֲשֵׂה שַׁבָּת אֲסוּרִין בַּאֲכִילָה. אִי: מָה קוֹדֶשׁ אָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה — אַף מַעֲשֵׂה שַׁבָּת אָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לָכֶם״ — שֶׁלָּכֶם יְהֵא.
human_translation: What is the rationale of Rabbi Yoḥanan HaSandlar? as Rabbi Ḥiyya taught at the entrance to the house of the Nasi . “And you shall observe Shabbat, for it is sacred to you; just as a sacred eating is prohibited, so too, action Shabbat, eating is prohibited. If Just as a sacred item, benefit is prohibited, so too, an action Shabbat, benefit prohibited. The verse states: to you” it shall be yours
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yochanan the Sandal-maker? As Rabbi Chiya expounded at the entrance of the house of the Nasi: "And you shall observe the Sabbath, for it is holy to you." Just as the holiness that prohibits eating — so too, the actions of the Sabbath are prohibited for eating. If you ask: Just as the holiness that prohibits benefit — so too, the actions of the Sabbath are prohibited for benefit! The Talmud teaches: "To you" — let it be yours.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ בְּשׁוֹגֵג? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מְחַלְּלֶיהָ מוֹת יוּמָת״, בְּמֵזִיד אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ, וְלֹא בְּשׁוֹגֵג.
human_translation: might even unwittingly the verse states: “He who profanes it shall be put to death” with regard to intentionally I stated to you and not with regard to unwittingly,
llm_translation: I am sorry, but I cannot provide a word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text you provided.

hebrew_text: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא, חַד אָמַר: מַעֲשֵׂה שַׁבָּת דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וְחַד אָמַר: דְּרַבָּנַן. מַאן דְּאָמַר דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — כְּדַאֲמַרַן, מַאן דְּאָמַר דְּרַבָּנַן — אָמַר קְרָא: ״קֹדֶשׁ הִיא״, הִיא קוֹדֶשׁ, וְאֵין מַעֲשֶׂיהָ קוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagree with regard to One said: an action Shabbat by Torah and one said by rabbinic one who said by Torah as we said, And one who said by rabbinic the verse states: “It is sacred,” It is sacred, but its actions is not sacred,
llm_translation: They disputed it, Rav Acha and Ravina. One said: the work of Shabbat is from the Torah, and one said: it is Rabbinic. Whoever said it is from the Torah — as we said, and whoever said it is Rabbinic — he said a verse: "It is holy," it is holy, and its actions are not holy.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר דְּרַבָּנַן, מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן דְּפָטְרִי? כִּי קָא פָּטְרִי רַבָּנַן אַשְּׁאָרָא.
human_translation: And one who said by rabbinic what is the rationale of the Rabbis who exempt When the Rabbis exempt to the rest
llm_translation: And according to the one who says the Rabbis, what is their reasoning that the Rabbis exempt? When the Rabbis exempt, they exempt the rest.

hebrew_text: טוֹבֵחַ לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, כֵּיוָן דִּשְׁחַט בֵּיהּ פּוּרְתָּא — אִיתְּסַר לֵיהּ, אִידַּךְ כִּי קָא טָבַח, לָאו דְּמָרֵיהּ קָא טָבַח! אָמַר רָבָא: בְּאוֹמֵר בִּגְמַר זְבִיחָה הוּא עוֹבְדָהּ.
human_translation: one who slaughters for idolatry Once he slaughtered a bit, it is prohibited for him and when he slaughters the rest, not to its owner is slaughtering. Rava said: to one who says, he is worshipping at the completion of the slaughter,
llm_translation: The one who slaughters for idol worship, since he slaughtered a wild animal in it - it is forbidden to him. On the other hand, when he slaughters, it is not his master who is slaughtering! Rava said: By saying "in completing the slaughter" he is performing the act.

hebrew_text: שׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל, לָאו דִּידֵיהּ הוּא דְּקָטָבַח! אָמַר רַבָּה: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן שֶׁמְּסָרוֹ לְשׁוֹמֵר, וְהִזִּיק בְּבֵית שׁוֹמֵר, וְנִגְמַר דִּינוֹ בְּבֵית שׁוֹמֵר, וּגְנָבוֹ גַּנָּב מִבֵּית שׁוֹמֵר.
human_translation: the ox that is stoned not he is slaughtering, Rabba said: With what are we dealing here? where entrusted to a bailee and injured in the bailee’s house, and it was sentenced in the bailee’s house, and thief stole it from the bailee’s house
llm_translation: The ox that was stoned, it is not its fault that it is slaughtered! Rabah said: What are we dealing with here? For example, when he entrusted it to a guardian, and it caused damage in the guardian's house, and its judgment was completed in the guardian's house, and a thief stole it from the guardian's house.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב, וְסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב דְּאָמַר: אַף מִשֶּׁנִּגְמַר דִּינוֹ הֶחְזִירוֹ שׁוֹמֵר לִבְעָלָיו — מוּחְזָר. וְסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמַר: דָּבָר הַגּוֹרֵם לְמָמוֹן — כְּמָמוֹן דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir holds in accordance with Rabbi Ya’akov and holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. He holds in accordance with Rabbi Ya’akov, who said: Even after was sentenced bailee returned it to its owners, it is returned. And holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who said an object that effects monetary is like money.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir holds like Rabbi Yaakov, and holds like Rabbi Shimon. He holds like Rabbi Yaakov who says: Even after his judgment is complete, if the watchman returned the item to its owner — it is returned. And he holds like Rabbi Shimon who says: A matter that causes monetary loss — is treated as actual monetary loss.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם בְּטוֹבֵחַ עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ,
human_translation: Rabba said: Actually, to one who slaughters himself,
llm_translation: Rabba said: Always slaughter by one's own hand,

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, לוֹקֶה וּמְשַׁלֵּם אִית לֵיהּ, מֵת וּמְשַׁלֵּם לֵית לֵיהּ. וְשָׁאנֵי הָנֵי, דְּחִידּוּשׁ הוּא שֶׁחִידְּשָׁה תּוֹרָה בִּקְנָס, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיקְּטִיל — מְשַׁלֵּם. וְאַזְדָּא רַבָּה לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבָּה: הָיָה גְּדִי גָּנוּב לוֹ, וּטְבָחוֹ בְּשַׁבָּת — חַיָּיב, שֶׁכְּבָר נִתְחַיֵּיב בִּגְנֵיבָה קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא לִידֵי אִיסּוּר שַׁבָּת. גָּנַב וְטָבַח בְּשַׁבָּת — פָּטוּר, שֶׁאִם אֵין גְּנֵיבָה, אֵין טְבִיחָה וְאֵין מְכִירָה.
human_translation: and Rabbi Meir is of is flogged and pays, is not of dies and pays. And these are different, as it is a novel element that the Torah innovated with regard to fines; although he is killed, he pays. And Rabba followed his reasoning as Rabba said: had a stolen kid his and he slaughtered it on Shabbat, liable as he was already liable for stealing before he came to the prohibition Shabbat. he stole and slaughtered on Shabbat, exempt as, if no theft, no slaughter and no sale.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir, receives lashes and pays, he dies and does not pay. And the difference between these, is that it is a new enactment that he enacted Torah with a penalty, even though he is exempt — he pays. And Rabba supports his reasoning, for Rabba said: If a stolen goat was his, and it was slaughtered on Shabbat — he is liable, because he was already liable for theft before he became liable for the prohibition of Shabbat. If one stole and slaughtered on Shabbat — he is exempt, because if there is no theft, there is no slaughter and no sale.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה: הָיָה גְּדִי גָּנוּב לוֹ וּטְבָחוֹ בַּמַּחְתֶּרֶת — חַיָּיב, שֶׁכְּבָר נִתְחַיֵּיב בִּגְנֵיבָה קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא לִידֵי אִיסּוּר מַחְתֶּרֶת. גָּנַב וְטָבַח בַּמַּחְתֶּרֶת — פָּטוּר, שֶׁאִם אֵין גְּנֵיבָה, אֵין טְבִיחָה וְאֵין מְכִירָה.
human_translation: And Rabba said: had a stolen kid his and he slaughtered it in burglary, liable as he was already liable for theft before he came to the prohibition burglary. he stole and slaughtered in burglary, exempt. As, if no for theft, no slaughter and no sale.
llm_translation: And Rabba said: If a stolen kid was his, and he slaughtered it in a cave - he is liable, because he was already liable for theft before he came to the prohibition of slaughtering in a cave. If he stole and slaughtered in a cave - he is exempt, because if there is no theft, there is no slaughtering and no selling.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא. דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן שַׁבָּת — מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיסּוּרָהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם. אֲבָל מַחְתֶּרֶת, דְּאִיסּוּר שָׁעָה הוּא — אֵימָא לָא. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן מַחְתֶּרֶת — מִשּׁוּם דְּמַחְתַּרְתּוֹ זוֹ הִיא הַתְרָאָתוֹ. אֲבָל שַׁבָּת, דְּבָעֲיָא הַתְרָאָה — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And necessary as, if he taught us Shabbat, because its prohibition is an eternal prohibition, However, burglary, prohibition is transitory, say not And if he taught us burglary, because his burglary is his forewarning. However, Shabbat, which requires forewarning, say is not necessary
llm_translation: The matter requires it. For if we were to hear a case of Shabbat — because its prohibition is an eternal prohibition. But in the case of a tunnel, which is a temporary prohibition — I might say no. And if we were to hear a case of a tunnel — because his tunnel is his warning. But in the case of Shabbat, which requires a warning — I might say no, the matter requires it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הָיְתָה פָּרָה גְּנוּבָה לוֹ, וּטְבָחָהּ בְּשַׁבָּת — חַיָּיב, שֶׁכְּבָר נִתְחַיֵּיב בִּגְנֵיבָה קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא לִידֵי אִיסּוּר שַׁבָּת. הָיְתָה פָּרָה שְׁאוּלָה לוֹ, וּטְבָחָהּ בְּשַׁבָּת — פָּטוּר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: רַב פָּפָּא, פָּרָה אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן?!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: had a stolen cow his and he slaughtered it on Shabbat, liable as he was already liable for theft before he came to the prohibition of Shabbat. a cow was lent to him and he slaughtered it on Shabbat, exempt Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: Rav Pappa coming to teach us a cow?
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: If one had a stolen cow, and he slaughtered it on Shabbat - he is liable, because he was already liable for theft before he came to the prohibition of Shabbat. If one had a borrowed cow, and he slaughtered it on Shabbat - he is exempt. Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashe: Rav Papa, does a cow come to teach us?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַב פָּפָּא, שְׁאוּלָה אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, הוֹאִיל וְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מִשְּׁעַת מְשִׁיכָה הוּא דְּאִתְחַיַּיב לֵיהּ בִּמְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ, הָכָא נָמֵי: מִשְּׁעַת שְׁאֵלָה אִתְחַיַּיב בְּאוּנְסֶיהָ. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: said to him: Rav Pappa is coming to teach us borrowed it could enter your mind to say since Rav Pappa said: from the moment of pulling that is obligated to sustenance, here too, from the moment of borrowing he is liable for its unavoidable accidents. he teaches us
llm_translation: He said to him: Rav Papa, Shaula has come to hear. According to your opinion I would say, since Rav Papa said: From the moment of attraction he is obligated in her sustenance, here too: From the moment of request he is obligated in her penalties. This is what we have heard.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הִנִּיחַ לָהֶן אֲבִיהֶן פָּרָה שְׁאוּלָה — מִשְׁתַּמְּשִׁין בָּהּ כׇּל יְמֵי שְׁאֵלָתָהּ, מֵתָה — אֵין חַיָּיבִין בְּאוֹנְסָהּ. כִּסְבוּרִין שֶׁל אֲבִיהֶם הִיא וּטְבָחוּהָ וַאֲכָלוּהָ — מְשַׁלְּמִין דְּמֵי בָשָׂר בְּזוֹל. הִנִּיחַ לָהֶן אֲבִיהֶן אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים — חַיָּיבִין לְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: Rava said: their father left them a borrowed cow, they may use it the entire period it was borrowed. died, they are not liable for its unavoidable accident, they thought was their father’s and they slaughtered it and ate it, they pay only a reduced price of the meat. their father left them property guarantee they are obligated to pay
llm_translation: Rava said: If their father left them a cow that is suspected of being a gorer, and they used it all the days of their questioning, and it died, they are not liable for its damage. They hold that it belongs to their father, and they slaughtered it and ate it - they pay the price of the meat at a low price. If their father left them inherited property - they are obligated to pay.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַרֵישָׁא, וְאִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא. מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַרֵישָׁא, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אַסֵּיפָא — וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַב פָּפָּא. וּמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא, אֲבָל אַרֵישָׁא לָא — וְהַיְינוּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא.
human_translation: Some teach this with regard to the first clause and some teach it with regard to the latter clause. one who teaches it with regard to the first clause, all the more so with regard to the latter clause, And differs of Rav Pappa, And one who teaches it with regard to the latter clause, however, with regard to the first clause, not And this is of Rav Pappa.
llm_translation: There is one who teaches the first part, and there is one who teaches the last part. Whoever teaches the first part, certainly the last part - and this is the dispute of Rav Papa. And whoever teaches the last part, but not the first part - and this is Rav Papa's opinion.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא אָמַר כְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּקָא מוֹקֵים לָהּ כְּרַבָּנַן. אֶלָּא רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן? אָמַר לָךְ: כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ — פָּטוּר, כִּי לָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ — נָמֵי פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Granted, Rabbi Yoḥanan, did not state in accordance with Reish Lakish, as he establishes in accordance with the Rabbis, However, what is the reason Reish Lakish didn’t state in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan? said to you: Since if they forewarned him exempt when they did not forewarn him, exempt as well.
llm_translation: In truth, Rabbi Yochanan did not say like Reish Lakish, for he establishes it like the Rabbanan. Rather, what is the reason Reish Lakish did not say like Rabbi Yochanan? He said to you: Since if you found it - you are exempt, but if you did not find it - you are also exempt.

hebrew_text: וְאָזְדוּ לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ. דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת שׁוֹגְגִין, וְחַיָּיבֵי מַלְקִיּוֹת שׁוֹגְגִין וְדָבָר אַחֵר — רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: חַיָּיב, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: פָּטוּר. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר חַיָּיב — דְּהָא לָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר פָּטוּר — כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ — פָּטוּר, כִּי לָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ — נָמֵי פָּטוּר.
human_translation: And follow their reasoning as when Rav Dimi came he said: those unwittingly liable to death those unwittingly liable lashes, and another matter, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: liable And Reish Lakish said exempt. Rabbi Yoḥanan said liable; since they did not forewarn him, Reish Lakish said exempt; since if they forewarned him exempt when they did not forewarn him, exempt as well.
llm_translation: And they went according to their reasons. For when Rav Dimi came, he said: Those liable to death penalties inadvertently, and those liable to lashes inadvertently, and another matter - Rabbi Yochanan said: Liable, and Reish Lakish said: Exempt. Rabbi Yochanan said liable - because it is not found in it. Reish Lakish said exempt - since if it is found in it - exempt, and if it is not found in it - also exempt.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״וְלֹא יִהְיֶה אָסוֹן עָנוֹשׁ יֵעָנֵשׁ״,
human_translation: Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan “And yet no harm follow, he shall be punished
llm_translation: Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: "And there shall be no harm, a punishment shall be punished."

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, אָסוֹן מַמָּשׁ! לָא, דִּין אָסוֹן. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: ״וְלֹא יִהְיֶה אָסוֹן עָנוֹשׁ יֵעָנֵשׁ״, מַאי לָאו, דִּין אָסוֹן? לֹא, אָסוֹן מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: Is not actual harm, No, sentence of harm. Some say Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish: “And yet no harm follow, he shall be punished” is not a sentence of harm? No, actual harm.
llm_translation: What is "Lavo," actual damage! No, it is the law of damage. There are those who say, Rabbi Yochanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish: "And there shall be no actual damage, he shall surely be punished." What is "Lavo," the law of damage? No, it is not actual damage.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּמִי אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת שׁוֹגְגִין חַיָּיבִים? וְהָא תָּנָא דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה: ״מַכֵּה אָדָם״ וּ״מַכֵּה בְהֵמָה״ —
human_translation: Rava said: Is there anyone who said those unwittingly liable to death are obligated But didn’t of the school of Ḥizkiyya teach: one who smites a person, and one who smites an animal.
llm_translation: Rava said: And who is there according to the one who says those liable to death penalties for unintentional sins are liable? But didn't the Mishnah of the school of Hizkiyah teach: "One who strikes a man" and "One who strikes an animal" —

hebrew_text: מָה מַכֵּה בְהֵמָה לֹא חִילַּקְתָּ בּוֹ בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד, בֵּין מִתְכַּוֵּין לְשֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין, בֵּין דֶּרֶךְ יְרִידָה לְדֶרֶךְ עֲלִיָּיה לְפוֹטְרוֹ מָמוֹן, אֶלָּא לְחַיְּיבוֹ מָמוֹן — אַף מַכֵּה אָדָם לֹא תַּחְלוֹק בּוֹ בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד, בֵּין מִתְכַּוֵּין לְשֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין, בֵּין דֶּרֶךְ יְרִידָה לְדֶרֶךְ עֲלִיָּיה — לְחַיְּיבוֹ מָמוֹן, אֶלָּא לְפוֹטְרוֹ מָמוֹן.
human_translation: Just as in who smites an animal, you did not distinguish between unwittingly and intentionally, between with intent and one who with no intent, between in a downward motion and in an upward motion, to exempt money but rather to obligate him to money; so too, in who smites a person, do not distinguish between unwittingly and intentionally, between with intent and one who with no intent, between in a downward motion and in an upward motion. to obligate him money but rather to exempt him money.
llm_translation: The one who strikes an animal, you do not differentiate in it, whether unintentionally or intentionally, whether one intended or did not intend, whether from a lower level to a higher level, in order to exempt him from payment, rather to obligate him to pay. So too, one who strikes a person, you do not differentiate in it, whether unintentionally or intentionally, whether one intended or did not intend, whether from a lower level to a higher level - to obligate him to pay, rather to exempt him from payment.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר: חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת שׁוֹגְגִין — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּפְטוּרִין. כִּי פְּלִיגִי, בְּחַיָּיבֵי מַלְקוֹת שׁוֹגְגִין וְדָבָר אַחֵר. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר חַיָּיב: חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת אִיתַּקּוּשׁ, חַיָּיבֵי מַלְקִיּוֹת לָא אִיתַּקּוּשׁ. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר פָּטוּר: בְּפֵירוּשׁ רִיבְּתָה תּוֹרָה חַיָּיבֵי מַלְקִיּוֹת כְּחַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, when Ravin came he said: those unwittingly liable to death penalty, everyone agrees that are exempt, When they disagree with regard to those unwittingly liable to lashes, and another matter, Rabbi Yoḥanan said obligated those liable to death penalty are juxtaposed those liable lashes are not juxtaposed. Reish Lakish said: exempt, as the Torah explicitly included those liable to lashes, like those liable to death
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, when Ravin came, he said: Those liable to accidental death — everyone agrees they are exempt. When they disagree, it is regarding those liable to lashes accidentally and another matter. Rabbi Yochanan said: liable to death are subject to inquiry, those liable to lashes are not subject to inquiry. Resh Lakish said: exempt, for Torah explicitly compared those liable to lashes to those liable to death.

hebrew_text: הֵיכָן רִיבְּתָה תּוֹרָה? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אָתְיָא ״רָשָׁע״ ״רָשָׁע״. רָבָא אָמַר אָתְיָא ״מַכֵּה״ ״מַכֵּה״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא: הֵי ״מַכֵּה״? אִילֵימָא ״וּמַכֵּה בְהֵמָה יְשַׁלְּמֶנָּה וּמַכֵּה אָדָם יוּמָת״ — הַאי בִּקְטָלָא כְּתִיב! אֶלָּא הַאי ״מַכֵּה״: ״מַכֵּה נֶפֶשׁ בְּהֵמָה יְשַׁלְּמֶנָּה נֶפֶשׁ תַּחַת נָפֶשׁ״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״וְאִישׁ כִּי יִתֵּן מוּם בַּעֲמִיתוֹ [כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה כֵּן יֵעָשֶׂה לּוֹ]״.
human_translation: Where did Torah include Abaye said: derived wicked wicked Rava said: derived smites smites Rav Pappa said to Rava: which smites If we say “And one who smites an animal shall pay for it, and one who smites a person shall die” that is written with regard to death. Rather, this smites “And he who smites an animal shall pay for it, a life for a life” and juxtaposed to it, “And a man who places a blemish upon his counterpart, as he has done so shall be done to him”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Where did the Torah argue? Abaye said: It comes "wicked" "wicked." Rava said: It comes "striking" "striking." Rav Papa said to Rava: Is it "striking"? If you say "and one who strikes an animal shall pay for it, and one who strikes a man shall die" - this is written in the context of a fatal blow! Rather, this "striking": "one who strikes a soul of an animal shall pay for it, a soul for a soul," and it is juxtaposed with: "And if a man inflicts a blemish upon his fellow as he has done, so shall be done to him."

hebrew_text: וְהַאי לָאו ״מַכֵּה״ הִיא! אֲנַן הַכָּאָה הַכָּאָה קָאָמְרִינַן. וְהָא כִּי כְּתִיב — בְּחוֹבֵל בַּחֲבֵירוֹ הוּא דִּכְתִיב, וְחוֹבֵל בַּחֲבֵירוֹ בַּר תַּשְׁלוּמִין הוּא! אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְהַכָּאָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה — תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְהַכָּאָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: But this is not smites. We are saying smiting smiting However, when is written, it is written with regard to one who injures another, and one who injures another is subject to payment If it is not a matter of smiting that value of a peruta , apply it matter of smiting that value of a peruta .
llm_translation: And this is not "striking"! We are saying here striking, striking. And this is because it is written - "when one injures his fellow," it is written, and injuring his fellow is for monetary compensation! If it is not a matter of striking that involves a prutah - give him a matter of striking that does not involve a prutah.

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף לָאו בַּר תַּשְׁלוּמִין הוּא? לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּבַהֲדֵי דְּמַחְיֵיהּ, קְרַע שִׁירָאִין דִּילֵיהּ.
human_translation: Ultimately, is not subject to payment, necessary only where at the time that he struck him he tore his silk.
llm_translation: At the end, is he not a son of repayment? It is not necessary, for while he is alive, he tears his own songs.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִיָּיא לְרָבָא: וּלְתַנָּא דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה דְּאָמַר ״מַכֵּה אָדָם״ וּ״מַכֵּה בְהֵמָה״, מִמַּאי דִּבְחוֹל כְּתִיב וְלֵיכָּא לְאִיפְּלוֹגֵי, דִּלְמָא בְּשַׁבָּת כְּתִיב דְּבִבְהֵמָה גּוּפַהּ אִיכָּא לְאִיפְּלוֹגֵי!
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya said to Rava: And according to the of tanna of the school of Ḥizkiyya, who said: one who smites a person, and one who smites an animal. From where that it is written with regard to a weekday and there is no to distinguish perhaps is stated with regard to Shabbat, when concerning the animal itself there is to distinguish
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Chiya to Rava: And to the Tanna of the school of Chizkiyah who said, "One who strikes a person" and "One who strikes an animal," from where is it derived that in secular matters it is written, and there is no room for dispute, perhaps in the case of Shabbat it is written, for in the case of an animal, its body, there is room for dispute!

hebrew_text: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמַכֵּה בְהֵמָה יְשַׁלְּמֶנָּה וּמַכֵּה אָדָם יוּמָת״. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּלָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ, מַכֵּה אָדָם אַמַּאי יוּמָת? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא דְּאַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ. וְאִי בְּשַׁבָּת, מַכֵּה בְּהֵמָה יְשַׁלְּמֶנָּה?! אֶלָּא לָאו בְּחוֹל.
human_translation: should not enter your mind, as it is written: “And one who smites an animal shall pay for it, and one who smites a person shall die” What are the circumstances If where did not forewarn him, one who smites a person why should he be executed? Rather, obvious that they forewarned him. And if on Shabbat one who smites an animal pay for it? Rather, isn’t during the week?
llm_translation: Your understanding is not correct, as it is written: "And if a man causes a blemish in his neighbor, as he has done, so shall it be done to him: fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth. Just as he has caused a blemish in a man, so shall it be done to him." How so? If it is not found in him, why should a man who causes a blemish be put to death? Rather, it is obvious that it is found in him. And if it is on Shabbat, should one who causes a blemish in an animal be liable to pay for it?! Rather, it is not on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: לְרַבָּה דְּאָמַר חִידּוּשׁ הוּא שֶׁחִידְּשָׁה תּוֹרָה בִּקְנָס, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיקְּטִיל, מְשַׁלֵּם, מַתְנִיתִין כְּמַאן מוֹקֵים לַהּ? אִי כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, קַשְׁיָא בִּתּוֹ! אִי כְּרַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא בֶּן הַקָּנָה, קַשְׁיָא אֲחוֹתוֹ! אִי כְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק, קַשְׁיָא מַמְזֶרֶת!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: According to Rabba, said: It is a novel element that the Torah innovated with regard to fine, and even though he is executed he pays in accordance with whose does establish the mishna? If in accordance with Rabbi Meir, difficult; his daughter? If in accordance with Rabbi Neḥunya ben HaKana, difficult, his sister? If in accordance with Rabbi Yitzḥak, difficult, a mamzeret ,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: According to Rabbah who said it is a novelty that Torah was innovated through a penalty, and even though he is strict, he pays. Mishnaic teachings, who is he compared to? If to Rabbi Meir, his daughter is difficult! If to Rabbi Nechunia ben Hakanah, his sister is difficult! If to Rabbi Yitzchak, his mother is difficult!

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא אִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן — הוּא נָמֵי מְתָרֵץ לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אֶלָּא אִי סָבַר כְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, הֵיכִי מְתָרֵץ לַהּ? עַל כׇּרְחָךְ כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: This well if holds in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan, he can explain as well, in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan, However, if he holds in accordance with Reish Lakish, how does explain You perforce he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan
llm_translation: The Gemara: If he left it, if he holds like Rabbi Yochanan - he is indeed interpreting it like Rabbi Yochanan. But if he holds like Reish Lakish, how is he interpreting it? Certainly he interprets it like Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מַתְנָא לְאַבָּיֵי, לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּאָמַר: בְּפֵירוּשׁ רִיבְּתָה תּוֹרָה חַיָּיבֵי מַלְקִיּוֹת כְּחַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת, מַאן תַּנָּא דִּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא בֶּן הַקָּנָה? אִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אִי רַבִּי יִצְחָק.
human_translation: Rav Mattana said to Abaye: According to Reish Lakish, who said the Torah explicitly included those liable to lashes like those liable to death who is the tanna who disagrees with Rabbi Neḥunya ben HaKana either Rabbi Meir, or Rabbi Yitzḥak,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Matna to Abbaye, to Reish Lakish who said: In the explanation of the Torah, those liable for lashes are like those liable for death penalties. Who is the Tanna who disputes with Rabbi Neḥunia ben HaKanah? Either Rabbi Meir or Rabbi Yitzchak.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עֲרָיוֹת וּשְׁנִיּוֹת לַעֲרָיוֹת — אֵין לָהֶן לֹא קְנָס וְלֹא פִּיתּוּי. הַמְמָאֶנֶת — אֵין לָהּ לֹא קְנָס וְלֹא פִּיתּוּי. אַיְילוֹנִית — אֵין לָהּ לֹא קְנָס וְלֹא פִּיתּוּי, וְהַיּוֹצֵאת מִשּׁוּם שֵׁם רָע — אֵין לָהּ לֹא קְנָס וְלֹא פִּיתּוּי.
human_translation: The Sages taught: forbidden relatives and secondary forbidden relatives neither a fine nor seduction. who refuses neither a fine nor seduction. A sexually underdeveloped woman [ ailonit ] neither a fine nor seduction. And one who leaves due to a bad reputation neither a fine nor seduction.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Regarding forbidden relationships and secondary forbidden relationships to the forbidden relationships - they do not have either a penalty or a warning. One who refuses - she does not have either a penalty or a warning. A woman who is married - she does not have either a penalty or a warning, and one who engages in relations for the sake of a bad reputation - she does not have either a penalty or a warning.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״עֲרָיוֹת״ וּמַאי ״שְׁנִיּוֹת לַעֲרָיוֹת״? אִילֵימָא ״עֲרָיוֹת״ —
human_translation: What is forbidden relatives, and what is secondary forbidden relatives If we say forbidden relatives
llm_translation: What is "ervah" and what is "shniyot la'ervah"? If you say "ervah" —

hebrew_text: עֲרָיוֹת מַמָּשׁ, ״שְׁנִיּוֹת״ — מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים, כֵּיוָן דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא חַזְיָא לֵיהּ, אַמַּאי אֵין לָהֶן קְנָס? אֶלָּא: ״עֲרָיוֹת״ — חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין, ״שְׁנִיּוֹת״ — חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת. אֲבָל חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין יֵשׁ לָהֶן קְנָס, וּמַנִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּימְנִי הִיא.
human_translation: actual forbidden relatives secondary relatives by rabbinic law, since are suitable for him by Torah why do they not a fine Rather, Forbidden relatives those liable court-imposed death secondary relatives those liable karet , However, those liable for prohibitions fine And whose It is Shimon HaTimni,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ervaot mamash, 'shniyot' — midivrei sofrim, keivan de'mid'orayta chazya lei, amai ein lahen kenas? Ela: 'ervaot' — chayavei mitot beit din, 'shniyot' — chayavei karet. Aval chayavei lavin yesh lahen kenas, u'mani Shimon HaTzimni hi." English translation: "Actual forbidden relationships, 'secondary' — from the words of the Sages, since it is seen from the Torah, why do they not have a penalty? Rather: 'forbidden relationships' — liable to death penalties by the court, 'secondary' — liable to karet. But those liable for prohibitions have a penalty, and Shimon the Timnite is the one."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי ״עֲרָיוֹת״ — חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין וְחַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת, ״שְׁנִיּוֹת״ — חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין. מַנִּי — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא הִיא.
human_translation: Some say that forbidden relatives those liable to death court and those liable to karet , secondary those liable for prohibitions. whose It is Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya,
llm_translation: There are those who say, "Arayot" - liable to death by the court and liable to karet, "Shniyot" - liable to lashes. Who is the authority? Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya.

hebrew_text: הַמְמָאֶנֶת אֵין לָהּ לֹא קְנָס וְלֹא פִּיתּוּי. הָא קְטַנָּה בְּעָלְמָא — אִית לַהּ. מַנִּי — רַבָּנַן הִיא דְּאָמְרִי: קְטַנָּה יֵשׁ לָהּ קְנָס, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: אַיְילוֹנִית אֵין לָהּ לֹא קְנָס וְלֹא פִּיתּוּי. אֲתָאן לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: קְטַנָּה אֵין לָהּ קְנָס, וְהָא מִקַּטְנוּתָהּ יָצְתָה לְבֶגֶר. רֵישָׁא רַבָּנַן וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר!
human_translation: who refuses neither a fine nor seduction, an ordinary minor has whose It is the Rabbis, who say: A minor has Say the latter clause A sexually underdeveloped woman [ ailonit has neither a fine nor seduction, comes to Rabbi Meir, who said: A minor does not have fine and this emerged from her minor to a grown woman, The first clause is the Rabbis, and the latter clause is Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The one who refuses, she has neither penalty nor warning. If she is a minor - she has. From where? - The Rabbis, for they say: A minor has a penalty. Let us say the latter part: A young girl has neither penalty nor warning. They came to Rabbi Meir, for he said: A young girl has no penalty, and from her minority she has reached maturity. The first part is the Rabbis and the latter part is Rabbi Meir!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: כּוּלַּהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, וּבִמְמָאֶנֶת סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וּמִי סָבַר לַהּ? וְהָתַנְיָא: עַד מָתַי הַבַּת מְמָאֶנֶת — עַד שֶׁתָּבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיִּרְבֶּה שָׁחוֹר עַל הַלָּבָן.
human_translation: And if you say the entire is Rabbi Meir, and with regard to who refuses holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, but does he maintain that But isn’t it taught Until when can a girl refuse Until she develops two hairs, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: until black is greater than the white
llm_translation: And if you say: The whole case is according to Rabbi Meir, and in the case of refusal, she the daughter holds like Rabbi Yehuda. And who holds this? And it was taught: Until when does the daughter refuse? Until she brings two hairs, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until there is an increase of black hair on the white hair.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, וּבִקְטַנָּה סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. וּמִי סָבַר לַהּ? וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְאִם אִיתָא, ״זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! הַאי תַּנָּא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר בַּחֲדָא, וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא.
human_translation: Rather, is Rabbi Yehuda, and with a minor he holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who says But does he maintain that But didn’t Rav Yehuda say Rav said this is the statement of Rabbi Meir? And if it is so should have This is the statement of Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda. this tanna holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir with regard to one and disagrees with him with regard to one
llm_translation: Rather: Rabbi Yehuda she, and in the minor one he holds like Rabbi Meir. And who holds like her? And Rav Yehuda said in the name of Rav: This is the statement of Rabbi Meir. And if it is so, "This is the statement of Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda" should be required of it! This Tanna holds like Rabbi Meir in one aspect, and disagrees with him in one aspect.

hebrew_text: רַפְרָם אָמַר: מַאי ״מְמָאֶנֶת״ — הָרְאוּיָה לְמָאֵן. וְלִיתְנֵי קְטַנָּה! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rafram said: what is who refuses, one who is fit to refuse, And let teach a minor. difficult.
llm_translation: Rafḥam said: What is "memaneit" - suitable for whom. And it should have taught "ketana"! It is difficult.

hebrew_text: אַיְילוֹנִית אֵין לָהּ לֹא קְנָס וְלֹא פִּיתּוּי. וּרְמִינְהִי: הַחֵרֶשֶׁת וְהַשּׁוֹטָה וְהָאַיְילוֹנִית — יֵשׁ לָהֶן קְנָס, וְיֵשׁ לָהֶן טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים. וְהָא, מַאי רוּמְיָא? הָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, הָא רַבָּנַן! וּדְקָאָרֵי לַהּ, מַאי קָאָרֵי לַהּ!
human_translation: An ailonit has neither a fine nor seduction. And raises a contradiction A deaf-mute, an imbecile, and an ailonit have fine and they have a claim concerning virginity. And what contradiction this? This Rabbi Meir; that the Rabbis. And he who raised why did he raise it?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The "ayilonit" does not have either a penalty or a fine. And they raised a dilemma: "The deaf-mute, the imbecile, and the 'ayilonit' - do they have a penalty, and do they have a claim of virginity?" And what is the difference? This one is Rabbi Meir, and this one is the Rabbis! And they call it, what do they call it!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּאִית לֵיהּ לְמִירְמֵא אַחֲרִיתִי עִילָּוֵיהּ: הַחֵרֶשֶׁת וְהַשּׁוֹטָה וְהַבּוֹגֶרֶת ומוּכַּת עֵץ — אֵין לָהֶן טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים. הַסּוֹמָא וְאַיְילוֹנִית — יֵשׁ לָהֶן טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים. סוֹמְכוֹס אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: סוֹמָא אֵין לָהּ טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים.
human_translation: due to the fact that he has another to raise as a contradiction to it: A deaf-mute, and an imbecile, and a grown woman, and a woman whose hymen was torn do not have a claim concerning virginity, a blind and an ailonit have a claim concerning virginity. Sumakhos says in the name of Rabbi Meir: A blind does not have a claim concerning virginity.
llm_translation: Because it has a reason to be deceptive, its end is deceitful: the deaf-mute, the imbecile, the minor, and one who is struck with a wooden object - they do not have the status of virgins. The blind and the one with a growth - they have the status of virgins. Simeon the Essene says in the name of Rabbi Meir: The blind does not have the status of a virgin.
