hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְהָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. אֵימַר דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הֵיכָא דְּקָא טָעֲנָה אִיהִי, הֵיכָא דְּלָא קָא טָעֲנָה אִיהִי, מִי שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ? אִין, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מְהֵימְנָא, כְּגוֹן זוֹ ״פְּתַח פִּיךָ לְאִלֵּם״ הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: not difficult, this Rabban Gamliel, And that Rabbi Yehoshua, Say that you heard Rabban Gamliel where she claims where she did not claim did you hear he Yes, since Rabban Gamliel said believed like that, is “Open your mouth for the mute”
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said, it is not difficult: here is Rabban Gamliel, and here is Rabbi Yehoshua. Should you say that you listen to Rabban Gamliel where he makes a claim, but where he does not make a claim, do you not listen to him? No, since Rabban Gamliel said, "Open your mouth for the mute," it is like this.

hebrew_text: וְהַבּוֹגֶרֶת אֵין לָהּ טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים. וְהָאָמַר רַב: בּוֹגֶרֶת, נוֹתְנִין לָהּ לַיְלָה הָרִאשׁוֹן!
human_translation: A grown woman does not have a claim concerning virginity But didn’t Rav say: give a grown the first night,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And the bogeret does not have the claim of virginity. And Rav said: A bogeret, one gives to her on the first night!"

hebrew_text: אִי דְּקָא טָעֵין טַעֲנַת דָּמִים — הָכִי נָמֵי. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — דְּקָטָעֵין טַעֲנַת פֶּתַח פָּתוּחַ.
human_translation: If proffers a claim blood indeed with what are we dealing here with who proffers a claim open entrance,
llm_translation: If he is mistaken about the claim of blood - this is the ruling. Here, what are we dealing with? - they are cutting the claim of an open entrance.

hebrew_text: סוֹמְכוֹס אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: סוֹמָא אֵין לָהּ טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּסוֹמְכוֹס? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנֶּחְבֶּטֶת עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע. כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי חַבּוֹטֵי מִיחַבְּטִי? כּוּלְּהוּ, רוֹאוֹת וּמַרְאוֹת לְאִמָּן. זוֹ, אֵינָהּ רוֹאָה וְאֵינָהּ מַרְאָה לְאִמָּהּ.
human_translation: Sumakhos says in the name of Rabbi Meir: A blind does not have a claim concerning virginity. What is the rationale of Sumakhos? Rabbi Zeira said: Due to that is struck onto the ground, All to be struck as well; all of see and show their mother. This does not see and does not show her mother.
llm_translation: SOMCHOS says in the name of Rabbi Meir: A blind person does not have the status of a virgin. What is the reason for SOMCHOS' statement? Rabbi Zeira said: Because she stumbled on the ground. Are all those who stumble considered to have stumbled? All of them, they see and are seen to be trusted. This one, she does not see and is not seen to be trusted by her mother.

hebrew_text: וְהַיּוֹצֵאת מִשּׁוּם שֵׁם רָע אֵין לָהּ לֹא קְנָס וְלֹא פִּיתּוּי. הַיּוֹצֵאת מִשּׁוּם שֵׁם רָע — בַּת סְקִילָה הִיא! אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הָכִי קָאָמַר: מִי שֶׁיָּצָא עָלֶיהָ שֵׁם רַע בְּיַלְדוּתָהּ — אֵין לָהּ לֹא קְנָס וְלֹא פִּיתּוּי.
human_translation: And one who leaves due to a bad reputation has neither a fine nor seduction. One who leaves due to a bad reputation is subject to stoning Rav Sheshet said: This is what is saying: One about whom a bad reputation emerged in her youth has neither a fine nor seduction,
llm_translation: The one who goes out because of a bad name, she has neither a fine nor an enticement. The one who goes out because of a bad name - she is a daughter of stoning! Rav Sheshet said: This is what he meant to say: One who acquires a bad name in her youth - she has neither a fine nor an enticement.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַאי שְׁטָרָא רִיעָא לָא מַגְבֵּינַן בֵּיהּ. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דִּנְפַק קָלָא עֲלֵיהּ דִּשְׁטָרָא (דְּ)זַיְיפָא הוּא, דִּכְווֹתַהּ הָכָא, דִּנְפַק עֲלַהּ קָלָא דְּזַנַּאי, וְהָא אָמַר רָבָא: יָצָא לָהּ שֵׁם מְזַנָּה בָּעִיר — אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Conclude from it this tainted document we do not collect with it. What are the circumstances? If you say that a rumor emerged about it that it is a forged document, the corresponding here, that a rumor emerged about her that she engaged in sexual relations; but didn’t Rava say: a rumor emerged about in a town one who engaged in sexual relations, one not be concerned about it?
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, hear from it: this document, we do not establish it with a shepherd. How so? If you say because a voice went out against it of the document, that it is forged here, that a voice went out against it of adultery, and Rava said: if the name of a prostitute has left her in the city, we are not concerned for her.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דַּאֲתוֹ בֵּי תְרֵי וְאָמְרִי: לְדִידְהוּ תְּבַעְתַּנְהִי בְּאִיסּוּרָא. דִּכְווֹתַהּ הָכָא: דַּאֲתוֹ בֵּי תְרֵי וְאָמְרִי: לְדִידְהוּ אֲמַר לְהוּ: ״זַיִּיפוּ לִי״. בִּשְׁלָמָא הָתָם — שְׁכִיחִי פְּרוּצִין. אֶלָּא הָכָא, אִם הוּא הוּחְזַק, כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל מִי הוּחְזְקוּ? הָכָא נָמֵי: כֵּיוָן דְּקָא מְהַדַּר אַזִּיּוּפָא, אֵימַר, זַיּוֹפֵי זַיֵּיף וּכְתַב.
human_translation: Rather, that two came and said: She propositioned us in forbidden the corresponding here where two came and said he said to us: Forge for me. Granted, there, immoral men are common, However, here, if he assumed presumptive status do all the Jewish people assume presumptive status Here too, since he is seeking a forgery, say that forged and wrote
llm_translation: Rather, the House of Two came and said: In their opinion, they made a claim with regard to the prohibition. For here it is stated: The House of Two came and said: In their opinion, he said to them, "Adorn for me." Now, there it is understandable - it is common for breaches. But here, if it is established, who among the children of Israel is established? Here too: since he was honoring the adornment, he would say, "Adorn, adorn, and write."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן קְנָס: הַבָּא עַל הַגִּיּוֹרֶת וְעַל הַשְּׁבוּיָה וְעַל הַשִּׁפְחָה שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ וְשֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירוּ וְשֶׁנִּשְׁתַּחְרְרוּ, יְתֵירוֹת עַל בְּנוֹת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שְׁבוּיָה שֶׁנִּפְדֵּית — הֲרֵי הִיא בִּקְדוּשָּׁתָהּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁגְּדוֹלָה.
human_translation: And these who do not a fine One who has intercourse with a convert or with a captive or with a maidservant, who were redeemed, converted, or emancipated more than three years and one day Rabbi Yehuda says: A captive who was redeemed in her sanctity even though an adult,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are cases that do not incur a penalty: one who has relations with a convert, a freed captive, or a freed maidservant, who were redeemed, converted, and freed, are exempt. Also exempt are daughters under the age of three years and one day. Rabbi Yehuda says: A redeemed captive retains her sanctity, even though she is an adult.

hebrew_text: הַבָּא עַל בִּתּוֹ, עַל בַּת בִּתּוֹ, עַל בַּת בְּנוֹ, עַל בַּת אִשְׁתּוֹ, עַל בַּת בְּנָהּ, עַל בַּת בִּתָּהּ — אֵין לָהֶן קְנָס, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמִּתְחַיֵּיב בְּנַפְשׁוֹ, שֶׁמִּיתָתָן בִּידֵי בֵּית דִּין. וְכׇל הַמִּתְחַיֵּיב בְּנַפְשׁוֹ אֵין מְשַׁלֵּם מָמוֹן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִם לֹא יִהְיֶה אָסוֹן עָנוֹשׁ יֵעָנֵשׁ״.
human_translation: one who engages in intercourse with his daughter, with his daughter’s daughter, with his son’s daughter, with his wife’s daughter, with her son’s daughter, with her daughter’s daughter; they do not a fine. due to that he is liable death that their death the court, and anyone who is liable death does not pay money, as it is stated: “And yet no harm follow, he shall be punished”
llm_translation: One who comes upon his daughter, his granddaughter, his great-granddaughter, his wife's daughter, his daughter-in-law, or his stepdaughter - they do not have a fine, because he is liable for his own life, as their death is in the hands of the court. And anyone who is liable for his own life does not pay money, as it is stated: "But if there is harm, then you shall give life for life."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי דּוֹסָא אָמְרוּ דָּבָר אֶחָד. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. רַבִּי דּוֹסָא, דְּתַנְיָא: שְׁבוּיָה — אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי דּוֹסָא. אָמַר רַבִּי דּוֹסָא: וְכִי מָה עָשָׂה לָהּ עַרְבִי הַלָּז? וְכִי מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמִּיעֵךְ לָהּ בֵּין דַּדֶּיהָ, פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Dosa said one thing Rabbi Yehuda that we said Rabbi Dosa as it is taught A captive partakes of teruma ; the statement of Rabbi Dosa. Rabbi Dosa said: And what did this Arab do to her? And due to that he squeezed between her breasts, render her unfit the priesthood?
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Dosa said one thing. Rabbi Yehuda - this is what we said. Rabbi Dosa, as it was taught: A captive woman eats of the terumah, the words of Rabbi Dosa. Rabbi Dosa said: And what did this Arab do to her? Just because he heard her between her breasts, he disqualifies her from the priesthood?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: דִּלְמָא לָא הִיא, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָכָא, אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא חוֹטֵא נִשְׂכָּר? אֲבָל הָתָם — כְּרַבָּנַן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ. אִי נָמֵי: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי דּוֹסָא הָתָם, אֶלָּא בִּתְרוּמָה דְּרַבָּנַן. אֲבָל קְנָס דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — כְּרַבָּנַן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabba said: Perhaps that is not so, Rabbi Yehuda states only here so that sinner will not profit However, there, he holds in accordance with the Rabbis, Alternatively, Rabbi Dosa stated only there, with regard to teruma by rabbinic However, fine, by Torah he holds in accordance with the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Rabba said: Perhaps it is not so, until here Rabbi Yehuda did not say, but rather that one should not sin intentionally? But there, according to Rabanan, he agrees. Alternatively: Until here Rabbi Dosa did not say, but rather concerning the Terumah of Rabanan. But a penalty from the Torah - according to Rabanan, he agrees.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָכָא, שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא חוֹטֵא נִשְׂכָּר הוּא? וְהָא תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שְׁבוּיָה שֶׁנִּשְׁבֵּית — הֲרֵי הִיא בִּקְדוּשָּׁתָהּ, אֲפִילּוּ בַּת עֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים — כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מָאתַיִם. וְהָתָם מַאי ״שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא חוֹטֵא נִשְׂכָּר״ אִיכָּא? הָתָם נָמֵי, דִּלְמָא מִימַּנְעִי וְלָא נָסְבִי לַהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said to And is the rationale Rabbi Yehuda here, that sinner will not profit? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: A captive who was taken captive in her sanctity Even ten years old, her marriage contract is two hundred And there, what is there that sinner will not profit? There too, perhaps men would refrain and not marry her,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And the reason of Rabbi Yehuda here, that a captive should not be considered a sinner? But it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says: A captive who was violated - she retains her sanctity, even if she is a nine-year-old girl - her marriage contract is worth two hundred. And there, what is the meaning of "that a captive should not be considered a sinner"? There too, perhaps she was withheld and not consented to.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בִּקְדוּשְׁתַּהּ קָיְימָה? וְהָתַנְיָא: הַפּוֹדֶה אֶת הַשְּׁבוּיָה — יִשָּׂאֶנָּה. מֵעִיד בָּהּ — לֹא יִשָּׂאֶנָּה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ לֹא יִשָּׂאֶנָּה! הָא גּוּפַהּ קַשְׁיָא, אָמְרַתְּ: הַפּוֹדֶה אֶת הַשְּׁבוּיָה — יִשָּׂאֶנָּה, וַהֲדַר תְּנָא: מֵעִיד בָּהּ — לֹא יִשָּׂאֶנָּה. מִשּׁוּם דְּמֵעִיד בָּהּ לֹא יִשָּׂאֶנָּה?!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda maintain in her sanctity? But isn’t it taught One who redeems a captive may marry her, testifies she he may not marry her? Rabbi Yehuda says: Both this and that he may not marry her, This itself is difficult. you said: One who redeems a captive may marry her, and then it was taught: testifies she he may not marry her. due to that he testifies she he may not marry her?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yehuda thought, in her holiness she remains? And it was taught: One who redeems a captive - he shall marry her. If he testifies about her - he shall not marry her. Rabbi Yehuda says: In either case, he shall not marry her! This is a difficulty in itself, you say: One who redeems a captive - he shall marry her, and then the Tanna teaches: If he testifies about her - he shall not marry her. Because if he testifies about her, he shall not marry her?!

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: הַפּוֹדֶה אֶת הַשְּׁבוּיָה וּמֵעִיד בָּהּ — יִשָּׂאֶנָּה, מֵעִיד בָּהּ כְּדִי — לֹא יִשָּׂאֶנָּה.
human_translation: not difficult, this is what is saying: One who redeems a captive and testifies she may marry her. only testifies she he may not marry her.
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: "This is not difficult, thus he said: One who redeems the captive woman and testifies about her — he may marry her, if he testifies about her accurately — he may not marry her."

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם קַשְׁיָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, אֵימָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ יִשָּׂאֶנָּה. רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם כִּדְקָתָנֵי, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְדִבְרֵיהֶם דְּרַבָּנַן קָאָמַר לְהוּ: לְדִידִי — בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ יִשָּׂאֶנָּה, אֶלָּא לְדִידְכוּ — בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ לֹא יִשָּׂאֶנָּה מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: In any case, difficult to Rabbi Yehuda, Rav Pappa said: say Rabbi Yehuda says: Both this that he may marry her. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, says: Actually, as it was taught. Rabbi Yehuda spoke to them to the statement of the Rabbis. to my both this and that he may marry her. However, to your should be both this and that he may not marry her.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From every place difficult for Rabbi Yehuda! Rav Papa said, perhaps Rabbi Yehuda says: In this way and in that way she shall be lifted. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, says: Always as they taught, Rabbi Yehuda according to the words of the Rabbis says to them: According to me - in this way and in that way she shall be lifted, but according to you - in this way and in that way she shall not be lifted, he wants it!

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: הַפּוֹדֶה אֶת הַשְּׁבוּיָה וּמֵעִיד בָּהּ יִשָּׂאֶנָּה — לָא שָׁדֵי אִינִישׁ זוּזֵי בִּכְדִי. מֵעִיד בָּהּ כְּדִי לֹא יִשָּׂאֶנָּה — שֶׁמָּא עֵינָיו נָתַן בָּהּ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis One who redeems a captive testifies she may marry her, a person does not throw money for nothing. only testifies she may not marry her, lest he had his eye on her
llm_translation: The Sages: One who redeems a captive and testifies about her, he should not give less than the value. If he testifies about her but does not give the value, perhaps he has set his eyes on her.

hebrew_text: רָמֵי לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יוֹסֵף:
human_translation: Rav Pappa bar Shmuel raised a contradiction before Rav Yosef:
llm_translation: Rav Papa son of Shmuel raised an objection to Rav Yosef:

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בִּקְדוּשְׁתַּהּ קָיְימָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: הַגִּיּוֹרֶת שֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירָה וְרָאֲתָה דָּם, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: דַּיָּהּ שְׁעָתָהּ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי הִיא כְּכׇל הַנָּשִׁים, וּמְטַמְּאָה מֵעֵת לְעֵת, וּמִפְּקִידָה לִפְקִידָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda maintain remains in her sanctity? But isn’t it taught convert who converted and saw blood Rabbi Yehuda says: her hour is sufficient for her. Rabbi Yosei says: Her is like all the women, and she transmits impurity for a twenty-four hour period from examination to examination,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yehuda thought in her holiness she is established? And it was taught: A female convert who converted and saw blood, Rabbi Yehuda says: Her time is sufficient. Rabbi Yosei says: She is like all other women, and she becomes impure from time to time, and from period to period.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר לֵיאָרֵס וְלִינָּשֵׂא מִיָּד. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גִּיּוֹרֶת אַשְּׁבוּיָהּ קָא רָמֵית? גִּיּוֹרֶת לָא מְנַטְּרָא נַפְשַׁהּ, שְׁבוּיָה מְנַטְּרָא נַפְשַׁהּ.
human_translation: And is required to wait three months the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei permits her to be betrothed and to be married immediately. said to Are you raising a contradiction a convert to a captive A convert does not protect herself a captive protects herself,
llm_translation: And needs to wait three months, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei permits engagement and marriage immediately. He said to him: Have you raised a convert who is still in captivity? A convert does not protect themselves, a captive protects themselves.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִי שְׁבוּיָה אַשְּׁבוּיָהּ, דְּתַנְיָא: הַגִּיּוֹרֶת וְהַשְּׁבוּיָה וְהַשִּׁפְחָה שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ וְשֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירוּ וְשֶׁנִּשְׁתַּחְרְרוּ יְתֵירוֹת עַל בְּנוֹת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד — צְרִיכוֹת לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר לֵיאָרֵס וְלִינָּשֵׂא מִיָּד. אִשְׁתִּיק.
human_translation: And raised a contradiction from a captive to a captive, as it is taught The convert, or the captive or the maidservant, who were redeemed, converted, or emancipated more than three years and one day are required to wait three months the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei permits to be betrothed and to be married immediately. was silent,
llm_translation: "And a non-Jewish captive, her captivity is captivity, as it was taught: A convert, a captive, and a freed maidservant who were redeemed, converted, and freed, are permitted to marry Jewish men after three years and one day - according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei permits engagement and marriage immediately. He remained silent."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִידֵּי שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ בְּהָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, שֶׁרָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה. אִי הָכִי מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי? אָמַר רַבָּה, קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אִשָּׁה מְזַנָּה מְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת בְּמוֹךְ, שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְעַבֵּר.
human_translation: said to him: Have you heard anything with regard to this said to him: This Rav Sheshet said: whom saw engage in intercourse. If so, what is the rationale Rabbi Yosei Rabba said: Rabbi Yosei holds a woman who engages in sexual relations has relations with resorbent that she will not become pregnant.
llm_translation: He said to him: From what did you hear this? He said to him: Thus said Rav Sheshet, that it is seen that she has been married. If so, what is the reason for Rabbi Yosei? Rabba said, Rabbi Yosei holds: A promiscuous woman uses contraception, so she will not conceive.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא גִּיּוֹרֶת, כֵּיוָן דְּדַעְתַּהּ לְאִיגַּיּוֹרֵי מְנַטְּרָא נַפְשַׁהּ. שְׁבוּיָה נָמֵי, דְּלָא יָדְעָה הֵיכָא מַמְטוּ לָהּ. שִׁפְחָה נָמֵי, דְּשָׁמְעָה מִפִּי מָרַהּ. אֶלָּא יוֹצְאָה בְּשֵׁן וָעַיִן, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: Granted, a convert since it is her intention to convert, she protects herself A captive too she does not know where they are taking her, A maidservant too, as she heard from her master However, emerges with tooth or eye, what is there to say?
llm_translation: In peace convert, since her intention is for conversion, she guards herself. A captive woman, for she does not know where to go. A maidservant, for she heard from her mistress. Rather, she goes out with tooth and eye, what can be said?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא כֹּל מִמֵּילָא לָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הֲרֵי אֲנוּסָה וּמְפוּתָּה, דְּמִמֵּילָא, וְתַנְיָא: אֲנוּסָה וּמְפוּתָּה צְרִיכוֹת לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר לֵיאָרֵס וְלִינָּשֵׂא מִיָּד!
human_translation: And if you say any on its own, Rabbi Yosei did not say a raped or seduced on its own and it is taught A raped woman and a seduced woman must wait three months the statement of Rabbi Yehuda; Rabbi Yosei permits to be betrothed and to be married immediately.
llm_translation: And if you will say, "All from the outset, did not Rabbi Yosei say," behold, one who is coerced and one who is seduced, it is from the outset, and it was taught: One who is coerced and one who is seduced require waiting three months, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei permits engagement and marriage immediately!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבָּה: קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אִשָּׁה מְזַנָּה מִתְהַפֶּכֶת כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְעַבֵּר. וְאִידַּךְ? חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא לֹא נֶהֶפְכָה יָפֶה יָפֶה.
human_translation: Rather, Rabba said: Rabbi Yosei holds: A woman engages in sexual relations turns over that she will not become pregnant. And the other We are concerned lest she did not turn over properly,
llm_translation: Rather, Rabah said: Rabbi Yosei holds the opinion that a promiscuous woman behaves in a provocative manner so as not to conceive. And the other opinion? We are concerned lest she does not conceive very beautifully.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְלֹא יִהְיֶה אָסוֹן עָנוֹשׁ יֵעָנֵשׁ וְכוּ׳. וְהָא מֵהָכָא נָפְקָא? מֵהָתָם נָפְקָא: ״כְּדֵי רִשְׁעָתוֹ״, מִשּׁוּם רִשְׁעָה אַחַת אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁתֵּי רִשְׁעָיוֹת!
human_translation: as it is stated: “And yet no harm follow, he shall be punished, etc.” And is this derived from here? it is derived from there: according to the measure of his iniquity” You can hold liable for one iniquity, but you do not hold him liable for two iniquities,
llm_translation: As it is stated, "and there shall be no harm, the punishment shall be punishment, etc." And how do we derive this from there? It is derived from there: "according to his wickedness," because of one wickedness you hold him liable, but if you do not hold him liable because of two wickednesses!

hebrew_text: חֲדָא בְּמִיתָה וּמָמוֹן, וַחֲדָא בְּמַלְקוֹת וּמָמוֹן. וּצְרִיכָא: דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן מִיתָה וּמָמוֹן, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא אִיבּוּד נְשָׁמָה, אֲבָל מַלְקוֹת וּמָמוֹן, דְּלֵיכָּא אִיבּוּד נְשָׁמָה, אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: One with regard to death and money, And one with regard to lashes and money, And are necessary, as if taught us death and money, due to that there is loss of life, however, lashes and money, where there is no loss of life, say no,
llm_translation: One case regarding death and money, and one case regarding lashes and money. And it is necessary: for if we were to hear a case of death and money, because there is the issue of the loss of a soul, but lashes and money, where there is no issue of the loss of a soul, we might say no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן מַלְקוֹת וּמָמוֹן, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא חֲמִיר אִיסּוּרֵיהּ. אֲבָל מִיתָה וּמָמוֹן, דַּחֲמִיר אִיסּוּרֵיהּ, אֵימָא לָא. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if taught us lashes and money, due to that prohibition is not severe, However, death and money, where prohibition is severe, say no, necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear lashes and money, because it is not stringent in its prohibitions. But death and money, since its prohibitions are stringent, we may say no. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּאָמַר לוֹקֶה וּמְשַׁלֵּם, תַּרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי? חֲדָא בְּמִיתָה וּמָמוֹן,
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Meir, who said is flogged and pays why do I two One with regard to death and money,
llm_translation: To Rabbi Meir who says "He is lashed and pays," why do I need two? One for death and money.

hebrew_text: וַחֲדָא בְּמִיתָה וּמַלְקוֹת. וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן מִיתָה וּמָמוֹן, מִשּׁוּם דַּחֲדָא בְּגוּפֵיהּ וַחֲדָא בְּמָמוֹנֵיהּ לָא עָבְדִינַן. אֲבָל בְּמִיתָה וּמַלְקוֹת, דְּאִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּגוּפֵיהּ, אֵימָא מִיתָה אֲרִיכְתָּא הִיא, וְנַעְבֵּיד בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: and one with regard to death and lashes, And are necessary, as if taught us death and monetary due to that we do not administer one to his body and one to his money. However, with regard to death and lashes, that both this, and that, to his body, say it is an extended death and let us administer to him
llm_translation: One is liable with regard to death penalty and lashes. And it is necessary, for if we were to hear liability for death penalty and monetary payment, because one transgression in regard to his person and one transgression in regard to his money we would not be able to do anything. But with regard to death penalty and lashes, since both transgressions are in regard to his person, say we, perhaps death penalty is more severe, and we bring the punishment upon him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן מִיתָה וּמַלְקוֹת, דְּתַרְתֵּי בְּגוּפֵיהּ לָא עָבְדִינַן. אֲבָל מִיתָה וּמָמוֹן, דַּחֲדָא בְּגוּפֵיהּ וַחֲדָא בְּמָמוֹנֵיהּ, אֵימָא נַעֲבֵיד בֵּיהּ. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if taught us death and lashes, due to that we do not administer two to his body. However, death and money, where one to his body and one to his money, say: Let us administer to him. necessary,
llm_translation: And if we were to say death and lashes, for both in themselves we do not do. But death and money, for one in itself and one in his money, let us say we do. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: ״וְלֹא תִקְחוּ כוֹפֶר לְנֶפֶשׁ רוֹצֵחַ״ לְמָה לִי? דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: לָא תִּשְׁקוֹל מָמוֹנָא מִינֵּיהּ וְתִפְטְרֵיהּ מִקְּטָלָא. ״לֹא תִקְחוּ כוֹפֶר לָנוּס אֶל עִיר מִקְלָטוֹ״ לְמָה לִי? דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: לָא תִּשְׁקוֹל מָמוֹנָא מִינֵּיהּ וְתִפְטְרֵיהּ מִן גָּלוּת.
human_translation: “And you shall take no ransom for the life of a murderer, why do I that the Merciful One says: Do not take money from him and exempt him from death you shall take no ransom for him that is fled to his city of refuge” why do I that the Merciful One says: Do not take money from him and exempt him from exile.
llm_translation: "And you shall not take a ransom for the life of a murderer" - Why do I need it? As the Merciful One said: Do not weigh his money against him and exempt him from execution. "You shall not take a ransom for one who flees to his city of refuge" - Why do I need it? As the Merciful One said: Do not weigh his money against him and exempt him from exile.

hebrew_text: וּתְרֵי קְרָאֵי לְמָה לִי! חַד בְּשׁוֹגֵג וְחַד בְּמֵזִיד. וּצְרִיכִי, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן מֵזִיד, מִשּׁוּם דַּחֲמִיר אִיסּוּרֵיהּ. אֲבָל שׁוֹגֵג, דְּלָא חֲמִיר אִיסּוּרֵיהּ — אֵימָא לָא. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן שׁוֹגֵג, מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵיכָּא אִיבּוּד נְשָׁמָה. אֲבָל מֵזִיד, דְּאִיכָּא אִיבּוּד נְשָׁמָה — אֵימָא לָא. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And why do I two verses One to unwittingly, and one to intentionally. And are necessary, as if taught us an intentional due to that prohibition he is severe. However, an unwitting where prohibition is not severe, say no, And if taught us an unwitting due to that there is no loss of life, However, an intentional where there is loss of life, say no, necessary.
llm_translation: Two verses, why do I need them! One for unintentional and one for intentional. And it is necessary, for if we were to hear intentional, because he is stringent in his prohibitions. But unintentional, since he is not stringent in his prohibitions — I might say no. And if we were to hear unintentional, because there is no intent of the soul. But intentional, since there is intent of the soul — I might say no. It is necessary.

hebrew_text: ״וְלָאָרֶץ לֹא יְכוּפַּר לַדָּם אֲשֶׁר שׁוּפַּךְ בָּהּ כִּי אִם בְּדַם שׁוֹפְכוֹ״ לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: “And no expiation can be made for the land for the blood that is shed therein, but by the blood of him that shed it” why do I
llm_translation: "And to the land not will be atoned for the blood that was shed in it except by the blood of the one who shed it." Why do I need this?

hebrew_text: מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאִם נִתְעָרְפָה עֲגָלָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִמְצָא הַהוֹרֵג, מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין פּוֹטְרִין אוֹתוֹ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלָאָרֶץ לֹא יְכוּפַּר לַדָּם אֲשֶׁר שׁוּפַּךְ בָּהּ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: It is necessary to that which is taught From where that if the calf was beheaded and the murderer was found thereafter, that one does not exempt him as it is stated: “And no expiation can be made for the land for the blood that is shed therein,
llm_translation: He sought to learn according to the teaching: From where do we derive that if a calf was decapitated and afterwards the killer was found, from where do we derive that we do not exempt him? - As it is stated: "And for the land, it shall not be atoned for the blood that is shed therein, etc."

hebrew_text: ״וְאַתָּה תְּבַעֵר הַדָּם הַנָּקִי מִקִּרְבֶּךָ״ לְמָה לִי? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ, לְכִדְתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִן לְמוּמָתִים בְּסַיִיף שֶׁהוּא מִן הַצַּוָּאר — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאַתָּה תְּבַעֵר הַדָּם הַנָּקִי מִקִּרְבֶּךָ״ — הוּקְשׁוּ כׇּל שׁוֹפְכֵי דָמִים לְעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה, מַה לְהַלָּן מִן הַצַּוָּאר — אַף שׁוֹפְכֵי דָמִים מִן הַצַּוָּאר.
human_translation: “And so shall you put away the innocent blood from your midst” Why do I it is necessary to that which is taught From where that those executed by sword, is from the neck, The verse states: “And so shall you put away the innocent blood from your midst” likening all spillers of blood to the beheaded calf Just as there, from the neck, so too, murderers from the neck.
llm_translation: "And you shall purge the innocent blood from your midst" - Why do I need it? It is necessary for him, as it was taught: From where do we derive the disqualification of those killed by the sword that severs from the neck? Scripture states: "And you shall purge the innocent blood from your midst" - Just as there, the blood of those killed by the sword that severs from the neck is disqualified, so too, the blood of those killed by the sword that severs from the neck is disqualified.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה לְהַלָּן בְּקוֹפִיץ וּמִמּוּל עוֹרֶף, אַף כָּאן בְּקוֹפִיץ וּמִמּוּל עוֹרֶף? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאָהַבְתָּ לְרֵעֲךָ כָּמוֹךָ״, בְּרוֹר לוֹ מִיתָה יָפָה.
human_translation: If so, just as there, with a cleaver [ kofitz ] and at the nape of the neck, here too with a cleaver and at the nape of the neck. Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said the verse says: “And you shall love your neighbor as yourself” Choose for him an agreeable death.
llm_translation: There, with a jump and from behind the neck, so too here, with a jump and from behind the neck? Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh, as it is stated in the verse: "You shall love your neighbor as yourself," choose for him a good death.

hebrew_text: ״כׇּל חֵרֶם אֲשֶׁר יׇחֳרַם מִן הָאָדָם לֹא יִפָּדֶה״ לְמָה לִי? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִן לַיּוֹצֵא לֵיהָרֵג, וְאָמַר אֶחָד ״עֶרְכּוֹ עָלַי״, מִנַּיִן שֶׁלֹּא אָמַר כְּלוּם —
human_translation: “Anything dedicated [ ḥerem ], that may be dedicated of men, shall not be redeemed; why do I need It is necessary that which is taught From where with regard to taken to be executed, and one said: His valuation is upon me that he did not say anything
llm_translation: "All cherem that one cherems from a person shall not be redeemed." Why do I need it? It is necessary for him according to the teaching: From where do we learn that one who goes out to be executed is to be killed, and he said, 'His blood is upon him'? From where do we learn that he did not say anything at all —"

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּל חֵרֶם אֲשֶׁר יׇחֳרַם מִן הָאָדָם לֹא יִפָּדֶה״. יָכוֹל אַף קוֹדֶם שֶׁנִּגְמַר דִּינוֹ כֵּן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִן הָאָדָם״ — וְלֹא כׇּל הָאָדָם.
human_translation: as it is stated: “Anything dedicated [ ḥerem ], that may be dedicated of men [ yoḥoram ], shall not be redeemed” might even before his verdict so, the verse states: of men,” but not entire men.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "Every devoted thing that is devoted from among men shall not be redeemed." Could it be that even before his judgment is completed? The Torah teaches: "From among men" - and not every man.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא, דְּאָמַר: נֶעֱרָךְ — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁדָּמָיו קְצוּבִין, הַאי ״כׇּל חֵרֶם״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya, said is valuated, because money his is fixed. this “Anything dedicated,” what does it?
llm_translation: To Rabbi Chananya ben Akavya, who said: "He is arranged" - because his blood vessels are severed, what does this "all cherem" do to him?

hebrew_text: מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: לְפִי שֶׁמָּצִינוּ לְמוּמָתִים בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם שֶׁנּוֹתְנִין מָמוֹן וּמִתְכַּפֵּר לָהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם כּוֹפֶר יוּשַׁת עָלָיו״. יָכוֹל אַף בִּידֵי אָדָם כֵּן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״חֵרֶם מִן הָאָדָם לֹא יִפָּדֶה״.
human_translation: He requires it that which is taught Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: Because we found with regard to those executed at the hand of Heaven, that they give money and their are atoned, as it is stated: If there be laid upon him a ransom might even at the hands of man so, the verse states: “Dedicated of men shall not be redeemed”
llm_translation: He wants according to the one who teaches: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah says: Because we have found that for the blemished offerings in the hands of Heaven, they receive money and atonement is made for them, as it is stated: "If a ransom is laid upon him." Can it also be the same for offerings in the hands of man? The Torah teaches: "No man shall redeem it."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא מִיתוֹת חֲמוּרוֹת שֶׁלֹּא נִיתְּנָה שִׁגְגָתָן לְכַפָּרָה, מִיתוֹת קַלּוֹת שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה שִׁגְגָתָן לְכַפָּרָה, מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כׇּל חֵרֶם״.
human_translation: And I have only severe death, for which no atonement is designated for their unwitting less severe death, for which atonement, is designated for their unwitting from where The verse states: “Anything dedicated,”
llm_translation: "And I have only severe deaths that their unintentional transgressions were not given for atonement, light deaths that their unintentional transgressions were given for atonement, from where? The Torah teaches: 'Every ban.'"

hebrew_text: וְלָא מִמֵּילָא מִ״לֹּא תִּקְחוּ כּוֹפֶר״ שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ — לָא תִּשְׁקוֹל מָמוֹנָא מִינֵּיהּ וְתִיפְטְרֵיהּ? ״כׇּל חֵרֶם״ לְמָה לִי? אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא:
human_translation: And didn’t you incidentally learn from “And you shall take no ransom Do not take money from him and exempt him Why, do I Any ḥerem ? Rami bar Ḥama said: necessary, it might enter your mind to say
llm_translation: And not from the word "lo tikchu kofeir" did you hear from it — you shall not weigh money from it and exempt it? "Every devoted thing" why do I need it? Ramei bar Chama said: It is necessary, as your mind I believe.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי, הֵיכָא דַּהֲרָגוֹ דֶּרֶךְ עֲלִיָּיה, שֶׁלֹּא נִיתְּנָה שִׁגְגָתוֹ לְכַפָּרָה. אֲבָל הֲרָגוֹ דֶּרֶךְ יְרִידָה, דְּנִיתְּנָה שִׁגְגָתוֹ לְכַפָּרָה, אֵימָא: נִישְׁקוֹל מָמוֹנָא מִינֵּיהּ וְנִיפְטְרֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: this applies only when one killed him in an upward motion, for which no atonement is designated for its unwitting However, killed him in a downward motion, for which atonement, is designated for its unwitting say: Let us take money from him and exempt him. teaches us
llm_translation: These matters, where he killed by way of ascent, that his unintentional act was not given for atonement. But if he killed by way of descent, that his unintentional act was given for atonement, say: his money will be lightened from him and he will be exempt, this is what we have heard.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: הָא מִדְּתַנָּא דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה נָפְקָא. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה: ״מַכֵּה אָדָם״ וּ״מַכֵּה בְהֵמָה״.
human_translation: Rava said to him: That is derived of the school of Ḥizkiyya taught, as of the school of Ḥizkiyya taught: one who smites a person, and one who smites an animal
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: This is from the teaching of the school of Hezekiah that has emerged. For it was taught in the school of Hezekiah: "One who strikes a person" and "one who strikes an animal."

hebrew_text: מָה מַכֵּה בְהֵמָה לֹא חִלַּקְתָּ בּוֹ בֵּין שׁוֹגֵג לְמֵזִיד, בֵּין מִתְכַּוֵּין לְשֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין, בֵּין דֶּרֶךְ יְרִידָה לְדֶרֶךְ עֲלִיָּיה — לְפוֹטְרוֹ מָמוֹן אֶלָּא לְחַיְּיבוֹ מָמוֹן. אַף מַכֵּה אָדָם לֹא תַּחְלוֹק בּוֹ בֵּין שׁוֹגֵג לְמֵזִיד, בֵּין מִתְכַּוֵּין לְשֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין, בֵּין דֶּרֶךְ יְרִידָה לְדֶרֶךְ עֲלִיָּה — לְחַיְּיבוֹ מָמוֹן אֶלָּא לְפוֹטְרוֹ מָמוֹן.
human_translation: Just as in who smites an animal, you did not distinguish between unwittingly and intentionally; between with intent and one who with no intent; between in a downward motion and in an upward motion; to exempt money but rather to obligate him to money; so too in who smites a person: Do not distinguish between unwittingly and intentionally; between with intent and one who with no intent; between in a downward motion and in an upward motion; to obligate him money but rather to exempt him money.
llm_translation: One who strikes an animal, you do not differentiate in it between unintentional and intentional, between intending to cause injury and not intending to cause injury, between a downward motion and an upward motion - to exempt him from payment but to obligate him to pay. Likewise, one who strikes a person, you do not differentiate in him between unintentional and intentional, between intending to cause injury and not intending to cause injury, between a downward motion and an upward motion - to obligate him to pay but to exempt him from payment.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא, אִיצְטְרִיךְ: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּסִימֵּא אֶת עֵינוֹ וַהֲרָגוֹ בָּהּ. אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּסִימֵּא אֶת עֵינוֹ וַהֲרָגוֹ בְּדָבָר אַחֵר, אֵימָא נִישְׁקוֹל מָמוֹנָא מִינֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: הָא נָמֵי מֵאִידַּךְ תַּנָּא דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה נָפְקָא. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה: ״עַיִן תַּחַת עַיִן״, וְלֹא עַיִן וְנֶפֶשׁ תַּחַת עַיִן.
human_translation: Rather, Rami bar Ḥama said necessary, as it might enter your mind to say this applies only where one blinded eye and killed him with However, where one blinded eye and killed him by different say: Let us take money from him Rava said to him: This is also derived from another tanna the school of Ḥizkiyya as of the school of Ḥizkiyya taught “An eye for an eye” but not an eye and a life for an eye.
llm_translation: Rather, Ramei bar Ḥama said, it is necessary: I would say, where is the place that he blinded his eye and killed him with it. But where he blinded his eye and killed him with something else, one might say that his money should be taken from him. Rava said to him: This statement is derived from your own source, as it was taught in the school of Ḥizkiyah: "An eye for an eye," and not an eye and a life for an eye.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אִיצְטְרִיךְ. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא הוֹאִיל וְחִידּוּשׁ הוּא שֶׁחִידְּשָׁה תּוֹרָה בִּקְנָס, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיקְּטִיל מְשַׁלֵּם, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. וּלְרַבָּה דְּאָמַר חִידּוּשׁ הוּא שֶׁחִידְּשָׁה תּוֹרָה בִּקְנָס, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיקְּטִיל מְשַׁלֵּם, הַאי ״כׇּל חֵרֶם״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? סָבַר לַהּ כְּתַנָּא קַמָּא דְּרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: necessary, it might enter your mind to say: Since it is a novel element that the Torah introduced with regard to a fine, even though he is killed he pays teaches us And according to Rabba, who said it is a novel element that the Torah introduced with regard to a fine, even though he is killed he pays what does do with this “Any ḥerem ”? holds to in accordance with the first tanna , Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashe said: It is necessary. According to your reasoning, I would say, since it is a new teaching that the Torah innovated with a penalty, even though one who transgresses pays, we infer. And according to Rabbah who said it is a new teaching that the Torah innovated with a penalty, even though one who transgresses pays, what does he do with the phrase "every devoted thing"? He holds like the first Tanna of Rabbi Hanania ben Akavya.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נַעֲרָה שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה — רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: אֵין לָהּ קְנָס. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ לָהּ קְנָס, וּקְנָסָהּ לְעַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: a young woman who was betrothed and divorced, Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: She does not fine Rabbi Akiva says: She fine and her fine to herself,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Mishnah: A young woman who was betrothed and then divorced—Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: She does not have a penalty. Rabbi Akiva says: She does have a penalty, and she penalizes herself.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי — אָמַר קְרָא: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא אוֹרָשָׂה״, הָא אוֹרָסָה — אֵין לָהּ קְנָס. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא אוֹרָשָׂה״ — לְאָבִיהָ, הָא אוֹרְסָה — לְעַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: What is the rationale Rabbi Yosei HaGelili? the verse states: who was not betrothed” she was betrothed she does not have fine And Rabbi Akiva who was not betrothed, to her father, she was betrothed, to herself.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei the Galilean? — Scripture says: "Who has not been betrothed," if she has been betrothed — she does not receive a penalty. And Rabbi Akiva? "Who has not been betrothed" — to her father, if she has been betrothed — to herself.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, ״נַעֲרָה״ וְלֹא בּוֹגֶרֶת, הָכִי נָמֵי דִּלְעַצְמָהּ? ״בְּתוּלָה״ וְלֹא בְּעוּלָה, הָכִי נָמֵי דִּלְעַצְמָהּ? אֶלָּא לִגְמָרֵי, הָכָא נָמֵי לִגְמָרֵי!
human_translation: But if so, a young woman and not a grown woman, so too, to herself. a virgin and not a non-virgin, so too, to herself. Rather, completely here too, completely
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, from now on, "na'arah" and not "bogeret," is it not true that for herself? "Betulah" and not "be'ulah," is it not true that for herself? Rather, completely, here it is truly completely!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: הַאי ״לָא אוֹרָשָׂה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא אוֹרָשָׂה״ — פְּרָט לְנַעֲרָה שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה, שֶׁאֵין לָהּ קְנָס, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ לָהּ קְנָס, וּקְנָסָהּ לְאָבִיהָ. וְהַדִּין נוֹתֵן: הוֹאִיל וְאָבִיהָ זַכַּאי בְּכֶסֶף קִידּוּשֶׁיהָ, וְאָבִיהָ זַכַּאי בְּכֶסֶף קְנָסָהּ. מָה כֶּסֶף קִידּוּשֶׁיהָ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה — לְאָבִיהָ, אַף כֶּסֶף קְנָסָהּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה — לְאָבִיהָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to you this “Who was not betrothed,” is required by him that is taught “Who was not betrothed” exclude a young woman who was betrothed and divorced that she does not fine the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. Rabbi Akiva says: She fine and her fine to her father, And logic dictates Since her father is entitled to the money of her betrothal and her father is entitled to the money of her fine; just as the money of her betrothal even though she was betrothed and divorced, to her father, so too, the money of her fine, although she was betrothed and divorced, to her father.
llm_translation: He said to you, Rabbi Akiva: This "she has not been betrothed" what does it come to include according to the teaching: "who has not been betrothed" - excluding a young woman who was engaged and then divorced, who does not incur a penalty, the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean. Rabbi Akiva says: She does incur a penalty, and her penalty is to her father. And the law gives: Since her father is entitled to the money of her betrothal, her father is entitled to the money of her penalty. Just as the money of her betrothal, even though she was engaged and then divorced, goes to her father, so too the money of her penalty, even though she was engaged and then divorced, goes to her father.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא אוֹרָשָׂה״ — מוּפְנֶה, לְהַקִּישׁ לוֹ וְלָדוּן הֵימֶנּוּ גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא אוֹרָשָׂה״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא אוֹרָשָׂה״. מָה כָּאן חֲמִשִּׁים — אַף לְהַלָּן חֲמִשִּׁים, וּמָה לְהַלָּן שְׁקָלִים — אַף כָּאן שְׁקָלִים.
human_translation: If so, why does the verse state: “Who was not betrothed”? free, and to liken and to derive from it a verbal analogy: It is stated here “Who was not betrothed,” and it is stated below: who was not betrothed” Just as here, fifty so too below, fifty. And just as below, shekels, so too here, shekels.
llm_translation: If so, what is the Talmud to say: "which has not been betrothed" - it is turned, to compare it and to judge it with a similar decree: it is stated here "which has not been betrothed," and it is stated there "which has not been betrothed." Just as here there are fifty - so too there are fifty there, and just as there are shekels there - so too here there are shekels.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, מַאי חָזֵית דַּ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא אוֹרָשָׂה״ לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה, וּ״בְתוּלָה״ לְמַעוֹטֵי בְּעוּלָה?
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, what did you see “Who was not betrothed” for a verbal analogy, and “virgin” to exclude a non-virgin
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, what do you see in the phrase "asher lo orasah" for the comparison to a decree, and "betulah" for the exclusions of marital relations?

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: ״בְּתוּלָה״ — לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה, וַ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא אוֹרָסָה״ — פְּרָט לְנַעֲרָה שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה!
human_translation: Say “virgin,” to a verbal analogy, and “Who was not betrothed” exclude a young woman who was betrothed and divorced.
llm_translation: Mother: "Virgin" - for a similar decree, and "who has not been betrothed" - excluding a young woman who was betrothed and divorced!

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא אוֹרָסָה״ לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה, שֶׁהֲרֵי אֲנִי קוֹרֵא בָּהּ ״נַעֲרָה בְּתוּלָה״. אַדְּרַבָּה: ״בְּתוּלָה״ לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה, שֶׁהֲרֵי אֲנִי קוֹרֵא בָּהּ ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא אוֹרָסָה״! מִסְתַּבְּרָא: הָא אִישְׁתַּנִּי גּוּפַהּ, וְהָא לָא אִישְׁתַּנִּי גּוּפַהּ.
human_translation: It stands to reason “Who was not betrothed” to a verbal analogy, as I can read “A young woman who is a virgin” to her. On the contrary, virgin to a verbal analogy, as I can read “Who was not betrothed” to her. It stands to reason this her body changed, and that her body did not change,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "It is logical that 'who has not been betrothed' is equivalent to a decree, for I read in it 'a young virgin.' On the contrary: 'a virgin' is equivalent to a decree, for I read in it 'who has not been betrothed'! It is logical: this one has changed its body, and this one has not changed its body."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי הַאי סְבָרָא מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִדְּתַנְיָא: ״כֶּסֶף יִשְׁקוֹל כְּמוֹהַר הַבְּתוּלוֹת״, שֶׁיְּהֵא זֶה כְּמוֹהַר הַבְּתוּלוֹת, וּמוֹהַר הַבְּתוּלוֹת כָּזֶה.
human_translation: And from where Rabbi Yosei HaGelili this conclusion He derives it from that which was taught “He shall weigh money like the dowry of the virgins” that this will be like the dowry to the virgins and the dowry to the virgins will be like this
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, does he hold this opinion? It can be derived from the Mishnah: "He shall pay money like the value of virgins," that this should be like the value of virgins, and the value of virgins like this.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אַדְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. תְּרֵי תַּנָּאֵי וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: difficult of Rabbi Akiva of Rabbi Akiva. two tanna’im in accordance with Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: The difficulty of Rabbi Akiva is the difficulty of Rabbi Akiva. Two Tannaim and the following of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּמַתְנִיתִין, לָא אָתְיָא גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה וּמַפְּקָא לֵיהּ לִקְרָא מִפְּשָׁטֵיהּ לִגְמָרֵי. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּבָרַיְיתָא, אָתְיָא גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה וּמַפְּקָא מִפְּשָׁטֵיהּ לִגְמָרֵי.
human_translation: Granted, Rabbi Akiva of the mishna a verbal analogy does not come and divert the verse from its plain meaning entirely. However, to Rabbi Akiva of the baraita , a verbal analogy come and divert the verse from its plain meaning entirely,
llm_translation: In truth, Rabbi Akiva of the Mishnah, a similar decree does not come and the verse is derived from its literal meaning to its conclusion. Rather, according to Rabbi Akiva of the Baraita, a similar decree does come and the verse is derived from its literal meaning to its conclusion.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: קְרִי בֵּיהּ ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא אֲרוּסָה״. אֲרוּסָה בַּת סְקִילָה הִיא! סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְחִידּוּשׁ הוּא שֶׁחִידְּשָׁה תּוֹרָה בִּקְנָס, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיקְּטִיל — מְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Interpret the verse Who is not betrothed. a betrothed is by stoning, it might enter your mind to say: Since it is a novel element that the Torah introduced with regard to a fine, even though he is killed he pays teaches us
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: It reads in it, "that is not betrothed." Betrothed is a daughter of stoning! Since your mind has arisen, I say: Since it is a novelty that she innovated Torah with a penalty, even though she is repulsive - he pays.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבָּה דְּאָמַר חִידּוּשׁ הוּא שֶׁחִידְּשָׁה תּוֹרָה בִּקְנָס, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיקְּטִיל מְשַׁלֵּם, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּמַתְנִיתִין.
human_translation: And according to Rabba, who said it is a novel element that the Torah introduced with regard to a fine, even though he is killed he pays what is there to say? holds in accordance with Rabbi Akiva of the mishna,
llm_translation: And for Rabbah who said: It is a novelty that she innovated Torah through a fine, even though he pays a penalty, what can be said? He holds like Rabbi Akiva of the Mishnah.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: קְנָסָהּ לְמִי, לְאָבִיהָ. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: לְעַצְמָהּ. לְעַצְמָהּ אַמַּאי! אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הָכָא בְּנַעֲרָה שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה עָסְקִינַן, וְקָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּמַתְנִיתִין וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּבָרַיְיתָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: to whom her fine to her father; and some say: to her. To her? Why? Rav Ḥisda said: Here we are dealing with a young woman who was betrothed and divorced, and disagree in the dispute between Rabbi Akiva of the mishna and Rabbi Akiva of the baraita ,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: To whom does the fine belong? To her father. And some say: To herself. Why to herself? Rav Ḥisda said: Here we are dealing with a young woman who was betrothed and then divorced, and we are discussing the dispute of Rabbi Akiva of the Mishnah and Rabbi Akiva of the Baraita.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בָּא עָלֶיהָ וּמֵתָה — פָּטוּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנָתַן לַאֲבִי הַנַּעֲרָה״ — וְלֹא לַאֲבִי מֵתָה. מִלְּתָא דִּפְשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ לְאַבָּיֵי, מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ לְרָבָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: one had intercourse with and she died exempt as it is stated: “And shall give to the father of the young woman” and not to the father of a dead matter that obvious to Abaye raised as a dilemma to Rava.
llm_translation: Abaye said: If he had intercourse with her and she died - he is exempt, as it is stated: "And he shall give the father of the young woman" - and not to the father of the deceased. The matter is clear to Abaye, but Rava requires it for himself.

hebrew_text: דְּבָעֵי רָבָא: יֵשׁ בֶּגֶר בַּקֶּבֶר, אוֹ אֵין בֶּגֶר בַּקֶּבֶר? יֵשׁ בֶּגֶר בַּקֶּבֶר — וְדִבְנָהּ הָוֵי, אוֹ דִלְמָא: אֵין בֶּגֶר בַּקֶּבֶר, וּדְאָבִיהָ הָוֵי.
human_translation: As Rava raised a dilemma: Is there grown-woman status in the grave or is there not grown-woman status in the grave? Is there grown-woman status in the grave, and it is her son Or perhaps there is no grown-woman status in the grave, and the fine is her father,
llm_translation: The words of Rava: Is there a convert in the grave, or is there no convert in the grave? If there is a convert in the grave — then it will collapse, or perhaps: if there is no convert in the grave, then it will be established.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מִעַבְּרָא? וְהָתָנֵי רַב בִּיבִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: שָׁלֹשׁ נָשִׁים מְשַׁמְּשׁוֹת בְּמוֹךְ, אֵלּוּ הֵן: קְטַנָּה, וּמְעוּבֶּרֶת, וּמְנִיקָה. קְטַנָּה — שֶׁמָּא תִּתְעַבֵּר וְתָמוּת, מְעוּבֶּרֶת — שֶׁמָּא תַּעֲשֶׂה עוּבָּרָהּ סַנְדָּל, מְנִיקָה — שֶׁמָּא תִּגְמוֹל אֶת בְּנָהּ.
human_translation: And can conceive? But didn’t Rav Beivai teach before Rav Naḥman: three women engage in relations with a resorbent. These are they: A minor, and a pregnant woman, and a nursing woman. A minor lest she conceive and die; a pregnant lest her fetus assume a sandal a nursing lest her wean her son
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who is the one who passes through? And it was taught by Rav Bibi before Rav Nachman: Three women who are involved in childbirth, these are they: a minor, a pregnant woman, and a nursing woman. A minor - lest she become pregnant and die, a pregnant woman - lest she miscarry her sandal, a nursing woman - lest she wean her son."

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזוֹהִי קְטַנָּה — מִבַּת אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה וְיוֹם אֶחָד עַד שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה וְיוֹם אֶחָד. פָּחוֹת מִיכֵּן וְיָתֵר עַל כֵּן מְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת כְּדַרְכָּהּ וְהוֹלֶכֶת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַחַת זוֹ וְאַחַת זוֹ מְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת כְּדַרְכָּהּ וְהוֹלֶכֶת, וּמִן הַשָּׁמַיִם יְרַחֵמוּ, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שׁוֹמֵר פְּתָאִים ה׳״!
human_translation: And What is a minor girl? from eleven years and one day old until twelve years and one day old. less than that more than that she proceeds and engages in relations in her usual manner; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: Both this and that she proceeds and engages in relations in her usual manner, and from Heaven they will have mercy due to that it is stated: “The Lord preserves the simple”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what is considered a minor girl? — From the age of eleven years and one day until the age of twelve years and one day. Less than this and more than this, she serves according to her usual manner and goes about, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: At either age, she serves according to her usual manner and goes about, and they the Sages pray for mercy from Heaven, as it is stated: "The Lord preserves the simple" (Psalms 116:6)! English translation:

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּאִיעַבַּרָא כְּשֶׁהִיא נַעֲרָה, וְאוֹלִידָה כְּשֶׁהִיא נַעֲרָה. וּבְשִׁיתָּא יַרְחֵי מִי קָא יָלְדָה? וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין בֵּין נַעֲרוּת לְבַגְרוּת אֶלָּא שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים. וְכִי תֵּימָא: בְּצִיר הוּא דְּלֵיכָּא, הָא טְפֵי — אִיכָּא, הָא ״אֶלָּא״ קָאָמַר!
human_translation: And if you say that she conceived when she was a young woman, and gave birth when she was a young woman, give birth in six months But didn’t Shmuel say: There are only six months between a young woman and a grown woman? And if you say less that there is not more there is as said: Only,
llm_translation: And if you will say that she conceived when she was a young girl, and gave birth when she was a young girl. And in the sixth month, who did she give birth to? And Samuel said: There is no difference between youth and maturity except for six months. And if you will say: It is in the summer that there is no fruit, but in the winter there is fruit, this is what "except" is saying!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָכִי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: יֵשׁ בֶּגֶר בַּקֶּבֶר וּפָקַע אָב, אוֹ דִלְמָא: אֵין בֶּגֶר בַּקֶּבֶר, וְלָא פָּקַע אָב? מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי בָּעֵי לַהּ הָכִי: מִיתָה עוֹשָׂה בַּגְרוּת, אוֹ אֵין עוֹשָׂה בַּגְרוּת? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rather, This is his dilemma: Is there grown-woman status in the grave and father lapsed; Or perhaps there is no grown-woman in the grave, and father did not lapse. Mar bar Rav Ashi raised the dilemma this death effect grown-woman status or does it not effect grown-woman status? stands
llm_translation: Rather, thus he asked him: Is there a bone in the grave and the father decomposed, or perhaps: there is no bone in the grave, and the father did not decompose? Mar bar Rav Ashi asked him thus: Does death cause decomposition, or does it not cause decomposition? This matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵאַבָּיֵי: בָּא עָלֶיהָ וְנִתְאָרְסָה, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, מִי כְּתִיב: ״וְנָתַן לַאֲבִי הַנַּעֲרָה אֲשֶׁר לֹא אֲרוּסָה״? וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, הָא דְּתַנְיָא: בָּא עָלֶיהָ וְנִשֵּׂאת, לְעַצְמָהּ: מִי כְּתִיב ״וְנָתַן לַאֲבִי הַנַּעֲרָה אֲשֶׁר לֹא נְשׂוּאָה״?
human_translation: Rava inquired of Abaye: had intercourse with and she was betrothed, what is said to him: Is it written: And he shall give to the father of the young woman who is not betrothed? And according to your reasoning, that which was taught had intercourse and she married, to her, Is it written: And he shall give to the father of the young woman who is not married?
llm_translation: Rava asked Abbaye: If he had relations with her and she became betrothed, what is the law? He said to him, who is it written for: "And he shall give to the father of the young woman that is not betrothed"? And according to your reasoning, as it was taught: If he had relations with her and she was married, for herself: who is it written for "And he shall give to the father of the young woman that is not married"?

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם, הוֹאִיל וּבַגְרוּת מוֹצִיאָה מֵרְשׁוּת אָב, וְנִישּׂוּאִין מוֹצִיאִין מֵרְשׁוּת אָב, מָה בַּגְרוּת בָּא עָלֶיהָ וּבָגְרָה — לְעַצְמָהּ, אַף נִישּׂוּאִין בָּא עָלֶיהָ וְנִשֵּׂאת — לְעַצְמָהּ. אֶלָּא אֵירוּסִין, מִי קָא מַפְּקִי מֵרְשׁוּתָא דְּאָב לִגְמָרֵי? הָא תְּנַן: נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה אָבִיהָ וּבַעְלָהּ מְפִירִין לָהּ נְדָרֶיהָ.
human_translation: How can compared? There, as grown-woman status removes her from authority of the father and marriage removes her from authority of the father. Just as grown-woman status, had intercourse with her and she became a grown woman, to her, so too, marriage, had intercourse with her and she married, to her. However, betrothal, does remove from authority of the father entirely? Didn’t we learn a betrothed young woman, her father and her husband nullify her vows?
llm_translation: So now?! There, since a betrothed woman removes from the domain of her father, and married women remove from the domain of her father, just as a betrothed woman comes upon herself and becomes responsible for herself, so too, married women come upon themselves and are responsible for themselves. But as for betrothal, who is removing her completely from the domain of her father? Didn't we learn: A young girl who is betrothed, her father and husband annul her vows.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְפַתֶּה נוֹתֵן שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים, וְהָאוֹנֵס אַרְבָּעָה. הַמְפַתֶּה נוֹתֵן בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם וּקְנָס, מוֹסִיף עָלָיו אוֹנֵס שֶׁנּוֹתֵן אֶת הַצַּעַר. מָה בֵּין אוֹנֵס לִמְפַתֶּה: הָאוֹנֵס נוֹתֵן אֶת הַצַּעַר, וְהַמְפַתֶּה אֵינוֹ נוֹתֵן אֶת הַצַּעַר. הָאוֹנֵס נוֹתֵן מִיָּד, וְהַמְפַתֶּה לִכְשֶׁיּוֹצִיא. הָאוֹנֵס שׁוֹתֶה בַּעֲצִיצוֹ, וְהַמְפַתֶּה, אִם רָצָה לְהוֹצִיא — מוֹצִיא.
human_translation: The seducer gives three things, and the rapist four. The seducer gives humiliation, degradation, and fine. A rapist adds his as he gives pain. What between a rapist and a seducer? The rapist gives the pain, and the seducer does not give the pain. The rapist gives immediately, and the seducer when he releases The rapist drinks from his vessel [ atzitzo ], and the seducer, if he wishes to release he releases
llm_translation: It was taught: One who entices a maiden gives three things, and one who forces her gives four. One who entices gives disgrace, blemish, and penalty; he adds to them the pain caused. What is the difference between one who forces and one who entices? One who forces causes the pain, while one who entices does not cause the pain. One who forces gives immediately, while one who entices gives when he brings her out. One who forces drinks in a goblet, while one who entices, if he wishes to bring her out — he brings her out.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד שׁוֹתֶה בַּעֲצִיצוֹ: אֲפִילּוּ הִיא חִיגֶּרֶת, אֲפִילּוּ הִיא סוֹמָא, וַאֲפִילּוּ הִיא מוּכַּת שְׁחִין. נִמְצָא בָּהּ דְּבַר עֶרְוָה, אוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לָבֹא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל — אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְקַיְּימָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלוֹ תִהְיֶה לְאִשָּׁה״, אִשָּׁה הָרְאוּיָה לוֹ.
human_translation: How does drink from his vessel? Even if is lame, even if she is blind, and even if she is afflicted with boils, a matter of licentiousness is found in her, or if she is unfit to enter the Jewish people, he is not permitted to sustain her as it is stated: “And to him she shall be as a wife” a woman who is suitable for him.
llm_translation: How does one drink from a cup: Even if it is cracked, even if it is blind, and even if it is covered with scabs. If it contains something indecent, or if it is not fitting to enter among the Israelites — one is not permitted to fulfill it, as it is stated: "And if she is not suitable to be his wife," a woman who is suitable for him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ צַעַר דְּמַאי? אָמַר אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: צַעַר שֶׁחֲבָטָהּ עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, חֲבָטָהּ עַל גַּבֵּי שִׁירָאִין, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּפָטוּר? וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי — וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אוֹנֵס אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם אֶת הַצַּעַר — מִפְּנֵי
human_translation: For what pain Shmuel’s father said: pain that he slammed her onto the ground Rabbi Zeira objects to this: But if so, he slammed her onto silk, so too that exempt And if you say indeed so, but isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: A rapist does not pay the pain due to
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the case of "tzar demai"? Abba, whose name is Shmuel, said: Tzar that she hit it on the ground. Rabbi Zeira objected to him: Rather, from now on, if she hit it on the teeth, is it thus said that she is exempt? And if you would say that it is thus said — and it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: A rapist does not pay for the pain — because

hebrew_text: שֶׁסּוֹפָהּ לְהִצְטַעֵר תַּחַת בַּעֲלָהּ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה נִבְעֶלֶת בְּאוֹנֶס לְנִבְעֶלֶת בְּרָצוֹן. אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: צַעַר שֶׁל פִּיסּוּק הָרַגְלַיִם. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וַתְּפַשְּׂקִי אֶת רַגְלַיִךְ לְכׇל עוֹבֵר״.
human_translation: that she will ultimately suffer under her husband? They said to him: One who has intercourse against will is not comparable to one who has intercourse willingly. Rather, Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: pain of spreading legs And likewise, says: “And you opened your legs to every passerby”
llm_translation: The end of it is to cause distress beneath her husband. They said to him: A woman who is violated against her will is not comparable to a woman who consents. Rather, Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: The pain of divorce is like the cutting off of the feet. And so it says: "And you have torn your feet to every passerby."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מְפוּתָּה נָמֵי! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: מָשָׁל דִּמְפוּתָּה לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? לְאָדָם שֶׁאָמַר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: קְרַע שִׁירָאִין שֶׁלִּי וְהִפָּטֵר. שֶׁלִּי?! דַּאֲבוּהּ נִינְהוּ? אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: פִּקְּחוֹת שֶׁבָּהֶן אוֹמְרוֹת: מְפוּתָּה אֵין לָהּ צַעַר.
human_translation: If so, a seduced woman also Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh stated a parable: To what can matter be compared? to a person who said to another: Tear my silk and be exempt my it is of her father, Rather, Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said the clever among them say a seduced woman has no pain
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, it is astonishing! Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: What is the parable of the matter similar to? To a person who said to his friend: Tear my garments and be exempt. My garments?! Are they his father's? Rather, Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: The wise women say: She has no pain.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָא חָזֵינַן דְּאִית לַהּ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֲמַרָה לִי אֵם, כְּמַיָּא חַמִּימֵי עַל רֵישֵׁיהּ דְּקַרְחָא. רָבָא אָמַר: אֲמַרָה לִי בַּת רַב חִסְדָּא: כִּי רִיבְדָּא דְכוּסִילְתָּא. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: אֲמַרָה לִי בַּת אַבָּא סוּרָאָה: כִּי נַהֲמָא אַקּוּשָׁא בְּחִינְכֵי.
human_translation: But don’t we see that has Abaye said: My mother told me like hot water on the head of a bald Rava said: Rav Ḥisda’s daughter, told me like the stab of a bloodletting knife. Rav Pappa said: Abba Sura’s daughter, told me like hard bread on the gums.
llm_translation: And here we see that she has it? Abaye said: His mother said to me, like warm water on the head of ice. Rava said: The daughter of Rav Hisda said to me, like a ribda of fine linen. Rav Pappa said: The daughter of Abba Sura said to me, like a sigh in the kidneys.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹנֵס נוֹתֵן מִיָּד הַמְפַתֶּה לִכְשֶׁיּוֹצִיא וְכוּ׳. לִכְשֶׁיּוֹצִיא?! אִשְׁתּוֹ הִיא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֵימָא לִכְשֶׁלֹּא יִכְנוֹס. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ הַמְפַתֶּה נוֹתֵן לִכְשֶׁלֹּא יִכְנוֹס, בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם נוֹתֵן מִיָּד. וְאֶחָד הָאוֹנֵס וְאֶחָד הַמְפַתֶּה, בֵּין הִיא וּבֵין אָבִיהָ יְכוֹלִין לְעַכֵּב.
human_translation: The rapist gives immediately, and the seducer when he releases her, etc. When he releases she his wife? Abaye said: Say when not marry That was also taught Although they said the seducer gives when not marry humiliation and degradation he gives immediately. both the rapist and the seducer both she and her father are able to prevent
llm_translation: The one who was forced gives immediately to the seducer when he takes out, etc. When he takes out?! Is she his wife? Abaye said: Say, when he does not retract. It was also taught likewise: Even though they said the seducer gives when he does not retract, he gives embarrassment and blemish immediately. And both the one who was forced and the seducer, whether she is his wife or her father, can delay.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מְפוּתָּה — כְּתִיב: ״אִם מָאֵן יְמָאֵן אָבִיהָ״. אֵין לִי אֶלָּא אָבִיהָ, הִיא עַצְמָהּ מִנַּיִן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יְמָאֵן״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: Granted, a woman who was seduced, it is written: “If her father refuses [ maen yemaen ] I have only her father from where do we she herself The verse states: yemaen , in any case,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Bishlama m'futah — k'tiv: 'im ma'en y'ma'en avihah'. Ein li ela avihah, hi atzmah minayin — talmud lomar: 'y'ma'en', mikol makom." English translation: "In the case of a woman who is divorced — it is written: 'if her father refuses to give her in marriage'. I have only her father, from where is she herself — the Talmud teaches: 'refuses', in any case."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אוֹנֵס? בִּשְׁלָמָא אִיהִי — כְּתִיב: ״וְלוֹ תִהְיֶה״, מִדַּעְתָּהּ. אֶלָּא אָבִיהָ מְנָלַן?
human_translation: However, a rapist? Granted, she it is written: “And to him she shall be with her consent. However, from where do we her father
llm_translation: Rather, is it by force? But according to her — it is written: "And if she does not please," from her own will. Rather, where is her father from?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא חוֹטֵא נִשְׂכָּר. רָבָא אָמַר: קַל וָחוֹמֶר, וּמָה מְפַתֶּה שֶׁלֹּא עָבַר אֶלָּא עַל דַּעַת אָבִיהָ בִּלְבַד, בֵּין הִיא וּבֵין אָבִיהָ יְכוֹלִין לְעַכֵּב — אוֹנֵס שֶׁעָבַר עַל דַּעַת אָבִיהָ וְעַל דַּעַת עַצְמָהּ, לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: Abaye said: so that a sinner will not profit. Rava said an a fortiori inference: Just as a seducer, who contravened only her father’s will, both she and her father can prevent a rapist, who contravened her father’s will and her own will, all the more so not
llm_translation: Abaye said: "One should not sin for reward." Rava said: "It is a fortiori reasoning. And if someone who only transgressed with the knowledge of her father alone, both she and her father can delay the punishment - how much more so someone who transgressed against the will of her father and her own will, is it not all the more so?!"

hebrew_text: רָבָא לָא אָמַר כְּאַבַּיֵּי. כֵּיוָן דְּקָא מְשַׁלֵּם קְנָס, לָאו חוֹטֵא נִשְׂכָּר הוּא. אַבָּיֵי לָא אָמַר כְּרָבָא: מְפַתֶּה דְּאִיהוּ מָצֵי מְעַכֵּב — אָבִיהָ נָמֵי מָצֵי מְעַכֵּב, אוֹנֵס דְּאִיהוּ לָא מָצֵי מְעַכֵּב — אָבִיהָ נָמֵי לָא מָצֵי מְעַכֵּב.
human_translation: Rava did not say in accordance with Abaye, since pays the fine he is not a sinner profits, Abaye did not say in accordance with Rava a seducer, where can prevent her father can also prevent a rapist, where cannot prevent her father also cannot prevent
llm_translation: Rava did not say like Abbaye. Since he is paying a penalty, he is not considered a willful sinner. Abbaye did not say like Rava: One who deceives and finds it effective—her father also finds it effective; one who violates her against her will and does not find it effective—her father also does not find it effective.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ אוֹנֵס נוֹתֵן מִיָּד, כְּשֶׁיּוֹצִיא הוּא אֵין לָהּ עָלָיו כְּלוּם. כְּשֶׁיּוֹצִיא?! מִי מָצֵי מַפֵּיק לַהּ?! אֵימָא: כְּשֶׁתֵּצֵא הִיא, אֵין לָהּ עָלָיו כְּלוּם. מֵת — יָצָא כֶּסֶף קְנָסָהּ בִּכְתוּבָּתָהּ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה מָנֶה.
human_translation: It was taught another Although said the rapist gives immediately, when he releases she has no upon him. When he releases Can he release her? say: When she leaves, she has no upon him. he died, money of her fine offsets her marriage contract. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: has a marriage contract one hundred dinars,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Another opinion: Even though they said that in the case of rape, the man must pay immediately, when he divorces her, she has no claim against him. When he divorces her?! Who will bring her out?! Say rather: when she leaves, she has no claim against him. If he dies, he must pay the fine written in her marriage contract. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: She has a designated marriage contract.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי. רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: טַעְמָא מַאי תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן כְּתוּבָּה — כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא קַלָּה בְּעֵינָיו לְהוֹצִיאָהּ, וְהָא לָא מָצֵי מַפֵּיק לַהּ. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: הָא נָמֵי מְצַעַר לַהּ עַד דְּאָמְרָה הִיא ״לָא בָּעֵינָא לָךְ״.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? The Rabbis maintain: What is the reason the Sages instituted a marriage contract so that she will not be inconsequential in his eyes, to divorce her. And this he cannot release her And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, maintains: this too, torment her until she says: I do not want you.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? The Rabbis hold: What is the reason that the Rabbis instituted it the decree of writing a get? — So that it should not be easy in his eyes to divorce her, and yet he cannot find a pretext to divorce her. But Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, holds: It is better for her to be distressed until she says, "I do not want you."

hebrew_text: אוֹנֵס שׁוֹתֶה בַּעֲצִיצוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא מִפַּרְזִקְיָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מִכְּדֵי מִיגְמָר גָּמְרִי מֵהֲדָדֵי,
human_translation: A rapist drinks from his vessel, Rava from Parzakya said to Rav Ashi: Since are derived from each other
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Ashi: "From the fact that he completes the cup, it is evident that he is compelled."

hebrew_text: לְהָא מִילְּתָא נָמֵי לִיגְמְרוּ מֵהֲדָדֵי! אָמַר קְרָא: ״מָהֹר יִמְהָרֶנָּה לּוֹ לְאִשָּׁה״, ״לוֹ״ — מִדַּעְתּוֹ.
human_translation: for this matter too, let them be derived from each other. the verse says “He shall pay a dowry for her to be a wife to him” “to him” in accordance with his will.
llm_translation: The matter should be completed quickly from Hadadei! The verse says: "He shall hasten to perform it for her," "for him" - according to his will.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד שׁוֹתֶה בַּעֲצִיצוֹ כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: אַמְרִיתַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב זְבִיד מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא: נֵיתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְנִדְחֵה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה!
human_translation: How does drink from his vessel? Rav Kahana said: I stated halakha before Rav Zevid of Neharde’a, positive come and override prohibition
llm_translation: How does one drink from a cup? Rav Kahana said: She said it in the presence of Rav Zevid from Nehardea: "Do it and be pushed away, do not do!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לִי: הֵיכָא אָמְרִינַן נֵיתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְנִידְחֵי לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה — כְּגוֹן מִילָה בְּצָרַעַת, דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר לְקַיּוֹמֵיהּ לַעֲשֵׂה. אֲבָל הָכָא, אִי אָמְרָה דְּלָא בָּעֵינָא, מִי אִיתֵיהּ לַעֲשֵׂה כְּלָל?
human_translation: He said to me: Where do we say a positive comes and overrides a prohibition? where circumcision with leprosy. as it is not possible to fulfill the positive However, here, if says: I do not want him is there a positive at all?
llm_translation: He said to me: Where do we say "come and do and it will be pushed aside" and "do not do" - such as circumcision on Shabbat, where it is not possible to fulfill the positive commandment. But here, if she said she does not want it, who is there to fulfill it at all?

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יְתוֹמָה שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הָאוֹנֵס — חַיָּיב, וְהַמְפַתֶּה — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: an orphan who was betrothed and divorced, Rabbi Elazar says: One who rapes is obligated and one who seduces her is exempt
llm_translation: It was taught in a Mishnah: A orphan girl who was betrothed and then divorced, Rabbi Elazar says: in the case of rape - he is liable, and in the case of seduction - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּשִׁיטַת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא רַבּוֹ אֲמָרָהּ, דְּאָמַר: יֵשׁ לָהּ קְנָס וּקְנָסָהּ לְעַצְמָהּ. מִמַּאי — מִדְּקָתָנֵי: יְתוֹמָה, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הָאוֹנֵס חַיָּיב, וְהַמְפַתֶּה פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabbi Elazar stated in accordance Rabbi Akiva, his teacher, as said She is entitled to fine and her fine to her. And from where From that teaches an orphan Rabbi Elazar says: One who rapes is obligated and one who seduces is exempt
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Rabbi Elazar in the name of Rabbi Akiva's school said, as he said: She has a fine and her fine for herself. From where? From what is taught: an orphan. Rabbi Elazar says: The one who rapes is liable, and the one who seduces is exempt.

hebrew_text: יְתוֹמָה, פְּשִׁיטָא? אֶלָּא הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּנַעֲרָה שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה, כִּיתוֹמָה. מָה יְתוֹמָה — לְעַצְמָהּ, אַף נַעֲרָה שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה — לְעַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: An orphan? obvious, Rather, this teaching us: That a young woman who was betrothed and divorced, like an orphan: Just as an orphan, to her, so too, a young woman who was betrothed and divorced, to her.
llm_translation: Orphan, obvious? Rather, here it is teaching us that a young woman who was betrothed and divorced is like an orphan. Just as an orphan is for herself, so too a young woman who was betrothed and divorced is for herself.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא סָבָא אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. קָרֵי רַב עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: ״טוּבְיָנָא דְחַכִּימֵי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said Rabba bar Sheila said Rav Hamnuna the Elder said Rav Adda bar Ahava said Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar. Rav exclaim about Rabbi Elazar: happiest of the Sages,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, Rabbi Abba bar Sheilah said, Rav Hamnuna the Elder said, Rav Adda bar Ahava said, Rav said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Eliezer. Rav recited regarding him: "The scholars of wisdom."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵיזֶהוּ בּוֹשֶׁת? הַכֹּל לְפִי הַמְבַיֵּישׁ וְהַמִּתְבַּיֵּישׁ. פְּגָם — רוֹאִין אוֹתָהּ כְּאִילּוּ הִיא שִׁפְחָה נִמְכֶּרֶת בַּשּׁוּק, כַּמָּה הָיְתָה יָפָה, וְכַמָּה הִיא יָפָה. קְנָס — שָׁוֶה בְּכׇל אָדָם, וְכֹל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ קִצְבָה מִן הַתּוֹרָה — שָׁוֶה בְּכׇל אָדָם.
human_translation: What is humiliation? all based on the one who humiliated and the one who was humiliated. degradation One considers her as though she were a maidservant sold in the marketplace, how much she was worth and how much she is worth, fine is equal for all people, and Any that has a fixed by Torah law is equal for all people,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: What is considered modesty? Everything is according to the one who is modest and the one who causes others to be modest. Regarding a blemish - one should view her as if she were a maidservant being sold in the market, how beautiful she was, and how beautiful she is. Regarding a penalty - she is equal in value to all people, and anyone who has a set measure from the Torah - she is equal in value to all people.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְאֵימָא: חֲמִשִּׁים סְלָעִים אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, מִכֹּל מִילֵּי! אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא יֹאמְרוּ: בָּעַל בַּת מְלָכִים חֲמִשִּׁים, בָּעַל בַּת הֶדְיוֹטוֹת חֲמִשִּׁים?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אִי הָכִי, גַּבֵּי עֶבֶד נָמֵי, יֹאמְרוּ: עֶבֶד נוֹקֵב מַרְגָּלִיּוֹת — שְׁלֹשִׁים, עֶבֶד עוֹשֶׂה
human_translation: And say the Merciful One said fifty sela from all matters, Rabbi Zeira said: they will say: one who engaged in forced intercourse with a daughter of kings fifty one who engaged in forced intercourse with the daughter of commoners [ hedyotot ] fifty Abaye said to him: if so, with regard to a slave they will say: a slave who pierces pearls [ margaliyyot ], thirty a slave who performs
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, and why not? 'Fifty stones,' said the Merciful One, of all things! Rabbi Zeira said: Let them say, 'A king's daughter has fifty, a commoner's daughter has fifty?!' Abaye said to him: If so, regarding a slave girl, should they say: A slave girl who pierces sandals - thirty, a slave girl who makes..." English translation:

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂה מַחַט — שְׁלֹשִׁים?!
human_translation: needlecraft thirty
llm_translation: The matter of a needle - thirty?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: אִילּוּ בָּאוּ עָלֶיהָ שְׁנַיִם, אֶחָד כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְאֶחָד שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, יֹאמְרוּ: בָּעַל שְׁלֵימָה — חֲמִשִּׁים, בָּעַל פְּגוּמָה — חֲמִשִּׁים? אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אִי הָכִי, גַּבֵּי עֶבֶד נָמֵי, יֹאמְרוּ: עֶבֶד בָּרִיא — שְׁלֹשִׁים, עֶבֶד מוּכֵּה שְׁחִין — שְׁלֹשִׁים?!
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Zeira said Had two engaged in forced intercourse with her, one vaginal intercourse, and one anal intercourse, they will say: engaged in forced intercourse an untainted fifty engaged in forced intercourse tainted, fifty Abaye said to him: if so, with regard to a slave as well, they will say a healthy slave thirty a slave afflicted with boils thirty
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Zeira said: If two engaged in intercourse with her, one in the usual manner and one not in the usual manner, should they say: A husband with integrity — fifty, a husband with a blemish — fifty? Abaye said to him: If so, regarding a slave who is standing, should they say: A healthy slave — thirty, a slave with a sore wound — thirty?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אָמַר קְרָא: ״תַּחַת אֲשֶׁר עִינָּהּ״, הָנֵי תַּחַת אֲשֶׁר עִינָּהּ, מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם. רָבָא אָמַר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְנָתַן הָאִישׁ הַשּׁוֹכֵב עִמָּהּ לַאֲבִי הַנַּעֲרָה חֲמִשִּׁים כָּסֶף״. הֲנָאַת שְׁכִיבָה חֲמִשִּׁים, מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם.
