human_translation: Rather, Abaye said The verse says: because he tormented her” these because he tormented her. may be inferred that there are humiliation and degradation Rava said The verse says: “And the man who lay with her shall give to the father of the young woman fifty shekels of silver” the pleasure of lying fifty may be inferred that there are humiliation and degradation,
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said, the verse says: "Because he has humiliated her," those words "because he has humiliated her" imply that there is disgrace and blemish in it. Rava said, the verse says: "And the man who lies with her shall give to the father of the young woman fifty silver shekels." The pleasure of lying with her is fifty, implying that there is disgrace and blemish in it.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא לְדִידַהּ? אָמַר קְרָא: ״בִּנְעוּרֶיהָ בֵּית אָבִיהָ״, כׇּל שֶׁבַח נְעוּרֶיהָ — לְאָבִיהָ.
human_translation: And say to her? the verse says: being in her young womanhood, in her father’s house” all profits her young womanhood to her father.
llm_translation: And why according to our view? The verse says: "In her youth, the house of her father," any praise of her youth - to her father.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן שֶׁמַּעֲשֵׂה הַבַּת לְאָבִיהָ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכִי יִמְכּוֹר אִישׁ אֶת בִּתּוֹ לְאָמָה. מָה אָמָה, מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לְרַבָּהּ — אַף בַּת, מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לְאָבִיהָ. לְמָה לִי? תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִ״בִּנְעוּרֶיהָ בֵּית אָבִיהָ״! אֶלָּא, הַהִיא בַּהֲפָרַת נְדָרִים הוּא דִּכְתִיב.
human_translation: However, that Rav Huna said Rav said: From where that the handiwork of the daughter to her father? as it is stated: “And if a man sells his daughter as a maidservant” Just as a maidservant, her handiwork to her master, so too a daughter, her handiwork to her father. Why do I Let him derive it “Being in her young womanhood, in her father’s house.” Rather, that is written with regard to the nullification of vows.
llm_translation: And rather, this that Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: From where do we derive that the daughter's actions are attributed to her father, as it is stated: "And if a man sells his daughter to be a maidservant, she shall not go out as the male servants do." Just as a maidservant, her actions are attributed to her master - so too, a daughter, her actions are attributed to her father. Why do I need this? Let it come out from "from her youth in her father's house"! Rather, that is in the case of annulment of vows that it is written.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא נֵילַף מִינֵּיהּ, מָמוֹנָא מֵאִיסּוּרָא לָא יָלְפִינַן. וְכִי תֵּימָא נֵילַף מִקְּנָסָא, מָמוֹנָא מִקְּנָסָא לָא יָלְפִינַן. אֶלָּא מִסְתַּבְּרָא דְּאָבִיהָ הָוֵי, דְּאִי בָּעֵי מָסַר לַהּ לִמְנֻוּוֹל וּמוּכֵּה שְׁחִין.
human_translation: And if you say: Let us derive from we do not derive monetary from ritual And if you say: Let us derive from a fine, we do not derive monetary from fines. Rather, it is reasonable that to her father, as if he wished give her to a repulsive or one afflicted with boils,
llm_translation: And if you say, we should separate from it, money from prohibition we do not separate. And if you say, we should separate from a penalty, money from a penalty we do not separate. Rather, it is logical that her father should be, for if he wants to give her to be betrothed and to strike a deal.

hebrew_text: פְּגָם, רוֹאִין אוֹתָהּ כְּאִילּוּ הִיא שִׁפְחָה נִמְכֶּרֶת. הֵיכִי שָׁיְימִינַן לַהּ? אָמַר אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: אוֹמְדִין כַּמָּה אָדָם רוֹצֶה לִיתֵּן בֵּין שִׁפְחָה בְּתוּלָה לְשִׁפְחָה בְּעוּלָה לְשַׁמְּשׁוֹ.
human_translation: degradation One considers her as though she were a maidservant sold How do we assess her Shmuel’s father said: One estimates between how much a person is willing to give a virgin maidservant and to a non-virgin maidservant to serve him.
llm_translation: The defect, we view it as if she is a maidservant being sold. How do we appraise her value? Abba, the son of Shmuel, said: We estimate how much a person is willing to give between a virgin maidservant and a non-virgin maidservant to serve him.

hebrew_text: מַאי נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִינַּהּ? אֶלָּא בֵּין שִׁפְחָה בְּעוּלָה לְשִׁפְחָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ בְּעוּלָה, לְהַשִּׂיאָה לְעַבְדּוֹ. וּלְעַבְדּוֹ מַאי נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִינַּהּ? בְּעֶבֶד שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ לְרַבּוֹ קוֹרַת רוּחַ הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: a non-virgin maidservant to serve him; what difference is there to him Rather, between a maidservant who engaged in intercourse and a maidservant who did not engage in intercourse to marry her to his slave. And to his slave, what difference is there to him with regard to a slave from whom his master has satisfaction,
llm_translation: What is derived from it? Rather, between a maidservant who is a virgin and a maidservant who is not a virgin, to marry her off to his male slave. And what is derived from it for his male slave? A slave who has a good reputation with his master.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ מֶכֶר — אֵין קְנָס. וְכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ קְנָס — אֵין מֶכֶר. קְטַנָּה — יֵשׁ לָהּ מֶכֶר, וְאֵין לָהּ קְנָס. נַעֲרָה — יֵשׁ לָהּ קְנָס, וְאֵין לָהּ מֶכֶר. הַבּוֹגֶרֶת — אֵין לָהּ לֹא מֶכֶר וְלֹא קְנָס.
human_translation: Any place where there is sale there is no fine And any place where there is a fine, there is no sale A minor is subject to sale and she is not entitled to a fine A young woman is entitled to a fine and is not subject to sale. A grown woman is neither subject to sale nor entitled to a fine.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: In any place where there is mekhir (sale) — there is no knas (penalty). And in any place where there is knas — there is no mekhir. A minor girl — she has mekhir, and she does not have knas. A young woman — she has knas, and she does not have mekhir. A mature woman — she has neither mekhir nor knas.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יֵשׁ לָהּ קְנָס בִּמְקוֹם מֶכֶר. דְּתַנְיָא: קְטַנָּה מִבַּת יוֹם אֶחָד וְעַד שֶׁתָּבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת — יֵשׁ לָהּ מֶכֶר וְאֵין לָהּ קְנָס. מִשֶּׁתָּבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת עַד שֶׁתִּיבְגַּר — יֵשׁ לָהּ קְנָס וְאֵין לָהּ מֶכֶר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ מֶכֶר — אֵין קְנָס, וְכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ קְנָס — אֵין מֶכֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: קְטַנָּה מִבַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד וְעַד שֶׁתִּיבְגַּר — יֵשׁ לָהּ קְנָס.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: This the statement of Rabbi Meir, but the Rabbis say: She is entitled to a fine where a sale, as it is taught A minor from one day old until she grows two hairs, is subject to sale and is not entitled to a fine. From when she grows two hairs until she matures she is entitled to a fine and she is not subject to sale; the statement of Rabbi Meir, as Rabbi Meir would state Any place where there is a sale there is no fine, and any place where there is a fine there is no sale. And the Rabbis say: A minor from the age of three years and one day until she matures is entitled to a fine.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said, Rav Yehudah said, Rav said: This is the statement of Rabbi Meir, but the sages say: She has a penalty in place of sale. As it was taught: A minor from one day old until she grows two pubic hairs - she has a sale and no penalty. Once she grows two pubic hairs until she reaches maturity - she has a penalty and no sale, the words of Rabbi Meir. For Rabbi Meir used to say: Any place where there is a sale - there is no penalty, and any place where there is a penalty - there is no sale. And the sages say: A minor from three years and one day old until she reaches maturity - she has a penalty.

hebrew_text: קְנָס אִין, מֶכֶר לָא?! אֵימָא: אַף קְנָס בִּמְקוֹם מֶכֶר. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְלוֹ תִּהְיֶה לְאִשָּׁה״ — בִּמְהַוָּה עַצְמָהּ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. וְרַבָּנַן? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, אָמַר קְרָא: ״נַעֲרָ״, אֲפִילּוּ קְטַנָּה בַּמַּשְׁמָע.
human_translation: A fine, yes, but sale, no? say: is even entitled to a fine where sale. Rav Ḥisda said: What is the rationale of Rabbi Meir? the verse says and to him she shall be as a wife” The verse is speaking with regard to one marry herself, And the Rabbis? Reish Lakish said the verse says “young woman [ na’ara ]”; even a minor girl is indicated
llm_translation: Penalty no, sale yes?! Say: Penalty also in place of sale. Rav Ḥisdah said: What is the reason for Rabbi Meir's opinion? Scripture says: "And if she shall be to a woman" — in what context is the verse speaking? And the Rabbis? Reish Lakish said, Scripture says: "A youth," even a minor in understanding.

hebrew_text: שַׁמְעַהּ רַב פָּפָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב חָנָן מִבֵּי כְלוֹחִית, אֲזַל אַמְרַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתּוּן, אַהָא מַתְנִיתוּ לַהּ. אֲנַן, אַהָא מַתְנֵינַן לָהּ, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הַמּוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע עַל הַקְּטַנָּה — פָּטוּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנָתְנוּ לַאֲבִי הַנַּעֲרָה״, ״נַעֲרָה״ מָלֵא דִּיבֵּר הַכָּתוּב.
human_translation: Rav Pappa, son Rav Ḥanan, from Bei Keloḥit, heard went and said it before Rav Shimi bar Ashi. said to him: You teach this concerning that We, teach it concerning this Reish Lakish said: One who slanders a minor girl, is exempt as it is stated: “And they shall give them to the father of the young woman [ na’ara ]” The verse spoke of na’ara , in full,
llm_translation: Sham'ah Rav Papa breih d'Rav Hanan mi'bei Keluchit, azal amra kamih d'Rav Shimi bar Ashe. Amar lei: Atun, aha matnitu la. Anan, aha matneinan la, amar Resh Lakish: Hamotzi shem ra al haketanah - patur, shene'emar: "venatnu la'avi hana'arah," "na'arah" malei diber hakahatuv.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: טַעְמָא דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״נַעֲרָה״, הָא לָאו הָכִי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא אֲפִילּוּ קְטַנָּה? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״וְאִם אֱמֶת הָיָה הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה לֹא נִמְצְאוּ בְתוּלִים לַנַּעֲרָה. וְהוֹצִיאוּ אֶת הַנַּעֲרָה אֶל פֶּתַח בֵּית אָבִיהָ וּסְקָלוּהָ״, וּקְטַנָּה לָאו בַּת עוֹנָשִׁין הִיא! אֶלָּא: כָּאן נַעֲרָה, הָא כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״נַעֲרָ״ — אֲפִילּוּ קְטַנָּה בַּמַּשְׁמָע.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava objects to this: The reason is that the Merciful One writes “ na’ara ” if that were not the case I would have said that even a minor girl? But isn’t it written: “And if this matter was true, that the hymen of this young woman was not found intact; then they shall remove the young woman to the entrance of her father’s house and stone her” And a minor is not subject to punishment. Rather, here, a na’ara , it may be inferred that it is stated “ na’ara ” even a minor girl is indicated.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rav Adda bar Ahava raised an objection to her: The reason the Merciful One wrote "na'arah" - is it not so that I might have thought even a minor girl? But it is written: "If this thing be true, that the tokens of virginity were not found for the na'arah. Then they shall bring out the na'arah to the door of her father's house, and the men of her city shall stone her." Is a minor not subject to punishment? Rather, here the term na'arah is used, but anywhere that "na'arah" is stated - even a minor is included by implication.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹמֵר: ״פִּתִּיתִי אֶת בִּתּוֹ שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי״ — מְשַׁלֵּם בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ, וְאֵין מְשַׁלֵּם קְנָס. הָאוֹמֵר: ״גָּנַבְתִּי״ — מְשַׁלֵּם אֶת הַקֶּרֶן עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ, וְאֵין מְשַׁלֵּם תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל וְתַשְׁלוּמֵי אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה. ״הֵמִית שׁוֹרִי אֶת פְּלוֹנִי״, אוֹ ״שׁוֹרוֹ שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי״ — הֲרֵי זֶה מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ. ״הֵמִית שׁוֹרִי עַבְדּוֹ שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי״ — אֵין מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל הַמְשַׁלֵּם יָתֵר עַל מַה שֶּׁהִזִּיק — אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: One who says: I seduced the daughter of so-and-so, pays humiliation and degradation on his own but does not pay fine. one who says: I stole, pays the principal, based on his own but does not pay double payment and payment four and five My ox killed so-and-so, or: an ox so-and-so, this pays on his own My ox killed a slave so-and-so, he does not pay on his own This is the principle: Anyone who pays more than what he damaged, he does not pay on his own
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who says, "I seduced the daughter of so-and-so" — he pays embarrassment and defamation on his own accord, and does not pay a fine. One who says, "I stole" — he pays the principal according to his own admission, and does not pay double or four or fivefold payments. "I killed the ox of so-and-so," or "the ox of so-and-so" — he pays according to his own admission. "I killed the ox of the slave of so-and-so" — he does not pay according to his own admission. This is the general rule: anyone who pays more than what he damaged — does not pay according to his own admission.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְלִיתְנֵי ״אָנַסְתִּי״! לָא מִבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִבַּעְיָא ״אָנַסְתִּי״, דְּלָא קָא פָּגֵים לַהּ, דִּמְשַׁלֵּם בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ, אֲבָל ״פִּתִּיתִי״, דְּקָא פָּגֵים לַהּ, אֵימָא: לָא מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And let teach I raped is speaking It is not necessary. It is not necessary I raped where he does not tarnish her he pays humiliation and degradation on his own However, I seduced where he tarnishes her say he does not pay on his own teaches us
llm_translation: Gemara: And it does not state "I was forced"! He is not saying that he does not require "I was forced," for he is not causing damage to it, as he is paying for the embarrassment and damage out of his own pocket, but "I enticed," for he is causing damage to it, saying: He does not pay out of his own pocket — this is implied to us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אַף בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ — לֹא כׇּל הֵימֶנּוּ שֶׁיִּפְגּוֹם בִּתּוֹ שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי.
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: Even humiliation and degradation, he does not pay on his own it is not within his power to tarnish the daughter of so-and-so
llm_translation: Mishnah that not like this Tanna, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: Even for embarrassment and blemish, one does not pay by his own admission - not every woman who claims that the blemish of Ploni's daughter is from him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: נִיחָא לַהּ לְדִידַהּ, מַאי? דִּלְמָא לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ לְאָבִיהָ. נִיחָא לֵיהּ לְאָבִיהָ, מַאי? דִּלְמָא לָא נִיחָא לְהוּ לִבְנֵי מִשְׁפָּחָה. נִיחָא לְהוּ לִבְנֵי מִשְׁפָּחָה, מַאי? אִי אֶפְשָׁר דְּלֵיכָּא חַד בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם דְּלָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: she herself is amenable what Perhaps her father is not amenable her father is amenable what Perhaps her family members are not amenable, family members amenable, what it is impossible that there not one in a country overseas who is not amenable
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: Is it preferable for her according to her own opinion, what? Perhaps it is not preferable for her according to her father. Is it preferable for her according to her father, what? Perhaps it is not preferable for them to the members of the family. Is it preferable for the members of the family, what? It is impossible, for there is not one in the coastal region who is not preferable to her.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר גָּנַבְתִּי מְשַׁלֵּם אֶת הַקֶּרֶן וְכוּ׳. אִיתְּמַר, פַּלְגָא נִיזְקָא, רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: פַּלְגָא נִיזְקָא — מָמוֹנָא. רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר: פַּלְגָא נִיזְקָא — קְנָסָא.
human_translation: One who says: I stole, pays the principal, It is stated half the damage Rav Pappa said: Half the damage money, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said half the damage fine.
llm_translation: The one who says, "I stole and will pay the principal, etc." It was stated: A half-damage was caused. Rav Pappa said: A half-damage - monetary. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: A half-damage - a penalty.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר פַּלְגָא נִיזְקָא מָמוֹנָא, קָסָבַר: סְתָם שְׁוָורִים לָאו בְּחֶזְקַת שִׁימּוּר קָיְימִי. וּבְדִין הוּא דִּמְשַׁלֵּם כּוּלֵּיהּ, וְרַחֲמָנָא הוּא דְּחָיֵיס עִלָּוֵיהּ, דְּאַכַּתִּי לָא אִיַּעַד תּוֹרָא. רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר פַּלְגָא נִיזְקָא קְנָסָא, קָסָבַר: סְתָם שְׁוָורִים בְּחֶזְקַת שִׁימּוּר קָיְימִי. וּבְדִין הוּא דְּלָא לִישַׁלֵּם כְּלָל, וְרַחֲמָנָא הוּא דְּקַנְסֵיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּנִינְטְרֵיהּ לְתוֹרֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Half the damage money, he maintains: Standard oxen do not exist in the presumptive status of safety, And by right, should pay the entire and it is the Merciful One that has compassion on him, as his ox is not yet forewarned Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said half the damage fine, he maintains: Standard oxen exist in the presumptive status of safety, And by right, should not pay at all, And it is the Merciful One that penalized him so that he would guard his ox.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Half damages are considered monetary compensation. He holds: Ordinary oxen are not considered to be in the category of watchfulness. And it is in a case where he pays in full, and it is the Merciful One who has mercy on him, for if not, the Torah would not be established. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Half damages are considered a penalty. He holds: Ordinary oxen are considered to be in the category of watchfulness. And it is in a case where he does not pay anything at all, and it is the Merciful One who penalizes him, so that he should be attentive to his Torah.

hebrew_text: סִימָן: הִיזִּיק, מָה, וְהֵמִית, כְּלָל. תְּנַן: הַנִּיזָּק וְהַמַּזִּיק בְּתַשְׁלוּמִין. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פַּלְגָא נִיזְקָא מָמוֹנָא, הַיְינוּ דְּשָׁיֵיךְ נִיזָּק בְּתַשְׁלוּמִין. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פַּלְגָא נִיזְקָא קְנָסָא, הַשְׁתָּא דְּלָאו דִּידֵיהּ קָא שָׁקֵיל, בְּתַשְׁלוּמִין אִיתֵיהּ?!
human_translation: a mnemonic Damaged; what; and killed; principle. We learned the damaged and the damager in the payments. Granted, according to the one who said half the damage money; that damaged party shares in the payments. However, according to he who said half the damage a fine, Now, takes that is not his; he in the payments?
llm_translation: Topic: Damages, What, and Kill, General Rule. We learned: One who is damaged and one who damages pay compensation. It is well according to the one who says that half of the damage is monetary, that is why he is liable to pay compensation. But according to the one who says that half of the damage is a penalty, now that he is not taking it upon himself, is he liable to pay compensation?!

hebrew_text: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לִפְחַת נְבֵילָה. פְּחַת נְבֵילָה, תְּנֵינָא: תַּשְׁלוּמֵי נֶזֶק — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהַבְּעָלִים מִטַּפְּלִין בַּנְּבֵילָה!
human_translation: necessary only for the degradation of the carcass. We learned the degradation of the carcass payments of damage, teaches that the owners tend to the carcass
llm_translation: Not needed except for a carcass. For a carcass, we learned: Payment for damages - teaches that the owners are negligent with the carcass!

hebrew_text: חֲדָא בְּתָם וַחֲדָא בְּמוּעָד. וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן תָּם: מִשּׁוּם דְּאַכַּתִּי לָא אִיַּעַד, אֲבָל מוּעָד דְּאִיַּעַד — אֵימָא לָא. וְאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן מוּעָד: מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא מְשַׁלֵּם כּוּלֵּיהּ, אֲבָל תָּם — אֵימָא לָא. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: One with regard to an innocuous and one with regard to a forewarned And necessary as if had taught us an innocuous due to that has not yet been forewarned; however, a forewarned that was forewarned, say no, And if had taught us a forewarned due to that he pays entire damage, However, an innocuous say no, necessary
llm_translation: One is in a state of innocence and one is in a state of intention. And it is necessary, for if we were to hear innocence: because it is not yet certain, but intention, if it is certain — say it is not. And if we were to hear intention: because he pays in full, but innocence — say it is not. It is necessary.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מָה בֵּין תָּם לְמוּעָד, שֶׁהַתָּם מְשַׁלֵּם חֲצִי נֶזֶק מִגּוּפוֹ, וּמוּעָד מְשַׁלֵּם נֶזֶק שָׁלֵם מִן הָעֲלִיָּיה. וְלָא קָתָנֵי שֶׁהַתָּם אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ, וּמוּעָד מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear What is between an innocuous and a forewarned that an innocuous pays half damage from its body. And a forewarned pays the entire damage from the property, did not teach an innocuous does not pay on his own and a forewarned pays on his own
llm_translation: Come and hear: What is the difference between Tam and Mu'ad? Tam pays half the damage from his own body, and Mu'ad pays full damage from the elevation. And it does not teach that Tam does not pay on his own accord, and Mu'ad pays on his own accord.

hebrew_text: תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר: מַאי שַׁיֵּיר דְּהַאי שַׁיַּיר! שַׁיַּיר חֲצִי כוֹפֶר. אִי מִשּׁוּם חֲצִי כוֹפֶר — לָאו שִׁיּוּרָא הוּא,
human_translation: taught and omitted What did he omit that he omitted this? He omitted half ransom If due to half ransom is not an omission.
llm_translation: Tanna: And he left over. What is the meaning of "left over"? Left over half a koper. If it is because of half a koper - it is not a leftover.

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: תָּם מְשַׁלֵּם חֲצִי כוֹפֶר.
human_translation: whose is this It is Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, who said: an innocuous pays half ransom.
llm_translation: This is the statement of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, for he said: "A simpleton pays half the atonement."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״הֵמִית שׁוֹרִי אֶת פְּלוֹנִי״, אוֹ ״שׁוֹרוֹ שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי״, הֲרֵי זֶה מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ. מַאי לָאו, בְּתָם! לָא, בְּמוּעָד.
human_translation: Come hear My ox killed so-and-so, or: an ox so-and-so, this pays on his own What, is not to an innocuous No, to a forewarned
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: 'He killed my ox, Ploni,' or 'the ox of Ploni,' this one pays according to his own admission. What, is it not so? No, it is at a festival."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בְּתָם מַאי, אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ? אַדְּתָנֵי סֵיפָא: עַבְדּוֹ שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ, נִיפְלוֹג וְנִיתְנֵי בְּדִידַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּמוּעָד, אֲבָל תָּם — אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ! כּוּלַּהּ בְּמוּעָד קָמַיְירֵי.
human_translation: However, of an innocuous what he does not pay on his own rather than teaching the latter clause killed a slave so-and-so does not pay on his own let him distinguish and teach within the case itself: In what is this statement said? with regard to a forewarned however, an innocuous does not pay on his own entire is speaking of a forewarned
llm_translation: But in a tam, what is the law? Does he not pay of his own accord? It was taught in the latter clause: The slave of so-and-so does not pay of his own accord, they disagreed and it was given according to his own opinion: In what case are these words said? - In a case of a Mo'ed, but in a case of a tam - he does not pay of his own accord! All this is said in a case of a Mo'ed.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל הַמְשַׁלֵּם יָתֵר עַל מַה שֶּׁהִזִּיק — אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ. הָא פָּחוֹת מִמַּה שֶּׁהִזִּיק — מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ. לָא תֵּימָא הָא פָּחוֹת מִמַּה שֶּׁהִזִּיק, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: הָא כְּמָה שֶׁהִזִּיק — מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear This is the principle: Anyone who pays more than what he damaged, he does not pay on his own less than what he damaged, he pays on his own Do not say: less than what he damaged, say: what he damaged, he pays on his own
llm_translation: Come and hear, this is the principle: Anyone who pays more than the damage caused - does not pay of his own accord. If he pays less than the damage caused - he pays of his own accord. Do not say if he pays less than the damage caused, rather say: if he pays as much as the damage caused - he pays of his own accord.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל פָּחוֹת מַאי, אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ? לִיתְנֵי, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם כְּמָה שֶׁהִזִּיק — אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ, דְּמַשְׁמַע פָּחוֹת וּמַשְׁמַע יָתֵר! תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: But less what he does not pay on his own let teach This is the principle: Anyone who does not pay that he damaged does not pay on his own as indicates less and indicates more a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: But less than what, does he not pay according to his own mouth? It should be taught: this is the principle: anyone who does not pay as much as he damaged - does not pay according to his own mouth, for it implies less and implies more! A contradiction.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא: פַּלְגָא נִיזְקָא קְנָסָא. תְּיוּבְתָּא וְהִלְכְתָא?! אִין: טַעְמָא מַאי אִיתּוֹתַב — מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא קָתָנֵי ״כְּמָה שֶׁהִזִּיק״, לָא פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ. כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא חֲצִי נֶזֶק צְרוֹרוֹת, דְּהִלְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ דְּמָמוֹנָא הוּא, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: And the halakha half the damage a fine. a conclusive refutation and halakha Yes, what is the reason was conclusively refuted? because does not teach: that he damaged. is not clear-cut for him, since there is half damage pebbles As it is a halakha transmitted that is a monetary due to that did not teach
llm_translation: The Halakha: Half of the damage is a penalty. A contradiction: "Teyubta and Halakha?!" No. What is the reason it is written - because it does not teach "how much damage," it does not cease. Since there is half damage in bundles, the Halakha is certain to him that it is money, therefore it does not teach.

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ פַּלְגָא נִיזְקָא קְנָסָא, הַאי כַּלְבָּא דְּאָכֵל אִימְּרֵי, וְשׁוּנָּרָא דְּאָכֵיל תַּרְנְגוֹלֵי רַבְרְבֵי, מְשׁוּנֶּה הוּא, וְלָא מַגְבֵּינַן בְּבָבֶל. אֲבָל זוּטְרֵי — אוֹרְחֵיהּ הוּא וּמַגְבֵּינַן.
human_translation: And now that you said half the damage a fine, this dog that ate lambs, and a cat that ate large roosters, is unusual and we do not collect in Babylonia. However, small is its usual manner, and we collect
llm_translation: At this time when you said half damage penalty, this dog that eats dates, and this cat that eats young chickens, it is similar, and we do not establish in Babylon. But small birds - it is its way and we establish.

hebrew_text: וְאִי תְּפַס — לָא מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ. וְאִי אָמַר: אַקְבְּעוּ לִי זִימְנָא לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל — מַקְבְּעִינַן לֵיהּ. וְאִי לָא אָזֵיל — מְשַׁמְּתִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And if seized we do not repossess it from him, And if said: Set me a time to in Eretz Yisrael, we set for him, and if does not go we excommunicate him.
llm_translation: If he seizes - we do not remove from him. And if he says, "Appoint for me a time to go to the land of Israel" - we appoint for him. And if he does not go - we impose upon him.

hebrew_text: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ מְשַׁמְּתִינַן לֵיהּ. דְּאָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: סַלֵּיק הֶזֵּיקָךְ, מִדְּרַבִּי נָתָן. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁלֹּא יְגַדֵּל אָדָם כֶּלֶב רַע בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, וְלֹא יַעֲמִיד סוּלָּם רָעוּעַ בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא תָשִׂים דָּמִים בְּבֵיתֶךָ״.
human_translation: Either way, we excommunicate him, as we say to him: Remove your damage, Rabbi Natan. As it is taught Rabbi Natan says: From where that a person may not raise a vicious dog in his house, and may not place an unsteady ladder in his house? as it is stated: that you shall not place blood in your house”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Between this and that we attribute it to him. For we say to him: "You have caused damage," in accordance with Rabbi Natan. As it was taught: Rabbi Natan says: From where do we derive that a person should not raise an evil dog in his house, nor place a shaky ladder in his house? As it is stated: "And you shall not place blood in your house."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אֵלּוּ נְעָרוֹת
llm_translation: We will return to you, these maidens.

hebrew_text: נַעֲרָה שֶׁנִּתְפַּתְּתָה — בּוֹשְׁתָּהּ וּפְגָמָהּ וּקְנָסָהּ שֶׁל אָבִיהָ, וְהַצַּעַר בִּתְפוּסָה. עָמְדָה בַּדִּין עַד שֶׁלֹּא מֵת הָאָב — הֲרֵי הֵן שֶׁל אָב. מֵת הָאָב — הֲרֵי הֵן שֶׁל אַחִין.
human_translation: a young woman who was seduced, her humiliation and her degradation and her fine to her father. And pain in raped. stood trial before the father died, these to her father, the father died to brothers.
llm_translation: A young woman who was seduced - her shame, her blemish, and the fine imposed by her father, and the pain in her capture. She stood in judgment until her father died - they are considered to be his. If her father died - they are considered to be her brother's.

hebrew_text: לֹא הִסְפִּיקָה לַעֲמוֹד בַּדִּין עַד שֶׁמֵּת הָאָב — הֲרֵי הֵן שֶׁל עַצְמָהּ, עָמְדָה בַּדִּין עַד שֶׁלֹּא בָּגְרָה — הֲרֵי הֵן שֶׁל אָב, מֵת הָאָב — הֲרֵי הֵן שֶׁל אַחִין. לֹא הִסְפִּיקָה לַעֲמוֹד בַּדִּין עַד שֶׁבָּגְרָה — הֲרֵי הֵן שֶׁל עַצְמָהּ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אִם לֹא הִסְפִּיקָה לִגְבּוֹת עַד שֶׁמֵּת הָאָב — הֲרֵי הֵן שֶׁל עַצְמָהּ,
human_translation: she did not manage to stand in judgment before the father died, to her, she stood trial before she reached majority, to her father, the father died, they to brothers, she did not manage to stand in judgment before she reached majority, to her. Rabbi Shimon says: if did not manage to collect before the father died, to her.
llm_translation: Not enough to stand in judgment until the father dies - they are considered her own; she stood in judgment until she reached maturity - they are considered the father's; when the father dies - they are considered the brother's. Not enough to stand in judgment until she reached maturity - they are considered her own. Rabbi Shimon says: If she did not have enough to collect until the father dies - they are considered her own.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ וּמְצִיאָתָהּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא גָּבְתָה, מֵת הָאָב — הֲרֵי הֵן שֶׁל אַחִין.
human_translation: her earnings and items she found, although she has not collected the father died they to brothers.
llm_translation: The work of her hands and her findings, even though she did not collect them, if the father dies - they belong to the brothers.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: הַמְפַתֶּה נוֹתֵן שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים, וְהָאוֹנֵס אַרְבָּעָה. הַמְפַתֶּה נוֹתֵן בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם וּקְנָס, מוֹסִיף עָלָיו אוֹנֵס שֶׁנּוֹתֵן אֶת הַצַּעַר! לְאָבִיהָ אִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ. לְאָבִיהָ נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא, מִדְּקָא יָהֵיב מְפַתֶּה, דְּאִי לְעַצְמָהּ — אַמַּאי יָהֵיב מְפַתֶּה? מִדַּעְתָּהּ עֲבַד!
human_translation: What is teaching us? We learned The seducer pays three types of indemnity and the rapist four. The seducer pays humiliation and degradation and fine A rapist adds an additional as he pays the pain is necessary for to her father. is also obvious to her father, from that a seducer pays as, if to her, why does a seducer pay he acted with her consent;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What does Gemara infer to us? We learned: The seducer gives three things, and the rapist four. The seducer gives shame, blemish, and fine; he adds to him the rape that causes distress! For her father, it is necessary. For her father, it is also obvious, since when he gave the seducer, if not for herself — why did he give the seducer? He acted according to her knowledge!

hebrew_text: עָמְדָה בַּדִּין אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: was necessary for stood for judgment a dispute between Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis
llm_translation: Stood in the court, it was necessary for him, a dispute of Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: ״אָנַסְתָּ וּפִיתִּיתָ אֶת בִּתִּי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא אָנַסְתִּי וְלֹא פִּיתִּיתִי״. ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר: ״אָמֵן״, וְאַחַר כָּךְ הוֹדָה — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: We learned there You raped or: You seduced my daughter, and says: I did not rape and I did not seduce, I administer an oath to you, and said: Amen, and afterward he admitted obligated
llm_translation: We learned there: "If a man seduces my daughter," and he says, "I did not seduce her and I did not entice her." "I swear to you," and he says, "Amen," and afterwards he confesses - he is liable.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר, שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם קְנָס עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם קְנָס עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ, אֲבָל מְשַׁלֵּם בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon exempts as he does not pay fine on his own said to him: Although he does not pay fine on his own indeed he does pay the humiliation and degradation on his own
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon exempts, as he does not impose a penalty upon himself. They said to him: Even though he does not impose a penalty upon himself, nevertheless he must pay for embarrassment and blemish upon himself.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ אַבָּיֵי מֵרַבָּה, הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: ״אָנַסְתָּ וּפִיתִּיתָ אֶת בִּתִּי, וְהֶעֱמַדְתִּיךָ בַּדִּין, וְנִתְחַיַּיבְתָּ לִי מָמוֹן״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא אָנַסְתִּי וְלֹא פִּיתִּיתִי, וְלֹא הֶעֱמַדְתַּנִי בַּדִּין, וְלֹא נִתְחַיַּיבְתִּי לְךָ מָמוֹן״, וְנִשְׁבַּע וְהוֹדָה, לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַאי?
human_translation: Abaye raised a dilemma before Rabba: one who says to another: You raped or: You seduced my daughter, and I made you stand in judgment and you were found obligated me money and says: I did not rape, or: I did not seduce, and you did not make me stand in judgment, and I was not found obligated you money, and took an oath and admitted according to Rabbi Shimon, what
llm_translation: Abaye asked Rabbah: One who says to his fellow, "You violated and seduced my daughter, and I brought you to court, and you are obligated to pay me money," and he responds, "I did not violate her, I did not seduce her, you did not bring me to court, and I am not obligated to pay you money," and he swears and admits, what is the ruling according to Rabbi Shimon?

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּעָמַד בַּדִּין — מָמוֹנָא הָוֵאי, וּמִיחַיַּיב עֲלֵיהּ קׇרְבַּן שְׁבוּעָה. אוֹ דִלְמָא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּעָמַד בַּדִּין, קְנָס הָוֵי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָמוֹנָא הָוֵי, וּמִיחַיַּיב עֲלֵיהּ קׇרְבַּן שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Since he stood trial is monetary and he is liable to offering oath Or perhaps although he stood trial is a fine. said to him: it is monetary and he is liable to offering of an oath.
llm_translation: When he stood in judgment - it is considered money, and he is obligated to bring a guilt offering. Or perhaps, even though he stood in judgment, is it considered a penalty? He said to him: It is considered money, and he is obligated to bring a guilt offering.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״אָנַסְתָּ וּפִיתִּיתָ אֶת בִּתִּי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא אָנַסְתִּי וְלֹא פִּיתִּיתִי״; ״הֵמִית שׁוֹרְךָ אֶת עַבְדִּי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא הֵמִית״; אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ עַבְדּוֹ ״הִפַּלְתָּ אֶת שִׁינִּי וְסִימִיתָ אֶת עֵינִי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא הִפַּלְתִּי וְלֹא סִימִיתִי״, וְנִשְׁבַּע וְהוֹדָה, יָכוֹל יְהֵא חַיָּיב —
human_translation: raised an objection to Rabbi Shimon says: might one who says to another: You raped or: You seduced my daughter, and he says: I did not rape or: I did not seduce Your ox killed my slave, and he says: did not kill or if his slave said to him: You knocked out my tooth, or: You blinded my eye and he says: I did not knock out, or: I did not blind and he takes an oath but admitted might should be liable
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Rabbi Shimon says: Can one say to his fellow, "You violated and seduced my daughter," and he responds, "I did not violate nor seduce her"; "You killed your slave," and he says, "I did not kill him"; or if his slave says to him, "You caused me to lose a tooth and blind my eye," and he responds, "I did not cause you to lose nor blind it," and he swears and admits, can he be liable —

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכִחֵשׁ בַּעֲמִיתוֹ בְּפִקָּדוֹן אוֹ בִתְשׂוּמֶת יָד אוֹ בְגָזֵל אוֹ עָשַׁק אֶת עֲמִיתוֹ. אוֹ מָצָא אֲבֵידָה וְכִחֶשׁ בָּהּ וְנִשְׁבַּע עַל שָׁקֶר״, מָה אֵלּוּ מְיוּחָדִין שֶׁהֵן מָמוֹן, אַף כֹּל שֶׁהֵן מָמוֹן. יָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ, שֶׁהֵן קְנָס.
human_translation: the verse states: and deal falsely with his neighbor in a matter of a deposit or of a pledge or of a robbery or have oppressed his neighbor, or have found that which was lost and deal falsely with it, and swear to a lie” Just as matters are unique that they are monetary so too, all that are monetary excludes these as they are fines.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And he denied in a deposit, or in a pledge, or in theft, or oppressed his fellow. Or he found a lost item and denied it and swore falsely." What are these specific cases that involve money? All cases involving money. These are the cases that incur a penalty.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בְּשֶׁעָמַד בַּדִּין! לָא, בְּשֶׁלֹּא עָמַד בַּדִּין.
human_translation: What, is it not where he has stood trial, No, where he has not stood trial.
llm_translation: What is the reason he did not stand in judgment? No, because he did not stand in judgment.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּרֵישָׁא בְּשֶׁעָמַד בַּדִּין, סֵיפָא נָמֵי בְּשֶׁעָמַד בַּדִּין. דְּקָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא דְּבָרִים שֶׁמְּשַׁלְּמִין עֲלֵיהֶם אֶת הַקֶּרֶן. תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל, תַּשְׁלוּמֵי אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה, וְהָאוֹנֵס וְהַמְפַתֶּה וּמוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע, מִנַּיִן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּמָעֲלָה מַעַל״, רִיבָּה.
human_translation: But from that first clause with who has stood trial, latter clause also with who has stood trial. As teaches first clause: I have only matters for which one pays the principal. the payments double payments four and five the rapist, and the seducer, and the defamer, from where The verse states: and commit a trespass [ ma’ala ma’al ]” amplify
llm_translation: The Gemara in the context of standing in judgment, the latter clause is similar to the former clause. For it is taught in the former clause: I have only matters for which the principal is paid. Double payment, payment of four or fivefold, and the seducer, the enticer, and one who defames, from where? The Talmud teaches: "And he acted deceitfully," he shall pay double.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּלֹא עָמַד בַּדִּין, כְּפֵילָא מִי אִיכָּא? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא בְּשֶׁעָמַד בַּדִּין. וּמִדְּרֵישָׁא בְּשֶׁעָמַד בַּדִּין, סֵיפָא נָמֵי בְּשֶׁעָמַד בַּדִּין!
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If when he has not stood trial, is there double Rather, is obvious where stood trial And from that first clause with who has stood trial, latter clause also with who has stood trial,
llm_translation: "How are they similar? If he did not stand in judgment, is there a double? Rather, it is obvious that he stood in judgment. And from the beginning, if he stood in judgment, the end also is that he stood in judgment!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, יָכֵילְנָא לְשַׁנּוֹיֵי לָךְ: רֵישָׁא בְּשֶׁעָמַד בַּדִּין, וְסֵיפָא בְּשֶׁלֹּא עָמַד בַּדִּין, וְכוּלַּהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא. וְשִׁינּוּיֵי דְּחִיקֵי לָא מְשַׁנֵּינַן לָךְ. דְּאִם כֵּן אָמְרַתְּ לִי: לִיתְנֵי רֵישָׁא ״רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר״, אוֹ לִיתְנֵי סֵיפָא ״דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן״.
human_translation: said to him: I could answer you first clause with who stood trial and latter clause with who has not stood trial, and entire is Rabbi Shimon. But I will not answer you a far-fetched answer, for if so, you say to me: Let teach first clause: Rabbi Shimon says, or let him teach latter clause: the statement of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: He said to him, "I am able to repeat it to you: the beginning when he stood in judgment, and the end when he did not stand in judgment, and all of it is Rabbi Shimon's. And the changes that are forced upon us, we do not repeat to you. For if you say to me: let the beginning be taught as 'Rabbi Shimon says,' or let the end be taught as 'the words of Rabbi Shimon.'"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: כּוּלַּהּ בְּשֶׁעָמַד בַּדִּין, וְרֵישָׁא רַבָּנַן וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rather, entire to who has stood trial, and first clause the Rabbis, And latter clause Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: Rather: the entirety when stood in judgment, and the beginning the Rabbis and the end Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדֵינָא לָךְ לְעִנְיַן קׇרְבַּן שְׁבוּעָה דְּרַחֲמָנָא פַּטְרֵיהּ, מִ״וְּכִחֵשׁ״.
human_translation: And I concede to you, with regard to an offering an oath that the Merciful One exempts him based upon “And deal falsely
llm_translation: And we concede to you regarding the matter of the Korban Shevuah that the Merciful One exempts it, from "u'kheish."

hebrew_text: וְכִי קָאָמֵינָא מָמוֹן הָוֵי — לְהוֹרִישׁוֹ לְבָנָיו.
human_translation: And when I say is monetary to bequeaths it to his sons.
llm_translation: And when I say "wealth," it refers to inheriting it to his sons.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אִם לֹא הִסְפִּיקָה לִגְבּוֹת עַד שֶׁמֵּת הָאָב — הֲרֵי הֵן שֶׁל עַצְמָהּ. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מָמוֹן הָוֵי לְהוֹרִישׁוֹ לְבָנָיו, לְעַצְמָהּ אַמַּאי? דְּאַחִין בָּעֵי מִיהְוֵי!
human_translation: raised an objection to Rabbi Shimon says: If did not manage to collect before the father died, they to her. And if you say is a monetary to bequeath it to his sons why to her? should be the brothers
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Rabbi Shimon says: If she did not have enough time to collect her kesuvah before the father died, they are considered her own. And if you say, "The money should be for her to bequeath to her sons, why should it be for herself?" - because brothers come first!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי מִילְּתָא קְשַׁאי בַּהּ רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף עֶשְׂרִין וְתַרְתֵּין שְׁנִין וְלָא אִיפְּרַק, עַד דִּיתֵיב רַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵישָׁא וּפָירְקַהּ: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְנָתַן הָאִישׁ הַשּׁוֹכֵב עִמָּהּ לַאֲבִי הַנַּעֲרָה חֲמִשִּׁים כֶּסֶף״, לֹא זִיכְּתָה תּוֹרָה לָאָב אֶלָּא מִשְּׁעַת נְתִינָה.
human_translation: Rava said: This matter was difficult for Rabba and Rav Yosef twenty-two years without resolution, until Rav Yosef sat at the head and resolved it There, it is different, as the verse states: “And the man who laid with her shall give the young woman’s father fifty shekels of silver” The Torah entitled the father only from the time of giving.
llm_translation: Rava said: This matter is difficult for Rabba and Rav Yosef, twenty-two years, and it was not resolved until Rav Yosef sat at the beginning and resolved it: It is different there, as the verse says: "And the man who lies with her shall give to the father of the young woman fifty silver shekels," the Torah did not grant the father anything except from the moment of giving.

hebrew_text: וְכִי קָאָמַר רַבָּה מָמוֹנָא הָוֵי לְהוֹרִישׁוֹ לְבָנָיו — בִּשְׁאָר קְנָסוֹת.
human_translation: And when Rabba said is monetary obligation to bequeath it to his sons, to other fines,
llm_translation: And when Ravah said, "Money is considered as an inheritance for his sons" - in other penalties.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה גַּבֵּי עֶבֶד, דִּכְתִיב: ״כֶּסֶף שְׁלֹשִׁים שְׁקָלִים יִתֵּן לַאדוֹנָיו״, הָכִי נָמֵי לֹא זִיכְּתָה תּוֹרָה לָאָדוֹן אֶלָּא מִשְּׁעַת נְתִינָה?! ״יִתֵּן״ לְחוּד, ״וְנָתַן״ לְחוּד.
human_translation: However, if so, with regard to a slave, where it is written: “He shall give to their master thirty shekels of silver” so too the Torah entitled the master only from the time of giving? “Shall give [ yiten ],” is distinct, “shall give [ venatan ],” is distinct.
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, regarding a slave, as it is written: "He shall give thirty shekels of silver to his master," thus it is stated: The Torah did not designate the master until the time of giving?! "He shall give" is distinct, "and it shall be given" is distinct.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכִחֵשׁ״? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנָתַן״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: If so, the verse states “and deal falsely,” should have the verse states “shall give,”
llm_translation: So, is it not so? The Talmud teaches to say: "and deny"? The Talmud teaches to say: "and he shall give" - who will give it to him!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כִּי אִיצְטְרִיךְ ״וְכִחֵשׁ״ — כְּגוֹן שֶׁעָמְדָה בַּדִּין, וּבָגְרָה וּמֵתָה. דְּהָתָם, כִּי קָא יָרֵית אָבִיהָ — מִינַּהּ דִּידַהּ קָא יָרֵית.
human_translation: Rava said: When it was necessary “and deal falsely,” where brought to trial, and she reached majority and died there, when the father inherits, from her he inherits.
llm_translation: Rava said: When it is needed "and she denied" - for example, when she stood trial, cursed, and died. There, when she cursed her father - she cursed her own kind.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, ״יָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ שֶׁהֵן קְנָס״, מָמוֹן הוּא! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: יָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ שֶׁעִיקָּרָן קְנָס.
human_translation: If so, Excluding these, as they are a fine, it is monetary Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said Excluding these, as they are originally a fine,
llm_translation: So it is, "These are those that are liable to pay a penalty," it is money! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "These are those whose essence is a penalty."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר, שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם קְנָס עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ. טַעְמָא דְּלֹא עָמַד בַּדִּין, הָא עָמַד בַּדִּין, דִּמְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ, קׇרְבַּן שְׁבוּעָה נָמֵי מִיחַיַּיב!
human_translation: raised an objection to Rabbi Shimon exempts as he does not pay a fine on his own The reason that he has not stood trial. he has stood trial in which case he pays on his own he should also be liable to an offering an oath
llm_translation: He raised an objection: Rabbi Shimon exempts one who does not pay a penalty of his own accord. The reason is that he did not stand in judgment; but if he stood in judgment and pays of his own accord, he is liable to bring a guilt-offering!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְדִבְרֵיהֶם דְּרַבָּנַן קָאָמַר לְהוּ: לְדִידִי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּעָמַד בַּדִּין — רַחֲמָנָא פַּטְרֵיהּ מִ״וְּכִחֵשׁ״. אֶלָּא לְדִידְכוּ, אוֹדוֹ לִי מִיהַת הֵיכָא דְּלֹא עָמַד בַּדִּין, דְּכִי קָא תָּבַע, קְנָסָא קָא תָּבַע,
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon stated to them in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis According to my although he has stood trial, the Merciful One exempts him from “And deal falsely However, according to your at least concede to me where he has not stood trial, that when one claims claims a fine
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon, regarding their words of the sages, said to them: According to my opinion, even though he stood in judgment, the Merciful One exempted him from "v'kachash." Rather, according to your opinion, admit to me from where is it that he did not stand in judgment, for when he demands, he is demanding a penalty.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדֶה בִּקְנָס פָּטוּר. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי, כִּי קָא תָבַע — בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם קָא תָבַע.
human_translation: And one who admits a fine is exempt. And the Rabbis hold when claims humiliation and degradation he claims.
llm_translation: He who admits to a penalty is exempt. And the Rabbis hold: when he demands - he demands embarrassment and blemish.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: לָא שָׁבֵיק אִינִישׁ מִידֵּי דְּקִיץ, וְתָבַע מִידֵּי דְּלָא קִיץ. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: לָא שָׁבֵיק אִינִישׁ מִידֵּי דְּכִי מוֹדֵי בֵּיהּ לָא מִיפְּטַר, וְתָבַע מִידֵּי דְּכִי מוֹדֵה בֵּיהּ מִיפְּטַר.
human_translation: with regard to what do disagree? Rav Pappa said: Rabbi Shimon holds a person does not leave something that fixed, and claim something that not fixed, And the Rabbis hold a person does not leave something that, if admits to it, he is not exempt and claim something that, if admits to it, he is exempt
llm_translation: With what do they argue? Rav Papa said, Rabbi Shimon holds: A person does not relinquish something willingly, and he claims something unwillingly. And the Rabbis hold: A person does not relinquish something when he does not admit to it, and he claims something when he admits to it.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי אֲבִינָא מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: בַּת הַנִּיזּוֹנֶת מִן הָאַחִין — מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לְמִי?
human_translation: Rabbi Avina raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: a daughter who is sustained by brothers, to whom do her earnings
llm_translation: Requested from him Rabbi Avina from Rav Sheshet: The daughter of the Nizonet from the brothers - the work of her hands is for whom?

hebrew_text: בִּמְקוֹם אָב קָיְימִי, מָה הָתָם — מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לָאָב, הָכָא נָמֵי — מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לָאַחִין, אוֹ דִלְמָא: לָא דָּמֵי לְאָב. הָתָם — מִדִּידֵיהּ מִיתַּזְנָא, הָכָא — לָאו מִדִּידְהוּ מִיתַּזְנָא.
human_translation: stand in place of father: Just as there, her earnings to the father, here too her earnings to the brothers. Or perhaps not similar father. there, she is sustained from his here, she is not sustained from their
llm_translation: In the place of a father is established, what is the comparison there - the work of her hands to the father, here it is stated - the work of her hands to her brothers, or perhaps: it is not comparable to a father. There - from her own, she benefits, here - not from their own, she benefits.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: אַלְמָנָה נִיזּוֹנֶת מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִים וּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ שֶׁלָּהֶן.
human_translation: said to him: You learned A widow is sustained from the property of the orphans, and her earnings are theirs.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Give it to her: a widow is sustained from the property of orphans and the work of their hands."

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? אַלְמְנָתוֹ, לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ בְּהַרְוָוחָה. בִּתּוֹ, נִיחָא לֵיהּ בְּהַרְווֹחָה.
human_translation: Are comparable? his widow, is not amenable her in comfort. his daughter, he is amenable in her comfort,
llm_translation: Who is similar? His widow, it is not pleasant for him with her. His daughter, it is pleasant for him with her.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּבִתּוֹ עֲדִיפָא לֵיהּ מֵאַלְמְנָתוֹ? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: עָשׂוּ אַלְמָנָה אֵצֶל הַבַּת כַּבַּת אֵצֶל אַחִין בִּנְכָסִין מוּעָטִין,
human_translation: Is that to say that his daughter is preferable to him than his widow? But didn’t Rabbi Abba say Rabbi Yosei said: established a widow with regard to the daughter, like a daughter with regard to brothers in a small estate
llm_translation: In the matter of his daughter, is it preferable for him than his widow? And Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yosei: They made a widow like a daughter in regard to inheritance of minimal assets.

hebrew_text: מָה הַבַּת אֵצֶל אַחִין — הַבַּת נִיזּוֹנֶת, וְהָאַחִין יִשְׁאֲלוּ עַל הַפְּתָחִים, אַף אַלְמָנָה אֵצֶל הַבַּת — אַלְמָנָה נִיזּוֹנֶת, וְהַבַּת תִּשְׁאַל עַל הַפְּתָחִים. לְעִנְיַן זִילוּתָא — אַלְמְנָתוֹ עֲדִיפָא לֵיהּ. לְעִנְיַן הַרְוָוחָה — בִּתּוֹ עֲדִיפָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Just as a daughter with regard to brothers, the daughter is sustained and the brothers beg at doors, so too, a widow with regard to the daughter, the widow is sustained and the daughters beg at doors. With regard to degradation, one’s widow is preferable to him, with regard to comfort, his daughter is preferable to him
llm_translation: Daughter by brothers - daughter is supported, and brothers inquire about the doors, also widow by daughter - widow is supported, and daughter inquires about the doors. Regarding modesty - his widow is preferable. Regarding inheritance - his daughter is preferable.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב יוֹסֵף: מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ וּמְצִיאָתָהּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא גָּבְתָה — מֵת הָאָב הֲרֵי הֵן שֶׁל אַחִין. טַעְמָא דִּבְחַיֵּי הָאָב, הָא לְאַחַר מִיתַת הָאָב — לְעַצְמָהּ. מַאי לָאו בְּנִיזּוֹנֶת? לָא, בְּשֶׁאֵינָהּ נִיזּוֹנֶת.
human_translation: Rav Yosef raised an objection her earnings and items she found, although she has not collected the father died, they her brothers. The reason in father’s lifetime, after the father’s death to her. What, is it not to who is sustained No, with who is not sustained
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Yosef raised a contradiction: Her handiwork and her findings, even though he did not betroth her — the father dies, they belong to her brothers. The reason is that while the father is alive, they belong to him, but after the father's death, they belong to her. What, is it not due to her maintenance? No, it is because she is not maintained.

hebrew_text: אִי בְּשֶׁאֵינָהּ נִיזּוֹנֶת, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יָכוֹל הָרַב לוֹמַר לָעֶבֶד ״עֲשֵׂה עִמִּי וְאֵינִי זָנָךְ״. הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּעֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי, דְּלָא כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ ״עִמָּךְ״.
human_translation: If of who is not sustained what of stating even according to the one who said a master can say to slave: Work for me but I will not feed you, this applies only to a Canaanite slave, with regard to whom it is not written “With you,”
llm_translation: If she is not sustained, what is the meaning to say? Even according to the one who says, "Can the master say to the servant, 'Do with me and I will not be unfaithful'?" These words are regarding a Canaanite servant, for it is not written in it "with you."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל עֶבֶד עִבְרִי דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״עִמָּךְ״ — לֹא. כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן בִּתּוֹ!
human_translation: However, a Hebrew slave, as it is written with regard to him: “With you” may not All the more so his daughter,
llm_translation: But a Hebrew slave, as it is written in it "with you" - no. All the more so his daughter!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְהַעֲדָפָה. אָמַר רָבָא: גַּבְרָא רַבָּה כְּרַב יוֹסֵף לָא יָדַע דְּאִיכָּא הַעֲדָפָה, וְקָמוֹתֵיב תְּיוּבְתָּא?
human_translation: Rabba bar Ulla said: necessary only for the surplus. Rava said a man great as Rav Yosef does not know that there is surplus, and he raises a refutation
llm_translation: Rabba bar Ulla said: It was not necessary except for preference. Rava said: A great man like Rav Yosef did not know that there is preference, and he established a contradiction?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: רַב יוֹסֵף מַתְנִיתִין גּוּפָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ. דְּקָתָנֵי: מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ וּמְצִיאָתָהּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא גָּבְתָה. מְצִיאָתָהּ מִמַּאן גָּבְיָא?
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: The mishna itself a difficulty to Rav Yosef as teaches: Her earnings and items she found, although she has not collected items she found, from whom does she collect
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Rav Yosef finds difficulty in the Mishnah itself. As it teaches: "The product of her hands and her findings," even though she did not collect it. From where does she collect it?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, הָכִי קָאָמַר: מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ כִּמְצִיאָתָהּ, מָה מְצִיאָתָהּ בְּחַיֵּי הָאָב — לָאָב, לְאַחַר מִיתַת הָאָב — לְעַצְמָהּ, אַף מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ נָמֵי: בְּחַיֵּי הָאָב — לָאָב, לְאַחַר מִיתַת הָאָב — לְעַצְמָהּ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, is it not this is what said: Her earnings like items she found: Just as items she found in father’s lifetime to father, after the father’s death to her, so too, her earnings as well: In the father’s lifetime, to the father, after the father’s death to her, learn from this
llm_translation: Rather, no, this is what it means: The product of her hands is like her acquisition. Just as her acquisition during the lifetime of the father belongs to the father, and after the father's death belongs to herself, so too, the product of her hands: during the lifetime of the father belongs to the father, and after the father's death belongs to herself. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בַּת הַנִּיזּוֹנֶת מִן הָאַחִין, מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לְעַצְמָהּ. אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: מַאי טַעְמָא — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִתְנַחַלְתֶּם אוֹתָם לִבְנֵיכֶם אַחֲרֵיכֶם״. ״אוֹתָם לִבְנֵיכֶם״, וְלֹא בְּנוֹתֵיכֶם לִבְנֵיכֶם. מַגִּיד שֶׁאֵין אָדָם מוֹרִישׁ זְכוּת בִּתּוֹ לִבְנוֹ.
human_translation: was also stated Rav Yehuda said Rav said: a daughter who is sustained by the brothers, her earnings to her. Rav Kahana said: What is the reason As it is written “And you may make them an inheritance for your sons after you” them, to your sons, and not your daughters to your sons. teaches that a man does not bequeath a right daughter to his son.
llm_translation: It was stated similarly, Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A daughter who inherits from her brothers, her handiwork is for herself. Rav Kahana said: What is the reason? - As it is written: "And you shall cause them to inherit it to your sons after you." "Them to your sons," and not your daughters to your sons. It is told that a person does not transfer the merit of his daughter to his son.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבָּה: וְאֵימָא בְּפִיתּוּי הַבַּת וּקְנָסוֹת וַחֲבָלוֹת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. וְכֵן תָּנָא רַב חֲנִינָא: בְּפִתּוּי הַבַּת וּקְנָסוֹת וַחֲבָלוֹת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר!
human_translation: Rabba objects to this But say the verse is speaking of the seduction of daughter, and fines and injuries And Rav Ḥanina likewise taught the verse is speaking of the seduction of daughter, and fines and injuries
llm_translation: Rabah objects to her: And say in the seduction of the daughter and fines and lashes the Scripture speaks. And similarly taught Rav Hanina: In the seduction of the daughter and fines and lashes the Scripture speaks!

hebrew_text: חֲבָלוֹת, צַעֲרָא דְגוּפָא נִינְהוּ. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא:
human_translation: injuries, they are her bodily pain, Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said:
llm_translation: Ropes, they are a source of bodily distress. Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said:

hebrew_text: שֶׁפְּצָעָהּ בְּפָנֶיהָ. אָמַר רַב זֵירָא אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה אָמַר רַב: בַּת הַנִּיזּוֹנֶת מִן הָאַחִין מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לְעַצְמָהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִתְנַחַלְתֶּם אוֹתָם לִבְנֵיכֶם אַחֲרֵיכֶם״. ״אוֹתָם לִבְנֵיכֶם״, וְלֹא בְּנוֹתֵיכֶם לִבְנֵיכֶם. מַגִּיד שֶׁאֵין אָדָם מוֹרִישׁ זְכוּת בִּתּוֹ לִבְנוֹ.
human_translation: when he injured her in her face, Rav Zeira said Rav Mattana said Rav said, and some say Rabbi Zeira said Rav Mattana said Rav said: a daughter who is sustained by the brothers, her earnings to her, as it is written: “And you may make them an inheritance for your sons after you” them, to your sons, and not your daughters to your sons. teaches that a man does not bequeath a right daughter to his son.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: If she was injured in her face. Rav Zeira said in the name of Rav Matna who said in the name of Rav, and some say, Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav Matna who said in the name of Rav: A daughter who inherits from her brothers, her handiwork is for herself, as it is written: "And you shall cause them to inherit to your sons after you." "Them to your sons," and not your daughters to your sons. It is told that a person does not transfer the merit of his daughter to his son.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֲבִימִי בַּר פַּפֵּי: שָׁקוּד אַמְרַהּ. שָׁקוּד מַנּוּ? שְׁמוּאֵל, הָא רַב אַמְרַהּ! אֵימָא: אַף שָׁקוּד אַמְרַהּ. אָמַר מָר בַּר אַמֵּימָר לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הָכִי אָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי: הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב, וְהִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב.
human_translation: Avimi bar Pappi said to Shakud said Who is Shakud? Shmuel. Didn’t Rav say it? say even Shakud said it, Mar bar Ameimar said to Rav Ashi: of Neharde’a say as follows: The halakha is in accordance with Rav Sheshet, Rav Ashi said: The halakha is in accordance with Rav, And the halakha is in accordance with Rav.
llm_translation: He said to him, Avimi son of Pappai: Shekud said. Shekud who said? Shmuel, but didn't Rav say it! I would say: Shekud also said. Mar son of Amemar said to Rav Ashei: Thus the Nahardeans say: The halakha follows the opinion of Rav Sheshet. Rav Ashei said: The halakha follows the opinion of Rav, and the halakha follows the opinion of Rav.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְאָרֵס אֶת בִּתּוֹ וְגֵרְשָׁהּ, אֵירְסָהּ וְנִתְאַרְמְלָה — כְּתוּבָּתָהּ שֶׁלּוֹ. הִשִּׂיאָהּ וְגֵרְשָׁהּ, הִשִּׂיאָהּ וְנִתְאַרְמְלָה — כְּתוּבָּתָהּ שֶׁלָּהּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הָרִאשׁוֹנָה שֶׁל אָב. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִם מִשֶּׁהִשִּׂיאָהּ, אֵין לְאָבִיהָ רְשׁוּת בָּהּ.
human_translation: One who betroths his daughter and divorces her, betroths her and she is widowed, her marriage contract, is his, married her and divorced her, married her and she was widowed, her marriage contract is hers. Rabbi Yehuda says the first to father. They said to him: If was after he married her her father no has authority over her.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who betroths his daughter and divorces her, betroths her and she is seduced - her marriage contract belongs to him. If he marries her off and divorces her, marries her off and she is seduced - her marriage contract belongs to her. Rabbi Yehuda says: The first case belongs to the father. They said to him: If he marries her off, her father has no authority over her.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טַעְמָא דְּהִשִּׂיאָהּ וְגֵרְשָׁהּ, הִשִּׂיאָהּ וְנִתְאַרְמְלָה, אֲבָל נִתְאַרְמְלָה תְּרֵי זִמְנֵי — תּוּ לָא חַזְיָא לְאִינְּסוֹבֵי. וְאַגַּב אוֹרְחֵיהּ קָא סָתֵים לַן תַּנָּא כְּרַבִּי, דְּאָמַר: בִּתְרֵי זִמְנֵי הָוְיָא חֲזָקָה.
human_translation: reason that married her and divorced her, married her and she was widowed. However, she was widowed twice she is no longer fit to be married, And tanna incidentally an unattributed in accordance with Rabbi who said presumption is by two occasions.
llm_translation: The taste of causing her to drink and divorcing her, causing her to drink and becoming barren, but becoming barren twice — it is not seen to be a cause. And because of her behavior, the Mishnah is in accordance with Rabbi, who said: Becoming barren twice establishes a presumption.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הָרִאשׁוֹנָה שֶׁל אָב. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: הוֹאִיל וּמִשְּׁעַת אֵירוּסִין זָכָה בָּהֶן הָאָב.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says the first to father. What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda? Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: Since the father is entitled to from the time of betrothal,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: The firstborn of the father. What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's statement? Both Rabba and Rav Yosef say: Since from the time of betrothal the father acquired rights in her.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הָרִאשׁוֹנָה שֶׁל אָב. וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בִּמְאָרֵס אֶת בִּתּוֹ כְּשֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה וּבָגְרָה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִשֵּׂאת, שֶׁאֵין לְאָבִיהָ רְשׁוּת בָּהּ. אַמַּאי? הָכָא נָמֵי לֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וּמִשְּׁעַת אֵירוּסִין זָכָה בָּהֶן הָאָב.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection Rabbi Yehuda says the first to father. And Rabbi Yehuda concedes of one who betroths his daughter when she is a minor, and she matures and subsequently marries, that her father no has authority over her why Here too, let him say: Since the father is entitled to from the time of betrothal,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rabbi Yehuda says, "The first marriage belongs to the father." And Rabbi Yehuda concedes in the case where he betroths his daughter when she is a minor and she grows up, and only afterwards does she get married, that her father has no authority over her. Why? Here too, it can be said: Since from the time of betrothal she gained merit through them, her father has no claim over her.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי אִתְּמַר, הָכִי אִתְּמַר: רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: הוֹאִיל וּבִרְשׁוּתוֹ נִכְתָּבִין.
human_translation: Rather, if was stated, it was stated as follows: Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: Since are written under his authority,
llm_translation: Rather, if it is stated, it is stated thus: Rabba and Rav Yosef both said: Since they were written with his permission.

hebrew_text: וּמִיגְבָּא, מֵאֵימַת גָּבְיָא?
human_translation: And From when collection
llm_translation: And from where is the source of "Gavya," from when is it derived?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מָנֶה מָאתַיִם מִן הָאֵירוּסִין, וְתוֹסֶפֶת מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין. וְרַב אַסִּי אָמַר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: one hundred dinars two hundred from the betrothal, but addition, from the marriage. And Rav Asi said: both this and that from the marriage.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: A hundred from the betrothed, and an addition from the married. And Rav Assi said: One from this and one from that of the married.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַב הוּנָא הָכִי? וְהָאִתְּמַר: הוֹצִיאָה עָלָיו שְׁתֵּי כְּתוּבּוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל מָאתַיִם, וְאַחַת שֶׁל שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת. וְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: בָּאתָה לִגְבּוֹת מָאתַיִם — גּוֹבָה מִזְּמַן רִאשׁוֹן, שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת — גּוֹבָה מִזְּמַן שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: And did Rav Huna say this, But wasn’t it stated produced against two marriage contracts, one of two hundred and one of three hundred? And Rav Huna said: she came to collect two hundred she collect from the first time, three hundred she collect from the second time.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who said so, Rav Huna thus? And it was taught: She shall bring upon him two documents, one of two hundred, and one of three hundred. And Rav Huna said: If she brought two hundred - she collects from the first time, three hundred - she collects from the second time.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אִיתָא, תִּיגְבֵּי מָאתַיִם מִזְּמַן רִאשׁוֹן, וּמֵאָה מִזְּמַן שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: And if it is so, let her collect two hundred from the first time, and the one hundred from the second time.
llm_translation: And if it is stated, it should be increased by two hundred from the first time, and one hundred from the second time.

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, תִּיגְבֵּי חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת כּוּלָּם? מָאתַיִם מִזְּמַן רִאשׁוֹן, תְּלָת מְאָה מִזְּמַן שֵׁנִי!
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, let her collect the entire five hundred two hundred from the first time three hundred from the second time.
llm_translation: "And according to your reasoning, should they all receive five hundred? Two hundred from the first time, three hundred from the second time!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת מַאי טַעְמָא לָא גָּבְיָא? כֵּיוָן דְּלָא כָּתַב לָהּ: ״צְבֵיתִי וְאוֹסֵיפִית לָךְ תְּלָת מְאָה אַמָּאתַיִם״. הָכִי קָאָמַר לַהּ: אִי מִזְּמַן רִאשׁוֹן גָּבְיַאתְּ — גְּבַאי מָאתַיִם, אִי מִזְּמַן שֵׁנִי גָּבְיַאתְּ — גְּבַאי תְּלָת מְאָה
human_translation: Rather, what is the reason she may not collect five hundred Since not write to her I chose add to your three hundred to two hundred this is what he say to her If you collect from the first time, you may collect two hundred if you collect from the second time, you may collect three hundred
llm_translation: Rather, five hundred, what is the reason it is not collected? Since it did not write to her: "I have set aside and added to you three hundred cubits." This is what he is saying to her: If from the first time it is collected - it is collected two hundred, if from the second time it is collected - it is collected three hundred.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּלָא גָּבְיָא, מִדְּלָא כְּתַב לַהּ ״אוֹסֵיפִית לִךְ מֵאָה אַמָּאתַיִם״, אַחוֹלֵי אַחֵילְתֵּיהּ לְשִׁעְבּוּדָא קַמָּא.
human_translation: Here too, this is the reasoning that she does not collect as he did not write to her I added one hundred to your of two hundred she forgave to the first lien
llm_translation: Here is the taste of not being high, since it did not write to her "I will add to you two hundred cubits," she would have been liable for the first service.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אִי בָּעֲיָא — בְּהַאי גָּבְיָא, אִי בָּעֲיָא — בְּהַאי גָּבְיָא. לֵימָא פְּלִיגָא דְּרַב נַחְמָן? דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: שְׁנֵי שְׁטָרוֹת הַיּוֹצְאִין בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה — בִּיטֵּל שֵׁנִי אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: The Master, said, if she wishes collect this if she wishes collect that Shall we say disagrees that Rav Naḥman? As Rav Naḥman said: two documents that are produced one after the other, second, nullifies the first.
llm_translation: Master said: If he wants - with this woman, if he wants - with that woman. Let us say, does this disagree with Rav Nachman? For Rav Nachman said: Two documents that come out one after the other - the second one annuls the first.

hebrew_text: לָאו מִי אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וּמוֹדֶה רַב נַחְמָן דְּאִי אוֹסֵיף בֵּיהּ דִּיקְלָא, לְתוֹסֶפֶת כַּתְבֵיהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי, הָא אוֹסֵיף לַהּ מִידֵּי!
human_translation: Was it not stated with regard to Rav Pappa said: And Rav Naḥman concedes that if he added a palm tree in he wrote it as an addition, Here too, he added something for her,
llm_translation: The text reads: "If it was not stated regarding it, Rav Papa said: and Rav Nachman concedes that if one adds to it a palm branch, he should write an addition. Here, it is stated, there he should add to it immediately!"

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: שְׁנֵי שְׁטָרוֹת הַיּוֹצְאִין בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה — בִּיטֵּל שֵׁנִי אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וּמוֹדֶה רַב נַחְמָן דְּאִי אוֹסֵיף בֵּיהּ דִּיקְלָא — לְתוֹסֶפֶת כַּתְבֵיהּ. פְּשִׁיטָא רִאשׁוֹן בְּמֶכֶר וְשֵׁנִי בְּמַתָּנָה, לְיַפּוֹת כֹּחוֹ הוּא דִּכְתַב לֵיהּ — מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא.
human_translation: itself: Rav Naḥman said: two documents that are produced one after the other, second nullifies the first. Rav Pappa said: And Rav Naḥman concedes that if he added a palm tree to it, he wrote it as an addition. is obvious first of a sale, and the second as a gift, he wrote to improve the rights due to the halakha one borders
llm_translation: Body. Rav Nachman said: Two documents that are issued, one after the other - the second one annuls the first. Rav Papa said: And Rav Nachman concedes that if one adds a date palm to it - it is considered an addition to its writing. It is obvious that the first one is for a sale and the second one is for a gift, for he wrote it beautifully - because of the law of the land.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן רִאשׁוֹן בְּמַתָּנָה וְשֵׁנִי בְּמֶכֶר, דְּאָמְרִינַן מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַעַל חוֹב הוּא דִּכְתַב כֵּן.
human_translation: And all the more so, first as a gift and the second of a sale, as we say due to the halakha a creditor that he wrote this way.
llm_translation: And all the more so, the first born in gift, and the second born in sale, as we say because of the law of a creditor, that he wrote thus.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי שְׁנֵיהֶם בְּמֶכֶר שְׁנֵיהֶם בְּמַתָּנָה בִּיטֵּל שֵׁנִי אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן. מַאי טַעְמָא? רַפְרָם אָמַר: אֵימַר אוֹדוֹיֵי אוֹדִי לֵיהּ. רַב אַחָא אָמַר: אֵימַר אַחוֹלֵי אַחְלֵיהּ לְשִׁיעְבּוּדֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, if both of them of sale both of them of gifts, second nullifies the first. What is the reason Rafram said: Say admitted to him Rav Aḥa said: Say forgave him his lien
llm_translation: Rather, both of them in a sale, both of them in a gift, the second one annuls the first. What is the reason? Rafḥam said: "Let him admit, let him admit to him." Rav Aḥa said: "Let him whisper, let him whisper to his servant."

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ: אוֹרוֹעֵי סָהֲדֵי.
human_translation: What is between The between them impair witnesses:
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them: "His witnesses are wicked."

hebrew_text: וּלְשַׁלּוֹמֵי פֵּירֵי וּלְטַסְקָא.
human_translation: And to paying produce And with regard to the land tax [ taska ].
llm_translation: And for those who seek peace and for Tascus.

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ דִּכְתוּבָּה? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מָנֶה מָאתַיִם מִן הָאֵירוּסִין, וְתוֹסֶפֶת מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין.
human_translation: What was about a marriage contract? Come hear as Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said in the name of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon: one hundred dinars two hundred from the betrothal, and the additional from the marriage.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of the verse? Come and hear, for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel in the name of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon: Count two hundred from the betrothal, and an addition from the marriage.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין. וְהִלְכְתָא: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: both this and that from the marriage. And the halakha both this and that, from the marriage,
llm_translation: The Sages say: "One this and one this from the betrotheds." And the halakha is: "One this and one this from the betrotheds."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַגִּיּוֹרֶת שֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירָה בִּתָּהּ עִמָּהּ וְזִינְּתָה — הֲרֵי זוֹ בְּחֶנֶק, אֵין לָהּ לֹא פֶּתַח בֵּית הָאָב, וְלֹא מֵאָה סֶלַע.
human_translation: convert whose daughter converted with her and engaged in licentious sexual relations she is by strangulation, She has neither entrance to father’s house, nor one hundred sela
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "If a convert converted her daughter with her and she engaged in prostitution - she is considered as if she were choked; she has no share in the World to Come, and she is not buried in the burial place of her fathers."

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה הוֹרָתָהּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּקְדוּשָּׁה וְלֵידָתָהּ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה — הֲרֵי זוֹ בִּסְקִילָה, וְאֵין לָהּ לֹא פֶּתַח בֵּית הָאָב, וְלֹא מֵאָה סֶלַע. הָיְתָה הוֹרָתָהּ וְלֵידָתָהּ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, הֲרֵי הִיא כְּבַת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכׇל דְּבָרֶיהָ.
human_translation: conception occurred was not in sanctity, but her birth in sanctity, this by stoning she has neither entrance to father’s house, nor one hundred sela her conception and birth occurred was in sanctity, she is like a Jewish woman in all matters.
llm_translation: Her pregnancy was not in sanctity and her birth was in sanctity - this one is subject to stoning, and she has neither the rights of a daughter of the father's house nor the rights of a hundred zuz. If her pregnancy and birth were in sanctity, she is like a daughter of Israel in all respects.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ לָהּ אָב וְאֵין לָהּ פֶּתַח בֵּית הָאָב, יֵשׁ לָהּ פֶּתַח בֵּית הָאָב וְאֵין לָהּ אָב — הֲרֵי זוֹ בִּסְקִילָה. לֹא נֶאֱמַר פֶּתַח בֵּית אָב אֶלָּא לְמִצְוָה.
human_translation: she has a father but does not have an entrance to father’s house, she has an entrance to father’s house but does not have a father, she is via stoning, as entrance to her father’s house is stated only for a mitzva
llm_translation: She has a father but does not have a doorway of the father's house, she has a doorway of the father's house but does not have a father - this is subject to stoning. It is not said "doorway of the father's house" except for a commandment.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״וָמֵתָה״, לְרַבּוֹת הוֹרָתָהּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּקְדוּשָּׁה וְלֵידָתָהּ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה.
human_translation: From where are these matters Reish Lakish said: As the verse states: that she die” to include whose conception was not in sanctity but her birth in sanctity.
llm_translation: Gemara: What do these words mean? Reish Lakish said, as the verse states "and she shall die," to include her conception not in sanctity and her birth in sanctity.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי מִילְקָא נָמֵי נִילְקֵי, וּמֵאָה סֶלַע נָמֵי לְשַׁלֵּם! אָמַר קְרָא ״וָמֵתָה״ — לְמִיתָה נִתְרַבְּתָה וְלֹא לִקְנָס. וְאֵימָא לְרַבּוֹת הוֹרָתָהּ וְלֵידָתָהּ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה? הָהִיא יִשְׂרְאֵלִית מְעַלַּיְיתָא הִיא.
human_translation: If so, let also be flogged and let him also pay one hundred sela . the verse states: “That she die” she was included with regard to death but not with regard to fine. Say to include whose conception and birth in sanctity. That is a full-fledged Jewish woman,
llm_translation: Thus, if so, words are similar to words, and a hundred rocks are similar to pay! The verse says, "And she shall die" - for death she was multiplied and not for a penalty. And why not to include her teachings and her giving birth in holiness? That Israelite woman is exceptional.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא לְרַבּוֹת הוֹרָתָהּ וְלֵידָתָהּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּקְדוּשָּׁה! אִם כֵּן, ״בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״ מַאי אַהֲנִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And say to include whose conception and birth not in sanctity. If so, “in Israel” what purpose does it
llm_translation: And why not to include her teaching and her childbirth not in holiness! If so, what relevance does "in Israel" have to it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: הַמּוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע עַל הַיְּתוֹמָה פָּטוּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנָתְנוּ לַאֲבִי הַנַּעֲרָה״ — פְּרָט לְזוֹ שֶׁאֵין לָהּ אָב.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: The defamer of an orphan is exempt, as it is stated: and give them to the father of the young woman” excludes this one who does not have a father.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina said: One who speaks a bad name against an orphan is exempt, as it is stated: "And they shall give to the father of the young woman" - excluding one who does not have a father.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר זְבִידָא: ״וְאִם מָאֵן יְמָאֵן אָבִיהָ״ — לְרַבּוֹת יְתוֹמָה לִקְנָס, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin, and some say Rabbi Yosei bar Zevida, raised an objection to this “If her father utterly refuse [ ma’en yima’en ] to include an orphan for fine, the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili.
llm_translation: The text states: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin raises an objection, and it was taught: Rabbi Yosei bar Zavida says, "And if her father refuses" - to include a father who refuses to marry off his orphan daughter, the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean.

hebrew_text: הוּא מוֹתֵיב לַהּ וְהוּא מְפָרֵק לַהּ: בָּבָא עָלֶיהָ וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְיַתְּמָה.
human_translation: raised the objection and he resolved it: one who had intercourse with her and afterward was orphaned.
llm_translation: He sets before her and he explains to her: he came upon her and afterwards she consented.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: חַיָּיב. מִמַּאי — מִדְּתָנֵי אַמֵּי: בְּתוּלַת יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְלֹא בְּתוּלַת גֵּרִים.
human_translation: Rava said, obligated From where from Ami taught “a virgin of Israel” and not a virgin a convert.
llm_translation: Rava said: obligated. From what? - from the teaching of the mothers: the virginity of Israel, but not the virginity of converts.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל מִיחַיַּיב, הַיְינוּ דְּאִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְמַעוֹטֵי גֵּרִים. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל כְּהַאי גַוְונָא פָּטוּר, הַשְׁתָּא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל פָּטוּר, בְּגֵרִים מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: Granted, if you say in a case like this, with regard to a Jew, he is obligated that is it was necessary the verse to exclude converts. However, if you say that in a case like this involving a Jew he is exempt, now involving a Jew exempt, is necessary that converts
llm_translation: If you say that in Israel, in such a case, one is liable, that is because a verse is needed to exclude converts. But if you say that in Israel, in such a case, one is exempt, now in Israel one is exempt, why would it be necessary for converts?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הַמּוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע עַל הַקְּטַנָּה — פָּטוּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנָתְנוּ לַאֲבִי הַנַּעֲרָה״, ״נַעֲרָה״ מָלֵא דִּבֵּר הַכָּתוּב.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: The defamer a minor is exempt, as it is stated: “And give them to the father of the young woman [ na’ara ]” the verse was speaking fully a young woman,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: One who speaks a bad name against a minor - exempt, as it is stated: "And they shall give to the father of the young woman," "young woman" the Scripture spoke full.
