hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אַחָא בַּר אַבָּא: טַעְמָא דִּכְתִיב בַּהּ ״הַנַּעֲרָה״, הָא לָאו הָכִי הֲוָה אָמֵינָא אֲפִילּוּ קְטַנָּה?! הָא כְּתִיב: ״וְאִם אֱמֶת הָיָה הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה לֹא נִמְצְאוּ בְתוּלִים לַנַּעֲרָה. וְהוֹצִיאוּ אֶת הַנַּעֲרָה אֶל פֶּתַח בֵּית אָבִיהָ וּסְקָלוּהָ״, וּקְטַנָּה לָאו בַּת עוֹנָשִׁין הִיא!
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Abba objects to this: the reason is that it is written her “ na’ara ” but if that were not so, I would say even a minor Isn’t it written: “But if this matter is true, that the tokens of virginity were not found in this young woman, then they shall bring out the young woman to the entrance to her father’s house and stone her” And a minor is not eligible for punishment,
llm_translation: The text reads: "Matkeif lah Rav Acha bar Abba: Ta'ama dichtiv bah 'han-na'arah', ha lav hachi hava ameina afilu ketanah?! Ha k'tiv: 've'im emet haya hadavar hazeh lo nimtzeu vetulim la-na'arah. Ve'hotzi'u et ha-na'arah el petach beit avia u'skaluha', u'ketanah lav bat onashin hi!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: כָּאן ״נַעֲרָה״, הָא כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״נַעֲרָ״ — אֲפִילּוּ קְטַנָּה בַּמַּשְׁמָע.
human_translation: Rather, Here, na’ara wherever it is stated na’ara it indicates even a minor
llm_translation: Rather: here "na'arah," whereas anywhere that it says "na'ar" - even a young girl in matters of betrothal.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי שֵׁילָא: שָׁלֹשׁ מִדּוֹת בַּנַּעֲרָה: בָּאוּ לָהּ עֵדִים בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ שֶׁזִּינְּתָה בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ —
human_translation: Sheila taught three circumstances with regard to a young woman witnesses came her in her father-in-law’s house, that she committed adultery in her father’s house,
llm_translation: Tanna taught in the name of Sheilah: Three characteristics in a betrothed maiden: Witnesses came to her in the house of her father-in-law that she committed adultery in her father's house—

hebrew_text: סוֹקְלִין אוֹתָהּ עַל פֶּתַח בֵּית אָבִיהָ, כְּלוֹמַר: רְאוּ גִּידּוּלִים שֶׁגִּידַּלְתֶּם. בָּאוּ לָהּ עֵדִים בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ שֶׁזִּינְּתָה בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ — סוֹקְלִין אוֹתָהּ עַל פֶּתַח שַׁעַר הָעִיר. סָרְחָה וּלְבַסּוֹף בָּגְרָה — תִּידּוֹן בְּחֶנֶק.
human_translation: one stones her at the entrance to her father’s house, as though to say: See what you have brought up. witnesses came her in her father’s house, that she committed adultery in her father’s house, one stones her at the entrance to the gate of the city. she went astray and subsequently reached majority, she is sentenced to strangulation,
llm_translation: They stone her at the entrance of her father's house, meaning to say: "See the offspring that you have produced." If witnesses came to testify about her in her father's house that she engaged in relations there - they stone her at the entrance of the city gate. If she rebelled and ultimately married - she is judged by strangulation.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּכֹל הֵיכָא דְּאִישְׁתַּנִּי גּוּפָא אִישְׁתַּנִּי קְטָלָא? וּרְמִינְהִי: נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה שֶׁזִּינְּתָה, וּמִשֶּׁבָּגְרָה הוֹצִיא עָלֶיהָ שֵׁם רַע הוּא אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה, וְאֵינוֹ נוֹתֵן מֵאָה סֶלַע, הִיא וְזוֹמְמֶיהָ מַקְדִּימִין לְבֵית הַסְּקִילָה.
human_translation: Is that to say that any where her body has changed death changes raises a contradiction a betrothed young woman who committed adultery, and after she reached majority defamed her, he is not flogged and does not give one hundred sela she and her conspiring witnesses are brought early to the place of stoning.
llm_translation: In the matter of wherever a man has engaged in intercourse, he has engaged in the act of killing? And they raised a dilemma: A betrothed maiden who was seduced, and after she became of age, if a bad name was uttered against her, he is not flogged, and he does not pay one hundred sela, she and her conspirators are brought to the house of stoning.

hebrew_text: הִיא וְזוֹמְמֶיהָ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא: אוֹ הִיא אוֹ זוֹמְמֶיהָ מַקְדִּימִין לְבֵית הַסְּקִילָה.
human_translation: enter your mind she and her conspiring witnesses, Rather, Either she or her conspiring witnesses are brought early to the place of stoning.
llm_translation: She and her plotters, is it according to your opinion?! Rather, either she or her plotters are brought before the court of stoning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע קָאָמְרַתְּ? שָׁאנֵי מוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע דְּחִידּוּשׁ הוּא, דְּהָא נִכְנְסָה לְחוּפָּה וְלֹא נִבְעֲלָה, בְּעָלְמָא, וְזִינְּתָה — בְּחֶנֶק, וְאִילּוּ מוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע — בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: Rava said: A defamer, you said? A defamer is different as it is a novel as, generally, entered the and did not have intercourse committed adultery, by strangulation, However, a defamer, by stoning,
llm_translation: Rava said: "Are you saying 'one who brings out a bad name'? It is different when one brings out a bad name in a new way, for example, she entered the wedding canopy but did not consummate the marriage, in general, and she committed adultery - by strangulation, but if one brings out a bad name - by stoning."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרָבָא: דִּלְמָא כִּי חַדֵּית רַחֲמָנָא הֵיכָא דְּלָא אִישְׁתַּנִּי גּוּפָא, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאִישְׁתַּנִּי גּוּפָא, לָא חַדֵּית רַחֲמָנָא!
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rava: Perhaps when the Merciful One introduced the novelty where her body has not changed However, where her body has changed the Merciful One did not introduce the novelty
llm_translation: He said to him Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua to Rava: Perhaps when the Merciful One is angry, where He does not change His mind, but where He changes His mind, the Merciful One does not become angry!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אִישְׁתַּנִּי וְלָא אִישְׁתַּנִּי, תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דִּתְנַן: חָטְאוּ עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִתְמַנּוּ, וְנִתְמַנּוּ, הֲרֵי הֵן כְּהֶדְיוֹטוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: changes or does not change is tanna’im , as we learned they sinned before they were appointed, and they were appointed, they are like commoners.
llm_translation: Rather, said Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: "It was taught, 'They sinned before they were appointed, and once they were appointed, they are like ordinary people.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אִם נוֹדַע לָהֶם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִתְמַנּוּ — חַיָּיבִים, מִשֶּׁנִּתְמַנּוּ — פְּטוּרִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: If became known to them before they were appointed, they are liable after they were appointed, they are exempt
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: If it was known to them before they were appointed - they are obligated, once they were appointed - they are exempt.

hebrew_text: אֵימוֹר דְּשָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָזֵיל אַף בָּתַר יְדִיעָה, דְּאָזֵיל בָּתַר יְדִיעָה וְלָא אָזֵיל בָּתַר חֶטְאָה מִי שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ? אִם כֵּן — לַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן כִּי דְּהַשְׁתָּא: מָשׁוּחַ פַּר, וְנָשִׂיא שָׂעִיר!
human_translation: Say that we heard that Rabbi Shimon follows even awareness, did you hear him that he follows awareness and does not follow sin? If so, let him bring offering that current anointed a bullock, and a prince, a goat.
llm_translation: Tractate: Eimor d'sham'inan lei l'Rabbi Shimon d'azil af batar yedi'ah, d'azil batar yedi'ah v'lo azil batar chet'ah mi sham'at lei? Im kein — laytei korban ki d'hashta: mashuach par, v'nasi sa'ir!

hebrew_text: הָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְתַנָּא: תְּנִי, תִּידּוֹן בִּסְקִילָה. וְאַמַּאי? ״נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא וְהָא בּוֹגֶרֶת הִיא! אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״הַנַּעֲרָה״ — הַנַּעֲרָה שֶׁהָיְתָה כְּבָר.
human_translation: Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say to tanna , Teach she is sentenced to stoning But why? The Merciful One says: A betrothed young woman, but this one is a grown woman. Rabbi Ile’a said: The verse states: The young woman, in reference to the young woman that she already was
llm_translation: The one said to him Rabbi Yochanan to the Tanna: Teach, they shall judge by stoning. And why? "A betrothed maiden" the Merciful One said, and she is a bogeret! Rabbi Ilai said, a verse said: "The maiden" - the maiden that she already was.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא לְרַבִּי אִילְעָא: אִי הָכִי מִילְקָא נָמֵי לִילְקֵי, וּמֵאָה סֶלַע נָמֵי לִישַׁלֵּם! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַחֲמָנָא נַיצְּלַן מֵהַאי דַּעְתָּא: אַדְּרַבָּה, רַחֲמָנָא נַיצְּלַן מִדַּעְתָּא דִּידָךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said to Rabbi Ile’a: If so, let also be flogged, and let him also pay one hundred sela said to him: May the Merciful One save us from this opinion, On the contrary, may the Merciful One save us from your opinion,
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Chananya to Rabbi Ilai: If so, let the milk be poured out, and let a hundred coins be paid! He said to him: The Merciful One should save us from such a thought: Adrabah, the Merciful One should save us from your thought.

hebrew_text: וְטַעְמָא מַאי? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אָבִין, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַבָּא: זוֹ מַעֲשֶׂיהָ גָּרְמוּ לָהּ, וְזֶה עֲקִימַת שְׂפָתָיו גָּרְמוּ לוֹ. זוֹ מַעֲשֶׂיהָ גָּרְמוּ לָהּ, (כְּשֶׁהִיא) [כִּי] זַנַּאי — [כְּשֶׁהִיא] נַעֲרָה זַנַּאי. וְזֶה עֲקִימַת שְׂפָתָיו גָּרְמוּ לוֹ, אֵימַת קָא מִיחַיַּיב? הָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא, וְהָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא בּוֹגֶרֶת הֲוַאי.
human_translation: And what is the reason Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Avin said, and some say Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Abba: this one, her act caused her whereas that one, the twisting of his lips caused his This one, her action caused her When she committed adultery, a young woman committed adultery, And that one, the twisting of his lips caused his When become liable? that time and that time was a grown woman.
llm_translation: The reason for this? Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avin said, and some say Rabbi Yitzchak bar Abba said: Her actions caused it for her, and his lip movements caused it for him. Her actions caused it for her, (when she is) acting promiscuously — (when she is) a promiscuous young woman. And his lip movements caused it for him, when is he liable? That moment, and that moment he is engaging in intercourse.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה שֶׁזִּינְּתָה — סוֹקְלִין אוֹתָהּ עַל פֶּתַח בֵּית אָבִיהָ. אֵין לָהּ פֶּתַח בֵּית הָאָב, סוֹקְלִין אוֹתָהּ עַל פֶּתַח שַׁעַר הָעִיר הַהִיא. וּבְעִיר שֶׁרוּבָּהּ גּוֹיִם — סוֹקְלִין אוֹתָהּ עַל פֶּתַח בֵּית דִּין. כַּיּוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: הָעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה — סוֹקְלִין אוֹתוֹ עַל שַׁעַר שֶׁעָבַד בּוֹ, וּבְעִיר שֶׁרוּבָּהּ גּוֹיִם — סוֹקְלִין אוֹתוֹ עַל פֶּתַח בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: The Sages taught a betrothed young woman who committed adultery, one stones her at the entrance to her father’s house. she does not have an entrance father’s house, one stones her at the entrance gate of that city. And in a city that is mostly gentiles, one stones her at the entrance the court. In a similar manner, you say: one who engaged in idol worship, one stones him at the entrance the gate where he worshipped, and in a city that is mostly gentiles one stones him at the entrance the court.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A betrothed maiden who committed adultery - they stone her at the entrance of her father's house. If she does not have a father's house, they stone her at the entrance of that city's gate. And in a city where most of the inhabitants are non-Jews - they stone her at the entrance of the court. By way of analogy, you can say: A worshipper of foreign idols - they stone him at the gate he worshipped through, and in a city where most of the inhabitants are non-Jews - they stone him at the entrance of the court.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״שְׁעָרֶיךָ״, זֶה שַׁעַר שֶׁעָבַד בּוֹ. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר שַׁעַר שֶׁעָבַד בּוֹ, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא שַׁעַר שֶׁנִּידּוֹן בּוֹ?
human_translation: From where are these matters As the Sages taught: “Your gates,” this is the gate where he worshipped you say the gate where he worshipped, or it is only the gate where he was sentenced,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What are these words?" For the Rabbis taught: "Your gates," this refers to a gate that was worked with. Do you say a gate that was worked with, or is it only a gate that is judged with?

hebrew_text: נֶאֱמַר ״שְׁעָרֶיךָ״ לְמַטָּה, וְנֶאֱמַר ״שְׁעָרֶיךָ״ לְמַעְלָה. מָה ״שְׁעָרֶיךָ״ הָאָמוּר לְמַעְלָה — שַׁעַר שֶׁעָבַד בּוֹ, אַף ״שְׁעָרֶיךָ״ הָאָמוּר לְמַטָּה — שַׁעַר שֶׁעָבַד בּוֹ.
human_translation: It is stated “your gates” below, and is stated “your gates” above, Just as “your gates” stated above gate where he worshipped, so too “your gates” stated below, gate where he worshipped
llm_translation: It is stated "your gates" below, and it is stated "your gates" above. Just as the "your gates" that is said above refers to a gate that has been worked with, so too the "your gates" that is said below refers to a gate that has been worked with.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״שְׁעָרֶיךָ״, וְלֹא שַׁעֲרֵי גוֹיִם. הַאי ״שְׁעָרֶיךָ״, הָא אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ? אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא ״שַׁעַר״, מַאי ״שְׁעָרֶיךָ״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: Alternatively, “your gates,” and not the gates of gentiles. This “your gates,” you have used it If so, let the verse say gate. what “your gates”? conclude two from it.
llm_translation: Another explanation: "Your gates," and not the gates of the nations. This "your gates," have you excluded it? If so, let the verse say "gate," what is "your gates"? Learn from it two.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה מְנָא לַן?
human_translation: We found idolatrous worship, From where do we a betrothed young woman
llm_translation: We have found foreign worship, where is the betrothed maiden for us?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: גָּמַר ״פֶּתַח״ מִ״פֶּתַח״, וּ״פֶתַח״ מִ״שַּׁעַר״, וְ״שַׁעַר״ מִ״שְּׁעָרֶיךָ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: derives “entrance” from “entrance” and entrance from “gate,” and “gate” from “your gates”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Avahu: "Learn 'petach' from 'petach,' and 'petach' from 'sha'ar,' and 'sha'ar' from 'she'arecha'."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמּוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע לוֹקֶה וְנוֹתֵן מֵאָה סֶלַע. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לִלְקוֹת — לוֹקֶה מִכׇּל מָקוֹם, מֵאָה סֶלַע, בָּעַל — נוֹתֵן, לֹא בָּעַל — אֵינוֹ נוֹתֵן.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who defames is flogged and gives one hundred sela . Rabbi Yehuda says: for flogging, he is flogged in any case. one hundred sela , he had intercourse he gives not have intercourse he does not give
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who utters a derogatory name is lashed and must pay one hundred sela. Rabbi Yehuda says: For striking - he is lashed from any place, one hundred sela; if he is a husband - he pays, if he is not a husband - he does not pay.

hebrew_text: קָא מִיפַּלְגִי בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב וְרַבָּנַן. וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: הַמּוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע — לוֹקֶה וְנוֹתֵן מֵאָה סֶלַע, בֵּין בָּעַל בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בָּעַל, כְּרַבָּנַן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לִלְקוֹת — לוֹקֶה מִכׇּל מָקוֹם, מֵאָה סֶלַע, בָּעַל — נוֹתֵן, לֹא בָּעַל — אֵינוֹ נוֹתֵן, כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב.
human_translation: disagree with regard to the dispute between Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov and the Rabbis, and this is what is saying: The defamer is flogged and gives one hundred sela , whether he had intercourse whether he did not have intercourse in accordance with the Rabbis. Rabbi Yehuda says: for flogging, he is flogged in any case, one hundred sela , he had intercourse he gives he not have intercourse he does not give in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: He was arguing in the dispute of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov and the Sages. And thus he said: One who utters a derogatory name — is liable and must pay one hundred sela, whether the accused is married or unmarried, following the opinion of the Sages. Rabbi Yehuda says: For lashes — one is liable to receive lashes from any place, one hundred sela, if married — must pay, if unmarried — does not pay, following the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: כּוּלַּהּ כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב. וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: הַמּוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע — לוֹקֶה וְנוֹתֵן מֵאָה סֶלַע, וְהוּא שֶׁבָּעַל. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לִלְקוֹת — לוֹקֶה מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: There are who say entire in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, and this is what is saying: The defamer is flogged and gives one hundred sela , but this he had intercourse Rabbi Yehuda says: for flogging, he is flogged in any case,
llm_translation: There are some who say: The entirety is like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. And thus he says: One who utters a derogatory name - is lashed and gives one hundred sela, and he is divorced. Rabbi Yehuda says: For lashes - he is lashed from any place.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לִלְקוֹת לוֹקֶה מִכׇּל מָקוֹם? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בָּעַל — לוֹקֶה, לֹא בָּעַל — אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לוֹקֶה מַכַּת מַרְדּוּת מִדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yehuda hold to flogging, he is flogged in any case? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: he had intercourse he is flogged; he did not have intercourse he is not flogged? Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: is flogged lashes for rebelliousness [ mardut ], by rabbinic
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And Rabbi Yehuda holds that one who is married is liable to receive lashes from any place? And it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: If one is married - he is liable, if one is not married - he is not liable! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: One is liable to receive a Rabbinic flogging for rebellious conduct."

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: מַאי ״בָּעַל לוֹקֶה״ דְּקָתָנֵי הָתָם — מָמוֹן. וְקָרֵי לֵיהּ לְמָמוֹן מַלְקוֹת? אִין, וְהָא תְּנַן: ״הָאוֹמֵר חֲצִי עֶרְכִּי עָלַי״ — נוֹתֵן חֲצִי עֶרְכּוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לוֹקֶה וְנוֹתֵן עֵרֶךְ שָׁלֵם. לוֹקֶה אַמַּאי? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לוֹקֶה בְּעֵרֶךְ שָׁלֵם.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: What that is taught there, he had intercourse flogged? money And call monetary flogging? Yes, and we learned One who says: Half my valuation is upon me, he gives half his valuation, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: He is flogged and gives full valuation. Why is he flogged? Rav Pappa said: He is flogged by a full valuation.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: What is the meaning of "ba'al lokeh" as it is taught there? — Money. And it is called "money" for which one is lashed? No, but didn't we learn: "One who says, 'Half of my value is upon me' — he gives half of his value." Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: He is lashed and gives the full value. Why is he lashed? Rav Papa said: He is lashed for the full value.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא — גְּזֵירָה ״חֲצִי עֶרְכּוֹ״ אַטּוּ ״עֵרֶךְ חֶצְיוֹ״. וְ״עֵרֶךְ חֶצְיוֹ״ הָוֵי לֵיהּ אֵבֶר שֶׁהַנְּשָׁמָה תְּלוּיָה בּוֹ.
human_translation: What is the reason decree half of his valuation, due to valuation of half of himself. And valuation of half of himself has a limb upon which life depends,
llm_translation: What is the reason? - A decree "half its value" they said "its value is half." And "its value is half" refers to a limb upon which the soul depends.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְעָנְשׁוּ אוֹתוֹ״ — זֶה מָמוֹן, ״וְיִסְּרוּ״ — זֶה מַלְקוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught “And they shall fine [ ve’anshu ] him”; this money. “And chastise this flogging.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "And they shall fine him" - this refers to monetary payment, "and they shall flog him" - this refers to lashes.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא ״וְעָנְשׁוּ״ זֶה מָמוֹן, דִּכְתִיב ״וְעָנְשׁוּ אוֹתוֹ מֵאָה כֶסֶף וְנָתְנוּ לַאֲבִי הַנַּעֲרָה״. אֶלָּא ״וְיִסְּרוּ״ זֶה מַלְקוֹת — מְנָלַן?
human_translation: Granted, “and they fine [ ve’anshu ] him,” this money, as it is written: And they shall fine him a hundred shekels of silver, and give them to the father of the young woman. However, “And chastise this flogging, from where do we
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "In truth, 'and they shall fine' - this refers to monetary payment, as it is written 'and they shall fine him a hundred silver shekels and give it to the father of the young woman.' Rather, 'and they shall discipline' - this refers to lashes - from where do we derive this?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: לָמַדְנוּ ״יִסְּרוּ״ מִ״יִּסְּרוּ״, וְ״יִסְּרוּ״ מִ״בֵּן״, וּ״בֵן״ מִ״בִּן״ — ״וְהָיָה אִם בִּן הַכּוֹת הָרָשָׁע״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: We learned chastise from chastise And chastise from son And son [ ben ] from bin “Then it shall be if the wicked man deserve [ bin ] to be flogged”
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: We learned "yisseru" from "yisseru," and "yisseru" from "ben," and "ben" from "ben" - "and if the son of the blows is wicked."

hebrew_text: אַזְהָרָה לְמוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע מְנָלַן? רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: מִ״לֹּא תֵלֵךְ רָכִיל״. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: מִ״וְּנִשְׁמַרְתָּ מִכֹּל דָּבָר רָע״.
human_translation: From where do we warning, for a defamer? Rabbi Elazar says from “You shall not go up and down as talebearer” Rabbi Natan says from: “Then you shall keep yourself from every evil thing [ davar ra ]”
llm_translation: Warning for one who speaks a bad name, wherefrom? Rabbi Elazar said: "From 'Do not go about as a talebearer.'" Rabbi Nathan says: "And 'You shall guard yourself from every evil thing.'"

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר מֵהַאי? הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי פִּנְחָס בֶּן יָאִיר. ״וְנִשְׁמַרְתָּ מִכֹּל דָּבָר רָע״, מִכָּאן אָמַר רַבִּי פִּנְחָס בֶּן יָאִיר: אַל יְהַרְהֵר אָדָם בַּיּוֹם וְיָבֹא לִידֵי טוּמְאָה בַּלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: And what is the reason Rabbi Elazar did not state this He requires that for Rabbi Pineḥas ben Yair, “Then you shall keep yourself from every evil thing”; from here Rabbi Pineḥas ben Yair said: A person should not think by day and come by night to impurity
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, what is the reason he did not say from this? That one sought to him according to Rabbi Pinchas ben Yair. "And you shall guard yourself from every evil thing," from here Rabbi Pinchas ben Yair said: A person should not contemplate during the day and come to impurity at night.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי נָתָן מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר מֵהַאי? הָהוּא: אַזְהָרָה לְבֵית דִּין שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא רַךְ לָזֶה וְקָשֶׁה לָזֶה.
human_translation: And what is the reason Rabbi Natan did not state from that that a warning to the court that it should not be soft to [ rakh la ] this and harsh to that
llm_translation: Rabbi Natan: What is the reason he did not say from this? That one: A warning to the court that they should not be lenient with this one and harsh with this one.

hebrew_text: לֹא אָמַר לְעֵדִים ״בּוֹאוּ וְהַעִידוּנִי״, וְהֵן מְעִידִים אוֹתוֹ מֵאֲלֵיהֶן — הוּא אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה, וְאֵינוֹ נוֹתֵן מֵאָה סְלָעִים. הִיא וְזוֹמְמֶיהָ מַקְדִּימִין לְבֵית הַסְּקִילָה.
human_translation: did not say to witnesses: Come and testify for me but they testify him of their own accord is not flogged and does not give one hundred sela , She and her conspiring witnesses are brought early to the place of stoning.
llm_translation: He did not say to witnesses, "Come and testify for me," and they testify against him from their own initiative - he is not punished, and he does not give a hundred sela. She and her conspirators are brought to the place of stoning.

hebrew_text: הִיא וְזוֹמְמֶיהָ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא: אוֹ הִיא אוֹ זוֹמְמֶיהָ מַקְדִּימִין לְבֵית הַסְּקִילָה.
human_translation: Does it enter your mind she and her conspiring witnesses Rather, Either she or her conspiring witnesses are brought early to the place of stoning.
llm_translation: She and her conspirators, is it your opinion?! Rather, either she or her conspirators are brought to the place of stoning.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּלָא אֲמַר לְהוּ, הָא אֲמַר לְהוּ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אַגְרִינְהוּ. לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּשְׂכּוֹר עֵדִים.
human_translation: reason that did not tell them but he told them although he did not hire them to exclude Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: is liable only if he hired witnesses.
llm_translation: Reason for not saying to them, this said to them, even though not I would have told them. To go out from Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says: He is not liable until witnesses are hired.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אַתְיָא ״שִׂימָה״ ״שִׂימָה״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְשָׂם לָהּ עֲלִילוֹת דְּבָרִים״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״לֹא תְשִׂימוּן עָלָיו נֶשֶׁךְ״, מָה לְהַלָּן מָמוֹן, אַף כָּאן מָמוֹן.
human_translation: What is the reason Rabbi Yehuda? Rabbi Abbahu said: derived placing, placing, It is written here, “And he place wanton charges against her” and it is written there: “Neither shall you place upon him interest” Just as below, money, so too here, money,
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda? Rabbi Avahu said: It comes from "place it, place it." It is written here: "And he shall put upon her the allegations of words," and it is written there: "You shall not place interest upon him," just as there it is money, so too here it is money.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, וְכֵן תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף צִידוֹנִי בֵּי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: אָתְיָא ״שִׂימָה״ ״שִׂימָה״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Rav Yosef Tzidoni likewise taught in the school of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: derived placing, placing,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, and similarly taught Rav Yosef the Sidonian in the house of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: "Come, 'Place it,' 'Place it.'"

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: שְׂכָרָן בְּקַרְקַע, מַהוּ? בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, מַהוּ? שְׁנֵיהֶם בִּפְרוּטָה, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raised a dilemma: hired with land what is with less than the value of a peruta , what is both with a peruta , what is
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rabbi Yirmeya: Their wage in land, what? Less than equivalent to a Perutah, what? Both of them in a Perutah, what?

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: הוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע עַל הַנִּישּׂוּאִין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, מַהוּ? עַל נִשּׂוּאֵי אָחִיו, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Ashi raised a dilemma he defamed with regard to first marriage, what is with regard to his brother’s marriage what is
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rav Ashi: He brought out a bad name on the first marriages, what? On the marriages of his brother, what?

hebrew_text: פְּשׁוֹט מִיהָא חֲדָא. דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי יוֹנָה: ״אֶת בִּתִּי נָתַתִּי לָאִישׁ הַזֶּה״. לְזֶה — וְלֹא לַיָּבָם.
human_translation: Resolve at least one as Rabbi Yona taught I gave my daughter to this man” to this and not to the yavam ,
llm_translation: Simply, one. As taught by Rabbi Yonah: "I have given my daughter to this man." To this one — and not to the levir.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבָּנַן וּמַאי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב? דְּתַנְיָא: כֵּיצַד הוֹצָאַת שֵׁם רַע? בָּא לְבֵית דִּין, וְאָמַר: פְּלוֹנִי, לֹא מָצָאתִי לְבִתְּךָ בְּתוּלִים. אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁזִּינְּתָה תַּחְתָּיו — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה מָנֶה.
human_translation: What the Rabbis and what Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, As it is taught How defamation came to the court and said So-and-so, I have not found your daughter’s virginity. If there are witnesses that she committed adultery under his she has a marriage contract of one hundred dinars.
llm_translation: What is the difference between a Rabbanan and a Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov? For it was taught: How does one bring forth a bad name? He comes to the court and says, "So-and-so, I did not find virginity in your daughter." If there are witnesses that she engaged in relations beneath him - she has a written document.

hebrew_text: אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁזִּינְּתָה תַּחְתָּיו יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה מָנֶה?! בַּת סְקִילָה הִיא! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁזִּינְּתָה תַּחְתָּיו — בִּסְקִילָה. זִינְּתָה מֵעִיקָּרָא, יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה מָנֶה.
human_translation: If there are witnesses that she committed adultery under his she have a marriage contract of one hundred dinars? She is by stoning. this is what said: If there are witnesses that she committed adultery under his to stoning. she engaged in licentious sexual relations at the outset, she has a marriage contract of one hundred dinars,
llm_translation: If there are witnesses that she committed adultery beneath him, does she have a marriage contract?! She is a daughter of stoning! This is what it means: If there are witnesses that she committed adultery beneath him - by stoning. If she committed adultery from the outset, she has a marriage contract.

hebrew_text: נִמְצָא (שֶׁ)שֵּׁם רַע [שֶׁ]אֵינוֹ שֵׁם רַע — הוּא לוֹקֶה וְנוֹתֵן מֵאָה סֶלַע, בֵּין בָּעַל וּבֵין לֹא בָּעַל. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: לֹא נֶאֶמְרוּ דְּבָרִים הַלָּלוּ אֶלָּא כְּשֶׁבָּעַל. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבָא אֵלֶיהָ״, ״וָאֶקְרַב אֵלֶיהָ״,
human_translation: discovered that the bad name is not a bad name, he is flogged and gives one hundred sela , whether he had intercourse with her whether he had not had intercourse with her. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: These matters were stated only where he had intercourse Granted, according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, this is as it is written: and go in unto her” “And when I came near to her,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If a bad name that is not a bad name is found - he is lashed and gives a hundred sela, whether he is married or not married. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: These words were only said when he is married. It is understandable for Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, as it is written: "And he came unto her," "and I approached her."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן, מַאי ״וּבָא אֵלֶיהָ״, ״וָאֶקְרַב אֵלֶיהָ״? ״וּבָא אֵלֶיהָ״ — בַּעֲלִילוֹת, ״וָאֶקְרַב אֵלֶיהָ״ — בִּדְבָרִים.
human_translation: However, according to the Rabbis, what is “and go in unto her,” “and when I came near to her,” “and go in unto her” to wanton charges “and when I came near to her” with words,
llm_translation: Rather, to the Rabbis, what is the meaning of "and he came to her," "and he approached her"? "And he came to her" - in actions, "and he approached her" - in words.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא מָצָאתִי לְבִתְּךָ בְּתוּלִים״. אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן, מַאי ״לֹא מָצָאתִי לְבִתְּךָ בְּתוּלִים״! לֹא מָצָאתִי לְבִתְּךָ כְּשֵׁרֵי בְתוּלִים.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, this is as it is written: “I did not find in your daughter the tokens of virginity” However, according to the Rabbis, what is “I did not find in your daughter the tokens of virginity,” I did not find for your daughter the fitness of virginity,
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, this is what is written: "I did not find for your daughter virgins." But according to the Rabbis, what does "I did not find for your daughter virgins" mean? I did not find for your daughter eligible virgins.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״וְאֵלֶּה בְּתוּלֵי בִתִּי״. אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן, מַאי ״וְאֵלֶּה בְּתוּלֵי בִתִּי״? וְאֵלֶּה כְּשֵׁרֵי בְּתוּלֵי בִתִּי.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, this is as it is written “And these are the tokens of my daughter’s virginity” However, according to the Rabbis, what is “And these are the tokens of my daughter’s virginity”? And these are the fitness of my daughter’s virginity,
llm_translation: In truth, for Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, that is as it is written, "And these are the virgins, my daughter." But for the Rabbis, what is "And these are the virgins, my daughter"? These are the eligible virgins of my daughter.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וּפָרְשׂוּ הַשִּׂמְלָה״. אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן, מַאי ״וּפָרְשׂוּ הַשִּׂמְלָה״?
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, this is at it is written: “And they shall spread the garment” However, according to the Rabbis, what is “And they shall spread the garment [ hasimla ]”?
llm_translation: In truth, to Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, that is what is written: "And they shall spread the garment." But to the Rabbis, what is "And they shall spread the garment"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: פָּרְשׂוּ מַה שֶּׁשָּׂם לָהּ. כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״וּפָרְשׂוּ הַשִּׂמְלָה״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁבָּאִין עֵדִים שֶׁל זֶה וְעֵדִים שֶׁל זֶה, וּבוֹרְרִין אֶת הַדָּבָר כְּשִׂמְלָה חֲדָשָׁה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: דְּבָרִים כִּכְתָבָן, שִׂמְלָה מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said They shall spread, that which he placed against her [ sam la ]. as it is taught “And they shall spread the garment”; teaches that the witnesses of this come and the witnesses of that and clarifies the matter like a new garment. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: The matters as they are written, an actual cloth.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: They explained what He set for her. As it was taught: "And they shall spread the garment," teaches that witnesses for this one and witnesses for that one come, and they clarify the matter like a new garment. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Words as they are written, an actual garment.

hebrew_text: שָׁלַח רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר רַב יַעֲקֹב בַּר גִּיּוֹרֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַף עַל גַּב שֶׁלֹּא מָצִינוּ בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁחִלֵּק הַכָּתוּב בֵּין בִּיאָה כְּדַרְכָּהּ לְבִיאָה שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ לְמַכּוֹת וְלָעוֹנָשִׁין, אֲבָל מוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע חִלֵּק: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּבְעוֹל שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְיוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע כְּדַרְכָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Rav Ya’akov bar Giyyorei sent in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Although we have not found in the entire Torah that verse distinguishes between sexual intercourse in a typical manner and sexual intercourse in an atypical manner, with regard to flogging or punishment. However, defamer, does distinguish is obligated only he had intercourse in an atypical manner, and defames in a typical manner
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak son of Rav Yaakov son of Giryorei sent in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Even though we did not find in the entire Torah that the Scripture differentiated between normal intercourse and abnormal intercourse in terms of punishments, but only in terms of bringing a bad name, one is not liable until he engages in abnormal intercourse, and he brings a bad name in the normal way.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? אִי כְּרַבָּנַן, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא בָּעַל. אִי כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב,
human_translation: accordance with whose If in accordance with the Rabbis, even if he did not have intercourse If in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov,
llm_translation: As whom? If like the sages, even though he is not married. If like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov,

hebrew_text: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי כְּדַרְכָּהּ בָּעֵינַן! אֶלָּא שְׁלַח רַב כָּהֲנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּבְעוֹל כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְיוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע בִּכְדַרְכָּהּ.
human_translation: we require both this, and that, a typical Rather, Rav Kahana sent in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan He is obligated only if he had intercourse a typical and defamed a typical
llm_translation: The text reads: "Both witnesses must testify in the usual manner! Rather, Rav Kahana sent in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: He is not liable until he engages in intercourse in the usual manner, and he brings a bad name upon her in the usual manner."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאָב זַכַּאי בְּבִתּוֹ בְּקִידּוּשֶׁיהָ בְּכֶסֶף, בִּשְׁטָר, וּבְבִיאָה. זַכַּאי בִּמְצִיאָתָהּ, וּבְמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, וּבַהֲפָרַת נְדָרֶיהָ, וּמְקַבֵּל אֶת גִּיטָּהּ. וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת בְּחַיֶּיהָ.
human_translation: A father has authority his daughter her betrothal through money, through document, or through intercourse. is entitled to items she found, and to her earnings, and to the nullification of her vows, And he accepts her bill of divorce And he does not consume the produce during her lifetime.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The father is entitled to his daughter's betrothal with money, with a document, and with intercourse. He is entitled to her findings, her handiwork, the annulment of her vows, and he receives her bill of divorce. However, he does not eat the produce of her property during her lifetime.

hebrew_text: נִשֵּׂאת — יָתֵר עָלָיו הַבַּעַל, שֶׁאוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת בְּחַיֶּיהָ, וְחַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ, וּבְפִרְקוֹנָהּ, וּקְבוּרָתָהּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ עָנִי שֶׁבְּיִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא יִפְחוֹת מִשְּׁנֵי חֲלִילִין וּמְקוֹנֶנֶת.
human_translation: married, the husband has more than as he consumes the produce during her lifetime, and he is obligated her sustenance, her redemption and her burial Rabbi Yehuda says: Even the poorest of the Jewish people may not fewer than two flutes and a lamenting woman,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Nise'et — yater alav habaal, she'okhel peirot bechayeha, ve'chayav bimzonoteiha, u'befirkonah, u'kevuratah. Rabbi Yehuda omer: afilu ani sheb'Yisrael lo yifchot mishnei chalilin u'mekonenet." Translation: "If she is married — her husband has precedence over her, as he consumes the fruits during her lifetime, and he is obligated in her sustenance, her redemption, and her burial. Rabbi Yehuda says: even the poorest person in Israel should not provide less than two flutes and a mourning woman."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּכֶסֶף מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְיָצְאָה חִנָּם אֵין כָּסֶף״, אֵין כֶּסֶף לְאָדוֹן זֶה, וְיֵשׁ כֶּסֶף לְאָדוֹן אַחֵר, וּמַנּוּ? אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: From where do we money Rav Yehuda said the verse states, “Then she shall go out for nothing, without money” There is no money for this master, but there is money for a different master, and who is Her father,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemar b'kesef menalan? Amar Rav Yehudah: Amar kra: 'Veyatza chinam ein kesef', ein kesef l'adon zeh, v'yesh kesef l'adon acher, u'manu? Aviha." English translation: "How is the completion with money derived? Rav Yehudah said: Scripture says, 'And she shall go out for nothing, there is no money.' There is no money for this master, but there is money for another master, and who is the one who counts? Her father."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא לְדִידַהּ! הַשְׁתָּא אָבִיהָ מְקַבֵּל קִידּוּשֶׁיהָ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶת בִּתִּי נָתַתִּי לָאִישׁ הַזֶּה״, אִיהִי שָׁקְלָא כַּסְפָּא?!
human_translation: But say to her, Now her father accepts her betrothal, as it is written: “I gave my daughter to this man” she takes the money
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And why not according to her opinion! Now, her father accepts her betrothal, as it is written: "I have given my daughter to this man." Where is the money taken from?!

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי קְטַנָּה, דְּלֵית לַהּ יָד. אֲבָל נַעֲרָה, דְּאִית לַהּ יָד — אִיהִי תְּקַדֵּשׁ נַפְשַׁהּ וְאִיהִי תִּשְׁקוֹל כַּסְפָּא! אָמַר קְרָא: ״בִּנְעוּרֶיהָ בֵּית אָבִיהָ״ — כׇּל שֶׁבַח נְעוּרִים לְאָבִיהָ.
human_translation: But say this applies a minor, who does not have a hand, However, a young woman, who does have a hand, she should betroth herself and she should take money. the verse states: “Being in her youth, in her father’s house” all gains youth, to her father.
llm_translation: And why these matters of a minor, who does not have control. But a young woman, who has control — she shall consecrate herself and she shall be valued at a price! The verse says: "In her youth in her father's house" — all praise of youth is to her father.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן שֶׁמַּעֲשֵׂה הַבַּת לְאָבִיהָ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכִי יִמְכּוֹר אִישׁ אֶת בִּתּוֹ לְאָמָה״, מָה אָמָה מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לְרַבָּהּ — אַף בַּת מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לְאָבִיהָ. לְמָה לִי? תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִ״בִּנְעוּרֶיהָ בֵּית אָבִיהָ״! אֶלָּא: הָהוּא בַּהֲפָרַת נְדָרִים הוּא דִּכְתִיב.
human_translation: But that which Rav Huna said Rav said: From where that the earnings of a daughter to her father? as it is stated: “And if a man sell his daughter to be a maidservant” just as a maidservant, her earnings to her master, so too a daughter, her earnings to her father. Why do I Let him derive it from “being in her youth, in her father’s house.” Rather, that is written with regard to the nullification of vows,
llm_translation: And rather, this that Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: From where do we derive that the daughter's actions are attributed to her father, as it is stated: "And if a man sells his daughter as a maidservant," just as the maidservant's actions are attributed to her master - so too, the daughter's actions are attributed to her father. Why do I need this? Let him derive it from "from her youth in her father's house"! Rather, that is in the case of annulment of vows that it is written.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא נֵילַף מִינַּהּ — מָמוֹנָא מֵאִיסּוּרָא לָא יָלְפִינַן. וְכִי תֵּימָא נֵילַף מִקְּנָסָא — מָמוֹנָא מִקְּנָסָא לָא יָלְפִינַן.
human_translation: And if you would say: Let us derive from here we do not derive monetary matters from ritual matters, And if you would say: Let us derive from fine we do not derive monetary matters from fines.
llm_translation: And if you will say, let us separate its kind — money from prohibition, we do not separate. And if you will say, let us separate from penalty — money from penalty, we do not separate.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא נֵילַף מִבּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם — שָׁאנֵי בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם דְּאָבִיהָ נָמֵי שָׁיֵיךְ בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And if you would say: Let us derive from humiliation and degradation, humiliation and degradation is different, as her father also has a share in it,
llm_translation: And if you will say, let us distinguish between "boshet" and "pegam" - the shame and the blemish, for the shame and the blemish of her father are fitting in her.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מִסְתַּבְּרָא דְּכִי מְמַעֵט רַחֲמָנָא — יְצִיאָה דִּכְווֹתַהּ קָא מְמַעֵט.
human_translation: Rather, it is reasonable that when the Merciful One excludes He excludes leaves in the corresponding
llm_translation: Rather, it is logical that when the Merciful One minimizes - the exit of its wound is minimized.

hebrew_text: וְהָא לָא דָּמְיָא הָא יְצִיאָה לְהָא יְצִיאָה: הָתָם, גַּבֵּי אָדוֹן, נָפְקָא לַהּ מֵרְשׁוּתֵיהּ לִגְמָרֵי, יְצִיאָה דְּאָב — אַכַּתִּי מְחַסְּרָא מְסִירָה לְחוּפָּה!
human_translation: But this leaving is not comparable to that leaving There, with regard to a master, she leaves his authority entirely, goes out of father, still lacks brought to the wedding canopy.
llm_translation: And this is not similar to that, this exit to that exit. There, regarding a master, it went out from his domain completely, the exit of a father — for he is lacking, he removes for protection!

hebrew_text: מֵהֲפָרַת נְדָרִים מִיהָא נָפְקָא לַהּ מֵרְשׁוּתֵיהּ, דִּתְנַן: נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה אָבִיהָ וּבַעְלָהּ מְפִירִין לָהּ נְדָרֶיהָ.
human_translation: From nullification of vows, at least, she has left his domain As we learned a betrothed young woman, her father and her husband nullify her vows
llm_translation: From the annulment of vows she goes out from his domain, as we learned: A betrothed maiden, her father and her husband annul her vows for her.

hebrew_text: שְׁטָר וּבִיאָה מְנָא לַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהָיְתָה לְאִישׁ אַחֵר״, אִיתַּקּוּשׁ הֲווֹיוֹת לַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: document or intercourse. From where do we the verse states: “And she becomes another man’s wife” becoming are compared to each other,
llm_translation: Document and marriage contract what for us? Said scripture: "And she shall be for another man," the witnesses were designated for Hadadezer.

hebrew_text: זַכַּאי בִּמְצִיאָתָהּ —
human_translation: is entitled to items she found.
llm_translation: It is meritorious in its finding—

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם אֵיבָה.
human_translation: due to enmity,
llm_translation: Because of enmity.

hebrew_text: בְּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ. מְנָלַן? דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן שֶׁמַּעֲשֵׂה הַבַּת לָאָב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכִי יִמְכּוֹר אִישׁ אֶת בִּתּוֹ לְאָמָה״, מָה אָמָה מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לְרַבָּהּ — אַף בַּת מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לְאָבִיהָ. וְאֵימָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי קְטַנָּה, דְּמָצֵי מְזַבֵּן לַהּ, אֲבָל נַעֲרָה, דְּלָא מָצֵי מְזַבֵּן לַהּ — מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ דִּידַהּ הָווּ!
human_translation: to earnings. From where do we As Rav Huna said Rav said: From where that the earnings of a daughter to her father? As it is stated: “And if a man sell his daughter to be a maidservant” just as a maidservant, her earnings to her master, so too a daughter, her earnings to her father. But say this applies a minor, as can sell her However, a young woman, whom he cannot sell, her earnings to her.
llm_translation: In the matter of her handiwork. Whence do we derive this? For Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: From where do we derive that the daughter's handiwork belongs to her father? As it is stated: "And if a man sells his daughter to be a maidservant," just as the maidservant's handiwork belongs to her master, so too the daughter's handiwork belongs to her father. But you may say: These are matters of a young girl, for whom one finds a buyer, but a young woman, for whom one does not find a buyer, her handiwork belongs to herself!

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא דְּאָבִיהָ הָווּ, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לָאו דְּאָבִיהָ, אֶלָּא הָא דְּזַכִּי לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְאָב לְמִימְסְרַהּ לְחוּפָּה, הֵיכִי מָצֵי מָסַר לַהּ? הָא קָמְבַטֵּל לַהּ מִמַּעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ.
human_translation: is reasonable to her father, as, if it should enter your mind her earnings not to her father, that the Merciful One entitles a father to bring to the wedding canopy? How can he bring her Doesn’t he cause her to neglect her earnings
llm_translation: The daughter's property they were discussing, for if it enters your mind that the work of her hands is not her father's, rather that which the Merciful One has granted to the father to hand over to her for marriage, how can he hand it over to her? He nullifies it from the work of her hands.

hebrew_text: פָּרֵיךְ רַב אַחַאי: אֵימָא דְּיָהֵיב לַהּ שְׂכַר פְּקַעְתַּהּ. אִי נָמֵי דִּמְסַר לָהּ בְּלֵילְיָא. אִי נָמֵי דִּמְסַר לַהּ בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים.
human_translation: Rav Aḥai refutes Say that he gives her the wages she neglects Alternatively, where he brought her at night, Alternatively, that he brought her on Shabbatot or Festivals,
llm_translation: Rav Ahai posed a question: Why did he give her the reward of her labor? Either because he gave it to her at night, or because he gave it to her on Sabbaths and festivals.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: קְטַנָּה לָא צְרִיכָא קְרָא — הַשְׁתָּא זַבּוֹנֵי מְזַבֵּין לַהּ, מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ מִיבְּעֵי?! [אֶלָּא] כִּי אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא, לְנַעֲרָה.
human_translation: Rather, a minor, is not necessary a verse Now, sell her necessary her earnings Rather, when the verse was necessary, to a young woman
llm_translation: Rather: smallness not needed verse — this is a question of those who slaughter for her, her own handiwork is required?! Rather, when the verse is necessary, for a young girl.

hebrew_text: בַּהֲפָרַת נְדָרֶיהָ. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״בִּנְעוּרֶיהָ בֵּית אָבִיהָ״.
human_translation: to the nullification of vows. From where do we that it is written: “Being in her youth, in her father’s house”
llm_translation: In the annulment of her vows. From where do we derive this? As it is written: "In her youth, in her father's house."

hebrew_text: וּמְקַבֵּל אֶת גִּיטָּהּ. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְיָצְאָה ... וְהָיְתָה״, אִיתַּקּוּשׁ יְצִיאָה לַהֲוָיָיהּ.
human_translation: And he accepts her bill of divorce From where do we that it is written: “And she departs and becomes juxtaposes departing and becoming
llm_translation: And he receives her bill of divorce. From where do we derive this? As it is written: "And she shall go out... and she shall become," the departure is necessary for her existence.

hebrew_text: וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת בְּחַיֶּיהָ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָאָב אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת בְּחַיֵּי בִתּוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הָאָב אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת בְּחַיֵּי בִתּוֹ. בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: בִּשְׁלָמָא בַּעַל, תַּקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן פֵּירֵי, דְּאִם כֵּן מִימְּנַע וְלָא פָּרֵיק,
human_translation: may not consume produce during her lifetime. The Sages taught A father may not consume the produce during his daughter’s lifetime. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: A father may consume produce during his daughter’s lifetime. With regard to what do they disagree? the first tanna holds: Granted, a husband, the Sages decreed for him produce, as if so, he would refrain from redeeming
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "And he does not eat the fruits during her lifetime. The Rabbis taught: The father does not eat the fruits during the lifetime of his daughter. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: The father does eat the fruits during the lifetime of his daughter. What are they arguing about? The first Tanna holds: It is well if the husband, the Rabbis established for him the fruits, for if not, he would refrain and not divorce."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָב, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר — דְּמִימְּנַע וְלָא פָּרֵיק? בְּלָאו הָכִי פָּרֵיק לַהּ! וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: אָב נָמֵי מִימְּנַע וְלָא פָּרֵיק. סָבַר: כִּיסָא נְקִיטָא עִילָּוַהּ, תֵּיזִיל וְתִפְרוֹק נַפְשַׁהּ.
human_translation: However, a father, what is there to say? That he will refrain from redeeming without this he will redeem her, And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, holds: a father will also refrain from redeeming will reason: A pouch is held in her let her go and redeem herself.
llm_translation: Rather, father, what is there to say - that he refused and did not separate? Without this, he separated for her! And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, holds: the father also refused and did not separate. He holds: when a purse is taken from above, it goes and separates itself.

hebrew_text: נִיסֵּת, יָתֵר עָלָיו הַבַּעַל שֶׁהוּא אוֹכֵל כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כָּתַב לָהּ פֵּירוֹת, כְּסוּת וְכֵלִים שֶׁיָּבוֹאוּ עִמָּהּ מִבֵּית אָבִיהָ לְבֵית בַּעְלָהּ — מֵתָה, לֹא זָכָה הַבַּעַל בִּדְבָרִים הַלָּלוּ. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי נָתָן אָמְרוּ: זָכָה הַבַּעַל בִּדְבָרִים הַלָּלוּ.
human_translation: married, the husband has more than as he consumes The Sages taught wrote for her produce, clothing, and vessels that would come with her from her father’s house to her husband’s house, she died the husband does not have the right to these objects. They said in the name of Rabbi Natan: The husband does have the right to these objects.
llm_translation: If she was tested, her husband has more than her, who eats it. The Rabbis taught: If he wrote for her fruits, clothing, and utensils that would come with her from her father's house to her husband's house - she dies, the husband did not acquire these items. In the name of Rabbi Natan they said: The husband acquired these items.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה וְרַבָּנַן קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דִּתְנַן: נִתְאַרְמְלָה אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשָׁה, בֵּין מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין בֵּין מִן הָאֵירוּסִין — גּוֹבָה אֶת הַכֹּל. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר: מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין — גּוֹבָה אֶת הַכֹּל, וּמִן הָאֵירוּסִין — בְּתוּלָה גּוֹבָה מָאתַיִם, וְאַלְמָנָה מָנֶה,
human_translation: Let us say that the dispute is the dispute Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya and the Rabbis. As we learned was widowed or divorced, whether from marriage or from betrothal, she collects entire Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: from marriage, she collects entire But from betrothal, a virgin she collects two hundred and a widow one hundred dinars.
llm_translation: Let us say in the dispute of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah and the Rabbis, for it was taught: Whether she was concealed or divorced, whether from the betrothed or from the married — she collects everything. Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says: From the betrothed — she collects everything, and from the married — a virgin collects two hundred, and a widow is counted.

hebrew_text: שֶׁלֹּא כָּתַב לָהּ אֶלָּא עַל מְנָת לְכוֹנְסָהּ. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לֹא זָכָה — כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר זָכָה — כְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: that he wrote only on the condition marry her, The one who says not have the right in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, And the one who said have the right in accordance with the Rabbis,
llm_translation: He did not write to her except for the purpose of marrying her. According to the one who says he did not merit - like Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah. And according to the one who says he did merit - like the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה. מַאן דְּאָמַר לֹא זָכָה — כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר זָכָה — עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אֶלָּא מִדִּידֵיהּ לְדִידַהּ, שֶׁלֹּא כָּתַב לָהּ אֶלָּא עַל מְנָת לְכוֹנְסָהּ.
human_translation: No, everyone agrees in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, The one who said not have the right in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, and the one who says have the right Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya states only with regard to from him to her, as he wrote for her only on the condition marry her,
llm_translation: Not like all the world is Rabbi Eliezer ben Azariah. Whoever says he did not merit - like Rabbi Eliezer ben Azariah. And whoever says he did merit - until here Rabbi Eliezer ben Azariah did not say, but from his own perspective, that he did not write it except for the purpose of gathering her.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מִדִּידַהּ לְדִידֵיהּ אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה מוֹדֵי, דְּמִשּׁוּם אִיחַתּוֹנֵי הוּא, וְהָא אִיחַתַּנֻי לְהוּ.
human_translation: However, from her to him, Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya concedes is due to marriage, and they have in marriage.
llm_translation: But from her perspective, according to her own opinion, even Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah agrees, because it is one of her arguments, and this is one of her arguments to him.

hebrew_text: חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: תִּיקְּנוּ מְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ תַּחַת מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, וּקְבוּרָתָהּ תַּחַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, לְפִיכָךְ בַּעַל אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: is obligated sustenance, The Sages taught instituted her sustenance in exchange for her earnings, and her burial in exchange for her marriage contract. Consequently, husband may consume the produce
llm_translation: He is obligated in her sustenance, etc. The Rabbis taught: They established her sustenance in place of her handiwork, and her burial in place of her marriage contract; therefore, the husband eats the fruits.

hebrew_text: פֵּירוֹת מַאן דְּכַר שְׁמַיְיהוּ?! חַסּוֹרֵי מְחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: תִּיקְּנוּ מְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ תַּחַת מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, וּפִירְקוֹנָהּ תַּחַת פֵּירוֹת, וּקְבוּרָתָהּ תַּחַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. לְפִיכָךְ בַּעַל אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: Produce, who mentioned that? is incomplete, and this it is teaching: They instituted her sustenance in exchange for her earnings; and her redemption in exchange for produce and her burial in exchange for her marriage contract. Consequently, a husband may consume the produce
llm_translation: Fruits who remembers their names?! lacking of lacking, and thus it was taught: "Establish her sustenance through her handiwork, and her redemption through fruits, and her burial through her inscription." Therefore, a husband should provide fruits.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״לְפִיכָךְ״?
human_translation: What consequently
llm_translation: What is "therefore"?

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מֵיכָל לָא נֵכְלִינְהוּ, אַנּוֹחֵי נַנְּחִינְהוּ. דְּאִם כֵּן, מִימְּנַע וְלָא פָּרֵיק, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּהָא עֲדִיפָא. זִימְנִין דְּלָא מָלוּ, וּפָרֵיק לַהּ מִדִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Lest you say not consume the produce leave it as, if so he will refrain from redeeming teaches us that this is preferable, sometimes will not amount and redeem her from his own
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? From where did they not eat, we will eat. For if so, it is withheld and not removed, it implies to us that it is preferable. Sometimes when they did not circumcise, and he removed it from himself.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא!
human_translation: But I can reverse
llm_translation: And the opposite, I say!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תִּיקְּנוּ מָצוּי לְמָצוּי, וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ מָצוּי לְשֶׁאֵינוֹ מָצוּי.
human_translation: Abaye said: instituted a common for a common and an uncommon for an uncommon
llm_translation: Abaye said: Establish a principle for a principle, and that which is not a principle for that which is not a principle.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי תַּנָּא סָבַר מְזוֹנוֹת מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״שְׁאֵרָהּ״ — אֵלּוּ מְזוֹנוֹת, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וַאֲשֶׁר אָכְלוּ שְׁאֵר עַמִּי״. ״כְּסוּתָהּ״ — כְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ. ״עוֹנָתָהּ״ — זוֹ עוֹנָה הָאֲמוּרָה בַּתּוֹרָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אִם תְּעַנֶּה אֶת בְּנוֹתַי״.
human_translation: Rava said: This tanna , maintains sustenance by Torah as it is taught “ She’era ”; this is sustenance, and it likewise states: “Who also eat the flesh [ she’er ] of my people” “ Kesuta ” is in its literal sense “ Onata ”; this is conjugal rights, which is stated in the Torah, and so it says: “If you shall afflict [ te’aneh ] my daughters”
llm_translation: Rava said: This Tanna holds that sustenance is from the Torah, as it was taught: "her remnant" - these are sustenance, and so it says: "and those who ate the remnant of my people." "Her covering" - as it sounds. "Her affliction" - this is the affliction mentioned in the Torah, and so it says: "if you afflict my daughters."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: ״שְׁאֵרָהּ״ — זוֹ עוֹנָה. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ אֶל כׇּל שְׁאֵר בְּשָׂרוֹ לֹא תִקְרְבוּ לְגַלּוֹת עֶרְוָה״. ״כְּסוּתָהּ״ — כְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ. ״עוֹנָתָהּ״ — אֵלּוּ מְזוֹנוֹת, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וַיְעַנְּךָ וְיַרְעִיבֶךָ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: “ She’era ”; this is conjugal rights, and so it says: “None of you shall approach to any who is near [ she’er ] of kin to him, to uncover their nakedness” “ Kesuta ” is in its literal sense “ Onata ”; this is sustenance, and so it says: “And He afflicted you [ vayanekha ], and made you suffer hunger,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: "She'erah" - this is punishment. And so he also says: "A man shall not approach to uncover nakedness of any flesh" (Leviticus 18:6). "Kesutah" - as it sounds. "Onatah" - these are sustenance, and so he also says: "And He afflicted you and let you hunger" (Deuteronomy 8:3).

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: ״שְׁאֵרָהּ כְּסוּתָהּ״ — לְפוּם שְׁאֵרָהּ תֵּן כְּסוּתָהּ, שֶׁלֹּא יִתֵּן לָהּ לֹא שֶׁל יַלְדָּה לִזְקֵינָהּ, וְלֹא שֶׁל זְקֵינָה לְיַלְדָּה. ״כְּסוּתָהּ וְעוֹנָתָהּ״ — לְפוּם עוֹנָתָהּ תֵּן כְּסוּתָהּ, שֶׁלֹּא יִתֵּן חֲדָשִׁים בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, וְלֹא שְׁחָקִים בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says she’era kesuta In accordance with her flesh [ she’era ], give her clothing [ kesuta ]. that he should not give of a young girl to an elderly woman, nor those of an elderly woman to a young girl. kesuta and onata In accordance with the time [ onata ], give her clothing [ kesuta ], that he should not give new, in the summer, nor worn-out in the rainy season,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: "Her remnant, her covering" - according to her remnant give her covering, that one should not give her from a young woman's covering to an elderly woman, and not from an elderly woman's covering to a young woman. "Her covering and her affliction" - according to her affliction give her covering, that one should not give new garments in the days of the sun, and not light garments in the days of rain.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: ״שְׁאֵרָהּ״ — זוֹ קֵרוּב בָּשָׂר, שֶׁלֹּא יִנְהַג בָּהּ מִנְהַג פָּרְסִיִּים שֶׁמְּשַׁמְּשִׁין מִטּוֹתֵיהֶן בִּלְבוּשֵׁיהֶן. מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הָאוֹמֵר ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי אֶלָּא אֲנִי בְּבִגְדִּי וְהִיא בְּבִגְדָּהּ״ — יוֹצִיא וְנוֹתֵן כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: Rav Yosef taught “ She’era ,” this closeness of flesh that he should not treat her in the manner of Persians, who have conjugal relations in their clothes. supports Rav Huna, as Rav Huna said: one who says: I do not want unless I am in my clothes and she is in her clothes, he must divorce and give marriage contract.
llm_translation: It was taught by Rav Yosef: "Its remnant" - this refers to close flesh, that one should not engage in the practice of the Persians who use their sheets in their clothing. This supports the statement of Rav Huna, for Rav Huna said: One who says, "I will only wear my garment and she will wear her garment" - he may divorce her and pay the marriage contract.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ עָנִי שֶׁבְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וְכוּ׳. מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר הָנֵי לָא. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאוֹרְחַהּ — מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא דְּאָמַר לָא? וְאִי דְּלָאו אוֹרְחַהּ — מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה?
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even the poorest of the Jewish people by inference that the first, tanna holds these not What are the circumstances? If is common her what is the reason for the first tanna who said not And if is not common her what is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even the poor among the children of Israel, etc. From the inference of the first Tanna, he holds that those poor are not included. How so? If it is because of his the first Tanna's practice, what is the reason that the first Tanna said no? And if it is not because of his practice, what is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda?

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא: כְּגוֹן דְּאוֹרְחֵיהּ דִּידֵיהּ וְלָאו אוֹרְחַהּ דִּידַהּ, תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: כִּי אָמְרִינַן עוֹלָה עִמּוֹ וְאֵינָהּ יוֹרֶדֶת עִמּוֹ — הָנֵי מִילֵּי מֵחַיִּים, אֲבָל לְאַחַר מִיתָה — לֹא.
human_translation: No, necessary where common his but not common her The first tanna holds: When we say ascends with him, and does not descend with him this applies only alive, but after death not
llm_translation: Not needed: For example, when his way and not her way, the first tanna thought: when we say "it goes up with him and does not come down with him" - those are words of the living, but after death - no.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ לְאַחַר מִיתָה. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda maintains: Even after death Rav Ḥisda said Mar Ukva said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds: even after death. Rav Ḥisdah said in the name of Mar Ukva: the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא: מִי שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּטָּה — בֵּית דִּין יוֹרְדִין לִנְכָסָיו וְזָנִין וּמְפַרְנְסִין אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וּבָנָיו וּבְנוֹתָיו, וְדָבָר אַחֵר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דְּתַנְיָא: מִי שֶׁהָלַךְ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וְאִשְׁתּוֹ תּוֹבַעַת מְזוֹנוֹת — בֵּית דִּין יוֹרְדִין לִנְכָסָיו, וְזָנִין וּמְפַרְנְסִין אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, אֲבָל לֹא בָּנָיו וּבְנוֹתָיו, וְלֹא דָּבָר אַחֵר?
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said Mar Ukva said: one who became insane, court enters his property and feeds and provides a livelihood for his wife, his sons, and his daughters, and something else, Ravina said to Rav Ashi: what is different from that which is taught one who went overseas and his wife claims sustenance, court descends to his property and feeds and provides a livelihood for his wife, but not his sons and daughters and not something else.
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Mar Ukva: If one went bankrupt, the court descends to his assets, and they provide for his wife, his sons, and his daughters, and another explanation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: What is the difference between this case and that which is taught: If one went to a maritime province and his wife demands her sustenance - the court descends to his assets, and they provide for his wife, but not for his sons and daughters, and there is no other explanation.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלָא שָׁאנֵי לָךְ בֵּין יוֹצֵא לְדַעַת לַיּוֹצֵא שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעַת?
human_translation: said to Is there no difference for you between leaves knowingly and one who leaves unknowingly?
llm_translation: He said to him: "And is it not different for you between one who goes out with knowledge and one who goes out without knowledge?"

hebrew_text: מַאי ״דָּבָר אַחֵר״? רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: זֶה תַּכְשִׁיט. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: צְדָקָה. מַאן דְּאָמַר תַּכְשִׁיט, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן צְדָקָה. מַאן דְּאָמַר צְדָקָה, אֲבָל תַּכְשִׁיט יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ, דְּלָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּתִינַּוַּול.
human_translation: What is something else Rav Ḥisda said: This is ornaments, Rav Yosef said: charity. the one who says ornaments all the more so charity. the one who says charity but it does give her ornaments, that it is not satisfactory for him be demeaned
llm_translation: "What is 'another matter' (davar acher)? Rav Ḥisda said: This refers to adornment. Rav Yosef said: Charity. One who says adornment, certainly charity. One who says charity, but adornment we give to her, as it is not pleasing to her to be adorned."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מִי שֶׁהָלַךְ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וּמֵתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ — בֵּית דִּין יוֹרְדִין לִנְכָסָיו, וְקוֹבְרִין אוֹתָהּ לְפִי כְבוֹדוֹ. לְפִי כְבוֹדוֹ וְלֹא לְפִי כְבוֹדָהּ?
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said Rav Huna said: one who went overseas and his wife died, court enters his property and buries her in accordance with his dignity. in accordance with his dignity and not in accordance with her dignity?
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Avin said in the name of Rav Huna: If one went to the sea and his wife died - the court descends to his assets, and they bury her according to his honor. According to his honor and not according to her honor?

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: אַף לְפִי כְבוֹדוֹ. הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: עוֹלָה עִמּוֹ וְאֵינָהּ יוֹרֶדֶת עִמּוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: Say Even in accordance with his dignity, This teach us she ascends with him and does not descend with him, and even after death,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Eima: Af l'fi k'vodo. Ha ka mashma lan: Olah imo v'einah yoredet imo, v'afilu l'achar mitah. English translation: Say: Even according to His honor. Here it implies to us: The burnt offering goes up with him and does not descend with him, even after his death.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה, הָאוֹמֵר: ״אִם מֵתָה, לֹא תִּקְבְּרוּהָ מִנְּכָסָיו״ — שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. מַאי שְׁנָא כִּי אָמַר — דְּנָפְלִי נִכְסֵי קַמֵּי יַתְמֵי. כִּי לָא אָמַר נָמֵי, נִכְסֵי קַמֵּי יַתְמֵי רְמוּ?
human_translation: Rav Mattana said: one who says if dies, not bury her from his property, listens to him. What is different when says that the property has come before the orphans even if he did not state the property is cast before the orphans
llm_translation: Rav Matna said: One who says, "If she dies, do not bury her from her estate" — we heed him. What is different when he says this? Because he is speaking about the estate falling before the heirs. If he did not say this, would the estate fall before the heirs?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הָאוֹמֵר: ״אִם מֵת הוּא, לֹא תִּקְבְּרוּהוּ מִנְּכָסָיו״ — אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. לָאו כׇּל הֵימֶנּוּ שֶׁיַּעֲשִׁיר אֶת בָּנָיו וְיַפִּיל עַצְמוֹ עַל הַצִּיבּוּר.
human_translation: Rather, one who says if he dies, not bury him from his property, one does not listen to him, not in his power to enrich his sons and to cast himself on the community.
llm_translation: Rather: One who says, "If he dies, do not bury him from his possessions" — we do not heed him. Is it not that everyone from him that he should make his sons wealthy and cast himself upon the community.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ לְעוֹלָם הִיא בִּרְשׁוּת הָאָב עַד שֶׁתִּכָּנֵס
human_translation: is always under her father’s authority until she enters
llm_translation: It was taught: Always she is in the domain of the father until she enters.

hebrew_text: לִרְשׁוּת הַבַּעַל לְנִשּׂוּאִין. מָסַר הָאָב לִשְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל — הֲרֵי הִיא בִּרְשׁוּת הַבַּעַל. הָלַךְ הָאָב עִם שְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל, אוֹ שֶׁהָלְכוּ שְׁלוּחֵי הָאָב עִם שְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל — הֲרֵי הִיא בִּרְשׁוּת הָאָב. מָסְרוּ שְׁלוּחֵי הָאָב לִשְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל — הֲרֵי הִיא בִּרְשׁוּת הַבַּעַל.
human_translation: husband’s authority in marriage delivered to the husband’s messengers she is under the husband’s authority. the father went with the husband’s messengers, or if the father’s messengers went with the husband’s messengers, she is under the father’s authority, and the father’s messengers delivered to the husband’s messengers, she is under husband’s authority.
llm_translation: To the authority of the husband for marriage. If the father handed over to the messengers of the husband - it is in the authority of the husband. If the father went with the messengers of the husband, or if the messengers of the father went with the messengers of the husband - it is in the authority of the father. If the messengers of the father handed over to the messengers of the husband - it is in the authority of the husband.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי לְעוֹלָם? לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִמִּשְׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה. דִּתְנַן: הִגִּיעַ זְמַן וְלֹא נִישְּׂאוּ — אוֹכְלוֹת מִשֶּׁלּוֹ וְאוֹכְלוֹת בִּתְרוּמָה. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: What is Always, to exclude initial mishna. As we learned the time arrived, and they were not married, eat from his and, eat teruma , teaches us always
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "le'olam"? To exclude from the first Mishnah. As we learned in a Mishnah: If the time arrived and they did not separate terumah, the women may eat from his the husband's and eat from terumah. This teaches us the meaning of "le'olam."

hebrew_text: מָסַר הָאָב לִשְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל, הֲרֵי הִיא בִּרְשׁוּת הַבַּעַל וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב: מְסִירָתָהּ לַכֹּל, חוּץ מִתְּרוּמָה. וְרַב אַסִּי אָמַר: אַף לִתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: the father delivered to the husband’s messengers, she is under the husband’s authority, Rav said: delivers her in all apart from teruma . And Rav Asi said even to teruma .
llm_translation: The father handed over to the messengers of the husband, behold it is in the domain of the husband, etc. Rav said: Her handing over is to everyone, except for terumah. And Rav Assi said: Even for terumah.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא לְרַב אַסִּי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ חִיָּיא בַּר רַב לְרַב אַסִּי: לְעוֹלָם הִיא בִּרְשׁוּת הָאָב עַד שֶׁתִּכָּנֵס לַחוּפָּה! אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב: לָאו אָמֵינָא לְכוּ לָא תֵּיזְלוּ בָּתַר אִיפְּכָא?! יָכֵול לְשַׁנּוֹיֵי לְכוּ: מְסִירָתָהּ, זוֹ הִיא כְּנִיסָתָהּ לְחוּפָּה.
human_translation: Rav Huna raised an objection to Rav Asi, and some say Ḥiyya, son of Rav, to Rav Asi: she is always under her father’s authority until she enters the wedding canopy. Rav said to them: Didn’t I tell you not to follow, opposing can answer you her delivery is her entrance to the wedding canopy,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rav Huna against Rav Assi, and some say it was raised by Ḥiyya bar Rav against Rav Assi: She is always under the authority of her father until she enters the wedding canopy! Rav said to them: Do you not agree with me? Do you not see the contradiction here?! You can explain it as follows: Her removal, that is her entry into the wedding canopy.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: לִירוּשָּׁתָהּ.
human_translation: And Shmuel said to her inheritance,
llm_translation: And Samuel said: To her inheritance.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: לִכְתוּבָּתָהּ. כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מַאי הִיא? דְּאִי מֵתָה יָרֵית לַהּ, הַיְינוּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל! אָמַר רָבִינָא: לוֹמַר כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מֵאַחֵר מָנֶה.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: to her marriage contract. What is her marriage contract? that if she dies inherits her that is Shmuel, Ravina said: to say her marriage contract from other is one hundred dinars,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: "Likhtuvatah." What is Likhtuvatah? If she dies, he inherits her, that is the opinion of Shmuel! Ravina said: To say Likhtuvatah from another maneh.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: מְסִירָתָהּ לַכֹּל, אַף לִתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Ḥanina both say delivery for all even teruma .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Chanina both said: "Her removal is for everyone, even for Terumah."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הָלַךְ הָאָב עִם שְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל, אוֹ שֶׁהָלְכוּ שְׁלוּחֵי הָאָב עִם שְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל, אוֹ שֶׁהָיְתָה לָהּ חָצֵר בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְנִכְנְסָה עִמּוֹ לָלִין, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁכְּתוּבָּתָהּ בְּבֵית בַּעְלָהּ, מֵתָה — אָבִיהָ יוֹרְשָׁהּ.
human_translation: raises an objection the father went with the husband’s messengers, or the father’s messengers went with the husband’s messengers, or she owned a courtyard along the way and she entered with to lodge, even if her marriage contract is in her husband’s house, she dies, her father inherits her,
llm_translation: The Tanna raises an objection: If the father went with the messengers of the husband, or if the messengers of the father went with the messengers of the husband, or if she had a courtyard on the way and she entered to lodge with him, even though her marriage contract is in her husband's house, if she dies, her father inherits her.

hebrew_text: מָסַר הָאָב לִשְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל, אוֹ שֶׁמָּסְרוּ שְׁלוּחֵי הָאָב לִשְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל, אוֹ שֶׁהָיְתָה לוֹ חָצֵר בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְנִכְנְסָה עִמּוֹ לְשׁוּם נִישּׂוּאִין, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁכְּתוּבָּתָהּ בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ, מֵתָה — בַּעְלָהּ יוֹרְשָׁהּ.
human_translation: the father delivered to the husband’s messengers, or if the father’s messengers delivered to the husband’s messengers, or if owned a courtyard along the way and she entered with him for the purpose of marriage, even if her marriage contract is in her father’s house she dies, her husband inherits her.
llm_translation: The father handed over to the emissaries of the husband, or if the emissaries of the father handed her over to the emissaries of the husband, or if she had a courtyard on the way and she entered with him for the purpose of marriage, even though her marriage contract is in her father's house, if she dies, her husband inherits her.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — לִירוּשָּׁתָהּ, אֲבָל לִתְרוּמָה, אֵין אִשָּׁה אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה עַד שֶׁתִּכָּנֵס לַחוּפָּה. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְכוּלְּהוּ! תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: In what is this statement said? to inherit her. However, to teruma , a woman may not partake of teruma until she enters the wedding canopy. a refutation of all of them, a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: In what matters are these words spoken? — Regarding her inheritance, but with regard to terumah, a woman does not eat of terumah until she enters the wedding canopy. The excellence of them all! The excellence.

hebrew_text: הָא גוּפָא קַשְׁיָא: אָמְרַתְּ נִכְנְסָה עִמּוֹ לָלִין. טַעְמָא דְּלָלִין, הָא סְתָמָא — לְשֵׁם נִישּׂוּאִין. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: נִכְנְסָה עִמּוֹ לְשֵׁם נִישּׂוּאִין, הָא סְתָמָא, לָלִין.
human_translation: This matter itself is difficult. You said she entered with him to lodge reason to lodge without specification for the sake of marriage. Say the latter clause she entered with him for the purpose of marriage, without specification, to lodge.
llm_translation: The matter is difficult: she said, "She entered with him to lodge." The reason for lodging is this: this is a presumption for marriage. Say the conclusion: if she entered with him for the purpose of marriage, this is a presumption for lodging.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: סְתָמֵי סְתָמֵי קָתָנֵי. סְתַם חָצֵר דִּידַהּ — לָלִין. סְתַם חָצֵר דִּידֵיהּ — לְנִשּׂוּאִין.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: taught without specification without specification, her courtyard without specification to lodge, his courtyard without specification, for marriage,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Anonymous teachings are taught anonymously. An anonymous courtyard belonging to us — for lodging. An anonymous courtyard belonging to them — for marriage.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא: מָסַר הָאָב לִשְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל וְזִינְּתָה — הֲרֵי זוֹ בְּחֶנֶק. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי בַּר חָמָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״לִזְנוֹת בֵּית אָבִיהָ״, פְּרָט לְשֶׁמָּסַר הָאָב לִשְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל.
human_translation: taught the father delivered to the husband’s messengers and she committed adultery, she is to strangulation, From where are these matters Rabbi Ami bar Ḥama said the verse states, “To play the whore in her father’s house” excludes when the father has delivered to the husband’s messengers,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If the father handed over his daughter to the messengers of her husband and she committed adultery - she is considered as if she were strangled. How do we derive these words? Rabbi Ammi bar Hama said, a verse states: "To commit adultery in her father's house," excluding the case where the father handed her over to the messengers of her husband.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: פְּרָט שֶׁנִּכְנְסָה לַחוּפָּה וְלֹא נִבְעֲלָה!
human_translation: But say excluding where she has entered the wedding canopy but she has not had intercourse,
llm_translation: And why? Specifically that she entered the wedding canopy and did not consummate the marriage!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אֲמַר לִי אַמֵּי, חוּפָּה בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיבָא: ״כִּי יִהְיֶה נַעֲרָה בְתוּלָה מְאוֹרָשָׂה לְאִישׁ״. ״נַעֲרָה״ — וְלֹא בּוֹגֶרֶת, ״בְּתוּלָה״ — וְלֹא בְּעוּלָה, ״מְאוֹרָשָׂה״ — וְלֹא נְשׂוּאָה.
human_translation: Rava said: Ami said to me wedding canopy is explicitly written “If there is a young woman who is a virgin betrothed to a man” “young woman” and not a grown woman; “virgin” and not a non-virgin; “betrothed” and not a married woman.
llm_translation: Rava said: Ammi told me, a document in the hand is written: "When a young girl, a virgin, is betrothed to a man." "Young girl" - not a mature woman, "virgin" - not married, "betrothed" - not fully married.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״נְשׂוּאָה״? אִילֵימָא נְשׂוּאָה מַמָּשׁ, הַיְינוּ ״בְּתוּלָה״ וְלֹא בְּעוּלָה! אֶלָּא לָאו, שֶׁנִּכְנְסָה לְחוּפָּה וְלֹא נִבְעֲלָה.
human_translation: What is A married woman, If we say actually married this is a virgin and not a non-virgin. Rather, is it not who has entered the wedding canopy but has not had intercourse,
llm_translation: What is "n'suah"? Perhaps "n'suah" literally, meaning "virgin" and not "married"! Rather, no, that she entered the bridal chamber but did not consummate the marriage.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: הֵיכָא דְּהָדְרָא לְבֵי נָשָׁא — הָדְרָא לְמִילְּתָא קַמַּיְיתָא? אָמַר רָבָא: הָהוּא כְּבָר פַּסְקַהּ תַּנָּא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל,
human_translation: But say where she returns to her father’s house, returns previous matter, Rava said: That has already been resolved the tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: And why do you say: where he returned to the house of the woman — he returned for the matter before him? Rava said: That one, as it has been taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael,

hebrew_text: דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְנֵדֶר אַלְמָנָה וּגְרוּשָׁה כֹּל אֲשֶׁר אָסְרָה עַל נַפְשָׁהּ יָקוּם עָלֶיהָ״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? וַהֲלֹא מוּצֵאת מִכְּלַל אָב וּמוּצֵאת מִכְּלַל בַּעַל!
human_translation: as the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “But the vow of a widow or of a divorcée, everything with which she has bound her soul shall stand against her” What the verse states Is it not she has been removed from the category father and she has been removed from the category husband?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Ishmael: "And the vow of a widow or divorced woman, whatever she has forbidden upon herself, shall stand against her."
