What is the teaching to say? Is it not derived from the general principle of a father and from the general principle of a husband!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הֲרֵי שֶׁמָּסַר הָאָב לִשְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל, אוֹ שֶׁמָּסְרוּ שְׁלוּחֵי הָאָב לִשְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל, וְנִתְאַרְמְלָה בַּדֶּרֶךְ אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשָׁה, הֵיאַךְ אֲנִי קוֹרֵא בָּהּ: בֵּית אָבִיהָ שֶׁל זוֹ, אוֹ בֵּית בַּעְלָהּ שֶׁל זוֹ? אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לְךָ: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיָּצְאָה שָׁעָה אַחַת מֵרְשׁוּת הָאָב — שׁוּב אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהָפֵר.
human_translation: Rather, where the father delivered to the husband’s messengers or where the father’s messengers delivered to the husband’s messengers, and she was widowed or divorced on way How do I consider her? her father’s house, or her husband’s house? Rather, to tell you: Since she has left her father’s domain a short time is no longer able to nullify
llm_translation: Rather, if the father handed over to the messengers of the husband, or if the messengers of the father handed over to the messengers of the husband, and she became lost on the way or was divorced, how do I read it: the father's house of this one, or the husband's house of this one? Rather, to tell you: once she has left the authority of the father for even a moment — he cannot retract.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: הַבָּא עַל נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה — אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא נַעֲרָה בְּתוּלָה מְאוֹרָסָה, וְהִיא בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ. בִּשְׁלָמָא ״נַעֲרָה״ — וְלֹא בּוֹגֶרֶת, ״בְּתוּלָה״ — וְלֹא בְּעוּלָה, ״מְאוֹרָסָה״ — וְלֹא נְשׂוּאָה. ״בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ״ לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לָאו לְמַעוֹטֵי מָסַר הָאָב לִשְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל?!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: We, too, learn One who has intercourse with a young woman betrothed is liable only if she is a virgin, a young woman, betrothed, and she is in her father’s house. Granted, young woman not a grown woman; a virgin, but not a non-virgin, betrothed, but not a married woman. in her father’s house, what to exclude? not to exclude the father delivered to the husband’s messengers,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: We also learned: One who engages in relations with a betrothed maiden is not liable until the maiden is a betrothed virgin, and she is in her father's house. It is understandable that "maiden" excludes a widow, "virgin" excludes a married woman, "betrothed" excludes one who is married. "In her father's house" - to exclude what? Is it not to exclude when the father handed her over to the husband's emissaries?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּכְנְסָה לִרְשׁוּת הַבַּעַל לְנִשּׂוּאִין, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נִבְעֲלָה — הַבָּא עָלֶיהָ הֲרֵי זֶה בְּחֶנֶק. נִכְנְסָה לִרְשׁוּת הַבַּעַל בְּעָלְמָא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: We, too, learn one who has intercourse with a married woman, once she has entered her husband’s authority for marriage, even though she has not had intercourse one who has intercourse with her is by strangulation, she merely entered the husband’s authority learn from here
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, "We also learned: One who has relations with a married woman, once she has entered the domain of her husband for the purpose of marriage, even though she has not yet been betrothed - if one has relations with her, he is liable to the death penalty by strangulation. Once she has entered the domain of her husband, it is assumed that she is his wife."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאָב אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹת בִּתּוֹ. זֶה מִדְרָשׁ דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים בַּכֶּרֶם בְּיַבְנֶה: הַבָּנִים יִירְשׁוּ וְהַבָּנוֹת יִזּוֹנוּ. מָה הַבָּנִים אֵינָן יוֹרְשִׁין אֶלָּא לְאַחַר מִיתַת הָאָב — אַף הַבָּנוֹת אֵין נִיזּוֹנוֹת אֶלָּא לְאַחַר מִיתַת אֲבִיהֶן.
human_translation: A father is not obligated to his daughter’s sustenance. This exposition was expounded Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya before the Sages in the vineyard of Yavne: the sons inherit and the daughters are sustained Just as the sons inherit only after the father’s death, so too, the daughters are sustained only after their father’s death.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: The father is not obligated to provide sustenance for his daughter. This is the exposition that Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah expounded before the sages in the vineyard in Yavneh: "The sons shall inherit, and the daughters shall be provided for." Just as the sons do not inherit until after the father's death, so too the daughters are not provided for until after their father's death.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּמְזוֹנוֹת בִּתּוֹ הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב, הָא בִּמְזוֹנוֹת בְּנוֹ — חַיָּיב. בִּתּוֹ נָמֵי: חוֹבָה הוּא דְּלֵיכָּא, הָא מִצְוָה אִיכָּא. מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין? לָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, לָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְלָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא.
human_translation: It is with regard to his daughter’s sustenance that he is not obligated, but with regard to his son’s sustenance, he is obligated. his daughter, too, there is no obligation, but there is a mitzva, whose the mishna? not Rabbi Meir, nor Rabbi Yehuda, nor Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka.
llm_translation: Gemar in sustenance in his daughter he is not obligated, but in sustenance in his son - he is obligated. His daughter also: it is a debt that does not exist, but there is a commandment. Who is the Tanna of this Mishnah? Not Rabbi Meir, not Rabbi Yehuda, and not Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: מִצְוָה לָזוּן אֶת הַבָּנוֹת, קַל וְחוֹמֶר לַבָּנִים — דְּעָסְקִי בַּתּוֹרָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִצְוָה לָזוּן אֶת הַבָּנִים, וְקַל וָחוֹמֶר לַבָּנוֹת — מִשּׁוּם זִילוּתָא. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא אוֹמֵר: חוֹבָה לָזוּן אֶת הַבָּנוֹת לְאַחַר מִיתַת אֲבִיהֶן, אֲבָל בְּחַיֵּי אֲבִיהֶן — אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ אֵינָן נִיזּוֹנִין.
human_translation: As it is taught a mitzva to sustain daughters, an a fortiori to sons, who are engaged in Torah. the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: a mitzva to sustain sons, an a fortiori with regard to daughters, due to dishonor Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says: an obligation to sustain the daughters after their father’s death; however, during their father’s lifetime these and those, are not sustained.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: There is a mitzvah to provide sustenance for daughters, all the more so for sons — this is the opinion of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: There is a mitzvah to provide sustenance for sons, and all the more so for daughters — due to modesty. Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka says: It is an obligation to provide sustenance for daughters after the death of their father, but during the lifetime of their father — both these and those are not provided for.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין? אִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר הָא אָמַר בָּנִים מִצְוָה?! אִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָא אָמַר בָּנִים נָמֵי מִצְוָה! אִי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא, אֲפִילּוּ מִצְוָה נָמֵי לֵיכָּא!
human_translation: Whose the mishna? If Rabbi Meir, didn’t he say sons a mitzva, If Rabbi Yehuda, didn’t he say sons also a mitzva, If Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, there is not even a mitzva
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is the Tanna of the Mishnah? If it is Rabbi Meir, did he not say that sons are a mitzvah?! If it is Rabbi Yehuda, did he not say that sons are also a mitzvah! If it is Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka, even if it is a mitzvah, it is not here!

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא.
human_translation: If you wish, say Rabbi Meir; if you wish, say Rabbi Yehuda; if you wish, say Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka.
llm_translation: If you wish, say it was stated: Rabbi Meir. If you wish, say it was stated: Rabbi Yehuda. If you wish, say it was stated: Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: הָאָב אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹת בִּתּוֹ, וְהוּא הַדִּין לִבְנוֹ. הָא מִצְוָה בְּבִתּוֹ אִיכָּא, קַל וָחוֹמֶר לַבָּנִים. וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי בִּתּוֹ — הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן:
human_translation: If you wish, say Rabbi Meir, and this is what he said A father is not obligated to his daughter’s sustenance, and the same is true with regard to his son. there is a mitzva, his daughter, an a fortiori to the sons. And that teaches his daughter, teaches us this:
llm_translation: If you will say, "Rabbi Meir says so," this is what he is saying: The father is not obligated to provide sustenance for his daughter, and the same applies to his son. There is a mitzvah to provide for his daughter, all the more so for his sons. And that which is taught regarding his daughter - this teaches us.

hebrew_text: דַּאֲפִילּוּ בִּתּוֹ, חוֹבָה הוּא דְּלֵיכָּא, הָא מִצְוָה אִיכָּא.
human_translation: That even his daughter, there is no obligation there is a mitzva
llm_translation: Even his daughter, it is an obligation that there is not, but there is a commandment.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: הָאָב אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹת בִּתּוֹ, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן לִבְנוֹ. הָא מִצְוָה בִּבְנוֹ אִיכָּא, וְקַל וָחוֹמֶר לַבָּנוֹת. וְהָא דְּקָתָנֵי בִּתּוֹ — הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דַּאֲפִילּוּ בִּתּוֹ חוֹבָה לֵיכָּא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rabbi Yehuda, and this what he said A father is not obligated sustenance for his daughter, and all the more so for his son. there is a mitzva with regard to a son, and a fortiori to the daughters. And that teaches his daughter teaches us this: That even his daughter no obligation,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say it is Rabbi Yehuda, and thus he says: The father is not obligated to provide sustenance for his daughter, all the more so for his son. There is a commandment regarding his son, and a fortiori for his daughters. And that which it teaches regarding his daughter - this teaches us that even regarding his daughter there is no obligation.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹת בִּתּוֹ, וְהוּא הַדִּין לִבְנוֹ. וְהוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ מִצְוָה נָמֵי לֵיכָּא, וְאַיְּידֵי דְּבָנוֹת לְאַחַר מִיתַת אֲבִיהֶן חוֹבָה, תְּנָא נָמֵי אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, and this is what he said not obligated sustenance for his daughter, and the same is true for his son. And the same is true not even a mitzva but since daughters after their father’s death an obligation also taught is not obligated
llm_translation: And if you wish, say it was Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka, and thus he said: He is not obligated to provide sustenance for his daughter, and the same applies to his son. And the same applies even if there is indeed a mitzvah, and since daughters are obligated to be supported after the death of their father, it is also taught that he is not obligated.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר חֲנִינָא: בְּאוּשָׁא הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהֵא אָדָם זָן אֶת בָּנָיו וְאֶת בְּנוֹתָיו כְּשֶׁהֵן קְטַנִּים. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ אוֹ אֵין הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ? תָּא שְׁמַע: כִּי הֲוָה אָתוּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אֲמַר לְהוּ: יָארוּד יָלְדָה, וְאַבְּנֵי מָתָא שָׁדְיָא?!
human_translation: Rabbi Ile’a said Reish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda bar Ḥanina: In Usha instituted that a man should sustain his sons and daughters when they are minors. A dilemma was raised before the halakha in accordance with his or is the halakha not in accordance with his Come hear: When they would come before Rav Yehuda he say to them: The jackal [ yarod ] bears and casts them on the residents of the town?
llm_translation: Rabbi Ilai said in the name of Reish Lakish in the name of Rabbi Yehuda bar Chanina: In Ousha, they established that a person should feed his sons and daughters when they are young. They asked: Does the halakha follow his opinion or not? Come and hear: When someone came before Rav Yehuda, he said to them: "A yarud gave birth, and the stones of the city wall fell?!"

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה אָתוּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: כְּפוֹ לֵיהּ אֲסִיתָא בְּצִבּוּרָא, וְלֵיקוּם וְלֵימָא: עוֹרְבָא בָּעֵי בְּנֵיהּ וְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא לָא בָּעֵי בְּנֵיהּ?! וְעוֹרְבָא בָּעֵי בְּנֵיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״לִבְנֵי עוֹרֵב אֲשֶׁר יִקְרָאוּ״! לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא בְּחִיוָּרֵי, הָא בְּאוּכָּמֵי.
human_translation: When they would come before Rav Ḥisda he say to them: Turn over a mortar for him in public, and let stand up and say The raven wants its sons, and this man does not want his sons. And the raven want its sons? But isn’t it written: to the young ravens that cry” not difficult, this to white ones, that to black ones.
llm_translation: When he came before Rav Ḥisda, he said to them: "Force him to marry his daughter to a scholar in public, and let him say: Does a raven need his children, and that man does not need his children?! Does a raven need his children? But it is written: 'For the sons of the raven who are called'! There is no difficulty: here in the villages, there in the cities."

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה אָתֵי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נִיחָא לָךְ דְּמִיתַּזְנִי בְּנָיךְ מִצְּדָקָה?
human_translation: When would come before Rava, he say to satisfactory to you that your sons are sustained through charity?
llm_translation: When he came before Rava, he said to him: Is it pleasing to you that your sons engage in commerce with justice?

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן, אֶלָּא דְּלָא אֲמִיד, אֲבָל אֲמִיד — כָּפֵינַן לֵיהּ עַל כֻּרְחֵיהּ. כִּי הָא דְּרָבָא כַּפְיֵיהּ לְרַב נָתָן בַּר אַמֵּי וְאַפֵּיק מִינֵּיהּ אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי לִצְדָקָה.
human_translation: And we said only when he is not wealthy but wealthy we coerce him against his will Like this of Rava, who coerced Rav Natan bar Ami, and collected from him four hundred dinars for charity.
llm_translation: We did not say, but rather that we did not say, but we did not say - we forced him against his will. For Rava forced Rav Natan bar Ammi, and he gave four hundred gold coins to charity.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: בְּאוּשָׁא הִתְקִינוּ הַכּוֹתֵב כׇּל נְכָסָיו לְבָנָיו — הוּא וְאִשְׁתּוֹ נִזּוֹנִים מֵהֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Ile’a said Reish Lakish said: In Usha instituted one who writes all his property to his sons he and his wife are sustained from
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ilai said Reish Lakish: In Ousha they established that one who writes all his property to his sons - he and his wife are sustained by them.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי: גְּדוֹלָה מִזּוֹ אָמְרוּ, אַלְמְנָתוֹ נִזּוֹנֶת מִנְּכָסָיו, הוּא וְאִשְׁתּוֹ מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira objects to this, and some say Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani: said a greater than that: widow is sustained from his property is necessary he and his wife,
llm_translation: Rebbe Zeira raised an objection and it was stated by Rebbe Shmuel bar Nachmani: "Greater than this they said, his widow is sustained from his estate, he and his wife are in need?!"

hebrew_text: דִּשְׁלַח רָבִין בְּאִיגַּרְתֵּיהּ: מִי שֶׁמֵּת וְהִנִּיחַ אַלְמָנָה וּבַת — אַלְמְנָתוֹ נִיזּוֹנֶת מִנְּכָסָיו. נִישֵּׂאת הַבַּת — אַלְמְנָתוֹ נִיזּוֹנֶת מִנְּכָסָיו.
human_translation: As Ravin sent in his letter one who died and left a widow and a daughter, his widow is sustained from his property, the daughter, married, his widow is sustained from his property.
llm_translation: Rabin sent in his letter: One who died and left a widow and a daughter - his widow is sustained from his estate. If the daughter gets married - his widow is sustained from his estate.

hebrew_text: מֵתָה הַבַּת, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן אֲחוֹתוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: עַל יָדִי הָיָה מַעֲשֶׂה, וְאָמְרוּ: אַלְמְנָתוֹ נִיזּוֹנֶת מִנְּכָסָיו. הוּא וְאִשְׁתּוֹ מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: the daughter died Rabbi Yehuda, son of the sister of Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina, said: I was involved in an incident and they said: his widow is sustained from his property. is necessary he and his wife
llm_translation: The daughter died, Rabbi Yehuda the son of his sister of Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina said: Through her it happened, and they said: His widow is sustained from his estate. He and his wife are in need?!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָתָם הוּא דְּלֵיכָּא דְּטָרַח, אֲבָל הָכָא — נִטְרַח לְדִידֵיהּ וּלְדִידַהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say it is there, as there is no one to toil but here, he can toil for himself and for her, teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? There, it is because there is no effort, but here - he exerted effort for himself and for her, it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ אוֹ לֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ? תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא וְרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן הֲווֹ קָיְימִי, אֲתָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא גְּחֵין וְנַשְּׁקֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אַכַּרְעֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי הַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כּוֹתֵב נְכָסָיו לְבָנָיו הוּא,
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before the halakha in accordance with or is the halakha not in accordance with his Come hear, as Rabbi Ḥanina and Rabbi Yonatan were standing a certain man approached, bent over, and kissed Rabbi Yonatan on his foot. Rabbi Ḥanina said to What is this? He said to him: He wrote his property to his sons,
llm_translation: He asked them: Does the halakha follow his reasoning or not? Come and hear: Rabbi Chanina and Rabbi Yonatan were standing, a certain man came, bowed down and kissed the feet of Rabbi Yonatan. Rabbi Chanina said to him: What is this? He said to him: He is writing his property to his sons.

hebrew_text: וְעַשִּׂיתִינְהוּ (לְזֻנֵיהּ) [וְזָנוּהּ]. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא לָאו דִּינָא, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי עַשִּׂיינְהוּ. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ דִּינָא — עַשֹּׂיִינְהוּ בָּעֵי?
human_translation: and I forced them to feed him, Granted, if you say not halakha , due to that force them but if you say halakha , need to force them
llm_translation: "And you shall make them (for her) and they shall commit adultery with her. If you say it is not the law, therefore make them. But if you say it is the law - do they need to be made?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא, בְּאוּשָׁא הִתְקִינוּ: הַמְבַזְבֵּז — אַל יְבַזְבֵּז יוֹתֵר מֵחוֹמֶשׁ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַמְבַזְבֵּז — אַל יְבַזְבֵּז יוֹתֵר מֵחוֹמֶשׁ, שֶׁמָּא יִצְטָרֵךְ לַבְּרִיּוֹת. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁבִּקֵּשׁ לְבַזְבֵּז [יוֹתֵר מֵחוֹמֶשׁ], וְלֹא הִנִּיחַ לוֹ חֲבֵירוֹ. וּמַנּוּ — רַבִּי יְשֵׁבָב. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: רַבִּי יְשֵׁבָב, וְלֹא הִנִּיחוֹ חֲבֵירוֹ, וּמַנּוּ — רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ile’a said: In Usha instituted one who dispenses should not dispense more than one-fifth. That is also taught One who scatters should not scatter more than one-fifth, lest he need of people. And an incident involving a certain who sought to dispense more than one-fifth and his friend did not let him And who Rabbi Yeshevav. And some say Rabbi Yeshevav and his friend did not let him and who was friend? Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ilai said, in Usha they instituted: One who wastes - should not waste more than a chomesh. It was taught similarly: One who wastes - should not waste more than a chomesh, lest he cause distress to creatures. And it happened with one who sought to waste more than a chomesh, and his fellow did not allow him. They counted - Rabbi Yeshivav. And some say: Rabbi Yeshivav, and his fellow did not allow him, they counted - Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, מַאי קְרָא: ״וְכׇל אֲשֶׁר תִּתֶּן לִי עַשֵּׂר אֲעַשְּׂרֶנּוּ לָךְ״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said, and some say Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov What is the verse “And of all that You shall give me, I will surely give a tenth of it [ aser a’asrenu ] to You”
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, and some say it was Rav Acha bar Yaakov, what is the verse: "And all that you give me I will surely tithe to you."

hebrew_text: וְהָא לָא דָּמֵי עִישּׂוּרָא בָּתְרָא לְעִישּׂוּרָא קַמָּא! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: ״אֲעַשְּׂרֶנּוּ״ לְבָתְרָא כִּי קַמָּא.
human_translation: But the latter tenth is not similar to the first tenth, Rav Ashi said: “I will a tenth of it [ a’asrenu ],” that the latter like the first one.
llm_translation: The text reads: "And this is not comparable, the first Eishura to the second Eishura!" Rav Ashe said: "I will tithe it" for the second one as for the first.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: וּשְׁמוּעוֹת הַלָּלוּ מִתְמַעֲטוֹת וְהוֹלְכוֹת. וְסִימָנָיךְ: קְטַנִּים כָּתְבוּ וּבִזְבְּזוּ.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: And these halakhot continually decrease. And your mnemonic Minors wrote and dispensed.
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashe said: And these reports diminish and go. And your sign: small ones wrote and were despised.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק, בְּאוּשָׁא הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהֵא אָדָם מִתְגַּלְגֵּל עִם בְּנוֹ, עַד שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, יוֹרֵד עִמּוֹ לְחַיָּיו. אִינִי?! וְהָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר שִׁילַת: בְּצִיר מִבַּר שֵׁית — לָא תְּקַבֵּיל. בַּר שֵׁית — קַבֵּיל וּסְפִי לֵיהּ כְּתוֹרָא!
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak said: In Usha enacted that a person should treat his son gently, until twelve years From this forward he harasses him his life Is that so? But didn’t Rav say to Rav Shmuel bar Sheilat, less than six years old, do not accept six years old, accept and stuff him like an ox,
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak said, in Usha they established that a person should play with his son until twelve years. From here on, he should go down with him to his livelihood. Is it not so?! But didn't Rav say to Rav Shmuel bar Shilat: In a time of grain surplus - do not accept it. In a time of grain shortage - accept it and lend it to him like a crown!

hebrew_text: אִין, סָפֵי לֵיהּ כְּתוֹרָא, מִיהוּ אֵינוֹ יוֹרֵד עִמּוֹ לְחַיָּיו עַד לְאַחַר שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא לְמִקְרָא, הָא לְמִשְׁנָה.
human_translation: yes, stuff him like an ox however, does not harass him his life until after twelve years And if you wish, say not difficult This to Bible, that to Mishna.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ein, safei lei k'tora, mi'hu einu yored imo l'chayav ad l'achar shtei esrei shana. V'ibayit eima, la kashya: ha l'mikra, ha l'mishna." English translation: "There is no end to it like a Torah, but it does not descend with him to his life until after twelve years. And if you wish, say: it is not difficult: this is for Scripture, this is for Mishnah."

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אֲמַרָה לִי אֵם: בַּר שֵׁית — לְמִקְרָא, בַּר עֶשֶׂר — לְמִשְׁנָה, בַּר תְּלֵיסַר — לְתַעֲנִיתָא מֵעֵת לְעֵת. וּבְתִינוֹקֶת — בַּת תְּרֵיסַר.
human_translation: as Abaye said: mother told me a six-year-old for Bible a ten-year-old to Mishna. a thirteen-year-old to fast for twenty-four hours And for a girl, twelve years old.
llm_translation: Abaye said, his mother said to me: "At six - for Scripture, at ten - for Mishnah, at thirteen - for fasting intermittently. And for a girl - at twelve."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אֲמַרָה לִי אֵם: הַאי בַּר שֵׁית דְּטָרְקָא לֵיהּ עַקְרַבָּא בְּיוֹמָא דְּמִישְׁלַם שֵׁית — לָא חָיֵי. מַאי אָסוּתֵיהּ — מְרָרְתָּא דְּדַיָּה חִיוָּרְתָּא בְּשִׁיכְרָא, נִשְׁפְּיֵיהּ וְנַשְׁקְיֵיהּ. הַאי בַּר שַׁתָּא דְּטָרֵיק לֵיהּ זִיבּוּרָא בְּיוֹמָא דְּמִישְׁלַם שַׁתָּא — לָא חָיֵי. מַאי אָסוּתֵיהּ — אַצְוָתָא דְּדִיקְלָא בְּמַיָּא, נִשְׁפְּיֵיהּ וְנַשְׁקְיֵיהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: mother told me a six-year-old who is stung by a scorpion on the day that completes six will not live What is his cure? The bile of a white vulture in beer. One should rub him and make him drink year-old who is stung by a hornet on the day that completes a year will not live What is his cure? Palm-tree fiber in water. one should rub him and make him drink
llm_translation: Abaye said, his mother said to me: this son of Sheit who drank a cup of vinegar on the day he ate six locusts - he will not live. What was his remedy? - a bitter herb of the size of a barleycorn in beer, he should roast it and drink it. This son of Shata who drank a cup of mustard on the day he ate six olives - he will not live. What was his remedy? - a decree of a palm tree in water, he should roast it and drink it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב קַטִּינָא: כׇּל הַמַּכְנִיס אֶת בְּנוֹ פָּחוּת מִבֶּן שֵׁשׁ — רָץ אַחֲרָיו וְאֵינוֹ מַגִּיעוֹ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: חֲבֵירָיו רָצִין אַחֲרָיו וְאֵין מַגִּיעִין אוֹתוֹ. וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ אִיתַנְהוּ: חֲלִישׁ וּגְמִיר. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא דִּכְחִישׁ, הָא דְּבָרִיא.
human_translation: Rav Ketina said: Anyone who brings his son younger than six years old run after him and not catch him. There are who say his friends run after him and not catch him, And both are weaken and learn If you wish, say This with a weak that to a healthy
llm_translation: Rav Katina said: Anyone who brings in his son less than six years old - runs after him and does not reach him. Some say: His friends run after him and do not reach him. And both are correct: one is weak and the other is strong. If you wish, say: this one is weak, that one is healthy.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא, בְּאוּשָׁא הִתְקִינוּ: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁמָּכְרָה בְּנִכְסֵי מְלוֹג בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ וּמֵתָה, הַבַּעַל מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת. אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף לְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ דַּהֲוָה קָאֵי בְּאוּכְלוּסָא דְאוּשָׁא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן מָרַהּ דִּשְׁמַעְתָּא דְאוּשָׁא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא. תְּנָא מִינֵּיהּ אַרְבְּעִין זִימְנִין, וְדָמֵי לֵיהּ כְּמַאן דְּמַנְּחָא לֵיהּ בְּכִיסְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: In Usha instituted a woman who sold usufruct property, in her husband’s lifetime, and died, the husband repossess from the purchasers. Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef found Rabbi Abbahu standing congregation [ ukhlusa ] of Usha. He said to him: Who is the Master the halakha Usha? He said to him: Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina. He learned it from forty times, and it seemed to him as though it were placed in his pocket.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina said, in Usha they instituted: If a woman sold property of her husband's estate during his lifetime and then died, the husband retrieves it from the buyers. Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef found Rabbi Avahu standing in the market of Usha, and said to him: Who is the master that you have heard this ruling from in Usha? He said to him: Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina. He repeated it from him forty times, and his words were as if he had placed them in his pocket.

hebrew_text: ״אַשְׁרֵי שׁוֹמְרֵי מִשְׁפָּט עוֹשֵׂה צְדָקָה בְכׇל עֵת״. וְכִי אֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹת צְדָקָה בְּכׇל עֵת? דָּרְשׁוּ רַבּוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁבְּיַבְנֶה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: זֶה הַזָּן בָּנָיו וּבְנוֹתָיו כְּשֶׁהֵן קְטַנִּים. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: זֶה הַמְגַדֵּל יָתוֹם וִיתוֹמָה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ וּמַשִּׂיאָן.
human_translation: “Happy are they who keep justice, who perform charity at all times” But is it possible to perform charity at all times? our Rabbis in Yavne taught, and some say Rabbi Eliezer: This is one who sustains his sons and daughters when they are minors. Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said: This is one who raises an orphan boy or an orphan girl in his house, and marries them off.
llm_translation: "Fortunate are the keepers of justice, who do righteousness at all times." Is it possible to do righteousness at all times? Our Rabbis in Yavneh interpreted, and Rabbi Eliezer said to them: This refers to one who feeds his sons and daughters when they are young. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: This refers to one who raises an orphan and a widow in his home and sustains them.

hebrew_text: ״הוֹן וָעוֹשֶׁר בְּבֵיתוֹ וְצִדְקָתוֹ עוֹמֶדֶת לָעַד״. רַב הוּנָא וְרַב חִסְדָּא, חַד אָמַר: זֶה הַלּוֹמֵד תּוֹרָה וּמְלַמְּדָהּ. וְחַד אָמַר: זֶה הַכּוֹתֵב תּוֹרָה נְבִיאִים וּכְתוּבִים וּמַשְׁאִילָן לַאֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: “Wealth and riches are in his house, and his charity endures forever” Rav Huna and Rav Ḥisda One said: This one who studies Torah and teaches it. And one said: This is one who writes the Torah, the Prophets, and the Writings, and lends them to others.
llm_translation: "Wealth and riches in his house, and his righteousness endures forever." Rav Huna and Rav Hisda, one said: This refers to one who learns Torah and teaches it. And one said: This refers to one who writes Torah, Prophets, and Writings, and lends them to others.

hebrew_text: ״וּרְאֵה בָנִים לְבָנֶיךָ שָׁלוֹם עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל״. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי כֵּיוָן שֶׁ״בָנִים לְבָנֶיךָ״ — ״שָׁלוֹם עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל״. דְּלָא אָתֵי לִידֵי חֲלִיצָה וְיִבּוּם. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: כֵּיוָן שֶׁ״בָנִים לְבָנֶיךָ״ — שָׁלוֹם עַל דַּיָּינֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, דְּלָא אָתֵי לְאִינְּצוֹיֵי.
human_translation: “And see your son’s sons; peace be upon Israel” Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Once your children children peace upon Israel, as they will not come the ritual through which the yavam frees the yevama of her levirate bonds [ ḥalitza ] or levirate marriage, Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said: Once your sons sons peace upon the judges of Israel, as will not come to quarrel
llm_translation: "and see children to your children peace upon Israel." Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Since "children to your children" - "peace upon Israel." For it does not lead to halitzah and levirate marriage. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: Since "children to your children" - peace upon the judges of Israel, for it does not lead to negligence.

hebrew_text: זֶה מִדְרָשׁ דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים כּוּ׳.
human_translation: This exposition was expounded Rabbi Elazar before the Sages
llm_translation: This is the exposition that Rabbi Elazar expounded before the sages:

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב יוֹסֵף קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא וְיָתֵיב רַב הַמְנוּנָא, וְקָאָמַר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין הַבָּנִים יוֹרְשִׁין אֶלָּא מִן הַקַּרְקַע — כָּךְ אֵין הַבָּנוֹת נִיזּוֹנוֹת אֶלָּא מִן הַקַּרְקַע. אֲוַושׁ עֲלֵיהּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא: דְּשָׁבֵיק אַרְעָא — הוּא דְּיָרְתִי לֵיהּ בְּנֵיהּ, דְּלָא שָׁבֵיק אַרְעָא — לָא יָרְתִי לֵיהּ בְּנֵיהּ?!
human_translation: Rav Yosef sat before Rav Hamnuna and Rav Hamnuna sat and said Just as sons inherit only from land, so too, daughters are sustained only from land. everyone clamored [ avash ] against him, who leaves land whose sons inherit him, who does not leave land, his sons do not inherit him?
llm_translation: Sitting Rav Yosef before Rav Hamnuna, and sitting Rav Hamnuna, and saying: Just as sons inherit only from the ground - so daughters are sustained only from the ground. All the people of the world are astonished at him: one who leaves land - he will have sons, one who does not leave land - he will not have sons?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: וְדִלְמָא כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין קָאָמַר מָר?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָר, דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּא הוּא, יָדַע מַאי קָאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said to Perhaps the Master was speaking marriage document male children, said to him: The Master, who is a great man, knows what I said,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yosef: "But perhaps the verse is speaking about the construction of a wall, Master?!" He said to him: "Master, he is a great man, he knows what I am saying."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף: רַב זָן מֵחִיטֵּי דַעֲלִיָּיה. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: פַּרְנָסָה הֲוַיא, וּמַאי עֲלִיָּיה — מֵעִילּוּיָיא דְאָב, וּכְדִשְׁמוּאֵל. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לְפַרְנָסָה, שָׁמִין בָּאָב.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef said: Rav sustain with wheat according to the aliyya A dilemma was raised before Was livelihood, and what is aliyya ? the status [ illuyya ] of the father, and in accordance with of Shmuel. As Shmuel said: With regard to livelihood, assesses in accordance with the father.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef said: Rav Zan is from the wheat of Aliyah. They asked him: Is it a livelihood, and what is Aliyah? — from the upper chambers of the father, as Shmuel said: For a livelihood, one should rely on the father.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא מְזוֹנֵי מַמָּשׁ הֲוָה, וּמַאי עֲלִיָּיה — מִדְּבָרִים טוֹבִים שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרוּ בָּעֲלִיָּיה. דְּאָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף: בָּעֲלִיָּיה הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ בָּנוֹת נִיזּוֹנוֹת מִן הַמִּטַּלְטְלִין.
human_translation: Or perhaps was actual sustenance, and what is aliyya ? of the good statements said in the upper chamber [ aliyya ], as Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef said: in the upper chamber they instituted that daughters should be sustained from movable property
llm_translation: Or perhaps it was actual sustenance, and what is the proof? — Good things that were said about it. As Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef said: They established that the daughters should be sustained from the movable property.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בִּידֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי בַּנַּאי אֲחוּהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא הֲווֹ מִטַּלְטְלִין דְּיַתְמֵי. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל זוּן.
human_translation: Come hear In the possession of Rabbi Banai, the brother of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, there was movable property to orphans, came before Shmuel, said to Go sustain
llm_translation: Come and hear: In the hands of Rabbi Bannai, the brother of Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba, there were hanging objects of metal. They came before Samuel. He said to him: Go and feed them.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו לִמְזוֹנֵי, וְכִדְרַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף סְבִירָא לֵיהּ? לָא, הָתָם לְפַרְנָסָה הֲוַאי. וּשְׁמוּאֵל לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לְפַרְנָסָה שָׁמִין בָּאָב.
human_translation: What, is it not with sustenance, and holds in accordance with Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef, No, there it is to livelihood, and Shmuel to his reasoning, as Shmuel said: With regard to livelihood, assesses in accordance with the father.
llm_translation: What is the reason why it is not for sustenance, and according to Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef he holds? No, there it is for livelihood. And Shmuel according to his reasoning, for Shmuel said: For livelihood, we assess based on the father.

hebrew_text: הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא, וְדוּן דַּיָּינֵי דִנְהַרְדְּעָא. בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא, וְאַגְבִּי רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב נַחְמָן: זִילוּ אַהְדַּרוּ, וְאִי לָא — מַגְבֵּינָא לְכוּ לְאַפַּדְנַיְיכוּ מִינַּיְיכוּ.
human_translation: There was an incident in Neharde’a, and the judges of Neharde’a ruled in Pumbedita, and Rav Ḥana bar Bizna collected Rav Naḥman said to Go reverse and if not, I will collect your houses [ appadnaikhu ] from you
llm_translation: The matter was in Nehardea, and the judges of Nehardea were deliberating. In Pumbedita, and Rab Hana bar Bizna was sitting. Rav Nahman said to them: Go and return, and if not, I will cause you to be excommunicated from me.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי סְבוּר לְמֵיזַן מִמִּטַּלְטְלֵי. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי: מִילְּתָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לָא עֲבַדוּ בָּהּ עוֹבָדָא אַתּוּן עָבְדִין בַּהּ עוֹבָדָא?!
human_translation: Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi thought to sustain from movable property. Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi said to them: a matter which Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish did not take action, you take action in
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi hold the opinion to mix from those who are moving. Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi said to them: The matter of Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish, did they not do the work in it, you are doing the work in it?!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר סָבַר לְמֵיזַן מִמִּטַּלְטְלִין. אָמַר לְפָנָיו רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְיָקִים: רַבִּי, יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי בְּךָ שֶׁאֵין מִדַּת הַדִּין אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה, אֶלָּא מִדַּת רַחְמָנוּת. אֶלָּא, שֶׁמָּא יִרְאוּ הַתַּלְמִידִים וְיִקְבְּעוּ הֲלָכָה לְדוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar thought to sustain from movable property. Rabbi Shimon ben Elyakim said before him: My teacher, I know about you that you are not acting the letter of the law, rather pity However, lest the students observe and establish halakha for generations.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar holds for Meizan from Mittaltelin. Rabbi Shimon ben Eliezer said before him: Rabbi, I know in you that you do not act with the measure of strict justice, but with the measure of mercy. Rather, lest the disciples see and establish a halakha for generations.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לַהּ מִתַּמְרֵי דְּעַל בּוּדְיָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אִילּוּ בַּעַל חוֹב הֲוָה כִּי הַאי גַּוְונָא, מִי הֲוָה יָהֵיב לֵיהּ מָר?
human_translation: A certain came before Rav Yosef said to Give from the dates on the mats [ budya ]. Abaye said to If it was a creditor would the Master give him in this
llm_translation: The one who came before Rav Yosef, said to him: "Give her from the dates of the palm tree." Abaye said to him: "If he had been a creditor, would he have given him this gift?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּחַזְיָיא לְבוּדְיָא קָאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: said to I spoke which are fit for mats.
llm_translation: He said to him: "D'chazya lubudya ka'ameina."

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף, כׇּל הָעוֹמֵד לִגְזוֹז כְּגָזוּז דָּמֵי! דִּצְרִיכָא לְדִיקְלָא קָאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: Ultimately, anything that is about to be sheared is considered sheared, I spoke is still in need of the palm tree.
llm_translation: At the end, anyone who stands to shear like the shearing of blood! For it needs a palm tree standing.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא יָתוֹם וִיתוֹמָה דַּאֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ רָבָא: הַעֲלוּ לַיָּתוֹם בִּשְׁבִיל יְתוֹמָה. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: וְהָא מָר הוּא דְּאָמַר מִמְּקַרְקְעֵי וְלָא מִמִּטַּלְטְלִי, בֵּין לִמְזוֹנֵי בֵּין לִכְתוּבָּה וּבֵין לְפַרְנָסָה!
human_translation: a certain orphan boy and orphan girl who came before Rava. Rava said to Increase to the orphan boy, for the orphan girl The Sages said to Rava: But it was the Master who said from land but not from movable property, whether for sustenance, whether for the marriage contract, or whether for livelihood.
llm_translation: That orphan and that widow who came before Rava. Rava said to them: "Raise the orphan for the sake of the widow." The sages said to Rava: "But isn't it the Master who said, 'From the ground and not from a cradle,' whether for sustenance, for a marriage contract, or for support!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִילּוּ רָצָה שִׁפְחָה לְשַׁמְּשׁוֹ, מִי לָא יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ? כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן הָכָא דְּאִיכָּא תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: said to them: If wanted a maidservant to serve him, would we not give him All the more so here, where there are two
llm_translation: He said to them: If a maidservant wants to serve him, who would not give her to him? All the more so here where there are two.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֶחָד נְכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת, וְאֶחָד נְכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת — מוֹצִיאִין לִמְזוֹן אִשָּׁה וּלְבָנוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: נְכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת — מוֹצִיאִין לַבָּנוֹת מִן הַבָּנִים, וְלַבָּנוֹת מִן הַבָּנוֹת, וְלַבָּנִים מִן הַבָּנִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught: both property that has a guarantee, and property that does not have a guarantee, removes for the sustenance of the wife and for the daughters. the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: property that has a guarantee, removes from the sons, for the daughters. from the daughters to the daughters. And from the sons to the sons.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One type of assets that have successors, and one type of assets that do not have successors - we provide sustenance for a wife and daughters, according to Rabbi. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Assets that have successors - we provide for daughters from sons, and for daughters from daughters, and for sons from sons.

hebrew_text: וְלַבָּנִים מִן הַבָּנוֹת בִּנְכָסִים מְרוּבִּין, אֲבָל לֹא לַבָּנִים מִן הַבָּנוֹת בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִין.
human_translation: And in a large of property, from the daughters to the sons, However, a small property, from the daughters to the sons.
llm_translation: And for stones from the daughters in properties abundant, but not for stones from the daughters in properties few.

hebrew_text: נְכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת מוֹצִיאִין לַבָּנִים מִן הַבָּנִים, וְלַבָּנוֹת מִן הַבָּנוֹת, וְלַבָּנִים מִן הַבָּנוֹת. אֲבָל לֹא לַבָּנוֹת מִן הַבָּנִים.
human_translation: property that does not have a guarantee, removes the sons, to the sons, and from the daughters to the daughters. And from the daughters, to the sons, However, not property from the sons to the daughters.
llm_translation: Assets that have no inheritance are taken out to the sons from the sons, and to the daughters from the daughters, and to the sons from the daughters. But not to the daughters from the sons.

hebrew_text: אַף עַל גַּב דְּקַיְימָא לַן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵחֲבֵירוֹ, הָכָא הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר. דְּאָמַר רָבָא, הִלְכְתָא: מִמְּקַרְקְעֵי וְלָא מִמְּטַלְטְלִי, בֵּין לִכְתוּבָּה, בֵּין לִמְזוֹנֵי, בֵּין לְפַרְנָסָה.
human_translation: Even though we maintain the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi his colleague, here the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. As Rava said: The halakha from land but not from movable property, whether for the marriage contract, for sustenance, or for livelihood.
llm_translation: Even though we establish the halakha like Rabbi Meḥavero, here the halakha is like Rabbi Shim'on ben El'azar. For Rava said: The halakha is from the ground and not from being carried, whether for a marriage contract, for sustenance, or for support.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ לֹא כָּתַב לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה — בְּתוּלָה גּוֹבָה מָאתַיִם, וְאַלְמָנָה מָנֶה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא תְּנַאי בֵּית דִּין. כָּתַב לָהּ שָׂדֶה שָׁוֶה מָנֶה תַּחַת מָאתַיִם זוּז, וְלֹא כָּתַב לָהּ ״כֹּל נְכָסִים דְּאִית לִי אַחְרָאִין לִכְתוּבְּתִיךְ״ — חַיָּיב, שֶׁהוּא תְּנַאי בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: did not write a marriage contract for a virgin collects two hundred and a widow one hundred dinars because it is a stipulation of the court he wrote her a field worth one hundred dinars instead of two hundred dinars and he did not write for her: All property I have guarantee for your marriage contract, obligated as it is a stipulation of the court
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If he did not write for her a document - a virgin receives two hundred, and a widow receives a hundred, because it is a stipulation of the court. If he wrote for her a field worth a hundred zuz, instead of two hundred, and did not write for her, "all other assets that I have are pledged to you" - he is liable, because it is a stipulation of the court.

hebrew_text: לֹא כָּתַב לָהּ: ״אִם תִּשְׁתְּבַאי, אֶפְרְקִינִּךְ וְאוֹתְבִינִּךְ לִי לְאִינְתּוּ״, וּבְכֹהֶנֶת: ״אַהְדְּרִינִּךְ לִמְדִינְתִּךָ״ — חַיָּיב, שֶׁהוּא תְּנַאי בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: he did not write for her If you are taken captive I will redeem you and restore you to me as a wife, and in of a priestess, I will return you to your province, obligated as it is a stipulation of the court.
llm_translation: He did not write to her: "If you marry me, I will redeem you and understand you as my wife," and with a priestess: "I will return you to your nation" - he is liable, as this is a condition set by the court.

hebrew_text: נִשְׁבֵּית — חַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹתָהּ. וְאִם אָמַר: הֲרֵי גִּיטָּהּ וּכְתוּבָּתָהּ, וְתִפְדֶּה אֶת עַצְמָהּ — אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי. לָקְתָה — חַיָּיב לְרַפְּאוֹתָהּ. אָמַר: ״הֲרֵי גִּיטָּהּ וּכְתוּבָּתָהּ, תְּרַפֵּא אֶת עַצְמָהּ״ — רַשַּׁאי.
human_translation: was taken captive, obligated to redeem her. And if he said: hereby her bill of divorce and her marriage contract, and let her redeem herself, he is not permitted was struck obligated to heal her, he said: hereby her bill of divorce and her marriage contract, and let her heal herself, he is permitted
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If she was captured - he is obligated to redeem her. And if he said: "Here is her bill of divorce and her marriage contract, and she can redeem herself" - he is not allowed. If he found her - he is obligated to heal her. If he said: "Here is her bill of divorce and her marriage contract, she can heal herself" - he is allowed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַנִּי — רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל הַפּוֹחֵת לִבְתוּלָה מִמָּאתַיִם וּלְאַלְמָנָה מִמָּנֶה — הֲרֵי זוֹ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת.
human_translation: Who is It is Rabbi Meir, who said: Anyone who decreases to a virgin than two hundred or to a widow than one hundred dinars, this is licentious sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: Gemara: "Gemani - Rabbi Meir Hi, de'amar: Kol hapocheit livtulah mimataim ule'almanah mimaneh - harei zo be'ilat zenut." Translation: "It was taught: 'Gemani - this is Rabbi Meir's opinion, as he said: Anyone who diminishes the value of a virgin from two hundred to one hundred, or of a widow from her own value - this is considered licentious intercourse.'"

hebrew_text: דְּאִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָאָמַר: רָצָה, כּוֹתֵב לִבְתוּלָה שְׁטָר שֶׁל מָאתַיִם, וְהִיא כּוֹתֶבֶת ״הִתְקַבַּלְתִּי מִמְּךָ מָנֶה״. וּלְאַלְמָנָה מָנֶה, וְהִיא כּוֹתֶבֶת: ״הִתְקַבַּלְתִּי מִמְּךָ חֲמִשִּׁים זוּז״.
human_translation: For if Rabbi Yehuda, didn’t he say wants, he may write a document for a virgin two hundred and she may write: I have received from you one hundred dinars, And he may pledge one hundred dinars of a widow, and she may write: I have received from you fifty dinars.
llm_translation: If Rabbi Yehuda said: "He desires," he writes a document for a virgin for two hundred, and she writes, "I have received from you a hundred." And for a widow, a hundred, and she writes: "I have received from you fifty."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: כָּתַב לָהּ שָׂדֶה שָׁוֶה מָנֶה תַּחַת מָאתַיִם זוּז, וְלֹא כָּתַב לָהּ ״כֹּל נְכָסִים דְּאִית לִי אַחְרָאִין לִכְתוּבְּתִיךְ״  — חַיָּיב, שֶׁהוּא תְּנַאי בֵּית דִּין. אֲתָאן לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: אַחְרָיוּת טָעוּת סוֹפֵר הוּא.
human_translation: say the latter clause he wrote her a field worth one hundred dinars instead of two hundred dinars and he did not write for her: All property I have guarantee for your marriage contract, obligated as it is a stipulation of the court we come to Rabbi Yehuda, who said guarantee is a scribal error,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: katav lah sadeh shaveh mane tahat matayim zuz, ve'lo katav lah 'kol nechasim de'it li achra'in likhtuvteich' — chayav, shehu tenai beit din. Atan leRabbi Yehuda, de'amar: achrayut ta'ut sofer hu." English translation: "The final clause: If he wrote for her a field worth a hundred zuz, and did not write for her 'all the possessions that I have are pledged to you' — he is liable, as it is a stipulation of the court. They came to Rabbi Yehuda, who said: The liability is due to the error of the scribe."

hebrew_text: דְּאִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, הָאָמַר: אַחְרָיוּת — לָאו טָעוּת סוֹפֵר הוּא. דִּתְנַן: מָצָא שִׁטְרֵי חוֹב — אִם
human_translation: For if Rabbi Meir, didn’t he say guarantee is not a scribal error, As we learned found promissory notes, if
llm_translation: If Rabbi Meir, who said: "Achrayut is not a mistake of the scribe," for it was taught: "If one finds promissory notes of debt — if"

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ בָּהֶן אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים — לֹא יַחֲזִיר, שֶׁבֵּית דִּין נִפְרָעִין מֵהֶן.
human_translation: they include a property guarantee he may not return as the court collects from
llm_translation: There is in them succession of property - he shall not return, for the court exacts payment from them.

hebrew_text: אֵין בָּהֶן אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים — יַחֲזִיר, שֶׁאֵין בֵּית דִּין נִפְרָעִין מֵהֶן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה לֹא יַחֲזִיר, שֶׁבֵּית דִּין נִפְרָעִין מֵהֶן.
human_translation: do not include a property guarantee he returns them, as the court does not collect from the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: both this and that he may not return as the court collects from
llm_translation: There is no responsibility for the return of assets - he shall return, for the court does not exact payment from them, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: Neither this one nor that one shall return, for the court exacts payment from them.

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה! וְכִי תֵּימָא כּוּלַּהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, וְשָׁאנֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר בֵּין כְּתוּבָּה לִשְׁטָרֵי. וּמִי שָׁאנֵי לֵיהּ?
human_translation: the first clause is Rabbi Meir, and the latter clause is Rabbi Yehuda. And if you would say entire is Rabbi Meir, and there is a difference for Rabbi Meir between a marriage contract and documents, is there a difference for him
llm_translation: Beginning: Rabbi Meir. And the end: Rabbi Yehuda! And if you say it is all Rabbi Meir, and it is different for Rabbi Meir between written documents and contracts. And who is different for him?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: חֲמִשָּׁה גּוֹבִין מִן הַמְחוֹרָרִין, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: פֵּירוֹת, וּשְׁבַח פֵּירוֹת, וְהַמְקַבֵּל עָלָיו לָזוּן אֶת בֶּן אִשְׁתּוֹ וּבַת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְגֵט חוֹב שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַחְרָיוּת, וּכְתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ אַחְרָיוּת.
human_translation: Isn’t it taught Five may be collected from free and they are as follows: Produce, and enhancement produce. And one who accepts upon himself to sustain his wife’s son or his wife’s daughter And a document of debt that does not include guarantee, and the marriage contract of a wife that does not include guarantee.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Five things from those who are obligated to pay from the best, and these are they: fruits, and the praise of fruits, and one who undertakes to provide sustenance for his wife's son and daughter, and a debt document that has no successors, and a marriage contract of a woman that has no successors.

hebrew_text: מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר אַחְרָיוּת לָאו טָעוּת סוֹפֵר הוּא — רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְקָתָנֵי כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: Whom have you heard say guarantee is not a scribal error? Rabbi Meir, and teaches marriage contract of a wife.
llm_translation: One who heard that he said "following is not a mistake of the scribe" - Rabbi Meir, and the Scriptures teach "a woman."

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הָתָם כָּתְבָה לֵיהּ ״הִתְקַבַּלְתִּי״, הָכָא לָא כָּתְבָה לֵיהּ ״הִתְקַבַּלְתִּי״.
human_translation: If you wish, say Rabbi Meir, and if you wish, say Rabbi Yehuda. If you wish, say Rabbi Yehuda, there, she wrote to him: I have received here, she did not write to him: I have received
llm_translation: If you will say it is according to Rabbi Meir, and if you will say it is according to Rabbi Yehuda. If you will say it is according to Rabbi Yehuda: There, it was written "I have been accepted," here, it was not written "I have been accepted."

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מַאי ״חַיָּיב״ דְּקָתָנֵי — מִן הַמְחוֹרָרִין.
human_translation: if you wish, say Rabbi Meir. what is obligated, which is taught from the free
llm_translation: If you will ask, say: Rabbi Meir: What is the meaning of "obligated" that it teaches? — From the clear ones.

hebrew_text: לֹא כָּתַב לָהּ וְכוּ׳. אָמַר אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: אֵשֶׁת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנֶּאֶנְסָה — אֲסוּרָה לְבַעְלָהּ. חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא תְּחִלָּתָהּ בְּאוֹנֶס וְסוֹפָהּ בְּרָצוֹן.
human_translation: did not write for her Shmuel’s father said: The wife of an Israelite who was raped is forbidden to her husband, we are concerned perhaps her started as rape and ended willingly,
llm_translation: He did not write for her, etc. Abba, the son of Shmuel, said: A Jewish woman who was forced - is forbidden to her husband. We are concerned that perhaps her beginning was by force, but her end was willingly.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב לַאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: ״אִם תִּשְׁתְּבַאי, אֶפְרְקִינִּךְ וְאוֹתְבִינִּךְ לִי לְאִינְתּוּ״! אִישְׁתִּיק.
human_translation: Rav raised an objection to Shmuel’s father If you are taken captive I will redeem you and restore you to me as a wife. was silent
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Rav to the father of Shmuel: "If you will be captured, I will redeem you and bring you back to me as my wife!" He remained silent.

hebrew_text: קָרֵי רַב עֲלֵיהּ דַּאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: ״שָׂרִים עָצְרוּ בְמִלִּים וְכַף יָשִׂימוּ לְפִיהֶם״. מַאי אִית לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר? בִּשְׁבוּיָה הֵקֵילּוּ.
human_translation: Rav recited about Shmuel’s father: “The princes refrained from talking and laid a hand upon their mouths” what is there for him to say in a captive woman they were lenient.
llm_translation: Rav recited regarding the father of Shmuel: "Princes refrained from speaking, and placed their hand on their mouth." What can be said about this? They were in captivity.

hebrew_text: וְלַאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אוֹנֶס דְּשַׁרְיַהּ רַחֲמָנָא הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? כְּגוֹן דְּקָאָמְרִי עֵדִים בְּצוֹוַחַת מִתְּחִלָּה וְעַד סוֹף.
human_translation: According to Shmuel’s father, how can you find rape where the Merciful One permits For example, where witnesses say that she screamed from beginning to end.
llm_translation: To his father, Samuel, if a rapist, the Merciful One, how does she forget him? For example, when witnesses contradict each other from the beginning to the end.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרָבָא. דְּאָמַר רָבָא: כֹּל שֶׁתְּחִלָּתָהּ בְּאוֹנֶס וְסוֹף [בְּרָצוֹן, אֲפִילּוּ] הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ, שֶׁאִלְמָלֵא (לֹא) נִזְקַק לָהּ הִיא שׂוֹכַרְתּוֹ, מוּתֶּרֶת. מַאי טַעְמָא — יֵצֶר אַלְבְּשַׁהּ.
human_translation: And disagrees of Rava. As Rava said: any that starts as rape and ends willingly, even she says: Leave him, that if he had not intercourse with her, she have hired him she is permitted What is the reason The inclination took hold of her
llm_translation: Disagreement of Rava. For Rava said: Anything whose beginning was by force and its end by will, even she says: Leave him, for if not, she would have to pay him, she is exempt. What is the reason? Her inclination clothed her.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרָבָא ״וְהִיא לֹא נִתְפָּשָׂה״, אֲסוּרָה. הָא נִתְפָּשָׂה — מוּתֶּרֶת. וְיֵשׁ לְךָ אַחֶרֶת, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נִתְפָּשָׂה — מוּתֶּרֶת, וְאֵיזוֹ — זוֹ כֹּל שֶׁתְּחִלָּתָהּ בְּאוֹנֶס וְסוֹפָהּ בְּרָצוֹן.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with Rava: and she was not taken” she is forbidden was taken permitted And that you have another where even though she was not taken she is permitted. And which is this? This is any that starts as rape and ends willingly.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rava: "And she was not seized," she is forbidden. If she was seized, she is permitted. And you have another case, that even though she was not seized, she is permitted, and which is it? This is any woman whose beginning was under coercion and her end was willingly.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״וְהִיא לֹא נִתְפָּשָׂה״ — אֲסוּרָה, הָא נִתְפָּשָׂה — מוּתֶּרֶת. וְיֵשׁ לְךָ אַחֶרֶת, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּתְפָּשָׂה — אֲסוּרָה, וְאֵיזוֹ — זוֹ אֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: is taught another “And she was not taken”; is forbidden she was taken she is permitted And you have another where, even though she was taken she is forbidden And which is this? This is the wife of a priest,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And she was not seized" - forbidden; but if she was seized - permitted. And you have another case, that even though she was seized - forbidden, and which case is this? This is the case of the wife of a Kohen.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְהִיא לֹא נִתְפָּשָׂה״ — אֲסוּרָה, הָא נִתְפָּשָׂה — מוּתֶּרֶת. וְיֵשׁ לָהּ אַחֶרֶת, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נִתְפָּשָׂה, מוּתֶּרֶת. וְאֵיזוֹ — זוֹ שֶׁקִּידּוּשֶׁיהָ קִדּוּשֵׁי טָעוּת, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ בְּנָהּ מוּרְכָּב עַל כְּתֵיפָהּ — מְמָאֶנֶת וְהוֹלֶכֶת לָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: “And she was not taken”; she is forbidden was taken she is permitted And there is another where, even though she was not taken permitted. And which is this? This to whose betrothal was a mistaken betrothal, as, even if her son is riding on her shoulders she may refuse and go her.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: "And she was not seized" - forbidden; if she was seized - permitted. And she has another status, that even though she was not seized, she is permitted. And who is this? This is a case where her betrothals are betrothals of error, that even if her son is riding on her shoulder - she refuses and leaves.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הָנֵי נְשֵׁי דִּגְנַבוּ גַּנָּבֵי — שַׁרְיָין לְגוּבְרַיְיהוּ. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב יְהוּדָה: וְהָא קָא מַמְטְיָאן לְהוּ נַהֲמָא! מֵחֲמַת יִרְאָה. וְהָא קָא מְשַׁלְּחָן לְהוּ גִּירֵי! מֵחֲמַת יִרְאָה. וַדַּאי, שַׁבְקִינְהוּ וְאָזְלָן מִנַּפְשַׁיְיהוּ — אֲסִירָן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: Those women stolen by kidnappers are permitted to their husbands, The Rabbis said to Rav Yehuda: But they bring bread. due to fear. But they send them arrows. due to fear. certainly leave them alone, and they go of their own accord, they are forbidden
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Those women who were captured by thieves - they are permitted to their husbands. The Rabbis said to Rav Yehudah: But they are repulsive to their husbands! Due to fear. And he is sending them away! Due to fear. And certainly, if he divorces them and they depart from him - he must divorce them.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁבוּיֵי מַלְכוּת — הֲרֵי הֵן כִּשְׁבוּיִין. גְּנוּבֵי לִיסְטוּת — אֵינָן כִּשְׁבוּיִין. וְהָתַנְיָא אִיפְּכָא!
human_translation: The Sages taught: captured by the monarchy they are like captives, those stolen by bandits are not like captives, But isn’t it taught the reverse
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Captives of the government - behold, they are considered captives. Kidnapped for ransom - they are not considered captives. And it was taught the opposite!

hebrew_text: מַלְכוּת אַמַּלְכוּת לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּמַלְכוּת אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ, הָא בְּמַלְכוּת בֶּן נֶצַּר.
human_translation: monarchy monarchy not difficult: This to the monarchy of Ahasuerus, that with the monarchy of ben Netzer,
llm_translation: Kingdom of Ahasuerus not difficult: this in the kingdom of Ahasuerus, this in the kingdom of Ben Nitzar.

hebrew_text: לִיסְטוּת אַלִּיסְטוּת לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּבֶן נֶצַּר, הָא בְּלִיסְטִים דְּעָלְמָא. וּבֶן נֶצַּר, הָתָם קָרֵי לֵיהּ מֶלֶךְ, וְהָכָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ לִסְטִים! אִין, גַּבֵּי אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ — לִסְטִים הוּא, גַּבֵּי לִסְטִים דְּעָלְמָא — מֶלֶךְ הוּא.
human_translation: bandits bandits not difficult: This to ben Netzer, that with regular bandits [ listim ], And ben Netzer, there he is called a king and here he is called a bandit? Yes, alongside Ahasuerus he is a bandit, alongside a regular bandit he is a king.
llm_translation: Dispute, not a dispute is difficult: here in Ben Nezzar, here in lists of the world. And Ben Nezzar, there it is called king, and here it is called lists! No, regarding Ahasuerus — he is a lists, regarding lists of the world — he is a king.

hebrew_text: וּבְכֹהֶנֶת אַהְדְּרִינִּךְ לִמְדִינְתִּךָ וְכוּ׳. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל — חַיָּיב לִפְדוֹתָהּ, שֶׁאֲנִי קוֹרֵא בָּהּ ״וּבְכֹהֶנֶת אַהְדְּרִינִּךְ לִמְדִינְתִּךָ״,
human_translation: And in a priestess, I will return you to your province, Abaye said: a widow to a High Priest, obligated to redeem her, as I apply her And in a priestess: I will return you to your province.
llm_translation: In the case of a widow of a High Priest - one must redeem her, for I read in her case "and in the widow of your father you shall honor."

hebrew_text: מַמְזֶרֶת וּנְתִינָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹתָהּ, שֶׁאֵין אֲנִי קוֹרֵא בָּהּ ״וְאוֹתְבִינִּךְ לִי לְאִנְתּוּ״. רָבָא אָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁאִיסּוּר שְׁבִיָּיה גּוֹרֵם לָהּ — חַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹתָהּ, אִיסּוּר דָּבָר אַחֵר גּוֹרֵם לָהּ — אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: a mamzeret or a Gibeonite woman to an Israelite, he is not obligated to redeem her, as I do not apply to her And I will restore you to me as a wife, Rava said: any where the prohibition of her captivity, causes her he is obligated to redeem her. another prohibition causes her he is not obligated to redeem her.
llm_translation: Illegitimate child and slave girl to a Jew - not obligated to redeem her, for I do not read in it "and you shall understand it for me as a wife." Rava said: Any prohibition of captivity causes her - obligated to redeem her, any other prohibition causes her - not obligated to redeem her.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: הַמַּדִּיר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְנִשְׁבֵּית — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: פּוֹדָהּ, וְנוֹתֵן לָהּ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֵן לָהּ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, וְאֵינוֹ פּוֹדָהּ.
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im . one who vows his wife and she taken captive, Rabbi Eliezer says: redeems and gives her her marriage contract. Rabbi Yehoshua says: gives her her marriage contract but he does not redeem
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaim: One who vows his wife and she is divorced - Rabbi Eliezer says: He redeems her and gives her her marriage contract. Rabbi Yehoshua says: He gives her her marriage contract, but does not redeem her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי נָתָן, שָׁאַלְתִּי אֶת סוֹמְכוֹס: כְּשֶׁאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ נוֹתֵן לָהּ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ וְאֵינוֹ פּוֹדָהּ, כְּשֶׁהִדִּירָהּ וּלְבַסּוֹף נִשְׁבֵּית, אוֹ בְּנִשְׁבֵּית וּלְבַסּוֹף הִדִּירָהּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Natan said: I asked Sumakhos: When Rabbi Yehoshua said gives her her marriage contract but he does not redeem where he vowed she and she was subsequently taken captive, or of one who was taken captive and he subsequently vowed she
llm_translation: Rabbi Nathan said, I asked Somchus: When Rabbi Yehoshua said, he gives her the written document and does not redeem her, if he divorces her and ultimately she marries, or if she marries and ultimately he divorces her?

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר לִי: לֹא שָׁמַעְתִּי, וְנִרְאִין דְּבָרִים שֶׁהִדִּירָהּ וּלְבַסּוֹף נִשְׁבֵּית. דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ נִשְׁבֵּית וּלְבַסּוֹף הִדִּירָהּ — אָתֵי לְאִיעָרוֹמֵי.
human_translation: And he said to me: I have not heard but it would appear that he vowed she and she was subsequently taken captive. As, if you say she was taken captive and he subsequently vowed she come to engage in trickery.
llm_translation: And he said to me: I did not hear, and it appears that the matter that she had arranged ultimately was overturned. For if you say it was overturned and ultimately she arranged it - it comes to contradict.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו: בְּמַדִּיר אֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן קָמִיפַּלְגִי, וְאַבָּיֵי דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וְרָבָא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ?
human_translation: What, is it not disagree about who vows the wife of a priest, And Abaye spoke in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer and Rava spoke in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: What is the reason that they do not agree in the case of a Kohen's wife dwelling in a certain place, and Abbaye who said like Rabbi Eliezer, and Rava who said like Rabbi Yehoshua?

hebrew_text: לָא, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּדְרָה אִיהִי, וְקַיֵּים לַהּ הוּא. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: הוּא נוֹתֵן אֶצְבַּע בֵּין שִׁינֶּיהָ. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר: הִיא נָתְנָה אֶצְבַּע בֵּין שִׁינֶּיהָ.
human_translation: No; with what are we dealing here? where she vowed and upheld it for her Rabbi Eliezer maintains he is putting his finger between her teeth, And Rabbi Yehoshua maintains she put her finger between her teeth,
llm_translation: Not here, what are we dealing with? For example, if she vowed, and he fulfilled it for her. Rabbi Eliezer holds: He places a finger between her teeth. And Rabbi Yehoshua holds: She placed a finger between her teeth.

hebrew_text: אִי הִיא נָתְנָה אֶצְבַּע בֵּין שִׁינֶּיהָ — כְּתוּבָּה מַאי עֲבִידְתַּהּ?
human_translation: If she put her finger between her teeth, what is the marriage contract doing
llm_translation: If she placed a finger between her teeth - what is the halachic ruling?

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, אָמַר רַבִּי נָתָן, שָׁאַלְתִּי אֶת סוֹמְכוֹס: כְּשֶׁאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ נוֹתֵן לָהּ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ וְאֵינוֹ פּוֹדָהּ, כְּשֶׁהִדִּירָהּ וּלְבַסּוֹף נִשְׁבֵּית, אוֹ בְּשֶׁנִּשְׁבֵּית וּלְבַסּוֹף הִדִּירָהּ? וְאָמַר: לֹא שָׁמַעְתִּי.
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Natan said: I asked Sumakhos: When Rabbi Yehoshua said gives her her marriage contract but he does not redeem where he vowed she and she was subsequently taken captive, or of one who was taken captive and he subsequently vowed she And he said I have not heard
llm_translation: And come, said Rabbi Natan, I asked Somchus: When Rabbi Yehoshua said to her, "Give her her document and do not redeem her," when he had her reside and ultimately she was destroyed, or when she was destroyed and ultimately he had her reside? And he said: I did not hear.

hebrew_text: וְאִי דִּנְדַרָה אִיהִי, מָה לִי הִדִּירָהּ וּלְבַסּוֹף נִשְׁבֵּית, מָה לִי נִשְׁבֵּית וּלְבַסּוֹף הִדִּירָהּ?
human_translation: But if where she vowed what is me he her vow and she was subsequently taken captive, what is me she was taken captive and he subsequently her vow?
llm_translation: "If she vowed, what do I need her vow for, and ultimately she annulled it, what do I need the annulment for, and ultimately she vowed it again?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְעוֹלָם דְּאַדְּרַהּ אִיהוּ. וְאַבָּיֵי מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ, וְרָבָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ. אַבָּיֵי מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ: אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּחַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹתָהּ, מַמְזֶרֶת וּנְתִינָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹתָהּ. מַדִּיר אֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן נָמֵי, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּחַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹתָהּ. דְּהַיְינוּ אַלְמָנָה [לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל].
human_translation: Rather, actually where he vowed she And Abaye explains to his reasoning, and Rava explains to his reasoning. Abaye explains to his reasoning a widow to a High Priest, everyone agrees obligated to redeem her. a mamzeret a Gibeonite woman to an Israelite, everyone agrees not obligated to redeem her. who takes a vow the wife of a priest, likewise everyone agrees obligated to redeem her, as this is a widow to a High Priest,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, forever he honors her. And Abbaye resolves according to his reasoning, and Rava resolves according to his reasoning. Abbaye resolves according to his reasoning: A widow of a High Priest everyone agrees that he is obligated to redeem her, a mamzeret and a natinah to an Israelite everyone agrees that he is not obligated to redeem her. If a Kohen marries a woman who is fit for a Kohen, everyone agrees that he is obligated to redeem her. This is referring to a widow of a High Priest.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּמַדִּיר אֵשֶׁת יִשְׂרָאֵל. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אָזֵיל בָּתַר מֵעִיקָּרָא, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָזֵיל בָּתַר בַּסּוֹף.
human_translation: When they disagree of who vows the wife of an Israelite, Rabbi Eliezer follows at the outset, And Rabbi Yehoshua follows at the end,
llm_translation: When they argued about a married woman of Israel. Rabbi Eliezer goes after the initial ruling, and Rabbi Joshua goes after the final ruling.

hebrew_text: רָבָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ: אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, מַמְזֶרֶת וּנְתִינָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹתָהּ. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּמַדִּיר, בֵּין אֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן וּבֵין אֵשֶׁת יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rava explains to his reasoning: a widow to a High Priest, a mamzeret or a Gibeonite woman to an Israelite, everyone agrees not obligated to redeem her, When they disagree one who vows whether the wife of a priest or the wife of an Israelite.
llm_translation: Rava resolves according to his reasoning: A widow to a High Priest, a mamzeret and a Netinah to an Israelite - the entire world agrees that he is not obligated to redeem her. Where they disagree is in a case of a dwelling, whether it be the wife of a priest or the wife of an Israelite.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אָזֵיל בָּתַר מֵעִיקָּרָא, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָזֵיל בָּתַר בַּסּוֹף.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer follows at the outset And Rabbi Yehoshua follows at the end,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer went after the beginning, and Rabbi Yehoshua went after the end.

hebrew_text: נִשְׁבֵּית חַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹתָהּ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נִשְׁבֵּית בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת בַּעְלָהּ. הִכִּיר בָּהּ בַּעֲלָהּ — יוֹרְשִׁין חַיָּיבִין לִפְדּוֹתָהּ. לֹא הִכִּיר בָּהּ בַּעֲלָהּ — אֵין יוֹרְשִׁין חַיָּיבִין לִפְדּוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: she was taken captive, is obligated to redeem her. The Sages taught taken captive in her husband’s lifetime and afterward her husband died her husband was aware of her heirs are obligated to redeem her, if her husband was not aware of her heirs are not obligated to redeem her.
llm_translation: If a woman miscarries, one is obligated to redeem her, etc. The Sages taught: If she miscarried during the lifetime of her husband, and afterwards her husband died, if her husband recognized her, his heirs are obligated to redeem her. If her husband did not recognize her, his heirs are not obligated to redeem her.

hebrew_text: לֵוִי סָבַר לְמִיעְבַּד עוֹבָדָא כִּי הָא מַתְנִיתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב, הָכִי אָמַר חַבִּיבִי: לֵית הִלְכְתָא כִּי הָא מַתְנִיתָא, אֶלָּא כִּי הָא דְּתַנְיָא: נִשְׁבֵּית לְאַחַר מִיתַת בַּעְלָהּ — אֵין הַיְּתוֹמִין חַיָּיבִין לִפְדּוֹתָהּ. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ נִשְׁבֵּית בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת בַּעְלָהּ — אֵין הַיְּתוֹמִין חַיָּיבִין לִפְדּוֹתָהּ. שֶׁאֵין אֲנִי קוֹרֵא בָּהּ ״וְאוֹתְבִינִּךְ לְאִינְתּוּ״.
human_translation: Levi thought to act in accordance with this baraita . Rav said to him: My uncle ḥavivi said as follows: The halakha is not in accordance with this baraita . Rather, in accordance with that which is taught taken captive after the death of her husband, the orphans are not obligated to redeem her. And moreover, even was taken captive in her husband’s lifetime and afterward her husband died, the orphans are not obligated to redeem her, as I cannot apply to her And I will restore you to me as a wife.
llm_translation: Levi thought to reconcile the matter with this Mishnah. Rav said to him, "Thus my beloved one said: There is no halacha like this Mishnah, but rather like this that is taught: If she remarried after her husband's death - the orphans are not obligated to redeem her. And not only that, but even if she remarried while her husband was alive, and then her husband died - the orphans are not obligated to redeem her. For I do not read in it 'and I will betroth you to Me forever.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נִשְׁבֵּית, וְהָיוּ מְבַקְּשִׁין מִמֶּנּוּ עַד עֲשָׂרָה בְּדָמֶיהָ, פַּעַם רִאשׁוֹנָה — פּוֹדָהּ. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ: רָצָה פּוֹדָהּ, רָצָה אֵינוֹ פּוֹדָהּ. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: The Sages taught: taken captive and they were seeking from up to ten times her value, first occasion redeem From this forward, wants he redeems want he does not redeem Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says:
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If she miscarried, and they were demanding from him up to ten times the value of her blood, the first time — he redeems her. From here and onwards: if he wants, he redeems her; if he does not want, he does not redeem her. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says:

hebrew_text: אֵין פּוֹדִין אֶת הַשְּׁבוּיִין יוֹתֵר עַל כְּדֵי דְמֵיהֶם, מִפְּנֵי תִּקּוּן הָעוֹלָם. הָא בִּכְדֵי דְמֵיהֶן פּוֹדִין, אַף עַל גַּב דְּפִרְקוֹנָהּ יוֹתֵר עַל כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: One does not redeem captives at more than their value. for the betterment of the world, in their value one does redeem even though redemption more than her marriage contract.
llm_translation: One does not redeem captives for more than their value, for the betterment of the world. But if it is for their value, one may redeem them, even though the redemption exceeds its written requirement.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: נִשְׁבֵּית, וְהָיוּ מְבַקְּשִׁין מִמֶּנּוּ עַד עֲשָׂרָה בִּכְתוּבָּתָהּ, פַּעַם רִאשׁוֹנָה — פּוֹדָהּ. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ: רָצָה פּוֹדָהּ, רָצָה אֵינוֹ פּוֹדָהּ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיָה פִּרְקוֹנָהּ כְּנֶגֶד כְּתוּבָּתָהּ — פּוֹדָהּ, אִם לָאו אֵינוֹ פּוֹדָהּ!
human_translation: And raises a contradiction she was taken captive and were seeking from up to ten times the value of her marriage contract, first occasion redeem From this forward, wants he redeems want he does not redeem Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: If her ransom was equal to her marriage contract he redeems If not, he does not redeem
llm_translation: And they asked: If she miscarried, and they were seeking from him until ten in her script, the first time - he redeems her. From here and onwards: if he wants to redeem her, he redeems her; if he does not want to redeem her, he does not redeem her. Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel says: If her value was equivalent to her script - he redeems her, if not, he does not redeem her!

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל תְּרֵי קוּלֵּי אִית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel is of two leniencies
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel has two voices.

hebrew_text: לָקְתָה חַיָּיב לְרַפְּאוֹתָהּ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַלְמָנָה נִיזּוֹנֶת מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִין וּצְרִיכָה רְפוּאָה — הֲרֵי הִיא כִּמְזוֹנוֹת. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: רְפוּאָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ קִצְבָה (נִתְרַפֵּאת) [תִּתְרַפֵּא] — מִכְּתוּבָּתָהּ, שֶׁאֵין לָהּ קִצְבָה — הֲרֵי הִיא כִּמְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: was struck obligated to heal her, The Sages taught a widow is sustained from the property of orphans and who requires medical treatment, are like sustenance, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: treatment that has a fixed is healed from her marriage contract, that does not have a fixed it is like sustenance.
llm_translation: Gleaned she is obligated to heal her. The Rabbis taught: A widow sustained from the property of orphans and requires healing — she is like his sustenance. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: If she has a prescription (she has healed) she will heal — from her document, if she does not have a prescription — she is like his sustenance.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עָשׂוּ הַקָּזַת דָּם בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל כִּרְפוּאָה שֶׁאֵין לָהּ קִצְבָה. קָרִיבֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הֲוָה לְהוּ אִיתַּת אַבָּא דַּהֲוָת צְרִיכָה רְפוּאָה כֹּל יוֹמָא. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֵיזִילוּ קוּצוּ לֵיהּ מִידֵּי לְרוֹפֵא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: established in Eretz Yisrael, bloodletting like a treatment that does not have a fixed The relatives of Rabbi Yoḥanan had wife of their father, who required treatment every day, They came before Rabbi Yoḥanan He said to them: Go fix sum with the doctor
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: They made the bloodletting in the land of Israel as a remedy that has no set measure. The wife of the father of Rabbi Yochanan had a need for healing every day. They came before Rabbi Yochanan, he said to them: Go and remove it immediately from the hands of the healer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עָשִׂינוּ עַצְמֵינוּ כְּעוֹרְכֵי הַדַּיָּינִין. מֵעִיקָּרָא מַאי סְבַר, וּלְבַסּוֹף מַאי סְבַר? מֵעִיקָּרָא סְבַר: ״וּמִבְּשָׂרְךָ לֹא תִתְעַלָּם״, וּלְבַסּוֹף סְבַר: אָדָם חָשׁוּב שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said We have made ourselves like legal advisors, At the outset, what did he hold and ultimately, what did he hold? At the outset he held “and that you do not hide yourself from your own flesh” And ultimately he held an important person is different.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: We made ourselves like arbitrators. What does he initially hold, and what does he ultimately hold? Initially, he holds: "And do not hide yourself from your own flesh," and ultimately he holds: A person is considered important, different.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ לֹא כָּתַב לָהּ ״בְּנִין דִּכְרִין דְּיִהְווֹ לִיכִי מִינַּאי אִינּוּן יִרְתוּן כֶּסֶף כְּתוּבְּתִיךְ יָתֵר עַל חוּלָקְהוֹן דְּעִם אֲחוּהוֹן״ — חַיָּיב, שֶׁהוּא תְּנַאי בֵּית דִּין. ״בְּנָן נוּקְבָן דְּיִהְוֹין לִיכִי מִינַּאי יֶהֶוְיָן יָתְבָן בְּבֵיתִי וּמִיתַּזְנָן מִנִּכְסַי עַד דְּתִלַּקְחָן לְגוּבְרִין״ — חַיָּיב, שֶׁהוּא תְּנַאי בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: did not write for her male children you will have from me will inherit the money of your marriage contract in addition to their portion that with their brothers, is obligated as it is a stipulation of the court female children you will have from me will sit in my house and be sustained from my property until they are taken by men, is obligated as it is a stipulation of the court.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "If he did not write for her in the marriage contract, 'with the building of male slaves that will come from me, they shall not inherit silver more than your written portion with their brothers' — he is liable, for this is a stipulation of the court. 'If he built a female slave that will come from me, they shall dwell in my house and benefit from my property until they are taken by men' — he is liable, for this is a stipulation of the court."

hebrew_text: ״אַתְּ תְּהֵא יָתְבָא בְּבֵיתִי וּמִיתַּזְנָא מִנִּכְסַי כֹּל יְמֵי מֵיגַר אַלְמְנוּתִיךְ בְּבֵיתִי״ — חַיָּיב, שֶׁהוּא תְּנַאי בֵּית דִּין. כָּךְ הָיוּ אַנְשֵׁי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם כּוֹתְבִין. אַנְשֵׁי גָלִיל הָיוּ כּוֹתְבִין כְּאַנְשֵׁי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם. אַנְשֵׁי יְהוּדָה הָיוּ כּוֹתְבִין: ״עַד שֶׁיִּרְצוּ הַיּוֹרְשִׁין לִיתֵּן לִךְ כְּתוּבְּתִיךְ״. לְפִיכָךְ אִם רָצוּ יוֹרְשִׁין — נוֹתְנִין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ וּפוֹטְרִין אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: You will sit in my house and be sustained from my property all the days you live a widow in my house, is obligated as it is a stipulation of the court. The residents of Jerusalem would write in this manner, the residents of the Galilee would write like the inhabitants of Jerusalem. the residents of Judea would write: Until the heirs want to give you your marriage contract. Consequently, if the heirs wish, they may give her marriage contract to her and release her,
llm_translation: "You shall dwell in my house, and you shall be sustained from my property all the days of your widowhood in my house" - obligated, as it is a stipulation of the court. This is how the people of Jerusalem used to write. The people of the Galilee used to write like the people of Jerusalem. The people of Judea used to write: "Until the heirs are willing to give you your writing." Therefore, if the heirs are willing, they give her her writing and exempt her.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: מִפְּנֵי מָה הִתְקִינוּ כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין — כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּקְפּוֹץ אָדָם וְיִכְתּוֹב לְבִתּוֹ כִּבְנוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: For what reason did enact the marriage document concerning male children? so that a man will take the initiative and write his daughter as his son
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rabbi Yochanan from the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: For what reason did they establish the writing of the building of males? - So that a person will jump and write to his daughter as to his son.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר בְּרָא לֵירוֹת בְּרַתָּא לָא תֵּירוֹת, וַאֲתוֹ רַבָּנַן וּמְתַקְּנִי דְּתֵירוֹת בְּרַתָּא?
human_translation: And is there anything where the Merciful One says the son inherits the daughter does not inherit, and the Sages came and enacted that the daughter should inherit?
llm_translation: And who is it that from the hand of the Merciful One said, "Create a well to be thrown into, not to be thrown into," and the Rabbis came and established to throw into a well?
