hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״קְחוּ נָשִׁים וְהוֹלִידוּ בָּנִים וּבָנוֹת וּקְחוּ לִבְנֵיכֶם נָשִׁים וְאֶת בְּנוֹתֵיכֶם תְּנוּ לַאֲנָשִׁים״. בִּשְׁלָמָא בָּנִים — בִּידֵיהּ קָיְימִי. אֶלָּא בְּנָתֵיהּ, מִי קָיְימָן בִּידֵיהּ?
human_translation: This also by Torah as it is written: “Take wives for yourselves and bear sons and daughters, and take wives for your sons, and give your daughters to husbands” Granted, sons are in his hands, but daughters, are they in his power
llm_translation: The matter is that it is from the Torah, as it is written: "Take wives and bear sons and daughters, and take wives for your sons, and give your daughters to men." Sons - are in her hands. But daughters, who are in her hands?

hebrew_text: הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּנַלְבְּשַׁהּ וְנִיכַסְּיַהּ וְנִיתֵּיב לַהּ מִידֵּי, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּקָפְצִי עֲלַהּ וְאָתוּ נָסְבִי לַהּ. וְעַד כַּמָּה? אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: עַד לְעִישּׂוּר נִכְסֵי.
human_translation: teaches us this, that should dress her and cover her and give her something, so that will take the initiative with her and come marry her. And up to how much Abaye and Rava both say: Up to one-tenth property
llm_translation: This is what we heard, that if one clothes her and marries her and then divorces her, it is as if he leaped upon her and then married her. And for how long? Abbaye and Rava both said: Until the property is acquired.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: דְּאָב לֵירוֹת, דְּבַעַל לָא לֵירוֹת! אִם כֵּן, אָב נָמֵי מִימְּנַע וְלָא כָּתֵב.
human_translation: But say that the father should inherit, the husband should not inherit. If so, father will also refrain writing
llm_translation: And why? Because he intended to shoot, but he did not intend to hit! If so, the father should withhold and not write.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: הֵיכָא דִּכְתַב אָב — לִכְתּוֹב בַּעַל, הֵיכָא דְּלָא כְּתַב אָב — לָא לִכְתּוֹב בַּעַל! לָא פְּלוּג רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: But say where father wrote let husband write when father did not write let husband not write The Sages did not distinguish
llm_translation: And why? Where it wrote "av" - to write "ba'al," where it did not write "av" - not to write "ba'al"! The Rabbis do not dispute.

hebrew_text: בַּת בֵּין הַבָּנִים נָמֵי תֵּירוֹת? כְּנַחֲלָה שַׁוְּיוּהָ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: a daughter among sons likewise inherit The Sages established similar to inheritance:
llm_translation: Daughter between the sons, is she considered like an inheritance? The Sages have established it.

hebrew_text: בַּת בֵּין הַבָּנוֹת תֵּירוֹת! לָא פְּלוּג רַבָּנַן. וְתִיגְבֵּי מִמִּטַּלְטְלִי? כִּכְתוּבָּה שַׁוְּיוּהָ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: a daughter among daughters should inherit? The Sages did not distinguish And let be collected from movable property, The Sages established similar to marriage contract,
llm_translation: Daughter between the daughters rebellious! Not dispute sages. And should it be from a hanging object? As it is written, establish it sages.

hebrew_text: תִּטְרוֹף מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי! ״יִרְתוּן״ תְּנַן. וְאֵימָא אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֵיכָּא מוֹתַר דִּינָר! בְּמָקוֹם דְּקָא מִיעַקְרָא נַחֲלָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, לָא תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Let it be collected from liened we learned Will inherit, But say even though there is no more a dinar left over In a case where would uproot inheritance by Torah the Sages did not enact
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Titrof mi'misha'bedi! 'Yirtun' tenan. V'eima af al gav de'leika motar dinar! B'makom de'ka miyaakra nachala de'orayta, la takinu rabanan." English translation: "It should be torn from the servant! 'They shall pay' we have learned. And why not even though there is no monetary value! In a case where the inheritance of the Torah is being uprooted, the Rabbis did not establish."

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אִיעֲסַק לֵיהּ לִבְרֵיהּ בֵּי אַבָּא סוּרָאָה. אָזֵיל לְמִיכְתַּב לַהּ כְּתוּבְּתַהּ. שְׁמַע יְהוּדָה בַּר מָרִימָר, נְפַק אֲתָא אִיתְחֲזִי לֵיהּ. כִּי מְטוֹ לְפִיתְחָא, הֲוָה קָא מִפְּטַר מִינֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נֵיעוּל מָר בַּהֲדַאי!
human_translation: Rav Pappa, arranged for his son the family Abba of Sura, went the writing of marriage contract. Yehuda bar Mareimar heard came out present himself before him, When they came to the entrance took his leave of him, said to him: Let the Master enter with me.
llm_translation: Rav Papa was engaged with his son in the house of Abba Sura. He went to write for him his document. Shema Yehuda, son of Marimr, went out and saw him. When he reached the entrance, he was being dismissed from him. He said to him: "May the Master be locked in this!"

hebrew_text: חַזְיֵיהּ דְּלָא הֲוָה נִיחָא לֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ — מִשּׁוּם דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה: שִׁינָּנָא, לָא תִּיהְוֵי בְּעַבּוֹרֵי אַחְסָנְתָּא אֲפִילּוּ מִבְּרָא בִּישָׁא לִבְרָא טָבָא — דְּלָא יְדִיעָא מַאי זַרְעָא נָפֵיק מִינֵּיהּ, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן מִבְּרָא לִבְרַתָּא,
human_translation: saw that was not amenable He said to him: What is your mind? due to that Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda: Shinnana , do not be in the transfer of an inheritance even from a bad son to a good son, as it is not known what seed will come from him? And all the more so, from a son to a daughter.
llm_translation: His eyes that were not pleased, he said to him: What is your opinion? Because Samuel said to Rav Yehudah: A tooth, should not be in a storehouse, even if it is a good tooth - for it is not known what seed will come out of it, and all the more so from a good seed to a good tooth.

hebrew_text: הַאי נָמֵי תַּקַּנְתָּא דְרַבָּנַן הִיא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנֵי מִילֵּי מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ. לְעַשּׂוֹיֵיהּ נָמֵי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַטּוּ מִי קָאָמֵינָא לָךְ דְּעוּל וְעַשְּׂיֵיהּ? עוּל וְלָא תְּעַשְּׂיֵיהּ קָאָמֵינָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַעֲלַאי דִּידִי הַיְינוּ עִשֻּׂיֵיהּ.
human_translation: this too is an ordinance of the Sages, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai, said to him: This applies only of his own will, force him as well? said to him: Did I say to you that you should enter and force him? I said enter, but do not force him. He said to him: My entrance is force him,
llm_translation: This is the decree of the Sages, as Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: He said to him, "These matters are from his knowledge." Should they be done? He said to him, "Are we saying to you to know and not to do? We are saying to know and to do." He said to him, "Our actions are the same as our knowledge."

hebrew_text: אַכְפְּיֵיהּ וְעוֹל. אִישְׁתִּיק וִיתֵיב. סְבַר הָהוּא מִירְתָּח רָתַח. כַּתְבֵיהּ לְכֹל מַאי דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ. לְסוֹף אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי לָא מִישְׁתַּעֵי מָר? חַיֵּי דְּמָר, לָא שְׁבַיקִי מִידֵּי לְנַפְשַׁאי.
human_translation: forced and he entered. He was silent, and sat thought was angry He wrote all that he had Ultimately, said to him: Even now the Master will not talk? By the Master’s life, I have left nothing for myself.
llm_translation: He pressed him and he ascended. He remained silent and sat. That certain one thought he was boiling hot. He wrote to him everything that was happening to him. In the end, he said to him: "Now, is the master not calming down? By the life of the master, he did not leave me immediately for my own sake."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי מִינַּאי דִּידִי — אֲפִילּוּ הַאי נָמֵי דִּכְתַבְתְּ לָא נִיחָא לִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי אֶהְדַּר בִּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁוּוֹיֵי נַפְשָׁךְ הַדְרָנָא — לָא קָאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: said to him: If for my that which you wrote is also not amenable to me. said to Now too, I will retract, said to him: I did not speak should turn yourself into who retracts
llm_translation: He said to him: If my own people - even this paper that you wrote does not please me. He said to him: Now that you have returned, it pleases me. He said to him: The equal of your soul, I do not say.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב יֵימַר סָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: מָכְרָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ לְבַעְלָהּ, יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין אוֹ אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְתִבְּעֵי לָךְ מוֹחֶלֶת.
human_translation: Rav Yeimar the Elder raised a dilemma before Rav Naḥman: sold her marriage contract to her husband, she have the marriage document concerning male children, or she not have the marriage document concerning male children? Rava said to him: And you can raise dilemma who forgoes
llm_translation: Requested from him Rav Yeimar the Elder from Rav Nachman: If she sold her document to her husband, does she have a document of building of males or does she not have a document of building of males? Rava said to him: And you require a pardon.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא, מוֹכֶרֶת קָמִיבַּעְיָא לִי, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר זוּזֵי אַנְסוּהָ, דְּאָמֵינָא כְּמַאן דְּקָא מָחוּ לַהּ מְאָה עוּכְלֵי בְּעוּכְלָא, מוֹחֶלֶת מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: said to him: Now, one who sells is a dilemma for me. As, although there is to say the money forced her, that I say is like one who is struck a hundred strikes [ ukelei ] of a hammer [ ukela ], one who forgoes is necessary
llm_translation: He said to him: "Now, she is selling a Kamibaya to me, even though there is room to say that I will test her coins, for I believe like the one who is testing her that she has removed one hundred Uklai from the Uklara, should I forgive her?!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, פְּשִׁיטָא לִי: מוֹכֶרֶת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ לַאֲחֵרִים — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין. מַאי טַעְמָא — זוּזֵי אַנְסוּהָ. מוֹחֶלֶת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ לְבַעְלָהּ — אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין, מַאי טַעְמָא — אַחוֹלֵי אַחֵילְתַּהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: is obvious to me sells her marriage contract to others, she has the marriage document concerning male children. What is the reason? The money forced her one who forgoes her marriage contract her husband does not have the marriage document concerning male children. What is the reason? She has forgiven it
llm_translation: Rava said, it is obvious to me: if a woman sells her document to others, she has a document of building rights. What is the reason? The coins testify for her. If she forgives her document to her husband, she does not have a document of building rights. What is the reason? She has relinquished her rights.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: מוֹכֶרֶת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ לְבַעְלָהּ, כְּמוֹכֶרֶת לַאֲחֵרִים דָּמֵי, אוֹ כְּמוֹחֶלֶת לְבַעְלָהּ דָּמֵי? בָּתַר דְּבַעְיַאּ הֲדַר פַּשְׁטַהּ: מוֹכֶרֶת כְּתוּבָּה לְבַעְלָהּ, כְּמוֹכֶרֶת לַאֲחֵרִים דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma one who sells her marriage contract to her husband, considered like one who sells to others, or is she considered like one who forgoes her husband, After he raised the dilemma he subsequently resolved it: One who sells her marriage contract to her husband is considered like one who sells to others,
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rava: If a woman sells her kesuvah to her husband, is it like selling to others the value, or is it like forgiving her husband the value? After he asked, he explained: If she sells her kesuvah to her husband, it is like selling to others the value.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: מֵתָה — אֵין יוֹרְשִׁין שֶׁל זֶה וְאֵין יוֹרְשִׁין שֶׁל זֶה יוֹרְשִׁין כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מַאי עֲבִידְתַּהּ?!
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin raised an objection: she died, neither heirs of this nor heirs of that inherit her marriage contract. And we discussed a marriage contract, what is its purpose?
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Idi bar Avin raised an objection: If she dies - neither the heirs of this one inherit nor the heirs of that one inherit, they inherit according to its writing. And we ask about it: According to its writing, what does it do?!

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין. וְאַמַּאי? הָכָא נָמֵי לֵימָא יֵצֶר אַנְסַהּ!
human_translation: And Rav Pappa said: the marriage document concerning male children. But why Here too, let us say desire forced her
llm_translation: And Rav Papa said: It is written in the construction of the male. And why? Here too, let us say, the inclination is forced!

hebrew_text: הָתָם, קְנָסָא הוּא דְּקַנְסוּהָ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: There it is a penalty which the Sages penalized her.
llm_translation: There, a penalty it is that the Rabbis penalized it.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רָבִין בַּר חֲנִינָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, וְיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מוֹחֶלֶת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ לְבַעְלָהּ — אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי לָאו דְּקָאָמְרַתְּ לִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא לָךְ: ״מֵשִׁיב רָעָה תַּחַת טוֹבָה לֹא תָמוּשׁ רָעָה מִבֵּיתוֹ״?!
human_translation: Ravin bar Ḥanina sat before Rav Ḥisda, and he sat and said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: One who forgoes her marriage contract her husband does not sustenance said to him: Had you not said to me in the name of a great man, I would have said to you “who rewards evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house”
llm_translation: Sitting Ravin son of Chanina before Rav Chisda, and sitting and saying from the name of Rabbi Elazar: "One who forgives her written document to her husband - she has no sustenance." He said to him: If not that you are saying to me from the name of a great man, would I believe you: "He who repays evil for good, evil will not depart from his house"?!

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב נַחְמָן וְעוּלָּא וַאֲבִימִי בַּר רַב פַּפֵּי, וְיָתֵיב רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אַמֵּי גַּבַּיְיהוּ. אֲתָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּשְׁכִיבָא אֲרוּסָתוֹ, אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: זִיל קְבַר, אוֹ הַב לָהּ כְּתוּבְּתַהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב חִיָּיא, תְּנֵינָא: אִשְׁתּוֹ אֲרוּסָה — לֹא אוֹנֵן וְלֹא מִיטַּמֵּא לַהּ, וְכֵן הִיא — לֹא אוֹנֶנֶת וְלֹא מִיטַּמְּאָה לוֹ. מֵתָה — אֵינוֹ יוֹרְשָׁהּ, מֵת הוּא — גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman was sitting, and Ulla and Avimei bar Rav Pappi and Rav Ḥiyya bar Ami was sitting with them, a certain man came whose betrothed had died. They said to him: Go bury or give her her marriage contract. Rav Ḥiyya said to them, we learned one’s betrothed wife neither an acute mourner nor becomes ritually impure for her and similarly, she neither an acute mourner nor becomes ritually impure for him. she died he does not inherit her, he died she collects her marriage contract.
llm_translation: Sat Rav Nachman and Ulai and Avimi son of Rav Papei, and sat Rav Chiya son of Ammi opposite them. A certain man came who had just married his betrothed, they said to him: Go bury her, or bring her as she is. Rav Chiya said to them: We learned: His wife, if she is betrothed - he does not mourn or become impure for her, and likewise she - she does not mourn or become impure for him. If she dies - he does not inherit her, if he dies - her marriage contract is nullified.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּמֵת הוּא, הָא מֵתָה הִיא — אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: שֶׁאֵין אֲנִי קוֹרֵא בָּהּ ״לִכְשֶׁתִּנָּשְׂאִי לְאַחֵר תִּטְּלִי מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב לִיכִי״.
human_translation: reason he died, she died she does not have a marriage contract, What is the reason Rav Hoshaya said: that I do not read with regard to her When you marry another he may take what is written for you,
llm_translation: Reason of dead he, she dead she — not to her written. What reason? Said Rav Hoshaya: that I not read in it "when you marry another, you shall remove what is written for you."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אֲרוּסָה שֶׁמֵּתָה — אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה. אֲמַר לְהוּ אַבָּיֵי, זִילוּ אִמְרוּ לֵיהּ:
human_translation: When Ravin came Reish Lakish said: A betrothed woman who died does not have a marriage contract. Abaye said to Go, say to
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Reish Lakish said: A betrothed woman who died - she does not have a ketubah. Abaye said to them, go and tell him:

hebrew_text: שְׁקִילָא טֵיבוּתָךְ שַׁדְיָא אַחִיזְרֵי, כְּבָר תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא לִשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ בְּבָבֶל.
human_translation: Your good is taken cast on thorns, Rav Hoshaya already interpreted halakha in Babylonia.
llm_translation: The translation of the text is as follows: "Shkila Teivutach Shadya Achizrei, kevar targemah Rav Hoshaya lishmateih b'Bavel." Translation: "The measure of your goodness, O Almighty, return to us, as Rav Hoshaya has already translated it for his listeners in Babylon."

hebrew_text: בְּנָן נוּקְבָן דְּיִהְוְיָין לִיכִי מִינַּאי וְכוּ׳. רַב תָּנֵי: ״עַד דְּתִלַּקְחָן לְגוּבְרִין״, וְלֵוִי תָּנֵי: ״עַד דְּתִבְגְּרָן״. לְרַב, אַף עַל גַּב דִּבְגַר?! וְלֵוִי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִינְּסִיב?!
human_translation: female children you will have from me Rav teach until they are taken by men, and Levi teach until they become grown women. According to Rav, even though they have become grown women, And Levi even though they are married
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Benan nukvan deyihviyan likhi minai ve'chu. Rav tanai: 'Ad d'tilakhchan legubrin', ve'Levi tanai: 'Ad d'tivg'ran'. Lerav, af al gav d'vigr?! Ve'Levi, af al gav d'insiv?!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: בְּגַר וְלָא אִינְּסִיב, אִינְּסִיב וְלָא בְּגַר — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בַּאֲרוּסָה וְלָא בְּגַר. וְכֵן תָּנֵי לֵוִי בְּמַתְנִיתֵיהּ: ״עַד דְּתִבְגְּרָן וְיִמְטֵי זִמְנֵיהוֹן דְּאִינַּסְבָן״. תַּרְתֵּי? אֶלָּא: אוֹ תִּבְגְּרָן אוֹ יִמְטֵי זִמְנֵיהוֹן לְאִיתְנַסְבָא.
human_translation: Rather, they became grown women and were not married, married and had not become grown women, everyone agrees When they disagree with regard to who was betrothed and had not become a grown woman. And Levi likewise taught in his baraita : Until they become grown women and the time arrives for their marriage. two Rather, either they become grown women or their time arrives for marriage.
llm_translation: Rather: in a state of adulthood and not yet married, or married and not yet in a state of adulthood - they do not disagree. For they disagree in the case of betrothal and not in the case of adulthood. And so Levi taught in his Mishnah: "Until they reach adulthood and their designated time for marriage arrives." Two? Rather: either they reach adulthood or their designated time for marriage arrives for them to get married.

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: עַד מָתַי הַבַּת נִזּוֹנֶית — עַד שֶׁתֵּאָרֵס, מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמְרוּ: עַד שֶׁתִּבְגַּר. תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: ״עַד דִּיהֶוְויָין״. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הֲוָיָה דְאֵירוּסִין, אוֹ הֲוָיָה דְנִישּׂוּאִין? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: like tanna’im . Until when is a daughter sustained Until she is betrothed. In the name of Rabbi Elazar they said: Until she becomes a grown woman. Rav Yosef taught Until they become a dilemma was raised before becoming betrothed or becoming married? shall stand
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The Tanna'im: Until when is the daughter maintained? - Until she is married, in the name of Rabbi Elazar they said: Until she reaches maturity. Rav Yosef taught: "Until they become of age." They asked him: Does this refer to betrothal, or does it refer to marriage? The matter remains undecided.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב יוֹסֵף: מִי שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, אֲרוּסָה יֵשׁ לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת, אוֹ אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשְׁמָע לָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי, אֶלָּא מִסְּבָרָא לֵית לַהּ: כֵּיוָן דְּאֵירְסַהּ, לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּתִיתְּזִיל.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said to Rav Yosef: Have you heard from Rav Yehuda a betrothed has sustenance or she does not have sustenance? said to him: hearing, I have not heard but by logical she does not have since has betrothed her it is not satisfactory for him that she be demeaned
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ḥisdah said to Rav Yosef: Who informed you of the opinion of Rav Yehudah, does a betrothed woman have maintenance or does she not have maintenance? He said to him: I did not hear it directly, rather from logical reasoning: Since he betrothed her, it is not appropriate for him to cast her off.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם מִשְׁמָע לָא שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ, מִסְּבָרָא אִית לַהּ. כֵּיוָן דְּלָא קִים לֵיהּ בְּגַוַּהּ, לָא שָׁדֵי זוּזֵי בִּכְדִי.
human_translation: said to If you have not heard by logical she have since is not sure her, he will not throw away money for nothing.
llm_translation: He said to him: If you do not hear, I will not listen to you, there is reasoning for it. Since it is not established in its place, it does not remove the movable objects in order.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשְׁמָע לָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי, מִסְּבָרָא אִית לַהּ — כֵּיוָן דְּלָא קִים לֵיהּ בְּגַוַּהּ, לָא שָׁדֵי זוּזֵי בִּכְדִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי מִשְׁמָע לָא שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ, מִסְּבָרָא לֵית לַהּ. כֵּיוָן דְּאֵירְסַהּ, לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּתִיתְּזִיל.
human_translation: And some say said to hearing, I have not heard by logical she does have Since he is not sure her, he will not throw away money for nothing. said to him: If you have not heard by logical she not have Since he has betrothed her it is not satisfactory for him that she be demeaned
llm_translation: And there are those who say, he said to him: "If you do not listen, it is not heard for me, from the reasoning it has - since it is not established in its place, it does not release the coins properly." He said to him: "If you do not listen, it is not heard for you, from the reasoning it does not have. Since she has inserted it, it is not pleasing to her that it should go out."

hebrew_text: סִימָן דְּגַבְרֵי: שַׁק זְרַף. מֵאֲנָה, וִיבָמָה, שְׁנִיָּה, אֲרוּסָה, וַאֲנֻסָה.
human_translation: a mnemonic for men, Shin , kuf , zayin , reish , peh . She refused, and a yevama , a secondary relationship, a betrothed woman, and a woman who was raped.
llm_translation: Section of the Masters: Shach Zeraph. She refused, and Yibamah, Shniyah, Arusah, and Anusah.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מְמָאֶנֶת, יֵשׁ לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת, אוֹ אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת?
human_translation: raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: one who refused, she have sustenance or she not have sustenance?
llm_translation: Inquired from him Rav Sheshet: "She refuses, does she have sustenance, or does she not have sustenance?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: אַלְמָנָה בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ, וּגְרוּשָׁה בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ, וְשׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ — יֵשׁ לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עוֹדָהּ בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ — יֵשׁ לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת, אֵינָהּ בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ — אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said to them: You learned it a widow in her father’s house, or a divorcée in her father’s house, or a widow awaiting her yavam in her father’s house, she has sustenance. Rabbi Yehuda says: she is still in her father’s house she has sustenance; she is not in her father’s house she does not have sustenance.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said to them: He taught it: A widow in her father's house, and a divorced woman in her father's house, and a waiting yevamah in her father's house - she is entitled to maintenance. Rabbi Yehuda says: If she is still in her father's house - she is entitled to maintenance, if she is not in her father's house - she is not entitled to maintenance.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא?! אֶלָּא לָאו, מְמָאֶנֶת אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר אִית לַהּ, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר לֵית לַהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda is the first tanna . Rather, is it not there is between them who refused as the first tanna maintains she has and Rabbi Yehuda maintains she does not have
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda is that the same as the first Tanna?! Rather, no, there is a distinction between them, for the first Tanna holds that there is an obligation, and Rabbi Yehuda holds that there is not.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: בַּת יְבָמָהּ, יֵשׁ לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת אוֹ אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת?
human_translation: Reish Lakish raised a dilemma: daughter a yevama , she have sustenance or she not have sustenance?
llm_translation: Inquiry of Reish Lakish: The daughter of her yavam, does she have sustenance or does she not have sustenance?

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר כְּתוּבָּתָהּ עַל נִכְסֵי בַּעְלָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן, לֵית לַהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּאִי לֵית לַהּ מֵרִאשׁוֹן, תַּקִּינוּ לַהּ רַבָּנַן מִשֵּׁנִי, אִית לַהּ? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Since the Master said marriage contract from the property of her first husband, not have Or perhaps, since if she does not have from the first the Sages enacted for her from the second have shall stand
llm_translation: As the Master said, "Since its writing is on the property of her first husband, she does not have it," or perhaps: "Since if she does not have it from the first, the Rabbis established it for her from the second, does she have it?" This matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בַּת שְׁנִיָּה, יֵשׁ לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת, אוֹ אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת?
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar raised a dilemma: daughter a secondary relationship, have sustenance or she not have sustenance?
llm_translation: The question of Rabbi Elazar's son: A daughter of a second marriage, does she have sustenance, or does she not have sustenance?

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּלֵית לַהּ כְּתוּבָּה — לֵית לַהּ מְזוֹנֵי, אוֹ דִלְמָא: אִמַּהּ דַּעֲבַדָא אִיסּוּרָא — קַנְסוּהָ רַבָּנַן, אִיהִי, דְּלָא עֲבַדָא אִיסּוּרָא — לָא קַנְסוּהָ רַבָּנַן. תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Since she does not have a marriage contract, does not have sustenance Or perhaps, her mother, who violated a prohibition, the Sages penalized her who did not violate a prohibition, the Sages did not penalize her. shall stand
llm_translation: Since there is no written document for her — she does not have sustenance, or perhaps: the mother who performs a prohibition — the Rabbis penalize her. If she did not perform a prohibition — the Rabbis do not penalize her. The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: בַּת אֲרוּסָה, יֵשׁ לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת, אוֹ אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת? כֵּיוָן דְּאִית לַהּ כְּתוּבָּה — אִית לַהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּלָא תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן כְּתוּבָּה עַד שְׁעַת נִישּׂוּאִין — לֵית לַהּ, תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: daughter of a betrothed woman, have sustenance or she not have sustenance? Since has a marriage contract, has Or perhaps, since the Sages did not enact a marriage contract until the time of marriage, does not have shall stand
llm_translation: Rava asked: Does a betrothed woman have a right to maintenance, or does she not have a right to maintenance? Once she has a marriage contract — she has a right to maintenance, or perhaps: since the Rabbis did not establish a marriage contract until the time of marriage — she does not have a right to maintenance. This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: בַּת אֲנוּסָה, יֵשׁ לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת, אוֹ אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת? אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, דְּאָמַר יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה מָנֶה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa raises a dilemma: the daughter a raped she have sustenance or she not have sustenance According to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, do not raise this dilemma, as he said has a marriage contract of one hundred dinars,
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rav Papa: Does a woman who was raped have a right to sustenance, or does she not have a right to sustenance? According to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, it should not be asked of you, as he said she has a written portion.

hebrew_text: כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי: יָצָא כֶּסֶף קְנָסָהּ בִּכְתוּבָּתָהּ, מַאי?
human_translation: let the dilemma be raised according to the Rabbis, who say money of her fine fulfilled her marriage contract, what
llm_translation: When you are in doubt, follow the opinion of the sages who say: "The payment of the fine is discharged by its writing." What is the reason?

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּלֵית לַהּ כְּתוּבָּה, לֵית לַהּ מְזוֹנֵי, אוֹ דִלְמָא: כְּתוּבָּה טַעְמָא מַאי — כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא קַלָּה בְּעֵינָיו לְהוֹצִיאָהּ, וְהָא — לָא מָצֵי מַפֵּיק לַהּ. תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: since does not have a marriage contract, does not have sustenance Or perhaps What is the reason the marriage contract So that will not be demeaned in his eyes such that divorce her. And this one, he cannot divorce her shall stand
llm_translation: As there is no writing for it, there are no provisions for it, or perhaps: what is the reason for the writing - in order that it not be easy in his eyes to divorce her, and this - he cannot divorce her. Teiku.

hebrew_text: אַתְּ תְּהֵא יָתְבָא בְּבֵיתִי וְכוּ׳. תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: ״בְּבֵיתִי״ — וְלָא בְּבִיקְתִּי, אֲבָל מְזוֹנֵי אִית לַהּ. מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מְזוֹנֵי נָמֵי לֵית לַהּ. וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּמָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי.
human_translation: You will sit in my house Rav Yosef taught: In my house, and not in my hovel [ bikati ]. However, she has sustenance Mar bar Rav Ashi said: She does not even have sustenance, And the halakha is not in accordance with Mar bar Rav Ashi.
llm_translation: You shall sit in my house, etc. Rav Yosef taught: "In my house" — and not in my courtyard, but she has sustenance. Mar bar Rav Ashi said: Even sustenance she does not have. And the halakha is not like Mar bar Rav Ashi.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: תְּבָעוּהָ לְהִנָּשֵׂא וְנִתְפַּיְּיסָה — אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת. הָא לֹא נִתְפַּיְּיסָה, יֵשׁ לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת? אָמַר רַב עָנָן: לְדִידִי מִפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִינֵּיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל: אָמְרָה ״מֵחֲמַת פְּלוֹנִי בַּעְלִי״ — יֵשׁ לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת, ״מֵחֲמַת בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁאֵינָן מְהוּגָּנִין לָהּ״ — אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: proposed to marry and she agreed, she no has sustenance not agreed, she has sustenance. Rav Anan said: It was explained to me personally by Mar Shmuel she said: due to so-and-so, my husband, she has sustenance because people who are unsuitable for her, she does not have sustenance,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: If she demands to be married and is appeased - she does not have sustenance. If she was not appeased, does she have sustenance? Rav Anan said: According to me, I can explain the statement of Shmuel: If she said, "Because of the property of so-and-so, my husband" - she has sustenance; "Because of the sons of men who are not respectable to her" - she does not have sustenance.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זִינְּתָה — אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: כִּיחֲלָה וּפִירְכְּסָה — אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: she engaged in licentious sexual relations she does not have sustenance Rav Yosef said: she painted and dyed she does not have sustenance
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: If she was married off (zinneta) - she has no sustenance. Rav Yosef said: If she was divorced and widowed - she has no sustenance.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר זִינְּתָה, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן כִּיחֲלָה וּפִירְכְּסָה. מַאן דְּאָמַר כִּיחֲלָה וּפִירְכְּסָה, אֲבָל זִינְּתָה אִית לַהּ, מַאי טַעְמָא — יֵצֶר אַנְסַהּ.
human_translation: the one who says engaged in licentious sexual relations all the more so she painted and dyed the one who says painted and dyed However, she engaged in licentious sexual relations she has What is the reason? inclination forced her,
llm_translation: The one who said "Zintha," all the more so "Kichala" and "Pirketsa." The one who said "Kichala" and "Pirketsa," but "Zintha" she has, what is the reason? - The Yetzer entices her.

hebrew_text: וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּכֹל הָנֵי שְׁמַעְתָּתָא, אֶלָּא כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַתּוֹבַעַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ בְּבֵית דִּין — אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: And the halakha is not in accordance with all of these statements. Rather, is, in accordance with that which Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: One who claims her marriage contract in court does not have sustenance,
llm_translation: The matter is not like all those reports, but as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A woman whose marriage contract is in the possession of the court - she is not entitled to maintenance.

hebrew_text: וְלָא?! וְהָתַנְיָא: מָכְרָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, וּמִשְׁכְּנָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, עָשְׂתָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ אַפּוֹתֵיקֵי לְאַחֵר — אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת. הָנֵי — אִין, אֲבָל תּוֹבַעַת — לָא!
human_translation: And not But isn’t it taught one who sold her marriage contract, or used her marriage contract as collateral, or established her marriage contract as designated repayment [ apoteiki ] for another she does not have sustenance these yes, However, claims no,
llm_translation: And not?! And it was taught: If she sold her written document, and her dwelling written document, and she made her written document into apothecary jars for another—she has no sustenance. Those—no, but a claim—yes!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי, בֵּין בְּבֵית דִּין בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין. תּוֹבַעַת, בְּבֵית דִּין — אִין, שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין — לָא.
human_translation: these whether in court whether not in court. one who claims in court, yes, not in court, no,
llm_translation: These, whether in a court or not in a court. A claim, in a court - yes, not in a court - no.

hebrew_text: וְכָךְ הָיוּ אַנְשֵׁי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם וְכוּ׳. אִתְּמַר, רַב אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּאַנְשֵׁי יְהוּדָה, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּאַנְשֵׁי גָלִיל.
human_translation: And the residents of Jerusalem would in this manner, It was stated Rav said the halakha is in accordance with the residents of Judea, and Shmuel said the halakha is in accordance with the residents of the Galilee
llm_translation: And so were the people of Jerusalem, etc. It was stated: Rav said: The halakha is like the people of Judah, and Shmuel said: The halakha is like the people of Galilee.

hebrew_text: בָּבֶל וְכֹל פַּרְווֹדֶהָא נְהוּג כְּרַב, נְהַרְדְּעָא וְכֹל פַּרְווֹדֶהָא נְהוּג כִּשְׁמוּאֵל. הָהִיא בַּת מָחוֹזָא דַּהֲוָת נְסִיבָא לִנְהַרְדְּעָא. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, שַׁמְעַהּ לְקָלַהּ דְּבַת מָחוֹזָא הִיא.
human_translation: Babylonia and all towns [ parvadaha ] act in accordance with Rav; Neharde’a and all towns act in accordance with Shmuel. a certain woman of Meḥoza who was married to Neharde’a. They came before Rav Naḥman He heard from her voice that she was from Meḥoza,
llm_translation: Bavel and all its surroundings follow the opinion of Rav, Nehardea and all its surroundings follow the opinion of Shmuel. There was a certain woman from Mahoza who was married to someone from Nehardea. She came before Rav Nachman, who heard the disgrace of the daughter of Mahoza.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: בָּבֶל וְכׇל פַּרְווֹדֶהָא נְהוּג כְּרַב. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וְהָא לִנְהַרְדְּעָא נְסִיבָא! אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי הָכִי, נְהַרְדְּעָא וְכׇל פַּרְווֹדֶהָא נְהוּג כִּשְׁמוּאֵל. וְעַד הֵיכָא נְהַרְדְּעָא — עַד הֵיכָא דְּסָגֵי קַבָּא דִנְהַרְדְּעָא.
human_translation: said to them: Babylonia and all towns act in accordance with Rav. They said to him: But she is marrying Neharde’a. He said to them: If so, Neharde’a and all towns act in accordance with Shmuel. And until where Neharde’a? Up to where the kav of Neharde’a is used.
llm_translation: He said to them: In Babylonia and all its surrounding areas, the custom is like Rav. They said to him: But in Nehardea, the custom is like Shmuel! He said to them: If so, in Nehardea and all its surrounding areas, the custom is like Shmuel. And until where is Nehardea? Until the end of the bank of the river Nehardea.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר. אַלְמָנָה, רַב אָמַר: שָׁמִין מַה שֶּׁעָלֶיהָ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין שָׁמִין מַה שֶּׁעָלֶיהָ. אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין: וְחִילּוּפָהּ בְּלָקִיט.
human_translation: It was stated a widow. Rav said: appraises that are upon her And Shmuel said does not appraise that are upon her. Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said: And the reverse with regard to a hired worker.
llm_translation: It was stated: A widow. Rav said: We listen to what she says. And Shmuel said: We do not listen to what she says. Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said: And the reversal of her statement is in the gathering.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא מַתְנֵי: וְכֵן בְּלָקִיט. וּמַנַּח בַּהּ סִימָנָא: ״יַתְמָא וְאַרְמַלְתָּא שְׁלַח וּפוֹק״.
human_translation: Rav Kahana teach: And likewise with regard to a hired worker, And he would apply a mnemonic An orphan and a widow, disrobe and remove
llm_translation: Rav Kahana teaches: And similarly in the gathering. And he places a sign in it: "Yatma, and Aramalta, send and go."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אַף עַל גַּב דִּתְנַן בְּמַתְנִיתִין כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב. דִּתְנַן: אֶחָד הַמַּקְדִּישׁ נְכָסָיו, וְאֶחָד הַמַּעֲרִיךְ אֶת עַצְמוֹ — אֵין לוֹ לֹא בִּכְסוּת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְלֹא בִּכְסוּת בָּנָיו, וְלֹא בְּצֶבַע שֶׁצָּבַע לִשְׁמָן, וְלֹא בְּסַנְדָּלִים חֲדָשִׁים שֶׁלָּקַח לִשְׁמָן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: Even though we learned in a mishna in accordance with Shmuel, the halakha is in accordance with Rav. As we learned both one who consecrates his property and one who valuates himself neither his wife’s clothing, nor his children’s clothing, nor dyed that he dyed for them, nor new sandals that he bought for them.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Even though it was taught in the Mishnah according to the opinion of Shmuel, the halakha is in accordance with the opinion of Rav. For it was taught: If one consecrates his property, and another appraises himself — he does not have a covering for his wife, nor for his children, nor for the oil he anointed himself with, nor for the new sandals he bought for himself.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דִּתְנַן מַתְנִיתִין כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אַמַּאי הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִכְאוֹרָה כִּשְׁמוּאֵל רְהִיטָא, כִּי מְעַיְּינַתְּ בָּהּ — הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב.
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: Once we have learned a mishna in accordance with Shmuel, why is the halakha in accordance with Rav? He said to him: It would seem [ likhora ] with Shmuel skimmed through when you examine it the halakha is in accordance with Rav.
llm_translation: He said to him Rava to Rav Nachman: And since we learned in a Mishnah according to the opinion of Shmuel, why is the halakha according to the opinion of Rav? He said to him: Apparently, like Shmuel's reasoning, for when you examine it closely - the halakha is according to the opinion of Rav.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? כִּי אַקְנִי לַהּ, אַדַּעְתָּא לְמֵיקַם קַמֵּיהּ. אַדַּעְתָּא לְמִשְׁקַל וּלְמִיפַּק — לָא אַקְנִי לַהּ.
human_translation: What is the reason When he bought her with the intention that she should stand before him He did not buy her with the intention that she should take and leave
llm_translation: What is the reason? Because I will acquire it, knowledge to establish before her. Knowledge to weigh and to assess - I will not acquire it for her.

hebrew_text: כַּלְּתָא דְּבֵי בַּר אֶלְיָשִׁיב הֲוָה קָא תָּבְעָה כְּתוּבְּתַהּ מִיַּתְמֵי. הֲוָה קָא מַמְטְיָא לְהוּ לְבֵי דִינָא, אָמְרִי: זִילָא לַן מִילְּתָא דְּתֵיזְלִי הָכִי. אֲזַלָא לְבֵישְׁתִּינְהוּ וְאִיכַּסִּתִינְהוּ לְכוּלֵּיהּ מָנָא. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבִינָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב, דְּאָמַר: אַלְמָנָה שָׁמִין מַה שֶּׁעָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: daughter-in-law of the house of the son of Elyashiv was claiming her marriage contract from the orphans, she was bringing them to the court. said demeaning for us that you should go in this manner, She went dressed and covered herself with all of her clothes. They came before Ravina, who said to them: The halakha is in accordance with Rav, said a widow, appraises that are upon her.
llm_translation: The room of the house of Bar Elayshiv was demanding its document from the witnesses. It was sending them to the court, saying: "Go and take care of the matter in this way." They went, embarrassed and covered themselves with a cloak. They came before Ravina, who said to them: The law is according to the opinion of Rav, who said: "A widow is believed regarding what is upon her."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: ״נְדוּנְיָא לִבְרַת״. זַל נְדוּנְיָא. אָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: פּוּרְנָא לְיַתְמֵי.
human_translation: A certain said to a dowry to daughter. a dowry depreciated, Rav Idi bar Avin said: profit [ purna ], to the orphans,
llm_translation: That one who said to them: "A punishment for the daughter." This is a punishment. Rav Idi bar Avin said: A mule for the daughter.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ:
human_translation: A certain said to
llm_translation: That one who said to them:

hebrew_text: ״אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי מִן חַמְרָא לִבְרַת״. אִיַּיקַּר חַמְרָא. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: רַוְוחָא לְיַתְמֵי.
human_translation: Four hundred dinars of wine to daughter, the wine appreciated Rav Yosef said: gain to the orphans,
llm_translation: "Four hundred zuz from a donkey to a pit." What is the value of the donkey? Rav Yosef said: "It is worth its weight in dates."

hebrew_text: קָרִיבֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הֲוָה לְהוּ אִיתַּת אַבָּא דַּהֲוָה קָמַפְסְדָה מְזוֹנֵי. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֵיזִילוּ וֶאֱמַרוּ לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּכוֹן דִּנְיַיחֵד לַהּ אַרְעָא לִמְזוֹנַהּ.
human_translation: The relatives of Rabbi Yoḥanan had a wife of father who would diminish sustenance. They came before Rabbi Yoḥanan He said to them: Go and say to your father that he should set aside land for her sustenance.
llm_translation: The wife of Abba, who was providing for her sustenance, was close to Rabbi Yochanan. They came before Rabbi Yochanan. He said to them: "Go and tell her father-in-law to allocate land for her sustenance."

hebrew_text: אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁרִיבָּה לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וְהָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא אָמַר הָכִי! אֲמַר לְהוּ: זִילוּ הַבוּ לַהּ. וְאִי לָא, מַפֵּיקְנָא לְכוּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מֵאוּנַּיְיכוּ. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֲמַר לְהוּ: מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה? שֶׁכְּנֶגְדִּי חָלוּק עָלַי.
human_translation: they came before Reish Lakish said to them: All the more so, he has increased sustenance to her. They said to him: But Rabbi Yoḥanan did not say so. He said to them: Go give her and if not, I will remove for you Rabbi Yoḥanan from your ears, They approached Rabbi Yoḥanan he said to them: What can I do? as equal to me disagrees with me.
llm_translation: They came before Reish Lakish, he said to them: All the more so that she should receive sustenance. They said to him: But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say otherwise! He said to them: Go and bring it to her. And if not, I will have Rabbi Yochanan take it from you. They came before Rabbi Yochanan, he said to them: What shall I do? A division has been made against me.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: לְדִידִי מִפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אָמַר ״לִמְזוֹנוֹת״ — רִיבָּה לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת. אָמַר ״בִּמְזוֹנוֹת״ — קָצַץ לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: was explained to me personally by Rabbi Yoḥanan. he said for sustenance, he has increased sustenance to her. he said as sustenance, he has fixed sustenance to her,
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: According to my understanding, Rabbi Yochanan's explanation is preferable to me. He said, "For sustenance" - he increased her sustenance. He said, "With sustenance" - he decreased her sustenance.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ נַעֲרָה
llm_translation: We will return to you, maiden.

hebrew_text: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ בְּתוּלָה גּוֹבָה מָאתַיִם וְאַלְמָנָה מָנֶה, אִם רָצָה לְהוֹסִיף אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה מָנֶה — יוֹסִיף. נִתְאַרְמְלָה אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשָׁה, בֵּין מִן הָאֵרוּסִין בֵּין מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין — גּוֹבָה אֶת הַכֹּל. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר: מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין — גּוֹבָה אֶת הַכֹּל, מִן הָאֵירוּסִין — בְּתוּלָה גּוֹבָה מָאתַיִם וְאַלְמָנָה מָנֶה, שֶׁלֹּא כָּתַב לָהּ אֶלָּא עַל מְנָת לְכוֹנְסָהּ.
human_translation: Although they said a virgin collects two hundred and a widow one hundred dinars, if wishes to add even ten thousand he may add she is widowed or divorced, whether from betrothal whether from marriage, she collects the entire Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: from marriage, she collects the total from betrothal, a virgin collects two hundred and a widow one hundred because he wrote for her only in order to marry her.
llm_translation: Even though they said regarding a virgin, two hundred silver coins, and a widow, one hundred silver coins, if he wants to add even a hundred silver coins - he may add. Whether she was secluded or divorced, whether from betrothal or from marriage - he must pay everything. Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says: From marriage - he must pay everything, from betrothal - a virgin is worth two hundred silver coins and a widow is worth one hundred silver coins, because he only wrote the marriage contract for the purpose of marrying her.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם רָצָה כּוֹתֵב לִבְתוּלָה שְׁטָר שֶׁל מָאתַיִם, וְהִיא כּוֹתֶבֶת ״הִתְקַבַּלְתִּי מִמְּךָ מָנֶה״, וּלְאַלְמָנָה מָנֶה וְהִיא כּוֹתֶבֶת ״הִתְקַבַּלְתִּי מִמְּךָ חֲמִשִּׁים זוּז״. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַפּוֹחֵת לִבְתוּלָה מִמָּאתַיִם וּלְאַלְמָנָה מִמָּנֶה — הֲרֵי זוֹ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says If he wishes, he may write for a virgin a document for two hundred and she may write I received one hundred dinars from you. And for a widow one hundred dinars and she may write I received from you fifty dinars. Rabbi Meir says: anyone who reduces than two hundred for a virgin or one hundred dinars for a widow, this licentious sexual relations
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: If one wishes, he may write a document of two hundred for a virgin, and she writes, "I have received from you a hundred," and for a widow, a hundred, and she writes, "I have received from you fifty." Rabbi Meir says: Anyone who diminishes from a virgin from two hundred, and from a widow from a hundred - this is considered licentious intercourse.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פְּשִׁיטָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: קִיצּוּתָא עֲבַדוּ רַבָּנַן שֶׁלֹּא לְבַיֵּישׁ אֶת מִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Isn’t obvious Lest you say the Sages instituted a fixed not to embarrass one who does not have teaches us
llm_translation: Gemara: Is it really obvious? What might you say: The Rabbis made a decree not to embarrass someone who does not have, this is what we hear.

hebrew_text: אִם רָצָה לְהוֹסִיף כּוּ׳. ״רָצָה לִכְתּוֹב לָהּ״ לָא קָתָנֵי, אֶלָּא ״רָצָה לְהוֹסִיף״. מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אַיְבוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַיְבוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: תְּנַאי כְּתוּבָּה כִּכְתוּבָּה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: if he wishes to add It does not teach: He wishes to write for her, rather: He wishes to add. This supports Rabbi Aivu, Rabbi Yannai said, as Rabbi Aivu said Rabbi Yannai said: The stipulation in the marriage contract are comparable to the marriage contract
llm_translation: If he wants to add, etc. "If he wants to write for her" is not taught, rather "if he wants to add." Rabbi Aivu supports him, as Rabbi Aivu said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: A written teaching is equivalent to a written teaching.

hebrew_text: נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ: לְמוֹכֶרֶת; וּלְמוֹחֶלֶת; לְמוֹרֶדֶת;
human_translation: a practical difference to one who sells and to one who waives to a rebellious
llm_translation: It came out from her: to the seller; and to the forgiver; to the rebel.

hebrew_text: וּלְפוֹגֶמֶת; לְתוֹבַעַת; וּלְעוֹבֶרֶת עַל דָּת;
human_translation: And to one who vitiates to one who demands and to one who violates the precepts
llm_translation: And for Pogemet; for Tovaaat; and for Overet al dat.

hebrew_text: לְשֶׁבַח; לִשְׁבוּעָה; וְלִשְׁבִיעִית;
human_translation: to an increase in value, to an oath, and to the Sabbatical Year,
llm_translation: For praise; for an oath; and for the seventh.

hebrew_text: וּלְכוֹתֵב כׇּל נְכָסָיו לְבָנָיו; לִגְבּוֹת מִן הַקַּרְקַע וּמִן הַזִּיבּוּרִית; וְכׇל זְמַן שֶׁהִיא בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ; וְלִכְתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין.
human_translation: And to one who writes all of his property to his sons collects from land, and from land of inferior quality; and as long as she is in her father’s home and to marriage contract male offspring
llm_translation: And to write all his property to his sons; to deduct from the land and from the storehouse; and as long as she is in her father's house; and to write a document of betrothal.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר. כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין, פּוּמְבְּדִיתָא אָמְרִי: לָא טָרְפָא מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי, ״יִרְתוּן״ תְּנַן.
human_translation: It was stated marriage contract male offspring Pumbedita say: It is not seized from liened we learned They will inherit
llm_translation: It was stated: In the writing of the building of the walls, the people of Pumbedita said: It is not rendered invalid from the time of its construction, as we have learned in the Mishnah: "They shall be firm."

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי מָתָא מַחְסֵיָא אָמְרִי: טָרְפָא מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי, ״יִסְּבוּן״ תְּנַן. וְהִלְכְתָא: לָא טָרְפָא מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי, ״יִרְתוּן״ תְּנַן.
human_translation: The residents of Mata Meḥasya say: It is seized from liened the mishna states They will take the halakha is that it is not seized from liened the mishna states: They will inherit.
llm_translation: Sons of Matya from Mahseya said: A treifah from the one who slaughtered, "they shall be turned" we learned. And the halakha is: Not a treifah from the one who slaughtered, "they shall be thrown" we learned.

hebrew_text: מִטַּלְטְלִי וְאִיתַנְהוּ בְּעֵינַיְיהוּ — בְּלָא שְׁבוּעָה,
human_translation: movable property, and are in their pure, without an oath
llm_translation: "Mitalteli ve'itanhu be'einayehu - bela shevu'ah."

hebrew_text: לֵיתַנְהוּ בְּעֵינַיְיהוּ — פּוּמְבְּדִיתָא אָמְרִי: בְּלֹא שְׁבוּעָה. בְּנֵי מָתָא מַחְסֵיָא אָמְרִי: בִּשְׁבוּעָה. וְהִלְכְתָא: בְּלֹא שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: are not in their pure, Pumbedita say without an oath. The residents of Mata Meḥasya say with an oath, And the halakha is without an oath,
llm_translation: They did not agree with each other - Pumbedita said: without a week. The people of Mata Machseya said: with a week. And the halakha is: without a week.

hebrew_text: יַיחֵד לַהּ אַרְעָא בְּאַרְבְּעָה מִצְרָנֶהָא — בְּלָא שְׁבוּעָה. בְּחַד מִצְרָא — פּוּמְבְּדִיתָא אָמְרִי: בְּלָא שְׁבוּעָה. בְּנֵי מָתָא מַחְסֵיָא אָמְרִי: בִּשְׁבוּעָה. וְהִלְכְתָא: בְּלָא שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: he set aside land for her, on four of its borders, without an oath. on one border, Pumbedita say without an oath, the residents of Mata Meḥasya say with an oath. And the halakha is without an oath.
llm_translation: She unites the land in four cubits - without a week. In one cubit - the Pumbedita scholars say: without a week. The people of Mata Machseya say: in a week. And the halakha is: without a week.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְעֵדִים ״כִּתְבוּ וְחִתְמוּ וְהַבוּ לֵיהּ״, קְנוֹ מִינֵּיהּ — לָא צְרִיךְ אִימְּלוֹכֵי בֵּיהּ. לָא קְנוֹ מִינֵּיהּ — פּוּמְבְּדִיתָא אָמְרִי: לָא צְרִיךְ אִימְּלוֹכֵי בֵּיהּ, בְּנֵי מָתָא מַחְסֵיָא אָמְרִי: צְרִיךְ אִימְּלוֹכֵי בֵּיהּ. וְהִלְכְתָא: צְרִיךְ אִימְּלוֹכֵי בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: told witnesses: Write and sign and give it to acquired it from him they do not need to consult with him they did not acquire it from him, Pumbedita say they do not need to consult with him the residents of Mata Meḥasya say they must consult with him. And the halakha is that they must consult with him
llm_translation: He said to the witnesses, "Write and sign and give it to him." If they acquired from him - not necessary to say to them. If they did not acquire from him - the people of the town of Machseya say: not necessary to say to them, the people of the town of Matat say: necessary to say to them. And the halakha is: necessary to say to them.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה וְכוּ׳. אִיתְּמַר. רַב וְרַבִּי נָתָן, חַד אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה, וְחַד אָמַר: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya It was stated: Rav and Rabbi Natan One said halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya. And one said halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah and so on. It was stated: Rav and Rabbi Natan, one said: the halakha is like Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, and one said: the halakha is not like Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיֵּים דְּרַבִּי נָתָן הוּא דְּאָמַר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה, דְּשָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי נָתָן דְּאָזֵיל בָּתַר אוּמְדָּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי נָתָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי בִּמְסוּכָּן,
human_translation: It may be concluded that Rabbi Natan is the one who said halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, as we have heard that Rabbi Natan follows assessing as Rabbi Natan said halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon Shezuri in in danger.
llm_translation: The matter was concluded by Rabbi Natan who said: the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, for we have heard it from Rabbi Natan who used to go after Umdana. For Rabbi Natan said: the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon Shezuri in the Mishnah.

hebrew_text: וּבִתְרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר שֶׁל דְּמַאי.
human_translation: And with regard to the teruma of the tithe from doubtfully tithed produce [ demai ].
llm_translation: And in the case of the terumah of ma'aser of demai.

hebrew_text: וְרַב לָא אָזֵיל בָּתַר אוּמְדָּנָא? וְהָא אִיתְּמַר: מַתְּנַת שְׁכִיב מְרַע שֶׁכָּתוּב בָּהּ קִנְיָן, בְּבֵי רַב מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אָמְרִי: אַרְכְּבֵיהּ אַתְּרֵי רִכְשֵׁי. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: לָא יָדַעְנָא מַאי אֵידוּן בַּהּ.
human_translation: And does Rav not follow assessing But it was stated gift on his deathbed, in which written acquisition. In the school of Rav, they say in the name of Rav: He had him ride on two horses, And Shmuel said: I do not know what to decide about it.
llm_translation: Rav did not go after Umdana? But it was stated: A gift of a dying person, in which it is written, is considered a valid acquisition. In the study hall of Rav, they said: "Its riders are owners of property." And Samuel said: "We do not know what is the law regarding it."

hebrew_text: בְּבֵי רַב מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אָמְרִי, אַרְכְּבֵיהּ אַתְּרֵי רִכְשֵׁי: הֲרֵי הִיא כְּמַתְּנַת בָּרִיא, וַהֲרֵי הִיא כְּמַתְּנַת שְׁכִיב מְרַע.
human_translation: In the school of Rav, they say in the name of Rav: He had him ride on two horses, it is similar to gift of a healthy and it is similar to gift on his deathbed.
llm_translation: In the house of Rav, in the name of Rav, they said: Its length is like the gift of a healthy person, and its width is like the gift of one who is bedridden.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי הִיא כְּמַתְּנַת בָּרִיא, דְּאִם עָמַד — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ. הֲרֵי הִיא כְּמַתְּנַת שְׁכִיב מְרַע, שֶׁאִם אָמַר ״הַלְוָאָתִי לִפְלוֹנִי״ — הַלְוָאָתוֹ לִפְלוֹנִי.
human_translation: it is similar to gift of a healthy that if he arose he cannot retract it, it is like gift on his deathbed that if he said: My loan, to so-and-so his loan to so-and-so.
llm_translation: Behold, it is like a healthy gift, for if he stood up - he cannot retract it. Behold, it is like a loan for lying down, for if he said, "My loan to so-and-so" - his loan is to so-and-so.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: לָא יָדַעְנָא מַאי אֵידוּן בַּהּ, שֶׁמָּא לֹא גָּמַר לְהַקְנוֹתוֹ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁטָר, וְאֵין שְׁטָר לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: I do not know what to decide about it. Perhaps he resolved to transfer it only with a bill And bill after the death
llm_translation: And Samuel said: We do not know what is the penalty for it, perhaps he did not complete its acquisition except with a document, and there is no document after death.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: תַּרְוַיְיהוּ אָזְלִי בָּתַר אוּמְדָּנָא.
human_translation: Rather, Both follow assessing
llm_translation: Rather: both of them went after the pillar of cloud.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר הֲלָכָה — שַׁפִּיר, מַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין הֲלָכָה — הָכָא נָמֵי אוּמְדַּן דַּעְתָּא הוּא. מִשּׁוּם אִיקָּרוֹבֵי דַּעְתָּא הוּא, וְהָא אִיקָּרַבָא לֵיהּ דַּעְתָּא.
human_translation: the one who says halakha well. the one who says halakha is not here too, this is an assessment intention. It was due to a sense of intimacy he did a sense of intimacy
llm_translation: One who says "halakha" - it is proper, one who says "ain halakha" - here too is a valid opinion. Because it is a matter of individual opinion, and the main thing is the closeness of one's opinion, and here his opinion is close.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב חֲנִינָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי וְקָאָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פּוֹק, קְרִי קְרָאָךְ לְבָרָא! אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanina, sat before Rabbi Yannai and said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya. said to him: Go out read your verses outside. halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya.
llm_translation: Sitting Rav Chanina before Rabbi Yannai and saying: Halacha like Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah. He said to him: Go out, a verse has called you a son! The halacha is not like Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי מִשּׁוּם רַבֵּינוּ: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi said in the name of our teacher, halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya. Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya.
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Avdimi said in the name of our teacher: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah. Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן דִּידֵיהּ אָמַר: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה. וּנְהַרְדָּעֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן אָמְרִי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָט רַב נַחְמָן וְאָמַר: כֹּל דַּיָּינָא דְּדָאֵין כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה הָכִי וְהָכִי תֶּיהְוֵי, אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה. וַהֲלָכָה לְמַעֲשֶׂה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said his halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya. And of Neharde’a say in the name of Rav Naḥman: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya. And although Rav Naḥman cursed and said: Any judge who rules in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, such and such will happen to him, even so halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya. And the practical halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya.
llm_translation: Rav Nahman said: The halakha is not like Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah. And the students of Rav Nahman from Nehardea said: The halakha is like Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah. And even though Rav Nahman persisted and said: All the matters of judgment that are like Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah in this way and that way, even so - the halakha is like Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah. And the halakha in practice is like Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבִין: נִכְנְסָה לְחוּפָּה וְלֹא נִבְעֲלָה, מַהוּ? חִיבַּת חוּפָּה קוֹנָה, אוֹ חִיבַּת בִּיאָה קוֹנָה.
human_translation: Ravin asks: What is entered the wedding canopy and without having had sexual intercourse? affection wedding effect Or, affection intercourse affects
llm_translation: Ba'ei Ravin: Nikhnasah le'chupah ve'lo niv'alah, mahu? Chibat chupah konah, o chibat bi'ah konah. Ravin asked: If she entered the wedding canopy but did not consummate the marriage, what is the law? Is the obligation of the canopy acquisition, or is the obligation of intercourse acquisition?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: שֶׁלֹּא כָּתַב לָהּ אֶלָּא עַל חִיבַּת לַיְלָה הָרִאשׁוֹן. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא חִיבַּת חוּפָּה קוֹנָה — הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר לַיְלָה הָרִאשׁוֹן, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ חִיבַּת בִּיאָה קוֹנָה, בִּיאָה — בְּלַיְלָה הָרִאשׁוֹן אִיתַהּ, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ לֵיתַהּ?!
human_translation: Come hear that Rav Yosef taught He wrote for her only on account of the affection of the first night Granted, if you say affection wedding affects this is it says the the first night, But if you say affection intercourse affects is there intercourse on the first night from this forward there is none?
llm_translation: Come and hear, as taught by Rav Yosef: that he only wrote to her regarding the obligation of the first night. If you say that through the obligation of the wedding canopy one acquires - that is, he said the first night, but if you say through the obligation of intercourse one acquires, intercourse - it is on the first night that it is present, from here on out it is not present?!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי, חוּפָּה? חוּפָּה בְּלֵילְיָא אִיתַהּ, בִּימָמָא לֵיתַהּ? וּלְטַעְמָיךְ — בִּיאָה בְּלֵילְיָא אִיתַהּ, בִּימָמָא לֵיתַהּ? הָא אָמַר רָבָא, אִם הָיָה בְּבַיִת אָפֵל מוּתָּר! הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: אוֹרַח אַרְעָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּבִיאָה בַּלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: But rather, what wedding? Is there a wedding at night not during the day? And according to your reasoning, is there intercourse at night not during the day? Rava say if it was in a dark house permitted? This not difficult. it teaches us the ordinary mode of behavior, that intercourse at night.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather what, a courtyard? A courtyard at night exists, in the day does it not exist? And according to your reasoning - at night it exists, in the day does it not exist? But Rava said, if it was dark in the house, it is permitted! This is not difficult: the way of the world is heard by us, that at night there is cohabitation.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא חוּפָּה קַשְׁיָא? חוּפָּה נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא: כֵּיוָן דִּסְתַם חוּפָּה לְבִיאָה קָיְימָא, אוֹרַח אַרְעָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּבַלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: Rather, wedding is difficult, The wedding also not difficult, since a wedding without specification takes place to intercourse. it teaches us the ordinary mode of behavior, at night.
llm_translation: Rather, is the wedding canopy difficult? The wedding canopy is indeed not difficult. Since the wedding canopy is closed for the consummation, the way of the land indicates to us that it is without light at night.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: נִכְנְסָה לְחוּפָּה וּפֵירְסָה נִידָּה, מַהוּ? אִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר חִיבַּת חוּפָּה קוֹנָה, חוּפָּה דְּחַזְיָא לְבִיאָה, אֲבָל חוּפָּה דְּלָא חַזְיָא לְבִיאָה — לָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא שְׁנָא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi asks entered the wedding canopy and began menstruating, what is If you say affection wedding affects a wedding fit to intercourse, and a wedding is not fit to intercourse not Or, perhaps it is not different. shall stand
llm_translation: Inquiry of Rav Ashe: If a woman entered a courtyard and emitted menstrual blood, what is the law? If you want to say that the obligation of the courtyard acquires the impurity, a courtyard that is fit for residence acquires impurity, but a courtyard that is not fit for residence does not acquire impurity — no, or perhaps it does not matter? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: רָצָה, כּוֹתֵב לִבְתוּלָה וְכוּ׳. וְסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּכוֹתְבִין שׁוֹבָר? וְהָתְנַן: מִי שֶׁפָּרַע מִקְצָת חוֹבוֹ — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: יַחְלִיף. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יִכְתּוֹב לוֹ שׁוֹבָר!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: he wishes, he may write for a virgin And Rabbi Yehuda hold writes a receipt But didn’t we learn one who repaid part of his debt, Rabbi Yehuda says: He should exchange Rabbi Yosei says: should write him a receipt
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "He desires, he writes for the virgin, etc." And Rabbi Yehuda holds that when one writes, does he break? But we learned in a Mishnah: "One who partially pays his debt - Rabbi Yehuda says: he may exchange. Rabbi Yosei says: he should write a receipt for him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: כְּשֶׁשּׁוֹבַרְתָּהּ מִתּוֹכָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: where the receipt is within
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: When she breaks it from within her.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בְּשֶׁאֵין שׁוֹבַרְתָּהּ מִתּוֹכָהּ, בִּשְׁלָמָא הָתָם, וַדַּאי פַּרְעֵיהּ — דִּלְמָא מִירְכַס תָּבַרְתָּא, וּמַפֵּיק לֵיהּ לִשְׁטָרָא, וַהֲדַר גָּבֵי זִימְנָא אַחֲרִינָא. הָכָא, וַדַּאי יְהַב לַהּ? מִילְּתָא בְּעָלְמָא הִיא דַּאֲמַרָה לֵיהּ, אִי נַטְרֵיהּ — נַטְרֵיהּ, אִי לָא נַטְרֵיהּ — אִיהוּ הוּא דְּאַפְסֵיד אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: Even you say where the receipt is not within it, Granted, there, it is certain repaid perhaps will lose the receipt take out the note and return and collect again. here, definitely give merely something she said to him If he saved he saved it; if he did not save it, it is he himself who will lose.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Even if you say that you do not break it from within, in the case of Shelama, it is understandable, and certainly its payment - perhaps it will become cracked, and you will take it to the scribe, and then come back at another time. Here, and certainly he gave it to her? It is a general matter that she said to him, if you guard it - guard it, if you do not guard it - he himself will cause his own loss.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא אַבָּיֵי לָא אָמַר כְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, לָא קָתָנֵי שׁוֹבַרְתָּהּ מִתּוֹכָהּ. אֶלָּא רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּאַבַּיֵּי? גְּזֵירָה שׁוֹבָר דְּהָכָא אַטּוּ שׁוֹבָר דְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Granted, Abaye did not say in accordance with Rabbi Yirmeya, does not teach receipt is within However, what is the reason Rabbi Yirmeya did not say in accordance with Abaye? decree this receipt due to the typical receipts.
llm_translation: In truth, Abaye did not say like Rabbi Yirmiyah, he did not teach that one may break it from within it. Rather, what is the reason that Rabbi Yirmiyah did not say like Abaye? A decree to break the vessel from here, they will come to break vessels from everywhere.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא — דְּכָתְבָה לֵיהּ, אֲבָל עַל פֶּה — לָא. אַמַּאי? דָּבָר שֶׁבְּמָמוֹן הוּא, וְשָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר: דָּבָר שֶׁבְּמָמוֹן — תְּנָאוֹ קַיָּים.
human_translation: The reason is she wrote him However, verbally, no, Why This is a monetary matter, and we heard that Rabbi Yehuda said: monetary matters his stipulation stands.
llm_translation: Reason — that it was written for him, but orally — no. Why? Because it involves a monetary matter, and we have heard it in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda who said: A monetary matter — the stipulation of the parties is valid.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין לִיךְ עָלַי שְׁאֵר כְּסוּת וְעוֹנָה״ הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וּתְנָאוֹ בָּטֵל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּדָבָר שֶׁבְּמָמוֹן — תְּנָאוֹ קַיָּים!
human_translation: as it is taught one who says to a woman: You are hereby betrothed to me on the condition that you have no from me food, clothing, or conjugal rights, she is betrothed and his stipulation is void; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: monetary matters, his stipulation stands;
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who says to a woman, "Behold, you are consecrated to me on the condition that you have no claim upon me for sustenance and clothing," she is indeed consecrated, but the condition is null and void, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: In matters of monetary value, the condition is upheld!

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: כְּתוּבָּה דְּרַבָּנַן, וַחֲכָמִים עָשׂוּ חִיזּוּק לְדִבְרֵיהֶם יוֹתֵר מִשֶּׁל תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds: marriage contract is a rabbinic and the Sages reinforced their pronouncements with greater than Torah law.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds: The writing of the Rabbis, and the Sages made a strengthening of their words more than that of the Torah.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי פֵּירוֹת דְּרַבָּנַן, וְלָא עֲבַדוּ לְהוּ רַבָּנַן חִיזּוּק! דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם הוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת — עַד שֶׁיִּכְתּוֹב לָהּ: ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי בִּנְכָסַיִךְ, וּבְפֵירוֹתֵיהֶן, וּבְפֵירוֹת פֵּירוֹתֵיהֶן עַד עוֹלָם״.
human_translation: produce is a rabbinic and the Sages did not reinforce them, as we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: he may actually consume the produce of the produce unless he writes her: I do not have any claim to your property, its produce, or the produce of its produce, forever.
llm_translation: Behold, the fruits of the Rabbis, yet the Rabbis did not establish a strengthening for them! For it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: One should always eat the fruits of fruits - until it is written for her: "I have no claim on your property, nor on its fruits, nor on the fruits of its fruits forever."

hebrew_text: וְקַיְימָא לַן: מַאי ״כּוֹתֵב״ — אוֹמֵר!
human_translation: And we maintain What is Writes? Says.
llm_translation: And it is established for us: What is "kotev" - he says!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לַכֹּל יֵשׁ כְּתוּבָּה, וְלֹא לַכֹּל יֵשׁ פֵּירוֹת. מִילְּתָא דִּשְׁכִיחָא — עֲבַדוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן חִיזּוּק, מִילְּתָא דְלָא שְׁכִיחָא — לָא עֲבַדוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן חִיזּוּק.
human_translation: Abaye said: Every has a marriage contract, but not all have produce, a common matter, the Sages reinforced about it an uncommon matter, the Sages did not reinforce about it,
llm_translation: Abaye said: For everything there is a written text, but not for everything are there explanations. A matter that is common - the Rabbis strengthened it, a matter that is not common - the Rabbis did not strengthen it.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי חַמָּרִים, דִּשְׁכִיחִי, וְלָא עֲבַדוּ לַהּ רַבָּנַן חִיזּוּק!
human_translation: donkey drivers, which is a common not the Sages reinforced about it.
llm_translation: Behold donkeys, which are common, yet the Rabbis did not establish for them reinforcement!

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הַחַמָּרִין שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ לָעִיר, וְאָמַר אֶחָד מֵהֶן: שֶׁלִּי חָדָשׁ, וְשֶׁל חֲבֵרִי יָשָׁן. שֶׁלִּי אֵינוֹ מְתוּקָּן, וְשֶׁל חֲבֵרִי מְתוּקָּן אֵין נֶאֱמָנִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמָנִים.
human_translation: as we learned donkey drivers who entered a city and one of them said: My is new but my associate’s is old Mine is not fit but my associate’s is fit are not afforded credibility. Rabbi Yehuda says: They are deemed credible.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If wine merchants entered a city, and one of them said, "Mine is new wine, and my friend's is old wine. Mine is not properly prepared, and my friend's is properly prepared but not trustworthy." Rabbi Yehuda says: They are trustworthy.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וַדַּאי דְּדִבְרֵיהֶם — עֲבַדוּ רַבָּנַן חִיזּוּק. סָפֵק דְּדִבְרֵיהֶם, לָא עֲבַדוּ רַבָּנַן חִיזּוּק. רָבָא אָמַר: בִּדְמַאי הֵקֵילּוּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: a certain involving a rabbinic the Sages reinforced an uncertain involving a rabbinic Sages did not reinforce Rava said: The Sages they were lenient about doubtfully tithed produce [ demai ],
llm_translation: Abaye said: And certainly their words — the sages strengthened. In a case of doubt in their words, the sages did not strengthen. Rava said: They were lenient in matters of Demai.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַפּוֹחֵת וְכוּ׳. כׇּל הַפּוֹחֵת אֲפִילּוּ בִּתְנָאָה — אַלְמָא קָסָבַר תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל, וְאִית לַהּ. וְכֵיוָן דְּאָמַר לַהּ ״לֵית לִיךְ אֶלָּא מָנֶה״ — לָא סָמְכָא דַּעְתַּהּ, וְהָוְיָא לַהּ בְּעִילָתוֹ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: anyone who reduces Anyone who reduces even if a stipulation Apparently, held his stipulation is void and she has but since he said to her: You have only one hundred she does not rely and becomes licentious sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: "Anyone who diminishes, etc." Anyone who diminishes, even in a condition - this implies that he holds that a condition is nullified, yet it has validity. And since he said to her, "You have nothing except the mohar," her consent is not relied upon, and it is considered to her as an act of promiscuity.

hebrew_text: וְהָא שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּאָמַר: כׇּל הַמַּתְנֶה עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה — תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל. הָא בִּדְרַבָּנַן — תְּנָאוֹ קַיָּים?! קָסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר כְּתוּבָּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: But we heard Rabbi Meir said anyone who stipulates counter to that which is written in the Torah, his stipulation is void. on a rabbinic his stipulation stand, Rabbi Meir holds a marriage contract is Torah
llm_translation: We have heard it from Rabbi Meir who said: Anyone who stipulates on that which is written in the Torah - his stipulation is nullified. But in the case of the Rabbis - is his stipulation upheld?! Rabbi Meir holds that the written law is of biblical origin.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַפּוֹחֵת לִבְתוּלָה מִמָּאתַיִם וּלְאַלְמָנָה מִמָּנֶה — הֲרֵי זוֹ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: רַשַּׁאי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: רָצָה, כּוֹתֵב לִבְתוּלָה שְׁטָר שֶׁל מָאתַיִם, וְהִיא כּוֹתֶבֶת לוֹ: ״הִתְקַבַּלְתִּי מִמְּךָ מָנֶה״, וּלְאַלְמָנָה מָנֶה, וְהִיא כּוֹתֶבֶת לוֹ: ״הִתְקַבַּלְתִּי מִמְּךָ חֲמִשִּׁים זוּז״.
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Meir says: anyone who reduces than two hundred for a virgin or one hundred for a widow, this licentious sexual intercourse. Rabbi Yosei says: One is permitted Rabbi Yehuda says: If one wishes, he may write for a virgin a document for two hundred and she may write him I received one hundred from you. And for a widow one hundred and she may write him: I received fifty dinars from you.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir says: Anyone who diminishes the marriage contract for a virgin from two hundred zuz, and for a widow from her original amount — this is considered licentious behavior. Rabbi Yosei says: It is permitted. Rabbi Yehuda says: If he wishes, he can write a marriage contract for the virgin for two hundred zuz, and she writes to him: "I have received from you a hundred zuz," and for the widow he can write fifty zuz, and she writes to him: "I have received from you fifty zuz."

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי רַשַּׁאי? וּרְמִינְהִי: אֵין עוֹשִׂין כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה מִטַּלְטְלִין, מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: וְכִי מָה תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם יֵשׁ בְּזוֹ? וַהֲלֹא אֵין קְצוּבִין וּפוֹחֲתִין!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei hold he is permitted raises a contradiction a woman’s marriage contract may not be made movable property. for the betterment of the world. Rabbi Yosei said: What betterment of the world is by this is not fixed, become devalued.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yosei the Rebellious thought? And they raised an objection: One may not make a woman's marriage contract (ketubah) into a swing, due to the improvement of the world. Rabbi Yosei said: And what improvement of the world is there in this? Are there not those who are more precise and those who are less precise!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא קַמָּא נָמֵי ״אֵין עוֹשִׂין״ קָאָמַר! אֶלָּא לָאו הָכִי קָאָמַר: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּשֶׁלֹּא קִבֵּל עָלָיו אַחְרָיוּת, אֲבָל קִבֵּל עָלָיו אַחְרָיוּת — עוֹשִׂין. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְמֵימַר כִּי קִיבֵּל עָלָיו אַחְרָיוּת אַמַּאי עוֹשִׂין? וַהֲלֹא אֵין קְצוּבִין וּפוֹחֲתִין!
human_translation: The first tanna also said: not be made Rather, is it not this is what said: In what is this statement said? one did not provide a guarantee But one did provide a guarantee, may be made And Rabbi Yosei comes to say: if one provided a guarantee, why can be made is not fixed, and become devalued.
llm_translation: We learned in the first teaching: "They do not do" he said! Rather, this is what he said: In what case are these matters said? - When he did not accept responsibility, but if he accepted responsibility - they do. And Rabbi Yosei came to say: If he accepted responsibility, why do they do? Are they not fixed and diminished!

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא, וּמָה הָתָם דְּדִלְמָא פָּחֲתִי — חָיֵישׁ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הָכָא, דְּוַדַּאי קָא פָּחֲתָה — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?! הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם לָא יָדְעָה דְּתַחֵיל, הָכָא יָדְעָה וְקָא מָחֲלָה.
human_translation: Now Just as there, perhaps it be devalued, Rabbi Yosei is concerned here, will definitely be devalued, not all the more so How can be compared? There, she does not know that she will waive here, she knows and she waived
llm_translation: The question was raised: And what is the difference there, that perhaps she was less careful - Rabbi Yosei is concerned there, but here, where she certainly was less careful - is it not all the more so?! Is it indeed so now?! There, she did not know from the beginning, but here she knew and was negligent.

hebrew_text: אֲחָתֵיהּ דְּרָמֵי בַּר חָמָא הֲוָת נְסִיבָא לְרַב אַוְיָא.
human_translation: The sister of Rami bar Ḥama was married to Rav Avya.
llm_translation: One of the daughters of Ramei bar Ḥama was married to Rav Avya.

hebrew_text: אִירְכַס כְּתוּבְּתַהּ. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Her marriage contract was lost, came before Rav Yosef He said to them: This is Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: That is the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The text: "Irchas k'tubtah. Atu l'kamei d'Rav Yosef, amar lehu: Hachi amar Rav Yehudah amar Shmuel: Zo divrei Rabbi Meir." Translation: "Her document was lost. They came before Rav Yosef, he said to them: Thus said Rav Yehudah in the name of Shmuel: These are the words of Rabbi Meir."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מְשַׁהֶא אָדָם אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ שְׁתַּיִם וְשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים בְּלֹא כְּתוּבָּה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר בִּגְזֵירוֹתָיו! אִי הָכִי, זִיל כְּתוֹב לַהּ.
human_translation: But the Rabbis say: a man may maintain his wife for two or three years without marriage contract. Abaye said to him: didn’t Rav Naḥman say Shmuel said halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir his decrees? If so, go and write her
llm_translation: But the sages say: A man may divorce his wife after two or three years without a marriage contract. Abaye said to him: But didn't Rav Nachman say in the name of Shmuel: The halakha follows Rabbi Meir in his decrees! If so, go and write it for her.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי מִשּׁוּם בַּר קַפָּרָא: מַחְלוֹקֶת בַּתְּחִלָּה, אֲבָל בַּסּוֹף — לְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵינָהּ מוֹחֶלֶת. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: בֵּין בָּזוֹ וּבֵין בָּזוֹ מַחְלוֹקֶת. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: לְדִידִי מִיפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דַּאֲנָא וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי לָא פְּלִיגִינַן אַהֲדָדֵי:
human_translation: when Rav Dimi came he said Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi in the name of bar Kappara: dispute to the beginning But to the end, all agree she cannot waive And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Both in this and in that a dispute. Rabbi Abbahu said: was explained to me by Rabbi Yoḥanan himself, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi and I do not disagree with one another.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Shimon ben Pazzi said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi in the name of Bar Kappara: Disagreement at the beginning, but in the end — according to everyone, it is not forgiven. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Whether in this case or in that case, there is disagreement. Rabbi Abahu said: According to me, the statements of Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi do not contradict each other.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״בַּתְּחִלָּה״ דְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי — תְּחִלַּת חוּפָּה, וּמַאי ״סוֹף״ — סוֹף בִּיאָה. וְכִי קָאָמֵינָא אֲנָא בֵּין בָּזוֹ וּבֵין בָּזוֹ מַחְלוֹקֶת, תְּחִלַּת חוּפָּה וְסוֹף חוּפָּה, דְּהִיא תְּחִילַּת בִּיאָה.
