human_translation: What is To the beginning, which Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said? the beginning of the wedding And what is end? end of intercourse; And when I said both in this and in that a dispute, the beginning wedding and the end wedding which is the beginning of intercourse.
llm_translation: What is "at the beginning" that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi is saying? - The beginning of the wedding. And what is "at the end"? - The end of the intercourse. And when I say, whether in this case or in that case there is a dispute, the beginning of the wedding and the end of the wedding, which is the beginning of the intercourse.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי מִשּׁוּם בַּר קַפָּרָא: מַחְלוֹקֶת לְבַסּוֹף, אֲבָל בַּתְּחִלָּה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוֹחֶלֶת, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: בֵּין בָּזוֹ וּבֵין בָּזוֹ מַחְלוֹקֶת. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: לְדִידִי מִיפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דַּאֲנָא וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי לָא פְּלִיגִינַן אַהֲדָדֵי: מַאי ״לְבַסּוֹף״ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי — סוֹף חוּפָּה, וּמַאי ״תְּחִלָּה״ — תְּחִלַּת חוּפָּה. וְכִי קָאָמֵינָא אֲנָא בֵּין בָּזוֹ בֵּין בָּזוֹ מַחְלוֹקֶת — תְּחִלַּת בִּיאָה וְסוֹף בִּיאָה.
human_translation: When Ravin came Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said in the name of bar Kappara: dispute the end but to the beginning, all agree she can waive And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Both in this and in that a dispute. Rabbi Abbahu said: was explained to me by Rabbi Yoḥanan himself, I and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi do not disagree with one another. What is The end, which Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said? end of the wedding And what is beginning? beginning of the wedding And when I said both in this and in that dispute, beginning of intercourse and end of intercourse.
llm_translation: When Rabbin came, Rabbi Shimon ben Pazzi said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi in the name of Bar Kappara: Dispute in the end, but in the beginning — everyone agrees to forgive, and Rabbi Yochanan said: Whether in this case or in that case there is a dispute. Rabbi Abahu said: According to my understanding, the words of Rabbi Yochanan are explained to me, for I and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi do not disagree with each other. What is the meaning of "in the end" that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said? — The end of the wedding, and what is the meaning of "in the beginning" — the beginning of the wedding. And when I say whether in this case or in that case there is a dispute — it is the beginning of intercourse and the end of intercourse.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אִי לָאו דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ ״לְדִידִי מִיפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דַּאֲנָא וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי לָא פְּלִיגִינַן אַהֲדָדֵי״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי פְּלִיגִי, רַב דִּימִי וְרָבִין לָא פְּלִיגִי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Had Rabbi Abbahu not said: was explained to me by Rabbi Yoḥanan himself, that I, and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi do not disagree with one another, I, would have said Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi disagree Rav Dimi Ravin do not disagree
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: If not for the fact that Rabbi Avahu said, "For my sake, explain to me the teachings of Rabbi Yochanan, as I and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi do not argue with each other," I would have thought that Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi do argue. Rav Dimi and Ravin do not argue.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״סוֹף״ דְּקָאָמַר רָבִין — סוֹף חוּפָּה, וּמַאי ״תְּחִלָּה״ דְּקָאָמַר רַב דִּימִי — תְּחִלַּת בִּיאָה.
human_translation: What is end, which Ravin said? end wedding And what is beginning, which Rav Dimi said? beginning of intercourse,
llm_translation: What is "end" that Ravin said? - The end of the wedding canopy. And what is "beginning" that Rav Dimi said? - The beginning of intercourse.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן?
human_translation: What is teaching us?
llm_translation: What is it teaching us?

hebrew_text: הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דִּפְלִיגִי תְּרֵי אָמוֹרָאֵי אַטַּעְמָא דְנַפְשַׁיְיהוּ, וְלָא פְּלִיגִי תְּרֵי אָמוֹרָאֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּחַד אָמוֹרָא.
human_translation: teaches us this: that two amora’im disagree with regard to their own reasons two amora’im disagree according to another amora ,
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: "This is what they are teaching us, that two Amoraim differ in the taste of their own soul, and two Amoraim do not differ in the taste of one Amora."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נוֹתְנִין לַבְּתוּלָה שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חוֹדֶשׁ מִשֶּׁתְּבָעָהּ הַבַּעַל, לְפַרְנֵס אֶת עַצְמָהּ. וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁנּוֹתְנִין לָאִשָּׁה — כָּךְ נוֹתְנִין לָאִישׁ לְפַרְנֵס אֶת עַצְמוֹ. וּלְאַלְמָנָה שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. הִגִּיעַ זְמַן וְלֹא נִישְּׂאוּ — אוֹכְלוֹת מִשֶּׁלּוֹ, וְאוֹכְלוֹת בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: gives a virgin twelve months from the husband asked her to prepare herself And just as gives a woman so too give a man to prepare himself, However, in a widow, thirty days the time arrived and they did not get married may partake of his And she may partake of teruma ,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One gives to a virgin twelve months from when her husband engages her, to provide for herself. Just as one gives to a woman, so too one gives to a man to provide for himself. And to a widow, thirty days. If the time arrives and they have not married, she eats from his, and she eats from the terumah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: נוֹתְנִין לָהּ הַכֹּל תְּרוּמָה. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מֶחֱצָה חוּלִּין וּמֶחֱצָה תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon says: He may give her all teruma . Rabbi Akiva says: half non-sacred and half teruma ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon says: "We give her everything as Terumah." Rabbi Akiva says: "Half is common and half is Terumah."

hebrew_text: הַיָּבָם אֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל בִּתְרוּמָה. עָשְׂתָה שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים בִּפְנֵי הַבַּעַל וְשִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים בִּפְנֵי הַיָּבָם, וַאֲפִילּוּ כּוּלָּן בִּפְנֵי הַבַּעַל חָסֵר יוֹם אֶחָד בִּפְנֵי הַיָּבָם, אוֹ כּוּלָּן בִּפְנֵי הַיָּבָם חָסֵר יוֹם אֶחָד בִּפְנֵי הַבַּעַל — אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: yavam , does not enable to partake of teruma If she completed six months under the aegis of the husband, and six months under the aegis of the yavam ; or even all of under the aegis of the husband except for one day under the aegis of the yavam ; or all of under the aegis of the yavam except for one day under the aegis of the husband, may not partake of teruma .
llm_translation: The yavam does not feed on terumah. She made six months in front of the husband and six months in front of the yavam, and even if all of them are lacking one day in front of the yavam, or all of them are lacking one day in front of the husband - she does not eat terumah.

hebrew_text: זוֹ מִשְׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה. בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל אַחֲרֵיהֶן אָמְרוּ:
human_translation: This the initial mishna. a court after them, said:
llm_translation: This is the first Mishnah. The court of the latter said:

hebrew_text: אֵין הָאִשָּׁה אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה עַד שֶׁתִּכָּנֵס לַחוּפָּה.
human_translation: A woman may not partake of teruma until she has entered the wedding canopy.
llm_translation: The woman does not eat of the terumah until she enters the wedding canopy.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אָחִיהָ וְאִמָּהּ תֵּשֵׁב הַנַּעֲרָה אִתָּנוּ יָמִים אוֹ עָשׂוֹר״.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rav Ḥisda said that the verse states “And her brother and mother said: Let the damsel abide with us for days, or ten”
llm_translation: Gemara: What are these words? Rav Ḥisda said, as the verse states: "And her brother and her mother said, 'Let the maiden stay with us a year or ten.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי ״יָמִים״? אִילֵּימָא תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי, מִשְׁתַּעֵי אִינִישׁ הָכִי? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ עַשְׂרָה יוֹמֵי?! אֶלָּא מַאי ״יָמִים״ — שָׁנָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״יָמִים תִּהְיֶה גְּאוּלָּתוֹ״.
human_translation: What “days”? If we say two days, a person speak like this? said to two days, he said to them no, they said to him ten days? Rather, what “days”? A year, as it is written: “For days he shall have redemption” “And her brother and mother said: Let the damsel abide with us for days, or ten”
llm_translation: What is meant by "days"? If you say two days, does a person act in this way? They said to him: Two days. He said to them: No. They said to him: Ten days?! Rather, what is meant by "days" - a year, as it is written: "His redemption shall be many days."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא חֹדֶשׁ, דִּכְתִיב ״עַד חֹדֶשׁ יָמִים״. אָמְרִי: דָּנִין ״יָמִים״ סְתָם מִ״יָּמִים״ סְתָם, וְאֵין דָּנִין ״יָמִים״ סְתָם מִ״יָּמִים״ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בָּהֶן חֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: And say a month, as it is written: “But month of days” They say: One derives unspecified “days” from unspecified “days,” And one does not derive an unspecified “days” from “days,” about which “month” is stated.
llm_translation: And why do we need to specify a month, for it is written "until a month of days." They said: When judging "days" mentioned without "of days," we do so and when not judging "days" mentioned without "of days," as it is said in them the days, a month.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא, תָּנָא: קְטַנָּה, בֵּין הִיא וּבֵין אָבִיהָ יְכוֹלִין לְעַכֵּב. בִּשְׁלָמָא אִיהִי מָצֵי מְעַכְּבָא, אֶלָּא אָבִיהָ — אִי אִיהִי נִיחָא לַהּ, אָבִיהָ מַאי נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִינַּהּ? סָבַר: הַשְׁתָּא לָא יָדְעָה, לִמְחַר מִימַּרְדָא וְנָפְקָא, וְאָתְיָא וְנָפְלָה עִילָּוַאי.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: taught a minor girl: Either she or her father may delay Granted, she, may delay but her father If it is suitable for her what difference does it make to her father? He thinks: now she does not know tomorrow, she will rebel, and leave and she will come and become to me.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, a Tanna taught: A minor, both she and her father can cause a delay. Granted if she causes a delay, but her father - if she is agreeable to him, what concern does he have from her? He holds: Now she does not know, tomorrow she may rebel and go out, and then come and fall into bad ways.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר לֵוִי: אֵין פּוֹסְקִין עַל הַקְּטַנָּה לְהַשִּׂיאָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה, אֲבָל פּוֹסְקִין עַל הַקְּטַנָּה לְהַשִּׂיאָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא גְּדוֹלָה. פְּשִׁיטָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא מְעַיְּילָא פַּחְדָּא מֵהַשְׁתָּא וְחָלְשָׁה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Levi said: One may not finalize a minor girl to marry her while she is a minor, but one may finalize a minor girl to marry her when she an adult woman. Isn’t obvious? Lest you say should be concerned she might become afraid from now, and will weaken, teaches us
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Levi said: We do not betroth a minor to marry her when she is a minor, but we betroth a minor to marry her when she is an adult. Is it not obvious? Lest you say: Let us be concerned that perhaps fear will come upon her now and she will become weak, the Mishnah teaches us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: בָּגְרָה יוֹם אֶחָד וְנִתְקַדְּשָׁה — נוֹתְנִין לָהּ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, כְּאַלְמָנָה. מֵיתִיבִי: בָּגְרָה הֲרֵי הִיא כִּתְבוּעָה. מַאי לָאו, כִּתְבוּעָה דִּבְתוּלָה? לָא, כִּתְבוּעָה דְּאַלְמָנָה.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: she has reached her majority, one day, and she is betrothed, given her thirty days like a widow, raises an objection she grew up, she is similar to who has been asked What, is it not similar to a virgin who has been asked No, similar to a widow who has been asked
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: If a girl reached one day of age and became consecrated - they give her thirty days, like a widow. It was asked: If she reached one day of age, isn't she like a claim? What is meant by "like a claim," that of a virgin? No, like a claim of a widow.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בּוֹגֶרֶת שֶׁשָּׁהֲתָה שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וְחַיָּיב בַּעְלָהּ בִּמְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ — יָפֵר! אֵימָא: בּוֹגֶרֶת וְשֶׁשָּׁהֲתָה שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חוֹדֶשׁ, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל ובַעְלָהּ חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ — יָפֵר.
human_translation: Come hear If a grown woman waited twelve months Rabbi Eliezer says: Since her husband is obligated for her sustenance, he may nullify Say if a grown woman or waited twelve months, Rabbi Eliezer says: Since her husband is obligated for her sustenance, he may nullify
llm_translation: Come and hear: A woman who was a niddah for twelve months, Rabbi Eliezer says: Since her husband is obligated in her sustenance - he shall divorce her! I might say: A woman who was a niddah for twelve months and a day, Rabbi Eliezer says: Since her husband is obligated in her sustenance - he shall divorce her.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמְאָרֵס אֶת הַבְּתוּלָה, בֵּין שֶׁתְּבָעָהּ הַבַּעַל וְהִיא מְעַכֶּבֶת, וּבֵין שֶׁתָּבְעָה הִיא וּבַעַל מְעַכֵּב — נוֹתְנִין לָהּ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ מִשְּׁעַת תְּבִיעָה, אֲבָל לֹא מִשְּׁעַת אֵירוּסִין. וּבָגְרָה, הֲרֵי הִיא כִּתְבוּעָה. כֵּיצַד: בָּגְרָה יוֹם אֶחָד וְנִתְקַדְּשָׁה — נוֹתְנִין לָהּ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, וְלַאֲרוּסָה שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרַב הוּנָא תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Come hear If someone betrothed a virgin, whether the husband asks her and she delays or whether she asks and husband delays she given twelve months from the time request but not from the time of the betrothal, a grown woman is similar to one who has been asked How so? she has reached her majority one day, and she is betrothed, she given twelve months One who was a betrothed woman thirty days. the refutation of Rav Huna is a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who betroths a virgin, whether the husband demands her and she refuses, or she demands him and he refuses — they give her twelve months from the time of the demand, but not from the time of the betrothal. And if she reaches puberty, she is considered as if she demanded. How so? If she reaches puberty one day and becomes consecrated — they give her twelve months, and to the betrothed thirty days. The challenge of Rav Huna is a challenge.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְלַאֲרוּסָה שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: בּוֹגֶרֶת שֶׁעָבְרוּ עָלֶיהָ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ בְּבַגְרוּת וְנִתְקַדְּשָׁה — נוֹתְנִין לָהּ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם כְּאַלְמָנָה.
human_translation: What And one who was a betrothed woman thirty days? Rav Pappa said: This is what it is saying: a grown woman who has been an adult for twelve months and is betrothed, she given thirty days, like a widow,
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "and for an engaged woman thirty days"? Rav Papa said, thus he is saying: A convert who has passed twelve months in maturity and has become betrothed - we give her thirty days like a widow.

hebrew_text: הִגִּיעַ זְמַן וְלֹא נִישְּׂאוּ. אָמַר עוּלָּא: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, אֲרוּסָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכֹהֵן כִּי יִקְנֶה נֶפֶשׁ קִנְיַן כַּסְפּוֹ״, וְהַאי נָמֵי קִנְיַן כַּסְפּוֹ הוּא. מָה טַעַם אָמְרוּ אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת — שֶׁמָּא יִמְזְגוּ לָהּ כּוֹס בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ, וְתַשְׁקֶה לְאָחִיהָ וְלַאֲחוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: If the time arrived and they did not get married, Ulla said: By Torah law, the daughter of a non-priest betrothed may partake of teruma as it is stated: “If a priest buy any soul, the acquisition of his money, and this is also an acquisition of his money What, is the reason said she may not partake? lest someone pour her a cup in her father’s house. she will give her brother or sister to drink
llm_translation: The time arrived and they did not marry. Ulla said: A matter of Torah, a betrothed daughter of Israel may eat terumah, as it is stated: "And if a priest acquires a soul, his acquisition shall be his money." And this acquisition is considered his money. Why did they say that she may not eat? Because perhaps they will mix a cup for her in her father's house, and she will give to her brothers and sisters.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הִגִּיעַ זְמַן וְלֹא נִישְּׂאוּ נָמֵי! הָתָם, דּוּכְתָּא מְיַיחֵד לַהּ.
human_translation: If so, if the time arrived and they did not get married, also There, he designates place for her.
llm_translation: Thus, if so, the time arrived and they did not marry the maidens! There, the decree unites them.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, לָקִיט כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל לָא לֵיכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה, דִּלְמָא אָתוּ לְמֵיכַל בַּהֲדֵיהּ! הַשְׁתָּא מִדִּידְהוּ סָפוּ לֵיהּ — מִדִּידֵיהּ אָכְלִי?!
human_translation: However, if that is so, a gleaner a priest by an Israelite may not partake of teruma , lest come to eat with him Now, feed from their would they eat from his
llm_translation: Rather from now, to gather priest to Israel not able in offering, perhaps they come to eat with him! Now from their side they stopped him - from their side they ate?!

hebrew_text: רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם סִימְפּוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yehuda said: due to abrogation [ simfon ],
llm_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yehudah said: in the name of Simpon.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, נִכְנְסָה לְחוּפָּה וְלֹא נִבְעֲלָה נָמֵי! הָתָם, מִיבְדָּק בָּדֵיק לַהּ וַהֲדַר מְעַיֵּיל.
human_translation: If so, entered the wedding canopy but has not engaged in sexual intercourse also There, he investigates her and then enters
llm_translation: If so, she entered the wedding canopy and did not consummate the marriage indeed! There, he examines her thoroughly and then brings her back.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, עֶבֶד כֹּהֵן שֶׁלְּקָחוֹ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל לָא לֵיכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה, מִשּׁוּם סִימְפּוֹן! סִימְפּוֹן בַּעֲבָדִים לֵיכָּא, דְּאִי דְּאַבָּרַאי — הָא קָחָזֵי לֵיהּ. וְאִי דְּגַוַּאי — לִמְלָאכָה קָא בָּעֵי, וְשֶׁבַּסֵּתֶר לָא אִיכְפַּת לֵיהּ. נִמְצָא גַּנָּב אוֹ
human_translation: However, if that is so, a priest’s slave whom purchased from an Israelite should not partake of teruma , due to abrogation. There is no abrogation with regard to slaves, that if is external, then he sees it And if is internal, he needs him for labor, concealed do not concern him. he was discovered a thief or
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, a slave of a Kohen who was taken from a Yisrael is not able to partake in Terumah, because of a "simpone"! A "simpone" does not apply to slaves, for if he is a free man - he can acquire it. And if he is a slave - he requires work, and in secret, it is not beneficial to him. It turns out, is he a thief or...

hebrew_text: קוּבְיוּסְטוּס — הִגִּיעוֹ. מַאי אִיכָּא — לִסְטִים מְזוּיָּין אוֹ מוּכְתָּב לַמַּלְכוּת, הָנְהוּ קָלָא אִית לְהוּ.
human_translation: a gambler [ kuvyustus ], it has come to him, What is an armed bandit or the king signed these generate publicity.
llm_translation: Kubistus - he arrived. What is there - distinguished garments or written for the kingdom, those are light for them.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדִי, בֵּין לְמָר וּבֵין לְמָר לָא אָכְלָה, מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ קִבֵּל, מָסַר, וְהָלַךְ.
human_translation: After all, according to this Sage, and according to that Sage, she may not partake what is between them? between them is he accepted, he transferred or went.
llm_translation: From there, between one master and another master she did not eat, what is the difference between them? There is a difference between them: she received, handed over, and left.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: נוֹתְנִין לָהּ הַכֹּל תְּרוּמָה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּבַת כֹּהֵן לְכֹהֵן, אֲבָל בְּבַת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מֶחֱצָה חוּלִּין וּמֶחֱצָה תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon says: He may give her everything teruma . Abaye said: dispute to a daughter a priest to a priest. But an Israelite woman to a priest, all agree half non-sacred and half teruma .
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon says: "One gives her everything as Terumah, etc." Abaye said: Dispute regarding the daughter of a Kohen to a Kohen, but regarding the daughter of an Israelite to a Kohen - the words of everyone are half common and half Terumah.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַחְלוֹקֶת בַּאֲרוּסָה, אֲבָל בִּנְשׂוּאָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מֶחֱצָה חוּלִּין וּמֶחֱצָה תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: And Abaye said dispute a betrothed woman but a married woman, all agree half non-sacred and half teruma ,
llm_translation: And Abaye said: A dispute in betrothal, but in marriage - the words of all are half secular and half sacred.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: נוֹתְנִין לָהּ הַכֹּל תְּרוּמָה. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מֶחֱצָה חוּלִּין וּמֶחֱצָה תְּרוּמָה. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּבַת כֹּהֵן לְכֹהֵן, אֲבָל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מֶחֱצָה חוּלִּין וּמֶחֱצָה תְּרוּמָה. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בַּאֲרוּסָה, אֲבָל בִּנְשׂוּאָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מֶחֱצָה חוּלִּין וּמֶחֱצָה תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: This is also taught Rabbi Tarfon says: He may give her everything teruma , Rabbi Akiva says: Half non-sacred and half teruma . In what is this statement said? a daughter a priest to a priest. But an Israelite woman to a priest, all agree half non-sacred and half teruma . In what is this statement said? With regard to a betrothed woman, but with regard to a married woman, all agree half non-sacred and half teruma .
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Tarfon says: One may give her everything as Terumah. Rabbi Akiva says: Half ordinary produce and half Terumah. In what case are these matters said? In the case of a daughter of a Kohen to a Kohen. But in the case of a daughter of Israel to a Kohen, everyone agrees that it is half ordinary produce and half Terumah. In what case are these matters said? In the case of a betrothed woman. But in the case of a married woman, everyone agrees that it is half ordinary produce and half Terumah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָא אוֹמֵר: נוֹתְנִין לָהּ שְׁתֵּי יָדוֹת שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה, וְאַחַת שֶׁל חוּלִּין. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֵן לָהּ הַכֹּל תְּרוּמָה, וְהִיא מוֹכֶרֶת וְלוֹקַחַת בַּדָּמִים חוּלִּין. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁהוּזְכְּרָה תְּרוּמָה — נוֹתְנִין לָהּ כִּפְלַיִם בְּחוּלִּין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: he may give her two parts teruma and one non-sacred Rabbi Yehuda says: He may give her all in teruma , but she sells she can buy non-sacred with the money. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Wherever teruma is mentioned, he give her double of non-sacred food,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah ben Betera says: We give her two hands of Terumah, and one of common produce. Rabbi Yehudah says: We give her all Terumah, and she sells and buys with the money common produce. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Any place where Terumah is mentioned - we give her double in common produce.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ טִירְחָא.
human_translation: What is between The between them effort.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in the matter of exertion.

hebrew_text: הַיָּבָם אֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל בִּתְרוּמָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? ״קִנְיַן כַּסְפּוֹ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְהַאי קִנְיָן דְּאָחִיו הוּא.
human_translation: a yavam does not enable to partake of teruma . What is the reason The Merciful One states “The acquisition of his money” but this is his brother’s acquisition
llm_translation: The yavam does not feed with terumah. What is the reason? "His money acquisition" the Merciful One said, and this acquisition is his.

hebrew_text: עָשְׂתָה שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים בִּפְנֵי הַבַּעַל. הַשְׁתָּא בִּפְנֵי הַבַּעַל אָמְרַתְּ לָא, בִּפְנֵי הַיָּבָם מִיבַּעְיָא?! ״זוֹ וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר זוֹ״ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: she completed six months under the aegis of the husband Now you say under the aegis of the husband not is necessary under the aegis of the yavam ? teaches This, and it is unnecessary to say that,
llm_translation: She made six months in front of the husband. The other one in front of the husband she said no, in front of the yavam he requires?! "This and no need to say this" it teaches.

hebrew_text: זוֹ מִשְׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה כּוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר עוּלָּא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה: מִשּׁוּם סִימְפּוֹן.
human_translation: this initial mishna. What is the reason Ulla said, and some say Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda due to abrogation,
llm_translation: This is the first Mishnah of tractate Kodashim. What is the reason? Ulla said, and some say it was Rabbi Shmuel bar Yehudah: Because of a tradition.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְעוּלָּא, קַמַּיְיתָא שֶׁמָּא יִמְזְגוּ לָהּ כּוֹס בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ, וּבָתְרָיְיתָא מִשּׁוּם סִימְפּוֹן.
human_translation: Granted, according to Ulla, the first lest pour her a cup in her father’s house. And the latter due to abrogation.
llm_translation: In truth, regarding Ulah, it was stated: perhaps they will mix for her a cup in her father's house, and afterwards due to a signet ring.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה, קַמַּיְיתָא מִשּׁוּם סִימְפּוֹן וּבָתְרָיְיתָא מִשּׁוּם סִימְפּוֹן, מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ?
human_translation: However, to Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda, the first due to abrogation and the latter due to abrogation. what is between
llm_translation: To Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah, it was asked in the name of Simpon, and it was answered in the name of Simpon, what is the difference between them?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ בְּדִיקַת חוּץ. מָר סָבַר: בְּדִיקַת חוּץ — שְׁמָהּ בְּדִיקָה. וּמָר סָבַר: בְּדִיקַת חוּץ — לֹא שְׁמָהּ בְּדִיקָה.
human_translation: between them is superficial investigation, Sage holds superficial investigation is considered investigation, and Sage holds superficial investigation is not considered investigation,
llm_translation: There is a difference between them in the examination of the outside. Mar said: in the examination of the outside - its name is examination. And Mar said: in the examination of the outside - its name is not examination.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּקְדִּישׁ מַעֲשֵׂה יְדֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ — הֲרֵי זוֹ עוֹשָׂה וְאוֹכֶלֶת. הַמּוֹתָר, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: הֶקְדֵּשׁ, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הַסַּנְדְּלָר אוֹמֵר: חוּלִּין.
human_translation: If one consecrates his wife’s earnings, she may work and sustain the surplus, Rabbi Meir says: consecrated Rabbi Yoḥanan the Cobbler says: non-sacred.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who consecrates the work of his wife's hands—this one is performing and eating. If it is permitted, Rabbi Meir says: It is consecrated; Rabbi Yochanan the Sandal-maker says: It is mundane.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: יְכוֹלָה אִשָּׁה לוֹמַר לְבַעְלָהּ ״אֵינִי נִיזּוֹנֶת וְאֵינִי עוֹשָׂה״. קָסָבַר: כִּי תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן מְזוֹנֵי — עִיקָּר, וּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם אֵיבָה. וְכִי אָמְרָה ״אֵינִי נִיזּוֹנֶת וְאֵינִי עוֹשָׂה״ — הָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Huna said Rav said: A woman may say to her husband: I will not be sustained I will not work, He holds when the Sages instituted sustenance the primary and her earnings due to animosity. if she says: I will not be sustained I will not work, she has permission to
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: Can a woman say to her husband, "I am not sustained and I do not work"? He thought: When the Rabbis established sustenance as primary, and the work of her hands due to enmity. And if she said, "I am not sustained and I do not work" - the authority is in her hands.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: תִּקְּנוּ מְזוֹנוֹת תַּחַת מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ! אֵימָא: תִּקְּנוּ מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ תַּחַת מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: raises an objection They instituted sustenance in exchange for her earnings. say They instituted her earnings in exchange for sustenance.
llm_translation: Challenger: They established sustenance in place of her handiwork! I might say: They established her handiwork in place of sustenance.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ מַעֲשֵׂה יְדֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ — הֲרֵי הִיא עוֹשָׂה וְאוֹכֶלֶת. מַאי לָאו, בְּנִיזּוֹנֶת? לָא, בְּשֶׁאֵינָהּ נִיזּוֹנֶת.
human_translation: Let us say that supports If one consecrates his wife’s earnings, she may work and sustain What, is it not who is sustained No, who is not sustained
llm_translation: Let us say it supports him: One who sanctifies the work of his wife's hands - behold, she performs and eats. What is the reason? Is it not because of her maintenance? No, it is because she is not maintained.

hebrew_text: אִי בְּשֶׁאֵינָהּ נִיזּוֹנֶת, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יָכוֹל הָרַב לוֹמַר לָעֶבֶד ״עֲשֵׂה עִמִּי וְאֵינִי זָנָךְ״ — הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּעֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי, דְּלָא כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ ״עִמָּךְ״, אֲבָל עֶבֶד עִבְרִי, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״עִמָּךְ״ — לָא, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן אִשְׁתּוֹ!
human_translation: If who is not sustained, what of stating Even according to the one who says a master can say to slave: Work for me I will not sustain you, this applies a Canaanite slave, about whom it is not written: “With you.” But a Hebrew slave about whom it is written: with you” not And all the more so his wife,
llm_translation: If she is not sustained, what is the meaning to say? Even according to the one who says, "The master may tell the slave, 'Do with me, but do not commit adultery,'" those words apply to a Canaanite slave, for it is not written in it "with you," but for a Hebrew slave, for it is written in it "with you" - no, and all the more so his wife!

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא אִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ: מוֹתָר, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: הֶקְדֵּשׁ, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הַסַּנְדְּלָר אוֹמֵר: חוּלִּין.
human_translation: the latter clause was necessary, the surplus: Rabbi Meir says consecrated Rabbi Yoḥanan the Cobbler says non-sacred.
llm_translation: The latter part is necessary for it: permitted, Rabbi Meir says: consecrated, Rabbi Yochanan the Sandal-maker says: ordinary.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לָא תֵּימָא טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר אָדָם מַקְדִּישׁ דָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא בָּא לָעוֹלָם. אֶלָּא טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְכוּפָּהּ לְמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ — נַעֲשָׂה כְּאוֹמֵר לָהּ ״יִקְדְּשׁוּ יָדַיִךְ לְעוֹשֵׂיהֶם״.
human_translation: disputes of Reish Lakish, as Reish Lakish said: Do not say the reason for Rabbi Meir since he maintains a person may consecrate an object that has not come into the world, Rather, the reason for Rabbi Meir since he can compel her her earnings he is considered as if he had said to her: Your hands are consecrated to the One Who made them,
llm_translation: Disagreement of Reish Lakish. For Reish Lakish said: Do not say the reason of Rabbi Meir is because he holds that a person can sanctify something that will never come into existence. Rather, the reason of Rabbi Meir is that since he is able to compel her to perform the act with her hands, it is considered as if he is saying to her, "Sanctify your hands to their makers."

hebrew_text: וְהָא לָא אֲמַר לַהּ הָכִי! כֵּיוָן דְּשָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּאָמַר: אֵין אָדָם מוֹצִיא דְּבָרָיו לְבַטָּלָה — נַעֲשֶׂה כְּאוֹמֵר לָהּ ״יִקְדְּשׁוּ יָדַיִךְ לְעוֹשֵׂיהֶם״.
human_translation: But he did not say this to her; Since we heard Rabbi Meir said: A person does not say things for naught, he is considered as if he had said to her: Your hands are consecrated to the One Who made them.
llm_translation: The text says: "But did he not say to her thus! Since we heard from Rabbi Meir who said: A person does not utter his words in vain - it will be done as it says to her, 'Sanctify your hands for those who do them.'"

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר אֵין אָדָם מַקְדִּישׁ דָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא בָּא לָעוֹלָם? וְהָתַנְיָא, הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי לְאַחַר שֶׁאֶתְגַּיֵּיר״, אוֹ: ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתִּתְגַּיְּירִי״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁאֶשְׁתַּחְרֵר״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתִּשְׁתַּחְרְרִי״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁיָּמוּת בַּעְלִיךְ״, אוֹ ״שֶׁתָּמוּת אֲחוֹתִיךְ״, אוֹ: ״לְאַחַר שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ לִיךְ יְבָמִיךְ״, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: Does Rabbi Meir hold a person may not consecrate an object that has not come into the world? Isn’t it taught says to a woman: You are hereby betrothed to me after I convert; or after you convert; After I am emancipated; After you are emancipated; After your husband dies; or After your sister dies, or After your yavam performs ḥalitza with you, Rabbi Meir says: she is betrothed.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Meir holds that a person does not sanctify something that has not come into the world? And it was taught: One who says to a woman, "Behold, you are sanctified to me after you convert," or, "After you convert," "After you are freed," "After you are freed," "After your husband dies," or "That your sister dies," or, "After your brother-in-law performs chalitzah for you," Rabbi Meir says: She is sanctified.

hebrew_text: מֵהַהִיא — אִין, מֵהָא לֵיכָּא לְמִשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: from that one can no to be learned from this
llm_translation: From there - no, from there it is not inferred.

hebrew_text: הַמּוֹתָר, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר הֶקְדֵּשׁ. אֵימַת קָדוֹשׁ? רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַויְיהוּ: מוֹתָר לְאַחַר מִיתָה קָדוֹשׁ. רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר: מוֹתָר מֵחַיִּים קָדוֹשׁ.
human_translation: the surplus, Rabbi Meir says: It is consecrated when consecrated? Rav and Shmuel both said: The surplus is consecrated after death. Rav Adda bar Ahava said: The surplus is consecrated while alive.
llm_translation: The permitted, Rabbi Meir says is holy. When is it holy? Rav and Shmuel both say: After death it is holy. Rav Adda bar Ahava says: From life it is holy.

hebrew_text: הָוֵי בַּהּ רַב פָּפָּא: בְּמַאי? אִילֵימָא בְּמַעֲלֶה לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת וּמַעֲלֶה לָהּ מָעָה כֶּסֶף לִצְרָכֶיהָ — מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר לְאַחַר מִיתָה קָדוֹשׁ?
human_translation: Rav Pappa discussed it, to what If we say provides for her sustenance and provides her with a silver ma’a for her needs, what is the reason for the one who said it is consecrated after death?
llm_translation: Be in it Rav Papa: With what? If you say with providing her sustenance and providing her with a hundred silver coins for her needs - what is the reason that one who says "after death is holy"?

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא כְּשֶׁאֵין מַעֲלֶה לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת וְלֹא מַעֲלֶה לָהּ מָעָה כֶּסֶף לִצְרָכֶיהָ — מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר מֵחַיִּים קָדוֹשׁ?
human_translation: And rather he does not provide for her sustenance and does not provide her with a silver ma’a for her needs, what is the reason for the one who said it is consecrated in her lifetime?
llm_translation: And rather when not he brings up for her sustenance and not he brings up for her a hundred silver for her needs — what is the reason of the one who says "from the living, holy"?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם בְּמַעֲלֶה לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת וְאֵינוֹ מַעֲלֶה לָהּ מָעָה כֶּסֶף לִצְרָכֶיהָ. רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל סָבְרִי: תִּקְּנוּ
human_translation: Actually, he provides for her sustenance, but does not provide her with a silver ma’a for her needs, Rav and Shmuel maintain they established
llm_translation: Always in the case of her sustenance, and not in the case of a coin of silver for her needs. Rav and Shmuel hold: they established.

hebrew_text: מְזוֹנוֹת תַּחַת מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, וּמָעָה כֶּסֶף תַּחַת מוֹתָר, וְכֵיוָן דְּלָא קָא יָהֵיב לַהּ מָעָה כֶּסֶף — מוֹתָר דִּידַהּ הָוֵי. רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה סָבַר: תִּקְּנוּ מְזוֹנוֹת תַּחַת מוֹתָר, וּמָעָה כֶּסֶף תַּחַת מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, וְכֵיוָן דְּקָא יָהֵיב לַהּ מְזוֹנֵי, מוֹתָר דִּידֵיהּ הָוֵי.
human_translation: sustenance in exchange for her earnings, and silver ma’a in exchange for the surplus And since he does not give her a silver ma’a the surplus is hers, Rav Adda bar Ahava maintains they established sustenance in exchange for the surplus, and a silver ma’a in exchange for her earnings. And since he provides her with sustenance, the surplus is his,
llm_translation: Provisions under her handiwork, and a coin of silver under her control, and since he did not give her a coin of silver - it is permissible for her. Rav Adda bar Ahava thought: Establish provisions under her control, and a coin of silver under her handiwork, and since he gave her provisions, it is permissible for her.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: מִידֵּי דִּשְׁכִיחַ מִמִּידֵּי דִּשְׁכִיחַ. וּמָר סָבַר: מִידֵּי דְּקִייץ מִמִּידֵּי דְּקִייץ.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Sage, holds that something common for something common. And Sage, holds that something a fixed amount for something fixed amount.
llm_translation: With what do they argue? One Master holds: from common occurrences to common occurrences. And one Master holds: from rare occurrences to rare occurrences.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: תִּקְּנוּ מְזוֹנוֹת תַּחַת מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ! אֵימָא: תַּחַת מוֹתַר מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ.
human_translation: raises an objection They established sustenance in exchange for her earnings. Say: in exchange for the surplus of her earnings.
llm_translation: Challenger: They established sustenance in place of her handiwork! I might say: In place of her surplus handiwork.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אִם אֵינוֹ נוֹתֵן לָהּ מָעָה כֶּסֶף לִצְרָכֶיהָ — מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ שֶׁלָּהּ. אֵימָא: מוֹתַר מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ שֶׁלָּהּ. וְהָא עֲלַהּ קָתָנֵי: מָה הִיא עוֹשָׂה לוֹ — מִשְׁקַל חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים שְׁתִי בִּיהוּדָה!
human_translation: Come hear: If he does not give her a silver ma’a for her needs, her earnings to her. Say: The surplus of her earnings to her. But it is taught of this What she earn for him? weight five sela warp in Judea,
llm_translation: Come and hear: If he does not give her a hundred silver coins for her needs - her handiwork is hers. I would say: Her handiwork is permitted. But isn't it taught: What does she do for him - she weighs five rocks in Judea!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ כַּמָּה הָוֵי, דְּלִידַּע מוֹתָר דִּידַהּ כַּמָּה — מִשְׁקַל חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים שְׁתִי בִּיהוּדָה, שֶׁהֵן עֶשֶׂר סְלָעִים בַּגָּלִיל.
human_translation: This is what it is saying: How much is her earnings, that can know how much the surplus, The weight five sela warp in Judea, which is ten sela the Galilee.
llm_translation: So it is stated: The work of her hands, how much it is worth, for she knows the value of her produce — she weighs five rocks in Judea, which are equivalent to ten rocks in the Galilee.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הַסַּנְדְּלָר.
human_translation: Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan the Cobbler.
llm_translation: Said Samuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yochanan the Sandal-maker.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הָכִי? וְהָתְנַן: ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֲנִי עוֹשָׂה לְפִיךָ״ — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְהָפֵר. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: יָפֵר, שֶׁמָּא תַּעֲדִיף עָלָיו יָתֵר מִן הָרָאוּי לוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי אָמַר: יָפֵר, שֶׁמָּא יְגָרְשֶׁנָּה וּתְהֵא אֲסוּרָה לַחֲזוֹר.
human_translation: And did Shmuel say this? didn’t we learn What I make to feed you, is like an offering konam does not need to nullify Rabbi Akiva says: should nullify lest she produce more than is appropriate for him, Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said: He should nullify lest he divorce her. she will be prohibited from remarrying
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said thus, Samuel? And it was taught: 'As it is written, 'I have bound them by the words of your mouth' - it is not necessary to annul. Rabbi Akiva says: It is necessary to annul, lest you prefer him more than is fitting. Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri says: It is necessary to annul, lest he divorce her and she becomes forbidden to return."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי. כִּי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי, לְהַעְדָּפָה.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, When Shmuel said halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, the surplus.
llm_translation: And Samuel said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri. For Samuel said the halakha is according to Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, to give preference.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי לְהַעְדָּפָה! אִי נָמֵי: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּתַנָּא קַמָּא! אִי נָמֵי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא!
human_translation: let him say halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri with regard to the surplus, alternatively, halakha is not in accordance with the first tanna , alternatively, halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva,
llm_translation: And say: Is the halakha according to Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri to give preference? If you say: The halakha is not according to the first Tanna! If you say: The halakha is according to Rabbi Akiva!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: קֻוֽנָּמוֹת קָאָמְרַתְּ? שָׁאנֵי קֻוֽנָּמוֹת, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁאָדָם אוֹסֵר פֵּירוֹת חֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו, אָדָם מַקְדִּישׁ דָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא בָּא לָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: Did you speak konamot Konamot are different, since a person can prohibit another’s produce to himself. a person consecrate an object that has not come into the world,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: Are you speaking about kuvnamot? They are different, because when a person restricts the fruits of his fellow, he consecrates something that has not come into the world.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: בִּשְׁלָמָא אָדָם אוֹסֵר פֵּירוֹת חֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו — שֶׁכֵּן אָדָם אוֹסֵר פֵּירוֹתָיו עַל חֲבֵירוֹ. יֶאֱסֹר דָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא בָּא לְעוֹלָם עַל חֲבֵירוֹ, שֶׁכֵּן אֵין אָדָם אוֹסֵר פֵּירוֹת חֲבֵירוֹ עַל חֲבֵירוֹ?
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Granted, a person can prohibit another’s produce to himself, because a person can prohibit his own produce to another. prohibit an object that has not come into the world to another, since a person cannot prohibit another’s produce to another.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: In truth, a person who prohibits his fruits upon his fellow - for so does a person prohibit his fruits upon his fellow. Can one prohibit something that will never come upon his fellow? For so does a person not prohibit his fruits upon his fellow upon his fellow?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: בְּאוֹמֶרֶת ״יִקְדְּשׁוּ יָדַי לְעוֹשֵׂיהֶם״, דְּיָדַיִם אִיתַנְהוּ בָּעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: when she says: My hands are consecrated to the One Who made them, because the hands exist in the world.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: With regard to the verse "They shall sanctify My hands for their work," hands are given to them in this world.

hebrew_text: וְכִי קָאָמְרָה הָכִי מִי מַקְדְּשָׁה? הָא מְשַׁעְבְּדָא לֵיהּ! דְּאָמְרָה לְכִי מִיגָּרְשָׁה.
human_translation: When she says this does it become consecrated? She is subjugated to She says when she will get divorced
llm_translation: And when she said so, did she mean who sanctified her? Rather, it is a matter of servitude to him! For she said to him, "Go, divorce her."

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּאִילּוּ הַשְׁתָּא לָא קַדִּישׁ וּלְקַמֵּיהּ קַדִּישׁ? אָמַר רַבִּי אִלְעַאי: אַלְּמָה לָא? אִילּוּ הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״שָׂדֶה זוֹ שֶׁאֲנִי מוֹכֵר לְךָ לִכְשֶׁאֶקָּחֶנָּה מִמְּךָ תִּיקְדַּשׁ״, מִי לָא קָדְשָׁה?
human_translation: Is there anything that if at present, consecration not and in the future consecration Rabbi Elai said: Why not? If one told another: This field that I am selling to you will be consecrated when I buy it from you, doesn’t become consecrated
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And is there not a case where even if he does not sanctify it now, he will sanctify it later? Rabbi Ilai said: Why not? If one says to his fellow, "This field that I am selling to you, when I will take it from you, it shall be sanctified," has it not been sanctified?

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם, בְּיָדוֹ לְהַקְדִּישָׁהּ. הָכָא, אֵין בְּיָדָהּ לְגָרֵשׁ אֶת עַצְמָהּ. הָא לָא דָּמְיָא אֶלָּא לָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״שָׂדֶה זוֹ שֶׁמָּכַרְתִּי לְךָ, לִכְשֶׁאֶקָּחֶנָּה מִמְּךָ — תִּיקְדַּשׁ״, דְּלָא קָדְשָׁה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya objects to this: Are comparable? There, it is in his power to consecrate it here, it is not in her power to divorce herself. this is comparable only to one says to another: This field that I sold to you will be consecrated when I buy it from you. is not consecrated,
llm_translation: Rebbe Yirmiyah objects to her: Who is similar? There, it is in his power to sanctify her. Here, it is not in her power to divorce herself. This is not similar except for saying to his fellow, "This field that I sold to you, when I will take it from you - it shall be sanctified," for she did not sanctify it.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם, גּוּפָא וּפֵירוֹת בִּידָא דְלוֹקֵחַ. הָכָא, גּוּפַהּ בִּידַהּ הוּא. הָא לָא דָּמְיָא אֶלָּא לָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to this: Is comparable? There, itself and produce in the possession of the buyer, Here, her body is in her possession, this is comparable only to one says to another:
llm_translation: Rav Papa objects to her: Who is comparable? There, the body and the fruits are in the hand of the buyer. Here, her body is in her hand. This is not comparable except to one who says to his fellow:

hebrew_text: ״שָׂדֶה זוֹ שֶׁמִּשְׁכַּנְתִּי לְךָ, לִכְשֶׁאֶפְדֶּנָּה מִמְּךָ — תִּיקְדַּשׁ״, דְּקָדְשָׁה.
human_translation: This field that I mortgaged to you will be consecrated when I redeem it from you. that it is consecrated,
llm_translation: "Field this that I acquired for you, when I redeem it from you — it shall be consecrated," it has been consecrated.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם, בְּיָדוֹ לִפְדּוֹתָהּ. הָכָא, אֵין בְּיָדָהּ לְגָרֵשׁ עַצְמָהּ! הָא לָא דָּמְיָא אֶלָּא לָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״שָׂדֶה זוֹ שֶׁמִּשְׁכַּנְתִּי לְךָ לְעֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים, לִכְשֶׁאֶפְדֶּנָּה מִמְּךָ — תִּיקְדַּשׁ״, דְּקָדְשָׁה.
human_translation: Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, objects to this: Is it comparable? There, it is in his power to redeem it, here, it is not in her power to divorce herself This is only comparable to one who says to another: This field that I have mortgaged to you for ten years will be consecrated when I redeem it from you. that it is consecrated.
llm_translation: Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, objects to her: Who is similar? There, it is in his hand to redeem her. Here, it is not in her hand to divorce herself! This is not similar except to one who says to his fellow, "This field that I have acquired for you for ten years, when I redeem it from you - it shall be consecrated," and it becomes consecrated.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם, לְעֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים מִיהָא בְּיָדוֹ לִפְדּוֹתָהּ. הָכָא, אֵין בְּיָדָהּ לְגָרֵשׁ עַצְמָהּ לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rav Ashi objects to this: Is it comparable? There, ten years in any case it will be in his power to redeem it, here, it is never in her power to divorce herself
llm_translation: Challenges to him Rav Ashe: Who is similar? There, for ten years he has the ability in his hand to redeem her. Here, she does not have the ability in her hand to divorce herself forever.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: קוּנָּמוֹת קָא אָמְרַתְּ? שָׁאנֵי קוּנָּמוֹת, דִּקְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף נִינְהוּ, וְכִדְרָבָא. דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הֶקְדֵּשׁ, חָמֵץ וְשִׁחְרוּר — מַפְקִיעִין מִידֵי שִׁיעְבּוּד.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: Did you speak konamot ? Konamot are different, they are inherent sanctity, in accordance with Rava. As Rava said: Consecration, leavened bread liberation can abrogate a lien on property.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashe said: Did you say "kunamot"? They are different kunamot, they are the sanctity of the body, like Rava said: One who sanctifies, chametz and freedom - they exempt from the obligation.

hebrew_text: וְנִקְדְּשׁוּ מֵהַשְׁתָּא? אַלְּמוּהָ רַבָּנַן לְשִׁיעְבּוּדֵיהּ דְּבַעַל, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא תִּיקְדַּשׁ מֵהַשְׁתָּא.
human_translation: let her earnings become consecrated from now, The Sages reinforced the husband’s lien in order that it not become consecrated now.
llm_translation: And they shall be sanctified from the moment? The Rabbis said to serve her husband, so that she will not be sanctified from the moment.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ מְלָאכוֹת שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה עוֹשָׂה לְבַעְלָהּ: טוֹחֶנֶת, וְאוֹפָה, וּמְכַבֶּסֶת, מְבַשֶּׁלֶת, וּמְנִיקָה אֶת בְּנָהּ, מַצַּעַת לוֹ הַמִּטָּה, וְעוֹשָׂה בַּצֶּמֶר. הִכְנִיסָה לוֹ שִׁפְחָה אַחַת — לֹא טוֹחֶנֶת וְלֹא אוֹפָה וְלֹא מְכַבֶּסֶת. שְׁתַּיִם — אֵין מְבַשֶּׁלֶת, וְאֵין מְנִיקָה אֶת בְּנָהּ. שָׁלֹשׁ — אֵין מַצַּעַת לוֹ הַמִּטָּה, וְאֵין עוֹשָׂה בַּצֶּמֶר. אַרְבַּע — יוֹשֶׁבֶת בְּקָתֶדְרָא.
human_translation: And these are tasks that a wife perform for her husband: She grinds and bakes, and washes clothes, cooks, and nurses her child, makes bed, and makes from wool If she brought him one maidservant, does not grind, and does not bake, and does not wash clothes. two she does not cook and does not nurse her child three she does not make his bed and does not make from wool. four she may sit in a chair [ katedra ]
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are the tasks that a woman performs for her husband: Grinding, baking, laundering, cooking, nursing her son, making his bed, and working with wool. If he brings in one maidservant for him - she does not grind, bake, or launder. If he brings in two - she does not cook or nurse her son. If he brings in three - she does not make his bed or work with wool. If he brings in four - she sits in a chair.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ הִכְנִיסָה לוֹ מֵאָה שְׁפָחוֹת — כּוֹפָהּ לַעֲשׂוֹת בַּצֶּמֶר, שֶׁהַבַּטָּלָה מְבִיאָה לִידֵי זִימָּה. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף הַמַּדִּיר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ מִלַּעֲשׂוֹת מְלָאכָה — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה, שֶׁהַבַּטָּלָה מְבִיאָה לִידֵי שִׁיעֲמוּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Even if she brought him a hundred maidservants, he can compel her to make from wool, since idleness leads to licentiousness. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even one who vows his wife from doing work must divorce and give marriage contract, since idleness leads to idiocy.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Even if he brought in for him a hundred maidservants — he forces her to work with wool, for idleness leads to immorality. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even one who prohibits his wife from doing work — he should divorce her and give her a marriage contract, for idleness leads to repugnance.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טוֹחֶנֶת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: מַטְחֶנֶת. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: בְּרִיחְיָא דִּידָא.
human_translation: Could it enter your mind grinds Rather, say she supervises the grinding if you wish, say with a hand mill.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "G'ma tochenet sal'ka da'tach?! Ela eima: mat'chenet. V'iba'ita eima: b'richaya dida." English translation: "Is your mind grinding flour?! Rather say: a grinder. And if you wish, say: in our millstones."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא, דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אֵין אִשָּׁה אֶלָּא לְיוֹפִי, אֵין אִשָּׁה אֶלָּא לְבָנִים. וְתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אֵין אִשָּׁה אֶלָּא לְתַכְשִׁיטֵי אִשָּׁה. וְתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: הָרוֹצֶה שֶׁיְּעַדֵּן אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ — יַלְבִּישֶׁנָּה כְּלֵי פִשְׁתָּן. הָרוֹצֶה שֶׁיַּלְבִּין אֶת בִּתּוֹ — יַאֲכִילֶנָּה אֶפְרוֹחִים וְיַשְׁקֶנָּה חָלָב סָמוּךְ לְפִירְקָהּ.
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Ḥiyya, as Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: A wife is only for beauty, a wife is only for children, And Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: A wife is only for a woman’s finery. And Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: One who wishes to beautify his wife should clothe her linen garments, one who wishes to whiten his daughter should feed her young chickens, and should give her milk to drink toward the time of her maturity.
llm_translation: Mishnaic teachings that are not like Rabbi Chiya, as Rabbi Chiya teaches: A woman is only for beauty, a woman is only for children. And Rabbi Chiya teaches: A woman is only for the adornments of a woman. And Rabbi Chiya teaches: One who wants to please his wife - should dress her in linen garments. One who wants to make his daughter beautiful - should feed her fowl and give her milk close to her weaning.

hebrew_text: וּמְנִיקָה אֶת בְּנָהּ. לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי. דְּתַנְיָא: נָדְרָה שֶׁלֹּא לְהָנִיק אֶת בְּנָהּ, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שׁוֹמֶטֶת דַּד מִפִּיו. בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: כּוֹפָהּ וּמְנִיקָתוֹ. נִתְגָּרְשָׁה — אֵינוֹ כּוֹפָהּ. וְאִם הָיָה מַכִּירָהּ — נוֹתֵן לָהּ שְׂכָרָהּ וְכוֹפָהּ, וּמְנִיקָתוֹ מִפְּנֵי הַסַּכָּנָה.
human_translation: nurses her child. Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Beit Shammai, as it is taught took a vow not to nurse her child, Beit Shammai say: she remove nipple from his mouth Beit Hillel say: can compel her, and she nurse she was divorced he cannot compel her. if recognized her, pay her a salary and compel her to nurse due to danger
llm_translation: And she nurses her son. Let us say a Mishnah according to Beit Shammai. As it was taught: If she vowed not to nurse her son, Beit Shammai says: She must wean him from her breast. Beit Hillel says: She must hire a wet nurse for him. If she was divorced - she does not have to hire a wet nurse. And if he recognizes her - he gives her her wages, hires her, and weans him due to danger.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּדְרָה הִיא, וְקִיֵּים לַהּ הוּא. וְקָסָבְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: הוּא נוֹתֵן אֶצְבַּע בֵּין שִׁינֶּיהָ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: הִיא נָתְנָה אֶצְבַּע בֵּין שִׁינֶּיהָ.
human_translation: Even you say Beit Shammai, here we are dealing with where she made vow and ratified for her Beit Shammai maintain he had placed his finger between her teeth, Beit Hillel maintain she put her finger between her teeth,
llm_translation: Even if you say Beit Shammai, here we are dealing with what? For example, if she vowed, and he fulfilled it for her. And Beit Shammai hold: he places a finger between her teeth, and Beit Hillel hold: she placed a finger between her teeth.

hebrew_text: וְנִפְלְגוּ בִּכְתוּבָּה בְּעָלְמָא. וְעוֹד: תַּנְיָא, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵינָהּ מְנִיקָה! אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי.
human_translation: let them dispute about a marriage contract in general, And furthermore, it is taught that Beit Shammai say She does not nurse Rather, it is clear the mishna is not in accordance with Beit Shammai.
llm_translation: "And they disputed in writing in the world. And furthermore: It was taught, Beit Shammai say: It does not nurse! Rather, it is a tradition from the house of Matnitin that is not like Beit Shammai."

hebrew_text: אִם הָיָה מַכִּירָהּ.
human_translation: if recognized her,
llm_translation: If he recognized her.

hebrew_text: עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חֲמִשִּׁים יוֹם. אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. בִּשְׁלָמָא רַב וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן — כׇּל חַד וְחַד כִּי חוּרְפֵּיהּ. אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל, כִּי הַאי גַּוְונָא מִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: How old Rava said Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said Rav said: Three months, and Shmuel said: Thirty days, and Rabbi Yitzḥak said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Fifty days. Rav Shimi bar Abaye said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yitzḥak said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan. Granted, Rav and Rabbi Yoḥanan each according to its intelligence, However, according to Shmuel, can you find a case like this,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Until when? Rava said, Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said in the name of Rav: three months, and Shmuel said: thirty days. And Rabbi Yitzchak said Rabbi Yochanan: fifty days. Rav Shimi bar Abaye said: the halacha is according to Rabbi Yitzchak who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan. Regarding Rav and Rabbi Yochanan - each one according to his reasoning. But regarding Shmuel, who forgets this calculation?

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל, אָמַר: לָא תְּצִיתִינְהוּ לְהָנֵי כְּלָלֵי דְּכָיֵיל יְהוּדָה אֲחִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל. הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמַּכִּירָהּ.
human_translation: When Rami bar Yeḥezkel came he said: Do not listen to, those principles that my brother Yehuda said in the name of Shmuel, this is what Shmuel said: Whenever he recognizes her,
llm_translation: When Ramei, son of Yehezkel, came, he said: "Do not extinguish them for the sake of the community of the village of Kehil Yehuda, the brother of Mishmei, whose name is Shmuel." Thus said Shmuel: "As long as one recognizes it."

hebrew_text: הָהִיא דַּאֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְרַב דִּימִי בַּר יוֹסֵף: זִיל בִּדְקֵהּ. אֲזַל אוֹתְבַהּ בְּדָרֵי דִנְשֵׁי, וְשַׁקְלֵיהּ לִבְרַהּ וְקָמְהַדַּר לֵיהּ עֲלַיְיהוּ. כִּי מְטָא לְגַבַּהּ, הֲוָת קָא מְסַוֵּי לְאַפַּהּ כְּבַשְׁתִּנְהִי לְעֵינַהּ מִינֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לַהּ: נְטֹף עֵינִיךְ, קוּם דְּרַי בְּרִיךְ. סוֹמֵא מְנָא יָדַע? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: בְּרֵיחָא וּבְטַעְמָא.
human_translation: A certain came before Shmuel, He said to Rav Dimi bar Yosef: Go and check her, He went, placed her in a row of women, and took her son and passed him near them When reached her, he looked at her face with joy, she averted her eyes from him, He said to her: Lift up your eyes, get up and take your son, how does a blind know Rav Ashi said: Through smell and through the taste
llm_translation: That one who came before Samuel. He said to Rav Dimi son of Joseph: Go check it. He went and sat in the rows of women, took it to his son and adorned it for him. When he came to his father, it was covering its face like a bride before her groom. He said to her: Lower your eyes, get up and bless. How did he know that she was blind? Rav Ashi said: By smell and taste.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יוֹנֵק תִּינוֹק וְהוֹלֵךְ עַד עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה חֹדֶשׁ, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — כְּיוֹנֵק שֶׁקֶץ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ אַרְבַּע וְחָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים. פֵּירַשׁ לְאַחַר עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה חֹדֶשׁ וְחָזַר — כְּיוֹנֵק שֶׁקֶץ.
human_translation: The Sages taught A child may continue to nurse until twenty-four months, from this forward, like one who nurses a non-kosher animal, the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Yehoshua says: even four or five years, if he ceased, after twenty-four months and resumed like one who nurses a non-kosher animal.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who nurses a child and continues until twenty-four months, from here on — like nursing an abomination, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Yehoshua says: Even up to four or five years. If he paused after twenty-four months and then resumed — like nursing an abomination.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ כְּיוֹנֵק שֶׁקֶץ. וּרְמִינְהִי: יָכוֹל יְהֵא חֲלֵב מְהַלְּכֵי שְׁתַּיִם טָמֵא. וְדִין הוּא: וּמָה בְּהֵמָה שֶׁהֵקַלְתָּ בְּמַגָּעָהּ — הֶחְמַרְתָּ בַּחֲלָבָהּ, אָדָם שֶׁהֶחְמַרְתָּ בְּמַגָּעוֹ — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁתַּחְמִיר בַּחֲלָבוֹ?
human_translation: The Master said From this forward like one who nurses from a non-kosher animal. raises a contradiction might milk bipeds, would be non-kosher logical derivation: Just as animal, where you were lenient with regard to its contact, you were stringent with regard to its milk, a person, where you were stringent about contact, isn’t it logical that you should be stringent with regard to his milk?
llm_translation: Master said: From here and onwards like a sucking abomination. And raise a dilemma: Can the milk of two walkers be impure? And it is a judgment: And what about an animal that you lightened with its touch - you lightened with its milk, a person that you lightened with his touch - is it not a judgment that he should be strict with his milk?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֶת הַגָּמָל כִּי מַעֲלֵה גֵרָה הוּא״, הוּא טָמֵא, וְאֵין חֲלֵב מְהַלְּכֵי שְׁתַּיִם טָמֵא, אֶלָּא טָהוֹר. יָכוֹל אוֹצִיא אֶת הֶחָלָב, שֶׁאֵינוֹ שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל, וְלֹא אוֹצִיא אֶת הַדָּם שֶׁהוּא שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״הוּא״ — הוּא טָמֵא, וְאֵין דַּם מְהַלְּכֵי שְׁתַּיִם טָמֵא, אֶלָּא טָהוֹר.
human_translation: the verse states: the camel, because it chews the cud it is impure, but milk bipeds is not impure; rather, kosher. might I should exclude the milk does not apply equally to everyone, I should not exclude blood, which apply equally to everyone. the verse states “it” it is impure, blood bipeds is not impure, rather kosher.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "The camel, for it brings up its cud," it is impure, and the milk of a two-year-old camel is impure, but it is pure. One might have thought to exclude the milk, which is not similar to everything, and not to exclude the blood, which is similar to everything - the Talmud teaches: "it" - it is impure, and the blood of a two-year-old camel is pure.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אֲפִילּוּ מִצְוַת פְּרִישָׁה אֵין בּוֹ.
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet said There is not even a command to refrain
llm_translation: And Rav Sheshet said: Even the commandment of separation is not in it.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּפָרֵישׁ, הָא דְּלָא פָּרֵישׁ.
human_translation: This not difficult, this when it removed that when it not removed.
llm_translation: Not difficult: this one who separated, this one who did not separate.

hebrew_text: וְחִילּוּפַהּ בְּדָם. כִּדְתַנְיָא: דָּם שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי כִּכָּר — גּוֹרְרוֹ וְאוֹכְלוֹ. שֶׁבֵּין הַשִּׁינַּיִם — מוֹצְצוֹ וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: And the opposite to blood: As it is taught blood was on a loaf scrapes off and eat was between teeth, he may suck it without concern,
llm_translation: And its exchange in blood. As it was taught: blood on the surface of a loaf - one may drag it and eat it. That which is between the teeth - one may suck it and is not concerned.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ אַרְבַּע וְחָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים. וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ חֲבִילָתוֹ עַל כְּתֵיפָיו! אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חַד שִׁיעוּרָא הוּא. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: The Master said Rabbi Yehoshua says: even four or five years. But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehoshua says: Even if his package on his shoulder both this and that are one, measure, Rav Yosef said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: Master said, Rabbi Yehoshua says: Even four and five years. And it was taught, Rabbi Yehoshua says: Even if his bundle is on his shoulders! Both are one measure. Rav Yosef said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי מָרִינוּס אוֹמֵר: גּוֹנֵחַ — יוֹנֵק חָלָב בְּשַׁבָּת. מַאי טַעְמָא: יוֹנֵק מְפָרֵק כִּלְאַחַר יָד, וּבִמְקוֹם צַעֲרָא לָא גְּזַרוּ רַבָּנַן. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מָרִינוּס.
human_translation: it is taught Rabbi Marinos says: One who is coughing may suck milk on Shabbat, What is the reason? Sucking extracting in an unusual manner. but in a situation pain, the Sages did not issue a decree. Rabbi Yosef said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Marinos.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Marinus says: One may press milk on Shabbat. What is the reason? A baby breaks the seal after the fact, and in a place of discomfort, the Rabbis did not decree. Rav Yosef said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Marinus.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, נַחוּם אִישׁ גַּלְיָא אוֹמֵר: צִינּוֹר שֶׁעָלוּ בּוֹ קַשְׁקַשִּׁין — מְמַעֲכָן בְּרַגְלוֹ בְּצִנְעָא בְּשַׁבָּת, וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ. מַאי טַעְמָא — מְתַקֵּן כִּלְאַחַר יָד הוּא, וּבִמְקוֹם פְּסֵידָא לָא גְּזַרוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הֲלָכָה כְּנַחוּם אִישׁ גַּלְיָא.
human_translation: is taught Naḥum of Galia says: a pipe is blocked by weeds [ kashkashin ] one may crush them with his foot in private without concern What is the reason This is repairing in an unusual manner, but in a situation loss, the Sages did not issue a decree. Rabbi Yosef said: halakha is in accordance with Naḥum of Galia.
llm_translation: It was taught: Nahum the man of Galia says: A pipe in which nuts were placed - one may step on it with his foot in a hidden place on Shabbat, and he need not be concerned. What is the reason? - It is being prepared for after the fact, and in a place of loss, the Rabbis did not decree. Rav Yosef said: The halakha is in accordance with Nahum the man of Galia.

hebrew_text: פֵּירַשׁ לְאַחַר עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה חֹדֶשׁ וְחָזַר — כְּיוֹנֵק שֶׁקֶץ. וְכַמָּה? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בַּר חֲבִיבָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, תָּנֵי רַב יְהוּדָה בַּר חֲבִיבָא קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים.
human_translation: ceased after twenty-four months and resumed, like one who nurses a non-kosher animal. How long Rav Yehuda bar Ḥaviva said Shmuel said: Three days. There are who say is taught Rav Yehuda bar Ḥaviva before Shmuel: three days.
llm_translation: He explained after twenty-four months and returned — like a detestable thing. And how much? Rav Yehudah bar Chaviva said in the name of Shmuel: three days. Some say, Rav Yehudah bar Chaviva taught before Shmuel: three days.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מֵינֶקֶת שֶׁמֵּת בַּעְלָהּ בְּתוֹךְ עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה חֹדֶשׁ — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תִּתְאָרֵס וְלֹא תִּינָּשֵׂא
human_translation: The Sages taught: A nursing woman whose husband died within twenty-four months may not be betrothed and may not get married
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A woman who loses her husband within twenty-four months - she shall not engage in betrothal or marriage.

hebrew_text: עַד עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה חֹדֶשׁ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר בִּשְׁמוֹנָה עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. אָמַר רַבִּי נָתָן בַּר יוֹסֵף: הֵן הֵן דִּבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, הֵן הֵן דִּבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל. שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה חֹדֶשׁ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: שְׁמוֹנָה עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: until twenty-four months the statement of Rabbi Meir. And Rabbi Yehuda permits after eighteen months. Rabbi Natan bar Yosef said: These are the same the statement of Beit Shammai, and those are the same the statement of Beit Hillel, as Beit Shammai say: Twenty-four months, and Beit Hillel say: Eighteen months.
llm_translation: Until twenty and four months, the words of Rabbi Meir. And Rabbi Yehuda permits until eighteen months. Rabbi Natan bar Yosef said: These are the words of Beit Shammai, these are the words of Beit Hillel. Beit Shammai says: twenty and four months, and Beit Hillel says: eighteen months.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: אֲנִי אַכְרִיעַ. לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה חֹדֶשׁ — מוּתֶּרֶת לִינָּשֵׂא בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד חֹדֶשׁ. לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר בִּשְׁמוֹנָה עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ — מוּתֶּרֶת לְהִנָּשֵׂא בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הֶחָלָב נֶעְכָּר אֶלָּא לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: I will decide. According to the one who says twenty-four months, she may marry after twenty-one months, According to the one who says eighteen months, she may marry after fifteen months, since the milk becomes spoiled only after three months.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: I will decide. According to the one who says twenty-four months - she is permitted to remarry after twenty-one months. According to the one who says eighteen months - she is permitted to remarry after fifteen months, because milk only becomes spoiled after three months.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְאָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא: לִי הִתִּיר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא לָשֵׂאת לְאַחַר חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. אֲרִיסֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַהוּ לֵיאָרֵס בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲדָא, דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְעוֹד: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל — הֲלָכָה כְּבֵית הִלֵּל. וְאָמַר עוּלָּא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְאָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא: לִי הִתִּיר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא לָשֵׂאת לְאַחַר חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דְּאַתְּ לֵיאָרֵס.
human_translation: Ulla said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. And Mar Ukva said: Rabbi Ḥanina allowed me to marry after fifteen months. Abaye’s tenant farmer came before Abaye He said to him: What is betrothing after fifteen months? said to him: One Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda, halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. And furthermore, Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel the halakha is in accordance with Beit Hillel. And Ulla said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. And Mar Ukva said: Rabbi Ḥanina allowed me to marry after fifteen months, and all the more so you betrothing
llm_translation: Ula said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehuda. And Mar Ukva said: Rabbi Chanina permitted me to marry after fifteen months. The son of Abbaye came before Abbaye, and he said to him: What is the reason to marry after fifteen months? He said to him: One, because Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda - the halakha is according to Rabbi Yehuda. And furthermore: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel - the halakha is according to Beit Hillel. Ula said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehuda, and Mar Ukva said: Rabbi Chanina permitted me to marry after fifteen months, all the more so that you should marry.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה חֹדֶשׁ, חוּץ מִיּוֹם שֶׁנּוֹלַד בּוֹ וְחוּץ מִיּוֹם שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה בּוֹ. רְהַט בָּתְרֵיהּ תְּלָתָא פַּרְסֵי וְאָמְרִי לַהּ פַּרְסָא בְּחָלָא, וְלָא אַדְרְכֵיהּ.
human_translation: When came before Rav Yosef said to him Rav and Shmuel both say: She must wait twenty-four months excluding the day that was born and excluding the day she became betrothed. he ran three parasangs and some say one parasang [ parsa ] through sand. but he did not catching up to him.
llm_translation: When he came before Rav Yosef, he said to him: Rav and Shmuel, both of them said: She must wait twenty-four months, except for the day on which she gave birth and except for the day on which she became engaged. He ran after her three parasangs and said to her a parsa in vinegar, but he did not catch her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַאי מִילְּתָא דַאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן אֲפִילּוּ בֵּיעֲתָא בְּכוּתָּחָא לָא לִישְׁרֵי אִינִישׁ בִּמְקוֹם רַבֵּיהּ, לָא מִשּׁוּם דְּמִיחֲזֵי כְּאַפְקִירוּתָא, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מִסְתַּיְּיעָא מִילְּתָא לְמֵימְרָא. דְּהָא אֲנָא הֲוָה גְּמִירְנָא לֵיהּ לְהָא דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל, אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא מִסְתַּיְּיעָא לִי מִילְּתָא לְמֵימַר.
human_translation: Abaye said that which the Sages said: A person should not permit even an egg in kutaḥ , in his teacher’s vicinity. not because it appears disrespectful rather because he will not be successful in saying the matter since I had learned this of Rav and Shmuel, even so I was unsuccessful in saying it
llm_translation: Abaye said: This matter that the Rabbis said, even if one were to shout in the marketplace, a person should not deviate from the opinion of his teacher, not because it appears like arrogance, but because the matter is not clear to him. For I had studied this with Rav and Shmuel, yet even so, the matter is not clear to me to say.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נָתְנָה בְּנָהּ לְמֵינֶקֶת, אוֹ גְּמָלַתּוּ, אוֹ מֵת — מוּתֶּרֶת לִינָּשֵׂא מִיָּד. רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סְבוּר לְמִיעְבַּד עוֹבָדָא כִּי הָא מַתְנִיתָא. אֲמַרָה לְהוּ הָהִיא סָבְתָּא: בְּדִידִי הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא, וַאֲסַר לִי רַב נַחְמָן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: If gave her child to a wet nurse or weaned him, or died, she is permitted to marry immediately. Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, thought to act in accordance with this baraita . a certain old woman said to them: There was an incident in which I and Rav Naḥman prohibited it for me.
llm_translation: The sages taught: If a woman gave her son to a wet nurse, or to a she-camel, or if he died — she is immediately permitted to remarry. Rav Papa and Rav Huna, the son of Rav Yehoshua, thought to act in accordance with the Mishnah. That elderly woman said to them: In my case, the matter was acted upon, and Rav Nachman prohibited me.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָא רַב נַחְמָן שְׁרָא לְהוּ לְבֵי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא! שָׁאנֵי בֵּי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא דְּלָא הָדְרִי בְּהוּ.
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t Rav Naḥman permit this for the Exilarch’s household? The Exilarch’s household is different, do not renege
llm_translation: I?! But didn't Rav Nachman send to the Exilarch's house! The Exilarch's house is different, as they do not retract.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב פַּפֵּי: וְאַתּוּן לָא תִּסְבְּרוּהָ — מֵהָא דְּתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיְתָה רְדוּפָה לֵילֵךְ לְבֵית אָבִיהָ, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה לָהּ כַּעַס בְּבֵית בַּעְלָהּ, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה בַּעְלָהּ חָבוּשׁ בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין, אוֹ שֶׁהָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה בַּעְלָהּ זָקֵן, אוֹ חוֹלֶה, אוֹ שֶׁהָיְתָה עֲקָרָה וּזְקֵנָה אַיְילוֹנִית וּקְטַנָּה, וְהַמַּפֶּלֶת אַחַר מִיתַת בַּעְלָהּ, וְשֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לֵילֵד — כּוּלָּן צְרִיכוֹת לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Rav Pappi said to And do you not maintain from that which is taught If frequently went to her father’s house or she had been angry with her husband in house; or her husband had been incarcerated in prison; or had gone overseas; or her husband had been old or ill; or if she was a barren woman, or elderly, a sexually underdeveloped woman, or a minor girl; or if she had miscarried after the death of her husband; or if she was unfit to give birth they must all wait three months. the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Pappai: And you do not consider it - from that which was taught: If she was pursued to go to her father's house, or if she had anger in her husband's house, or if her husband was imprisoned in a house of captives, or if her husband went to a maritime province, or if her husband was old, or sick, or if she was barren, elderly, and young, and she miscarried after her husband's death, and she is not fit to conceive - all of these require waiting three months, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר לֵיאָרֵס וְלִינָּשֵׂא מִיָּד. וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר בִּגְזֵירוֹתָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei permits to be betrothed and to marry immediately, And Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir his decrees.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei permits le'ars and linasei immediately. And Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is like Rabbi Meir in his decrees.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: לָאו אַדַּעְתִּין. וְהִלְכְתָא: מֵת — מוּתָּר, גְּמָלַתּוּ — אָסוּר. מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מֵת נָמֵי אָסוּר, דִּלְמָא קָטְלָה לֵיהּ וְאָזְלָא וּמִינַּסְבָא. הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא וַחֲנַקְתֵּיהּ. וְלָא הִיא, הָהִיא שׁוֹטָה הֲוַאי, דְּלָא עָבְדִי נְשֵׁי דְּחָנְקָן בְּנַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: They answered him: was not in our mind, The halakha died, is permitted she had weaned him, is prohibited Mar bar Rav Ashi said: Even if died, she is also prohibited she might kill him and go and get married. there was an incident a woman strangled that is not so, That woman was insane, women do not strangle their children,
llm_translation: They said to him: We do not know. And the halakha is: if he dies - it is permitted, but his camel - it is forbidden. Mar bar Rav Ashi said: Even if he dies, it is also forbidden, perhaps he killed him and then went and married his wife. It was an incident and they choked him. But it is not so, that one is a fool, for they did not marry the wives of those whom they choked.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הֲרֵי שֶׁנָּתְנוּ לָהּ בֵּן לְהָנִיק — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תָּנִיק עִמּוֹ לֹא בְּנָהּ וְלֹא בֶּן חֲבֶרְתָּהּ. פָּסְקָה קִימְעָא — אוֹכֶלֶת הַרְבֵּה. לֹא תֹּאכַל עִמּוֹ דְּבָרִים הָרָעִים לְחָלָב.
human_translation: The Sages taught: someone gave a child to nurse she may not nurse her child or another child with him, if she fixed a small she must eat large she may not eat with him, things bad for milk.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If they gave her a son to nurse - behold, she shall not nurse with him, neither her son nor her friend's son. Kim'a ceased - she eats a lot. She shall not eat with him things that are harmful to milk.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא בְּנָהּ אָמְרַתְּ לָא, בֶּן חֲבֶרְתָּהּ מִיבַּעְיָא?! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: בְּנָהּ הוּא דְּחָיְיסָ[א] עִילָּוֵיהּ מַמְצְיָא לֵיהּ טְפֵי. אֲבָל בֶּן חֲבֶרְתָּהּ, אִי לָאו דַּהֲוָה לַהּ מוֹתָר לָא הֲוָה מַמְצְיָא לֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Now you said not her own child is necessary another woman’s child? Lest you say her child, as she favors him, she will feed him more but another child, if she did not have surplus she would not feed him, teaches us
llm_translation: The daughter said no, does her friend's son really need it?! What might you say: it is her son that she is concerned about his welfare, she would find him a better match. But her friend's son, if it were not that it was permissible for her, she would not find him a match, this is what we hear.

hebrew_text: פָּסְקָה קִימְעָא — אוֹכֶלֶת הַרְבֵּה. מֵהֵיכָא? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מִשֶּׁלָּהּ.
human_translation: if she fixed a small she must eat large From where Rav Sheshet said: From her own
llm_translation: The Gemara concluded: Kimea eats a lot. From where? Rav Sheshet said: From her own.

hebrew_text: לֹא תֹּאכַל עִמּוֹ דְּבָרִים הָרָעִים. מַאי נִינְהוּ? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: כְּגוֹן כְּשׁוּת וַחֲזִיז וְדָגִים קְטַנִּים וַאֲדָמָה. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ קָרָא וַחֲבוּשָׁא. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ קוֹרָא וְכוּפְרָא. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ כַּמְכָּא וְהַרְסָנָא. מִינַּיְיהוּ פָּסְקִי חֲלָבָא, מִינַּיְיהוּ עָכְרִי חֲלָבָא.
human_translation: She may not eat with him things bad for What are these Rav Kahana said: For example, hops; and young, green grain small fish; and soil. Abaye said: Even pumpkin and quince. Rav Pappa said: Even pumpkin and palm branches Rav Ashi said: Even kutaḥ [ kamka ] and small fish. some cause milk to dry up some cause milk to spoil.
llm_translation: "Do not eat with him evil things." What are they? Rav Kahana said: Such as leeks, beets, small fish, and earth. Abbaye said: Even leeks and beets. Rav Papa said: Even leeks and vinegar. Rav Ashe said: Even a cooked dish and mustard. They disagreed about milk, they disagreed about cheese."

hebrew_text: דִּמְשַׁמְּשָׁא בֵּי רִיחְיָא — הָווּ לַהּ בְּנֵי נִכְפֵּי. דִּמְשַׁמְּשָׁא עַל אַרְעָא — הָווּ לַהּ בְּנֵי שְׁמוּטֵי. דְּדָרְכָא עַל (רְמָא) [דְּמָא] דַּחֲמָרָא — הָווּ לַהּ בְּנֵי גִּירְדָּנֵי. דְּאָכְלָה חַרְדְּלָא — הָווּ לַהּ בְּנֵי זַלְזְלָנֵי. דְּאָכְלָה תַּחְלֵי — הָווּ לַהּ בְּנֵי דּוּלְפָנֵי. דְּאָכְלָה מוֹנִינֵי — הָווּ לַהּ בְּנֵי מְצִיצֵי עֵינָא. דְּאָכְלָה גַּרְגּוּשְׁתָּא — הָווּ לַהּ בְּנֵי מְכוֹעָרֵי. דְּשָׁתְיָא שִׁיכְרָא — הָווּ לַהּ בְּנֵי אוּכָּמֵי. דְּאָכְלָה בִּישְׂרָא וְשָׁתְיָא חַמְרָא — הָווּ לַהּ בְּנֵי
human_translation: A woman who engages in intercourse in a mill will have epileptic children; engages in intercourse on the ground will have long-necked children; steps on a donkey’s dung will have bald children; eats mustard will have gluttonous children; eats garden cress [ taḥlei ] will have tearful children; eats brine [ moninei ] will have children with blinking eyes; eats soil will have ugly children; drinks intoxicating liquor will have black children; eats meat and drinks wine will have children
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If one uses the water of the Rechaya well - he will have sons who are palmers. If one uses the water of the ground - he will have sons who are free men.
