If one walks on the sand of the winepress - he will have sons who are gardeners. If one eats mustard - he will have sons who are scoffers. If one eats endives - he will have sons who are informers. If one eats purslane - he will have sons who are impudent. If one drinks beer - he will have sons who are brawlers. If one eats meat with bread and drinks wine - he will have sons who are...

hebrew_text: בָּרְיֵי. דְּאָכְלָה בֵּיעֵי — הָווּ לַהּ בְּנֵי עֵינָנֵי. דְּאָכְלָה כְּווֹרֵי — הָווּ לַהּ בְּנֵי חִינָּנֵי. דְּאָכְלָה כַּרְפְּסָא — הָווּ לַהּ בְּנֵי זִיוְתָנֵי. דְּאָכְלָה כּוּסְבַּרְתָּא — הָווּ לַהּ בְּנֵי בִּישְׂרָנֵי. דְּאָכְלָה אֶתְרוֹגָא — הָווּ לַהּ בְּנֵי רֵיחָנֵי. בְּרַתֵּיה דְּשַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא אֲכַלָה בַּהּ אַמָּה אֶתְרוֹגָא, וַהֲווֹ מַסְּקִי לַהּ לְקַמֵּיהּ אֲבוּהּ בְּרֵישׁ רֵיחָנֵי.
human_translation: healthy; eats eggs will have large-eyed children; eats fish will have graceful children; eats celery will have beautiful children; eats coriander [ kusbarta ] will have corpulent children; eats etrogim will have sweet-smelling children. the daughter of King Shapur her mother ate etrogim they used to place her in front of her father on top of all the spices,
llm_translation: Daughters of Akhlah Beieye - she had sons of Einanei. Daughters of Akhlah Kevorei - she had sons of Chinanei. Daughters of Akhlah Karpesa - she had sons of Zivsanei. Daughters of Akhlah Kusparta - she had sons of Bishranei. Daughters of Akhlah Esrogah - she had sons of Reichanei. Her daughter, the daughter of King Shabur, ate with her a cubit of Esrogah, and they would perfume her with the scent of Reichanei.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, בְּדַק לַן רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא: הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת לְהָנִיק, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר שֶׁלֹּא לְהָנִיק — שׁוֹמְעִין לָהּ. צַעֲרָא דִּידַהּ הוּא. הוּא אוֹמֵר לְהָנִיק, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת שֶׁלֹּא לְהָנִיק, מַהוּ? כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּלָאו אוֹרְחַהּ — שׁוֹמְעִין לָהּ. הִיא אוֹרְחַהּ וְהוּא לָאו אוֹרְחֵיהּ, מַאי? בָּתַר דִּידֵיהּ אָזְלִינַן, אוֹ בָּתַר דִּידַהּ אָזְלִינַן?
human_translation: Rav Huna said: Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana tested us, If she says to nurse and he says does not to nurse we accede to her she is the one suffering he says to nurse and she says not to nurse, what is Anywhere that she is not accustomed, we accede to her if she is accustomed and he is not accustomed, what we follow his or do we follow her
llm_translation: Rav Huna said, "We checked with Rav Huna bar Chinana: If she says to nurse and he says not to nurse - we listen to her. It is her discomfort. If he says to nurse and she says not to nurse, what is the law? Wherever it is not her way - we listen to her. If it is her way and not his way, what is the law? Do we follow her or him?"

hebrew_text: וּפָשֵׁיטְנָא לֵיהּ מֵהָא: עוֹלָה עִמּוֹ וְאֵינָהּ יוֹרֶדֶת עִמּוֹ. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַאי קְרָאָה — ״וְהִיא בְּעוּלַת בָּעַל״, בַּעֲלִיָּיתוֹ שֶׁל בַּעַל, וְלֹא בִּירִידָתוֹ שֶׁל בַּעַל. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״כִּי הִיא הָיְתָה אֵם כׇּל חָי״, לְחַיִּים נִיתְּנָה, וְלֹא לְצַעַר נִיתְּנָה.
human_translation: And we answered his from this she ascends with him but she does not descend with him Rav Huna said: What is the verse “She is a man’s wife” with the ascension [ aliya ] of her husband but does not with the descent of her husband. Rabbi Elazar said: from here: “As she was the mother of all living” she was given for living but was not given to pain
llm_translation: We shall derive it from this: "An elevation-offering with him and it does not descend with him." Rav Huna said: What is the verse? "And she is the wife of her husband," the elevation-offering of her husband, and not the descent of her husband. Rabbi Elazar said from here: "For she is the mother of all living," given for life, and not for sorrow.

hebrew_text: הִכְנִיסָה לוֹ שִׁפְחָה וְכוּ׳. הָא שְׁאָרָא עָבְדָא. וְתֵימָא לֵיהּ: עַיֵּילִית לָךְ אִיתְּתָא בַּחֲרִיקַאי! מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמַר לַהּ: הָא טָרְחָא לְדִידִי וּלְדִידַהּ, קַמֵּי דִידָךְ מַאן טָרַח?
human_translation: if she brought him one maidservant she perform the other Let say to him: I brought you a woman in my place [ baḥarikai ] because can say to her: This toils for me and for herself who will toil for you?
llm_translation: He brought in for him a maidservant, etc. The other servant. And say to him: Did you bring a wife for yourself in the marketplace! Because he said to her: This is a burden for me and for you, in front of you who should bear the burden?

hebrew_text: שְׁתַּיִם אֵינָהּ מְבַשֶּׁלֶת וְאֵינָהּ מְנִיקָה וְכוּ׳. הָא שְׁאָרָא עָבְדָא. וְתֵימָא לֵיהּ: עַיֵּילִית לָךְ אִיתְּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי דְּטָרְחָה לְדִידִי וּלְדִידַהּ, וַחֲדָא לְדִידָךְ וּלְדִידַהּ! מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמַר לַהּ: קַמֵּי אוֹרְחֵי וּפָרְחֵי מַאן טָרַח?
human_translation: two she does not cook and does not need to nurse She perform the other Let say to him: I brought you another woman who can toil for me and for herself, and one for you and for herself. because he can say to her: Who is going to toil for the guests and wayfarers
llm_translation: Two she does not cook and she does not nurse, etc. The other maidservant did it. And say to him: Did you bring another wife for yourself who will toil for me and for her, and one for yourself and for her! Because he said to her: Before travelers and passersby, who will toil?

hebrew_text: שָׁלֹשׁ, אֵינָהּ מַצַּעַת הַמִּטָּה. הָא שְׁאָרָא עָבְדָא. וְתֵימָא לֵיהּ: עַיֵּילִית לָךְ אַחֲרִיתִי לְאוֹרְחֵי וּפָרְחֵי! מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמַר לַהּ: נְפִישׁ בְּנֵי בֵיתָא, נְפִישׁ אוֹרְחֵי וּפָרְחֵי.
human_translation: three she does not make his bed She perform the other Let her say to him: I brought you another for the guests and wayfarers, because he can say to her: the members of the house increase, of guests and wayfarers increases
llm_translation: Three, it is not the mattress of the bed. The other matter is a service. And say to him: "I have brought you the last for the travelers and the flowers!" Because he said to her: "The sons of the household are important, the travelers and the flowers are important."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ אַרְבַּע נָמֵי! אַרְבַּע, כֵּיוָן דִּנְפִישִׁי לְהוּ, מְסַיְּיעָן אַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: If so, even four as well, four, since there are many they assist one another
llm_translation: If so, even four rows! Four, since they are multiplied, they help each other.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי: לֹא הִכְנִיסָה לוֹ מַמָּשׁ, אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן שֶׁרְאוּיָה לְהַכְנִיס, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא הִכְנִיסָה. תָּנָא: אֶחָד שֶׁהִכְנִיסָה לוֹ, וְאֶחָד שֶׁצִּמְצְמָה לוֹ מִשֶּׁלָּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥana, and some say Rav Shmuel bar Naḥmani, said: not that she actually brought him Rather, once she is able to bring although she did not bring him taught: Whether she brought him whether she reduced her own needs
llm_translation: Rav Ḥanā said, and some say it was Rabbi Shemu'el bar Naḥmani: He did not bring it in with a tangible object, but once it is fitting to bring it in, even though he did not bring it in. It was taught in a baraita: One who brought it in, and one whose own property shrunk for him.

hebrew_text: אַרְבַּע, יוֹשֶׁבֶת בְּקָתֶדְרָא. אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר חֲנַנְיָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ יוֹשֶׁבֶת בְּקָתֶדְרָא, אֲבָל מוֹזֶגֶת לוֹ כּוֹס וּמַצַּעַת לוֹ אֶת הַמִּטָּה ומַרְחֶצֶת לוֹ פָּנָיו יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו.
human_translation: four she may sit in a chair Rav Yitzḥak bar Ḥananya said Rav Huna said: Although they said she may sit in a chair she pour his cup; and make his bed; and wash his face, hands, and feet,
llm_translation: Four, she sits in the katedra. Rav Yitzchak bar Chananya said in the name of Rav Huna: Even though they said she sits in the katedra, but she pours him a cup, and makes the bed for him, and washes his face, hands, and feet.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר חֲנַנְיָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כׇּל מְלָאכוֹת שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה עוֹשָׂה לְבַעְלָהּ, נִדָּה עוֹשָׂה לְבַעְלָהּ, חוּץ מִמְּזִיגַת הַכּוֹס, וְהַצָּעַת הַמִּטָּה, וְהַרְחָצַת פָּנָיו יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Ḥananya said Rav Huna said All tasks that a wife performs for her husband, a menstruating woman may perform for her husband, except for: Pouring cup; and making bed; and washing face, hands, and feet.
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Chananya said in the name of Rav Huna: All tasks that a woman does for her husband, she does for her husband, except for pouring the cup, making the bed, and washing his face, hands, and feet.

hebrew_text: וְהַצָּעַת הַמִּטָּה. אָמַר רָבָא: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בְּפָנָיו, אֲבָל שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו — לֵית לַן בַּהּ. וּמְזִיגַת הַכּוֹס. שְׁמוּאֵל מְחַלְּפָא לֵיהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ בִּידָא דִשְׂמָאלָא. אַבָּיֵי מַנְּחָא לֵיהּ אַפּוּמָּא דְכוּבָּא. רָבָא אַבֵּי סַדְיָא. רַב פָּפָּא אַשַּׁרְשִׁיפָא.
human_translation: And making bed, Rava said: We said only in front of him, but not in front of him, we have no with it. pouring cup, Shmuel’s wife would change toward him with her left hand, Abaye’s place on top of a barrel, Rava’s on his pillow, Rav Pappa’s on the bench
llm_translation: The text: "And the leaning of the bed. Rava said: We only said this when it is in front of him, but if it is not in front of him - we do not have a concern with it. And the mixing of the cup. Shmuel would pass it to his household with his left hand. Abbaye would place a sponge of lead for him. Rava, Abaye the physician. Rav Pappa the astrologer."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר חֲנַנְיָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הַכֹּל מְשַׁהִין בִּפְנֵי הַשַּׁמָּשׁ, חוּץ מִבָּשָׂר וְיַיִן. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בָּשָׂר שָׁמֵן וְיַיִן יָשָׁן. אָמַר רָבָא: בָּשָׂר שָׁמֵן — כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ, יַיִן יָשָׁן — בִּתְקוּפַת תַּמּוּז.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Ḥananya said Rav Huna said: All withheld from before the waiter, except for meat and wine, Rav Ḥisda said: fatty meat and aged wine. Rava said: fatty meat all year round aged wine during the season of Tammuz,
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Chananya said in the name of Rav Huna: All are permitted before sunset, except for meat and wine. Rav Chisda said: fatty meat and old wine. Rava said: fatty meat - the entire year, old wine - during the summer solstice.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עָנָן בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא: הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל וְאַיְיתוֹ לֵיהּ תַּבְשִׁילָא דְאַרְדֵי, וְאִי לָאו דִּיהַב לִי, אִיסְתַּכַּנִי. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא וְאַיְיתוֹ לֵיהּ גַּרְגְּלִידֵי דְלִיפְתָּא בְּחַלָּא, וְאִי לָאו דִּיהַב לִי, אִיסְתַּכַּנִי. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תְּמַרְתָּא דַּהֲנוּנִיתָא. כְּלָלָא דְמִילְּתָא: כֹּל דְּאִית לֵיהּ רֵיחָא וְאִית לֵיהּ קִיּוּהָא.
human_translation: Rav Anan bar Taḥalifa said: I was standing before Mar Shmuel, and they brought him a cooked dish of mushrooms, and if he had not given me I would have been endangered Rav Ashi said: I was standing before Rav Kahana, and they brought him slices [ gargelidei ] of turnip in vinegar, and if he had not given me I would have been endangered. Rav Pappa said: Even a fragrant date The principle of the matter everything that has an aroma or has a sharp taste
llm_translation: Rav Anan bar Tachlifa said: We were standing before Mar Shmuel, and they brought him a dish of lentils. If he gives it to me, I will partake. Rav Ashe said: We were standing before Rav Kahana, and they brought him calf's feet cooked in milk. If he gives it to me, I will partake. Rav Papa said: Even a date of Nehunia. The general principle is: whoever has a sense of smell and has an appetite.

hebrew_text: אֲבוּהּ בַּר אִיהִי וּמִנְיָמִין בַּר אִיהִי, חַד סָפֵי מִכֹּל מִינָא וּמִינָא, וְחַד סָפֵי מֵחַד מִינָא. מָר — מִשְׁתַּעֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ בַּהֲדֵיהּ, וּמָר — לָא מִשְׁתַּעֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ בַּהֲדֵיהּ.
human_translation: Avuh bar Ihi and Minyamin bar Ihi, one of them to give from every type one would give one of the types Elijah spoke with Sage, but Elijah did not speak with that Sage,
llm_translation: Avuh bar Ihi and Minyamin bar Ihi, one end from all kinds and kinds, and one end from one kind. Mar - Eliyahu appeared to him, and Mar - Eliyahu did not appear to him.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ תַּרְתֵּין חֲסִידֵי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: רַב מָרִי וְרַב פִּנְחָס בְּנֵי רַב חִסְדָּא, מָר קָדֵים סָפֵי, וּמָר מְאַחַר סָפֵי. דְּקָדֵים סָפֵי — אֵלִיָּהוּ מִשְׁתַּעֵי בַּהֲדֵיהּ, דִּמְאַחַר סָפֵי — לָא מִשְׁתַּעֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ בַּהֲדֵיהּ.
human_translation: two pious men, and some say Rav Mari and Rav Pineḥas, the sons of Rav Ḥisda: Sage would give before Sage would give after who gave earlier, Elijah spoke with him. But who gave later, Elijah did not speak with him.
llm_translation: Behold, there were two pious individuals, and they said: "Rav Mari and Rav Pinchas, sons of Rav Chisda, one is early to finish, and one is late to finish. The one who finishes early—Eliyahu appears to him, but the one who finishes late—Eliyahu does not appear to him."

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר וּמָר זוּטְרָא וְרַב אָשֵׁי הָווּ קָא יָתְבִי אַפִּיתְחָא דְּבֵי אִזְגּוּר מַלְכָּא. חָלֵיף וְאָזֵיל אֲטוּרַנְגָּא דְמַלְכָּא. חַזְיֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְמָר זוּטְרָא
human_translation: Ameimar and Mar Zutra and Rav Ashi were sitting at the entrance to the house of King Izgur. The king’s chief butler was passing by Rav Ashi saw Mar Zutra’s
llm_translation: Ammar and Mar Zutra and Rav Ashe were sitting at the entrance of the house of the Exilarch. He turned and went to the palace of the king. Rav Ashe saw Mar Zutra.

hebrew_text: דַּחֲוַור אַפֵּיהּ, שְׁקַל בְּאֶצְבַּעְתֵּיהּ אַנַּח לֵיהּ בְּפוּמֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַפְסַדְתְּ לִסְעוֹדְתָּא דְּמַלְכָּא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי תִּיעְבֵּיד הָכִי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאן דְּעָבֵיד הָכִי פְּסִיל לְמַאֲכַל דְּמַלְכָּא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: דָּבָר אַחֵר חֲזַאי בֵּיהּ. בְּדַקוּ וְלָא אַשְׁכַּחוּ. שְׁקַל אֶצְבַּעְתֵּיהּ, אַנַּח עֲלֵיהּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכָא מִי בָּדְקִיתוּ? בְּדַקוּ אַשְׁכַּחוּ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: מַאי טַעְמָא סָמְכַתְּ אַנִּיסָּא? אֲמַר לְהוּ: חֲזַאי רוּחַ צָרַעַת דְּקָא פָרְחָה עִילָּוֵיהּ.
human_translation: face blanch took with his finger put it in mouth. said to him: You have spoiled the king’s meal, said to him: Why did you do this? He said to them: The one who makes such spoiled the king’s food. They said to him: Why He said to them: I saw something else, in this They checked and didn’t find anything. He took his finger and placed it on said to them: Did you check here? They checked found The Sages said to What is the reason you relied on a miracle He said to them: I saw a leprous spirit hovering over
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Dachavar his nose, took with his fingers a breath for him in his mouth. He said to him: You have ruined the king's meal. They said to him: Why did you do this? He said to them: Whoever does this, a graven image for the king's food. They said to him: Why? He said to them: Another thing I see in it. They examined and did not find. He took his fingers, breathed on it, and said to them: Did you examine here? They examined and found. The Rabbis said to him: What is the reason you relied on the miracle? He said to them: I see the spirit of leprosy spreading on it."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא רוֹמָאָה דַּאֲמַר לָהּ לְהַהִיא אִיתְּתָא: מִינַּסְבַת לִי? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: לָא. אֲזַל אַיְיתִי רֻימָּנֵי, פַּלִּי וַאֲכַל קַמַּהּ. כֹּל מַיָּא דְּצַעֲרִי לַהּ, בְּלַעְתֵּיהּ, וְלָא הַב לַהּ עַד דְּזָג לַהּ. לְסוֹף אֲמַר לַהּ: אִי מַסֵּינָא לָךְ, מִינַּסְבַת לִי? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אִין. אֲזַל אַיְיתִי רֻימָּנֵי, פַּלִּי וַאֲכַל קַמַּהּ. אֲמַר לַהּ: כֹּל מַיָּא דְּצַעֲרִי לִךְ, תּוּף שְׁדַאי תּוּף שְׁדַאי! עַד דְּנָפְקָא מִינַּהּ כִּי הוּצָא יַרְקָא וְאִתְּסִיאַת.
human_translation: A certain Roman said to a certain woman: Will you marry me? She said to him: No. he went and brought pomegranates and peeled them and ate in front of her she swallowed all saliva that caused her anguish, but he did not give her until she became ill Ultimately, he said to her: If I cure you, will you marry me? She said to him: Yes. He went and brought pomegranates, peeled them and ate in front of her. He said to her: All the saliva that causes you anguish, spit it out, spit it out. until like a green leaf came out of her, and she was cured.
llm_translation: That Roman woman who said to that certain woman: "Are you married to me?" She said to him: "No." He went, brought pomegranates, peeled and fed her. All the water that caused her distress, she swallowed, and did not bring it up until she vomited. In the end, he said to her: "If I marry you, will you be married to me?" She said to him: "No." He went, brought pomegranates, peeled and fed her. He said to her: "All the water that causes you distress, spit it out, spit it out!" Until she expelled from her mouth a greenish liquid and was relieved.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹשָׂה בַּצֶּמֶר. בְּצֶמֶר אִין, בְּפִשְׁתִּים לָא. מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵינוֹ כּוֹפָהּ לֹא לַעֲמוֹד לִפְנֵי אָבִיו, וְלֹא לַעֲמוֹד לִפְנֵי בְנוֹ, וְלֹא לִיתֵּן תֶּבֶן לִפְנֵי בְהֶמְתּוֹ. אֲבָל כּוֹפָהּ לִיתֵּן תֶּבֶן לִפְנֵי בְקָרוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף אֵינוֹ כּוֹפָהּ לַעֲשׂוֹת בְּפִשְׁתָּן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁפִּשְׁתָּן מַסְרִיחַ אֶת הַפֶּה, וּמְשַׁרְבֵּט אֶת הַשְּׂפָתַיִם. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּכִיתָּנָא רוֹמָאָה.
human_translation: make from wool. must from wool, not from flax. Whose mishna? It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught may not compel to stand before his father or to stand before his son or to place straw before his animals, but he can compel her to place straw before his cattle, Rabbi Yehuda said: He also cannot compel her to make from flax, because flax, causes the mouth to smell and the lips to stiffen. This applies only to Roman flax,
llm_translation: And he shall make it of wool. With wool, yes; with linen, no. The Mishnah teaches — this is the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught: One may not force his son to stand before him, nor to stand before his son, nor to give fodder to his animal. But he may force him to give fodder to his ox. Rabbi Yehuda says: He may not even force him to work with linen, because linen causes bad breath and chaps the lips. And these matters are in the Roman tunic.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ הִכְנִיסָה לוֹ מֵאָה שְׁפָחוֹת. אָמַר רַב מַלְכִּיּוֹ אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Even if she brought him a hundred maidservants, Rav Malkiyyu said Rav Adda bar Ahava said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Even if he brought in for him a hundred maidservants. Rav Malkiyo said in the name of Rav Adda bar Ahava: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: שַׁפּוּד, שְׁפָחוֹת וְגוּמוֹת — רַב מַלְכִּיּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina, son of Rav Ika, said: a skewer maidservants and follicles Rav Malkiyyu.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chanina, son of Rav Ika: "Shafud, Sh'fachot, and G'mot - Rav Malkiyo."

hebrew_text: בְּלוֹרִית, אֵפֶר מִקְלֶה וּגְבִינָה — רַב מַלְכִּיָּא.
human_translation: forelock, burnt ashes and cheese Rav Malkiya.
llm_translation: In the BeLorit, ashes of a stick and cheese - Rav Malkiya.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: מַתְנִיתִין וּמַתְנִיתָא — רַב מַלְכִּיָּא. שְׁמַעְתָּתָא — רַב מַלְכִּיּוֹ. וְסִימָנָךְ: מַתְנִיתָא מַלְכְּתָא. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ — אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ שְׁפָחוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: a mishna or a baraita Rav Malkiya, halakhot Rav Malkiyyu. And your mnemonic is: The mishna is a queen [ malketa ], What is between There is between them maidservants.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Matnitin and Matnita — Rav Malkiya. Shemasta — Rav Malkiyo. And your mnemonic: Matnita Malketa. What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in regard to maidservants.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳. הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא! אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּמִיטַּלְּלָא בְּגוּרְיָיתָא קִיטָנְיָיתָא וְנַדְרְשִׁיר.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: This is the first tanna , The between them is she plays with small dogs [ guriyyata kitanyata ] or games [ nadrashir ]
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says, and so forth. This is what the first Tanna taught! There is a difference between them: one who mixes in a large basket and a small basket, and it is valid.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּדִּיר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ מִתַּשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת. בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: שַׁבָּת אַחַת.
human_translation: one who vows his wife from marital relations Beit Shammai say: two weeks, Beit Hillel say: one week.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who prohibits his wife from marital relations on the bed, Beit Shammai say: two Sabbaths. Beit Hillel say: one Sabbath.

hebrew_text: הַתַּלְמִידִים יוֹצְאִין לְתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. הַפּוֹעֲלִים שַׁבָּת אַחַת. הָעוֹנָה הָאֲמוּרָה בַּתּוֹרָה: הַטַּיָּילִין — בְּכׇל יוֹם. הַפּוֹעֲלִים — שְׁתַּיִם בְּשַׁבָּת. הַחַמָּרִים — אַחַת בְּשַׁבָּת. הַגַּמָּלִים — אַחַת לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם. הַסַּפָּנִים — אַחַת לְשִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: Students may leave to learn Torah without permission thirty days, laborers one week. The set interval stated in the Torah Men of leisure, every day, laborers twice a week, donkey drivers once a week, camel drivers once every thirty days, sailors once every six months. the statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: The students go out to study Torah without permission for thirty days. Workers - one Sabbath. The season mentioned in the Torah: travelers - every day. Workers - two on Sabbath. Donkeys - one on Sabbath. Camels - one every thirty days. Ships - one every six months. The words of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? גָּמְרִי מִיּוֹלֶדֶת נְקֵבָה. וּבֵית הִלֵּל? גָּמְרִי מִיּוֹלֶדֶת זָכָר.
human_translation: What is the reason Beit Shammai They derive a woman who gave birth a female And Beit Hillel They derive a woman who gave birth a male,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason for the opinion of Beit Shammai? They learn from a female newborn. And Beit Hillel? They learn from a male newborn.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל נָמֵי נִגְמְרוּ מִיּוֹלֶדֶת נְקֵבָה! אִי מִיּוֹלֶדֶת גָּמְרִי לַהּ — הָכִי נָמֵי, אֶלָּא בֵּית הִלֵּל מִנִּדָּה גָּמְרִי לַהּ.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel should also derive from a woman who gave birth a female, If they derived it from a woman who gave birth, indeed Rather, Beit Hillel derived it from a menstruating woman,
llm_translation: House of Hillel agrees that they are completed from a female fetus! If completed from a male fetus, they would say to her - this is what they say, rather House of Hillel completes her from a menstruating woman.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: מִידֵּי דִּשְׁכִיחַ מִמִּידֵּי דִּשְׁכִיחַ, וּמָר סָבַר: מִידֵּי דְּהוּא גָּרֵים לַהּ מִמִּידֵּי דְּהוּא גָּרֵים לַהּ.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Sage, holds a common matter from a common matter. And Sage, holds a matter that one caused, from a matter that he caused,
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? One Master holds: from where it is common, from where it is common, and one Master holds: from where he dwells with her, from where he dwells with her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּמְפָרֵשׁ, אֲבָל בִּסְתָם — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל יוֹצִיא לְאַלְתַּר וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בִּסְתָם נָמֵי יַמְתִּין, שֶׁמָּא יִמְצָא פֶּתַח לְנִדְרוֹ.
human_translation: Rav said: dispute concerns one who specifies but unspecified all agree he must divorce immediately and give marriage contract. And Shmuel said: Even unspecified he should also wait perhaps he will find an extenuation of his vow
llm_translation: Rav said: Dispute in a specific case, but in a general case - the words of everyone should be taken out immediately and put in writing. And Shmuel said: Even in a general case, one should wait, lest he find an opening for his vow.

hebrew_text: הָא פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא, דִּתְנַן: הַמַּדִּיר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ מִלֵּיהָנוֹת לוֹ, עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — יַעֲמִיד פַּרְנָס, יוֹתֵר מִכָּאן — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. וְאָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּמְפָרֵשׁ, אֲבָל בִּסְתָם — יוֹצִיא לְאַלְתַּר וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בִּסְתָם נָמֵי יַמְתִּין, שֶׁמָּא יִמְצָא פֶּתַח לְנִדְרוֹ!
human_translation: Didn’t they disagree about this once As we learned one who vows his wife from benefiting from him up to thirty days, he must appoint a trustee more than that he must divorce and give marriage contract. And Rav said They taught only where he specifies but without specification, he must divorce immediately and give marriage contract. And Shmuel said: Even without specification, he should also wait, perhaps he will discover an extenuation of his vow.
llm_translation: This is a dispute in it one time, as we learned: One who prohibits his wife from benefitting from him, for thirty days - he must provide sustenance, beyond this - he must divorce her and give her a marriage contract. And Rav said: They only taught this regarding when he specifies, but if it is general - he must divorce her immediately and give her a marriage contract. And Shmuel said: Even if it is general, he should wait, lest he find a loophole for his vow!

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא: בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַב — מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר בְּפַרְנָס, אֲבָל בְּהַהִיא דְּאֶפְשָׁר בְּפַרְנָס — אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל. וְאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָהִיא — בְּהָךְ קָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, אֲבָל בְּהָא — אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַב, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: It necessary if it were stated with regard to this in this Rav says because there is no possibility of a trustee, but with regard to that which can be by a trustee, say concedes to Shmuel if was stated with regard to that in that Shmuel said but in this say concedes to Rav. it necessary
llm_translation: The matter is, for if it was stated in this case: in this case Rav said - because it is not possible for sustenance, but in that case where it is possible for sustenance - say it is in agreement with Shmuel. And if it was stated in that case - in that case Shmuel said, but in this case - say it is in agreement with Rav, this is necessary.

hebrew_text: הַתַּלְמִידִים יוֹצְאִין לְתַלְמוּד וְכוּ׳. בִּרְשׁוּת כַּמָּה? כַּמָּה דְּבָעֵי.
human_translation: students may leave to learn Torah, with permission, how long as long as they want.
llm_translation: The students go out to study, etc. With whose permission? With the permission of Ba'ei.

hebrew_text: אוֹרְחָא דְמִילְּתָא כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַב: חֹדֶשׁ כָּאן, וְחֹדֶשׁ בַּבַּיִת. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְכׇל דְּבַר הַמַּחְלְקוֹת הַבָּאָה וְהַיּוֹצֵאת חֹדֶשׁ בְּחֹדֶשׁ לְכֹל חׇדְשֵׁי הַשָּׁנָה״. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: חֹדֶשׁ כָּאן וּשְׁנַיִם בְּבֵיתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חֹדֶשׁ יִהְיוּ בַלְּבָנוֹן שְׁנַיִם חֳדָשִׁים בְּבֵיתוֹ״.
human_translation: how much manner for this matter? Rav said: a month here, and a month at home. as it is stated “In any matter of the courses, which came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year” And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one month here, and two in his home, as it is stated “A month they were in Lebanon, and two months at home”
llm_translation: The way of the matter how much? Rav said: A month here, and a month in the house. As it is stated: "For every matter of dispute that comes and goes, a month in a month, for all the months of the year." And Rabbi Yochanan said: A month here and two in his house, as it is stated: "There shall be a month in Lebanon, two months in his house."

hebrew_text: וְרַב נָמֵי, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר מֵהַהִיא? שָׁאנֵי בִּנְיַן בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, דְּאֶפְשָׁר עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר מֵהַהִיא? שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאִית לֵיהּ הַרְוָוחָה.
human_translation: And what is the reason Rav did not also say from that The construction of the Temple is different, since it is possible by others, And what is the reason Rabbi Yoḥanan did not say from that There, it is different, since he gains profit
llm_translation: Rav Namei, what reason is there that he did not say it from that source? It is different regarding the construction of the Temple, for it is possible through others. And Rabbi Yochanan, what reason is there that he did not say it from that source? It is different there, for he has a support.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: אֲנָחָה שׁוֹבֶרֶת חֲצִי גּוּפוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה בֶן אָדָם הֵאָנַח בְּשִׁבְרוֹן מׇתְנַיִם וּבִמְרִירוּת תֵּאָנַח״. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אַף כׇּל גּוּפוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיָה כִּי יֹאמְרוּ אֵלֶיךָ עַל מָה אַתָּה נֶאֱנָח וְאָמַרְתָּ אֶל שְׁמוּעָה כִי בָאָה וְנָמֵס כׇּל לֵב וְרָפוּ כׇל יָדַיִם וְכִהֲתָה כׇל רוּחַ וְכׇל בִּרְכַּיִם תֵּלַכְנָה מַּיִם״.
human_translation: Rav said: Groaning breaks half of a person’s body, as it is stated: “Groan, therefore, you son of man, with the breaking of your loins, groan so bitterly” And Rabbi Yoḥanan said even a person’s entire body, as it is stated: “And it shall be, when they say to you: Why are you groaning? That you shall say: Due to the tiding, for it comes, and every heart shall melt, and all hands shall be slack, and every spirit shall be faint, and all knees shall drip with water”
llm_translation: Rav said: A sigh breaks half of a person's body, as it is stated: "And you, son of man, sigh with breaking of loins and with bitterness you shall sigh." And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even his entire body, as it is stated: "And it shall be when they say to you, 'Why do you sigh?' that you shall answer, 'Because of the news that is coming; every heart will melt, all hands will be feeble, every spirit will faint, and all knees will drip with water.'"

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב ״בְּשִׁבְרוֹן מׇתְנַיִם״! הָהִיא דְּכִי מַתְחֲלָא — מִמׇּתְנַיִם מַתְחֲלָא. וְרַב נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב: ״וְנָמֵס כׇּל לֵב וְרָפוּ כׇל יָדַיִם וְכִהֲתָה כׇל רוּחַ״! שָׁאנֵי שְׁמוּעָה דְּבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, דְּתַקִּיפָא טוּבָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan also Isn’t it written: “With the breaking of your loins,” This that when begins it begins from his loins. And Rav also Isn’t it written: “And every heart shall melt, and all hands shall be slack, and every spirit shall be faint,” The news with regard to the Temple is different, as it is extremely crushing
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan Nami said, it is written "in Shevron he died"! That one who becomes ill — from Shevron becomes ill. And Rav Nami said, it is written: "and all hearts will melt, and all hands will become weak, and all spirits will faint"! This is different from the tradition of the Temple, which is very strong.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹי דַּהֲווֹ קָאָזְלִי בְּאוֹרְחָא בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. לָא אִימְּצִי גּוֹי לְסַגּוֹיֵי בַּהֲדֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל. אַדְכְּרֵיהּ חוּרְבַּן בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, נְגִיד וְאִיתְּנַח, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא אִימְּצִי גּוֹי לְסַגּוֹיֵי בַּהֲדֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו אָמְרִיתוּ ״אֲנָחָה שׁוֹבֶרֶת חֲצִי גּוּפוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנֵי מִילֵּי מִילְּתָא חַדְתִּי, אֲבָל הָא דַּשְׁנַן בָּהּ — לָא. דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: (דְּמַלְּפִי) [דְּמַלְּפָא] תִּכְלֵי — לָא בָּהֲתָה.
human_translation: a certain Jew and a gentile were walking along the road together. The gentile could not keep up with the Jew, he reminded him of the destruction of the Temple The Jew sighed and groaned, but even so the gentile could not keep up with him, said to him: Don’t you say that groaning breaks half of a person’s body? He said to him: This applies only a new affair, but this, which we have repeatedly not as people say: One who is used to being bereaved does not panic [ bahata ]
llm_translation: That Israelite and non-Jew who were walking on the road together. He did not find a non-Jew to accompany him in the presence of Jews. He mentioned to him the destruction of the Temple, its leaders and its ministers, and even so, he did not find a non-Jew to accompany him in his presence. He said to him: Did they not say, "I am breaking half of a person's body"? He said to him: Those are new matters, but what we learned in it - no. For people say: When the axe is dull - it is not in its sharpening.

hebrew_text: הַטַּיָּילִין בְּכׇל יוֹם. מַאי ״טַיָּילִין״? אָמַר רָבָא: בְּנֵי פִירְקֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מַאן דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ ״שָׁוְא לָכֶם מַשְׁכִּימֵי קוּם מְאַחֲרֵי שֶׁבֶת אוֹכְלֵי לֶחֶם הָעֲצָבִים כֵּן יִתֵּן לִידִידוֹ שֵׁנָא״, וְאָמַר רַב יִצְחָק: אֵלּוּ נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן שֶׁל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁמְּנַדְּדוֹת שֵׁינָה מֵעֵינֵיהֶם בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, וּבָאוֹת לְחַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ בְּנֵי פִירְקֵי?!
human_translation: men of leisure every day. What men of leisure? Rava said: students their lectures Abaye said to him: those about whom it is written: “It is vain for you to rise early and sit up late, you that eat the bread of toil, so He gives to His beloved in sleep” and Rabbi Yitzḥak said These are the wives of Torah scholars who deprive their eyes of sleep in this world and reach the life of the World-to-Come. and you say students their lectures
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Ha-tayyilin b'kol yom. Mai 'tayyilin'? Amar Rava: Bnei pirkei. Amar lei Abaye: Man dichtiv behu 'shavu lakhem mashkimei kum me'acharei shevet okhlei lechem ha'atzavim ken yiten liyidido shena,' ve'amar Rav Yitzchak: Elu neshoteihen shel talmidei chachamim, she'menad'dedot sheinah me'eineihem ba'olam hazeh, u'va'ot le'chayei ha'olam haba, ve'at amarta b'nei pirkei?!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כִּדְרַב, דְּאָמַר רַב: כְּגוֹן רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר שִׁילַת, דְּאָכֵיל מִדִּידֵיהּ, וְשָׁתֵי מִדִּידֵיהּ, וְגָנֵי בְּטוּלָּא דְאַפַּדְנֵיהּ, וְלָא חָלֵיף פְּרִיסְתְּקָא דְמַלְכָּא אַבָּבֵיהּ. כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר: כְּגוֹן מְפַנְּקִי דְמַעְרְבָא.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: in accordance with the opinion of Rav, as Rav said: such as Rabbi Shmuel bar Sheilat, who ate his own drank his own slept in the shade of his own house, and the king’s tax collector [ peristaka ] did not pass by his door, When Ravin came he said: For example, the pampered in the West,
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Like Rav, as Rav said: Such as Rav Shmuel bar Shilat, who would eat from his own, drink from his own, sleep in the shadow of his bed, and not turn over the bread of his king, his father. When Ravin came, he said: Like the indulgent ones of Ma'arva.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ הֲוָה קָאֵי בֵּי בָאנֵי. הֲווֹ סָמְכִי לֵיהּ תְּרֵי עַבְדֵי. אִיפְּחִית בֵּי בָאנֵי מִתּוּתֵיהּ, אִיתְרְמִי לֵיהּ עַמּוּדָא, סְלֵיק וְאַסְּקִינְהוּ. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הֲוָה קָסָלֵיק בְּדַרְגָּא, הֲווֹ סָמְכִי לֵיהּ רַב אַמֵּי וְרַב אַסִּי. אִיפְּחִתָא דַּרְגָּא תּוּתֵיהּ, סְלֵיק וְאַסְּקִינְהוּ. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּהָכִי, לְמָה לֵיהּ לְמִיסְמְכֵיהּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִם כֵּן מָה אַנִּיחַ לְעֵת זִקְנָה?
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu was standing in the bathhouse and two slaves were supporting The bathhouse collapsed under him He found a pillar, got out, and pulled them up Rabbi Yoḥanan was going up stairs, Rav Ami and Rav Asi were supporting The stair collapsed under him, but he went up and pulled them up The Sages said to him: Since so why do you need to support you? He said to them: If so, what will I leave for old age?
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu was standing in the house of the bathhouse attendants. Two slaves were supporting him. When the bathhouse attendants removed their support from him, a pillar collapsed, and he ascended and saved them. Rabbi Yochanan was climbing a ladder, and Rab Ami and Rab Asi were supporting him. When the rung of the ladder broke, he ascended and saved them. The Sages said to him: Since this is the case, why did you need to rely on them? He said to them: If so, what will I leave for old age?

hebrew_text: וְהַפּוֹעֲלִים שְׁתַּיִם בַּשַּׁבָּת. וְהָתַנְיָא: הַפּוֹעֲלִים אַחַת בַּשַּׁבָּת! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּעוֹשִׂין מְלָאכָה בְּעִירָן, כָּאן בְּעוֹשִׂין מְלָאכָה בְּעִיר אַחֶרֶת. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַפּוֹעֲלִים שְׁתַּיִם בַּשַּׁבָּת, בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּעוֹשִׂין מְלָאכָה בְּעִירָן, אֲבָל בְּעוֹשִׂין מְלָאכָה בְּעִיר אַחֶרֶת — אַחַת בַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: laborers twice a week. Isn’t it taught laborers, once a week? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: not difficult: Here, where they work in their own city. There, where they work in another city. This is also taught laborers, twice a week. In what is this statement said? when they work in their own city, but when they work in another city, once a week.
llm_translation: The workers two on the Sabbath. And it was taught: the workers one on the Sabbath! Said Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina, not difficult: here they are doing work in their city, here they are doing work in another city. It was also taught likewise: the workers two on the Sabbath, in what case are these words said — when they are doing work in their city, but when they are doing work in another city — one on the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: הַחַמָּרִים אַחַת בַּשַּׁבָּת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר רַב חָנָן לְאַבָּיֵי: אִיכְּפַל תַּנָּא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן טַיָּיל וּפוֹעֵל? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא,
human_translation: donkey drivers once a week, Rabba bar Rav Ḥanan said to Abaye: Did the tanna go to all that trouble just to teach us a man of leisure and a laborer? He said to him: No,
llm_translation: The donkeys one on the Sabbath. Said to him Rabba bar Rav Hana to Abbaye: How did the Mishnah teach us to hear "tying and untying"? He said to him: No.

hebrew_text: אַכּוּלְּהוּ. וְהָא שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים קָאָמַר? אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ פַּת בְּסַלּוֹ לְמִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ פַּת בְּסַלּוֹ.
human_translation: with regard to all of them, But it said six months; one who has bread in his basket is not comparable to one who does not have bread in his basket.
llm_translation: He ate. But is he saying six months? It is not comparable - one who has bread in his basket to one who does not have bread in his basket.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר רַב חָנָן לְאַבָּיֵי: חַמָּר וְנַעֲשֶׂה גַּמָּל, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רוֹצָה אִשָּׁה בְּקַב וְתִיפְלוּת מֵעֲשָׂרָה קַבִּין וּפְרִישׁוּת.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Hanan said to Abaye: If a donkey driver become a camel driver, what He answered him: A woman prefers a kav , with conjugal relations to ten kav with abstinence.
llm_translation: Rabah bar Rav Ḥanan said to Abbaye: Wine turns into vinegar, what is it? He said to him: A woman wants a kab of flax and ten kab of tithe and separation.

hebrew_text: הַסַּפָּנִים אַחַת לְשִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. אָמַר רַב בְּרוֹנָא אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר רַב: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הַתַּלְמִידִים יוֹצְאִין לְתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה שְׁתַּיִם וְשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת. אָמַר רָבָא: סָמְכוּ רַבָּנַן אַדְּרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה וְעָבְדִי עוֹבָדָא בְּנַפְשַׁיְיהוּ.
human_translation: sailors, once every six months. This is the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. Rav Berona said Rav said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. Rav Adda bar Ahava said Rav said: This is the statement of Rabbi Eliezer, but the Rabbis say: Students may leave to study Torah two or three years without permission Rava said: The Sages relied on Rabbi Adda bar Ahava’s and performed an action themselves,
llm_translation: The sappanin one for six months, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. Rav Barona said in the name of Rav: The halacha is according to Rabbi Eliezer. Rav Adda bar Ahava said in the name of Rav: This is the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer, but the sages say: Students may engage in Torah study for two or three years without permission. Rava said: The Rabbis relied on Rav Adda bar Ahava and acted according to their own judgment.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּרַב רְחוּמִי הֲוָה שְׁכִיחַ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא בְּמָחוֹזָא, הֲוָה רְגִיל דַּהֲוָה אָתֵי לְבֵיתֵיהּ כֹּל מַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְכִיפּוּרֵי. יוֹמָא חַד מְשַׁכְתֵּיהּ שְׁמַעְתָּא. הֲוָה מְסַכְּיָא דְּבֵיתְהוּ: הַשְׁתָּא אָתֵי, הַשְׁתָּא אָתֵי. לָא אֲתָא. חֲלַשׁ דַּעְתַּהּ, אַחִית דִּמְעֲתָא מֵעֵינַהּ. הֲוָה יָתֵיב בְּאִיגָּרָא, אִפְּחִית אִיגָּרָא מִתּוּתֵיהּ וְנָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: as about Rav Reḥumi, who would commonly before Rava in Meḥoza: He was accustomed to come to his home every eve of Yom Kippur. One day he was engrossed in halakha His wife was expecting him Now he is coming, now he is coming. he did not come. She was distressed a tear fell from her eye. was sitting on the roof. The roof collapsed under him and he died.
llm_translation: This is what Rav Reḥumi would often find before Rava in the district. He was accustomed that he would come to his house every day of Yom Kippur. One day, he delayed. He heard a sound. He was covering his head: "Now he comes, now he comes." He did not come. Her mind weakened, a tear fell from her eye. He was sitting on the roof, he removed the roof from above him and his soul departed.

hebrew_text: עוֹנָה שֶׁל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים אֵימַת? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת לְעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת. ״אֲשֶׁר פִּרְיוֹ יִתֵּן בְּעִתּוֹ״, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב הוּנָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב נַחְמָן: זֶה הַמְשַׁמֵּשׁ מִטָּתוֹ מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת לְעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: When the time for Torah scholars Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: from Shabbat eve to Shabbat eve, “that brings forth its fruit in its season” Rav Yehuda said, and some say Rav Huna, and some say Rav Naḥman: This who engages in marital relations, from Shabbat eve to Shabbat eve.
llm_translation: The question of the punishment of the disciples of the sages, when? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: from one Shabbat eve to the next Shabbat eve. "Whose fruit will give in its time," said Rav Yehudah, and some say Rav Huna, and some say Rav Nachman: this is one who engages in marital relations from one Shabbat eve to the next Shabbat eve.

hebrew_text: יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא, חַתְנֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי, הֲוָה אָזֵיל וְיָתֵיב בְּבֵי רַב, וְכׇל בֵּי שִׁמְשֵׁי הֲוָה אָתֵי לְבֵיתֵיהּ, וְכִי הֲוָה אָתֵי, הֲוָה קָא חָזֵי קַמֵּיהּ עַמּוּדָא דְנוּרָא. יוֹמָא חַד מְשַׁכְתֵּיהּ שְׁמַעְתָּא. כֵּיוָן דְּלָא חָזֵי הָהוּא סִימָנָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי יַנַּאי: כְּפוּ מִטָּתוֹ, שֶׁאִילְמָלֵי יְהוּדָה קַיָּים לֹא בִּיטֵּל עוֹנָתוֹ. הֲוַאי כִּ״שְׁגָגָה שֶׁיּוֹצָא מִלִּפְנֵי הַשַּׁלִּיט״, וְנָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya son-in-law of Rabbi Yannai, would go and sit in the study hall, and every at twilight he would come to his house. When he would come, would see a pillar of fire preceding him One day he was engrossed in halakha When Rabbi Yannai did not see that sign he said to Turn his bed over, if Yehuda were alive he would not have missed his set interval became “like an error that proceeds from a ruler” and died.
llm_translation: Judah son of Rabbi Hiyya, son-in-law of Rabbi Yannai, would go and sit in the study hall of Rabbi. All the attendants of the sun would come to his house, and when they would come, he would see a pillar of fire standing before him. One day, he pulled his bed and heard. Since he did not see that sign, Rabbi Yannai said to him: "Turn over his bed, for if Judah had not fulfilled his obligation, he would not have neglected his duty." This is like "an unintentional sin that comes out before the ruler," and he saved himself.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אִיעֲסֵק לֵיהּ לִבְרֵיהּ בֵּי רַבִּי חִיָּיא, כִּי מְטָא לְמִיכְתַּב כְּתוּבָּה נָח נַפְשַׁהּ דִּרְבִיתָא. אָמַר רַבִּי: חַס וְשָׁלוֹם פְּסוּלָא אִיכָּא? יְתִיבוּ וְעַיִּינוּ בְּמִשְׁפָּחוֹת, רַבִּי אָתֵי מִשְּׁפַטְיָה בֶּן אֲבִיטַל, וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא אָתֵי מִשִּׁמְעִי אֲחִי דָוִד.
human_translation: Rabbi arranged for his son the household of Rabbi Ḥiyya. When he came to write the marriage contract, the girl died. Rabbi said: Is there, Heaven forbid, some disqualification They sat and looked into the families’ Rabbi was descended from Shefatya ben Avital, Rabbi Ḥiyya was descended from Shimi, David’s brother.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yiaskei to his son, of the house of Rabbi Chiya, when he came to write a document, his soul was at ease. Rabbi said: "Is there a disqualified witness here?" They sat and examined the genealogies. Rabbi Atai is from the descendants of Avital, and Rabbi Chiya is from the family of Shimei, the brother of David.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל אִיעֲסֵק לֵיהּ לִבְרֵיהּ בֵּי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן זִימְרָא. פְּסַקוּ לֵיהּ תַּרְתֵּי סְרֵי שְׁנִין לְמֵיזַל בְּבֵי רַב. אַחְלְפוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: נִיהְווֹ שֵׁית שְׁנִין. אַחְלְפוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֶיכְנֹיס וַהֲדַר אֵיזִיל. הֲוָה קָא מִכְּסִיף מֵאֲבוּהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנִי, דַּעַת קוֹנְךָ יֵשׁ בָּךְ —
human_translation: He went and arranged for his son of the household of Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra. They agreed for him twelve years to go to study in the study hall. They passed in front of he said: Let it be six years. They passed her in front of him he said to them: I will marry her and then go He was ashamed his father, said to him: My son, you have your Maker’s perception,
llm_translation: He went to engage with his son, the house of Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra. They decided to spend two years to go to the house of Rav. They exchanged it before him, he said to them: "It has become six years." They exchanged it before him, he said to them: "How shall I enter and then leave?" He was covering with silver from his father. He said to him: "My son, you have wisdom in you—."

hebrew_text: מֵעִיקָּרָא כְּתִיב: ״תְּבִיאֵמוֹ וְתִטָּעֵמוֹ״, וּלְבַסּוֹף כְּתִיב: ״וְעָשׂוּ לִי מִקְדָּשׁ וְשָׁכַנְתִּי בְּתוֹכָם״.
human_translation: initially it is written: “You bring them and plant them And ultimately it is written: “And let them make Me a Sanctuary, that I may dwell among them”
llm_translation: From the outset it is written: "You shall bring them and plant them," and in the end it is written: "And let them make Me a sanctuary, that I may dwell among them."

hebrew_text: אֲזַל יְתֵיב תַּרְתֵּי סְרֵי שְׁנֵי בְּבֵי רַב. עַד דַּאֲתָא, אִיעֲקַרָא דְּבֵיתְהוּ. אָמַר רַבִּי: הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד, נְגָרְשָׁהּ — יֹאמְרוּ: עֲנִיָּיהּ זוֹ לַשָּׁוְא שִׁימְּרָה. נִינְּסִיב אִיתְּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי — יֹאמְרוּ: זוֹ אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְזוֹ זוֹנָתוֹ. בְּעָא עֲלַהּ רַחֲמֵי וְאִיתַּסִּיאַת.
human_translation: he went and sat for twelve years in the study hall. By the time he came back his wife had become infertile, Rabbi said: What do? If he will divorce her, will say: This poor woman waited for naught. If he will marry another woman will say: This one, is his wife and that one, is his mistress. pleaded to have mercy on her and she was cured.
llm_translation: He went and sat at the entrance of the house of Rav. Until she came, the roof of his house collapsed. Rabbi said: What shall we do? If we divorce her, they will say she was innocent and the house collapsed for no reason. If he marries another woman, they will say she is his wife and she is his harlot. He prayed for mercy and the roof was repaired.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן חֲכִינַאי הֲוָה קָאָזֵיל לְבֵי רַב בְּשִׁילְהֵי הִלּוּלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיעַכַּב לִי עַד דְּאָתֵי בַּהֲדָךְ. לָא אִיעַכַּב לֵיהּ. אֲזַל יְתֵיב תְּרֵי סְרֵי שְׁנֵי בְּבֵי רַב. עַד דְּאָתֵי, אִישְׁתַּנּוֹ שְׁבִילֵי דְמָתָא וְלָא יְדַע לְמֵיזַל לְבֵיתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥananya ben Ḥakhinai went to the study hall at the end of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai’s wedding feast. said to him: Wait for me until I come with you, he did not wait went and sat for twelve years in the study hall. By the time he came back, all the paths of his city had changed and he did not know how to go to his home.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chananya ben Chakinai was walking to the house of Rav in the alleys of his praise of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai. He said to him: "Wait for me until I come with you." He did not wait for him. He went and sat for two or three hours in the house of Rav. Until he came, he placed paths of blood and did not know how to go back to his house.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל יְתֵיב אַגּוּדָּא דְּנַהֲרָא. שְׁמַע לְהַהִיא רְבִיתָא דַּהֲווֹ קָרוּ לַהּ: ״בַּת חֲכִינַאי, בַּת חֲכִינַאי, מַלַּי קוּלְּתִיךְ וְתָא נֵיזִיל״. אֲמַר: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הַאי רְבִיתָא דִּידַן. אֲזַל בָּתְרַהּ. הֲוָה יְתִיבָא דְּבֵיתְהוּ קָא נָהֲלָה קִמְחָא, דַּל עֵינַהּ חֲזִיתֵיהּ, סְוִי לִבַּהּ, פְּרַח רוּחַהּ, אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, עֲנִיָּיה זוֹ זֶה שְׂכָרָהּ?! בְּעָא רַחֲמֵי עֲלַהּ וְ[אַ]חֲיַיהּ.
human_translation: He went sat on the bank of the river and heard people calling to a certain girl: Daughter of Ḥakhinai, daughter of Ḥakhinai, fill your pitcher and come up. He said: I can conclude from this that this is our daughter, He followed her His wife was sitting and sifting flour. She lifted her eyes up, saw him and her heart fluttered she passed away said before Master of the universe, is this the reward of this poor woman? He pleaded for mercy for her and she lived.
llm_translation: He went and sat by the bank of the river. He heard that a certain woman was calling out: "Daughter of the wise, daughter of the wise, your voice is pleasant and your appearance is beautiful." He said: Learn from this the nature of our Torah scholarship. He went after her. She was sitting in her house kneading dough, her eyes were downcast, her heart was pure, her spirit was joyful. He said before Him: Master of the Universe, is this poor woman's reward?! He prayed for mercy upon her and her brothers.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר בֵּיסָא אֲזַיל יְתֵיב תְּרֵי סְרֵי שְׁנֵי בְּבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא. כִּי אֲתָא, אֲמַר: לָא אֶיעֱבֵיד כִּדְעָבֵיד בֶּן חֲכִינַאי. עָיֵיל יָתֵיב בֵּ[י] מִדְרְשָׁא, שְׁלַח לְבֵיתֵיהּ. אֲתָא רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא בְּרֵיהּ, יָתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ. הֲוָה קָא מְשַׁאֵיל לֵיהּ שְׁמַעְתָּא, חֲזָא דְּקָא מְחַדְּדִי שְׁמַעְתָּתֵיהּ, חֲלַשׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ, אֲמַר: אִי הֲוַאי הָכָא, הֲוָה לִי זֶרַע כִּי הַאי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Bisa went and sat for twelve years in the study hall. When he came he said: I will not do what the son of Ḥakhinai, did. He went and sat in the study hall and sent to his house his son Rabbi Oshaya, came and sat before him. asked him halakha , and saw that the halakhot of were incisive, was distressed and said: If I had been here I would have had a child like this.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Beisa went and sat for twelve years in the study hall. When he came, he said: I will not act as Ben Ḥakina did. He went and sat in the study hall, and sent a message to his house. Rabbi Oshaya his son came, and sat before him. He was asking him a matter, and he saw that his understanding was weakening, he weakened his mind, and said: If this one is here, I have a seed like this.

hebrew_text: עָל לְבֵיתֵיהּ, עָל בְּרֵיהּ, קָם קַמֵּיהּ. הוּא סָבַר לְמִשְׁאֲלֵיהּ שְׁמַעְתְּתָא קָא בָעֵי, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ: מִי אִיכָּא אַבָּא דְּקָאֵים מִקַּמֵּי בְּרָא? קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: ״הַחוּט הַמְשׁוּלָּשׁ לֹא בִּמְהֵרָה יִנָּתֵק״ — זֶה רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר בֵּיסָא.
human_translation: went in to his house his son went in stood up before him he thought he wanted to ask him a matter of halakha . His wife said to him: Is there a father who stands up before his son? Rami bar Ḥama read about him: “A threefold cord is not quickly broken” This Rabbi Oshaya, son of Rabbi Ḥama bar Bisa,
llm_translation: He went to his house, to his son, he stood before him. He thought that she wanted to ask him for something, she said to him from her house: "Who is the father who stands before the son?" He called to him: "The twisted thread will not quickly break" - this is Rabbi Oshaya, the son of Rabbi Chama bar Beisa.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא רָעֲיָא דְּבֶן כַּלְבָּא שָׂבוּעַ הֲוָה, חֲזִיתֵיהּ בְּרַתֵּיה דַּהֲוָה צְנִיעַ וּמְעַלֵּי, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אִי מִקַּדַּשְׁנָא לָךְ, אָזְלַתְּ לְבֵי רַב? אֲמַר לַהּ: אִין, אִיקַּדַּשָׁא לֵיהּ בְּצִינְעָה וְשַׁדַּרְתֵּיהּ. שְׁמַע אֲבוּהָ, אַפְּקַהּ מִבֵּיתֵיהּ אַדְּרַהּ הֲנָאָה מִנִּכְסֵיהּ. אֲזַל יְתֵיב תְּרֵי סְרֵי שְׁנִין בְּבֵי רַב. כִּי אֲתָא, אַיְיתִי בַּהֲדֵיהּ תְּרֵי סְרֵי אַלְפֵי תַּלְמִידֵי. שַׁמְעֵיהּ לְהָהוּא סָבָא דְּקָאָמַר לַהּ: עַד כַּמָּה
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva was the shepherd of ben Kalba Savua, daughter saw that he was humble and refined. She said to him: If I betroth myself to you, will you go to the study hall He said to her: Yes. She became betrothed to him privately and sent him Her father heard He removed her from his house vow benefiting from his property. went sat for twelve years in the study hall. When he came he brought twelve thousand students he heard an old man saying to For how long
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, the shepherd of Ben Kalba Savua, was. His daughter saw that she was modest and praiseworthy, she said to him: If it is pleasing to you, would you go to study with a Rabbi? He said to her: No, I will be sanctified through you in modesty and righteousness. Listen, father, she took a precious item from her house and went and supported him. He went and sat for twelve years in the study hall. When he came, he brought with him twelve thousand pairs of students. They heard that old man saying to her: Until when.

hebrew_text: קָא מִדַּבְּרַתְּ אַלְמְנוּת חַיִּים?! אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אִי לְדִידִי צָיֵית — יָתֵיב תְּרֵי סְרֵי שְׁנֵי אַחְרָינְיָי[תָא]. אָמַר: בִּרְשׁוּת קָא עָבֵידְנָא. הֲדַר אָזֵיל וְיָתֵיב תְּרֵי סְרֵי שְׁנֵי אַחְרָינְיָי[תָא] בְּבֵי רַב. כִּי אֲתָא אַיְיתִי בַּהֲדֵיהּ עֶשְׂרִין וְאַרְבְּעָה אַלְפֵי תַּלְמִידֵי, שְׁמַעָה דְּבֵיתְהוּ, הֲוָת קָא נָפְקָא לְאַפֵּיהּ. אֲמַרוּ לַהּ שִׁיבָבָתָא: שְׁאִילִי מָאנֵי לְבוֹשׁ וְאִיכַּסַּאי. אֲמַרָה לְהוּ: ״יוֹדֵעַ צַדִּיק נֶפֶשׁ בְּהֶמְתּוֹ״. כִּי מָטְיָא לְגַבֵּיהּ, נְפַלָה עַל אַפַּהּ, קָא מְנַשְּׁקָא לֵיהּ לְכַרְעֵיהּ. הֲווֹ קָא מְדַחֲפִי לַהּ שַׁמָּעֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: שִׁבְקוּהָ, שֶׁלִּי וְשֶׁלָּכֶם — שֶׁלָּהּ הוּא.
human_translation: will you lead widow of a living man, She said to him: If he listen to me, he would sit for another twelve years. he said: I have permission to do He went back and sat for another twelve years in the study hall. When he came he brought twenty-four thousand students with him. His wife heard and went out to greet him. Her neighbors said: Borrow some clothes and wear them, She said to them: “A righteous man understands the life of his beast” When she came to him she fell on her face and kissed his feet. His attendants pushed her he said to them: Leave her my and yours is hers.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "She is speaking about the widowhood of life?! She said to him: If according to my opinion, I am sitting with two rows of my brothers. He said: I am acting with permission. Then he went and sat with two rows of his brothers in the house of Rav. When he came, he brought with him twenty-four thousand students. The sound of their learning was heard in his house, and she went out to meet him. Her attendants said to her: Ask him where his clothing and jewelry are. She said to them: 'The righteous knows the soul of his beast.' When he reached her, she stumbled on her face, and he kissed her on her foot. They were pushing her away. He said to them: Leave her, what is mine and what is yours is hers."

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע אֲבוּהָ דַּאֲתָא גַּבְרָא רַבָּה לְמָתָא, אָמַר: אֵיזִיל לְגַבֵּיהּ, אֶפְשָׁר דְּמֵפַר נִדְרַאי. אֲתָא לְגַבֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַדַּעְתָּא דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּה מִי נְדַרְתְּ? אָמַר לוֹ: אֲפִילּוּ פֶּרֶק אֶחָד, וַאֲפִילּוּ הֲלָכָה אַחַת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא הוּא. נְפַל עַל אַפֵּיהּ וְנַשְּׁקֵיהּ עַל כַּרְעֵיהּ וִיהַב לֵיהּ פַּלְגָא מָמוֹנֵיהּ. בְּרַתֵּיה דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא עֲבַדָא לֵיהּ לְבֶן עַזַּאי הָכִי. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רְחֵילָא בָּתַר רְחֵילָא אָזְלָא, כְּעוֹבָדֵי אִמָּא כָּךְ עוֹבָדֵי בְּרַתָּא.
human_translation: her father heard that a great man came to the town. He said: I will go to him. Maybe he will nullify my vow He came to him said to him: Did you vow thinking that would become a great man? He said to him: even one chapter or even one halakha He said to him: I am he. fell on his face and kissed his feet and gave him half of his money. Rabbi Akiva’s daughter did the same for ben Azzai, This that people say: The ewe follows the ewe; the daughter’s actions are the same as her mother’s.
llm_translation: Listen, father, when a great man came to the city, he said: "I will go to him, perhaps I can annul my vows." He went to him, and said to him: "Do you know whose vows you seek to annul?" He said to him: "Even a whole chapter, and even one halakha." He said to him: "I am he." He fell on his face, kissed his feet, and gave him half of his wealth. The daughter of Rabbi Akiva did the same for Ben Azzai. And this is what people say: "The daughter follows the mother, just as the mother's servants do, so do the daughter's servants."

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא שַׁדְּרֵיהּ אֲבוּהִי לְבֵי רַב לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף. פְּסַקוּ לֵיהּ שֵׁית שְׁנֵי. כִּי הֲוָה תְּלָת שְׁנֵי, מְטָא מַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְכִפּוּרֵי, אָמַר: אֵיזִיל וְאֶיחְזִינְהוּ לְאִינָשֵׁי בֵּיתִי. שְׁמַע אֲבוּהִי, שְׁקַל מָנָא וּנְפַק לְאַפֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זוֹנָתְךָ נִזְכַּרְתָּ? אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יוֹנָתְךָ נִזְכַּרְתָּ? אִיטְּרוּד. לָא מָר אִיפְּסִיק, וְלָא מָר אִיפְּסִיק.
human_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rava, was sent by his father to the study hall before Rav Yosef. agreed he six years When three years had the eve of Yom Kippur arrived he said: I will go and see the members of my household, His father heard and took a weapon, and went to meet him. he said to him: Did you remember your mistress, There are who say Did you remember your dove? they were preoccupied this Master did not eat the cessation and that Master did not eat the cessation
llm_translation: Rav Yosef son of Rava sent a message from his father's house to the house of Rav Yosef. They set for him six years. When it was the third year, the day of atonement arrived, he said: "I will go and show them to the people of my house." His father heard, took a vessel and went out to meet him. He said to him: "Have you remembered your harlot?" Some say he said to him: "Have you remembered your dove?" They did not stop him, and they did not stop him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוֹרֶדֶת עַל בַּעְלָהּ — פּוֹחֲתִין לָהּ מִכְּתוּבָּתָהּ שִׁבְעָה דִּינָרִין בַּשַּׁבָּת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שִׁבְעָה טַרְפְּעִיקִין. עַד מָתַי הוּא פּוֹחֵת — עַד כְּנֶגֶד כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם הוּא פּוֹחֵת וְהוֹלֵךְ, עַד שֶׁאִם תִּפּוֹל לָהּ יְרוּשָּׁה מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר, גּוֹבָה הֵימֶנָּה. וְכֵן, הַמּוֹרֵד עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ — מוֹסִיפִין עַל כְּתוּבָּתָהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה דִּינָרִין בְּשַׁבָּת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שְׁלֹשָׁה טַרְפְּעִיקִין.
human_translation: who rebels against her husband her marriage contract is reduced seven dinars week. Rabbi Yehuda says: Seven half-dinars [ terapa’ikin ] Until when does he reduce Until equivalent to her marriage contract, Rabbi Yosei says: He can always continue to deduct so that if she will receive an inheritance from another source, he can collect from her. And similarly, rebels against his wife, three dinars a week are added to her marriage contract. Rabbi Yehuda says: Three terapa’ikin .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who rebels against her husband - we decrease from her ketubah seven dinars on Shabbat. Rabbi Yehuda says: seven terfa'ikin. Until when do we decrease - until it matches her ketubah. Rabbi Yosei says: one should always decrease and continue, until if she falls, inheritance will be collected from another place, to fulfill her ketubah. Similarly, one who rebels against his wife - we add to her ketubah three dinars on Shabbat. Rabbi Yehuda says: three terfa'ikin.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מוֹרֶדֶת מִמַּאי? רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: מִתַּשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: מִמְּלָאכָה. תְּנַן: וְכֵן הַמּוֹרֵד עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִתַּשְׁמִישׁ, לְחַיֵּי. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִמְּלָאכָה, מִי מְשׁוּעְבָּד לַהּ? אִין, בְּאוֹמֵר ״אֵינִי זָן וְאֵינִי מְפַרְנֵס״.
human_translation: Against what she rebel; Rav Huna said: Against marital relations. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: Against tasks The mishna states: Similarly, if rebels against his wife. Granted, according to the one who says against marital relations, it is well, However, according to the one who says against tasks, is he subjugated to her Yes, someone who says: I will not sustain and I will not support
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar mordeit mimmai? Rav Huna amar: mitashmish hamittah. Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Chanina amar: mimmelacha. Tenan: vechein hamored al ishto. Bishlama leman de'amar mitashmish, lechayei. Ella leman de'amar mimmelacha, mi meshu'bad la? Ein, be'omer "eini zan ve'eini mifarnes." English translation: What is the cause of a rebellious wife? Rav Huna said: from marital relations. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: from work. We learned: And similarly, one who rebels against his wife. It is well according to the one who said from marital relations, for it is for the sake of life. But according to the one who said from work, who is obligated to her? No one, as he says, "I will neither feed nor support her."

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב: הָאוֹמֵר ״אֵינִי זָן וְאֵינִי מְפַרְנֵס״ — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה! וְלָאו לְאִמְּלוֹכֵי בֵּיהּ בָּעֵי?
human_translation: But didn’t Rav say: One who says: I will not sustain and I will not support must divorce and give her marriage contract? Shouldn’t he be consulted
llm_translation: And he said, Rav: One who says, "I will not provide sustenance and I will not support," — he shall divorce and give a written document! But is it not for the sake of the kings that he requires it?

hebrew_text: מֵיתִבִי: אַחַת לִי אֲרוּסָה, וּנְשׂוּאָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ נִדָּה, וַאֲפִילּוּ חוֹלָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם.
human_translation: raises an objection It is the same to me, a betrothed woman, or a married woman, or even a menstruating woman, or even ill, or even a widow waiting for her yavam
llm_translation: Maitvee: one to me betrothed, and married, and even menstruating, and even sick, and even waiting for levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִמְּלָאכָה, שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִתַּשְׁמִישׁ — נִדָּה בַּת תַּשְׁמִישׁ הִיא? אָמַר לָךְ: אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ פַּת בְּסַלּוֹ לְמִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says tasks, it is well. However, according to the one who says against marital relations, a menstruating woman fit to marital relations? said to you: One who has bread in his basket, is not comparable to one who does not have
llm_translation: In peace, according to the one who says from work, it is good. But according to the one who says from use — is menstruation like the use of a loaf? I say to you: it is not comparable, one who has bread in his basket to one who does not.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִתַּשְׁמִישׁ, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי חוֹלָה.
human_translation: There are who say Granted, according to the one who says engaging in marital relations, this is that which is taught an ill woman,
llm_translation: There are those who say: Regarding Shlama, according to the one who says "from use," that is what is taught in the Mishnah.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִמְּלָאכָה, חוֹלָה בַּת מְלָאכָה הִיא? אֶלָּא: מִתַּשְׁמִישׁ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּהָוְיָא מוֹרֶדֶת. כִּי פְּלִיגִי מִמְּלָאכָה, מָר סָבַר: מִמְּלָאכָה — לָא הָוְיָא מוֹרֶדֶת, וּמָר סָבַר: מִמְּלָאכָה — נָמֵי הָוְיָא מוֹרֶדֶת.
human_translation: However, according to the one who says against tasks, an ill woman fit to perform tasks? Rather, against marital relations, everyone agrees that she is a rebellious They disagree against tasks. Sage, holds against performing tasks is not a rebellious woman, and Sage, holds against performing tasks is also a rebellious
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says that from work, is a woman's labor considered a weekday? Rather, from using all the utensils of the world, they do not disagree that it is considered rebellion. When they disagree regarding work, one Master holds: from work - it is not considered rebellion, and one Master holds: from work - it is also considered rebellion.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: הַמּוֹרֶדֶת עַל בַּעֲלָהּ — פּוֹחֲתִין לָהּ מִכְּתוּבָּתָהּ שִׁבְעָה דִּינָרִים בְּשַׁבָּת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שִׁבְעָה טַרְפְּעִיקִין. רַבּוֹתֵינוּ חָזְרוּ וְנִמְנוּ, שֶׁיְּהוּ מַכְרִיזִין עָלֶיהָ אַרְבַּע שַׁבָּתוֹת זוֹ אַחַר זוֹ, וְשׁוֹלְחִין לָהּ בֵּית דִּין: הֱוִי יוֹדַעַת שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ כְּתוּבָּתִיךְ מֵאָה מָנֶה הִפְסַדְתְּ. אַחַת לִי אֲרוּסָה וּנְשׂוּאָה, אֲפִילּוּ נִדָּה, אֲפִילּוּ חוֹלָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם.
human_translation: the itself: rebels against her husband we reduce her marriage contract seven dinars week, Rabbi Yehuda says: Seven terapa’ikin . Our Sages went back and were counted again, they would make announcements about her for four consecutive Shabbatot . And that the court would send to her Be aware that even if your marriage contract is worth ten thousand dinars, you will lose it is the same to me, a betrothed woman or a married woman, even a menstruating woman, and even ill, and even a widow awaiting her yavam
llm_translation: Body: One who rebels against her husband - they reduce from her ketubah seven dinars on Shabbat. Rabbi Yehuda says: seven terfa'ikin. Our Rabbis reconsidered and counted, that they proclaim against her four consecutive Shabbats, and they send her to the court: Be aware that even if your ketubah is diminished by one hundred mana, whether she is betrothed or married, even if she is a menstruant, even if she is ill, and even if she is waiting for yibum.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף לִשְׁמוּאֵל: נִדָּה בַּת תַּשְׁמִישׁ הִיא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ פַּת בְּסַלּוֹ לְמִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ פַּת בְּסַלּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef said to Shmuel: Is a menstruating woman fit conjugal relations? He said to him: One who has bread in his basket, is not comparable to one who does not have bread in his basket.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef to Shmuel: Is a niddah a daughter of menstruation? He said to him: It is not comparable, one who has bread in his basket to one who does not have bread in his basket.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: אֵין מַכְרִיזִין עָלֶיהָ אֶלָּא בְּבָתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבְבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת. אָמַר רָבָא: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: אַרְבַּע שַׁבָּתוֹת זוֹ אַחַר זוֹ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ. אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: פַּעֲמַיִם שׁוֹלְחִין לָהּ מִבֵּית דִּין, אַחַת קוֹדֶם הַכְרָזָה, וְאַחַת לְאַחַר הַכְרָזָה.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said: We make announcements about her only in synagogues and study halls, Rava said: The is also precise, as it teaches: four consecutive Shabbatot , Conclude from Rami bar Ḥama said: The court sends with her twice, once before the announcement and once after the announcement.
llm_translation: Ramai bar Ḥama said: They do not announce it except in synagogues and study halls. Rava said: It is specifically stated, as it is taught: Four Sabbaths, one after the other. Learn from it. Ramai bar Ḥama said: They send to her from the court twice, once before the announcement, and once after the announcement.

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר רַב חִסְדָּא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבּוֹתֵינוּ. אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי בּוּרְכָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַאי בּוּרְכָתֵיהּ? אֲנָא אַמְרִיתַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ, וּמִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּה אַמְרִיתַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ, וּמַנּוּ, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Rav Ḥisda taught The halakha is in accordance with our Sages. Rava said: This is an absurdity [ burkha ]. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to him: What is absurd about this? I said this to him, and I said it to him in the name of a great man. And who is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina.
llm_translation: Rav Nahman son of Rav Hisda expounded: The halakha follows our Sages. Rava said: This is a blessing. Rav Nahman son of Yitzhak said to him: What is its blessing? I said it, he accepted it, and in the name of the great man, he said it, and they counted it, Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Hanina.

hebrew_text: וְאִיהוּ כְּמַאן סָבַר? כִּי הָא דְּאִתְּמַר: רָבָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הֲלָכָה, נִמְלָכִין בָּהּ. רַב הוּנָא בַּר יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הֲלָכָה, אֵין נִמְלָכִין בָּהּ.
human_translation: And in accordance with whose hold? In accordance with that which was stated: Rava Rav Sheshet said: halakha is she is consulted Rav Huna bar Yehuda Rav Sheshet said: The halakha is we do not consult with her.
llm_translation: And who is of the opinion? Like this that was said: Rava said Rav Sheshet: Halakha, we rule by it. Rav Huna son of Yehuda said Rav Sheshet: Halakha, we do not rule by it.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמְיָא מוֹרֶדֶת? אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: דְּאָמְרָה ״בָּעֵינָא לֵיהּ וּמְצַעַרְנָא לֵיהּ״. אֲבָל אָמְרָה ״מְאִיס עֲלַי״ — לָא כָּיְיפִינַן לַהּ. מָר זוּטְרָא אָמַר: כָּיְיפִינַן לָהּ.
human_translation: What are the circumstances a rebellious Ameimar said: she says: I want him, but I want to cause him anguish However, she said: I am disgusted with him, we do not compel her Mar Zutra said: We compel her
llm_translation: "How is the case of a rebellious wife similar? Amar Ameimar: As it says, 'I desire him, but he causes me distress.' But if she says, 'I despise him,' we do not compel her. Mar Zutra said: We compel her."

hebrew_text: הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא וְאַכְפְּיַהּ מָר זוּטְרָא, וּנְפַק מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִסּוּרָא. וְלָא הִיא: הָתָם סִיַּיעְתָּא דִשְׁמַיָּא הֲוָה.
human_translation: There was an incident and Mar Zutra compelled her And from this issued Rabbi Ḥanina of Sura. That is not so. there was heavenly assistance.
llm_translation: There was a certain incident, and Master Zutra rebuked him, and Rabbi Chanina of Sura left him. But it was not so; there, the assistance of Heaven was present.

hebrew_text: כַּלְּתֵיהּ דְּרַב זְבִיד אִימְּרַדָא, הֲוָה תְּפִיסָא חַד שֵׁירָא. יְתֵיב אַמֵּימָר וּמָר זוּטְרָא וְרַב אָשֵׁי, וִיתֵיב רַב גַּמָּדָא גַּבַּיְיהוּ. יָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: מָרְדָה — הִפְסִידָה בְּלָאוֹתֶיהָ קַיָּימִין. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב גַּמָּדָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּרַב זְבִיד גַּבְרָא רַבָּה, מַחְנִיפִיתוּ לֵיהּ? וְהָאָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: מִיבַּעְיָא בָּעֵי רָבָא, וְלָא פְּשִׁיט? אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, יָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי, מָרְדָה — לֹא הִפְסִידָה בְּלָאוֹתֶיהָ קַיָּימִין. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב גַּמָּדָא:
human_translation: the daughter-in-law of Rav Zevid rebelled She was holding a certain garment Ameimar, Mar Zutra, and Rav Ashi were sitting, and Rav Gamda was sitting with them. They sat and said: rebelled, she lost her worn clothes, Rav Gamda said to them: Because Rav Zevid is a great man, you flatter him Didn’t Rav Kahana say: Rava raises a dilemma and he did not resolve it? There are who say sat and said: rebelled, she did not lose her worn clothes. Rav Gamda said to them:
llm_translation: The bride of Rav Zevid was from Immerda, she had one black hair. Amemar, Mar Zutra, and Rav Ashe were sitting, and Rav Gammada was sitting before them. They sat and said: "The bride - she has lost her adornments, but her obligations remain." Rav Gammada said to them: "Because Rav Zevid is a great man, do you flatter him?" But didn't Rav Kahana say: "A master requires a master, and it is not obvious?" Some say they sat and said: "The bride - she has not lost her obligations." Rav Gammada said to them:

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּרַב זְבִיד גַּבְרָא רַבָּה הוּא, אָפְכִיתוּ לֵיהּ לְדִינָא עִילָּוֵיהּ? הָאָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: מִיבַּעְיָא בָּעֵי לַהּ רָבָא, וְלָא פְּשִׁיט?! הַשְׁתָּא דְּלָא אִתְּמַר לָא הָכִי וְלָא הָכִי, תְּפַסָה — לָא מַפְּקִינַן מִינַּהּ, לָא תְּפַסָה — לָא יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ.
human_translation: Because Rav Zevid is a great man, you twist the judgment against him? Didn’t Rav Kahana say: Rava raises a dilemma and did not resolve Now that it was not stated this way or that way, if she seized we do not take it away from her, did not seize we do not give her.
llm_translation: On account of Rav Zebid, a great man, did they turn his case over to him? For Rav Kahana said: Does Rava require to ask for it, and it is not obvious?! Now that it was not stated thus and not thus, if it is caught — we do not take it from her, if it is not caught — we do not give it to her.

hebrew_text: וּמְשַׁהֵינַן לַהּ תְּרֵיסַר יַרְחֵי שַׁתָּא אַגִּיטָּא, וּבְהָנָךְ תְּרֵיסַר יַרְחֵי שַׁתָּא לֵית לַהּ מְזוֹנֵי מִבַּעַל.
human_translation: And we delay her bill of divorce twelve months the year And during those twelve months the year she does not sustenance from husband.
llm_translation: We draw for her twelve months a document, and in the meantime twelve months she does not have sustenance from her husband.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב טוֹבִי בַּר קִיסְנָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כּוֹתְבִין אִגֶּרֶת מָרֶד עַל אֲרוּסָה, וְאֵין כּוֹתְבִין אִגֶּרֶת מָרֶד עַל שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם. מֵיתִיבִי: אַחַת לִי אֲרוּסָה וּנְשׂוּאָה, אֲפִילּוּ נִדָּה, אֲפִילּוּ חוֹלָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם!
human_translation: Rav Tuvi bar Kisna said Shmuel said: writes a letter of rebellion about a betrothed woman But it does not write a letter of rebellion about a widow awaiting her yavam raises an objection It is the same to me a betrothed woman or a married woman, even a menstruating woman, even ill, and even a widow awaiting her yavam .
llm_translation: Rav Tovi bar Kisna said in the name of Shmuel: One may write a letter of rebellion against one's betrothed, but one may not write a letter of rebellion against the levirate bondwoman. An objection was raised: "One for me is my betrothed and my wife, even if she is a menstruant, even if she is ill, and even if she is a levirate bondwoman!"

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן שֶׁתָּבַע הוּא, כָּאן שֶׁתָּבְעָה הִיא. דְּאָמַר רַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר אֲבִימִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: תָּבַע הוּא — נִזְקָקִין לוֹ. תָּבְעָה הִיא — אֵין נִזְקָקִין לָהּ.
human_translation: This not difficult, Here, he asked her there, she asked him As Rav Taḥalifa bar Avimi said Shmuel said: If he asked, responds to his but if she asked, it does not respond to her
llm_translation: The difficulty is not difficult: here where he demanded, here where she demanded. For Rav Tahalifa son of Avimi said in the name of Shmuel: If he demanded - we are concerned for him. If she demanded - we are not concerned for her.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְתַּהּ לְהָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל — בְּשֶׁתָּבְעָה הִיא, הַאי ״כּוֹתְבִין אִגֶּרֶת מֶרֶד עַל אֲרוּסָה״? ״לַאֲרוּסָה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, תְּנִי ״לָאֲרוּסָה״.
human_translation: In what did you establish that which Shmuel If she asked this: writes a letter of rebellion about a betrothed woman, should have for a betrothed woman, This not difficult, Teach For a betrothed woman.
llm_translation: In what is she established according to that which Shmuel said? - In seven days. This verse, "writing a bill of divorce for his wife," does it require "for his wife"? This is not difficult, teach "for his wife."

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם דְּלָא — דְּאָמְרִינַן לַהּ: זִיל, לָא מִפַּקְּדַתְּ, אֲרוּסָה נָמֵי, נֵימָא לַהּ: זִיל, לָא מִפַּקְּדַתְּ! אֶלָּא בְּבָאָה מֵחֲמַת טַעֲנָה, דְּאָמְרָה: בָּעֵינָא חוּטְרָא לִידָא וּמָרָה לִקְבוּרָה.
human_translation: What is different a widow awaiting her yavam , Because we say to her: Go away; you are not commanded a betrothed woman, too, let us say to her: Go away; you are not commanded. Rather, comes with a claim, saying: I want a staff in hand and a hoe for burial,
llm_translation: What is different about a yevamah who is not observing yibum? For we say to her: Go, you are not fulfilling the obligation, let the betrothed one also go, we say to her: Go, you are not fulfilling the obligation! Rather, it is in the case of a woman who comes due to a claim, for she says: I need a thread for my hand and a bitter herb for my burial.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם, בְּבָאָה מֵחֲמַת טַעֲנָה?! אֶלָּא, אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי שֶׁתָּבַע הוּא, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן לַחֲלוֹץ, וְכָאן לְיַיבֵּם. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי פְּדָת אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: תָּבַע לַחְלוֹץ — נִזְקָקִין לוֹ. תָּבַע לְיַיבֵּם — אֵין נִזְקָקִין לוֹ.
human_translation: So too here, a widow awaiting her yavam who comes with a claim, Rather, this and that where he asks not difficult. Here, to perform ḥalitza There, to consummate the levirate marriage, as Rabbi Pedat said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: If asked her to perform ḥalitza responds to him. If he asked to perform levirate marriage, does not respond to him.
llm_translation: So it was stated: "A woman who is a yevamah, when she comes due to a claim?!" Rather, both this and that are necessary, and it is not difficult: here for chalitzah, and here for yibum. As Rabbi Pedat said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If he demands chalitzah - we attend to him. If he demands yibum - we do not attend to him.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא לְיַיבֵּם דְּלָא, דְּאָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: זִיל וּנְסֵיב אִיתְּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי. לַחְלוֹץ נָמֵי נֵימָא לֵיהּ: זִיל וּנְסֵיב אִיתְּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי!
human_translation: What is different to consummate the levirate marriage, that does not Because we say to him: Go and marry another woman. to perform ḥalitza also, let us say to him: Go and marry another woman.
llm_translation: What is different about Yibum that we do not say to him: Go and marry another woman afterwards. Rather, we say to him: Go and marry another woman afterwards!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּאָמַר: ״כֵּיוָן דַּאֲגִידָא בִּי, לָא קָא יָהֲבוּ לִי אַחֲרִיתִי״.
human_translation: Rather, he says: Since she is attached to me they will not give me another
llm_translation: Rather, he said: "Since they have spoken against me, they will not give me a chance."

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי: ״כֵּיוָן דַּאֲגִידָא בִּי, לָא קָא יָהֲבוּ לִי אַחֲרִיתִי״! אֶלָּא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי שֶׁתָּבַע לְיַיבֵּם, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — כְּמִשְׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה, כָּאן — כְּמִשְׁנָה אַחֲרוֹנָה.
human_translation: here too, Since she is attached to me they will not give me another. Rather, this and that where he asked to consummate the levirate marriage. And it not difficult. Here, in accordance the first mishna. There, in accordance the ultimate mishna.
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Here it is stated: "Since I have spoken about it, they did not give me my due end!" Rather, both this one and that one who demanded levirate marriage, and it is not difficult: here — like the first Mishnah, here — like the last Mishnah.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: מִצְוַת יִבּוּם קוֹדֶמֶת לְמִצְוַת חֲלִיצָה — בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, שֶׁהָיוּ מִתְכַּוְּונִין לְשׁוּם מִצְוָה. עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוְּונִין לְשׁוּם מִצְוָה, אָמְרוּ: מִצְוַת חֲלִיצָה קוֹדֶמֶת לְמִצְוַת יִבּוּם.
human_translation: As we learned The mitzva of levirate marriage precedes the mitzva of ḥalitza . originally when would intend for the sake of the mitzva. now that do not intend for the sake of the mitzva, said: The mitzva of ḥalitza precedes the mitzva of levirate marriage.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: The mitzvah of yibum takes precedence over the mitzvah of chalitzah — initially, when they intended for the sake of a mitzvah. Now that they do not intend for the sake of a mitzvah, they said: The mitzvah of chalitzah takes precedence over the mitzvah of yibum.

hebrew_text: עַד מָתַי הוּא פּוֹחֵת וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַרְפְּעִיקִין? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אִסְתֵּירָא. וְכַמָּה אִסְתֵּירָא — פַּלְגָא דְזוּזָא. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שְׁלֹשָׁה טַרְפְּעִיקִין, שֶׁהֵן תֵּשַׁע מֵעֵין, מָעָה וַחֲצִי לְכׇל יוֹם.
human_translation: Until when does he reduce What are terapa’ikin ? Rav Sheshet said: An asteira , And how much is an asteira ? A half of a dinar. This is also taught Rabbi Yehuda says: Three terapa’ikin , which are nine ma’as , a ma’a and a half for each day,
