llm_translation: Talmudic text: Until when does it decrease, etc. What are "terpe'ikin"? Rav Sheshet said: It is hidden. And how much is hidden? Half of a zuz. It was also taught similarly: Rabbi Yehuda says: Three terpe'ikin, which are nine me'ain, a hundred and a half for each day.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף לִשְׁמוּאֵל: מַאי שְׁנָא אִיהוּ דְּיָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ דְּשַׁבָּת. וּמַאי שְׁנָא אִיהִי דְּלָא יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ דְּשַׁבָּת? אִיהִי דְּמִיפְחָת קָא פָחֵית, לָא מִיחֲזֵי כִּשְׂכַר שַׁבָּת, אִיהוּ דְּאוֹסוֹפֵי קָא מוֹסְפָא,
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef said to Shmuel: What is different him, that we give him for Shabbat, what is different her that we do not give her for Shabbat she who is reduced, does not appear to be Shabbat wages, he who add
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef to Shmuel: What is different about the one who we give for Shabbat. And what is different about the one we do not give to him for Shabbat? The one we give, since he is occupied, it does not appear as if it is payment for Shabbat; the one we do not give, since he is idle, it appears as if it is an addition.

hebrew_text: מִיחֲזֵי כִּשְׂכַר שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: appear to be Shabbat wages.
llm_translation: Behold, like the reward of Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף לִשְׁמוּאֵל: מָה בֵּין מוֹרֵד לְמוֹרֶדֶת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: צֵא וּלְמַד מִשּׁוּק שֶׁל זוֹנוֹת, מִי שׂוֹכֵר אֶת מִי? דָּבָר אַחֵר: זֶה יִצְרוֹ מִבַּחוּץ, וְזוֹ יִצְרָהּ מִבִּפְנִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef said to Shmuel: What is between a rebellious and a rebellious He said to him: Go and learn from the market of prostitutes. Who hires whose Alternatively, he his inclination on the outside, But her, her inclination is on the inside,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef to Shmuel: What is the difference between a male rebel and a female rebel? He said to him: Go out and learn from the marketplace of prostitutes, who hires whom? Another explanation: This one, his inclination is from the outside, and hers is from within.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּשְׁרֶה אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ עַל יְדֵי שָׁלִישׁ — לֹא יִפְחוֹת לָהּ מִשְּׁנֵי קַבִּין חִטִּין, אוֹ מֵאַרְבָּעָה קַבִּין שְׂעוֹרִין. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לֹא פָּסַק לָהּ שְׂעוֹרִין אֶלָּא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, שֶׁהָיָה סָמוּךְ לֶאֱדוֹם. וְנוֹתֵן לָהּ חֲצִי קַב קִיטְנִית, וַחֲצִי לוֹג שֶׁמֶן, וְקַב גְּרוֹגְרוֹת אוֹ מָנֶה דְּבֵילָה. וְאִם אֵין לוֹ — פּוֹסֵק לְעוּמָּתָן פֵּירוֹת מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר.
human_translation: feeds his wife by means of a third party not her less than two kav wheat or four kav barley Rabbi Yosei said: Only Rabbi Yishmael, who was near Edom, allotted her barley. And he give her half a kav legumes, and half a log oil, and a kav dried figs or a maneh fig cakes. And if he does not have he apportion a corresponding fruit from elsewhere.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who feeds his wife through a messenger - he should not give her less than two kav of wheat, or less than four kav of barley. Rabbi Yosei said: Only Rabbi Yishmael ruled that barley should not be less than two kav, as he was close to Edom. And he should give her half a kav of small legumes, and half a log of oil, and a kav of dried figs or a maneh of pressed figs. And if he does not have these, he should provide her with fruits from elsewhere.

hebrew_text: וְנוֹתֵן לָהּ מִטָּה, מַפָּץ וּמַחְצֶלֶת. וְנוֹתֵן לָהּ כִּפָּה לְרֹאשָׁהּ, וַחֲגוֹר לְמׇתְנֶיהָ, וּמִנְעָלִים מִמּוֹעֵד לְמוֹעֵד, וְכֵלִים שֶׁל חֲמִשִּׁים זוּז מִשָּׁנָה לְשָׁנָה. וְאֵין נוֹתְנִין לָהּ לֹא חֲדָשִׁים בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, וְלֹא שְׁחָקִים בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים. אֶלָּא נוֹתֵן לָהּ כֵּלִים שֶׁל חֲמִשִּׁים זוּז בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים, וְהִיא מִתְכַּסָּה בִּבְלָאוֹתֵיהֶן בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה. וְהַשְּׁחָקִים — שֶׁלָּהּ.
human_translation: And he give her a bed, a soft mat, and mat. And he give her a cap for her head, and a belt for her waist, and shoes from Festival to Festival, And garments of fifty dinars from year to year. And he may not give her new in the summer, nor worn in the rainy season, Rather, he should give her clothes of fifty dinars in the rainy season, and she covers herself with worn in the summer And worn to her.
llm_translation: And he gives to her a bed, a pillow, and a sheet. And he gives to her a covering for her head, and a belt for her waist, and shoes from festival to festival, and utensils worth fifty zuz from year to year. And one does not give her new clothes in the days of the sun, nor white clothes in the days of rain. Rather, one gives her utensils worth fifty zuz in the days of rain, and she covers herself with her garments in the days of the sun. And the white clothes are hers.

hebrew_text: נוֹתֵן לָהּ מָעָה כֶּסֶף לְצוֹרְכָּהּ. וְאוֹכֶלֶת עִמּוֹ מִלֵּילֵי שַׁבָּת לְלֵילֵי שַׁבָּת. וְאִם אֵין נוֹתֵן לָהּ מָעָה כֶּסֶף לְצוֹרְכָּהּ — מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ שֶׁלָּהּ.
human_translation: he give her silver ma’a for her needs. And she eats with him from Shabbat evening to Shabbat evening. And if he does not give her a silver ma’a for her needs, her earnings to her.
llm_translation: He gives her a silver coin for her needs. And she eats with him from Sabbath eve to Sabbath eve. And if he does not give her a silver coin for her needs - her handiwork is hers.

hebrew_text: וּמָה הִיא עוֹשָׂה לוֹ? מִשְׁקַל חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים שְׁתִי בִּיהוּדָה, שֶׁהֵן עֶשֶׂר סְלָעִים בַּגָּלִיל. אוֹ מִשְׁקַל עֶשֶׂר סְלָעִים עֵרֶב בִּיהוּדָה, שֶׁהֵן עֶשְׂרִים סְלָעִים בַּגָּלִיל. וְאִם הָיְתָה מְנִיקָה — פּוֹחֲתִין לָהּ מִמַּעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, וּמוֹסִיפִין לָהּ עַל מְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּעָנִי שֶׁבְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, אֲבָל בִּמְכוּבָּד הַכֹּל לְפִי כְּבוֹדוֹ.
human_translation: And what that she earn for him? weight five sela warp in Judea, which are ten sela to Galilee, or the weight ten sela woof, in Judea, which are twenty sela to Galilee. And if she is nursing is reduced from her earnings and is added for her sustenance. In what is this statement, said? With the poorest of Jews, However, in the case of prominent man, all according to his prominence.
llm_translation: And what does she do for him? She weighs five stones in Judea, which are ten stones in the Galilee. Or she weighs ten stones in the evening in Judea, which are twenty stones in the Galilee. And if she is nursing - they reduce her from her handiwork, and add to her sustenance. In what circumstances are these things said? In the poverty of Israel, but in honor, everything is according to his honor.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין, לָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא, וְלָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. דִּתְנַן: וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּרוֹ — מְזוֹן שְׁתֵּי סְעוּדוֹת לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד. מְזוֹנוֹ לַחוֹל וְלֹא לַשַּׁבָּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לַשַּׁבָּת וְלֹא לַחוֹל. וְזֶה וָזֶה מִתְכַּוְּונִין לְהָקֵל.
human_translation: Whose the mishna? not Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka and not Rabbi Shimon, as we learned What is the measure food two meals for each and every one one’s food on a weekday and not on Shabbat; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: on Shabbat and not on a weekday. And this and that intend to be lenient,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, Mani Matnitin, la Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka, v'la Rabbi Shimon. Ditnan: v'kama shi'uro - mezon shetei se'udot lechol echad v'echad. Mezonu lachol v'lo l'Shabbat, divrei Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda omer: l'Shabbat v'lo lachol. V'zeh vazeh mitkavvinin lehakel. English translation: Gemara, who is the Tanna? Not Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka, and not Rabbi Shimon. We learned in a Mishnah: And how much is the measure? The sustenance for two meals for each and every person. His sustenance is for weekdays and not for Shabbat, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: for Shabbat and not for weekdays. And both this and that are intended to be lenient.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא אוֹמֵר: כִּכָּר הַלָּקוּחַ בְּפוּנְדְּיוֹן, מֵאַרְבַּע סְאִין לְסֶלַע. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׁתֵּי יָדוֹת לַכִּכָּר, מִשָּׁלֹשׁ כִּכָּרוֹת לַקַּב.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says: a loaf bought with a pundeyon , when four se’a for a sela . Rabbi Shimon says: two parts of a loaf, when three loaves from a kav
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka says: A kikar purchased in Pundei'on, from four se'ah to a sela. Rabbi Shimon says: Two hands for a kikar, from three kikarot to a kab.

hebrew_text: חֶצְיָהּ — לְבַיִת הַמְנוּגָּע. וַחֲצִי חֶצְיָהּ — לִפְסוֹל אֶת הַגְּוִיָּיה. וַחֲצִי חֲצִי חֶצְיָהּ — לְקַבֵּל טוּמְאַת אוֹכָלִין.
human_translation: half for a leprous house. And half of its half, renders the body unfit. And half of one half of its half, susceptible to ritual impurity as food.
llm_translation: Half of it - to a house afflicted with tzara'at. And half of half of it - to disqualify its roof. And half of half of half of it - to receive the impurity of foods.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא, תַּמְנֵי הָוְיָין! וְאִי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, תַּמְנֵי סְרֵי הָוְיָין!
human_translation: Who is the mishna If Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, are eight And if Rabbi Shimon, are eighteen
llm_translation: Who is it? If it is Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka, there are eight! And if it is Rabbi Shimon, there are ten!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא, וְכִדְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: צֵא מֵהֶן שְׁלִישׁ לַחֶנְווֹנִי. הָכָא נָמֵי: אַיְיתִי תִּילְתָּא שְׁדִי עֲלַיְיהוּ. אַכַּתִּי תַּרְתֵּי סְרֵי הָוְיָין! אוֹכֶלֶת עִמּוֹ לֵילֵי שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Actually, Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, and as Rav Ḥisda said Deduct one-third for the grocer’s Here, too, bring one-third add to Still, they are twelve meals. She eats with him on Shabbat evening.
llm_translation: Always Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka, and as Rav Chisda said: "Leave them a third for the Chanvoni." Here it is stated: "I brought three demons upon them. Two of them were female demons! I eat with him on Shabbat nights."

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֲכִילָה מַמָּשׁ. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֲכִילָה תַּשְׁמִישׁ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? וְעוֹד, תְּלֵיסַר הָוְיָין! אֶלָּא כִּדְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, צֵא מֵהֶן מֶחֱצָה לַחֶנְווֹנִי. הָכִי נָמֵי אַיְתִי פַּלְגָא וּשְׁדִי עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says literal eating. However, according to the one who says eating conjugal relations, what can be said? And furthermore, they are thirteen Rather, as Rav Ḥisda said, Deduct one-half for the grocer’s So too bring a half and add to
llm_translation: The one who says actual eating. Rather, the one who says eating for pleasure, what can be said? Furthermore, there are thirteen! Rather, as Rav Ḥisdah said, take out half for the gardener. So too, a half comes and falls upon them.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא דְּרַב חִסְדָּא אַדְּרַב חִסְדָּא! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּאַתְרָא דְּיָהֲבִי צִיבֵי, הָא בְּאַתְרָא דְּלָא יָהֲבִי צִיבֵי.
human_translation: difficult of Rav Ḥisda, of Rav Ḥisda. not difficult. This to a place where they give wood That to a place where they do not give wood,
llm_translation: The difficulty of Rav Ḥisda is difficult, the difficulty of Rav Ḥisda! It is not difficult: here in a place where he gives a gift, here in a place where he does not give a gift.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, שִׁיתַּסְרֵי הָוְיָין. כְּמַאן, כְּרַבִּי חִידְקָא, דְּאָמַר: אַרְבַּע סְעוּדוֹת חַיָּיב אָדָם לֶאֱכוֹל בַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: If so, are sixteen who is the mishna? in accordance with Rabbi Ḥidka, who said a person is obligated to eat four meals on Shabbat?
llm_translation: If so, six cups there should be. According to whom? According to Rabbi Ḥidḳa, who said: A person is obligated to eat four meals on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, דַּל חֲדָא לְאָרְחֵי וּפָרְחֵי.
human_translation: You even say the Rabbis, remove one meal for guests and wayfarers.
llm_translation: Even if you say it is the opinion of the Rabbis, a poor person is allowed to collect and distribute.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: לְרַבָּנַן — דַּל תְּלָת לְאָרְחֵי וּפָרְחֵי, לְרַבִּי חִידְקָא — דַּל תַּרְתֵּי לְאָרְחֵי וּפָרְחֵי.
human_translation: Now that you have arrived at this you even say Rabbi Shimon, of the Rabbis, remove three for guests and wayfarers, of Rabbi Ḥidka, remove two for guests and wayfarers.
llm_translation: The question that was raised in this manner, even if you say Rabbi Shimon: to the sages - poor three for paths and flowers, to Rabbi Ḥidqa - poor two for paths and flowers.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לֹא פָּסַק שְׂעוֹרִין וְכוּ׳. אֶלָּא בֶּאֱדוֹם הוּא דְּאָכְלִין שְׂעוֹרִים, בְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא אָכְלִי! הָכִי קָאָמַר: לֹא פָּסַק שְׂעוֹרִים כִּפְלַיִם בְּחִטִּין אֶלָּא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל שֶׁהָיָה סָמוּךְ לֶאֱדוֹם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשְּׂעוֹרִין אֲדוֹמִיּוֹת רָעוֹת הֵן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: Only allotted her barley. But it is in Edom that they eat barley, in the rest of the world they do not eat This is what is saying: Only Rabbi Yishmael, who was near Edom, allotted her a double of barley of wheat, since Edomite barley is bad,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: "Barley did not cease, etc." Rather, it is in Edom that they eat barley, but in all other places they do not eat it! This is what he is saying: Barley did not cease like wheat, but Rabbi Yishmael, who was close to Edom, because Edomite barley is bad.

hebrew_text: וְנוֹתֵן לָהּ חֲצִי קַב קִיטְנִית. וְאִילּוּ יַיִן לָא קָתָנֵי. מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר
human_translation: And he give her half a kav legumes And yet wine is not taught This supports of Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar said:
llm_translation: And he gives to her half a kab of katinet. And if it is wine, it is not considered as small. It supports the opinion of Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar said:

hebrew_text: אֵין פּוֹסְקִין יֵינוֹת לָאִשָּׁה, וְאִם תֹּאמַר: ״אֵלְכָה אַחֲרֵי מְאַהֲבַי נוֹתְנֵי לַחְמִי וּמֵימַי צַמְרִי וּפִשְׁתִּי שַׁמְנִי וְשִׁקּוּיָי״ — דְּבָרִים שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה מִשְׁתּוֹקֶקֶת עֲלֵיהֶן, וּמַאי נִינְהוּ — תַּכְשִׁיטִין.
human_translation: Wines are not allotted to a wife. And if you say “I will go after my lovers who give me my bread and my water, my wool and my flax, my oil and my drink” items that a woman desires [ mishtokeket ]. And what are these? Jewelry
llm_translation: We do not stop serving wine for a woman, and if she says: "I will go after my lovers, who give me my bread, my water, my wool, my flax, my oil, and my drink" — things that the woman desires, what are they? — ornaments.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אִישׁ כְּפַר נְבִירְיָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אִישׁ כְּפַר נְפוֹר חַיִל: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין פּוֹסְקִין יֵינוֹת לָאִשָּׁה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתָּקׇם חַנָּה אַחֲרֵי אׇכְלָה בְשִׁילֹה וְאַחֲרֵי שָׁתֹה״. ״שָׁתָה״, וְלֹא ״שָׁתָת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda of the village of Neviraya, and some say of the village of Nefor Ḥayil, interpreted From where that one does not allot wines for a woman? As it is stated: “So Hannah rose up after she had eaten in Shiloh and after he had drunk” “He had drunk,” and not: She had drunk.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, man of Kfar Neviriya, expounded, and some say it was a man of Kfar Nofor Chayil: From where do we derive that one does not interrupt wine for a woman? As it is stated: "And Channah rose up after eating in Shiloh and after drinking." "Drinking," and not "had drunk."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה ״אָכְלָה״ וְלֹא ״אׇכְלוֹ״, הָכִי נָמֵי?! אֲנַן מִדְּשַׁנִּי קְרָא בְּדִבּוּרֵיהּ קָאָמְרִינַן. מִכְּדֵי בְּגַוַּהּ קָא עָסֵיק וְאָתֵי, מַאי טַעְמָא שַׁנִּי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ ״שָׁתָה״ וְלֹא ״שָׁתָת״.
human_translation: However, if that is so, “she had eaten,” indeed and he did not eat? We say from that the verse changed its language. Since was already dealing with her, what is the reason changed learn from this “he had drunk” but she did not drink.
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, "she ate" and not "he ate," is it so?! We derive it from the fact that the verse speaks in the singular. Since he was engaged in his arrogance and came, what is the reason for the change? Learn from it that it is "she drank" and not "he drank."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: רְגִילָה — נוֹתְנִין לָהּ! רְגִילָה שָׁאנֵי, דְּאָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר כָּהֲנָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: רְגִילָה — נוֹתְנִין לָהּ כּוֹס אֶחָד. שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְגִילָה — נוֹתְנִין לָהּ שְׁנֵי כּוֹסוֹת.
human_translation: raises an objection accustomed she is given accustomed is different, as Rav Ḥinnana bar Kahana said Shmuel said: accustomed she is given one cup, is not accustomed she is given two cups.
llm_translation: Challenger: Regular - we give to her! Regular is different, as Rav Ḥinnana bar Kahana said in the name of Shmuel: Regular - we give her one cup. If she is not regular - we give her two cups.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר?! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: רְגִילָה, בִּפְנֵי בַּעְלָהּ — שְׁנֵי כּוֹסוֹת, שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בַעְלָהּ — נוֹתְנִין לָהּ כּוֹס אֶחָד. אֵינָהּ רְגִילָה, בִּפְנֵי בַעְלָהּ — אֶלָּא כּוֹס אֶחָד, שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בַעְלָהּ — אֵין נוֹתְנִין לָהּ כׇּל עִיקָּר.
human_translation: What is saying? Abaye said: This is what is saying: she is accustomed in the presence of her husband two cups, is not in the presence of her husband she is given one cup. she is not accustomed in the presence of her husband only one cup, is not in the presence of her husband she is not given at all.
llm_translation: What is he saying?! Abaye said, thus he is saying: If she is accustomed, in the presence of her husband — two cups, not in the presence of her husband — they give her one cup. If she is not accustomed, in the presence of her husband — only one cup, not in the presence of her husband — they do not give her anything at all.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: רְגִילָה, נוֹתְנִין לָהּ לְצִיקֵי קְדֵירָה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּכַלָּתוֹ שֶׁל נַקְדִּימוֹן בֶּן גּוּרְיוֹן שֶׁפָּסְקוּ לָהּ חֲכָמִים סָאתַיִם יַיִן לְצִיקֵי קְדֵרָה מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת לְעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת. אָמְרָה לָהֶן: כָּךְ תִּפְסְקוּ לִבְנוֹתֵיכֶם. תָּנָא: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם הָיְתָה, וְלֹא עָנוּ אַחֲרֶיהָ אָמֵן.
human_translation: And if you wish, say she is accustomed she is given for pudding [ tzikei ], in a pot. As Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: An incident involving the daughter-in-law of Nakdimon ben Guryon, The Sages apportioned for her two se’a wine for pudding, from one Shabbat eve to another. She said to them, So may you apportion for your daughters taught: She was a widow waiting for her yavam , and the Sages did not answer amen after her
llm_translation: If you wish, I will say: If she is accustomed, they give her for the pot's crumbs. For Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: There was an incident with the bride of Nakdimon ben Gurion, where the Sages allotted her two se'ahs of wine for the pot's crumbs from Friday evening to Friday evening. She said to them: Thus shall you allot for your daughters. It was taught: She was a yevamah who was waiting, and they did not respond after her, Amen.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: כּוֹס אֶחָד — יָפֶה לָאִשָּׁה. שְׁנַיִם — נִיוּוּל הוּא. שְׁלֹשָׁה — תּוֹבַעַת בַּפֶּה. אַרְבָּעָה — אֲפִילּוּ חֲמוֹר תּוֹבַעַת בַּשּׁוּק וְאֵינָהּ מַקְפֶּדֶת. אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין בַּעְלָהּ עִמָּהּ. אֲבָל בַּעְלָהּ עִמָּהּ, לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: taught One cup good for a woman; two is a disgrace, three verbally request four even request a donkey in the marketplace, as she is not particular Rava said: They taught only if her husband is not with her. However, her husband is with her, we have no with it.
llm_translation: The text states: "It was taught: One cup - beautiful for a woman. Two cups - it is a disgrace. Three cups - a demand in the mouth. Four cups - even if a donkey demands in the market, and she is not particular. Rava said: They only taught this when her husband is not with her. But if her husband is with her, we have no concern about it."

hebrew_text: וְהָא חַנָּה, דְּבַעְלָהּ עִמָּהּ הֲוַאי! אַכְסְנַאי שָׁאנֵי. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מִנַּיִן לְאַכְסְנַאי שֶׁאָסוּר בְּתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּשְׁכִּימוּ בַבֹּקֶר וַיִּשְׁתַּחֲווּ לִפְנֵי ה׳ וַיָּשׁוּבוּ וַיָּבֹאוּ אֶל בֵּיתָם הָרָמָתָה וַיֵּדַע אֶלְקָנָה אֶת חַנָּה אִשְׁתּוֹ וַיִּזְכְּרֶהָ ה׳״, הַשְׁתָּא — אִין, מֵעִיקָּרָא — לָא.
human_translation: But Hannah was in which her husband was with her, a guest is different, as Rav Huna said: From where that a guest is prohibited from conjugal relations? As it is stated: “And they rose up in the morning early, and worshipped before the Lord, and returned, and came to their house to Ramah; and Elkanah knew Hannah his wife; and the Lord remembered her” now, yes, at the outset, no,
llm_translation: And this Chanah, her husband was with her! A hospitable person is different. As Rav Huna said: From where do we derive that a hospitable person is prohibited in marital relations? As it is stated: "And they arose in the morning and prostrated themselves before the Lord, and returned and came to their house at Ramah, and Elkanah knew Hannah his wife, and the Lord remembered her." At present - no, originally - yes.

hebrew_text: חוּמָא דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּאַבָּיֵי אֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: פְּסוֹק לִי מְזוֹנֵי! פְּסַק לַהּ. פְּסוֹק לִי חַמְרָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יָדַעְנָא בֵּיהּ בְּנַחְמָנִי דְּלָא הֲוָה שָׁתֵי חַמְרָא. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: חַיֵּי דְּמָר דַּהֲוָה מַשְׁקֵי לִי בְּשׁוּפְרָזֵי כִּי הַאי. בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָא מַחְוְיָא לֵיהּ אִיגַּלִּי דְּרָעַאּ, נְפַל נְהוֹרָא בְּבֵי דִינָא.
human_translation: Abaye’s wife, Ḥoma, came before Rava She said to him: Apportion sustenance for me, apportioned for her. Apportion wine for me said to her: I know that Naḥmani, did not drink wine. She said to him: By the Master’s life, he would give to drink in cups [ shufrazei ] as large as this. While she was showing him her arm became uncovered, a light had shined in the courtroom.
llm_translation: The wall of the house of Abaye came before Rava. She said to him: "Cut me my food!" He cut for her. "Cut me wine!" He said to her: "I know about you from Nachmani that you did not drink wine." She said to him: "By the life of Mar who used to give me in Shufrazei like this." While he was laughing at her, a candle fell in the house of the court.

hebrew_text: קָם רָבָא, עָל לְבֵיתֵיהּ תַּבְעַהּ לְבַת רַב חִסְדָּא. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ בַּת רַב חִסְדָּא: מַאן הֲוַי הָאִידָּנָא בְּבֵי דִּינָא? אֲמַר לַהּ: חוּמָא דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּאַבָּיֵי. נָפְקָא אַבָּתְרַהּ, מָחֲתָא לָהּ בְּקוּלְפֵי דְשִׁידָּא עַד דְּאַפְּקַהּ לַהּ מִכּוּלֵּי מָחוֹזָא. אָמְרָה לַהּ: קְטַלְתְּ לִיךְ תְּלָתָא, וְאָתֵת לְמִיקְטַל אַחֲרִינָא?!
human_translation: Rava arose, went home, requested from daughter of Rav Ḥisda. daughter of Rav Ḥisda said to him: Who was now in the courtroom? He said to her: Ḥoma, Abaye’s wife, went after struck her with the lock of a chest [ kulpei deshida ] until she drove her out of the entire Meḥoza, saying to her: You have killed three and you come to kill another
llm_translation: Rava arose, went to the house of the daughter of Rav Ḥisda. The daughter of Rav Ḥisda said to him: Who is the judge in the court today? He said to her: The father of the house of Abaye. She went out after him, she struck him with a skullcap until she removed him from all the city. She said to him: You killed three, and you want to kill others?!

hebrew_text: דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נְחֶמְיָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: פְּסוֹק לִי מְזוֹנֵי! פְּסַק לַהּ. פְּסוֹק לִי חַמְרָא! פְּסַק לַהּ. אֲמַר לַהּ: יָדַעְנָא בְּהוּ בִּבְנֵי מָחוֹזָא דְּשָׁתוּ חַמְרָא.
human_translation: The wife of Rav Yosef, son of Rava, came before Rav Neḥemya, son of Rav Yosef, She said to him: Apportion sustenance for me. apportioned for her. She said to him: Apportion wine for me He apportioned for her. He said to her: I know that the residents of Meḥoza drinking wine,
llm_translation: The household of Rav Yosef, son of Rava, came before Rav Nechemyah, son of Rav Yosef. She said to him: "Allocate me sustenance!" He allocated to her. She said to him: "Allocate me wine!" He allocated to her. He said to her: "We are familiar with them in the villages of the district that they drink wine."

hebrew_text: דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב מְנַשְּׁיָא מִדְּוִיל אֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: פְּסוֹק לִי מְזוֹנֵי! פְּסַק לַהּ. פְּסוֹק לִי חַמְרָא! פְּסַק לַהּ. פְּסוֹק לִי שִׁירָאֵי! אֲמַר לַהּ: שִׁירָאֵי לְמָה? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: לָךְ וּלְחַבְרָךְ וּלְחַבְרוּרָךְ.
human_translation: the wife of Rav Yosef, son of Rav Menashya of D’vil, came before Rav Yosef. She said to him: Apportion sustenance for me. He apportioned for her. Apportion wine for me. He apportioned for her. Apportion silk for me. said to her: Why silk She said to him: For you, for your friends, and for your friends’ friends.
llm_translation: The household of Rav Yosef, son of Rav Menashya from Dweil, came before Rav Yosef. She said to him: "Allocate me my sustenance!" He allocated to her. "Allocate me wine!" He allocated to her. "Allocate me barley!" He said to her: "Why barley?" She said to him: "For you, for your friend, and for your friend's friend."

hebrew_text: וְנוֹתֵן לָהּ מִטָּה וּמַפָּץ וְכוּ׳. מַפָּץ וּמַחְצֶלֶת לְמָה לַהּ דְּיָהֵב לַהּ? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּאַתְרָא דִּנְהִיגִי דְּמָלוּ פּוּרְיָא בְּחַבְלֵי, דְּמַבְגַּר לַהּ.
human_translation: And he give her a bed, a soft mat, Why does he to give her a soft mat and mat Rav Pappa said: of a place where it is the custom to fill a bed with ropes. Because age [ mevager ] her,
llm_translation: And he gives to her a bed and a sheet, etc. For what does she need a sheet and a pillow? Rav Papa said: In the place where they customarily fill the bed with ropes, so that it will be firm for her.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין נוֹתְנִין לָהּ כַּר וָכֶסֶת. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי נָתָן אָמְרוּ: נוֹתְנִין לָהּ כַּר וָכֶסֶת. הֵיכִי דָמֵי: אִי דְּאוֹרְחַהּ, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא? וְאִי דְּלָאו אוֹרְחַהּ, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי נָתָן?
human_translation: The Sages taught: One does not give a pillow and a cushion. In the name of Rabbi Natan, they said: One give her a pillow and a cushion. What are the circumstances? If it is her manner what is the reason for the first tanna And if it is not her manner, what is the reason for Rabbi Natan?
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One does not give her a pillow and a blanket. On account of Rabbi Natan they said: One gives her a pillow and a blanket. What is the case? If she is his regular wayfarer, what is the reason for the first Tanna's teaching? And if she is not his regular wayfarer, what is the reason for Rabbi Natan?

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, כְּגוֹן דְּאוֹרְחֵיהּ דִּידֵיהּ וְלָאו אוֹרְחַהּ דִּידַהּ. תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר, אָמַר לַהּ: כִּי אָזֵילְנָא שָׁקֵילְנָא לְהוּ, וְכִי אָתֵינָא, מַיְיתֵינָא לְהוּ בַּהֲדַאי. וְרַבִּי נָתָן סָבַר: אָמַרָה לֵיהּ: זִימְנִין דְּמִיתְרְמֵי בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת וְלָא מָצֵית מַיְיתֵת לְהוּ, וְשָׁקְלַתְּ לְהוּ לְדִידִי וּמַגְנֵית לִי עַל אַרְעָא.
human_translation: No, necessary where his manner but not her manner. The first tanna holds says to her: When I go away I will take and when I come I will bring it with me. And Rabbi Natan holds she say to him: Sometimes it happens at twilight and you are unable to bring it and you take my and you make me lie on the ground.
llm_translation: Not necessary, like his usual way and not her usual way. The first Tanna thought, he said to her: "When I go, I take them, and when I come, I bring them back." But Rabbi Natan thought: She said to him: "Sometimes when they are available between the suns and you did not find them, you bring them to me, and you take for yourself and protect me on the ground."

hebrew_text: וְנוֹתֵן לָהּ כִּפָּה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי:
human_translation: And he give her a cap, Rav Pappa said to Abaye:
llm_translation: And he gives to her a kippah. Rav Papa said to Abbaye:

hebrew_text: הַאי תַּנָּא שְׁלִיחַ עַרְטִלַאי וּרְמֵי מְסָאנֵי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תַּנָּא בִּמְקוֹם הָרִים קָאֵי, דְּלָא סַגִּיא בְּלָא תְּלָתָא זוּגֵי מְסָאנֵי. וְאַגַּב אוֹרְחֵיהּ קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּנִיתְּבִינְהוּ נִיהֲלַהּ בַּמּוֹעֵד, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּנֶיהְוֵי לַהּ שִׂמְחָה בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: This tanna left naked but wearing shoes, said to him: The tanna is standing, a mountainous region, in which she cannot do without three pairs of shoes, And in passing, teaches us that he should give them to her on a Festival, so that she will rejoice in them
llm_translation: This Mishna, the messenger of the Artilai and the shepherds of Masanei! He said to him: The Mishna is standing in a mountainous place, where it is not too difficult without the pairing of three shepherds. And due to its path, we hear that they would conduct it at the appointed time, so that it would be a joy for them in their gatherings.

hebrew_text: וְכֵלִים שֶׁל חֲמִשִּׁים זוּז. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: חֲמִשִּׁים זוּזֵי פְּשִׁיטֵי. מִמַּאי? מִדְּקָתָנֵי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּעָנִי שֶׁבְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, אֲבָל בִּמְכוּבָּד — הַכֹּל לְפִי כְּבוֹדוֹ. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ חֲמִשִּׁים זוּז מַמָּשׁ, עָנִי, חֲמִשִּׁים זוּז מְנָא לֵיהּ? אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ חֲמִשִּׁים זוּזֵי פְּשִׁיטֵי.
human_translation: And he give her clothes of fifty dinars. Abaye said: fifty simple [ peshitei ] dinars, From where From that it teaches: In what is this statement said? with the poorest of Jews. However, of a prominent man, all in accordance with his prominence. And if it enters your mind literally fifty dinars, from where a poor man fifty dinars? Rather, learn from this fifty simple dinars.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And vessels of fifty zuz. Abaye said: Fifty zuzim are obvious. From where? Because it is taught: In what case are these things said? In the case of a poor person in Israel, but in the case of an honored person, everything is according to his honor. And if it enters your mind that fifty zuzim literally, a poor person, how can he afford fifty zuzim? Rather, conclude from it that fifty zuzim are obvious."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין נוֹתְנִין לָהּ לֹא חֲדָשִׁים וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מוֹתַר מְזוֹנוֹת לַבַּעַל, מוֹתַר בְּלָאוֹת לָאִשָּׁה. מוֹתַר בְּלָאוֹת לָאִשָּׁה, לְמָה לַהּ? אָמַר רַחֲבָה: שֶׁמִּתְכַּסָּה בָּהֶן בִּימֵי נִדָּתָהּ, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְגַּנֶּה עַל בַּעְלָהּ.
human_translation: And he may not give her new The Sages taught: Leftover sustenance to the husband, leftover, worn clothes to the wife. worn clothes to the wife, why she Raḥava said: as she covers herself with them during her days of menstruation, so that she does not become repulsive to her husband.
llm_translation: And we do not give to her neither new ones etc. The Rabbis taught: It is permitted for the husband to provide sustenance, it is permitted for the wife to engage in marital relations. It is permitted for the wife to engage in marital relations, why is this? Rabah said: So that she may cover herself with them during her period of menstruation, in order that she not be disgraced before her husband.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נָקְטִינַן, מוֹתַר בְּלָאוֹת אַלְמָנָה לְיוֹרְשָׁיו. הָתָם הוּא דְּלָא תִּתְגַּנֵּי בְּאַפֵּיהּ, הָכָא — תִּתְגַּנֵּי וְתִתְגַּנֵּי.
human_translation: Abaye said: We have a tradition leftover, worn clothes a widow to heirs. it is there, so that she does not become repulsive to her husband here, let her become repulsive.
llm_translation: Abaye said: We have learned, it is permitted in negative commandments for a widow to her heirs. There, because she does not provoke with her mouth; here, she provokes and provokes.

hebrew_text: נוֹתֵן לָהּ מָעָה כֶּסֶף וְכוּ׳. מַאי ״אוֹכֶלֶת״? רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: אוֹכֶלֶת מַמָּשׁ. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: תַּשְׁמִישׁ.
human_translation: he gives her a silver ma’a , What is She eats, Rav Naḥman said: literally she eats Rav Ashi said: sexual relations.
llm_translation: He gives her a hundred silver coins, etc. What does "eating" mean? Rav Nachman said: Eating literally. Rav Ashi said: Intercourse.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: אוֹכֶלֶת עִמּוֹ לֵילֵי שַׁבָּת. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֲכִילָה — הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״אוֹכֶלֶת״, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר תַּשְׁמִישׁ, מַאי ״אוֹכֶלֶת״? לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״אָכְלָה וּמָחֲתָה פִיהָ וְאָמְרָה לֹא פָעַלְתִּי אָוֶן״.
human_translation: The mishna states: And she eats with him Shabbat evening Granted, according to the one who says eating, this is that which is taught: She eats. However, according to the one who says sexual relations, what is She eats? a euphemism, as it is written: she eats, and wipes her mouth, and says: I have done no wickedness”
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: A woman may eat with him on Shabbat night. Granted according to the one who says it refers to eating - that is why it uses the term "eating." But according to the one who says it refers to marital relations, what is the meaning of "eating"? To teach a higher level of intimacy, as it is written: "She has eaten and wiped her mouth, and said, 'I have done no wrong.'"

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אוֹכֶלֶת בְּלֵילֵי שַׁבָּת וְשַׁבָּת. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֲכִילָה — הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״וְשַׁבָּת״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר תַּשְׁמִישׁ — תַּשְׁמִישׁ בְּשַׁבָּת מִי אִיכָּא? וְהָאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: יִשְׂרָאֵל קְדוֹשִׁים הֵן, וְאֵין מְשַׁמְּשִׁין מִטּוֹתֵיהֶן בַּיּוֹם! הָאָמַר רָבָא: בְּבַיִת אָפֵל מוּתָּר.
human_translation: raises an objection: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says, She eats on Shabbat evening and Shabbat. Granted, according to the one who says eating, this is that which is taught: And Shabbat, However, according to the one who says sexual relations, are there sexual relations on Shabbat? But didn’t Rav Huna say: The Jewish people are holy and do not engage in sexual relations during the day? Rava said: in a dark house, it is permitted
llm_translation: The question was raised: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One may eat on the eve of Shabbat and on Shabbat. Granted according to the one who says eating is permitted — that is what is taught as "and Shabbat." But according to the one who says engaging in marital relations — is there engaging in marital relations on Shabbat? And Rav Huna said: The Israelites are holy and do not engage in marital relations during the day! Rava said: In a dark house it is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הָיְתָה מְנִיקָה. דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי עוּלָּא רַבָּה אַפִּיתְחָא דְּבֵי נְשִׂיאָה: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ אֵין אָדָם זָן אֶת בָּנָיו וּבְנוֹתָיו כְּשֶׁהֵן קְטַנִּים, אֲבָל זָן קְטַנֵּי קְטַנִּים.
human_translation: And if she is nursing, Rabbi Ulla the Great taught at the entrance to the house of the Nasi : Although said a person is not to sustain his sons and daughters when they are young, still, he sustain the very young ones.
llm_translation: "And if she was nursing. Rabbi Ulla sought out Rabba Apitha of the house of the Nasi: Even though they said, 'A man does not nurse his sons and daughters when they are small,' but he does nurse the very small ones."

hebrew_text: עַד כַּמָּה — עַד בֶּן שֵׁשׁ, כִּדְרַב אַסִּי. דְּאָמַר רַב אַסִּי: קָטָן בֶּן שֵׁשׁ יוֹצֵא בְּעֵירוּב אִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Until when Until the age of six, in accordance with Rav Asi, as Rav Asi said: A six-year-old minor may go out by his mother’s eiruv ,
llm_translation: Until when? Until the age of six, as Rav Assi said: A minor of the age of six may participate in the Eruv of his mother.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? מִדְּקָתָנֵי: הָיְתָה מְנִיקָה — פּוֹחֲתִין לָהּ מִמַּעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, וּמוֹסִיפִין לָהּ עַל מְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ. מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּבָעֵי לְמֵיכַל בַּהֲדַהּ? וְדִלְמָא מִשּׁוּם דְּחוֹלָה הִיא.
human_translation: From where from that it teaches: If she is nursing, is reduced from her earnings and is added for her sustenance. What is the reason not because needs to eat with her? But perhaps because she is ill
llm_translation: From what? Since it teaches: If she was nursing - they decrease her from her handiwork, and they add to her from her sustenance. What is the reason? Is it not because she needs to eat with dignity? And perhaps it is because she is sick.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, לִיתְנֵי ״אִם הָיְתָה חוֹלָה״, מַאי אִם הָיְתָה מְנִיקָה? וְדִלְמָא הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דִּסְתַם מְנִיקוֹת חוֹלוֹת נִינְהוּ. אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מוֹסִיפִין לָהּ יַיִן, שֶׁהַיַּיִן יָפֶה לְחָלָב.
human_translation: If so, let teach: If she was ill. What If she was nursing? But perhaps teaches us this, ordinary nursing women are ill, It was stated Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Wine is added for as wine is good for milk.
llm_translation: If so, let it teach: "If she was sick," what if she was nursing? And perhaps this teaches us that generally nursing women are considered sick. It was stated, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: They should add wine for her, for wine is good for milk.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אַף עַל פִּי
llm_translation: We will return to you even upon your mouth.

hebrew_text: מְצִיאַת הָאִשָּׁה וּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לְבַעְלָהּ. וִירוּשָּׁתָהּ — הוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת בְּחַיֶּיהָ. בּוֹשְׁתָּהּ, וּפְגָמָהּ — שֶׁלָּהּ.
human_translation: object found by a wife and earnings to her husband. And her inheritance, enjoys the profits in her lifetime. her humiliation and her degradation, to her.
llm_translation: Discovery of a woman and the work of her hands belong to her husband. And her inheritance - he eats its fruits during her lifetime. Her shame and blemish - belong to her.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא אוֹמֵר: בִּזְמַן שֶׁבַּסֵּתֶר — לָהּ שְׁנֵי חֲלָקִים, וְלוֹ אֶחָד. וּבִזְמַן שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי לוֹ שְׁנֵי חֲלָקִים, וְלָהּ אֶחָד. שֶׁלּוֹ יִנָּתֵן מִיָּד, וְשֶׁלָּהּ יִלְקַח בָּהֶן קַרְקַע, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: When that in a concealed she two parts, and one And when that in an exposed he two parts, and she one His should be given immediately. And her land should be purchased with it, and he enjoys the profits
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera says: When it is in secret - to her two shares, and to him one. And when it is in public - to him two shares, and to her one. His should be given immediately, and hers should be taken with them land, and he eats its fruits.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא הָאָב זַכַּאי בְּבִתּוֹ בְּקִידּוּשֶׁיהָ, בְּכֶסֶף, בִּשְׁטָר וּבְבִיאָה. זַכַּאי בִּמְצִיאָתָהּ וּבְמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ וּבַהֲפָרַת נְדָרֶיהָ. מְקַבֵּל אֶת גִּיטָּהּ, וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת בְּחַיֶּיהָ. נִישֵּׂאת — יָתֵר עָלָיו הַבַּעַל, שֶׁהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת בְּחַיֶּיהָ.
human_translation: What is teaching us? We learned the father is entitled, in his daughter, to her betrothal, with money, with a document, or through sexual intercourse. is entitled to object she finds, and to her earnings, and to nullification of her vows receives her bill of divorce but he does not enjoy the profits in her lifetime. she is married, the husband are greater than his, as enjoys the profits in her lifetime.
llm_translation: Gemara: What does this teach us? We learned: The father is entitled to his daughter through her betrothal, with money, with a document, and with intercourse. He is entitled through her finding, through her handiwork, and through annulling her vows. He can accept her divorce, but he does not eat the produce during her lifetime. If she is married, the husband has precedence over him, as he eats the produce during her lifetime.

hebrew_text: בּוֹשְׁתָּהּ וּפְגָמָהּ אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא וְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: was necessary for her humiliation and her degradation, a dispute between Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira and the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Her embarrassment and blemish are necessary for him, a dispute of Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא: מְצִיאַת הָאִשָּׁה לְעַצְמָהּ. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: לְבַעְלָהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה הַעֲדָפָה,
human_translation: A tanna teaches before Rava: object found by a wife to her; Rabbi Akiva says to her husband. said to Now, if, surplus
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rava: The finding of a woman for herself. Rabbi Akiva says: For her husband. He said to him: Now, what is the preference,

hebrew_text: דְּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ הִיא, אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְעַצְמָהּ — מְצִיאָתָהּ לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: which is her earnings Rabbi Akiva says to her, objects she found, not all the more so
llm_translation: The work of her hands, Rabbi Akiva said about herself - her finding, not all the more so?!

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֲנִי עוֹשָׂה לְפִיךָ״ — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְהָפֵר. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: יָפֵר, שֶׁמָּא תַּעֲדִיף עָלָיו יוֹתֵר מִן הָרָאוּי לוֹ! אֶלָּא אֵיפוֹךְ: מְצִיאַת הָאִשָּׁה לְבַעְלָהּ. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: לְעַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: as we learned that I produce konam , to your mouth, he need not nullify Rabbi Akiva says: He should nullify lest she produce surplus more than is fitting for him, Rather, reverse objects found by a wife to her husband; Rabbi Akiva says: to her.
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: "Their bow I will make of steel" - it does not need to be broken. Rabbi Akiva says: It should be broken, lest you prefer it more than what is fitting for you! Rather, the opposite: a woman's finding for her husband. Rabbi Akiva says: for herself.

hebrew_text: וְהָא כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּהַעְדָּפָה שֶׁלֹּא עַל יְדֵי הַדְּחָק — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּבַעַל הָוֵי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּהַעְדָּפָה שֶׁעַל יְדֵי הַדְּחָק: תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר לְבַעְלָהּ, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר לְעַצְמָהּ. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מְצִיאָתָהּ כְּהַעְדָּפָה שֶׁעַל יְדֵי הַדְּחָק דָּמֵי. פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: But when Ravin came didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan said: With regard to surplus that is not through effort, everyone agrees that it is husband’s. Where they disagree of surplus that is through effort. The first tanna holds to her husband, and Rabbi Akiva holds to her. Rav Pappa said: object found by comparable to surplus that is through effort, dispute between Rabbi Akiva and the Rabbis.
llm_translation: When Rabbin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: In a case of neglect that was not due to coercion - everyone agrees that it is considered as if it was intentional. When they disagree, it is in a case of neglect due to coercion: The first Tanna holds it is attributed to her husband, and Rabbi Akiva holds it is attributed to herself. Rav Papa said: Her finding is considered like neglect due to coercion. This is the dispute between Rabbi Akiva and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: עָשְׂתָה לוֹ שְׁתַּיִם בְּבַת אַחַת, מַהוּ? בָּעֵי רָבִינָא: שְׁלֹשָׁה אוֹ אַרְבָּעָה בְּבַת אַחַת, מַהוּ? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa raises a dilemma: she performed two for him simultaneously, what is Ravina raises a dilemma: three or four simultaneously, what is shall stand
llm_translation: The question of Rav Papa: She made for him two in one daughter, what? The question of Ravina: Three or four in one daughter, what? This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: בּוֹשְׁתָּהּ וּפְגָמָהּ. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא בַּר רַב חָנָן: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, בִּיֵּישׁ סוּסָתוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּבָעֵי לְמִיתַּן לֵיהּ בּוֹשֶׁת? וְסוּס בַּר בּוֹשֶׁת הוּא?! אֶלָּא: רָקַק בְּבִגְדוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּבָעֵי לְמִיתַּן לֵיהּ בּוֹשֶׁת?
human_translation: her humiliation and her degradation Rava bar Rav Ḥanan strongly objects to this: If that is so humiliated another’s horse, that also is required to give him humiliation? And a horse subject to humiliation? Rather, if one spat on another’s clothing, that also be required to give him humiliation?
llm_translation: She is ashamed and disgraced. Rava son of Rav Hanan objects to her: Rather, from now on, if his friend's horse is found in his possession, is it fitting to give him shame? Is a horse the son of shame?! Rather, if he spat on his friend's garment, is it fitting to give him shame?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי — וְהָתְנַן: רָקַק וְהִגִּיעַ בּוֹ הָרוֹק, וּפָרַע רֹאשׁ הָאִשָּׁה, וְהֶעֱבִיר טַלִּיתוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ — חַיָּיב לִיתֵּן לוֹ אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת זוּז. וְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בּוֹ, אֲבָל בְּבִגְדּוֹ — פָּטוּר! בְּבִגְדּוֹ — לֵית לֵיהּ זִילוּתָא, אִשְׁתּוֹ — אִית לַהּ זִילוּתָא.
human_translation: And if you would say indeed but didn’t we learn he spat and the saliva reached him, or he uncovered a woman’s head, or he removed his garment from he is obligated to give him four hundred dinars, And Rav Pappa said: They taught only his However, his garment, exempt. on one’s garment, he does not dishonor, one’s wife she dishonor,
llm_translation: And if you will say so, it is thus indeed — And we learned in a Mishnah: If one spits and the spittle reaches him, and he dishevels the head of the woman, and he removes his garment from him — he is obligated to pay him four hundred zuz. And Rav Papa said: They only taught this regarding him, but regarding his garment — he is exempt! Regarding his garment — there is no degradation, but regarding his wife — there is degradation.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, בִּיֵּישׁ עָנִי בֶּן טוֹבִים, דְּאִית לְהוּ זִילוּתָא לְכוּלְּהוּ בְּנֵי מִשְׁפָּחָה, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּבָעֵי לְמִיתַּן לְהוּ בּוֹשֶׁת לְכׇל בְּנֵי מִשְׁפָּחָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם — לָאו גּוּפַיְיהוּ, הָכָא — אִשְׁתּוֹ גּוּפֵיהּ הִיא.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: However, if that is so, one humiliated a poor person of noble descent, where there is dishonor for all members of the family, also that he is required to give humiliation to all members of the family? said to him There, not they themselves Here, one’s wife is his own self,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Rather, from now on, if there is a poor man who is a descendant of good lineage, who has the ability to provide for all the members of his family, is it proper that he should cause shame to all the members of his family? He said to him: There — it is not their own selves, but here — it is his wife herself.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַפּוֹסֵק מָעוֹת לַחֲתָנוֹ, וּמֵת חֲתָנוֹ, אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: יָכוֹל הוּא שֶׁיֹּאמַר: לְאָחִיךָ הָיִיתִי רוֹצֶה לִיתֵּן, וְלָךְ אִי אֶפְשִׁי לִיתֵּן.
human_translation: one who pledges money for his son-in-law and his son-in-law dies The Sages said: can say To your brother, I wanted to give but to you I do not want to give
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one designates gifts for his son-in-law, and the son-in-law dies, the Sages said: It is possible for him to say, "I intended to give to your brother, and to you I did not intend to give."

hebrew_text: פָּסְקָה לְהַכְנִיס לוֹ אֶלֶף דִּינָר — הוּא פּוֹסֵק כְּנֶגְדָּן חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה מָנֶה, וּכְנֶגֶד הַשּׁוּם הוּא פּוֹסֵק פָּחוֹת חוֹמֶשׁ.
human_translation: pledged to bring in for him one thousand dinars he pledges, fifteen hundred dinars against them. And against appraisal he pledges one-fifth less
llm_translation: He decided to bring in a thousand dinars - he decides against them fifteen mana, and against the value he decides less a fifth.

hebrew_text: שׁוּם בְּמָנֶה וְשָׁוֶה מָנֶה — אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא מָנֶה. שׁוּם בְּמָנֶה, הִיא נוֹתֶנֶת שְׁלֹשִׁים וְאֶחָד סֶלַע וְדִינָר. וּבְאַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת, הִיא נוֹתֶנֶת חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת. מַה
human_translation: appraisal at one hundred dinars and is worth one hundred dinars, he has only one hundred dinars. appraisal one hundred dinars she is giving thirty-one sela and dinar, And four hundred she is giving five hundred, what
llm_translation: Shum in a Maneh and Shaveh Maneh - he has only a Maneh. Shum in a Maneh, she gives thirty-one Selah and Dinar. And in four hundred, she gives five hundred. What

hebrew_text: שֶּׁחָתָן פּוֹסֵק — הוּא פּוֹסֵק פָּחוֹת חוֹמֶשׁ.
human_translation: son-in-law pledges he pledges one-fifth less
llm_translation: The son-in-law decides - he decides less a fifth.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר רִאשׁוֹן תַּלְמִיד חָכָם וְשֵׁנִי עַם הָאָרֶץ, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ רִאשׁוֹן עַם הָאָרֶץ וְשֵׁנִי תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, יָכוֹל לוֹמַר: לְאָחִיךְ הָיִיתִי רוֹצֶה לִיתֵּן, לְךָ אִי אֶפְשִׁי לִיתֵּן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Needless to say, first a Torah scholar and second an ignoramus, But even first an ignoramus and second a Torah scholar, may say: To your brother, I wanted to give to you I do not want to give
llm_translation: The Sages taught: It is unnecessary to say "the first is a Torah scholar and the second is an ignoramus," rather even if the first is an ignoramus and the second is a Torah scholar, he can say: "I wanted to give to your brother, but I cannot give to you."

hebrew_text: פָּסְקָה לְהַכְנִיס לוֹ אֶלֶף דִּינָר כּוּ׳. הַיְינוּ רֵישָׁא! תְּנָא שׁוּמָא רַבָּה וְקָתָנֵי שׁוּמָא זוּטָא. תְּנָא שׁוּמָא דִּידֵיהּ, וְקָתָנֵי שׁוּמָא דִּידַהּ.
human_translation: pledged to bring him one thousand These are the same as the first clause of the mishna, teaches a large appraisal and he teaches a small appraisal teaches appraisal and he teaches appraisal
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He decided to give him a thousand dinars." That is the beginning! One Tanna says: Shumah Rabba, and another Tanna says: Shumah Zuta. One Tanna according to his opinion, and another Tanna according to her opinion.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ פָּסְקָה לְהַכְנִיס לוֹ כְּסָפִים — סַלְעָהּ נַעֲשֶׂה שִׁשָּׁה דִּינָרִין. הֶחָתָן מְקַבֵּל עָלָיו עֲשָׂרָה דִּינָרִים לַקּוּפָּה לְכׇל מָנֶה וּמָנֶה. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: הַכֹּל כְּמִנְהַג הַמְּדִינָה.
human_translation: she pledged to bring him money her sela , becomes six groom accepts upon himself ten to the account for each and every hundred dinars Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Everything in accordance with the regional custom.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If she stipulated to bring in money for him - her kesuvah is six dinars. The groom accepts upon himself ten dinars for the kupah for each maneh. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Everything follows the custom of the land.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הַיְינוּ פּוֹסֵק כְּנֶגְדָּם חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר מָנֶה!
human_translation: This is he pledges against them fifteen hundred dinars.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Gemar ha'inu posek kenegdaam chamishah asar maneh!"

hebrew_text: תְּנָא עִסְקָא רַבָּה, וּתְנָא עִסְקָא זוּטָא. וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי תְּנָא עִסְקָא רַבָּה — דִּנְפִישׁ רַוְוחָא, אֲבָל עִסְקָא זוּטָא, דְּזוּטַר רַוְוחָא — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן עִסְקָא זוּטָא — דְּזוּטַר זִיּוּנָא, אֲבָל עִסְקָא רַבָּה, דִּנְפִישׁ זִיּוּנָא — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: taught large capital taught small capital. And necessary because if he taught large capital, which abundant profit, However, small capital, which small profit, say not necessary And if taught us small capital, because little expense, However, large capital, which abundant expense, say not necessary
llm_translation: The Mishna is great, and the Mishna is small. And it is necessary, for if the Mishna is great - it is expansive, but the Mishna is small, which is more concise - say no, it is necessary. And if we hear that the Mishna is small - it is more precise, but the Mishna is great, which is more expansive - say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: הֶחָתָן מְקַבֵּל עָלָיו עֲשָׂרָה דִּינָר לַקּוּפָּה. מַאי קוּפָּה? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: קוּפָּה שֶׁל בְּשָׂמִים. וְאָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לֹא נֶאֶמְרוּ דְּבָרִים הַלָּלוּ אֶלָּא בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: son-in-law accepts upon himself ten dinars to the account. What account? Rav Ashi said: an account of perfumes And Rav Ashi said: This statement was said only in Jerusalem,
llm_translation: The groom accepts upon himself ten dinars for the kuppah. What is kuppah? Rav Ashe said: Kuppah of perfumes. And Rav Ashe said: These matters were only stated in Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: בְּמָנֶה הַנִּישּׁוֹם, אוֹ בְּמָנֶה הַמִּתְקַבֵּל?
human_translation: Rav Ashi raises a dilemma: of hundred dinars that are appraised or of hundred dinars that are accepted
llm_translation: The question of Rav Ashi: In a maneh of Nishom, or in a maneh that is received?

hebrew_text: אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר מָנֶה הַמִּתְקַבֵּל: יוֹם רִאשׁוֹן, אוֹ כׇּל יוֹם וָיוֹם? אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר כׇּל יוֹם וָיוֹם: שַׁבָּת רִאשׁוֹנָה, אוֹ כׇּל שַׁבָּת וְשַׁבָּת? אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר כׇּל שַׁבָּת וְשַׁבָּת: חֹדֶשׁ רִאשׁוֹן, אוֹ כׇּל חֹדֶשׁ וָחֹדֶשׁ? אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר כׇּל חֹדֶשׁ וָחֹדֶשׁ: שָׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה, אוֹ כׇּל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: If you say hundred dinars that is accepted, first day or each day? If you say every day, first week or each week? If you say each week, first month or each month? If you say each month, first year or each year? shall stand
llm_translation: If you find to say "a maneh that is accepted": the first day, or every day? If you find to say every day: the first Shabbat, or every Shabbat? If you find to say every Shabbat: the first month, or every month? If you find to say every month: the first year, or every year? Teiku.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּבִתּוֹ שֶׁל נַקְדִּימוֹן בֶּן גּוּרְיוֹן שֶׁפָּסְקוּ לָהּ חֲכָמִים אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת זְהוּבִים לַקּוּפָּה שֶׁל בְּשָׂמִים לְבוֹ בַּיּוֹם. אָמְרָה לָהֶם: כָּךְ תִּפְסְקוּ לִבְנוֹתֵיכֶם, וְעָנוּ אַחֲרֶיהָ אָמֵן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: an incident involving daughter of Nakdimon ben Guryon. When the Sages designated for her four hundred gold for her account of perfumes, for on that same day, she said to them: This you pledge for your daughters, and they answered after her: Amen.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: There was an incident with the daughter of Nakdimon ben Gurion, where the sages allotted her four hundred gold coins for the incense box to be in her possession by day. She said to them: "Thus shall you allot for your daughters," and they responded after her, "Amen."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי שֶׁהָיָה רוֹכֵב עַל הַחֲמוֹר וְהָיָה יוֹצֵא מִירוּשָׁלַיִם, וְהָיוּ תַּלְמִידָיו מְהַלְּכִין אַחֲרָיו. רָאָה רִיבָה אַחַת שֶׁהָיְתָה מְלַקֶּטֶת שְׂעוֹרִים מִבֵּין גֶּלְלֵי בְהֶמְתָּן שֶׁל עַרְבִיִּים. כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאֲתָה אוֹתוֹ, נִתְעַטְּפָה בִּשְׂעָרָהּ וְעָמְדָה לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: The Sages taught: an incident involving Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai. When he was riding on a donkey and leaving Jerusalem, and his students were walking after him he saw a certain young woman who was gathering barley from among the dung of the animals of Arabs. When she saw him, she wrapped herself in her hair, stood before him.
llm_translation: The rabbis taught: There was an incident involving Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai who was riding on a donkey and was leaving Jerusalem, and his disciples were walking behind him. He saw a certain Arab woman who was gathering barley from among the dung of Arab horses. As soon as she saw him, she covered herself with her hair and stood before him.

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה לוֹ: רַבִּי, פַּרְנְסֵנִי. אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי, מִי אַתְּ? אָמְרָה לוֹ: בַּת נַקְדִּימוֹן בֶּן גּוּרְיוֹן אֲנִי. אֲמַר לַהּ: בִּתִּי, מָמוֹן שֶׁל בֵּית אָבִיךָ הֵיכָן הָלַךְ? אָמְרָה לוֹ: רַבִּי, לָא כְּדֵין מָתְלִין מַתְלָא בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם: ״מֶלַח מָמוֹן — חֶסֶר״? וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: ״חֶסֶד״. וְשֶׁל בֵּית חָמִיךְ הֵיכָן הוּא? אָמְרָה לוֹ: בָּא זֶה וְאִיבֵּד אֶת זֶה.
human_translation: She said to him: My teacher, sustain me. he said to her: My daughter, who are you? She said to him: I am daughter of Nakdimon ben Guryon. He said to her: My daughter, the money of your father’s household, where did go? She said to him: My teacher, is it not say such a proverb in Jerusalem: Salt for money is lacking [ ḥaser ]? And some say kindness [ ḥesed ] And of your father-in-law’s house, where is it? She said to him: This one came and destroyed that one;
llm_translation: She said to him: Rabbi, provide for me. He said to her: My daughter, who are you? She said to him: I am the daughter of Nakdimon ben Gurion. He said to her: My daughter, where did the money of your father's house go? She said to him: Rabbi, in Jerusalem they do not hang a purse on a peg: "Salt is money - lacking"? And some say: "Kindness." And where is the money of your father-in-law's house? She said to him: This one came and caused the other to be lost.

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה לוֹ: רַבִּי, זָכוּר אַתָּה כְּשֶׁחָתַמְתָּ עַל כְּתוּבָּתִי? אָמַר לָהֶן לְתַלְמִידָיו: זָכוּר אֲנִי כְּשֶׁחָתַמְתִּי עַל כְּתוּבָּתָהּ שֶׁל זוֹ, וְהָיִיתִי קוֹרֵא בָּהּ: אֶלֶף אֲלָפִים דִּינְרֵי זָהָב מִבֵּית אָבִיהָ, חוּץ מִשֶּׁל חָמִיהָ. בָּכָה רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי וְאָמַר: אַשְׁרֵיכֶם יִשְׂרָאֵל, בִּזְמַן שֶׁעוֹשִׂין רְצוֹנוֹ שֶׁל מָקוֹם אֵין כׇּל אוּמָּה וְלָשׁוֹן שׁוֹלֶטֶת בָּהֶם, וּבִזְמַן שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין רְצוֹנוֹ שֶׁל מָקוֹם, מוֹסְרָן בְּיַד אוּמָּה שְׁפָלָה. וְלֹא בְּיַד אוּמָּה שְׁפָלָה, אֶלָּא בְּיַד בְּהֶמְתָּן שֶׁל אוּמָּה שְׁפָלָה.
human_translation: She said to him: My teacher, you remember when you signed on my marriage contract? He said to his students: I remember that when I signed on the marriage contract of this and I read in it, a thousand thousands, gold dinars from her father’s house, aside from that from her father-in-law. Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai cried and said: How fortunate are you, Israel, when performs the will of Omnipresent, no nation or tongue rule over them; and when does not perform the will of the Omnipresent, He delivers them into the hand of a lowly nation. Not into the hand of a lowly nation, but even into the hand of the animals of a lowly nation,
llm_translation: She said to him: Rabbi, are you mindful when you affixed your signature to my document? He said to his disciples: I am mindful when I affixed my signature to her document, and I used to read in it: One thousand talents of gold from her father's house, except for that of her father-in-law. Rabban Yohanan ben Zakkai wept and said: Happy are you, Israel, when you do the will of the Omnipresent, no nation or tongue rules over you, but when you do not do the will of the Omnipresent, you are delivered into the hand of a low nation. And not into the hand of a low nation, but into the hand of an animal of a low nation.

hebrew_text: וְנַקְדִּימוֹן בֶּן גּוּרְיוֹן לָא עֲבַד צְדָקָה? וְהָתַנְיָא: אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל נַקְדִּימוֹן בֶּן גּוּרְיוֹן כְּשֶׁהָיָה יוֹצֵא מִבֵּיתוֹ לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, כְּלֵי מֵילָת הָיוּ
human_translation: And did not Nakdimon ben Guryon perform charity? Isn’t it taught They said about Nakdimon ben Guryon when he would leave his home to the study hall, fine woolen garments would
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Nakdimon ben Gurion did not do charity? And it was taught: They said about Nakdimon ben Gurion, when he would go out from his house to the study hall, they were garments of royalty.

hebrew_text: מַצִּיעִין תַּחְתָּיו, וּבָאִין עֲנִיִּים וּמְקַפְּלִין אוֹתָן מֵאַחֲרָיו! אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לִכְבוֹדוֹ הוּא דַּעֲבַד, וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כִּדְבָעֵי לֵיהּ לְמִיעְבַּד לָא עֲבַד. כִּדְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: לְפוּם גַּמְלָא שִׁיחְנָא.
human_translation: spread underneath him and the poor come and fold them up from behind him If you wish, say that he acted for his own honor, And if you wish, say that as he should have done, he did not do. As people say, according to the camel the burden.
llm_translation: We place cushions beneath him, and the poor come and fold them up from behind him! If you wish, say: It is for his honor that they do this, and if you wish, say: As the people say: According to the camel's strength.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק: אֶרְאֶה בְּנֶחָמָה, אִם לֹא רְאִיתִיהָ שֶׁהָיְתָה מְלַקֶּטֶת שְׂעוֹרִים מִבֵּין טַלְפֵי סוּסִים בְּעַכּוֹ. קָרָאתִי עָלֶיהָ מִקְרָא זֶה: ״אִם לֹא תֵדְעִי לָךְ הַיָּפָה בַּנָּשִׁים צְאִי לָךְ בְּעִקְבֵי הַצֹּאן וּרְעִי אֶת גְּדִיּוֹתַיִךְ״. אַל תִּקְרֵי ״גְּדִיּוֹתַיִךְ״, אֶלָּא ״גְּוִיּוֹתַיִךְ״.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said I will see the consolation if I did not see her gathering barley from between the hooves of horses in Akko. I recited this verse about her: “If you know not, O you fairest among women, go your way forth by the footsteps of the flock and feed your kids, Do not read “your kids [ gediyotayikh ]” but rather your bodies [ geviyotayikh ].
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said: I will see her in comfort, if I did not see her when she was gathering barley from among the hooves of horses in Akko. I called upon this verse regarding her: "If you do not know, O fairest among women, go forth in the footsteps of the flock, and pasture your kids." Do not read it as "your kids," rather as "your bodyguards."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הִכְנִיסָה לוֹ זָהָב — שָׁמִין אוֹתוֹ, וַהֲרֵי הוּא כְּשׇׁוְויוֹ. מֵיתִיבִי: הַזָּהָב הֲרֵי הוּא כְּכֵלִים. מַאי לָאו: כְּכֵלִים שֶׁל כֶּסֶף, דְּפָחֲתִי! לָא, כְּכֵלִים שֶׁל זָהָב, דְּלָא פָּחֲתִי. אִם כֵּן, כְּכֵלָיו מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rav Shemen bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: she brings him gold appraises it, and it is according to its value, raises an objection the gold is like utensils What, is it not like which diminish, No, like utensils of gold, which do not diminish. If so, should have like its utensils,
llm_translation: Rav Shemen bar Abba said, Rabbi Yochanan said: If he brought in gold for him — we estimate it, and behold, it is equivalent. It was asked: Gold is like vessels. What is the reason? Like silver vessels, which diminish! No, like gold vessels, which do not diminish. If so, he should require its vessels!

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא: זָהָב הֲרֵי הוּא כְּכֵלִים. דִּינְרֵי זָהָב, הֲרֵי הֵן כִּכְסָפִים. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ שֶׁלֹּא לְפוֹרְטָן — שָׁמִין אוֹתָן וַהֲרֵי הֵן בְּשׇׁוְויֵהֶן. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַסֵּיפָא, מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר אֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ שֶׁלֹּא לְפוֹרְטָן? הָא לָא נָפְקִי!
human_translation: And moreover, It is taught gold is like utensils gold are like silver Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: In a place where were accustomed not to exchange them, appraises them, and they are at their appraised worth, To which Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel If we say on the latter clause by inference that the first tanna holds even in a place where were accustomed not to exchange them. But they are not used
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And furthermore, it was taught: Gold, behold it is like vessels. Gold dinars, behold they are like silver coins. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: In a place where they are accustomed not to specify them - we evaluate them and behold they are equivalent. Is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel Ahaiya? If you say the latter part, from the general principle that the first Tanna holds that even in a place where they are accustomed not to specify them? But this does not come out!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו אַרֵישָׁא, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: זָהָב הֲרֵי הוּא כְּכֵלִים, מַאי כֵּלִים — כֵּלִים שֶׁל כֶּסֶף. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי הוּא כְּדִינָרִין שֶׁל זָהָב, בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ שֶׁלֹּא לְפוֹרְטָן!
human_translation: Rather, is it not on the first clause and this is what is saying: gold is like utensils. What utensils? Utensils of silver. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: it is like gold in a place where they are accustomed not to exchange it
llm_translation: Rather, it is not the first case, and thus he says: gold is like vessels, what are vessels - silver vessels. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: it is like gold dinars, in a place where they are accustomed not to specify them!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם אַסֵּיפָא, וּדְנָפְקִי עַל יְדֵי הַדְּחָק. וּבְהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּנָפְקִי, מַשְׁבְּחִינַן לַהּ, וּמָר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּלָא נָפְקִי אֶלָּא עַל יְדֵי הַדְּחָק, לָא מַשְׁבְּחִינַן לַהּ.
human_translation: No, actually on the latter clause and because they are used with difficulty. And they disagree about this: Sage, holds since they are used we increase for And Sage, holds since they are used only with difficulty, we do not increase for her.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: No, rather, the conclusion is, and it emerges through difficulty. And in that case where they disagreed, one Master holds: since it emerged, we praise Him, and the other Master holds: since it only emerged through difficulty, we do not praise Him.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כּוּלַּהּ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הִיא, וְחַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: זָהָב הֲרֵי הוּא כְּכֵלִים, דִּינְרֵי זָהָב הֲרֵי הֵן כִּכְסָפִים. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לְפוֹרְטָן. אֲבָל בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ שֶׁלֹּא לְפוֹרְטָן — שָׁמִין אוֹתָם וַהֲרֵי הֵן בְּשׇׁוְויֵהֶן, דִּבְרֵי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. שֶׁרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ שֶׁלֹּא לְפוֹרְטָן, שָׁמִין אוֹתָם וַהֲרֵי הֵן בְּשׇׁוְויֵהֶן.
human_translation: If you wish, say entire is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and is incomplete and this it is teaching: gold is like utensils gold dinars are like money. In what is this statement said? In a place where accustomed to exchange the However, in a place where the accustomed not to exchange the appraises their and they are at their appraised worth. the statement of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, as Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: In a place where the accustomed not to exchange them, appraises their and they are at their appraised worth.
llm_translation: If you wish, say: The entire matter is according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and the lacking are from the lacking. And thus it was taught: Gold, behold it is like vessels, gold coins, behold they are like silver. In what case are these matters said? In a place where they are accustomed to specify. But in a place where they are not accustomed to specify - we evaluate them and behold they are equal, the words of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. For Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: In a place where they are not accustomed to specify, we evaluate them and behold they are equal.

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם, ״כְּכֵלָיו״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! קַשְׁיָא. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בְּדַהֲבָא פְּרִיכָא. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: בְּמַמְלָא.
human_translation: in any case, should have like its utensils difficult. If you wish, say With what are we dealing here? With smashed gold Rav Ashi said: with granules
llm_translation: From every place, "like its vessel" is required! Difficulty. If you wish, say: What are we dealing with here - with refined gold. Rav Ashi said: with a full measure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: בְּשָׂמִים שֶׁל אַנְטוֹכְיָא — הֲרֵי הֵן כִּכְסָפִים. אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: גְּמַלִּים שֶׁל עַרְבִיָּא — אִשָּׁה גּוֹבָה פֻּרְנָא מֵהֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: spices in Antioch, are like money. Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: camels in Arabia, a woman may collect marriage settlement from them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: with the perfumes of Antioch, behold they are like silver. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: camels of Arabia, a woman can take a loaf of bread from them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פַּפִּי: הָנֵי תּוֹתְבֵי דְּבֵי מִכְסֵי, אִשָּׁה גּוֹבָה פֻּרְנָא מֵהֶם. וְאָמַר רַב פַּפִּי: הָנֵי שַׂקֵּי דְרוּדְיָא וְאַשְׁלֵי דְקִמְחוֹנְיָא — אִשָּׁה גּוֹבָה פֻּרְנָא מֵהֶן. אָמַר רָבָא, מֵרֵישׁ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי אַרְנְקֵי דְמָחוֹזָא — אִשָּׁה גּוֹבָה פֻּרְנָא מֵהֶם. מַאי טַעְמָא? אַסְמַכְתַּיְיהוּ עֲלַיְיהוּ. כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזַאי דְּשָׁקְלִי לְהוּ וְנָפְקִי, וְכִי מַשְׁכְּחִי אַרְעָא זָבְנִי בְּהוּ, אָמֵינָא: אַסְמַכְתַּיְיהוּ אַאַרְעָא הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Pappi said: those robes in Bei Mikhsei, a woman may collect marriage settlement from them And Rav Pappi said: these sacks in Rodya and ropes in Kimḥonya, a woman may collect marriage settlement from them. Rava said: Initially, I would have said those money pouches [ arnakei ] in Meḥoza, a woman may collect from them. What is the reason? They rely on them, Once I saw that they take them and are used, and when they find land they buy with them I said rely on land.
llm_translation: Rav Pappi said: Those officials of the tax authorities, a woman collects her due from them. And Rav Pappi said: Those officials of the city of Dura and the officials of the city of Kimchonya - a woman collects her due from them. Rava said, from the beginning I thought: Those officials of the city of Mahoza - a woman collects her due from them. What is the reason? I rely on them. Once she sees that she took from them and left, and when she finds a field she buys with it, I say: I rely on them, it is a field.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּשִּׂיא אֶת בִּתּוֹ סְתָם — לֹא יִפְחוֹת לָהּ מֵחֲמִשִּׁים זוּז. פָּסַק לְהַכְנִיסָהּ עֲרוּמָּה — לֹא יֹאמַר הַבַּעַל ״כְּשֶׁאַכְנִיסֶנָּה לְבֵיתִי אֲכַסֶּנָּה בִּכְסוּתִי״, אֶלָּא מְכַסָּהּ וְעוֹדָהּ בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ. וְכֵן הַמַּשִּׂיא אֶת הַיְּתוֹמָה — לֹא יִפְחוֹת לָהּ מֵחֲמִשִּׁים זוּז. אִם יֵשׁ בַּכִּיס — מְפַרְנְסִין אוֹתָהּ לְפִי כְּבוֹדָהּ.
human_translation: one who marries his daughter unspecified, he must not give her less than fifty dinars. pledged to bring her bare, the husband should not say: When I bring her into my house, I will clothe her with my clothing, Rather, he must clothe her while she is yet in her father’s house, And similarly, who marries an orphan girl, must not give her less than fifty dinars. If there are in the fund, provide for her, according to her dignity.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who marries off his daughter in secret - he may not provide her with less than fifty zuz. If he decided to bring her into the marriage chamber naked - the husband may not say, "When I bring her into my house, I will provide her with clothing," rather he must cover her and provide her with clothing in her father's house. Similarly, one who marries off an orphan girl - he may not provide her with less than fifty zuz. If he has money in his pocket - they sustain her according to her honor.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: חֲמִשִּׁים זוּזֵי פְּשִׁיטֵי. מִמַּאי — מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אִם יֵשׁ בַּכִּיס — מְפַרְנְסִין אוֹתָהּ לְפִי כְּבוֹדָהּ, וְאָמְרִינַן מַאי כִּיס? אָמַר רַחֲבָה: אַרְנְקִי שֶׁל צְדָקָה. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתִּין חֲמִשִּׁים זוּזֵי מַמָּשׁ, אִם יֵשׁ בַּכִּיס כַּמָּה יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ? אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ חֲמִשִּׁים זוּזֵי פְּשִׁיטֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said: fifty dinars provincial From where From that the latter clause teaches: If there are in the fund, provide for her, according to her dignity. And we say: What is fund? Raḥava said: charity fund. And if it enters our minds fifty actual, dinars, if there are in the fund, how many do we give him? Rather, conclude from this fifty provincial dinars.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Abaye: fifty zuzim obvious. From what — from the end of the Mishnah: if there is in the purse — they provide for her according to her honor, and we say what is a purse? Rabbah said: a charity purse. And if you think fifty zuzim literally, if there is in the purse how much should we give her? Rather, understand from it fifty zuzim obvious.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יָתוֹם וִיתוֹמָה שֶׁבָּאוּ לְהִתְפַּרְנֵס — מְפַרְנְסִין אֶת הַיְּתוֹמָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְפַרְנְסִין אֶת הַיָּתוֹם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָאִישׁ דַּרְכּוֹ לַחְזוֹר עַל הַפְּתָחִים, וְאֵין אִשָּׁה דַּרְכָּהּ לַחְזוֹר. יָתוֹם וִיתוֹמָה
human_translation: The Sages taught: an orphan boy and an orphan girl who have come to be supported provide for the orphan girl and afterward provide for the orphan boy. because it is the way of a man to circulate about the entryways and it is not a woman’s way to circulate an orphan boy and orphan girl
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: An orphan boy and an orphan girl who come to be supported - they support the orphan girl first, and afterwards they support the orphan boy, because a man's way is to return to the doors, and a woman's way is not to return. Orphan boy and orphan girl.

hebrew_text: שֶׁבָּאוּ לִינָּשֵׂא — מַשִּׂיאִין אֶת הַיְּתוֹמָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַשִּׂיאִין אֶת הַיָּתוֹם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁבּוֹשְׁתָּהּ שֶׁל אִשָּׁה מְרוּבָּה מִשֶּׁל אִישׁ.
human_translation: who have come to be married marry the orphan girl and afterward marry the orphan boy, because the humiliation of a woman is greater than that of man.
llm_translation: When they come to marry - they marry off the orphan girl first, and afterwards they marry off the orphan boy, because the embarrassment of a woman is greater than that of a man.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יָתוֹם שֶׁבָּא לִישָּׂא — שׂוֹכְרִין לוֹ בַּיִת, וּמַצִּיעִין לוֹ מִטָּה וְכׇל כְּלֵי תַשְׁמִישׁוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַשִּׂיאִין לוֹ אִשָּׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״דֵּי מַחְסוֹרוֹ אֲשֶׁר יֶחְסַר לוֹ״. ״דֵּי מַחְסוֹרוֹ״ — זֶה הַבַּיִת, ״אֲשֶׁר יֶחְסַר״ — זֶה מִטָּה וְשֻׁלְחָן, ״לוֹ״ — זוֹ אִשָּׁה. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אֶעֱשֶׂה לּוֹ עֵזֶר כְּנֶגְדּוֹ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: an orphan who has come to marry, rent a house for him, arrange for him a bed and all his utensils, and thereafter marry him a wife, as it is stated: sufficient for his deficiency in that which is deficient for him” “sufficient for his deficiency,” this the house. “Which is deficient”; this bed and table. “For him [ lo ]”; this a wife. And similarly states: “I will make him [ lo ] a helpmate for him”
llm_translation: The sages taught: A orphan who comes to get married - they rent a house for him, and offer him a bed and all the utensils of his use, and afterwards they find him a wife, as it is said: "According to the lack that he lacks." "According to the lack that he lacks" - this refers to the house, "that he lacks" - this refers to a bed and a table, "for him" - this refers to a wife. And so it says: "I will make him a helpmate opposite him."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״דֵּי מַחְסוֹרוֹ״ — אַתָּה מְצֻוֶּוה עָלָיו לְפַרְנְסוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְצֻוֶּוה עָלָיו לְעַשְּׁרוֹ. ״אֲשֶׁר יֶחְסַר לוֹ״ — אֲפִילּוּ סוּס לִרְכּוֹב עָלָיו וְעֶבֶד לָרוּץ לְפָנָיו. אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל הִלֵּל הַזָּקֵן שֶׁלָּקַח לְעָנִי בֶּן טוֹבִים אֶחָד סוּס לִרְכּוֹב עָלָיו וְעֶבֶד לָרוּץ לְפָנָיו. פַּעַם אַחַת לֹא מָצָא עֶבֶד לָרוּץ לְפָנָיו, וְרָץ לְפָנָיו שְׁלֹשָׁה מִילִין.
human_translation: the Sages taught: “Sufficient for his deficiency”; you are commanded with respect to to support him, but you are not commanded with respect to him to make him wealthy, “Which is deficient for him”; even a horse upon which to ride and a servant to run in front of him They said about Hillel the Elder that he obtained for a poor person of noble descent a horse upon which to ride and a servant to run in front of him. One time he did not find a servant to run in front of him, and ran in front of him three mil ,
llm_translation: The sages taught: "His lack" - you are commanded to sustain him, but you are not commanded to enrich him. "What he lacks" - even if he lacks a horse to ride upon and a servant to run before him. They said about Hillel the Elder that he bought for a poor man a horse to ride upon and a servant to run before him. Once he could not find a servant to run before him, so he ran before him for three miles.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאַנְשֵׁי גָּלִיל הָעֶלְיוֹן שֶׁלָּקְחוּ לְעָנִי בֶּן טוֹבִים אֶחָד מִצִּיפּוֹרִי לִיטְרָא בָּשָׂר בְּכׇל יוֹם. לִיטְרָא בָּשָׂר מַאי רְבוּתָא? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לִיטְרָא בָּשָׂר מִשֶּׁל עוֹפוֹת. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא בְּלִיטְרָא, בָּשָׂר מַמָּשׁ. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הָתָם כְּפָר קָטָן הָיָה, בְּכׇל יוֹמָא הֲוָה מַפְסְדִי חֵיוְתָא אַמְּטוּלְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: an incident involving the people of the Upper Galilee, who bought for a poor person of noble descent from Tzippori a litra of meat every day. a litra of meat, what is the novelty Rav Huna said: a litra of meat of poultry, And if you wish, say for a litra actual meat. Rav Ashi said there, it was a small village, every day they would lose animal for him.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident involving the people of the Upper Galilee who would give Ani son of Tovim one Litra of meat every day. What is Litra of meat? Rav Huna said: Litra of meat from birds. And if you wish, say: Litra, actual meat. Rav Ashe said: There, it was a small village, and every day his livestock would suffer a loss.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, אָמַר לֵיהּ: בַּמָּה אַתָּה סוֹעֵד? אֲמַר לֵיהּ בְּבָשָׂר שָׁמֵן וְיַיִן יָשָׁן. רְצוֹנְךָ שֶׁתְּגַלְגֵּל עִמִּי בַּעֲדָשִׁים? גִּלְגֵּל עִמּוֹ בַּעֲדָשִׁים וָמֵת. אָמַר: אוֹי לוֹ לְזֶה שֶׁהֲרָגוֹ נְחֶמְיָה. אַדְּרַבָּה, ״אוֹי לוֹ לִנְחֶמְיָה שֶׁהֲרָגוֹ לְזֶה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא: אִיהוּ הוּא דְּלָא אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְפַנּוֹקֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ כּוּלֵּי הַאי.
human_translation: A certain came before Rabbi Neḥemya He said to him: On what do you dine? He said to him: on fatty meat and aged wine. Is it your wish to belittle yourself with me in lentils, He partook with him of lentils, and he died, said: Woe to this one who was killed Neḥemya. On the contrary, should have said: Woe to Neḥemya who killed this one. Rather, he, who should not have pampered himself so
llm_translation: That one who came before Rabbi Nechemiah, he said to him: "With what do you dine?" He said to him: "With fatty meat and aged wine." "Would you like to roll with me in lentils?" He rolled with him in lentils and died. He said: "Woe to this one, for Nechemiah killed him." Ravah said, "Woe to Nechemiah, for he killed this one." Rather, he himself did not want to endanger himself for all of this.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אָמַר לוֹ: בַּמָּה אַתָּה סוֹעֵד? אָמַר לוֹ: בְּתַרְנְגוֹלֶת פְּטוּמָה וְיַיִן יָשָׁן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלָא חָיְישַׁתְּ לְדוּחְקָא דְּצִיבּוּרָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַטּוּ מִדִּידְהוּ קָאָכֵילְנָא? מִדְּרַחְמָנָא קָאָכֵילְנָא! דְּתָנֵינָא: ״עֵינֵי כֹל אֵלֶיךָ יְשַׂבֵּרוּ וְאַתָּה נוֹתֵן לָהֶם אֶת אׇכְלָם בְּעִתּוֹ״. ״בְּעִתָּם״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״בְּעִתּוֹ״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד נוֹתֵן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא פַּרְנָסָתוֹ בְּעִתּוֹ.
human_translation: A certain person came before Rava He said to him: On what do you dine? He said to him: On a fattened hen and aged wine. He said to him: And were you not concerned for a burden to the community He said to him: Is that to say from their I eat? I eat from the Merciful One. as we learned “the eyes of all wait for You, and You give them their food in its time” At their time, is stated, rather “in its time.” teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, gives each and every one his sustenance at its proper time,
llm_translation: That one who came before Rava, he said to him: "With what do you sustain yourself?" He said to him: "With a roasted chicken and aged wine." He said to him: "And you are not concerned about the distress of the community?" He said to him: "Are we eating from our own, or are we eating from the Merciful One's?" As it was taught: "The eyes of all look to You with hope, and You give them their food in its time." It does not say "in their time," but rather "in its time" — this teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, provides sustenance for each and every one in its time.

hebrew_text: אַדְּהָכִי, אֲתַאי אֲחָתֵיהּ דְּרָבָא דְּלָא חָזְיָא לֵיהּ תְּלֵיסְרֵי שְׁנֵי, וְאַתְיָא לֵיהּ תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת פְּטוּמָה וְיַיִן יָשָׁן. אָמַר: מַאי דְּקַמָּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נַעֲנֵתִי לְךָ, קוּם אֱכוֹל.
human_translation: In the meantime, Rava’s sister, who had not seen him for thirteen years, came. And she brought him a fattened hen and aged wine. Rava said What is this that in front of me said to him: I have responded [ na’aneti ] to your Arise eat.
