llm_translation: So, his sister came, whom Rava did not see for thirteen years, and she brought him a roasted chicken and aged wine. He said: "What is this that has come first?" She said to him: "I have prepared for you, get up and eat."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין לוֹ וְאֵינוֹ רוֹצֶה לְהִתְפַּרְנֵס — נוֹתְנִין לוֹ לְשׁוּם הַלְוָאָה, וְחוֹזְרִין וְנוֹתְנִין לוֹ לְשׁוּם מַתָּנָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: נוֹתְנִין לוֹ לְשׁוּם מַתָּנָה, וְחוֹזְרִין וְנוֹתְנִין לוֹ לְשׁוּם הַלְוָאָה. לְשׁוּם מַתָּנָה? הָא לָא שָׁקֵיל! אָמַר רָבָא: לִפְתּוֹחַ לוֹ לְשׁוּם מַתָּנָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: does not have and does not want to be supported provide him as a loan and go back and give to him as a gift; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: give him as a gift, and go back and give to him as a loan. as a gift? he does not take it Rava said: to begin with him as a gift.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If he has no desire to engage in business - they give him for the purpose of a loan, and then they go back and give him for the purpose of a gift, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: they give him for the purpose of a gift, and then they go back and give him for the purpose of a loan. For the purpose of a gift? Isn't that obvious! Rava said: to open up for him for the purpose of a gift.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ לוֹ וְאֵינוֹ רוֹצֶה לְהִתְפַּרְנֵס — נוֹתְנִין לוֹ לְשׁוּם מַתָּנָה, וְחוֹזְרִין וְנִפְרָעִין מִמֶּנּוּ. חוֹזְרִין וְנִפְרָעִין הֵימֶנּוּ, תּוּ לָא שָׁקֵיל! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לְאַחַר מִיתָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ לוֹ וְאֵינוֹ רוֹצֶה לְהִתְפַּרְנֵס — אֵין נִזְקָקִין לוֹ. אֵין לוֹ וְאֵינוֹ רוֹצֶה לְהִתְפַּרְנֵס — אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: הָבֵא מַשְׁכּוֹן וָטוֹל, כְּדֵי שֶׁתָּזוּחַ דַּעְתּוֹ עָלָיו.
human_translation: he has but does not want to support himself give him as a gift, and then go back and collect from him. go back and collect from him? subsequently he would not take Rav Pappa said: after death. Rabbi Shimon says, he has and does not want to be supported do not get involved with him, he does not have and does not want to be supported say to him: Bring collateral and take so that his mindset should be raised for him,
llm_translation: He has and does not want to support himself - they give him a gift, and then they take it back from him. They take it back from him, woe to him! Rav Papa said: after his death. Rabbi Shimon says: he has and does not want to support himself - we do not need him. He does not have and does not want to support himself - they say to him: bring collateral and take, so that his mind will be at ease about it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״הַעֲבֵט״, זֶה שֶׁאֵין לוֹ וְאֵינוֹ רוֹצֶה לְהִתְפַּרְנֵס, שֶׁנּוֹתְנִים לוֹ לְשׁוּם הַלְוָאָה, וְחוֹזְרִין וְנוֹתְנִין לוֹ לְשׁוּם מַתָּנָה. ״תַּעֲבִיטֶנּוּ״, זֶה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ וְאֵינוֹ רוֹצֶה לְהִתְפַּרְנֵס, שֶׁנּוֹתְנִין לוֹ לְשׁוּם מַתָּנָה, וְחוֹזְרִין וְנִפְרָעִין הֵימֶנּוּ לְאַחַר מִיתָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught “ Ha’avet ”; this who does not have and does not want to be supported that provide him as a loan and go back and give to him as a gift. “ Ta’avitenu ”; this who has and does not want to support that provide as a gift, and then go back and collect from after death. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Ha'avet," this refers to one who has no desire to support himself, so they give him for the purpose of a loan, and then they go back and give him for the purpose of a gift. "Ta'avitenhu," this refers to one who has but does not want to support himself, so they give him for the purpose of a gift, and then they go back and collect from his estate after his death, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יֵשׁ לוֹ וְאֵינוֹ רוֹצֶה לְהִתְפַּרְנֵס — אֵין נִזְקָקִין לוֹ. וְאֶלָּא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״תַּעֲבִיטֶנּוּ״? דִּבְּרָה תוֹרָה כִלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: he has and does not want to support do not get involved with him. How then do I uphold “ ha’avet ta’avitenu ”? The Torah spoke in the language of men,
llm_translation: The sages say: If he has the ability but does not wish to support himself - we are not obligated to support him. But rather, how do I fulfill "you shall surely support him"? The Torah spoke in the language of people.

hebrew_text: מָר עוּקְבָא הֲוָה עַנְיָא בְּשִׁיבָבוּתֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה רְגִיל כׇּל יוֹמָא דְּשָׁדֵי לֵיהּ אַרְבְּעָה זוּזֵי בְּצִינּוֹרָא דְּדַשָּׁא. (יוֹם אֶחָד) [יוֹמָא חַד] אֲמַר: אֵיזִיל אִיחְזֵי מַאן קָעָבֵיד בִּי הָהוּא טֵיבוּתָא. הָהוּא יוֹמָא נְגַהָא לֵיהּ לְמָר עוּקְבָא לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא, אָתְיָא דְּבֵיתְהוּ בַּהֲדֵיהּ.
human_translation: Mar Ukva a pauper in his neighborhood, was accustomed every day to toss four dinars for him into the hinge of the door. One day said: I will go see who is doing this service for me. That day Mar Ukva was delayed in the study hall, his wife came with him
llm_translation: Mar Ukva was poor in his old age, as he used to spend four zuzim daily on the maintenance of the drainpipe. One day he said, "I will go and see who is honoring me with that goodness." On that day, the wife of Mar Ukva went to the study hall, and he came to his house in her absence.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּחַזְיֵוהּ דְּקָא מַצְלֵי לֵיהּ לְדַשָּׁא, נְפַק בָּתְרַיְיהוּ. רְהוּט מִקַּמֵּיהּ, עָיְילִי לְהָהוּא אַתּוּנָא דַּהֲוָה גְּרִופָה נוּרָא, הֲוָה קָא מִיקַּלְיָין כַּרְעֵיהּ דְּמָר עוּקְבָא. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ: שְׁקוֹל כַּרְעָיךְ אוֹתֵיב אַכַּרְעַאי. חֲלַשׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אֲנָא שְׁכִיחָנָא בְּגַוֵּיהּ דְּבֵיתָא וּמְקָרְבָא אַהֲנָיָיתִי.
human_translation: When saw that was turning the door, went out after them ran from before him they entered a certain furnace whose fire was raked Mar Ukva’s legs were being singed, his wife said to him: Raise your legs and set them on my legs, became distraught. she said to him: I am found inside the house, and my assistance is ready
llm_translation: Since he saw that he was preparing a dish for him to eat, he went out after him. He ran after him, and they came to a certain furnace that was fiery hot, and the heat was melting the heels of Rabbi Akiva. His wife said to him: "Take off your shoes and sit down." His mind weakened, and she said to him: "I am accustomed to the poverty of our house and I am satisfied with it."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי כּוּלֵּי הַאי? דְּאָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא, וְאָמְרִי לָהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: נוֹחַ לוֹ לָאָדָם שֶׁיִּמְסוֹר עַצְמוֹ לְתוֹךְ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ, וְאַל יַלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵרוֹ בָּרַבִּים. מְנָא לַן — מִתָּמָר, דִּכְתִיב: ״הִיא מוּצֵאת״.
human_translation: And what all this? as Mar Zutra bar Toviya said Rav said, and some say Rav Huna bar Bizna said Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida said, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: It is preferable for a person to deliver himself into a fiery furnace so that not whiten face his friend in public. From where do we From the Tamar, as it is written: she was brought forth,
llm_translation: "What is the meaning of this? For Mar Zutra son of Tobiah said in the name of Rav, and some say in the name of Rav Huna son of Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Chasida, and some say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: It is better for a person to be thrown into a fiery furnace than to shame his fellow in public. How do we know this? From a palm tree, as it is written: 'She finds it.'"

hebrew_text: מָר עוּקְבָא הֲוָה עַנְיָא בְּשִׁיבָבוּתֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה רְגִיל לְשַׁדּוֹרֵי לֵיהּ אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי כׇּל מַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְּכִיפּוּרָא. יוֹמָא חַד שַׁדְּרִינְהוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ בְּיַד בְּרֵיהּ. אֲתָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא צְרִיךְ. אָמַר מַאי חֲזֵית? חֲזַאי דְּקָא מְזַלְּפִי לֵיהּ יַיִן יָשָׁן. אָמַר: מְפַנַּק כּוּלֵּי הַאי! עַיְיפִינְהוּ וְשַׁדְּרִינְהוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: Mar Ukva pauper in his neighborhood, was accustomed to send to him four hundred dinars every eve of Yom Kippur. One day he sent to him by the hand of his son. returned said to him: does not need said: What did you see I saw them spilling old wine for him, said: pampered this much He doubled and sent them to him.
llm_translation: Mar Ukva was poor in his old age, as he used to distribute four hundred zuz every day of Yom Kippur. One day, his son-in-law sent it to him in the hand of his son. He came and said to him: It is not necessary. He said, "What did you see?" He saw that he was diluting old wine for him. He said, "You are pampering this old man!" He exhausted himself and distributed it himself.

hebrew_text: כִּי קָא נִיחָא נַפְשֵׁיהּ, אֲמַר: אַיְיתוֹ לִי חוּשְׁבְּנַאי דִּצְדָקָה. אַשְׁכַּח דַּהֲוָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ שִׁבְעַת אַלְפֵי דִּינָרֵי סְיָאנְקֵי. אֲמַר: זַוְודַאי קַלִּילֵי וְאוֹרְחָא רַחִיקְתָּא. קָם בַּזְבְּזֵיהּ לְפַלְגֵיהּ מָמוֹנֵיהּ. הֵיכִי עֲבַד הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעַאי, בְּאוּשָׁא הִתְקִינוּ: הַמְבַזְבֵּז — אַל יְבַזְבֵּז יוֹתֵר מֵחוֹמֶשׁ! הָנֵי מִילֵּי מֵחַיִּים, שֶׁמָּא יֵרֵד מִנְּכָסָיו. אֲבָל לְאַחַר מִיתָה לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: When was dying, he said: Bring me my charity records. He found that it was written there seven thousand siankei , dinars, He said: My provisions are light, and the way is far. He got up spent half his money How did he do this? But didn’t Rabbi Ilai say: In Usha they instituted: One who spends he should not spend more than one-fifth This applies while he is alive, perhaps he will descend from his holdings But after death, we have no with it.
llm_translation: When he found himself in a favorable situation, he said: "Bring me the account of charity." He found that it was written in it seven thousand dinars of fine silk. He said: "Certainly they are light and the way is long." He rose and squandered half of his wealth. How did he act in this manner? But didn't Rabbi Ilai say, in Ousha they established: one who squanders - should not squander more than a fifth! These are matters of life, perhaps he will descend from his wealth. But after death, we have no concern with it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַבָּא הֲוָה צָיַיר זוּזֵי בְּסוּדָרֵיהּ, וְשָׁדֵי לֵיהּ לַאֲחוֹרֵיהּ, וּמַמְצֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ לְבֵי עַנְיֵי, וּמַצְלֵי עֵינֵיהּ מֵרַמָּאֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba would wrap coins in his scarf and toss behind him And would place himself at the homes of the poor And he would incline his eyes from swindlers
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba was drawing coins in his notebooks, and he would throw them behind him, and they would reach the poor people's homes, and he would avert his eyes from the deceitful.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא הֲוָה הָהוּא עַנְיָא דַּהֲוָה רְגִיל לְשַׁדּוֹרֵי לֵיהּ אַרְבְּעָה זוּזֵי כׇּל מַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא. יוֹמָא חַד שַׁדְּרִינְהוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ בְּיַד דְּבֵיתְהוּ, אֲתַאי אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: לָא צְרִיךְ. מַאי חֲזֵית? שְׁמַעִי דַּהֲוֹה קָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: בַּמָּה אַתָּה סוֹעֵד,
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina a certain pauper was accustomed to send to him four dinars every Shabbat eve. One day he sent it in the hand of his wife. She came said to him: does not need What did you see I heard them saying to him With what do you dine:
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina was that poor person who used to collect four coins every Shabbat eve. One day his wife found them in his hand, she came and said to him: "It is not necessary." What did she see? She heard that they were saying to him: "With what are you supporting yourself?"

hebrew_text: בִּטְלֵי כֶסֶף אוֹ בִּטְלֵי זָהָב? אָמַר: הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בּוֹאוּ וְנַחֲזִיק טוֹבָה לָרַמָּאִין, שֶׁאִלְמָלֵא הֵן, הָיִינוּ חוֹטְאִין בְּכׇל יוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְקָרָא עָלֶיךָ אֶל ה׳ וְהָיָה בְךָ חֵטְא״.
human_translation: Silver, tablecloths [ telei ] or gold, tablecloths? said: This is what Rabbi Elazar said: Come and let us appreciate the swindlers because were it not them, we would be sinning every day as it is stated: and he cry to the Lord against you, and it be sin in you”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Bit'lei kesef o bit'lei zahav? Amar: Hainu de'amar Rabbi Elazar: Bo'u venachazik tovah larama'in, she'imalei hen, hayinu chot'in bechol yom, shene'emar: 'Ve'kara alecha el Hashem vehayah becha chet.'" English translation: "Nullification of silver or nullification of gold? He said: This is what Rabbi Elazar said: Come and let us hold good for the deceitful, for if not for them, we would be sinning every day, as it is stated: 'And he shall call upon you to the Lord, and it shall be a sin in you.'"

hebrew_text: וְתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר רַב מִדִּיפְתִּי, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַמַּעֲלִים עֵינָיו מִן הַצְּדָקָה — כְּאִילּוּ עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״הִשָּׁמֶר לְךָ פֶּן יִהְיֶה דָבָר עִם לְבָבְךָ בְלִיַּעַל וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״יָצְאוּ אֲנָשִׁים בְּנֵי בְלִיַּעַל״. מָה לְהַלָּן עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, אַף כָּאן עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Rav of Difti taught: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: anyone who averts his eyes from the charity, is as if he engages in idol worship. written here “Beware that there be not a base [ beliya’al ] thought in your heart… and written there “Certain base [ beliya’al ] fellows gone out” Just as there, idol worship, so too here, idol worship.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chiya bar Rav from Difti taught: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: Anyone who averts his eyes from giving charity—it is as though he worships idols. It is written here: "Take heed to yourself, lest there be a base thought in your heart, etc." And it is written there: "Worthless men have gone out." Just as there it refers to idol worship, so too here it refers to idol worship.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמְסַמֵּא אֶת עֵינוֹ וְהַמַּצְבֶּה אֶת בִּטְנוֹ, וְהַמְקַפֵּחַ אֶת שׁוֹקוֹ — אֵינוֹ נִפְטָר מִן הָעוֹלָם עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא לִידֵי כָךְ. הַמְקַבֵּל צְדָקָה וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לְכָךְ — סוֹפוֹ אֵינוֹ נִפְטָר מִן הָעוֹלָם עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא לִידֵי כָךְ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who blinds his eye, and one who bloats his stomach and one who crushes [ mekape’aḥ ] his leg, will not depart from the world before he comes to this one who receives charity and does not need it, his end he will not depart from the world before he comes to this
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who blinds his eye, and one who distends his stomach, and one who stretches his leg - does not depart from the world until he experiences this. One who receives charity and does not need it - ultimately does not depart from the world until he experiences this.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: אֵין מְחַיְּיבִין אוֹתוֹ לִמְכּוֹר אֶת בֵּיתוֹ וְאֶת כְּלֵי תַשְׁמִישׁוֹ. וְלָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: הָיָה מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בִּכְלֵי זָהָב — יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בִּכְלֵי כֶסֶף, בִּכְלֵי כֶסֶף — יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בִּכְלֵי נְחוֹשֶׁת!
human_translation: We learned in a mishna elsewhere do not require him to sell his house and his accessories And not But isn’t it taught he was use gold wares, he should use silver wares. silver wares, copper wares.
llm_translation: We learned there: One is not obligated to sell his house and his household utensils. And is it not so? But it was taught in a Baraita: If one was using golden vessels - he should use silver vessels; if silver vessels - he should use copper vessels!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זְבִיד לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּמִטָּה וְשׁוּלְחָן, הָא — בְּכוֹסוֹת וּקְעָרוֹת. מַאי שְׁנָא כּוֹסוֹת וּקְעָרוֹת דְּלָא — דְּאָמַר: מְאִיסִי לִי. מִטָּה וְשׁוּלְחָן נָמֵי, אָמַר: לָא מְקַבַּל עִילָּוַאי. אָמַר רָבָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה: בְּמַחֲרֵישָׁה דְכַסְפָּא.
human_translation: Rav Zevid said: This not difficult. This of a bed and a table, that of cups and plates. What is different cups and plates, that not because he says: disgusting to me, a bed and a table also say: I do not accept upon myself, Rava, son of Rabba, said: of a silver comb
llm_translation: Rav Zevid said: It is not difficult. This - regarding bed and table, that - regarding cups and bowls. What is the difference between cups and bowls that one says, "I dislike them"? Bed and table also, he said: "I do not accept my yoke." Rava, son of Rabbah, said: In the silence of money.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא לִידֵי גִיבּוּי. כָּאן — לְאַחַר שֶׁיָּבֹא לִידֵי גִיבּוּי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: This not difficult. Here, before he comes to collecting There, after he comes to collecting
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, not difficult: here - before it comes to obligation. Here - after it comes to obligation.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יְתוֹמָה שֶׁהִשִּׂיאַתָּה אִמָּהּ אוֹ אַחֶיהָ מִדַּעְתָּהּ, וְכָתְבוּ לָהּ בְּמֵאָה אוֹ בַּחֲמִשִּׁים זוּז — יְכוֹלָה הִיא מִשֶּׁתַּגְדִּיל לְהוֹצִיא מִיָּדָן מַה שֶּׁרָאוּי לְהִנָּתֵן לָהּ.
human_translation: orphan girl whose mother or brothers married her off, with her consent And wrote for her of one hundred or of fifty dinars, she may, upon reaching majority, exact from that is fit to be given to her
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: An orphan girl who was married off by her mother or brother without her consent, and they wrote for her a marriage contract for a hundred or fifty zuz - she is able, once she grows up, to demand from them what is fitting to be given to her.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם הִשִּׂיא אֶת הַבַּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה — יִנָּתֵן לַשְּׁנִיָּה כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁנָּתַן לָרִאשׁוֹנָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: פְּעָמִים שֶׁאָדָם עָנִי וְהֶעֱשִׁיר, אוֹ עָשִׁיר וְהֶעֱנִי. אֶלָּא שָׁמִין אֶת הַנְּכָסִים וְנוֹתְנִין לָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If married off the first daughter should be given to the second in the same manner that he gave to the first And the Rabbis say: sometimes a person poor and becomes wealthy, or wealthy becomes poor, Rather, appraises the property and gives her
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If one married off the first daughter, the second daughter should be given in the same manner as the first. And the Sages say: Sometimes a person is poor and becomes rich, or rich and becomes poor. Rather, we evaluate the assets and give to her.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לְפַרְנָסָה — שָׁמִין בָּאָב. מֵתִיבִי: הַבָּנוֹת נִיזּוֹנוֹת וּמִתְפַּרְנְסוֹת מִנִּכְסֵי אֲבִיהֶן. כֵּיצַד? אֵין אוֹמְרִים אִילּוּ אָבִיהָ קַיָּים, כָּךְ וְכָךְ הָיָה נוֹתֵן לָהּ. אֶלָּא שָׁמִין אֶת הַנְּכָסִים וְנוֹתְנִין לַהּ. מַאי לָאו: פַּרְנָסַת הַבַּעַל? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לֹא, בְּפַרְנָסַת עַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: Shmuel said: to support evaluates based on the father raises an objection: The daughters are sustained and supported from the property of their father. How so? We do not say: If her father were alive, he would give her such and such Rather, appraises the property and gives her What, is it not support the husband, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: No, to her own support
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Shmuel: for sustenance - we evaluate based on the father. It was asked: daughters are sustained and provided for from their father's property. How so? We do not say, "If her father were alive, he would give her this and that." Rather, we evaluate the assets and provide for her. What is the reason? Is it not the sustenance of her husband? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: No, it is her own sustenance.

hebrew_text: הָא נִיזּוֹנוֹת וּמִתְפַּרְנְסוֹת קָתָנֵי, מַאי לָאו: אַחַת — פַּרְנָסַת הַבַּעַל, וְאַחַת — פַּרְנָסַת עַצְמָהּ?! לָא, אִידִי וְאִידִי בְּפַרְנָסַת עַצְמָהּ, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בַּאֲכִילָה וּבִשְׁתִיָּה, וְהָא — בִּלְבוּשָׁא וְכִיסּוּיָא.
human_translation: But teaches: sustained and supported, What, is it not one support the husband and one her own support? No, this one and that one to her own support And not difficult, this to eating and drinking, and that to clothing and covering.
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: Talmudic text: "These women, who are small earners and support themselves, what is the reason that they are not allowed to marry one man: one to support the husband, and one to support herself?! No, both can be supported by herself, and it is not difficult: this is referring to food and drink, and this is referring to clothing and covering."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: פְּעָמִים שֶׁאָדָם עָנִי וְהֶעֱשִׁיר אוֹ עָשִׁיר וְהֶעֱנִי, אֶלָּא שָׁמִין הַנְּכָסִים וְנוֹתְנִין לָהּ. מַאי ״עָנִי״, וּמַאי ״עָשִׁיר״? אִי נֵימָא ״עָנִי״ — עָנִי בִּנְכָסִים, ״עָשִׁיר״ — עָשִׁיר בִּנְכָסִים, מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר אֲפִילּוּ עָשִׁיר וְהֶעֱנִי כִּדְמֵעִיקָּרָא יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ — הָא לֵית לֵיהּ?
human_translation: We learned And the Rabbis say: Sometimes a person poor and becomes wealthy, or is wealthy becomes poor, Rather, appraises the property and gives her What poor, and what wealthy? If we say poor poor in property, wealthy wealthy in property, by inference that the first tanna holds even wealthy and became poor, we give like originally But he does not have
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah, and the Sages say: There are times when a person is poor and his wife is rich, or he is rich and his wife is poor, yet they evaluate the assets and give to her. What is meant by "poor" and what is meant by "rich"? If you say "poor" - poor in assets, "rich" - rich in assets. From the general principle that we learned earlier, he holds that even if he is rich and she is poor, initially they give to her - is there not?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו ״עָנִי״ — עָנִי בְּדַעַת, ״עָשִׁיר״ — עָשִׁיר בְּדַעַת, וְקָתָנֵי: שָׁמִין אֶת הַנְּכָסִים וְנוֹתְנִין לָהּ, אַלְמָא לָא אָזְלִינַן בָּתַר אוּמְדָּנָא, וּתְיוּבְתָּא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל! הוּא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם הִשִּׂיא בַּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה — יִנָּתֵן לַשְּׁנִיָּה כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁנָּתַן לָרִאשׁוֹנָה.
human_translation: Rather, is it not poor poor in mindset, wealthy wealthy in mindset, And teaches appraises the property and gives her. Apparently, we do not follow assessment and a conclusive refutation of Shmuel. has said in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, as we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: If married off the first daughter, should be given to the second in the same manner that he gave to the first.
llm_translation: Rather, no, "poor" — poor in knowledge, "rich" — rich in knowledge. And the Mishna teaches: they evaluate her assets and give to her, implying that we do not go after the final assessment, and the excellence of Shmuel! This is what Rabbi Yehuda said. As we learned, Rabbi Yehuda says: if he married the first daughter — he shall give to the second one as he gave to the first one.

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה! אִי אָמַר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא דַּוְקָא הִשִּׂיאָהּ, דְּגַלִּי דַּעְתֵּיהּ. אֲבָל לֹא הִשִּׂיאָהּ — לָא! קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָזְלִינַן בָּתַר אוּמְדָּנָא, לָא שְׁנָא הִשִּׂיאָהּ וְלָא שְׁנָא לֹא הִשִּׂיאָהּ.
human_translation: And let say the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. If he said the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, I would have said specifically he marries off as he revealed his mind but he did not marry her off not teaches us reason behind Rabbi Yehuda’s that we follow assessment is no different he married and is no different if he did not marry
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was stated: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehudah! If one says the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehudah, it is specifically because he has persuaded her, for he has revealed his opinion. But if he has not persuaded her - no! We infer the reasoning of Rabbi Yehudah that we go after the final decision, whether he has persuaded her or not persuaded her.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי ״הִשִּׂיאָהּ״ — לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחָן דְּרַבָּנַן, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּהִשִּׂיאָהּ וְגַלִּי דַּעְתֵּיהּ, לָא אָזְלִינַן בָּתַר אוּמְדָּנָא.
human_translation: And that which teaches He married off to convey to you the far-reaching nature of the Rabbis, that although married off and revealed his mind we do not follow an assessment
llm_translation: This that it teaches "he caused her to drink" — to inform you the power of the Rabbis, that even though he caused her to drink and revealed her thoughts, we do not rely on divination afterwards.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב חִסְדָּא: דָּרְשִׁינַן מִשְּׁמָךְ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יְהֵא רַעֲוָא כֹּל כִּי הָנֵי מִילֵּי מְעַלְּיָיתָא תִּדְרְשׁוּ מִשְּׁמַאי.
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Ḥisda: We teach in your name halakha with Rabbi Yehuda He said to him: May it be will you will teach in my name all proper statements such as this.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava said to Rav Ḥisda: We interpret the halakha according to Rabbi Yehuda. He said to him: Let all the matters of halakha be sought from Shammai.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רָבָא הָכִי? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בַּת הַנִּיזּוֹנֶת מִן הָאַחִין — נוֹטֶלֶת עִישּׂוּר נְכָסִים. וְאָמַר רָבָא: הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי! לָא קַשְׁיָא הָא — דַּאֲמֵידְנֵיהּ, הָא — דְּלָא אֲמֵידְנֵיהּ.
human_translation: And did Rava say this, But isn’t it taught Rabbi says: daughter who is sustained from the brothers, takes one-tenth of estate And Rava said The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi This not difficult. this because we assessed that because we did not assess
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who said thus, Rava? And it was taught, Rabbi says: A daughter of a nizoneit from the brothers - she takes a sixth of the property. And Rava said: The halakha is like Rabbi! It is not difficult - this one, that we establish it, and this one, that we do not establish it.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: מַעֲשֶׂה וְנָתַן לָהּ רַבִּי אֶחָד מִשְּׁנֵים עָשָׂר בַּנְּכָסִים! קַשְׁיָין אַהֲדָדֵי. אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הָא — דַּאֲמֵידְנֵיהּ, הָא — דְּלָא אֲמֵידְנֵיהּ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable, as Rav Adda bar Ahava said: an incident, and Rabbi gave one-twelfth of property are difficult, each other. Rather, isn’t it conclude from this because we assessed that because we didn’t assess Conclude from this
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: For Rav Adda bar Ahava said: He performed an act and gave her one of the twelve estates! They contradicted each other. Rather, it is not conclusive: this one - who believed her, this one - who did not believe her. It is inconclusive.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי: בַּת הַנִּיזּוֹנֶת מִן הָאַחִין נוֹטֶלֶת עִישּׂוּר נְכָסִים. אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי: לִדְבָרֶיךָ, מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ עֶשֶׂר בָּנוֹת וּבֵן, אֵין לוֹ לַבֵּן בִּמְקוֹם בָּנוֹת כְּלוּם!
human_translation: the itself. Rabbi daughter who is sustained from the brothers, takes one-tenth estate They said to Rabbi According to your opinion, one who has ten daughters and a son, the son does not have anything where daughters,
llm_translation: The body, said Rabbi: A daughter who inherits from her brothers takes a one-sixth share of the estate. They said to him: According to your words, if a man has ten daughters and a son, the son has no share in the place of the daughters at all!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן, כָּךְ אֲנִי אוֹמֵר: רִאשׁוֹנָה נוֹטֶלֶת עִישּׂוּר נְכָסִים, שְׁנִיָּה — בַּמֶּה שֶׁשִּׁיְּירָה, וּשְׁלִישִׁית — בַּמֶּה שֶׁשִּׁיְּירָה. וְחוֹזְרוֹת וְחוֹלְקוֹת בְּשָׁוֶה.
human_translation: said to them: This is what I say: first takes one-tenth of the estate; second of what left, and third of what left; and then they redistribute equally,
llm_translation: He said to them, "This is what I say: The first one takes a fifth of the property, the second - with what is left, and the third - with what is left. And they return and divide equally."

hebrew_text: כׇּל חֲדָא וַחֲדָא דְּנַפְשַׁהּ שָׁקְלָה? הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם בָּאוּ כּוּלָּם לְהִנָּשֵׂא כְּאַחַת חוֹלְקוֹת בְּשָׁוֶה.
human_translation: each and every takes her own This is what said, If they all come to be married at the same time, they divide equally.
llm_translation: Each and every individual who takes for himself? This is what he is saying: If they all came to marry her at once, they divide equally.

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב מַתְנָה. דְּאָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: אִם בָּאוּ לְהִנָּשֵׂא כּוּלָּם כְּאַחַת — נוֹטְלוֹת עִישּׂוּר אֶחָד. עִישּׂוּר אֶחָד סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא: נוֹטְלוֹת עִישּׂוּר כְּאֶחָד.
human_translation: supports of Rav Mattana, as Rav Mattana said: If they all come to be married at one they take one-tenth. enter your mind one-tenth Rather, they take one-tenth in one
llm_translation: He assists him to Rav Matna. For Rav Matna said: If they come to be married all at once - they take one Eishur. One Eishur? Is it your opinion? Rather, they take Eishur like one.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַבָּנוֹת בֵּין בָּגְרוּ עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִישְּׂאוּ וּבֵין נִישְּׂאוּ עַד שֶׁלֹּא בָּגְרוּ — אִיבְּדוּ מְזוֹנוֹתֵיהֶן וְלֹא אִיבְּדוּ פַּרְנָסָתָן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף אִיבְּדוּ פַּרְנָסָתָן. כֵּיצַד הֵן עוֹשׂוֹת? שׂוֹכְרוֹת לָהֶן בְּעָלִים, וּמוֹצִיאִין לָהֶן פַּרְנָסָתָן.
human_translation: The Sages taught the daughters, whether they matured before they were married or were married before they matured, they lost their sustenance. However, they not lose their support, the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: lost even their support. What do they do They hire themselves husbands, and appropriate their support, for themselves.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Regarding daughters, whether they are minors or have reached maturity but have not yet married, and whether they are married but have not yet reached maturity - they should inspect their sustenance but not their earnings, the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: They should also inspect their earnings. How do they do this? They hire for them husbands, who provide for them their sustenance.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אָמַר לִי הוּנָא: הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: יְתוֹמָה שֶׁהִשִּׂיאַתָּה אִמָּהּ אוֹ אַחֶיהָ מִדַּעְתָּהּ, וְכָתְבוּ לָהּ בְּמֵאָה אוֹ בַּחֲמִשִּׁים זוּז, יְכוֹלָה הִיא מִשֶּׁתַּגְדִּיל לְהוֹצִיא מִיָּדָם מַה שֶּׁרָאוּי לְהִנָּתֵן לָהּ. טַעְמָא דִּקְטַנָּה, הָא גְּדוֹלָה, וִיתְּרָה!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: Huna told me the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman an orphan girl whose mother or brothers married her off with her consent and wrote for her of one hundred or of fifty dinars, she may, upon reaching majority, exact from them that which is fit to be given to her The reason that a minor girl, but an adult woman, she forgoes
llm_translation: Rav Nahman said, Hunah said to me: the halakha is like Rabbi. Rava raised an objection to Rav Nahman: A orphan girl who caused her mother or brother to be aware, and they wrote for her a hundred or fifty zuz, she is able to grow up and take from them what is fitting to be given to her. The reason for the small one, she is now grown up, and more!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּמַחַאי, הָא — דְּלָא מַחַאי.
human_translation: This not difficult; this because she protests, that because she does not protest,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this - that he strikes, this - that he does not strike.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִם כֵּן, קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי אַדְּרַבִּי. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בַּת הַנִּיזּוֹנֶת מִן הָאַחִין — נוֹטֶלֶת עִישּׂוּר נְכָסִים. נִיזּוֹנֶת — אִין, שֶׁאֵינָהּ נִיזּוֹנֶת — לָא.
human_translation: This, too, stands to reason, since if indeed difficult: of Rabbi of Rabbi as it is taught Rabbi says: daughter who is sustained by the brothers takes one-tenth of the estate is sustained yes, if she is not sustained no,
llm_translation: So it was stated: If so, the difficulty of Rabbi AdRabbi arises. As it was taught: Rabbi says: A daughter of the Nizonet from the brothers - she takes a share of the estate. If she is a Nizonet - yes, if she is not a Nizonet - no.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הָא — דְּמַחַאי, הָא — דְּלָא מַחַאי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, is it not conclude from this this when she protests that when she does not protest? Conclude from this
llm_translation: Rather, it is not a conclusive proof. This one - that he struck, this one - that he did not strike. Conclusive proof.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא: אֲמַר לַן רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה מִשְּׁמָךְ: בָּגְרָה — אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לְמַחוֹת, נִישֵּׂאת — אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לְמַחוֹת. בָּגְרָה וְנִישֵּׂאת — צְרִיכָה לְמַחוֹת.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rava: Rav Adda bar Ahava said to us in your name: matured, she does not need to protest she became married, she does not need to protest. she matured and became married, she needs to protest
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rava: Rav Adda bar Ahava told us in your name: If she is a virgin - she does not need to be examined, if she is married - she does not need to be examined. If she is a virgin and married - she needs to be examined.

hebrew_text: מִי אָמַר רָבָא הָכִי? וְהָא אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן יְתוֹמָה, וְשַׁנִּי לֵיהּ: הָא — דְּמַחַי, הָא — דְּלָא מַחַי! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּקָא מִיתַּזְנָא מִינַּיְיהוּ. הָא — דְּלָא קָא מִיתַּזְנָא מִינַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Did Rava say this? But Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman an orphan and answered him this when she protested, and that when she did not protest. not difficult. This when is sustained by them That when she is not sustained by them,
llm_translation: Who said so, Rava? But didn't Rava present the following objection to Rav Nachman the orphan, and answer it: This one - who lives, this one - who does not live! It is not difficult: this one - who is engaging in promiscuity with them. This one - who is not engaging in promiscuity with them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַבִּי: פַּרְנָסָה אֵינָהּ כִּתְנַאי כְּתוּבָּה. מַאי ״אֵינָהּ כִּתְנַאי כְּתוּבָּה״? אִי נֵימָא: דְּאִילּוּ פַּרְנָסָה — טָרְפָא מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי, וּתְנַאי כְּתוּבָּה — לָא טָרְפָא מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי, מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? הָא מַעֲשִׂים בְּכׇל יוֹם מוֹצִיאִין לְפַרְנָסָה, וְאֵין מוֹצִיאִין לִמְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Huna said Rabbi said: Support is not like a stipulation in the marriage contract. What Is not like a stipulation in the marriage contract? If we say that Whereas, support, seize from liened and a stipulation in the marriage contract, not seize from liened what is he teaching us? But incidents daily appropriate for support but does not appropriate for sustenance.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said in the name of Rabbi: Livelihood is not like the teachings of the Mishnah. What is meant by "is not like the teachings of the Mishnah"? If we say: because if it were livelihood, it would be considered treifah from one's own actions, and the teachings of the Mishnah are not considered treifah from one's own actions, what does this teach us? That with regard to livelihood, people go out every day to seek it, but they do not go out to seek sustenance.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, דְּאִילּוּ פַּרְנָסָה גָּבְיָא נָמֵי מִמִּטַּלְטְלִי, וּתְנַאי כְּתוּבָּה מִמְּקַרְקְעֵי גָּבְיָא, מִמִּטַּלְטְלִי לָא גָּבְיָא.
human_translation: But rather, Whereas support, also collect from movable property a stipulation in the marriage contract, from real estate, from movable property not collect
llm_translation: And rather, for if sustenance were suspended in the air, and a teaching were written from the ground of the air, it would not be suspended.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי מִיגְבָּא גָּבְיָא, דְּתַנְיָא: אֶחָד נְכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת וְאֶחָד נְכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת — מוֹצִיאִין לִמְזוֹן הָאִשָּׁה וְלַבָּנוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי.
human_translation: According to Rabbi this and that collect as it is taught Whether property that has a guarantee or whether property that does not have a guarantee, appropriates for the sustenance of the wife and the daughters. the statement of Rabbi
llm_translation: To Rabbi Idi and Idi from Geba, as it was taught: One who has assets that have heirs and one who has assets that do not have heirs - they provide for the sustenance of his wife and daughters, the words of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי ״פַּרְנָסָה אֵינָהּ כִּתְנַאי כְּתוּבָּה״ — לְכִדְתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר ״אַל יִזּוֹנוּ בְּנוֹתָיו מִנְּכָסָיו״ — אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. ״אַל יִתְפַּרְנְסוּ בְּנוֹתָיו מִנְּכָסָיו״ — שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, שֶׁהַפַּרְנָסָה אֵינָהּ כִּתְנַאי כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: Rather, what Support is not like a stipulation in the marriage contract? to that which is taught one who says his daughters should not be sustained from his estate, one does not listen to him, his daughters should not be supported from his estate, does listen to him, as the legal status of the dowry is not like that of a stipulation in the marriage contract.
llm_translation: Rather, what is the meaning of "Parnasah einah kitnai kituvah"? — According to one Tanna: One who says, "Let his daughters not engage in promiscuity from his property" — they do not heed him. "Let his daughters not be supported from his property" — they heed him, for support is not like promiscuity as it is written.

hebrew_text: תְּלָה לֵיהּ רַב לְרַבִּי בֵּינֵי חִטֵּי: הָאַחִין שֶׁשִּׁיעְבְּדוּ, מַהוּ? הֲוָה יָתֵיב רַבִּי חִיָּיא קַמֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָכְרוּ אוֹ מִשְׁכְּנוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? בֵּין מָכְרוּ בֵּין שֶׁמִּשְׁכְּנוּ — מוֹצִיאִין לְפַרְנָסָה וְאֵין מוֹצִיאִין לִמְזוֹנוֹת!
human_translation: Rav attached for Rabbi between lines brothers who mortgaged what is Rabbi Ḥiyya was sitting before He said to him: they sell or they pledge said to him: What difference does it make? Whether they sold or pledged may appropriate for support but may not appropriate sustenance.
llm_translation: Rav entrusted to Rabbi the matter of wheat: The brothers who worked, what is the law? Rabbi Chiya was sitting before him. He said to him: Did they sell it or mortgage it? He said to him: What difference does it make? Whether they sold it or mortgaged it — they may take from it for sustenance, but they may not take from it for maintenance!

hebrew_text: וְרַב, אִי מָכְרוּ קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ, נִכְתּוֹב לֵיהּ מָכְרוּ? אִי מִשְׁכְּנוּ קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ, נִכְתּוֹב לֵיהּ מִשְׁכְּנוּ?!
human_translation: And Rav if he is raising a dilemma they sold let him write they sold if he is raising a dilemma they pledged let him write they pledged
llm_translation: Rav, if they sold, he asks for it, should it be written for him "they sold"? If they rented, he asks for it, should it be written for him "they rented"?!

hebrew_text: רַב תַּרְוַיְיהוּ קָמִבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ וְסָבַר: אִי כָּתֵיבְנָא לֵיהּ מָכְרוּ, הָא נִיחָא אִי שָׁלַח לִי דְּמוֹצִיאִין — כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן מִשְׁכְּנוּ. אִי שָׁלַח לִי אֵין מוֹצִיאִין — אַכַּתִּי מִשְׁכְּנוּ קָמִיבַּעְיָא לִי.
human_translation: Rav was raising a dilemma about both and thought: If I write to him they sold it out well if sends to me that appropriate all the more so, pledged if he sends to me does not appropriate still pledged be a dilemma for me.
llm_translation: Rav Tarvayeh stood before him and thought: If we wrote to him "sell," it is well; if we wrote to him "send," they are taken out - all the more so his dwelling. If we wrote to him "do not send," they are not taken out - then his dwelling is certainly before me.

hebrew_text: אִי כָּתֵיבְנָא לֵיהּ מִשְׁכְּנוּ, אִי שָׁלַח לִי דְּאֵין מוֹצִיאִין — כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן מָכְרוּ. אִי שָׁלַח לִי מוֹצִיאִין, אַכַּתִּי מָכְרוּ קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לִי. אֶכְתּוֹב לֵיהּ שִׁיעְבְּדוּ, דְּמַשְׁמַע הָכִי וּמַשְׁמַע הָכִי.
human_translation: if I write to him pledged if he sends to me that does not appropriate all the more so sold if he sends me does appropriate still sold be a dilemma for me. I will write to him mortgaged which implies this and implies that
llm_translation: We have written to him, "Bring it to me," if he does not bring it out - certainly they sold. If he sends it to me, they bring it out, for he is asking me to sell. It should be written to him, "Serve him," for it implies this and it implies that.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה אֵין מוֹצִיאִין. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, לָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ הָא דְּרַבִּי, וְאִי שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ הֲוָה מְקַבֵּל לֵיהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא: שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ וְלָא מְקַבֵּל לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Whether this or whether that, does not appropriate A dilemma was raised before them: that Rabbi Yoḥanan did not hear this of Rabbi but had he heard it, he would have accepted it? Or, perhaps, he had heard it, he would not have accepted it?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: One this and one this not bring out. It was asked to him: to Rabbi Yochanan, not heard to him this of Rabbi, and if heard to him would accept it, or perhaps: heard to him and not accept it?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאִתְּמַר: מִי שֶׁמֵּת וְהִנִּיחַ שְׁתֵּי בָּנוֹת וּבֵן, וְקָדְמָה הָרִאשׁוֹנָה וְנָטְלָה עִישּׂוּר נְכָסִים, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיקָה שְׁנִיָּה לִגְבּוֹת עַד שֶׁמֵּת הַבֵּן,
human_translation: Come hear as it was stated one who died and left two daughters and a son, and the first advanced and took one-tenth of estate but the second did not have enough time to collect before the son died.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for it was stated: If one died and left behind two daughters and a son, and the first daughter preceded and took possession of the estate, and the second did not have enough to collect until the son died,

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁנִיָּה וִיתְּרָה. אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא, גְּדוֹלָה מִזּוֹ אָמְרוּ: מוֹצִיאִין לְפַרְנָסָה וְאֵין מוֹצִיאִין לִמְזוֹנוֹת, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ שְׁנִיָּה וִיתְּרָה?!
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The second forfeited Rabbi Ḥanina said: said greater than this appropriates for support, but does not appropriate for sustenance. And say the second forfeited
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Sh'niyah v'Yit'rah." Rabbi Chanina said, "Greater than this they said: 'One may expend for livelihood but not for sustenance,' and you say 'Sh'niyah v'Yit'rah'?!

hebrew_text: וְאִם אִיתָא, נֵימָא לֵיהּ: מַאן אַמְרַהּ? וְדִלְמָא לְעוֹלָם לָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ, וְכִי שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ — קַבֵּיל, וְשָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאִיכָּא רְוַוח בֵּיתָא.
human_translation: And if it is so, let say to Who stated that, And perhaps he actually did not hear it; but he heard it, he accepted it. And it is different there, since there is abundance the house.
llm_translation: "And if it is stated, let him say to him: Who said it? And perhaps he will never hear it, and if he hears it - he will accept, and it is different there, for there is a spacious house."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יֵימַר לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, אַשְׁכְּחָה מְצִיאָה בְּעָלְמָא, דְּאִיכָּא רְוַוח בֵּיתָא — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ עִישּׂוּר נְכָסִים?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא רְוַוח בֵּיתָא מֵהָנֵי נִכְסֵי קָאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: Rav Yeimar said to Rav Ashi: If so, she found a generic lost object, as there is abundance the house so too would we not give her one-tenth of the estate? He said to him: I would say abundance the house from these properties
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yeimar to Rav Ashi: Rather, from now on, forget about finding a husband in the world, for if there is peace in the house - is this not a sign that we did not give her a marriage settlement?! He said to him: I am at peace in the house because of the property I possess.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: בַּת יוֹרֶשֶׁת הָוְיָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר: אִילּוּ בָּעֵי לְסַלּוֹקַהּ בְּזוּזֵי, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא מָצֵי לְסַלּוֹקַהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. אִי בָּעֵי לְסַלּוֹקַהּ בַּחֲדָא אַרְעָא, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא מָצֵי מְסַלֵּק לַהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין.
human_translation: Ameimar said: A daughter is an inheritor. Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: if wants to remove her by money indeed unable to remove her? He said to him: Yes, If wants to remove her by one land, also unable to remove her, He said to him: Yes,
llm_translation: Amemar said: A daughter is like an heir. Rav Ashe said to Amemar: If he wants to remove her with coins, is it really true that he cannot remove her? He said to him: No. If he wants to remove her with one plot of land, is it really true that he cannot remove her? He said to him: No.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: בַּת — בַּעֲלַת חוֹב הָוְיָא. וְאַף אַמֵּימָר הֲדַר בֵּיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב מִנְיוֹמֵי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נִיחוּמִי: הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּאַמֵּימָר, וַאֲתַאי הַאי אִיתְּתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ, דַּהֲוָת קָא בָּעֲיָא עִישּׂוּר נְכָסִים. וַחֲזֵיתֵיהּ לְדַעְתֵּיהּ דְּאִי בָּעֵי לְסַלּוֹקַהּ בְּזוּזֵי הֲוָה מְסַלֵּק לַהּ. דְּשָׁמְעִי מֵאַחֵי דַּהֲווֹ קָאָמְרִי לַהּ: אִילּוּ הֲוָה לַן זוּזֵי, סַלֵּיקְנָא בְּזוּזֵי וְאִישְׁתִּיק, וְלָא אֲמַר לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: A daughter is a creditor And even Ameimar retracted as Rav Minyumi, son of Rav Niḥumi, said: I was standing in front of Ameimar, and this woman came before him, as she was asking one-tenth estate. And I saw that his opinion that if wants to remove her by money, may remove her, as I heard from brothers that they were saying to her: If we had money, we would remove you with money. And Ameimar was silent and did not say anything to them.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: A daughter is considered as a creditor. And even Amemar retracted his statement, as Rav Minyumei, the son of Rav Nichumi, said: I was standing before Amemar, and this woman came before him, seeking a share of the estate. And he observed her intentions, that if she wanted to take it by force, he would give it to her. For I heard from my brothers that they used to say to her: If we had money, we would give it to you and be silent, and not say anything to you.

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ בַּעֲלַת חוֹב הָוְיָא: דְּאַבָּא אוֹ דְאַחֵי? לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְמִיגְבֵּא לְבֵינוֹנִית שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה, וְזִיבּוּרִית בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: And now that you said is a creditor, of father or of brothers? With regard to what a practical difference? to collecting intermediate-quality land without an oath and inferior-quality land with an oath.
llm_translation: At this time when you said, "The creditor's wife should be considered," was it the father or the brother? What is the practical difference? To distinguish between a non-virgin who is not in the week of menstruation, and a virgin who is in the week of menstruation.

hebrew_text: מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע דְּרָבִינָא אַגְבְּיַהּ לְבַרְתֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי מִמָּר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי בֵּינוֹנִית, וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה. מִבְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב סַמָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי זִבּוּרִית, בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: What is Come hear as Ravina provided for the daughter of Rav Ashi From Mar, son of Rav Ashi, intermediate-quality land without an oath. from the son of Rav Sama, son of Rav Ashi, inferior-quality land, with an oath.
llm_translation: What? Come and hear the teaching of Ravina, the son-in-law of Rav Ashi, from Mar Bar Rav Ashi, his son, in the middle of the week, and not on Shabbat. From the son of Rav Sama, the son of Rav Ashi, in Zibburit, on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַב נְחֶמְיָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף לְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא זוּטָא מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא: כִּי אָתְיָא הָא אִיתְּתָא לְקַמָּךְ, אַגְבְּיַהּ עִישּׂוּר נִכְסֵי אֲפִילּוּ מֵאִיצְטְרוֹבְלָא. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כִּי הֲוֵינַן בֵּי רַב כָּהֲנָא, הֲוָה מַגְבֵּינַן אֲפִילּוּ מֵעַמְלָא דְבֵיתֵי.
human_translation: Rav Neḥemya, son of Rav Yosef, sent to Rabba bar Rav Huna the Small, of Neharde’a: When this woman comes before you, provide her one-tenth of estate, even of the millstone itzterubela Rav Ashi said: When we were in Rav Kahana’s house, we would collect even from the the rental fees houses
llm_translation: Send to him Rav Nechemyah son of Rav Yosef to Rabbah bar Rav Huna Zuta from Nehardea: "When the woman comes before you, investigate her property even from the city of Istrobola." Rav Ashi said: "When we were in the house of Rav Kahana, we would investigate even from the labor of the household."

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַב עָנָן לְרַב הוּנָא: הוּנָא חַבְרִין, שְׁלָם! כִּי אָתְיָא הָא אִיתְּתָא לְקַמָּךְ אַגְבְּיַהּ עִישּׂוּר נִכְסֵי. הֲוָה יָתֵיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת קַמֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל אֵימָא לֵיהּ: וּבְשַׁמְתָּא יְהֵא מַאן דְּלָא אָמַר לֵיהּ: ״עָנָן עָנָן! מִמְּקַרְקְעֵי אוֹ מִמִּטַּלְטְלִי?״ וּ״מַאן יָתֵיב בֵּי מַרְזֵיחָא בְּרֵישָׁא?״
human_translation: Rav Anan sent Rav Huna: Huna, our friend, peace. When this woman letter comes before you, provide her one-tenth of estate. Rav Sheshet was sitting before him, said to him: Go say to And whoever does not say to him is excommunication: Anan, Anan, from real estate or from movable property? And, who sits at the head the house of a marzeiḥa ?
llm_translation: Send to him Rav Anan to Rav Huna: Huna, colleague, peace! When a woman comes before you regarding the collection of debts, Rav Sheshet was sitting before him, he said to him: Go and say to her, "And with a name, whoever did not say to her: 'Anan, Anan! From the ground or from the hanging?'" And "Who was sitting in the house of the tanner at first?"

hebrew_text: אֲזַל רַב שֵׁשֶׁת לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב עָנָן, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָר רַבָּה, וְרַב הוּנָא רַבֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה, וְשַׁמּוֹתֵי שַׁמֵּית מַאן דְּלָא אָמַר לֵיהּ, וְאִי לָאו דְּשַׁמֵּית, לָא הֲוָה קָאָמֵינָא: ״עָנָן, עָנָן, מִמְּקַרְקְעֵי אוֹ מִמִּטַּלְטְלִי? וּמַאן יָתֵיב בֵּי מַרְזֵיחָא בְּרֵישָׁא?״
human_translation: Rav Sheshet went before Rav Anan said to him, Master a teacher, but Rav Huna teacher of teacher. Moreover, he excommunicates whoever does not say to him, and if were not that excommunicate I would not say Anan, Anan, from real estate or from movable property? And, who sits at the head the house of a marzeiḥa ?
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet went to stand before Rav Anan, he said to him: Master Rabba, and Rav Huna his teacher, and the names you have named, who did not say to him, and if not for the names, I would not be standing: "Anan, Anan, from the ground or from the hanging? And who sits in the house of Marzeicha first?"

hebrew_text: אֲזַל רַב עָנָן לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּמָר עוּקְבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזִי מָר הֵיכִי שְׁלַח לִי רַב הוּנָא ״עָנָן עָנָן״, וְעוֹד ״מַרְזֵיחָא״ דִּשְׁלַח לִי [לָא יָדַעְנָא] מַאי נִיהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִימָּא לִי אִיזִי
human_translation: Rav Anan went before Mar Ukva said to him: Master see how Rav Huna sent me Anan, Anan. Moreover, marzeiḥa that he sent me, I do not know what it is. said to him: Say me, my friend [ izi ],
llm_translation: Rav Anan went to stand before Mar Ukva. He said to him: "Master, see how Rav Huna sent me 'Anan Anan,' and also 'Marzeicha,' which he sent to me I do not know what it is." He said to him: "Say to me, 'Go away.'"

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא דְעוֹבָדָא הֵיכִי הֲוָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי וְהָכִי הֲוָה מַעֲשֶׂה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גַּבְרָא דְּלָא יָדַע מַאי נִיהוּ ״מַרְזֵיחָא״, שָׁלַח לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא ״הוּנָא חַבְרִין״?! מַאי ״מַרְזֵיחָא״ — אֵבֶל, דִּכְתִיב: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ אַל תָּבֹא בֵּית מַרְזֵחַ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: how the incident itself happened. He said to him: Such and such was incident, He said to him: A man who does not know what a marzeiḥa is sends to Rav Huna Huna, our friend? What is a marzeiḥa ? A mourner, as it is written: “For so says the Lord: Enter not into the house of mourning [ marze’aḥ
llm_translation: The body of the work, how was it? He said to him: thus and thus was the deed. He said to him: a man who does not know what "Marzeicha" is, sent to Rav Huna "Huna the colleague"?! What is "Marzeicha" - mourning, as it is written: "Thus says the Lord, do not enter the house of Marzeach, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מִנַּיִן לָאָבֵל שֶׁמֵּיסֵב בָּרֹאשׁ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶבְחַר דַּרְכָּם וְאֵשֵׁב רֹאשׁ וְאֶשְׁכּוֹן כְּמֶלֶךְ בַּגְּדוּד כַּאֲשֶׁר אֲבֵלִים יְנַחֵם״. יְנַחֵם אֲחֵרִים מַשְׁמַע! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: ״יִנָּחֵם״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said From where that a mourner sits at the head? As it is stated: “I chose out their way, and sat as chief, and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that would comfort [ yenaḥem ] the mourners” yenaḥem implies others Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: as it were written “would be comforted [ yinnaḥem ],”
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: From where do we derive that a mourner should sit at the head of the gathering? As it is stated: "I will choose their way and seat myself at the head, and dwell like a king in the troop, as one who comforts mourners." It implies comforting others! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "He will comfort" is written.

hebrew_text: מָר זוּטְרָא אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״וְסָר מִרְזַח סְרוּחִים״. מַר וָזַח — נַעֲשֶׂה שַׂר לִסְרוּחִים.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: from here: “And the revelry [ mirzaḥ ] of those who stretched themselves shall pass away [ sar ]” bitter and flustered, is made ruler of those who sit,
llm_translation: Mar Zutra said, from here: "And remove the dross from the silver." Mar and Zah - they will become leaders for the dross.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, הִלְכְתָא: מִמְּקַרְקְעֵי וְלָא מִמִּטַּלְטְלִי, בֵּין לִמְזוֹנֵי, בֵּין לִכְתוּבָּה, בֵּין לְפַרְנָסָה.
human_translation: The halakha from real estate and not from movable property, whether for sustenance, whether for marriage contract, whether for support,
llm_translation: Rava said, a halacha: from the ground and not from being moved, whether for sustenance, whether for a marriage contract, whether for support.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּשְׁלִישׁ מָעוֹת לְבִתּוֹ, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: נֶאֱמָן בַּעְלִי עָלַי — יַעֲשֶׂה הַשָּׁלִישׁ מַה שֶּׁהוּשְׁלַשׁ בְּיָדוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: וְכִי אֵינָהּ אֶלָּא שָׂדֶה, וְהִיא רוֹצָה לְמוֹכְרָהּ, הֲרֵי הִיא מְכוּרָה מֵעַכְשָׁיו. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים: בִּגְדוֹלָה. אֲבָל בִּקְטַנָּה — אֵין מַעֲשֵׂה קְטַנָּה כְּלוּם.
human_translation: one who transfers money for his daughter If she says My husband is trustworthy for me, The third party should execute that was entrusted in his power; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: And were it only a field and she wanted to sell it, it sold immediately. In what is this statement said? With an adult woman. But with a minor girl, action of a minor girl is nothing
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who gives money to his daughter as a gift, and she says, "My husband is trustworthy regarding me," the husband should do with the money as he pleases, in accordance with Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: If it is only a field, and she wishes to sell it, it is considered sold from now. In what case are these words said? In the case of an adult daughter. But in the case of a minor daughter, a minor's act is of no consequence.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמַּשְׁלִישׁ מָעוֹת לַחֲתָנוֹ לִיקַּח מֵהֶן שָׂדֶה לְבִתּוֹ, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: יִנָּתְנוּ לְבַעְלִי, מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין — הָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדָהּ, מִן הָאֵירוּסִין — יַעֲשֶׂה הַשָּׁלִישׁ מַה שֶּׁהוּשְׁלַשׁ בְּיָדוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הַגְּדוֹלָה, בֵּין מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין וּבֵין מִן הָאֵירוּסִין — הָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדָהּ. קְטַנָּה, בֵּין מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין בֵּין מִן הָאֵירוּסִין — יַעֲשֶׂה הַשָּׁלִישׁ מַה שֶּׁהוּשְׁלַשׁ בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught one who transfers money for his son-in-law, in order to purchase with it a field for his daughter, and she says: Let be given to my husband from the marriage she has authority from the betrothal the third party should execute that was entrusted in his power; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: the adult woman, whether from the marriage or from the betrothal, she has authority. a minor girl, whether from the marriage or from the betrothal, the third party should execute that was entrusted in his power.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who gives money to his daughter's husband to buy a field from it, and she says, "Let it be given to my husband," from the betrothed - the ownership is in her hand, from the married - the agent should do what he was appointed to do, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: If she is an adult, whether from the betrothed or from the married - the ownership is in her hand. If she is a minor, whether from the betrothed or from the married - the agent should do what he was appointed to do.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִילֵימָא קְטַנָּה מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר הָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדָהּ, וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְמֵימַר אֲפִילּוּ מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין נָמֵי: גְּדוֹלָה אִין, קְטַנָּה לָא.
human_translation: what is between them? If we say: The practical difference between them a minor girl from marriage as Rabbi Meir holds she has authority, and Rabbi Yosei comes to say that also, even from the marriage, yes, an adult woman a minor girl not,
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? If you say that there is a small difference in the carrying, for Rabbi Meir holds that the domain is in her hand, and Rabbi Yosei came to say that even in the carrying there is also a difference: for a large item there is a difference, for a small item there is not.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: אֲבָל בִּקְטַנָּה — אֵין מַעֲשֵׂה קְטַנָּה כְּלוּם. הָא מַאן קָתָנֵי לַהּ? אִילֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הָא מֵרֵישָׁא שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: וְכִי אֵינָהּ אֶלָּא שָׂדֶה וְהִיא רוֹצָה לְמוֹכְרָהּ, הֲרֵי הִיא מְכוּרָה מֵעַכְשָׁיו. גְּדוֹלָה דְּבַת זְבִינֵי — אִין, קְטַנָּה דְּלָאו בַּת זְבִינֵי הִיא — לָא!
human_translation: Say the latter clause But with a minor girl, action of a minor girl is nothing. But who teaches this? If we say it is Rabbi Yosei, but you learn from the first clause, as Rabbi Yosei said: And were it only a field and she wanted to sell it, it sold immediately. an adult woman, who is capable of selling, yes, a minor girl, who is not capable of selling, no,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: aval biktanah - ein ma'aseh ktanah kelum. Ha man katanei la?" Ileima Rabbi Yosei, ha meresha shamatei minah, de'amar Rabbi Yosei: "ve'chi enah ela sadeh vehi rotzah lemocharah, harei hi mekura me'achshav. Gedolah d'vat zevinei - ein, ktanah d'lo bat zevinei hi - la!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, וְחַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: יַעֲשֶׂה הַשָּׁלִישׁ מַה שֶּׁהוּשְׁלַשׁ בְּיָדוֹ. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — מִן הָאֵירוּסִין, אֲבָל מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין — הָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדָהּ. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּגְדוֹלָה, אֲבָל בִּקְטַנָּה — אֵין מַעֲשֵׂה קְטַנָּה כְּלוּם. אֶלָּא גְּדוֹלָה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rather, is Rabbi Meir. And is incomplete and this it is teaching: The third party should execute that was entrusted in his power. In what is this statement said? From the betrothal. However, from the marriage she has the authority In what is this statement said? For an adult woman. However, for a minor girl, action of a minor girl is nothing. Rather, practical difference between them is an adult woman from betrothal
llm_translation: Rather, it is Rabbi Meir, and the lacking from the lacking, and thus it was taught: The agent should do what the principal has in his hand. In what case are these words said? — In the case of betrothal, but in the case of marriage, the authority is in her hand. In what case are these words said? — In the case of an adult woman, but in the case of a minor, a minor's act is nothing. Rather, there is a difference between an adult woman from betrothal.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: It was stated Rav Yehuda Shmuel said: The halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. Rava Rav Naḥman said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. Rava said Rav Nachman said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אִילְפָא תְּלָא נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּאִיסְקַרְיָא דְּמָכוּתָא, אֲמַר: אִיכָּא דְּאָתֵי דְּאָמַר לִי מִילְּתָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא וְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא וְלָא פָּשֵׁיטְנָא לֵיהּ מִמַּתְנִיתִין, נָפֵילְנָא מֵאִסְקַרְיָא וְטָבַעְנָא.
human_translation: Ilfa suspended himself from the mast [ iskarya ] of a ship [ makhuta ]. He said: there is who comes, who tells me a matter of the school of Rabbi Ḥiyya and Rabbi Oshaya, and I do not resolve it from a mishna, I will fall from the mast and drown.
llm_translation: Elfa Tela sacrificed himself in the pit of Makuta, he said: There is one who came and told me a matter from the house of Rabbi Chiya and Rabbi Oshaya, and we did not find it in the Mishnah, we fell from the pit and drowned.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא הָהוּא סָבָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ: הָאוֹמֵר ״תְּנוּ שֶׁקֶל לְבָנַי בְּשַׁבָּת״, וּרְאוּיִן לִיתֵּן לָהֶם סֶלַע — נוֹתְנִין לָהֶם סֶלַע. וְאִם אָמַר ״אַל תִּתְּנוּ לָהֶם אֶלָּא שֶׁקֶל״ — אֵין נוֹתְנִין לָהֶם אֶלָּא שֶׁקֶל. וְאִם אָמַר ״אִם מֵתוּ יִירְשׁוּ אֲחֵרִים תַּחְתֵּיהֶם״, בֵּין שֶׁאָמַר ״תְּנוּ״, בֵּין שֶׁאָמַר ״אַל תִּתְּנוּ״ — אֵין נוֹתְנִים לָהֶם אֶלָּא שֶׁקֶל.
human_translation: A certain older man came taught him one who says Give a shekel to my sons for week, And appropriate gives them a sela , gives them a sela . But if he said: Give them only a shekel, gives them only a shekel. And if he said: If they die others should inherit in their stead, whether he said: Give or whether he said: Don’t give gives them only a shekel,
llm_translation: A certain elder came and taught him: One who says, "Give a shekel to my sons on Shabbat," and it is fitting to give them a selah - we give them a selah. But if he says, "Do not give them anything except a shekel" - we only give them a shekel. And if he says, "If they die, others will inherit beneath them," whether he said "Give" or he said "Do not give" - we only give them a shekel.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָא מַנִּי?
human_translation: said to him: whose is this
llm_translation: He said to him: "Ha mani?"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מִצְוָה לְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי הַמֵּת.
human_translation: It is Rabbi Meir, who says it is a mitzva to fulfill the instructions of the dead,
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir it is, who said: It is a mitzvah to fulfill the words of the deceased.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא, הִלְכְתָא: בֵּין שֶׁאָמַר ״תְּנוּ״ וּבֵין שֶׁאָמַר ״אַל תִּתְּנוּ״ — נוֹתְנִין לָהֶם כׇּל צוֹרְכָּם. הָא קַיְימָא לַן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: מִצְוָה לְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי הַמֵּת? הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּמִילֵּי אַחְרָנְיָתָא, אֲבָל בְּהָא מֵינָח נִיחָא לֵיהּ, וְהָא דְּאָמַר הָכִי — לְזָרוֹזִינְהוּ הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said Mar Ukva said: halakha whether says: Give or whether says: Do not give gives all of their needs. But We maintain halakha in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who says it is a mitzva to fulfill the statements of the dead. This applies in other matters, but in this it is preferable to him And that he said this he came to encourage them
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Mar Ukva, a halakha: Whether one said "give" or whether one said "do not give" — we give them all their needs. This fulfills for us the halakha according to Rabbi Meir, who said: Is it a mitzvah to fulfill the words of the deceased? These matters are in other matters, but in this case, it is appropriate for him, and this is what he meant by saying — to hasten their arrival.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הַפָּעוֹטוֹת מִקָּחָן מִקָּח וּמִמְכָּרָן מֶכֶר בְּמִטַּלְטְלִים.
human_translation: We learned there children, acquisitions acquisitions and their sales sales. with movable properties,
llm_translation: We learned there: The minors, their acquisition is an acquisition, and their sale is a sale when they are moving.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַפְרָם: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין שָׁם אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס, אֲבָל יֵשׁ שָׁם אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס — אֵין מִקָּחָן מִקָּח, וְאֵין מִמְכָּרָן מֶכֶר.
human_translation: Rafram said: They taught only if there is no steward [ apotropos ] However, if there is a steward, the acquisitions are not acquisitions and their sales are not sales,
llm_translation: Rafhram said: They only taught that there is no apotropos there, but if there is an apotropos there - their acquisition is not an acquisition, and their sale is not a sale.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? מִדְּקָתָנֵי: אֵין מַעֲשֵׂה קְטַנָּה כְּלוּם. וְדִלְמָא הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא שָׁלִישׁ שָׁאנֵי? אִם כֵּן לִיתְנֵי ״אֲבָל בִּקְטַנָּה, יַעֲשֶׂה שָׁלִישׁ מַה שֶּׁהוּשְׁלַשׁ בְּיָדוֹ״. מַאי ״אֵין מַעֲשֵׂה קְטַנָּה כְּלוּם״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אֲפִילּוּ בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: From where From that it teaches action of a minor girl is nothing. And perhaps where there is a third party is different? If so, let it teach: But with a minor girl, third party should execute that was entrusted in his power. What action of a minor girl is nothing? Conclude from this even generally,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where? From that which it is taught: A small act is as nothing. But perhaps in a case where there is a third party? If so, let it teach, "But in a small act, he should do a third of what he has in his hand." What is "a small act is as nothing"? Understand from it that even in a trivial matter. English translation:

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ מְצִיאַת הָאִשָּׁה
llm_translation: We will return to you regarding the finding of the woman.

hebrew_text: הַמַּדִּיר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ מִלֵּיהָנוֹת לוֹ, עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם יַעֲמִיד פַּרְנָס. יָתֵר מִיכֵּן — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: one who vows his wife, from benefiting from him up to thirty days, he must appoint a trustee [ parnas ] more than this he must divorce and give marriage contract.
llm_translation: The one who prohibits his wife from her adornments, until thirty days he establishes a livelihood. Beyond that — he shall divorce and give a document.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, חֹדֶשׁ אֶחָד — יְקַיֵּים, וּשְׁנַיִם — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. בְּכֹהֵן, שְׁנַיִם — יְקַיֵּים, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If Israelite, one month, he may maintain and two he must divorce and give marriage contract. if a priest, two he may maintain and three he must divorce and give marriage contract.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: In Israel, one month - he fulfills, and two - he may give and take in writing. In a Kohen, two - he fulfills, and three - he may give and take in writing.

hebrew_text: הַמַּדִּיר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא תִּטְעוֹם אֶחָד מִכׇּל הַפֵּירוֹת — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, יוֹם אֶחָד — יְקַיֵּים, שְׁנַיִם — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. וּבְכֹהֵן, שְׁנַיִם — יְקַיֵּים, שְׁלֹשָׁה — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: One who vows his wife, not to taste a particular type of produce, must divorce and give marriage contract. Rabbi Yehuda says: If Israelite, one day he may maintain two he must divorce and give marriage contract. And if a priest, two he may maintain three he must divorce and give marriage contract.
llm_translation: The one who prohibits his wife from tasting any one of all the fruits - he shall divorce and give her the marriage contract. Rabbi Yehuda says: In Israel, one day - he shall fulfill, two - he shall divorce and give her the marriage contract. And for a Kohen, two - he shall fulfill, three - he shall divorce and give her the marriage contract.

hebrew_text: הַמַּדִּיר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְקַשֵּׁט בְּאֶחָד מִכׇּל הַמִּינִין — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בַּעֲנִיּוּת — שֶׁלֹּא נָתַן קִצְבָה, וּבַעֲשִׁירוּת — שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: One who vows his wife, not to adorn herself with a particular type must divorce and give marriage contract. Rabbi Yosei says For poor women, when he did not establish a set amount of time and for wealthy women, thirty days,
llm_translation: The one who prohibits his wife from adorning herself with any of the types of jewelry - he shall divorce her and give her the marriage contract. Rabbi Yosei says: In poverty - if he did not set a limit, and in wealth - thirty days.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְכֵיוָן דִּמְשׁוּעְבַּד לָהּ הֵיכִי מָצֵי מַדִּיר לַהּ? כָּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ דְּמַפְקַע לַהּ לְשִׁיעְבּוּדַהּ?
human_translation: And since he is under a obligation to her how can he vow her Is it in his power to remove obligation to her?
llm_translation: Gemara: Since she is already married to him, how can he make a dwelling for her? All of her types that he removes for her for her dwelling?

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֵינִי עוֹשָׂה לְפִיךָ״ — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְהָפֵר. אַלְמָא כֵּיוָן דִּמְשַׁעְבְּדָא לֵיהּ, לָאו כָּל כְּמִינַהּ דְּמַפְקַע לֵיהּ לְשִׁיעְבּוּדֵיהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי: כֵּיוָן דִּמְשׁוּעְבַּד לַהּ, לָאו כָּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ דְּמַפְקַע לַהּ לְשִׁיעְבּוּדַהּ!
human_translation: But didn’t we learn It is like an offering [ konam ] that I will not perform for your mouth, he does not need to nullify Apparently, since she is under obligation for him, it is not in her power to remove obligation to him. Here too, since he is under a obligation for her, it is not in his power to remove obligation to her.
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: "If their measure is not according to your mouth" — one does not need to nullify it. This implies that once it is done for him, any similar type that he nullifies for his benefit. Here too: once it is done for her, any similar type that she nullifies for her benefit!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁיָּכוֹל לוֹמַר לָהּ ״צְאִי מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַיִךְ בִּמְזוֹנוֹתַיִךְ״,
human_translation: Rather, Since he is able to say to her Spend your earnings to sustain yourself,
llm_translation: Rather: since he can say to her, "Go out with the earnings of my hands."

hebrew_text: נַעֲשָׂה כְּאוֹמֵר לָהּ ״צְאִי מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַיִךְ בִּמְזוֹנוֹתַיִךְ״. וְאִם אִיתַהּ לְהָא דְּרַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: יְכוֹלָה אִשָּׁה שֶׁתֹּאמַר לְבַעְלָהּ ״אֵינִי נִיזּוֹנֶת וְאֵינִי עוֹשָׂה״, ״קוּנָּם שֶׁאֲנִי עוֹשָׂה לְפִיךָ״, אַמַּאי אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְהָפֵר? לֵימָא: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁיְּכוֹלָה לוֹמַר ״אֵינִי נִיזּוֹנֶת וְאֵינִי עוֹשָׂה״, נַעֲשֶׂה כְּמִי שֶׁאוֹמֶרֶת לוֹ: ״אֵינִי נִיזּוֹנֶת וְאֵינִי עוֹשָׂה״.
human_translation: it is considered as he saying to her: Spend your earnings to sustain yourself. And if it is so, that that that Rav Huna said Rav said, as Rav Huna said Rav said: A wife may say to her husband: I will not be sustained and, I will not work, which I perform for your mouth forbidden like an offering [ konam ], why does he not need to nullify let say: Since she is able to say: I will not be sustained and I will not work, it is considered as she saying to him I will not be sustained and I will not work,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was done as it says to her "Go, the work of your hands in your provisions." And if she wants to do like Rav Huna said Rav, as Rav Huna said Rav: Can a woman say to her husband "I am not sustained and I do not do," "I am like those who do according to your mouth," why does he not need to annul? Let us say: Since she can say "I am not sustained and I do not do," it is done as if she says to him: "I am not sustained and I do not do." English translation:

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לָא תֵּימָא ״נַעֲשֶׂה״, אֶלָּא בְּאוֹמֵר לָהּ: ״צְאִי מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַיִךְ בִּמְזוֹנוֹתַיִךְ״.
human_translation: Rather, Do not say it is considered as Rather, where he says to her: Spend your earnings to sustain yourself.
llm_translation: Rather, do not say "we will make," but rather say to her: "Go out, the work of your hands in your sustenance."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי פַּרְנָס לְמָה לַהּ? בִּדְלָא סָפְקָה: אִי בִּדְלָא סָפְקָה — הֲדַר קוּשְׁיַין לְדוּכְתֵּיהּ? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: בְּמַסְפֶּקֶת לִדְבָרִים גְּדוֹלִים, וְאֵינָהּ מַסְפֶּקֶת לִדְבָרִים קְטַנִּים.
human_translation: If so, why she a trustee? where is not enough If where is not enough our difficulty is restored to its place: Rav Ashi said: where enough for large things, but not enough for small things.
llm_translation: So is a provider, why to her? If not doubtful: if doubtful — return questions to its place? Rav Ashi said: in doubt for important matters, and not in doubt for minor matters.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי דְּבָרִים קְטַנִּים, הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דִּרְגִילָה בְּהוּ — הָא רְגִילָה בְּהוּ! וְאִי לָא רְגִילָה בְּהוּ — פַּרְנָס לְמָה לַהּ? לָא צְרִיכָא: דִּרְגִילָה בְּבֵית נָשָׁא, וְקָא מְגַלְגְּלָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ, דְּאָמְרָה לֵיהּ: עַד הָאִידָּנָא דְּלָא אַדַּרְתַּן — גַּלְגֵּילְנָא בַּהֲדָךְ, הַשְׁתָּא דְּאַדַּרְתַּן — לָא מָצֵינָא דֶּאֱיגַלְגֵּל בַּהֲדָךְ.
human_translation: these small things what are the circumstances? If she is accustomed to them, she is accustomed to them And if she is not accustomed to them, why she a trustee? No, necessary where accustomed in her father’s house, but she abided with him. For she says to him: Until now, when you did not vow I abided with you. now that you have vowed, I can no abide with you,
llm_translation: These matters of minor importance, how so? If accustomed to them - behold, accustomed to them! And if not accustomed to them - why bother? It is unnecessary: accustomed in the house of marriage, and she is rolling in front of him, for she said to him: Until now that I have not adorned myself - roll in your adornment, now that I have adorned myself - I do not find that I should roll in your adornment.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם? עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם לֹא שָׁמְעִי בַּהּ אִינָשֵׁי וְלָא זִילָא בַּהּ מִילְּתָא, טְפֵי — שָׁמְעִי בַּהּ אִינָשֵׁי וְזִילָא בַּהּ מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: And what is different Up to thirty days? up to thirty days people do not hear about her, and the matter is not demeaning for her. longer people hear about her, and the matter is demeaning for her.
llm_translation: And what is different about thirty days? Until thirty days, people do not pay attention to it, and they do not go to discuss the matter, for it is insignificant - they do not pay attention to it, and they do not go to discuss the matter.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא שֶׁהִדִּירָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲרוּסָה, אֲרוּסָה מִי אִית לַהּ מְזוֹנֵי? שֶׁהִגִּיעַ זְמַן וְלֹא נִשְּׂאוּ. דִּתְנַן: הִגִּיעַ זְמַן וְלֹא נִשְּׂאוּ — אוֹכְלוֹת מִשֶּׁלּוֹ וְאוֹכְלוֹת בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: If you wish, say where he vowed her when she a betrothed woman, Does a betrothed woman have sustenance when the time had arrived and they had not married. As we learned the time arrived they had not married, may eat from his and they may partake of teruma .
llm_translation: If you ask, say, when she is betrothed, who is responsible for her sustenance? When the time arrives and they have not yet married. As we learned: "When the time arrives and they have not yet married - she eats from his and from the terumah."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם? עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם עָבֵיד שָׁלִיחַ שְׁלִיחוּתֵיהּ, טְפֵי — לָא עָבֵיד שָׁלִיחַ שְׁלִיחוּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: But what is different up to thirty days up to thirty days, agent will carry out his agency longer, agent will not carry out his agency
llm_translation: And what is the difference until thirty days? Until thirty days, a messenger performs his mission, less than that - a messenger does not perform his mission.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא שֶׁהִדִּירָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲרוּסָה וְנִישֵּׂאת, נִישֵּׂאת — הָא סְבַרָה וְקַבִּילָה! דְּאָמְרָה: כִּסְבוּרָה אֲנִי שֶׁאֲנִי יְכוֹלָה לְקַבֵּל, עַכְשָׁיו אֵין אֲנִי יְכוֹלָה לְקַבֵּל.
human_translation: And if you wish, say he vowed her when she was a betrothed woman and she married she married she considered and accepted when says: I thought that I could accept now I cannot accept
llm_translation: And if you will say that she dwelled when she was engaged and married, if she married - she consented and accepted! For she said: "I thought that I could accept, but now I cannot accept."

hebrew_text: אֵימַר דְּאָמְרִינַן הָכִי גַּבֵּי מוּמִין, לְעִנְיַן מְזוֹנֵי מִי אָמְרִינַן הָכִי? אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְשַׁנִּינַן מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: say that we say so, with regard to blemishes, with regard to sustenance can we say so? Rather, it is clear as we initially answered:
llm_translation: Statement: When we say this regarding blemishes, in the matter of whose sustenance do we say this? Rather, like we say from the outset.

hebrew_text: עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם יַעֲמִיד פַּרְנָס. וּפַרְנָס לָאו שְׁלִיחוּתֵיהּ קָא עָבֵיד? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, בְּאוֹמֵר: ״כׇּל הַזָּן אֵינוֹ מַפְסִיד״.
human_translation: up to thirty days he must appoint a trustee And does a trustee not perform agency? Rav Huna said: to one who says Whoever sustains will not lose out.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Until thirty days he establishes a provider. And a provider, is it not his agency that he is doing? Rav Huna said, by saying: "All who are sustained do not lose."

hebrew_text: וְכִי אָמַר הָכִי לָאו שְׁלִיחוּתֵיהּ קָעָבֵיד? וְהָתְנַן: מִי שֶׁהָיָה מוּשְׁלָךְ בְּבוֹר, וְאָמַר: ״כׇּל הַשּׁוֹמֵעַ קוֹלוֹ יִכְתּוֹב גֵּט לְאִשְׁתּוֹ״ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִכְתְּבוּ וְיִתְּנוּ!
human_translation: And when says this, not performing agency? But didn’t we learn one who was cast into a pit and said whoever hears his voice should write a bill of divorce for his wife, those should write and give
llm_translation: And if so, did he say that his messenger is honored? And we learned: One who was trapped in a pit and said, "Anyone who hears my voice should write a bill of divorce for my wife" - these shall be written and given!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם קָאָמַר ״יִכְתּוֹב״, הָכָא מִי קָאָמַר ״יָזוּן״? ״כׇּל הַזָּן״ קָאָמַר!
human_translation: How can be compared? There, says should write Here, does say should sustain He says: Whoever sustains
llm_translation: So now?! There it says "it shall be written," here who is saying "it shall be nourished"? "All who nourish" is what he is saying!

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: בִּדְלֵיקָה הִתִּירוּ לוֹמַר: ״כׇּל הַמְכַבֶּה אֵינוֹ מַפְסִיד״. בִּדְלֵיקָה לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לָאו לְמַעוֹטֵי כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא?! לָא, לְמַעוֹטֵי שְׁאָר אִיסּוּרִים דְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: But Rabbi Ami said: of a fire permitted to say Whoever extinguishes will not lose out. of a fire, to exclude what? not exclude a case like this? No, to exclude other prohibitions of Shabbat.
llm_translation: And this, Rabbi Ammi said: In the case of a candle, they permitted to say, "One who extinguishes does not incur a penalty." In the case of a candle, to exclude what? Is it not to exclude this case?! No, to exclude other prohibitions of Shabbat.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבָּה: הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ, וְאֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל — יֵלֵךְ אֵצֶל חֶנְוָנִי הָרָגִיל אֶצְלוֹ, וְיֹאמַר לוֹ: ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי מוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מִמֶּנִּי, וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה לוֹ״. הוּא נוֹתֵן לוֹ, וּבָא וְנוֹטֵל מִזֶּה. הָכִי הוּא דִּשְׁרֵי, אֲבָל ״כׇּל הַזָּן אֵינוֹ מַפְסִיד״ — לָא!
human_translation: Rabba raised an objection one prohibited by a vow from deriving benefit from another and he does not have to eat, he may go to a storekeeper with whom he is familiar and say to him: So-and-so is prohibited by a vow from deriving benefit from me, and I do not know what I can do for him. gives to him, and comes and takes from this This is what is permitted, but not Whoever sustains will not lose out,
llm_translation: Rabba raises an objection: One who is accustomed to deriving benefit from his fellow, and he has nothing to eat - he should go to Chanvani the butcher who is accustomed to him, and say to him: "So-and-so has vowed to abstain from benefiting from me, and I do not know what to do for him." He gives it to him, and he comes and takes from it. This is permitted, but "one who feeds does not lose" - no!
