hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא ״כׇּל הַזָּן אֵינוֹ מַפְסִיד״ — דִּלְעָלְמָא קָאָמַר, אֲבָל הַאי, כֵּיוָן דְּרָגִיל אֶצְלוֹ וְקָאָזֵיל קָאָמַר לֵיהּ, כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ זִיל, ״הַב לֵיהּ אַתְּ״ דָּמֵי — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: is speaking It is not necessary, It is not necessary Whoever sustains will not lose out, as he is speaking to everyone But this since is familiar with him and he goes says to him, like the one who said to him: Go, give him yourself. teaches us
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Not of need is saying: 'Not of need' — for in general it is saying, but this one, since he is accustomed to it and goes and says to him, as one who says to him, 'Go, bring it to him,' it is considered as if he has given it to him — he is indicating to us."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְאֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל, הוֹלֵךְ אֵצֶל חֶנְוָנִי הָרָגִיל אֶצְלוֹ, וְאוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי מוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מִמֶּנִּי, וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה לוֹ״. הוּא נוֹתֵן לוֹ, וּבָא וְנוֹטֵל מִזֶּה. בֵּיתוֹ לִבְנוֹת, וּגְדֵירוֹ לִגְדּוֹר, וְשָׂדֵהוּ לִקְצוֹר — הוֹלֵךְ אֵצֶל פּוֹעֲלִין הָרְגִילִין אֶצְלוֹ, וְאוֹמֵר לָהֶן: ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי מוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מִמֶּנִּי וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה לוֹ״. הֵן עוֹשִׂין עִמּוֹ, וּבָאִין וְנוֹטְלִים שְׂכָרָן מִזֶּה.
human_translation: the itself: one prohibited by a vow from deriving benefit from another and he does not have to eat, may go to a storekeeper with whom he is familiar and say to him: So-and-so is prohibited by a vow from deriving benefit from me, and I do not know what I can do for him. gives to him, and comes and takes from this to build his house, or to erect his fence, or to reap his field, go to workers with whom he is familiar and say to them: So-and-so is prohibited by a vow from deriving benefit from me, and I do not know what I can do for him. They perform for and they come and take their wages from this
llm_translation: Body: One who is obligated to provide enjoyment to his fellow and has nothing to eat, goes to a storekeeper who is accustomed to him, and says to him: "So-and-so is obligated to provide me with enjoyment, and I do not know what to do for him." He gives to him, and comes and takes from this one. His house to build, his fence to fence, and his field to harvest - he goes to workers who are accustomed to him, and says to them: "So-and-so is obligated to provide me with enjoyment, and I do not know what to do for him." They do with him, and come and take their reward from this one.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ מְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וְאֵין עִמּוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל — נוֹתֵן לְאַחֵר לְשׁוּם מַתָּנָה, וְהַלָּה נוֹטֵל וְאוֹכֵל, וּמוּתָּר. וְאִם אֵין שָׁם אַחֵר — מַנִּיחַ עַל גַּבֵּי הַסֶּלַע אוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי הַגָּדֵר, וְאוֹמֵר: ״הֲרֵי הֵן מוּפְקָרִין לְכׇל מִי שֶׁיַּחְפּוֹץ״, וְהַלָּה נוֹטֵל וְאוֹכֵל, וּמוּתָּר. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹסֵר. אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם
human_translation: were walking along the way, and does not have with him to eat, give to a different as a gift, and this takes and eats, and permitted, And if there is no other there place on a rock or on a fence and say: They are ownerless for anyone who wants and this takes and eats and permitted. But Rabbi Yosei prohibits Rava said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei? decree due to
llm_translation: They were walking on the road, and he has nothing to eat - he gives to another as a gift, and the latter takes and eats, and it is permitted. And if there is no one else there - he places it on top of a rock or on top of a fence, and says: "Behold, they are ownerless for anyone who desires," and the latter takes and eats, and it is permitted. But Rabbi Yosei prohibits. Rava said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei's prohibition? It is a decree due to...

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה דְּבֵית חוֹרוֹן.
human_translation: incident of Beit Ḥoron,
llm_translation: The matter of Beit Horon.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל חֹדֶשׁ אֶחָד וְכוּ׳. הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כֹּהֶנֶת אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן. רָבָא אָמַר: חֹדֶשׁ מָלֵא וְחֹדֶשׁ חָסֵר אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If Israelite, one month, This is the first tanna . Abaye said: he comes to teach us wife of a priest. Rava said: between them is a full month and a deficient month
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: In Israel, one month and etc. Is this the same as the first Tanna? Abaye said: The Kohenet came to teach us. Rava said: There is a full month and a deficient month between them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּמְפָרֵשׁ, אֲבָל בִּסְתָם — יוֹצִיא לְאַלְתַּר וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בִּסְתָם לֹא יוֹצִיא, שֶׁמָּא יִמְצָא פֶּתַח לְנִדְרוֹ.
human_translation: Rav said: they taught only where he specifies But without specification he must divorce immediately and give marriage contract. And Shmuel said: Even without specification, he should not divorce perhaps he will discover an opening of his vow.
llm_translation: Rav said: They only taught this regarding an explicit vow, but with an implicit vow — one should immediately fulfill it and give it in writing. And Shmuel said: Even with an implicit vow, one should not fulfill it, lest he find a loophole for his vow.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיפְּלִגוּ בַּיהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא, דִּתְנַן: הַמַּדִּיר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ מִתַּשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת. — וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: שַׁבָּת אַחַת. וְאָמַר רַב: מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּמְפָרֵשׁ, אֲבָל בִּסְתָם — יוֹצִיא לְאַלְתַּר וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בִּסְתָם נָמֵי לֹא יוֹצִיא, שֶׁמָּא יִמְצָא פֶּתַח לְנִדְרוֹ.
human_translation: But they have already disagreed about this one time as we learned one who vows his wife, from marital relations Beit Shammai say: two weeks, and Beit Hillel say one week. And Rav said: The dispute is where he specifies, but in an unspecified he must divorce immediately and give marriage contract. And Shmuel said: Even in an unspecified he also should not divorce perhaps he will discover an opening of his vow.
llm_translation: And this, they disagreed in it one time, as we learned: One who prohibits his wife from marital relations, Beit Shammai says: two Sabbaths. And Beit Hillel says: one Sabbath. And Rav said: Disagreement in explicit cases, but in general cases — he should immediately divorce her and give her the marriage contract. And Shmuel said: Even in general cases, he should not divorce her, lest he find a loophole for his vow.

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָהִיא: בְּהָהִיא קָאָמַר רַב — מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר בְּפַרְנָס, אֲבָל בְּהָא, דְּאֶפְשָׁר בְּפַרְנָס — אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל. וְאִי אִתְּמַר בְּהָא: בְּהָא קָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל — מִשּׁוּם דְּאֶפְשָׁר בְּפַרְנָס, אֲבָל בְּהַהִיא, אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לְרַב — צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: necessary as, if it was stated in that in that Rav says because it is impossible through a trustee. But in this which is possible through a trustee, say he concedes to Shmuel And if it were stated in this in this Shmuel says because it is possible through a trustee, but in that say he concedes to Rav necessary
llm_translation: The matter is, for if it was stated in this case: in this case Rav is saying - because it is not possible for sustenance, but in that case, where it is possible for sustenance - say that Shmuel agrees with him. And if it was stated in that case: in that case Shmuel is saying - because it is possible for sustenance, but in this case, say that he agrees with Rav - this is necessary.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַמַּדִּיר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא תִּטְעוֹם אֶחָד מִכׇּל הַפֵּירוֹת — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב: כָּאן בִּסְתָם, כָּאן בִּמְפָרֵשׁ. אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: We learned One who vows his wife, not to taste a particular type of produce, must divorce and give marriage contract. Granted to Rav, here unspecified there, where he specifies But to Shmuel, difficult.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: One who prohibits his wife from tasting any of the fruits - he must divorce her and give her the marriage contract. According to Rav, this is understandable: here it is in general terms, here it is in detail. But according to Shmuel, it is difficult!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּדְרָה הִיא, וְקִיֵּים לָהּ אִיהוּ. וְקָסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר, הוּא נוֹתֵן אֶצְבַּע בֵּין שִׁינֶּיהָ.
human_translation: Here we are dealing with where she vowed and he ratified it for her And Rabbi Meir, holds he is putting his finger between her teeth,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - For example, if she made a vow, and he fulfilled it for her. And Rabbi Meir holds, he places a finger between her teeth.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר הוּא נוֹתֵן אֶצְבַּע בֵּין שִׁינֶּיהָ? וְהָתַנְיָא: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁנָּדְרָה בְּנָזִיר, וְשָׁמַע בַּעְלָהּ וְלֹא הֵפֵר לָהּ, רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמְרִים: הִיא נָתְנָה אֶצְבַּע בֵּין שִׁינֶּיהָ, לְפִיכָךְ אִם רָצָה הַבַּעַל לְהָפֵר — יָפֵר. וְאִם אָמַר אִי אֶפְשִׁי בְּאִשָּׁה נַדְרָנִית — תֵּצֵא שֶׁלֹּא בִּכְתוּבָּה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir hold he is putting his finger between her teeth, But isn’t it taught A woman who vowed, that a nazirite, and her husband heard and did not nullify it, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda say: She put her finger between her teeth, Therefore, if the husband wishes to nullify he may nullify And if he said: I do not want a vowing wife, she be divorced without of marriage contract.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Meir holds that he inserts a finger between her teeth? And it was taught: A woman who vowed to be a Nazirite, and her husband heard and did not annul it for her, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda say: She has inserted a finger between her teeth, therefore if the husband wishes to annul it - he may annul it. But if he says, "I cannot bear a vowed woman" - she shall leave without a document.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמְרִים: הוּא נוֹתֵן אֶצְבַּע בֵּין שִׁינֶּיהָ, לְפִיכָךְ אִם רָצָה הַבַּעַל לְהָפֵר — יָפֵר. וְאִם אָמַר: אִי אֶפְשִׁי בְּאִשָּׁה נַדְרָנִית — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה! אֵיפוֹךְ, רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמְרִים: הוּא נוֹתֵן, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמְרִים: הִיא נָתְנָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Elazar say: he is putting his finger between her teeth, therefore if the husband wishes to nullify he may nullify And if he said: I do not want a vowing wife, he must divorce and give marriage contract. Reverse Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda say: He is putting Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Elazar say: She put
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Elazar say: "He places a finger between her teeth, therefore if the husband wishes to annul it - he may annul it. But if he says, 'I find something repulsive in her' regarding a woman who has taken a vow - he should divorce her and give her a written document." In contrast, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda say: "He places it, Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Elazar say: 'She placed it.'"

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא נָתְנָה? וְהָתְנַן: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בַּעֲנִיּוּת שֶׁלֹּא נָתַן קִצְבָה!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei hold she put But didn’t we learn Rabbi Yosei says: For poor women, when he did not establish a set amount of time
llm_translation: And thought Rabbi Yosei she gave? And we learned: Rabbi Yosei says: In poverty, she did not give a portion!

hebrew_text: אֵימָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמְרִים: הוּא נוֹתֵן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמְרִים: הִיא נָתְנָה. וְסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא נָתְנָה? וְהָתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹם אֶחָד — יְקַיֵּים!
human_translation: Say Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yosei say: He is putting Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Elazar say: She put And Rabbi Yehuda hold she put But didn’t we learn Rabbi Yehuda says: For an Israelite, one day he may maintain
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yosei say: He gives, Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Elazar say: She gave. And Rabbi Yehuda thinks she gave? But we learned in a Mishnah, Rabbi Yehuda says: In Israel one day - it shall be fulfilled!"

hebrew_text: אֵימָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמְרִים: הוּא נוֹתֵן, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הִיא נָתְנָה. וְאִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר זוּגֵי זוּגֵי קָתָנֵי, אֵימָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמְרִים: הִיא נָתְנָה, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמְרִים: הוּא נוֹתֵן. וְהָא סְתָמָא דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Say Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei say he is putting and Rabbi Elazar says she put And if you say are taught in pairs, say: Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Elazar say she put Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei say he is putting And this unattributed is not in accordance with Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei say: He gives, and Rabbi Elazar says: She gave. And if you find it to say pairs of pairs of Tannaim, Eima, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Elazar say: She gave, Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei say: He gives. And the anonymous Mishna does not follow Rabbi Meir."

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּעֲנִיּוּת שֶׁלֹּא נָתַן קִצְבָה, אַלְמָא בַּעַל מָצֵי מֵיפַר? וּרְמִינְהוּ: אֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁהַבַּעַל מֵיפֵר: דְּבָרִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן עִינּוּי נֶפֶשׁ, ״אִם אֶרְחַץ״, ״אִם לֹא אֶרְחַץ״. ״אִם אֶתְקַשֵּׁט״, ״אִם לֹא אֶתְקַשֵּׁט״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֵין אֵלּוּ נִדְרֵי עִינּוּי נֶפֶשׁ, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן נִדְרֵי עִינּוּי נֶפֶשׁ: ״שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל בָּשָׂר״, וְ״שֶׁלֹּא אֶשְׁתֶּה יַיִן״, וְ״שֶׁלֹּא אֶתְקַשֵּׁט
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei hold, poor women, that he did not establish a set amount of time apparently, a husband can nullify And raises a contradiction These are the cases that the husband may nullify: Cases that involve affliction, If I bathe, If I do not bathe, If I adorn If I do not adorn Rabbi Yosei said: These are not vows of affliction, but these, are vows of affliction: that I will not eat meat, or that I will not drink wine, or that I will not adorn myself
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yosei holds in the case of not giving a specific measure, hence the husband may annul? And they raised an objection: These are the things that the husband may annul: matters involving self-affliction, "if I will bathe," "if I will not bathe," "if I will adorn myself," "if I will not adorn myself." Rabbi Yosei said: These are not vows of self-affliction, but these are vows of self-affliction: "I will not eat meat," "I will not drink wine," "if I will not adorn myself."

hebrew_text: בְּבִגְדֵי צִבְעוֹנִין״! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בִּדְבָרִים שֶׁבֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ.
human_translation: with colored garments, Here we are dealing with with regard to matters that are between him and her,
llm_translation: "In garments of colors!" Here, with what are we dealing? - With matters that are between him and her.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דְּבָרִים שֶׁבֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ הַבַּעַל מֵיפֵר. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין הַבַּעַל מֵיפֵר, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? דְּאִתְּמַר: דְּבָרִים שֶׁבֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ, רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: הַבַּעַל מֵיפֵר, רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר: אֵין הַבַּעַל מֵיפֵר, שֶׁלֹּא מָצִינוּ שׁוּעָל שֶׁמֵּת בַּעֲפַר פִּיר.
human_translation: This well according to the one who said the husband can nullify matters that are between him and her, But according to the one who said the husband cannot nullify what can be said? as it is stated: matters that are between him and her, Rav Huna said the husband nullify Rav Adda bar Ahava said the husband cannot nullify Since we have not found a fox that died in the dirt of a hole
llm_translation: The one who says that matters between them and her, the husband annuls. Rather, the one who says the husband does not annul, what is there to say? For it was stated: Matters between them and her, Rav Huna said: the husband annuls, Rav Adda bar Ahava said: the husband does not annul, for we have not found a fox that dies in a pit.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן דִּתְלָ[תַ]נְהוּ לְקִישּׁוּטֶיהָ בְּתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה, דְּאָמְרָה: ״יֵאָסֵר הֲנָאַת תַּשְׁמִישְׁךָ עָלַי אִם אֶתְקַשֵּׁט״, כִּדְאָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא.
human_translation: Rather, with what are we dealing here? where she made sexual intercourse contingent upon her adornment, as she said: The pleasure of intercourse with you is forbidden to me if I adorn myself, as Rav Kahana said
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, here with what are we dealing? - For example, that they taught regarding the bedspread, that she said: "I will prohibit your use of the bedspread upon me if you adorn yourself," as Rav Kahana said.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: ״הֲנָאַת תַּשְׁמִישִׁי עָלֶיךָ״ — כּוֹפָהּ וּמְשַׁמַּשְׁתּוֹ. ״הֲנָאַת תַּשְׁמִישְׁךָ עָלַי״ — יָפֵר, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין מַאֲכִילִין לָאָדָם דָּבָר הָאָסוּר לוֹ.
human_translation: As Rav Kahana said: The pleasure of intercourse with me to you, compel her and have sexual intercourse with him, The pleasure of intercourse with you to me, he may nullify since one cannot feed a person an object which is forbidden to him.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Rav Kahana said: "The benefit of my use is upon you" - she may compel him and he must serve her. "The benefit of your use is upon me" - he may annul it, because one does not feed a person something that is forbidden to him.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא תִּתְקַשֵּׁט וְלֹא תֵּאָסֵר! אִם כֵּן קָרוּ לַהּ ״מְנֻוֶּולֶת״.
human_translation: And let her not adorn herself and she will not be forbidden. If so, they call her repulsive
llm_translation: And not adorn and not prohibit! If so, they called her "Menovevet."

hebrew_text: וְתִתְקַשֵּׁט וְתֵאָסֵר, אִי לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי שְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת, אִי לְבֵית הִלֵּל שַׁבָּת אַחַת! הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּאַדְּרַהּ אִיהוּ, דְּסָבְרָה: מִירְתָּח רָתַח עִילָּוַאי וְהַשְׁתָּא מוֹתֵיב דַּעְתֵּיהּ. אֲבָל הָכָא, דִּנְדַרָה אִיהִי וְשָׁתֵיק לַהּ, סָבְרָה מִדְּאִישְׁתִּיק — מִיסְנָא הוּא דְּסָנֵי לִי.
human_translation: And let her adorn herself and be prohibited if according to Beit Shammai, two weeks; if according to Beit Hillel, one week. This applies where he took a vow as she thinks: He is angry with me, but now he will calm down But here, where she vows and he is silent she thinks: Since he is silent, he despises me,
llm_translation: "And if she adorns herself and refrains, whether according to Beit Shammai two Sabbaths, or according to Beit Hillel one Sabbath! These matters, where he is accustomed, he thinks: 'Yesterday he was boiling hot water, and now he is cooling his mind.' But here, where she made a vow and kept silent, she thinks since he is silent — it is a Mishnah that supports me."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בַּעֲנִיּוּת שֶׁלֹּא נָתַן קִצְבָה. וְכַמָּה קִצְבָה? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים. רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר אֲבִימִי: רֶגֶל, שֶׁכֵּן בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל מִתְקַשְּׁטוֹת בָּרֶגֶל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: For poor women, when he did not establish a set amount of time And how long is set amount of time? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Twelve months. Rabba bar bar Ḥanna Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Ten years. Rav Ḥisda Avimi said: A pilgrim Festival, since Jewish women adorn themselves on the pilgrim Festival.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: In poverty, one does not set a limit. And how much is the limit? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: twelve months. Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: ten years. Rav Ḥisda said Avimi: a foot, as this is how the daughters of Israel adorn themselves with the foot.

hebrew_text: וּבַעֲשִׁירוּת שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. מַאי שְׁנָא שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שֶׁכֵּן אִשָּׁה חֲשׁוּבָה נֶהֱנֵית מֵרֵיחַ קִשּׁוּטֶיהָ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: And for wealthy women, thirty days. What is different thirty days Abaye said: Because an important woman enjoys the scent of her adornments thirty days,
llm_translation: In wealth thirty days. What is different about thirty days? Abaye said: Because a woman of importance enjoys the scent of her perfume for thirty days.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּדִּיר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא תֵּלֵךְ לְבֵית אָבִיהָ, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהוּא עִמָּהּ בָּעִיר — חוֹדֶשׁ אֶחָד יְקַיֵּים, שְׁנַיִם יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. וּבִזְמַן שֶׁהוּא בְּעִיר אַחֶרֶת — רֶגֶל אֶחָד יְקַיֵּים, שְׁלֹשָׁה — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: one who vows his wife not to go to her father’s house, when is with her in the city, one month, he may maintain two he must divorce and give marriage contract. And when is in a different city, one pilgrim Festival, he may maintain three he must divorce and give marriage contract.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who prohibits his wife from going to her father's house, while he is with her in the same city - he must fulfill it for one month, for two months he must divorce her and give her the marriage contract. And if he is in a different city - he must fulfill it for one foot, for three feet - he must divorce her and give her the marriage contract.

hebrew_text: הַמַּדִּיר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא תֵּלֵךְ לְבֵית הָאֵבֶל אוֹ לְבֵית הַמִּשְׁתֶּה — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנּוֹעֵל בְּפָנֶיהָ. וְאִם הָיָה טוֹעֵן מִשּׁוּם דָּבָר אַחֵר — רַשַּׁאי.
human_translation: one who vows his wife not to go to a house of mourning or to a house of feasting must divorce and give marriage contract. Because locking in front of her. And if he claimed due to something else, he is permitted
llm_translation: The one who prohibits his wife from going to the house of mourning or to the house of feasting - he shall divorce her and give her a written document, because he is locking her in. And if he was abstaining for another reason - he is permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהּ: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁתֹּאמְרִי לִפְלוֹנִי מַה שֶּׁאָמַרְתָּ לִי״, אוֹ: ״מַה שֶּׁאָמַרְתִּי לָךְ״, אוֹ שֶׁתְּהֵא מְמַלְּאָה וּמְעָרָה לָאַשְׁפָּה — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: he said to her: on condition that you tell so-and-so what you told me, or what I told you, or she fill and pour into the refuse, he must divorce and give marriage contract.
llm_translation: He said to her: "On condition that you say to so-and-so what I said to you," or: "What I said to you," or that she should be filling and emptying for the witch - he should divorce her and give her a written document.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא גּוּפַהּ קַשְׁיָא: אָמְרַתְּ רֶגֶל אֶחָד יְקַיֵּים. הָא שְׁנַיִם — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: שְׁלֹשָׁה — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. הָא שְׁנַיִם — יְקַיֵּים.
human_translation: This itself is difficult: You said one pilgrim Festival he may maintain that two he must divorce and give marriage contract. say the latter clause: three he must divorce and give marriage contract, that two he may maintain
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Ha, the body is difficult. You said one foot fulfills. This is two - he brings out and gives in writing. Say the end: Three - he brings out and gives in writing. This is two - fulfills." English translation: "The Gemara: This, the body is difficult. You said one foot fulfills. This is two - he brings out and gives in writing. Let us say the end: Three - he brings out and gives in writing. This is two - fulfills."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: סֵיפָא אֲתָאן לְכֹהֶנֶת, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא. רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא אָמַר, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּרְדוּפָה, כָּאן בְּשֶׁאֵינָהּ רְדוּפָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: the latter clause, we have come to the wife of a priest, And is Rabbi Yehuda, Rabba bar Ulla said: not difficult, Here, to eager there, to who is not eager.
llm_translation: Abaye said: The latter part comes to teach about a Kohenet, and it is Rabbi Yehudah. Rabbah bar Ulla said, it is not difficult: here in a case of pursuit, here in a case where there is no pursuit.

hebrew_text: ״אָז הָיִיתִי בְעֵינָיו כְּמוֹצְאֵת שָׁלוֹם״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּכַלָּה שֶׁנִּמְצֵאת שְׁלֵמָה בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ, וּרְדוּפָה לֵילֵךְ וּלְהַגִּיד שִׁבְחָהּ בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: “Then I was in his eyes as one that found peace” Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Like a bride who is considered perfect in her father-in-law’s house, and is eager to go and relate her praise in her father’s house,
llm_translation: "Then I was in his eyes like one who finds peace," said Rabbi Yochanan: Like a bride who is found complete in her father-in-law's house, and is pursued to go and praise her in her father's house.

hebrew_text: ״וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא נְאוּם ה׳ תִּקְרְאִי אִישִׁי וְלֹא תִקְרְאִי לִי עוֹד בַּעְלִי״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּכַלָּה בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ, וְלֹא כְּכַלָּה בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: “And it shall be on that day, says the Lord, that you will call Me: My Husband [ Ishi ], and you will no longer call Me: My Master [ Ba’ali ]” Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Like a bride in her father-in-law’s house and not like a bride in her father’s house,
llm_translation: "On that day," declares the Lord, "you will call Me 'My husband' and no longer call Me 'My Baal.'" Rabbi Yochanan said: Like a bride in her father's house, and not like a bride in her mother-in-law's house.

hebrew_text: הַמַּדִּיר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְכוּ׳. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְבֵית הַמִּשְׁתֶּה
human_translation: One who vows his wife Granted, to a house of feasting,
llm_translation: The one who makes a vow regarding his wife, etc. Granted, concerning the house of feasting...

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא נוֹעֵל בְּפָנֶיהָ, אֶלָּא לְבֵית הָאֵבֶל מַאי נוֹעֵל בְּפָנֶיהָ אִיכָּא? תָּנָא: לְמָחָר הִיא מֵתָה וְאֵין כׇּל בְּרִיָּה סוֹפְדָהּ. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אֵין כׇּל בְּרִיָּה סוֹפְנָהּ.
human_translation: there is locking in front of her but to a house of mourning, what locking in front of her is there? He taught: In the future she will die, and no person will eulogize her And some say: No person will value her
llm_translation: There is one who wears shoes in her presence, but only to the house of mourning. What does it mean to wear shoes in her presence? It was taught: The next day she died, and no creature eulogized her. And there are those who say: No creature mourned her.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״טוֹב לָלֶכֶת אֶל בֵּית אֵבֶל מִלֶּכֶת אֶל בֵּית מִשְׁתֶּה בַּאֲשֶׁר הוּא סוֹף כׇּל הָאָדָם וְהַחַי יִתֵּן אֶל לִבּוֹ״, מַאי ״וְהַחַי יִתֵּן אֶל לִבּוֹ״? דְּבָרִים שֶׁל מִיתָה: דְּ[יִ]סְפֹּד — יִסְפְּדוּנֵיהּ, דְּ[יִ]קְבַּר — יִקְבְּרוּנֵיהּ, דִּידַל — יְדַלּוּנֵיהּ, דִּ[י]לַוֵּאי — יְלַוּוֹנֵיהּ, דְּ[יִ]טְעֹן — יִטְעֲנוּנֵיהּ.
human_translation: it is taught Rabbi Meir used to say: What is which is written: “It is better to go to a house of mourning than to go to a house of feasting, since that is the end of all men, and the living will take it to heart” What “and the living will take it to heart” matters to death who eulogizes will eulogize him; who buries will bury him; who lifts will lift who escorts will escort him; who carries will carry him.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir would say: What is the meaning of the verse, "It is better to go to a house of mourning than to go to a house of feasting, for that is the end of all men, and the living will take it to heart"? What is meant by "and the living will take it to heart"? Matters of death: if they eulogize, they shall eulogize it; if they bury, they shall bury it; if they lament, they shall lament it; if they escort, they shall escort it; if they load, they shall load it.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הָיָה טוֹעֵן מִשּׁוּם דָּבָר אַחֵר — רַשַּׁאי. מַאי ״דָּבָר אַחֵר״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מִשּׁוּם בְּנֵי אָדָם פְּרוּצִין שֶׁמְּצוּיִין שָׁם. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּאִיתַּחְזַק, אֲבָל לָא אִיתַּחְזַק — לֹא כָּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And if he claimed due to something else, he is permitted What is something else? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: due to promiscuous individuals that are found there, Rav Ashi said: We said only where a presumption has been but no presumption has been it is not in his power
llm_translation: "And if he was weighing due to another matter - he is permitted. What is 'another matter'? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Because of promiscuous people who are commonly found there. Rav Ashe said: We only said this when it is established, but if it is not established - not all similar cases."

hebrew_text: וְאִם אָמַר לָהּ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתֹּאמְרִי. וְתֵימָא? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: דְּבָרִים שֶׁל קָלוֹן.
human_translation: And if he said to her: on condition that you tell And let her say it. Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: degrading matters,
llm_translation: "And if he said to her 'on the condition that you will say,' and you might say? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: matters of disgrace."

hebrew_text: אוֹ שֶׁתְּהֵא מְמַלְּאָה וּמְעָרָה לְאַשְׁפָּה. וְתִיעְבֵּיד! אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שֶׁתְּמַלֵּא וְנוֹפֶצֶת. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תַּנָּא: שֶׁתְּמַלֵּא עֲשָׂרָה כַּדֵּי מַיִם וּתְעָרֶה לְאַשְׁפָּה.
human_translation: Or that she fill and pour into the refuse. And let her do it. Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: that she fill and shake It was taught in a baraita : that to fill ten jugs of water and pour into the refuse,
llm_translation: Or that she should be filling and sifting for ash. And it is difficult! Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: that she should fill and scatter. In the Mishnah it was taught: that she should fill ten measures of water and sift for ash.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לִשְׁמוּאֵל — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. אֶלָּא לְמַתְנִיתָא מַאי נָפְקָא לַהּ מִינַּהּ? תִּיעְבֵּיד! אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּרְאִיתָ כְּשׁוֹטֶה.
human_translation: Granted according to Shmuel, due to that he must divorce and give marriage contract. But according to the baraita , what difference does it make to her? Let her do it. Rabba bar bar Ḥanna said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Because she appear insane
llm_translation: In truth, for Shmuel — because of this he should bring forth and give in writing. But for the Mishnah, what does she derive from it? Let her do it! Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Because you appeared like a fool.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: הַמַּדִּיר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁאַל וְשֶׁלֹּא תַּשְׁאִיל נָפָה וּכְבָרָה וְרֵיחַיִם וְתַנּוּר — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. שֶׁמַּשִּׂיאָהּ שֵׁם רַע בִּשְׁכֵינוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: One who vows his wife not to borrow or not to lend a sifter, or a sieve, or a mill, or an oven, must divorce and give marriage contract, since he causes her to develop a bad reputation among her neighbors,
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: One who prohibits his wife from borrowing and lending a hand-mill, a sieve, a winnowing shovel, and an oven—should divorce her and give her the marriage contract, for he causes her a bad reputation among her neighbors.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַמַּדִּיר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁאַל וְשֶׁלֹּא תַּשְׁאִיל נָפָה וּכְבָרָה רֵיחַיִם וְתַנּוּר — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּשִּׂיאָהּ שֵׁם רַע בִּשְׁכֵינוֹתֶיהָ. וְכֵן הִיא שֶׁנָּדְרָה שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁאַל וְשֶׁלֹּא תַּשְׁאִיל נָפָה וּכְבָרָה וְרֵיחַיִם וְתַנּוּר, וְשֶׁלֹּא תֶּאֱרוֹג בְּגָדִים נָאִים לְבָנָיו — תֵּצֵא שֶׁלֹּא בִּכְתוּבָּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּשִּׂיאָתוֹ שֵׁם רַע בִּשְׁכֵינָיו.
human_translation: That is also taught One who vows his wife not to borrow or not to lend a sifter, or a sieve, or a mill, or an oven, must divorce and give marriage contract, since he causes her to develop a bad reputation among her neighbors. And similarly, she who vowed not to borrow or not to lend a sifter, or a sieve, or a mill, or an oven, or that she will not weave nice garments for his children, she divorced without marriage contract. because she causes him to develop a bad reputation among his neighbors,
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: If one prohibits his wife from borrowing or lending a sieve, a winnowing shovel, a spice box, or an oven, he must divorce her and give her the marriage contract, because he causes her to be spoken ill of in her neighbors' houses. Similarly, if she vows not to borrow or lend a sieve, a winnowing shovel, a spice box, or an oven, or not to weave fine garments for her children, she must leave without a marriage contract, because she causes her husband to be spoken ill of in his neighbors' houses.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ יוֹצְאוֹת שֶׁלֹּא בִּכְתוּבָּה — הָעוֹבֶרֶת עַל דָּת מֹשֶׁה וִיהוּדִית. וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא דָּת מֹשֶׁה? מַאֲכִילָתוֹ שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְעוּשָּׂר, וּמְשַׁמַּשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה, וְלֹא קוֹצָה לָהּ חַלָּה, וְנוֹדֶרֶת וְאֵינָהּ מְקַיֶּימֶת.
human_translation: And these divorced without marriage contract: who violates precepts of Moses, or Jewish And who is precepts of Moses? she feeds him that has not been tithed, or she engages in sexual intercourse with him a menstruating woman, or she does not separate a portion of dough to be given to a priest [ ḥalla ], or she vows and does not fulfill
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are the women who may be divorced without a formal bill of divorce - one who violates the laws of Moses and Judah. And what is the law of Moses? One who feeds him untithed food, and she serves him while in a state of menstruation, and she does not separate for him the portion of dough due to the priest, and she makes vows and does not fulfill them.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזוֹהִי דָּת יְהוּדִית? יוֹצְאָה וְרֹאשָׁהּ פָּרוּעַ, וְטוֹוֶה בְּשׁוּק, וּמְדַבֶּרֶת עִם כָּל אָדָם. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: אַף הַמְקַלֶּלֶת יוֹלְדָיו בְּפָנָיו. רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף הַקּוֹלָנִית. וְאֵיזוֹהִי קוֹלָנִית? לִכְשֶׁהִיא מְדַבֶּרֶת בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתָהּ וּשְׁכֵינֶיהָ שׁוֹמְעִין קוֹלָהּ.
human_translation: And who is precepts of Jewish goes out and her head, uncovered; or spins in the marketplace; or speaks with every man Abba Shaul says: Also one who curses his, parents in his presence. Rabbi Tarfon says: Also a loud woman. And who is a loud woman? When she speaks inside her house and her neighbors hear her voice.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what is the Jewish way? Her hair is uncovered, and she spins in the marketplace, and she speaks with all people. Abba Shaul says: Even one who curses his parents in his presence. Rabbi Tarfon says: Even the loud-voiced woman. And what is a loud-voiced woman? When she speaks within her house and her neighbors hear her voice.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאֲכִילָתוֹ שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְעוּשָּׂר, הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּיָדַע — נִפְרוֹשׁ. אִי דְּלָא יָדַע — מְנָא יָדַע? לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאָמְרָה לֵיהּ ״פְּלוֹנִי כֹּהֵן תִּיקֵּן לִי אֶת הַכְּרִי״, וְאָזֵיל שַׁיְילֵיהּ, וְאִשְׁתְּכַח שִׁיקְרָא.
human_translation: She feeds him that has not been tithed. What are the circumstances If he knows he should abstain if he does not know how does he know No, necessary when she tells him: So-and-so priest rectified the pile for me and he went and asked and it was found a lie.
llm_translation: Gemara: If one feeds his animal with produce that is not tithed, what is the law? If he knows - he should separate the tithe. If he does not know - how should he know? It is not necessary, for he said to him, "So-and-so, the priest, should fix my plow," and he goes and finds it to be false.

hebrew_text: וּמְשַׁמַּשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּיָדַע בָּהּ — נִפְרוֹשׁ, אִי דְּלָא יָדַע — נִסְמוֹךְ עִילָּוַהּ. דְּאָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר כָּהֲנָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מִנַּיִן לְנִדָּה שֶׁסּוֹפֶרֶת לְעַצְמָהּ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְסָפְרָה לָּהּ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים״, ״לָהּ״ — לְעַצְמָהּ!
human_translation: Or she engages in sexual intercourse with him a menstruating woman. What are the circumstances? If he knows about her he should abstain. if he does not know, he should rely on her. Because Rav Ḥinnana bar Kahana said Shmuel said: From where that a menstruating woman can count for herself, As it is stated: “Then she shall count to herself seven days” “To herself” by herself,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And he serves a menstruating woman. How so? If he knows her - he should separate; if he does not know - he should rely on her statement. For Rav Ḥinnana bar Kahana said in the name of Shmuel: From where do we derive that a menstruating woman who counts for herself - as it is stated: "And she shall count for herself seven days," "for herself" - for herself!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאָמְרָה לֵיהּ: פְּלוֹנִי חָכָם טִיהֵר לִי אֶת הַדָּם, וַאֲזַל שַׁיְילֵיהּ, וְאִשְׁתְּכַח שִׁיקְרָא. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא כִּדְרַב יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הוּחְזְקָה נִדָּה בִּשְׁכֵינוֹתֶיהָ — בַּעְלָהּ לוֹקֶה עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם נִדָּה.
human_translation: No, necessary when she tells him: So-and-so Sage purified the blood for me and he went and asked him, and it was found a lie. And if you wish, say similar to that which Rav Yehuda as Rav Yehuda stated: she is known by her neighbors to be a menstruating woman, her husband is flogged if her, due to a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: Not needed, for she said to him: "So-and-so, a wise man, purify the blood for me," and he went and tested it, and found it to be false. And if you wish, say it is like Rav Yehudah, for Rav Yehudah said: If a woman is suspected of being a menstruant in her neighborhood, her husband may administer lashes to her on account of her suspected menstruation.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא קוֹצָה לָהּ חַלָּה. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּיָדַע — נִפְרוֹשׁ, אִי דְּלָא יָדַע — מְנָא יָדַע? לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאָמְרָה לֵיהּ: פְּלוֹנִי גַּבָּל תִּיקֵּן לִי אֶת הָעִיסָּה, וְאָזֵיל שַׁיְילֵיהּ, וְאִשְׁתְּכַח שִׁיקְרָא.
human_translation: Or she does not separate ḥalla . What are the circumstances? If he knows he should abstain. If he does not know, how does he know No, necessary when she tells him: So-and-so kneader rectified the dough for me and he went and asked him, and it was found a lie.
llm_translation: "And not cut for it dough. How so? If he knows - he separates, if he does not know - how does he know? It is necessary, for she said to him: 'So-and-so, mend the dough for me, and then go and knead it, and you will find falsehood.'"

hebrew_text: וְנוֹדֶרֶת וְאֵינָהּ מְקַיֶּימֶת. דְּאָמַר מָר: בַּעֲוֹן נְדָרִים בָּנִים מֵתִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַל תִּתֵּן אֶת פִּיךָ לַחֲטִיא אֶת בְּשָׂרֶךָ וְגוֹ׳״. וְאֵיזוֹ הֵן מַעֲשֵׂה יָדָיו שֶׁל אָדָם — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר בָּנָיו וּבְנוֹתָיו. רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״לַשָּׁוְא הִכֵּיתִי אֶת בְּנֵיכֶם״, ״לַשָּׁוְא״ — עַל עִסְקֵי שָׁוְא.
human_translation: Or she vows and does not fulfill As the Master said: Due to vows, children die, as it is stated: Do not allow your mouth to bring your flesh to sin… And what is the work of a person’s hands? You must say his sons and his daughters. Rav Naḥman said: from here: “In vain I smote your children” “in vain” For matters vain
llm_translation: And she vows and does not fulfill. For Mar said: Because of the sin of unfulfilled vows, children die, as it is stated: "Do not give your mouth to cause your flesh to sin, etc." And what are the deeds of a person's hands? He should say his sons and daughters. Rav Nachman said from here: "In vain I have struck your children," "in vain" - concerning matters of vanity.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַיּוֹדֵעַ בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁנּוֹדֶרֶת וְאֵינָהּ מְקַיֶּימֶת — יַחְזוֹר וְיַדִּירֶנָּה. יַדִּירֶנָּה?! בְּמַאי מְתַקֵּן לַהּ? אֶלָּא: יַחְזוֹר וְיַקְנִיטֶנָּה, כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּדּוֹר בְּפָנָיו וְיָפֵר לָהּ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין אָדָם דָּר עִם נָחָשׁ בִּכְפִיפָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir used to say: Anyone who knows concerning his wife that she vows and does not fulfill should return and vow her. He should vow her? How will he rectify for her Rather, he should return and provoke her, so that she will vow in his presence and he can nullify for her. They said to him: a person does not reside in a basket [ kefifa ], with a snake,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir would say: Anyone who knows that his wife vowed and did not fulfill it - he should annul it. Annul it?! How can he rectify it for her? Rather, he should provoke her to fulfill it, so that it will be pleasing to her. They said to him: A person should not live with a snake in the same basket.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַיּוֹדֵעַ בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ קוֹצֶה לוֹ חַלָּה — יַחְזוֹר וְיַפְרִישׁ אַחֲרֶיהָ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין אָדָם דָּר עִם נָחָשׁ בִּכְפִיפָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yehuda used to say: Anyone who knows concerning his wife that she does not separate ḥalla for him should go back and separate after she They said to him: a person does not reside in a basket with a snake.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda would say, "Anyone who knows that his wife is not pleasing to him should divorce her." They said to him: "A man should not live with a snake in the same basket."

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַהָא, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אַהָךְ. אֲבָל מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי אַהָךְ, אֲבָל הָא — זִימְנִין דְּמִקְּרֵי וְאָכֵיל.
human_translation: He who teaches it with regard to this, all the more so for that, But he who teaches it with regard to that, but this sometimes he happen to eat
llm_translation: One who teaches her father, certainly her brother. But one who teaches her brother, but this - sometimes called and eats.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזוֹהִי דָּת יְהוּדִית? יוֹצְאָה וְרֹאשָׁהּ פָּרוּעַ. רֹאשָׁהּ פָּרוּעַ דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּפָרַע אֶת רֹאשׁ הָאִשָּׁה״, וְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אַזְהָרָה לִבְנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלֹּא יֵצְאוּ בִּפְרוּעַ רֹאשׁ! דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא —
human_translation: And who is precepts of Jewish goes out and her head is uncovered. her head uncovered it is by Torah as it is written “And he shall uncover the head of the woman” the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: warning to Jewish women not to go out with an uncovered head, By Torah
llm_translation: "And what is the Jewish custom? Her hair is uncovered. Her hair is uncovered, as it is a biblical law, as it is written: 'And he shall uncover the woman's head.' And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Ishmael: A warning to the daughters of Israel not to go out with uncovered heads! As it is a biblical law—"

hebrew_text: קַלְתָּהּ שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי, דָּת יְהוּדִית — אֲפִילּוּ קַלְתָּהּ נָמֵי אָסוּר.
human_translation: her basket kilta it seems well precepts of Jewish even her basket is also prohibited;
llm_translation: Her light is beautiful, the Jewish law - even if her light is dim, it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: קַלְתָּהּ, אֵין בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם פְּרוּעַ רֹאשׁ. הָוֵי בַּהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: הֵיכָא? אִילֵּימָא בְּשׁוּק — דָּת יְהוּדִית הִיא! וְאֶלָּא בֶּחָצֵר — אִם כֵּן לֹא הִנַּחְתָּ בַּת לְאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ שֶׁיּוֹשֶׁבֶת תַּחַת בַּעְלָהּ! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב כָּהֲנָא: מֵחָצֵר לְחָצֵר וְדֶרֶךְ מָבוֹי.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: her basket, there is no an uncovered head. Rabbi Zeira discussed it: Where If we say in the marketplace, this is precepts of Jewish And rather in courtyard, if so, you have not allowed daughter of our father Abraham to remain with her husband, Abaye said, and some say that Rav Kahana from courtyard to courtyard or via an alleyway.
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: She is light, she does not have the status of uncovered head. Rabbi Zeira said to him: Where? If you say in the marketplace - it is a Jewish custom! Rather, in the courtyard - if so, did you not leave the daughter of our forefather Abraham who sits beneath her husband! Abaye said, and it was stated by Rav Kahana: From courtyard to courtyard and through an alleyway.

hebrew_text: וְטוֹוֶה בַּשּׁוֹק. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּמַרְאָה זְרוֹעוֹתֶיהָ לִבְנֵי אָדָם. רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר אֲבִימִי: בְּטוֹוֶה וְרַד כְּנֶגֶד פָּנֶיהָ, וּמְדַבֶּרֶת עִם כׇּל אָדָם. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בִּמְשַׂחֶקֶת עִם בַּחוּרִים.
human_translation: And spins in the marketplace. Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: that she reveals her arms to people Rav Ḥisda said Avimi when she spins a red vered opposite her face Or she speaks with every man Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: that she flirts with young men.
llm_translation: "And adorned in the marketplace. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: With the appearance of her arms to people. Rav Ḥisdah said in the name of Avimi: Adorned and descending opposite her face, and speaking with all people. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Engaging in play with young men."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: זִימְנָא חֲדָא הֲוָה קָאָזֵילְנָא בָּתְרֵיהּ דְּרַב עוּקְבָא, חֲזִיתֵיהּ לְהַהִיא עַרְבָיָא דַּהֲוָה יָתְבָה קָא שָׁדְיָא פִּילְכַּהּ, וְטוֹוֶה וְרַד כְּנֶגֶד פָּנֶיהָ. כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזֵיתִינַן, פְּסַיקְתֵּיהּ לְפִילְכַּהּ שְׁדֵיתֵיהּ. אֲמַרָה לִי: עוּלָם, הַב לִי פֶּלֶךְ. אָמַר בַּהּ רַב עוּקְבָא מִילְּתָא. מַאי אָמַר בָּהּ? רָבִינָא אָמַר: ״טוֹוָה בַּשּׁוּק״ אָמַר בַּהּ. רַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: ״מְדַבֶּרֶת עִם כׇּל אָדָם״ אָמַר בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥanna said: One time I was walking behind Rav Ukva. I saw an Arab woman who was sitting, casting her spindle, and spinning a red opposite her face. Once she saw us, she tore the spindle and threw it down. She said to me: Young man, give me spindle. Rav Ukva made a comment about her, What did he say about her? Ravina said: He said about her spins in the marketplace. The Rabbis said: He said about her speaks with every man.
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: One time, I was walking behind Rav Ukva, I saw that he was sitting at the entrance of a certain inn, and a woman was spreading out her hair, and combing it, and arranging it in front of her face. When she noticed us, she covered her hair with her scarf. She said to me: "Forever, bring me a mirror." Rav Ukva said to her a word. What did he say to her? Ravina said: "Beautiful in the market," he said to her. The Rabbis say: "Speaking with every man," he said to her.

hebrew_text: אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: אַף הַמְקַלֶּלֶת יוֹלְדָיו בְּפָנָיו. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בִּמְקַלֶּלֶת יוֹלְידָיו בִּפְנֵי מוֹלָידָיו. וְסִימָנָיךְ: ״אֶפְרַיִם וּמְנַשֶּׁה כִּרְאוּבֵן וְשִׁמְעוֹן יִהְיוּ לִי״. אָמַר רַבָּה: דְּאָמְרָה לֵיהּ ״נֵיכְלֵיהּ אַרְיָא לְסָבָא בְּאַפֵּי בְּרֵיהּ״.
human_translation: Abba Shaul says: Also who curses parents in his presence Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: when she curses his parents in the presence of his children And your mnemonic is “Ephraim and Manasseh will be to me like Reuben and Simeon” Rabba said: that she said in the presence of son: May a lion devour grandfather.
llm_translation: Abba Saul says: Even one who curses his parents in his presence. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: By cursing his parents in the presence of his parents. And your mnemonic: "Ephraim and Manasseh shall be mine like Reuben and Simeon." Rabbah said: As she said to him, "Let the lioness come to the old man in the presence of his son."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף הַקּוֹלָנִית. מַאי ״קוֹלָנִית״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּמַשְׁמַעַת קוֹלָהּ עַל עִסְקֵי תַּשְׁמִישׁ. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: בִּמְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת בְּחָצֵר זוֹ וְנִשְׁמַע קוֹלָהּ בְּחָצֵר אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon says: Also a loud woman. What a loud woman? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: when she raises her voice about matters relating to intercourse, It was taught in a baraita : When she engages in intercourse in this courtyard and her voice is heard in another courtyard.
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon says: Even the Kolanit. What is "Kolanit"? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: With the sound of her voice during marital relations. In a Baraita it was taught: If she is using a hand-mill in this courtyard and her voice is heard in another courtyard.

hebrew_text: וְנִיתְנְיַיהּ גַּבֵּי מוּמִין בְּמַתְנִיתִין! אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְשַׁנִּין מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: But this should be taught with blemishes in the mishna Rather, it is clear as we initially answered,
llm_translation: "And it was taught regarding blemishes in the Mishnah! Rather, it is like we learned from the outset."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמִּקְדָּשׁ אֶת הָאִשָּׁה עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין עָלֶיהָ נְדָרִים, וְנִמְצְאוּ עָלֶיהָ נְדָרִים — אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, כְּנָסָהּ סְתָם וְנִמְצְאוּ עָלֶיהָ נְדָרִים — תֵּצֵא שֶׁלֹּא בִּכְתוּבָּה.
human_translation: one who betroths a woman on condition that there are no vows upon her, and discovered vows upon her, she is not betrothed. he married her without specification and discovered vows upon her, she divorced without marriage contract,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who betroths a woman on the condition that she has no vows upon her, and vows are found upon her - she is not betrothed. If he betroths her conditionally without specifying a reason, and vows are found upon her - she may leave without a marriage contract.

hebrew_text: עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ מוּמִין וְנִמְצְאוּ בָּהּ מוּמִין — אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. כְּנָסָהּ סְתָם וְנִמְצְאוּ בָּהּ מוּמִין — תֵּצֵא שֶׁלֹּא בִּכְתוּבָּה. כֹּל הַמּוּמִין הַפּוֹסְלִין בַּכֹּהֲנִים — פּוֹסְלִין בְּנָשִׁים.
human_translation: on condition that she has no blemishes, and discovered she blemishes, she is not betrothed. he married her without specification, and discovered she blemishes, she divorced without marriage contract. All of the blemishes that disqualify priests disqualify women,
llm_translation: On condition that it has no blemishes, and blemishes are found in it - it is not sanctified. If one collected it without specifying, and blemishes are found in it - it shall go out without a written document. All blemishes that disqualify in priests - disqualify in women.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּתְנַן נָמֵי גַּבֵּי קִדּוּשִׁין כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא! הָכָא — כְּתוּבּוֹת אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, תַּנָּא קִדּוּשִׁין אַטּוּ כְּתוּבּוֹת. הָתָם — קִדּוּשִׁין אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, תְּנָא כְּתוּבּוֹת אַטּוּ קִדּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: And we learned also concerning betrothal like this case. Here, it was necessary for marriage contracts, he taught betrothal due to marriage contracts. There, it was necessary for him betrothal, he taught marriage contracts due to betrothal.
llm_translation: Gemara: And we learned in a Baraita regarding the matter of Kiddushin, for this is the case! Here - written texts are necessary for it, a Tanna taught Kiddushin, then written texts. There - Kiddushin is necessary for it, a Tanna taught written texts, then Kiddushin.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: בְּאֵלּוּ נְדָרִים אָמְרוּ — שֶׁלֹּא תֹּאכַל בָּשָׂר, וְשֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁתֶּה יַיִן, וְשֶׁלֹּא תִּתְקַשֵּׁט בְּבִגְדֵי צִבְעוֹנִים. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: בְּאֵלּוּ נְדָרִים אָמְרוּ — דְּבָרִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן עִינּוּי נֶפֶשׁ: שֶׁלֹּא תֹּאכַל בָּשָׂר, וְשֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁתֶּה יַיִן, וְשֶׁלֹּא תִּתְקַשֵּׁט בְּבִגְדֵי צִבְעוֹנִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: These are the vows they spoke about she will not eat meat or that she will not drink wine or that she will not adorn herself with colored garments. That is also taught These are the vows they spoke about: Matters that involve affliction, that she will not eat meat, or that she will not drink wine, or that she will not adorn herself with colored garments.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: In these vows they said — not to eat meat, and not to drink wine, and not to adorn oneself with colored garments. It was also taught likewise: In these vows they said — matters that involve self-affliction: not to eat meat, and not to drink wine, and not to adorn oneself with colored garments.

hebrew_text: הָוֵי בַּהּ רַב פָּפָּא: אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַרֵישָׁא: כֵּיוָן דְּקָא קָפֵיד — אֲפִילּוּ כֹּל מִילֵּי נָמֵי! אֶלָּא אַסֵּיפָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa discussed it: To which If we say to the first clause since he is particular even any matters, also Rather, to the latter clause
llm_translation: Be in it Rav Papa: Aheiya? If you say the first: Since he is strict - even all other matters! Rather, the latter.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם אַרֵישָׁא, וּמִידִּי דְּקָפְדִי בַּהּ אִינָשֵׁי — הֲוָה קְפִידֵיהּ קְפִידָא. מִידֵּי דְּלָא קָפְדִי בַּהּ אִינָשֵׁי — לָא הָוֵי קְפִידֵיהּ קְפִידָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Actually, to the first clause a matter about which people are particular, his insistence is insistence, a matter about which people are not particular, his insistence is not insistence,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Always at first, and from the fact that people are meticulous about it - there was meticulousness. From the fact that people are not meticulous about it - there is no meticulousness.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: קִידְּשָׁה עַל תְּנַאי וּכְנָסָהּ סְתָם, רַב אָמַר: צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי:
human_translation: It was stated betrothed her conditionally, and he married her without specification, Rav said: she requires a bill of divorce from him. And Shmuel said: she does not require a bill of divorce from him. Abaye said:
llm_translation: It was stated: She was betrothed based on the condition, and he consummated the marriage without specifying the condition. Rav said: She requires a bill of divorce from him. And Shmuel said: She does not require a bill of divorce from him. Abaye said:

hebrew_text: לָא תֵּימָא טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַב כֵּיוָן שֶׁכְּנָסָהּ סְתָם אַחוֹלֵי אַחֲלֵיהּ לִתְנָאֵיהּ, אֶלָּא טַעְמָא דְרַב: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אָדָם עוֹשֶׂה בְּעִילָתוֹ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת.
human_translation: Do not say Rav’s reason since he married her without specification, he waived his condition Rather, Rav’s reason because a person does not engage in licentious sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: Do not say, the reason of Rav is that once he has entered her, he may have intercourse with her secretly, but rather the reason of Rav is: because a man does not engage in his marital relations as he does in promiscuous relations.

hebrew_text: הָא פְּלִיגִי בַהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא, דְּאִתְּמַר: קְטַנָּה שֶׁלֹּא מֵיאֲנָה, וְהִגְדִּילָה, עָמְדָה וְנִישֵּׂאת — רַב אָמַר: אֵין צְרִיכָה גֵּט מִשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: But they disagree about this one time. As it is stated: a minor girl who did not refuse and she became an adult she arose and married Rav said: She does not require a bill of divorce from the second one.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "This is where they argued once, as it was stated: 'A small one who did not refuse, and she grew up, stood and carried - Rav said: She does not need a divorce document from the second husband."

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: צְרִיכָה גֵּט מִשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: She requires a bill of divorce from the second one.
llm_translation: And Samuel said: A get is required from the second.

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אִתְּמַר בְּהָהִיא: בְּהָהִיא קָאָמַר רַב מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵיכָּא תְּנָאָה, אֲבָל בְּהָא דְּאִיכָּא תְּנָאָה — אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: necessary For if it was stated in that in that Rav stated because there is no condition But in this where there is a condition say that he concedes to Shmuel
llm_translation: The matter is, for if it was stated in that case: in that case Rav said because there is no Mishnah, but in this case where there is a Mishnah — say that Shmuel agrees with him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִתְּמַר בְּהָא: בְּהָא קָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, אֲבָל בְּהָךְ — אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַב, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if it was stated in this in this Shmuel said but in that say he concedes to Rav. necessary
llm_translation: And if it is said in this: in this it is stated by Shmuel, but in that - say it to Rav, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: כְּנָסָהּ סְתָם וְנִמְצְאוּ עָלֶיהָ נְדָרִים — תֵּצֵא שֶׁלֹּא בִּכְתוּבָּה. כְּתוּבָּה הוּא דְּלָא בָּעֲיָא, הָא גִּיטָּא בָּעֲיָא. מַאי לָאו, קִידְּשָׁה עַל תְּנַאי וּכְנָסָהּ סְתָם, תְּיוּבְתָּא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל!
human_translation: We learned he married her without specification, and it was discovered that vows were incumbent upon her, she divorced without marriage contract. She does not require marriage contract, but she does require a bill of divorce. What, is it not he betrothed her conditionally and married her without specification? a conclusive refutation of Shmuel’s
llm_translation: We learned: If a woman entered into marriage covertly and vows were found upon her - she shall go out without a bill of divorce. It is without a bill of divorce that is not required, but a bill of divorce is required. What is the reason? She was betrothed conditionally and entered into marriage covertly, the statement of Shmuel is preferable!

hebrew_text: לָא, קִידְּשָׁה סְתָם, וּכְנָסָהּ סְתָם.
human_translation: No, he betrothed her without specification and married her without specification.
llm_translation: No, she was betrothed in private, and he married her in private.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל, קִידְּשָׁה עַל תְּנַאי וּכְנָסָהּ סְתָם — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא בָּעֲיָא גִּיטָּא? אַדְּתָנֵי הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת הָאִשָּׁה עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין עָלֶיהָ נְדָרִים וְנִמְצְאוּ עָלֶיהָ נְדָרִים אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, לִיתְנֵי: כְּנָסָהּ סְתָם וְנִמְצְאוּ עָלֶיהָ נְדָרִים — אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן הָא.
human_translation: But he betrothed her conditionally and married her without specification, indeed that she does not require a bill of divorce? instead of teaching one betroths a woman on condition that there are no vows upon her and it was discovered vows upon her, she is not betrothed, let teach married her without specification and it was discovered vows were upon her, she is not betrothed. And all the more so this
llm_translation: Talmudic text: However, if she consecrated herself based on a condition and her vows were hidden - so it is said, that she does not require a divorce? For it was taught: One who consecrates a woman on the condition that she has no vows upon her, and vows are found upon her, she is not consecrated. Let it be taught: If her vows were hidden and vows are found upon her - she is not consecrated, and all the more so in this case.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי קָאָמַר: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת הָאִשָּׁה עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין עָלֶיהָ נְדָרִים וּכְנָסָהּ סְתָם, וְנִמְצְאוּ עָלֶיהָ נְדָרִים — אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. קִידְּשָׁה סְתָם וּכְנָסָהּ סְתָם — תֵּצֵא שֶׁלֹּא בִּכְתוּבָּה.
human_translation: That is also what he is saying, One who betroths a woman on condition that there are no vows upon her and marries her without specification, and it is discovered vows were upon her, she is not betrothed. he betrothed her without specification and married her without specification, she divorced without marriage contract.
llm_translation: So it was stated: One who betroths a woman on the condition that she has no vows upon her, and her vows are found upon her - she is not betrothed. If he betrothed her conditionally and her vows were conditional - she shall depart without a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: כְּתוּבָּה הוּא דְּלָא בָּעֲיָא, הָא גִּיטָּא — בָּעֲיָא. וּמַאי שְׁנָא כְּתוּבָּה דְּלָא בָּעֲיָא — דְּאָמַר: אִי אֶפְשִׁי בְּאִשָּׁה נַדְרָנִית, אִי הָכִי גֵּט נָמֵי לָא תִּיבְּעֵי!
human_translation: she does not require marriage contract, but she does require a bill of divorce. And what is different a marriage contract that she does not require Because he says: I do not want a vowing wife, If so, she should also not require a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: It is written that it is not needed, here a bill of divorce - is needed. And what is the difference between a case where it is not needed? Because it is said: "If she is married to a vow, then her vow shall stand, or the utterance of her lips with which she has bound her soul."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: צְרִיכָה גֵּט מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם. וְכֵן אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: צְרִיכָה גֵּט מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם. רָבָא אָמַר: תַּנָּא סַפּוֹקֵי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ, גַּבֵּי מָמוֹנָא לְקוּלָּא, גַּבֵּי אִיסּוּרָא לְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: Rabba said: She requires a bill of divorce from the words of And similarly, Rav Ḥisda said: She requires a bill of divorce from the words of Rava said tanna is uncertain Concerning monetary matters, should be lenient. concerning prohibitions must be stringent,
llm_translation: Rabba said: A get is required from their words. And so said Rav Ḥisda: A get is required from their words. Rava said: A tanna taught a doubt to him, regarding monetary matters leniently, regarding prohibitions strictly.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּטָעוּת שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים. אֲבָל בְּטָעוּת אִשָּׁה אַחַת — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט.
human_translation: Rabba said: The dispute is in an error two women. But in an error one woman, all agree, that she does not require a bill of divorce from him.
llm_translation: Rabba said: The dispute is regarding the error of two women. But in the error of one woman - everyone agrees that she does not require a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר (לֵיהּ) אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּטָעוּת אִשָּׁה אַחַת הִיא, וְקָמוֹתְבִינַן תְּיוּבְתָּא מִינַּיהּ!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: But the mishna an error one woman, and we raise an objection from it
llm_translation: Abaye said to him: But the Mishnah states that it is the error of one woman, and we write a contradiction from it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִתְּמַר הָכִי אִתְּמַר, אָמַר רַבָּה: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּטָעוּת אִשָּׁה אַחַת כְּעֵין שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים. אֲבָל בְּטָעוּת אִשָּׁה אַחַת גְּרֵידְתָּא — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט.
human_translation: Rather, If was said, it was said as follows: Rabba said the dispute is with regard to an error one woman similar to two women. But in error only one woman, all agree she does not require a bill of divorce from him.
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus. Rabah said: A dispute regarding the mistaken act of one woman is like the case of two women. But in the case of the mistaken act of one woman with a kerchief — everyone agrees that she does not require a bill of divorce from him.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: קִידְּשָׁהּ בְּטָעוּת, וּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, וְכֵן קָטָן שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשָּׁלַח סִבְלוֹנוֹת לְאַחַר מִיכֵּן — אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, שֶׁמֵּחֲמַת קִדּוּשִׁין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים שָׁלַח. וְאִם בָּעֲלוּ — קָנוּ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמַר: אִם בָּעֲלוּ לֹא קָנוּ.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to betrothed her in error, or less than the value of a peruta , and similarly a minor boy who betrothed even if later sent presents [ sivlonot ] she is not betrothed, because he sent on the basis of the original betrothal. And if engaged in sexual intercourse they have acquired Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: if they engage in sexual intercourse, they have not acquired
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Abaye raised an objection: If he betrothed her by mistake, and less than the value of a perutah, and similarly a minor who betrothed, even though he sent gifts to her afterwards - she is not betrothed, because the initial betrothal was sent. And if they consummated - they acquired. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: If they consummated, they did not acquire.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא דְּטָעוּת אִשָּׁה אַחַת הִיא, וּפְלִיגִי. מַאי לָאו טָעוּת נְדָרִים?
human_translation: But here where is an error one woman, and disagree; what, is it not that Betrothed error vows,
llm_translation: And here, where it is a case of the error of one woman, and they dispute. What is the reason that it is not an error of vows?

hebrew_text: לָא, טָעוּת פָּחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה. פָּחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה בְּהֶדְיָא קָתָנֵי לַהּ: קִידְּשָׁהּ בְּטָעוּת וּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה! פָּרוֹשֵׁי קָא מְפָרֵשׁ: קִידְּשָׁהּ בְּטָעוּת כֵּיצַד? כְּגוֹן שֶׁקִּידְּשָׁהּ בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: No, error, less than the value of a peruta . less than the value of a peruta , teaches it explicitly he betrothed her in error, or less than the value of a peruta . It is explaining What is betrothed her in error? For example, when he betrothed her with less than the value of a peruta ,
llm_translation: Not, mistaken less than equal penny. Less than equal penny in Hadya taught to it: sanctified her in mistake and less than equal penny! Commentators interpreting: sanctified her in mistake how? For example, that he sanctified her with less than equal penny.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, וְגָמַר וּבָעַל לְשֵׁם קִדּוּשִׁין. וּמַר סָבַר: אֵין אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, וְכִי קָא בָעַל, אַדַּעְתָּא דְּקִדּוּשִׁין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים בָּעַל.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Sage, holds a person knows that betrothal does not take effect with less than the value of a peruta . Consequently, decides to engage in sexual intercourse for the purpose of betrothal And Sage, holds a person does not know that betrothal does not take effect with less than the value of a peruta , and when he engages in sexual intercourse, he does so on the basis of the original betrothal,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: With what do they argue? Master holds: A person knows that sanctifications do not take effect in less than the value of a perutah, and he completes and acquires for the sake of sanctifications. And Master holds: A person does not know that sanctifications do not take effect in less than the value of a perutah, and when he acquires, he acquires with the intent that the initial sanctifications acquire. English translation:

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: ״הֲרֵינִי בּוֹעֲלִיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁיִּרְצֶה אַבָּא״, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא רָצָה הָאָב — מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: רָצָה הָאָב מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, לֹא רָצָה הָאָב אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. וְהָא הָכָא, דְּכִי טָעוּת אִשָּׁה אַחַת דָּמֵי, וּפְלִיגִי!
human_translation: raised an objection to I am engaging in sexual intercourse with you on condition that father will desire although the father did not desire she is betrothed Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: the father desires she is betrothed, the father does not desire she is not betrothed, But here it is similar to a mistake one woman, and they disagree
llm_translation: He raised an objection: "I am betrothing you on the condition that my father will consent," even if the father did not consent — she is betrothed. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: If the father consented, she is betrothed; if the father did not consent, she is not betrothed. And here, where the mistake of one woman is similar, they disagree!

hebrew_text: הָתָם בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁיִּרְצֶה הָאָב״ — עַל מְנָת שֶׁיִּשְׁתּוֹק הָאָב, וְהָא שָׁתֵיק לֵיהּ. וּמָר סָבַר ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁיֹּאמַר אַבָּא ׳הֵן׳״, וְהָא לָא אָמַר אַבָּא ׳הֵן׳.
human_translation: There, they disagree about this: Sage, holds that: On condition that father will desire On condition that father is silent. Consequently, and he was silent about it. And Sage, holds On condition that father says yes, and he did not say yes.
llm_translation: There, in that case where he stumbled, Master holds "in order that the father may be pleased" - in order that the father may be silent, and he remained silent. And Master holds "in order that it may be said 'father, yes'", but he did not say 'yes'.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: מוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בִּקְטַנָּה שֶׁהִשִּׂיאָהּ אָבִיהָ, וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה וְהִיא יְתוֹמָה בְּחַיֵּי הָאָב, וְהֶחְזִירָהּ — שֶׁחוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַבֶּמֶת,
human_translation: raised an objection to The Rabbis concede to Rabbi Eliezer concerning a minor girl who was married off by her father and divorced and is an orphan in the lifetime of the father, and remarried her, that she performs ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: They raised an objection against him: The sages concede to Rabbi Eliezer in the case of a minor who her father betrothed her, and she was divorced while still a minor and she is an orphan during her father's lifetime, and he remarried her - she is exempt from levirate marriage and does not perform levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁגֵּירוּשֶׁיהָ גֵּירוּשִׁין גְּמוּרִין, וְאֵין חֲזָרָתָהּ חֲזָרָה גְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: because her divorce was a full-fledged divorce, and her return is not a full-fledged return,
llm_translation: Because her divorces are complete divorces, and her remarriage is a complete remarriage.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁגֵּירְשָׁהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה, וְהֶחְזִירָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה. אֲבָל גֵּירְשָׁהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה וְהֶחְזִירָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא גְּדוֹלָה, אוֹ שֶׁהֶחְזִירָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה וְגָדְלָה אֶצְלוֹ וָמֵת — אוֹ חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: In what is this statement said? When he divorced her while she was a minor girl and remarried her while she was a minor girl. But he divorced her while she was a minor girl, and remarried her when she was an adult woman, or he remarried her while she was a minor girl and she became an adult woman to him, And he died, either she performs ḥalitza or she enters into levirate marriage
llm_translation: In what case are these words spoken? — When he divorced her while she was young, and he remarried her while she was young. But if he divorced her while she was young and remarried her while she was older, or if he remarried her while she was young and she grew older and he died — she may either perform halitzah or enter into levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אָמְרוּ: חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת. וְהָא הָכָא, דִּכְטָעוּת אִשָּׁה אַחַת דָּמֵי, וּפְלִיגִי!
human_translation: In the name of Rabbi Eliezer they said she performs ḥalitza , but she may not enter into levirate marriage. But here, similar to an error one woman, and disagree.
llm_translation: From the statement of Rabbi Eliezer they said: She performs ḥalitza but does not perform levirate marriage. But here, where the blood of one woman is in question, they disagree!

hebrew_text: הָתָם נָמֵי בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר: אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין קִידּוּשֵׁי קְטַנָּה כְּלוּם, וְגָמַר וּבָעַל לְשֵׁם קִידּוּשִׁין, וּמַר סָבַר: אֵין אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין קִידּוּשֵׁי קְטַנָּה כְּלוּם, וְכִי קָא בָעַל — אַדַּעְתָּא דְּקִידּוּשִׁין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים קָא בָעַל.
human_translation: there too disagree Sage, holds a person knows that the betrothal of a minor girl is nothing, and he decides to engage in sexual intercourse for the purpose of betrothal. And Sage, holds that a person does not know that the betrothal of a minor girl is nothing, and when he engages in sexual intercourse he does so on the basis of the initial betrothal,
llm_translation: There, in that case, in this matter he argued, Master holds: A person knows that the betrothals of a minor are nothing, and he completes and acquires for the sake of betrothals. And Master holds: A person does not know that the betrothals of a minor are nothing, and when he acquires - he acquires with the intent of the initial betrothals.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ עַל תְּנַאי וּבָעַל — [דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל] אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא בַּר אֲחָתֵיהּ: חֲלִיצָה מוּטְעֵת כְּשֵׁירָה. אֵיזוֹ הִיא חֲלִיצָה מוּטְעֵת? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כֹּל שֶׁאוֹמֵר לוֹ ״חֲלוֹץ לָהּ, וּבְכָךְ אַתָּה כּוֹנְסָהּ״.
human_translation: It was also stated Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One who betrothed conditionally and engaged in sexual intercourse all agree she does not require a bill of divorce from him. Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, son of sister, raised an objection to A mistaken ḥalitza is valid. What is A mistaken ḥalitza ? Reish Lakish said: Any when says to Perform ḥalitza with her and by so you will marry her.
llm_translation: It was stated: Namely, Rav Aḥa son of Ya'akov said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: One who consecrates conditionally and then marries — according to all she does not require a bill of divorce from him. Rav Aḥa son of Rava's brother Ika, raised an objection to him: A conditional divorce is effective. What is a conditional divorce? Reish Lakish said: Any case where he says to her, "Divorce her, and in this way you are acquiring her."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֲנִי שׁוֹנֶה: בֵּין שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּון הוּא וְלֹא נִתְכַּוְּונָה הִיא, בֵּין שֶׁנִּתְכַּוְּונָה הִיא וְלֹא נִתְכַּוֵּון הוּא חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה, עַד שֶׁיִּתְכַּוְּונוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם. וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ חֲלִיצָתָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה? אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כֹּל שֶׁאוֹמֵר לוֹ ״חֲלוֹץ לָהּ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתֵּן לְךָ מָאתַיִם זוּז״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: I teach Whether he intended and she did not intend whether she intended and he did not intend her ḥalitza is invalid; until they both intend And you say her ḥalitza is valid? Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan said any where says to Perform ḥalitza with her on condition that she gives you two hundred dinars
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, I differ: whether he intended and she did not intend, or she intended and he did not intend, her halitzah is invalid until both intend. And you say her halitzah is valid? Rather Rabbi Yochanan said: anyone who says to him, "Perform halitzah for her on condition that you give me two hundred zuz."

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא כֵּיוָן דַּעֲבַד מַעֲשֶׂה — אַחוֹלֵי אַחֲלֵיהּ לִתְנָאֵיהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דִּבְעַל — אַחוֹלֵי אַחֲלֵיהּ לִתְנָאֵיהּ!
human_translation: Apparently, since he performed an action, he waived his condition, here too, since he engaged in sexual intercourse, he has waived his condition,
llm_translation: The Gemara: Since he performed an action - he should eat with his colleagues. Here too, since he married - he should eat with his colleagues!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּר בֵּי רַב: שַׁפִּיר קָא אָמְרַתְּ? מִכְּדֵי כֹּל תְּנַאי מֵהֵיכָא גָּמְרִינַן — מִתְּנַאי בְּנֵי גָד וּבְנֵי רְאוּבֵן,
human_translation: He said to him: Student of the academy, you spoken well? After all, from where we learn all conditions? From the conditions the descendants of Gad and the descendants of Reuben.
llm_translation: He said to him, Bar Bei Rav: "Is it good that you said?" From where do we conclude all the teachings? From the teachings of the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben.

hebrew_text: תְּנָאָה דְּאֶפְשָׁר לְקַיּוֹמֵיהּ עַל יְדֵי שָׁלִיחַ, כִּי הָתָם — הָוֵי תְּנָאֵיהּ תְּנָאָה. דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר לְקַיּוֹמֵיהּ עַל יְדֵי שָׁלִיחַ, כִּי הָתָם — לָא הָוֵי תְּנָאָה.
human_translation: a condition that can be fulfilled by means of an agent, as there, a condition is condition. that cannot be fulfilled by means of an agent as there is not condition.
llm_translation: The teaching that it is possible for it to be upheld through an agent, for there — let his teaching be a teaching. That it is not possible for it to be upheld through an agent, for there — it is not a teaching.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בִּיאָה, דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר לְקַיּוֹמַיהּ עַל יְדֵי שָׁלִיחַ כִּי הָתָם, וְקָא הָוֵי תְּנָאָה!
human_translation: But sexual intercourse that cannot be fulfilled by means of an agent as there, and it is condition.
llm_translation: And this regarding betrothal, for it is not possible to establish it through an agent, as there, and it is considered a condition!

hebrew_text: הָתָם, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיתַּקּוּשׁ הֲוָיוֹת לַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: There, because becoming are juxtaposed to each other.
llm_translation: There, because there are connections to Hadadei.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עוּלָּא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמִלְוָה וּבָעַל, עַל תְּנַאי וּבָעַל, בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה וּבָעַל — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט.
human_translation: Rav Ulla bar Abba said Ulla said Rabbi Elazar said: one who betroths with a loan and engages in sexual intercourse conditionally and engages in sexual intercourse with less than the value of a peruta , and engages in sexual intercourse all agree she requires a bill of divorce from him.
llm_translation: Rav Ula son of Abba said Ula said Rabbi Elazar: One who consecrates with a loan and marries, conditionally and marries, with less than the value of a Perutah and marries - all agree that a Get is required.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי מְנַחֵם אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה וּבָעַל, צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט. בְּהָא הוּא דְּלָא טָעֵי, אֲבָל בְּהָנָךְ טָעֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yosef bar Abba said Rabbi Menaḥem said Rabbi Ami said: one who betroths with less than the value of a peruta and engages in sexual intercourse she requires a bill of divorce from him. it is in this that he does not err. But with regard to other err.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef son of Abba said, Rabbi Menachem said, Rabbi Amei said: One who consecrates with less than a perutah and has relations, she requires a bill of divorce from him. In this case, he is not mistaken, but in that case, he is mistaken.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ עַל תְּנַאי וּבָעַל — צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט. זֶה הָיָה מַעֲשֶׂה, וְלֹא הָיָה כֹּחַ בַּחֲכָמִים לְהוֹצִיאָהּ בְּלֹא גֵּט.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said in the name of Ulla: one who betroths conditionally and engages in sexual intercourse she requires a bill of divorce from him, This was an incident and the Sages did not have power to allow her to leave without a bill of divorce,
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said in the name of Ulla: One who sanctifies upon a condition and then marries - she requires a bill of divorce from him. This was a case, and the sages did not have the power to annul it without a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מֵהַאי תַּנָּא. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְהִיא לֹא נִתְפָּשָׂה״ — אֲסוּרָה. הָא נִתְפָּשָׂה — מוּתֶּרֶת. וְיֵשׁ לְךָ אַחֶרֶת שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נִתְפָּשָׂה, מוּתֶּרֶת. וְאֵיזוֹ זוֹ? שֶׁקִּידּוּשֶׁיהָ קִידּוּשֵׁי טָעוּת, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ בְּנָהּ מוּרְכָּב עַל כְּתֵיפָהּ,
human_translation: to exclude of this tanna , Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: “And she was not seized” forbidden Consequently, was seized permitted And you have another who, although she was not seized permitted And who is this? whose betrothal was a mistaken betrothal, as even if her son is riding on her shoulders,
llm_translation: To go out from this Mishnah. For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: "And she was not seized" - it is forbidden. If she was seized - she is permitted. And you have another case where even though she was not seized, she is permitted. And which is that? When her betrothals are betrothals of error, that even if her son is riding on her shoulder,

hebrew_text: מְמָאֶנֶת וְהוֹלֶכֶת לָהּ.
human_translation: she may refuse and go her
llm_translation: Refusing and going for her.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָלְכָה אֵצֶל חָכָם וְהִתִּירָהּ — מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. אֵצֶל רוֹפֵא וְרִיפֵּא אוֹתָהּ — אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. מָה בֵּין חָכָם לְרוֹפֵא? חָכָם עוֹקֵר אֶת הַנֶּדֶר מֵעִיקָּרוֹ, וְרוֹפֵא אֵינוֹ מְרַפֵּא אֶלָּא מִכָּאן וּלְהַבָּא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: she goes to a halakhic authority and he dissolves her she is betrothed. to a doctor and he heals her she is not betrothed. What between a halakhic authority and a doctor? a halakhic authority uproots the vow retroactively. But a doctor only heals from here onward.
