llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If a Halacha was brought before a Sage and he permitted it - it becomes sanctified. If it was brought before a doctor and he healed it - it does not become sanctified. What is the difference between a Sage and a doctor? A Sage uproots the vow from its inception, while a doctor only heals from here onward.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵצֶל חָכָם וְהִתִּירָהּ, אֵצֶל רוֹפֵא וְרִיפֵּא אוֹתָהּ — אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת! אָמַר רָבָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא — רַבִּי מֵאִיר, הָא — רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. הָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: אָדָם רוֹצֶה שֶׁתִּתְבַּזֶּה אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּבֵית דִּין. הָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר: אֵין אָדָם רוֹצֶה שֶׁתִּתְבַּזֶּה אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught to a halakhic authority and he dissolves her to a doctor and he heals her she is not betrothed? Rava said: not difficult, this Rabbi Meir, that Rabbi Elazar. This Rabbi Meir, who said a man is willing for his wife to be degraded to court That Rabbi Elazar, who said a man is not willing for his wife to be degraded in court.
llm_translation: The text states: And it was taught in a Baraita: If it is permitted by a wise person, and she the woman consented, if it is permitted by a doctor, and he healed her — she is not considered sanctified! Rava said: It is not difficult to reconcile the opinions, here is Rabbi Meir, here is Rabbi Elazar. Here is Rabbi Meir, who said: A man prefers that his wife be shamed in court. Here is Rabbi Elazar, who said: A man does not prefer that his wife be shamed in court.

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא? דִּתְנַן: הַמּוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ מִשּׁוּם נֶדֶר — לֹא יַחְזִיר. מִשּׁוּם שֵׁם רָע — לֹא יַחְזִיר.
human_translation: What is As we learned who divorces his wife due to a vow he may not remarry due to a bad reputation he may not remarry
llm_translation: "What is it?" As we learned: One who divorces his wife due to a vow - he shall not return. Due to a bad name - he shall not return.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל נֶדֶר שֶׁיָּדְעוּ בּוֹ רַבִּים — לֹא יַחֲזִיר. לֹא יָדְעוּ בּוֹ רַבִּים — יַחֲזִיר. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל נֶדֶר שֶׁצָּרִיךְ חֲקִירַת חָכָם — לֹא יַחֲזִיר. וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ חֲקִירַת חָכָם — יַחֲזִיר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: any vow that is known by many he may not remarry it is not known by many he may remarry Rabbi Meir says: Any vow that requires investigation by a halakhic authority, he may not remarry And that does not require the investigation by a halakhic authority, he may remarry
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: Any vow that many are aware of - do not annul. If few are aware of it - annul it. Rabbi Meir says: Any vow that requires investigation by a sage - do not annul. And one that does not require investigation by a sage - annul it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד צָרִיךְ וְאֶחָד אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ — לֹא יַחֲזִיר. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא אָסְרוּ צָרִיךְ אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? דִּכְתִיב:
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Both requires and one that does not require he may not remarry Rabbi Elazar said They prohibited requires only due to that does not require What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda’s As it is written:
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Whether one needs it or does not need it - do not return it. Rabbi Elazar said: They only prohibited returning it because one does not need it. What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's opinion? As it is written:

hebrew_text: ״וְלֹא הִכּוּם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל כִּי נִשְׁבְּעוּ לָהֶם נְשִׂיאֵי הָעֵדָה״, וְכַמָּה רַבִּים? רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: שְׁלֹשָׁה. יָמִים — שְׁנַיִם, רַבִּים — שְׁלֹשָׁה. רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר: עֲשָׂרָה,  ״עֵדָה״ כְּתִיב בְּהוּ.
human_translation: “And the children of Israel did not smite them, for the princes of the assembly had sworn to them” And how many many Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Three, “Days” two, “many three. Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Ten, as “assembly” is written in relation to the
llm_translation: "And they did not strike them, the children of Israel, for the leaders of the congregation had sworn to them." And how many leaders? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: three. If days – two, if leaders – three. Rabbi Yitzchak said: ten, "congregation" is written in it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל נֶדֶר שֶׁצָּרִיךְ חֲקִירַת חָכָם — לֹא יַחֲזִיר. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: לֹא אָסְרוּ צָרִיךְ אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ. בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: אָדָם רוֹצֶה שֶׁתִּתְבַּזֶּה אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּבֵית דִּין, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר סָבַר: אֵין אָדָם רוֹצֶה שֶׁתִּתְבַּזֶּה אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: any vow that requires investigation by a halakhic authority, he may not remarry Rabbi Elazar says: They prohibited requires only due to that does not require With regard to what they disagree? Rabbi Meir holds a man is willing for his wife to be degraded in court, Rabbi Elazar maintains a man is not willing for his wife to be degraded in court
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Any vow that requires investigation by a sage - should not be annulled. Rabbi Eliezer says: They only prohibited it because it is unnecessary. What are they arguing about? Rabbi Meir holds: A man wants his wife to be disgraced in court, Rabbi Eliezer holds: A man does not want his wife to be disgraced in court.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: הָכָא בְּאִשָּׁה חֲשׁוּבָה עָסְקִינַן, דְּאָמַר: לָא נִיחָא לִי דְּאִיתְּסַר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rava said Here we are dealing with an important woman, as he says: It is not amenable to me to be forbidden to her relatives.
llm_translation: Rava said: Here we are dealing with a prominent woman, as he said: "I do not find it pleasing that she is involved with her relatives."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, סֵיפָא דְּקָתָנֵי: אֲבָל הוּא שֶׁהָלַךְ אֵצֶל חָכָם וְהִתִּירוֹ, אֵצֶל רוֹפֵא וְרִיפֵּא אוֹתוֹ — מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, לִיתְנֵי אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְלֵימָא הָכָא בְּאָדָם חָשׁוּב עָסְקִינַן, דְּאָמְרָה: לָא נִיחָא לִי דְּאִיתְּסַר בְּקָרִיבֵיהּ!
human_translation: If so, the latter clause which teaches: But he goes to a halakhic authority and he dissolves his to a doctor and he heals him, she is betrothed. let teach she is not betrothed, and let say here we are dealing with an important person, as she says: It is not amenable to me to be forbidden to his relatives.
llm_translation: If so, the latter part of the Mishnah teaches: But if he went to a sage and he permitted him, or to a physician and he healed him - she is sanctified, let him not marry her; and why not say here that we are dealing with a prominent person, for she said: I do not want to be involved with one who is often in danger!

hebrew_text: אִיהִי בְּכׇל דְּהוּ נִיחָא לַהּ, כִּדְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: ״טָב לְמֵיתַב טַן דּוּ מִלְּמֵיתַב אַרְמְלוּ״, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: דְּשׁוּמְשְׁמָנָא גַּבְרָא כּוּרְסְיַהּ בֵּי חָרָאתָא רָמֵי לַהּ.
human_translation: it is amenable to her with any as Reish Lakish: As Reish Lakish said It is better to dwell as two tan du than to dwell a widow. Abaye said whose husband is as an ant, places her seat among the noblewomen,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ihi b'kol dehu nicha la, kidreish Lakish. D'amar Reish Lakish: 'Tav l'meitav tan du milmeitav armelu', Abbaye amar: d'shumshemana gavra Kurseiyah bei Charata raimei la."

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: דְּנַפָּסָא גַּבְרָא, תִּיקְרְיֵיהּ בְּסִיפֵּי בָבָא וְתֵיתִיב. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: דְּקַלָּסָא גַּבְרָא, לָא בָּעֲיָא טְלָפְחֵי לְקִידְרָא. תָּנָא: וְכוּלָּן מְזַנּוֹת וְתוֹלוֹת בְּבַעְלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said whose husband is a wool comber nafsa calls him to sit at the entrance to the house, Rav Ashi said: whose husband lowly kalsa does not require lentils for her pot. taught: And all of these commit adultery and attribute to their husbands.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: If a man is negligent, call him to the end of the gate of Bava and have him sit. Rav Ashe said: If a man is bald, he does not need a hat for the pot. It was taught in a Baraita: And all of them are provided for and dependent on their husbands.

hebrew_text: כׇּל מוּמִין שֶׁפּוֹסְלִין וְכוּ׳. תָּנָא: הוֹסִיפוּ עֲלֵיהֶן זֵיעָה, וְשׁוּמָא, וְרֵיחַ הַפֶּה. וְהָנֵי בְּכָהֲנֵי לָא פָּסְלִי? וְהָתְנַן: הַזָּקֵן, וְהַחוֹלֶה, וְהַמְזוֹהָם. וּתְנַן: מוּמִין אֵלּוּ, בֵּין קְבוּעִין בֵּין עוֹבְרִין — פְּסוּלִין בָּאָדָם.
human_translation: all blemishes that disqualify taught To these, they added Sweat, a mole, and odor from the mouth. And these not disqualify priests? Didn’t we learn The old, the sick, and the filthy? And it was taught These blemishes whether permanent whether temporary, people, disqualified
llm_translation: Talmudic text: All blemishes that disqualify, etc. It was taught: Add to them slobber, and pus, and bad breath. And these, with regard to priests, do not disqualify? But didn't we learn: The old, the sick, and the repulsive. And we learned: Blemishes, whether permanent or temporary — disqualify in a person.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּזֵיעָה עוֹבֶרֶת, כָּאן בְּזֵיעָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ עוֹבֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: not difficult. Here, removable sweat, There, of sweat that is not removable.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina, it is not difficult: here with a live fetus, here with a non-live fetus.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: זֵיעָה אַמְּזוֹהָם קָא רָמֵית? הָתָם גַּבֵּי כֹּהֲנִים — אֶפְשָׁר לְעַבֹּרַהּ בְּקִיּוּהָא דְחַמְרָא. וּמֵרֵיחַ הַפֶּה נָמֵי — אֶפְשָׁר דְּנָקֵט פִּילְפְּלָא בְּפוּמֵּיהּ וְעָבֵיד עֲבוֹדָה. אֲבָל גַּבֵּי אִשָּׁה לָא אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said Have you raised a contradiction between sweat filth? there, with regard to priests it is possible to remove it by wine vinegar. And also from odor of the mouth, possible to hold pepper in his mouth and perform the service. But with regard to a woman it is not possible
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Is it possible to raise a question about sweat? There, regarding priests - it is possible to pass it off as the result of wine. And regarding bad breath - it is possible that he chewed pepper and performed the service. But regarding a woman, it is not possible.

hebrew_text: הַאי שׁוּמָא הֵיכִי דָּמְיָא? אִי דְּאִית בַּהּ שֵׂעָר — הָכָא וְהָכָא פָּסְלָה. אִי דְּלָא אִית בַּהּ שֵׂעָר, אִי שׁוּמָא גְּדוֹלָה הִיא — הָכָא וְהָכָא פָּסְלָה, אִי שׁוּמָא קְטַנָּה הִיא — הָכָא וְהָכָא לָא פָּסְלָה, דְּתַנְיָא: שׁוּמָא שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ שֵׂעָר — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם. אֵין בָּהּ שֵׂעָר, גְּדוֹלָה הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם, קְטַנָּה אֵין זֶה מוּם. וְאֵיזוֹהִי גְּדוֹלָה? פֵּירֵשׁ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: עַד כְּאִיסָּר הָאִיטַלְקִי.
human_translation: What are the circumstances this mole? If it has hair in it, here and there, is disqualifying. If it does not have hair in it, If it is a large mole, here and there is disqualifying. If it is a small mole, here and there is not disqualifying, as it is taught A mole that has hair in it, this is a blemish. does not have a hair in it, large, this is a blemish. small, this is not a blemish. And what is large? Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel explained: As of an Italian issar ,
llm_translation: This thorn, how is it considered? If it has hair - here and here it renders it unfit. If it does not have hair, perhaps it is large - here and here it renders it unfit. If perhaps it is small - here and here it does not render it unfit, as it was taught: A thorn that has hair - this is a blemish. If it does not have hair, if it is large, this is a blemish; if it is small, this is not a blemish. And what is considered large? Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel explained: Until the size of an Italian issar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בְּעוֹמֶדֶת עַל פַּדַּחְתָּהּ. פַּדַּחְתָּהּ — רָאָה וְנִיפַּיַּיס הוּא! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּעוֹמֶדֶת לָהּ תַּחַת כִּפָּה שֶׁל רֹאשָׁהּ, וְזִימְנִין דְּמִתְחַזְיָא וְזִימְנִין דְּלָא מִתְחַזְיָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: that is positioned on her forehead. her forehead, it is seen and accepted. Rav Pappa said: that is positioned under cap of her head. Sometimes it is visible and sometimes it is not visible,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: "While standing at her threshold." Her threshold - he saw and was appeased! Rav Papa said: "While standing beneath her head-covering, sometimes she is seen and sometimes she is not seen."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הָא מִילְּתָא מִגַּבְרָא רַבָּה שְׁמִיעַ לִי, וּמַנּוּ — רַבִּי שֵׁילָא: נְשָׁכָהּ כֶּלֶב וְנַעֲשָׂה מְקוֹמוֹ צַלֶּקֶת — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: קוֹל עָבֶה בָּאִשָּׁה — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי קוֹלֵךְ עָרֵב וּמַרְאֵךְ נָאוֶה״. תָּנֵי רַבִּי נָתָן בִּירָאָה: בֵּין דַּדֵּי אִשָּׁה טֶפַח. סָבַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי לְמֵימַר טֶפַח לִמְעַלְּיוּתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: גַּבֵּי מוּמִין תַּנְיָא, וְכַמָּה? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שָׁלֹשׁ אֶצְבָּעוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: I heard this matter from a great man, and who was Rabbi Sheila a dog bit and the place developed into a scar, this is a blemish. Rav Ḥisda said: A deep voice in a woman, this is a blemish, as it is stated: “For your voice is sweet and your appearance pleasant” Rabbi Natan Bira’a taught: A handbreadth between a woman’s breasts. Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, thought to say before Rav Ashi a handbreadth is perfection Rav Ashi said to him: is taught with regard to blemishes, And how much Abaye said: three fingers.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: This matter, a great man told me, and who is it? — Rabbi Sheila: If a dog bit her and it became a scar, this is a blemish. Rav Ḥisda said: A thick voice in a woman is a blemish, as it is stated: "Your voice is sweet and your appearance is pleasant." Rabbi Natan taught with fear: Between a woman's breasts is a handbreadth. Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, thought before Rav Ashi to say a handbreadth for modesty. Rav Ashi said to him: Regarding blemishes, it is taught, and how much? Abaye said: Three fingerbreadths.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: כׇּל אִשָּׁה שֶׁדַּדֶּיהָ גַּסִּין מִשֶּׁל חַבְרוֹתֶיהָ — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם. וְכַמָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי מְיָישָׁא בַּר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: טֶפַח. וּמִי אִיכָּא כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא? אִין, דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: אֲנִי רָאִיתִי עַרְבִיָּא אַחַת שֶׁהִפְשִׁילָה דַּדֶּיהָ לַאֲחוֹרֶיהָ וְהֵנִיקָה אֶת בְּנָהּ.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Natan says: Any woman whose breasts are larger than those of other this is a blemish. And how much Rabbi Meyasha, son of the son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: a handbreadth And is there a case like this? Yes, as Rabba bar bar Ḥanna said: I saw a certain Arab woman who flung her breasts behind her and nursed her child.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Nathan says: Any woman whose breasts are larger than those of her companions - this is a blemish. And how much? Rabbi Meyasha, son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: A handbreadth. And is there such a case? No, for Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: I saw a certain Arab woman who threw her breasts behind her and nursed her son.

hebrew_text: ״וּלְצִיּוֹן יֵאָמַר אִישׁ וְאִישׁ יוּלַּד בָּהּ וְהוּא יְכוֹנְנֶהָ עֶלְיוֹן״. אָמַר רַבִּי מְיָישָׁא בַּר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: אֶחָד הַנּוֹלָד בָּהּ, וְאֶחָד הַמְצַפֶּה לִרְאוֹתָהּ. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וְחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ עֲדִיף כִּתְרֵי מִינַּן. אָמַר רָבָא: וְחַד מִינַּן כִּי סָלֵיק לְהָתָם — עֲדִיף כִּתְרֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ. דְּהָא רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה דְּכִי הֲוָה הָכָא לָא הֲוָה יָדַע מַאי קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן, כִּי סְלֵיק לְהָתָם, קָרֵי לַן ״בַּבְלָאֵי טַפְשָׁאֵי״.
human_translation: “And of Zion it shall be said, this man and this man were born in her, and the Most High shall establish her” Rabbi Meyasha, son of the son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, said: Both the born in and one who looks forward to seeing her Abaye said: And one of is superior to two of us, Rava said: And one of us when he ascends to is superior to two As Rabbi Yirmeya, when he was here, did not know what the Sages say. when he ascended there, he called us foolish Babylonians
llm_translation: "And for Zion it shall be said, 'Each and every one was born in her,' and He, the Most High, shall establish her." Rabbi Meyasha, son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, said: One who was born in her, and one who eagerly awaits to see her. Abaye said: And one of them is preferable over two of us. Rava said: And one of us, when he ascends there, is preferable over two of them. For Rabbi Yirmeya, when he was here, did not know what the Rabbis were saying, but when he ascended there, he called us 'Babylonian fools.'"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיוּ בָּהּ מוּמִין וְעוֹדָהּ בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ — הָאָב צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה שֶׁמִּשֶּׁנִּתְאָרְסָה הָיוּ בָּהּ מוּמִין הַלָּלוּ וְנִסְתַּחֲפָה שָׂדֵהוּ. נִכְנְסָה לִרְשׁוּת הַבַּעַל — הַבַּעַל צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה שֶׁעַד שֶׁלֹּא נִתְאָרְסָה הָיוּ בָּהּ מוּמִין אֵלּוּ, וְהָיָה מִקָּחוֹ מִקָּח טָעוּת. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּמוּמִין שֶׁבַּסֵּתֶר,
human_translation: she has blemishes and she is still in her father’s house, the father must bring proof that these blemishes appeared on her after she became betrothed, and his field was flooded, entered the husband’s domain the husband must bring proof that she had these blemishes before she was betrothed, and the transaction was a mistaken transaction. the statement of Rabbi Meir. But the Rabbis say: In what is this statement, said? With regard to hidden blemishes.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If there were blemishes in her and she was still in her father's house - the father must bring proof that when she was betrothed, these blemishes were present. If these blemishes became apparent after her field was enclosed, and she entered the domain of her husband - the husband must bring proof that until she was betrothed, these blemishes were not present, and his acquisition was an erroneous acquisition. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: In what case are these things said? In the case of hidden blemishes.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בְּמוּמִין שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִטְעוֹן. וְאִם יֵשׁ מֶרְחָץ בְּאוֹתָהּ הָעִיר — אַף מוּמִין שֶׁבַּסֵּתֶר אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִטְעוֹן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא בּוֹדְקָהּ בִּקְרוֹבוֹתָיו.
human_translation: But with regard to visible blemishes, he cannot claim And if there is a bathhouse in the city, even hidden blemishes he cannot claim, because he examines her through his female relatives.
llm_translation: But in blemishes that are visible, one cannot argue. And if there is a bathhouse in that city — even blemishes that are hidden cannot argue, because he inspects it in his close ones.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טַעְמָא דְּמַיְיתֵי הָאָב רְאָיָה, הָא לָא מַיְיתֵי הָאָב רְאָיָה — (הַ)בַּעַל מְהֵימַן. מַנִּי? רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא, דְּאָמַר: לָא מִפִּיהָ אָנוּ חַיִּין.
human_translation: The reason that the father brings proof, but if the father does not bring proof the husband is deemed credible whose It is Rabbi Yehoshua, who said we don’t live from, her mouth,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The taste of the water of the father is like the appearance, this is not like the appearance - (the) Baal Mehemann. Who is it? It is Rabbi Yehoshua, who said: "We do not live by her mouth."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: נִכְנְסָה לִרְשׁוּת הַבַּעַל — הַבַּעַל צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה. טַעְמָא דְּמַיְיתֵי הַבַּעַל רְאָיָה, הָא לָא מַיְיתֵי הַבַּעַל רְאָיָה — (הָ)אָב מְהֵימַן. אֲתָאן לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל דְּאָמַר נֶאֱמֶנֶת! אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: תַּבְרַהּ, מִי שֶׁשָּׁנָה זוֹ לֹא שָׁנָה זוֹ.
human_translation: say the latter clause entered the husband’s domain, the husband must bring proof. The reason is that the husband brings proof, but if the husband does not bring proof the father is deemed credible. We arrive at Rabban Gamliel, who said deemed credible Rabbi Elazar said: disjointed, who taught this did not teach that
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Eima seifa: Nichnasa lireshut habaal - habaal tzarich lehavi re'ayah. Tamah de'maitei habaal re'ayah, ha la maitei habaal re'ayah - (ha)av meheman. Atan l'raban Gamliel de'amar ne'emanet! Amar Rabbi Elazar: Tabrah, mi she'shana zo lo shana zo. English translation: Why the latter clause: If she entered the domain of her husband - the husband must bring proof. The reason that the husband brings proof is that if the husband brings proof, if the husband does not bring proof - the father is believed. They came to Rabban Gamliel who said: She is believed! Rabbi Elazar said: Let it be clear, one who changed this did not change this.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לָא תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לָא אָזֵיל בָּתַר חֲזָקָה דְגוּפָא כְּלָל, אֶלָּא: כִּי לָא אָזֵיל רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בָּתַר חֲזָקָה דְגוּפָא, הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא חֲזָקָה דְמָמוֹנָא.
human_translation: Rava said: Do not say Rabbi Yehoshua does not follow the presumptive status of the body at all, Rather, that Rabbi Yehoshua does not follow the presumptive status of the body when there is an monetary possession.
llm_translation: Rava said: Do not say that Rabbi Yehoshua did not go after the primary presumption of the body as a whole, rather, when Rabbi Yehoshua did not go after the primary presumption of the body, in a case where there is a presumption of money.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא חֲזָקָה דְמָמוֹנָא — אָזֵיל רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בָּתַר חֲזָקָה דְגוּפָא. דְּתַנְיָא: אִם בַּהֶרֶת קוֹדֵם לְשֵׂעָר לָבָן — טָמֵא, אִם שֵׂעָר לָבָן קוֹדֵם לַבַּהֶרֶת — טָהוֹר, סָפֵק — טָמֵא. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כֵּהָה. מַאי ״כֵּהָה״? אָמַר רַבָּה: ״כֵּהָה״ — טָהוֹר.
human_translation: But when there is no possession of money, Rabbi Yehoshua follow the presumptive status of the body. As it is taught If bright white spot preceded the white hair ritually impure; if the white hair preceded the bright white spot pure. uncertain impure. And Rabbi Yehoshua says: Dull. What is dull? Rabba said dull ritually pure,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But here where there is no presumption of money - Rabbi Yehoshua goes after the presumption of the body. As it was taught: If the white hair precedes the white spot - it is impure, if the white spot precedes the white hair - it is pure, in a doubtful case - it is impure. And Rabbi Yehoshua says: Light. What is "light"? Rabbah said: "Light" - pure.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: רֵישָׁא, כָּאן נִמְצְאוּ וְכָאן הָיוּ. סֵיפָא נָמֵי, כָּאן נִמְצְאוּ וְכָאן הָיוּ.
human_translation: Rava said first clause they were discovered here, they were here. latter clause as well, they were discovered here, they were here,
llm_translation: Rava said: The beginning, here they were found and here they were. The end, similarly, here they were found and here they were.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: נִכְנְסָה לִרְשׁוּת הַבַּעַל — הַבַּעַל צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה שֶׁעַד שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְאָרֵס הָיוּ בָּהּ מוּמִין אֵלּוּ, וְהָיָה מִקָּחוֹ מִקָּח טָעוּת. עַד שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְאָרֵס — אִין, מִשֶּׁתִּתְאָרֵס — לָא, וְאַמַּאי? לֵימָא: כָּאן נִמְצְאוּ וְכָאן הָיוּ!
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to entered the husband’s domain the husband must bring proof that she had these blemishes before she was betrothed, and his transaction was a mistaken transaction. before she was betrothed yes, from she was betrothed, not But why? let us say they were discovered here, they were here,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Abaye: If she entered the domain of her husband - the husband must bring proof that until she was betrothed, she had these blemishes, and if his acquisition was a mistaken acquisition. Until she is betrothed - no, once she is betrothed - yes, and why? Let us say: Here they were found, and here they were!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשֶּׁנִּתְאָרְסָה. מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר: חֲזָקָה אֵין אָדָם שׁוֹתֶה בְּכוֹס אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן בּוֹדְקוֹ. וְהַאי רָאָה וְנִיפַּיַּיס הוּא.
human_translation: said to him: from she was betrothed, Because it can be said a presumption a person does not drink from a cup unless he examines it. And this has seen and been appeased
llm_translation: He said to him: From when she becomes betrothed. Because there is to say: A woman is not considered to have drunk from a cup unless she inspects it. And this one saw and was pleased.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, עַד שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְאָרֵס נָמֵי! אֶלָּא אָמְרִינַן: חֲזָקָה אֵין אָדָם מִיפַּיֵּיס בְּמוּמִין. הָכָא נָמֵי, חֲזָקָה אֵין אָדָם מִיפַּיֵּיס בְּמוּמִין!
human_translation: If that is so, before she was betrothed, also Rather, we say presumption a person does not become appeased with regard to blemishes. Here too, presumption a person does not become appeased with regard to blemishes.
llm_translation: So it is, until you do not get engaged, Namai! Rather we say: Strong, a person does not appease with blemishes. Here, Namai, strong, a person does not appease with blemishes!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מִשֶּׁנִּתְאָרְסָה, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא תַּרְתֵּי: חֲזָקָה הַעֲמֵד הַגּוּף עַל חֶזְקָתוֹ, וַחֲזָקָה אֵין אָדָם שׁוֹתֶה בְּכוֹס אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן בּוֹדְקוֹ, וְהַאי רָאָה וְנִיפַּיַּיס הוּא. מַאי אָמְרַתְּ? חֲזָקָה אֵין אָדָם מִיפַּיֵּיס בְּמוּמִין — הָוֵי
human_translation: Rather, from she was betrothed, because there are two presumption Establish the body to its presumptive, status and presumption a person does not drink from a cup unless he examines it, and this has seen and been appeased. What do you say presumption a man does not become appeased with regard to blemishes? it is
llm_translation: Rather: from when she becomes betrothed, because there are two: strong the body stands on its strength, and strong no person drinks in a cup unless he examines it, and this is a case of seeing and being convinced. What do you say? Strong no person is convinced in blemishes - be.

hebrew_text: חֲדָא בִּמְקוֹם תַּרְתֵּי, וַחֲדָא בִּמְקוֹם תַּרְתֵּי לָא אָמְרִינַן. עַד שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְאָרֵס — הַעֲמֵד הַגּוּף עַל חֶזְקָתוֹ לָא אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר. מַאי אִיכָּא? חֲזָקָה דְּאֵין אָדָם שׁוֹתֶה בְּכוֹס אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן בּוֹדְקוֹ, וְהַאי רָאָה וְנִיפַּיַּיס הוּא — אַדְּרַבָּה: חֲזָקָה אֵין אָדָם מִיפַּיֵּיס בְּמוּמִין, וְהַעֲמֵד מָמוֹן עַל חֶזְקָתוֹ.
human_translation: one opposed by two And we do not say one opposed by two. before she was betrothed, we cannot say: Establish the body to its presumptive status, What is there presumption that a person does not drink from a cup unless he examines it, and this has seen and been appeased. On the contrary, presumption a person does not become appeased with regard to blemishes, and money is established to its presumptive status
llm_translation: One in the place of two, and one in the place of two we do not say. Until she is betrothed - the body is not established in its presumption, we cannot say. What is it that we cannot say? The presumption that a person does not drink from a cup unless he examines it, and this one saw and was convinced - on the contrary: the presumption is that a person does not get convinced by blemishes, and he established his money on his presumption.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: רֵישָׁא ״מָנֶה לְאַבָּא בְּיָדְךָ״, וְסֵיפָא ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said first clause father has one hundred dinars in your possession. And the latter clause I have one hundred dinars in your possession.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: The beginning, "Appoint for yourself," and the end, "Appoint for me."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַוְיָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּמוּמִין הָרְאוּיִין לָבֹא עִמָּהּ מִבֵּית אָבִיהָ, שֶׁעַל הָאָב לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה. וְאַמַּאי? ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״ הוּא!
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avya, raised an objection to Rav Ashi’s Rabbi Meir concedes with regard to blemishes that naturally come with her from her father’s house, that the father must bring proof But why It is I have one hundred dinars in your possession,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Rav Acha, son of Rav Avya, raised an objection to Rav Ashe: Rabbi Meir concedes regarding blemishes that are fit to come with her from her father's house, that it is the father's responsibility to provide proof. And why? "Appoint for me in your hand" it is!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בִּיתֶירֶת. יְתֶירֶת, מַאי רְאָיָה מַיְיתֵי? רְאָיָה דְּרָאָה וְנִיפַּיַּיס הוּא.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? With an additional an additional what proof bring proof that saw and he became appeased
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - with a surplus. What is the proof that a surplus is brought? It is the proof of seeing and being satisfied.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמַּחֲלִיף פָּרָה בַּחֲמוֹר, וּמָשַׁךְ בַּעַל הַחֲמוֹר אֶת הַפָּרָה, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק בַּעַל הַפָּרָה לִמְשׁוֹךְ אֶת הַחֲמוֹר עַד שֶׁמֵּת הַחֲמוֹר — עַל בַּעַל הַחֲמוֹר לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה שֶׁהָיָה חֲמוֹרוֹ קַיָּים בִּשְׁעַת מְשִׁיכַת פָּרָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: who exchanges a cow for a donkey, And the owner of the donkey pulled the cow, but before the owner of the cow could pull the donkey the donkey died. the owner of the donkey must bring proof that his donkey was alive at the time when the cow was pulled.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One who exchanges a cow for a donkey, and the owner of the donkey pulls the cow, and the owner of the cow did not manage to pull the donkey until the donkey died - it is upon the owner of the donkey to bring proof that his donkey was alive at the time of pulling the cow.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא תּוּנָא כַּלָּה. הֵי כַּלָּה? אִילֵּימָא
human_translation: And the tanna taught a bride. Which a bride If we say
llm_translation: "And it was taught: Tunna is like a bride. Is it like a bride? Perhaps..."

hebrew_text: כַּלָּה בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ, מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם — מַיְיתֵי אָב רְאָיָה וּמַפֵּיק, הָכָא — מַיְיתֵי בַּעַל הַחֲמוֹר רְאָיָה וּמוֹקֵים.
human_translation: a bride in her father’s house, is comparable? There, the father brings proof and takes here, the owner of the donkey brings proof and maintains
llm_translation: A bride in her father's house, who is comparable? There — the father brings in and sends out, here — the husband of the donkey brings in and establishes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: כַּלָּה בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ. וְאַכַּתִּי לָא דָּמֵי: הָתָם — בַּעַל מַיְיתֵי רְאָיָה וּמַרַע לֵיהּ לַחֲזָקֵיהּ דְּאָב, הָכָא — בַּעַל הַחֲמוֹר מַיְיתֵי רְאָיָה וּמוֹקֵים חֲזָקֵיהּ בִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said: a bride in her father-in-law’s house, And are still not comparable: There, the husband brings proof and undermines the presumption of the father, here, the owner of the donkey brings proof and maintains the presumptive status in his possession.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said: A bride in her father's house. And it is not comparable: there — the husband brings proof and establishes her status as a virgin, here — the husband brings proof and establishes her status with his own hands.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: כַּלָּה בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ, וּלְקִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: a bride in her father’s house, but with regard to betrothal,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: A bride in her father's house, and for betrothals.

hebrew_text: וְלָא תֵּימָא אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר קִדּוּשִׁין לָאו לְטִיבּוּעִין נִיתְּנוּ. אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר קִדּוּשִׁין לְטִיבּוּעִין נִיתְּנוּ — הָנֵי מִילֵּי קִידּוּשֵׁי וַדַּאי, אֲבָל קִידּוּשֵׁי טָעוּת, אִי מַיְיתֵי רְאָיָה — אִין, אִי לָא — לָא.
human_translation: And do not say according to the one who says betrothal was not given to be lost, Rather, even according to the one who says betrothal was given to be lost, this applies only a betrothal certain. But mistaken betrothal, if brings proof yes, if not not
llm_translation: And do not say, according to the opinion that says that betrothals are not for the purpose of marriage were given. Rather, even according to the opinion that says that betrothals are for the purpose of marriage were given - those matters of betrothals are certainly binding, but matters of mistaken betrothals, if evidence is brought - they are binding, if not - they are not.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מַחַט שֶׁנִּמְצֵאת בְּעוֹבִי בֵּית הַכּוֹסוֹת, מִצַּד אֶחָד — כְּשֵׁרָה. מִשְּׁנֵי צְדָדִין — טְרֵיפָה. נִמְצָא עָלֶיהָ קוֹרֶט דָּם — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁהוּא לִפְנֵי שְׁחִיטָה, לֹא נִמְצָא עָלֶיהָ קוֹרֶט דָּם — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁהוּא לְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה.
human_translation: raises an objection a needle that is found in the thick wall of second stomach, from one side, kosher. from both sides, an animal with a condition that will cause it to die within twelve months tereifa a drop of blood is found on top of it is certain that before slaughtering no drop of blood is found on it, it is certain that it after slaughtering,
llm_translation: Challenger: A needle found in the thickness of the walls of the intestines, on one side - it is valid. On both sides - it is treif. If there is blood found on it - it is known that it was there before slaughter. If there is no blood found on it - it is known that it was there after slaughter.

hebrew_text: הוּגְלַד פִּי הַמַּכָּה — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁשְּׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה. לֹא הוּגְלַד פִּי הַמַּכָּה — הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה. וְאִי יְהַיב טַבָּח דְּמֵי — בָּעֵי לְאֵיתוֹיֵי רְאָיָה וּמַפֵּיק.
human_translation: a scab appeared over the wound it is certain that three days before slaughtering. a scab did not appear over the wound, the burden of proof rests upon the claimant. And if butcher had given the money, he needs to bring proof and take
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Huglad pi hamakha — beyadua she'sheloshah yamim kodem shchitah. Lo huglad pi hamakha — hamotzi me'chaveiro alav har'ayah. Ve'i yehav tabach demei — ba'ei le'etoyei re'ayah umapeik." English translation: "If the windpipe of the animal was uncovered — it is known that it was within three days before slaughter. If the windpipe of the animal was not uncovered — the burden of proof is upon the one who brings the claim against his fellow. And if one gives the butcher the money — he requires to bring proof and then he can take it."

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? בַּעַל בְּהֵמָה לַיְיתֵי רְאָיָה וְנוֹקֵים?
human_translation: But why Let owner of the animal, bring proof and establish
llm_translation: And why? A ba'al behemah should bring a ra'ayah and be acquitted?

hebrew_text: בִּדְלָא יְהַיב טַבָּחָא דָּמֵי. מַאי פַּסְקָא?
human_translation: where the butcher had not given money, Why without qualification?
llm_translation: He did not give the fee of the slaughterer. What is the ruling?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּי אֲתָא רָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל, אָמַר: לָא תְּצִייתִינְהוּ לְהָנֵי כְּלָלֵי דְּכָיֵיל יְהוּדָה אַחִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל. הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כֹּל שֶׁנּוֹלַד סָפֵק בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה. וְתַנָּא תּוּנָא כַּלָּה.
human_translation: Rather, when Rami bar Yeḥezkel came, he said: Pay no attention to those rules formulated by my brother Yehuda in the name of Shmuel. this is Shmuel said: whosesoever’s domain the uncertainty came into being, the burden of proof rests upon him. And the tanna taught a bride.
llm_translation: Rather, when Ramei, son of Yehezkel, came, he said: "I did not give them over to those members of the assembly of the school of Yehudah, my brother, whose name is Shmuel." So said Shmuel: "Anyone born with doubt, the responsibility is upon him." And a Baraita taught like the statement of a bride.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מַחַט שֶׁנִּמְצֵאת בְּעוֹבִי בֵּית הַכּוֹסוֹת כּוּ׳, וְאִי דְּלָא יְהַיב טַבָּח דָּמֵי — בַּעַל בְּהֵמָה בָּעֵי לְאֵיתוֹיֵי רְאָיָה וּמַפֵּיק, וְאַמַּאי? סְפֵיקָא בִּרְשׁוּת טַבָּח אִיתְיְילִיד!
human_translation: raises an objection: A needle that is found in the thick wall of second stomach… And if butcher had not given the money, owner of the animal needs to bring proof, and take But why? The uncertainty was formed in butcher’s possession.
llm_translation: Challenger: A needle found in the thickness of the wall of the cupbearer's house is pure, and if it is not given the appearance of blood - the owner of the animal needs to bring proof and then he can take it out. And why? It is a doubt in the domain of the butcher, a doubt is resolved in favor of the butcher!

hebrew_text: דִּיהַיב טַבָּח דְּמֵי. וּמַאי פַּסְקָא? סְתָמָא דְמִילְּתָא, כַּמָּה דְּלָא יָהֵיב אִינִישׁ זוּזֵי — לָא יָהֵיב אִינִישׁ חֵיוְתָא.
human_translation: where the butcher had given the money. But why without qualification? The ordinary situation as long as a person has not given money, person will not give the animal.
llm_translation: He gave the money to the butcher. And what is the ruling? Perhaps it is a common matter, as much as a person does not give coins — he does not give livestock.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּמוּמִין שֶׁבַּסֵּתֶר. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן:
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: In what is this statement said? With regard to hidden blemishes. Rav Naḥman said:
llm_translation: The Sages say: In what case are these words spoken? In the case of blemishes that are hidden. Rav Nachman said:

hebrew_text: וְנִכְפֶּה — כְּמוּמִין שֶׁבַּסֵּתֶר דָּמֵי. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי דִּקְבִיעַ לֵיהּ זְמַן, אֲבָל לָא קְבִיעַ לֵיהּ — כְּמוּמִין שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And an epileptic is considered like a hidden blemish, And this applies if at regular intervals, But not at regular is considered like a visible blemish,
llm_translation: "And he shall be fined" - like blemishes that are in hidden places, the value of the fixed time, but not the value of the unfixed time - like blemishes that are in open places.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאִישׁ שֶׁנּוֹלְדוּ בּוֹ מוּמִין — אֵין כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ לְהוֹצִיא. אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּמוּמִין הַקְּטַנִּים, אֲבָל בְּמוּמִין הַגְּדוֹלִים — כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ לְהוֹצִיא.
human_translation: a man who developed blemishes does not force him to divorce Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what is this statement said? with regard to minor blemishes. However, with regard to major blemishes, does force him to divorce
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A man in whom blemishes were born - we do not compel him to divorce. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what case are these words said? In the case of minor blemishes, but in the case of major blemishes - we compel him to divorce.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רַב יְהוּדָה תָּנֵי נוֹלְדוּ. חִיָּיא בַּר רַב תָּנֵי הָיוּ. מַאן דְּאָמַר נוֹלְדוּ, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן הָיוּ — (דְּקָסָבְרָה) [דְּהָא סְבַרָה] וְקַבִּילָה. מַאן דְּאָמַר הָיוּ, אֲבָל נוֹלְדוּ — לֹא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda teaches developed Ḥiyya bar Rav teaches: had The one who says developed all the more so had as she was aware and accepted the one who says had but they developed not
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah taught: They were born. Hiyya bar Rav taught: They were. One who says they were born, certainly they were - (for he holds) since he holds and accepted. One who says they were, but they were not born - no.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּמוּמִין קְטַנִּים, אֲבָל בְּמוּמִין גְּדוֹלִים — כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ לְהוֹצִיא. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״נוֹלְדוּ״, הַיְינוּ דְּשָׁאנֵי בֵּין גְּדוֹלִים לִקְטַנִּים. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״הָיוּ״ — מָה לִי גְּדוֹלִים מָה לִי קְטַנִּים? הָא סְבַרָה וְקַבִּילָה!
human_translation: We learned Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what is this statement said? with regard to minor blemishes, but with regard to major blemishes forces him to divorce Granted, according to the one who says Developed this is that there is a difference between major and minor But according to the one who says Had what to me major what to me minor she was aware and accepted
llm_translation: We learned: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what case are these words said? — In the case of minor blemishes, but in the case of major blemishes, we force him to pay. Granted according to the one who says "they were born," that is where the difference lies between major and minor blemishes. But according to the one who says "they were," what difference does it make to me whether they are major or minor? This is logical and accepted!

hebrew_text: כִּסְבוּרָה הִיא שֶׁיְּכוֹלָה לְקַבֵּל, וְעַכְשָׁיו אֵין יְכוֹלָה לְקַבֵּל. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן מוּמִין גְּדוֹלִים? פֵּירֵשׁ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: [כְּגוֹן] נִיסְמֵית עֵינוֹ, נִקְטְעָה יָדוֹ, וְנִשְׁבְּרָה רַגְלוֹ.
human_translation: that she thought that she could accept but now cannot accept And what are major blemishes Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel explained: For example, his eye was blinded, his hand cut off, or his leg broken.
llm_translation: It is thought that she could conceive, but now she cannot conceive. And what are considered major blemishes? Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel explained: For example if her eye was removed, her hand was cut off, or her leg was broken.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר, רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Abba bar Yaakov Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. Rava Rav Naḥman said: The halakha is in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Abba bar Yaakov said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The halakha is according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. Rava said in the name of Rav Nachman: The halakha is according to the words of the Sages.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי? וְהָא אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁשָּׁנָה רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּמִשְׁנָתֵנוּ — הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ, חוּץ מֵעָרֵב, וְצַיְדָן, וּרְאָיָה אַחֲרוֹנָה. אָמוֹרָאֵי נִינְהוּ וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: And did Rabbi Yoḥanan say so, But Rabba bar bar Ḥanna said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Wherever Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel taught in our Mishna, the halakha is in accordance with him, apart from a guarantor Sidon latter evidence They are amora’im , and with regard to of Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said thus, Rabbi Yochanan? But didn't Rabbah bar bar Chanah say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: In every place that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel changed in our Mishnah - the halacha is like his opinion, except for Erev, Tzaidan, and the last sighting. These are the words of the Amoraim and the statement of Rabbi Yochanan."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁכּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ לְהוֹצִיא: מוּכֵּה שְׁחִין, וּבַעַל פּוֹלִיפּוּס, וְהַמְקַמֵּץ, וְהַמְצָרֵף נְחוֹשֶׁת, וְהַבּוּרְסִי. בֵּין שֶׁהָיוּ עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִישְּׂאוּ, וּבֵין מִשֶּׁנִּישְּׂאוּ נוֹלְדוּ. וְעַל כּוּלָּן אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהִתְנָה עִמָּהּ, יְכוֹלָה הִיא שֶׁתֹּאמַר: ״סְבוּרָה הָיִיתִי שֶׁאֲנִי יְכוֹלָה לְקַבֵּל, וְעַכְשָׁיו אֵינִי יְכוֹלָה לְקַבֵּל״.
human_translation: And these for which forces him to divorce afflicted with boils; or one who has a polyp; or one who a gatherer, or one who a melder of copper, or one who a tanner Whether had before they married, or whether they developed after they married, And with regard to all of these, Rabbi Meir said: Even though he stipulated with her she can say: I thought I could accept but now I cannot accept
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are the cases where a woman can be compelled to undergo halitzah: one who strikes a boil, a man with polypus, a coppersmith, a brass refiner, and a bursi. Whether they were betrothed but not yet married, or after they were married, their children are considered legitimate. And regarding all of them, Rabbi Meir said: Even though he stipulated with her, she can still say, "I thought I could accept, but now I cannot accept."

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מְקַבֶּלֶת הִיא עַל כׇּרְחָהּ, חוּץ מִמּוּכֵּה שְׁחִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמְּמִקָּתוֹ. מַעֲשֶׂה בְּצַיְדוֹן בְּבוּרְסִי אֶחָד שֶׁמֵּת, וְהָיָה לוֹ אָח בּוּרְסִי. אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: יְכוֹלָה הִיא שֶׁתֹּאמַר ״לְאָחִיךָ הָיִיתִי יְכוֹלָה לְקַבֵּל, וּלְךָ אֵינִי יְכוֹלָה לְקַבֵּל״.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: she must accept it against her will, apart from afflicted with boils. because consumes An incident in Sidon involving a certain tanner who died and he had a brother a tanner. The Sages said: She can say: I could accept for your brother but I cannot accept it for you,
llm_translation: The sages say: A woman is betrothed against her will, except in the case of a skin disease, due to his repulsion. There was an incident in Tzaidon with a certain man named Bursi who died, and he had a brother named Bursi. The sages said: It is possible for her to say, "I could have accepted for your brother, but I cannot accept for you."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״בַּעַל פּוֹלִיפּוּס״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: רֵיחַ הַחוֹטֶם. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: רֵיחַ הַפֶּה. רַב אַסִּי מַתְנִי אִיפְּכָא. וּמַנַּח בַּהּ סִימָנָא: שְׁמוּאֵל לָא פָּסֵיק פּוּמֵּיהּ מִכּוּלֵּיהּ פִּירְקִין.
human_translation: What is one who has a polyp? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: a odor of the nose. It was taught in a baraita : a odor of the mouth. Rav Asi teaches the reverse, And he provided a mnemonic for Shmuel did not close his mouth from our entire chapter,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is "Ba'al Polipus"? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The smell of the nostril. In the Mishnah it was taught: The smell of the mouth. Rav Assi reconciled the two opinions. And he placed a mnemonic on it: Shmuel did not cease from all his interpretations.

hebrew_text: וְהַמְקַמֵּץ. מַאי ״מְקַמֵּץ״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: זֶה הַמְקַבֵּץ צוֹאַת כְּלָבִים. מֵיתִיבִי: ״מְקַמֵּץ״ זֶה בּוּרְסִי! וּלְטַעְמָיךְ תִּיקְשֵׁי לָךְ מַתְנִיתִין: ״הַמְקַמֵּץ וְהַמְצָרֵף נְחוֹשֶׁת וְהַבּוּרְסִי״!
human_translation: Or one who a gatherer. What is a gatherer? Rav Yehuda said: This one who gathers dog excrement raises an objection A gatherer, this a tanner. And according to your reasoning, the mishna should present a difficulty for you, One who a gatherer, or one who a melder of copper, or one who a tanner
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "And the one who gathers. What is 'gathers'? Rav Yehudah said: This is one who gathers the excrement of dogs. It was objected: 'Gathers' refers to a bursi! And according to your reasoning, reconcile this with the Mishnah: 'The one who gathers and the one who refines copper and the bursi'!"

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מַתְנִיתִין לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּבוּרְסִי גָּדוֹל, כָּאן בְּבוּרְסִי קָטָן. אֶלָּא לְרַב יְהוּדָה קַשְׁיָא! תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״מְקַמֵּץ״ זֶה בּוּרְסִי, וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: זֶה הַמְקַמֵּץ צוֹאַת כְּלָבִים.
human_translation: Granted, the mishna not difficult, here, to a large tanner, there, of a tanner. But according to Rav Yehuda it is difficult. It is tanna’im , as it is taught A gatherer, this a tanner, and some say: This one who gathers dog excrement.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In truth, the Mishnah is not difficult: here in Bursi Gadol, here in Bursi Katan. Rather, it is difficult for Rav Yehudah! It is a teaching, as it was taught: "Mekametz" - this is Bursi, and some say: this is the one who gathers the droppings of dogs.

hebrew_text: וְהַמְצָרֵף נְחוֹשֶׁת וְהַבּוּרְסִי. מַאי ״מְצָרֵף נְחוֹשֶׁת״? רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: חָשְׁלֵי דּוּדֵי. רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר: זֶה הַמְחַתֵּךְ נְחוֹשֶׁת מֵעִיקָּרוֹ. תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: אֵיזֶהוּ ״מְצָרֵף״? זֶה הַמְחַתֵּךְ נְחוֹשֶׁת מֵעִיקָּרוֹ.
human_translation: And a coppersmith and a tanner. What is a coppersmith? Rav Ashi said: A kettle smith, Rabba bar bar Ḥanna said: This is one who hews copper from its source is taught in accordance with Rabba bar bar Ḥanna: Who is a coppersmith? This is one who hews copper from its source.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And the one who refines copper and the bursi. What is 'refining copper'? Rav Ashi said: the dross of the crucible. Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said: this is one who cuts copper from its source. It was taught in a baraita in accordance with the opinion of Rabbah bar bar Ḥana: What is 'refining'? This is one who cuts copper from its source."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: הָאוֹמֵר ״אֵינִי זָן וְאֵינִי מְפַרְנֵס״ — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. אֲזַל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אַמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל. אָמַר: אַכְּסוּהּ שְׂעָרֵי לְאֶלְעָזָר. עַד שֶׁכּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ לְהוֹצִיא — יִכְפּוּהוּ לָזוּן.
human_translation: Rav said: who says: I will not sustain and I will not provide a livelihood must divorce and give her marriage contract. Rabbi Elazar went recited halakha before Shmuel. said: Feed [ akhsuha ] barley, to Elazar. rather than forcing him to divorce to force him to sustain
llm_translation: Rav said: One who says, "I will not provide sustenance and I will not support," he shall be compelled and made to give a written undertaking. Rabbi Elazar went to the study hall before Shmuel and said: "Cover his hair for Elazar." Until they compel him to provide, they shall compel him to support.

hebrew_text: וְרַב: אֵין אָדָם דָּר עִם נָחָשׁ בִּכְפִיפָה. כִּי סְלֵיק רַבִּי זֵירָא, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַבִּי בִּנְיָמִין בַּר יֶפֶת דְּיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר לַהּ, מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַל דָּא אַכְּסוּהּ שְׂעָרִין לְאֶלְעָזָר בְּבָבֶל.
human_translation: And Rav a person does not reside in a basket, with a snake. When Rabbi Zeira ascended he found Rabbi Binyamin bar Yefet sitting and reciting in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan. He said to him: On account of this they fed Elazar with barley in Babylonia.
llm_translation: Rav said: A person should not live with a snake in the same basket. When Rabbi Zeira ascended, he found Rabbi Benjamin bar Yefet sitting and saying to him, in the name of Rabbi Yochanan. He said to him: Because of this, Elazar was buried in Babylon.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: אֵין מְעַשִּׂין אֶלָּא לִפְסוּלוֹת. כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אֲמַר: כְּגוֹן אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, וּגְרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, מַמְזֶרֶת וּנְתִינָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְנָתִין וּלְמַמְזֵר. אֲבָל נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה וְשָׁהָה עִמָּהּ עֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים וְלֹא יָלְדָה — אֵין כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav Asi said: forces only to unfit When I recited this before Shmuel, he said: for example, a widow to a High Priest, a divorcée or a yevama who underwent ḥalitza [ ḥalutza ] to a common priest, a daughter born from an incestuous or adulterous relationship [ mamzeret ], or a Gibeonite woman to an Israelite, a daughter of an Israelite to a Gibeonite or to a mamzer . But married a woman and stayed with her ten years and she did not give birth, does not force him
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav Assi: We only act regarding disqualifications. For when Shmuel said it, he said: For example, a widow to a High Priest, a divorced woman and a halutzah to an ordinary priest, a mamzeret and a netinah to an Israelite, a daughter of an Israelite to a netin and to a mamzer. But if a man married a woman and stayed with her for ten years and she did not bear children - we do not compel him.

hebrew_text: וְרַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר אֲבִימִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֲפִילּוּ נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה וְשָׁהָה עִמָּהּ עֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים וְלֹא יָלְדָה — כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ. תְּנַן, אֵלּוּ שֶׁכּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ לְהוֹצִיא: מוּכֵּה שְׁחִין וּבַעַל פּוֹלִיפּוּס. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב אַסִּי: דְּרַבָּנַן קָתָנֵי, דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא קָתָנֵי. אֶלָּא לְרַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר אֲבִימִי, לִיתְנֵי נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה וְשָׁהָה עִמָּהּ עֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים וְלֹא יָלְדָה — כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: And Rav Taḥalifa bar Avimi Shmuel said: Even married a woman and stayed with her ten years and she did not give birth, forces him We learned And these are for forces him to divorce afflicted with boils or one who has a polyp. Granted, according to Rav Asi, by rabbinic are taught by Torah are not taught. However, according to Rav Taḥalifa bar Avimi, let teach married a woman and stayed with her ten years and she did not give birth, forces him
llm_translation: Rav Taḥlifa bar Avimi said in the name of Shmuel: Even if a man married a woman and lived with her for ten years without bearing children - he is compelled to divorce her. We learned: These are the cases where he is compelled to divorce her: one who strikes a boil and one who has polypus. According to Rav Assi, it is well understood, for the Rabbis taught, and they did not teach it as a biblical law. But according to Rav Taḥlifa bar Avimi, it should be taught: if a man married a woman and lived with her for ten years without bearing children - he is compelled to divorce her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּמִילֵּי, הָא בְּשׁוֹטֵי. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא: ״בִּדְבָרִים לֹא יִוָּסֶר עָבֶד״! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: הָא וְהָא בְּשׁוֹטֵי,
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: not difficult, this by verbal that by rods. Rabbi Abba strongly objects to this: “A servant will not be corrected by words” Rather, Rabbi Abba said: this and that by rods,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, not difficult: here in matters of circumcision, here in matters of lashes. Rabbi Abba objected to him: "By words a servant will not be corrected"! Rather, Rabbi Abba said: here and here in matters of lashes.

hebrew_text: הָתָם, כִּי אָמְרָה ״הָוְיָנָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ״ — שָׁבְקִינַן לַהּ. הָכָא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאָמְרָה ״הָוְיָנָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ״ — לָא שָׁבְקִינַן לַהּ. וַהֲרֵי מוּכֵּה שְׁחִין, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דַּאֲמָרָהּ ״הָוְיָנָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ״ — לָא שָׁבְקִינַן לַהּ. דִּתְנַן: חוּץ מִמּוּכֵּה שְׁחִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמְּמִקָּתוֹ וְקָתָנֵי!
human_translation: there, if she says: I to be with him, we leave her here, even though she says: I to be with him, we do not leave her But afflicted with boils, where even though she says: I to be with him, we do not leave her As we learned Apart from afflicted with boils, because consumes And is taught
llm_translation: There, when she said "have it in his hand" - we left it for her. Here, even though she said "have it in his hand" - we did not leave it for her. And there is the case of one who strikes a boil, where even though she said "have it in his hand" - we did not leave it for her. As we learned: Except for one who strikes a boil, because it is from his wound and it is disgusting!

hebrew_text: הָתָם כִּי אָמְרָה ״דָּיְירָנָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ בְּסָהֲדֵי״ — שָׁבְקִינַן לַהּ. הָכָא אַף עַל גַּב דְּאָמְרָה ״דָּיְירָנָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ בְּסָהֲדֵי״ — לָא שָׁבְקִינַן לַהּ.
human_translation: there, if she says: I live with him of witnesses; we leave her here, even though she says: I live with him of witnesses, we do not leave her
llm_translation: There, when she said, "Dainana bahadei besahadei" - we left her. Here, even though she said, "Dainana bahadei besahadei" - we did not leave her.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: שָׂח לִי זָקֵן אֶחָד מֵאַנְשֵׁי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם: עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה מוּכֵּי שְׁחִין הֵן, וְכוּלָּן אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים תַּשְׁמִישׁ קָשֶׁה לָהֶן, וּבַעֲלֵי רָאתָן קָשֶׁה מִכּוּלָּן. מִמַּאי הָוֵי? דְּתַנְיָא: הִקִּיז דָּם וְשִׁימֵּשׁ — הָוַיִין לוֹ בָּנִים וִיתִיקִין. הַקִּיזוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם וְשִׁימְּשׁוּ — הָוַיִין לוֹ בָּנִים בַּעֲלֵי רָאתָן. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא טָעֵים מִידֵּי, אֲבָל טָעֵים מִידֵּי — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yosei said: A certain Elder from the residents of Jerusalem told me are twenty-four afflicted with boils, and all of them the Sages said sexual relations are harmful to them, and afflicted with ra’atan , are harmed than all of the From where come about? As it is taught who let blood and engaged in sexual relations will have weak vitaykin children. both of them let blood and engaged in sexual relations, he will have children afflicted with ra’atan . Rav Pappa said We said only if he did not taste anything but he tasted something we have no with it,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei said: I have heard from an elder of the people of Jerusalem: twenty-four types of boils there are, and all the sages said that sexual intercourse is difficult for them, and for those with a rash, it is more difficult than all of them. From where is this derived? For it was taught: If he sprinkled blood and waited, he will have sons and scholars. If they both sprinkled and waited, he will have sons who are scholars. Rav Papa said: We only said this for those who are not affected by it, but for those who are affected by it, we have nothing to say about it.

hebrew_text: מַאי סִימָנֵיהּ? דָּלְפָן עֵינֵיהּ, וְדָיְיבִי נְחִירֵיהּ, וְאָיתֵי לֵיהּ רִירָא מִפּוּמֵּיהּ, וּרְמוּ דִּידְבֵי עִילָּוֵיהּ. וּמַאי אָסוּתֵיהּ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: פִּילָא, וְלוּדָנָא, גִּירְדָּא דֶאֱגוֹזָא, וְגִירְדָּא דְּאַשְׁפָּא, וּכְלִיל מַלְכָּא, וּמְתַחְלָא דְּדִיקְלָא סוּמָּקָא. וְשָׁלֵיק לְהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, וּמְעַיֵּיל לֵיהּ לְבֵיתָא דְשֵׁישָׁא. וְאִי לָא אִיכָּא בֵּיתָא דְשֵׁישָׁא — מְעַיֵּיל לֵיהּ לְבֵיתָא דְּשַׁב לִבְנֵי וַאֲרִיחָא,
human_translation: What are the symptoms His eyes water, his nose runs, drool comes out of his mouth, and flies rest upon him. And what is his cure Abaye said: pila and ladanum lodana and the ground shell of a nut; and shavings of smoothed hides; and artemisia [ kelil malka ]; and the calyx of a red date palm. And cooks them together and brings into a marble house, And if there is no marble house brings into a house of seven bricks and small brick.
llm_translation: What is its sign? It drips its eyes, and its nostrils are wide, and bile comes out of its mouth, and its excrement is round. And what is its remedy? Abaye said: pepper, and resin, a nutmeg, and a walnut, and royal lily, and the red part of a palm tree. And he should roast them on coals of myrtle wood, and bring him to a house of marble. And if there is no house of marble - bring him to a house of white bricks and plaster.

hebrew_text: וְנָטֵיל לֵיהּ תְּלָת מְאָה כָּסֵי עַל רֵישֵׁיהּ, עַד דְּרָפְיָא אַרְעִיתָא דְמוֹחֵיהּ, וְקָרַע לְמוֹחֵיהּ וּמַיְיתֵי אַרְבַּע טַרְפֵי דְאָסָא וּמַדְלֵי כֹּל חַד כַּרְעָא וּמוֹתֵיב חַד, וְשָׁקֵיל בִּצְבָתָא וְקָלֵי לֵיהּ. דְּאִי לָא — הָדַר עִילָּוֵיהּ.
human_translation: And pours three hundred cups on head until his skull is soft, and tears to his brain, and brings four myrtle leaves and lifts up each one foot and places one and takes with tweezers. And burns because if not will return to him.
llm_translation: And we place upon his head three hundred silver coins, until the earth of his brain is softened, and he tears his brain and brings four pieces of the size of a lentil and removes each one separately and places one, and takes a nail and pierces it and hangs it. And if not - he repeats the process.

hebrew_text: מַכְרִיז רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הִזָּהֲרוּ מִזְּבוּבֵי (שֶׁל) בַּעֲלֵי רָאתָן. רַבִּי זֵירָא לָא הֲוָה יָתֵיב בְּזִיקֵיהּ. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לָא עָיֵיל בְּאֻהְלֵיהּ. רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי לָא הֲווֹ אָכְלִי מִבֵּיעֵי דְּהָהִיא מְבוֹאָה. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי מִיכְרָךְ בְּהוּ וְעָסֵיק בַּתּוֹרָה. אָמַר: ״אַיֶּלֶת אֲהָבִים וְיַעֲלַת חֵן״, אִם חֵן מַעֲלָה עַל לוֹמְדֶיהָ, אַגּוֹנֵי לָא מַגְּנָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan announce: Be careful of the flies on those afflicted with ra’atan , Rabbi Zeira would not sit wind Rabbi Elazar would not enter tent Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi would not eat eggs from an alley Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi attach himself them and study Torah, saying a loving hind and a graceful doe” If bestows grace on those who learn it, it not protect
llm_translation: Announcement Rabbi Yochanan: Be cautious of the flies of the owners of Ra'atan. Rabbi Zeira did not sit in his own courtyard. Rabbi Elazar did not enter his tents. Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi did not eat from the entrance of that alleyway. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi would inspect it and engage in Torah. He said: "A lovely deer and a graceful doe," if grace elevates its students, the thorns do not shield them?

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה שָׁכֵיב, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְמַלְאַךְ הַמָּוֶת: זִיל, עֲבֵיד לֵיהּ רְעוּתֵיהּ. אֲזַל אִיתְחֲזִי לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַחְוִי לִי דּוּכְתַּאי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְחַיֵּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לִי סַכִּינָךְ, דִּלְמָא מְבַעֲתַתְּ לִי בְּאוֹרְחָא. יַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. כִּי מְטָא לְהָתָם דַּלְיַיהּ, קָא מַחְוֵי לֵיהּ. שְׁוַור נְפַל לְהָהוּא גִּיסָא.
human_translation: When was dying, they said to the Angel of Death: Go perform his bidding, went appeared to him. said to him: Show me my place He said to him: Very well. said to him: Give me your knife lest you frighten me on the way. He gave it to him. When he arrived there, he lifted he showed it to him. jumped fell into that side,
llm_translation: When he was lying down, they said to the Angel of Death: "Go, do your will." He went and appeared to him. He said to him: "Give me my knife." He said to him: "By your life." He said to him: "Bring me your knife, lest you frighten me on the way." He gave it to him. When he arrived there, his jug fell, and he was delayed. A bull came and butted that jug.

hebrew_text: נַקְטֵיהּ בְּקַרְנָא דִגְלִימֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בִּשְׁבוּעֲתָא דְּלָא אָתֵינָא. אֲמַר קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא: אִי אִיתְּשִׁיל אַשְּׁבוּעֲתָא — נֶיהְדַּר. אִי לָא — לָא נֶיהְדַּר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לִי סַכִּינַאי. לָא הֲוָה קָא יָהֵיב לֵיהּ. נְפַקָא בַּת קָלָא וַאֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: הַב נִיהֲלֵיהּ, דְּמִיתַּבְעָא לְבִרְיָיתָא. מַכְרִיז אֵלִיָּהוּ קַמֵּיהּ: פַּנּוּ מָקוֹם לְבַר לֵיוַאי! פַּנּוּ מָקוֹם לְבַר לֵיוַאי!
human_translation: grabbed him by the corner of his cloak. said to him: I swear that I will not come The Holy One, blessed be He, said: If he requested concerning an oath he must return If not not return. said to him: give me my knife did not give to him, A Divine Voice emerged and said to him: Give to him, as is necessary to the created Elijah announced before him: Make way for the son of Levi, make way for the son of Levi.
llm_translation: He took it by the horn of his garment. He said to him: In the week that I am not coming. The Holy One, blessed be He, said: If he will fulfill the week - he will be honored. If not - he will not be honored. He said to him: Bring me my knife. He was not giving it to him. A heavenly voice came out and said to him: Bring it back, for it is needed for creation. Elijah proclaimed before him: Make way for the son of Levi! Make way for the son of Levi!

hebrew_text: אֲזַל, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי דַּהֲוָה יָתֵיב עַל תְּלָת עֲשַׂר תַּכְטָקֵי פִּיזָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתְּ הוּא בַּר לֵיוַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֵן. נִרְאֲתָה קֶשֶׁת בְּיָמֶיךָ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֵן. אִם כֵּן, אִי אַתָּה בַּר לֵיוַאי. וְלָא הִיא, דְּלָא הֲוַאי מִידֵּי. אֶלָּא סָבַר: לָא אַחְזֵיק טֵיבוּתָא לְנַפְשַׁאי.
human_translation: went found Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai sitting on thirteen golden stools [ takhtekei ]. said to him: Are you the son of Levi? He said to him: Yes. a rainbow seen in your days? He said: Yes. If so, you are not the son of Levi, And that is not so, for there was no at all but thought: I do not want to take credit for myself
llm_translation: He went and found Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai who was sitting on thirteen cushions of gold. He said to him: Are you the son of Levi? He said to him: Yes. Has a rainbow appeared in your days? He said to him: Yes. If so, you are not the son of Levi. But it is not so, for it did not come immediately. Rather, he thought: I will not hold goodness for myself.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא שׁוֹשְׁבִינֵיהּ הֲוָה. כִּי הֲוָה קָא נָיְחָא נַפְשֵׁיהּ, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְמַלְאַךְ הַמָּוֶת: זִיל עָבֵיד לֵיהּ רְעוּתֵיהּ. אֲזַל לְגַבֵּיהּ וְאִיתְחֲזִי לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שִׁבְקַי תְּלָתִין יוֹם עַד דְּנַהְדַּר תַּלְמוּדַאי. דְּאָמְרִי: אַשְׁרֵי מִי שֶׁבָּא לְכָאן וְתַלְמוּדוֹ בְּיָדוֹ. שַׁבְקֵיהּ, לְבָתַר תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין אֲזַל אִיתְחֲזִי לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַחְוִי לִי דּוּכְתַּאי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְחַיֵּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לִי סַכִּינָךְ דִּלְמָא מְבַעֲתַתְּ לִי בְּאוֹרְחָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּחַבְרָךְ בָּעֵית לְמִיעְבַּד לִי?
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa was a friend When was dying, they said to the Angel of Death: Go perform his bidding. He went before him and appeared to him. He said to Leave me thirty days until I have reviewed my studies, for they say: Happy is he who comes here, with his learning in his hand. He left him, after thirty days he went appeared to him. He said to Show me my place He said to him: Very well. said to him: Give me your knife, lest you frighten me on the way. said to him: you wish to do to me as your friend
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Papa was sitting and dozing off. When he was dozing off, they said to the Angel of Death: Go do his will. He went over to him and appeared to him. He said to him: Wait thirty days until my studies are completed. As they say: Fortunate is he who comes here with his studies in his hand. He waited, and after thirty days, he went and appeared to him. He said to him: Have you come for me? He said to him: Yes. He said to him: Give me your knife, perhaps it will frighten me on the way. He said to him: Like your friend, do you want me to be in distress?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִי סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה וַחֲזִי מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ דְּלָא קַיֵּימְתֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי אִיכָּרַכְתְּ בְּבַעֲלֵי רָאתָן וְאִיעֲסֵקְתְּ בַּתּוֹרָה? וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ אַפְסֵיק לֵיהּ עַמּוּדָא דְנוּרָא בֵּין דִּידֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא. וּגְמִירִי דְּלָא מַפְסֵיק עַמּוּדָא דְנוּרָא אֶלָּא לְחַד בְּדָרָא אוֹ לִתְרֵין בְּדָרָא.
human_translation: He said to him: Bring a Torah scroll and see: Is there anything written in it that I have not fulfilled? He said to him: But did you attach yourself to those afflicted with ra’atan and study Torah, And even so, when he passed away a pillar of fire separated him from everyone. And is learned that a pillar of fire separates only for one in a generation or for two in a generation.
llm_translation: He said to him: I brought a Torah scroll and see if there is anyone who can refute it, as it is written in it that it cannot be upheld. He said to him: Did you engage in the study of Ba'alei Ra'atan and involve yourself in Torah? Even so, when his soul is at ease, he will cease the pillar of fire between him and the world. And we have learned that one does not interrupt the pillar of fire except for one at a time or two at a time.

hebrew_text: קְרַב לְגַבֵּיהּ רַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי, אָמַר: ״עֲשֵׂה בִּשְׁבִיל כְּבוֹד חֲכָמִים״. לָא אַשְׁגַּח. ״עֲשֵׂה בִּשְׁבִיל כְּבוֹד אָבִיךָ״. לָא אַשְׁגַּח. ״עֲשֵׂה בִּשְׁבִיל כְּבוֹד עַצְמְךָ״, אִיסְתַּלַּק. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִמַּאן דְּלָא קַיֵּים (אֲפִילּוּ אוֹת אַחַת). אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָא: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִמָּר דְּלָא אִית לֵיהּ מַעֲקֶה לְאִיגָּרֵיהּ. וְלָא הִיא: מִיהְוָה הֲוָה, וְהָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא הוּא דְּשַׁדְיֵיהּ זִיקָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Alexandri approached him said: Make in honor of the Sages. not pay attention Make in honor of your father. not pay attention Make in your own honor, disappeared. Abaye said: to exclude from those who have not fulfilled even one letter Rav Adda bar Mattana said to him: to exclude from the Master who does not have a guardrail for his roof. And that is not so did have but the wind had blown it off at that time.
llm_translation: Approaching him, Rabbi Alexandri said: "Do it for the sake of the honor of the sages." He did not pay attention. "Do it for the sake of the honor of your father." He did not pay attention. "Do it for the sake of your own honor," he accepted. Abaye said: To refrain from angering someone who does not fulfill (even one sign). Rav Adda bar Matna said to him: To refrain from someone who does not have a place to lean on. And it is not: From God it was, and that hour was the time of his anger.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה אֵין בַּעֲלֵי רָאתָן בְּבָבֶל — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאוֹכְלִין תְּרָדִין, וְשׁוֹתִין שֵׁכָר שֶׁל הִיזְמֵי. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִפְּנֵי מָה אֵין מְצוֹרָעִין בְּבָבֶל — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאוֹכְלִין תְּרָדִין, וְשׁוֹתִין שֵׁכָר, וְרוֹחֲצִין בְּמֵי פְרָת.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: For what reason are there no people afflicted with ra’atan in Babylonia? Because eat beets [ teradin ] and drink beer made from the hizmei Rabbi Yoḥanan said: For what reason are there no lepers in Babylonia? Because they eat beets, drink beer, and bathe in the waters of the Euphrates,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: Why are there no people with scurvy in Babylon? Because they eat beets and drink beer made from barley. Rabbi Yochanan said: Why are there no lepers in Babylon? Because they eat beets, drink beer, and bathe in the waters of the Euphrates.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַמַּדִּיר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ
llm_translation: The one who prohibits his wife, we will return to you.

hebrew_text: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לָהּ נְכָסִים עַד שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְאָרֵס — מוֹדִים בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל שֶׁמּוֹכֶרֶת וְנוֹתֶנֶת וְקַיָּים. נָפְלוּ לָהּ מִשֶּׁנִּתְאָרְסָה — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: תִּמְכּוֹר, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לֹא תִּמְכּוֹר. אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ מוֹדִים שֶׁאִם מָכְרָה וְנָתְנָה קַיָּים.
human_translation: woman to whom property was bequeathed before she was betrothed, Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel agree that she may sell or give and is valid. was bequeathed to her after she was betrothed, Beit Shammai say: She may sell and Beit Hillel say: She may not sell these, and those, agree that if she sold or gave valid.
llm_translation: The woman to whom assets fell before she was betrothed - Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel agree that she may sell and give and it is valid. If the assets fell to her after she was betrothed - Beit Shammai says: she should sell, and Beit Hillel says: she should not sell. Both these and those agree that if she sold and gave, it is valid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים לִפְנֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: הוֹאִיל וְזָכָה בָּאִשָּׁה, לֹא יִזְכֶּה בַּנְּכָסִים? אָמַר לָהֶם: עַל הַחֲדָשִׁים אָנוּ בּוֹשִׁים, אֶלָּא שֶׁאַתֶּם מְגַלְגְּלִין עָלֵינוּ אֶת הַיְּשָׁנִים?!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said the Sages said before Rabban Gamliel: Since he acquired the woman not acquire the property said to them: With regard to the new we are ashamed, and you impose upon us the old
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: The sages said before Rabban Gamliel: Since he merited a woman, will he not merit wealth? He said to them: We are embarrassed by new moons, yet you roll the old ones upon us?!

hebrew_text: נָפְלוּ לָהּ מִשֶּׁנִּשֵּׂאת, אֵלּוּ וְאֵלּוּ מוֹדִים שֶׁאִם מָכְרָה וְנָתְנָה, שֶׁהַבַּעַל מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת. עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִשֵּׂאת וְנִשֵּׂאת, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אִם מָכְרָה וְנָתְנָה — קַיָּים. אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא, אָמְרוּ לִפְנֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: הוֹאִיל וְזָכָה בָּאִשָּׁה, לֹא יִזְכֶּה בַּנְּכָסִים? אָמַר לָהֶם: עַל הַחֲדָשִׁים אָנוּ בּוֹשִׁים, אֶלָּא שֶׁאַתֶּם מְגַלְגְּלִין עָלֵינוּ הַיְּשָׁנִים?!
human_translation: was bequeathed to her after she was married, these, and those, agree that if she sold or gave the husband may repossess from the purchasers. before she was married and was married, Rabban Gamliel says: If she sold or gave valid. Rabbi Ḥanina ben Akavya said said before Rabban Gamliel: Since he acquired the woman not acquire the property? said to them: With regard to the new we are ashamed, and you impose upon us the old
llm_translation: They fell to her from when she was betrothed, these and these agree that if she sold and gave, the husband takes from the hands of the buyers. Until she is betrothed and betrothed, Rabban Gamliel says: if she sold and gave — it is valid. Rabbi Chanina ben Akavya said in front of Rabban Gamliel: Since he succeeded in a wife, will he not succeed in property? He said to them: We are embarrassed about the new moons, but you are rolling upon us the old ones?!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חוֹלֵק בֵּין נְכָסִים לִנְכָסִים, נְכָסִים הַיְּדוּעִין לַבַּעַל — לֹא תִּמְכּוֹר, וְאִם מָכְרָה וְנָתְנָה — בָּטֵל. שֶׁאֵינָן יְדוּעִין לַבַּעַל — לֹא תִּמְכּוֹר, וְאִם מָכְרָה וְנָתְנָה — קַיָּים.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon distinguishes between property and property: Property that is known to the husband she may not sell and if she sold or gave void. that is unknown to the husband she may not sell, but if she sold or gave valid.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon differentiates between known assets and unknown assets, known assets belonging to the husband - do not sell, and if she sold and gave - it is nullified. That which is not known to the husband - do not sell, and if she sold and gave - it is valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא דְּלָא פְּלִיגִי, וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא דִּפְלִיגִי?
human_translation: What is different first clause that do not disagree, and what is different the latter clause, that they disagree?
llm_translation: Gemara: What is different about the beginning that they do not argue, and what is different about the end that they do argue?

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: רֵישָׁא — בִּזְכוּתָהּ נָפְלוּ. סֵיפָא — בִּזְכוּתוֹ נָפְלוּ.
human_translation: of the school of Rabbi Yannai say: In the first clause, was bequeathed she rights in the latter clause, was bequeathed he rights
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Yannai said: The beginning - they fell in her merit. The end - they fell in his merit.

hebrew_text: אִם בִּזְכוּתוֹ נָפְלוּ, כִּי מָכְרָה וְנָתְנָה אַמַּאי קַיָּים? אֶלָּא: רֵישָׁא — וַדַּאי בִּזְכוּתָהּ נָפְלוּ. סֵיפָא — אֵימַר בִּזְכוּתָהּ, אֵימַר בִּזְכוּתוֹ. לְכַתְּחִלָּה לֹא תִּמְכּוֹר, אִם מָכְרָה וְנָתְנָה — קַיָּים.
human_translation: If, was bequeathed he rights why valid when she sold or gave Rather, the first clause, certainly was bequeathed she rights the latter clause, say she has rights say he has rights she may not sell ab initio , if she sold or gave valid.
llm_translation: If by her merit they fell, for she sold and gave, why are they valid? Rather: the beginning - certainly by her merit they fell. The end - say by her merit, say by his merit. Initially, do not sell; if she sold and gave - it is valid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אָמְרוּ לִפְנֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַלְּכַתְּחִלָּה, אוֹ אַדִּיעֲבַד?
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said said before Rabban Gamliel: A dilemma was raised before Rabbi Yehuda to ab initio , or to after the fact,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehuda, they said before Rabban Gamliel. He asked them, Rabbi Yehuda, initially or after the fact?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אָמְרוּ לִפְנֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: הוֹאִיל וְזוֹ אִשְׁתּוֹ וְזוֹ אִשְׁתּוֹ — זוֹ מִכְרָהּ בָּטֵל, אַף זוֹ מִכְרָהּ בָּטֵל! אָמַר לָהֶן: עַל הַחֲדָשִׁים אָנוּ בּוֹשִׁים, אֶלָּא שֶׁאַתֶּם מְגַלְגְּלִים עָלֵינוּ אֶת הַיְּשָׁנִים? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דִּיעֲבַד קָאָמַר: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda said they said before Rabban Gamliel: Since this his wife, and that one, his wife, this her sale is void, so this her sale void. said to them: With regard to the new we are ashamed while you impose upon us the old Learn from this stated after the fact, learn from this
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: They said before Rabban Gamliel: Since this one is his wife and this one is his wife - if this one annulled her sale, this one also annulled her sale! He said to them: We are embarrassed by the new ones, yet you are rolling the old ones upon us? Learn from it that which happened, he is saying: Learn from it.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא: לֹא כָּךְ הֱשִׁיבָן רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לַחֲכָמִים, אֶלָּא כָּךְ הֱשִׁיבָן: לֹא אִם אֲמַרְתֶּם בִּנְשׂוּאָה — שֶׁכֵּן בַּעְלָהּ זַכַּאי בִּמְצִיאָתָהּ וּבְמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ וּבַהֲפָרַת נְדָרֶיהָ, תֹּאמְרוּ בַּאֲרוּסָה שֶׁאֵין בַּעְלָהּ זַכַּאי לֹא בִּמְצִיאָתָהּ וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ וְלֹא בַּהֲפָרַת נְדָרֶיהָ!
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Ḥanina ben Akavya said Rabban Gamliel did not respond to the Sages in that Rather, this he replied to them: No, if you said with regard to a married as her husband is entitled to found and to her earnings and to nullify her vows, will you say with regard to a betrothed woman, whose husband is not entitled to found, nor her earnings, nor nullification of her vows?
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Chanina ben Akavya said: Rabban Gamliel did not respond to the sages in this manner, but rather he responded to them: If you say regarding a married woman - that her husband is deserving in her acquisition, in her handiwork, and in annulling her vows, then you should say regarding a betrothed woman that her husband is not deserving, neither in her acquisition, nor in her handiwork, nor in annulling her vows!

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: רַבִּי, מָכְרָה לָהּ עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִשֵּׂאת, נִשֵּׂאת וְאַחַר כָּךְ מָכְרָה, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַף זוֹ מוֹכֶרֶת וְנוֹתֶנֶת וְקַיָּים. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: הוֹאִיל וְזָכָה בָּאִשָּׁה, לֹא יִזְכֶּה בַּנְּכָסִים?! אָמַר לָהֶם: עַל הַחֲדָשִׁים אָנוּ בּוֹשִׁין, אֶלָּא שֶׁאַתֶּם מְגַלְגְּלִין עָלֵינוּ אֶת הַיְּשָׁנִים?!
human_translation: said to him: My teacher, she sold for herself before she was married, she was married and afterward sold what is said to them: Even this one may sell and give and valid. They said to him: Since he acquired the woman, will he not acquire the property? He said to them: With regard to the new we are ashamed, and you impose upon us the old
llm_translation: They said to him: Rabbi, she sold to her before she married, she married and afterwards she sold, what is the law? He said to them: This one also sells and gives and fulfills. They said to him: Since he has succeeded with a woman, will he not succeed with property?! He said to them: We are embarrassed about new things, but you are rolling the old ones over us?!

hebrew_text: וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן: עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִשֵּׂאת וְנִשֵּׂאת, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אִם מָכְרָה וְנָתְנָה — קַיָּים.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn before she was married and was married, Rabban Gamliel says: If she sold or gave valid.
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: Until she is married and married, Rabban Gamliel says: If she sold and gave - it is valid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זְבִיד, תְּנִי: מוֹכֶרֶת וְנוֹתֶנֶת וְקַיָּים. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, הָא רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? הָכִי קָאָמַר: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל דָּבָר זֶה.
human_translation: Rav Zevid said: Teach She may sell and give and valid. Rav Pappa stated not difficult, this Rabbi Yehuda according to Rabban Gamliel, that Rabbi Ḥanina ben Akavya according to Rabban Gamliel. Rabbi Ḥanina ben Akavya with Beit Shammai, This is what is saying: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree with regard to this matter
llm_translation: Rav Zevid said, "It was taught: a seller and a buyer and a guarantor." Rav Pappa said, "It is not difficult: this is like Rabbi Yehuda in the school of Rabban Gamliel, and this is like Rabbi Chanina ben Akavya in the school of Rabban Gamliel. And Rabbi Chanina ben Akavya is like Beit Shammai? This is what he is saying: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree on this matter."

hebrew_text: רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: בֵּין שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לָהּ נְכָסִים עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִתְאָרְסָה, בֵּין שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לָהּ נְכָסִים מִשֶּׁנִּתְאָרְסָה, וְנִיסֵּת — הַבַּעַל מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת.
