human_translation: Rav and Shmuel, who both say: Whether property was bequeathed to her before she was betrothed, whether property was bequeathed to her after she was betrothed and she was married, the husband may repossess from the purchasers.
llm_translation: Rav and Shmuel both said: Whether the assets fell to her before she was betrothed, or whether the assets fell to her after she was betrothed, and she was divorced - the husband must pay the woman immediately.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? דְּלֹא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְלֹא כְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא! אִינְהוּ דְּאָמְרִי כְּרַבּוֹתֵינוּ. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבּוֹתֵינוּ חָזְרוּ וְנִמְנוּ: בֵּין שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לָהּ עַד שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְאָרֵס, וּבֵין שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לָהּ מִשֶּׁנִּתְאָרְסָה וְנִיסֵּת — הַבַּעַל מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת.
human_translation: According to whose not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda and not in accordance with Rabbi Ḥanina ben Akavya, They, say in accordance with our Rabbis. As it is taught Our Rabbis returned and voted whether property was bequeathed to her before she was betrothed, whether property was bequeathed to her after she was betrothed and she was married, the husband may repossess from the purchasers.
llm_translation: As whom? That not like Rabbi Yehuda and not like Rabbi Chanina ben Akavya! They who say like our Rabbis. For it was taught: Our Rabbis returned and counted: Whether they fell to her before she was betrothed, or whether they fell to her after she was betrothed and she was tested — the husband removes the child from the hands of the buyers.

hebrew_text: מִשֶּׁנִּיסֵּת אֵלּוּ וְאֵלּוּ מוֹדִים. לֵימָא תְּנֵינָא לְתַקָּנַת אוּשָׁא? דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, בְּאוּשָׁא הִתְקִינוּ: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁמָּכְרָה בְּנִכְסֵי מְלוֹג בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ וּמֵתָה — הַבַּעַל מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת.
human_translation: after she was married, these, and those, agree Let us say we learned the ordinance Usha. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: In Usha they instituted a woman who sold her usufruct property, in her husband’s lifetime and died, the husband repossesses from the purchasers.
llm_translation: From when do these laws and these laws admit to the following case? Let us say: Do we learn for the rectification of Usha? For Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: In Usha they instituted: If a woman sold property of her husband for melog payment and then died, the husband retrieves the property from the hands of the buyers.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין — בְּחַיֶּיהָ וּלְפֵירוֹת, תַּקָּנַת אוּשָׁא — בְּגוּפָהּ שֶׁל קַרְקַע וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: the mishna during her lifetime, and to the produce The ordinance of Usha, to the land itself, and after death
llm_translation: Mishnah - in its lifetime and for its fruits, the enactment of Usha - in its body of the ground and after its death.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חוֹלֵק בֵּין נְכָסִים. אֵלּוּ הֵן יְדוּעִין וְאֵלּוּ הֵן שֶׁאֵינָן יְדוּעִין? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: יְדוּעִין — מְקַרְקְעֵי. שֶׁאֵינָן יְדוּעִין — מִטַּלְטְלִין. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ יְדוּעִין הֵן. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן שֶׁאֵינָן יְדוּעִין — כֹּל שֶׁיּוֹשֶׁבֶת כָּאן וְנָפְלוּ לָהּ נְכָסִים בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon distinguishes between property Which are known and which are unknown? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: known land, that is unknown movable property. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: these, and those, are known And these are unknown any where she resides here and property was bequeathed to her overseas.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon divides between assets. What are the known ones and what are the unknown ones? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: Known ones - immovable property. Unknown ones - movable property. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Both these and those are known. And the unknown ones are all assets that one sits here and assets fall to him in the sea state.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אֵלּוּ הֵן שֶׁאֵינָן יְדוּעִין — כֹּל שֶׁיּוֹשֶׁבֶת כָּאן וְנָפְלוּ לָהּ נְכָסִים בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם.
human_translation: That is also taught These are unknown any where she resides here and property was bequeathed to her overseas.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: These are the ones that are not known - anyone who resides here and assets fall to her in a maritime state.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דְּבָעֲיָא דְּתַבְרְחִינְהוּ לְנִכְסַהּ מִגַּבְרַהּ, כְּתַבְתִּינְהוּ לִבְרַתַּהּ. אִינְּסִיבָה וְאִיגָּרַשָׁה.
human_translation: a certain woman who sought to distance her property from her husband. She wrote to her daughter was married and divorced.
llm_translation: That woman who asked her husband for permission to borrow from him, he wrote for her a document. He married her and divorced her.

hebrew_text: אֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, קַרְעֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לִשְׁטָרָא. אֲזַל רַב עָנָן לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּמָר עוּקְבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזִי מָר נַחְמָן חַקְלָאָה הֵיכִי מְקָרַע שְׁטָרֵי דְאִינָשֵׁי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵימָא לִי אִיזִי, גּוּפָא דְעוֹבָדָא הֵיכִי הֲוָה?
human_translation: came before Rav Naḥman Rav Naḥman tore the document, Rav Anan went before Mar Ukva, said to him: the Master observe Naḥman the farmer, how tears people’s documents. Mar Ukva said to him: Tell me, please, what was the actual incident?
llm_translation: He came before Rav Nachman, Rav Nachman tore the document. Rav Anan went before Mar Ukva, he said to him: "Master, see how Nachman tears people's documents." He said to him: "Why don't you come with me, how was the actual incident?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי וְהָכִי הֲוָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁטַר מַבְרַחַת קָא אָמְרַתְּ? הָכִי אָמַר רַב חֲנִילַאי בַּר אִידִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מוֹרֶה הוֹרָאָה אֲנִי: אִם יָבֹא שְׁטַר מַבְרַחַת לְיָדִי — אֶקְרָעֶנּוּ.
human_translation: said to This and that transpired; said to him: Are you saying a document of evasion? This Rav Ḥanilai bar Idi said Shmuel said: I am issues rulings If a document of evasion comes to my hand, I will tear it,
llm_translation: He said to him: thus and thus it was. He said to him: are you saying a bill of divorce? This is what Rav Chanilai son of Idi said in the name of Shmuel: I am a teacher of teaching: if a bill of divorce comes into my hand - I will tear it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: טַעְמָא מַאי? דְּלָא שָׁבֵיק אִינִישׁ נַפְשֵׁיהּ וְיָהֵיב לְאַחֲרִינֵי. הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְאַחֲרִינֵי, אֲבָל לִבְרַתַּהּ יָהֲיבָא! אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי: בִּמְקוֹם בְּרַתַּהּ, נַפְשָׁהּ עֲדִיפָא לַהּ.
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: What is the reason because a person does not abandon his own and give to others? That applies to others but to her daughter give Even so, where of her daughter, her own are preferable to her,
llm_translation: He said to him Rava to Rav Nachman: Reason what? That not leave a person his soul and give to others. These words to others, but to his daughter gave! Even so: in place of his daughter, her soul is preferable to her.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הָרוֹצָה שֶׁתַּבְרִיחַ נְכָסֶיהָ מִבַּעְלָהּ, כֵּיצַד הִיא עוֹשָׂה? כּוֹתֶבֶת שְׁטַר פַּסִּים לַאֲחֵרִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: raises an objection: one who seeks to distance her property from her husband, how does she proceed? She writes a document of agreement to others, the statement of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text you provided translates into English as follows: Challenger: One who wishes to protect her property from her husband, how does she do it? She writes a document of divorce for others. These are the words of Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: רָצָה — מְצַחֵק בָּהּ. עַד שֶׁתִּכְתּוֹב לוֹ מֵהַיּוֹם וְלִכְשֶׁאֶרְצֶה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: wishes, he can deceive her until she writes to him from today and while I wish
llm_translation: The sages say: "He desires - he jests with her." Until she writes for him "from this day" and when he desires.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּכָתְבָה לֵיהּ הָכִי, הָא לָא כָּתְבָה לֵיהּ הָכִי — קְנַנְהִי לוֹקֵחַ!
human_translation: The reason that she wrote this to him; but if she did not write this to him, the purchaser has acquired
llm_translation: Reason for which it was written to him thus, this not was written to him thus — acquire it, he acquires!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּכוּלַּהּ, הָא — בְּמִקְצָתַהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: not difficult, this, about all that about part of
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, not difficult: here - in its entirety, here - in part.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא קְנַנְהִי לוֹקֵחַ — נִיקְנִינְהוּ בַּעַל! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: עֲשָׂאוּם כִּנְכָסִים שֶׁאֵין יְדוּעִין לַבַּעַל, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: And if the purchaser does not acquire the husband should acquire it. Abaye said: rendered like property that is unknown to the husband, and in accordance with Rabbi Shimon
llm_translation: "If he did not acquire them, the buyer acquires them." Abaye said: They made them like hidden assets that are not known to the owner, following the opinion of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נָפְלוּ לָהּ כְּסָפִים — יִלָּקַח בָּהֶן קַרְקַע, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת. פֵּירוֹת הַתְּלוּשִׁין מִן הַקַּרְקַע — יִלָּקַח בָּהֶן קַרְקַע, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: money was bequeathed to land is acquired with it, and consumes the produce produce that is detached from the ground, land is acquired with it and he consumes the produce
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "If coins fell to her - land shall be acquired with them, and he eats its fruits. Fruits detached from the land - land shall be acquired with them, and he eats its fruits."

hebrew_text: [פֵּירוֹת] הַמְחוּבָּרִים בַּקַּרְקַע? אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: שָׁמִין אוֹתָהּ כַּמָּה הִיא יָפָה בְּפֵירוֹת וְכַמָּה הִיא יָפָה בְּלֹא פֵּירוֹת, וּמוֹתַר — יִלָּקַח בָּהֶן קַרְקַע, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הַמְחוּבָּרִים לַקַּרְקַע — שֶׁלּוֹ, וְהַתְּלוּשִׁין מִן הַקַּרְקַע — שֶׁלָּהּ, וְיִלָּקַח בָּהֶן קַרְקַע, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: produce that is attached to the ground, Rabbi Meir says: One evaluates how much worth with produce, and how much it is worth without produce, and surplus Land is acquired with and he consumes the produce. And the Rabbis say: That which is attached to the ground is his, And that which is detached from the ground hers, and land is acquired with it and he consumes the produce.
llm_translation: FRUITS CONNECTED TO THE GROUND? RABBI MEIR SAID: WE EVALUATE IT HOW IT IS BEAUTIFUL WITH FRUITS AND HOW IT IS BEAUTIFUL WITHOUT FRUITS, AND IT IS PERMITTED — ONE MAY TAKE THE GROUND WITH THEM, AND HE EATS THE FRUITS. AND THE SAGES SAY: THOSE CONNECTED TO THE GROUND — BELONG TO IT, AND THOSE DETACHED FROM THE GROUND — BELONG TO HER, AND ONE MAY TAKE THE GROUND WITH THEM, AND HE EATS THE FRUITS.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מְקוֹם שֶׁיִּפָּה כֹּחוֹ בִּכְנִיסָתָהּ — הוֹרַע כֹּחוֹ בִּיצִיאָתָהּ. מְקוֹם שֶׁהוֹרַע כֹּחוֹ בִּכְנִיסָתָהּ — יִפָּה כֹּחוֹ בִּיצִיאָתָהּ. כֵּיצַד? פֵּירוֹת הַמְחוּבָּרִים לַקַּרְקַע, בִּכְנִיסָתָהּ — שֶׁלּוֹ, וּבִיצִיאָתָהּ — שֶׁלָּהּ. וְהַתְּלוּשִׁין מִן הַקַּרְקַע, בִּכְנִיסָתָהּ — שֶׁלָּהּ, וּבִיצִיאָתָהּ — שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: case where his right is superior upon her entrance his right is inferior upon her exit case where his right is inferior upon her entrance, his right is superior upon her exit. How so? produce that is attached to the ground, upon her entrance his, and upon her exit, hers, But that is detached from the ground, upon her entrance hers, and upon her exit his,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: The place where its strength is exerted upon entry - its strength is diminished upon exit. The place where its strength is diminished upon entry - its strength is exerted upon exit. How so? Attached fruits to the ground, upon entry - belong to it, and upon exit - belong to it. And detached fruits from the ground, upon entry - belong to it, and upon exit - belong to it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פְּשִׁיטָא: אַרְעָא וּבָתֵּי — אַרְעָא. בָּתֵּי וְדִיקְלֵי — בָּתֵּי. דִּיקְלֵי וְאִילָנֵי — דִּיקְלֵי. אִילָנֵי וְגוּפְנֵי — אִילָנֵי.
human_translation: obvious land and houses, land, houses and palm trees, houses. palm trees or trees, palm trees. trees or grapevines, trees.
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: "Gemara: It is obvious: Land and houses - land. Houses and palm trees - houses. Palm trees and other trees - palm trees. Other trees and vines - other trees."

hebrew_text: אִבָּא, זַרְדְּתָא, וּפִירָא דְכַוְורֵי, אָמְרִי לַהּ פֵּירָא וְאָמְרִי לַהּ קַרְנָא. כְּלָלָא דְּמִילְּתָא: גִּזְעוֹ מַחְלִיף — פֵּירָא, אֵין גִּזְעוֹ מַחְלִיף — קַרְנָא.
human_translation: a forest [ abba ] hawthorn [ zeradeta ] or a fishpond, Some say produce, and some say principal, The principle of the matter trunk renews produce, trunk does not renew principal.
llm_translation: Father, Zardeta, and Pira deKavrei, said to it: Pira, and said to it: Karna. General principle: If its trunk changes - Pira, if its trunk does not change - Karna.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: הַגּוֹנֵב
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said Rabbi Oshaya said Rabbi Yannai said, and some say Rabbi Abba said Rabbi Oshaya said Rabbi Yannai said: One who steals
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira said Rabbi Oshaya said Rabbi Yannai, and some say he said, Rabbi Abba said Rabbi Oshaya said Rabbi Yannai: "The thief."

hebrew_text: וְלַד בֶּהֱמַת מְלוֹג — מְשַׁלֵּם תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל לָאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: offspring an animal of usufruct must pay payment of double to the woman.
llm_translation: And a son of an animal that is a firstborn - he pays the redemption of double to the woman.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? לָא כְּרַבָּנַן וְלָא כַּחֲנַנְיָה! דְּתַנְיָא: וְלַד בֶּהֱמַת מְלוֹג לְבַעַל, וְלַד שִׁפְחַת מְלוֹג לָאִשָּׁה, וַחֲנַנְיָה בֶּן אֲחִי יֹאשִׁיָּה אָמַר: עָשׂוּ וְלַד שִׁפְחַת מְלוֹג כִּוְלַד בֶּהֱמַת מְלוֹג.
human_translation: In accordance with whose not in accordance with the Rabbis, and not in accordance with Ḥananya. As it is taught The offspring a usufruct animal to the husband, the child a usufruct maidservant to the wife. And Ḥananya, son of Yoshiya’s brother, said: They made child a usufruct maidservant like the offspring a usufruct animal,
llm_translation: As whom? Not like the Rabbanan and not like Hananya! For it was taught: "A child of a maidservant belongs to the master, and a child of a maidservant belongs to the woman." And Hananya, the son of Josiah, said: "They made a child of a maidservant like a child of an animal."

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל: פֵּירָא תַּקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן, פֵּירָא דְפֵירָא לָא תַּקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: You even say all agree the Sages instituted for produce, the Sages did not institute for him produce of produce.
llm_translation: Even if you say "the words of everyone," the Rabbis established a decree regarding the fruit, but they did not establish a decree regarding the pit.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לַחֲנַנְיָה — הַיְינוּ דְּלָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְמִיתָה.
human_translation: Granted, according to Ḥananya, this is because we are not concerned about death
llm_translation: In peace to Chananya - that is, we are not concerned for death.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבָּנַן אִי חָיְישִׁי לְמִיתָה — אֲפִילּוּ וְלַד בֶּהֱמַת מְלוֹג נָמֵי לָא. וְאִי לָא חָיְישִׁי לְמִיתָה — אֲפִילּוּ וְלַד שִׁפְחַת מְלוֹג נָמֵי?
human_translation: But the Rabbis, if are concerned about death even offspring a usufruct animal not either. And if are not concerned about death even the child of a usufruct maidservant also
llm_translation: Rather, the Rabbis: If one is concerned for death - even if a woman gives birth to a full-grown animal, it is not considered. And if one is not concerned for death - even if a maidservant gives birth to a full-grown animal, is it considered?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם חָיְישִׁי לְמִיתָה, וְשָׁאנֵי בְּהֵמָה דְּאִיכָּא עוֹרָהּ.
human_translation: Actually, are concerned about death, but an animal is different, as there is its hide,
llm_translation: Forever cautious of death, and different is the case with an animal that has its skin.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִיָּיא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כַּחֲנַנְיָה. אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אַף עַל גַּב דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הֲלָכָה כַּחֲנַנְיָה, מוֹדֶה חֲנַנְיָה שֶׁאִם נִתְגָּרְשָׁה — נוֹתֶנֶת דָּמִים וְנוֹטַלְתָּן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁבַח בֵּית אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Ḥananya Rava said Rav Naḥman said: Although Shmuel said halakha is in accordance with Ḥananya, Ḥananya concedes that if was divorced, she pays money and takes because assets of her paternal family,
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Chiyya said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is like Chananya. Rava said in the name of Rav Nachman: Even though Shmuel said the halakha is like Chananya, Chananya concedes that if she was divorced, she gives the blood money and takes it, because of the honor of her father's house.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הִכְנִיסָה לוֹ עֵז לַחֲלָבָהּ וְרָחֵל לְגִיזָּתָהּ, וְתַרְנְגוֹלֶת לְבֵיצָתָהּ, וְדֶקֶל לְפֵירוֹתָיו — אוֹכֵל וְהוֹלֵךְ עַד שֶׁתִּכְלֶה הַקֶּרֶן. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: עַיִּילָא לֵיהּ גְּלִימָא — פֵּירָא הָוֵי, מִכַּסֵּי בֵּיהּ וְאָזֵיל עַד דְּכָלְיָא.
human_translation: Rava said Rav Naḥman said: If she brought in for him a goat for its milk, or a sheep for its shearings, or a hen for its eggs, or a palm tree for its produce, continues to consume until the principal is consumed, Rav Naḥman said: she brought in for him a cloak is produce, he may cover with it until is consumed.
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Nachman said: If one brings a goat to its milk, and a ewe to its shearing, and a hen to its egg, and a palm tree to its fruit - it eats and goes until the horn is finished. Rav Nachman said: If you cover it with a cloak - it will be fruitful, cover it and go until it is finished.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: הַמֶּלַח וְהַחוֹל — הֲרֵי זֶה פֵּירוֹת. פִּיר שֶׁל גׇּפְרִית, מַחְפּוֹרֶת שֶׁל צָרִיף, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: קֶרֶן. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught salt and sand this is produce. a quarry of sulfur a mine of alum, Rabbi Meir says: principal, and the Rabbis say: produce,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "K'man? Ki hai tanna, d'tanya: Ha'melach v'ha'chol — harei zeh peirot. Pir shel gofrit, machporet shel tzarif, Rabbi Meir omer: Keren. Va'chachamim omerim: Peirot." English translation: "As whom? Like this tanna, as it was taught: Salt and sand — behold, these are fruits. Sulfur ash, potash of natron, Rabbi Meir says: Horn. And the sages say: Fruits."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר מָקוֹם שֶׁיִּפָּה כֹּחוֹ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא? אָמַר רָבָא: מְחוּבָּרִין בִּשְׁעַת יְצִיאָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: case where his right is superior Rabbi Shimon is the first tanna , Rava said: between attached at the time of departure
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says, "The place where his strength fails." Is this the same Rabbi Shimon as the first Tanna? Rava said: There is a difference between them at the time of departure.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נָפְלוּ לָהּ עֲבָדִים וּשְׁפָחוֹת זְקֵנִים — יִמָּכְרוּ, וְיִלָּקַח מֵהֶן קַרְקַע, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: לֹא תִּמְכּוֹר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן שֶׁבַח בֵּית אָבִיהָ. נָפְלוּ לָהּ זֵיתִים וּגְפָנִים זְקֵנִים — יִמָּכְרוּ, וְיִלָּקַח בָּהֶן קַרְקַע, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא תִּמְכּוֹר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן שֶׁבַח בֵּית אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: elderly slaves or maidservants were bequeathed to her, they are sold and land is acquired with them, and consumes the produce Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: She not sell because they are assets of her paternal family, old olive or grapevines were bequeathed to her, they are sold and land is acquired with them, and he consumes the produce. Rabbi Yehuda says: She not sell because they are assets of her paternal family.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If old slaves or maidservants fell to her - they are to be sold, and land is to be taken from them, and she eats the produce. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Do not sell them, because they are the glory of her father's house. If old olive trees or grapevines fell to her - they are to be sold, and land is to be taken from them, and she eats the produce. Rabbi Yehuda says: Do not sell them, because they are the glory of her father's house.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר רַב: מַחְלוֹקֶת שֶׁנָּפְלוּ בְּשָׂדֶה שֶׁלָּהּ, אֲבָל בְּשָׂדֶה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁלָּהּ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל תִּמְכּוֹר, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא כָלְיָא קַרְנָא.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said Rav said: dispute when they were bequeathed in her field, But in a field that is not hers, everyone agrees she must sell because principal consumed.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rav Kahana said Rav: Dispute that fell in her field, but in a field that is not hers - words of everyone sell, because it is like a horned vessel.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: הֲרֵי עֲבָדִים וּשְׁפָחוֹת, דְּכִי שָׂדֶה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁלָּהּ דָּמֵי, וּפְלִיגִי! אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר רַב: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בְּשָׂדֶה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁלָּהּ, אֲבָל בְּשָׂדֶה שֶׁלָּהּ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל לֹא תִּמְכּוֹר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁבַח בֵּית אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef objects to this: But slaves and maidservants are considered like a field that is not hers, and disagree Rather, was stated, it was stated as follows: Rav Kahana said Rav said: dispute in a field that is not hers, but in her field, everyone agrees she not sell because assets of her paternal family.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef objects to her: Behold, slaves and maidservants, since a field that is not hers, its value, and they argue! Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus: Rav Kahana said in the name of Rav: Disagreement regarding a field that is not hers, but regarding her field — the words of all, you shall not sell, because of the honor of her father's house.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוֹצִיא הוֹצָאוֹת עַל נִכְסֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ, הוֹצִיא הַרְבֵּה וְאָכַל קִימְעָא, קִימְעָא וְאָכַל הַרְבֵּה — מַה שֶּׁהוֹצִיא הוֹצִיא, וּמַה שֶּׁאָכַל אָכַל. הוֹצִיא וְלֹא אָכַל — יִשָּׁבַע כַּמָּה הוֹצִיא, וְיִטּוֹל.
human_translation: one who pays expenditures for his wife’s property he paid a large and ate a small a small and ate a large that which he spent he has spent, and that which he ate he has eaten. paid and did not eat he takes an oath how much he paid and takes
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who brings out expenses on his wife's property, if he brought out much and consumed little, or consumed much and brought out little - whatever he brought out, he brought out, and whatever he consumed, he consumed. If he brought out but did not consume - he must swear how much he brought out, and then he may take it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְכַמָּה קִימְעָא? אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: אֲפִילּוּ גְּרוֹגֶרֶת אַחַת, וְהוּא שֶׁאֲכָלָהּ דֶּרֶךְ כָּבוֹד. אָמַר
human_translation: And how much is small Rabbi Asi said: even one dried fig, provided he ate it in a dignified manner said
llm_translation: Gemara: And how much is a kezayit? Rabbi Assi said: Even if it is just one dried fig, and he ate it in a dignified manner. He said:

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַבָּא, אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב: אֲפִילּוּ שִׁיגְרָא דְתַמְרֵי. בָּעֵי רַב בִּיבִי: חוּבְצָא דְתַמְרֵי מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba the school of Rav they say: even a cluster of dates Rav Beivai asks: dough of dates, what shall stand
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said, the house of Rav said: Even the peel of dates. Rav Bivi asked: What about the pit of dates? This matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: לָא אָכְלָה דֶּרֶךְ כָּבוֹד מַאי? אָמַר עוּלָּא: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ תְּרֵי אָמוֹרָאֵי בְּמַעְרְבָא, חַד אָמַר: בִּכְאִיסָּר, וְחַד אָמַר: בִּכְדִינָר.
human_translation: he did not eat it in a dignified manner, what Ulla said: Two amora’im in the West, disagree this One said: of an issar , and one said: of a dinar.
llm_translation: She did not eat in a dignified manner, what is the law? Ula said: Two Amoraim in the West disagree about it, one said: with a Kesit, and one said: with a Dinar.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי דַּיָּינֵי דְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא: עֲבַד רַב יְהוּדָה עוֹבָדָא בַּחֲבִילֵי זְמוֹרוֹת. רַב יְהוּדָה לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: אֲכָלָהּ עׇרְלָה, שְׁבִיעִית, וְכִלְאַיִם — הֲרֵי זוֹ חֲזָקָה.
human_translation: The judges of Pumbedita say: Rav Yehuda took action of a bundle of branches. Rav Yehuda to his reasoning. Rav Yehuda said: consumed prohibition against eating the fruit of a tree during the first three years after its planting orla the seventh year, diverse kinds, this taking possession
llm_translation: The scholars of Pumbedita said: Rav Yehudah performed work with bundles of branches. Rav Yehudah according to his reasoning, for Rav Yehudah said: If it consumed orlah, the produce of the seventh year, and kilayim - it is considered established.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הַמּוֹצִיא הוֹצָאוֹת עַל נִכְסֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ קְטַנָּה — כְּמוֹצִיא עַל נִכְסֵי אַחֵר דָּמֵי. מַאי טַעְמָא — עֲבַדוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן תַּקַּנְתָּא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא נִיפְסְדִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yaakov said Rav Ḥisda said: one who outlays expenditures for property of his wife minor girl considered like one who outlays for the property of someone else. What is the reason The Sages enacted this ordinance in order that he should not depreciate.
llm_translation: Rav Yaakov said in the name of Rav Chisda: One who spends money on the expenses of his minor wife - it is like spending on someone else's money. What is the reason? The Rabbis made a decree regarding this, so that they would not be lost.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דִּנְפַלוּ לַהּ אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי בֵּי חוֹזָאֵי, אֲזַל גַּבְרָא אַפֵּיק שֵׁית מְאָה אַיְיתַי אַרְבַּע מְאָה. בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָאָתֵי, אִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ חַד זוּזָא וּשְׁקַל מִנַּיְיהוּ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַה שֶּׁהוֹצִיא — הוֹצִיא, וּמַה שֶּׁאָכַל — אָכַל.
human_translation: a certain woman who had four hundred dinars bequeathed to her Bei Ḥozai, man, went took six hundred brought four hundred. While he was coming he required one dinar, which he took from He came before Rabbi Ami said to him: That which he spent he has spent, and that which he ate he has eaten.
llm_translation: That woman, four hundred coins fell to her from the house of Ḥozai. A man went and brought six hundred coins. While he was standing, he needed one coin, so he took it from them. He came before Rabbi Ammi, he said to him: Whatever he has taken out, he has taken out, and whatever he has eaten, he has eaten.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַבִּי אַמֵּי: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּקָאָכֵיל פֵּירָא, הָא קַרְנָא קָאָכֵיל וְהוֹצָאָה הִיא. אִם כֵּן, הָוֵה לֵיהּ הוֹצִיא וְלֹא אָכַל, יִשָּׁבַע כַּמָּה הוֹצִיא, וְיִטּוֹל.
human_translation: The Rabbis said to Rabbi Ami: This applies where consumes produce this ate principal, and it is expenditures. If so, this is and did not eat, he takes an oath how much he paid and takes
llm_translation: The sages said to Rabbi Ammi: Those words, where he is eating fruit, the horn is eating and it is an emission. If so, let him have an emission and not eat, he should swear how many emissions he had and take.

hebrew_text: יִשָּׁבַע כַּמָּה הוֹצִיא וְיִטּוֹל. אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: וְהוּא שֶׁיֵּשׁ שֶׁבַח כְּנֶגֶד הוֹצָאָה. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שֶׁאִם הָיָה שֶׁבַח יָתֵר עַל הוֹצָאָה — נוֹטֵל אֶת הַהוֹצָאָה בְּלֹא שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: He takes an oath how much he spent and takes Rabbi Asi said: And this if there is enhancement corresponding to expense. to what halakha Abaye said: that if enhancement was greater than expense, he takes the expense without an oath.
llm_translation: He shall swear how much he has taken and shall return. Rabbi Assi said: And this is praise corresponding to the taking. What is the halakha? Abaye said: If the praise was greater than the taking - he takes the taking without an oath.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אִם כֵּן, אָתֵי לְאִיעָרוֹמֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: שֶׁאִם הָיְתָה הוֹצָאָה יְתֵירָה עַל הַשֶּׁבַח — אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא הוֹצָאָה שִׁיעוּר שֶׁבַח, וּבִשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Rava said to him: If so, he will come to deceive, Rather, Rava said: that if the expense was greater than the enhancement, he has expense only amount of enhancement, and by an oath.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: If so, he comes to be naked! Rather, Rava said: If there was excessive expenditure on praise - he has only the expenditure of the appropriate amount of praise, and in a week.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בַּעַל שֶׁהוֹרִיד אֲרִיסִין תַּחְתָּיו, מַהוּ? אַדַּעְתָּא דְבַעַל נָחֵית. אִיסְתַּלַּיק לֵיהּ בַּעַל, אִיסְתַּלַּיקוּ לְהוּ. אוֹ דִלְמָא: אַדַּעְתָּא דְאַרְעָא נָחֵית, וְאַרְעָא כִּי קָיְימָא — לַאֲרִיסֵי קָיְימָא?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before a husband who engaged sharecroppers in his stead, what is begin work with the intention for the husband, the husband departs they depart Or perhaps begins work with the intention the land, and the land, as it stands, stands by sharecroppers?
llm_translation: He asked them: If a landowner lowers the sharecroppers beneath him, what is the law? The opinion is that the landowner descends. If the landowner descends, they descend with him. Or perhaps: the opinion is that the land remains in place, and when the land remains in place, do the sharecroppers remain in place?

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא בַּר רַב חָנָן: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהַיּוֹרֵד לְתוֹךְ שְׂדֵה חֲבֵירוֹ וּנְטָעָהּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת, שָׁמִין לוֹ, וְיָדוֹ עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה?
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Ḥanan objects to this what is different from of one who entered the field and planted it without permission? one evaluates for him and he is at a disadvantage.
llm_translation: Rava son of Rav Hanan objects to her: What is different about one who descends into his fellow's field and plants it without permission, that we listen to him, and his hand is on the lower part?

hebrew_text: הָתָם לֵיכָּא אִינִישׁ דְּטָרַח, הָכָא אִיכָּא בַּעַל דְּטָרַח.
human_translation: There, there is no one that exert here, there is a husband who exerts
llm_translation: There, there is one who is troubled; here, there is one who is the master of the trouble.

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: חָזֵינַן אִי בַּעַל אָרִיס הוּא — אִיסְתַּלַּק לֵיהּ בַּעַל, אִסְתַּלַּקוּ לְהוּ. אִי בַּעַל לָאו אָרִיס הוּא, אַרְעָא לַאֲרִיסֵי קָיְימָא.
human_translation: What was about Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: We examine If husband is a sharecropper the husband departs they depart, If husband is not a sharecropper, the land is ready for sharecroppers,
llm_translation: What is the ruling regarding it? Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: If it is with the consent of the landowner, the tenants may leave, and if not, they must remain on the land.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בַּעַל שֶׁמָּכַר קַרְקַע לְפֵירוֹת, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן מַאי דְּקָנֵי (לַהּ) אַקְנִי, אוֹ דִלְמָא: כִּי תַּקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן פֵּירוֹת לְבַעַל —
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before husband who sold land for produce, what is Do we say: That which belongs to he has transferred or perhaps that when the Sages instituted produce to the husband,
llm_translation: He asked them: If a person sells land for produce, what is the law? Do we say, "What he acquires, let him acquire," or perhaps: "When the Rabbis established produce for the owner —"

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם רְוַוח בֵּיתָא, אֲבָל לְזַבּוֹנֵי — לָא? יְהוּדָה מָר בַּר מָרִימָר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אָמַר: מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה, עָשׂוּי. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם.
human_translation: for gain of the house, but to sell not Yehuda Mar bar Mareimar said in the name of Rava: What he did is done, Rav Pappa said in the name of Rava: He did not do anything.
llm_translation: Due to the comfort of the house, but for the builders - no? Yehudah Mar Bar Marimr from the name of Rava said: What he did, it is done. Rav Papa said in the name of Rava: He did not do anything, and it is not considered.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הָא דִּיהוּדָה מָר בַּר מָרִימָר לָאו בְּפֵירוּשׁ אִתְּמַר, אֶלָּא מִכְּלָלָא אִתְּמַר. דְּהָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דְּעַיִּילָה לֵיהּ לְגַבְרַאּ תַּרְתֵּי אַמְהָתָא, אֲזַל גַּבְרָא נְסֵיב אִיתְּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי, עַיֵּיל לַהּ חֲדָא מִנַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: This of Yehuda Mar bar Mareimar was not stated explicitly Rather, was stated from an inference which a certain woman brought in for husband two maidservants man went married another woman He brought in to one of
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said: This that Yehudah the son of Mar Ukva did not say explicitly, rather it was said implicitly. For that woman who used to bring him two cubits of wood, the man went and married another woman, so she brought him only one cubit from them.

hebrew_text: אֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, צְוַוחָה, לָא אַשְׁגַּח בַּהּ. מַאן דַּחֲזָא סָבַר מִשּׁוּם דְּסָבַר מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי. וְלָא הִיא, מִשּׁוּם רְוַוח בֵּיתָא — וְהָא קָא רָוַוח.
human_translation: came before Rava cried Rava took no notice of her, He who observed thought because he holds what he did is done, But that is not so, for the gain of the house, and the house does gain
llm_translation: He came before Rava, shouting, but he did not pay attention to him. Whoever sees this thinks that what was done was intentional. But it is not so, it was done due to a draft in the house - and there was a draft.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא: בַּעַל שֶׁמָּכַר קַרְקַע לְפֵירוֹת — לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְּלוּם. מַאי טַעְמָא? אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא תַּכְסִיף. רָבָא אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם רְוַוח בֵּיתָא.
human_translation: And the halakha a husband who sold land for produce did not do anything. What is the rationale Abaye said: We are concerned perhaps will deteriorate Rava said: because gain of the house
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the Halakha is: One who sells land for produce - has not done anything and it is not annulled. What is the reason? Abbaye said: We are concerned lest it the produce spoil. Rava said: It is because of the comfort of the house."

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ אַרְעָא דִּמְקָרְבָא לְמָתָא, אִי נָמֵי: בַּעַל אָרִיס הוּא. אִי נָמֵי, זוּזֵי וְקָא עָבֵיד בְּהוּ עִיסְקָא.
human_translation: What is the difference between The practical difference between them land that is close to town, Alternatively, a husband is a sharecropper Alternatively, money and does business with it,
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them: the land that is close to the city. If yes: it is a sharecropper. If no, he is making business with them.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לָהּ נְכָסִים — מוֹדִים בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל שֶׁמּוֹכֶרֶת וְנוֹתֶנֶת וְקַיָּים.
human_translation: a widow waiting for her yavam who property bequeathed to her, Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel agree that she may sell or give and valid.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "A yevamah who inherited assets - Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel agree that she may sell, exchange, and retain."

hebrew_text: מֵתָה, מָה יַעֲשׂוּ בִּכְתוּבָּתָהּ וּבִנְכָסִים הַנִּכְנָסִין וְהַיּוֹצְאִין עִמָּהּ? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יַחְלְקוּ יוֹרְשֵׁי הַבַּעַל עִם יוֹרְשֵׁי הָאָב. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: נְכָסִים בְּחֶזְקָתָן, וּכְתוּבָּה בְּחֶזְקַת יוֹרְשֵׁי הַבַּעַל. נְכָסִים הַנִּכְנָסִים וְהַיּוֹצְאִים עִמָּהּ — בְּחֶזְקַת יוֹרְשֵׁי הָאָב.
human_translation: died, what should they do with her marriage contract and with the property that comes and goes with her, Beit Shammai say: the husband’s heirs, divide with father’s heirs. And Beit Hillel say: The property its status, and marriage contract in the possession of the husband’s heirs, property that comes and goes with her, in the possession of the heirs of the father,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: If she dies, what should be done with her ketubah and with the assets that came in with her and those that went out with her? Beit Shammai says: The heirs of the husband shall divide with the heirs of the father. And Beit Hillel says: The assets remain in their possession, and the ketubah remains in the possession of the heirs of the husband. The assets that came in and went out with her - remain in the possession of the heirs of the father.

hebrew_text: הִנִּיחַ אָחִיו מָעוֹת — יִלָּקַח בָּהֶן קַרְקַע, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת. פֵּירוֹת הַתְּלוּשִׁין מִן הַקַּרְקַע — יִלָּקַח בָּהֶן קַרְקַע, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: his brother left money land is acquired with it, and consumes the produce. produce that is detached from the ground, land is acquired with it and consumes the produce.
llm_translation: He left his brother's coins - he shall take with them land, and he eats its fruits. Fruits detached from the land - he shall take with them land, and he eats the fruits.

hebrew_text: הַמְחוּבָּרִין בַּקַּרְקַע, אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: שָׁמִין אוֹתָן כַּמָּה הֵן יָפִין בְּפֵירוֹת, וְכַמָּה הֵן יָפִין בְּלֹא פֵּירוֹת, וְהַמּוֹתָר — יִלָּקַח בָּהֶן קַרְקַע, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: that is attached to the ground, Rabbi Meir says: One evaluates how much they are worth with produce, and how much they are worth without produce. And the surplus, land is acquired with it and consumes the produce.
llm_translation: The intertwined ones in the ground, Rabbi Meir said: We evaluate them how many are beautiful with fruits, and how many are beautiful without fruits, and the surplus - one may take the ground with them, and he eats the fruits.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: פֵּירוֹת הַמְחוּבָּרִין בַּקַּרְקַע — שֶׁלּוֹ. הַתְּלוּשִׁין מִן הַקַּרְקַע — כׇּל הַקּוֹדֵם זָכָה בָּהֶן. קָדַם הוּא — זָכָה, קָדְמָה הִיא — יִלָּקַח בָּהֶן קַרְקַע וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Produce that is attached to the ground his. that is detached from the ground, whoever first has acquired it. first, has acquired she first, land is acquired with it and he consumes the produce.
llm_translation: The sages say: Fruits attached to the ground - belong to it. Detached from the ground - whoever comes first, acquires them. If he came first - he acquires, if she came first - he takes the ground and eats the fruits.

hebrew_text: כְּנָסָהּ, הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאִשְׁתּוֹ לְכׇל דָּבָר. בִּלְבַד שֶׁתְּהֵא כְּתוּבָּתָהּ עַל נִכְסֵי בַּעְלָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: married her, her that of his wife in every sense, except that her marriage contract through the property of her first husband,
llm_translation: When she enters, she is like his wife in every matter. Only that her marriage contract should be written on the properties of her first husband.

hebrew_text: לֹא יֹאמַר לָהּ ״הֲרֵי כְּתוּבָּתִיךְ מוּנַּחַת עַל הַשֻּׁלְחָן״, אֶלָּא כׇּל נְכָסָיו אַחְרָאִין לִכְתוּבָּתָהּ. וְכֵן: לֹא יֹאמַר אָדָם לְאִשְׁתּוֹ ״הֲרֵי כְּתוּבָּתִיךְ מוּנַּחַת עַל הַשֻּׁלְחָן״, אֶלָּא כׇּל נְכָסָיו אַחְרָאִין לִכְתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: may not say to her: Your marriage contract is placed on the table. Rather, all property is mortgaged for her marriage contract And similarly, a man may not say to his wife: Your marriage contract is placed on the table. Rather, all his property is mortgaged for her marriage contract.
llm_translation: He shall not say to her, "Behold, your marriage contract is placed on the table," rather all his possessions are subject to her marriage contract. And similarly, a man shall not say to his wife, "Behold, your marriage contract is placed on the table," rather all his possessions are subject to her marriage contract.

hebrew_text: גֵּירְשָׁהּ — אֵין לָהּ אֶלָּא כְּתוּבָּה. הֶחְזִירָה — הֲרֵי הִיא כְּכׇל הַנָּשִׁים, וְאֵין לָהּ אֶלָּא כְּתוּבָּה בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: divorced her she has only her marriage contract, remarried her, she is like all women, and she has nothing but her marriage contract.
llm_translation: She was divorced - she has only a writ. He remarried her - behold, she is like all women, and she has only a writ alone.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁמֵּתָה, מִי קוֹבְרָהּ? יוֹרְשֵׁי הַבַּעַל קָבְרִי לַהּ דְּקָא יָרְתִי כְּתוּבָּה, אוֹ דִלְמָא יוֹרְשֵׁי הָאָב קָבְרִי לַהּ, דְּקָא יָרְתִי נְכָסִים הַנִּכְנָסִין וְהַיּוֹצְאִין עִמָּהּ? אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁמֵּתָה —
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before a widow awaiting her yavam who dies, who buries her? husband’s heirs bury her, as they inherit the marriage contract, or perhaps father’s heirs bury her, as they inherit property that comes and goes with her? Rav Amram said: Come hear As it is taught a widow waiting for her yavam who dies,
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: If a yevamah who was being guarded dies, who buries her? Do the heirs of the husband bury her because it is written in the document, or perhaps the heirs of the father bury her, as they inherit the property that comes in and goes out with her? Rav Amram said: Come and hear, as it was taught: If a yevamah who was being guarded dies —

hebrew_text: יוֹרְשֶׁיהָ יוֹרְשֵׁי כְּתוּבָּתָהּ חַיָּיבִין בִּקְבוּרָתָהּ. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: אַלְמָנָה נִיזּוֹנֶת מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִין, וּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ שֶׁלָּהֶן, וְאֵין חַיָּיבִין בִּקְבוּרָתָהּ. יוֹרְשֶׁיהָ יוֹרְשֵׁי כְתוּבָּתָהּ חַיָּיבִין בִּקְבוּרָתָהּ, וְאֵיזוֹהִי אַלְמָנָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ שְׁנֵי יוֹרְשִׁין? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: זוֹ שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם.
human_translation: her heirs, the heirs of her marriage contract, are obligated in her burial. Abaye said: We too learn A widow is sustained from the property of the orphans, and her earnings are theirs, and are not obligated in her burial. her heirs, the heirs of her marriage contract, are obligated in her burial. And who is the widow who has two heirs, You must say this a widow waiting for her yavam ,
llm_translation: The heirs of her heirs are obligated in her burial. Abaye said, we also learned: A widow is sustained from the property of orphans, and her handiwork is theirs, and they are not obligated in her burial. The heirs of her heirs are obligated in her burial. And who is a widow that has two heirs? One would say: This is a woman who is waiting for her brother-in-law.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, וְלֵימָא: אָח אֲנִי יוֹרֵשׁ. אִשְׁתּוֹ אֵין אֲנִי קוֹבֵר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִשּׁוּם דְּבָאִין עָלָיו מִשְּׁנֵי צְדָדִין: אִם אָחִיו יוֹרֵשׁ — יִקְבּוֹר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ. אִם אֵינוֹ קוֹבֵר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ — יִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: But let say: I inherit brother, his wife I not bury, Abaye said to him: because they come upon him from two sides, If he inherits his brother he should bury his wife. If he does not bury his wife, he should give her marriage contract
llm_translation: Rava said, and let us say: "I am the brother inheriting. His wife, I do not bury." Abaye said to him: Because they come upon him from two sides: If his brother inherits - he should bury his wife. If he does not bury his wife - he should give her ketubah.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי קָא אָמֵינָא: אָח אֲנִי יוֹרֵשׁ, אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ אֵין אֲנִי קוֹבֵר. וְאִי מִשּׁוּם כְּתוּבָּה — לֹא נִיתְּנָה כְּתוּבָּה לִגָּבוֹת מֵחַיִּים.
human_translation: said to him: I say as follows: I inherit brother, his wife I not bury, And if due to marriage contract, a marriage contract cannot be collected during lifetime
llm_translation: He said to him, thus I say: a brother I am inheriting, his wife I am not burying. And if because of a written document — a written document was not given to override life.

hebrew_text: מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאִית לֵיהּ מִדְרַשׁ כְּתוּבָּה — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי. וְשָׁמְעִינַן לְהוּ לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי דְּאָמְרִי: שְׁטָר הָעוֹמֵד לִגְבּוֹת כְּגָבוּי דָּמֵי!
human_translation: Who did you hear who is of one expounds the marriage contract Beit Shammai, and we have heard that Beit Shammai say a document that is ready to be collected is considered collected.
llm_translation: One who heard that there is to him a Midrash written - Beit Shammai. And we heard for them for Beit Shammai that they say: "A document that is standing to collect as if it were collected money!"

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: מֵתוּ בַּעֲלֵיהֶן עַד שֶׁלֹּא שָׁתוּ — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נוֹטְלוֹת כְּתוּבָה וְלֹא שׁוֹתוֹת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אוֹ שׁוֹתוֹת אוֹ לֹא נוֹטְלוֹת כְּתוּבָה.
human_translation: as we learned If the husbands died before drank Beit Shammai say: They take the marriage contract and do not drink, and Beit Hillel say: Either they drink or they do not take the marriage contract.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If their husbands died before they drank - Beit Shammai say: they receive their ketubah but do not drink, and Beit Hillel say: either they drink or they do not receive their ketubah.

hebrew_text: אוֹ שׁוֹתוֹת?! ״וְהֵבִיא הָאִישׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ אֶל הַכֹּהֵן״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֵיכָּא! אֶלָּא: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁלֹּא שׁוֹתוֹת — לֹא נוֹטְלוֹת כְּתוּבָה.
human_translation: Either they drink? The Merciful One states: “Then shall the man bring his wife to the priest” and there is no Rather, Since they do not drink, they do not take the marriage contract,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Or shotot?! "And the man brought his wife to the kohen," the Merciful One said, but it is not so! Rather, because they did not drink - they do not take a document.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נוֹטְלוֹת כְּתוּבָה וְלֹא שׁוֹתוֹת. וְאַמַּאי? סְפֵיקָא הוּא: סָפֵק זַנַּאי סָפֵק לָא זַנַּאי — וְקָאָתֵי סָפֵק וּמוֹצִיא מִידֵי וַדַּאי.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: They take the marriage contract and do not drink. But why It is a uncertainty: Perhaps she committed adultery; perhaps she did not commit adultery. and uncertain comes and supersedes certain
llm_translation: House of Shammai say: They take it written and not drink. And why? It is a doubt: Doubtful if it is wine, doubtful if it is not wine — and he is in a situation of doubt and he definitely removes himself.

hebrew_text: קָסָבְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: שְׁטָר הָעוֹמֵד לִגְבּוֹת — כְּגָבוּי דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Beit Shammai maintain: A document that is ready to be collected is considered collected.
llm_translation: The House of Shammai holds: A promissory note that is due to be collected - is like collecting actual money.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בָּעֵינַן: ״כְּשֶׁתִּנָּשְׂאִי לְאַחֵר תִּטְּלִי מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב לִיכִי״, וְלֵיכָּא?
human_translation: But we require When you marry another you take that which is written to you, and this is not
llm_translation: And this we need: "When you marry another, you shall remove what is written for you," and there is no such thing?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: יָבָם נָמֵי כְּאַחֵר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: yavam is also considered like another
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Yavam, also, like other, his blood.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רָבָא לְאַבָּיֵי בְּיַד רַב שְׁמַעְיָה בַּר זֵירָא: וּמִי נִתְּנָה כְּתוּבָּה לִגָּבוֹת מֵחַיִּים?
human_translation: Rava sent Abaye by way of Rav Shemaya bar Zeira: And can marriage contract be collected during lifetime?
llm_translation: Send to him Rava to Abbaye by the hand of Rav Shema'ya bar Zeira: "And who has been given in writing to collect from the living?"

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אַבָּא אוֹמֵר, שָׁאַלְתִּי אֶת סוֹמְכוֹס: הָרוֹצֶה שֶׁיִּמְכּוֹר בְּנִכְסֵי אָחִיו, כֵּיצַד הוּא עוֹשֶׂה? אִם כֹּהֵן הוּא — יַעֲשֶׂה סְעוּדָה וִיפַיֵּיס. אִם יִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא — מְגָרֵשׁ בְּגֵט וְיַחְזִיר.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi Abba says: I asked Sumakhos: who wants to sell his brother’s property how can he proceed? If he is a priest, he should prepare a feast and persuade If he is a Israelite, divorce with a bill of divorce, and remarry
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: Rabbi Abba says, I asked Symmachus: If one wishes to sell the property of his brother, how should he proceed? If he is a Kohen, he should make a feast and appease him. If he is an Israelite, he should divorce him with a bill of divorce and return it.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתִּין נִתְּנָה כְּתוּבָּה לִגָּבוֹת מֵחַיִּים, נְיַיחֵד לַהּ שִׁיעוּר כְּתוּבָּה, וְהַשְּׁאָר לִיזַבֵּין! וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, וְלוֹתְבַהּ מִמַּתְנִיתִין: לֹא יֹאמַר לָהּ הֲרֵי כְּתוּבָּתִיךְ מוּנַּחַת לִיךְ עַל הַשֻּׁלְחָן, אֶלָּא כׇּל נְכָסָיו אַחְרָאִין לִכְתוּבָּתָהּ?!
human_translation: And if it enters our mind a marriage contract can be collected during lifetime, Let him set aside for her the amount of the marriage contract, and the rest let him sell. And according to your reasoning, let him raise from the mishna, he may not say to her: Your marriage contract is placed on the table for you. Rather, all his property is mortgaged for her marriage contract.
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind that the document was given to collect from the living, let it be designated for her the exact amount written, and the rest to be left! And according to your reasoning, and learn it from the Mishnah: One should not say to her, "Behold, your document is placed before you on the table," rather all his possessions are liable for her document?!

hebrew_text: הָתָם עֵצָה טוֹבָה קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, סֵיפָא דְּקָתָנֵי: וְכֵן לֹא יֹאמַר אָדָם לְאִשְׁתּוֹ ״הֲרֵי כְּתוּבָּתִיךְ מוּנַּחַת לִיךְ עַל הַשֻּׁלְחָן״, אֶלָּא כׇּל נְכָסָיו אַחְרָאִין לִכְתוּבַּת אִשְׁתּוֹ — אִי בָּעֵי לֵיהּ לְזַבּוֹנֵי, הָכָא נָמֵי דְּלָא מָצֵי מְזַבֵּין?! אֶלָּא עֵצָה טוֹבָה קָמַשְׁמַע לַן, הָכָא נָמֵי עֵצָה טוֹבָה קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן,
human_translation: there teaches us good advice, As, if you do not say so, the latter clause which teaches: And similarly, a man may not say to his wife: Your marriage contract is placed on the table. Rather, all his property is mortgaged for her marriage contract. If he wants to sell, here too, may he not sell? Rather, teaches us good advice, here too, he teaches us good advice.
llm_translation: There, good advice is heard by us. For if you do not say so, the end of the teaching states: "And likewise, a man should not say to his wife, 'Behold, your marriage contract is placed before you on the table,' but all his possessions are subject to his wife's marriage contract - if he wants to sell them, can he not sell them?! Rather, good advice is heard by us here, good advice is heard by us here."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא קַשְׁיָא? דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא, מִשּׁוּם אֵיבָה.
human_translation: But of Rabbi Abba is difficult. of Rabbi Abba also not difficult, due to enmity.
llm_translation: Rather, is it not difficult according to Rabbi Abba? Rabbi Abba himself is not difficult, due to enmity.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּנְפַלָה לֵיהּ יְבָמָה בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא, בָּעֵי אֲחוּהּ לְמִפְסְלַהּ (לַהּ) בְּגִיטָּא מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: A certain man had a yevama who happened him in Pumbedita. His brother wanted to disqualify her from him by a bill of divorce,
llm_translation: That man who fell to him a yevamah in Pumbedita, he wants his brother to carve for her in a get from him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ — מִשּׁוּם נִכְסֵי? אֲנָא בְּנִכְסֵי פָּלֵיגְנָא לָךְ.
human_translation: said to him: What is your opinion? due to the property, I will divide the property with you.
llm_translation: He said to him: What is your opinion - because of the property? I argue with you based on the property.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: כֵּיוָן דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן לָא לִיזַבֵּין, אַף עַל גַּב דְּזַבֵּין — לָא הֲוָה זְבִינֵיהּ זְבִינֵי. דְּתַנְיָא: מִי שֶׁמֵּת וְהִנִּיחַ שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם, וְהִנִּיחַ נְכָסִים בְּמֵאָה מָנֶה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁכְּתוּבָּתָהּ אֵינָהּ אֶלָּא מָנֶה — לֹא יִמְכּוֹר, שֶׁכׇּל נְכָסָיו אַחְרָאִין לִכְתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Since the Sages said may not sell although he sold his sale is not sale. As it is taught one who died and left a widow waiting for her yavam and left property of one hundred maneh , although her marriage contract is only maneh , may not sell as all of his property is mortgaged for her marriage contract.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Since the Rabbis said not to marry, even though they did marry - his marriage is not a valid marriage. As it was taught: If a man died leaving a widow awaiting levirate marriage, and he left assets worth one hundred mana, even though her written marriage contract is only for one mana - she may not sell them, for all his assets are liable for her written marriage contract.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְכׇל הֵיכָא דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן לָא לִיזַבֵּין — אַף עַל גַּב דְּזַבֵּין לָא הֲוָה זְבִינֵיהּ זְבִינֵי? וְהָתְנַן: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים תִּמְכּוֹר, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים לֹא תִּמְכּוֹר, אֵלּוּ וְאֵלּוּ מוֹדִים שֶׁאִם מָכְרָה וְנָתְנָה — קַיָּים. שַׁלְחוּהָ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פַּפֵּי, שַׁלְחַהּ: כִּדְרַב יוֹסֵף.
human_translation: Abaye said to And anywhere that the Sages said may not sell, although he sold, his sale is no sale? But didn’t we learn Beit Shammai say: She may sell, and Beit Hillel say: She may not sell; these, and those, agree that if she sold or gave valid? They sent before Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappi, sent in accordance with of Rav Yosef.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And wherever it is stated the Sages did not agree — even though they did not agree, was their disagreement not a disagreement? And we learned: Beit Shammai says to sell, and Beit Hillel says not to sell, both these and those agree that if she sold and gave, it is valid. They sent it before Rabbi Chanina bar Pappi, she sent it: as Rav Yosef.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אַטּוּ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פַּפֵּי כִּיפֵי תְּלָה לַהּ? שַׁלְחוּהָ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב מִנְיוֹמֵי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נְחוּמִי, שַׁלְחַהּ: כִּדְאַבָּיֵי, וְאִי אָמַר בַּהּ רַב יוֹסֵף טַעְמָא אַחֲרִינָא שִׁלְחוּ לִי.
human_translation: Abaye said Is that to say Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappi has hung jewelry upon it, They sent before Rav Minyumi, son of Rav Naḥumi, sent in accordance with of Abaye, but if Rav Yosef states a different reason for it, send to me
llm_translation: Abaye said: Did Rabbi Chanina bar Pappai's skull hang? They sent it to Rav from the town of his son, Rav Nachumi. He sent it back: as Abaye said, and if Rav Yosef gives another reason, send it to me.

hebrew_text: נְפַק רַב יוֹסֵף דָּק וְאַשְׁכַּח דְּתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה נוֹשֶׁה בְּאָחִיו, וּמֵת וְהִנִּיחַ שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם, לֹא יֹאמַר: הוֹאִיל וְשֶׁאֲנִי יוֹרֵשׁ — הֶחְזַקְתִּי, אֶלָּא מוֹצִיאִין מִיָּבָם, וְיִקַּח בָּהֶן קַרְקַע וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Yosef went, examined and found As it is taught If one claimed from his brother and died and left a widow waiting for her yavam , may not say: Since I inherit I take possession Rather, one appropriates from the yavam , and he purchases land with it and he eats the produce.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef went out and found that it was taught: If one was married to his brother's wife, and he died leaving her for yibum, he should not say, "Since I inherit her, I have acquired her," but rather they should remove her from yibum, and he should take possession of the land and eat its fruits.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: דִּלְמָא דְּטָבָא לֵיהּ עֲבַדוּ לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תַּנָּא תָּנֵי מוֹצִיאִין, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ דְּטָבָא לֵיהּ עֲבַדוּ לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Perhaps they did for him which is good for him. said to him: The tanna teaches: One appropriates, and you say that they did for him which is good for him?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: perhaps they did it for him better. He said to him: a Tanna taught, we take out, and you say perhaps they did it for him better?

hebrew_text: הֲדוּר שַׁלְחוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב מִנְיוֹמֵי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נְחוּמִי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: זוֹ אֵינָהּ מִשְׁנָה.
human_translation: They again sent before Rav Minyumi, son of Rav Naḥumi. He said to them: So said Rav Yosef bar Minyumi Rav Naḥman said: This is not a mishna
llm_translation: Adorned, they sent her before Rav Minyomei, son of Rav Neḥumi. He said to them: Thus said Rav Yosef bar Minyomei said Rav Naḥman: This is not Mishnah.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּהָווּ לְהוּ מִטַּלְטְלִי, וּמִטַּלְטְלִי לִכְתוּבָּה לָא מְשַׁעְבְּדִי — דִּלְמָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מִטַּלְטְלִי מְשַׁעְבְּדִי לִכְתוּבָּה.
human_translation: What is the reason If we say because is movable property, and movable property is not mortgaged to a marriage contract, Perhaps it is Rabbi Meir, who said movable property is mortgaged to a marriage contract.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Perhaps because they were meant to be moved, and if they are moved, they are not considered permanent - for maybe it is according to Rabbi Meir, who said: If they are moved, they are considered permanent.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא — מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמַר לַהּ: אַתְּ לָאו בַּעֲלַת דְּבָרִים דִּידִי אַתְּ.
human_translation: Rather, because he says to her: You are not my litigant.
llm_translation: And rather — because he said to her: "You are not the mistress of my words."

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא רַבִּי נָתָן הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לַנּוֹשֶׁה בַּחֲבֵירוֹ מָנֶה, וַחֲבֵירוֹ בַּחֲבֵירוֹ, מִנַּיִן שֶׁמּוֹצִיאִין מִזֶּה וְנוֹתְנִין לָזֶה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנָתַן לַאֲשֶׁר אָשַׁם לוֹ״.
human_translation: perhaps it is Rabbi Natan. As it is taught Rabbi Natan says: From where that claims one hundred dinars of another, and the other of another, that one appropriates from this one, and gives it to this one, The verse states: “And he shall give it to him in respect of whom he has been guilty”
llm_translation: Perhaps it is Rabbi Natan. As it was taught, Rabbi Natan says: From where do we learn that one can appoint a proxy for his friend, and his friend for another friend, and from where do we learn that one can take from this and give to that? The Talmud teaches: "And he shall give it to the one who is guilty of the guilt."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: לָא אַשְׁכְּחַן תַּנָּא דְּמַחְמִיר תְּרֵי חוּמְרֵי בִּכְתוּבָּה, אֶלָּא אִי כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר אִי כְּרַבִּי נָתָן.
human_translation: Rather, We have not found a tanna who is stringent two stringencies with regard to a marriage contract. Rather, either in accordance with Rabbi Meir or in accordance with Rabbi Natan.
llm_translation: Rather: we did not find a Mishnah that is stringent in two matters in Scripture, rather either like Rabbi Meir or like Rabbi Nathan.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִם כֵּן, הַיְינוּ דִּשְׁמַעְנָא לֵיהּ לְאַבָּיֵי דְּאָמַר: ״זוֹ אֵינָהּ מִשְׁנָה״, וְלָא יָדַעְנָא מַאי הִיא.
human_translation: Rava said: If so, that which I heard from Abaye, who said: This is not a mishna, and I did not know what it is.
llm_translation: Rava said: If so, this is what we heard from Abbaye who said: "This is not a Mishnah," and we do not know what it is.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּנְפַלָה לֵיהּ יְבָמָה בְּמָתָא מַחְסֵיָא. בְּעָא אֲחוּהּ לְמִיפְסְלַהּ בְּגִיטָּא מִינֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ, אִי מִשּׁוּם נִכְסֵי — אֲנָא בְּנִכְסֵי פָּלֵיגְנָא לָךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִסְתְּפֵינָא דְּעָבְדַתְּ לִי כְּדַעֲבַיד פּוּמְבְּדִיתָאָה רַמָּאָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי בָּעֵית — פְּלוֹג לָךְ מֵהַשְׁתָּא.
human_translation: a certain man who had a yevama happen before him in Mata Meḥasya, his brother wanted to disqualify her from him by a bill of divorce. said to What is your opinion? If due to the property I will divide the property with you. said to him: I am scared that you will do to me like the swindler from Pumbedita did, said to him: If you wish, divide it for yourself from now.
llm_translation: That man who fell to him a yevamah in the city of Mahseya. He wanted his brother to disqualify her with a get from him. He said to him: What is your opinion, if due to property — I have divided my property for you. He said to him: I am afraid that you will do to me as Pumbedita did. He said to him: If you want — separate from now.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי: אַף עַל גַּב דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״לֵךְ וּמְשׁוֹךְ פָּרָה זוֹ וְלֹא תִּהְיֶה קְנוּיָה לְךָ אֶלָּא לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״, לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם קָנָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ עוֹמֶדֶת בַּאֲגַם.
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi said although when Rav Dimi came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan one who says to another: Go and pull this cow and it will be acquired for you only after thirty days, after thirty days he has acquired and even was standing in a meadow,
llm_translation: Master Bar Rav Ashei said: Even though Rav Dimi came and said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who says to his fellow, "Go and draw this cow, and it will not be acquired by you until after thirty days," after thirty days he acquires it, even if it is standing in a swamp.

hebrew_text: הָתָם — בְּיָדוֹ, הָכָא — לָאו בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: There, in power Here, not in his power
llm_translation: There — in his hand, here — not in his hand.

hebrew_text: וְהָא כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָא קָנֵי! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״קְנֵי מֵעַכְשָׁיו״, הָא דְּלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ ״קְנֵי מֵעַכְשָׁיו״.
human_translation: But when Ravin came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan not acquired not difficult, this when he says to him: Acquire from now, that when he did not say to him: Acquire from now.
llm_translation: And this, when Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: He did not acquire! It is not difficult: this that he said to him "acquire from now," this that he did not say to him "acquire from now."

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵעוּלָּא: יִבֵּם וְאַחַר כָּךְ חִילֵּק, מַהוּ? לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם. חִילֵּק וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִבֵּם, מַהוּ? לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם.
human_translation: They inquired of Ulla: performed levirate marriage and afterward divided what is He has done nothing. he divided and afterward performed levirate marriage, what is He has done nothing.
llm_translation: He asked him from his teaching: If he performed yibum and then divided the inheritance, what is the law? He did not fulfill his obligation and it is not considered a valid division. If he divided the inheritance and then performed yibum, what is the law? He did not fulfill his obligation and it is not considered a valid division.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הַשְׁתָּא יִבֵּם וְאַחַר כָּךְ חִילֵּק, לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם, חִילֵּק וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִבֵּם מִבַּעְיָא?! שְׁנֵי מַעֲשִׂים הֲווֹ.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet objects to this Now he performed levirate marriage and afterward divided he has done nothing, divided and afterward performed levirate marriage, is it necessary there were two incidents
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet objects to him: If he betrothed her and then divided his property, he did not do anything wrong, and there is no blemish. If he divided his property and then betrothed her, is it necessary?! These are two separate actions.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: בֵּין יִבֵּם וְאַחַר כָּךְ חִילֵּק, בֵּין חִילֵּק וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִבֵּם — לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם. וְהִלְכְתָא: לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם.
human_translation: When Ravin came he said Reish Lakish Whether he performed levirate marriage and afterward divided whether he divided afterward performed levirate marriage, he has done nothing. And the halakha he has done nothing.
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Reish Lakish said: Whether he performed yibum and then divided the inheritance, or divided the inheritance and then performed yibum - he has not done anything and has not completed anything. And the halakha is: he has not done anything and has not completed anything.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: פֵּירוֹת הַמְחוּבָּרִים לַקַּרְקַע — שֶׁלּוֹ. אַמַּאי? וְהָא כׇּל נְכָסָיו אַחְרָאִין וְעַרְבָאִין לִכְתוּבָּתָהּ! אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: תְּנִי — שֶׁלָּהּ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Produce that is attached to the ground is his. Why Doesn’t all of his property guarantee and security for her marriage contract? Reish Lakish said: teach: hers.
llm_translation: The sages say: Fruits attached to the ground - belong to it. Why? But all his other possessions are subject to his deed and pledge! Reish Lakish said: Teach - they are hers.

hebrew_text: כְּנָסָהּ — הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאִשְׁתּוֹ. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לוֹמַר שֶׁמְּגָרְשָׁהּ בְּגֵט וּמַחְזִירָהּ. מְגָרְשָׁהּ בְּגֵט פְּשִׁיטָא?
human_translation: he married her, she is like his wife. With regard to what halakha Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: to say that he divorces her with a bill of divorce and he may remarry her he divorces her with a bill of divorce obvious;
llm_translation: "Kenasah - behold she is like his wife. For what halakha? Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina said: to say that he divorces her with a get and returns her. He divorces her with a get - is it not obvious?"

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: ״וְיִבְּמָהּ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וַעֲדַיִין יִבּוּמִין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים עָלֶיהָ. לָא תִּיסְגֵּי לַהּ בְּגֵט אֶלָּא בַּחֲלִיצָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say the Merciful One states and consummate the levirate marriage” and the first levirate marriage is still upon her, it should not suffice for her by a bill of divorce, but by ḥalitza teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning: "and he shall take her in marriage" - the Merciful One said, and still the first brothers-in-law perform levirate marriage with her. She shall not be released from him except through halitzah, this is what we hear.

hebrew_text: מַחְזִירָהּ: פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: he may remarry her: obvious
llm_translation: Returning it: It is obvious!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מִצְוָה דִּרְמָא רַחֲמָנָא עֲלֵיהּ עַבְדַּהּ, וְהַשְׁתָּא תֵּיקוּם עֲלֵיהּ בְּאִיסּוּר אֵשֶׁת אָח, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say he has performed mitzva the Merciful One placed upon him and now she should stand to him with the prohibition a brother’s wife, teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? The commandment that the Merciful One has commanded concerning it, and now they establish concerning it with the prohibition of a brother's wife, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי! אָמַר קְרָא ״וּלְקָחָהּ לוֹ לְאִשָּׁה״. כֵּיוָן שֶׁלְּקָחָהּ — נַעֲשֵׂית כְּאִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: And say indeed, The verse states: “And he will take her to him to be his wife” he has taken her, she has become like his wife
llm_translation: And why not say it like this! The verse says, "and he shall take her to be his wife." Once he has taken her - she becomes like his wife.

hebrew_text: בִּלְבַד שֶׁתְּהֵא כְּתוּבָּתָהּ עַל נִכְסֵי בַּעְלָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן. מַאי טַעְמָא — אִשָּׁה הִקְנוּ לוֹ מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: except that her marriage contract is upon the property of her first husband. What is the reason from Heaven they acquired a wife for him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Only that its writing should be on the property of her first husband. What is the reason? — A woman is acquired for him from heaven.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לֵית לַהּ מֵרִאשׁוֹן, אִית לַהּ מִשֵּׁנִי. כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא קַלָּה בְּעֵינָיו לְהוֹצִיאָהּ.
human_translation: And if she does not have from the first she has from the second So that she will not be demeaned in his eyes such that divorce her.
llm_translation: And if she does not have from the first, she has from the second. So that it should not be light in his eyes to divorce her.

hebrew_text: לֹא יֹאמַר לָהּ ״הֲרֵי כְּתוּבָּתִיךְ״. מַאי וְכֵן?
human_translation: may not say to her: Here is your marriage contract, What And similarly,
llm_translation: He shall not say to her, "Behold your marriage contract." What is the reason? And so?

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָתָם הוּא דְּלָא כְּתַב לָהּ ״דִּקְנַאי וּדְקָנֵינָא״, אֲבָל הָכָא דִּכְתַב לַהּ ״דִּקְנַאי וּדְקָנֵינָא״, אֵימָא סָמְכָה דַּעְתַּהּ — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say is there, where not write for her that I have bought and that I will buy But here, where he did write for her That I have bought and that I will buy, say that she relies teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reason? There, because he did not write for her "I am zealous and I have zealously avenged," but here, since he wrote for her "I am zealous and I have zealously avenged," say: she relied on her opinion - it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: גֵּרְשָׁהּ — אֵין לָהּ אֶלָּא כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. גֵּרְשָׁהּ — אִין, לֹא גֵּרְשָׁהּ — לָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כִּדְרַבִּי אַבָּא.
human_translation: he divorced her she has only her marriage contract. he divorced her, yes, he did not divorce her, no, teaches us in accordance with Rabbi Abba,
llm_translation: She was divorced - she has only her written document. She was divorced - if yes, if not divorced - no. This teaches us like Rabbi Abba.

hebrew_text: הֶחְזִירָה — הֲרֵי הִיא כְּכׇל הַנָּשִׁים, וְאֵין לָהּ אֶלָּא כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. הֶחְזִירָה, מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: הַמְגָרֵשׁ אֶת הָאִשָּׁה וּמַחְזִירָה, עַל מְנָת כְּתוּבָּה רִאשׁוֹנָה מַחְזִירָהּ!
human_translation: remarried her, she is like all women, and she has nothing other her marriage contract. What is teaching us remarried her? We learned one who divorces a woman and remarries her, he remarries her on the basis of first marriage contract,
llm_translation: The pig — behold, it is like all women, and it has nothing except its writing. The pig, what does it teach us? We learned: One who divorces his wife and remarries her, he remarries her based on the original writing!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אִשְׁתּוֹ הוּא דְּאִיהוּ כְּתַב לַהּ כְּתוּבָּה מִינֵּיהּ, אֲבָל יְבִמְתּוֹ דְּלָא אִיהוּ כְּתַב לַהּ, הֵיכָא דְּגָרְשַׁהּ וְאַהְדְּרַהּ — אֵימָא כְּתוּבְּתַהּ מִינֵּיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say it is a wife, since he writes for her a marriage contract from him, But his yevama , where he did not write for her where he divorced her and remarried her, say her marriage contract from him teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? His wife, he is the one who wrote a document for her, but his yevamah, if he did not write for her, in a case where he divorced her and remarried her — say that her document is from him, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ כּוֹתְבִין לִבְתוּלָה מָאתַיִם וּלְאַלְמָנָה מָנֶה, וְהָיוּ מַזְקִינִין וְלֹא הָיוּ נוֹשְׂאִין נָשִׁים, עַד שֶׁבָּא שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח וְתִיקֵּן, כׇּל נְכָסָיו אַחְרָאִין לִכְתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: At first they would write for a virgin two hundred and for a widow one hundred dinars. and would grow old and would not marry women, until Shimon ben Shataḥ came and instituted all of his property is guaranteed for her marriage contract.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Initially, they would write for a virgin two hundred, and for a widow they would allocate. And they would grow old and not marry women, until Shimon ben Shatach came and established: all his assets are designated for her ketubah.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ כּוֹתְבִין לִבְתוּלָה מָאתַיִם וּלְאַלְמָנָה מָנֶה, וְהָיוּ מַזְקִינִין וְלֹא הָיוּ נוֹשְׂאִין נָשִׁים. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיִּהְיוּ מַנִּיחִין אוֹתָהּ בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ. וַעֲדַיִין: כְּשֶׁהוּא כּוֹעֵס עָלֶיהָ, אוֹמֵר לָהּ: ״לְכִי אֵצֶל כְּתוּבָּתִיךְ״,
human_translation: That is also taught At first they would write for a virgin two hundred and for a widow one hundred dinars, and they would grow old and would not marry women, instituted that they should place it, in her father’s house, And still when he was angry at say to her: Go to your marriage contract,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Initially, they would write for a virgin two hundred, and for a widow one hundred. And they would age and not marry women. They established that they should place her in her father's house. And still, when he is angry with her, he says to her: "Go to your writing."

hebrew_text: הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיִּהְיוּ מַנִּיחִין אוֹתָהּ בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ. עֲשִׁירוֹת עוֹשׂוֹת אוֹתָהּ קְלָתוֹת שֶׁל כֶּסֶף וְשֶׁל זָהָב, עֲנִיּוֹת הָיוּ עוֹשׂוֹת אוֹתָהּ עָבִיט שֶׁל מֵימֵי רַגְלַיִם.
human_translation: instituted that they would place it in her father-in-law’s house, wealthy would craft baskets of silver and of gold, poor would craft it a large vessel of urine,
llm_translation: They established that they should place it in her father's house. The wealthy women make it of silver and gold, the poor women make it of the water of the feet.

hebrew_text: וַעֲדַיִין, כְּשֶׁכּוֹעֵס עָלֶיהָ אוֹמֵר לָהּ: ״טְלִי כְּתוּבָּתִיךְ וָצֵאִי״. עַד שֶׁבָּא שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח וְתִיקֵּן, שֶׁיְּהֵא כּוֹתֵב לָהּ: כׇּל נְכָסַי אַחְרָאִין לִכְתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: And still, when he was angry at her he say to her: Take your marriage contract and leave, until Shimon ben Shataḥ came and instituted that he should write to her: All my property is guaranteed for her marriage contract,
llm_translation: And still, when he is angry with her, he says to her: "Take your writing and go out." Until Shimon ben Shatach came and enacted that he should write for her: "All my property is obligated for your writing."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הָאִשָּׁה
llm_translation: We will return to you, woman.

hebrew_text: הַכּוֹתֵב לְאִשְׁתּוֹ : ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי בִּנְכָסַיִךְ״ — הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹכֵל פֵּרוֹת בְּחַיֶּיהָ, וְאִם מֵתָה יוֹרְשָׁהּ. אִם כֵּן, לָמָּה כָּתַב לָהּ ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי בִּנְכָסַיִךְ״? שֶׁאִם מָכְרָה וְנָתְנָה — קַיָּים.
human_translation: One who writes for his wife I have no legal or involvement with your property, may consume the produce in her lifetime. And if she dies he inherits her. If so, why write for her: I have no legal or involvement with your property? that if she sold or gave binding,
llm_translation: He who writes to his wife: "I have no claim in your property" - he may eat the fruits during her lifetime, and if she dies, her heirs. If so, why did he write to her "I have no claim in your property"? Because if she sells and gives away - it is valid.

hebrew_text: כָּתַב לָהּ ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי בִּנְכָסַיִךְ וּבְפֵירוֹתֵיהֶן״ — הֲרֵי זֶה אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל פֵּרוֹת בְּחַיֶּיהָ, וְאִם מֵתָה — יוֹרְשָׁהּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אוֹכֵל פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת. עַד שֶׁיִּכְתּוֹב לַהּ ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי בִּנְכָסַיִךְ וּבְפֵירוֹתֵיהֶן וּבְפֵירֵי פֵירוֹתֵיהֶן עַד עוֹלָם״.
human_translation: he writes for her: I have no legal or involvement with your property or with its produce, he may not consume the produce during her lifetime, but if she dies he inherit her. Rabbi Yehuda says: He always consumes the produce of the produce. until he writes for her: I have no legal or involvement with your property, or with its produce, or with the produce of its produce forever.
llm_translation: He wrote to her, "Judgment and matters I have no in your property and in their fruits" — behold this one does not eat the fruits in her lifetime, and if she dies — her heirs inherit her. Rabbi Yehuda says: Always eat the fruits of the fruits. Until it is written to her, "Judgment and matters I have no in your property and in their fruits and in the fruits of their fruits forever."

hebrew_text: כָּתַב לַהּ ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי בִּנְכָסַיִךְ וּבְפֵירוֹתֵיהֶן וּבְפֵירֵי פֵירוֹתֵיהֶן בְּחַיַּיִךְ וּבְמוֹתֵךְ״ — אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת בְּחַיֶּיהָ, וְאִם מֵתָה — אֵינוֹ יוֹרְשָׁהּ. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אִם מֵתָה — יִירָשֶׁנָּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּתְנֶה עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה, וְכׇל הַמַּתְנֶה עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה — תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל.
human_translation: he writes for her: I have no legal or involvement with your property or with its produce, or with the produce of its produce, in your lifetime and after your death, he may not consume the produce in her lifetime. And if she dies, he does not inherit her. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: If she dies, he does inherit her, because stipulates counter to that which is written in the Torah. and whoever stipulates counter to that which is written in the Torah, his stipulation is void.
llm_translation: He wrote to her, "Judgment and words I have no in your possessions and in their fruits and in the fruits of their fruits in your life and in your death" — he does not eat the fruits in her lifetime, and if she dies — he does not inherit her. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: If she dies — he shall inherit her, because he made a condition based on what is written in the Torah, and anyone who makes a condition based on what is written in the Torah — his condition is valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: ״הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשְׁתּוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya taught One who says to his wife;
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Chiya taught: "One who says to his wife..."

hebrew_text: וְכִי כְּתַב לַהּ הָכִי, מַאי הָוֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי עַל שָׂדֶה זוֹ״, ״וְאֵין לִי עֵסֶק בָּהּ״, ״וְיָדַי מְסוּלָּקֹת הֵימֶנָּה״ — לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם!
human_translation: And if he wrote this to her, what of it? But isn’t it taught One who says, to another I have no legal or involvement with this field, or I have no dealings with it, or my hands are removed from it, has not said anything?
llm_translation: And if he wrote to her thus, what is the ruling? And it was taught: One who says to his fellow, "I have no claim on this field," "I have no business with it," "and my hands are removed from it" — he has not said anything!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: בְּכוֹתֵב לָהּ וְעוֹדָהּ אֲרוּסָה, כִּדְרַב כָּהֲנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: נַחֲלָה הַבָּאָה לְאָדָם מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר — אָדָם מַתְנֶה עָלֶיהָ שֶׁלֹּא יִירָשֶׁנָּה, וְכִדְרָבָא. דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הָאוֹמֵר ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי בְּתַקָּנַת חֲכָמִים כְּגוֹן זוֹ״ — שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ.
human_translation: the school of Rabbi Yannai say: to one who writes for her while she is still betrothed. in accordance with Rav Kahana, as Rav Kahana said: an inheritance that comes to a person from another place, the person can stipulate with regard to it that he will not inherit it. And in accordance with Rava, as Rava said: one who says: I do not want an ordinance of the Sages such as this listens to him.
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Yannai said: If one writes for her and betroths her, she is considered betrothed, in accordance with Rav Kahana. For Rav Kahana said: If a person acquires property from another place, the person must make a stipulation that they will not inherit it, in accordance with Rava. For Rava said: One who says, "I do not agree with the enactment of the sages, such as this one," we listen to him.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״כְּגוֹן זוֹ״? כִּדְרַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: יְכוֹלָה אִשָּׁה שֶׁתֹּאמַר לְבַעְלָהּ ״אֵינִי נִיזּוֹנֶת וְאֵינִי עוֹשָׂה״.
human_translation: What Such as this that of Rav Huna, Rav said As Rav Huna said Rav said a woman is able say to her husband: I will not be sustained I will not work,
llm_translation: What is "such as this"? Like Rav Huna said in the name of Rav. For Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: Can a woman say to her husband, "I am not nourished and I do not work"?

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ נְשׂוּאָה נָמֵי?
human_translation: If that is so, even married, also
llm_translation: If so, even if she is married?
