hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נְשׂוּאָה — יָדוֹ כְּיָדָהּ. רָבָא אָמַר: יָדוֹ עֲדִיפָא מִיָּדָהּ. נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ לְשׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם.
human_translation: Abaye said: a married his hand, is like her hand. Rava said: his hand is preferable to her hand, practical difference of a widow awaiting her brother-in-law [ yavam ]
llm_translation: Abaye said: A married woman - her hand is like her hand. Rava said: Her hand is preferable to her hand. It emerged from her to the levirate bondswoman.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: קָנוּ מִיָּדוֹ, מַהוּ? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מִדִּין וּדְבָרִים קָנוּ מִיָּדוֹ. רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: מִגּוּפָהּ שֶׁל קַרְקַע קָנוּ מִיָּדוֹ. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִילְּתָא דְּרַב יוֹסֵף
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is performed an act of acquisition from him? Rav Yosef said: They acquired from him I have no legal or involvement Rav Naḥman said: they acquired the land itself from him. Abaye said: statement of Rav Yosef is reasonable
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: If one acquires land from his hand, what is the law? Rav Yosef said: They acquired it from his hand through a document and words. Rav Nachman said: They acquired it from his hand through the body of the ground. Abaye said: The matter of Rav Yosef is reasonable.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹרֵר. אֲבָל בְּעוֹמֵד, מִגּוּפָהּ שֶׁל קַרְקַע קָנוּ מִיָּדוֹ.
human_translation: in one who objects However, in one who waits one acquired from him the land itself,
llm_translation: In the case of "b'eorer," but in the case of "be'omed," they acquired the ground's body from his hand.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: הִלְכְתָא, מִגּוּפָהּ שֶׁל קַרְקַע קָנוּ מִיָּדוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר: בְּעוֹרֵר אוֹ בְּעוֹמֵד? לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ, לְכִדְרַב יוֹסֵף. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי. כְּלוֹמַר: לָא סְבִירָא לִי.
human_translation: Ameimar said: The halakha one acquired from him the land itself. Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: with regard to one who objects or with regard to one who waits? With regard to what is a practical difference? to of Rav Yosef. said to him: I did not hear That is to say, I do not hold
llm_translation: Amemar said: The halakha is that one acquires the body of the ground immediately. Rav Ashe said to Amemar: By stirring or by standing? What difference does it make according to Rav Yosef? He said to him: I do not agree. Meaning: I do not think so.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן לָמָּה כָּתַב לָהּ וְכוּ׳. וְתֵימָא לֵיהּ: מִכׇּל מִילֵּי סַלֵּיקְתְּ נַפְשָׁךְ! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: יַד בַּעַל הַשְּׁטָר עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה.
human_translation: If so, why write for her: And say to him: You removed yourself from everything? Abaye said: the owner of the document is at a disadvantage.
llm_translation: "If so, why did he write to her, etc." And if you wish, say to him: "You have exhausted all the words!" Abaye said: "The hand of the holder of the document is on the lower part."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא מִפֵּירֵי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״בּוּצִינָא טָב מִקָּרָא״.
human_translation: And say from the produce? Abaye said: a cucumber is better than a gourd
llm_translation: And why not from the fruits? Abaye said: "A verse is better than a date."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא מִיְּרוּשָּׁה! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִיתָה שְׁכִיחָא, מְכִירָה לָא שְׁכִיחָא. וְכִי מְסַלֵּיק אִינִישׁ נַפְשֵׁיהּ מִמִּילְּתָא דְּלָא שְׁכִיחָא, מִמִּילְּתָא דִּשְׁכִיחָא לָא מְסַלֵּיק אִינִישׁ נַפְשֵׁיהּ. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר, ״בִּנְכָסַיִיךְ״ — וְלֹא בְּפֵירוֹתֵיהֶן, ״בִּנְכָסַיִיךְ״ — וְלֹא לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: And say from the inheritance? Abaye said: Death common, a sale not common, And when a person removes himself, from an uncommon matter. a person does not remove himself from something that is common. Rav Ashi said to your property, not to its produce. To your property, But not after death.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And why not from inheritance! Abaye said: Death is common, but selling is not common. When a person removes himself from a matter that is not common, from a matter that is common he does not remove himself. Rav Ashi said, 'With your estates' — and not with their fruits, 'With your estates' — and not after death."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם הוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵלּוּ הֵן פֵּירוֹת וְאֵלּוּ הֵן פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת? הִכְנִיסָה לוֹ קַרְקַע וְעָשְׂתָה פֵּירוֹת — הֲרֵי הֵן פֵּירוֹת. מָכַר פֵּירוֹת וְלָקַח מֵהֶן קַרְקַע וְעָשְׂתָה פֵּירוֹת — הֲרֵי הֵן פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: He always consumes the produce of the produce. The Sages taught Which is produce, and which is produce of the produce? she brought for land that produced produce, this is produce. sold produce and purchased land from their and produced produce, this is the produce of the produce.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Always he eats fruits of fruits. The Rabbis taught: What are fruits and what are fruits of fruits? If he entered and made it ground and made fruits - behold they are fruits. If he sold fruits and took from them ground and made fruits - behold they are fruits of fruits.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה ״פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת״ דַּוְקָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא ״עַד עוֹלָם״ דַּוְקָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא תַּרְוַיְיהוּ דַּוְקָא?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before According to Rabbi Yehuda, specifically produce of the produce Or, perhaps specifically forever, Or perhaps specifically both of the
llm_translation: He asked them: Is it specifically "the fruit of fruits" according to Rabbi Yehuda, or perhaps specifically "forever," or perhaps both specifically?

hebrew_text: אִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר ״פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת״ דַּוְקָא, ״עַד עוֹלָם״ לְמָה לִי? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: כֵּיוָן דִּכְתַב לַהּ ״פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת״, כְּמַאן דִּכְתַב לַהּ ״עַד עוֹלָם״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: If you say specifically produce of the produce why do I forever? This teaches us since he wrote to her: Produce of the produce, it is as though he wrote to her forever,
llm_translation: If you want to say "the fruits of his fruits" specifically, why do I need "forever"? This teaches us: Once it writes for it "the fruits of his fruits," it is similar to one who writes for it "forever."

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר ״עַד עוֹלָם״ דַּוְקָא, ״פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת״ לְמָה לִי? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: אַף עַל גַּב דִּכְתַב לַהּ ״פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת״, אִי כְּתַב לַהּ ״עַד עוֹלָם״ — אִין, אִי לָא — לָא.
human_translation: And if you say specifically forever, why do I Produce of the produce? This teaches us although he wrote to her: Produce of the produce, if he wrote to her forever, yes, if not not
llm_translation: And if you might say "forever" specifically, "the fruit of fruits" why do I need it? This teaches us: even though it is written for it "the fruit of fruits," if it had written for it "forever" - yes, if not - no.

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר תַּרְוַיְיהוּ דַּוְקָא, תַּרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי? צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי כְּתַב לַהּ ״פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת״, וְלֹא כְּתַב לָהּ ״עַד עוֹלָם״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת הוּא דְּלָא אָכֵיל, אֲבָל פֵּירָא דְּפֵירֵי פֵירוֹת — אָכֵיל, לְהָכִי אִיצְטְרִיךְ ״עַד עוֹלָם״. וְאִי כְּתַב לַהּ ״עַד עוֹלָם״, וְלָא כְּתַב לָהּ ״פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: לְעוֹלָם אַפֵּירוֹת קָאֵי, לְהָכִי אִיצְטְרִיךְ ״פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת״.
human_translation: And if you say specifically both of the why do I two necessary for if he had written for her Produce of the produce, and not written for her: Forever, I would say it is the produce of the produce that he may not consume, but the produce of the produce of the produce he may consume. For this necessary forever. And if he had written for her Forever, and not written for her: Produce of the produce, I would say forever is referring to the produce, For this necessary produce of the produce.
llm_translation: And if you might say, "Their desire specifically," why do I need two? It is necessary, for if one wrote for her "fruit of fruits" and did not write for her "forever," I would say: It is the fruit of fruits that one does not eat, but the fruit itself of the fruit of fruits—one eats. Therefore, "forever" is required. And if one wrote for her "forever" and did not write for her "fruit of fruits," I would say: Forever stands for fruits, therefore "fruit of fruits" is required.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ, כָּתַב לָהּ: ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי בִּנְכָסַיִיךְ וּבְפֵירֵי פֵירוֹת״, מַהוּ שֶׁיֹּאכַל פֵּירוֹת? מִפֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת סַלֵּיק נַפְשֵׁיהּ, מִפֵּירֵי לָא סַלֵּיק נַפְשֵׁיהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא: מִכֹּל מִילֵּי סַלֵּיק נַפְשֵׁיהּ?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before the husband wrote to his wife: I have no claim to your property or to the produce of your produce, what is that he may consume the produce he removed himself from the produce of the produce, from the produce he has not removed himself? Or perhaps he has removed himself from all matters,
llm_translation: He asked them: If he wrote to her, "I have no claim on your property and on the produce of your fruits," what may he eat of the fruits? If he eats of the produce of the fruits, his soul is satisfied; if he eats of other fruits, his soul is not satisfied. Or perhaps: from all matters his soul is satisfied?

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא דְּמִכֹּל מִילֵּי סַלֵּיק נַפְשֵׁיהּ. דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ מִפֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת סַלֵּיק נַפְשֵׁיהּ, מִפֵּירֵי לָא סַלֵּיק נַפְשֵׁיהּ: כֵּיוָן דְּאַכְלִינְהוּ לְפֵירוֹת — פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת מֵהֵיכָא?
human_translation: obvious that he has removed himself from all matters, for if you say he has removed himself from the produce of the produce, from the produce he has not removed himself, since he consumes the produce, from where produce of the produce?
llm_translation: The straightforwardness of all matters, his soul departs. For if you say from the fruits of fruits his soul departs, from non-fruits his soul does not depart: since he ate them for the sake of fruits - where are the fruits of fruits from?

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ — הָא דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם הוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת כּוּ׳. כֵּיוָן דְּאַכְלִינְהוּ לְפֵירֵי, פֵּירֵי פֵירוֹת מֵהֵיכָא? אֶלָּא בִּדְשַׁיַּירָא, הָכָא נָמֵי בִּדְשַׁיַּיר.
human_translation: But according to your reasoning, as we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: He always consumes the produce of the produce, Since he consumes the produce, from where produce of the produce? Rather, to one who left over here too, of one who left over
llm_translation: "And to titaimakh - this that we learned, Rabbi Yehuda says: One should always eat the fruits of his fruits. Since he ate them as fruits, where are the fruits of his fruits from? Rather, in the place of the titaimakh, here too in the place of the titaimakh."

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְלָא מִטַּעְמֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Rav said: halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel but not his reasoning.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says thus. Rav said: The halakha is according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, but not for his reasons.

hebrew_text: מַאי הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְלָא מִטַּעְמֵיהּ? אִילֵּימָא הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּאָמַר: אִם מֵתָה יִירָשֶׁנָּה, וְלָאו מִטַּעְמֵיהּ, דְּאִילּוּ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: מַתְנֶה עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה — תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל, וְרַב סָבַר: תְּנָאוֹ קַיָּים, וְקָסָבַר: יְרוּשַּׁת הַבַּעַל דְּרַבָּנַן, וַחֲכָמִים עָשׂוּ חִיזּוּק לְדִבְרֵיהֶם יוֹתֵר מִשֶּׁל תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: What is halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, but not his reasoning? If we say the halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said if she dies he inherits her, but not reasoning, as Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds stipulates counter to that which is written in the Torah, his condition is void, and Rav hold his condition is valid. But for he holds the inheritance of a husband by rabbinic and the Sages reinforced their pronouncements with greater than Torah law
llm_translation: What is the halakha like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and not according to his reasoning? Perhaps the halakha is like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said: If she dies, he shall inherit her. But not according to his reasoning, for if Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds that if one stipulates something contrary to what is written in the Torah, the stipulation is null and void, and Rav holds that the stipulation is valid, and he maintains that the husband's inheritance is in accordance with the words of the Sages more than with those of the Torah.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַב תְּנָאוֹ קַיָּים? וְהָא אִיתְּמַר: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין לְךָ עָלַי אוֹנָאָה, רַב אָמַר: יֵשׁ לוֹ עָלָיו אוֹנָאָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין לוֹ עָלָיו אוֹנָאָה.
human_translation: And Rav hold his condition is valid? But it was stated: One who says to another: on the condition that you have no fraud against me, Rav said: He does have fraud against him, And Shmuel said: He does not have fraud against him.
llm_translation: And Rav thought, does the Tanna hold that the agreement is valid? But it was stated: One who says to his fellow, "On condition that you have no claim of ona'ah against me," Rav said: He has a claim of ona'ah against him. And Shmuel said: He has no claim of ona'ah against him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל דְּאָמַר: הַמַּתְנֶה עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה — תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל, וְלָאו מִטַּעְמֵיהּ, דְּאִילּוּ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: מֵתָה — יִירָשֶׁנָּה, וְרַב סָבַר: מֵתָה — לֹא יִירָשֶׁנָּה.
human_translation: Rather, The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said: One who stipulates counter to that which is written in the Torah, his condition is void, but not his reasoning. As Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds died, he inherits her, and Rav holds she died he does not inherit from her.
llm_translation: Rather: Halacha like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel who said: One who stipulates on what is written in the Torah - his stipulation is nullified, and not for its reason, for even though Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: if she dies - he shall inherit her, and Rav holds: if she dies - he shall not inherit her.

hebrew_text: הַאי מִטַּעְמֵיהּ וְלָא כְּהִילְכְתֵיהּ הוּא!
human_translation: This his reasoning but not in accordance with his halakha ,
llm_translation: This reason and not according to his usual practice it is!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל דְּאָמַר אִם מֵתָה יִירָשֶׁנָּה, וְלָאו מִטַּעְמֵיהּ, דְּאִילּוּ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל — הָא בִּדְרַבָּנַן תְּנָאוֹ קַיָּים. וְרַב סָבַר אֲפִילּוּ בִּדְרַבָּנַן — תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל.
human_translation: Rather, The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said if she died he inherits her, but not his reasoning. As Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds in Torah his condition is void, in rabbinic his condition is valid; and Rav holds even in rabbinic his condition is void.
llm_translation: Rather: the halakha is according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel who said if she dies, he shall inherit her, and not for his reasoning, for even if Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds that a Tannaite ruling is annulled, it stands according to the Rabbis. And Rav holds that even according to the Rabbis, the ruling is annulled.

hebrew_text: הַאי כְּטַעְמֵיהּ וּכְהִילְכְתֵיהּ הוּא, וְרַב מוֹסִיף הוּא!
human_translation: This in accordance with his reasoning and in accordance with his halakha , and Rav is adding
llm_translation: This is his reasoning and his practice, and Rav adds!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל דְּאָמַר אִם מֵתָה יִירָשֶׁנָּה, וְלָאו מִטַּעְמֵיהּ, דְּאִילּוּ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר יְרוּשַּׁת הַבַּעַל דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וְכׇל הַמַּתְנֶה עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה — תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל. וְרַב סָבַר: יְרוּשַּׁת הַבַּעַל דְּרַבָּנַן, וַחֲכָמִים עָשׂוּ חִיזּוּק לְדִבְרֵיהֶם כְּשֶׁל תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rather, The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said if she died he inherits her, but not his reasoning. As Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds the inheritance of a husband by Torah and whoever stipulates counter to that which is written in the Torah, his condition is void; and Rav holds the inheritance of a husband by rabbinic the Sages reinforced their pronouncements with of Torah law
llm_translation: Rather: the halakha is according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel who said if she dies, he shall inherit her, and not according to his reasoning, for even Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds that the inheritance of the husband is from the Torah, and any stipulation based on what is written in the Torah — its stipulation is nullified. And Rav holds: the inheritance of the husband is Rabbinic, and the Sages made a strengthening of their words like that of the Torah.

hebrew_text: וְרַב סָבַר יְרוּשַּׁת הַבַּעַל דְּרַבָּנַן? וְהָתְנַן, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא אוֹמֵר: הַיּוֹרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, יַחְזִיר לִבְנֵי מִשְׁפָּחָה, וִינַכֶּה לָהֶן מִן הַדָּמִים.
human_translation: And Rav hold the inheritance of a husband by rabbinic But didn’t we learn Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says: One who inherits his wife must return to family members and deduct for them of the monetary
llm_translation: Rav holds: Does the inheritance of the husband's estate belong to the Sages? And it was taught: Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka says: If one inherits his wife, he shall return to her family members, and he shall pay them from the blood.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: מַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר יְרוּשַּׁת הַבַּעַל דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, אַמַּאי יַחְזִיר? וְאִי דְּרַבָּנַן, דָּמִים מַאי עֲבִידְתַּיְיהוּ?
human_translation: And we discussed What does hold? If holds the inheritance of a husband by Torah why must he return And if by rabbinic what is the purpose of money
llm_translation: We were learning in it: What does he hold? If he holds the inheritance of the husband is biblical, why should he return? And if it is rabbinic, what can they do with the blood?

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב: לְעוֹלָם קָסָבַר יְרוּשַּׁת הַבַּעַל דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּכְגוֹן שֶׁהוֹרִישַׁתּוּ אִשְׁתּוֹ בֵּית הַקְּבָרוֹת, מִשּׁוּם פְּגַם מִשְׁפָּחָה אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן לִישְׁקוֹל דְּמֵי וְלַיהְדַּר.
human_translation: And Rav said: Actually, holds the inheritance of a husband by Torah and where his wife bequeathed to him graveyard. Due to a family flaw, the Sages said he should take compensation and return
llm_translation: And Rav said: Always he holds that the inheritance of the husband is from the Torah, and for example, if his wife inherited for him a burial plot, due to a blemish in the family, the Rabbis say to sell it and to dwell.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי ״יְנַכֶּה לָהֶן מִן הַדָּמִים״ — דְּמֵי קֶבֶר אִשְׁתּוֹ. כִּדְתַנְיָא: הַמּוֹכֵר קִבְרוֹ, וְדֶרֶךְ קִבְרוֹ, מַעֲמָדוֹ, וּמְקוֹם הֶסְפֵּידוֹ — בָּאִין בְּנֵי מִשְׁפָּחָה וְקוֹבְרִין אוֹתוֹ בְּעַל כׇּרְחוֹ, מִשּׁוּם פְּגַם מִשְׁפָּחָה!
human_translation: And what is And deduct for them of the monetary monetary of his wife’s grave. As it is taught one who sells his grave, or path his grave, the place stand or the place of his eulogies, the members family may come and bury him against wishes due to a family flaw,
llm_translation: "And what is meant by 'they shall be compensated from the blood'? — The value of his wife's burial. As it was taught: One who sells his burial plot, the path to his burial plot, his standing place, and the place of his eulogy — his family members come and bury him against his will, on account of the disgrace to the family!"

hebrew_text: רַב לְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא קָאָמַר, וְלֵיהּ לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav spoke in accordance with the reasoning of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka. but he himself does not hold accordingly.
llm_translation: Rav according to his reasoning of Rabbi Yochanan ben Baroka was saying, and to him it does not seem correct.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁמֵּת וְהִנִּיחַ אִשָּׁה וּבַעַל חוֹב וְיוֹרְשִׁין, וְהָיָה לוֹ פִּקָּדוֹן אוֹ מִלְוָה בְּיַד אֲחֵרִים, רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: יִנָּתְנוּ לַכּוֹשֵׁל שֶׁבָּהֶן. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין מְרַחֲמִין בַּדִּין, אֶלָּא יִנָּתְנוּ לַיּוֹרְשִׁין. שֶׁכּוּלָּן צְרִיכִין שְׁבוּעָה, וְאֵין הַיּוֹרְשִׁין צְרִיכִין שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: one who died and left a wife, and a creditor and heirs, and he had a deposit or a loan in the possession of others, Rabbi Tarfon says: will be given to the weakest of them, Rabbi Akiva says: One is not merciful in judgment. Rather, will be given to the heirs, as all require an oath but the heirs do not require an oath.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who dies and leaves behind a wife, a creditor, and heirs, and had a deposit or loan in the hands of others, Rabbi Tarfon says: Let it be given to the stumbling block among them. Rabbi Akiva says: We do not show mercy in matters of judgment, rather let it be given to the heirs. All of them require an oath, but the heirs do not require an oath.

hebrew_text: הִנִּיחַ פֵּירוֹת תְּלוּשִׁין מִן הַקַּרְקַע, כׇּל הַקּוֹדֵם בָּהֶן — זָכָה בָּהֶן. זָכְתָה אִשָּׁה יוֹתֵר מִכְּתוּבָּתָהּ, וּבַעַל חוֹב יוֹתֵר עַל חוֹבוֹ, הַמּוֹתָר — רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: יִנָּתְנוּ לַכּוֹשֵׁל שֶׁבָּהֶן. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין מְרַחֲמִין בַּדִּין, אֶלָּא יִנָּתְנוּ לַיּוֹרְשִׁין. שֶׁכּוּלָּם צְרִיכִין שְׁבוּעָה, וְאֵין הַיּוֹרְשִׁין צְרִיכִין שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: left produce detached from the ground, whoever first of them acquired wife acquired more than her marriage contract, or the creditor more than his debt, the surplus? Rabbi Tarfon says: will be given to the weakest of them, Rabbi Akiva says: One is not merciful in judgment. Rather, it will be given to the heirs, as all require an oath but the heirs do not require an oath.
llm_translation: He placed detached fruits from the ground, whoever preceded in them - acquired in them. A woman acquired more than her written document, and a creditor more than his debt, the one who is permissible - Rabbi Tarfon says: they should be given to the one who stumbles in them. Rabbi Akiva says: there is no mercy in judgment, rather they should be given to the heirs. For all of them require an oath, and the heirs do not require an oath.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנֵי מִלְוָה, לָמָּה לִי לְמִיתְנֵי פִּקָּדוֹן? צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי תְּנָא מִלְוָה, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, מִשּׁוּם דְּמִלְוָה לְהוֹצָאָה נִיתְּנָה. אֲבָל פִּקָּדוֹן, דְּאִיתֵיהּ בְּעֵינֵיהּ — אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: Why do I to teach a loan, why do I to teach a deposit? necessary for if he taught a loan, In that Rabbi Tarfon says due to a loan is given to be spent. However, a deposit, which exists in its pure, say he concedes to Rabbi Akiva
llm_translation: Gemara: Why do I need to learn about loans, why do I need to learn about deposits? It is necessary, for if one teaches about loans, in this matter Rabbi Tarfon said, because a loan was given for expenditure. But a deposit, which is in his possession — I might say that Rabbi Akiva agrees with him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי תְּנָא הָא, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אֲבָל בְּהָךְ — אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לְרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if taught that only in that Rabbi Akiva says in this say that he concedes to Rabbi Tarfon necessary
llm_translation: "If you will say this, in this case Rabbi Akiva said, but in that case — say it is in agreement with Rabbi Tarfon, it is necessary."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״לַכּוֹשֵׁל״? רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אוֹמֵר: לַכּוֹשֵׁל שֶׁבִּרְאָיָה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: לִכְתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה, מִשּׁוּם חִינָּא.
human_translation: What To the weakest? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: to the one proof weakest, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: to the wife’s marriage contract. due to favor
llm_translation: What is "lakoshel"? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, says: The stumbling block in creation. Rabbi Yochanan says: A woman's handwriting, due to grace.

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי, רַבִּי בִּנְיָמִין אוֹמֵר: לַכּוֹשֵׁל שֶׁבִּרְאָיָה, וְהוּא כָּשֵׁר. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: לִכְתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה, מִשּׁוּם חִינָּא.
human_translation: like tanna’im : Rabbi Binyamin says: to the one proof weakest, and this is proper Rabbi Elazar says: to the wife’s marriage contract, due to favor
llm_translation: The scholars taught: Rabbi Benjamin says: A stumbling block in creation, yet it is valid. Rabbi Elazar says: For a married woman to write, due to grace.

hebrew_text: הִנִּיחַ פֵּירוֹת הַתְּלוּשִׁין. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, מַאי אִירְיָא מוֹתָר? כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי דְּיוֹרְשִׁין הָווּ? אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, וְאַיְּידֵי דְּאָמַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן מוֹתָר, תְּנָא אִיהוּ נָמֵי מוֹתָר.
human_translation: left produce that was detached, And Rabbi Akiva, why specifically surplus? All also the heirs, Yes, it is indeed so. but since Rabbi Tarfon spoke a surplus, he also taught a surplus.
llm_translation: He left hanging fruits. And Rabbi Akiva, what is the reason it is permitted? All of them are considered as if they are inherited? It is not so, and since Rabbi Tarfon said it is permitted, the Tanna also says it is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, תְּפִיסָה לָא מַהְנְיָא כְּלָל? אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: וְהוּא שֶׁתָּפַס מֵחַיִּים.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, seizure not effective at all? Rava said Rav Naḥman said: And this, provided that one seized from alive.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, "Tefisah" does not hold at all? Rava said, Rav Nachman said: And that is when he took from a living animal.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, דְּמַנְּחִי הֵיכָא? רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: וְהוּא שֶׁצְּבוּרִין וּמוּנָּחִין בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, אֲבָל בְּסִימְטָא — לֹא. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: אֲפִילּוּ בְּסִימְטָא.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Tarfon, where was placed? Rav and Shmuel, who both say: And this, provided that arranged in a pile and placed in the public domain. However, in an alley [ simta ], not And Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish, who both say: Even in an alley,
llm_translation: To Rabbi Tarfon, where does he place it? Rav and Shmuel both said: In a public domain where people are walking and resting, but in an alleyway - no. And Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish both said: Even in an alleyway.

hebrew_text: דּוּן דַּיָּינֵי כְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, וְאַהְדְּרֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְעוֹבָדָא מִינַּיְיהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עָשִׂיתָ כְּשֶׁל תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: judges judged in accordance with Rabbi Tarfon, and Reish Lakish reversed their action. Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: You acted like of Torah
llm_translation: Judge the judges like Rabbi Tarfon, and then Reish Lakish joined him in the judgment of the heretics. Rabbi Yochanan said to him: You have acted like the Torah.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמָר סָבַר טָעָה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה חוֹזֵר, וּמָר סָבַר טָעָה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר?
human_translation: Let us say that they disagree about this: That Sage, holds erred in a matter Mishna, revoked. And Sage, holds erred in a matter Mishna, not revoked.
llm_translation: Let us say in this case he disagrees: for Mar holds, if one erred in a matter of Mishnah, he must retract; and Mar holds, if one erred in a matter of Mishnah, he need not retract.

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא טָעָה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה חוֹזֵר. וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְלֹא מֵרַבּוֹ, וּמָר סָבַר הֲלָכָה אֲפִילּוּ מֵרַבּוֹ.
human_translation: No, everyone, erred in a matter Mishna, revoked, and here they disagree about this: Sage, holds halakha in accordance with Rabbi Akiva his colleague, but not his teacher, And Sage, holds halakha even his teacher.
llm_translation: Not, that, all, of, the, world, erred, in, a, matter, of, Mishnah, he returns. And, here, in, this, he disputes: Master, thought, halacha, like, Rabbi Akiva, from, his colleague, and, not, from, his teacher, and, Master, thought, halacha, even, from, his teacher.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְלֹא מֵרַבּוֹ. וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן רַבּוֹ הֲוָה, וּמָר סָבַר חֲבֵירוֹ הֲוָה.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone halakha in accordance with Rabbi Akiva his colleague but not his teacher. And here they disagree about this: Sage, holds Rabbi Tarfon was teacher, and Sage, holds was his colleague.
llm_translation: And if you will say: that the entire world follows the halakha like Rabbi Akiva from his colleague and not from his teacher. And here in this case they dispute: one Master holds that Rabbi Tarfon was his teacher, and one Master holds that his colleague was his teacher.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא חֲבֵירוֹ הֲוָה, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר הֲלָכָה אִיתְּמַר, וּמָר סָבַר מַטִּין אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone was colleague, and here they disagree about this: Sage, holds was stated halakha . And Sage, holds was stated one is inclined
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In all the world, his friend was, and here in this case he argues: Master A holds that the Halakha was stated, and Master B holds that Matin was stated.

hebrew_text: קָרִיבֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן תְּפוּס פָּרָה דְיַתְמֵי מִסִּימְטָא. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֲמַר לְהוּ: שַׁפִּיר תְּפַסְתּוּהָ. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, אָמַר לְהוּ: זִילוּ אַהְדּוּר. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה? שֶׁכְּנֶגְדִּי חָלוּק עָלַי.
human_translation: The relatives of Rabbi Yoḥanan seized a cow of orphans from an alley They came before Rabbi Yoḥanan he said to them: is well you seized They came before Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, said to them: Go return They came before Rabbi Yoḥanan, He said to them: What can I do, as one whose corresponds to my disagrees with me,
llm_translation: The close students of Rabbi Yochanan caught a cow from the left side. They came before Rabbi Yochanan, he said to them: "You have caught it well." They came before Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, he said to them: "Go and return it." They came before Rabbi Yochanan again. He said to them: "What shall I do? A division is against me."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא בַּקָּרָא דְיַתְמֵי דְּתָפְסִי תּוֹרָא מִינֵּיהּ. בַּעַל חוֹב אָמַר: מֵחַיִּים תְּפֵיסְנָא לֵיהּ. וּבַקָּרָא אָמַר: לְאַחַר מִיתָה תַּפְסֵיהּ. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִית לְךָ סָהֲדֵי דְּתַפְסֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִגּוֹ דְּיָכוֹל לְמֵימַר ״לָקוּחַ הוּא בְּיָדִי״, יָכוֹל נָמֵי לְמֵימַר ״מֵחַיִּים תְּפֵיסְנָא לֵיהּ״.
human_translation: a certain herdsman of orphans from whom seized an ox creditor said: I seized it from while alive. And the herdsman said: He seized it after death. They came before Rav Naḥman said to you have witnesses that he seized from you? He said to him: No. said to him: since can say: It in my possession it was purchased he can also say: I seized it from while alive.
llm_translation: That one in the village who seized a bull from him. The creditor said: "We will seize it alive." But the verse says: "After its death you shall seize it." They came before Rav Nachman. He said to him: "Do you have witnesses that you seized it?" He said to him: "No." He said to him: "Just as you could have said, 'It is in my possession,' you could also have said, 'We will seize it alive.'"

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הַגּוֹדְרוֹת אֵין לָהֶן חֲזָקָה! שָׁאנֵי תּוֹרָא דִּמְסִירָה לְרוֹעֶה.
human_translation: But didn’t Reish Lakish say moving livestock, no presumption An ox is different as is handed over to a shepherd,
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said: Fences do not have a presumption of ownership! This is different from the Torah law of transferring possession to a shepherd.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי נְשִׂיאָה תְּפוּס אַמְתָא דְיַתְמֵי מִסִּימְטָא. יְתֵיב רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פַּפִּי וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא, וִיתֵיב רַבִּי אַבָּא גַּבַּיְיהוּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: שַׁפִּיר תָּפְסִיתוּהָ. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי אַבָּא: מִשּׁוּם דְּבֵי נְשִׂיאָה נִינְהוּ מְחַנְּפִיתוּ לְהוּ? וְהָא דּוּן דַּיָּינֵי כְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, וְאַהְדְּרֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ עוֹבָדָא מִינַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: the house of the prince seized a maidservant of orphans in an alley, Rabbi Abbahu and Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappi and Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa were sitting and Rabbi Abba was sitting with them. said to them: is well you seized Rabbi Abba said to because they are the house of the prince, will you curry favor with them judges judged in accordance with Rabbi Tarfon, and Reish Lakish reversed their action,
llm_translation: Houses of the princes, they took a cubit from the left side. Rabbi Abbahu and Rabbi Hanina bar Pappi and Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha were sitting, and Rabbi Abba sat before them. He said to them: "You have taken it well." Rabbi Abba said to them: "Because they are from the houses of the princes, do they mock them? But this one judged like Rabbi Tarfon, and Resh Lakish retracted from him."

hebrew_text: יֵימַר בַּר חָשׁוּ הֲוָה מַסֵּיק בֵּיהּ זוּזֵי בְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא, שְׁכֵיב וּשְׁבַק אַרְבָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לִשְׁלוּחֵיהּ: זִיל, תְּפַסָה נִיהֲלִי. אֲזַל תַּפְסַהּ. פְּגַעוּ בֵּיהּ רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אַתְּ תּוֹפֵס לְבַעַל חוֹב בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁחָב לַאֲחֵרִים. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַתּוֹפֵס לְבַעַל חוֹב בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁחָב לַאֲחֵרִים
human_translation: Yeimar bar Ḥashu was owed money by a certain man died and left a boat. said to his agent: Go seize for me. went seized it. Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, encountered him. They said to him: You are seizing for a creditor in a situation a disadvantage for others, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said one who seizes for a creditor in a situation a disadvantage for others
llm_translation: It shall be said: Bar Hashu was collecting money for that man, he lay down and left. He said to his messenger: "Go, take my wages." He went and took it. Rav Papa and Rav Huna, sons of Rav Yehoshua, encountered him, and they said to him: "You are seizing the debtor's property in a place where he owes to others." And Rabbi Yochanan said: "One who seizes the debtor's property in a place where he owes to others."

hebrew_text: לֹא קָנָה. תַּפְסוּהָ אִינְהוּ. רַב פָּפָּא מְימַלַּח מַלּוֹחֵי. רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מְמַתַּח לַהּ בְּאַשְׁלָא. מָר אָמַר: אֲנָא קָנֵינָא לַהּ לְכוּלַּהּ, וּמָר אָמַר: אֲנָא קָנֵינָא לַהּ לְכוּלַּהּ.
human_translation: has not acquired they seized Rav Pappa steered with an oar, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, pulled it with a rope. Sage said: I acquired all of it; and Sage said: I acquired all of it.
llm_translation: He did not acquire it. They seized it. Rav Papa salted the fish. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, rubbed it with leek. Mar said: I acquired it entirely for her, and Mar said: I acquired it entirely for her.

hebrew_text: פְּגַע בְּהוּ רַב פִּנְחָס בַּר אַמֵּי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ וְהוּא שֶׁצְּבוּרִין וּמוּנָּחִין בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים! אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנַן נָמֵי מֵחֲרִיפוּתָא דְנַהֲרָא תְּפֵיסְנָא.
human_translation: Rav Pineḥas bar Ami encountered them said to them: Rav and Shmuel, who both say: And this, provided that arranged in a pile and placed in the public domain, They said to him: We too seized it from the current of the river,
llm_translation: Encountered him Rav Pinchas bar Ammi, said to him: Rav and Shmuel who both said and they are standing and resting in a public domain! Said to them: We too, due to the sharpness of this riverbank, we grasp.

hebrew_text: אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: קָאקֵי חִיוָּרֵי, מְשַׁלְּחֵי גְּלִימֵי דְאִינָשֵׁי! הָכִי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: וְהוּא שֶׁתְּפָסָהּ מֵחַיִּים.
human_translation: They came before Rava He said to them: white geese [ kakei ḥivvarei ], who remove people’s cloaks, This is what Rav Naḥman said: And this, provided that one seized from while alive.
llm_translation: They came before Rava, he said to them: "The roosters crow, the people send out their garments!" Thus said Rav Nachman: "And he who caught it while alive."

hebrew_text: אֲבִימִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ הֲווֹ מַסְּקִי בֵּיהּ זוּזֵי בֵּי חוֹזָאֵי, שַׁדְּרִינְהוּ בְּיַד חָמָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר אֲבָהוּ. אֲזַל פַּרְעִינְהוּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לִי שְׁטָרָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: סִיטְרָאֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Avimi, son of Rabbi Abbahu, owed money Bei Ḥozai. He sent in the possession of Ḥama, son of Rabba bar Abbahu, went paid said to Give me the document They said to him: was for side
llm_translation: Avimi son of Rabbi Avahu were dealing with the coins of the household of the Hozai family, they entrusted them to Hamma, son of Rabba bar Avahu. He went and lost them. He said to them: "Give me a document." They said to him: "They are private coins."

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִית לְךָ סָהֲדֵי דִּפְרַעְתִּינְהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִיגּוֹ דִּיכוֹלִין לוֹמַר ״לֹא הָיוּ דְבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם״, יְכוֹלִין נָמֵי לְמֵימַר ״סִיטְרָאֵי נִינְהוּ״.
human_translation: came before Rabbi Abbahu. He said to you have witnesses that you paid them? He said to him: No. said to him: He could have made a more advantageous claim [ miggo ]. Since they can say: These matters never occurred, they can also say: These are side
llm_translation: He came before Rabbi Avahu. He said to him: Do you have witnesses that I have appeased them? He said to him: No. He said to him: Since they could have said, "They were never words," they could also say, "They are just lies."

hebrew_text: לְעִנְיַן שַׁלּוֹמֵי שָׁלִיחַ מַאי? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: חָזֵינַן, אִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ ״שְׁקוֹל שְׁטָרָא וְהַב זוּזֵי״ — מְשַׁלֵּם. ״הַב זוּזֵי וּשְׁקוֹל שְׁטָרָא״ — לָא מְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: With regard to the payment of the agent, what Rav Ashi said: We see if said to him: Take the document and give money, pay Give money and take the document, he does not pay,
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of the peace of a messenger, what is it? Rav Ashe said: We have seen, if he says to him, "Take the document and give the money" — he pays. "Give the money and take the document" — he does not pay.

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ מְשַׁלֵּם. דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״לְתַקּוֹנֵי שַׁדַּרְתָּיךָ וְלָא לְעַוּוֹתֵי״.
human_translation: And this is not so; Whether this or whether that pay, as say to him: I sent you to my benefit, and not to my detriment.
llm_translation: And not it, between so and between so pays. For he said to him: "For your benefit I have sent you, and not to harm you."

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דַּהֲווֹ מִיפַּקְדִי גַּבַּהּ מְלוּגָא דִשְׁטָרֵי. אֲתוֹ יוֹרְשִׁים קָא תָּבְעִי לֵיהּ מִינַּהּ. אֲמַרָה לְהוּ: מֵחַיִּים תְּפֵיסְנָא לְהוּ. אֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, אֲמַר לַהּ: אִית לִיךְ סָהֲדֵי דְּתַבְעוּהָ מִינִּיךְ מֵחַיִּים וְלָא יְהַבְיתְּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ? אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: לָא. אִם כֵּן, הָוֵי תְּפִיסָה דִּלְאַחַר מִיתָה, וּתְפִיסָה דִּלְאַחַר מִיתָה — לֹא כְּלוּם הִיא.
human_translation: a certain woman who had a bag [ meloga ] of documents deposited with her. The heirs came claimed it from her. She said to them: I seized while alive, They came before Rav Naḥman He said to her: you have witnesses that claimed from you while alive and you did not give it to him? She said to him: No, If so, this is seizing after death, and seizing after death is nothing.
llm_translation: That woman who was being pursued by the tax collectors of the authorities. Her heirs came and demanded her portion. She said to them: "I have a claim against you." She came before Rav Nachman, and he said to her: "Do you have witnesses that you demanded from them your claim while you were alive, and they did not give it to you?" She said to him: "No." If so, it is a claim after death, and a claim after death is nothing.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דְּאִיחַיַּיבָא שְׁבוּעָה בֵּי דִינָא דְּרָבָא. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ בַּת רַב חִסְדָּא: יָדְעָנָא בָּהּ דַּחֲשׁוּדָה אַשְּׁבוּעָה. אַפְכַהּ רָבָא לִשְׁבוּעָה אַשֶּׁכְּנֶגְדָּהּ.
human_translation: a certain woman who was obligated an oath in Rava’s court. The daughter of Rav Ḥisda said to I know that she is suspect with regard to oath. Rava reversed the oath onto the other
llm_translation: That woman, the wife of Ikhayyava, was obligated to take an oath in the court of Rava. The daughter of Rav Hisda said to him: "We know about her that she is suspected, let her take an oath." Rava overturned the oath, as it is opposite her.

hebrew_text: זִימְנִין הָווּ יָתְבִי קַמֵּיהּ רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָא, אַיְיתוֹ הָהוּא שְׁטָרָא גַּבֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא: יָדַעְנָא בֵּיהּ דִּשְׁטָרָא פְּרִיעָא הוּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיכָּא אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ דְּמָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיכָּא מָר, עֵד אֶחָד לָאו כְּלוּם הוּא.
human_translation: On occasion, Rav Pappa and Rav Adda bar Mattana were sitting before A certain document was brought before Rav Pappa said to I know about this document, that it paid. said to him: Is there another person with Master He said to him: No, said to him: Although there is Master one witness is nothing.
llm_translation: Times were when sat in front of him Rav Papa and Rav Adda bar Matna, they brought before him that document. Rav Papa said to him: We know about this document that it is a valid one. He said to him: Is there anyone else with you, Master? He said to him: No. He said to him: Even though there is no one else, one witness is nothing.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָא: וְלֹא יְהֵא רַב פָּפָּא כְּבַת רַב חִסְדָּא? בַּת רַב חִסְדָּא קִים לִי בְּגַוַּוהּ, מָר לָא קִים לִי בְּגַוֵּויהּ.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Mattana said to And should Rav Pappa not be like Rav Ḥisda’s daughter, Rav Ḥisda’s daughter I know with certainty about her Master I do not know with certainty about him
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Adda bar Matna: "And should Rav Papa not be like the daughter of Rav Hisda? The daughter of Rav Hisda is established in her beauty, Master, I am not established in my beauty."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמַר מָר ״קִים לִי בְּגַוֵּויהּ״ מִילְּתָא הִיא, כְּגוֹן אַבָּא מָר בְּרִי דְּקִים לִי בְּגַוֵּויהּ, קָרַעְנָא שְׁטָרָא אַפּוּמֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Now that the Master, has said I know with certainty about him, is matter, For example, Abba Mar, my son, about whom I know with certainty I tear the document on his word.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: The year that Master said, "I have a claim against him," is a matter, for example, Abba the son of Kima who said, "I have a claim against him," tore up the document in his presence.

hebrew_text: קָרַעְנָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא: מַרַעְנָא שְׁטָרָא אַפּוּמֵּיהּ.
human_translation: enter your mind tear Rather, I weaken the document on his word,
llm_translation: We have torn the basket of your knowledge?! Rather: We have torn the document in front of him.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דְּאִיחַיַּיבָא שְׁבוּעָה בֵּי דִינָא דְּרַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי. אֲמַר לְהוּ הַהוּא בַּעַל דִּין: תֵּיתֵי וְתִישְׁתְּבַע בְּמָתָא, אֶפְשָׁר דְּמִיכַּסְפָא וּמוֹדְיָא. אֲמַרָה לְהוּ: כְּתֻבוּ לִי זַכְווֹתָא, דְּכִי מִשְׁתְּבַעְנָא יָהֲבִי לִי. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: כִּתְבוּ לַהּ.
human_translation: a certain woman who was obligated an oath Rav Beivai bar Abaye’s court. litigant said to her come and take an oath in the town. It is possible that she will be ashamed and will admit She said to Write rights for me, that when I take the oath they will give to me, Rav Beivai bar Abaye said to them: Write for her.
llm_translation: That woman, the wife of Ikhayyiva, was obligated to take an oath in the court of Rav Bibi bar Abbaye. The judge said to them: "Bring her and have her take an oath in the town, perhaps she will retract and admit." She said to them: "Write me a document of merit, for when I take an oath, you will give it to me." Rav Bibi bar Abbaye said to them: "Write it for her."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פַּפֵּי: מִשּׁוּם דְּאָתֵיתוּ מִמּוּלָאֵי אָמְרִיתוּ מִילֵּי מוּלְיָתָא?!
human_translation: Rav Pappi said: because you come from unfortunate people [ de’atitu mimmula’ei ] you say unfortunate things?
llm_translation: Rav Pappi said: Because they came from the uncircumcised, did they say words of Aramaic?!

hebrew_text: הָא אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי אַשַּׁרְתָּא דְּדַיָּינֵי דְּמִיכַּתְבָא מִקַּמֵּי דְּנַחְווֹ סָהֲדֵי אַחֲתִימוּת יְדַיְיהוּ — פְּסוּלָה. אַלְמָא מִיחְזֵי כְּשִׁיקְרָא, הָכִי נָמֵי מִיחְזֵי כְּשִׁיקְרָא.
human_translation: Didn’t Rava say: This ratification of judges, which was written before witnesses had seen about their signature, is invalid, Apparently, the appearance of falsehood Here too, have the appearance of falsehood,
llm_translation: Rava said: This document that the judges wrote before they heard the testimony of the witnesses is invalid. This shows that it appears as a lie, for it indeed appears as a lie.

hebrew_text: וְלֵיתַהּ, מִדְּרַב נַחְמָן. דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אֲפִילּוּ מְצָאוֹ בְּאַשְׁפָּה וַחֲתָמוֹ וּנְתָנוֹ לָהּ — כָּשֵׁר. וַאֲפִילּוּ רַבָּנַן לָא פְּלִיגִי עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר אֶלָּא בְּגִיטֵּי נָשִׁים, דְּבָעֵינַן כְּתִיבָה לִשְׁמָהּ, אֲבָל בִּשְׁאָר שְׁטָרוֹת מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And not because of of Rav Naḥman, as Rav Naḥman said: Rabbi Meir would say: Even if found in the garbage, and he had it signed and gave it to valid. And the Rabbis do not disagree with Rabbi Meir, except bills of divorce of women, since the writing needs for the sake of But for other documents, they concede to him
llm_translation: And there is no disagreement from Rav Nachman. For Rav Nachman said, Rabbi Meir used to say: Even if they found it in the garbage, sealed it, and gave it to her — it is valid. And even the Rabbis do not disagree with Rabbi Meir except in the case of women's bills of divorce, where we require the writing to be for her sake, but in other documents they agree with him.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁטָר שֶׁלָּוָה בּוֹ וּפְרָעוֹ — אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר וְלֹוֶה בּוֹ. שֶׁכְּבָר נִמְחַל שִׁיעְבּוּדוֹ: טַעְמָא דְּנִמְחַל שִׁיעְבּוּדוֹ, אֲבָל לְמִיחְזֵי
human_translation: that Rav Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a document that one borrowed based on it and repaid he may not borrow money again based on it. because its lien has already been forgiven. The reason because its lien has been forgiven, but as appearance
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "D'amar Rav Assi amar Rabbi Yochanan: shtar shelavah bo u'fera'o - einu chozer v'loveh bo. Shekevar nimchal shi'budav: ta'ama d'nimchal shi'budav, aval l'michzei." English translation: "For Rav Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A loan document in which the borrower's obligation has been erased - he cannot return and borrow with it. Because his obligation has already been forgiven: the reason for his obligation being forgiven, but to borrow again."

hebrew_text: כְּשִׁיקְרָא לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: of falsehood, we are not concerned.
llm_translation: When he reads, we are not concerned.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאַפְקֵיד שַׁב מַרְגָּנְיָתָא דְּצַיְירִי בִּסְדִינָא בֵּי רַבִּי מְיָאשָׁא בַּר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי. שְׁכֵיב רַבִּי מְיָאשָׁא וְלָא פַּקֵּיד. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: חֲדָא, דְּיָדַעְנָא בֵּיהּ בְּרַבִּי מְיָאשָׁא בַּר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי דְּלָא אֲמִיד. וְעוֹד, הָא קָא יָהֵיב סִימָנָא.
human_translation: a certain man who deposited seven pearls [ marganita ] tied up in a sheet the house of Rabbi Meyasha, son of the son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. Rabbi Meyasha passed away without instructing came before Rabbi Ami He said to them: first since I know about Rabbi Meyasha, son of the son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, that he is not wealthy And furthermore, has provided a distinguishing mark
llm_translation: That man who was in charge of the wine cellar of the house of Rabbi Meyasha, son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, he laid down Rabbi Meyasha and did not appoint a guard. He came before Rabbi Ammi, he said to them: "One who knows about him, the son of Rabbi Meyasha, son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, that he is not trustworthy." Furthermore, he gave a sign.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא רְגִיל דְּעָיֵיל וְנָפֵיק לְהָתָם. אֲבָל רָגִיל דְּעָיֵיל וְנָפֵיק לְהָתָם, אֵימָא אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא אַפְקֵיד וְאִיהוּ מִיחְזָא חֲזָא.
human_translation: And we said only does not usually enter and exit there. But usually enters and exits there, say a different person deposited and he saw
llm_translation: And we did not say except that he is not accustomed to go and come out there. But if he is accustomed to go and come out there, one might say, "Let someone else go and he will see."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאַפְקֵיד כָּסָא דְכַסְפָּא בֵּי חָסָא. שָׁכֵיב חָסָא, וְלָא פַּקֵּיד. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן אֲמַר לְהוּ: יָדַעְנָא בֵּיהּ בְּחָסָא דְּלָא אֲמִיד. וְעוֹד, הָא קָא יָהֵיב סִימָנָא. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא רְגִיל דְּעָיֵיל וְנָפֵיק לְהָתָם, אֲבָל רְגִיל דְּעָיֵיל וְנָפֵיק לְהָתָם, אֵימַר אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא אַפְקֵיד וְאִיהוּ מִיחְזָא חֲזָא.
human_translation: a certain man who deposited a silver goblet the house of Ḥasa. Ḥasa passed away without instructing They came before Rav Naḥman He said to them: I know about Ḥasa that he is not wealthy, And furthermore, has provided a distinguishing mark. And we said only does not usually enter and exit there. But usually enters and exits there, say a different person deposited and he saw
llm_translation: That man who was in charge of the treasury of silver at the house of Hasa. Hasa fell asleep, and he did not appoint a replacement. He came before Rav Nachman and said to him: "I know about him in the house of Hasa that he is not reliable. Furthermore, he gave a sign." And we only said that he is not accustomed to go and come out there, but if he is accustomed to go and come out there, one might say, "Let someone else be appointed, and he will be seen."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דְּאַפְקֵיד מְטַכְסָא בֵּי רַב דִּימִי אֲחוּהּ דְּרַב סָפְרָא, שָׁכֵיב רַב דִּימִי וְלָא פַּקֵּיד. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: חֲדָא, דְּיָדַעְנָא בֵּיהּ בְּרַב דִּימִי דְּלָא אֲמִיד. וְעוֹד, הָא קָא יָהֵיב סִימָנָא. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא רְגִיל דְּעָיֵיל וְנָפֵיק לְהָתָם, אֲבָל רְגִיל דְּעָיֵיל וְנָפֵיק לְהָתָם, אֵימָא אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא אַפְקֵיד וְאִיהוּ מִיחְזָא חֲזָא.
human_translation: a certain who deposited silk [ metakesa ] the house of Rav Dimi, brother of Rav Safra. Rav Dimi passed away without instructing They came before Rabbi Abba said to them: first since I know about Rav Dimi that he is not wealthy. And furthermore, has provided a distinguishing mark. And we said only does not usually enter and exit there. But usually enters and exit there, say a different person deposited and he saw
llm_translation: That one who appointed a tax collector in the house of Rav Dimi the brother of Rav Safra, Rav Dimi fell ill and did not appoint another. He came before Rabbi Abba, he said to them: "One, I know about him in Rav Dimi that he is not reliable. Furthermore, he gave a sign. And we only said that if he is not accustomed to go and come out there, but if he is accustomed to go and come out there, one should appoint another and he will see."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: נִכְסַיי לְטוֹבִיָּה. שָׁכֵיב, אֲתָא טוֹבִיָּה. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲרֵי בָּא טוֹבִיָּה.
human_translation: a certain who said to My property to Toviya. passed away, Toviya came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Toviya has come,
llm_translation: That one who said to him: "My properties to Toviya." He lay down, Toviya came. Rabbi Yochanan said: "Behold, Toviya has come."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר ״טוֹבִיָּה״ וַאֲתָא רַב טוֹבִיָּה — לְטוֹבִיָּה אֲמַר, לְרַב טוֹבִיָּה לָא אֲמַר. וְאִי אִינִישׁ דְּגִיס בֵּיהּ, הָא גִּיס בֵּיהּ. אֲתוֹ שְׁנֵי טוֹבִיָּה, שָׁכֵן וְתַלְמִיד חָכָם — תַּלְמִיד חָכָם קוֹדֵם. קָרוֹב וְתַלְמִיד חָכָם — תַּלְמִיד חָכָם קוֹדֵם.
human_translation: said: Toviya, and Rav Toviya came he said: to Toviya. He did not say: to Rav Toviya. But if a person who is familiar with he was familiar with him. two Toviya came neighbor a Torah scholar Torah scholar takes precedence. a relative and a Torah scholar, the Torah scholar takes precedence.
llm_translation: He said, "Toviyyah," and Rav Toviyyah came. To Toviyyah he said, to Rav Toviyyah he did not say. And if someone is greater than he, then he should defer to him. Two Toviyyahs came, a neighbor and a Torah scholar - the Torah scholar takes precedence. A relative and a Torah scholar - the Torah scholar takes precedence.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: שָׁכֵן וְקָרוֹב מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע: ״טוֹב שָׁכֵן קָרוֹב מֵאָח רָחוֹק״. שְׁנֵיהֶם קְרוֹבִים, וּשְׁנֵיהֶם שְׁכֵנִים, וּשְׁנֵיהֶם חֲכָמִים? שׁוּדָא דְּדַיָּינֵי.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before a neighbor and a relative, what Come hear “A close neighbor is better than a distant brother” they both relatives, or both neighbors, or both scholars, the discretion of the judges.
llm_translation: He asked them: "Neighbor and close, what is it?" Come and hear: "Better a neighbor nearby than a brother far away." Both are close, and both are neighbors, and both are wise? A sufficient answer.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לִבְרֵיהּ דְּרַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין: תָּא אֵימָא לָךְ מִילְּתָא מְעַלַּיְותָא דַּהֲוָה אָמַר אֲבוּךְ. הָא דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הַמּוֹכֵר שְׁטַר חוֹב לַחֲבֵירוֹ וְחָזַר וּמְחָלוֹ — מָחוּל, וַאֲפִילּוּ יוֹרֵשׁ מוֹחֵל — מוֹדֶה שְׁמוּאֵל בְּמַכְנֶסֶת שְׁטַר חוֹב לְבַעְלָהּ, וְחָזְרָה וּמְחָלַתּוֹ — שֶׁאֵינוֹ מָחוּל, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּדוֹ כְּיָדָהּ.
human_translation: Rava said to the son of Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin: Come, I will tell you something excellent that your father would say that which Shmuel said: one who sells a promissory note to another, and went back and forgave it is forgiven, and even heir can forgive Shmuel concedes with regard to brings in a promissory note for her husband, and she went back and forgave that is not forgiven. Because his hand is like her hand,
llm_translation: Rava said to the son of Rav Chiya bar Avin: Come, I will say to you a matter of heights that your father said. As Shmuel said: One who sells a promissory note of debt to his fellow and then retracts - he retracts. And even if the heir retracts, Shmuel concedes regarding the acquisition of a promissory note of debt to its owner, and if she retracts - it is not considered a retraction, because his hand is like her hand.

hebrew_text: קָרִיבְתֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן זַבֵּינְתַּהּ לִכְתוּבְּתַהּ בְּטוֹבַת הֲנָאָה — אִיגָּרַשָׁה וּשְׁכִיבָה. אֲתוֹ קָא תָבְעִי לַהּ לִבְרַתַּהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב נַחְמָן: לֵיכָּא דְּלַיסְּבַהּ (לָהּ) עֵצָה?!
human_translation: A relative of Rav Naḥman sold her marriage contract for financial advantage. She was divorced and died, came claimed from her daughter. Rav Naḥman said to no who can give advice,
llm_translation: The offering of Rav Nachman, his wife wrote in her marriage contract for her benefit - she is divorced and receives her marriage settlement. He came to demand her marriage settlement. Rav Nachman said to them: Is there no one to advise her?!

hebrew_text: תֵּיזִיל וְתַיחֲלַהּ לִכְתוּבְּתַהּ דְּאִמַּהּ לְגַבֵּי אֲבוּהּ, וְתֵירְתַהּ מִינֵּיהּ. שְׁמַעָה אֲזַלָה אַחֵילְתַּהּ.
human_translation: she should go and forgive her mother’s marriage contract for her father, and she inherit from him? heard went and forgave
llm_translation: She should go out and first write her mother's name before her father's, and erase her from it. When she heard, she went and fulfilled it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר רַב נַחְמָן: עָשִׂינוּ עַצְמֵינוּ כְּעוֹרְכֵי הַדַּיָּינִין. מֵעִיקָּרָא מַאי סְבַר, וּלְבַסּוֹף מַאי סְבַר? מֵעִיקָּרָא סְבַר: ״וּמִבְּשָׂרְךָ לֹא תִתְעַלָּם״, וּלְבַסּוֹף סָבַר: אָדָם חָשׁוּב שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said We have made ourselves like advisors of judges. At the outset, what did he hold and ultimately, what did he hold At the outset, he held “And you should not hide yourself from your own flesh” And ultimately he held that an important person is different.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: We made ourselves like arbitrators. What does he initially hold, and what does he ultimately hold? Initially, he holds: "And from your flesh, do not hide," and ultimately he holds: A person is considered important.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמּוֹכֵר שְׁטַר חוֹב לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וְחָזַר וּמְחָלוֹ — מָחוּל, וַאֲפִילּוּ יוֹרֵשׁ מוֹחֵל. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: וְאִי פִּקֵּחַ הוּא, מְקַרְקֵשׁ לֵיהּ זוּזֵי, וְכָתֵב לֵיהּ שְׁטָרָא בִּשְׁמֵיהּ.
human_translation: the itself. Shmuel said: one who sells a promissory note to another, and went back and forgave it is forgiven, and even heir can forgive Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: And if is perspicacious, jangle [ mekarkesh ] dinars and write for him note in name,
llm_translation: The body, Shmuel said: One who sells a promissory note of debt to his fellow, and then retracts and forgives it - it is forgiven, even if the inheritor forgives. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: And if he is clever, he should shake out the coins for him, and write a document for him in his name.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: מַאן דְּדָאֵין דִּינָא דִגְרָמֵי — מַגְבֵּי בֵּיהּ דְּמֵי שְׁטָרָא מְעַלְּיָא. מַאן דְּלָא דָּאֵין דִּינָא דְגַרְמֵי, מַגְבֵּי בֵּיהּ דְּמֵי נְיָירָא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Ameimar said: One who judges cases of liability for indirect damage collects in this the value the proper document. One who does not judge cases of liability for indirect damage collects in this only the value of the paper
llm_translation: Amemar said: Whoever insists on the law of causation - he collects the money of a document from above. Whoever does not insist on the law of causation - he collects the money of ordinary paper.

hebrew_text: הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא וְכַפְיֵיהּ רַפְרָם לְרַב אָשֵׁי, וְאַגְבִּי בֵּיהּ כִּי כְשׁוּרָא לְצַלְמֵי.
human_translation: there was an incident and Rafram pressured Rav Ashi and collected in this as a beam for a sculpture,
llm_translation: The work was being done, and his hands were soft to Rav Ashei, and he embraced him like a relative.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב חָמָא: הַאי מַאן דְּאִיכָּא עֲלֵיהּ כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה וּבַעַל חוֹב, וְאִית לֵיהּ אַרְעָא וְאִית לֵיהּ זוּזֵי — לְבַעַל חוֹב מְסַלְּקִינַן לֵיהּ בְּזוּזֵי, לְאִשָּׁה מְסַלְּקִינַן לַהּ בְּאַרְעָא, הַאי כִּי דִינֵיהּ וְהַאי כִּי דִינֵיהּ.
human_translation: Ameimar said in the name of Rav Ḥama: one who has upon himself wife’s marriage contract and a creditor, and possesses land and possesses money, to the creditor is settled with money, to the woman is settled with land, this one in accordance with his law, and that one in accordance with her law.
llm_translation: Ammar Amemar mishmei d'Rav Ḥama: Hai man d'ika aleih ketubat isha u'ba'al ḥov, ve'it leih ar'a ve'it leih zuzai — l'ba'al ḥov mesalkinan leih be'zuzai, l'isha mesalkinan la be'ar'a, hai ki dineih ve'hai ki dineih.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא אִיכָּא אֶלָּא חַד אַרְעָא וְלָא חַזְיָא אֶלָּא לְחַד — לְבַעַל חוֹב יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ, לְאִשָּׁה לָא יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ. מַאי טַעְמָא — יוֹתֵר מִמַּה שֶּׁהָאִישׁ רוֹצֶה לִישָּׂא, אִשָּׁה רוֹצָה לְהִנָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: And if there is only one land, and adequate for only one we give it to the creditor, we do not give it to the woman. What is the reason more than a man wants to marry, a woman wants to be married.
llm_translation: And if there is only one piece of land and not a field, but not a courtyard, only for one - to a creditor we give it, to a woman we do not give it. What is the reason? - More than what a man wants to marry, a woman wants to be married.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרַב חָמָא: וַדַּאי דְּאָמְרִיתוּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, הַאי מַאן דְּמַסְּקִי בֵּיהּ זוּזֵי, וְאִית לֵיהּ אַרְעָא, וַאֲתָא בַּעַל חוֹב וְקָא תָבַע מִינֵּיהּ, וְאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״זִיל שְׁקוֹל מֵאַרְעָא״, אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: ״זִיל זַבֵּין אַתְּ, וְאַיְיתִי הַב לֵיהּ״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rav Ḥama: correct that you say in the name of Rava: one who owes money and has land, and the creditor comes and demands from him and says to him: Go take from the land, we say to him: Go sell the land yourself and give him said to him: not
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Rav Hama: And certainly, that you said in the name of Rava, this one who takes money from it, and it has land, and a creditor comes and demands from him, and he says to him: "Go take from the land," we say to him: "Go sell it, and bring him the proceeds?" He said to him: No.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא לִי גּוּפָא דְעוֹבָדָא הֵיכִי הֲוָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תּוֹלֶה מְעוֹתָיו בְּגוֹי הֲוָה, הוּא עָשָׂה שֶׁלֹּא כַּהוֹגֶן — לְפִיכָךְ עָשׂוּ בּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא כַּהוֹגֶן.
human_translation: Tell me the incident itself, what happened said to him: was one who attached his money to a gentile. This acted improperly, consequently, acted improperly with him
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima li gupha de'avada heichi hava." Amar lei: "Toleh me'otav begoi hava, hu asah shelo kahogen - lefichach asu bo shelo kahogen." English translation: "Say to me the essence of the matter, how was it done." He said to him: "He hung his tent among the nations, he acted in a way that was not proper - therefore they acted towards him in a way that was not proper."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא לְרַב פָּפָּא: לְדִידָךְ דְּאָמְרַתְּ פְּרִיעַת בַּעַל חוֹב מִצְוָה, אָמַר: ״לָא נִיחָא לִי דְּאֶיעְבֵּיד מִצְוָה״, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵינָא: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּמִצְוַת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, אֲבָל בְּמִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה, כְּגוֹן שֶׁאוֹמְרִין לוֹ עֲשֵׂה סוּכָּה וְאֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה, לוּלָב וְאֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה —
human_translation: Rav Kahana said to Rav Pappa: According to your that you say the repayment of a creditor a mitzva, said: It is not amenable to me to perform a mitzva, what He said to him: We learned In what is this statement said, with regard to negative mitzvot. However, with regard to positive mitzvot, for example, if says to Perform sukka , and he does not do palm branch, and he does not do
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Kahana said to Rav Papa: According to your opinion that causing distress to a creditor is a mitzvah, he said: "I do not want to perform a mitzvah." What is the reason? He said to him, we learned: In what case are these words said - in the case of a negative commandment, but in the case of a positive commandment, for example, if they tell him to make a sukkah and he does not make it, or to take a lulav and he does not take it -

hebrew_text: מַכִּין אוֹתוֹ עַד שֶׁתֵּצֵא נַפְשׁוֹ.
human_translation: strikes him until his soul departs,
llm_translation: They strike him until his soul departs.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא מֵרַב חִסְדָּא: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ, וְלֹא תִּתְגָּרְשִׁי בּוֹ אֶלָּא לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״, וְהָלְכָה וְהִנִּיחַתּוּ בְּצִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama inquired of Rav Ḥisda: This is your bill of divorce but you are divorced with it only after thirty days, and went and placed it in the sides of the public domain, what is
llm_translation: He asked him: Ramei son of Hama from Rav Hisda: "Here is your bill of divorce, and you shall not be divorced from him except after thirty days." And the law is to leave it on the side of the public domain, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, מִדְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל. דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ, וְהוּא שֶׁצְּבוּרִין וּמוּנָּחִין בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וְצִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים כִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים דָּמוּ.
human_translation: said to him: She is not divorced. from of Rav and Shmuel, as Rav and Shmuel who both say provided that they are arranged in piles and placed in the public domain, And the sides of the public domain are considered like the public domain.
llm_translation: He said to him: She is not divorced, from Rav and Shmuel. For Rav and Shmuel both said, and this is when they are standing and resting in a public domain, and the sides of a public domain are like the public domain itself.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, מִדְּרַב נַחְמָן. דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: ״מְשׁוֹךְ פָּרָה זוֹ, וְלֹא תִּהְיֶה קְנוּיָה לָךְ עַד לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״ — קָנָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ עוֹמֶדֶת בַּאֲגַם. מַאי לָאו: הַיְינוּ אֲגַם, וְהַיְינוּ צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים? לָא, אֲגַם לְחוּד וְצִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לְחוּד.
human_translation: On the contrary, she is divorced, of Rav Naḥman, as Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: one who says to his friend: Go pull this cow and it will be acquired by you only after thirty days, he has acquired And even was standing in meadow [ agam ]. What, is it not this is a meadow and this is the sides of the public domain, No, a meadow is discrete, and the sides of the public domain is discrete,
llm_translation: The great Rabba, the wife of Rav Nachman. For Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: One who says to his fellow, "Pull this cow, and it will not be acquired by you until after thirty days" — he acquires it, even if it is standing in the public domain. What is the reason? Is it not the same as a public domain and the same as private domain boundaries? No, the public domain is distinct, and private domain boundaries are distinct.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, מִדְּרַב נַחְמָן. וְצִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים כַּאֲגַם דָּמֵי. אַדְּרַבָּה: אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, מִדְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל. מַאי לָאו: הַיְינוּ ״רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים״, וְהַיְינוּ ״צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים״. לָא, רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לְחוֹד, וְצִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לְחוֹד.
human_translation: Some say said to She is divorced, Rav Naḥman and the sides of the public domain are considered like a meadow. On the contrary, she is not divorced, from Rav and Shmuel What, is it not this is the public domain and this is the sides of the public domain? No, the public domain is discrete and the sides of the public domain are discrete.
llm_translation: There are some who say, he said to him: "Migorshet, from Rav Nachman." And the sides of the public domain are like a pool of blood. Adrabah: She is not Migorshet, from Rav and Shmuel. What is the reason? Is it not the same "public domain" and the same "sides of the public domain"? No, the public domain is one thing, and the sides of the public domain are another.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוֹשִׁיב אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ חֶנְווֹנִית, אוֹ שֶׁמִּינָּהּ אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּיָא — הֲרֵי זֶה מַשְׁבִּיעָהּ כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁיִּרְצֶה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ עַל פִּילְכָּהּ וְעַל עִיסָּתָהּ.
human_translation: one who establishes his wife storekeeper or he appointed her steward this administer an oath to her, whenever he wants. Rabbi Eliezer says: even with regard to her spindle and for her dough,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who makes his wife a menstruant, or who makes her a potter's field, may swear to her as often as he pleases. Rabbi Eliezer says: Even on the dough and the batter.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר עַל יְדֵי גִלְגּוּל קָאָמַר — אוֹ לְכַתְּחִלָּה קָאָמַר?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Rabbi Eliezer he saying by means of extension or, he saying ab initio ?
llm_translation: Gemara: He asked them: Rabbi Eliezer, is he saying by way of reincarnation, or is he saying initially?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: אֵין אָדָם דָּר עִם נָחָשׁ בִּכְפִיפָה. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא לְכַתְּחִלָּה — שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ עַל יְדֵי גִלְגּוּל, מַאי נָפְקָא לַהּ מִינַּהּ?
human_translation: Come hear said to Rabbi Eliezer: A person does not reside in a basket with a snake. Granted, if you say ab initio , well. However, if you say by means of an extension what difference does it make to her?
llm_translation: Come and hear, they said to Rabbi Eliezer: A person does not live with a snake in the same basket. If you say it is initially permissible - fine. But if you say it is through a roundabout way, what benefit does she derive from it?

hebrew_text: דְּאָמְרָה לֵיהּ: כֵּיוָן דְּקָדָיְיקַתְּ בָּתְרַאי כּוּלֵּי הַאי — לָא מָצְיָנָא דְּאֵדוּר בַּהֲדָךְ.
human_translation: that she says to him: Since you are so exacting with me, I cannot live with you.
llm_translation: She said to him: Since you have been diligent in this matter, we do not find that you have erred in anything.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הֲרֵי שֶׁלֹּא פָּטַר אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ מִן הַנֶּדֶר וּמִן הַשְּׁבוּעָה, וְהוֹשִׁיבָהּ חֶנְווֹנִית, אוֹ שֶׁמִּינָהּ אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּיָא — הֲרֵי זֶה מַשְׁבִּיעָהּ כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁיִּרְצֶה. לֹא הוֹשִׁיבָהּ חֶנְווֹנִית, וְלֹא מִינָּהּ אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּיָא — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהַשְׁבִּיעָהּ.
human_translation: Come hear one who did not exempt his wife from a vow and from an oath, and he established her storekeeper or appointed her steward, he administer an oath to her whenever he wants. did not establish her storekeeper or appoint her steward, cannot administer an oath to her.
llm_translation: Come and hear: If he did not annul his wife's vow or oath, and he made her sit in a corner or appointed her as a doorkeeper, he may swear at her whenever he pleases. If he did not make her sit in a corner or appoint her as a doorkeeper, he cannot swear at her.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא הוֹשִׁיבָהּ חֶנְווֹנִית, וְלֹא מִינָּהּ אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּיָא — הֲרֵי זֶה מַשְׁבִּיעָהּ כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁיִּרְצֶה, שֶׁאֵין לְךָ אִשָּׁה שֶׁלֹּא נַעֲשֵׂית אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּיָא שָׁעָה אַחַת בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ עַל פִּילְכָּהּ וְעַל עִיסָּתָהּ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין אָדָם דָּר עִם נָחָשׁ בִּכְפִיפָה. שְׁמַע מִינָּהּ לְכַתְּחִלָּה שְׁמַע מִינָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Although he did not establish her storekeeper or appoint her steward, he administer an oath to her whenever he wants, as you have no wife who did not become a steward one hour in her husband’s lifetime for her spindle and for her dough. said to him: A person does not reside in a basket with a snake. conclude from this ab initio . Conclude from it
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Even though she did not sit on the huppah, and he did not betroth her, this constitutes a valid marriage as long as he desires, for there is no woman who does not become a betrothed wife for one moment in her husband's lifetime, based on her consent and acceptance. They said to him: A man does not live with a snake in a basket. Learn from this at the outset, learn from this.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כָּתַב לָהּ ״נֶדֶר וּשְׁבוּעָה אֵין לִי עָלַיִךְ״ — אֵין יָכוֹל לְהַשְׁבִּיעָהּ, אֲבָל מַשְׁבִּיעַ הוּא אֶת יוֹרְשֶׁיהָ, וְאֶת הַבָּאִים בִּרְשׁוּתָהּ.
human_translation: one wrote to I do not have a vow or an oath upon you, cannot administer an oath to her. However, he can administer an oath to her heirs, and to those who come on her authority,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a man wrote to her, "I have no authority over you with regard to vows and oaths," he cannot annul her vows. However, he can annul the vows of her heirs and those who are under her authority.

hebrew_text: ״נֶדֶר וּשְׁבוּעָה אֵין לִי עָלַיִךְ וְעַל יוֹרְשַׁיִךְ וְעַל הַבָּאִים בְּרִשּׁוּתֶיךָ״ — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהַשְׁבִּיעָהּ, לֹא הִיא, וְלֹא יוֹרְשֶׁיהָ, וְלֹא אֶת הַבָּאִים בִּרְשׁוּתָהּ. אֲבָל יוֹרְשָׁיו מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ וְאֶת יוֹרְשֶׁיהָ, וְאֶת הַבָּאִים בִּרְשׁוּתָהּ.
human_translation: I do not have a vow or an oath upon you, or upon your heirs, or upon those who come on your authority, cannot administer an oath her; not to her, nor her heirs, nor those who come on her authority. But heirs can administer an oath to her, and to her heirs, and to those who come on her authority.
llm_translation: "Neder and Shevuah, I have no obligation upon you, nor upon your heirs, nor upon those who come with your permission." — He cannot make her swear, neither she, nor her heirs, nor those who come with her permission. But his heirs can make her swear, and her heirs, and those who come with her permission.

hebrew_text: ״נֶדֶר וּשְׁבוּעָה אֵין לִי, וְלֹא לְיוֹרְשַׁי, וְלֹא לַבָּאִים בִּרְשׁוּתִי עָלַיִךְ, וְעַל יוֹרְשַׁיִךְ, וְעַל הַבָּאִים בִּרְשׁוּתִיךְ״ — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהַשְׁבִּיעָהּ, לֹא הוּא וְלֹא יוֹרְשָׁיו וְלֹא הַבָּאִים בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ, לֹא אוֹתָהּ וְלֹא יוֹרְשֶׁיהָ, וְלֹא הַבָּאִים בִּרְשׁוּתָהּ.
human_translation: Neither I, nor my heirs, nor those who come on my authority have a vow or an oath upon you, or upon your heirs, or upon those who come on your authority, cannot administer an oath her not he, nor his heirs, nor those who come on his authority not to her, nor her heirs, nor those who come on her authority.
llm_translation: "Neder and Shevuah I do not have, neither for my heirs, nor for those who come into my domain upon you, and upon your heirs, and upon those who come into your domain" — he cannot impose an oath, neither he nor his heirs nor those who come into his domain, not that one nor her heirs, nor those who come into her domain.

hebrew_text: הָלְכָה מִקֶּבֶר בַּעְלָהּ לְבֵית אָבִיהָ, אוֹ שֶׁחָזְרָה לְבֵית חָמִיהָ וְלֹא נַעֲשֵׂית אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּיָא — אֵין הַיּוֹרְשִׁין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ. וְאִם נַעֲשֵׂית אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּיָא — הַיּוֹרְשִׁין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ עַל הֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, וְאֵין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ עַל מַה שֶּׁעָבַר.
human_translation: went from her husband’s grave, to her father’s house, or where she returned to her father-in-law’s house and did not become a steward the heirs cannot administer an oath to her And if she became a steward, the heirs may administer an oath to her about the future, but they cannot administer an oath to her with regard to what in the past,
llm_translation: Halakha from the grave of her husband to the house of her father, or if she returned to the house of her father-in-law and was not made a widow - the heirs do not make her swear. And if she was made a widow - the heirs make her swear for the future, but they do not make her swear for what has passed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שְׁבוּעָה מַאי עֲבִידְתֵּהּ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב:
human_translation: What is the purpose of an oath? Rav Yehuda said Rav said:
llm_translation: Gemara: "What is the work of a 'Gem Shvu'ah'?" Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav:

hebrew_text: עַל אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּיָא שֶׁנַּעֲשֵׂית בְּחַיֵּי בַעְלָהּ. רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: עַל הַפּוֹגֶמֶת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: to who became a steward during her husband’s lifetime, Rav Naḥman Rabba bar Avuh said: to a woman who claims that she received partial payment of her marriage contract,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Concerning the potion that was made during her husband's lifetime. Rav Nachman said Rabba bar Avuh: Concerning the adulteress, her writing is stated.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל רַב מָרְדֳּכַי, אַמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר עַל הַפּוֹגֶמֶת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ — דְּמַסְּקָא אַדַּעְתַּהּ: דִּלְמָא מִצְטָרְכִי לִי זוּזֵי וְשָׁקֵילְנָא מִכְּתוּבְּתַאי, וְאָמְרָה לֵיהּ: כְּתוֹב לִי דְּלָא מַשְׁבְּעַתְּ לִי. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר עַל אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּיָא שֶׁנַּעֲשֵׂית בְּחַיֵּי בַעְלָהּ, אִיהִי מִי הֲוָת יָדְעָה דְּמוֹתֵיב לַהּ אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּיָא, דְּאָמְרָה לֵיהּ: ״כְּתוֹב לִי דְּלָא מַשְׁבְּעַתְּ לִי״?
human_translation: Rav Mordekhai went said halakha before Rav Ashi Granted, according to the one who says it is referring to a woman who claims that she received partial payment of her marriage contract, that it enters her mind Perhaps I will require money, and I will take from my marriage contract And she says to him Write for me that you will not administer an oath to me However, according to the one who says is referring to who became a steward during her husband’s lifetime, did she know that would establish her as a steward, to say to him: Write for me that you will not administer an oath to me?
llm_translation: Rav Mordechai went, she said in front of Rav Ashi: "It is understandable for one who says about the blemished one, its writing is known: perhaps I need money and I will take from my writings, and she said to him: Write for me that you did not swear to me. But for one who says about the suspected adulteress that she was made during her husband's lifetime, would she have known that the adulteress was standing before her, that she said to him: 'Write for me that you did not swear to me'?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתּוּן, אַהָא מַתְנִיתוּ לַהּ, אֲנַן אַהָא מַתְנֵינַן לַהּ: הָלְכָה מִקֶּבֶר בַּעְלָהּ לְבֵית אָבִיהָ, אוֹ שֶׁחָזְרָה לְבֵית חָמִיהָ וְלֹא נַעֲשֵׂית אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּיָא — אֵין הַיּוֹרְשִׁין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ. וְאִם נַעֲשֵׂית אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּיָא — יוֹרְשִׁין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ עַל הֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, וְאֵין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ עַל שֶׁעָבַר.
human_translation: said to him: You teach this with regard to that We, teach it with regard to this she went from her husband’s grave to her father’s house or where she returned to her father-in-law’s house and did not become a steward the heirs cannot administer an oath to her And if she became a steward, the heirs may administer an oath to her about the future, but they cannot administer an oath to her with regard to what in the past,
llm_translation: He said to him: You, they have taught her, we have taught her: The halacha is from the grave of her husband to the house of her father, or if she returned to the house of her mother-in-law and she did not become a widow — the heirs do not make her swear. And if she became a widow — the heirs make her swear for the future, but they do not make her swear for the past.

hebrew_text: שֶׁעָבַר מַאי עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: עַל אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּיָא שֶׁנַּעֲשֵׂית בְּחַיֵּי הַבַּעַל,
human_translation: What is the purpose of the past? Rav Yehuda said Rav said: to who became a steward during her husband’s lifetime.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: What does he do? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Concerning the apotropos that was made during the lifetime of the husband,

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בֵּין מִיתָה לִקְבוּרָה מַשְׁבְּעִינַן לַהּ. וְרַב מַתְנָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בֵּין מִיתָה לִקְבוּרָה לָא מַשְׁבְּעִינַן לַהּ, דְּאָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי: לִכְרָגָא וְלִמְזוֹנֵי וְלִקְבוּרָה — מְזַבְּנִינַן בְּלָא אַכְרָזְתָּא.
human_translation: But they can administer an oath to her between death and burial. And Rav Mattana said: Even between death and burial, they cannot administer an oath to her, as Neharde’a say: For head tax [ karga ], and for sustenance, and for burial, we sell without an announcement.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But between death and burial we require an oath from her. And Rav Matna said: Even between death and burial we do not require an oath from her, as the Nahardeans say: For betrothal, sustenance, and burial - we transact without a public announcement. English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא: ״דְּלָא נֶדֶר וּדְלָא שְׁבוּעָה״ — הוּא אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהַשְׁבִּיעָהּ, אֲבָל יוֹרְשִׁין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ. ״נְקִי נֶדֶר נְקִי שְׁבוּעָה״ — בֵּין הוּא וּבֵין יוֹרְשִׁין אֵין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ. הָכִי קָאָמַר לַהּ: מְנַקְּיַתְּ מִשְּׁבוּעֲתָא.
human_translation: Rabba said Rabbi Ḥiyya said: Not a vow and not an oath, he cannot administer an oath to her, but heirs can administer an oath to her. clear, a vow clear an oath, neither he nor heirs can administer an oath to her. this is what he is saying to her: You are clear the oath,
