llm_translation: Rabba said in the name of Rabbi Chiya: "If it is not a vow and it is not an oath," he cannot make her swear, but heirs can make her swear. "A clean vow, a clean oath" - neither he nor heirs make her swear. This is what he said to her: "She is cleared from the oath."

hebrew_text: וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא: ״דְּלָא נֶדֶר וּדְלָא שְׁבוּעָה״ — הוּא אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהַשְׁבִּיעָהּ, אֲבָל יוֹרְשִׁין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ. ״נְקִי נֶדֶר נְקִי שְׁבוּעָה״ — בֵּין הוּא וּבֵין יוֹרְשִׁין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ. הָכִי קָאָמַר לַהּ: נַקַּי נַפְשִׁךְ בִּשְׁבוּעֲתָא.
human_translation: But Rav Yosef Rabbi Ḥiyya said Not a vow and not an oath, he cannot administer an oath to her, but heirs can administer an oath to her. clear a vow clear an oath, either he or heirs can administer an oath to her. this is what he is saying to her: Clear yourself by an oath.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said in the name of Rabbi Chiya: "One who did not make a vow and did not take an oath - he cannot swear, but his heirs can swear for him. 'A clean vow, a clean oath' - whether he or his heirs can swear for him. This is what he is saying to her: 'Keep your soul clean with an oath.'"

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח רַבִּי זַכַּאי לְמָר עוּקְבָא: בֵּין ״דְּלָא שְׁבוּעָה״, בֵּין ״דִּנְקִי שְׁבוּעָה״, בֵּין ״דְּלָא נֶדֶר״ וּבֵין ״דִּנְקִי נֶדֶר״ — ״בְּנִכְסַי״ הוּא אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהַשְׁבִּיעָהּ, אֲבָל יוֹרְשִׁין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ. מִנִּכְסַיָּא אִילֵּין — בֵּין הוּא וּבֵין יוֹרְשָׁיו אֵין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zakkai sent to Mar Ukva Whether Not an oath, whether Clear an oath, whether Not a vow, whether Clear a vow, With regard to my property, he cannot administer an oath to her, but heirs can administer an oath to her. From these properties, neither he nor his heirs can administer an oath to her.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zakkai sent to Mar Ukva: Whether "not an oath," or "a clean oath," or "not a vow," or "a clean vow" — "with his possessions" he cannot swear, but his heirs can swear for him. With movable property — neither he nor his heirs can swear for him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשּׁוּם אַבָּא שָׁאוּל בֶּן אִימָּא מִרְיָם: בֵּין ״דְּלָא שְׁבוּעָה״, בֵּין ״דִּנְקִי שְׁבוּעָה״, בֵּין ״דְּלָא נֶדֶר״, וּבֵין ״דִּנְקִי נֶדֶר״, בֵּין ״מִנִּכְסַי״, וּבֵין ״מִנִּכְסַיָּא אִילֵּין״ — בֵּין הוּא וּבֵין יוֹרְשָׁיו אֵין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ. אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: הַבָּא לִיפָּרַע מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִים לֹא יִפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said in the name of Abba Shaul ben Imma Miriam: Whether Not an oath, whether Clear an oath, whether Not a vow, whether Clear a vow, whether From my property, whether From these properties, neither he nor his heirs can administer an oath to her However, what can I do, as the Sages said one who comes to collect from the property of orphans may collect only by an oath?
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel in the name of Abba Shaul son of Imma Miryam: Whether it is "not an oath," or "a clean oath," or "not a vow," or "a clean vow," or "from my property," or "from the property of others," — neither he nor his heirs can swear to it. But what shall I do? For the sages have said: One who seeks to collect from the property of orphans can only collect through an oath.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי לַהּ, מַתְנִיתָא אַבָּא שָׁאוּל בֶּן אִימָּא מִרְיָם אָמַר: בֵּין ״דְּלָא שְׁבוּעָה״, בֵּין ״דִּנְקִי שְׁבוּעָה״, בֵּין ״דְּלָא נֶדֶר״, וּבֵין ״נְקִי נֶדֶר״, בֵּין ״מִנִּכְסֵי״, וּבֵין ״מִנִּכְסַיָּא אִילֵּין״ — בֵּין הוּא וּבֵין יוֹרְשָׁיו אֵין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ, אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: הַבָּא לִיפָּרַע מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִים לֹא יִפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּבֶן אִימָּא מִרְיָם.
human_translation: And some say a baraita , Abba Shaul ben Imma Miriam said: Whether Not an oath, whether Clear an oath, whether Not a vow, whether Clear a vow, whether From my property, whether From these properties, neither he nor his heirs can administer an oath to her However, what can I do, as the Sages said one who comes to collect from the property of orphans may collect only by an oath? Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with ben Imma Miriam.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And there are those who say to her, a Baraita: Abba Shaul son of Imma Miryam said: Whether "not an oath," or "a clean oath," or "not a vow," or "a clean vow," whether "from estates," or "from my estates" - whether he or his heirs do not swear, but what shall I do, for the sages said: One who comes to collect from the estates of orphans should only collect through an oath. Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is like Ben Imma Miryam.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַפּוֹגֶמֶת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ — לֹא תִּפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה. עֵד אֶחָד מְעִידָהּ שֶׁהִיא פְּרוּעָה — לֹא תִּפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה. מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִים, וּמִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים, וְשֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו — לֹא תִּפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: who vitiates her marriage contract can collect only by an oath. one witness testifies that is paid, she can collect only by an oath. from the property of orphans, or from liened property or when not in presence, can collect only by an oath.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "If the dowry of the bride is written — she may only collect it through a formal claim in court. If one witness testifies that it has been released — she may only collect it through a formal claim in court. From the estates of orphans, and from estates of slaves who are not in his presence — she may only collect it through a formal claim in court."

hebrew_text: הַפּוֹגֶמֶת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ כֵּיצַד? הָיְתָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ אֶלֶף זוּז, וְאָמַר לָהּ: הִתְקַבַּלְתְּ כְּתוּבָּתִיךְ, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: לֹא הִתְקַבַּלְתִּי אֶלָּא מָנֶה — לֹא תִּפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: who vitiates her marriage contract, how so, her marriage contract was a thousand dinars, and said to her: You received your marriage contract, and she says: I received only one hundred dinars, can collect only an oath.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: How is the pogemet written? Its writing was one thousand zuz, and he said to her: "Have you accepted your writing?" And she says: "I have only accepted a maneh." You shall not collect except within a week.

hebrew_text: עֵד אֶחָד מְעִידָהּ שֶׁהִיא פְּרוּעָה, כֵּיצַד? הָיְתָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ אֶלֶף זוּז, וְאָמַר לָהּ: הִתְקַבַּלְתְּ כְּתוּבָּתִיךְ, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: לֹא הִתְקַבַּלְתִּי, וְעֵד אֶחָד מְעִידָהּ שֶׁהִיא פְּרוּעָה — לֹא תִּפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: one witness testifies that is paid, how so? her marriage contract was a thousand dinars, and said to her: You received your marriage contract, and she says: I did not receive and one witness testifies about that it is paid, can collect only by an oath.
llm_translation: One witness testifies that she is divorced, how so? Her marriage contract was written for a thousand zuz, and he said to her: "Have you received your marriage contract?" And she says: "I have not received it." And one witness testifies that she is divorced - she may only collect through an oath.

hebrew_text: מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים כֵּיצַד? מָכַר נְכָסָיו לַאֲחֵרִים וְהִיא נִפְרַעַת מִן הַלָּקוֹחוֹת — לֹא תִּפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: From liened property, how so? sold his property to others, and she collect from the purchasers, she can collect only by an oath.
llm_translation: Properties that are enslaved, how? He sold his properties to others and she is redeemed from the buyers - she shall not be redeemed except with a week.

hebrew_text: מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִים כֵּיצַד? מֵת וְהִנִּיחַ נְכָסָיו לִיתוֹמִים, וְהִיא נִפְרַעַת מִן הַיְּתוֹמִים — לֹא תִּפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: From the property of orphans, how so? died and left his property to orphans, and she collect from the orphans, can collect only by an oath.
llm_translation: Estates of orphans, how? One who died and left his estate to orphans, and she collects from the orphans - she may only collect within a week.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו כֵּיצַד? הָלַךְ לוֹ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וְהִיא נִפְרַעַת שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו — אֵינָהּ נִפְרַעַת אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Or when not in his presence, how so? he went a country overseas and she collects when not in his presence, can collect only by an oath.
llm_translation: And not in his presence how? He went to the province of the sea, and it was repaid not in his presence - it is repaid only in a week.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהִיא תּוֹבַעַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ — הַיּוֹרְשִׁין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ, וְאִם אֵינָהּ תּוֹבַעַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ — אֵין הַיּוֹרְשִׁין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Whenever she claims her marriage contract, the heirs administer an oath to her. And if she does not claim her marriage contract, the heirs do not administer an oath to her.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: As long as she demands her marriage contract - the heirs make her swear, and if she does not demand her marriage contract - the heirs do not make her swear.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ סָבַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא לְמֵימַר שְׁבוּעָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — דְּקָא טָעֵין מָאתַיִם וְקָא מוֹדֵה לֵיהּ בְּמֵאָה, הָוְיָא לֵיהּ הוֹדָאָה בְּמִקְצָת הַטַּעֲנָה, וְכׇל הַמּוֹדֶה בְּמִקְצָת הַטַּעֲנָה — יִשָּׁבַע.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama thought to say an oath by Torah as claims two hundred and she concedes to him with regard to one hundred. This is a partial admission of the claim, and whoever admits to part of a claim must take an oath
llm_translation: Gemar says: Ramei son of Hama thought to say: A biblical oath, for he is claiming two hundred and he admits to one hundred, he should have partial admission in his claim, and anyone who admits partially in his claim - should swear.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁתֵּי תְשׁוּבוֹת בַּדָּבָר: חֲדָא — דְּכׇל הַנִּשְׁבָּעִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה נִשְׁבָּעִין וְלֹא מְשַׁלְּמִין, וְהִיא נִשְׁבַּעַת וְנוֹטֶלֶת. וְעוֹד: אֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין עַל כְּפִירַת שִׁעְבּוּד קַרְקָעוֹת.
human_translation: Rava said: two answers in the matter, One that anyone who take an oath in the Torah takes an oath and does not pay. and she takes an oath and takes And furthermore, one does not take an oath with regard to a denial of a lien on land.
llm_translation: Rava said: Two responses on the matter: One - that all who swear by the Torah swear and do not pay, and she swears and takes. And furthermore: They do not swear regarding the denial of the servitude of estates.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: מִדְּרַבָּנַן, דְּפָרַע — דָּיֵיק, דְּמִיפְּרַע — לָא דָּיֵיק, וּרְמוֹ רַבָּנַן שְׁבוּעָה עֲלַהּ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּתִידּוֹק.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: by rabbinic who pays is precise who was paid is not precise. and the Sages imposed an oath upon her, so that she should be precise
llm_translation: Rava said: From the Rabbis, who interpret - it is precise; who do not interpret - it is not precise. And the Rabbis imposed an oath upon him in order to clarify.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: פּוֹגֶמֶת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ בְּעֵדִים, מַהוּ? אִם אִיתָא דְּפָרְעָה — בְּעֵדִים הֲוָה פָּרַע לַהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא אִיתְרְמוֹיֵי אִיתְרְמִי לֵיהּ?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before a woman vitiates her marriage contract in witnesses, what is if it is that he has paid her he would have paid her in witnesses, Or perhaps he happened to have
llm_translation: He asked them: If its writing is blemished in the presence of witnesses, what is the law? If it is found that Pharaoh — he blemished it in the presence of witnesses, or perhaps the blemishers blemished it for him?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: כׇּל הַנִּשְׁבָּעִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה נִשְׁבָּעִין וְלֹא מְשַׁלְּמִין. וְאֵלּוּ נִשְׁבָּעִין וְנוֹטְלִין: הַשָּׂכִיר, וְהַנִּגְזָל, וְהַנֶּחְבָּל, וְשֶׁכְּנֶגְדּוֹ חָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבוּעָה, וְחֶנְוָנִי עַל פִּנְקָסוֹ, וְהַפּוֹגֵם שְׁטָרוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בְּעֵדִים. שֶׁלֹּא בְּעֵדִים — אִין, בְּעֵדִים — לָא!
human_translation: Come hear Anyone who take an oath in the Torah takes an oath and does not pay. And these take an oath and take The hired worker and one who was robbed; and one who was injured, and the one opposing him, suspected with regard to oaths; and a storekeeper on his notebook [ pinkaso ]; and one who receives partial payment of his document not in witnesses. not in witnesses, yes, in witnesses, no,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: All those who take an oath in the Torah are obligated to take an oath and do not pay. And these are those who take an oath and collect: the hired worker, the one who steals, the one who damages, one against whom there is a claim of an oath, the creditor for his promissory note, and one who alters his document without witnesses. Without witnesses - no, with witnesses - yes!

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא בְּעֵדִים — דְּוַדַּאי צְרִיכָה שְׁבוּעָה, אֲבָל שֶׁלֹּא בְּעֵדִים, אֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי כְּמֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה וְתִשְׁקוֹל בְּלֹא שְׁבוּעָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: is speaking It is not necessary: It is not necessary in witnesses, she certainly requires an oath. However, not in witnesses, say should be like one who restores lost property. And she should take without an oath, teaches us
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Lā mibbaʿyā qāʾāmar: lā mibbaʿyā bəʿēdīm — dəwaddai ṣərīkhā shəvuʿāh, ʾavāl shello bəʿēdīm, ʾēmā tēhwe kəmēshīv ʾavēdāh wətišqōl bəlō shəvuʿāh, qāʾ mashmaʿ lan." English translation: "He does not need to say: he does not need witnesses — for sure, if it requires an oath, but if it does not require witnesses, say it is like returning a lost object and weighing it without an oath, this is what he implies to us."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הַפּוֹגֶמֶת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ פָּחוֹת פָּחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן: כֵּיוָן דְּקָא דָיְיקָא כּוּלֵּי הַאי, קוּשְׁטָא קָא אַמְרַהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא אִיעָרוֹמֵי קָא מִעָרְמָא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before a woman who vitiates her marriage contract less than the value of a peruta , what is Do we say since she is precise to such an extent she telling the truth, or perhaps is deceiving shall stand
llm_translation: The Gemara asked them: If the writing of the bill of divorce is missing letter by letter less than the size of a perutah, what is the law? Do we say: Since it is still discernible, it is valid, or perhaps it is considered erased? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: פּוֹחֶתֶת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן הַיְינוּ פּוֹגֶמֶת, אוֹ דִלְמָא: פּוֹגֶמֶת מוֹדְיָא בְּמִקְצָת, הָא לָא קָא מוֹדְיָא בְּמִקְצָת.
human_translation: dilemma was raised before reduces her marriage contract what is Do we say this is a woman who vitiates Or perhaps a woman who vitiates admits to part of this one does not admit to
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: He asked them: If its writing is diminished, what is the law? Do we say that this is a blemish, or perhaps: a blemish is admitted in part, but not admitted in part.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: פּוֹחֶתֶת — תִּפָּרַע שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה. כֵּיצַד? הָיְתָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ אֶלֶף זוּז, וְאָמַר לָהּ ״הִתְקַבַּלְתְּ כְּתוּבָּתִיךְ״, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת ״לֹא הִתְקַבַּלְתִּי, וְאֵינָהּ אֶלָּא מָנֶה״ — נִפְרַעַת שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Come hear One who reduces can collect without an oath. How so? her marriage contract was a thousand dinars, and said to her: You have received your marriage contract, and she says: I have not received but it is only one hundred dinars, may collect without an oath.
llm_translation: Come and hear: A widow — she collects her ketubah not within the week. How so? If her ketubah was written for a thousand zuz, and he said to her, "Have you received your ketubah?" and she says, "I have not received it, and it is only a mana" — she collects it not within the week.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי גָּבְיָא? בְּהַאי שְׁטָרָא? הַאי שְׁטָרָא חַסְפָּא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא! אָמַר רָבָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה: בְּאוֹמֶרֶת ״אֲמָנָה הָיְתָה לִי בֵּינִי לְבֵינוֹ״.
human_translation: with what does she collect With this document? This document is merely earthenware, Rava, son of Rabba, said: to one who says: There was trust between him and me
llm_translation: With what is it concerned? With this document? This document is merely a regular document! Rava, son of Rabba, said: By saying, "There was a pledge between me and him."

hebrew_text: עֵד אֶחָד מְעִידָהּ שֶׁהִיא פְּרוּעָה. סְבַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא לְמֵימַר שְׁבוּעָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא יָקוּם עֵד אֶחָד בְּאִישׁ לְכׇל עָוֹן וּלְכׇל חַטָּאת״. לְכׇל עָוֹן וּלְכׇל חַטָּאת הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ קָם, אֲבָל קָם הוּא לִשְׁבוּעָה. וְאָמַר מָר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁהַשְּׁנַיִם מְחַיְּיבִין אוֹתוֹ מָמוֹן — אֶחָד מְחַיְּיבוֹ שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: one witness testifies that was paid Rami bar Ḥama thought to say an oath by Torah as it is written: “One witness shall not rise up against a man for any iniquity, or for any sin” It is for any iniquity or for any sin that he may not rise up, but he may rise up for an oath. And the Master said: any place, where two deem one liable money, one obligates him to take an oath.
llm_translation: One witness testifies that it is spread out. Ramei Bar Chama thought to say an oath of Torah, as it is written: "One witness shall not rise up against a man for any iniquity or for any sin." For any iniquity and for any sin, that is where he does not rise up, but he does rise up for an oath. And the Master said: Any place where two obligate him to pay money, one obligates him to take an oath.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, שְׁתֵּי תְּשׁוּבוֹת בַּדָּבָר. חֲדָא: דְּכׇל הַנִּשְׁבָּעִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה נִשְׁבָּעִין וְלֹא מְשַׁלְּמִין, וְהִיא נִשְׁבַּעַת וְנוֹטֶלֶת. וְעוֹד: אֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין עַל כְּפִירַת שִׁיעְבּוּד קַרְקָעוֹת.
human_translation: Rava said: two answers in the matter, One that anyone who take an oath in the Torah takes an oath and does not pay. and she takes an oath and takes And furthermore, one does not take an oath with regard to a denial of a lien on land.
llm_translation: Rava said, two responses on the matter. One: that all who swear in the Torah swear and do not fulfill, and she swears and takes. And furthermore: they do not swear on the denial of the service of the ground.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: מִדְּרַבָּנַן, כְּדֵי לְהָפִיס דַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל בַּעַל.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: by rabbinic in order to put the husband’s mind at ease.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: From the Sages, in order to appease the opinion of the owner.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא:
human_translation: Rav Pappa said:
llm_translation: Rav Papa said:

hebrew_text: אִי פִּיקֵּחַ הוּא, מַיְיתֵי לַהּ לִידֵי שְׁבוּעָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. יָהֵיב לַהּ כְּתוּבְּתַהּ בְּאַפֵּי חַד סָהֲדָא, וְסָמֵיךְ סָהֲדָא קַמָּא אַסָּהֲדָא בָּתְרָא, וּמוֹקֵים לְהוּ לְהָנָךְ קַמָּאֵי בְּמִלְוָה.
human_translation: If is perspicacious, induce her to an oath by Torah He gives her her entire marriage contract in the presence of one witness, and joins the first witness to the last witness, And he establishes this first as a loan,
llm_translation: If he is a witness, he brings her to the obligation of an oath from the Torah. He gives her her document in one hand, and the witness stands with her on one side and the other witness on the other side, and they establish for her a place to rest in front of them in a loan.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: הֵיאַךְ סָמֵיךְ סָהֲדָא קַמָּא אַסָּהֲדָא בָּתְרָא? אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: יָהֵיב לַהּ כְּתוּבְּתַהּ בְּאַפֵּי סָהֲדָא קַמָּא וְסָהֲדָא בָּתְרָא וּמוֹקֵים לְה[וּ] לְהָנָךְ קַמָּאֵי בְּהַלְוָאָה.
human_translation: Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, objects to this: How can he join the first witness to the last witness Rather, Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: He gives her her entire marriage contract in the presence of the first witness and the last witness. And he establishes this first as a loan,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, objects to her: How can you establish testimony in front of one witness and testimony afterwards? Rather, Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: He should give her her document in the presence of the first witness and the witness afterwards, and establish it for her to rest on in a loan.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי, אַכַּתִּי יְכוֹלָה לְמֵימַר: שְׁתֵּי כְּתוּבּוֹת הֲוַאי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הוּא דְּמוֹדַע לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi objects to this: can still say: I had two marriage contracts. Rather, Rav Ashi said: It he informs
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Ashe, "Perhaps she could say: 'Two Scriptures are here!' Rather, Rav Ashe said: It is known to Him."

hebrew_text: מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים. תְּנַן הָתָם: וְכֵן הַיְּתוֹמִים לֹא יִפָּרְעוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: from liened property We learned there And similarly, orphans can collect only by an oath.
llm_translation: Properties that are mortgaged. We learned there: And similarly, orphans may only collect payment through a promissory note.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאן? אִילֵימָא מִלֹּוֶה — הַשְׁתָּא אֲבִיהֶן שָׁקֵיל בְּלָא שְׁבוּעָה, וְאִינְהוּ בִּשְׁבוּעָה?! אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְכֵן הַיְּתוֹמִים מִן הַיְּתוֹמִים — לֹא יִפָּרְעוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: From whom If we say from one who borrowed Now, their father, take without an oath and they, by an oath? Rather, this is what saying: And similarly, the orphans the orphans can collect only by an oath.
llm_translation: From whom? If you say from a lender - this very day their father takes without a pledge, and they (the orphans) with a pledge?! Rather, this is what it means: "And so the orphans from the orphans - they shall not collect except with a pledge."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זְרִיקָא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאָמְרוּ יְתוֹמִים: אָמַר לָנוּ אַבָּא ״לָוִיתִי וּפָרַעְתִּי״, אֲבָל אָמְרוּ: אָמַר לָנוּ אַבָּא ״לֹא לָוִיתִי״ — אַף בִּשְׁבוּעָה לֹא יִפָּרְעוּ.
human_translation: Rav Zerika said Rav Yehuda said: It was taught only if orphans said: father said to us: I borrowed and repaid. However, said: father said to us: I did not borrow, they may not collect even an oath.
llm_translation: Rav Zerika said in the name of Rav Yehuda, they only taught this regarding what orphans said: Abba told us, "I have pledged and not redeemed," but they said: Abba told us, "I have not pledged" — even during the week they should not redeem.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא, אַדְּרַבָּה: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״לֹא לָוִיתִי״ — כְּאוֹמֵר ״לֹא פָּרַעְתִּי״ דָּמֵי,
human_translation: Rava objects to this: On the contrary, anyone who says: I did not borrow is considered like one who says: I did not repay.
llm_translation: Rava objects to her, saying: On the contrary, it is abundant: anyone who says "I did not lend" - it is like saying "I did not pay," the equivalent.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִתְּמַר, הָכִי אִתְּמַר, אָמַר רַב זְרִיקָא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאָמְרוּ יְתוֹמִים: אָמַר לָנוּ אַבָּא ״לָוִיתִי וּפָרַעְתִּי״, אֲבָל אָמְרוּ: אָמַר לָנוּ אַבָּא ״לֹא לָוִיתִי״ — נִפְרָעִין שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה. שֶׁכׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״לֹא לָוִיתִי״ כְּאוֹמֵר ״לֹא פָּרַעְתִּי״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rather, If it was stated, it was stated like this: Rav Zerika said Rav Yehuda said: They taught only if the orphans said: father said to us: I borrowed and repaid. However, they said: father said to us: I did not borrow, can collect without an oath, for anyone who says: I did not borrow is considered like one who says: I did not repay.
llm_translation: Rather, if it is said, thus it is said, Rav Zeirika said Rav Yehuda: They only taught that orphans said: Our father told us "I will pay and I will not pay," but they said: Our father told us "I will not pay" - they are exempt from an oath. For anyone who says "I will not pay" is like saying "I have not paid."

hebrew_text: וְנִפְרַעַת שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו, לֹא תִּפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה. אָמַר רַב אַחָא שַׂר הַבִּירָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בָּא לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יִצְחָק בְּאַנְטוֹכְיָא, וְאָמַר: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לִכְתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה, מִשּׁוּם חִינָּא. אֲבָל בַּעַל חוֹב — לָא.
human_translation: one who collect when not in presence can collect only by an oath. Rav Aḥa Sar HaBira said: An incident came before Rabbi Yitzḥak in Antioch, and he said: They taught only with regard to the wife’s marriage contract; because favor However, a creditor not
llm_translation: "And one may exact payment not in his presence, rather only through a proxy. Rav Acha, the governor of the city, said: An incident occurred before Rabbi Yitzchak in Antuchya, and he said: They only taught this regarding a married woman, due to grace. But for a debtor - no."

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אֲפִילּוּ בַּעַל חוֹב, שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד נוֹטֵל מְעוֹתָיו שֶׁל חֲבֵרוֹ, וְהוֹלֵךְ וְיוֹשֵׁב בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וְאַתָּה נוֹעֵל דֶּלֶת בִּפְנֵי לוֹוִין.
human_translation: And Rava Rav Naḥman said: Even a creditor so that each and every person will not take his friend’s money and go and reside in a country overseas And you would be locking the door in the face of borrowers,
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Nachman said: Even in the case of a debtor, that he should not take each one his fellow's money, and go and sit in the province of the sea, while you lock the door in front of the Levites.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁתּוֹבַעַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ וְכוּ׳. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אַהֵיָיא? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, אַהָא: וְנִפְרַעַת שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו, לָא תִּפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה. לָא שְׁנָא לִמְזוֹנֵי וְלָא שְׁנָא לִכְתוּבָּה. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְמֵימַר: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁתּוֹבַעַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ — יוֹרְשֶׁיהָ מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Whenever she claims her marriage contract, To which Rabbi Shimon Rabbi Yirmeya said: to this And one who collect when not in presence can collect only by an oath. is no different for sustenance, and is no different for marriage contract. And Rabbi Shimon comes to say whenever she claims her marriage contract heirs administer an oath to her
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: As long as she demands her marriage contract, etc. Rabbi Shimon Ahaiya? Rabbi Yirmeya said: Ah, and she is to be repaid not in his presence, she is only repaid through an oath. It is no different for sustenance or for a marriage contract. And Rabbi Shimon came to say: As long as she demands her marriage contract, her heirs must swear to it.

hebrew_text: אֵינָהּ תּוֹבַעַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ — אֵין יוֹרְשִׁין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ. וְקָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּחָנָן וּבְנֵי כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים. דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁהָלַךְ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וְאִשְׁתּוֹ תּוֹבַעַת מְזוֹנוֹת, חָנָן אוֹמֵר: תִּשָּׁבַע בַּסּוֹף, וְלֹא תִּשָּׁבַע בַּתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: she does not claim her marriage contract, heirs do not administer an oath to her. And they disagree with regard to the dispute of Ḥanan and the sons of the High Priests, as we learned one who went to a country overseas and his wife claims sustenance, Ḥanan says: She takes an oath at the conclusion, And she does not take an oath at the beginning,
llm_translation: The text: "Eina tova'at ketuvatah - ein yorshin mashbi'in otah. Vekamifalgi biflugta dechanan uvenei kohanim gedolim. Ditnan: Mi shehalakh limdinat hayam veishto tova'at mezonot, chanan omer: tishava basof, velo tishava batichila." Translation: "Her claim is not in accordance with her written document - her heirs do not swear her claim. And they dispute in the dispute of Chananiah and the sons of the great priests. For it was taught: If one went to a maritime province and his wife claims maintenance, Chananiah says: She should swear at the end, and not swear at the beginning."

hebrew_text: נֶחְלְקוּ עָלָיו בְּנֵי כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים וְאָמְרוּ: תִּשָּׁבַע בַּתְּחִלָּה וּבַסּוֹף. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן כְּחָנָן, רַבָּנַן כִּבְנֵי כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים.
human_translation: The sons of the High Priests disagreed with him, and said: She takes an oath at the beginning, and at the conclusion, Rabbi Shimon like Ḥanan, the Rabbis, like the sons of the High Priests,
llm_translation: The sons of the great priests disagreed with him and said: "You shall swear at the beginning and at the end." Rabbi Shimon Kehanan, the sages like the sons of the great priests.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הַאי יוֹרְשִׁין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ? בֵּית דִּין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rav Sheshet objects to this heirs administer an oath to her? It should the court administers an oath to her,
llm_translation: Challenges to him Rav Sheshet: these inheritors swear her? Court swears her from requires to him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, אַהָא: הָלְכָה מִקֶּבֶר בַּעְלָהּ לְבֵית אָבִיהָ, אוֹ שֶׁחָזְרָה לְבֵית חָמִיהָ וְלֹא נַעֲשֵׂית אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּיָא — אֵין הַיּוֹרְשִׁים מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ. וְאִם נַעֲשֵׂית אַפּוֹטְרוֹפְּיָא — יוֹרְשִׁין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ עַל הֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, וְאֵין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ עַל מַה שֶּׁעָבַר. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְמֵימַר: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁתּוֹבַעַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ — יוֹרְשִׁין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ, אֵינָהּ תּוֹבַעַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ — אֵין הַיּוֹרְשִׁין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Sheshet said to this went from her husband’s grave, to her father’s house, or where she returned to her father-in-law’s house and did not become a steward, the heirs cannot administer an oath to her And if she became a steward, the heirs may administer an oath to her about the future, but they cannot administer an oath to her with regard to what in the past, And Rabbi Shimon came to say whenever she claims her marriage contract heirs administer an oath to her, she does not claim her marriage contract, heirs do not administer an oath to her.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Sheshet said, "Aha: If a woman goes from her husband's grave to her father's house, or if she returns to her father-in-law's house and she is not made a widow — the heirs do not make her swear. But if she is made a widow — the heirs make her swear regarding what is to come, and they do not make her swear regarding what has passed." And Rabbi Shimon came to say: "As long as she demands her marriage contract — the heirs make her swear, if she does not demand her marriage contract — the heirs do not make her swear."

hebrew_text: וְקָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל וְרַבָּנַן. דִּתְנַן: אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס שֶׁמִּינָּהוּ אֲבִי יְתוֹמִים — יִשָּׁבַע. מִינּוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין — לֹא יִשָּׁבַע. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר, חִילּוּף הַדְּבָרִים: מִינּוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין — יִשָּׁבַע, מִינָּהוּ אֲבִי יְתוֹמִים — לֹא יִשָּׁבַע.
human_translation: And they disagree with regard to the dispute of Abba Shaul and the Rabbis, as we learned A steward who was appointed the father of orphans must take an oath the court appointed him not take an oath. Abba Shaul says: The matters are reversed. court appointed him, he must take an oath; the father of orphans appointed him, not take an oath.
llm_translation: And they argued in the case of the dispute of Abba Sha'ul and the Rabbis. For it was taught: If an apotropos is appointed, who is the father of orphans — he shall swear. If he is appointed by the court — he shall not swear. Abba Sha'ul says, reversing the matter: If he is appointed by the court — he shall swear, if he is the father of orphans — he shall not swear.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל, וְרַבָּנַן כְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon in accordance with Abba Shaul, And the Rabbis in accordance with the Rabbis
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon is like Abba Saul, and the Rabbis are like the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ אַבָּיֵי: הַאי ״כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁתּוֹבַעַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ״ — אִם תּוֹבַעַת מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Abaye objects to This whenever she claims her marriage contract, he should If she claims,
llm_translation: Abbaye objects to her: This "as long as she demands her marriage contract" - if she demands, he must give it to her!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אַהָא: כָּתַב לָהּ ״נֶדֶר וּשְׁבוּעָה אֵין לִי עָלַיִךְ״ — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהַשְׁבִּיעָהּ כּוּ׳. ״נֶדֶר וּשְׁבוּעָה אֵין לִי, וְלֹא לְיוֹרְשַׁי, וְלֹא לַבָּאִים בִּרְשׁוּתִי, עָלַיִךְ, וְעַל יוֹרְשַׁיִךְ, וְעַל הַבָּאִין בִּרְשׁוּתִךְ״ — אֵין יָכוֹל לְהַשְׁבִּיעָהּ לֹא הוּא, וְלֹא יוֹרְשָׁיו, וְלֹא הַבָּאִין בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ. לֹא הִיא, וְלֹא יוֹרְשֶׁיהָ, וְלֹא הַבָּאִין בִּרְשׁוּתָהּ. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְמֵימַר: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁתּוֹבַעַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ — יוֹרְשִׁין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said to this wrote for her: I do not have a vow or an oath upon you, cannot administer an oath to her. Neither I, nor my heirs, nor those who come on my authority have a vow or an oath upon you, or upon your heirs, or upon those who come on your authority, cannot administer an oath her not he, nor his heirs, nor those who come on his authority not to her, nor her heirs, nor those who come on her authority. And Rabbi Shimon came to say whenever she claims her marriage contract heirs administer an oath to her.
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said, "Aha: If he wrote to her, 'I have no vow or oath upon you,' he cannot make her swear. 'I have no vow or oath, neither for myself, nor for my heirs, nor for those who come into my possession, upon you, and upon your heirs, and upon those who come into your possession' — he cannot make her swear, neither he, nor his heirs, nor those who come into his possession. Not she, nor her heirs, nor those who come into her possession. And Rabbi Shimon came to say: As long as she demands her document, the heirs make her swear."

hebrew_text: וְקָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל בֶּן אִימָּא מִרְיָם וְרַבָּנַן. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל, וְרַבָּנַן כְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And they disagree with regard to the dispute of Abba Shaul ben Imma Miriam and the Rabbis. Rabbi Shimon in accordance with Abba Shaul, And the Rabbis in accordance with the Rabbis
llm_translation: And they argued in the dispute of Abba Saul the son of Imma Miriam and the Rabbis. Rabbi Shimon is like Abba Saul, and the Rabbis are like the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: הָתִינַח כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁתּוֹבַעַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. אֵינָהּ תּוֹבַעַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to this: This well whenever she demands her marriage contract. what can be said does not demand her marriage contract?
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Rav Papa objects to her: "She is entitled as long as she demands her marriage contract. If she does not demand her marriage contract, what can be said?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וּמַחְלוּקְתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said to the exclusion of Rabbi Eliezer and those who dispute him
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Papa said: to go out from the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer and his dispute.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הוֹצִיאָה גֵּט וְאֵין עִמּוֹ כְּתוּבָּה —
human_translation: produced a bill of divorce and it unaccompanied by a marriage contract,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "She may bring out a divorce document even if it does not have writing with it."

hebrew_text: גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: she collects her marriage contract,
llm_translation: Height as it is written.

hebrew_text: כְּתוּבָּה וְאֵין עִמָּהּ גֵּט, הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: אָבַד גִּיטִּי. וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: אָבַד שׁוֹבָרִי. וְכֵן בַּעַל חוֹב שֶׁהוֹצִיא שְׁטַר חוֹב וְאֵין עִמּוֹ פְּרוֹזְבּוּל — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ לֹא יִפָּרְעוּ.
human_translation: a marriage contract, and it unaccompanied by a bill of divorce, she says: My bill of divorce was lost, and he says: my receipt was lost; and likewise, a creditor who produced a promissory note unaccompanied by a document that prevents the Sabbatical Year from forgiving an outstanding debt [ prosbol ], these may not be collected.
llm_translation: Written and without with it a bill of divorce, she says: "My bill of divorce is lost." And he says: "My bond is lost." And similarly, a creditor who produced a promissory note without the collateral - these may not collect.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מִן הַסַּכָּנָה וְאֵילָךְ — אִשָּׁה גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ שֶׁלֹּא בְּגֵט, וּבַעַל חוֹב גּוֹבֶה שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְרוֹזְבּוּל.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: From the danger and onward, a woman collects her marriage contract without a bill of divorce, and a creditor collects without a prosbol .
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: From the danger and onwards - a woman collects her written document not with a divorce document, and a creditor collects his debt not with a promissory note.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כּוֹתְבִין שׁוֹבָר. דְּאִי אֵין כּוֹתְבִין שׁוֹבָר, לֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא מַפְּקָא לַהּ לִכְתוּבְּתַהּ, וְגָבְיָא בַּהּ.
human_translation: Conclude from writes a receipt as, if one does not write a receipt, let us be concerned lest she produce her marriage contract and collect with it
llm_translation: Gemara: If one heard a report about it, they write a shovar. For if they do not write a shovar, there is concern that perhaps it will be forgotten to be written, and it will be lost.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין כּוֹתְבִין כְּתוּבָּה עָסְקִינַן. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אַף בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁכּוֹתְבִין כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: Rav said: we are dealing with a place where one does not write a marriage contract. And Shmuel said even a place where one writes a marriage contract,
llm_translation: Rav said: In a place where they do not write a document, we are dealing. And Shmuel said: Even in a place where they write a document.

hebrew_text: וְלִשְׁמוּאֵל כּוֹתְבִין שׁוֹבָר? אָמַר רַב עָנָן: לְדִידִי מִיפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִינֵּיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל: בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין כּוֹתְבִין וְאָמַר ״כָּתַבְתִּי״ — עָלָיו לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה. בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁכּוֹתְבִין וְאָמְרָה ״לֹא כָּתַב לִי״ — עָלֶיהָ לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה.
human_translation: And according to Shmuel, does one write a receipt? Rav Anan said: It was explained to me by the Sage Shmuel himself: a place where one does not write and said: I wrote upon him to bring proof a place where one writes and she said: He did not write for me, she must bring proof
llm_translation: Regarding Shmuel, do we write a receipt? Rav Anan said: According to me, I have a tradition from the master Shmuel: In a place where one does not write and he says, "I have written," he must bring proof. In a place where one writes and she says, "He did not write for me," she must bring proof.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַב הֲדַר בֵּיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב: בֵּין בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁכּוֹתְבִין, בֵּין בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין כּוֹתְבִין, גֵּט — גּוֹבָה עִיקָּר. כְּתוּבָּה — גּוֹבָה תּוֹסֶפֶת. וְכׇל הָרוֹצֶה לְהָשִׁיב — יָבֹא וְיָשִׁיב.
human_translation: And even Rav retracted his as Rav said Both in a place where one writes and in a place where one does not write a bill of divorce, she collects the main a marriage contract she collects the additional And whoever wishes to challenge let him come and challenge
llm_translation: And also Rav Hadr in it, as Rav said: Whether in a place where they write, or in a place where they do not write, a divorce document - height is essential. A document - height is an addition. And anyone who wants to retract - let him come and retract.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: כְּתוּבָּה וְאֵין עִמָּהּ גֵּט, הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת ״אָבַד גִּיטִּי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר ״אָבַד שׁוֹבָרִי״. וְכֵן בַּעַל חוֹב שֶׁהוֹצִיא שְׁטַר חוֹב וְאֵין עִמּוֹ פְּרוֹזְבּוּל — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ לֹא יִפָּרְעוּ.
human_translation: We learned a marriage contract, and it unaccompanied by a bill of divorce, she says: My bill of divorce was lost, and he says: my receipt was lost; and likewise, a creditor who produced a promissory note unaccompanied by a prosbol , these may not be collected.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: If a woman has a marriage contract but does not have a divorce document with it, she says, "My divorce document is lost," while he says, "My loan document is lost." Similarly, if a creditor produced a loan document but does not have the promissory note with it, these individuals are not to be paid.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לִשְׁמוּאֵל — מוֹקֵי לַהּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין כּוֹתְבִין וְאָמַר כָּתַבְתִּי, דְּאָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִי רְאָיָה, וְאִי לָא מַיְיתֵי רְאָיָה, אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: זִיל פַּרְעֵיהּ.
human_translation: Granted, according to Shmuel, establishes a place where that one does not write and had said: I wrote As we say to him, Bring proof and if he does not bring proof, we say to him: Go pay
llm_translation: In truth, to Shmuel — one may erase it in a place where they do not write, and he said, "I have written," for we say to him: "Bring proof," and if he does not bring proof, we say to him: "Go undo it."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַב: נְהִי דְּעִיקָּר לָא גָּבְיָא, תּוֹסֶפֶת מִיהָא תִּיגְבֵּי.
human_translation: However, according to Rav, Although she cannot collect the main she should collect the additional
llm_translation: To Rav: "Yes, indeed, primarily not applicable, an addition from it shall be applicable."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּשֶׁאֵין שָׁם עֵדֵי גֵירוּשִׁין. מִיגּוֹ דְּיָכוֹל לְמֵימַר: לֹא גֵּירַשְׁתִּיהָ,
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: With what are we dealing here? where there are no witnesses to the divorce there. Since can say: I did not divorce her
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Here we are dealing with what? When there are no witnesses of divorce. Because he could have said: "I did not divorce her."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לְמֵימַר: גֵּירַשְׁתִּיהָ וְנָתַתִּי לָהּ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: can say: I divorced her and gave her her marriage contract.
llm_translation: I am able to say: I divorced her and gave her her writ.

hebrew_text: הָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מִן הַסַּכָּנָה וְאֵילָךְ אִשָּׁה גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ שֶׁלֹּא בְּגֵט, וּבַעַל חוֹב שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְרוֹזְבּוּל. בִּדְאִיכָּא עֵדֵי גֵירוּשִׁין עָסְקִינַן. דְּאִי לֵיכָּא עֵדֵי גֵירוּשִׁין, בְּמַאי גָּבְיָא?
human_translation: From that the last clause teaches Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: From the danger and onward, a woman collects her marriage contract without a bill of divorce, and a creditor without a prosbol , we are dealing with when there are witnesses to the divorce. As, if there are no witnesses to the divorce, with what does collect
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The latter clause states: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: From the danger zone and onwards, a woman's divorce document is written without a get, and a debtor's bill of indebtedness is written without a pruzbul. We are dealing with witnesses of divorce. For if there are no witnesses of divorce, with what are we dealing?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כּוּלָּהּ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הִיא, וְחַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ לֹא יִפָּרְעוּ. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים: כְּשֶׁאֵין שָׁם עֵדֵי גֵירוּשִׁין, אֲבָל יֵשׁ שָׁם עֵדֵי גֵירוּשִׁין — גָּבְיָא תּוֹסֶפֶת. וְעִיקָּר, אִי מַפְּקָא גִּיטָּא — גָּבְיָא, וְאִי לָא מַפְּקָא גִּיטָּא — לָא גָּבְיָא.
human_translation: Rather, The entire is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and is incomplete and is this is what it is teaching: These may not be collected. In what is this statement said? when there are no witnesses to the divorce there. However, there are witnesses to the divorce there, she collects additional And main if she produces a bill of divorce, she collects But if she does not produce a bill of divorce, she does not collect
llm_translation: Rather, the entirety is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and lacking from the lacking, and thus it teaches: These shall not pay. In what circumstances are these words spoken: when there are no witnesses of divorce, but if there are witnesses of divorce - the additional part. And the main point is, if the bill of divorce is produced - the additional part, and if the bill of divorce is not produced - it is not the additional part.

hebrew_text: וּמִן הַסַּכָּנָה וְאֵילָךְ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא מַפְּקָא גִּיטָּא — גָּבְיָא. שֶׁרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מִסַּכָּנָה וְאֵילָךְ אִשָּׁה גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ שֶׁלֹּא בְּגֵט, וּבַעַל חוֹב שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְרוֹזְבּוּל.
human_translation: And from the danger and onward, even she does not produce a bill of divorce, she collects as Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: From the danger and onward a woman collects her marriage contract without a bill of divorce, and a creditor without a prosbol .
llm_translation: From the danger and onwards, even though a divorce document is not produced - it is valid. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: From the danger and onwards, a woman is divorced by her written document, not by a bill of divorce, and a debtor is released not by a promissory note.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא וְרַב אַסִּי לְרַב: לְדִידָךְ דְּאָמְרַתְּ גֵּט גּוֹבָה עִיקָּר, אַלְמָנָה מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין בְּמַאי גָּבְיָא? בְּעֵדֵי מִיתָה. וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא גֵּירְשָׁהּ, וּמַפְּקָא לְגִיטָּא וְגָבְיָא בֵּיהּ?! בְּיוֹשֶׁבֶת תַּחַת בַּעְלָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Kahana and Rav Asi said to Rav: According to your that you said a bill of divorce collects main a widow from marriage, with what does she collect with witnesses to death. But shouldn’t we be concerned perhaps he divorced her and produce the bill of divorce and collect with it when she was living under her husband
llm_translation: They said to him, Rav Kahana and Rav Assi said to Rav: According to your opinion that you said, a divorce document is primarily important, how does a widow collect her marriage settlement? With witnesses of death. And lest you say that perhaps she was divorced, and she produces a divorce document and collects her marriage settlement with it?! No, while she is still under her husband's authority.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא סָמוּךְ לְמִיתָה גֵּירְשָׁהּ! אִיהוּ הוּא דְּאַפְסֵיד אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: But perhaps he divorced her near his death, he who his own loss,
llm_translation: Perhaps if close to death, she will divorce! He is the one who endangers his own life.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָנָה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין בְּמַאי גָּבְיָא — בְּעֵדֵי מִיתָה, וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא גֵּירְשָׁהּ, וּמַפְּקָא גִּיטָּא וְגָבְיָא!
human_translation: With what a widow from betrothal collect with witnesses death. But shouldn’t we be concerned perhaps he divorced her and produce the bill of divorce and collect
llm_translation: Widow from the Erusin, with what is she liable? - With the witnesses of her death, and be concerned lest perhaps she was divorced, and bring forth her divorce document and be liable!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: בִּמְקוֹם דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר כָּתְבִינַן שׁוֹבָר. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, עֵדֵי מִיתָה גּוּפַיְיהוּ נֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא מַפְּקָא עֵדֵי מִיתָה בְּהַאי בֵּי דִינָא וְגָבְיָא, וַהֲדַר מַפְּקָא בְּבֵי דִינָא אַחֲרִינָא וְגָבְיָא. אֶלָּא וַדַּאי בִּמְקוֹם דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר כָּתְבִינַן שׁוֹבָר.
human_translation: Rather, wherever it is not possible one writes a receipt, as if you do not say so witnesses to death themselves, we should be concerned perhaps she will bring out witnesses to death in this court and collect and again bring out in a different court and collect Rather, certainly wherever it is not possible one writes a receipt.
llm_translation: Rather: in a place where it is not possible, we write a break. For if you do not say this, the witnesses themselves are suspected of perhaps producing witnesses of death in this court and then producing witnesses of death in another court. Rather, certainly in a place where it is not possible, we write a break.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר קַשִּׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אַלְמָנָה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין, מְנָלַן דְּאִית לַהּ כְּתוּבָּה? אִילֵּימָא מֵהָא: נִתְאַרְמְלָה אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשָׁה, בֵּין מִן הָאֵירוּסִין בֵּין מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין, גּוֹבָה אֶת הַכֹּל — דִּלְמָא דִּכְתַב לַהּ.
human_translation: Mar the Elder, son of Rav Ḥisda, said to Rav Ashi: From where do we a widow from betrothal has a marriage contract? If we say from this is widowed or divorced, whether from betrothal whether from marriage, she collects the entire Perhaps he wrote for her
llm_translation: The Master, Kashisha, son of Rav Chisda, said to Rav Ashi: "If a widow from betrothal, from where do we know that she has a document? If we say from here: 'Whether she was seduced or divorced, whether from betrothal or from marriage, she collects everything' - perhaps he wrote it for her."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: אִי כְּתַב לַהּ, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא! לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה, דְּאָמַר: שֶׁלֹּא כָּתַב לָהּ אֶלָּא עַל מְנָת שֶׁהוּא כּוֹנְסָהּ.
human_translation: And if you would say if he wrote for her, what stating exclude of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, who said as wrote for her only in order to marry her.
llm_translation: And if you will say: If he wrote to her, what is there to say! To go out from the teaching of Rabbi Eliezer ben Azariah, who said: He only wrote to her on the condition that he would marry her.

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: גּוֹבָה אֶת הַכֹּל. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּכָתַב לָהּ — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי גּוֹבָה אֶת הַכֹּל. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ דְּלָא כְּתַב לַהּ. מַאי ״גּוֹבָה אֶת הַכֹּל״? מָנֶה מָאתַיִם הוּא דְּאִית לָהּ!
human_translation: is also precise, as it teaches: She collects the entire Granted, if you say he wrote for her, due to that she collects entire But if you say he did not write for her, what is She collects entire She has one hundred dinars or two hundred
llm_translation: The precise meaning is as it was taught: "He takes everything." If you say it is because it is written for her — therefore, "He takes everything." But if you say it is not written for her. What is "He takes everything"? It is a count of two hundred that she has!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, מִדְּתָנֵי רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין: אִשְׁתּוֹ אֲרוּסָה, לֹא אוֹנֵן וְלֹא מִיטַּמֵּא לָהּ. וְכֵן הִיא, לֹא אוֹנֶנֶת וְלֹא מִיטַּמְּאָה לוֹ. מֵתָה — אֵינוֹ יוֹרְשָׁהּ, מֵת הוּא — גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: But rather, from which was taught Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin: one’s betrothed wife, not an acute mourner, nor become impure And likewise, she neither an acute mourner nor becomes impure for him. she dies, he does not inherit her. he dies, she collects her marriage contract.
llm_translation: And rather, from what Rav Chiya bar Avin taught: His wife, when betrothed, does not mourn and does not become impure for her. And likewise, she, does not mourn and does not become impure for him. If she dies — he does not inherit her, if he dies — her written marriage contract is collected.

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא דִּכְתַב לַהּ. וְכִי תֵּימָא: אִי כְּתַב לַהּ מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מֵתָה אֵינוֹ יוֹרְשָׁהּ אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Perhaps wrote for her And if you would say if he wrote for her, what stating it was necessary for him she dies, he does not inherit her.
llm_translation: Perhaps he wrote to her. And if you will say: If he wrote to her, what is the meaning to say? If she dies, he does not inherit her, it is necessary for him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְרַב הוּנָא: לְרַב דְּאָמַר גֵּט גּוֹבָה עִיקָּר, לֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא מַפְּקָא גִּיטָּא בְּהַאי בֵּי דִינָא וְגָבְיָא, וְהָדְרָא מַפְּקָא בְּבֵי דִינָא אַחֲרִינָא וְגָבְיָא? וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּקָרְעִינַן לֵיהּ! אָמְרָה: בָּעֵינָא לְאִנְּסוֹבֵי בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to Rav Huna: According to Rav, who said a bill of divorce she collect the main shouldn’t there be a concern lest she produce the bill of divorce in this court and collect with it, and again produce it in a different court and collect And should you say that we tear it, she say: I need to marry with it
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman to Rav Huna: According to Rav who said a divorce document is primarily important, should we be concerned that perhaps the woman will take out the divorce document in this court and then take it out in another court and take it out again in yet another court? And if you will say that we will tear it! She said: I want to be surrounded by it.

hebrew_text: דְּקָרְעִינַן לֵיהּ וְכָתְבִינַן אַגַּבֵּיהּ: גִּיטָּא דְּנַן קְרַעְנוֹהִי לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּגִיטָּא פָּסוּל הוּא, אֶלָּא דְּלָא תִּיהְדַּר וְתִיגְבֵּי בֵּיהּ זִמְנָא אַחֲרִינָא.
human_translation: that we tear it and write on its back: We tore this bill of divorce, not because it is an invalid bill of divorce, but that she not return and collect with it another time.
llm_translation: We tear it and write on it over it: our document we tore is not because our document is invalid, but so that it should not be used and another time should be added to it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁנֵי גִיטִּין וּשְׁתֵּי כְתוּבּוֹת, גּוֹבָה שְׁתֵּי כְתוּבּוֹת.
human_translation: two bills of divorce and two marriage contracts collects two marriage contracts.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Two Gitin and two Kutubot, the height of two Kutubot."

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵּי כְתוּבּוֹת וְגֵט אֶחָד, אוֹ כְּתוּבָּה וּשְׁנֵי גִטִּין, אוֹ כְּתוּבָּה וְגֵט וּמִיתָה — אֵינָהּ גּוֹבָה אֶלָּא כְּתוּבָּה אַחַת. שֶׁהַמְגָרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְהֶחְזִירָהּ — עַל מְנָת כְּתוּבָּה הָרִאשׁוֹנָה מַחְזִירָהּ.
human_translation: two marriage contracts and one bill of divorce; or marriage contract and two bills of divorce; or a marriage contract, a bill of divorce, and death she collects only one marriage contract. that one who divorces his wife and remarries her, remarries her with the intention first marriage contract,
llm_translation: Two writings and one divorce document, or one writing and two divorce documents, or one writing, a divorce document, and death — only the writing is collected. One who divorces his wife and remarries her — he remarries her based on the original writing.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִי בָּעֲיָא בְּהַאי — גָּבְיָא, אִי בָּעֲיָא בְּהַאי — גָּבְיָא?
human_translation: if desires, she can collect with this one, and if desires, she can collect with that one?
llm_translation: Gemara: If he wants with this one - Gabaya, if he wants with this one - Gabaya?

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל. דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁנֵי שְׁטָרוֹת הַיּוֹצְאִין בָּזֶה אַחַר זֶה, בִּיטֵּל שֵׁנִי אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: let us say that it is a conclusive refutation of Rav Naḥman Shmuel said, as Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: two documents that are issued one after the other, second cancels the first
llm_translation: Let it be the preference of Rav Nachman said Shmuel. For Rav Nachman said Shmuel: Two documents that are issued, one after the other, nullify the first.

hebrew_text: לָאו אִתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וּמוֹדֵה רַב נַחְמָן דְּאִי אוֹסֵיף בֵּיהּ דִּיקְלָא, לְתוֹסֶפֶת כַּתְבֵיהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי בִּדְאוֹסֵיף לַהּ.
human_translation: Was it not stated with regard to Rav Pappa said: And Rav Naḥman concedes that if he added to a palm tree he wrote as an addition Here too, with when he added for her
llm_translation: It was not stated regarding it, Rav Papa said: and Rav Nachman concedes that if one adds to it a palm branch, he should write an addition. Here, it is also stated that he should add to it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הוֹצִיאָה גֵּט וּכְתוּבָּה וּמִיתָה,
human_translation: The Sages taught: she produced a bill of divorce, a marriage contract, and death,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: she brought out a divorce document and it was written and she died.

hebrew_text: אִם גֵּט קוֹדֵם לַכְּתוּבָּה — גּוֹבָה שְׁתֵּי כְּתוּבּוֹת. כְּתוּבָּה קוֹדֶמֶת לַגֵּט — אֵינָהּ גּוֹבָה אֶלָּא כְּתוּבָּה אַחַת, שֶׁהַמְּגָרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְהֶחְזִירָהּ — עַל מְנָת כְּתוּבָּה הָרִאשׁוֹנָה הֶחְזִירָהּ.
human_translation: if bill of divorce precedes of the marriage contract, she two marriage contracts. marriage contract precedes of the bill of divorce, she collects only one marriage contract. that one who divorces his wife and remarries her, remarries her with the intention first marriage contract,
llm_translation: If a get precedes the ketubah - two writings are collected. If the ketubah precedes the get - only one writing is collected, as one who divorces his wife and returns her - he returns her based on the first writing.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ קָטָן שֶׁהִשִּׂיאוֹ אָבִיו — כְּתוּבָּתָהּ קַיֶּימֶת, שֶׁעַל מְנָת כֵּן קִיְּימָהּ. גֵּר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירָה אִשְׁתּוֹ עִמּוֹ — כְּתוּבָּתָהּ קַיֶּימֶת, שֶׁעַל מְנָת כֵּן קִיְּימָהּ.
human_translation: a minor who was married by his father, marriage contract is valid as on this condition, he maintained her a convert whose wife converted with him, marriage contract is valid, for on this condition he maintained her
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A minor whom his father betrothed - its writing stands, for on this condition she stood. A convert whose wife converted with him - its writing stands, for on this condition she stood.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מָנֶה מָאתַיִם, אֲבָל תּוֹסֶפֶת — אֵין לָהּ. וְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תּוֹסֶפֶת יֵשׁ לָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: They taught only one hundred dinars two hundred However, she does not have additional And Rav Yehuda said: She has even additional
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Huna said: They only taught regarding a hundred, but an addition - it does not have. And Rav Yehudah said: Even an addition, it has.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: חִידְּשׁוּ — נוֹטֶלֶת מַה שֶּׁחִידְּשׁוּ. חִידְּשׁוּ אִין, לֹא חִידְּשׁוּ לָא!
human_translation: raises an objection introduced she takes that they introduced. Yes, what they introduced. they did not introduce not
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: The opponent raises an objection: "They innovated" - one takes what they innovated. If they did not innovate, they did not innovate at all!

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: אַף מַה שֶּׁחִידְּשׁוּ. וְהָא לָא תָּנֵי הָכִי: חִידְּשׁוּ — נוֹטֶלֶת מַה שֶּׁחִידְּשׁוּ, לֹא חִידְּשׁוּ — בְּתוּלָה גּוֹבָה מָאתַיִם, וְאַלְמָנָה מָנֶה! תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרַב יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Say even that which they introduced, But did not teach this, they introduced she takes that which they introduced. they did not introduce a virgin collects two hundred and a widow one hundred dinars. a conclusive refutation of Rav Yehuda,
llm_translation: Fear: Even what they innovated. But didn't it teach like this: they innovated - she takes what they innovated, they did not innovate - a virgin receives two hundred, and a widow a hundred! The dispute of Rav Yehudah.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה מַתְנִיתִין אַטְעֵיתֵיהּ, הוּא סָבַר: ״כְּתוּבָּתָהּ קַיֶּימֶת״ — אַכּוּלַּהּ מִילְּתָא קָאֵי. וְלָא הִיא, אַעִיקַּר כְּתוּבָּה קָאֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda was misled by the mishna He thought Her marriage contract is valid, is referring to the entire matter, But that is not so, is referring to the main
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah of Matnitin planted it, he holds: "its writing is established" - the matter stands. And if not, the main writing stands.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַכּוֹתֵב לְאִשְׁתּוֹ
llm_translation: The one who writes to his wife, it is permitted for you.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁהָיָה נָשׂוּי שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים, וָמֵת — הָרִאשׁוֹנָה קוֹדֶמֶת לַשְּׁנִיָּה. וְיוֹרְשֵׁי הָרִאשׁוֹנָה קוֹדְמִין לְיוֹרְשֵׁי שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: one who was married to two women and died, the first precedes the second the heirs of the first precede the heirs of the second
llm_translation: One who was married to two women, and died - the first one precedes the second. And the heirs of the first one precede the heirs of the second.

hebrew_text: נָשָׂא אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה וָמֵתָה, נָשָׂא שְׁנִיָּה וּמֵת הוּא — שְׁנִיָּה וְיוֹרְשֶׁיהָ קוֹדְמִין לְיוֹרְשֵׁי הָרִאשׁוֹנָה.
human_translation: he married a first and she died, married a second and he died, the second and her heirs precede the heirs of the first
llm_translation: He married the first wife and she died, he married a second one and he died - the second one and her heirs take precedence over the heirs of the first wife.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִדְּקָתָנֵי ״הָרִאשׁוֹנָה קוֹדֶמֶת לַשְּׁנִיָּה״, וְלָא קָתָנֵי ״הָרִאשׁוֹנָה יֵשׁ לָהּ וְהַשְּׁנִיָּה אֵין לָהּ״, מִכְּלָל דְּאִי קָדְמָה שְׁנִיָּה וְתָפְסָה — לָא מַפְּקִינַן מִינַּהּ,
human_translation: From that it teaches: The first precedes the second and it does not teach the first has and the second does not have by inference that if the second preceded and seized we do not expropriate it from her,
llm_translation: The text states: "If it is taught 'the first one precedes the second one,' and it is not taught 'the first one has it and the second one does not have it,' from the inference that if the second one preceded and took it, we do not remove it from her."

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בַּעַל חוֹב מְאוּחָר שֶׁקָּדַם וְגָבָה — מַה שֶּׁגָּבָה גָּבָה.
human_translation: Learn from a creditor later who preceded and collected whatever he collected, he has collected,
llm_translation: Listen to the conclusion: A creditor who is owed money from before and a later creditor - the one who is owed from before takes precedence and collects.

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ: מָה שֶּׁגָּבָה — לֹא גָּבָה, וּמַאי ״קוֹדֶמֶת״ — לִגְמָרֵי קָתָנֵי, כְּדִתְנַן: בֵּן קוֹדֵם לַבַּת.
human_translation: Actually, I will say to you what he collected, he has not collected, And what precedes teaches completely As we learned A son precedes a daughter
llm_translation: Forever say to you: What that tall — not tall, and what "preceding" — completely small, as we learned: a son precedes a daughter.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מִדְּלָא קָתָנֵי ״אִם קָדְמָה שְׁנִיָּה וְתָפְסָה אֵין מוֹצִיאִין מִיָּדָהּ״, מִכְּלָל דְּאִי קָדְמָה שְׁנִיָּה וְתָפְסָה — מַפְּקִינַן מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: There are who say From the fact that it does not teach: If the second preceded and seized it is not expropriated from her, by inference that if the second preceded and seized we do appropriate it from her.
llm_translation: There are those who say: since it does not teach "if she preceded a second time and took, we do not remove from her immediately," it implies that if she preceded a second time and took - we do remove from her.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בַּעַל חוֹב מְאוּחָר שֶׁקָּדַם וְגָבָה — מַה שֶּׁגָּבָה לֹא גָּבָה.
human_translation: Learn from a creditor later who preceded and collected whatever he collected, he has not collected,
llm_translation: Listen to the conclusion: A creditor who is late but precedes and demands payment — what he demands, he does not demand.

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ מַה שֶּׁגָּבָה — גָּבָה, אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא: שְׁנִיָּה וְיוֹרְשֶׁיהָ קוֹדְמִין לְיוֹרְשֵׁי הָרִאשׁוֹנָה,
human_translation: Actually, I will say to you what collected, he has collected, since the mishna taught The second and her heirs precede the heirs of the first,
llm_translation: Forever say to you what that is high - high, as it was taught: "A second wife and her heirs take precedence over the heirs of the first wife."

hebrew_text: תְּנָא נָמֵי: הָרִאשׁוֹנָה קוֹדֶמֶת לַשְּׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: it taught as well The first precedes the second,
llm_translation: Tanna Namei: HaRishonah Kodemet LaShniyah.

hebrew_text: נָשָׂא אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּלָת: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אַחַת בְּחַיָּיו וְאַחַת בְּמוֹתוֹ יֵשׁ לָהֶן כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין, וְלָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְאִינְּצוֹיֵי.
human_translation: he married the first Conclude three from this Conclude from it one in his lifetime and one his death, are entitled to marriage contract concerning male children and we are not concerned quarreling.
llm_translation: He lifted the first. Hear from it three: hear from it one in his lifetime and one in his death, they have a scriptural basis in the building of the male, and we are not concerned about contradictions.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי — מִדְּקָתָנֵי: שְׁנִיָּה וְיוֹרְשֶׁיהָ קוֹדְמִים לְיוֹרְשֵׁי רִאשׁוֹנָה, מִיקְדָּם הוּא דְּקָדְמִי, הָא אִיכָּא — שָׁקְלִי.
human_translation: From where From that it teaches: second and her heirs precede the heirs of the first they precede but there are take
llm_translation: From what — from where does it teach: a second wife and her heirs take precedence over the heirs of the first wife, because the second wife came before them, but if there is — take.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כְּתוּבָּה נַעֲשֵׂית מוֹתָר לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ.
human_translation: conclude from it is one marriage contract becomes surplus for the other.
llm_translation: And hear from it: as it is written, it is permitted to her companion.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? מִדְּלָא קָתָנֵי ״אִם יֵשׁ שָׁם מוֹתַר דִּינָר״.
human_translation: From where From that it does not teach If there is a surplus of a dinar
llm_translation: From where? Since it does not teach "if there is a permitted dinar there."

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין לָא טָרְפָה מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתִּין טָרְפָה מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי — לֵיתוֹ בְּנֵי רִאשׁוֹנָה וְלִטְרְפִינְהוּ לִבְנֵי שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: And conclude from it the marriage contract concerning male children, he cannot seize liened As, if it should enter your mind that it can be repossessed from liened let the sons of the first come and repossess by the sons of the second
llm_translation: And hear from it: the writing of the building of the male organs does not render it a treifah from the time of its formation, for if it were to be a treifah from the time of its formation - the firstborn sons would come out and they would render them treifah for the secondborn sons.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ אַחַת בְּחַיָּיו וְאַחַת בְּמוֹתוֹ אֵין לָהֶן כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין, וּמַאי ״קוֹדְמִין״ — לְנַחֲלָה קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi objects to From where Perhaps I actually say to you one in his lifetime and one his death, no one is entitled to marriage contract concerning male children. And what does precede? it is teaching inherit
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: Rav Ashei objects to her: From where? Perhaps I will say to you, one in his lifetime and one in his death, they do not have a written building of the graves, and what is "preceding" - it refers to inheritance.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: ״יוֹרְשֵׁי הָרִאשׁוֹנָה״ לְמָה לִי? אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא ״שְׁנִיָּה וְיוֹרְשֶׁיהָ״, תְּנָא נָמֵי ״לְיוֹרְשֵׁי הָרִאשׁוֹנָה״.
human_translation: And if you would say why do I the heirs of the first since it taught: The second and her heirs, also taught The heirs of the first
llm_translation: And if you will say: "The heirs of the first wife," why do I need it? Since it was taught: "A second wife and her heirs," it was also taught: "To the heirs of the first wife."

hebrew_text: וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ: כְּתוּבָּה נַעֲשֵׂית מוֹתָר לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ — דִּלְמָא לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ: אֵין כְּתוּבָּה נַעֲשֵׂית מוֹתָר לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ, וְהָכָא הוּא דְּאִיכָּא מוֹתַר דִּינָר.
human_translation: And concerning what you said one marriage contract becomes surplus for the other, Perhaps I actually say to you one marriage contract does not become surplus for the other, and here is where there is a surplus of dinar,
llm_translation: And she said: "Written, it is made, permitted to her friend - perhaps forever I will say to you: Written, it is made, permitted to her friend, and here is where there is a permitted dinar.

hebrew_text: ״וְאַחַת בְּחַיָּיו וְאַחַת בְּמוֹתוֹ״ — תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: מֵתוּ אַחַת בְּחַיָּיו וְאַחַת בְּמוֹתוֹ, בֶּן נַנָּס אוֹמֵר: יְכוֹלִין בְּנֵי הָרִאשׁוֹנָה לוֹמַר לִבְנֵי הַשְּׁנִיָּה: בְּנֵי בַּעֲלַת חוֹב אַתֶּם, טְלוּ כְּתוּבַּת אִמְּכֶם וּצְאוּ.
human_translation: one in his lifetime and one his death, is tanna’im As it is taught they died, one in his lifetime and one his death, ben Nanas says: The sons of the first can say to the sons of the second You are the children of a creditor, collect your mother’s marriage contract and leave,
llm_translation: "And one in his life, and one in his death" — this is a teaching, as it is taught: "They die one in his life, and one in his death." Ben Nanas says: Can the firstborn sons say to the secondborn sons: "You are the sons of a creditor, fulfill the writing of your mother and depart."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּבָר קָפְצָה נַחֲלָה מִלִּפְנֵי בְּנֵי הָרִאשׁוֹנָה וְנָפְלָה לִפְנֵי בְּנֵי הַשְּׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: inheritance already eluded the sons of the first and came into the sons of the second
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Already leaped the inheritance from before the first sons and fell before the second sons.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: אַחַת בְּחַיָּיו וְאַחַת בְּמוֹתוֹ — יֵשׁ לָהֶן כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין, וּמָר סָבַר: אַחַת בְּחַיָּיו וְאַחַת בְּמוֹתוֹ — אֵין לָהֶן כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין.
human_translation: What, is it not that they disagree about this: One Sage, holds one in his lifetime and one his death, are entitled to marriage contract concerning male children. And Sage, holds one in his lifetime and one his death, are not entitled to marriage contract concerning male children.
llm_translation: What is the reason they do not argue about this? Because Mar holds: one in his lifetime and one in his death - they have a written building in the masculine form. And Mar holds: one in his lifetime and one in his death - they do not have a written building in the masculine form.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה, אַשְׁכַּחְתִּינְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דְּבֵי רַב דְּיָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אַחַת בְּחַיָּיו וְאַחַת בְּמוֹתוֹ — יֵשׁ לָהֶן כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין, וְהָכָא בִּכְתוּבָּה נַעֲשֵׂית מוֹתָר לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ וְהוּא הַדִּין לְבַעַל חוֹב קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: Rabba said: I found the Sages of the school of Rav sitting and saying: Everyone agrees one in his lifetime and one his death, are entitled to marriage contract concerning male children. Here, they disagree with regard to marriage contract becomes surplus for the other And the same is true to a creditor,
llm_translation: Rabah said, "I found them saying to the sages of the house of Rav who were sitting and saying: 'Throughout the entire world, one woman in his lifetime and one woman in his death — they have a written document of marriage, and here in this case with a written document it is permitted for her friend, and the same applies to a creditor, he Rav disagrees."

hebrew_text: מָר סָבַר: כְּתוּבָּה נַעֲשֵׂית מוֹתָר לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְבַעַל חוֹב, וּמַר סָבַר: אֵין כְּתוּבָּה נַעֲשֵׂית מוֹתָר לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְבַעַל חוֹב,
human_translation: Sage, holds marriage contract becomes surplus for the other, and the same is true to a creditor, and Sage, holds marriage contract does not become surplus for the other, and the same is true to a creditor.
llm_translation: Master holds: A document is made, permitted to her friend, and it is the same law for a creditor, and Master holds: A document is not made, permitted to her friend, and it is the same law for a creditor.

hebrew_text: וְאָמֵינָא לְהוּ אֲנָא: בְּבַעַל חוֹב כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּהָוֵי מוֹתָר, כִּי פְּלִיגִי בִּכְתוּבָּה.
human_translation: And I said to them: With regard to a creditor, everyone agrees that it is surplus When they disagree with regard to a marriage contract
llm_translation: And I would say to them: In the case of a debtor, everyone in the world does not disagree that it is permitted, for they disagree in the written law.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: אִי הָכִי, ״רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּבָר קָפְצָה נַחֲלָה״ — ״אִם יֵשׁ מוֹתַר דִּינָר״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rav Yosef objects to this. If that is so, Rabbi Akiva says: The inheritance already eluded it should have said: If there is a surplus of a dinar,
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Yosef: If so, "Rabbi Akiva says: 'The inheritance has already leaped.'" — "If there is an extra dinar," he asks her!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: בְּאַחַת בְּחַיָּיו וְאַחַת בְּמוֹתוֹ קָא מִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: They disagree with regard to one in his lifetime and one his death,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: In one in his lifetime and one in his death he is divided.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי כִּי הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: נָשָׂא אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה וָמֵתָה, נָשָׂא אֶת הַשְּׁנִיָּה וּמֵת הוּא — בָּאִין בָּנֶיהָ שֶׁל זוֹ לְאַחַר מִיתָה וְנוֹטְלִין כְּתוּבַּת אִמָּן. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אִם יֵשׁ מוֹתַר דִּינָר — אֵלּוּ נוֹטְלִין כְּתוּבַּת אִמָּן, וְאֵלּוּ נוֹטְלִין כְּתוּבַּת אִמָּן. וְאִם לָאו — חוֹלְקִין בְּשָׁוֶה.
human_translation: And these tanna’im , are like those tanna’im , as it is taught he married a first and she died, married a second and he died, the sons of this come after death and collect their mother’s marriage contract Rabbi Shimon says: If there is a surplus of a dinar, these collect their mother’s marriage contract, and these collect their mother’s marriage contract, and if not, they divide equally
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And these Tannaim, for these Tannaim, as it was taught: If he married the first wife and she died, he married the second wife and he died - her sons from this one come after her death and take their mother's written document. Rabbi Shimon says: If there is an extra dinar - these take their mother's written document, and these take their mother's written document. And if not - they divide equally.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: אַחַת בְּחַיָּיו וְאַחַת בְּמוֹתוֹ — יֵשׁ לָהֶן כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין, וּמָר סָבַר: אַחַת בְּחַיָּיו וְאַחַת בְּמוֹתוֹ — אֵין לָהֶם כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין.
human_translation: What, is it not they disagree with regard to Sage, holds one in his lifetime and one his death, are entitled to marriage contract concerning male children; and Sage, holds one in his lifetime and one his death, are not entitled to marriage contract concerning male children,
llm_translation: What is the reason they do not argue about this? For Mar holds: one in his lifetime and one in his death - they have a written building of male, and Mar holds: one in his lifetime and one in his death - they do not have a written building of male.

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אַחַת בְּחַיָּיו וְאַחַת בְּמוֹתוֹ — יֵשׁ לָהֶן כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין,
human_translation: No, everyone one in his lifetime and one his death, are entitled to marriage contract concerning male children,
llm_translation: Not, all the world one in his life and one in his death - they have a written building of males.

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא בְּדִינָר מְקַרְקְעֵי קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: מְקַרְקְעֵי — אִין, מִטַּלְטְלֵי — לָא. וּמָר סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ מִטַּלְטְלִי.
human_translation: and here they disagree about a dinar’s worth real estate: Sage, holds real estate, yes, movable property, no, and Sage, holds even movable property.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "And here with a dinar of land he falls. Mar thought: land - no, movable property - yes. And Mar thought: even movable property."

hebrew_text: וּמִי מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ הָכִי? וְהָתְנַן, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ יֵשׁ שָׁם נְכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת — אֵינָן כְּלוּם, עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא שָׁם נְכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת יָתֵר עַל שְׁתֵּי כְּתוּבּוֹת דִּינָר!
human_translation: But how can you say Didn’t we learn Rabbi Shimon says: Even if there is property that does not a guarantee it is considered as nothing, unless there is property that a guarantee exceeding the two marriage contracts dinar.
llm_translation: And who found saying thus? And it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says: Even if there are assets there that have no heirs - they are not considered ownerless until there are assets there that have more heirs than two dinars!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָכָא בְּדִינָר מְשַׁעְבְּדִי קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: מִבְּנֵי חוֹרִין — אִין, מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי — לָא, וּמָר סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי.
human_translation: Rather, here they disagree about a dinar of liened Sage, holds unsold yes, liened no, And Sage, holds even liened
llm_translation: Rather, here with a dinar, slaves are half-freed. Master holds: from free men - no, from slaves - yes, and master holds: even from slaves.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״אִם יֵשׁ שָׁם מוֹתַר דִּינָר״ — ״כֵּיוָן שֶׁיֵּשׁ שָׁם מוֹתַר דִּינָר״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: If that is so, Rabbi Shimon says: If there is a surplus of a dinar. it should have Since there is a surplus of a dinar.
llm_translation: "If so, Rabbi Shimon says: 'If there is a surplus of a dinar there' - 'since there is a surplus of a dinar there,' he requires it!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: בְּפָחוֹת מִדִּינָר קָמִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר: דִּינָר — אִין, פָּחוֹת מִדִּינָר — לָא, וּמָר סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ פָּחוֹת מִדִּינָר.
human_translation: Rather, They disagree about less than a dinar Sage, holds a dinar, yes, less than a dinar no, And Sage, holds even less than a dinar.
llm_translation: Rather: in less than a dinar half, Mar Savar: dinar - no, less than a dinar - yes, and Mar Savar: even less than a dinar.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן ״דִּינָר״ קָאָמַר! וְכִי תֵּימָא: אֵיפוֹךְ, תַּנָּא קַמָּא דְּמַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דִּינָר קָאָמַר!
human_translation: But Rabbi Shimon said: a dinar, And if you would say: Reverse first tanna of the mishna also said dinar.
llm_translation: The text: "And Rabbi Shimon said 'dinar'! And if you say: 'ephoq', the first Tanna of the Mishnah also said 'dinar'!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי הָנָךְ תְּרֵי לִישָּׁנֵאי קַמָּאֵי וְאֵיפוֹךְ.
human_translation: Rather, according to those first two formulations And reverse
llm_translation: Rather, when there are two scholars before you, choose the younger one.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, הִלְכְתָא: אַחַת בְּחַיָּיו וְאַחַת בְּמוֹתוֹ — יֵשׁ לָהֶן כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין, וּכְתוּבָּה נַעֲשֵׂית מוֹתָר לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said in the name of Rav Pappa: The halakha one in his lifetime and one his death are entitled to the marriage contract concerning male children, and marriage contract becomes surplus for the other.
llm_translation: Master Zutra said in the name of Rav Papa, the halacha: One during his lifetime and one after his death - they have a written building of males, and a written one is permitted to his companion.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא אִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן אַחַת בְּחַיָּיו וְאַחַת בְּמוֹתוֹ יֵשׁ לָהֶן כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּיכְרִין, וְלָא אַשְׁמְעִינַן כְּתוּבָּה נַעֲשֵׂית מוֹתָר לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אִי אִיכָּא מוֹתַר דִּינָר — אִין, אִי לָא — לָא.
human_translation: Granted, if would have taught us one in his lifetime and one his death, are entitled to marriage contract concerning male children, and he not have taught us marriage contract becomes surplus for the other, I would say if there is a surplus of a dinar yes, if not, no,
llm_translation: In truth, if we were to hear that one vow is during his lifetime and one vow is after his death, they have a written building of male sheep, and if we were not to hear that a written building is made, it is permitted to her friend, I would say: If there is a dinar of permission - no, if not - no.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לַישְׁמְעִינַן כְּתוּבָּה נַעֲשֵׂית מוֹתָר לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ, וַאֲנָא יָדַעְנָא מִשּׁוּם דְּאַחַת בְּחַיָּיו וְאַחַת בְּמוֹתוֹ יֵשׁ לָהֶן כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּכְרִין!
