human_translation: However, let him teach us marriage contract becomes surplus for the other, and I would know due to one in his lifetime and one his death, are entitled to marriage contract concerning male children.
llm_translation: Rather, we learn that a written document is made, it is permissible for her husband, and I know this because in his lifetime and in his death, they have a written document of betrothal!

hebrew_text: אִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָכִי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּשָׂא שָׁלֹשׁ נָשִׁים, וָמֵתוּ שְׁתַּיִם בְּחַיָּיו וְאַחַת בְּמוֹתוֹ. וְהָךְ דְּמָיֵית לְאַחַר מִיתָה — יוֹלֶדֶת נְקֵבָה הִיא, וְלָאו בַּת יְרוּשָּׁה הִיא.
human_translation: If he taught us that, I would say where married three women, and two died in his lifetime and one his death, and that who died his death given birth to a daughter and the daughter does not inherit
llm_translation: We might hear it thus, I would say: For example, if one married three women, and two of them died during his lifetime and one after his death. And the child born after his death is a female, and she is not an heir.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אַחַת בְּחַיָּיו וְאַחַת בְּמוֹתוֹ, וְהָא דִּלְאַחַר מִיתָה יוֹלֶדֶת זָכָר הִיא — אֵימָא לֵיחוּשׁ לְאִינְּצוֹיֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: However, one in his lifetime and one his death, where the one who after his death given birth to a son say concern about quarreling to teach us
llm_translation: But one during his lifetime and one after his death, and that which after death she gives birth to a male — say that we should not be concerned for miscarriages, for it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁהָיָה נָשׂוּי שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים, וָמֵתוּ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת הוּא, וִיתוֹמִים מְבַקְּשִׁין כְּתוּבַּת אִמָּן וְאֵין שָׁם אֶלָּא שְׁתֵּי כְתוּבּוֹת — חוֹלְקִין בְּשָׁוֶה.
human_translation: one who was married to two women and died, and subsequently he died, and the orphans are seeking their mother’s marriage contract, but there is only enough two marriage contracts, distribute equally
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who was married to two women, and they both died, and afterwards he himself died, and orphans seek their mother's document, and there are only two documents there - they divide equally.

hebrew_text: הָיָה שָׁם מוֹתַר דִּינָר — אֵלּוּ נוֹטְלִים כְּתוּבַּת אִמָּן וְאֵלּוּ נוֹטְלִים כְּתוּבַּת אִמָּן.
human_translation: there was a surplus of a dinar there, these collect their mother’s marriage contract and those collect their mother’s marriage contract,
llm_translation: There was there a surplus of a dinar - these take according to the writing of their mother and these take according to the writing of their mother.

hebrew_text: אִם אָמְרוּ יְתוֹמִים: אֲנַחְנוּ מַעֲלִים עַל נִכְסֵי אָבִינוּ יָפֶה דִּינָר כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּטְּלוּ כְּתוּבַּת אִמָּן — אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לָהֶן, אֶלָּא שָׁמִין אֶת הַנְּכָסִים בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: If the orphans say: We inflate our father’s property by a dinar, so that they can collect their mother’s marriage contract, not listen to them. Rather, the property is appraised in court,
llm_translation: If orphans say: "We are selling our father's property for a nice sum of money in order to fulfill our mother's written document" - they are not listened to, but the assets are heard in court.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ שָׁם נְכָסִים בְּרָאוּי — אֵינָן כִּבְמוּחְזָק.
human_translation: there was potential there, are not in possession
llm_translation: There were assets there in potential - they are not considered as established.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ יֵשׁ שָׁם נְכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת, אֵינָן כְּלוּם, עַד שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שָׁם נְכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת יוֹתֵר עַל שְׁתֵּי הַכְּתוּבּוֹת דִּינָר.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Even if there is property that does not guarantee it does not any unless there is property that a guarantee, exceeding the two marriage contracts dinar.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Even if there are assets there that have no heirs, they are not considered as nothing until there are assets there that have more heirs than two dinars.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לָזוֹ אֶלֶף וְלָזוֹ חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת, אִם יֵשׁ שָׁם מוֹתַר דִּינָר — אֵלּוּ נוֹטְלִין כְּתוּבַּת אִמָּן וְאֵלּוּ נוֹטְלִין כְּתוּבַּת אִמָּן. וְאִם לָאו — יַחְלְקוּ בְּשָׁוֶה.
human_translation: The Sages taught this one thousand that five hundred if there is a surplus of one dinar, these collect their mother’s marriage contract and those collect their mother’s marriage contract. And if not, they divide equally.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: For this one, one thousand, and for this one, five hundred, if there is a surplus of a dinar there — these take according to the inscription of their mother, and these take according to the inscription of their mother. And if not — they shall divide equally.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא: מְרוּבִּין וְנִתְמַעֲטוּ — כְּבָר זָכוּ בָּהֶן יוֹרְשִׁין. מוּעָטִין וְנִתְרַבּוּ מַאי?
human_translation: is obvious abundant but they depreciated the heirs have already acquired rights to what few, but they appreciated
llm_translation: The straightforward ruling: If the majority are diminished — the heirs have already acquired them. If the minority are diminished and the majority increased — what is the law?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּנִיכְסֵי דְּבֵי בַּר צַרְצוּר מוּעָטִין וְנִתְרַבּוּ הֲווֹ, וַאֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב עַמְרָם. אֲמַר לְהוּ: זִילוּ פַּיְּיסִינְהוּ. לָא אַשְׁגַּחוּ.
human_translation: Come hear properties of the house of bar Tzartzur few, and they appreciated. came before Rav Amram He said to Go appease They did not heed
llm_translation: Come and hear: The tax collectors of the house of Bar Tzartzur were few, and they multiplied. They came before Rav Amram. He said to them: Go appease them. They did not pay attention.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי לָא מְפַיְּיסִיתוּ לְהוּ, מָחֵינָא לְכוּ בְּסִילְוָא דְּלָא מַבַּע דְּמָא. שַׁדְּרִינְהוּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, אָמַר לָהֶן: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמְּרוּבִּין וְנִתְמַעֲטוּ
human_translation: He said to them: If you will not appease them, I will strike you with a thorn [ silva ] that does not draw blood, He sent them before Rav Naḥman. said to them: Just as abundant but depreciated,
llm_translation: He said to them: If you do not appease them, I will spit blood in their faces. They sent them to stand before Rav Nachman, he said to them: Just as they increased, so shall they decrease.

hebrew_text: זָכוּ בָּהֶן יוֹרְשִׁין — כָּךְ מוּעָטִין וְנִתְרַבּוּ זָכוּ בָּהֶן יוֹרְשִׁין.
human_translation: the heirs acquired rights to so too, few and appreciated, the heirs have acquired rights
llm_translation: They merited with them inheritors — thus few and multiplied they merited with them inheritors.

hebrew_text: (סִימַן: אֶלֶף וּמֵאָה מִצְוָה בִּכְתוּבָּה יַעֲקֹב זָקַף שְׂדוֹתָיו בִּדְבָרִים עֲסִיקִין).
human_translation: a mnemonic One thousand, and one hundred, mitzva, in the marriage contract, Ya’akov, set up, his fields, with words, disputants.
llm_translation: Tractate: (Chapter: One Hundred and One, Commandments Written, Jacob Stood His Fields with Matters Engaged).

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲווֹ מַסְּקִי בֵּיהּ אַלְפָּא זוּזֵי, הֲווֹ לֵיהּ תְּרֵי אַפַּדְנֵי, זַבְּנִינְהוּ חֲדָא בַּחֲמֵשׁ מְאָה וַחֲדָא בַּחֲמֵשׁ מְאָה. אֲתָא בַּעַל חוֹב טַרְפַאּ לַחֲדָא מִינַּיְיהוּ, הֲדַר קָטָרֵיף לְאִידַּךְ.
human_translation: a certain man who a claim one thousand dinars against him. He had two mansions [ appedanei ]. He sold them, one for five hundred and the other for five hundred. The creditor came and repossessed one of them He subsequently repossess the other
llm_translation: That man who used to deal with one thousand coins, had two partners, they bought one for five hundred and one for five hundred. A creditor came and took one of them, then he tore the other.

hebrew_text: שְׁקַל אַלְפָּא זוּזֵי וְקָא אָזֵיל לְגַבֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי שַׁוְיָא לָךְ אַלְפָּא זוּזֵי — לְחַיֵּי, וְאִי לָא — שְׁקֹיל אַלְפָּא זוּזֵי וְאִיסְתַּלַּק.
human_translation: took one thousand dinars and went to He said to him: If worth one thousand dinars to you, very well, and if not, take one thousand dinars and abrogate
llm_translation: He took a thousand zuzim and went to him, he said to him: If a thousand zuzim are suitable for you - live, and if not - take a thousand zuzim and depart.

hebrew_text: סְבַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא לְמֵימַר: הַיְינוּ מַתְנִיתִין אִם אָמְרוּ יְתוֹמִים ״הֲרֵי אָנוּ מַעֲלִין עַל נִכְסֵי אָבִינוּ יָפֶה דִּינָר״.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama thought to say this is the mishna: If the orphans say: We inflate our father’s property by a dinar,
llm_translation: Savar Ramei bar Ḥama to say: This is the Mishnah if they said orphans, "Behold, we are elevating upon the property of our father a dinar."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם — אִית לְהוּ פְּסֵידָא לְיַתְמֵי, הָכָא — מִי אִית לֵיהּ פְּסֵידָא? אַלְפָּא יָהֵיב וְאַלְפָּא שָׁקֵיל!
human_translation: Rava said to him: Are comparable? There, the orphans loss Here, does he incur a loss? He lent one thousand and took one thousand
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: Who is similar? There — there is a loss to the seller, here — who has a loss? One gives and one takes!

hebrew_text: וְטִירְפָא, בְּכַמָּה כָּתְבִינַן?
human_translation: what amount is written authorization to repossess
llm_translation: And Tirfa, in how many places did we write?

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: בְּאַלְפָּא. רַב עַוִּירָא אָמַר: בַּחֲמֵשׁ מְאָה. וְהִלְכְתָא: בַּחֲמֵשׁ מְאָה.
human_translation: Ravina said: for one thousand Rav Avira said: for five hundred The halakha is for five hundred
llm_translation: Ravina said: in a thousand. Rav Avira said: in five hundred. And the halakha is: in five hundred.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲווֹ מַסְּקִי בֵּיהּ מְאָה זוּזֵי. הֲווֹ לֵיהּ תְּרֵי קַטִּינֵי דְאַרְעָא, (חַד זַבֵּינְהוּ) [זַבְּנִינְהוּ לְחַד] בְּחַמְשִׁין וְחַד בְּחַמְשִׁין. אֲתָא בַּעַל חוֹב טַרְפַאּ לְחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, הֲדַר אֲתָא וְקָטָרֵיף לְאִידַּךְ.
human_translation: a certain man who a claim one hundred dinars against him. He had two small of land. He sold one for fifty and one for fifty. The creditor came and repossessed one of them He subsequently came, repossess the other
llm_translation: That man who used to deal with one hundred coins. He had two small fields, (one of them) he sold for fifty and one for fifty. A creditor came and seized one of them, then he came and seized the other.

hebrew_text: שְׁקַל מְאָה זוּזֵי וְקָאָזֵיל לְגַבֵּיהּ וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי שָׁוְיָא לָךְ מְאָה זוּזֵי — לְחַיֵּי, וְאִי לָא — שְׁקוֹל מְאָה זוּזֵי וְאִיסְתַּלַּק.
human_translation: took one hundred dinars and went to He said to him: If worth one hundred dinars to you, very well, and if not, take one hundred dinars and abrogate
llm_translation: He took one hundred zuz and threw it to him and said to him: "If one hundred zuz are satisfactory for you - live, but if not - take one hundred zuz and depart."

hebrew_text: סָבַר רַב יוֹסֵף לְמֵימַר: הַיְינוּ מַתְנִיתִין אִם אָמְרוּ יְתוֹמִים כּוּ׳. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם — אִית לְהוּ פְּסֵידָא לְיַתְמֵי, הָכָא — מַאי פְּסֵידָא אִית לֵיהּ? מְאָה יָהֵיב, מְאָה שָׁקֵיל.
human_translation: Rav Yosef thought to say is the mishna, if the orphans say: Abaye said to him: Are comparable? There, the orphans a loss here, what loss incur? He lent one hundred and took one hundred
llm_translation: Rav Yosef thought to say: This is the Mishnah, if they said orphans, etc. Abaye said to him: Who is similar? There — there is a loss to the orphans, here — what loss is there? He gives a hundred, he takes a hundred.

hebrew_text: וְטִירְפָּא בְּכַמָּה כָּתְבִינַן? רָבִינָא אָמַר: בִּמְאָה, רַב עַוִּירָא אָמַר: בְּחַמְשִׁין. וְהִלְכְתָא בְּחַמְשִׁין.
human_translation: what amount is written authorization to repossess Ravina said for one hundred. Rav Avira said for fifty. The halakha is for fifty
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And how many letters are in a 'Tirpa'? Ravina said: In one hundred, Rav Avira said: In fifty. And the halakha is in fifty."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲווֹ מַסְּקִי בֵּיהּ מְאָה זוּזֵי. שָׁכֵיב, שְׁבַק קַטִּינָא דְּאַרְעָא דַּהֲוָה שָׁוְיָא חַמְשִׁין זוּזֵי. אֲתָא בַּעַל חוֹב וְקָטָרֵיף לֵיהּ, אֲזוּל יַתְמֵי יְהַבוּ לֵיהּ חַמְשִׁין זוּזֵי, הֲדַר קָטָרֵיף לַהּ.
human_translation: a certain man who a claim of one hundred dinars against him. He died left a small of land worth fifty dinars. The creditor came and repossessed it. The orphans came gave him fifty dinars He returned repossessed it
llm_translation: That man who was dealing with him one hundred zuz. He lay down, left a small piece of land that was worth fifty zuz. A creditor came and seized it, went to the waters, gave him fifty zuz, then returned the seized property to him.

hebrew_text: אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי. אָמַר לָהֶן: מִצְוָה עַל הַיְּתוֹמִים לִפְרוֹעַ חוֹב אֲבִיהֶן. הָנֵי קַמָּאֵי מִצְוָה עָבְדִיתוּ, הַשְׁתָּא כִּי טָרֵיף — בְּדִין קָטָרֵיף.
human_translation: They came before Abaye He said to them: It is a mitzva for orphans to settle their father’s debt. initially, you performed a mitzva, now, when he repossesses he is repossesses lawfully.
llm_translation: They came before Abaye. He said to them: "It is a commandment for orphans to pay the debts of their father." Those before him fulfilled the commandment, now that he is insolvent - he is treated as an insolvent.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן דְּלָא אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: ״הָנֵי חַמְשִׁין זוּזֵי דְּמֵי דְּאַרְעָא קַטִּינָא״, אֲבָל אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: ״הָנֵי חַמְשִׁין זוּזֵי דְּמֵי אַרְעָא קַטִּינָא״ — סַלּוֹקֵי סַלְּקוּהּ.
human_translation: And we said where did not say to These fifty dinars are payment the small of land. However, they said to him: These fifty dinars are payment the small of land, they have removed him
llm_translation: And we did not say that they did not say to him: "These five dinars are the value of a small plot of land," but rather they said to him: "These five dinars are the value of a small plot of land" - they removed it, they removed it.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּזַבְּנַהּ לִכְתוּבְּתַהּ דְּאִימֵּיהּ בְּטוֹבַת הֲנָאָה, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי אָתְיָא אֵם וּמְעַרְעֲרָא, לָא מְפַצֵּינָא לָךְ.
human_translation: a certain man who sold his mother’s marriage contract for financial advantage, And he told If mother comes and objects I will not reimburse you
llm_translation: That man who bought a gift for his mother with the intention of pleasing her, and he said to her: "If you come and object, I will not appease you."

hebrew_text: שְׁכִיבָא אִימֵּיהּ וְלָא (אִי)עַרְעַרָא, וַאֲתָא אִיהוּ וְקָא מְעַרְעַר. סְבַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא לְמֵימַר: אִיהוּ בִּמְקוֹם אִימֵּיהּ קָאֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: נְהִי דְּאַחְרָיוּת דִּידַהּ לָא קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ, אַחְרָיוּת דִּידֵיהּ מִי לָא קַבֵּיל?
human_translation: His mother died and not objected He, came and contested Rami bar Ḥama thought to say he stands in his mother’s place Rava said to him: Granted that he did not take upon himself guarantee did he not take upon himself guarantee his own
llm_translation: The mother's bed and not (her) maidservant, and he came and was maidservant. He thought Ramei Bar Hama to say: He is standing in his mother's place. Rava said to him: Granted that he did not accept her authority, did he not accept his own authority?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: רְאוּבֵן שֶׁמָּכַר שָׂדֶה לְשִׁמְעוֹן שֶׁלֹּא בְּאַחְרָיוּת, וַאֲתָא שִׁמְעוֹן וּמְכָרָהּ לִרְאוּבֵן בְּאַחְרָיוּת,
human_translation: bar Ḥama said: Reuven sold a field to Shimon without a guarantee, and Shimon came and sold to Reuven, with a guarantee
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: Reuben who sold a field to Shimon not with a right of redemption, and then Shimon came and sold it back to Reuben with a right of redemption.

hebrew_text: וַאֲתָא בַּעַל חוֹב דִּרְאוּבֵן וְקָטָרֵיף לֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ — דִּינָא הוּא דְּאָזֵיל שִׁמְעוֹן וּמְפַצֵּי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: and Reuven’s creditor came and repossessed from him, the law is that Shimon go and compensate [ mefatzei ] Reuven,
llm_translation: And came Baal Hov of Reuven and cut from him - the law is that it goes to Shimon and he compensates him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: נְהִי דְּאַחְרָיוּת דְּעָלְמָא קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ, אַחְרָיוּת דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ מִי קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rava said to him: Granted, that took upon himself guarantee general, did he take upon himself guarantee own
llm_translation: He said to him Rava: The afterlife of the world receives him, but who receives his own afterlife?

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדֶה רָבָא בִּרְאוּבֵן שֶׁיָּרַשׁ שָׂדֶה מִיַּעֲקֹב, וּמְכָרָהּ לְשִׁמְעוֹן שֶׁלֹּא בְּאַחְרָיוּת, וַאֲתָא שִׁמְעוֹן וּמְכָרָהּ לִרְאוּבֵן בְּאַחְרָיוּת, וַאֲתָא בַּעַל חוֹב דְּיַעֲקֹב, וְקָטָרֵיף לֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ — דִּינָא הוּא דְּאָזֵיל שִׁמְעוֹן וּמְפַצֵּי לֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And Rava concedes in Reuven inherited a field from Ya’akov, and sold it to Shimon with no guarantee. Shimon came and sold it to Reuven with a guarantee. Ya’akov’s creditor came and repossessed the field from the law is that Shimon go and compensate
llm_translation: Rava concedes regarding Reuven that he inherited a field from Yaakov, and he sold it to Shimon without stipulating a right of redemption, then Shimon came and sold it to Reuven with a right of redemption. The creditor of Yaakov came and seized it from him - this is the law that Shimon goes and collects from him.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? בַּעַל חוֹב דְּיַעֲקֹב כְּבַעַל חוֹב דְּעָלְמָא דָּמֵי.
human_translation: What is the reason Ya’akov’s creditor is comparable to a general
llm_translation: What is the reason? The creditor of Jacob is like the creditor of the whole world.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: רְאוּבֵן שֶׁמָּכַר שָׂדֶה לְשִׁמְעוֹן בְּאַחְרָיוּת, וְזָקַף עָלָיו בְּמִלְוָה, וּמֵת רְאוּבֵן, וַאֲתָא בַּעַל חוֹב דִּרְאוּבֵן וְקָטָרֵיף לַהּ מִשִּׁמְעוֹן וּפַיְּיסֵיהּ בְּזוּזֵי —
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said: Reuven sold a field to Shimon with a guarantee and set up as a loan Reuven died, and a creditor of Reuven came and repossessed from Shimon. appease him with money
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: Reuben who sold a field to Shimon on credit, and then demanded payment from him as a loan, and Reuben died, and the creditor of Reuben came and seized it from Shimon and appeased him with money —

hebrew_text: דִּינָא הוּא דְּאָמְרִי לֵיהּ בְּנֵי רְאוּבֵן: אֲנַן מִטַּלְטְלִי שְׁבַק אֲבוּן גַּבָּךְ, וּמִטַּלְטְלִי דְיַתְמֵי לְבַעַל חוֹב לָא מִשְׁתַּעְבְּדִי.
human_translation: The law is that the sons of Reuven say to Our father left us movable property with you, and the movable property of orphans is not liened to a creditor.
llm_translation: The law is as the sons of Reuben said to him: "We move aside the stone from your father's grave, and we move aside the debt to the creditor will not be fulfilled."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִי פִּקֵּחַ אִידַּךְ, מַגְבֵּי לְהוּ נִיהֲלַיְיהוּ אַרְעָא וַהֲדַר גָּבֵי לַהּ מִינַּיְיהוּ, כְּרַב נַחְמָן. דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: יְתוֹמִים שֶׁגָּבוּ קַרְקַע בְּחוֹבַת אֲבִיהֶן — בַּעַל חוֹב חוֹזֵר וְגוֹבֶה אוֹתָהּ מֵהֶן.
human_translation: Rava said If the other is clever he will pay them real estate can then collect from them in accordance with Rav Naḥman, as Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: orphans collect real estate for a debt owed to their father creditor come and seize this from them.
llm_translation: Rava said: If one opens his the orphan's document, he the creditor collects from the land and then returns to collect from them the orphans, like Rav Nachman. For Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: Orphans who collected a debt owed to their father by plowing the ground - if the creditor comes back, he can collect it from them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: רְאוּבֵן שֶׁמָּכַר כׇּל שְׂדוֹתָיו לְשִׁמְעוֹן, וְחָזַר שִׁמְעוֹן וּמָכַר שָׂדֶה אַחַת לְלֵוִי, וַאֲתָא בַּעַל חוֹב דִּרְאוּבֵן — רָצָה מִזֶּה גּוֹבֶה, רָצָה מִזֶּה גּוֹבֶה.
human_translation: Rabba said: Reuven sold all his fields to Shimon, Shimon then sold one field to Levi, and Reuven’s creditor came he desires, he can collect from this one, he desires, he can collect from that one,
llm_translation: Rabah said: Reuven who sold all his fields to Shimon, and then Shimon returned and sold one field to Levi, and the creditor of Reuven came - he can collect from either one.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּזַבְּנֵהּ בֵּינוֹנִית, אֲבָל זַבְּנֵהּ עִידִּית וְזִבּוּרִית, מָצֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְהָכִי טְרַחִי וּזְבַינִי אַרְעָא דְּלָא חַזְיָא לָךְ.
human_translation: And we said only sold land of intermediate quality, but he sold land of superior quality or inferior quality, can say to for this I made an effort buy land that is not fit for you,
llm_translation: And we did not say except that he bought it with a medium coin, but if he bought it with a witness coin and a gold coin, he can say to him: "Therefore, make an effort and sell the land that is not visible to you."

hebrew_text: וּבֵינוֹנִית נָמֵי לָא אֲמַרַן, אֶלָּא דְּלָא שְׁבַק בֵּינוֹנִית דִּכְווֹתַהּ,
human_translation: And land of intermediate quality, we said only where did not leave equivalent land of intermediate quality.
llm_translation: And regarding the intermediate wall, we did not say, but that he did not leave the intermediate wall that he marked.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל שְׁבַק בֵּינוֹנִית דִּכְווֹתַהּ, מָצֵי אָמַר לֵיהּ: הִנַּחְתִּי לָךְ מָקוֹם לִגְבּוֹת הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: However, left similar land of intermediate quality he can say to I have left you a place from which to collect;
llm_translation: But he left the intermediate area of her waist, he found her and said to her: "I have prepared a place for you to rest upon it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רְאוּבֵן שֶׁמָּכַר שָׂדֶה לְשִׁמְעוֹן בְּאַחְרָיוּת, וַאֲתָא בַּעַל חוֹב דִּרְאוּבֵן וְקָטָרֵיף לַהּ מִינֵּיהּ, דִּינָא הוּא דְּאָזֵיל רְאוּבֵן וּמְפַצֵּי לֵיהּ. וְלָא מָצֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו בַּעַל דְּבָרִים דִּידִי אַתְּ. מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: דְּמַפְּקַתְּ מִינֵּיהּ, עָלַי הָדַר.
human_translation: Abaye said: where Reuven sold a field to Shimon with a guarantee and Reuven’s creditor comes and repossesses from the law is that Reuven goes and rescues and cannot say to I am not legally answerable to you because can retort: What you take from him comes back to me:
llm_translation: Abaye said: Reuven who sold a field to Shimon on credit, and the creditor of Reuven came and seized it from him, the law is that Reuven goes and collects from Shimon. And if he cannot find him, he should say to him: "You are not a man of integrity." Because he said to him: "Since you have caused me a loss, it is upon me to return."

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא בְּאַחְרָיוּת נָמֵי, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: לָא נִיחָא לִי דְּתֶהְוֵי לֵיהּ לְשִׁמְעוֹן תַּרְעוֹמֶת עָלַי.
human_translation: And there are who say even with no guarantee, also because say to not amenable to me that Shimon will have a grievance against me
llm_translation: And there are those who say: Even if not in succession, for he said to him: It is not pleasing to me that Shimon the Re'em should be upon me.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רְאוּבֵן שֶׁמָּכַר שָׂדֶה לְשִׁמְעוֹן שֶׁלֹּא בְּאַחְרָיוּת, וְיָצְאוּ עָלָיו
human_translation: Abaye said: where Reuven sold a field to Shimon with no guarantee, and it emerged he had
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Reuven who sold a field to Shimon without a right of redemption, and they went out against him.

hebrew_text: עֲסִיקִין, עַד שֶׁלֹּא הֶחְזִיק בָּהּ — יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ, מִשֶּׁהֶחְזִיק בָּהּ — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ. מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: חַיְיתָא דְּקִיטְרֵי סְבַרְתְּ וְקַבֵּילְתְּ. וּמֵאֵימַת מַחְזֵיק בַּהּ? מִכִּי דָיֵישׁ אַמִּצְרֵי.
human_translation: disputants as long as has not taken possession of it, he can renege once he has taken possession, cannot renege because can say to him: You agreed a sack [ ḥaita ] of knots and you received it, And from when taken possession of from when he walks the boundaries
llm_translation: Engaged, until he did not hold onto it - he can retract, once he held onto it - he cannot retract. Because he said to him: "The living creature of the incense you thought and received." And from when does he hold onto it? From when there is an Egyptian cubit.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי אֲפִילּוּ בְּאַחְרָיוּת נָמֵי. דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: אַחְוִי טִירְפָךְ וַאֲשַׁלֵּם לָךְ.
human_translation: There are who say even with a guarantee, as can say to Show me your authorization to repossess and I will pay you.
llm_translation: There is one who says even in the end, indeed. He said to him: "I will heal your wounds and repay you."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁהָיָה נָשׂוּי שָׁלֹשׁ נָשִׁים, וָמֵת, כְּתוּבָּתָהּ שֶׁל זוֹ מָנֶה, וְשֶׁל זוֹ מָאתַיִם, וְשֶׁל זוֹ שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת, וְאֵין שָׁם אֶלָּא מָנֶה — חוֹלְקִין בְּשָׁוֶה.
human_translation: one who was married three women and died the marriage contract of this one hundred dinars and of this two hundred and of this three hundred, and only one hundred dinars, divide equally.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who was married to three women, and he died, the marriage contract of this one is for one hundred, and of this one for two hundred, and of this one for three hundred, and there is only one hundred there — they divide equally.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ שָׁם מָאתַיִם, שֶׁל מָנֶה נוֹטֶלֶת חֲמִשִּׁים, שֶׁל מָאתַיִם וְשֶׁל שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁל זָהָב. הָיוּ שָׁם שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת — שֶׁל מָנֶה נוֹטֶלֶת חֲמִשִּׁים, וְשֶׁל מָאתַיִם מָנֶה, וְשֶׁל שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת שִׁשָּׁה שֶׁל זָהָב.
human_translation: there were two hundred for one hundred dinars takes fifty for two hundred and three hundred three of gold each, there were three hundred for one hundred takes fifty for two hundred takes one hundred and the one whose for three hundred six of gold,
llm_translation: There were there two hundred, of a mina takes fifty, of two hundred and of three hundred three three of gold. There were there three hundred - of a mina takes fifty, and of two hundred minas, and of three hundred six of gold.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁהִטִּילוּ לַכִּיס, פִּיחֲתוּ אוֹ הוֹתִירוּ — כָּךְ הֵן חוֹלְקִין.
human_translation: Similarly, three who deposited into a purse, incurred a loss or earned a profit, they divide in this manner,
llm_translation: And similarly, three who cast into a purse, whether they ground it or left it — thus they divide.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שֶׁל מָנֶה נוֹטֶלֶת חֲמִשִּׁים? תְּלָתִין וּתְלָתָא וְתִילְתָּא הוּא דְּאִית לַהּ!
human_translation: for one hundred take fifty? She should have thirty-three and one-third
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemah shel mane notlet chamishim? Telatin u'tlata v'tilta hu d'it lah! English translation: A coin of a mane takes fifty? Thirty and three and two-thirds is what it has!

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּכוֹתֶבֶת בַּעֲלַת מָאתַיִם לְבַעֲלַת מָנֶה ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי עִמָּךְ בְּמָנֶה״.
human_translation: Shmuel said: where whose was for two hundred writes to whose was for one hundred I do not have legal or involvement with you with regard to hundred dinars.
llm_translation: Samuel said: When a woman writes a document to her husband for two hundred zuz for her husband to acquire a maneh, "I have no claim against you in regard to the maneh."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: שֶׁל מָאתַיִם וְשֶׁל שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁלֹשׁ שֶׁל זָהָב. תֵּימָא לַהּ: הָא סַלֵּקְתְּ נַפְשִׁךְ מִינַּהּ!
human_translation: If that is so, say the latter clause whose was for two hundred and whose was for three hundred take three of gold each. should say to You have removed yourself from
llm_translation: If so, say the conclusion: of two hundred and of three hundred three three of gold. Say to her: you have removed your soul from it!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרָה לַהּ: מִדִּין וּדְבָרִים הוּא דְּסַלִּיקִי נַפְשַׁאי.
human_translation: because can say to I have removed myself from legal or involvement,
llm_translation: From the fact that she said to him: "From judgment and words is it that my soul is lifted up."

hebrew_text: הָיוּ שָׁם שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: there were three hundred
llm_translation: There were there three hundred and etc.

hebrew_text: שֶׁל מָאתַיִם מָנֶה? שִׁבְעִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה הוּא דְּאִית לַהּ!
human_translation: whose was for two hundred one hundred dinars? She should have seventy-five.
llm_translation: Of two hundred mana? Seventy and five is what it has!

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּכוֹתֶבֶת בַּעֲלַת שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת לְבַעֲלַת מָאתַיִם וּלְבַעֲלַת מָנֶה ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי עִמָּכֶם בְּמָנֶה״.
human_translation: Shmuel said: where whose was for three hundred writes to whose was for two hundred and to whose was for one hundred I have no legal or involvement with you with regard to hundred dinars.
llm_translation: Samuel said: If a woman writes a document to her husband for three hundred zuz to her husband for two hundred zuz, and to her husband for a hundred zuz, "I have no claim against you for the hundred zuz."

hebrew_text: רַב יַעֲקֹב מִנְּהַר פְּקוֹד מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא אָמַר: רֵישָׁא בִּשְׁתֵּי תְפִיסוֹת, וְסֵיפָא בִּשְׁתֵּי תְפִיסוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Ya’akov of Nehar Pekod said in the name of Ravina: The first clause where two seizures and the latter clause a case where two seizures
llm_translation: Rav Yaakov from Nehar Pekod, from the name of Ravina, said: The beginning in two graspings, and the end in two graspings.

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא בִּשְׁתֵּי תְפִיסוֹת — דְּנָפְלוּ שִׁבְעִין וַחֲמִשָּׁה בְּחַד זִימְנָא, וּמֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה בְּחַד זִימְנָא.
human_translation: The first clause where two seizures as seventy-five at one time and one hundred and twenty-five at another time.
llm_translation: The beginning in two holds - fell seventy and five in one time, and one hundred and twenty-five in one time.

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא בִּשְׁתֵּי תְפִיסוֹת — דְּנָפְלוּ שִׁבְעִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה בְּחַד זִימְנָא, וּמָאתַיִם וְעֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה בְּחַד זִימְנָא.
human_translation: The latter clause, where two seizures as seventy-five became available at one time and two hundred and twenty-five at another time.
llm_translation: The latter clause in two holds - seventy and five fell in one time, and two hundred and twenty five in one time.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: זוֹ מִשְׁנַת רַבִּי נָתָן. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אֵין אֲנִי רוֹאֶה דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי נָתָן בְּאֵלּוּ, אֶלָּא חוֹלְקוֹת בְּשָׁוֶה.
human_translation: It is taught This is the teaching of Rabbi Natan. Rabbi says: I do not agree with Rabbi Natan’s statement with regard to these rather, they divide equally.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: This is the teaching of Rabbi Natan. Rabbi says: I do not see the words of Rabbi Natan in these, rather they are disputes in similarity.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁהֵטִילוּ. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהִטִּילוּ לְכִיס, זֶה מָנֶה וְזֶה מָאתַיִם —
human_translation: Similarly, three who deposited into a purse, Shmuel said: two who deposited into a purse, this one hundred dinars and that two hundred,
llm_translation: And similarly, three who cast lots. Shmuel said: Two who cast lots for a purse, one is a hundred coins and the other is two hundred —

hebrew_text: הַשָּׂכָר לָאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: the earnings are divided equally.
llm_translation: The reward is not in the middle.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִילְּתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל בְּשׁוֹר לַחֲרִישָׁה וְעוֹמֵד לַחֲרִישָׁה, אֲבָל בְּשׁוֹר לַחֲרִישָׁה וְעוֹמֵד לִטְבִיחָה — זֶה נוֹטֵל לְפִי מְעוֹתָיו וְזֶה נוֹטֵל לְפִי מְעוֹתָיו. וְרַב הַמְנוּנָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹר לַחֲרִישָׁה וְעוֹמֵד לִטְבִיחָה — הַשָּׂכָר לָאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: Rabba said: Shmuel’s statement stands to reason where an ox for plowing and it was used for plowing, However, where an ox for plowing, but it was used for slaughter this takes according to his monetary and that takes according to his monetary And Rav Hamnuna said: Even an ox for plowing and used for slaughter, the earnings are divided equally.
llm_translation: Rabba said: It is reasonable that the matter of Shmuel is with an ox for plowing and standing for plowing, but with an ox for plowing and standing for slaughtering - this one takes according to his value and this one takes according to his value. And Rav Hamnuna said: Even if an ox is for plowing and standing for slaughtering - the wage is not in the middle.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהִטִּילוּ לַכִּיס, זֶה מָנֶה וְזֶה מָאתַיִם — הַשָּׂכָר לָאֶמְצַע. מַאי לָאו, בְּשׁוֹר לַחֲרִישָׁה וְעוֹמֵד לִטְבִיחָה, וּתְיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבָּה? לָא, בְּשׁוֹר לַחֲרִישָׁה וְעוֹמֵד לַחֲרִישָׁה.
human_translation: raises an objection two who deposited into a purse, this one hundred dinars and that two hundred, the earnings are divided equally. What, is it not of an ox for plowing and was used for slaughter, and a conclusive refutation of Rabba? No, of an ox for plowing and used for plowing.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Challenger: Two who contributed to the purse, one a hundred and one a hundred — the wage is not divided. What is the reason? In the case of an ox for plowing and standing for slaughter, and the surplus of Rabba? No, in the case of an ox for plowing and standing for plowing.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל שׁוֹר לַחֲרִישָׁה וְעוֹמֵד לִטְבִיחָה מַאי — זֶה נוֹטֵל לְפִי מְעוֹתָיו וְזֶה נוֹטֵל לְפִי מְעוֹתָיו. אַדְּתָנֵי סֵיפָא: לָקַח זֶה בְּשֶׁלּוֹ וְזֶה בְּשֶׁלּוֹ וְנִתְעָרְבוּ — זֶה נוֹטֵל לְפִי מְעוֹתָיו, וְזֶה נוֹטֵל לְפִי מְעוֹתָיו,
human_translation: But in an ox purchased for plowing and used for slaughter, what this takes according to his monetary and that takes according to his monetary rather than teaching the latter clause this purchased with his own and that with his own and they became mixed this takes according to his monetary and that takes according to his monetary
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But if an ox is intended for plowing and stands ready for slaughter, what is the law? — This one takes according to his value, and this one takes according to his value. It was taught in the latter clause: If one took his own and the other took his own, and they became mixed up — this one takes according to his value, and this one takes according to his value.

hebrew_text: לִיפְלוֹג וְלִיתְנֵי בְּדִידֵיהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים, בְּשׁוֹר לַחֲרִישָׁה וְעוֹמֵד לַחֲרִישָׁה. אֲבָל בְּשׁוֹר לַחֲרִישָׁה וְעוֹמֵד לִטְבִיחָה — זֶה נוֹטֵל לְפִי מְעוֹתָיו וְזֶה נוֹטֵל לְפִי מְעוֹתָיו!
human_translation: Let distinguish and teach within the case itself, In what is this statement said, In an ox for plowing and used for plowing, but in an ox for plowing and used for slaughter, this takes according to his monetary and that takes according to his monetary
llm_translation: To argue and to place in their own: In what case are these matters said? In a case where the ox is silent and standing. But in a case where the ox is silent and standing to gore - this one takes according to his damages and this one takes according to his damages!

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי קָאָמַר: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים, בְּשׁוֹר לַחֲרִישָׁה וְעוֹמֵד לַחֲרִישָׁה. אֲבָל בְּשׁוֹר לַחֲרִישָׁה וְעוֹמֵד לִטְבִיחָה — נַעֲשֶׂה כְּמִי שֶׁלָּקַח זֶה בְּשֶׁלּוֹ וְזֶה בְּשֶׁלּוֹ וְנִתְעָרְבוּ, זֶה נוֹטֵל לְפִי מְעוֹתָיו וְזֶה נוֹטֵל לְפִי מְעוֹתָיו.
human_translation: That is indeed what is saying: In what is this statement said? In an ox for plowing and used for plowing, but in an ox for plowing but used for slaughter, it becomes like where this purchased with his own and that with his own and they became mixed this takes according to his monetary and that takes according to his monetary
llm_translation: So it was stated: In what case are these words said? In a case where an ox is intended for plowing and stands for plowing. But in a case where an ox is intended for plowing and stands for slaughtering — it is considered as if one took his own and the other took his own, and they intermingled, this one takes according to his value and that one takes according to his value.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: וְכֵן שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁהִטִּילוּ לַכִּיס, פִּחֲתוּ אוֹ הוֹתִירוּ — כָּךְ הֵן חוֹלְקִין,
human_translation: We learned Similarly, three who deposited into a purse, incurred a loss or earned a profit they divide in this manner,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: And similarly, three individuals who contributed to a purse, whether they deducted or left over money — this is how they divide the funds.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו: ״פִּחֲתוּ״ — פִּחֲתוּ מַמָּשׁ, ״הוֹתִירוּ״ — הוֹתִירוּ מַמָּשׁ!
human_translation: What, is it not They incurred a loss, they incurred an actual loss, They earned a profit, they earned an actual profit,
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "pichatu" - they actually diminished, "hotiru" - they actually left over!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: לָא, ״הוֹתִירוּ״ — זוּזֵי חַדְתֵי, ״פִּחֲתוּ״ — אִסְתֵּירָא דְצוֹנִיתָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: No, they earned a profit, new dinars, they incurred a loss, coins for a wound.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: No, "leave" - these are the new ones, "diminish" - the covering of the flock.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁהָיָה נָשׂוּי אַרְבַּע נָשִׁים וָמֵת — הָרִאשׁוֹנָה קוֹדֶמֶת לַשְּׁנִיָּה, וּשְׁנִיָּה לַשְּׁלִישִׁית, וּשְׁלִישִׁית לָרְבִיעִית. וְרִאשׁוֹנָה נִשְׁבַּעַת לַשְּׁנִיָּה. וּשְׁנִיָּה לַשְּׁלִישִׁית, וּשְׁלִישִׁית לָרְבִיעִית, וְהָרְבִיעִית נִפְרַעַת שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה. בֶּן נַנָּס אוֹמֵר: וְכִי מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא אַחֲרוֹנָה נִשְׂכֶּרֶת? אַף הִיא לֹא תִּפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: one who was married four women and died, the first precedes the second the second the third, and the third the fourth. And first takes an oath to the second and second to the third, and third to the fourth. The fourth is paid without an oath. Ben Nanas says: Should she gain because she is last? she too is not paid without an oath.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who was married to four women and died—the first one takes precedence over the second, the second over the third, and the third over the fourth. And the first one swears to the second, and the second to the third, and the third to the fourth. And the fourth is repaid only after a week. Ben Nanas says: Just because she is the last, is she rented out? She too is repaid only after a week.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ יוֹצְאוֹת כּוּלָּן בְּיוֹם אֶחָד — כׇּל הַקּוֹדֶמֶת לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ אֲפִילּוּ שָׁעָה אַחַת זָכְתָה. וְכָךְ הָיוּ כּוֹתְבִין בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם שָׁעוֹת. הָיוּ כּוּלָּן יוֹצְאוֹת בְּשָׁעָה אַחַת, וְאֵין שָׁם אֶלָּא מָנֶה — חוֹלְקוֹת בְּשָׁוֶה.
human_translation: if all of were issued on the same day, whichever precedes another, even by a single hour, has acquired And so, in Jerusalem they would write the hours all were issued in the same hour and there is only one hundred dinars divide equally.
llm_translation: They were all going out on the same day - whoever preceded her friend, even by just one hour, she would merit. And so they would write in Jerusalem hours. They would all go out at the same hour, and there was only a portion - they would divide equally.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל:
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Shmuel said:
llm_translation: Gemara: With what did Gamaliel disagree? Shmuel said:

hebrew_text: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּמְצֵאת אַחַת מֵהֶן שָׂדֶה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁלּוֹ. וּבְבַעַל חוֹב מְאוּחָר שֶׁקָּדַם וְגָבָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: where it is discovered that one of the is not his And they disagree with regard to a creditor later he collected before
llm_translation: For example, if one of them is found in a field that is not his. And the creditor is delayed, he who preceded and was tall stumbled.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: מַה שֶּׁגָּבָה לֹא גָּבָה.
human_translation: The first tanna holds what has collected, he has not collected,
llm_translation: It was taught in the first Tanna: "What is high did not become high."

hebrew_text: וּבֶן נַנָּס סָבַר: מַה שֶּׁגָּבָה גָּבָה.
human_translation: And ben Nanas holds that what has collected, he has collected,
llm_translation: And Ben Nanas holds: "Whatever is high, is high."

hebrew_text: (אָמַר) רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא — מַה שֶּׁגָּבָה לֹא גָּבָה. וְהָכָא בְּחָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא תַּכְסִיף קָמִיפַּלְגִי,
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: Everyone agrees what has collected, he has not collected, they disagree here we are concerned perhaps she will deplete
llm_translation: (He said) Rav Nachman said Rabba bar Avuh: Regarding all the people of the world - what is high did not become high. And here we are concerned lest you might stumble.

hebrew_text: מָר סָבַר: חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא תַּכְסִיף. וּמַר סָבַר: לָא חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא תַּכְסִיף.
human_translation: Sage, holds we are concerned perhaps she will deplete And Sage, holds that we are not concerned perhaps she will deplete
llm_translation: Mar thought: we are concerned that perhaps she will cover. And Mar thought: we are not concerned that perhaps she will cover.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: דְּאַבָּיֵי קַשִּׁישָׁא אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. דְּתָנֵי אַבָּיֵי קַשִּׁישָׁא: יְתוֹמִים שֶׁאָמְרוּ — גְּדוֹלִים. וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר קְטַנִּים.
human_translation: Abaye said: There is between them, of Abaye the Elder, as Abaye the Elder taught: orphans said adult and, needless to say, minors.
llm_translation: Abaye said: For Abaye there is a difficulty between them. For Abaye taught a difficulty: Orphans who said - adults. And there is no need to say minors.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא קַמָּא לֵית לֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי קַשִּׁישָׁא. וּבֶן נַנָּס אִית לֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי קַשִּׁישָׁא.
human_translation: The first tanna does not of Abaye the Elder And ben Nanas accepts of Abaye the Elder
llm_translation: The first Tanna does not have the wisdom of Abbaye the Elder. But Ben Nanas has the wisdom of Abbaye the Elder.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הָנֵי תְּרֵי אַחֵי וּתְרֵי שׁוּתָּפֵי דְּאִית לְהוּ דִּינָא בַּהֲדֵי חַד, וַאֲזַל חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ בַּהֲדֵיהּ לְדִינָא — לָא מָצֵי אִידַּךְ לְמֵימַר לֵיהּ: אַתְּ לָאו בַּעַל דְּבָרִים דִּידִי אַתְּ. אֶלָּא שְׁלִיחוּתֵיהּ עֲבַד.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: two brothers or two partners who have legal against individual, and one of them went to legal against him the other cannot say I am not legally answerable to you, Rather, acted as his agent.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Those two brothers and those two partners who have a legal case together, and one of them goes away from the other to court - the other cannot say to him: "You are not my representative." Rather, his agency is effective.

hebrew_text: אִקְּלַע רַב נַחְמָן לְסוּרָא. שַׁיְילוּהִי: כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא מַאי?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman happened to Sura. They asked him: What a case like this
llm_translation: Rav Nachman arrived in Sura. They asked him: What is the nature of this matter?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ, מַתְנִיתִין הִיא: הָרִאשׁוֹנָה נִשְׁבַּעַת לַשְּׁנִיָּה, וּשְׁנִיָּה לַשְּׁלִישִׁית, וּשְׁלִישִׁית לָרְבִיעִית. וְאִילּוּ רִאשׁוֹנָה לַשְּׁלִישִׁית לָא קָתָנֵי, מַאי טַעְמָא, לָאו מִשּׁוּם דִּשְׁלִיחוּתַהּ עָבְדָה?
human_translation: He said to them: It is a mishna: The first takes an oath to the second, the second to the third, and the third to the fourth. it does not teach the first to the third What is the reason? Is it not due to she is acting as agent
llm_translation: He said to them, it is a Mishnah: the first one swore to the second, and the second to the third, and the third to the fourth. But if the first one swore to the third, it does not teach, what is the reason, is it not because her agency was not effective?

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם שְׁבוּעָה לְאֶחָד וּשְׁבוּעָה לְמֵאָה, הָכָא אָמַר: אִילּוּ אֲנָא הֲוַאי, טָעֵינְנָא טְפֵי.
human_translation: Is it comparable? There, an oath to one is an oath to one hundred, Here, say: Had I been I would have a more claim.
llm_translation: Who is similar? There, an oath for one and an oath for a hundred. Here, it says: If I were there, we would have loaded more.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא אִיתֵיהּ בְּמָתָא, אֲבָל אִיתֵיהּ בְּמָתָא — אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמֵיתֵי.
human_translation: We said only is not in town However, he is in town, he should come
llm_translation: And we did not say except that it is not present in the city, but if it is present in the city - he should bring witnesses to prove it.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: שְׁנֵי שְׁטָרוֹת הַיּוֹצְאִים בְּיוֹם אֶחָד, רַב אָמַר: חוֹלְקִין, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: שׁוּדָא דְּדַיָּינֵי.
human_translation: It was stated two deeds that are issued, on the same day, Rav said: They divide and Shmuel said: the discretion [ shuda ] of the judges.
llm_translation: It was stated: Two documents that are issued on the same day. Rav said: They are divided, and Shmuel said: The pouch of judges.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַב דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי חֲתִימָה כָּרְתִי.
human_translation: Shall we say Rav said in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who said signatory witnesses effect
llm_translation: Let us say, Rav said as Rabbi Meir said: Witnesses of signature, I have cut.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי מְסִירָה כָּרְתִי.
human_translation: And Shmuel said in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, who said witnesses of the transmission effect
llm_translation: And Samuel said in the name of Rabbi Elazar, who said: "Witnesses of removal, I have cut."

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, רַב סָבַר: חֲלוּקָּה עֲדִיפָא. וּשְׁמוּאֵל סָבַר: שׁוּדָא דְּדַיָּינֵי עֲדִיפָא.
human_translation: No, that everyone in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, and here they disagree about the following: Rav holds division is preferable, and Shmuel holds the discretion of the judges is preferable.
llm_translation: Not, that all the world like Rabbi Elazar, and here in this case they disagree, Rav holds: division is preferable. And Shmuel holds: a gift of judges is preferable.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מָצֵית מוֹקְמַתְּ לֵיהּ לְרַב כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר? וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּגִיטִּין. כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אָמַר: אַף בִּשְׁטָרוֹת. מִכְּלָל דְּרַב סָבַר בִּשְׁטָרוֹת לָא! אֶלָּא: מְחַוַּורְתָּא רַב כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, וּשְׁמוּאֵל כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: Can you really establish of Rav in accordance with Rabbi Elazar? Didn’t Rav Yehuda say Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar with regard to bills of divorce? When I said this in the presence of Shmuel, he said: even with regard to documents By inference, that Rav holds documents, no, Rather, it is clear Rav in accordance with Rabbi Meir, and Shmuel in accordance with Rabbi Elazar.
llm_translation: And who established for Rav like Rabbi Elazar? And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The halakha is like Rabbi Elazar in matters of divorce. For when you said it before Shmuel, he said: Even in documents. From the general principle, Rav does not hold in documents! Rather, the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir, and Shmuel is like Rabbi Elazar.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: שְׁנֵי שְׁטָרוֹת הַיּוֹצְאִים בְּיוֹם אֶחָד חוֹלְקִין, תְּיוּבְתָּא דִשְׁמוּאֵל. אָמַר לָךְ שְׁמוּאֵל: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, וַאֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: raises an objection two deeds that are issued the same day, divide a conclusive refutation of Shmuel? Shmuel said to you: whose is this It is Rabbi Meir, and I said in accordance with Rabbi Elazar.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Challenger: Two documents that are issued on the same day are divided, the rebuttal of Shmuel. Shmuel said to you: This is the opinion of Rabbi Meir, and I say like Rabbi Elazar.

hebrew_text: אִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: כָּתַב לְאֶחָד וּמָסַר לְאַחֵר — זֶה שֶׁמָּסַר לוֹ קָנָה. וְאִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אַמַּאי קָנָה? הָאָמַר עֵדֵי חֲתִימָה כָּרְתִי!
human_translation: If Rabbi Meir, say the latter clause he wrote to one and transmitted it to another the one to whom was transmitted has acquired If Rabbi Meir, why acquire Didn’t say the signatory witnesses effect the transaction
llm_translation: If it is Rabbi Meir, say the latter part: he wrote to one and gave to another - this one who gave acquired. And if it is Rabbi Meir, why did he acquire? Because he said: Witnesses of a signature I have made!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יַחְלוֹקוּ, וְכָאן אָמְרוּ: מַה שֶּׁיִּרְצֶה הַשָּׁלִישׁ, יַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: is tanna’im as it is taught The Rabbis say: should divide And here, they said: The third can do as he pleases
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita. As it was taught: And the Sages say: They shall divide, and here they said: Whatever the agent desires, he shall do.

hebrew_text: אִמֵּיהּ דְּרָמֵי בַּר חָמָא כְּתַבְתִּינְהוּ לְנִכְסַהּ לְרָמִי בַּר חָמָא בְּצַפְרָא, לְאוּרְתָּא כְּתַבְתִּינְהוּ לְמָר עוּקְבָא בַּר חָמָא.
human_translation: the mother of Rami bar Ḥama wrote in the morning her property to Rami bar Ḥama, in the evening she wrote her property to Mar Ukva bar Ḥama.
llm_translation: His mother of Ramei son of Hama wrote for him to Niksa to Ramei son of Hama in Tzafra, to Urta I wrote for Mar Ukva son of Hama.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת, אוֹקְמֵיהּ בְּנִכְסֵי. אֲתָא מָר עוּקְבָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, אוֹקְמֵיהּ בְּנִכְסֵי. אֲתָא רַב שֵׁשֶׁת לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא עֲבַד מָר הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּמַאי טַעְמָא עֲבַד מָר הָכִי?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama came before Rav Sheshet established his to the property. Mar Ukva, came before Rav Naḥman established his to the property. Rav Sheshet came before Rav Naḥman said to him: What is the reason that the Master did this, said to him: And what is the reason that the Master did this,
llm_translation: Ramai son of Hama came before Rav Sheshet, he established him with properties. Mar Ukva came before Rav Nachman, he established him with properties. Rav Sheshet came before Rav Nachman, he said to him: What is the reason that Master did so? He said to him: And what is the reason that Master did so?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּקְדֵים. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַטּוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם יָתְבִינַן דְּכָתְבִינַן שָׁעוֹת? אֶלָּא מָר מַאי טַעְמָא עֲבַד הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שׁוּדָא דְּדַיָּינֵי.
human_translation: said to him: Because preceded said to Is that to say we are sitting in Jerusalem, that we write the hours But what is the reason that the Master did this, said to him: the discretion of the judges,
llm_translation: He said to him: "Earlier." He said to him: "Now in Jerusalem do we understand that we write hours? Rather, Master, why did he do so?" He said to him: "A support for judges."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא נָמֵי שׁוּדָא דְּדַיָּינֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲדָא, דַּאֲנָא דַּיָּינָא וּמָר לָאו דַּיָּינָא. וְעוֹד, מֵעִיקָּרָא לָאו בְּתוֹרַת הָכִי אֲתֵית לַהּ.
human_translation: said to I also the discretion of the judges said to him: One that I am a judge, and the Master is not a judge, Furthermore, at the outset, you did not arrive at for this
llm_translation: He said to him: I am also a merchant of wine. He said to him: One, for I am a merchant and not the son of a merchant. Furthermore, from the beginning, it is not in the Torah that you have come to him.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ תְּרֵי שְׁטָרֵי דַּאֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף. חַד הֲוָה כָּתוּב בְּחַמְשָׁא בְּנִיסָן, וְחַד הֲוָה כָּתוּב בֵּיהּ בְּנִיסָן סְתָמָא. אוֹקְמֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף לְהָהוּא דְּחַמְשָׁא בְּנִיסָן בִּנְכָסִים.
human_translation: these two deeds that came before Rav Yosef. one it was written on the fifth of Nisan, and in one it was written in Nisan, without specifying Rav Yosef established the one the fifth of Nisan to the property.
llm_translation: Behold, two documents that were brought before Rav Yosef. One was written on the fifth of Nisan, and one was written in it on the fifth of Nisan anonymously. Rav Yosef established the one written on the fifth of Nisan regarding property.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אִידַּךְ: וַאֲנָא אַפְסֵיד? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתְּ יָדְךָ עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה, אֵימָא בַּר עֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה בְּנִיסָן אַתְּ.
human_translation: The other said to Should I lose? said to him: You are at a disadvantage, say your deed is from the twenty-ninth of Nisan.
llm_translation: He said to him: And I, should I lose? He said to him: Your hand on the lower one, say on the twenty-ninth of Nisan you are.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְנִכְתּוֹב לִי מָר
human_translation: said to him: Let the Master write me
llm_translation: He said to him: "And it shall be written for me, Master."

hebrew_text: טִירְפָא מֵאִיָּיר וְאֵילָךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יָכְלִי לְמֵימַר לָךְ: אַתְּ בַּר חַד בְּנִיסָן אַתְּ.
human_translation: authorization to repossess from Iyyar and on. said to him: can say to you: Your the first of Nisan,
llm_translation: Tirfa from Iyyar and onwards. He said to him: I can say to you: You are the son of Chad in Nisan, you.

hebrew_text: מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? נִכְתְּבוּ הַרְשָׁאָה לַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: what is his remedy? Let write authorization to each other.
llm_translation: What is its benefit? Permission was written for Hadadei.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁהָיָה נָשׂוּי שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים וּמָכַר אֶת שָׂדֵהוּ, וְכָתְבָה רִאשׁוֹנָה לַלּוֹקֵחַ ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי עִמָּךְ״ — הַשְּׁנִיָּה מוֹצִיאָה מֵהַלּוֹקֵחַ, וְרִאשׁוֹנָה מִן הַשְּׁנִיָּה, וְהַלּוֹקֵחַ מִן הָרִאשׁוֹנָה. וְחוֹזְרוֹת חֲלִילָה, עַד שֶׁיַּעֲשׂוּ פְּשָׁרָה בֵּינֵיהֶם. וְכֵן בַּעַל חוֹב, וְכֵן אִשָּׁה בַּעֲלַת חוֹב.
human_translation: one who was married two women and sold his field, and the first wrote to the purchaser: I do not have legal or involvement with you, the second may appropriate from the purchaser the first from the second The purchaser from the first continue cycle [ ḥalila ] until they compromise between them. And so too, a creditor, and so too, a female creditor.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who was married to two women and sold his field, and the first wife wrote to the buyer, "I have no claim against you" - the second wife can invalidate it from the buyer, and the first wife from the second wife, and the buyer from the first wife. And they should not do this, God forbid, until they make a compromise between them. The same applies to a debtor and a creditor woman.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְכִי כָּתְבָה לֵיהּ מַאי הָוֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי עַל שָׂדֶה זוֹ״, וְ״אֵין לִי עֵסֶק בָּהּ״, וְ״יָדַי מְסוּלָּקֹת הֵימֶנָּה״ — לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בְּשֶׁקָּנוּ מִיָּדָהּ.
human_translation: And if wrote to him, what of it? Isn’t it taught One who says to another, I have no legal or involvement with regard to this field, or: I have no connection to it, or: I have withdrawn from it, has said nothing, With what are we dealing here? where he acquired from her possession
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: And if she wrote to him, what is the halakha? And it was taught in a baraita: One who says to his fellow, 'I have no claim on this field,' 'I have no business with it,' or 'my hands are removed from it' — he has not said anything. What are we dealing with here? We are dealing with a case where he acquired it immediately." English translation:

hebrew_text: וְכִי קָנוּ מִיָּדָהּ מַאי הָוֵי? תֵּימָא: נַחַת רוּחַ עָשִׂיתִי לְבַעְלִי. מִי לָא תְּנַן: לָקַח מִן הָאִישׁ וְחָזַר וְלָקַח מִן הָאִשָּׁה — מִקָּחוֹ בָּטֵל. אַלְמָא: יְכוֹלָה הִיא שֶׁתֹּאמַר נַחַת רוּחַ עָשִׂיתִי לְבַעְלִי.
human_translation: And if they acquired it from her, what of it? Let say I please my husband, Didn’t we learn purchased from a man, went back and purchased from the wife, the transaction is nullified? Apparently, can say: I please my husband
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And if she acquired the property from her hand, what is the law? Say: 'I have brought contentment to my husband.' Did we not learn: If he took from the man and then took from the woman — his acquisition is nullified. This implies that she can say, 'I have brought contentment to my husband.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, הָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said Rav Ḥisda said: not difficult: This is Rabbi Meir, and that Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav Hisda, it is not difficult: this is Rabbi Meir, this is Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: כָּתַב לָרִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא חָתְמָה לוֹ, לַשֵּׁנִי וְחָתְמָה לוֹ — אִיבְּדָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: As it is taught wrote to one but did not sign for him to a second and signed for him, she has lost her marriage contract this is the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one wrote a document for the first party but did not sign it for him, and for the second party and signed it for him — its writing is examined, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, יְכוֹלָה הִיא שֶׁתֹּאמַר: ״נַחַת רוּחַ עָשִׂיתִי לְבַעְלִי, אַתֶּם מַה לָּכֶם עָלַי״?
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says she can say: I please my husband and you, what do you have against me?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says, "It is possible to say: 'I have brought contentment to my husband, what is it to you?'"

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי, סָתֵם לַהּ הָכָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר וְסָתֵם לַהּ הָתָם כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה?!
human_translation: Rabbi unattributed here in accordance with Rabbi Meir and unattributed there in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: And Rabbi, here it is anonymous like Rabbi Meir, and there it is anonymous like Rabbi Yehuda?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בִּגְרוּשָׁה, וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: to a divorcée and everyone agrees
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: In the case of a divorcee, and the words of everyone.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כּוּלַּהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, וְעַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר הָתָם, אֶלָּא בִּשְׁנֵי לָקוֹחוֹת, דְּאָמְרִי לַהּ: אִי אִיתָא דְּנַחַת רוּחַ עֲבַדְתְּ — לְקַמָּא אִיבְּעִי לָךְ לְמִיעְבַּד. אֲבָל בְּלוֹקֵחַ אֶחָד, אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר מוֹדֶה. וּמַתְנִיתִין דִּכְתַב לֵיהּ לְאַחֵר.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: It is all Rabbi Meir, and Rabbi Meir states there only in two purchasers, as they say to her: If it is that you acted please you should have done so with regard to the first However, where one purchaser, even Rabbi Meir concedes And the mishna where wrote to another
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The entire matter is in accordance with Rabbi Meir, and until here Rabbi Meir did not say there, but rather in two tablets, as they say to it: If you have done something that has caused satisfaction — go and make yourself happy. But with one tablet, even Rabbi Meir agrees. And the Mishnah that wrote it to another.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: אֵין נִפְרָעִין מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ נְכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין, וַאֲפִילּוּ הֵן זִיבּוּרִית. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אִישְׁתְּדוּף בְּנֵי חָרֵי, מַהוּ דְּלִיטְרוֹף מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי?
human_translation: We learned elsewhere One does not collect from liened property where there is unsold property even is inferior quality. A dilemma was raised before the unsold became blighted what is to repossess liened
llm_translation: We learned there: One does not collect debts from properties of slaves in a place where there are free properties, even if they are mixed. It was asked of them: If the properties of free men were destroyed, what is the law regarding collecting from slaves?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: כָּתַב לָרִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא חָתְמָה לוֹ, לַשֵּׁנִי וְחָתְמָה לוֹ — אִיבְּדָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Come hear wrote to one but did not sign for him, to a second and signed for him, she has lost her marriage contract this is the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: "Come and hear: If one wrote a document for the first party and did not sign it for him, then for the second party and signed it for him — its writing is examined, these are the words of Rabbi Meir."

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אִישְׁתְּדוּף בְּנֵי חָרֵי טָרֵיף מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי, נְהִי דְּאִיבְּדָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מִשֵּׁנִי — מֵרִאשׁוֹן מִיהָא תִּיגְבֵּי.
human_translation: if it should enter your mind the unsold became blighted repossess liened though she lost her marriage contract from the second she should at least collect from the first
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind that the sons of the town of Tarif were mixed with the slaves, even though its writing was lost from the beginning, it should be established from there.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַאי ״אִיבְּדָה״ — אִיבְּדָה מִשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: what She has lost she has lost from the second
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: What is "ibb'dah" - she lost from the second.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁתֵּי תְּשׁוּבוֹת בַּדָּבָר, חֲדָא: דְּ״אִיבְּדָה״ לִגְמָרֵי מַשְׁמַע. וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא: לָוָה מִן הָאֶחָד וּמָכַר נְכָסָיו לִשְׁנַיִם, וְכָתַב בַּעַל חוֹב לְלוֹקֵחַ שֵׁנִי: ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי עִמָּךְ״ — אֵין לוֹ עַל לוֹקֵחַ רִאשׁוֹן כְּלוּם. מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לוֹמַר: הִנַּחְתִּי לְךָ מָקוֹם לִגְבּוֹת הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: Rava said: two responses statement One She has lost, indicates entirely, And furthermore, it is taught borrowed from one and sold his property to two and the creditor wrote to the second I do not have legal or involvement with you, he has no toward the first purchaser because able to say I left you a place from to collect
llm_translation: Rava said: Two returns in the matter, one: that "it is lost" implies complete loss. Furthermore, it was taught: If one borrowed from one person and sold his property to another, and the creditor wrote to the buyer: "I have no claim against you" — he has nothing against the first buyer. Because he can say: I left a place for you to collect from him.

hebrew_text: הָתָם אִיהוּ דְּאַפְסֵיד נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּיָדַיִם.
human_translation: There, he who causes a loss to himself by action
llm_translation: There, he caused himself to lose his life by his own hands.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יֵימַר לְרַב אָשֵׁי:
human_translation: Rav Yeimar said to Rav Ashi:
llm_translation: Rav Yeimar said to Rav Ashei:

hebrew_text: וְהָא מַעֲשִׂים בְּכׇל יוֹם, דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּמַישְׁכֵּן לֵיהּ פַּרְדֵּיסָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ לַעֲשַׂר שְׁנִין, וְקַשׁ לַחֲמֵשׁ שְׁנִין, וַאֲתָא לְקַמַּיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן וּכְתַבוּ לֵיהּ טִירְפָא!
human_translation: But it is a daily occurrence as a certain man who mortgaged his orchard [ pardeisa ] to another for ten years, five years grew old came before the Sages and they wrote him authorization to repossess
llm_translation: And this is the deeds every day, for that man who drew for him a paradise for his friends for ten years, and difficult for five years, and came before the sages and they wrote for him a certificate!

hebrew_text: הָתָם נָמֵי, אִינְהוּ הוּא דְּאַפְסִידוּ אַנַּפְשַׁיְיהוּ, כֵּיוָן דַּהֲווֹ יָדְעִי דְּפַרְדֵּיסָא עָבֵיד דְּקִישׁ, לָא אִיבְּעִי לְהוּ לְמִיזְבַּן.
human_translation: There too, it was they, who brought this loss upon themselves since they know that an orchard tends to age. they should not have purchased
llm_translation: There, in that case, they are the ones who caused harm to themselves, since they knew that the orchard was producing thorns, they should not have come to buy it.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא: אִישְׁתְּדוּף בְּנֵי חָרֵי — טָרְפָא מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי.
human_translation: And the halakha unsold became blighted, may repossess liened
llm_translation: The Halakha: A man who is pursued by the sons of Harai - he is considered a mortal danger.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״נְכָסַי לִיךְ וְאַחֲרַיִךְ לִפְלוֹנִי״, וְעָמְדָה וְנִיסֵּת — בַּעַל לוֹקֵחַ הָוֵי, וְאֵין לְ״אַחֲרַיִךְ״ בִּמְקוֹם בַּעַל כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Abaye said: My property to you, and after you to so-and-so, and went and married her husband is a purchaser, And after you, nothing where there is a husband.
llm_translation: Abaye said: "If one says, 'My property is yours, and after you to so-and-so,' and the woman stands and remarries - the first husband is considered as the one who takes her, and the 'after you' has no standing in the place of the first husband."

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן — כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״נְכָסַי לִיךְ וְאַחֲרַיִךְ לִפְלוֹנִי״, יָרַד הָרִאשׁוֹן וּמָכַר — הַשֵּׁנִי מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵין לַשֵּׁנִי אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁשִּׁיֵּיר רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: In accordance with whose In accordance with this tanna , as it is taught My property to you, and after you to so-and-so, the first entered, and sold the second repossess from the purchasers the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The second has only that which the first left
llm_translation: As to whom? — For this Mishnah, as it was taught: "My property is for you, and after you for so-and-so," the first one descended and sold — the second one removes from the hands of the buyers, the words of Rabbi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The second one only has what the first one left.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר אַבָּיֵי הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֵיזֶהוּ רָשָׁע עָרוּם — זֶה הַמַּשִּׂיא עֵצָה לִמְכּוֹר בִּנְכָסִים כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל!
human_translation: And did Abaye say so? Didn’t Abaye say: Who is a wily, wicked person? One who gives advice to sell property in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said thus, Abaye? And Abaye said: Who is a cunning wicked person? This is one who advises to sell assets, like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel!"

hebrew_text: מִי קָאָמַר תִּינָּשֵׂא? ״נִשֵּׂאת״ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Did he say should marry He said married
llm_translation: Who said "tinasei"? "Nis'eta" is what he said.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״נְכָסַי לִיךְ וְאַחֲרַיִךְ לִפְלוֹנִי״ וּמָכְרָה וָמֵתָה — הַבַּעַל מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת, וְ״אַחֲרַיִךְ״ מִיַּד בַּעַל, וְלוֹקֵחַ מִיַּד ״אַחֲרַיִךְ״. וּמוֹקְמִינַן לְכוּלְּהוּ בִּידָא דְלוֹקֵחַ.
human_translation: And Abaye said: My property to you, and after you to so-and-so, and she sold and died, the husband repossess from the purchasers. And after you, from the possession the husband And the purchaser may repossess from the possession of after you, the property is established in the possession of the purchaser.
llm_translation: And Abaye said: "My property to you, and after you to so-and-so," and she sold it and died - the husband takes it from the hands of the buyers, and "after you" from the hand of the husband, and the buyer takes it from the hand of "after you." And we establish all of them in the possession of the buyer.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: וְחוֹזְרוֹת חֲלִילָה עַד שֶׁיַּעֲשׂוּ פְּשָׁרָה בֵּינֵיהֶן? הָתָם אִית לְהוּ פְּסֵידָא לְכוּלְּהוּ, הָכָא לוֹקֵחַ הוּא דְּאִית לֵיהּ פְּסֵידָא.
human_translation: what is different from that which we learned the mishna: continue cycle until they compromise between them? There, they all incur a loss, Here, it is purchaser who incur a loss,
llm_translation: What is different from what we learned: "And they keep going back and forth until they reach a compromise between them?" There, there is a loss for both of them, but here, he takes the loss upon himself.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל רַפְרָם אֲמַר לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי. מִי אָמַר אַבָּיֵי הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״נְכָסַי לִיךְ וְאַחֲרַיִךְ לִפְלוֹנִי״, עָמְדָה וְנִיסֵּת — בַּעַל לוֹקֵחַ הָוֵי, וְאֵין לְ״אַחֲרַיִךְ״ בִּמְקוֹם בַּעַל כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Rafram went and stated this halakha before Rav Ashi Did Abaye say this? Didn’t Abaye say: My property to you, and after you to so-and-so, went and married her husband is a purchaser, and after you, nothing where there is a husband.
llm_translation: Rafhram went, he said to hear before Rav Ashe. Who said Abaye thus? And Abaye said: "My property to you, and after you to so-and-so," she stood and vanished - the buyer becomes the owner, and there is no "after you" in place of the buyer.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם דְּאָמַר לַהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא פְּנוּיָה, הָכָא דְּאָמַר לַהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא נְשׂוּאָה. מַאי קָאָמַר לַהּ — ״אַחֲרַיִךְ״ לִיקְנֵי, בַּעַל לָא לִיקְנֵי.
human_translation: said to him: There, where spoke to while she was unmarried, here, he spoke to her when she was married. What he is saying to her after you shall acquire husband shall not acquire
llm_translation: He said to her: There, where he said to her when she is single, here where he said to her when she is married. What is he saying to her - "after you" he can acquire, but not a husband.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בַּעַל חוֹב. תָּנָא: וְכֵן בַּעַל חוֹב וּשְׁנֵי לָקוֹחוֹת.
human_translation: And so too, a creditor, taught And so too, a creditor two purchasers.
llm_translation: And so too a creditor. It was taught: And so too a creditor and two witnesses.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אִשָּׁה בַּעֲלַת חוֹב וּשְׁנֵי לָקוֹחוֹת.
human_translation: And so too, a female creditor, and two purchasers
llm_translation: And so too a woman, owner of a debt, and two tablets.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ מִי שֶׁהָיָה נָשׂוּי
llm_translation: We will return to you, O one who was married.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָנָה נִיזּוֹנֶת מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִים — מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ שֶׁלָּהֶן, וְאֵין חַיָּיבִין בִּקְבוּרָתָהּ. יוֹרְשֶׁיהָ יוֹרְשֵׁי כְתוּבָּתָהּ חַיָּיבִין בִּקְבוּרָתָהּ.
human_translation: A widow is sustained from the property of orphans. Her earnings belong to them, and they are not obligated to her burial. Her heirs, inherit her marriage contract, are obligated to her burial.
llm_translation: Widow supported from property of orphans — her handiwork, and not obligated in her burial. Her heirs, the heirs of her written document, are obligated in her burial.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״נִיזּוֹנֶת״ תְּנַן אוֹ ״הַנִּיזּוֹנֶת״ תְּנַן? נִיזּוֹנֶת תְּנַן, וּכְאַנְשֵׁי גָלִיל, וְלָא סַגִּי דְּלָא יָהֲבִי לַהּ,
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before we learn is sustained, or we learn who is sustained? we learned is sustained, And in accordance with the people of Galilee, And it is impossible not to give her
llm_translation: Gemara: He asked them: "Did we teach 'nizonet' or 'hanizonet'?" We taught 'nizonet,' like the people of the Galilee, and not like those who do not give it to her.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא ״הַנִּיזּוֹנֶת״ תְּנַן, וּכְאַנְשֵׁי יְהוּדָה, וְאִי בָּעוּ לָא יָהֲבִי לַהּ.
human_translation: Or perhaps, we learned who is sustained, And in accordance with the people of Judea, And if they desire, they not give her
llm_translation: Or perhaps "hanizzonet" we learned, and like the men of Judah, and if they do not want, he does not give to her.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מְצִיאַת אַלְמָנָה לְעַצְמָהּ. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא ״הַנִּיזּוֹנֶת״ תְּנַן — שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ ״נִיזּוֹנֶת״ תְּנַן, נִיהְווֹ כְּבַעַל: מָה בַּעַל מְצִיאַת אִשָּׁה לְבַעְלָהּ, הָכָא נָמֵי מְצִיאַת אִשָּׁה לַיּוֹרְשִׁים!
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Zeira said Shmuel said: article found by the widow for herself. Granted, if you say we learned who is sustained, well However, if you say we learned is sustained let be like the husband Just as the husband, article found by wife to the husband, here too, article found by wife to the heirs.
llm_translation: Come and hear. Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Shmuel: A widow's find is for herself. If you say we learn "the one who is sustained" - it is fine. But if you say we learn "the one who sustains" - they become like a husband. Just as a husband's find is for her husband, here too, a woman's find is for the heirs!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ: ״נִיזּוֹנֶת״ תְּנַן: טַעְמָא מַאי אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן מְצִיאַת אִשָּׁה לְבַעְלָהּ — דְּלָא תֶּיהְוֵי לַהּ אֵיבָה. הָנֵי — תֶּיהְוֵי לְהוּ אֵיבָה.
human_translation: Actually, I will say to you we learned is sustained, What is the reason the Sages said article found by wife to her husband? so that she should not be subject to enmity. these let them have enmity
llm_translation: Always say to you: "Nizonet" we learned: Reason what say sages finding a woman for her husband - that not will be to her enmity. These - will be to them enmity.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: כׇּל מְלָאכוֹת שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה עוֹשָׂה לְבַעְלָהּ, אַלְמָנָה עוֹשָׂה לַיּוֹרְשִׁים, חוּץ מִמְּזִיגַת הַכּוֹס וְהַצָּעַת הַמִּטָּה וְהַרְחָצַת פָּנָיו יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: All tasks that a wife performs for her husband, a widow performs for the heirs, except for filling cup; and making bed; and washing his face, hands, and feet,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina said: All tasks that a woman does for her husband, a widow does for her heirs, except for pouring the cup, making the bed, and washing his face, hands, and feet.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל מְלָאכוֹת שֶׁהָעֶבֶד עוֹשֶׂה לְרַבּוֹ — תַּלְמִיד עוֹשֶׂה לְרַבּוֹ, חוּץ מֵהַתָּרַת (לוֹ) מִנְעָל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: All tasks that slave performs for his master, a student performs for his teacher, except for untying his shoe,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: All tasks that a servant performs for his master - a student performs for his master, except for removing his shoe.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מַכִּירִין אוֹתוֹ, אֲבָל בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁמַּכִּירִין אוֹתוֹ לֵית לַן בַּהּ. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: וּבִמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מַכִּירִין אוֹתוֹ נָמֵי, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא מַנַּח תְּפִלִּין, אֲבָל מַנַּח תְּפִלִּין — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: We said this only in a place where not familiar with However, in a place where familiar with we have no with it Rav Ashi said: And in a place where not familiar with we said this only he is not donning phylacteries, but if he is donning phylacteries, we have no with it.
llm_translation: Rava said: We only said this in a place where they do not recognize him, but in a place where they recognize him, we do not have this issue. Rav Ashe said: And in a place where they do not recognize him also, we only said this that he does not put on tefillin, but if he puts on tefillin, we do not have this issue.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַמּוֹנֵעַ תַּלְמִידוֹ מִלְּשַׁמְּשׁוֹ — כְּאִילּוּ מוֹנֵעַ מִמֶּנּוּ חֶסֶד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לַמָּס מֵרֵעֵהוּ חָסֶד״. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אוֹמֵר: אַף פּוֹרֵק מִמֶּנּוּ יִרְאַת שָׁמַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיִרְאַת שַׁדַּי יַעֲזוֹב״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Anyone who prevents his student from serving him, it is as if he withheld from him kindness, as it is stated: “To him that is ready to faint [ lamas ], from his friend kindness is due” Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: He even removes from the fear of Heaven, as it is stated “Even to one who forsakes the fear of the Almighty.”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: Anyone who prevents his student from serving him - as if he withholds kindness from him, as it is said: "He who withholds kindness from his friend." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak says: He also separates from him the fear of Heaven, as it is said: "And the fear of Shaddai he will forsake."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אַלְמָנָה שֶׁתָּפְסָה מִטַּלְטְלִין בִּמְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ — מַה שֶּׁתָּפְסָה תָּפְסָה. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אַלְמָנָה שֶׁתָּפְסָה מִטַּלְטְלִין בִּמְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ — מַה שֶּׁתָּפְסָה תָּפְסָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: a widow who seized movable property for her sustenance, that which she seized, she seized That is also taught A widow who seized movable property for her sustenance, that which she seized, she seized.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: A widow who caught termites in her provisions—whatever she caught, she caught. It was also taught in a baraita: A widow who caught termites in her provisions—whatever she caught, she caught.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּכַלָּתוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי שַׁבְּתַי שֶׁתָּפְסָה דִּסַקַּיָּא מְלֵאָה מָעוֹת, וְלֹא הָיָה כֹּחַ בְּיַד חֲכָמִים לְהוֹצִיא מִיָּדָהּ.
human_translation: And likewise, when Rav Dimi came he said: an incident involving Rabbi Shabbtai’s daughter-in-law, who seized a saddlebag [ diskayya ] full of coins and the Sages did not have the authority to remove it from her possession.
llm_translation: And so, when Rav Dimi came, he said: There was an incident with the daughter-in-law of Rabbi Shabbati who grabbed a basket full of coins, and the Sages were unable to take it out of her hand.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא לִמְזוֹנֵי, אֲבָל לִכְתוּבָּה — מַפְּקִינַן מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said: We said only for her sustenance. However, as her marriage contract, we remove it from her.
llm_translation: Ravina said: And we only said this regarding sustenance, but for a marriage contract - we remove her from it.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי שְׁנָא לִכְתוּבָּה, דְּמִמְּקַרְקְעֵי וְלָא מִמִּטַּלְטְלִי? מְזוֹנוֹת נָמֵי מִמְּקַרְקְעֵי וְלָא מִמִּטַּלְטְלִי! אֶלָּא לִמְזוֹנֵי — מַאי דְּתָפְסָה תָּפְסָה, הָכִי נָמֵי לִכְתוּבָּה!
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi objects to this: What is different as her marriage contract, that from real estate and not from movable property, sustenance also from real estate and not from movable property. Rather, for her sustenance, that which she seized, she seized, so too, as her marriage contract.
llm_translation: The Master, Bar Rav Ashi, objected to her: What is different about writing, that it is from the ground and not from moving? Also, sustenance is also from the ground and not from moving! Rather, regarding sustenance - what is grasped, is grasped, so it is indeed written!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יִצְחָק בַּר נַפְתָּלִי לְרָבִינָא: הָכִי אָמְרִינַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא כְּווֹתָיךְ.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Naftali said to Ravina: We say this in the name of Rava, in accordance with your
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yitzchak bar Naftali to Ravina: Thus we say in the name of Rava, "Like your name."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן זִימְרָא: אַלְמָנָה שֶׁשָּׁהֲתָה שְׁתַּיִם וְשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְלֹא תָּבְעָה מְזוֹנוֹת — אִיבְּדָה מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra: A widow who waited two or three years and did not demand sustenance has forfeited sustenance
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra: A widow who waited two or three years and did not demand sustenance - she forfeits her sustenance.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא שְׁתַּיִם — אִיבְּדָה, שָׁלֹשׁ מִיבַּעְיָא?! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בַּעֲנִיָּה, כָּאן בַּעֲשִׁירָה.
human_translation: Now two she forfeited is necessary three not difficult. Here, to a poor woman There, to a rich woman
llm_translation: The Mishnah: "If she drank twice - she is examined, why does she need three examinations?!" It is not difficult: here in poverty, here in wealth.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: כָּאן בִּפְרוּצָה, כָּאן בִּצְנוּעָה.
human_translation: Alternatively, here to an unabashed woman, There, to a modest woman,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ii namei: kan bifrutza, kan bitsnuah." English translation: If so: here in public, here in private.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא לְמַפְרֵעַ, אֲבָל לְהַבָּא יֵשׁ לָהּ.
