human_translation: Rava said: We said only retroactively; However, from onward, she has
llm_translation: Rava said: We only said it for one who acts rebelliously, but for one who comes willingly, she has.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יְתוֹמִים אוֹמְרִים נָתַנְנוּ, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת לֹא נָטַלְתִּי, עַל מִי לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raises a dilemma: orphans say: We gave and she says: I took none, upon whom to bring proof
llm_translation: The question of Rabbi Yochanan: Orphans say "we have given," and she says "I did not take," upon whom is the burden of proof?

hebrew_text: נִכְסֵי בְּחֶזְקַת יַתְמֵי קָיְימִי וְעַל אַלְמָנָה לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה, אוֹ דִלְמָא נִכְסֵי בְּחֶזְקַת אַלְמָנָה קָיְימִי, וְעַל הַיְּתוֹמִים לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה.
human_translation: the property is in the possession of the orphans and upon the widow to bring proof Or, perhaps property is in the widow’s possession and upon the orphans bring proof
llm_translation: Properties in the possession of orphans are established, and regarding a widow to bring proof, or perhaps properties in the possession of a widow are established, and regarding orphans to bring proof.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי לֵוִי: אַלְמָנָה, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁלֹּא נִיסֵּת — עַל הַיְּתוֹמִים לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה. נִיסֵּת — עָלֶיהָ לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה.
human_translation: Come hear that Levi taught: a widow, as long as she has not married upon the orphans to bring proof she married upon her to bring proof
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught by Levi: A widow, as long as she has not been tested—she must provide proof for the orphans. Once she has been tested—it is upon her to provide proof.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי, כְּתַנָּאֵי: מוֹכֶרֶת, וְכוֹתֶבֶת: ״אֵלּוּ לִמְזוֹנוֹת מָכַרְתִּי״ וְ״אֵלּוּ לִכְתוּבָּה מָכַרְתִּי״, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מוֹכֶרֶת וְכוֹתֶבֶת סְתָם, וְכֵן כֹּחָהּ יָפֶה.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: subject to tanna’im sells and writes: These I sold for sustenance and these I sold for marriage contract; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: She sells and writes without specification And so her power is enhanced,
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashei said, as the Tannaim taught: "A woman sells and writes: 'I have sold these for sustenance' and 'I have sold these for a marriage contract,'" the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: "A woman sells and writes generally, and her power is effective."

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר בָּעֵי לְפָרוֹשֵׁי, סָבַר: נִכְסֵי בְּחֶזְקַת יַתְמֵי קָיְימִי, וְעַל הָאַלְמָנָה לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: לָא בָּעֵי לְפָרוֹשֵׁי, נִכְסֵי בְּחֶזְקַת אַלְמָנָה קָיְימִי, וְעַל הַיְּתוֹמִים לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה.
human_translation: What, is it not they disagree with regard to this According to Rabbi Yehuda, who said she is required to specify he holds the property is in the possession of the orphans, and upon the widow to provide proof. And Rabbi Yosei holds she does not need to specify the property is in the widow’s possession, and upon the orphans to provide proof.
llm_translation: What is the reason that he does not argue with this? According to Rabbi Yehuda who says, "He requires for the heirs," he holds: The properties are established in the possession of the orphans, and it is upon the widow to bring proof. And Rabbi Yosei holds: He does not require for the heirs, the properties are established in the possession of the widow, and it is upon the orphans to bring proof.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא נִכְסֵי בְּחֶזְקַת אַלְמָנָה קָיְימִי, וְעַל הַיְּתוֹמִים לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה עֵצָה טוֹבָה קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן — דְּלָא לִיקְרוֹ לַהּ רַעַבְתָנוּתָא.
human_translation: From where Perhaps everyone the property is in the widow’s possession and upon the orphans to provide proof. And Rabbi Yehuda teaches us good advice, so that they will not call her a glutton
llm_translation: From where? Perhaps the entire world is established in the presumption of a widow's property, and concerning orphans to bring proof, and Rabbi Yehuda heard a good advice for us - not to call her a widow.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, הָא דְּבָעֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, תִּפְשׁוֹט לֵיהּ מִמַּתְנִיתִין: מוֹכֶרֶת לִמְזוֹנוֹת שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין, וְכוֹתֶבֶת: ״אֵלּוּ לִמְזוֹנוֹת מָכַרְתִּי״! אֶלָּא מִמַּתְנִיתִין לֵיכָּא לְמִשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, דְּעֵצָה טוֹבָה קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. הָכִי נָמֵי עֵצָה טוֹבָה קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: As, if you do not say so, the dilemma raised Rabbi Yoḥanan, resolve from the mishna sells for sustenance when not in court, and writes: These I sold for sustenance? Rather, cannot be derived from this mishna, as it teaches us only good advice So too, teaches us good advice,
llm_translation: If you do not say so, this is what Rabbi Yochanan requires: We interpret it from the Mishnah: A woman who sells her sustenance without the court, and writes: "I have sold these for sustenance"! Rather, from the Mishnah, we do not learn its essence, for it is considered good advice for us. So too, it is considered good advice for us.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא נִכְסֵי בְּחֶזְקַת יַתְמֵי קָיְימִי, וְהַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — כִּדְאַבָּיֵי קַשִּׁישָׁא. דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי קַשִּׁישָׁא, מָשָׁל דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? לִשְׁכִיב מְרַע שֶׁאָמַר ״תְּנוּ מָאתַיִם זוּז לִפְלוֹנִי בַּעַל חוֹבִי״, רָצָה — בְּחוֹבוֹ נוֹטְלָן, רָצָה — בְּמַתָּנָה נוֹטְלָן.
human_translation: Alternatively, Everyone the property is in the possession of the orphans, and this is the reasoning Rabbi Yosei, as Abaye the Elder, as Abaye the Elder said a parable to Rabbi Yosei: To what is this matter comparable? To on his deathbed who said: Give two hundred dinars to so-and-so, my creditor. he desires, he takes as payment of debt him. desires, he takes as a gift.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Iy namei: dechulei olma nikhsei bechezkat yatmei kayemi, vehainu taama deRabbi Yosei — kidabayei kashisha. De'amar Abbayei kashisha, mashal deRabbi Yosei lema hadavar domeh? Lishkiv mera she'amar 'tenu mataim zuz lifloni baal chovi', ratza — bechovo notlan, ratza — bematana notlan." English translation: "It is true: all the property of the world is considered as belonging to orphans in possession, and this is the reason of Rabbi Yosei — as the elders of Kashisha said. For Kashisha said, what is the parable of Rabbi Yosei similar to? It is like a creditor who said, 'Give two hundred zuz to so-and-so, the debtor,' he can take them as a loan if he wishes, or he can take them as a gift if he wishes."

hebrew_text: אִם בְּמַתָּנָה נוֹטְלָן לֹא כָּךְ יָפֶה כֹּחוֹ.
human_translation: If he takes it as a gift, his power is not enhanced this manner.
llm_translation: If with a gift they take, not so beautiful his strength.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד מוֹכֶרֶת? אָמַר רַבִּי דָּנִיאֵל בַּר רַב קַטִּינָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מוֹכֶרֶת אַחַת לִשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, וְלוֹקֵחַ מְפַרְנֵס אַחַת לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם. וְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: מוֹכֶרֶת לְשִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים, וְלוֹקֵחַ מְפַרְנֵס אַחַת לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: How does sell Rabbi Daniel bar Rav Ketina said Rav Huna said: She sells once every twelve months and the buyer provides once every thirty days. And Rav Yehuda said: She sells every six months and the buyer provides once every thirty days.
llm_translation: How does she sell? Rabbi Daniel son of Rav Katina said in the name of Rav Huna: She sells one slave for twelve months, and the buyer provides sustenance for thirty days. And Rav Yehudah said: She sells for six months, and the buyer provides sustenance for thirty days.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא: מוֹכֶרֶת לִשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, וְלוֹקֵחַ מְפַרְנֵס אַחַת לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם. תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: מוֹכֶרֶת לְשִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים, וְלוֹקֵחַ מְפַרְנֵס אַחַת לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with Rav Huna: She sells every twelve months, and the buyer provides once every thirty days. is taught in accordance with Rav Yehuda: She sells every six months, and the buyer provides once every thirty days.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Huna: A woman sells her marital rights for twelve months, and the man provides her sustenance for thirty days. It was taught in the school of Rav Yehudah: A woman sells her marital rights for six months, and the man provides her sustenance for thirty days.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר, הִלְכְתָא: מוֹכֶרֶת לְשִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים וְלוֹקֵחַ מְפַרְנֵס אַחַת לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר: דְּרַב הוּנָא מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי, כְּלוֹמַר: לָא סְבִירָא לִי.
human_translation: Ameimar said: The halakha she sells every six months and the buyer provides once every thirty days, Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: What of Rav Huna? He said to him: I did not hear that is to say, I do not hold
llm_translation: Amemar said, a halacha: a seller has six months to deliver, and a buyer has thirty days to inspect. Rav Ashe said to Amemar: What about Rav Huna's opinion? He said to him: I did not hear, meaning, I do not agree.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מוֹכֶרֶת לִמְזוֹנוֹת, מַהוּ שֶׁתַּחֲזוֹר וְתִטְרוֹף לִכְתוּבָּה?
human_translation: raised a dilemma to Rav Sheshet: sells for sustenance, what is Can she return and seize for marriage contract?
llm_translation: From his teacher Rav Sheshet: If she sells for sustenance, what if she goes back and tears it up for a written document?

hebrew_text: קָמִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ בִּדְרַב יוֹסֵף. דְּאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אַרְמַלְתָּא דְּזַבֵּין — אַחְרָיוּת אַיַּתְמֵי, וּבֵי דִינָא דְּזַבֵּין — אַחְרָיוּת אַיַּתְמֵי. מַאי?
human_translation: They raised this dilemma in by Rav Yosef, as Rav Yosef said: a widow who sold the guarantee upon the orphans. And a court that sold the guarantee upon the orphans. What
llm_translation: He came to them with Rav Yosef. For Rav Yosef said: The wool of those who dye - their aftergrowth is consumed, and in the court of those who dye - their aftergrowth is consumed. What is the reason?

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּאַחְרָיוּת אַיַּתְמֵי, טָרְפָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא מָצֵי אָמְרִי לַהּ: נְהִי דְּאַחְרָיוּת דְּעָלְמָא לָא קַבֵּילְתְּ עִילָּוָךְ, אַחְרָיוּת דְּנַפְשָׁךְ מִי לָא קַבּוֹלֵי קַבֵּילְתְּ?
human_translation: since the guarantee on the orphans, she seize Or perhaps are able to say to her: Granted, you did not accept upon yourself guarantee for everyone, did you not accept a guarantee your own
llm_translation: Since after him you are waiting, it is a trefah, or perhaps you might say to it: "Even though the afterlife of the world did not accept your ascension, will the afterlife of your soul not accept it?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: מוֹכֶרֶת וְהוֹלֶכֶת עַד כְּדֵי כְתוּבָּתָהּ, וְסֶמֶךְ לָהּ שֶׁתִּגְבֶּה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מִן הַשְּׁאָר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: שַׁיַּירָא — אִין, לָא שַׁיַּירָא — לָא.
human_translation: said to You learned sells she continues until the value of her marriage contract, and she relies upon that she will collect her marriage contract from the remainder Learn from this she left yes, she did not leave no,
llm_translation: He said to him, "Give it to her: a seller who goes until the time of her writing, and rely on her that she will collect her writing from the rest. Learn from it: if she leaves - no, if she does not leave - no."

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא עֵצָה טוֹבָה קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּלָא לִיקְרוֹ לַהּ הַדְרָנִיתָא. אִם כֵּן, לִיתְנֵי: ״גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מִן הַשְּׁאָר״, מַאי ״סֶמֶךְ לָהּ״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: שַׁיַּירָא — אִין, לָא שַׁיַּירָא — לָא.
human_translation: But perhaps teaches us good advice, so that they will not call her a retractor If so, let it teach: She collects her marriage contract from the remainder. What She relies? Learn from she left yes, she did not leave over, no,
llm_translation: And perhaps a good advice is implied to us, that she should not be called the Hadranita. If so, let it teach: "Her height is written differently from the rest," what is "leaning on her"? Learn from it: if she remains - yes, if she does not remain - no.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: זַבֵּין וְלָא אִיצְטְרִיכוּ לֵיהּ זוּזֵי, הָדְרִי זְבִינֵי, אוֹ לָא הָדְרִי זְבִינֵי?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before sold and he did not need the money the sale is reversed? Or, is the sale not reversed
llm_translation: He asked them: If merchants did not need coins, should they return the merchandise, or should they not return the merchandise?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּזַבֵּין אַרְעָא לְרַב פָּפָּא, דְּאִצְטְרִיכוּ לֵיהּ זוּזֵי לְמִיזְבַּן תּוֹרֵי. לְסוֹף לָא אִיצְטְרִיכוּ לֵיהּ, וְאַהְדְּרַיהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַרְעֵיהּ. רַב פָּפָּא לִפְנִים מִשּׁוּרַת הַדִּין הוּא דַּעֲבַד.
human_translation: Come hear a certain man who sold land to Rav Pappa because he needed money to buy oxen. In the end, he did not need and Rav Pappa returned his land to him. Rav Pappa acted beyond the letter of the law.
llm_translation: Come and hear: There was a certain man who sold land to Rav Pappa, and he required payment in coins to buy Torah scrolls. In the end, he did not require payment, and Rav Pappa returned the land to him. Rav Pappa acted beyond the letter of the law.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּהָהוּא בִּצּוּרְתָּא דַּהֲוָת בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא, זַבְּנִינְהוּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לְאַפַּדְנַיְיהוּ, לְסוֹף אֲתוֹ חִיטֵּי. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב נַחְמָן: דִּינָא הוּא דְּהָדְרִי אַפַּדְנֵי לְמָרַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Come hear was a certain drought in Neharde’a everyone sold his mansion [ appadna ] In the end, wheat arrived, Rav Naḥman said to them: The halakha is that the mansions are returned to their owners.
llm_translation: Come and hear: There was a certain incident in the town of Nahardea, where they built all the walls to fortify them, until they reached the wheat. Rav Nachman said to them: It is the law that you should fortify for your Master.

hebrew_text: הָתָם נָמֵי: זְבִינֵי בְּטָעוּת הֲווֹ, דְּאִיגַּלַּאי מִילְּתָא דְּאַרְבָּא בְּעִקּוּלֵי הֲוָה קָיְימָא.
human_translation: There too, the sale was in error, as it became known that the ship was in the bays of the river
llm_translation: There, it was stated: The merchants in the market were mistaken, for the matter of the fourth year produce was standing on the scales.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ רָמֵי בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב נַחְמָן: אִם כֵּן נִמְצֵאתָ מַכְשִׁילָן לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַטּוּ כׇּל יוֹמָא בִּצּוּרְתָּא שְׁכִיחָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, בִּצּוּרְתָּא בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא מִשְׁכָּח שְׁכִיחָא.
human_translation: If so, this is what Rami bar Shmuel said to Rav Naḥman If so, you find yourself obstructing them for the future. said to him: Is that to say common, a drought every day? He said to him: Yes, in Neharde’a drought is a frequent
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, this is what Ramei son of Shmuel said to Rav Nachman: If that's the case, you are causing us to stumble in the future! He said to him: Is it common every day in Tzurta? He said to him: No, in Tzurta it is not common, in Nehardea it is common.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא: זַבֵּין וְלָא אִיצְטְרִיכוּ לֵיהּ זוּזֵי — הָדְרִי זְבִינֵי.
human_translation: And the halakha is sold and did not need the money the sale is reversed.
llm_translation: The Halakha: If merchants did not need his coins - return the coins.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַלְמָנָה, בֵּין מִן הָאֵירוּסִין בֵּין מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין — מוֹכֶרֶת שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: A widow, whether from betrothal or from marriage, sells when not in court.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A widow, whether from betrothal or from marriage, may sell without the authorization of the court.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין מוֹכֶרֶת שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין, מִן הָאֵירוּסִין לֹא תִּמְכּוֹר אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת. וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת — לֹא תִּמְכּוֹר אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: from marriage sells when not in court, from betrothal may sell only in court, because she does not receive sustenance and anyone who does not receive sustenance may sell only in court.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: A widow may sell property without approval of the court, but a betrothed woman may only sell property with approval of the court, because she has no sustenance. And anyone who has no sustenance - may only sell property with approval of the court.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין — מִשּׁוּם מְזוֹנֵי,
human_translation: Granted, from marriage due to her sustenance
llm_translation: Gemara: "G'ma' bishlama min hanis'u'in - mishum mezonai."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִן הָאֵירוּסִין מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר עוּלָּא: מִשּׁוּם חִינָּא. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אָדָם רוֹצֶה שֶׁתִּתְבַּזֶּה אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: However, what is the reason from betrothal Ulla said: Due to desirability. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Because a man does not want his wife to be disgraced in court
llm_translation: Rather, from the betrothal. What is the reason? Ulla said: Because of modesty. Rabbi Yohanan said: Because a man does not want his wife to be disgraced in court.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ גְּרוּשָׁה. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם חִינָּא — גְּרוּשָׁה נָמֵי בָּעֲיָא חֵן, לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אָדָם רוֹצֶה שֶׁתִּתְבַּזֶּה אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּבֵית דִּין — גְּרוּשָׁה לָא אִיכְפַּת לֵיהּ.
human_translation: What is between between them a divorcée. According to the one who says due to desirability, a divorcée also requires desirability. according to the one who says because a man does not want his wife to be disgraced in court, does not care ex-wife
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in the case of divorce. According to the one who says it is due to grace - a divorced woman also requires grace. According to the one who says because a man does not want his wife to be disgraced in court - divorce is not of concern to him.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: וּגְרוּשָׁה לֹא תִּמְכּוֹר אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אָדָם רוֹצֶה שֶׁתִּתְבַּזֶּה אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּבֵית דִּין — גְּרוּשָׁה לָא אִיכְפַּת לֵיהּ. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם חִינָּא, גְּרוּשָׁה נָמֵי בָּעֲיָא חֵן!
human_translation: We learned And a divorcée may sell only in court. Granted, according to the one who says because a man does not want his wife to be disgraced in court, he does not care ex-wife However, according to the one who says due to desirability, a divorcée also requires desirability,
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: "And a divorced woman may only be sold through a court." Granted, according to the one who says that a man does not want his wife to be disgraced in court, a divorced woman is of no concern to him. But according to the one who says it is out of grace, a divorced woman also requires favor!

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא.
human_translation: whose is this It is Rabbi Shimon
llm_translation: This is the translation: "This is a dispute — Rabbi Shimon says."

hebrew_text: אִי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ רֵישָׁא: מִן הָאֵירוּסִין לֹא תִּמְכּוֹר כּוּ׳?
human_translation: If Rabbi Shimon, it taught in the first clause from betrothal sells
llm_translation: If Rabbi Shimon, the one who taught the beginning, said: "From the non-Jews, do not sell it?"

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אַלְמָנָה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין הוּא דְּלָא נְפִישׁ חֵן דִּידַהּ, אֲבָל גְּרוּשָׁה דִּנְפִישׁ חֵן דִּידַהּ, אֵימָא תִּיבְּעֵי חֵן.
human_translation: lest you say: a widow from betrothal, she is not great her desirability, however, a divorcée, who is great her desirability say requires desirability
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? That a widow from the betrothed ones, it is that she does not have our favor, but a divorced woman who has our favor, say she may seek favor.

hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: ״כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת״. לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לָאו לְאֵתוֹיֵי גְּרוּשָׁה?
human_translation: we learn also And anyone who does not receive sustenance to add what? it not to add divorcée
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches: "Any woman who does not have sustenance." What does this come to include? Is it not to include a divorcee?

hebrew_text: לָא, לְאֵתוֹיֵי ״מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת וְאֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת״ — כִּדְרַבִּי זֵירָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאָמְרוּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת וְאֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת — בַּעַל חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: No, to include she is divorced or she is not divorced, and it is in accordance with Rabbi Zeira, as Rabbi Zeira said: Wherever it was said: she is divorced or she is not divorced, husband is obligated her sustenance
llm_translation: Not to, for the purpose of "divorced and not divorced" - like Rabbi Zeira. For Rabbi Zeira said: Any place where they said "divorced and not divorced" - the husband is obligated in her sustenance.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמּוֹכֶרֶת שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין, כָּךְ יוֹרְשֶׁיהָ יוֹרְשֵׁי כְתוּבָּתָהּ מוֹכְרִים שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אָדָם רוֹצֶה שֶׁתִּתְבַּזֶּה אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּבֵית דִּין, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאִיהִי לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּתִתְבַּזֵּי — יוֹרְשֶׁיהָ נָמֵי לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלִיבַּזּוּ, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם חִינָּא, יוֹרְשֶׁיהָ מַאי חֵן אִיכָּא? תַּרְגְּמַהּ עוּלָּא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁיְּרָשַׁתָּה בִּתָּהּ אוֹ אֲחוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: Come hear Just as sells when not in court, so too, her heirs, inherit her marriage contract, sell when not in court. Granted, according to the one who says because a man does not want his wife to be disgraced in court, just as he is not amenable that she will be disgraced, he also is not amenable that her heirs will be disgraced. However, according to the one who says due to desirability, what desirability do her heirs have? Ulla interpreted it: for example, her daughter or her sister inherited her,
llm_translation: Come and hear: Just as a woman may sell her property without the involvement of a court, so too her heirs may sell it without the involvement of a court. Now, according to the one who says that since a man does not want his wife to be disgraced in court, for it is not pleasant for him that she be disgraced, her heirs also do not want her to be disgraced, but according to the one who says it is out of grace, what grace is there for her heirs? The above translation: For example, if her daughter or her sister inherited it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָכְרָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ אוֹ מִקְצָתָהּ, מִשְׁכְּנָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ אוֹ מִקְצָתָהּ, נָתְנָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ לְאַחֵר אוֹ מִקְצָתָהּ — לֹא תִּמְכּוֹר אֶת הַשְּׁאָר אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מוֹכֶרֶת הִיא אֲפִילּוּ אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה פְּעָמִים. וּמוֹכֶרֶת לִמְזוֹנוֹת שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין, וְכוֹתֶבֶת ״לִמְזוֹנוֹת מָכַרְתִּי״. וּגְרוּשָׁה לֹא תִּמְכּוֹר אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: sold all or part of her marriage contract, she mortgaged all or part of her marriage contract, she gave all or part of her marriage contract to another, she sells the remainder only in court. And the Rabbis say: She sells even four or five times, And sells for sustenance when not in court, and she writes I sold for sustenance. And a divorcée, sells only in court.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If she sold her document or part of it, her dwelling or part of it, or gave her document to another or part of it, she may not sell the remainder except through a court. And the Sages say: She may sell it even four or five times. And she may sell it for sustenance without going through a court, and she writes, "I have sold it for sustenance." And a divorced woman may only sell through a court.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: מָכְרָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, מִשְׁכְּנָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, עָשְׂתָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ אַפּוֹתֵיקֵי לְאַחֵר — אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא מָכְרָה וְלֹא מִשְׁכְּנָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ אֶלָּא מַחֲצִיתָהּ — אִבְּדָה מְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: Whose mishna? It is Rabbi Shimon, as it is taught she sold her marriage contract, mortgaged her marriage contract, she made her marriage contract designated repayment to another, she does not sustenance the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Shimon says: Although she has not sold or mortgaged her marriage contract, but only half of it, she has lost her sustenance.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara matnitin mani? Rabbi Shimon hi. Detanya: Makra k'tuvatah, mishkenah k'tuvatah, asatah k'tuvatah apoteikei le'acher - ein lah mezonot, divrei Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Shimon omer: Af al pi shelo makra velo mishkenah k'tuvatah ela machatzitah - ibedah mezonoteha. English translation: Gemara, from which Mishnah? It is Rabbi Shimon's. As it was taught: If she sold her written document, or her dwelling written document, or she made her written document into apothecary jars for others - she has no sustenance, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Shimon says: Even though she did not sell it, and did not use it as collateral, but only divided it - she loses her sustenance.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר דְּלָא אָמְרִינַן מִקְצָת כֶּסֶף כְּכׇל כֶּסֶף, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי אָמְרִינַן מִקְצָת כֶּסֶף כְּכׇל כֶּסֶף?
human_translation: Is this to say that Rabbi Shimon holds that we do not say part of the money like the entire money? and the Rabbis hold that we say part of the money is like the entire money.
llm_translation: In the matter of Rabbi Shimon, he holds that we do not say "some silver is like all silver," and the Rabbis hold that we do say "some silver is like all silver"?

hebrew_text: הָא אִיפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לְהוּ! דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְהוּא אִשָּׁה בִּבְתוּלֶיהָ״ — פְּרָט לְבוֹגֶרֶת שֶׁכָּלוּ בְּתוּלֶיהָ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַכְשִׁירִין בְּבוֹגֶרֶת.
human_translation: we hear them say the opposite? As it is taught “And he a wife in her virginity,” to exclude a grown woman whose virginity has diminished the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon declare as fit even a grown woman
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: "We have learned the opposite! For it was taught: 'And she is a woman in her virginity' - excluding a matured young woman who is still in her virginity, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon permit marriage with a matured young woman."

hebrew_text: הָתָם בִּקְרָאֵי פְּלִיגִי. רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: ״בְּתוּלָה״ — אֲפִילּוּ מִקְצָת בְּתוּלִים. ״בְּתוּלֶיהָ״ — עַד דְּאִיכָּא כּוּלְּהוּ בְּתוּלִים. ״בִּבְתוּלֶיהָ״, בִּכְדַרְכָּהּ — אִין, שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ — לָא.
human_translation: There they disagree verses. Rabbi Meir holds a virgin, even if part virginity, “Her virginity,” until there is virginity in its entirety. “in her virginity” in the typical manner, yes, sexual intercourse in an atypical manner, not
llm_translation: There, in the verses they dispute. Rabbi Meir holds: "in her virginity" - even some virgins. "in her virgins" - until all are virgins. "in her virgins," in her usual way - yes, not in her usual way - no.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבְרִי: ״בְּתוּלָה״ — שְׁלֵמָה מַשְׁמַע, ״בְּתוּלֶיהָ״ — אֲפִילּוּ מִקְצָת בְּתוּלִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon hold virgin implies a complete virgin, “Her virginity,” even if part of virginity,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon hold: "Betulah" - complete virginity implies, "Betuleha" - even some virgins.

hebrew_text: ״בִּבְתוּלֶיהָ״ — שֶׁיְּהוּ כׇּל בְּתוּלֶיהָ קָיְימִין, בֵּין בִּכְדַרְכָּהּ בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ.
human_translation: “in her virginity,” that her virginity should be fully intact, whether in the typical manner or through atypical
llm_translation: "Bi'vtuleha" - that all her virginities are intact, whether in her usual manner or not in her usual manner.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דִּתְפַסָה כָּסָא דְכַסְפָּא בִּכְתוּבְּתַהּ, קָתָבְעָה מְזוֹנֵי. אֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ לְיַתְמֵי: זִילוּ הַבוּ לַהּ מְזוֹנוֹת, לֵית דְּחָשׁ לְהָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר: לָא אָמְרִינַן מִקְצָת כֶּסֶף כְּכׇל כֶּסֶף.
human_translation: a certain woman who seized a silver cup her marriage contract demanded sustenance. She came before Rava He said to the orphans: Go and give her sustenance, none who are concerned about the of Rabbi Shimon, who said we do not say that part of the money like the entire money.
llm_translation: That woman who found a silver cup in her possession, she established sustenance. She came before Rava. He said to them: Go bring her sustenance, there is no concern for that which Rabbi Shimon said: We do not say some money is like all money.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב יוֹסֵף: מוֹכֶרֶת שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין צְרִיכָה שְׁבוּעָה, אוֹ אֵין צְרִיכָה שְׁבוּעָה? וְתִבְּעֵי לָךְ הַכְרָזָה?!
human_translation: Rabba, son of Rava, sent to Rav Yosef: sells when not in court need an oath or does she not need an oath? But you should have raised the dilemma a public announcement
llm_translation: Send to him Rabba son of Rava to Rav Yosef: A seller not in court needs an oath, or not needs an oath? And she demands of you a proclamation?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַכְרָזָה לָא קָמִיבַּעְיָא לִי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אַלְמָנָה שֶׁשָּׁמָה לְעַצְמָהּ — לֹא עָשְׂתָה וְלֹא כְּלוּם.
human_translation: He said to him I am not raising the dilemma a public announcement, as Rabbi Zeira said Rav Naḥman said: A widow who assessed for herself has accomplished nothing.
llm_translation: He said to him: The proclamation is not necessary for me, as Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav Nachman: A widow who remains by herself - she did not do anything and nothing.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאַכְרוּז — אַמַּאי לֹא עָשְׂתָה וְלֹא כְּלוּם? אֶלָּא לָאו, דְּלָא אַכְרוּז, וּלְעַצְמָהּ הוּא דְּלֹא עָשְׂתָה וְלֹא כְּלוּם, הָא לְאַחֵר — מַה שֶּׁעָשְׂתָה עָשְׂתָה.
human_translation: what are the circumstances If they publicly announced why she has accomplished nothing? Rather, is it not that no public announcement was made; and for herself, she has accomplished nothing, to someone else, her action is effective,
llm_translation: "How are the cases similar? If it is due to a proclamation - why did she not do anything and not complete it? Rather, it is not that she made a proclamation, but it is by itself that she did not do anything and did not complete it, so that another woman - whatever she did, she did."

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּאַכְרוּז, וּדְאָמְרִי לַהּ: מַאן שָׁם לִיךְ?
human_translation: Actually, where they made a public announcement and where they said to her: Who assessed for you?
llm_translation: Forever, they proclaimed, and they said to her: "Who placed you here?"

hebrew_text: כִּי הַאי דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאַפְקִידוּ גַּבֵּיהּ כִּיסְתָּא דְיַתְמֵי. אֲזַל, שָׁמַהּ לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּאַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי. אִיַּיקַּר קָם בְּשֵׁית מְאָה.
human_translation: is similar to this of a certain man with whom had deposited coral belonging to orphans. He went assessed for himself at four hundred dinars appreciated stood six hundred dinars.
llm_translation: This man who entrusted his purse to another, went, and there he found for himself four hundred coins. The owner came and claimed six hundred.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן שָׁם לָךְ?
human_translation: He came before Rabbi Ammi said to him: Who assessed this for you?
llm_translation: He came before Rabbi Ammi. He said to him: Who placed you here?

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא: צְרִיכָה שְׁבוּעָה וְאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הַכְרָזָה.
human_translation: And the halakha she is required an oath, but she is not required a public announcement.
llm_translation: The Halacha: It requires an oath and it does not require a public announcement.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַלְמָנָה שֶׁהָיְתָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מָאתַיִם, וּמָכְרָה שָׁוֶה מָנֶה בְּמָאתַיִם, אוֹ שָׁוֶה מָאתַיִם בְּמָנֶה — נִתְקַבְּלָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: a widow whose marriage contract was two hundred and she sold worth one hundred dinars for two hundred or worth two hundred for one hundred dinars, she has received her marriage contract
llm_translation: It was taught: If a widow whose marriage contract was for two hundred zuz, and she sold property worth a hundred zuz for two hundred zuz, or property worth two hundred zuz for a hundred zuz — her marriage contract is accepted.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מָנֶה, וּמָכְרָה שָׁוֶה מָנֶה וְדִינָר בְּמָנֶה — מִכְרָהּ בָּטֵל. אֲפִילּוּ הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת אַחְזִיר דִּינָר לַיּוֹרְשִׁין — מָכְרָה בָּטֵל.
human_translation: her marriage contract was one hundred dinars and she sold worth one hundred dinars and a dinar for one hundred dinars, the sale is void Even she says: I will return dinar to the heirs, sale is void.
llm_translation: Its writing was a Maneh, and she sold it for a Maneh and a Dinar in a Maneh - her sale is nullified. Even if she says, "I will return a Dinar to the heirs" - her sale is nullified.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם מִכְרָהּ קַיָּים, עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא שָׁם כְּדֵי שֶׁתְּשַׁיֵּיר בְּשָׂדֶה — בַּת תִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין, וּבְגִנָּה — בַּת חֲצִי קַב, וּכְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — בֵּית רוֹבַע.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Actually, the sale is valid. until there is there would have remained in the field an area required for sowing nine kav of seed, And a garden, an area required for sowing a half- kav of seed, Or, according to the statement of Rabbi Akiva, an area required for sowing a quarter- kav of seed.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Always its sale is valid, until there is there the amount that will remain in the field - in a field: the daughter of nine kav, and in a garden: the daughter of half a kav, and according to the words of Rabbi Akiva - a quarter of a house.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת זוּז וּמָכְרָה לָזֶה בְּמָנֶה, וְלָזֶה בְּמָנֶה, וְלָאַחֲרוֹן יָפֶה מָנֶה וְדִינָר בְּמָנֶה — שֶׁל אַחֲרוֹן בָּטֵל, וְשֶׁל כּוּלָּן מִכְרָן קַיָּים.
human_translation: her marriage contract was four hundred dinars, and she sold to this for one hundred dinars, and to that for one hundred dinars, and to the last one worth one hundred dinars and a dinar for one hundred dinars, of the last is void, And all of the others, their sale is valid,
llm_translation: The text reads: Its writing was four hundred zuz, and she sold it to this one for a mana, and to that one for a mana, and to the last one for a beautiful mana and a dinar for a mana - the last one's is nullified, and all of theirs sales are valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא שָׁוֶה מָאתַיִם בְּמָנֶה — דְּאָמְרִי לַהּ: אַתְּ אַפְסֵדְתְּ, שָׁוֶה מָנֶה בְּמָאתַיִם נָמֵי, תֵּימָא: אֲנָא אַרְוַוחְנָא!
human_translation: What is different worth two hundred for one hundred dinars, as say to her: You lose out worth one hundred dinars for two hundred also say I profited
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the difference between "shaveh maneh" of two hundred? - For they say to it: "You have lost, shaveh maneh is also two hundred." Alternatively, one might say: "I will explain!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ:
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said:
llm_translation: Said Rav Nachman said Rabba bar Avuh:

hebrew_text: כָּאן שָׁנָה רַבִּי, הַכֹּל לְבַעַל הַמָּעוֹת, כִּדְתַנְיָא: הוֹסִיפוּ לוֹ אַחַת יְתֵירָה, הַכֹּל לַשָּׁלִיחַ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: חוֹלְקִין.
human_translation: Here Rabbi taught, everything to the owner of the money. as it is taught they added for him one extra the entire to the agent; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: split
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: Here, Rabbi changed the ruling, everything belongs to the owner of the coins, as it was taught: If they added one more coin for him, everything belongs to the agent, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: They divide it.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הַכֹּל לְבַעַל הַמָּעוֹת! אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא. כָּאן בְּדָבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ קִצְבָה, כָּאן בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ קִצְבָה.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei says: Everything to the owner of the money? Rami bar Ḥama said: not difficult. Here an item that has a fixed there, an item that does not have a fixed
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught, Rabbi Yosei says: Everything belongs to the owner of the money! Ramei bar Hama said: It is not difficult. Here in a matter that has a fixed time, here in a matter that does not have a fixed time.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הִלְכְתָא: דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ קִצְבָה — חוֹלְקִין, דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ קִצְבָה — הַכֹּל לְבַעַל הַמָּעוֹת. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? שִׁינּוּיָא דְּשַׁנִּינַן שִׁינּוּיָא הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: The halakha an item that has a fixed is split, an item that does not have a fixed the entire to the owner of the money. What is he teaching us the answer that we taught is the answer,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, a halacha: a matter that has a set time - they divide, a matter that does not have a set time - all goes to the owner of the money. What does this teach us? A change of possession is a change of possession.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זַבֵּין לִי לִיתְכָּא, וַאֲזַל וְזַבֵּין לֵיהּ כּוֹרָא, מַאי? מוֹסִיף עַל דְּבָרָיו הוּא, וְלִיתְכָּא מִיהָא קָנֵי, אוֹ דִלְמָא מַעֲבִיר עַל דְּבָרָיו הוּא, וְלִיתְכָּא נָמֵי לָא קָנֵי?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before one said to Sell my a half- kor , and went and sold for him a kor , what he adding to the words at least acquired a half- kor . Or perhaps he is disregarding his words, and even the half- kor is not acquired
llm_translation: He asked them, he said to him: "Sell me a barrel of wine, and he went and sold him a beam. What? He adds to his words, and does he acquire the wine from it, or perhaps he overrides his words, and he also does not acquire the wine?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יַעֲקֹב מִנְּהַר פְּקוֹד מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמַר בַּעַל הַבַּיִת לִשְׁלוּחוֹ: ״תֵּן לָהֶן חֲתִיכָה לָאוֹרְחִין״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״טְלוּ שְׁתַּיִם״, וְהֵן נָטְלוּ שָׁלֹשׁ — כּוּלָּן מָעֲלוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ya’akov of Pekod River said in the name of Ravina: Come hear the host said to his agent: Give the guests a piece and said Take two and they took three, they are all guilty of misusing consecrated property.
llm_translation: Rav Yaakov from Nehar Pekod, in the name of Ravina, said: Come and hear. The master of the house said to his messenger, "Give them a piece for the guests." But he said, "Take two," and they took three - all of them ascended.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא מוֹסִיף עַל דְּבָרָיו הָוֵי — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי בַּעַל הַבַּיִת מָעַל. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ מַעֲבִיר עַל דְּבָרָיו הָוֵי — בַּעַל הַבַּיִת אַמַּאי מָעַל? וְהָתְנַן: הַשָּׁלִיחַ שֶׁעָשָׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ — בַּעַל הַבַּיִת מָעַל, לֹא עָשָׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ — שָׁלִיחַ מָעַל!
human_translation: Granted, if you say is adding to the words due to that the host is guilty of misusing consecrated property. However, if you say is disregarding the words why the host guilty of misusing consecrated property? Didn’t we learn an agent who performed his agency the host is guilty of misusing consecrated property; did not perform his agency, the agent is guilty of the misuse
llm_translation: If you say that when one adds to his words, he is considered as if he has transgressed, why then does the homeowner transgress? Rather, if you say that when one overlooks his words, he is considered as if he has transgressed, why then does the homeowner transgress? And we learned in a Mishnah: If the agent performed his mission, the homeowner transgresses; if the agent did not perform his mission, the agent transgresses!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, דְּאָמַר לְהוּ: ״טְלוּ אַחַת מִדַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, וְאַחַת מִדַּעְתִּי״, וּשְׁקַלוּ אִינְהוּ תְּלָת.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where said to Take one with the consent of the host, and one with my consent, and they took three
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? That he said to them: "Take one from the knowledge of the homeowner, and one from my knowledge," and they weighed three.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָיְתָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מָנֶה, וּמָכְרָה שָׁוֶה מָנֶה וְדִינָר בְּמָנֶה — מִכְרָהּ בָּטֵל.
human_translation: Come hear her marriage contract was one hundred dinars, and she sold worth one hundred dinars and a dinar for one hundred dinars, the sale is void.
llm_translation: Come and hear: If its writing was a Maneh, and she sold it for a Maneh and a Dinar in Maneh - her sale is void.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו דְּזַבֵּין שָׁוֶה מָנֶה וְדִינָר בְּמָנֶה וְדִינָר, וּמַאי ״בְּמָנֶה״ — מָנֶה שֶׁלָּהּ. וּמַאי ״אֲפִילּוּ״? אֲפִילּוּ הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת ״אַחְזִיר אֶת הַדִּינָר לַיּוֹרְשִׁים בְּדִינָר מְקַרְקְעֵי״, וְקָתָנֵי: מִכְרָהּ בָּטֵל.
human_translation: What, is it not that she sold worth one hundred dinars and a dinar for one hundred dinars and a dinar, And what for one hundred dinars? one hundred dinars her And what Even even if she says: I will return the dinar to the heirs by a dinar’s from my land, And teaches sale is void,
llm_translation: What is the reason that one who sells a Maneh for a Dinar and a Dinar for a Maneh, and what is "for a Maneh" - a Maneh of hers. And what is "even"? Even if she says, "I will return the Dinar to the heirs in Dinar of real estate," and it teaches: her sale is nullified.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נָתָן: לָא, בִּדְאוֹזֵיל.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, said: No, where she reduced
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, said: No, in Dauzil.

hebrew_text: הָא מִדְּסֵיפָא בִּדְאוֹזֵיל הָוֵי, רֵישָׁא בִּדְלָא אוֹזֵיל, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: הָיְתָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת זוּז, מָכְרָה לָזֶה בְּמָנֶה וְלָזֶה בְּמָנֶה, וְלָאַחֲרוֹן יָפֶה מָנֶה וְדִינָר בְּמָנֶה — שֶׁל אַחֲרוֹן מִכְרָהּ בָּטֵל, וְשֶׁל כּוּלָּן מִכְרָן קַיָּים!
human_translation: Since the last clause where she reduced the first clause is where she did not reduce As it teaches the last clause her marriage contract was four hundred dinars she sold to this for one hundred dinars, and to that for one hundred dinars, and to the last one worth one hundred dinars and a dinar for one hundred dinars, the of the last is void. And all of the others, their sale is valid
llm_translation: The Gemara concludes: in the latter case, if he went out, it is valid; in the former case, if he did not go out, for it was taught in the latter clause: if its value was four hundred zuz, she sold it to this one for a maneh and to that one for a maneh, and to the last one for a maneh and a dinar for a maneh - the sale by the last one annuls it, but the sale by all of them is valid!

hebrew_text: לָא, רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא בִּדְאוֹזֵיל, וְסֵיפָא הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: טַעְמָא דְּאוֹזֵיל בִּדְיַתְמֵי, אֲבָל בְּדִידַהּ — מִכְרָהּ קַיָּים.
human_translation: No, first and the last clauses where she reduced And the last clause teaches us this: The reason she reduced with of the orphans in her own her sale is valid.
llm_translation: Not, beginning and end in D'ozil, and end this indicates to us: the reason of D'ozil in its own, but in its own — its sale is valid.

hebrew_text: הָא מִדְּרֵישָׁא שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ: הָיְתָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מָאתַיִם, וּמָכְרָה שָׁוֶה מָנֶה בְּמָאתַיִם, אוֹ שָׁוֶה מָאתַיִם בְּמָנֶה — נִתְקַבְּלָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: concluded from the first clause a widow whose marriage contract was two hundred and she sold worth one hundred dinars for two hundred or worth two hundred for one hundred dinars, she has received her marriage contract
llm_translation: The first teaching: You heard its type: If its writing was two hundred, and she sold a Maneh for two hundred, or she sold two hundred for a Maneh - its writing is accepted.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָתָם הוּא דְּאִיסְתַּלַּקָא לַהּ מֵהַאי בֵּיתָא לִגְמָרֵי, אֲבָל הָכָא נִיגְזוֹר מָנֶה רִאשׁוֹן אַטּוּ מָנֶה אַחֲרוֹן — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Lest you say: There, she has left this house entirely, however, here, decree first one hundred dinars due to the last one hundred dinars. teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reason: There, he was completely absorbed in studying from this house, but here, the first portion was cut off, then the latter portion - it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: הָא לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ הֵיכָא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״זִיל זַבֵּין לִי לִיתְכָּא וְזַבֵּין לֵיהּ כּוֹרָא״, דְּוַדַּאי מוֹסִיף עַל דְּבָרָיו הָוֵי.
human_translation: And there are who say: Don’t raise this dilemma where said to Go sell my a half- kor , and sold for him a kor , as he was certainly adding to the words,
llm_translation: And there are those who say: This is not necessary for you, where he said to him, "Go slaughter for me a lamb, and slaughter for him a ram," for surely adding to his words is fitting.

hebrew_text: כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״זִיל זַבֵּין לִי כּוֹרָא״ וַאֲזַל וְזַבֵּין לֵיהּ לִיתְכָּא, מַאי? מִי אָמְרִינַן אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּטָבָא לָךְ עֲבַדִי לָךְ, דְּאִי לָא מִצְטָרְכִי לָךְ זוּזֵי, לָא מָצֵית הָדְרַתְּ בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Where you raise the dilemma which said to Go sell my a kor , and he went and sold for him a half kor . What Do we say say to I did what is good for you because if you do not need the money you will not be able to reverse
llm_translation: When you want to argue with him, for he said to him: "Go slaughter a korah for me," and he went and slaughtered it for him, it was found to be blemished. What is the ruling? Who said to him: "Do good for yourself, do it for yourself, for if you do not need its money, you have not lost anything."

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא נִיחָא לִי דְּלִיפֻּשׁוּ שְׁטָרֵי עִילָּוַאי.
human_translation: Or perhaps say to I am not amenable that will increase the bills I
llm_translation: Or perhaps he said to him: "It is not pleasing to me that the documents of the upper chambers be spread out."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִסּוּרָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: נָתַן לוֹ דִּינָר שֶׁל זָהָב וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״הָבֵא לִי חָלוּק״, וְהָלַךְ וְהֵבִיא לוֹ בְּשָׁלֹשׁ חָלוּק וּבְשָׁלֹשׁ טַלִּית — שְׁנֵיהֶם מָעֲלוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina of Sura said: Come hear one gave a gold dinar, and said to him: Get me a robe. And he went and brought him a robe that three and a cloak that three both are guilty of misusing consecrated property.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina from Sepphoris said: Come and hear: He gave him a gold dinar and said to him, "Bring me a portion." And he went and brought him three portions and three cloths - both of them are liable.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא: שְׁלִיחַ כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ, וּמוֹסִיף עַל דְּבָרָיו הָוֵי — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי בַּעַל הַבַּיִת מָעַל, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ: מַעֲבִיר עַל דְּבָרָיו הָוֵי — אַמַּאי מָעַל?
human_translation: Granted, if you say agent in a case like this performing his agency, and he was adding to the words due to that the homeowner is guilty of misusing consecrated property. However, if you say disregarding the words why guilty of misusing consecrated property?
llm_translation: If you say "Shaliach ki ha'gavna oseh shlichuto, u'mosif al devarav havei," it is because of this that the homeowner is liable. But if you say "Ma'avir al devarav havei," why is he liable?

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — דְּאַיְיתִי לֵיהּ שָׁוֶה שֵׁשׁ בְּשָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: Here we are dealing with where he brought him worth six for three
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - that he brought it equal to six in three.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, שָׁלִיחַ אַמַּאי מָעַל? אַטַּלִּית.
human_translation: If that is so, why agent guilty of misusing consecrated property? the cloak,
llm_translation: If so, why did the mother's messenger transgress? He should have annulled the vow.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי אֵימָא סֵיפָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף בָּזֶה בַּעַל הַבַּיִת לֹא מָעַל, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לוֹמַר: חָלוּק גָּדוֹל הָיִיתִי מְבַקֵּשׁ, וְאַתָּה הֵבֵאתָ לִי חָלוּק קָטָן וָרַע.
human_translation: If that is so, say the last clause Rabbi Yehuda says: Even in this the homeowner is not guilty of misusing consecrated property because he is able to say: I would have requested a large robe and you brought me a robe small and bad.
llm_translation: If so, say the latter: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even in this case, the homeowner is not disgraced, because he can say, "I was seeking a large portion, and you brought me a small and bad portion."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״רַע״? רַע בְּדָמִים, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי אַיְיתֵית לִי בְּשֵׁית, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דַּהֲוָה שָׁוֵה תַּרְתֵּי סְרֵי.
human_translation: What bad? It is bad monetary say to him: if you had brought me for six all the more so been worth twelve
llm_translation: "What is 'evil'? Evil in blood, as it says to him: 'If you had brought it to me in a drink, all the more so would it have been worth two sela."

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּקִטְנִית שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם מָעֲלוּ,
human_translation: is also precise as it teaches: Rabbi Yehuda concedes both are guilty of misusing consecrated property in legumes,
llm_translation: Precisely, as it is taught: Rabbi Yehuda concedes regarding a minor that both of them are considered to have reached the age of majority.

hebrew_text: שֶׁהַקִּטְנִית בְּסֶלַע, וְקִטְנִית בִּפְרוּטָה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: As, legumes for a sela or legumes for a peruta , Learn from here
llm_translation: The small one in the rock, and the small one in the crevice. Hear from it.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא בְּאַתְרָא דִּמְזַבְּנִי בְּשׁוּמָא, הֵיכָא דְּיָהֵיב לֵיהּ סֶלַע — מוֹזְלִי גַּבֵּיהּ טְפֵי!
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say in a locale where they sell by appraisal then when he gives the merchant a sela reduces the price for him more
llm_translation: "How are the laws of equivalence established? If you say it is in a place where they sell by weight, where one gives him a rock - he should add a little more!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּאַתְרָא דְּכָיְילִי בְּכַנֵּי, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״כַּנָּא כַּנָּא בִּפְרוּטָה״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: a locale where one measures with vessels said to him: vessel for a peruta .
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: In the place of Khailey in Kannei, who said to him: "Kanna, kanna in detail."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָיְתָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת זוּז, מָכְרָה לָזֶה בְּמָנֶה וְלָזֶה בְּמָנֶה וְלָאַחֲרוֹן יָפֶה מָנֶה וְדִינָר בְּמָנֶה — שֶׁל אַחֲרוֹן בָּטֵל, וְשֶׁל כּוּלָּן מִכְרָן קַיָּים.
human_translation: Come hear her marriage contract was four hundred dinars, she sold to this for one hundred dinars, and to that for one hundred dinars, and to the last worth one hundred dinars and a dinar for one hundred dinars, the of the last is void, and all of the others, their sale is valid,
llm_translation: Come and hear: If its writing was four hundred zuz, she sold to this one for a mana and to this one for a mana, and to the last one for a better mana, and a dinar for a mana - the last one's is nullified, and all of theirs are upheld.

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי, בְּקַטִּינֵי, הָכָא נָמֵי בְּקַטִּינֵי.
human_translation: It is as Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said with regard to small Here too, with regard to small
llm_translation: As Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said, in small matters, here it is also said in small matters.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, אָמַר ״לְאֶחָד, וְלֹא לִשְׁנַיִם״ — הָאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״לְאֶחָד וְלֹא לִשְׁנַיִם״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ ״לְאֶחָד״ סְתָמָא, מַאי?
human_translation: It is obvious said to to one but not to two, he said to him: To one, but not to two, said to to one without specifying what
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Peshita, he said, 'to one, and not to two' — he said to him 'to one and not to two.' He said to him 'to one' presumably, what?"

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: ״לְאֶחָד״, וְלֹא לִשְׁנַיִם. רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: ״לְאֶחָד״, וַאֲפִילּוּ לִשְׁנַיִם. ״לְאֶחָד״, וַאֲפִילּוּ לְמֵאָה.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: to one not to two Rav Ḥisda and Rabba, son of Rav Huna, who both say: to one and even to two to one and even to one hundred
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: "To one," and not to two. Rav Ḥisda and Rabbah bar Rav Huna both said: "To one," and even to two. "To one," and even to one hundred.

hebrew_text: אִיקְּלַע רַב נַחְמָן לְסוּרָא, עוּל לְגַבֵּיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא מַאי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: ״לְאֶחָד״ וַאֲפִילּוּ לִשְׁנַיִם, ״לְאֶחָד״ וַאֲפִילּוּ לְמֵאָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman happened to Sura. Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna entered before him. They said to him: In a case like this what He said to them: to one and even to two to one and even to one hundred
llm_translation: Rav Nachman arrived in Sura, Rav Chisda and Rabbah bar Rav Huna came to meet him. They said to him: "What is the status of this vessel?" He said to them: "It is 'to one,' and even to two, 'to one,' and even to one hundred."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אַף עַל גַּב דִּטְעָה שָׁלִיחַ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: דִּטְעָה שָׁלִיחַ לָא קָאָמֵינָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וְהָאָמַר מָר אֵין אוֹנָאָה לְקַרְקָעוֹת!
human_translation: said to him: the agent even though he erred, said to them: I do not say where the agent erred. They said to him: But didn’t the Master say there is no fraud of land,
llm_translation: They said to him: Even though the agent erred? He said to them: If the agent erred, I am not speaking. They said to him: But didn't Mar say, "There is no ona'ah with regard to land!"

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דִּטְעָה בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, אֲבָל טְעָה שָׁלִיחַ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״לְתַקּוֹנֵי שַׁדַּרְתָּיךָ וְלָא לְעַוּוֹתֵי״.
human_translation: This applies only where the homeowner erred, However, the agent erred, say to I sent you to my benefit and not to my detriment,
llm_translation: These are the words: where the owner of the house erred, but if the messenger erred, he said to him: "For the repair of your sending and not to pervert."

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא דְּשָׁאנֵי בֵּין שָׁלִיחַ לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת?
human_translation: And from where do you say that a difference between an agent and a homeowner?
llm_translation: And who will say the difference between a messenger and the homeowner?

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הָאוֹמֵר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ צֵא וּתְרוֹם — תּוֹרֵם כְּדַעַת בַּעַל הַבַּיִת. וְאִם אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ דַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת — תּוֹרֵם בְּבֵינוֹנִית אֶחָד מֵחֲמִשִּׁים, פִּיחֵת עֲשָׂרָה אוֹ הוֹסִיף עֲשָׂרָה — תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: As we learned one who says to his agent: Go out and separate separates in accordance with the mind-set of the homeowner. And if he does not know the mind-set of homeowner, he separates an intermediate one-fiftieth he subtracted ten or added ten his teruma teruma .
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: One who says to his emissary, "Go out and separate a terumah" - he separates according to the discretion of the homeowner. And if he does not know the homeowner's discretion - he separates with an average measure of one out of fifty, a fistful of ten, or he added ten - his terumah is a valid terumah.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ גַּבֵּי בַּעַל הַבַּיִת תַּנְיָא: תָּרַם וְעָלָה בְּיָדוֹ אֲפִילּוּ אֶחָד מֵעֶשְׂרִים — תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: Whereas with regard to the homeowner it is taught he separated and even one-twentieth came up in his hand, his donation teruma .
llm_translation: And if regarding the owner of the house, it was taught: If he lifted it and brought it in his hand, even one out of twenty - his contribution is a contribution.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָיְתָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת זוּז, מָכְרָה לָזֶה בְּמָנֶה וְלָזֶה בְּמָנֶה וְלָאַחֲרוֹן שָׁוֶה מָנֶה וְדִינָר בְּמָנֶה — שֶׁל אַחֲרוֹן בָּטֵל, וְשֶׁל כּוּלָּן מִכְרָן קַיָּים.
human_translation: Come hear her marriage contract was four hundred dinars, she sold to this for one hundred dinars, and to that for one hundred dinars, and to the last one worth one hundred dinars and a dinar for one hundred dinars, the of the last is void, and all of the others, their sale is valid,
llm_translation: Come and hear: If its writing was four hundred zuz, she sold to this one for a mana and to this one for a mana, and to the last one she sold for a mana and a dinar for a mana - the last one's sale is nullified, but the sales of all of them are valid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: בְּקַטִּינֵי.
human_translation: Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: with regard to small
llm_translation: Said Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi: In small containers.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שׁוּם הַדַּיָּינִין שֶׁפִּיחֲתוּ שְׁתוּת אוֹ הוֹסִיפוּ שְׁתוּת — מִכְרָן בָּטֵל.
human_translation: the assessment of the judges Where they decreased one-sixth or added one-sixth their sale is void.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Any appraisers who undervalued or overvalued - their appraisal is nullified.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מִכְרָן קַיָּים. אִם כֵּן — מָה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין יָפֶה? אֲבָל אִם עָשׂוּ אִגֶּרֶת בִּקּוֹרֶת בֵּינֵיהֶן, אֲפִילּוּ מָכְרוּ שָׁוֶה מָנֶה בְּמָאתַיִם אוֹ שָׁוֶה מָאתַיִם בְּמָנֶה — מִכְרָן קַיָּים.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Their sale is valid. If so what advantage the power of the court However, if they made a document of inspection, even if they sold worth one hundred dinars for two hundred or worth two hundred for one hundred dinars, their sale is valid,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Their sale is valid. If so, what power does the court have? But if they made an agreement with a document between them, even if they sold a hundred for two hundred or two hundred for a hundred, their sale is valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: שָׁלִיחַ, כְּמַאן?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before An agent like whom?
llm_translation: Gemara: He asked them: "Shaliach, who?"

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: שָׁלִיחַ כְּדַיָּינִין. רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר בִּיסְנָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כְּאַלְמָנָה.
human_translation: Rava said Rav Naḥman agent like judges. Rav Shmuel bar Bisna Rav Naḥman said: like a widow.
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Nachman: A messenger is like a judge. Rav Shmuel bar Bisna said, Rav Nachman: Like a widow.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: שָׁלִיחַ כְּדַיָּינִין. מָה דַיָּינִין לָאו לְדִידְהוּ — אַף שָׁלִיחַ נָמֵי לָאו לְדִידֵיהּ, לְאַפּוֹקֵי אַלְמָנָה דִּלְדִידֵהּ.
human_translation: Rava said Rav Naḥman agent like judges. Just as the judges do not for their so too, the agent also does not for his to the exclusion of a widow for her own
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Nachman: A messenger is like a judge. Just as judges are not for themselves - so too, a messenger is not for himself, except for the case of a widow for himself.

hebrew_text: רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר בִּיסְנָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כְּאַלְמָנָה, מָה אַלְמָנָה יְחִידָה — אַף שָׁלִיחַ יָחִיד, לְאַפּוֹקֵי בֵּית דִּין — דְּרַבִּים נִינְהוּ. וְהִלְכְתָא, שָׁלִיחַ כְּאַלְמָנָה.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel, son of Bisna, Rav Naḥman said: like a widow. Just as a widow an individual, so too the agent an individual. to the exclusion of the court, which is many And the halakha is an agent is like a widow.
llm_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Bisna said, Rav Nachman said: Like a widow, just as a widow is alone - so too, a single agent, to go to the court - they are considered as many. And the halakha is, an agent is like a widow.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: הָאוֹמֵר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ ״צֵא וּתְרוֹם״ — תּוֹרֵם כְּדַעַת בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, וְאִם אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ דַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת — תּוֹרֵם בְּבֵינוֹנִית אֶחָד מֵחֲמִשִּׁים. פִּיחֵת עֲשָׂרָה אוֹ הוֹסִיף עֲשָׂרָה, תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: And what is different from this As we learned in a mishna one who says to his agent: Go out and separate separates in accordance with the mind-set of the homeowner. And if he does not know the mind-set of homeowner, he separates an intermediate one-fiftieth he subtracted ten or added ten his teruma teruma .
llm_translation: And what is the difference from that which we learned: One who says to his emissary, "Go out and tithe" - he tithes according to the understanding of the homeowner, and if he does not know the understanding of the homeowner - he tithes with one out of fifty. If he subtracted ten or added ten, his tithe is a tithe.

hebrew_text: הָתָם כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא דְּתוֹרֵם בְּעַיִן רָעָה וְאִיכָּא דְּתוֹרֵם בְּעַיִן יָפָה, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְהָכִי אֲמַדְתָּיךְ. אֲבָל הָכָא טָעוּתָא הוּא, אָמַר לֵיהּ: לָא אִיבְּעִי לָךְ לְמִיטְעֵי.
human_translation: There, since there are who separate in a miserly fashion and there are who separate generously say to I estimated you However, here It is an error say to him: You ought not to have erred.
llm_translation: There, since there are some who give with an evil eye and some who give with a good eye, he said to him: "Thus I have estimated you." But here it is a mistake, he said to him: "I do not require you to plant."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים: וְלֵית לֵיהּ לְרַב נַחְמָן מָה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין יָפֶה? וְהָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: יְתוֹמִים שֶׁבָּאוּ לַחְלוֹק בְּנִכְסֵי אֲבִיהֶן — בֵּית דִּין מַעֲמִידִין לָהֶן אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס, וּבוֹרְרִין לָהֶם חֵלֶק יָפֶה. הִגְדִּילוּ — יְכוֹלִין לְמַחוֹת. וְרַב נַחְמָן דִּידֵיהּ אָמַר: הִגְדִּילוּ — אֵין יְכוֹלִין לְמַחוֹת, אִם כֵּן מָה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין יָפֶה.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥanina said Rav Naḥman said: halakha is in accordance with the statement of Rabbis Does Rav Naḥman not What the power of the court? Didn’t Rav Naḥman say Shmuel said: orphans who came to divide their father’s property, the court appoints a steward [ apotropos ] for them and selects for appropriate portions matured, they are able to protest And Rav Naḥman said his own matured, they are not able to protest, as if so, what advantage the power of the court?
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Chanina said in the name of Rav Nachman, the halacha follows the words of the sages. And Rav Nachman does not have the strength of the court? But didn't Rav Nachman say in the name of Shmuel: Orphans who come to divide their father's estate - the court appoints for them an apotropos, and they allocate for them a fair share. If they grow up - they can protest. And Rav Nachman himself said: If they grow up - they cannot protest, then what strength does the court have?

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דִּטְעוֹ, הָא דְּלָא טְעוֹ.
human_translation: not difficult. where erred where they did not err,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this one who erred, this one who did not err.

hebrew_text: אִי דְּלָא טְעוֹ, בְּמַאי יְכוֹלִין לְמַחוֹת? בְּרוּחוֹת.
human_translation: If where did not err, to what could protest? with regard to locations;
llm_translation: If he did not err, with what may they extinguish? With winds.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: מַעֲשֶׂה וְעָשָׂה רַבִּי כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים, אָמַר לְפָנָיו פַּרְטָא בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן פַּרְטָא בֶּן בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי פַּרְטָא הַגָּדוֹל: אִם כֵּן מָה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין יָפֶה, וְהֶחְזִיר רַבִּי אֶת הַמַּעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: incident and Rabbi acted in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis Perata, son of Rabbi Elazar ben Perata, grandson of Rabbi Perata the Great, said before him: If what advantage the power of the court And Rabbi reversed the incident.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: "Rabbi acted in accordance with the words of the sages." He said before him: "Parta, the son of Rabbi Elazar ben Parta, the grandson of Rabbi Parta the Great." If so, how great is the power of the court, and Rabbi returned the matter.

hebrew_text: רַב דִּימִי מַתְנֵי הָכִי, רַב סָפְרָא מַתְנֵי הָכִי: מַעֲשֶׂה וּבִיקֵּשׁ רַבִּי לַעֲשׂוֹת כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים, אָמַר לְפָנָיו פַּרְטָא בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן פַּרְטָא בֶּן בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי פַּרְטָא הַגָּדוֹל: אִם כֵּן מָה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין יָפֶה? לֹא עָשָׂה רַבִּי אֶת הַמַּעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Rav Dimi teach this Rav Safra teach this an incident, and Rabbi wished to act in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis Perata, son of Rabbi Elazar ben Perata, grandson of Rabbi Perata the Great, said before him: If what advantage power of the court Rabbi did not take action
llm_translation: Rav Dimi teaches thus, Rav Safra teaches thus: There was an incident, and Rabbi sought to act in accordance with the words of the Sages. He said before him, "Parta, the son of Rabbi Elazar ben Parta, the grandson of Rabbi Parta the Great." If so, what strength does the court have? Rabbi did not carry out the matter.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר: טָעָה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה — חוֹזֵר, וּמָר סָבַר: אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר.
human_translation: Let us say that they disagree about this: Sage, holds erred in a matter Mishna, revoked. And Sage, holds is not revoked.
llm_translation: Let us say in this case where he stumbled, Master holds: If he made a mistake in a matter of Mishnah - he goes back, and Master holds: He does not go back.

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא טָעָה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה חוֹזֵר, וּמָר סָבַר הָכִי הֲוָה מַעֲשֶׂה, וּמָר סָבַר הָכִי הֲוָה מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: No, everyone erred in a matter Mishna, is revoked. Sage holds incident in this and Sage holds incident in this
llm_translation: Not so, for the entire world erred in a matter of Mishnah, he retracts, and the Master thought thus: it was an actual event, and the Master thought thus: it was an actual event.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אַרְמַלְתָּא דְּזַבִּינָה — אַחְרָיוּת אַיַּתְמֵי. וּבֵית דִּין דְּזַבֵּין — אַחְרָיוּת אַיַּתְמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: a widow who sold guarantee upon the orphans. And court sold guarantee upon the orphans.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: The Aramaic of Zabinah - its aftermath is Ayatmei. And a court that sells - its aftermath is Ayatmei.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: Isn’t obvious?
llm_translation: The Talmudic text "פְּשִׁיטָא!" can be translated into English as "It is obvious!"

hebrew_text: אַלְמָנָה לָא אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ. כִּי אִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ, בֵּי דִינָא — מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא:
human_translation: it was not necessary widow, Where was necessary for court. Lest you say:
llm_translation: Widow not she needs. For she needs, in court — what you say:

hebrew_text: כֹּל דְּזָבֵין מִבֵּי דִינָא — אַדַּעְתָּא לְמִיפַּק לֵיהּ קָלָא הוּא דְּזָבֵין, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Everyone who buys from the court buys with understanding that generates publicity, teaches us
llm_translation: All who leave the court - know that it is a light matter to leave, it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר כּוּ׳. וְעַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: עַד פַּלְגָא.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says And to what Rav Huna bar Yehuda said Rav Sheshet said: Until half
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "Until when?" Rav Huna bar Yehuda said in the name of Rav Sheshet: "Until half."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בֵּית דִּין שֶׁמָּכְרוּ שָׁוֶה מָאתַיִם בְּמָנֶה אוֹ שָׁוֶה מָנֶה בְּמָאתַיִם — מִכְרָן קַיָּים.
human_translation: That is also taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: A court that sold worth one hundred dinars for two hundred or worth two hundred for one hundred dinars, their sale is valid.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Namai the Elder, thus said Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel: A court that sold a hundred for two hundred, or sold two hundred for a hundred — their sale is valid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף: בֵּית דִּין שֶׁמָּכְרוּ בְּלֹא הַכְרָזָה — נַעֲשׂוּ כְּמִי שֶׁטָּעוּ בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה וְחוֹזְרִין.
human_translation: Ameimar said in the name of Rav Yosef: a court that sold without an announcement, is considered as they erred in a matter Mishna and reversed.
llm_translation: Said Amemar in the name of Rav Yosef: A court that sold without announcement - they are like one who planted something mistakenly and must return.

hebrew_text: נַעֲשׂוּ? וַדַּאי טָעוּ! דִּתְנַן: שׁוּם הַיְּתוֹמִין שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, וְשׁוּם הַהֶקְדֵּשׁ שִׁשִּׁים יוֹם, וּמַכְרִיזִין בַּבֹּקֶר וּבָעֶרֶב.
human_translation: is considered as it certainly erred As we learned assessment the orphans thirty days, and the assessment consecrated property sixty days, and they make announcements in the morning and in the evening.
llm_translation: They did it? Surely they erred! As we learned: The name of orphans for thirty days, and the name of consecrated items for sixty days, and they announce in the morning and in the evening.

hebrew_text: אִי מֵהַהִיא הֲוָה אָמֵינָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי שָׁלִיחַ, אֲבָל בֵּית דִּין — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If from that I would say this applies an agent but not to a court. teaches us
llm_translation: If from there was I saying those words of a messenger, but a court - no, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר: שׁוּם הַדַּיָּינִין שֶׁפִּחֲתוּ שְׁתוּת אוֹ הוֹתִירוּ שְׁתוּת — מִכְרָן בָּטֵל. הָא שָׁוֶה בְּשָׁוֶה — מִכְרָן קַיָּים. מַאי לָאו דְּלָא אַכְרוּז? לָא, בִּדְאַכְרוּז.
human_translation: Rav Ashi raised an objection to Ameimar: the assessment the judges where they decreased one-sixth or added one-sixth their sale is void. for its value, their sale is valid. What, is not no announcement was made? No, where they did make an announcement.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Amemar: Any merchants who decreased their measures or increased their measures - their sale is nullified. But if they are equal to each other - their sale is valid. What is the reason? Is it not because they are not proclaimed? No, it is because they are proclaimed.

hebrew_text: הָא מִדְּסֵיפָא בִּדְאַכְרוּז הָוֵי, רֵישָׁא בִּדְלָא אַכְרוּז, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אִם עָשׂוּ אִגֶּרֶת בִּקּוֹרֶת, אֲפִילּוּ מָכְרוּ שָׁוֶה מָנֶה בְּמָאתַיִם אוֹ שָׁוֶה מָאתַיִם בְּמָנֶה — מִכְרָן קַיָּים.
human_translation: the last clause is where made an announcement, the first clause where they did not make announcements, as it teaches in the final clause: If they made a document of inspection even if they sold worth one hundred dinars for two hundred or worth two hundred for one hundred dinars, their sale is valid.
llm_translation: The Gemara concludes: in the case of a document of sale, it is effective if it was written on parchment, but if it was not written on parchment, as the latter clause teaches: if they made a document of sale on a keret, even if they sold a sela for two hundred or two hundred for a sela — their sale is valid.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְעוֹלָם בִּדְלָא אַכְרוּז, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּדְבָרִים שֶׁמַּכְרִיזִין עֲלֵיהֶן, כָּאן בִּדְבָרִים שֶׁאֵין מַכְרִיזִין עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rather, Actually, where they did not make an announcement, and not difficult. Here, to items for which one makes an announcement, There, items for which one does not make announcements.
llm_translation: Rather, always with a proclamation, and not difficult: here with matters that are proclaimed upon, here with matters that are not proclaimed upon.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵין מַכְרִיזִין עֲלֵיהֶן: הָעֲבָדִים וְהַמִּטַּלְטְלִין וְהַשְּׁטָרוֹת. עֲבָדִים טַעְמָא מַאי? שֶׁמָּא יִשְׁמְעוּ וְיִבְרְחוּ. מִטַּלְטְלִין וּשְׁטָרוֹת — שֶׁמָּא יִגָּנְבוּ.
human_translation: And these are items for which one does not make an announcement: Slaves, movable property, and contracts. What is the reason slaves lest they hear and escape. movable property and contracts Lest they be stolen.
llm_translation: These are the things that one does not announce publicly: slaves, portable beds, and documents. Slaves, what is the reason? Lest they hear and run away. Portable beds and documents - lest they be stolen.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כָּאן בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁמַּכְרִיזִין, כָּאן בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאֵין מַכְרִיזִין.
human_translation: And if you wish, say here a time when one makes an announcement, there a time when one does not make an announcement.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Here, when they announce, here, when they do not announce.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי: לִכְרָגָא לִמְזוֹנֵי וְלִקְבוּרָה — מְזַבְּנִינַן בְּלָא אַכְרָזְתָּא.
human_translation: As of Neharde’a say: For head tax, for sustenance, and for burial, sells without an announcement
llm_translation: The Riverdais say: For a loaf of bread, for sustenance, and for burial - we sell without a public announcement.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כָּאן בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁמַּכְרִיזִין, כָּאן בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מַכְרִיזִין. דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מֵעוֹלָם לֹא עָשׂוּ אִגֶּרֶת בִּקּוֹרֶת בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say here, a locale where one makes an announcement, there, a locale where one does not make an announcement, as Rav Naḥman said: They never made a document of inspection in Neharde’a.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Here, in a place where they announce, here, in a place where they do not announce. As Rav Nachman said: They never made a decree of reading the Megillah in Nehardea.

hebrew_text: סְבוּר מִינַּהּ מִשּׁוּם דִּבְקִיאֵי בְּשׁוּמָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי: לְדִידִי מִיפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָרוּ לְהוּ ״בְּנֵי אָכְלִי נִכְסֵי דְאַכְרָזְתָּא״.
human_translation: understood from because expert in the appraisal Rav Yosef bar Minyumi said to them: was explained to me by Rav Naḥman himself: because are called: People consume property that was publicly announced.
llm_translation: He thought that it was because they were diligent in the matter. Rav Yosef bar Minyumei said to him: In my opinion, I have a tradition from Rav Nachman's teachings, because they are called "the sons of the eaters of the property of the tax collector."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מִטַּלְטְלִין שֶׁל יְתוֹמִים — שָׁמִין אוֹתָן וּמוֹכְרִין אוֹתָן לְאַלְתַּר. רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר אֲבִימִי: מוֹכְרִין אוֹתָן לִשְׁוָוקִים.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Movable property that belongs to orphans is appraised and sold immediately Rav Ḥisda Avimi said: is sold on a market
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: We evaluate the orphans' movable property and sell it immediately. Rav Ḥisdah said in the name of Avimi: We sell it to shopkeepers.

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: הָא — דִּמְיקָרַב שׁוּקָא, הָא — דִּמְרַחַק שׁוּקָא.
human_translation: And not disagree this when market is approaching, That when market is far off.
llm_translation: And not dispute: this - that is close market, this - that is far market.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ שִׁכְרָא דְּרַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא בַּר חִילְקַאי יַתְמָא. שַׁהֲיֵיהּ עַד רִיגְלָא, אָמַר: אַף עַל גַּב דְּנָפֵל בֵּיהּ אִיצְצָתָא, מַיְיתֵי זוּזָא חֲרִיפָא.
human_translation: Rav Kahana was in possession of beer to Rav Mesharshiyya bar Ḥilkai, an orphan. He delayed it until the Festival. said: Although that it may deteriorate [ itzatzta ] it brings money
llm_translation: Rav Kahana had in his possession a flask of wine of Rav Mesharshaya bar Chilkaya from Tama. When it was up to his foot, he said: Even though a chip fell into it, he brought a hot coal.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ חַמְרָא דְּרָבִינָא זוּטֵי יַתְמָא בַּר אֲחָתֵיהּ. הֲוָה לְדִידֵיהּ נָמֵי חַמְרָא, הֲוָה קָמַסֵּיק לֵיהּ לְסִיכְרָא.
human_translation: Ravina was in possession of wine to orphan Ravina the younger, was his sister’s son. He also had wine of his own, he was taking to Sikhra
llm_translation: Ravina had in his possession wine of Ravina Zuti, the son of his brother. He also had his own wine. He would mix it for him in a flask.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַהוּ לְאַמְטוֹיֵי בַּהֲדַן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל, לָא עֲדִיף מִדִּידָךְ.
human_translation: He came before Rav Ashi said to him: What is I to bring with He said to him: Go is no better than yours,
llm_translation: He came before Rav Ashi, he said to him: What about the amtuvei in Hadan? He said to him: Go, it is not better than yours.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְמָאֶנֶת, הַשְּׁנִיָּה, וְהָאַיְלוֹנִית — אֵין לָהֶן כְּתוּבָּה, וְלֹא פֵּירוֹת וְלֹא מְזוֹנוֹת וְלֹא בְּלָאוֹת.
human_translation: one who refuses a secondary relative and a sexually underdeveloped woman [ ailonit ], is not entitled to a marriage contract; and not produce and not sustenance; and not worn clothes
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "One who refuses, the second wife, and the woman who is suspected of adultery - they do not have a marriage contract, nor do they have rights to produce offspring, nor do they have sustenance."

hebrew_text: אִם מִתְּחִלָּה נְשָׂאָהּ לְשֵׁם אַיְלוֹנִית — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: If, from the start, he married her with the understanding an ailonit , she is entitled to a marriage contract.
llm_translation: If from the beginning he married her for the sake of the Aylonit - she has a marriage contract.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, מַמְזֶרֶת וּנְתִינָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְנָתִין וּלְמַמְזֵר — יֵשׁ לָהֶם כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: a widow a High Priest; a divorcée or a yevama who performed ḥalitza a common priest; a daughter born from an incestuous or adulterous relationship [ mamzeret ] or a Gibeonite woman an Israelite; a Jewish woman a Gibeonite or a mamzer , entitled to a marriage contract.
llm_translation: Widow to High Priest, divorced and halutzah to common priest, mamzeret and netinah to Israelite, daughter of Israel to netin and to mamzer — they have a document.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רַב תָּנֵי: קְטַנָּה — יוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה. וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן מְמָאֶנֶת.
human_translation: Rav taught a minor girl is divorced with a bill of divorce is not entitled to marriage contract. And all the more so, one who refuses
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav taught: A minor - she can leave with a divorce document, she does not have a marriage contract. And certainly she is refused.

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל תָּנֵי: מְמָאֶנֶת — אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה, אֲבָל יוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: Shmuel taught one who refuses is not entitled to marriage contract, but one who is divorced with a bill of divorce is entitled to marriage contract.
llm_translation: Shmuel taught: "Mema'enet" - she does not have a document, but if she goes out with a divorce document - she has a document.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא שְׁמוּאֵל לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מְמָאֶנֶת — אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה, יוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: And Shmuel follows reasoning, as Shmuel said: One who refuses is not entitled to marriage contract, one who is divorced with a bill of divorce is entitled to marriage contract.
llm_translation: And it was established according to the opinion of Shmuel, for Shmuel said: "If she refuses - she does not have a document, if she goes out with a divorce document - she has a document."

hebrew_text: מְמָאֶנֶת — לֹא פְּסָלָהּ מִן הָאַחִין, וְלֹא פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה. יוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט — פְּסָלָהּ מִן הָאַחִין, וּפְסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה.
