human_translation: One who refuses not disqualified from the brothers And is not disqualified from the priesthood. one who is divorced with a bill of divorce disqualified from the brothers and disqualified from the priesthood.
llm_translation: Refusing — not disqualified from the brothers, and not disqualified from the priesthood. If she leaves with a divorce document — disqualified from the brothers, and disqualified from the priesthood.

hebrew_text: מְמָאֶנֶת אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים,
human_translation: One who refuses does not need to wait three months
llm_translation: Refusing she not needs to wait three months.

hebrew_text: יוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: One who leaves through a bill of divorce is required to wait three months
llm_translation: She who goes out with a divorce document requires to wait three months.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא כּוּלְּהוּ: הַמְמָאֶנֶת בְּאִישׁ — הוּא מוּתָּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וְהִיא מוּתֶּרֶת בִּקְרוֹבָיו, וְלֹא פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה. נָתַן לָהּ גֵּט — הוּא אָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וְהִיא אֲסוּרָה בִּקְרוֹבָיו, וּפְסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: What is teaching us We learned it all one who refuses with man, he is permitted to her relatives and she is permitted to his relatives, and she is not disqualified from the priesthood. he gave her a bill of divorce, he is forbidden to her relatives and she is forbidden to his relatives, and she is disqualified from the priesthood.
llm_translation: What is implied for us? We have learned all of them: If she refuses her husband - he is permitted to her relatives, and she is permitted to his relatives, and she is not disqualified from the priesthood. If he gives her a bill of divorce - he is forbidden to her relatives, and she is forbidden to his relatives, and she is disqualified from the priesthood.

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, דְּלָא תְּנַן.
human_translation: It was necessary for him she is required to wait three months as we did not learn
llm_translation: It is necessary to wait three months, it is necessary for him, as we do not teach.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַעֲשֵׂה קְטַנָּה כְּלוּם, וְאֵין בַּעְלָהּ זַכַּאי בִּמְצִיאָתָהּ, וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, וְלֹא בַּהֲפָרַת נְדָרֶיהָ, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹרְשָׁהּ, וְאֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא לָהּ. כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר: אֵינָהּ כְּאִשְׁתּוֹ לְכׇל דָּבָר, אֶלָּא שֶׁצְּרִיכָה מֵיאוּן.
human_translation: Let us say parallel to Rabbi Eliezer says: The act of a minor girl is nothing, and her husband is not entitled to article that she finds, and not to her earnings; and not to annul her vows; and he does not inherit her; nor does he become impure for her principle is not that of his wife in every sense, only that she requires a refusal
llm_translation: Let us say according to the Tannaim, Rabbi Eliezer says: A minor's act is nothing, and her husband is not entitled to her findings, nor to the work of her hands, nor to annul her vows, and he does not inherit her, and he does not become impure for her. The general principle of the matter: She is not like his wife in all matters, except that she requires consent.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מַעֲשֵׂה קְטַנָּה כְּלוּם, וּבַעְלָהּ זַכַּאי בִּמְצִיאָתָהּ, וּבְמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, וּבַהֲפָרַת נְדָרֶיהָ, וְיוֹרְשָׁהּ, וּמִיטַּמֵּא לָהּ. כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר: הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאִשְׁתּוֹ לְכׇל דָּבָר, אֶלָּא שֶׁיּוֹצְאָה בְּמֵיאוּן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: The act of a minor girl is something, and her husband is entitled to article that she finds and to her earnings; and to annul her vows; and he inherits her; and he becomes impure her, principle is that that of his wife in every sense, except that she leaves through refusal
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: The work of a small woman is nothing, and her husband merits through finding her, and through her handiwork, and through annulling her vows, and inheriting her, and becoming impure for her. The general principle of the matter: She is like his wife in all respects, except that she leaves through a divorce.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַב דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ?
human_translation: Shall we say that Rav said in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, and that Shmuel said in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua,
llm_translation: Let us say, Rav said like Rabbi Eliezer, and Shmuel said like Rabbi Yehoshua?

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי.
human_translation: According to of Rabbi Eliezer, everyone agrees
llm_translation: In the school of Rabbi Eliezer, everyone does not disagree.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: שְׁמוּאֵל כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, וְרַב: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הָתָם אֶלָּא מִדִּידַהּ לְדִידֵיהּ, אֲבָל מִדִּידֵיהּ לְדִידַהּ — לָא.
human_translation: When they disagree, in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua. Shmuel in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua. And Rav Rabbi Yehoshua said there only to her toward him. But to his toward her, not
llm_translation: When they disputed in the study hall of Rabbi Yehoshua: Shmuel is like Rabbi Yehoshua, and Rav: until here Rabbi Yehoshua did not say, rather from his perspective to his perspective, but from his perspective to her perspective - no.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא בְּלָאוֹת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִיָּיא לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: אֲמַרְתְּ לַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא נִכְסֵי מְלוֹג, אֲבָל נִכְסֵי צֹאן בַּרְזֶל, אִית לַהּ.
human_translation: and not worn clothes. Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya said to Rav Kahana: You told us in the name of Shmuel: They taught only usufruct property [ nikhsei melog ], but she does have guaranteed property [ tzon barzel ].
llm_translation: "And not with blisters." Rav Huna son of Chiya said to Rav Kahana: You have told us in the name of Shmuel: They only did not differentiate with regard to property of a bathhouse, but property of iron sheep, it has."

hebrew_text: הָוֵי בַּהּ רַב פָּפָּא: אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַמְּמָאֶנֶת, אִי דְּאִיתַנְהוּ — אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי שָׁקְלָא. וְאִי דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ — אִידֵּי וְאִידִי לָא שָׁקְלָא!
human_translation: Rav Pappa discussed it To which If we say to one who refuses if are still she takes both And if they are no longer then she does not take either
llm_translation: Be in it Rav Papa: Aheyya? If you say she refuses, if they gave - both took. And if they did not give - neither took!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַאַיְילוֹנִית: אִי דְּאִיתַנְהוּ — אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי שָׁקְלָא, אִי דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ — אִיפְּכָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: נִכְסֵי מְלוֹג דְּבִרְשׁוּתַהּ קָיְימִי — אִית לַהּ, נִכְסֵי צֹאן בַּרְזֶל דְּלָאו בִּרְשׁוּתַהּ קָיְימִי — לֵית לַהּ!
human_translation: Rather, to an ailonit . if are still she takes both If they are no longer should have opposite usufruct property, which remains in her possession she does she does not the guaranteed property, which does not remain in her possession
llm_translation: Rather, the Eilonit: if they have it - both will take it, if they do not have it - it is turned over from one to the other. If the property of a creditor is in his possession - he has it, if the property of sheep of iron is not in his possession - he does not have it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַשְּׁנִיָּה, וּקְנַסוּ רַבָּנַן לְדִידַהּ בְּדִידֵיהּ וּלְדִידֵיהּ בְּדִידַהּ.
human_translation: Rather, to a secondary relative, and Sages penalized to her with regard to his And to him with regard to her
llm_translation: Rather, Ashniya, and the Rabbis penalized her with her own and with her own with hers.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִדְּרַב כָּהֲנָא: עַיִּילָא לֵיהּ גְּלִימָא — קַרְנָא הָוֵי, וְלָא מִכַּסֵּי לַהּ וְאָזֵיל עַד דְּבָלֵי.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: Conclude from of Rav Kahana if brought to a cloak it is capital, and he may not go and cover himself with it until it wears out.
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashe said, hear from it from Rav Kahana: If he brings him a cloak - it should be a horn, and not cover him, and he should go until he wastes away.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן פֵּירָא הָוֵי! דְּרַב נַחְמָן פְּלִיגָא.
human_translation: But didn’t Rav Naḥman say is the produce of Rav Naḥman disagreement
llm_translation: And he said, Rav Nachman Peira was! For Rav Nachman is in disagreement.

hebrew_text: אֵין לָהֶן כְּתוּבָּה. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מָנֶה מָאתַיִם, אֲבָל תּוֹסֶפֶת, יֵשׁ לָהֶן.
human_translation: are not entitled to a marriage contract. Shmuel said: They taught this only one hundred dinars two hundred However, additional they are entitled to
llm_translation: "They do not have a written document." Shmuel said: They only did not change except for a hundred, but additional, they have.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: נָשִׁים שֶׁאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים אֵין לָהֶן כְּתוּבָּה, כְּגוֹן הַמְמָאֶנֶת וְחַבְרוֹתֶיהָ — אֵין לָהֶן מָנֶה מָאתַיִם, אֲבָל תּוֹסֶפֶת — יֵשׁ לָהֶן.
human_translation: That is also taught Women whom the Sages said: They are not entitled to a marriage contract, for example, one who refused and her companions, they are not entitled one hundred dinars two hundred But additional they are entitled to
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: The following are women whom the Sages said do not have a marriage contract, such as one who refuses to marry and her companions — they do not have the two hundred zuz of the marriage contract, but they do have the additional amount.

hebrew_text: נָשִׁים שֶׁאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים יוֹצְאוֹת שֶׁלֹּא בִּכְתוּבָּה, כְּגוֹן עוֹבֶרֶת עַל דָּת וְחַבְרוֹתֶיהָ — אֵין לָהֶן תּוֹסֶפֶת, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן מָנֶה מָאתַיִם. וְהַיּוֹצֵאת מִשּׁוּם שֵׁם רָע — נוֹטֶלֶת מַה שֶּׁלְּפָנֶיהָ וְיוֹצְאָה.
human_translation: women whom the Sages said: They are divorced without marriage contract, for example, a woman who violates precepts and her companions, are not entitled to the additional And all the more so one hundred dinars two hundred And one who is divorced because a bad reputation takes what is left and is divorced.
llm_translation: Women who the sages said are exempt from the written law, such as one who violates the custom and her companions - they do not receive any additional payment, and certainly not the two hundred. And one who goes out because of a bad reputation - she takes what is before her and leaves.

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: זִינְּתָה לֹא הִפְסִידָה
human_translation: supports of Rav Huna, as Rav Huna said: was licentious has not lost
llm_translation: Assists him to Rav Huna, for Rav Huna said: "If she was promiscuous, she did not lose."

hebrew_text: בְּלָאוֹתֶיהָ קַיָּימִין.
human_translation: her worn clothes existence.
llm_translation: In its wearings they stand.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: זִינְּתָה — הִפְסִידָה בְּלָאוֹתֶיהָ קַיָּימִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם הִיא זִינְּתָה, כֵּלֶיהָ מִי זַנַּאי? תָּנֵי: לֹא הִפְסִידָה בְּלָאוֹתֶיהָ קַיָּימִין.
human_translation: The tanna teaches before Rav Naḥman: was licentious lost her extant, worn clothes, He said to him: If she engaged in sexual intercourse were her items licentious? teach has not lost her extant worn clothes.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Nachman: If she has committed adultery, her vessels are not considered adulterous. He said to him: If she has committed adultery, who is the adulterer? It was taught: If she has not lost her vessels, they are still valid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מְנַחֵם סְתִימְתָּאָה, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: זִינְּתָה — לֹא הִפְסִידָה בְּלָאוֹתֶיהָ קַיָּימִין.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This is the statement of Rabbi Menaḥem, the unattributed, However, the Rabbis say she was licentious, she has not lost her extant worn clothes.
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: This is the statement of Rabbi Menachem the Seemingly Conclusive, but the Sages say: If she was promiscuous, she has not lost her rights to her marital obligations.

hebrew_text: אִם מִתְּחִלָּה נָשְׂאָה כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אַיְלוֹנִית — אִשָּׁה וְאֵינָהּ אִשָּׁה, אַלְמָנָה — אִשָּׁה גְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: if, from the start, he married Rav Huna said: An ailonit a wife and she is not a wife, a widow entirely a wife.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If from the beginning she bore a male. Rav Huna said: Aylonit - a woman and she is not a woman, a widow - a complete woman.

hebrew_text: אַיְלוֹנִית אִשָּׁה וְאֵינָהּ אִשָּׁה: הִכִּיר בָּהּ — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה, לֹא הִכִּיר בָּהּ — אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה. אַלְמָנָה אִשָּׁה גְּמוּרָה: בֵּין הִכִּיר בָּהּ, בֵּין לֹא הִכִּיר בָּהּ — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: An ailonit a wife and she not a wife. he knew about her she is entitled to marriage contract he did not know about her she is not entitled to marriage contract. A widow entirely a wife. Whether he knew about her whether he did not know about her, she is entitled to marriage contract.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Aylonit is a woman, and she is not a woman: if one recognizes her - she has a document, if one does not recognize her - she does not have a document. An almanah is a complete woman: whether one recognizes her or does not recognize her - she has a document.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַחַת זוֹ וְאַחַת זוֹ אִשָּׁה וְאֵינָהּ אִשָּׁה. הִכִּיר בָּהּ — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה, לֹא הִכִּיר בָּהּ — אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says: Both the the a wife and not a wife. he knew about her she is entitled to marriage contract. he did not know about her she is not entitled to marriage contract.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah says: One this and one this woman and she is not a woman. Recognized her - she has a marriage contract, did not recognize her - she does not have a marriage contract.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כְּנָסָהּ בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהִיא כֵּן, וְנִמְצֵאת שֶׁהִיא כֵּן — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה. הָא סְתָמָא — אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection he married with the presumption that she is so, and it is found that she is so she is entitled to marriage contract. without specification, she is not entitled to marriage contract.
llm_translation: Challenger: If she entered with the presumption that she is thus, and it is found that she is thus - she has a document. But if it is a presumption - she does not have a document.

hebrew_text: לָא תֵּימָא: הָא סְתָמָא אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כְּנָסָהּ בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁאֵינָהּ כֵּן, וְנִמְצֵאת שֶׁהִיא כֵּן — אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: Do not say that without specification she is not entitled to marriage contract. Rather, say he married her with the presumption that she is not so and it is found that she is so, she is not entitled to marriage contract.
llm_translation: Do not say: This presumption has no written proof, rather say: If she entered with a presumption that she is not so, and it is found that she is so - she has no written proof.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל סְתָמָא מַאי — אִית לַהּ, אַדְּתָנֵי בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהִיא כֵּן וְנִמְצֵאת שֶׁהִיא כֵּן יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה, לַשְׁמְעִינַן סְתָמָא, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן הָא!
human_translation: But without specification, what she is entitled of teaching with the presumption that she is so and she is found to be so she is entitled to marriage contract, let him teach us without specification. all the more so this
llm_translation: But what about a regular case - what does it have? It was taught in a Mishnah: If it is assumed to be so and it is found to be so, it has a document. To teach us a regular case, and all the more so this!

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, תָּנֵי: כְּנָסָהּ בְּיָדוּעַ וְנִמְצֵאת בְּיָדוּעַ — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה, כְּנָסָהּ סְתָם — אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרַב הוּנָא!
human_translation: And further, is taught he married her knowing and it is found as was known, she is entitled to marriage contract. without specification, she is not entitled to marriage contract. a conclusive refutation of Rav Huna.
llm_translation: And furthermore, it was taught: If her betrothal was done knowingly and it is found to be done knowingly - she has a document; if her betrothal was done unknowingly - she does not have a document. The excellence of Rav Huna!

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא מַתְנִיתִין אַטְעִיתֵיהּ. הוּא סָבַר: מִדְּקָא מְפַלֵּיג בְּאַיְלוֹנִית וְלָא קָמְפַלֵּיג בְּאַלְמָנָה, מִכְּלָל דְּאַלְמָנָה אֲפִילּוּ בִּסְתָמָא נָמֵי אִית לַהּ, וְלָא הִיא: כִּי קָתָנֵי לַהּ לְאַלְמָנָה, אַפְּלוּגְתָּא דְּאַיְלוֹנִית קָאֵי.
human_translation: Rav Huna was misled by the mishna He thought that since differentiates with an ailonit , but does not differentiate with a widow, by inference that a widow, even where she is entitled that is not so. When teaches of the widow, it on the differentiation with the ailonit .
llm_translation: Rav Huna taught a Mishnah. He holds: when he differentiates between a widow and a virgin, it is not differentiating between a widow in general, for even a regular widow has something unique about her, and not this: for it is taught about a widow, even the most distinguished virgin stands.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אַלְמָנָה נִיזּוֹנֶת
llm_translation: We will return to you, O widow who is supported.

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹשֵׂא אֶת הָאִשָּׁה וּפָסְקָה עִמּוֹ כְּדֵי שֶׁיָּזוּן אֶת בִּתָּהּ חָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים — חַיָּיב לְזוּנָהּ חָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים.
human_translation: One who marries a woman, and she stipulated with him that he would sustain her daughter five years, is obligated to sustain her five years.
llm_translation: The one who carries the woman and she stops with him in order that he may feed her daughter five years - obligated to feed her five years.

hebrew_text: נִיסֵּת לְאַחֵר, וּפָסְקָה עִמּוֹ כְּדֵי שֶׁיָּזוּן אֶת בִּתָּהּ חָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים חַיָּיב לְזוּנָהּ חָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים. לֹא יֹאמַר הָרִאשׁוֹן: לִכְשֶׁתָּבֹא אֶצְלִי אֱזוּנָהּ, אֶלָּא מוֹלִיךְ לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ לַמָּקוֹם שֶׁאִמָּהּ.
human_translation: was married to another and she stipulated with him that he would sustain her daughter five years, he is obligated to sustain her five years. The first may not say: When she comes to me, I will sustain her. Rather, he brings her sustenance to her, to the place where her mother
llm_translation: He married another, and she stopped with him in order to feed her daughter five years, he is obligated to feed her for five years. The first one should not say: "When she comes to me, then I will feed her," rather he should bring her sustenance to the place where her mother is.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן לֹא יֹאמְרוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם ״הֲרֵי אָנוּ זָנִין אוֹתָהּ כְּאֶחָד״, אֶלָּא אֶחָד זָנָה, וְאֶחָד נוֹתֵן לָהּ דְּמֵי מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: And likewise, both of them may not say: We will sustain as one Rather, one sustains her, the other gives her the monetary of the sustenance.
llm_translation: And so they should not say, "Behold, we will prostitute her together," but rather one prostitutes, and one gives her the payment of sustenance.

hebrew_text: נִיסֵּת — הַבַּעַל נוֹתֵן לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת, וְהֵן נוֹתְנִין לָהּ דְּמֵי מְזוֹנוֹת. מֵתוּ — בְּנוֹתֵיהֶן נִיזּוֹנוֹת מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין, וְהִיא נִיזּוֹנֶת מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא כְּבַעֲלַת חוֹב.
human_translation: was married husband provides her sustenance and provide her with the monetary value of the sustenance. died, their daughters are sustained from unsold property, and she, is sustained from liened property due to that her like a creditor,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Nicet - the husband provides her sustenance, and they provide her sustenance money. If he dies - their daughters are sustained from the property of free men, and she is sustained from the property of slaves, because she is a creditor."

hebrew_text: הַפִּקְּחִים הָיוּ כּוֹתְבִים: עַל מְנָת שֶׁאָזוּן אֶת בִּתֵּךְ חָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאַתְּ עִמִּי.
human_translation: The perspicacious would write on the condition that I will sustain your daughter for five years as long as you are with me.
llm_translation: The scribes were writing: "In order to feed your daughter for five years as long as you are with me."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִתְּמַר: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״חַיָּיב אֲנִי לְךָ מָנֶה״. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: חַיָּיב, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: פָּטוּר.
human_translation: It was stated one who says to another: I am obligated to you one hundred dinars, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: obligated and Reish Lakish said: exempt.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was stated: One who says to his fellow, "I am obligated to you a Maneh." Rabbi Yochanan said: He is obligated, and Reish Lakish said: He is exempt.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דְּאָמַר לְהוּ ״אַתֶּם עֵדַיי״, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּקָפָטַר! אִי דְּלָא אָמַר לְהוּ ״אַתֶּם עֵדַיי״, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּקָמְחַיֵּיב?
human_translation: What are the circumstances If he said to You are my witnesses, what is the reasoning of Reish Lakish, who exempts If he did not say to them: You are my witnesses, what is the reasoning of Rabbi Yoḥanan, who obligates
llm_translation: "How are they similar? If he said to them, 'You are my witnesses,' what is the reason that Reish Lakish is exempt? If he did not say to them, 'You are my witnesses,' what is the reason that Rabbi Yochanan obligates?"

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּלָא קָאָמַר לְהוּ ״אַתֶּם עֵדַיי״, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ ״חַיָּיב אֲנִי לְךָ מָנֶה בִּשְׁטָר״. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: חַיָּיב — אַלִּימָא מִילְּתָא דִשְׁטָרָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר לְהוּ ״אַתֶּם עֵדִים״ דָּמֵי. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: פָּטוּר, לָא אַלִּימָא מִילְּתָא דִשְׁטָרָא.
human_translation: Actually, where he did not say to You are my witnesses. here we are dealing with where he said to I am obligated to you one hundred dinars, in a contract, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: He is obligated word a contract is as authoritative as one who said to You are my witnesses. Reish Lakish said: He is exempt word a contract is not authoritative
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Forever not said to them 'You are my witnesses,' and here with what are we dealing - that he said to him 'I am obligated to you a hundred in a document.' Rabbi Yochanan said: Obligated - say the matter of the document is like one who said to them 'You are witnesses' it is similar. Reish Lakish said: Exempt, not say the matter of the document."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַנּוֹשֵׂא אֶת הָאִשָּׁה וּפָסְקָה עִמּוֹ לָזוּן אֶת בִּתָּהּ חָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים, חַיָּיב לְזוּנָהּ חָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים. מַאי לָאו כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא?
human_translation: We learned One who marries a woman, and she stipulated with him to sustain her daughter five years, is obligated to sustain her five years. What, is it not a case like this,
llm_translation: We learned: One who marries a woman and she lives with him to support her daughter for five years, he is obligated to support her for five years. What is the reason? Is it not because of this quality?

hebrew_text: לָא, בִּשְׁטָרֵי פְסִיקָתָא, וְכִדְרַב גִּידֵּל.
human_translation: No, of documents of stipulation and in accordance with Rav Giddel.
llm_translation: No, in the case of a document of separation, as Rav Gidel said.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: כַּמָּה אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לְבִנְךָ? כָּךְ וְכָךְ. וְכַמָּה אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לְבִתְּךָ? כָּךְ וְכָךְ. עָמְדוּ וְקִידְּשׁוּ — קָנוּ. הֵן הֵן הַדְּבָרִים הַנִּקְנִין בַּאֲמִירָה.
human_translation: As Rav Giddel said Rav said: How much do you give your son? Such and such How much do you give your daughter? Such and such arose and performed the betrothal, acquired These are the things that are acquired through words
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: 'How much do you give to your son?' 'Such and such.' 'And how much do you give to your daughter?' 'Such and such.' They stood and betrothed - they acquired. Indeed, these are the things that are acquired through speech."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, כָּתַב לְכֹהֵן: ״שֶׁאֲנִי חַיָּיב לְךָ חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים״ — חַיָּיב לִיתֵּן לוֹ חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים, וּבְנוֹ אֵינוֹ פָּדוּי.
human_translation: Come hear he wrote to a priest I am obligated to you five sela , he is obligated to give him five sela and his son is not redeemed
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema, katav lekohen: 'she'ani chayav lekha chamish sela'im' — chayav liten lo chamish sela'im, uveno einu paduy." English translation: "Come and hear, he wrote to the priest: 'I am obligated to you five sela'im' — he must give him five sela'im, and his son is not redeemed."

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דִּמְשׁוּעְבַּד לֵיהּ מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא: אִי הָכִי, אַמַּאי כָּתַב? כְּדֵי לְבָרֵר לוֹ כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: It is different there, because he is obligated to him by Torah If that is so, why did he write In order to select for himself a priest
llm_translation: The matter is different there, for it is derived from the Torah: If so, why did he write? In order to clarify for him the priest.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, בְּנוֹ אַמַּאי אֵינוֹ פָּדוּי? כִּדְעוּלָּא. דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה — פָּדוּי לִכְשֶׁיִּתֵּן, וּמַאי טַעְמָא אָמְרוּ בְּנוֹ אֵינוֹ פָּדוּי? גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ פּוֹדִין בִּשְׁטָרוֹת.
human_translation: If that is so, why is his son not redeemed in accordance with Ulla. As Ulla said, by Torah law is redeemed when gives And for what reason did Sages say: His son is not redeemed? decree lest say one can redeem with documents,
llm_translation: If so, why is the son of a mother not redeemed? Like a du'la. As Ula said: Regarding a matter of Torah - it is redeemed when given, so why did they say the son of a mother is not redeemed? A decree lest they say they redeem with documents.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, כְּתַנָּאֵי: עָרֵב הַיּוֹצֵא אַחַר חִיתּוּם שְׁטָרוֹת — גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין.
human_translation: Rava said: like tanna’im a guarantor appears after the signatures contracts, collects from unsold property
llm_translation: Rava said, like the Tannaim: If one acted as a guarantor after the sealing of the documents - he collects from free property.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה בָּא לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וְאָמַר: גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין. אָמַר לוֹ בֶּן נַנָּס: אֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה לֹא מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין וְלֹא מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים.
human_translation: An incident came before Rabbi Yishmael, and he said: collects from unsold property. Ben Nannas said to him: He does not collect not from unsold property, nor from liened property
llm_translation: The matter came before Rabbi Yishmael, and he said: "One may collect debts from free men's property." Ben Nanas said to him: "One may not collect debts from free men's property nor from slaves' property."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: לָמָּה? אָמַר לוֹ: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה חוֹנֵק אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ בַּשּׁוּק, וּמְצָא[וֹ] חֲבֵירוֹ וְאָמַר לוֹ: הַנַּח לוֹ, וַאֲנִי אֶתֵּן לָךְ — פָּטוּר, שֶׁלֹּא עַל אֱמוּנָתוֹ הִלְוָהוּ.
human_translation: said to him: Why? said to him: was strangling another in the marketplace and a friend found and said to Leave him and I will give you exempt did not lend the money based on his trust
llm_translation: He said to him: Why? He said to him: Behold, if he was choking his fellow in the marketplace, and his fellow found him and said to him: Leave him, and I will give you - he is exempt, for he did not lend him on trust.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּאָמַר כְּבֶן נַנָּס.
human_translation: Let us say Rabbi Yoḥanan stated in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, and Reish Lakish stated in accordance with ben Nannas.
llm_translation: Let us say, Rabbi Yochanan said like Rabbi Yishmael, and Reish Lakish said like Ben Nanas.

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דְּבֶן נַנָּס כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי,
human_translation: According to of ben Nannas, everyone agrees
llm_translation: On the matter of Ben Nanas, everyone does not argue.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ — עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הָתָם אֶלָּא דְּשָׁיֵיךְ לֵיהּ לְשִׁיעְבּוּדָא דְאוֹרָיְיתָא, אֲבָל הָכָא לָא שָׁיֵיךְ שִׁיעְבּוּדָא דְאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: When they disagree, it is in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Yoḥanan in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael. And Reish Lakish Rabbi Yishmael states only there, which relates to an obligation of Torah But here, does not relate an obligation of Torah
llm_translation: When they disputed in the study hall of Rabbi Yishmael, Rabbi Yochanan is like Rabbi Yishmael, and Reish Lakish — up to this point Rabbi Yishmael did not say, rather it is fitting for the service of the Torah, but here it is not fitting for the service of the Torah.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: ״כַּמָּה אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לְבִנְךָ?״, ״כָּךְ וְכָךְ״. ״וְכַמָּה אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לְבִתְּךָ?״, ״כָּךְ וְכָךְ״. עָמְדוּ וְקִידְּשׁוּ קָנוּ, הֵן הֵן הַדְּבָרִים הַנִּקְנִים בַּאֲמִירָה.
human_translation: the itself Rav Giddel said Rav said: How much do you give your son? Such and such How much do you give your daughter? Such and such arose and performed the betrothal, acquired These are the things that are acquired through words
llm_translation: The body, Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: "How much do you give to your son?" "Such and such." "And how much do you give to your daughter?" "Such and such." They stood up and sanctified the transaction, these are the things acquired through speech.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִילְּתָא דְּרַב בְּבִתּוֹ נַעֲרָה — דְּקָא מָטֵי הֲנָאָה לִידֵיהּ, אֲבָל בּוֹגֶרֶת דְּלָא מָטֵי הֲנָאָה לִידֵיהּ — לָא.
human_translation: Rava said: Rav’s statement is reasonable in whose daughter a young woman, since derives benefit However, a grown woman, where the does not derive benefit no,
llm_translation: Rava said: It is logical that the matter of Rav concerning his daughter-in-law - for he is deriving pleasure from her, but a virgin who does not bring him pleasure - no.

hebrew_text: וְהָאֱלֹהִים! אָמַר רַב: אֲפִילּוּ בּוֹגֶרֶת. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, אֲבִי הַבֵּן מַאי הֲנָאָה אֲתָא לִידֵיהּ? אֶלָּא בְּהַהִיא הֲנָאָה דְּקָמִיחַתְּנִי אַהֲדָדֵי גָּמְרִי וּמַקְנִי לַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: But by God! Rav said even a grown woman, as, if you do not say so, the father of the groom, what benefit does he derive Rather, in that benefit, that marry each other, fully transfer the rights to each other.
llm_translation: And God! Said Rav: Even with a needle. For if you do not say this, what benefit does the father have from the son? Rather, with that benefit that Ahadadai has finished and given to Hadadai.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: דְּבָרִים הַלָּלוּ נִיתְּנוּ לִיכָּתֵב, אוֹ לֹא נִיתְּנוּ לִיכָּתֵב? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֹא נִיתְּנוּ לִיכָּתֵב.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Are these matters, allowed to be written or not allowed to be written said to him: They are not allowed to be written
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Were these matters given to be written down, or were they not given to be written down? He said to him: They were not given to be written down.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: הַפִּקְחִין הָיוּ כּוֹתְבִין ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאָזוּן אֶת בִּתֵּךְ חָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאַתְּ עִמִּי״! מַאי ״כּוֹתְבִין״ — אוֹמְרִים.
human_translation: raised an objection to The perspicacious would write on the condition that I will sustain your daughter for five years as long as you are with me. What write say.
llm_translation: He raised an objection: The wise men used to write, "On the condition that you will feed your daughter for five years as long as she is with me." What is meant by "they used to write"? - They say.

hebrew_text: וְקָרֵי לֵיהּ לַאֲמִירָה כְּתִיבָה? אִין, וְהָתְנַן: הַכּוֹתֵב לְאִשְׁתּוֹ ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי בִּנְכָסַיִיךְ״, וְתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: Does refer to saying writing? Yes. And so we learned One who writes to his wife: I have no legal or involvement in your properties, and Rabbi Ḥiyya taught One who says to his wife.
llm_translation: And it is read for the purpose of saying, is it written? No, and we learned: One who writes to his wife, "I have no claim on your property," and Rabbi Chiya teaches: One who says to his wife.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אֵין כּוֹתְבִין שְׁטָרֵי אֵירוּסִין וְנִשּׂוּאִין אֶלָּא מִדַּעַת שְׁנֵיהֶם. הָא מִדַּעַת שְׁנֵיהֶם כּוֹתְבִין. מַאי לָאו שְׁטָרֵי פְסִיקָתָא!
human_translation: Come hear One writes documents of betrothal and marriage only with the consent of both of them. with the consent of both of them, one write What, is it not documents of stipulation
llm_translation: Come and hear: One does not write marriage contracts and divorce documents except with the consent of both parties. If both parties consent, they may be written. Why not consider them legally binding documents!

hebrew_text: לָא, שְׁטָרֵי אֵירוּסִין מַמָּשׁ. כִּדְרַב פָּפָּא וְרַב שֵׁרֵבְיָא. דְּאִיתְּמַר: כְּתָבוֹ לִשְׁמָהּ, וְשֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּהּ — רַבָּה וְרָבִינָא אָמְרִי: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב שֵׁרֵבְיָא אָמְרִי: אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: No, actual betrothal documents. in accordance with Rav Pappa and Rav Sherevya. As it was stated: wrote for the sake of but without her consent, Rabba and Ravina say: She is betrothed Rav Pappa and Rav Sherevya say: She is not betrothed.
llm_translation: The document of betrothal is not effective in truth. As Rav Papa and Rav Sheravya said: If he wrote it for her sake, but without her knowledge - Rabbah and Ravina said: She is betrothed. Rav Papa and Rav Sheravya said: She is not betrothed.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מֵתוּ — בְּנוֹתֵיהֶן נִיזּוֹנוֹת מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין, וְהִיא נִיזּוֹנֶת מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא כְּבַעֲלַת חוֹב.
human_translation: Come hear died, their daughters are sustained from unsold property, and she, is sustained from liened property due to that her like a creditor,
llm_translation: Come and hear: when they die — their daughters are sustained from the free property of the sons of free men, and she is sustained from the property of slaves, because she is a creditor.

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בְּשֶׁקָּנוּ מִיָּדוֹ.
human_translation: Here, we are dealing with where acquired from
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - With what he acquired from his hand.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, בָּנוֹת נָמֵי! בְּשֶׁקָּנוּ לָזוֹ וְלֹא קָנוּ לָזוֹ.
human_translation: If that is so, daughters also where they acquired for this and they did not acquire for that
llm_translation: Thus, the daughters are saying! They acquired for this one and did not acquire for this one.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי פַּסְקָא? אִיהִי דַּהֲוַאי בִּשְׁעַת קִנְיָן — מַהֲנֵי לַהּ קִנְיָן, בָּנוֹת דְּלָא הֲווֹ בִּשְׁעַת קִנְיָן — לָא מַהֲנֵי לְהוּ קִנְיָן.
human_translation: What necessary She, was present at the time of the transaction for her the transaction is effective. daughters who were not present at the time of the transaction, for them the transaction is not effective.
llm_translation: And what is the ruling? That which was at the time of acquisition — what is acquired for it, daughters who were not at the time of acquisition — are not acquired for them.

hebrew_text: מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דַּהֲוַאי בִּשְׁעַת קִנְיָן, וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי — כְּגוֹן דְּגָרְשַׁהּ וְאַהְדְּרַהּ!
human_translation: Are we not dealing with were present at the time of the transaction? And what are the circumstances such as where divorced and then took her back,
llm_translation: We are dealing with a case where he was in the process of acquiring, and how is it comparable? For example, he divorced her and then remarried her!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אִיהִי דְּלֵיתַאּ בִּתְנַאי בֵּית דִּין — מַהֲנֵי לַהּ קִנְיָן, בָּנוֹת דְּאִיתַנְהוּ בִּתְנַאי בֵּית דִּין — לָא מַהֲנֵי לְהוּ קִנְיָן.
human_translation: Rather, She, is not included in the stipulation of the court for her the transaction is effective. daughters, who are included in the stipulation of the court, for them the transaction is not effective.
llm_translation: Rather: where there is no stipulation by the court — how does she acquire? Daughters who were stipulated by the court — she does not acquire for them.

hebrew_text: מִגְרָע גָּרְעִי? אֶלָּא: בְּנוֹתָיו הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא — כֵּיוָן דְּאִיתַנְהוּ בִּתְנַאי בֵּית דִּין, אֵימַר צְרָרֵי אֶתְפְּסִינְהוּ.
human_translation: they are worse off? Rather, this is the reason his daughters Since they are included in the stipulation of the court, say that gave them bundles of money
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Is it a deduction of a deduction? Rather, his daughters, that is the reason - since they were given in marriage by the court, we say, 'Bind them together.'"

hebrew_text: לֹא יֹאמַר הָרִאשׁוֹן. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת בַּת אֵצֶל אִמָּהּ.
human_translation: the first may not say Rav Ḥisda said: That is to say daughter with her mother.
llm_translation: The first one should not say. Rav Hisda said: This is what is meant by "a daughter is like her mother."

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי דְּבִגְדוֹלָה עָסְקִינַן? דִּלְמָא בִּקְטַנָּה עָסְקִינַן, וּמִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה.
human_translation: From where we are dealing with of an adult woman Perhaps we are dealing with a minor girl, and due to an incident that occurred.
llm_translation: From what are we dealing with greatness? Perhaps we are dealing with smallness, and because of the incident that occurred.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: מִי שֶׁמֵּת וְהִנִּיחַ בֵּן קָטָן לְאִמּוֹ, יוֹרְשֵׁי הָאָב אוֹמְרִים: יְהֵא גָּדֵל אֶצְלֵנוּ, וְאִמּוֹ אוֹמֶרֶת: יְהֵא בְּנִי גָּדֵל אֶצְלִי — מַנִּיחִין אוֹתוֹ אֵצֶל אִמּוֹ, וְאֵין מַנִּיחִין אוֹתוֹ אֵצֶל רָאוּי לְיוֹרְשׁוֹ. מַעֲשֶׂה הָיָה וּשְׁחָטוּהוּ עֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח!
human_translation: As it is taught one who died and left a minor son to his mother, the heirs of the father say: should grow up with us, and his mother says: My son should grow up with me, one leaves with his mother, and one does not leave with fit to inherit him, An incident occurred, and they slaughtered him on the eve of Passover.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one dies and leaves a young son to his mother, the heirs of the father say: "Let him grow up with us," and his mother says: "Let my son grow up with me." They leave him with his mother, and do not leave him with one who is fit to inherit. There was an incident, and they slaughtered him on the eve of Passover!

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן לִיתְנֵי לְמָקוֹם שֶׁהִיא,
human_translation: If that is so, let teach to the place where she,
llm_translation: If so, let it be given to the place that it is.

hebrew_text: מַאי לִמְקוֹם שֶׁאִמָּהּ? שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ בַּת אֵצֶל הָאֵם, לָא שְׁנָא גְּדוֹלָה וְלָא שְׁנָא קְטַנָּה.
human_translation: What To the place where her mother Conclude from here daughter with mother; no different an adult woman, and no different a minor girl.
llm_translation: What is the law regarding the place of her mother? You heard from her daughter in the presence of her mother, it makes no difference whether she is an adult or a minor.

hebrew_text: לֹא יֹאמְרוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: both of them may not say
llm_translation: They shall not say, "both of them, etc."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאוֹגַר לֵיהּ רִיחְיָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ לִטְחִינָה. לְסוֹף אִיעַתַּר, זְבֵין רִיחְיָא וְחַמְרָא,
human_translation: a certain man who rented out a millstone to another for grinding, In the end, became rich, he purchased millstone and a donkey,
llm_translation: That man who stored spices for his friends for making tahini. Eventually, the spices and vinegar spoiled.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַד הָאִידָּנָא הֲוָה טָחֵינְנָא גַּבָּךְ, הַשְׁתָּא הַב לִי אַגְרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִיטְחָן טָחֵינְנָא לָךְ.
human_translation: said to Until now I would ground by you, Now, give me payment said to him: I will grind for you
llm_translation: He said to him: Until now we were grinding in your favor, now bring me a wage. He said to him: We were grinding for you.

hebrew_text: סְבַר רָבִינָא לְמֵימַר: הַיְינוּ מַתְנִיתִין לֹא יֹאמְרוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם ״הֲרֵי אָנוּ זָנִין אוֹתָהּ כְּאֶחָד״, אֶלָּא אֶחָד זָנָהּ וְאֶחָד נוֹתֵן לָהּ דְּמֵי מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Ravina thought to say this is the same as the mishna both of them may not say: We will sustain as one Rather, one sustains her, the other gives her the monetary of the sustenance.
llm_translation: Ravina thought to say: The Mishnah should not state, "Behold, we will prostitute her like one," rather, one should prostitute her and one should give her the payment for her sustenance.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב עַוִּירָא: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם, חַד כְּרֵיסָא אִית לַהּ, תַּרְתֵּי כְּרֵיסָתָא לֵית לַהּ. הָכָא מָצֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: טְחוֹן וְזַבֵּין, טְחוֹן וְאוֹתֵיב.
human_translation: Rav Avira said to Are the comparable? There, she has one stomach; she does not have two stomachs. Here, is able to say to him: Grind and sell, grind and store
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Avira: Who is similar? There, one has a single beam, here one does not have two beams. Here he found and said to him: Grinding and selling, grinding and sitting.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ טְחִינָא לְרִיחְיָא, אֲבָל אִית לֵיהּ טְחִינָא לְרִיחְיָא — כְּגוֹן זוֹ כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ עַל מִדַּת סְדוֹם.
human_translation: We said only where does not have grinding with the millstone However, he has grinding with the millstone, such as this one forces him conduct of Sodom
llm_translation: And we did not say except that it does not have seasoning for the smell, but if it has seasoning for the smell - such as this, they force him according to the measure of Sodom.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַלְמָנָה שֶׁאָמְרָה: אִי אֶפְשִׁי לָזוּז מִבֵּית בַּעְלִי — אֵין הַיּוֹרְשִׁין יְכוֹלִין לוֹמַר לָהּ: ״לְכִי לְבֵית אָבִיךְ וְאָנוּ זָנִין אוֹתָךְ״, אֶלָּא זָנִין אוֹתָהּ, וְנוֹתְנִין לָהּ מָדוֹר לְפִי כְּבוֹדָהּ.
human_translation: a widow who said: I do not want to move from my husband’s house, the heirs are not able to say to her: Go to your father’s house and we will sustain you. Rather, they sustain her and they give her living quarters befitting her dignity.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A widow who said, "If I do not consent to be moved from my husband's house - the heirs cannot say to her, 'Go to your father's house and we will support you,' but rather they support her and provide her with a dwelling according to her honor.

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה: ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי לָזוּז מִבֵּית אַבָּא״ — יְכוֹלִין הַיּוֹרְשִׁין לוֹמַר לָהּ: אִם אַתְּ אֶצְלֵנוּ — יֵשׁ לִיךְ מְזוֹנוֹת, וְאִם אֵין אַתְּ אֶצְלֵנוּ אֵין לִיךְ מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: she said: I do not want to move from my father’s house, the heirs are able to say to her: If you are with us, you have sustenance but if you are not with us, you not have sustenance
llm_translation: She said: "If you are willing to move from the house of your father" - the heirs can say to her: "If you are with us - you have sustenance, and if you are not with us - you do not have sustenance."

hebrew_text: אִם הָיְתָה טוֹעֶנֶת מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא יַלְדָּה וְהֵן יְלָדִים — זָנִין אוֹתָהּ וְהִיא בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: If she argued because she is young, and they, are young, they sustain her and she in her father’s house.
llm_translation: If she was spinning because she is a minor and they are minors - they may feed her and she remains in her father's house.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִשְׁתַּמֶּשֶׁת בַּמָּדוֹר כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁמִּשְׁתַּמֶּשֶׁת בְּחַיֵּי בַעְלָהּ. בַּעֲבָדִים וּשְׁפָחוֹת כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁמִּשְׁתַּמֶּשֶׁת בְּחַיֵּי בַעְלָהּ. בְּכָרִים וּכְסָתוֹת כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁמִּשְׁתַּמֶּשֶׁת בְּחַיֵּי בַעְלָהּ. בִּכְלֵי כֶסֶף וּבִכְלֵי זָהָב כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁמִּשְׁתַּמֶּשֶׁת בְּחַיֵּי בַעְלָהּ. שֶׁכָּךְ כָּתַב לָהּ: ״וְאַתְּ תְּהֵא יָתְבַתְּ בְּבֵיתִי וּמִיתַּזְנָא מִנִּכְסַי כֹּל יְמֵי מֵגַר אַרְמְלוּתִיךְ בְּבֵיתִי״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: uses the living quarters in the manner that she use in her husband’s lifetime. the slaves and the maidservants in the manner that she use in her husband’s lifetime, the pillows and the sheets in the manner that she use in her husband’s lifetime, the silver utensils and gold utensils in the manner that she use in her husband’s lifetime. because this he wrote to her And you will reside in my house and be sustained from my property all the days that you live in my house as a widow.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who uses the dining room should do so in the manner that she uses her husband's life. With regard to male and female slaves, one should use them in the manner that she uses her husband's life. With regard to livestock and clothing, one should use them in the manner that she uses her husband's life. With regard to silver and gold vessels, one should use them in the manner that she uses her husband's life. For thus it is written to her: "And you shall sit in my house, and not commit harlotry, and not be bound by any man's estate all the days of your life in my house."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: ״בְּבֵיתִי״ — וְלֹא בְּבִקְתִּי.
human_translation: Rav Yosef taught: in my house, And not in my hut.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita by Rav Yosef: "In my house" — and not in my field.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: יְתוֹמִים שֶׁמָּכְרוּ מְדוֹר אַלְמָנָה — לֹא עָשׂוּ וְלֹא כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: Orphans who sold the living quarters of a widow did not do anything,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Orphans who sold the property of a widow - they did not act and they did not finish.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מִדְּרַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן? דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יְתוֹמִים שֶׁקָּדְמוּ וּמָכְרוּ בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִין — מַה שֶּׁמָּכְרוּ מָכְרוּ.
human_translation: And what different from that which Rabbi Asi Rabbi Yoḥanan said? As Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: orphans who preemptively sold from the small quantity of property what they sold is sold,
llm_translation: And what is the difference from Rabbi Assi? Rabbi Yochanan said: For Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Orphans who came forward and sold with a small amount of property - whatever they sold, they sold.

hebrew_text: הָתָם לָא מִשְׁתַּעְבְּדִי לַהּ מֵחַיִּים, הָכָא מִשְׁתַּעְבְּדִי לַהּ מֵחַיִּים.
human_translation: There, is not mortgaged to from lifetime Here, mortgaged to her from lifetime
llm_translation: There, not serve to her from living, here serve to her from living.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, נְקִיטִינַן: מְדוֹר אַלְמָנָה שֶׁנָּפַל — אֵין הַיּוֹרְשִׁין חַיָּיבִין לִבְנוֹתוֹ,
human_translation: Abaye said: We hold a widow’s living quarters that collapsed, the heirs are not obligated to rebuild it,
llm_translation: Abbaye said, we take hold of: a dwelling of a widow that collapsed - the heirs are not obligated to rebuild it.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מְדוֹר אַלְמָנָה שֶׁנָּפַל — אֵין הַיּוֹרְשִׁין חַיָּיבִין לִבְנוֹתוֹ. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת ״הַנִּיחוּנִי וְאֶבְנֶנּוּ מִשֶּׁלִּי״ — אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לָהּ.
human_translation: This is also taught a widow’s living quarters that collapsed, the heirs are not obligated to rebuild it. And not only but if she says: Leave me and I will rebuild it from my own one does not listen to her,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Namai the Elder said: If a widow's dwelling collapses, the heirs are not obligated to rebuild it. And not only that, but even if she says, "Leave me and let it be built from my own," we do not listen to her.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי אַבָּיֵי: שִׁיפְּצָה, מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Abaye raised a dilemma: she repaired what shall stand
llm_translation: Ba'ei Abaye: Shipetza, mai? Teiku.

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה אִי אֶפְשִׁי.
human_translation: she said: I do not want
llm_translation: She said: "I will not be appeased."

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְּבוּ לַהּ כִּי יָתְבָה הָתָם? מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: בִּרְכַּת הַבַּיִת בְּרוּבָּה.
human_translation: And They should give her as she were living there, supports Rav Huna, as Rav Huna said: The blessing of the house is in its abundance
llm_translation: And they should sit for her when she sits there? It supports for Rav Huna. For Rav Huna said: The blessing of the house is in a large group.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְּבוּ לַהּ לְפִי בִּרְכַּת הַבַּיִת? הָכִי נָמֵי.
human_translation: And they should give her according to the blessing of the house, Indeed,
llm_translation: And should they sit for her according to the blessing of the house? So it is stated.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לְשׁוֹן חֲכָמִים בְּרָכָה, לְשׁוֹן חֲכָמִים עוֹשֶׁר, לְשׁוֹן חֲכָמִים מַרְפֵּא. בְּרָכָה הָא דַּאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: language of the Sages blessing, language of the Sages wealth, language of the Sages healing. blessing, that which we said
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: The language of the sages is a blessing, the language of the sages is wealth, the language of the sages is healing. "A blessing, as we have said."

hebrew_text: עוֹשֶׁר, דִּתְנַן: הַמּוֹכֵר פֵּירוֹת לַחֲבֵירוֹ, מָשַׁךְ וְלֹא מָדַד — קָנָה, מָדַד וְלֹא מָשַׁךְ — לֹא קָנָה. וְאִם הָיָה פִּקֵּחַ — שׂוֹכֵר אֶת מְקוֹמוֹ.
human_translation: wealth, as we learned One who sells produce to another, pulled but did not measure he has acquired he measured but did not pull he has not acquired And if was perspicacious rent the place
llm_translation: Wealth, as we learned: One who sells fruits to his fellow, if he stretched the measuring rope and did not measure - he acquired; if he measured and did not stretch - he did not acquire. And if he was discerning - he rents out his place.

hebrew_text: מַרְפֵּא, דִּתְנַן: לֹא יִלְעוֹס אָדָם חִטִּין וְיַנִּיחַ עַל גַּבֵּי מַכָּתוֹ בַּפֶּסַח, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּחְמִיצוֹת.
human_translation: healing, as we learned A person should not chew wheat and place it on his wound during Passover because will become leavened
llm_translation: Healer, as we learned: A person should not chew wheat and place it on the wound on Passover, because it ferments.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, בִּשְׁעַת פְּטִירָתוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי, אָמַר: לְבָנַי אֲנִי צָרִיךְ. נִכְנְסוּ בָּנָיו אֶצְלוֹ. אָמַר לָהֶם: הִזָּהֲרוּ בִּכְבוֹד אִמְּכֶם. נֵר יְהֵא דָּלוּק בִּמְקוֹמוֹ, שׁוּלְחָן יְהֵא עָרוּךְ בִּמְקוֹמוֹ, מִטָּה תְּהֵא מוּצַּעַת בִּמְקוֹמָהּ. יוֹסֵף חׇפְנִי שִׁמְעוֹן אֶפְרָתִי הֵם שִׁמְּשׁוּנִי בְּחַיַּי, וְהֵם יְשַׁמְּשׁוּנִי בְּמוֹתִי.
human_translation: The Sages taught: At the time of the passing of Rabbi he said: I need my sons. His sons entered his He said to them Be careful with the honor of your mother. lamp should be lit in its place, table should be set in its place, the bed should be arranged in its place. Yosef Ḥeifani Shimon Efrati; they served me during my lifetime and they will serve me in my death.
llm_translation: The sages taught: At the time of Rabbi's passing, he said: "My sons, I am in need." His sons entered to him. He said to them: "Be careful with the honor of your mother. Let the lamp be lit in its place, let the table be set in its place, let the bed be made in its place." Joseph the silent, Shimon the righteous, they served me in my life, and they will serve me in my death.

hebrew_text: הִזָּהֲרוּ בִּכְבוֹד אִמְּכֶם. דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא, דִּכְתִיב: ״כַּבֵּד אֶת אָבִיךָ וְאֶת אִמֶּךָ״! אֵשֶׁת אָב הֲוַאי.
human_translation: Be careful with the honor of your mother. this by Torah as it is written: “Honor your father and your mother” She was father’s wife.
llm_translation: Be cautious with the honor of your mother, for it is a biblical commandment, as it is written: "Honor your father and your mother"! The wife of one's father is included.

hebrew_text: אֵשֶׁת אָב נָמֵי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״כַּבֵּד אֶת אָבִיךָ וְאֶת אִמֶּךָ״, ״אֶת אָבִיךָ״ — זוֹ אֵשֶׁת אָבִיךָ, ״וְאֶת אִמֶּךָ״ — זוֹ בַּעַל אִמֶּךָ, וָיו יְתֵירָה — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת אָחִיךָ הַגָּדוֹל!
human_translation: a father’s wife is also by Torah as it is taught Honor your father [ et avikha ] and your mother [ ve’et immekha ]. Your father; this your father’s wife. And your mother; this your mother’s husband. the extra vav , to add your older brother
llm_translation: The wife of one's father is as the Torah, as it is taught: "Honor your father and your mother," "your father" - this is the wife of your father, "and your mother" - this is the husband of your mother, and the additional "and" - to include your older brother!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי מֵחַיִּים, אֲבָל לְאַחַר מִיתָה לָא.
human_translation: This applies during lifetime. However, following death, no,
llm_translation: These are matters of the living, but not after death.

hebrew_text: ״נֵר יְהֵא דָּלוּק בִּמְקוֹמוֹ, שׁוּלְחָן יְהֵא עָרוּךְ בִּמְקוֹמוֹ, מִטָּה תְּהֵא מוּצַּעַת בִּמְקוֹמָהּ״, מַאי טַעְמָא? כֹּל בֵּי שִׁמְשֵׁי הֲוָה אָתֵי לְבֵיתֵיהּ.
human_translation: lamp should be lit in its place, table should be set in its place, the bed should be arranged in its place. What is the reason Every Shabbat eve, would come to his house
llm_translation: "The lamp should be lit in its place, the table should be set in its place, the bed should be made in its place." What is the reason? So that all the members of the household will come to their home."

hebrew_text: הַהוּא בֵּי שִׁמְשָׁא אֲתַאי שִׁבָבְתָּא, קָא קָרְיָה אַבָּבָא, אֲמַרָה אַמְּתֵיהּ: שְׁתִיקוּ, דְּרַבִּי יָתֵיב. כֵּיוָן דִּשְׁמַע, שׁוּב לָא אֲתָא, שֶׁלֹּא לְהוֹצִיא לַעַז עַל צַדִּיקִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים.
human_translation: a certain Shabbat eve neighbor came called at the door. His maidservant said Be quiet, for Rabbi is sitting. When he heard he did not come again, so as not to cast aspersions on earlier righteous
llm_translation: That one, the son of Shimsa, came to Shavbata, he was calling "Abava." His mother said to him: "Be silent, for Rabbi Yateiv is sitting." Once he heard, he did not come back, so as not to bring disgrace upon the righteous of former generations.

hebrew_text: ״יוֹסֵף חׇפְנִי שִׁמְעוֹן אֶפְרָתִי, הֵם שִׁמְּשׁוּנִי בְּחַיַּי וְהֵם יְשַׁמְּשׁוּנִי בְּמוֹתִי״. סְבוּר מִינָּה בְּהָדֵין עָלְמָא הוּא דְּקָאָמַר, כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דְּקָדֵים עַרְסַיְיהוּ לְעַרְסֵיהּ, אָמְרִי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְהָהוּא עָלְמָא הוּא דְּקָאָמַר.
human_translation: Yosef Ḥeifani Shimon Efrati, they served me during my lifetime and they will serve me in my death. understood from was speaking of this world, when they saw that their biers preceded his bier, they said: Conclude from here that he was speaking of that world.
llm_translation: "Yosef Hofni Shimon Ephrati, they served me in my life, and they will serve me in my death." He thought in that case it is the general principle he is saying, once they saw that their predecessors were serving their successors, they said: infer from this that it is that world he is speaking about.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי דַּאֲמַר הָכִי — דְּלָא לֵימְרוּ: מִילְּתָא הֲוַאי לְהוּ וְעַד הָאִידָּנָא נָמֵי זְכוּתוֹ דְּרַבִּי הוּא דְּאַהַנְיָא לְהוּ.
human_translation: And the he said this people should not say: There was something with them, and until now, too, it was the merit of Rabbi that benefited them
llm_translation: And this that he said thus - that not they should say: a matter it was to him, and until now also the merit of Rabbi it is that he benefits them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: לְחַכְמֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲנִי צָרִיךְ. נִכְנְסוּ אֶצְלוֹ חַכְמֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, אָמַר לָהֶן: ״אַל תִּסְפְּדוּנִי בָּעֲיָירוֹת,
human_translation: said to I need the Sages of Israel. The Sages of Israel entered his He said to them: Do not eulogize me in the towns
llm_translation: He said to them: "I need the sages of Israel." The sages of Israel came to him, and he said to them: "Do not eulogize me in the cities,

hebrew_text: וְהוֹשִׁיבוּ יְשִׁיבָה לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״. ״שִׁמְעוֹן בְּנִי חָכָם, גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּנִי נָשִׂיא, חֲנִינָא בַּר חָמָא יֵשֵׁב בָּרֹאשׁ״.
human_translation: and reconvene the yeshiva after thirty days My son Shimon is a Sage. My son Gamliel Nasi . Ḥanina bar Ḥama will sit at the head
llm_translation: "And they shall establish a session after thirty days." "Shimon, my son, the wise one; Gamliel, my son, the prince; Chanina, son of Chama, shall sit at the head."

hebrew_text: אַל תִּסְפְּדוּנִי בָּעֲיָירוֹת — סְבוּר מִינַּהּ מִשּׁוּם טִרְחָא הוּא דְּקָאָמַר. כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דְּקָסָפְדִי בִּכְרַכִּים וְקָאָתוּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא, אָמְרוּ: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִשּׁוּם יְקָרָא הוּא דְּקָאָמַר.
human_translation: Do not eulogize me in the towns. understood from that he said this due to the trouble when they saw that they were eulogizing him in the cities and everyone came they said: Conclude from here that he said this due to honor.
llm_translation: Do not eulogize me in the cities - he thought that it is because of the trouble that he is saying. Once they saw that he eulogized in the villages and everyone came, they said: Understand from this that it is because of honor that he is saying.

hebrew_text: הוֹשִׁיבוּ יְשִׁיבָה לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — דְּלָא עֲדִיפְנָא מִמֹּשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּבְכּוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת מֹשֶׁה בְּעַרְבוֹת מוֹאָב שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״, תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין סָפְדִין בִּימָמָא וְלֵילְיָא, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ סָפְדוּ בִּימָמָא וְגָרְסִי בְּלֵילְיָא, אוֹ סָפְדוּ בְּלֵילְיָא וְגָרְסִי בִּימָמָא, עַד דְּסָפְדִי תְּרֵיסַר יַרְחֵי שַׁתָּא.
human_translation: Reconvene the yeshiva after thirty days because I am not better than Moses, our teacher, as it is written: “And the children of Israel wept for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days” thirty days they eulogized by day and night. From this forward they eulogized by day and they studied by night, or they eulogized by night and studied by day, until they eulogized for twelve months the year.
llm_translation: Establish a session after thirty days - for we do not prefer it over our teacher Moses, as it is written: "And the children of Israel wept for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days." For thirty days they eulogized by day and by night; from here on, they eulogized by day and read by night, or they eulogized by night and read by day, until they eulogized for twelve months.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא יוֹמָא דְּאַשְׁכָּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי נְפַקָא בַּת קָלָא וַאֲמַרָה: כֹּל דַּהֲוָה בְּאַשְׁכָּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי, מְזוּמָּן הוּא לְחַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. הָהוּא כּוֹבֵס כֹּל יוֹמָא הֲוָה אָתֵי קַמֵּיהּ, הָהוּא יוֹמָא לָא אֲתָא. כֵּיוָן דִּשְׁמַע הָכִי, סְלֵיק לְאִיגָּרָא וּנְפַל לְאַרְעָא וּמִית. יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: אַף הַהוּא כּוֹבֵס מְזוּמָּן הוּא לְחַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: on the day of the funeral Rabbi a Divine Voice emerged and said: Whoever was at the funeral of Rabbi is destined for life the World-to-Come. a certain launderer would come before every day. On that day, he did not come When he heard this, he ascended to the roof and fell to the ground and died. A Divine Voice emerged and said: That launderer too is destined for life the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: On that day when Rabbi's soul departed, Bat Kol emerged and said: "Anyone who is present at the time of Rabbi's passing is destined for the World to Come." There was a certain launderer who would come every day before him, but one day he did not come. When he heard this, he ascended to the roof, fell to the ground, and died. Bat Kol went forth and said: "That launderer too is destined for the World to Come."

hebrew_text: שִׁמְעוֹן בְּנִי חָכָם — מַאי קָאָמַר? הָכִי קָאָמַר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשִּׁמְעוֹן בְּנִי חָכָם, גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּנִי נָשִׂיא.
human_translation: My son Shimon is a Sage; What he saying, This is what he saying: Although my son Shimon is a Sage, my son Gamliel Nasi .
llm_translation: Shimon Beni Chacham - what is he saying? This is what he is saying: Even though Shimon Beni Chacham, Gamliel Beni Nasi.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לֵוִי: צְרִיכָא לְמֵימַר? אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר רַבִּי: צְרִיכָא לָךְ וּלְמַטְלַעְתָּךְ. מַאי קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ — הָא קְרָא קָאָמַר: ״וְאֶת הַמַּמְלָכָה נָתַן לִיהוֹרָם כִּי הוּא הַבְּכוֹר״!
human_translation: Levi said: Need this be said? Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi said: necessary for you and for your limp. What did difficult Doesn’t the verse state: “But the kingdom he gave to Jehoram because he was the firstborn”
llm_translation: Levi said: Is it necessary to say? Rabbi Shimon son of Rabbi said: It is necessary for you and for your bed. What is difficult for him? - This verse is what it says: "And he gave the kingdom to Jehoram because he was the firstborn!"

hebrew_text: הַהוּא, מְמַלֵּא מְקוֹם אֲבוֹתָיו הֲוָה, וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אֵינוֹ מְמַלֵּא מְקוֹם אֲבוֹתָיו הֲוָה.
human_translation: He, filled the place of his fathers, Rabban Gamliel did not fill the place of his fathers,
llm_translation: That one, fulfilling the place of his forefathers was, and Rabban Gamliel does not fulfill the place of his forefathers was.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מַאי טַעְמָא עֲבַד הָכִי? נְהִי דְּאֵינוֹ מְמַלֵּא מְקוֹם אֲבוֹתָיו בְּחׇכְמָה — בְּיִרְאַת חֵטְא מְמַלֵּא מְקוֹם אֲבוֹתָיו הֲוָה.
human_translation: And what is the reason Rabbi did this? Although he did not fill the place of his fathers with regard to wisdom, he did fill the place of his fathers with regard to fear of sin
llm_translation: Rabbi, what is the reason he did so? Because even though he does not fill the place of his fathers with wisdom, he fills the place of his fathers with fear of sin.

hebrew_text: חֲנִינָא בַּר חָמָא יֵשֵׁב בָּרֹאשׁ — לֹא קִיבֵּל רַבִּי חֲנִינָא, שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי אַפָּס גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים וּמֶחֱצָה. יְתֵיב רַבִּי אַפָּס בְּרֵישָׁא וִיתֵיב רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אַבָּרַאי, וַאֲתָא לֵוִי וִיתֵיב גַּבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Ḥanina bar Ḥama will sit at the head Rabbi Ḥanina did not accept because Rabbi Afes was older than him two and a half years Rabbi Afes sat at the head and Rabbi Ḥanina sat outside, And Levi came and sat with him
llm_translation: Hanina bar Hama sat at the head — Rabbi Hanina did not accept, for Rabbi Appas was greater than him by two and a half years. Rabbi Appas sat at the beginning, and Rabbi Hanina the son of Abba sat, and Levi came and sat beside him.

hebrew_text: נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַפָּס וִיתֵיב רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בְּרֵישָׁא, וְלָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְלֵוִי אִינִישׁ לְמֵיתַב גַּבֵּיהּ, וְקָאָתֵא לְבָבֶל. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי לֵיהּ לְרַב: גַּבְרָא רַבָּה אִקְּלַע לִנְהַרְדְּעָא וּמַטְלַע וְדָרֵישׁ כְּלִילָא שְׁרֵי. אֲמַר: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַפָּס, וִיתֵיב רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בְּרֵישָׁא, וְלָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְלֵוִי אִינִישׁ לְמֵיתַב גַּבֵּיהּ, וְקָאָתֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Afes died, and Rabbi Ḥanina, sat at the head And Levi did not have anyone to sit with, and he came to Babylonia. And this is they said to Rav: A great man came to Neharde’a, and he limps, and he taught: is permitted kelila , said: Conclude from this Rabbi Afes died and Rabbi Ḥanina, sat at the head and Levi did not have anyone to sit with, and he came
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The soul of Rabbi Apsus rested, and Rabbi Chanina sat at the beginning, and there was no man named Levi to sit opposite him, and he was going to Babylon. And this is what they said to Rav: A great man who falls into a river and swims and studies Torah like a full vessel. He said: Learn from this that the soul of Rabbi Apsus rested, and Rabbi Chanina sat at the beginning, and there was no man named Levi to sit opposite him, and he was going.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא, רַבִּי חֲנִינָא נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ וְרַבִּי אַפָּס כְּדִיתֵיב יְתֵיב, וְלָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְלֵוִי אִינִישׁ לְמֵיתַב גַּבֵּיהּ וְקָאָתֵי? אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לֵוִי לְרַבִּי אַפָּס מִיכָּף הֲוָה כַּיִיף לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Say Rabbi Ḥanina died, Rabbi Afes sat as he had sat, and Levi did not have anyone to sit with, and he came If you wish, say Levi was subordinate to Rabbi Afes
llm_translation: And why not? Rabbi Chanina passed away, and Rabbi Apsus sat down. And Levi was not there to sit next to him and engage in discussion? If you wish, say: Levi was busy with Rabbi Apsus, enjoying his company.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר ״רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר חָמָא יֵשֵׁב בָּרֹאשׁ״ — לָא סַגִּי דְּלָא מָלֵיךְ, דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ בְּצַדִּיקִים: ״וְתִגְזַר אוֹמֶר וְיָקׇם לָךְ״.
human_translation: And if you wish, say since Rabbi said: Ḥanina bar Ḥama will sit at the head it is not possible that he will not rule as it is written about the righteous: “You shall also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto you”
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Since Rabbi Chanina bar Chama said, "Yeshiv barosh" - it is not sufficient, for it is written in them with the righteous: "And decree a thing, and it shall be established unto you."

hebrew_text: וְהָא הֲוָה רַבִּי חִיָּיא! נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ. וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אֲנִי רָאִיתִי קִבְרוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי, וְהוֹרַדְתִּי עָלָיו דְּמָעוֹת! אֵיפוֹךְ.
human_translation: But wasn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya He died But didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya say: I saw the grave site of Rabbi and I shed tears over it? Reverse
llm_translation: And this was Rabbi Chiya! May his soul rest in peace. And Rabbi Chiya said: I saw the grave of Rabbi, and I poured tears upon it! Turn around.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם שֶׁמֵּת רַבִּי בָּטְלָה קְדוּשָּׁה! אֵיפוֹךְ.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya say: that day that Rabbi died, sanctity ceased? Reverse
llm_translation: And he said Rabbi Chiya: That day that Rabbi died, holiness ceased! Conversely.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: כְּשֶׁחָלָה רַבִּי, נִכְנַס רַבִּי חִיָּיא אֶצְלוֹ וּמְצָאוֹ שֶׁהוּא בּוֹכֶה, אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, מִפְּנֵי מָה אַתָּה בּוֹכֶה? וְהָתַנְיָא: מֵת מִתּוֹךְ הַשְּׂחוֹק — סִימָן יָפֶה לוֹ, מִתּוֹךְ הַבֶּכִי — סִימָן רַע לוֹ. פָּנָיו לְמַעְלָה — סִימָן יָפֶה לוֹ, פָּנָיו לְמַטָּה — סִימָן רַע לוֹ. פָּנָיו כְּלַפֵּי הָעָם — סִימָן יָפֶה לוֹ, כְּלַפֵּי הַכּוֹתֶל — סִימָן רַע לוֹ. פָּנָיו יְרוּקִּין — סִימָן רַע לוֹ, פָּנָיו צְהוּבִּין וַאֲדוּמִּים — סִימָן יָפֶה לוֹ. מֵת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — סִימָן יָפֶה לוֹ. בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת — סִימָן רַע לוֹ. מֵת בְּעֶרֶב יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — סִימָן רַע לוֹ, בְּמוֹצָאֵי יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — סִימָן יָפֶה לוֹ. מֵת מֵחוֹלִי מֵעַיִים — סִימָן יָפֶה לוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרוּבָּם שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים מִיתָתָן בְּחוֹלִי מֵעַיִים.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught When Rabbi fell ill, Rabbi Ḥiyya entered with him and found him crying. He said to him: My teacher, for what are you crying? Isn’t it taught dies while laughing, it is a good sign for him; while crying, it is a bad sign for him. his face upward, it is a good sign for him; his face downward, it is a bad sign for him. his face facing the people it is a good sign for him; his face facing the wall, it is a bad sign for him. face sallow, it is a bad sign for him; his face yellow or ruddy, it is a good sign for him. dies on the Shabbat eve it is a good sign for him, at the conclusion of Shabbat it is a bad sign for him. dies on the eve of Yom Kippur, it is a bad sign for him, the conclusion of Yom Kippur it is a good sign for him, dies due to an intestinal disease, it is a good sign for him, because most of the righteous die due to intestinal disease.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: When Rabbi became ill, Rabbi Chiya entered to visit him and found him crying. He said to him: Rabbi, why are you crying? And it was taught: If one dies while laughing, it is a good sign for him; if one dies while weeping, it is a bad sign for him. If his face is upwards, it is a good sign for him; if his face is downwards, it is a bad sign for him. If his face is towards the people, it is a good sign for him; if his face is towards the wall, it is a bad sign for him. If his face is green, it is a bad sign for him; if his face is pale or red, it is a good sign for him. If one dies on Friday evening, it is a good sign for him. On the eve of the Sabbath, it is a bad sign for him. If one dies on the eve of Yom Kippur, it is a bad sign for him; on the eve of Yom Kippur itself, it is a good sign for him. If one dies from intestinal illness, it is a good sign for him, because the death of the righteous is through intestinal illness.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא אַתּוֹרָה וּמִצְוֹת קָא בָכֵינָא!
human_translation: said to him: I am crying for the Torah and the mitzvot
llm_translation: He said to him: "I Torah and commandments am weeping!"

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא אֵיפוֹךְ, וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ, רַבִּי חִיָּיא עָסוּק בְּמִצְוֹת הֲוָה וְרַבִּי סָבַר לָא אֲפַגְּרֵיהּ.
human_translation: If you wish, say reverse And if you wish, say actually do not reverse Rabbi Ḥiyya was occupied with mitzvot and Rabbi thought: I will not hold him back
llm_translation: If you wish, say "turn around," and if you wish, say "do not turn around." Rabbi Chiya was engaged in fulfilling commandments, and Rabbi Savar did not agree with him.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּכִי הֲווֹ מִינְּצוּ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא: בַּהֲדֵי דִידִי מִינְּצֵת? דְּאִם חַס וְשָׁלוֹם נִשְׁתַּכְּחָה תּוֹרָה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, מַהְדַּרְנָא לֵיהּ מִפִּלְפּוּלַי.
human_translation: And this is when Rabbi Ḥanina and Rabbi Ḥiyya argued. Rabbi Ḥanina said to Rabbi Ḥiyya: You are arguing with me? If, Heaven forfend, the Torah would be forgotten from the Jewish people, I would restore it through my analyses,
llm_translation: And this is what happened when Rabbi Chanina and Rabbi Chiya were sitting together, Rabbi Chanina said to Rabbi Chiya: "Have you found favor in our eyes? For if God forbid the Torah were to depart from Israel, we would return it from our ruins."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אֲנָא עֲבַדִי דְּלָא מִשְׁתַּכְחָה תּוֹרָה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל. דְּאַיְיתִינָא כִּיתָּנָא וְשָׁדֵיינָא, וּמְגַדֵּלְנָא נִישְׁבֵּי, וְצָיֵידְנָא טְבֵי(א), וּמַאֲכֵילְנָא בִּישְׂרָא לְיַתְמֵי, וְאָרֵיכְנָא מְגִילְּתָא מִמַּשְׁכֵי דִטְבֵי, וְסָלֵיקְנָא לְמָתָא דְּלֵית בַּהּ מַקְרֵי דַרְדְּקֵי, וְכָתֵיבְנָא חַמְשָׁא חוּמְשֵׁי לְחַמְשָׁא יָנוֹקֵי, וּמַתְנֵינָא שִׁיתָּא סִידְרֵי לְשִׁיתָּא יָנוֹקֵי, לְכֹל חַד וְחַד אֲמַרִי לֵיהּ אַתְנִי סִידְרָךְ לְחַבְרָךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya said I am working that the Torah will not be forgotten from the Jewish people. For I bring flax and I plant it, and I weave nets I trap deer, and I feed meat to orphans, and I form scrolls from the skins of the deer. And I go to a town that has no teachers of children in it and I write the five books for five children. And I teach the six orders to six children. To each and every one I say: Teach your order to your friends.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Chiya: I, who am a servant, am that the Torah did not become forgotten from Israel. For we bring flax and weave it, and make nets, and catch deer, and feed the orphans in Israel, and we lengthen the scroll from the threads of the linen, and we go out to a town that has no millstones, and we write five lines for five children, and we teach six orders to six children, to each and every one we say, "Teach your order to your friend."

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי: כַּמָּה גְּדוֹלִים מַעֲשֵׂה חִיָּיא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי: אֲפִילּוּ מִמְּךָ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֲפִילּוּ מֵאַבָּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חַס וְשָׁלוֹם, לֹא תְּהֵא כָּזֹאת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: And this is Rabbi said: How great are the actions of Ḥiyya. Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi said to Even than your He said to him: Yes. Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said to Even than father? said to him: Heaven forfend. Such should not be among the Jewish people.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And this is what Rabbi said: How great are the deeds of Ḥiyya. Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi, said to him: Even greater than you? He said to him: No. Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said to him: Even greater than my father? He said to him: Heaven forbid, may it not be so in Israel."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: לִבְנִי קָטָן אֲנִי צָרִיךְ. נִכְנַס רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אֶצְלוֹ, מָסַר לוֹ סִדְרֵי חׇכְמָה,
human_translation: He said to them: I need my younger son. Rabbi Shimon entered his He transmitted to him the orders of wisdom,
llm_translation: He said to them: "For my young son I need." Rabbi Shimon entered to him, he handed to him the order of wisdom,

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: לִבְנִי גָּדוֹל אֲנִי צָרִיךְ. נִכְנַס רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אֶצְלוֹ, וּמָסַר לוֹ סִדְרֵי נְשִׂיאוּת. אָמַר לוֹ: ״בְּנִי, נְהוֹג נְשִׂיאוּתָךְ בְּרָמִים, זְרוֹק מָרָה בַּתַּלְמִידִים״.
human_translation: He said to them: I need my older son. Rabban Gamliel entered his and transmitted to him the procedures of the Nasi . said to My son, conduct your Nasi with assertiveness cast fear upon students,
llm_translation: He said to them: "I need a large brick." Rabban Gamliel entered to him, and handed him the order of leadership. He said to him: "My son, conduct your leadership with compassion, and instill awe in the disciples."

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״וְאֶת יִרְאֵי ה׳ יְכַבֵּד״, וְאָמַר מָר: זֶה יְהוֹשָׁפָט מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה, כְּשֶׁהָיָה רוֹאֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הָיָה עוֹמֵד מִכִּסְּאוֹ, וּמְחַבְּקוֹ וּמְנַשְּׁקוֹ, וְקוֹרֵא לוֹ: רַבִּי רַבִּי, מָרִי מָרִי!
human_translation: Is that so But isn’t it written: “But he honors those that fear the Lord” and the Master said: This Jehoshaphat, king of Judea. When he would see a Torah scholar he would rise from his throne and hug him and kiss him and call to him: My teacher, my teacher, my master, my master.
llm_translation: I? But isn't it written: "And those who honor Hashem, He will honor"? And the Master said: This is King Yehoshafat of Judah. When he would see a Torah scholar, he would rise from his throne, embrace and kiss him, and call him: "My teacher, my teacher, my master, my master!"

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּצִינְעָא, הָא בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא.
human_translation: not difficult. This in private, that in public,
llm_translation: Not difficult: here in Tzine'a, here in Parhesya.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי מוּטָל בְּצִיפּוֹרִי, וּמָקוֹם מוּכָן לוֹ בְּבֵית שְׁעָרִים. וְהָתַנְיָא: ״צֶדֶק צֶדֶק תִּרְדֹּף״ — הַלֵּךְ אַחַר רַבִּי לְבֵית שְׁעָרִים!
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi lying Tzippori and a site was ready for him in Beit She’arim. But isn’t it taught “Justice, justice shall you follow” follow Rabbi to Beit She’arim,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Mutal in Tsippori, and a designated place for him in Beit She'arim. And it was taught: "Justice, justice you shall pursue" - follow Rabbi to Beit She'arim!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי בְּבֵית שְׁעָרִים הֲוָה, אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן דַּחֲלַשׁ אַמְטְיוּהִי לְצִיפּוֹרִי,
human_translation: Rabbi was in Beit She’arim, but when he became ill they transferred him to Tzippori,
llm_translation: Rabbi in Beit She'arim was, rather once he weakened his arm to the birds,

hebrew_text: דְּמִדַּלְיָא וּבְסִים אַוֵּירָא.
human_translation: which is high and air is scented.
llm_translation: From Dilaya and Besim, the air comes forth.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא יוֹמָא דְּנָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי, גְּזַרוּ רַבָּנַן תַּעֲנִיתָא, וּבְעוֹ רַחֲמֵי, וְאָמְרִי: כֹּל מַאן דְּאָמַר ״נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי״ — יִדָּקֵר בַּחֶרֶב.
human_translation: on the day that Rabbi died, the Sages decreed a fast, and begged for mercy And they said: Anyone who says that Rabbi has died will be stabbed with a sword.
llm_translation: On that day when Rabbi died, the Rabbis decreed a fast, and they sought mercy, and they said: Anyone who says, "Rabbi has died," shall be stabbed with a sword.

hebrew_text: סְלִיקָא אַמְּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי לְאִיגָּרָא, אָמְרָה: עֶלְיוֹנִים מְבַקְּשִׁין אֶת רַבִּי, וְהַתַּחְתּוֹנִים מְבַקְּשִׁין אֶת רַבִּי. יְהִי רָצוֹן שֶׁיָּכוֹפוּ תַּחְתּוֹנִים אֶת הָעֶלְיוֹנִים. כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזַאי כַּמָּה זִימְנֵי דְּעָיֵיל לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא וְחָלַץ תְּפִילִּין וּמַנַּח לְהוּ וְקָמִצְטַעַר, אֲמַרָה: יְהִי רָצוֹן שֶׁיָּכוֹפוּ עֶלְיוֹנִים אֶת הַתַּחְתּוֹנִים.
human_translation: The maidservant of Rabbi ascended to the roof said: The upper are requesting Rabbi and the lower are requesting Rabbi May it be will that the lower should impose upon the upper when she saw how many times he would enter the bathroom and remove phylacteries, and put them on, and he was suffering she said: May it be will that the upper should impose upon the lower
llm_translation: The text: The maidservant of Rabbi went up to the roof, she said: The upper ones seek Rabbi, and the lower ones seek Rabbi. May it be the will that the lower ones overpower the upper ones. As soon as she saw how many times he ascended to the roof and removed his phylacteries and placed them down and became distressed, she said: May it be the will that the upper ones overpower the lower ones.

hebrew_text: וְלָא הֲווֹ שָׁתְקִי רַבָּנַן מִלְּמִיבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי. שָׁקְלָה כּוּזָא, שָׁדְיָיא מֵאִיגָּרָא [לְאַרְעָא], אִישְׁתִּיקוּ מֵרַחֲמֵי, וְנָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: And the Sages, would not be silent, from begging for mercy she took a jug [ kuza ] threw it from the roof to the ground. were silent from mercy, and Rabbi died.
llm_translation: The sages did not remain silent from seeking mercy. She took a pitcher, descended from the roof to the ground, they stopped seeking mercy, and the soul of Rabbi rested.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְבַר קַפָּרָא: זִיל עַיֵּין, אֲזַל אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ דְּנָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ. קַרְעֵיהּ לִלְבוּשֵׁיהּ וְאַהְדְּרֵיהּ לְקִרְעֵיהּ לַאֲחוֹרֵיהּ, פְּתַח וַאֲמַר: אֶרְאֶלִּים וּמְצוּקִים אָחֲזוּ בַּאֲרוֹן הַקֹּדֶשׁ, נִצְּחוּ אֶרְאֶלִּים אֶת הַמְּצוּקִים, וְנִשְׁבָּה אֲרוֹן הַקֹּדֶשׁ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַתּוּן קָאָמְרִיתוּ וַאֲנָא לָא קָאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: The Sages said to bar Kappara: Go and ascertain He went found that had died. He tore his clothing and reversed the tear behind him he opened and said: angels [ erelim ] and righteous clutched the sacred ark. The angels triumphed the righteous, and the sacred ark was captured. They said to him: he died? He said to them: You have said it and I did not say it,
llm_translation: The sages said to Bar Kappara: "Go and see," he went and found that he had died. He tore his garments and turned them backward, opened and said: "The cherubim and the staves were grasping the Ark of the Covenant, the cherubim prevailed over the staves, and the Ark of the Covenant was captured." They said to him: "Has he died?" He said to them: "You are saying it, but I am not saying it."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁעַת פְּטִירָתוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי זָקַף עֶשֶׂר אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה, אֲמַר: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! גָּלוּי וְיָדוּעַ לְפָנֶיךָ שֶׁיָּגַעְתִּי בְּעֶשֶׂר אֶצְבְּעוֹתַי בַּתּוֹרָה, וְלֹא נֶהֱנֵיתִי אֲפִילּוּ בְּאֶצְבַּע קְטַנָּה. יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ שֶׁיְּהֵא שָׁלוֹם בִּמְנוּחָתִי. יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: ״יָבֹא שָׁלוֹם יָנוּחוּ עַל מִשְׁכְּבוֹתָם״.
human_translation: At the time of the death of Rabbi he raised his ten fingers toward Heaven said Master of the Universe, it is revealed and known before You that I toiled with my ten fingers in the Torah, and I have not derived any benefit even with small finger. May it be Your will that there be peace in my repose. A Divine Voice emerged and said: “He enters in peace, they rest in their beds”
llm_translation: At the time of the passing of Rabbi Zakkai, his ten fingers were facing upwards, he said: "Master of the Universe! It is revealed and known before You that I toiled with my ten fingers in the Torah, and I did not even benefit from the smallest finger. May it be Your will that there be peace in my rest. A heavenly voice emerged and said: 'May peace come, they shall rest on their beds.'"
