hebrew_text: ״עַל מִשְׁכָּבְךָ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! מְסַיֵּיעַ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר גַּמָּדָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר גַּמָּדָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן שָׁאוּל: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַצַּדִּיק נִפְטָר מִן הָעוֹלָם, אוֹמְרִים מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, צַדִּיק פְּלוֹנִי בָּא. אוֹמֵר לָהֶם: יָבוֹאוּ צַדִּיקִים וְיֵצְאוּ לִקְרָאתוֹ, וְאוֹמְרִים לוֹ: ״יָבֹא בְּשָׁלוֹם״, יָנוּחוּ עַל מִשְׁכְּבוֹתָם.
human_translation: It should have In your bed, supports Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Gamda. As Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Gamda said Rabbi Yosei ben Shaul said: At the time when a righteous individual departs from the world, the ministering angels say before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, the righteous so-and-so is coming. says to them: The righteous should come and they should go out toward him. And say to He enters in peace, rest in their beds.
llm_translation: "On your bed" - who said this? It supports Rabbi Hiyya bar Gamda. For Rabbi Hiyya bar Gamda said in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Sha'ul: At the moment when a righteous person departs from the world, the ministering angels say before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, so-and-so righteous person is coming. He says to them: Let righteous people come and go out to meet him, and they say to him: "May he come in peace," and they rest on their beds.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַצַּדִּיק נִפְטָר מִן הָעוֹלָם, שָׁלֹשׁ כִּיתּוֹת שֶׁל מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת יוֹצְאוֹת לִקְרָאתוֹ, אַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת לוֹ: ״בֹּא בְּשָׁלוֹם״, וְאַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת: ״הוֹלֵךְ נִכְחוֹ״, וְאַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת לוֹ: ״יָבֹא שָׁלוֹם יָנוּחוּ עַל מִשְׁכְּבוֹתָם״. בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהָרָשָׁע נֶאֱבָד מִן הָעוֹלָם, שָׁלֹשׁ כִּיתּוֹת שֶׁל מַלְאֲכֵי חַבָּלָה יוֹצְאוֹת לִקְרָאתוֹ, אַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת: ״אֵין שָׁלוֹם אָמַר ה׳ לָרְשָׁעִים״, וְאַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת לוֹ: ״לְמַעֲצֵבָה יִשְׁכַּב״, וְאַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת לוֹ: ״רְדָה וְהׇשְׁכְּבָה אֶת עֲרֵלִים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: At the time when a righteous individual departs from the world, three contingents of ministering angels go out toward him. One says to him: Enter in peace; and one says that walks in his uprightness; and one says to him: He enters in peace, they rest in their beds. At the time when a wicked person perishes from the world, three contingents of angels of destruction go out toward him. One says “There is no peace, says the Lord concerning the wicked” and one says to him: “You shall lie down in sorrow” and one says to him: “Go down, and be laid with the uncircumcised”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: At the moment when the righteous person departs from the world, three groups of ministering angels go out to meet him, one saying to him: "Come in peace," and one saying: "Go in front of him," and one saying to him: "May peace come, may they rest on their beds." At the moment when the wicked person is lost from the world, three groups of destroying angels go out to meet him, one saying: "There is no peace, says the Lord, for the wicked," and one saying to him: "He shall lie down in torment," and one saying to him: "Descend and lie with the uncircumcised."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהִיא בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ, גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ לְעוֹלָם. כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהִיא בְּבֵית בַּעְלָהּ, גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ עַד עֶשְׂרִים וְחָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים. שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְחָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים שֶׁתַּעֲשֶׂה טוֹבָה כְּנֶגֶד כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: As long as is in the house of her father she may always collect her marriage contract, As long as she is in the house of her husband, she may collect her marriage contract until twenty-five years because there is in twenty-five years for her to do favors equals her marriage contract. the statement of Rabbi Meir, who said in the name of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: As long as she is in her father's house, her marriage contract remains in force forever. As long as she is in her husband's house, her marriage contract remains in force for twenty-five years. If within twenty-five years she does a good deed corresponding to her marriage contract, these are the words of Rabbi Meir who said in the name of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהִיא בְּבֵית בַּעְלָהּ — גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ לְעוֹלָם, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהִיא בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ — גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ עַד עֶשְׂרִים וְחָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say As long as she is in the house of her husband she may always collect her marriage contract, as long as she is in the house of her father she may collect her marriage contract until twenty-five years
llm_translation: The sages say: As long as she is in her husband's house - her marriage contract is valid forever, as long as she is in her father's house - her marriage contract is valid for twenty-five years.

hebrew_text: מֵתָה — יוֹרְשֶׁיהָ מַזְכִּירִין כְּתוּבָּתָהּ עַד עֶשְׂרִים וְחָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים.
human_translation: she died, her heirs mention her marriage contract until twenty-five years
llm_translation: Deceased — her heirs mention her written document until twenty-five years.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: עֲנִיָּיה שֶׁבְּיִשְׂרָאֵל עַד עֶשְׂרִים וְחָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים, וּמָרְתָּא בַּת בַּיְיתּוֹס עַד עֶשְׂרִים וְחָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים?
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: the poorest among the Jewish people, until twenty-five years and Marta bat Baitos, within twenty-five years?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: The poor of Israel until twenty and five years, and Marta bat Bayitos until twenty and five years?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְפוּם גַּמְלָא שִׁיחְנָא.
human_translation: He said to him: According to the camel is the load,
llm_translation: He said to him: According to the camel's strength is its load.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מַהוּ שֶׁתְּשַׁלֵּשׁ? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before According to Rabbi Meir, what is she divides shall stand
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: To Rabbi Meir, what is the ruling regarding a case of tripling? The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל זְמַן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: אֲתַאי קוֹדֶם שְׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה — גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, לְאַחַר שְׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה לָא גָּבְיָא? בְּהַהִיא פּוּרְתָּא אַחֵילְתַּהּ?
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: As long as Abaye said to Rav Yosef: she came before the setting of the sun she collects her marriage contract, after the setting of the sun she may not collect In that slight did she waive
llm_translation: The sages say: "All the time." Abaye said to Rav Yosef: "Does it come before the setting of the sun - its height is written, but after the setting of the sun, is it not written?" In that case, do you wait for it?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, כׇּל מִדַּת חֲכָמִים, כֵּן הִיא. בְּאַרְבָּעִים סְאָה — טוֹבֵל, בְּאַרְבָּעִים סְאָה חָסֵר קוּרְטוֹב — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִטְבּוֹל בָּהֶן.
human_translation: He said to him: Yes. All the measures of the Sages are such in forty se’a one may immerse in forty se’a less kortov , he is unable to immerse therein
llm_translation: He said to him: No, every measure of the sages, so it is. In forty se'ah - it is immersed, in forty se'ah lacking a quarter log - one cannot immerse in them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לִפְנֵי רַבִּי, שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם אָבִיו: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין שְׁטַר כְּתוּבָּה יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יָדֶיהָ, אֲבָל שְׁטַר כְּתוּבָּה יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יָדֶיהָ — גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ לְעוֹלָם. וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ שְׁטַר כְּתוּבָּה יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יָדֶיהָ — אֵינָהּ גּוֹבָה אֶלָּא עַד עֶשְׂרִים וְחָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, testified before Rabbi said in the name of his father, They taught only she does not have a marriage contract in her possession, but where she does have a marriage contract in her possession, she may collect her marriage contract forever. And Rabbi Elazar said: Even if she has a marriage contract in her possession, she collects only within twenty-five years
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, testified before Rabbi, saying in the name of his father: They only taught that a document is not valid if it is not written with her consent, but if a document is written with her consent, its validity is forever. And Rabbi Elazar said: Even if a document is written with her consent, its validity is only up to twenty-five years.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: בַּעַל חוֹב גּוֹבֶה שֶׁלֹּא בְּהַזְכָּרָה. הֵיכִי דָמֵי, אִי דְּלָא נָקֵט שְׁטָרָא — בְּמַאי גָּבֵי? אֶלָּא דְּנָקֵיט שְׁטָרָא: וּבַעַל חוֹב הוּא דְּלָאו בַּר אַחוֹלֵי הוּא, הָא אַלְמָנָה אַחֵילְתַּהּ!
human_translation: Rav Sheshet raised an objection A creditor may collect without mentioned What are the circumstances? If he does not hold the document with what is he collecting Rather, he does hold the document. a creditor, who is not one forgiven But a widow waived
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: A creditor can collect a debt even without a formal document. What is the reason? If he did not take a document, with what can he collect? Rather, he took a document. And it is the creditor who is not a common person, for if he were a common person, the widow would have trusted him!

hebrew_text: הוּא מוֹתֵיב לַהּ וְהוּא מְפָרֵק לַהּ: לְעוֹלָם דְּלָא נָקֵיט שְׁטָרָא, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּשֶׁחַיָּיב מוֹדֶה.
human_translation: raised the objection and he resolved it: Actually, does not hold a document and here we are dealing with where the debtor admits
llm_translation: He sets before her and he explains to her: Always that we do not take a document, and here with what are we dealing - when he admits.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אִלְעָא, שׁוֹנִין: גְּרוּשָׁה הֲרֵי הִיא כְּבַעַל חוֹב. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּלָא נְקִיטָא כְּתוּבָּה, בְּמַאי גָּבְיָא? אֶלָּא לָאו דִּנְקִיטָא כְּתוּבָּה, וּגְרוּשָׁה הִיא דְּלָאו בַּת אַחוֹלֵי הִיא, הָא אַלְמָנָה אַחֵילְתַּהּ!
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Ela say: teach A divorcée is like a creditor What are the circumstances? If she does not hold a marriage contract with what is she collecting Rather, is it not she holds a marriage contract and it is a divorcée as she is not one waived But a widow waive
llm_translation: And he said, Rabbi Ilai, we learn: A divorced woman is like a creditor. How so? If she does not take a document, with what does she collect? Rather, if she does not take a document, and she is divorced, she is not like a woman who is waiting for her husband to die, for then she would inherit.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי כְּשֶׁחַיָּיב מוֹדֶה.
human_translation: Here too, where the debtor, admits
llm_translation: Here it is taught: "When one is obligated, he admits."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: תָּנֵי רַב יְהוּדָה בַּר קָזָא בְּמַתְנִיתָא דְּבֵי בַּר קָזָא: תָּבְעָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ —
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Rav Yehuda bar Kaza teaches in a baraita of the school bar Kaza: demanded her marriage contract,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said: Rav Yehuda son of Kaza taught in the Mishnah of the house of Bar Kaza: "She demanded her marriage contract —"

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי הִיא כְּבַתְּחִלָּה. וְאִם הָיָה שְׁטַר כְּתוּבָּה יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יָדֶיהָ — גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: as though she is at the beginning And if she has a marriage contract in her possession, she may collect her marriage contract forever.
llm_translation: Behold, it is like the beginning. And if there was a written document coming out from under her hand - the obligation of her document is forever.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יַעֲקֹב: יְלַמְּדֵנוּ רַבֵּינוּ, כְּשֶׁשְּׁטַר כְּתוּבָּה יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יָדָהּ מַחְלוֹקֶת, אוֹ כְּשֶׁאֵין שְׁטַר כְּתוּבָּה יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יָדָהּ? וַהֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי מִי?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman, son of Rav Ḥisda, sent to Rav Naḥman bar Ya’akov: Our teacher, instruct us. dispute where she has a marriage contract in her possession, or where she does not have a marriage contract in her possession? And in accordance with the statement of whom is the halakha
llm_translation: Send to him Rav Nachman bar Rav Chisda to Rav Nachman bar Yaakov: Teach us, our teacher, when a written document exits from her hand, is there a dispute, or when a written document does not exit from her hand? And the halakha is according to whose words?

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: בְּשֶׁאֵין שְׁטַר כְּתוּבָּה יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יָדָהּ מַחְלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל שְׁטַר כְּתוּבָּה יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יָדָהּ — גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ לְעוֹלָם. וַהֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: sent to him: When she does not have a marriage contract in her possession, a dispute, where she has a marriage contract in her possession, she may collect her marriage contract forever. halakha is in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Send to him: when there is no written document, dispute arises from under her hand, but when there is a written document, it is collected according to its writing forever. And the halakha is according to the words of the sages.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי מִשּׁוּם בַּר קַפָּרָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מָנֶה מָאתַיִם, אֲבָל תּוֹסֶפֶת — יֵשׁ לָהּ.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said in the name of bar Kappara: They taught only one hundred dinars two hundred dinars, However, she has the additional
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Shimon ben Pazzi said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi in the name of Bar Kappara: They only taught regarding the hundred, but for an addition - it has.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲפִילּוּ תּוֹסֶפֶת אֵין לָהּ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַיְיבוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: תְּנַאי כְּתוּבָּה כִּכְתוּבָּה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan She does not have even of the additional as Rabbi Aivu said Rabbi Yannai said: The stipulation in the marriage contract is like the marriage contract.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yochanan: Even an addition it does not have. As Rabbi Yannai said: A Tannaic teaching is like a written teaching, it is considered as a written teaching.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מָנֶה מָאתַיִם, אֲבָל תּוֹסֶפֶת יֵשׁ לָהּ.
human_translation: was also stated Rabbi Abba said Rav Huna said Rav said: They taught only one hundred two hundred dinars, but she has the additional
llm_translation: It was stated: Naḥmei said, Rabbi Abba said, Rav Huna said, Rav said: They only taught regarding a hundred, but there is an additional amount.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְרַב הוּנָא: אֲמַר רַב הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִישְׁתִּיק(ן) קָאָמְרַתְּ, אוֹ אַשְׁקְיַין קָאָמְרַתְּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִישְׁתִּיק(ן) קָאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Rav Huna: Rav say so? said to Did you say silence me, Or did you say give me drink? said to him: I said silence
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Abba to Rav Huna: Did Rav Haki say? He said to him: Are you saying "Ishtikin" or "Ashkayin"? He said to him: I am saying "Ishtikin."

hebrew_text: חֲמָתֵיהּ דְּרַב חִיָּיא אֲרִיכָא אִינְתַּת אֲחוּהּ הֲוַאי, וְאַלְמָנָה בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ הֲוַאי, וְזָנַהּ עֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמֵשׁ שְׁנִין בְּבֵי נָשָׁא.
human_translation: the mother-in-law of Rav Ḥiyya Arikha, was the wife of his brother, and she was a widow in the house of her father, and sustained her twenty-five years in the house of her father,
llm_translation: The anger of Rav Chiya was long, his wife was his sister, and the widow was in her father's house, and she committed adultery for twenty-five years in her husband's house.

hebrew_text: לְסוֹף אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: הַב לִי מְזוֹנֵי. אֲמַר לַהּ: לֵית לִיךְ מְזוֹנֵי. הַב לִי כְּתוּבָּה. אֲמַר לַהּ: לָא מְזוֹנֵי אִית לִיךְ, וְלָא כְּתוּבָּה אִית.
human_translation: At the end she said to him: Give me sustenance. He said to her: You do not have sustenance. give me marriage contract. He said to her: you have no sustenance and you have no marriage contract.
llm_translation: At the end, he said to her: "Bring me sustenance." He said to her: "You do not have sustenance." "Bring me a document." He said to her: "You do not have sustenance, and you do not have a document."

hebrew_text: תְּבַעְתֵּיהּ לְדִינָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵימָא לִי אִיזִי גּוּפָא דְעוֹבָדָא הֵיכִי הֲוָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זָנִיתַהּ עֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמֵשׁ שָׁנִים בְּבֵי נָשָׁא, בְּחַיֵּי דְמָר, דִּבְכַתְפַאי אַמְטַאי לַהּ.
human_translation: She summoned him for judgment before Rabba bar Sheila. He said to Tell me, then, what was the essence of the case? said to him: I sustained her twenty-five years in the house of her father, by the life of the Master, that I delivered to her on my shoulders.
llm_translation: He brought him to judgment before Rabba bar Sheilah. He said to him: "Show me the body of the deed, how was it?" He said to him: "You have committed adultery for twenty-five years in the house of men, by the life of Mar, for at the shoulder I found her."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: טַעְמָא מַאי אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהִיא בְּבֵית בַּעְלָהּ גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ לְעוֹלָם, דְּאָמְרִינַן: מִשּׁוּם כִּיסּוּפָא הוּא דְּלָא תָּבְעָה. הָכָא נָמֵי: מִשּׁוּם כִּיסּוּפָא הוּא דְּלָא תָּבְעָה, זִיל הַב לַהּ.
human_translation: said to him: What is the reason the Sages said as long as is in the house of her husband, she may always collect her marriage contract? because we say it is due to embarrassment that she did not demand Here too, it is due to embarrassment that she did not demand go give her
llm_translation: He said to him: The reason, what is it that the Rabbis say: As long as she is in her husband's house, her marriage contract is always valid, for we say: It is due to the suspicion that she will not demand it. Here too: It is due to the suspicion that she will not demand it, go and bring it to her.

hebrew_text: לָא אַשְׁגַּח. כְּתַב לַהּ אַדְרָכְתָּא אַנִּיכְסֵיה. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזִי מָר הֵיכִי דָּנַן! אָמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁפִּיר דָּנָךְ.
human_translation: did not heed wrote an authorization for her to his property came before Rava, he said to him: Let the Master see how judged me. said to him: He has judged you well.
llm_translation: Not concerned. Wrote to her a prescription, I will enter it. Came before Rava, he said to him: Master, see how we judge! He said to him: You judged well.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אִי הָכִי, לֵיזִיל לַהְדַּר לִי פֵּירֵי דְּמִן הָהוּא יוֹמָא עַד הָאִידָּנָא. אֲמַר לַהּ: אַחְוִי לִי אַדְרָכְתִּיךְ. חַזְיַיהּ דְּלָא הֲוָה כְּתִוב בָּהּ ״וְאִישְׁתְּמוֹדַעְנָא דִּנְכָסִים אֵלּוּ דְּמִיתָנָא אִינּוּן״. אֲמַר לַהּ: אַדְרָכְתָּא לָאו שַׁפִּיר כְּתִיבָא.
human_translation: said to If so, he should go return to me produce from that day until today. He said to her: Show me your authorization. He saw that it was not written in it: And it is known to us that these properties are of the deceased. Rava said to her: The authorization is not written well.
llm_translation: She said to him: If so, go and return to me the fruits from that day until today. He said to her: Show me the path. He saw that it was not written in it "and the familiar acquaintance who betrayed me are not." He said to her: The path is not clear in the writing.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: תֵּיזִיל אַדְרַכְתָּא, אֶישְׁקוֹל מִיּוֹמָא דִּשְׁלִימִי יוֹמֵי אַכְרָזְתָּא עַד הַשְׁתָּא. אֲמַר לַהּ: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָא כְּתִיב טָעוּתָא בְּאַדְרָכְתָּא, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דִּכְתִיב טָעוּתָא בְּאַדְרָכְתָּא — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: She said to him: Let the authorization go, I should take from the time when the days of announcement were completed, until now. He said to her: This applies where there was no error written into the authorization, but where there was an error written into the authorization, we have no with it.
llm_translation: She said to him: Go out to the marketplace, and announce from the day of the festival until now. He said to her: Those words, where it is not written a mistake in the marketplace, but where it is written a mistake in the marketplace - we do not have it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: וְהָא מָר הוּא דְּאָמַר אַחְרָיוּת טָעוּת סוֹפֵר הוּא.
human_translation: She said to him: But wasn’t it Master, who said guarantee is a scribal error,
llm_translation: She said to him: But this is the master who said, "Following is a mistake; it is the error of the scribe."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לַהּ רָבָא: בְּהָא לֵיכָּא לְמֵימַר טָעוּת סוֹפֵר הוּא, דִּבְהָא אֲפִילּוּ רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא טָעֵי. מֵעִיקָּרָא הוּא סְבַר הָנֵי וְהָנֵי דִּידֵיהּ, מָה לִי מֵהָנֵי, מָה לִי מֵהָנֵי,
human_translation: Rava said to her: In this it cannot be said it scribal error, because in this even Rabba bar Sheila erred Initially, thought these and those are his, what to me from these what to me from those
llm_translation: He said to her, Rava: In this case, it is possible to say that it is a mistake of the scribe, for in this case even Rabbah bar Sheilah makes a mistake. Initially, he thought that these and those are his own, what do I need from these, what do I need from those.

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא. זִימְנִין דְּאָזְלָה וּמַשְׁבְּחָה לְהוּ וּדְבַעְלַהּ מַכְסְפִי, וְאָמַר לַהּ: שְׁקוּל דִּידָךְ וְהַב לִי דִּידִי, וְאָתֵי לְאַפּוֹקֵי לַעַז עַל בֵּי דִינָא.
human_translation: But that is not so. Sometimes will go and improve and of her husband depreciate And say to her: Take your and give me my And will come to cast aspersion on the court
llm_translation: "And not she. Sometimes she would go and praise them, and her husband would cover her with silver, and he said to her: 'Take your jug and give me my jug,' and she would come to pour out wine in the house of judgment."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַנּוֹשֵׂא
llm_translation: We will return to you, O bearer.

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵי דַּיָּינֵי גְּזֵירוֹת הָיוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, אַדְמוֹן וְחָנָן בֶּן אֲבִישָׁלוֹם. חָנָן אוֹמֵר שְׁנֵי דְּבָרִים, אַדְמוֹן אוֹמֵר שִׁבְעָה. מִי שֶׁהָלַךְ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וְאִשְׁתּוֹ תּוֹבַעַת מְזוֹנוֹת, חָנָן אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: There were two judges decrees in Jerusalem, Admon and Ḥanan ben Avishalom. Ḥanan states two matters Admon states seven. one who went overseas and his wife is demanding sustenance, Ḥanan says:
llm_translation: Two judges of the court were in Jerusalem, Admon and Hanan son of Avishalom. Hanan says two things, Admon says seven. If one goes to the coastal region and his wife demands maintenance, Hanan says:

hebrew_text: תִּשָּׁבַע בַּסּוֹף, וְלֹא תִּשָּׁבַע בַּתְּחִלָּה. נֶחְלְקוּ עָלָיו בְּנֵי כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים, וְאָמְרוּ: תִּשָּׁבַע בַּתְּחִלָּה וּבַסּוֹף. אָמַר רַבִּי דּוֹסָא בֶּן הַרְכִּינָס כְּדִבְרֵיהֶם. אָמַר רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי: יָפֶה אָמַר חָנָן, לֹא תִּשָּׁבַע אֶלָּא בַּסּוֹף.
human_translation: She takes an oath at the end And she does not take an oath at the outset The sons of High Priests disagreed with and said: She takes an oath at the outset and at the end. Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas said: in accordance with their statement, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai said Ḥanan spoke well: She takes an oath only at the end.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "She shall swear at the end, and not swear at the beginning. The prominent priests disputed this, saying: 'She shall swear both at the beginning and at the end.' Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas agreed with their words. Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai said: 'Hananiah spoke well, one should only swear at the end.'"

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּרְמִינְהִי: שְׁלֹשָׁה דַּיָּינֵי גְזֵילוֹת הָיוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם: אַדְמוֹן בֶּן גַּדַּאי, וְחָנָן הַמִּצְרִי, וְחָנָן בֶּן אֲבִישָׁלוֹם. קַשְׁיָא תְּלָת אַתְּרֵין, קַשְׁיָא גְּזֵירוֹת אַגְּזֵילוֹת!
human_translation: And raises a contradiction There were three judges of theft [ gezeilot ] in Jerusalem: Admon ben Gaddai, Ḥanan the Egyptian, and Ḥanan ben Avishalom. three difficult, as two; decrees difficult as theft.
llm_translation: Gemara: And they raised a dilemma: There were three prominent thieves in Jerusalem: Admon ben Gaddai, and Hanan the Egyptian, and Hanan ben Avishalom. A difficulty in three places, a difficulty in the thefts they stole!

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא תְּלָת אַתְּרֵין לָא קַשְׁיָא: דַּחֲשִׁיב לֵיהּ — קָתָנֵי, דְּלָא חֲשִׁיב לֵיהּ — לָא קָתָנֵי. אֶלָּא גְּזֵירוֹת אַגְּזֵילוֹת קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: Granted, three that two not difficult, who are important to him teaches and who are not important to him does not teach However, decrees to theft is difficult.
llm_translation: In truth, three matters are not difficult: if it is considered important - it is taught, if it is not considered important - it is not taught. Rather, it is difficult decrees upon decrees!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: שֶׁהָיוּ גּוֹזְרִין גְּזֵירוֹת עַל גְּזֵילוֹת. כִּדְתַנְיָא: קִיטְּמָה נְטִיעָה, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: גּוֹזְרֵי גְזֵירוֹת שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם אוֹמְרִים: נְטִיעָה בַּת שְׁנָתָהּ — שְׁתֵּי כֶסֶף, בַּת שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים — אַרְבַּע כֶּסֶף.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: as they would issue decrees concerning theft, as it is taught severed plant Rabbi Yosei says those who issue decrees in Jerusalem said: a plant one year old, two silver two years old, four silver
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: They would decree decrees regarding stolen items. As it was taught: If a sapling was uprooted, Rabbi Yosei says: The decree-makers in Jerusalem say: A sapling in its first year - two silver coins, a sapling in its second year - four silver coins.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי, שְׁלֹשָׁה דַּיָּינֵי גְזֵירוֹת הָיוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם: אַדְמוֹן וְחָנָן וְנַחוּם! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מַאן תְּנָא נַחוּם — רַבִּי נָתָן הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: אַף נַחוּם הַמָּדִי מִגּוֹזְרֵי גְזֵירוֹת שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם הָיָה, וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: raises a contradiction There were three judges decrees in Jerusalem: Admon, Ḥanan, and Naḥum. Rav Pappa said: Who taught Naḥum? It is Rabbi Natan, as it is taught Rabbi Natan says: Naḥum HaMadi was also among those who issue decrees in Jerusalem, but the Sages did not agree with
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: there were three judges of decrees in Jerusalem: Admon, Hanan, and Nahum! Rav Papa said: Who is the Tanna of Nahum? — It is Rabbi Natan. As it was taught, Rabbi Natan says: Even Nahum the Mede was among the judges of decrees in Jerusalem, and the Sages did not acknowledge him.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ לֵיכָּא? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי פִּנְחָס אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת וְתִשְׁעִים וְאַרְבָּעָה בָּתֵּי דִינִין הָיוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, כְּנֶגְדָּן בָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת, וּכְנֶגְדָּן בָּתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת, וּכְנֶגְדָּן בָּתֵּי סוֹפְרִים! דַּיָּינִין טוּבָא הֲווֹ, וְכִי קָאָמְרִינַן — אַגּוֹזְרֵי גְזֵירוֹת קָאָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: And no more Didn’t Rabbi Pineḥas say Rabbi Oshaya said: There were 394 courts in Jerusalem, and a comparable number of synagogues, and a comparable number of study halls, and a comparable number of houses of teachers There were many judges, but when we say concerning those who issue decrees we say
llm_translation: And is it so? But didn't Rabbi Pinchas say in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: There were three hundred and ninety-four courts in Jerusalem, corresponding to them were synagogues, and corresponding to them were study halls, and corresponding to them were houses of scribes! They were a sufficient number of judges, and when we say "decree-makers," we mean decree-makers.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: גּוֹזְרֵי גְזֵירוֹת שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם הָיוּ נוֹטְלִין שְׂכָרָן תִּשְׁעִים וָתֵשַׁע מָנֶה מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה, לֹא רָצוּ — מוֹסִיפִין לָהֶם. לֹא רָצוּ? אַטּוּ בְּרַשִּׁיעֵי עָסְקִינַן? אֶלָּא: לֹא סָפְקוּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא רָצוּ — מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav Asi said: Those who issue decrees in Jerusalem would take their wages, ninety-nine maneh , from the collection of the chamber. they did not wish one adds they did not wish Is that to say we are dealing with wicked Rather, insufficient even if they did not wish one adds to their
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav Assi: The decree-makers in Jerusalem used to take ninety-nine mana from the Terumah of the Chamber as their reward. If they did not want it, they would add to it. Did they not want it? Are we dealing with wicked people? Rather, they did not hesitate, so even though they did not want it, they would add to it.

hebrew_text: קַרְנָא הֲוָה שָׁקֵיל אִיסְתֵּירָא מִזַּכַּאי וְאִיסְתֵּירָא מֵחַיָּיב, וְדָאֵין לְהוּ דִּינָא. וְהֵיכִי עָבֵיד הָכִי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְשׁוֹחַד לֹא תִקָּח״!
human_translation: Karna would take an istera , from the innocent party, and an istera from the guilty party, and he would judge their case. But how could he do so? Isn’t it written: “And you shall take no bribe”
llm_translation: The horn was taken, he acquitted one from liability and obligated the other, and there is no judgment for them. And how did he do this? And it is written: "And you shall not take a bribe!"

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָא שָׁקֵיל מִתַּרְוַיְיהוּ דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאַצְלוֹיֵי דִּינָא, קַרְנָא כֵּיוָן דְּשָׁקֵיל מִתַּרְוַיְיהוּ — לָא אָתֵי לְאַצְלוֹיֵי דִּינָא, וְכִי לָא אָתֵי לְאַצְלוֹיֵי דִּינָא מִי שְׁרֵי?
human_translation: And if you say this applies only when does not take from both perhaps he may come to pervert the judgment Karna, since he took from both he will not come to pervert the judgment, Is it permitted when one will not pervert the judgment?
llm_translation: And if you will say, these matters, where they do not take from both of them, perhaps it will come to the conclusion of the law, the horn, since they take from both of them - it will not come to the conclusion of the law. And if it will not come to the conclusion of the law, is it permitted?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: ״וְשׁוֹחַד לֹא תִקָּח״ מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? אִם לְלַמֵּד שֶׁלֹּא לְזַכּוֹת אֶת הַחַיָּיב וְשֶׁלֹּא לְחַיֵּיב אֶת הַזַּכַּאי — הֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״לֹא תַטֶּה מִשְׁפָּט״, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לְזַכּוֹת אֶת הַזַּכַּאי וּלְחַיֵּיב אֶת הַחַיָּיב אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״וְשׁוֹחַד לֹא תִקָּח״!
human_translation: But isn’t it taught “And you shall take no bribe” what the verse states If to teach that not acquit the guilty and not convict the innocent it is already stated: “You shall not wrest judgment” Rather, even to acquit the innocent and convict the guilty, the Torah says: “And you shall take no bribe.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: "And you shall not take a bribe" - what is the Talmud to say? If to teach that not to acquit the guilty and not to incriminate the innocent - behold, it is already stated "You shall not pervert justice," rather even to acquit the innocent and incriminate the guilty, the Torah said "And you shall not take a bribe!"

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּשָׁקֵיל בְּתוֹרַת שׁוֹחַד, קַרְנָא בְּתוֹרַת אַגְרָא הֲוָה שָׁקֵיל. וּבְתוֹרַת אַגְרָא מִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָתְנַן: הַנּוֹטֵל שָׂכָר לָדוּן — דִּינָיו בְּטֵלִין! הָנֵי מִילֵּי אֲגַר דִּינָא, קַרְנָא אֲגַר בְּטֵילָא הֲוָה שָׁקֵיל.
human_translation: This applies only when one takes the money in the form of a bribe, Karna took in the form of a salary, But is it permitted in the form of a salary? Didn’t we learn one who takes a salary to judge his judgments are void? This applies only compensation for judging Karna as compensation for unemployment,
llm_translation: These are matters: where one takes with the law of bribery, a horn with the law of a wage was taken. And with the law of a wage, who permits? And it was taught: One who takes payment for judgment - his judgments are nullified! These are matters of a wage of judgment, a horn of a wage with nullification was taken.

hebrew_text: וַאֲגַר בְּטֵילָא מִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: מְכוֹעָר הַדַּיָּין שֶׁנּוֹטֵל שָׂכָר לָדוּן, אֶלָּא שֶׁדִּינוֹ דִּין. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִילֵּימָא אֲגַר דִּינָא, דִּינוֹ דִּין? וְהָתַנְיָא: הַנּוֹטֵל שָׂכָר לָדוּן — דִּינָיו בְּטֵילִין! אֶלָּא אֲגַר בְּטֵילָא, וְקָתָנֵי: מְכוֹעָר הַדַּיָּין!
human_translation: And is permitted as compensation for unemployment? Isn’t it taught Ugly is the judge who takes a salary to judge however, his judgments are judgments? What are the circumstances If we say compensation for judging, his judgments judgments? But didn’t we learn one who takes a salary to judge his judgments are void? Rather, compensation for unemployment, and teaches: Ugly is the judge.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And is a wage for a judge permissible? And it was taught: A judge who takes payment for judging is considered despicable, except that his judgment is a valid judgment. How so? If you say it is a wage for his judgment, then his judgment is invalid? And it was taught: One who takes payment for judging—his judgments are nullified! Rather, a wage for a judge is permissible, and it was taught: A judge who takes payment is despicable!" English translation: "And is a wage for a judge permissible? And it was taught: A judge who takes payment for judging is considered despicable, except that his judgment is a valid judgment. How so? If you say it is a wage for his judgment, then his judgment is invalid? And it was taught: One who takes payment for judging—his judgments are nullified! Rather, a wage for a judge is permissible, and it was taught: A judge who takes payment is despicable!"

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּטֵילָא דְּלָא מוֹכְחָא. קַרְנָא בְּטֵילָא דְמוֹכְחָא הֲוָה שָׁקֵיל, דַּהֲוָה תָּהֵי בְּאַמְבָּרָא דְחַמְרָא וְיָהֲבִי לֵיהּ זוּזָא.
human_translation: This applies only unemployment is not evident, Karna, would take unemployment it was evident as he was examining wine stores [ ambara ] and they would pay him dinar
llm_translation: These matters are in a place where they are not established. A horn in a place where it is established was taken, for it would be in a wine cellar and he would give it a coin.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּרַב הוּנָא כִּי הֲוָה אָתֵי דִּינָא לְקַמֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לִי גַּבְרָא דְּדָלֵי לִי בַּחֲרִיקַאי וְאֵידוּן לְכוּ דִּינָא.
human_translation: resembles Rav Huna. When would come judgment before him, say to them: give me a man who can draw water for me, and I will judge your case.
llm_translation: This is what Rav Huna said when the judgment came before him: He said to them, "Bring me a man who is poor in my eyes but sharp in my thorns, and let the judgment be for you."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: בֹּא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה סְמוּיוֹת עֵינֵיהֶן שֶׁל מְקַבְּלֵי שׁוֹחַד. אָדָם חָשׁ בְּעֵינָיו, נוֹתֵן מָמוֹן לָרוֹפֵא — סָפֵק מִתְרַפֵּא סָפֵק אֵינוֹ מִתְרַפֵּא. וְהֵן נוֹטְלִין שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה וּמְסַמִּין עֵינֵיהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי הַשּׁוֹחַד יְעַוֵּר פִּקְחִים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: Come and see how blind are the eyes of those who accept bribes, a person has pain in his eyes, gives a doctor money, it is uncertain he will be healed whether he will not be healed. And take value a peruta , and blind their eyes, as it is stated: “For a bribe blinds those who have sight”
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: Come and see how the eyes of those who accept bribes are blind. A person feels pain in his eyes, he gives money to the doctor - sometimes he is healed, sometimes he is not healed. And they take a bribe of a small coin and close their eyes, as it is said: "For a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כִּי הַשּׁוֹחַד יְעַוֵּר עֵינֵי חֲכָמִים״, קַל וָחוֹמֶר לַטִּפְּשִׁין. ״וִיסַלֵּף דִּבְרֵי צַדִּיקִים״, קַל וָחוֹמֶר לָרְשָׁעִים. מִידֵּי טִפְּשִׁים וּרְשָׁעִים בְּנֵי דִינָא נִינְהוּ? אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״כִּי הַשּׁוֹחַד יְעַוֵּר עֵינֵי חֲכָמִים״, אֲפִילּוּ חָכָם גָּדוֹל וְלוֹקֵחַ שׁוֹחַד — אֵינוֹ נִפְטָר מִן הָעוֹלָם בְּלֹא סַמְיוּת הַלֵּב. ״וִיסַלֵּף דִּבְרֵי צַדִּיקִים״,
human_translation: The Sages taught: “For a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise” a fortiori of fools. “And perverts the words of the righteous” a fortiori of the wicked. Are fools and the wicked suitable for judgment, Rather, this is what said: “For a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise”; even very wise but he took a bribe, will not leave world without blindness of the heart, “And perverts the words of the righteous”;
llm_translation: The sages taught: "For bribery blinds the eyes of the wise," a fortiori for the simple-minded. "And subverts the cause of the righteous," a fortiori for the wicked. Are the sons of judgment considered simple-minded and wicked? Rather, this is what it means to say: "For bribery blinds the eyes of the wise," even a great sage who accepts a bribe — he does not depart from the world without a dimming of the heart. "And subverts the cause of the righteous,"

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ צַדִּיק גָּמוּר וְלוֹקֵחַ שׁוֹחַד — אֵינוֹ נִפְטָר מִן הָעוֹלָם בְּלֹא טֵירוּף דַּעַת.
human_translation: even if he is completely righteous but he took a bribe, he will not leave world without becoming demented.
llm_translation: Even a completely righteous person who accepts a bribe - does not depart from the world without a blemish of knowledge.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אֲמַר: דָּרֵשׁ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר כֹּהֵן, מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״מֶלֶךְ בְּמִשְׁפָּט יַעֲמִיד אָרֶץ וְאִישׁ תְּרוּמוֹת יֶהֶרְסֶנָּה״ — אִם דּוֹמֶה דַּיָּין לְמֶלֶךְ, שֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לִכְלוּם — ״יַעֲמִיד אָרֶץ״. וְאִם דּוֹמֶה לְכֹהֵן שֶׁמְּחַזֵּר עַל הַגֳּרָנוֹת — ״יֶהֶרְסֶנָּה״.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said Rav Naḥman bar Kohen interpreted homiletically What is which is written: “The king by justice establishes the land, but he who exacts gifts [ terumot ] overthrows it” If a judge is like a king, that he does not need anything he establishes the land, But if he is like a priest, who seeks out from granaries, he overthrows
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: Rav Nachman bar Kokhein expounded, "What is the meaning of the verse, 'A king establishes a land with justice, but a man of gifts tears it down'? If one compares a judge to a king, who does not require flattery - 'he establishes a land.' But if one compares him to a priest who inspects the granaries - 'he tears it down.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב שֵׁילָא: הַאי דַּיָּינָא דְּשָׁאֵיל שְׁאֵילְתָא — פָּסוּל לְמֵידַן דִּינָא. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ לְאוֹשׁוֹלֵי, אֲבָל אִית לֵיהּ לְאוֹשׁוֹלֵי — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Sheila said: This judge who borrows from others is disqualified from rendering judgment And we said this only where he does not have to lend However, if he has to lend we have no with it.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Sheilah said: This judge who asks a question is disqualified from judging. And we only said this when he does not have an answer, but if he has an answer, we do not have a problem with him.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא רָבָא שָׁאֵיל שְׁאֵילְתָא מִדְּבֵי בַּר מָרִיּוֹן אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא שָׁיְילִי מִינֵּיהּ? הָתָם לְאַחְשׁוֹבִינְהוּ הוּא דְּבָעֵי.
human_translation: Is that so? But Rava borrow from the house of bar Maryon even though they would not borrow from him. There, he wanted to cause them to more important
llm_translation: I am not? But didn't Rava ask a question from the house of the son of Mariyon even though I did not ask from him? There, let us consider that he wanted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּשׁוּחְדָּא? כֵּיוָן דְּקַבֵּיל לֵיהּ שׁוּחְדָּא מִינֵּיהּ, אִיקָּרְבָא לֵיהּ דַּעְתֵּיהּ לְגַבֵּיהּ וְהָוֵי כְּגוּפֵיהּ, וְאֵין אָדָם רוֹאֶה חוֹבָה לְעַצְמוֹ. מַאי ״שׁוֹחַד״ — שֶׁהוּא חַד. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא לֵידוּן אִינִישׁ דִּינָא לְמַאן דְּרָחֵים לֵיהּ, וְלָא לְמַאן דְּסָנֵי לֵיהּ. דְּרָחֵים לֵיהּ — לָא חָזֵי לֵיהּ חוֹבָה, דְּסָנֵי לֵיהּ — לָא חָזֵי לֵיהּ זְכוּתָא.
human_translation: Rava said: What is the reason for a bribe? Once accepts a bribe from his thoughts draw closer to him and he becomes like his self, and a person does not find fault in himself. What is shoḥad , Shehu ḥad , Rav Pappa said: A person should not judge a case involving one whom he loves, nor involving one whom he hates. whom he loves, he will not find any fault in him, whom he hates, he will not find any merit in him.
llm_translation: Rava said: What is the reason for bribery? Since he accepted a bribe from him, his mind becomes close to him and it is as if it is his own, and a person does not see his own obligation. What is "bribe"? — That it is one. Rav Papa said: A person should not judge a case for one he favors, nor for one he dislikes. For one he favors — he does not see the obligation, for one he dislikes — he does not see the merit.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַאי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן דִּמְרַחֲמִין לֵיהּ בְּנֵי מָתָא — לָאו מִשּׁוּם דִּמְעַלֵּי טְפֵי, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מוֹכַח לְהוּ בְּמִילֵּי דִּשְׁמַיָּא.
human_translation: Abaye said: this Torah scholar who is beloved by the residents it is not because he is a superior rather, because he does not reprove them in Heavenly matters.
llm_translation: Abaye said: This student who is favored by the sages, the sons of the city - not because of the drops of dew, but because it is not evident to them in matters of Heaven.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, מֵרֵישׁ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי בְּנֵי מָחוֹזָא כּוּלְּהוּ רָחֲמוּ לִי. כֵּיוָן דַּהֲוַאי דַּיָּינָא, אָמֵינָא: מִינַּיְיהוּ סָנוּ לִי וּמִינַּיְיהוּ רָחֲמוּ לִי. כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזַאי דְּמַאן דְּמִיחַיַּיב (לֵיהּ) הָאִידָּנָא קָא זָכֵי לִמְחַר, אָמֵינָא: אִם מִרְחָם — כּוּלְּהוּ רָחֲמוּ לִי, אִי מִסְנוֹ — כּוּלְּהוּ סָנוּ לִי.
human_translation: Rava said: At first I would say all these residents of Meḥoza love me; once I became a judge I said some of them hate me and some of them love me, When I saw that the one I declared guilty today found innocent the following day, I said: If love, they all love me, if hate, they all hate me,
llm_translation: Rava said, "Initially, I used to think: all the inhabitants of Mehoza are merciful to me. But now that this wine has come, I think: some of them are hostile to me and some are merciful to me. Now that it is seen who is liable for the present, I say: if he is merciful - all are merciful to me, if he is hostile - all are hostile to me."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְשׁוֹחַד לֹא תִקָּח״, אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר שׁוֹחַד מָמוֹן, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹחַד דְּבָרִים נָמֵי אָסוּר, מִדְּלָא כְּתִיב ״בֶּצַע לֹא תִקָּח״. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי שׁוֹחַד דְּבָרִים?
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And you shall take no bribe” It is not necessary to say bribery money; however, even verbal bribery, is also prohibited. from that it is not written: And you shall take no profit. What are the circumstances of bribing with words?
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And you shall not take a bribe" - it is not necessary to say that a bribe is money, but even a bribe of words is also prohibited, as it is not written "a bribe you shall not take." What is the comparison of a bribe of words?

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל הֲוָה עָבַר בְּמַבָּרָא, אֲתָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא יָהֵיב לֵיהּ יְדֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי עֲבִידְתָּיךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּינָא אִית לִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּסִילְנָא לָךְ לְדִינָא.
human_translation: by that involving Shmuel, who was crossing on ferry. A certain man came and gave him a hand said to him: What are you doing said to him: I have a case said to him: I am disqualified from your case,
llm_translation: This is what Samuel was passing through in the crossing, that man came and gave him his hand, he said to him: "What is your occupation?" He said to him: "I am a judge." He said to him: "A stumbling block to you in judgment."

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר הֲוָה יָתֵיב וְקָא דָאֵין דִּינָא. פְּרַח גַּדְפָּא אַרֵישֵׁיהּ, אֲתָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא שַׁקְלֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי עֲבִידְתָּיךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּינָא אִית לִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּסִילְנָא לָךְ לְדִינָא. מָר עוּקְבָא הֲוָה שְׁדֵי רוּקָּא קַמֵּיהּ, אֲתָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא כַּסְּיֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי עֲבִידְתָּיךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּינָא אִית לִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּסִילְנָא לָךְ לְדִינָא.
human_translation: Ameimar was sitting and judging a case a feather floated on his head. A certain man came removed it said to him: What are you doing He said to him: I have a case said to him: I am disqualified from your case, There was spittle lying before Mar Ukva. A certain man came covered it. He said to him: What are you doing He said to him: I have a case said to him: I am disqualified from your case.
llm_translation: Ammemar was sitting and judging a case. The litigant opened his head, another man came and took it. He said to him: What are you doing? He said to him: I have a case. He said to him: I disqualify you from the case. Mar Ukva was sitting and spitting in front of him, another man came and covered it. He said to him: What are you doing? He said to him: I have a case. He said to him: I disqualify you from the case.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הֲוָה רְגִיל אֲרִיסֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה מַיְיתֵי לֵיהּ כׇּל מַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא כַּנְתָּא דְפֵירֵי. יוֹמָא חַד אַיְיתִי לֵיהּ בְּחַמְשָׁה בְּשַׁבְּתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי שְׁנָא הָאִידָּנָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּינָא אִית לִי, וְאָמֵינָא, אַגַּב אוֹרְחִי אַיְיתֵי לֵיהּ לְמָר. לָא קַבֵּיל מִינֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּסִילְנָא לָךְ לְדִינָא.
human_translation: sharecropper of Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, was accustomed to bringing him a basket [ kanta ] of fruits every Shabbat eve. One day, he brought him on a Thursday. said to him: What is different now, said to him: I have a case and I said along my way I will bring to the Master did not accept from him, said to him: I am disqualified from your case.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, used to rent his donkey to anyone who needed it every Shabbat eve. One day, someone rented it from him for five days on Shabbat. He said to him: "What is different today?" He said to him: "I have a legal case, and I thought, since you are on the way, I will bring it to the master." He did not accept it from him. He said to him: "I have disqualified you for acting against the law."

hebrew_text: אוֹתֵיב זוּזָא דְרַבָּנַן וְקָדָיְינִין לֵיהּ. בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָאָזֵיל וְאָתֵי אֲמַר: אִי בָּעֵי — טָעֵין הָכִי, וְאִי בָּעֵי — טָעֵין הָכִי. אָמַר: תִּיפַּח נַפְשָׁם שֶׁל מְקַבְּלֵי שׁוֹחַד! וּמָה אֲנִי שֶׁלֹּא נָטַלְתִּי, וְאִם נָטַלְתִּי — שֶׁלִּי נָטַלְתִּי, כָּךְ, מְקַבְּלֵי שׁוֹחַד — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: seated a pair of rabbinic and they judged As was coming and going, he said If he wants, he claim this, and if he wants, he could claim that, He said Blast the souls of those who accept bribes. If I, who did not accept and if I had accepted, I accepted my own this all the more so those who accept bribes
llm_translation: He sat the coin of the sages and they sanctified it. While he was walking and coming, he said: If he wants - let him taste like this, and if he wants - let him taste like this. He said: The souls of those who accept bribes should be blown away! And what am I that I have not taken, and if I have taken - I have taken for myself, so, those who accept bribes - how much more so.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בַּר אֱלִישָׁע אַיְיתִי לֵיהּ הַהוּא גַּבְרָא רֵאשִׁית הַגֵּז. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מֵהֵיכָא אַתְּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִדּוּךְ פְּלָן. וּמֵהָתָם לְהָכָא לָא הֲוָה כֹּהֵן לְמִיתְּבָא לֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּינָא אִית לִי, וְאָמֵינָא, אַגַּב אוֹרְחַאי אַיְיתֵי לֵיהּ לְמָר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּסִילְנָא לָךְ לְדִינָא, לָא קַבֵּיל מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael bar Elisha, a certain man brought him the first shearing. said to him: From where are you? said to him: from such and such a place. said to him: And from there to here was there no priest to give He said to him: I have a case and I said along my way I will bring to the Master said to him: I am disqualified from your case, not accept from him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael bar Elisha brought him the man, the beginning of the shearing. He said to him: From where are you? He said to him: From such and such a place. And from there to here, was there not a priest to sit with him? He said to him: I have a judgment, and I believe, regarding my guest I brought him to the master. He said to him: I reject your judgment, I do not accept it from you.

hebrew_text: אוֹתֵיב לֵיהּ זוּגָא דְרַבָּנַן וְקָדָיְינִי לֵיהּ. בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָאָזֵיל וְאָתֵי, אֲמַר: אִי בָּעֵי טָעֵין הָכִי, וְאִי בָּעֵי טָעֵין הָכִי. אָמַר: תִּיפַּח נַפְשָׁם שֶׁל מְקַבְּלֵי שׁוֹחַד! וּמָה אֲנִי שֶׁלֹּא נָטַלְתִּי, וְאִם נָטַלְתִּי — שֶׁלִּי נָטַלְתִּי, כָּךְ, מְקַבְּלֵי שׁוֹחַד — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: seated a pair of rabbinic and they judged his As was coming and going, he said If he wants, he claim this, and if he wants, he could claim that. He said Blast the souls of those who accept bribes. If I, who did not accept and if I had accepted, I accepted my own this all the more so those who accept bribes.
llm_translation: He presented to him a pair of sages and he accepted them. As he was going and coming, he said: If he wants to taste it this way, and if he wants to taste it that way. He said: The souls of those who accept bribes should be blasted! And what about me, that I did not take, and if I did take — I took for myself, so, those who accept bribes — how much more so.

hebrew_text: רַב עָנָן אַיְיתִי לֵיהּ הַהוּא גַּבְרָא כַּנְתָּא דְגִילְדָּנֵי דְּבֵי גִילֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי עֲבִידְתָּיךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּינָא אִית לִי. לָא קַבֵּיל מִינֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּסִילְנָא לָךְ לְדִינָא.
human_translation: a certain man brought to Rav Anan a basket of small fish [ gildanei devei gilei ]. He said to him: What are you doing said to him: I have a case not accept from him, he said to him: I am disqualified from your case,
llm_translation: Rav Anan brought before him that man, the leader of the Givladei family. He said to him: What is your occupation? He replied: I am a judge. He did not accept him. He said to him: We disqualify you from being a judge.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּינָא דְּמָר לָא בָּעֵינָא, קַבּוֹלֵי לְקַבֵּיל מָר דְּלָא לִמְנְעַן מָר מֵאַקְרוֹבֵי בִּכּוּרִים. דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְאִישׁ בָּא מִבַּעַל שָׁלִישָׁה וַיָּבֵא לְאִישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים לֶחֶם בִּכּוּרִים עֶשְׂרִים לֶחֶם שְׂעוֹרִים וְכַרְמֶל בְּצִקְלוֹנוֹ״. וְכִי אֱלִישָׁע אוֹכֵל בִּכּוּרִים הֲוָה? אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לָךְ: כׇּל הַמֵּבִיא דּוֹרוֹן לְתַלְמִיד חָכָם — כְּאִילּוּ מַקְרִיב בִּכּוּרִים.
human_translation: The man said to him: I do not need the Master’s judgment. let the Master accept my gift so that the Master does not prevent me from presenting first fruits. As it is taught “And there came a man came from Ba’al Shalisha, and he brought the man of God bread of the first fruits, twenty loaves of barley and fresh ears of corn in his sack” But did Elisha, eat first fruits? Rather, to tell you: Whoever brings a gift to a Torah scholar, it is as though he has presented first fruits.
llm_translation: He said to him: The judgment of the master I do not need, I accept to accept the master so as not to prevent the master from coming close with first fruits. As it was taught: "And a man came from Baal-shalishah, and brought to the man of God bread of first fruits, twenty loaves of barley, and fresh ears of grain in his sack." Was Elisha eating first fruits? Rather, to say to you: Anyone who brings a gift to a wise student - it is as if he is offering first fruits.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קַבּוֹלֵי לָא בָּעֵינַן דְּאֵיקַבֵּיל, הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ לִי טַעְמָא, מְקַבֵּילְנָא. שַׁדְּרֵיהּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: נִידַיְּינֵיהּ מָר לְהַאי גַּבְרָא, דַּאֲנָא עָנָן פְּסִילְנָא לֵיהּ לְדִינָא. אָמַר: מִדִּשְׁלַח לִי הָכִי, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ קָרִיבֵיהּ הוּא. הֲוָה קָאֵים דִּינָא דְיַתְמֵי קַמֵּיהּ, אֲמַר:
human_translation: said to him: I do not want to take it from you, now that you have explained to me the reason I will accept it sent to Rav Naḥman, he sent him Let the Master judge this man’s because I, Anan, am disqualified from judging his said From the fact that he sent me this conclude from here he is his relative. a case involving orphans was before He said:
llm_translation: He said to him: We do not need to receive the teaching that you have received, now that you have told me the reason, we receive it. He sent him to Rav Nachman, he sent to him: "My master, this man's witnesses are against me, I am bringing a counter-claim against him." He said: Since he sent me like this, listen from him, he is bringing his claim close. When the judgment was being held before him, he said:

hebrew_text: הַאי עֲשֵׂה וְהַאי עֲשֵׂה — עֲשֵׂה דִּכְבוֹד תּוֹרָה עֲדִיף. סַלְּקֵיהּ לְדִינָא דְּיַתְמֵי וְאַחֲתֵיהּ לְדִינֵיהּ, כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזָא בַּעַל דִּינֵיהּ יְקָרָא דְּקָא עָבֵיד לַיהּ, אִיסְתַּתֻּם טַעְנָתֵיהּ.
human_translation: This is a positive mitzva, and this is a positive mitzva, the positive mitzva of honor to the Torah takes precedence. he put aside the case of the orphans and settled down to judge Once the litigant saw the honor being accorded to his claim, became closed,
llm_translation: This one positive commandment and this one positive commandment - the positive commandment of honoring the Torah is superior. One is for its own judgment and the other is for its judgment, since when the master of its judgment sees that he is doing for him, he will be satisfied with his claims.

hebrew_text: רַב עָנָן הֲוָה רְגִיל אֵלִיָּהוּ דְּאָתֵי גַּבֵּיהּ, דַּהֲוָה מַתְנֵי לֵיהּ סֵדֶר דְּאֵלִיָּהוּ. כֵּיוָן דַּעֲבַד הָכִי, אִיסְתַּלַּק. יְתֵיב בְּתַעֲנִיתָא וּבְעָא רַחֲמֵי וַאֲתָא. כִּי אֲתָא, הֲוָה מְבַעֵית לֵיהּ בַּעוֹתֵי.
human_translation: Elijah was accustomed to come Rav Anan, as was teaching him Seder deEliyahu , Once did this departed. sat in a fast and prayed for mercy, and came when came he would scare him,
llm_translation: Rav Anan used to frequent Elijah, who would teach him the order of Elijah. Once he did so, he departed. He sat in a fast and prayed for mercy, and he came. When he came, he would ask him questions.

hebrew_text: וַעֲבַד תֵּיבוּתָא וִיתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ עַד דְּאַפֵּיק לֵיהּ סִידְרֵיהּ. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי: סֵדֶר דְּאֵלִיָּהוּ רַבָּה, סֵדֶר אֵלִיָּהוּ זוּטָא.
human_translation: And made a box and he sat before until he took out for him, his Seder . And this is what they say: Seder deEliyahu Rabba , Seder Eliyahu Zuta ,
llm_translation: And he prepared the dish and sat before him until he arranged his order. And this is what they say: the order of Eliyahu Rabba, the order of Eliyahu Zuta.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁנֵי דְּרַב יוֹסֵף הֲוָה רִיתְחָא. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב יוֹסֵף: לִיבְעֵי מָר רַחֲמֵי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה אֱלִישָׁע דְּכִי הֲווֹ רַבָּנַן מִיפַּטְרִי מִקַּמֵּיהּ, הֲווֹ פָּיְישִׁי תְּרֵי אַלְפֵי וּמָאתַן רַבָּנַן, בְּעִידָּן רִיתְחָא לָא הֲוָה בָּעֵי רַחֲמֵי, אֲנָא אֶיבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי?
human_translation: In the years of Rav Yosef there was anger, The Sages said to Rav Yosef: Let the Master pray for mercy He said to them: Now, if Elisha, when the Sages would take their leave of him, 2,200 Sages would remain would not pray for mercy at a time of anger should I pray for mercy?
llm_translation: In the days of Rav Yosef, there was a certain incident. The Sages said to Rav Yosef: "The Master should pray for mercy." He said to them: "Now, when Elisha was with the Sages and they were not departing from him, did he pray for mercy? I, too, should pray for mercy?"

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּפָיְישִׁי הָכִי? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר מְשָׁרְתוֹ מָה אֶתֵּן זֶה לִפְנֵי מֵאָה אִישׁ״. מַאי ״לִפְנֵי מֵאָה אִישׁ״? אִילֵימָא דְּכוּלְּהוּ, לִפְנֵי מֵאָה אִישׁ בִּשְׁנֵי בַצּוֹרֶת טוּבָא הֲווֹ! אֶלָּא דְּכֹל חַד וְחַד קַמֵּי מֵאָה אִישׁ.
human_translation: And from where that this would remain As it is written: “And his servant said: How should I set this before a hundred men” What “before a hundred men”? If we say that all of before one hundred men, in years of drought this was a good Rather, that each and every one before one hundred men.
llm_translation: From where do we derive this? As it is written: "And his servant said, 'What shall I give this before a hundred men?'" What is meant by "before a hundred men"? If you say it refers to all of them, then before a hundred men in two rows of good appearance they were! Rather, it means that each and every one stood before a hundred men.

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲווֹ מִיפַּטְרִי רַבָּנַן מִבֵּי רַב, הֲווֹ פָּיְישִׁי אַלְפָּא וּמָאתַן רַבָּנַן. מִבֵּי רַב הוּנָא, הֲווֹ פָּיְישִׁי תַּמְנֵי מְאָה רַבָּנַן. רַב הוּנָא הֲוָה דָּרֵישׁ בִּתְלֵיסַר אָמוֹרָאֵי. כִּי הֲווֹ קָיְימִי רַבָּנַן מִמְּתִיבְתָּא דְּרַב הוּנָא וְנָפְצִי גְּלִימַיְיהוּ הֲוָה סָלֵיק אַבְקָא וְכָסֵי לֵיהּ לְיוֹמָא, וְאָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא: קָמוּ לֵיהּ מִמְּתִיבְתָּא דְּרַב הוּנָא בַּבְלָאָה.
human_translation: When the Sages would take their leave from the school Rav, 1,200 Sages would remain from the school Rav Huna, eight hundred Sages would remain Rav Huna would expound by thirteen speakers, When the Sages would arise in the yeshiva of Rav Huna and dust off their cloaks, the dust would rise and block out the sun, And they would say in the West, The have arisen in the yeshiva of Rav Huna the Babylonian.
llm_translation: When the Rabbis would finish their studies at the house of Rav, they would disperse in groups of one hundred and two hundred Rabbis. From the house of Rav Huna, they would disperse in groups of one hundred Rabbis. Rav Huna used to expound in groups of thirteen Amoraim. When the Rabbis would finish from the study hall of Rav Huna, and their cloaks would be torn, they would take a piece of cloth and cover it for the day, and they would say in Aramaic: "They have come from the study hall of Rav Huna in Babla'a."

hebrew_text: כִּי מִיפַּטְרִי רַבָּנַן מִבֵּי רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף, הֲווֹ פָּיְישִׁי אַרְבַּע מְאָה רַבָּנַן, וְקָרוּ לְנַפְשַׁיְיהוּ: ״יַתְמֵי״. כִּי הֲווֹ מִיפַּטְרִי רַבָּנַן מִבֵּי אַבָּיֵי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ מִבֵּי רַב פָּפָּא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ מִבֵּי רַב אָשֵׁי, הֲווֹ פָּיְישִׁי מָאתַן רַבָּנַן, וְקָרוּ נַפְשַׁיְיהוּ ״יַתְמֵי דְּיַתְמֵי״.
human_translation: When the Sages would take their leave from the school Rabba and Rav Yosef, four hundred Sages would remain and they would refer to themselves as orphans, When the Sages would take their leave from the school Abaye, and some say from the school Rav Pappa, and some say from the school Rav Ashi, two hundred scholars would remain and they would refer to themselves as orphans of orphans.
llm_translation: When the Rabbis would depart from the house of Rabba and Rav Yosef, they would be four hundred Rabbis, and they would call themselves: "Yatmei." When they would depart from the house of Abbaye, and some say from the house of Rav Papa, and some say from the house of Rav Ashi, they would be two hundred Rabbis, and they would call themselves "Yatmei deYatmei."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר רְדִיפָא אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: מְבַקְּרֵי מוּמִין שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, הָיוּ נוֹטְלִין שְׂכָרָן מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הַמְלַמְּדִין הִלְכוֹת שְׁחִיטָה לְכֹהֲנִים, הָיוּ נוֹטְלִין שְׂכָרָן מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Redifa said Rabbi Ami said: Inspectors of blemishes in Jerusalem, would take their wages from the collection of the chamber. Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Torah scholars who teach the halakhot of slaughter to the priests would take their wages from collection of the chamber.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak bar Redifa, said Rabbi Ammi: Those who inspect the blemishes in Jerusalem, they would take their reward from the Temple Chamber tithe. Said Rav Yehudah, said Shmuel: Torah scholars who teach the laws of ritual slaughter to the priests, they would take their reward from the Temple Chamber tithe.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הַמְלַמְּדִים הִלְכוֹת קְמִיצָה לַכֹּהֲנִים, נוֹטְלִין שְׂכָרָן מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַגִּיהֵי סְפָרִים שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, הָיוּ נוֹטְלִין שְׂכָרָן מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה.
human_translation: Rav Giddel said Rav said: Torah scholars who teach the halakhot of the removal of a handful to the priests would take their wages from the collection of the chamber. Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The proofreaders of scrolls in Jerusalem would take their wages from the collection of the chamber.
llm_translation: Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: Disciples of sages who teach laws of the handful offering to the priests, they take their reward from the contribution of the chamber. Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Those who deliver books in Jerusalem, they would take their reward from the contribution of the chamber.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: נָשִׁים הָאוֹרְגוֹת בַּפָּרֹכוֹת, נוֹטְלוֹת שְׂכָרָן מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה. וַאֲנִי אוֹמֵר, מִקׇּדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת. הוֹאִיל וּפָרֹכוֹת תַּחַת בִּנְיָן עֲשׂוּיוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Rav said: The women who weave the curtains would take their wages from the collection of the chamber. But I say from consecrated for Temple maintenance. Since the curtains served in place building,
llm_translation: Rav Nahman said in the name of Rav: Women who weave the curtains take their reward from the contribution of the Temple treasury. And I say, from the sanctified funds of the Temple courtyard. Since the curtains are made as part of the construction.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: נָשִׁים הָאוֹרְגוֹת בַּפָּרֹכוֹת, וּבֵית גַּרְמוּ עַל מַעֲשֵׂה לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים, וּבֵית אַבְטִינָס עַל מַעֲשֵׂה הַקְּטֹרֶת — כּוּלָּן הָיוּ נוֹטְלוֹת שְׂכָרָן מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה!
human_translation: raises an objection The women who weave the curtains, and the house of Garmu, of the preparation of the shewbread, and the house of Avtinas, of the preparation of the incense, all would take their wages from the collection of the chamber.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: It was raised: Women who weave the curtains, and the House of Garmu for the work of the showbread, and the House of Avtinas for the work of the incense - all of them used to take their reward from the contribution of the Temple chamber!

hebrew_text: הָתָם בִּדְבָבֵי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב: שְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה פָּרֹכוֹת הָיוּ בְּמִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי, שֶׁבַע כְּנֶגֶד שִׁבְעָה שְׁעָרִים, אַחַת לְפִתְחוֹ שֶׁל הֵיכָל, וְאַחַת לְפִתְחוֹ שֶׁל אוּלָם. שְׁתַּיִם בַּדְּבִיר, שְׁתַּיִם כְּנֶגְדָּן בָּעֲלִיָּה.
human_translation: There, of the gates, As Rabbi Zeira said Rav said: There were thirteen curtains in the Second Temple, seven opposite, seven gates, one at the entrance to the Sanctuary, one at the entrance to the Entrance Hall, two within the partition, and two corresponding to them in the upper chamber.
llm_translation: There, in the case of bees. As Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav: There were thirteen curtains in the Second Temple, seven corresponding to the seven gates, one for the entrance of the Sanctuary, and one for the entrance of the Hall. Two in the Holy of Holies, and two corresponding to them in the upper chamber.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נָשִׁים הַמְגַדְּלוֹת בְּנֵיהֶן לַפָּרָה — הָיוּ נוֹטְלוֹת שְׂכָרָן מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: נָשִׁים יְקָרוֹת שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם הָיוּ זָנוֹת אוֹתָן וּמְפַרְנְסוֹת אוֹתָן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: the women who raise their children for heifer, would take their wages from the collection of the chamber. Abba Shaul said: prominent women of Jerusalem would sustain them and provide them with a livelihood.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Women who raise their sons for the sake of the cow - they would receive their reward from the contribution of the Chamber. Abba Saul says: The noble women of Jerusalem would commit adultery with them and provide for them.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב הוּנָא מֵרַב:
human_translation: Rav Huna raised a dilemma before Rav:
llm_translation: Requested from him Rav Huna from Rav:

hebrew_text: כְּלֵי שָׁרֵת מַהוּ שֶׁיֵּעָשׂוּ מִקׇּדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת? צוֹרֶךְ מִזְבֵּחַ נִינְהוּ, וּמִקׇּדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת אָתוּ? אוֹ צוֹרֶךְ קׇרְבָּן נִינְהוּ, וּמִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין אוֹתָן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין נַעֲשִׂין אֶלָּא מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה.
human_translation: service vessels, what is that they may be prepared by consecrated for Temple maintenance? Are they requirements of the altar, and came from consecrated for Temple maintenance, or are they requirements of offerings, and they were prepared from the collection of the chamber? said to him: They are prepared only from the collection of the chamber.
llm_translation: Vessels of service, what are they made from the sanctified funds of the Temple courtyard? Are they needed for the altar, and they are made from the sanctified funds of the Temple courtyard? Or are they needed for a sacrifice, and they were made from the contribution of the chamber? He said to him: They are made only from the contribution of the chamber.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: ״וּכְכַלּוֹתָם הֵבִיאוּ לִפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ וִיהוֹיָדָע (הַכֹּהֵן) אֶת שְׁאָר הַכֶּסֶף וַיַּעֲשֵׂהוּ כֵלִים לְבֵית ה׳ כְּלֵי שָׁרֵת וְגוֹ׳״!
human_translation: raised an objection to “And when they had made an end, they brought the rest of the money before the king and Jehoiada, of which were made vessels for the house of the Lord, vessels with which to minister,
llm_translation: He raised an objection: "And when they had finished, they brought the rest of the money before the king and Jehoiada the priest (הַכֹּהֵן) made it into vessels for the house of the Lord, vessels for service, etc."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּאַקְרְיָיךְ כְּתוּבֵי לָא אַקְרְיָיךְ נְבִיאֵי, ״אַךְ לֹא יֵעָשֶׂה בֵּית ה׳ סִפּוֹת וְגוֹ׳ כִּי לְעֹשֵׂי הַמְּלָאכָה יִתְּנֻהוּ״.
human_translation: said to him: Whoever taught you the Writings did not teach you the Prophets, “But there were not made for the house of the Lord cups for they gave that to those who did the work”
llm_translation: He said to him: "That which is written, I will not read as written, the Prophets, 'But the house of the Lord shall not be made with boards, etc., for those who do the work shall provide it.'"

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, קָשׁוּ קְרָאֵי אַהֲדָדֵי! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן שֶׁגָּבוּ וְהוֹתִירוּ, כָּאן שֶׁגָּבוּ וְלֹא הוֹתִירוּ.
human_translation: If so, the verses contradict each other, not difficult; here where they collected and there was left over. here, where they collected and there was nothing left over,
llm_translation: Thus, the verses of Ahadadei are difficult! It is not difficult: here where they included and left, here where they included and did not leave.

hebrew_text: וְכִי גָּבוּ וְהוֹתִירוּ מַאי הָוֵי? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: לֵב בֵּית דִּין מַתְנֶה עֲלֵיהֶן, אִם הוּצְרְכוּ — הוּצְרְכוּ, וְאִם לָאו — יְהוּ לִכְלֵי שָׁרֵת.
human_translation: And if they collected and there was left over, what of it? Rabbi Abbahu said: The court sets a mental stipulation about the If it is required it is required and if not, it will be for the service vessels.
llm_translation: "And if they collected and left over, what is the ruling? Rabbi Avahu said: The court should decide regarding them, if they are needed - they are needed, and if not - they shall be for the vessels of the Temple service."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כְּלֵי שָׁרֵת בָּאִין מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶת שְׁאָר הַכֶּסֶף״, אֵיזֶהוּ כֶּסֶף שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שִׁירַיִים — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה תְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: service vessels comes from the collection of the chamber, as it is stated: “The rest of the money” Which money has a remainder? You must say this the collection of the chamber.
llm_translation: Tanna of the school of Rabbi Ishmael: The vessels of service come from the contribution of the chamber, as it is stated: "the rest of the silver," what is the silver that has leftovers - say this is the contribution of the chamber.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא שִׁירַיִים גּוּפַיְיהוּ? כִּדְאָמַר רָבָא: ״הָעוֹלָה״ — עוֹלָה רִאשׁוֹנָה, הָכִי נָמֵי: ״הַכֶּסֶף״ — כֶּסֶף רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: But say the remainder itself as Rava said “the burnt-offering” the first burnt-offering; so too, “the money” the first money,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And why are they called "Shirayim" themselves? As Rava said: "The burnt offering" - the first burnt offering, so too: "The silver" - the first silver.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַקְּטוֹרֶת וְכׇל קׇרְבְּנוֹת צִבּוּר — בָּאִין מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה, מִזְבַּח הַזָּהָב וּלְבוֹנָה וּכְלֵי שָׁרֵת — בָּאִין מִמּוֹתַר נְסָכִים.
human_translation: raises an objection the incense and all communal offerings come from the collection of the chamber. the golden altar, the frankincense, and the service vessels come from the leftover the libations.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text you provided translates into English as follows: Challenger: The incense and all communal offerings - they come from the Chamber's contribution, the golden altar, the frankincense, and the service vessels - they come from leftover libations.

hebrew_text: מִזְבַּח הָעוֹלָה, הַלְּשָׁכוֹת וְהָעֲזָרוֹת — בָּאִין מִקׇּדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת. חוּץ לְחוֹמַת הָעֲזָרָה — בָּאִין מִשְּׁיָרֵי הַלְּשָׁכוֹת. זוֹ הִיא שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ: חוֹמַת הָעִיר וּמִגְדְּלוֹתֶיהָ וְכׇל צׇרְכֵי הָעִיר בָּאִין מִשְּׁיָרֵי הַלִּשְׁכָּה.
human_translation: the altar of burnt-offerings, the chambers, and the courtyards, come from consecrated for Temple maintenance. outside the walls of courtyard come from the remainder of the chambers. And this we learned: The wall of the city, its towers, and all of the requirements of the city come from the remainder of the chamber.
llm_translation: Altar of the burnt offering, the chambers and the courtyards - they enter from the sanctified areas of the Temple Mount. Outside the wall of the courtyard - they enter from the passages of the chambers. This is what we learned: the wall of the city, its towers, and all the needs of the city - they enter from the passages of the chamber.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דִּתְנַן: מוֹתַר תְּרוּמָה, מָה הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין בָּהּ? רִיקּוּעֵי זָהָב צִיפּוּי לְבֵית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: מוֹתַר פֵּירוֹת — לְקֵיץ הַמִּזְבֵּחַ. מוֹתַר תְּרוּמָה — לִכְלֵי שָׁרֵת.
human_translation: It is tanna’im , as we learned What would they do with the leftover of the collection golden plates coating for the Holy of Holies. Rabbi Yishmael says: The leftover produce repletion [ keitz ] of the altar, The leftover of the collection to service vessels.
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: As we learned in a Mishnah: "Permitted Terumah," what were they doing with it? Golden decorations overlaid for the chambers of the Holy of Holies. Rabbi Yishmael says: "Permitted fruits are for the trimming of the altar. Permitted Terumah is for the Temple vessels."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מוֹתַר תְּרוּמָה — לְקֵיץ הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, מוֹתַר נְסָכִים — לִכְלֵי שָׁרֵת. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא סְגַן הַכֹּהֲנִים אוֹמֵר: מוֹתַר נְסָכִים לְקֵיץ הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, מוֹתַר תְּרוּמָה לִכְלֵי שָׁרֵת. וְזֶה וָזֶה, לֹא הָיוּ מוֹדִים בְּפֵירוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: The leftover of the collection for the repletion of the altar, The leftover libations to service vessels. Rabbi Ḥanina, the deputy High Priest, says: The leftover libations the repletion of the altar, the leftover of the collection to service vessels. this and that did not agree with regard to produce.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "Permitted is Terumah - for the end of the altar, permitted are libations - for the vessels of service." Rabbi Chanina, the deputy of the priests, says: "Permitted are libations for the end of the altar, permitted is Terumah for the vessels of service. And both of these, they did not agree upon in their explanation."

hebrew_text: ״פֵּירוֹת״ מַאי הִיא? — דְּתַנְיָא: מוֹתַר תְּרוּמָה מָה הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין בָּהּ? לוֹקְחִין פֵּירוֹת בְּזוֹל וּמוֹכְרִין אוֹתָם בְּיוֹקֶר, וְהַשָּׂכָר — מְקַיְּצִין בּוֹ אֶת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ. וְזוֹ הִיא שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ: מוֹתַר פֵּירוֹת לְקֵיץ הַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: What is this produce? As it is taught What would they do with the leftover of the collection? They buy produce at a cheap and sell at an expensive and the profit for the repletion of the altar. And this we learned: The leftover of produce for the repletion of the altar.
llm_translation: "Fruits" what is it? — as it was taught: with regard to leftover Terumah, what would they do with it? They would take fruits cheaply and sell them at a high price, and the profit they would use to beautify the altar. And this is what we learned: leftover fruits for beautifying the altar.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״זֶה וָזֶה לֹא הָיוּ מוֹדִין בְּפֵירוֹת״? דִּתְנַן: מוֹתַר שְׁיָרֵי לִשְׁכָּה מָה הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין בָּהֶן? לוֹקְחִין בָּהֶן יֵינוֹת שְׁמָנִים וּסְלָתוֹת, וְהַשָּׂכָר — לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין מִשְׂתַּכְּרִין בְּשֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ, אַף לֹא בְּשֶׁל עֲנִיִּים.
human_translation: what this and that did not agree with regard to the produce? as we learned What would they do with the leftover remainder of the chamber? They purchase wine, oil, and fine flour And the profit to consecrated the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: One may not generate profit by consecrated nor from for the poor.
llm_translation: What is meant by "neither of them were used for fruit"? For it was taught: What did they do with the leftover wine offerings? They would take them for the use of the Temple, the oil offerings, and the meal offerings, and the proceeds would be used for sanctification, according to the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: One may not become intoxicated with sanctified wine, nor with wine intended for the poor.

hebrew_text: בְּשֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ מַאי טַעְמָא לָא — אֵין עֲנִיּוּת בִּמְקוֹם עֲשִׁירוּת. בְּשֶׁל עֲנִיִּים מַאי טַעְמָא לָא — דִּלְמָא מִתְרְמֵי לְהוּ עַנְיָא וְלֵיכָּא לְמִיתְּבָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: What is the reason not consecrated there is no poverty in a place of wealth, What is the reason not for the poor perhaps one will encounter a poor person and there will be nothing to give him,
llm_translation: Regarding the sanctification of the tithe, what is the reason that it is not valid? — There is no poverty in a place of wealth. Regarding the sanctification of the poor person's tithe, what is the reason that it is not valid? — Perhaps they the poor will take it the tithe and there will be nothing for him the poor person to sit down to.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁהָלַךְ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם. אִיתְּמַר, רַב אָמַר:
human_translation: one who went overseas It was stated Rav said:
llm_translation: One who went to the province of the sea. It was stated: Rav said:

hebrew_text: פּוֹסְקִין מְזוֹנוֹת לְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין פּוֹסְקִין מְזוֹנוֹת לְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מוֹדֶה לִי אַבָּא בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אָדָם מַנִּיחַ בֵּיתוֹ רֵיקָן.
human_translation: apportions sustenance for a married woman, And Shmuel said: does not apportion sustenance for a married woman. Shmuel said: Abba, concedes to me for the first three months. because a person does not leave his house empty,
llm_translation: We allocate sustenance for a man's wife. And Samuel said: We do not allocate sustenance for a man's wife. Samuel said: My father admitted to me for the first three months, because a person does not leave his house empty.

hebrew_text: בְּשֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ בּוֹ שֶׁמֵּת כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי, בְּשֶׁלֹּא שָׁמְעוּ בּוֹ שֶׁמֵּת. רַב אָמַר: פּוֹסְקִין, דְּהָא מְשׁוּעְבַּד לַהּ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין פּוֹסְקִין.
human_translation: where they heard that died, everyone agrees When they disagree where they did not hear that he had died Rav said apportions as mortgaged to her and Shmuel said does not apportion
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When they heard about him, the whole world did not dispute. When they disputed, it is when they did not hear about him that he died. Rav said: They stop learning, for he is already obligated to learn. And Shmuel said: They do not stop learning.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? רַב זְבִיד אָמַר: אֵימָא צְרָרֵי אַתְפְּסַהּ. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא אָמַר לָהּ ״צְאִי מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַיִךְ בִּמְזוֹנוֹתַיִךְ״.
human_translation: What is the reason Rav Zevid said: say that he gave her a bundle Rav Pappa said: We are concerned perhaps he said to her Spend your earnings to sustain yourself,
llm_translation: "What is the reason? Rav Zevid said: Perhaps you will encounter trouble. Rav Papa said: We are concerned lest he say to her, 'Go out, my handiwork, with my sustenance.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ גְּדוֹלָה, וְלָא סָפְקָה.
human_translation: What is between There is between them an adult, and not enough
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a great difference between them, and it is not insignificant.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי קְטַנָּה וְסָפְקָה.
human_translation: Alternatively, a minor but enough
llm_translation: If so, a small vessel and a doubt.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: מִי שֶׁהָלַךְ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וְאִשְׁתּוֹ תּוֹבַעַת מְזוֹנוֹת, חָנָן אָמַר: תִּשָּׁבַע בַּסּוֹף, וְלֹא תִּשָּׁבַע בַּתְּחִלָּה. נֶחְלְקוּ עָלָיו בְּנֵי כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים וְאָמְרוּ: תִּשָּׁבַע בַּתְּחִלָּה וּבַסּוֹף. עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן שְׁבוּעָה, אֲבָל מְזוֹנֵי יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ! תַּרְגְּמַהּ שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּשֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ בּוֹ שֶׁמֵּת.
human_translation: We learned one who went overseas and his wife is demanding sustenance, Ḥanan says: She takes an oath at the end, and she does not take an oath at the outset. The sons of High Priests disputed and said: She takes an oath at the outset and at the end. They disagree only with regard to an oath; however, sustenance that gives to her. Shmuel interpreted when they heard concerning him that he died
llm_translation: We learned: One who went to the province of the sea and his wife demands maintenance, Chaninah said: She should swear at the end, and not swear at the beginning. The sons of great priests disagreed with him and said: She should swear at the beginning and at the end. They only disagreed with him regarding the matter of an oath, but as for maintenance, we give it to her! Shmuel translated his name: When they heard about him, he died.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מִי שֶׁהָלַךְ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וְאִשְׁתּוֹ תּוֹבַעַת מְזוֹנוֹת, בְּנֵי כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים אוֹמְרִים: תִּשָּׁבַע, חָנָן אוֹמֵר: לֹא תִּשָּׁבַע. וְאִם בָּא וְאָמַר: פָּסַקְתִּי לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת — נֶאֱמָן!
human_translation: Come hear one who went overseas and his wife is demanding sustenance, the sons of High Priests say: She takes an oath. Ḥanan says: She does not take an oath, And if he came and said: I apportioned for her sustenance he is deemed credible
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who goes to a maritime province and his wife demands sustenance, the great priests say: She should take an oath, Hanan says: She should not take an oath. And if he comes and says: "I have cut off her sustenance" — he is believed!

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי בְּשֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ בּוֹ שֶׁמֵּת. וְהָא ״אִם בָּא וְאָמַר״ קָאָמַר! אִם בָּא לְאַחַר שְׁמוּעָה.
human_translation: Here, too, where they heard concerning him that he died But said: If he came and said, If he came after the rumor.
