llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: Talmudic text: Here it is stated where they heard about his death. And there, "if he comes and says," is what it means! If he comes after hearing.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מִי שֶׁהָלַךְ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וְאִשְׁתּוֹ תּוֹבַעַת מְזוֹנוֹת, וְאִם בָּא וְאָמַר ״צְאִי מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַיִךְ בִּמְזוֹנוֹתַיִךְ״ — רַשַּׁאי. קָדְמוּ בֵּית דִּין וּפָסְקוּ — מַה שֶּׁפָּסְקוּ פָּסְקוּ. הָכָא נָמֵי בְּשֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ בּוֹ שֶׁמֵּת.
human_translation: Come hear one who went overseas and his wife is demanding sustenance, if he came and said Spend your earnings to sustain yourself, he is permitted If the court went ahead and apportioned what they apportioned is apportioned, Here, too, where they heard concerning him that he died
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who goes to a maritime province and his wife demands her sustenance, and if he comes and says, "Go out, my handiwork, with my sustenance" - he is permitted. The court preceded and ruled - whatever they ruled, they ruled. Here they say when they heard about him that he died.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מִי שֶׁהָלַךְ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וְאִשְׁתּוֹ תּוֹבַעַת מְזוֹנוֹת — בֵּית דִּין יוֹרְדִים לִנְכָסָיו וְזָנִין וּמְפַרְנְסִין לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, אֲבָל לֹא בָּנָיו וּבְנוֹתָיו, וְלֹא דָּבָר אַחֵר!
human_translation: Come hear one who went overseas and his wife is demanding sustenance, court descends to his property and feeds and provides a livelihood for his wife, but not his sons and daughters, and not something else.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who goes to a maritime province and his wife demands her sustenance - the court descends to his assets and they feed and provide for his wife, but not for his sons and daughters, and nothing else!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: בְּמַשְׁרֶה אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ עַל יְדֵי שָׁלִישׁ. אִי הָכִי, בָּנָיו וּבְנוֹתָיו נָמֵי! כְּשֶׁהִשְׁרָה לָזוֹ, וְלֹא הִשְׁרָה לָזוֹ. מַאי פַּסְקָא?
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: to one who feeds his wife by means of a third party. If so, his sons and daughters also where he appointed for this but he did not appoint for this why without qualification?
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: "He should engage in marital relations with his wife through a messenger." If so, his sons and daughters are also considered his offspring! When he engaged in relations with this one, and did not engage in relations with this one. What is the halakha?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּשֶׁשָּׁמְעָה בּוֹ שֶׁמֵּת בְּעֵד אֶחָד. הִיא, דְּאִי בָּעֲיָא אִינְּסוֹבֵי בְּעֵד אֶחָד מָצְיָא מִינַּסְבָא — מְזוֹנֵי נָמֵי יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said where she heard that he had died, by one witness. she where if she wanted to remarry on one witness she may marry, also provides her with sustenance,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said: When she heard about him, she died in one witness. That is, if she wants, she can be married to one witness; she receives sustenance from the estate.

hebrew_text: בָּנָיו וּבְנוֹתָיו, דְּאִי בָּעוּ לְמֵיחַת לִנְכָסָיו בְּעֵד אֶחָד לָא מָצוּ נָחֲתִי — מְזוֹנֵי נָמֵי לָא יָהֲבִינַן לְהוּ.
human_translation: his sons and daughters, where if they wanted to descend to his estate on one witness, they may not descend also does not provide them with sustenance.
llm_translation: His sons and daughters, for if they come to divide his property in one moment and do not find a resting place - we do not give them sustenance.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״דָּבָר אַחֵר״? רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: תַּכְשִׁיט. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: צְדָקָה. מַאן דְּאָמַר תַּכְשִׁיט, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן
human_translation: What is: Something else, Rav Ḥisda said: ornaments, Rav Yosef said: charity. the one who said ornaments all the more so
llm_translation: "What is 'another matter' (דָּבָר אַחֵר)? Rav Ḥisdah said: adornment. Rav Yosef said: charity. One who said adornment, all the more so."

hebrew_text: צְדָקָה. מַאן דְּאָמַר צְדָקָה — אֲבָל תַּכְשִׁיט יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ, דְּלָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּתִינַּוַּול.
human_translation: charity, the one who said charity However, they do give her ornaments, that it is not satisfactory for him to be degraded
llm_translation: Charity. Who said charity - but jewelry we give to her, for it is not pleasing to her to be adorned.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַיְּבָמָה — שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים נִיזּוֹנֶת מִשֶּׁל בַּעְלָהּ,
human_translation: Come hear: a yevama , first three months she is sustained from her husband.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: hayevamah - shloshah chodashim harishonim nizonet mishel ba'alah," English translation: Come and hear: The yevamah - for the first three months she is sustained from her husband's estate.

hebrew_text: מִיכָּן וְאֵילָךְ, אֵינָהּ נִיזּוֹנֶת לֹא מִשֶּׁל בַּעְלָהּ וְלֹא מִשֶּׁל יָבָם. עָמַד בַּדִּין וּבָרַח — נִיזּוֹנֶת מִשֶּׁל יָבָם.
human_translation: From then on, she is not sustained, neither from her husband nor from yavam . stood in judgment and he fled, she is sustained from yavam .
llm_translation: From here and onwards, she is not sustained neither by her husband nor by her brother-in-law. If he stood in judgment and fled - she is sustained by her brother-in-law.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ שְׁמוּאֵל: לְמַאי נֵיחוּשׁ לַהּ לְהַאי? אִי מִשּׁוּם צְרָרֵי — לָא מִיקָּרְבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ לְגַבַּהּ, אִי מִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ — לָא מִשְׁתַּעְבְּדָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Shmuel said to you: With regard to what we be concerned this If due to a bundle the mind of is not close to if due to her earnings, she is not obligated to him
llm_translation: He said to you, Samuel: For what is she concerned about this? If because of her rivals - her mind does not draw near to arrogance, if because of her handiwork - she does not submit to it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁהָלְכָה הִיא וּבַעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וּבָאת וְאָמְרָה ״מֵת בַּעְלִי״, רָצְתָה — נִיזּוֹנֶת, רָצְתָה — גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. ״גֵּירְשַׁנִי בַּעֲלִי״ — מִתְפַּרְנֶסֶת וְהוֹלֶכֶת עַד כְּדֵי כְתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: Come hear: a wife who went with her husband overseas, and she came and said: My husband died, she wishes she is sustained she wishes she collects her marriage contract. My husband divorced me, she is continually sustained up to the amount of her marriage contract.
llm_translation: Come and hear: A woman who went with her husband to a maritime province, and she came and said, "My husband has died," if she desires - she is sustained, if she desires - she receives her marriage settlement. "My husband divorced me" - she is supported and goes until her marriage settlement.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי כְּשֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ בּוֹ שֶׁמֵּת. וּמַאי שְׁנָא עַד כְּדֵי כְתוּבָּתָהּ? דְּאִיהִי הִיא דְּאַפְסֵידָה אַנַּפְשַׁהּ.
human_translation: Here, too, they heard concerning that he died. And what is different up to the amount of her marriage contract; that she is caused loss to herself.
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: Here they said when they heard about him that he died. And what is the difference until the time of its writing? Because it is the one that caused its loss.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: כֵּיצַד אָמְרוּ מְמָאֶנֶת אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת? אִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לוֹמַר בְּיוֹשֶׁבֶת תַּחַת בַּעְלָהּ — שֶׁהֲרֵי בַּעְלָהּ חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹת. אֶלָּא כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, לָוְתָה וְאָכְלָה עָמְדָה וּמֵיאֲנָה. טַעְמָא דְּמֵיאֲנָה, הָא לֹא מֵיאֲנָה — יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ!
human_translation: Come hear: How, did say refuses does not sustenance? You cannot say to who is living under her husband, as her husband is obligated in her sustenance. Rather, where her husband went overseas, she borrowed and sustained she arose and refused reason that she refused she did not refuse gives
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: How do they say she refuses to receive sustenance? If you might say while she is residing under her husband — for her husband is obligated to provide sustenance. Rather, for example, if her husband went to the overseas province, she weaves and eats, stands and refuses. The reason she refuses, if she does not refuse — we give it to her!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ שְׁמוּאֵל: הָכָא לְמַאי נֵיחוּשׁ לַהּ? אִי מִשּׁוּם צְרָרֵי — צְרָרֵי לִקְטַנָּה לָא מַתְפֵּיס, וְאִי מִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ — קְטַנָּה לָא סָפְקָה.
human_translation: Shmuel said to you: With regard to what we be concerned here? If due to a bundle one does not give a bundle to a minor. If due to her earnings, a minor not enough
llm_translation: He said to you, Samuel: Here, for what is she suspected? If because of bundles - bundles of a minor do not hold, and if because of her handiwork - a minor does not suffice.

hebrew_text: מַאי הֲוָה עֲלַהּ? כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: מַעֲשֶׂה בָּא לִפְנֵי רַבִּי בְּבֵית שְׁעָרִים וּפָסַק לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת. לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּצִפּוֹרִי, וְלֹא פָּסַק לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת. תָּהֵי בַּהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְכִי מָה רָאָה רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל שֶׁלֹּא פָּסַק לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת? הָא לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בְּנֵי כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים וְחָנָן אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן שְׁבוּעָה, אֲבָל מְזוֹנֵי יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ!
human_translation: What is about this When Rav Dimi came he said: An incident came before Rabbi in Beit She’arim, and he apportioned sustenance for her. before Rabbi Yishmael in Tzippori, and he did not apportion sustenance for her. Rabbi Yoḥanan wondered about this And what did Rabbi Yishmael see that he did not apportion sustenance for her? the sons of High Priests and Ḥanan disagreed only with regard to an oath, but sustenance gives it to her.
llm_translation: What was the matter with her? When Rav Dimi came, he said: A case came before Rabbi in Beis Sha'arim, and he ruled in her favor regarding sustenance. Before Rabbi Yishmael in Tzipori, however, he did not rule in her favor regarding sustenance. Let Rabbi Yochanan come and ask: What did Rabbi Yishmael see that he did not rule in her favor regarding sustenance? They only disagreed, the sons of the great priests and Chaninah, in the matter of an oath, but regarding sustenance, they would have provided for her!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא: כְּבָר תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַבֵּינוּ שְׁמוּאֵל בְּבָבֶל כְּשֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ בּוֹ שֶׁמֵּת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פָּתְרִיתוּ בָּהּ כּוּלֵּי הַאי?
human_translation: Rav Shemen bar Abba said to Our Rabbi in Babylonia, Shmuel, already interpreted it they heard concerning that he died. said to him Have you gone that far
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Shemen bar Abba: "Already translated it our master Shmuel in Babylon when they heard about his death." He said to him: "Did they resolve all the difficulties in it?"

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר: מַעֲשֶׂה בָּא לִפְנֵי רַבִּי בְּבֵית שְׁעָרִים, וְלֹא פָּסַק לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת. לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּצִיפּוֹרִי, וּפָסַק לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מָה רָאָה רַבִּי שֶׁלֹּא פָּסַק לָהּ? דְּהָא לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ חָנָן וּבְנֵי כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן שְׁבוּעָה, אֲבָל מְזוֹנוֹת יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא: כְּבָר תַּרְגְּמַהּ שְׁמוּאֵל בְּבָבֶל כְּשֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ בּוֹ שֶׁמֵּת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פָּתְרִיתוּ בָּהּ כּוּלֵּי הַאי?
human_translation: When Ravin came he said An incident came before Rabbi in Beit She’arim, and he did not apportion sustenance for her; before Rabbi Yishmael in Tzippori, and he apportioned sustenance for her. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: And what did Rabbi see that he did not apportion sustenance for her? As, the sons of High Priests and Ḥanan disagreed only with regard to an oath, but sustenance, gives it to her. Rav Shemen bar Abba said to Shmuel in Babylonia already interpreted it they heard concerning him that he died. said to him Have you gone that far
llm_translation: When Rabbin came, he said: A case came before Rabbi in Beit She'arim, and he did not rule regarding her sustenance. Before Rabbi Yishmael in Tzipori, and he ruled regarding her sustenance. Rabbi Yochanan said: What did Rabbi see that he did not rule regarding her? For Hanan and the sons of great priests only disagreed regarding the matter of an oath, but regarding sustenance, they would have provided for her. Rav Shemen bar Abba said to him: Samuel in Babylonia already translated it when they heard that he died. He said to him: Did they solve all of this in it?

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב, וּפוֹסְקִין מְזוֹנוֹת לְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ. וְהִלְכְתָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: יְכוֹלָה אִשָּׁה שֶׁתֹּאמַר לְבַעְלָהּ ״אֵינִי נִיזּוֹנֶת וְאֵינִי עוֹשָׂה״.
human_translation: And the halakha is in accordance with Rav, and one apportions sustenance for a married woman And the halakha is in accordance with Rav Huna Rav said. As Rav Huna said Rav said: A woman can say to her husband: I will not be sustained and I will not work,
llm_translation: The halakha is in accordance with the opinion of Rav, and we rule that a husband must provide sustenance for his wife. The halakha is in accordance with the opinion of Rav Huna as stated by Rav. For Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: A woman may say to her husband, "I am not sustained, and I do not work."

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב זְבִיד בְּקוּנְיָא. דְּאָמַר רַב זְבִיד: הָנֵי מָאנֵי דְקוּנְיָא — חִיוָּרֵי וְאוּכָּמֵי שְׁרוּ.
human_translation: And the halakha is in accordance with Rav Zevid with regard to glazed [ kunya ] As Rav Zevid said: these glazed vessels [ manei dekunya ], white and black ones are permitted
llm_translation: The halakha is like the opinion of Rav Zevid in Kunya, for Rav Zevid said: Those utensils of Kunya - they are black and smooth.

hebrew_text: יְרוּקֵּי אֲסִירִי. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלֵית בְּהוּ קַרְטוּפָנֵי, אֲבָל אִית בְּהוּ קַרְטוּפָנֵי — אֲסִירִי.
human_translation: green are forbidden, And we said only if they do not have cracks; however, if they have cracks they are forbidden,
llm_translation: The green ones of the prisoners. And we only said that they do not have leeks, but if they have leeks - prisoners.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁהָלַךְ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וְעָמַד אֶחָד וּפִירְנֵס אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, חָנָן אוֹמֵר: אִיבֵּד אֶת מְעוֹתָיו.
human_translation: who went overseas, and someone arose and sustained his wife Ḥanan says: lost his money,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who went to the province of the sea, and one stood and supported his wife, Chanin says: He loses his money.

hebrew_text: נֶחְלְקוּ עָלָיו בְּנֵי כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים וְאָמְרוּ: יִשָּׁבַע כַּמָּה הוֹצִיא וְיִטּוֹל. אָמַר רַבִּי דּוֹסָא בֶּן הַרְכִּינָס כְּדִבְרֵיהֶם. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי: יָפֶה אָמַר חָנָן, הִנִּיחַ מְעוֹתָיו עַל קֶרֶן הַצְּבִי.
human_translation: The sons of High Priests disagreed and said: swears how much he spent and he takes Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas said in accordance with their statement. Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Zakkai said: Ḥanan spoke well placed his money on the horn of a deer
llm_translation: The sons of the great priests disputed with him and said: He should swear how much he took out and return. Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas said in accordance with their words. Rabbi Yochanan ben Zakkai said: Hanan said well, he left his coins on the horn of the deer.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנַן הָתָם: הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ —
human_translation: We learned there one prohibited by a vow deriving benefit from another,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah there: One who is vowed to abstain from benefit from his fellow --

hebrew_text: שׁוֹקֵל לוֹ אֶת שִׁקְלוֹ, וּפוֹרֵעַ אֶת חוֹבוֹ, וּמַחֲזִיר לוֹ אֲבֵידָתוֹ. וּבְמָקוֹם שֶׁנּוֹטְלִין שָׂכָר — תִּפּוֹל הֲנָאָה לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: may contribute his shekel for him, and he may repay his debt And he may return to him his lost object, and in a place where one takes a wage the benefit goes to consecrated
llm_translation: He weighs his shekel, and pays his debt, and returns his lost item to him. And in a place where they take wages - benefit shall accrue to the Temple.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא שׁוֹקֵל לוֹ אֶת שִׁקְלוֹ — מִצְוָה קָעָבֵיד. דִּתְנַן: תּוֹרְמִין עַל הָאָבוּד וְעַל הַגָּבוּי וְעַל הֶעָתִיד לִגָּבוֹת.
human_translation: Granted, he may contribute his shekel for him, he performs a mitzva. as we learned One collection that is lost, and that has been gathered and that will be gathered in the future.
llm_translation: In truth, he weighs his shekel for him — it is a mitzvah that is esteemed. For it was taught: One may separate terumah for the lost, for the stolen, and for that which is destined to be collected.

hebrew_text: וּמַחֲזִיר לוֹ אֲבֵידָתוֹ נָמֵי מִצְוָה קָעָבֵיד. אֶלָּא פּוֹרֵעַ לוֹ אֶת חוֹבוֹ, הָא קָמִשְׁתָּרְשִׁי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And he may return to him his lost object, he also performs a mitzva he may repay his debt provides a gain for
llm_translation: And returning to him his lost item is more esteemed than a mitzvah, for it is difficult. Rather, he should pay him his debt, as it is better for him!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: הָא מַנִּי? חָנָן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אִיבֵּד אֶת מְעוֹתָיו.
human_translation: Rav Oshaya said: whose is this It is Ḥanan, who said lost his money.
llm_translation: Rav Oshaya said: Is this Mani? It is Hanan, as he said: "He has destroyed his wealth."

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, שֶׁלָּוָה עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא לִפְרוֹעַ.
human_translation: And Rava said: You even say the Rabbis, and here we are dealing with borrowed on the condition that he not pay it back
llm_translation: And Rava said: Even if you say the Rabbis, here we are dealing with what? With a loan on condition that it not be annulled.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רָבָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: דְּמוֹקֵים לַהּ כְּרַבָּנַן. אֶלָּא רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרָבָא? אָמַר לָךְ רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: נְהִי דַּהֲנָאָה לֵית לֵיהּ,
human_translation: Granted, Rava did not say of Rav Oshaya, as he establishes in accordance with the Rabbis. However, what is the reason Rav Oshaya did not say in accordance with Rava? Rav Oshaya said to you: Although there is no benefit to
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In truth, Rava did not say like Rav Oshaya: that they are similar to him like the Rabbanan. Rather, Rav Oshaya, what is the reason he did not say like Rava? Rav Oshaya said to you: "Because it does not have this benefit."

hebrew_text: כִּיסּוּפָא מִי לֵית לֵיהּ? הָתָם נָמֵי אִית לֵיהּ הֲנָאָה בְּהָהִיא הֲנָאָה דְּמִיכְּסִיף מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: doesn’t he have shame There too, he has benefit; benefit that he is ashamed before him
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Kisufa mi lei? Hatam namei it lei hanaha behahiya hanaha de mikhsif minei." English translation: "Is there no embarrassment? There, too, there is pleasure in that pleasure that he derives from it."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַדְמוֹן אוֹמֵר, שִׁבְעָה: מִי שֶׁמֵּת וְהִנִּיחַ בָּנִים וּבָנוֹת, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַנְּכָסִים מְרוּבִּין — הַבָּנִים יוֹרְשִׁים, וְהַבָּנוֹת נִזּוֹנוֹת. וּבִנְכָסִים מוּעָטִים — הַבָּנוֹת יִזּוֹנוּ, וְהַבָּנִים — יְחַזְּרוּ עַל הַפְּתָחִים. אַדְמוֹן אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁאֲנִי זָכָר הִפְסַדְתִּי?! אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: רוֹאֶה אֲנִי אֶת דִּבְרֵי אַדְמוֹן.
human_translation: Admon states seven one who died and left sons and daughters, when the estate is large the sons inherit and the daughters are provided with sustenance And with regard to a small estate, the daughters are provided with sustenance and the sons go round at the doors. Admon says: Because I am a male, I lose out? Rabban Gamliel said: I see the statement of Admon.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Admon says, seven: If one dies and leaves sons and daughters, when the assets are plentiful — the sons inherit, and the daughters are supported. But when the assets are meager — the daughters are supported, and the sons must go out to the doorways. Admon says: Because I am male, have I suffered a loss?! Rabban Gamliel said: I see the words of Admon.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁאֲנִי זָכָר וְרָאוּי לַעֲסוֹק בַּתּוֹרָה — הִפְסַדְתִּי?
human_translation: What is he saying? Abaye said this is what he is saying: Because I am a male and, am fit to engage in Torah I lose out?
llm_translation: Gemara: What is he saying? Abaye said, thus he is saying: Because I am male and fit to engage in Torah study - have I lost?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: מַאן דְּעָסֵיק בַּתּוֹרָה הוּא דְּיָרֵית, מַאן דְּלָא עָסֵיק בַּתּוֹרָה לָא יָרֵית?! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁאֲנִי זָכָר וְרָאוּי לִירַשׁ בִּנְכָסִים מְרוּבִּין — הִפְסַדְתִּי בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִין?!
human_translation: Rava said to him: one who is engaged in Torah who inherits, one not engaged in Torah does not inherit? Rather, Rava said this is what is saying: Because I am a male, and it is fitting to inherit when the estate is large, I lose out in a small estate?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: Who engages in Torah study will inherit, and who does not engage in Torah study will not inherit?! Rather, Rava said, this is what he meant: Because I am remembered and worthy to inherit abundant assets - I have lost meager assets?!

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַטּוֹעֵן אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ כַּדֵּי שֶׁמֶן וְהוֹדָה בַּקַּנְקַנִּים, אַדְמוֹן אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וְהוֹדָה בְּמִקְצָת הַטְּעָנָה — יִשָּׁבַע. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין הוֹדָאַת מִקְצָת מִמִּין הַטַּעֲנָה. אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: רוֹאֶה אֲנִי אֶת דִּבְרֵי אַדְמוֹן.
human_translation: one who claims another jugs of oil, and admits to pitchers Admon says: Since he made a partial admission to the claim, he takes an oath And the Rabbis say: The partial admission is not of the same type as the claim, Rabban Gamliel said: I see the statement of Admon.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who loads his fellow's animal with enough oil and admits to the jugs, Admon says: Since he admitted to part of the load, he must take an oath. But the Sages say: Admission of part is not like admission of the entire load. Rabban Gamliel said: I see the words of Admon.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְרַבָּנַן: טְעָנוֹ חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין וְהוֹדָה בִּשְׂעוֹרִין — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: conclude from here to the Rabbis, claimed wheat and barley, and admitted to the barley, exempt,
llm_translation: The Gemara: Heard from it to the Rabbis: If one claimed wheat and barley, and admitted to barley - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תִּהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: טְעָנוֹ חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִים וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן — חַיָּיב!
human_translation: Let us say that it is a conclusive refutation of Rav Naḥman Shmuel said. As Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: claimed against wheat and barley, and admitted to one of he is obligated
llm_translation: Let it be the rebuttal of Rav Nachman said Shmuel, as Rav Nachman said Shmuel: If one loaded wheat and barley and admitted to one of them - he is liable!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בְּטוֹעֲנוֹ מִדָּה. אִי הָכִי, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּאַדְמוֹן?
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: to he claimed measure If so, what is the rationale of Admon
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: When one is measuring with a measuring rod. If so, what is the reason for calling it "Admon"?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא הֵיכָא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״מְלֹא עֲשָׂרָה כַּדֵּי שֶׁמֶן יֵשׁ לִי בְּבוֹרֶךָ״, שֶׁמֶן קָטָעֵין לֵיהּ, קַנְקַנִּים לָא קָטָעֵין לֵיהּ. ״עֲשָׂרָה כַּדֵּי שֶׁמֶן מְלֵאִים יֵשׁ לִי אֶצְלְךָ״ — שֶׁמֶן וְקַנְקַנִּים קָטָעֵין לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: Everyone agrees that where he said to him: I have ten jugfuls of oil in your pit, he is claiming oil from him he is not claiming pitchers from him I have ten full jugs of oil with you, he is claiming from him oil and pitchers,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: In all the world, in a case where one says to another, "I have filled ten measures of oil in your pit," the oil is cut off for him, but the jugs are not cut off for him. "I have filled ten measures of oil at your place" — both the oil and the jugs are cut off for him.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי הֵיכָא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״עֲשָׂרָה כַּדֵּי שֶׁמֶן יֵשׁ לִי אֶצְלְךָ״. אַדְמוֹן אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ בַּלָּשׁוֹן הַזֶּה לְשׁוֹן קַנְקַנִּים, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אֵין בַּלָּשׁוֹן הַזֶּה לְשׁוֹן קַנְקַנִּים.
human_translation: When they disagree where he said to him I have ten jugs of oil with you. Admon says: This expression includes pitchers, the Rabbis hold this expression does not include pitchers.
llm_translation: When they disputed here where he said to him, "I have ten measures of oil by you," Admon says: In this language there is the language of merchants, and the Rabbis hold: In this language there is not the language of merchants.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא טַעְמָא דְּאֵין בַּלָּשׁוֹן הַזֶּה לְשׁוֹן קַנְקַנִּים, הָא יֵשׁ בַּלָּשׁוֹן הַזֶּה לְשׁוֹן קַנְקַנִּים — חַיָּיב. לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: טְעָנוֹ חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִים וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶם — פָּטוּר!
human_translation: Rather, the reason is that the expression does not include pitchers, the expression includes pitchers, obligated let us say this is a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba. As Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said: claimed wheat and barley, and admitted to one of he is exempt
llm_translation: Rather, the reason that in this language it is not the language of "kanakanim," is that in this language there is the language of "kanakanim" - he is liable. Let it be the preference of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba. For Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: If one loaded wheat and barley and admitted to one of them - he is exempt!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: נַעֲשָׂה כְּמִי שֶׁטְּעָנוֹ רִימּוֹן בִּקְלִיפָּתוֹ. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבִינָא: רִימּוֹן בְּלֹא קְלִיפָּתוֹ לָא מִינְּטַר, שֶׁמֶן מִינְּטַר בְּלֹא קַנְקַנִּים!
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: is like one who claimed the other a pomegranate in its peel, Ravina strongly objects to this: A pomegranate without its peel cannot be preserved, oil can be preserved without pitchers,
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashei said: It is done like one who planted a pomegranate in its peel. Ravina objected to him: A pomegranate without its peel is not considered a pomegranate, just as oil without its vessel is not considered oil!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: עֲשָׂרָה כַּדֵּי שֶׁמֶן יֵשׁ לִי אֶצְלְךָ, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ אִידַּךְ: שֶׁמֶן — לֹא הָיוּ דְבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם, קַנְקַנִּים נָמֵי — חַמְשָׁה אִית לָךְ, וְחַמְשָׁה לֵית לָךְ.
human_translation: Rather, here we are dealing with said to I have ten jugs of oil with you, and the other said to him: oil, these matters never occurred; pitchers as well, you do have five but you do not have five
llm_translation: Rather, here we are dealing with what? For he said to him: "I have ten measures of oil with you," and he said to him: "On the other hand, oil - they were never things, jugs are in front of me - you have five, and five you do not have."

hebrew_text: אַדְמוֹן אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ בַּלָּשׁוֹן הַזֶּה לְשׁוֹן קַנְקַנִּים, וּמִגּוֹ דְּקָמִשְׁתְּבַע אַקַּנְקַנִּים מִשְׁתְּבַע נָמֵי אַשֶּׁמֶן עַל יְדֵי גִּלְגּוּל. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אֵין בַּלָּשׁוֹן הַזֶּה לְשׁוֹן קַנְקַנִּים. מַה שֶּׁטְּעָנוֹ לֹא הוֹדָה לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁהוֹדָה לוֹ — לֹא טָעֲנוּ.
human_translation: Admon says: This expression includes pitchers, and since he takes an oath about the pitchers, he takes an oath about the oil as well, by means of an extension And the Rabbis hold this expression does not include pitchers, that which claimed from him did not admit to and that which admitted to, had not claimed from him.
llm_translation: Admon says: There is in this language a language of "kanakanim," and from the time that "akkanakanim" became established, oil became established through the process of rolling. And the Rabbis hold: There is no language of "kanakanim" in this language. What they claimed, they did not admit to, and what they admitted to, they did not claim.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַפּוֹסֵק מָעוֹת לַחֲתָנוֹ, וּפָשַׁט לוֹ אֶת הָרֶגֶל —
human_translation: apportions money for his son-in-law and he went bankrupt,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who designates a dowry for his daughter-in-law, and he provides her with a leg—

hebrew_text: תֵּשֵׁב עַד שֶׁיַּלְבִּין רֹאשָׁהּ. אַדְמוֹן אוֹמֵר: יְכוֹלָה הִיא שֶׁתֹּאמַר: אִילּוּ אֲנִי פָּסַקְתִּי לְעַצְמִי — אֵשֵׁב עַד שֶׁיַּלְבִּין רֹאשִׁי, עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁאַבָּא פָּסַק — מָה אֲנִי יְכוֹלָה לַעֲשׂוֹת? אוֹ כְּנוֹס, אוֹ פְּטוֹר. אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: רוֹאֶה אֲנִי אֶת דִּבְרֵי אַדְמוֹן.
human_translation: sit until her head turns white. Admon says she can say: Had I apportioned myself sit until my head turns white. now that father apportioned what can I do? Either marry or release Rabban Gamliel said: I see the statement of Admon.
llm_translation: She shall sit until she whitens her head. Admon says: It is possible to say: If I had decided for myself - I would sit until I whitened my head, now that my father has decided - what can I do? Either marry or be exempt. Rabban Gamliel said: I see the words of Admon.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אַדְמוֹן וַחֲכָמִים עַל הַפּוֹסֵק מָעוֹת לַחֲתָנוֹ וּפָשַׁט לוֹ אֶת הָרֶגֶל, שֶׁיְּכוֹלָה הִיא שֶׁתֹּאמַר: ״אַבָּא פָּסַק עָלַי, מָה אֲנִי יְכוֹלָה לַעֲשׂוֹת״.
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said: Admon and the Rabbis did not disagree with regard to one who apportions money for his son-in-law and went bankrupt, that can say: father apportioned for me; what can I do?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The Mishnah states that this Tanna did not say, as it is taught: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said: Admon and the Sages did not argue regarding the one who designates gifts for his daughter-in-law and he interprets for her the leg, for she can say, "My father-in-law decided for me, what can I do?"

hebrew_text: עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל שֶׁפָּסְקָה הִיא עַל עַצְמָהּ. שֶׁחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: תֵּשֵׁב עַד שֶׁתַּלְבִּין רֹאשָׁהּ. אַדְמוֹן אוֹמֵר, יְכוֹלָה הִיא שֶׁתֹּאמַר: כִּסְבוּרָה אֲנִי שֶׁאַבָּא נוֹתֵן עָלַי, וְעַכְשָׁיו שֶׁאֵין אַבָּא נוֹתֵן עָלַי — מָה אֲנִי יְכוֹלָה לַעֲשׂוֹת? אוֹ כְּנוֹס אוֹ פְּטוֹר. אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: רוֹאֶה אֲנִי אֶת דִּבְרֵי אַדְמוֹן.
human_translation: With regard to what did they disagree? with regard to where she apportioned for herself, as the Rabbis say: Let her sit until her head turns white, Admon says she can say: I thought that father would give for me, and now that father is not giving for me, what can I do? Either marry or release Rabban Gamliel said: I see the statement of Admon,
llm_translation: On what do they argue? On the fact that she has cut off by herself. The sages say: she should sit until her head becomes white. Admon says, she can say: I thought my father would support me, but now that my father does not support me, what can I do? Either marry or be released. Rabban Gamliel said: I see the words of Admon.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים בִּגְדוֹלָה, אֲבָל בִּקְטַנָּה — כּוֹפִין. כּוֹפִין לְמַאן? אִילֵימָא לְאָב — אִיפְּכָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כּוֹפִין לַבַּעַל לִיתֵּן גֵּט.
human_translation: taught: In what is this statement said? of an adult However, to a minor compels Whom do they compel? If we say father should have stated the opposite. Rather, Rava said: compels the groom to give a bill of divorce
llm_translation: Mishnah: In what case is this statement said in regard to an adult woman, but in regard to a minor girl — we compel. We compel for whom? If you say for the father — it is the opposite of what he wants! Rather, Rava said: We compel the husband to give a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּחִזְקִיָּה: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל ״רוֹאֶה אֲנִי אֶת דִּבְרֵי אַדְמוֹן״ — הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: אֲפִילּוּ בְּבָרַיְיתָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי קָאָמְרִינַן בַּמִּשְׁנָה?! בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁאָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל קָאָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Elazar said in the name of Ḥizkiyya: Anywhere that Rabban Gamliel said: I see the statement of Admon, the halakha is in accordance with his Rava said to Rav Naḥman: even in a baraita ? said to him: Did we say: in the Mishna? We said: Anywhere that Rabban Gamliel said,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak ben Elazar said in the name of Chizkiyah: "In any place where Rabban Gamliel said, 'I see the words of Admon,' the halakha is like his." Rava said to Rav Nachman: "Even in a baraita?" He said to him: "Who are we saying in the Mishnah?! In any place where Rabban Gamliel said, we say."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר יִרְמְיָה: שְׁנֵי דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָמַר חָנָן — הֲלָכָה כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ, שִׁבְעָה דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָמַר אַדְמוֹן — אֵין הֲלָכָה כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ. מַאי קָאָמַר?
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said Rabba bar Yirmeya said: two statements that Ḥanan said, halakha is in accordance with similarly to him, seven statements that Admon said, halakha is not in accordance with similarly to him, What is he saying?
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, Rabbi Yirmeya said: Two things that Hanan said - the halacha is like him. Seven things that Admon said - the halacha is not like him. What is he saying?

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא הָכִי קָאָמַר: שְׁנֵי דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָמַר חָנָן — הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ וְכַיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ, וְשִׁבְעָה דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָמַר אַדְמוֹן — אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ וְלֹא כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ. וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּחִזְקִיָּה: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל ״רוֹאֶה אֲנִי אֶת דִּבְרֵי אַדְמוֹן״ — הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ!
human_translation: If we say this is what is saying: two statements that Ḥanan said, halakha is in accordance with his and in accordance with similarly to him, and seven statements that Admon said, halakha is not in accordance with his and not in accordance with similarly to him, but didn’t Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Elazar say in the name of Ḥizkiyya: Anywhere that Rabban Gamliel said: I see the statement of Admon, halakha is in accordance with his
llm_translation: The Gemara says thus: Two matters that Hanan said - the halacha is like him and similar to it, and seven matters that Admon said - the halacha is not like him and not similar to it. And Rabbi Yitzchak ben Elazar said in the name of Chizkiyah: Any place where Rabban Gamliel said, "I see the words of Admon" - the halacha is like him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: שְׁנֵי דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָמַר חָנָן — הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ וְכַיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ, שִׁבְעָה דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָמַר אַדְמוֹן — אֵין הֲלָכָה כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ. הָא כְּמוֹתוֹ — הֲלָכָה בְּכוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: Rather, this is what is saying: two statements that Ḥanan said, halakha is in accordance with his and is in accordance with similarly to him, seven statements that Admon said, the halakha is not in accordance with similarly to the halakha is in accordance with in all
llm_translation: Rather, thus he said: Two matters that Hanan stated — the halacha follows his opinion and the like thereof, seven matters that Admon stated — the halacha does not follow the like thereof. What is meant by "the like thereof"? The halacha in its entirety.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּחִזְקִיָּה: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל ״רוֹאֶה אֲנִי אֶת דִּבְרֵי אַדְמוֹן״ — הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ, אָמַר — אִין, לֹא אָמַר — לָא!
human_translation: Didn’t Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Elazar say in the name of Ḥizkiyya: Anywhere that Rabban Gamliel said: I see the statement of Admon, halakha is in accordance with his said yes, did not say no,
llm_translation: The text reads: "And Rabbi Yitzchak ben Elazar said in the name of Chizkiyah: Any place where Rabban Gamliel said, 'I see the words of Admon,' the halakha is like his opinion. He said - yes, he did not say - no!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: שְׁנֵי דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָמַר חָנָן — הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ וְכַיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ, שִׁבְעָה דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָמַר אַדְמוֹן — יֵשׁ מֵהֶן שֶׁהֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ וְכַיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ, וְיֵשׁ מֵהֶן שֶׁאֵין הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ אֶלָּא כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, this is what is saying: two statements that Ḥanan said, halakha is in accordance with his and in accordance with similarly to him. seven statements that Admon said, there are among those which halakha is in accordance with his and in accordance with similarly to him, and there are among those which halakha is not in accordance with his but in accordance with similarly to him.
llm_translation: Rather, thus he said: Two matters that Hanan said — halacha like his opinion and the like thereof, seven matters that Admon said — some of them halacha like his opinion and the like thereof, and some of them not halacha like his opinion but the like thereof.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁאָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל רוֹאֶה אֲנִי אֶת דִּבְרֵי אַדְמוֹן — הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ, אִינָךְ — לָא.
human_translation: anywhere that Rabban Gamliel said: I see the statement of Admon, halakha is in accordance with his other not
llm_translation: In every place that Rabban Gamliel said, "I see the words of Admon," - the halakha is like his. Are you not? - No.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָעוֹרֵר עַל הַשָּׂדֶה, וְהוּא חָתוּם עָלֶיהָ בְּעֵד — אַדְמוֹן אוֹמֵר: הַשֵּׁנִי נוֹחַ לִי, וְהָרִאשׁוֹן קָשֶׁה הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: one who contests of a field, and is signed as a witness on Admon says: The second is easier for me, but the first is more difficult than him.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who plows in a field, and it is signed upon by witnesses - Admon says: The second is pleasing to me, and the first is difficult from it.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אִיבֵּד אֶת זְכוּתוֹ. עֲשָׂאָהּ סִימָן לְאַחֵר — אִיבֵּד אֶת זְכוּתוֹ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: He lost his right he established as a marker for another he lost his right.
llm_translation: The sages say: "Examine his merit. If he made it a sign for another - examine his merit."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא עֵד, אֲבָל דַּיָּין — לֹא אִיבֵּד אֶת זְכוּתוֹ. דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אֵין הָעֵדִים חוֹתְמִין עַל הַשְּׁטָר אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן קְרָאוּהוּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: They taught only a witness However, a judge has not lost his right. as Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: Witnesses do not sign a document unless they have read it,
llm_translation: Gemara said Abaye: Not they taught except witness, but judge — not he will lose his right. As taught Rabbi Chiya: Not the witnesses sign on the document except if they read it.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הַדַּיָּינִין חוֹתְמִים אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא קְרָאוּהוּ.
human_translation: However, judges do sign a document even though they have not read it,
llm_translation: But the dayanim sign even though they did not read it.

hebrew_text: עֲשָׂאָהּ סִימָן לְאַחֵר. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְאַחֵר, אֲבָל לְעַצְמוֹ — לֹא אִיבֵּד אֶת זְכוּתוֹ.
human_translation: established as a marker for another Abaye said: They taught only for another However, for himself, not lost his right.
llm_translation: They made it a sign for others. Abaye said: They only taught for others, but for himself - he did not lose his merit.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר: אִי דְּלָא עֲבַדִי לֵיהּ הָכִי לָא הֲוָה מְזַבֵּין לַהּ נִיהֲלִי, מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר? אִיבְּעִי לִי לְמִימְסַר מוֹדָעָא — חַבְרָךְ חַבְרָא אִית לֵיהּ, וְחַבְרָא דְחַבְרָךְ חַבְרָא אִית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: that say: Had I not done this to him, he would not have sold me this other What have you to say I should have put out a notice your friend has a friend and your friend’s friend has a friend.
llm_translation: He said: If I did not do so, it would not be fitting to appoint him as a steward. What do you have to say? If I want to entrust a deposit — your friend has a friend, and the friend of your friend has a friend.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּעֲשָׂאָהּ סִימָן לְאַחֵר, עַרְעַר, וּשְׁכֵיב, וְאוֹקֵים אַפּוֹטְרוֹפָּא. אֲתָא אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עֲשָׂאָהּ סִימָן לְאַחֵר אִיבֵּד אֶת זְכוּתוֹ.
human_translation: a certain who established as a marker for another contested and died. And appointed a steward The steward came before Abaye. said to him: established as a marker for another, and he has lost his right
llm_translation: That one who made a sign for another, he erred, and he laid down, and he stood up. The sign-maker came before Abbaye. He said to him: "He made a sign for another, he has lost his merit."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר: אִי הֲוָה אֲבוּהוֹן דְּיַתְמֵי קַיָּים, הֲוָה טָעֵין וְאָמַר: ״תֶּלֶם אֶחָד עָשִׂיתִי לָךְ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁפִּיר קָאָמְרַתְּ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אִם טָעַן וְאָמַר ״תֶּלֶם אֶחָד עָשִׂיתִי לָךְ״ — נֶאֱמָן. זִיל הַב לֵיהּ מִיהַת תֶּלֶם אֶחָד.
human_translation: said If the father of orphans were alive he would have claimed and said: I established one furrow you. said to him: You have spoken well, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: If he claimed and said: I established one furrow you, he is deemed credible. Go give him one furrow in any event,
llm_translation: He said: If he was their father, who was standing before them, he would err and say, "I have made one talisman for you." He said to him: You have spoken well. For Rabbi Yochanan said, if he erred and said, "I have made one talisman for you," he is believed. Go and bring him the talisman.

hebrew_text: הֲוָה עֲלַהּ רִיכְבָּא דְּדִיקְלֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הֲוָה אֲבוּהוֹן דְּיַתְמֵי קַיָּים, הֲוָה טָעֵין וְאָמַר, חָזַרְתִּי וְלָקַחְתִּי מִמֶּנּוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁפִּיר קָאָמְרַתְּ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אִם טָעַן וְאָמַר ״חָזַרְתִּי וּלְקַחְתִּיו מִמֶּנּוּ״ — נֶאֱמָן. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַאי מַאן דְּמוֹקֵים אַפּוֹטְרוֹפָּא — נוֹקֵים כִּי הַאי דְּיָדַע לְאַפּוֹכֵי בִּזְכוּתָא דְיַתְמֵי.
human_translation: On that there was a row of palm trees, He said to If the father of orphans were alive he would have claimed and said: I went back and bought from him said to him: You have spoken well, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: If he claimed and said: I went back and bought it from him, he is deemed credible. Abaye said: One who appoint a steward should appoint like this who knows how to look out for the rights of the orphans
llm_translation: The chariot of the palm trees ascended, he said to him: If their father was standing nearby, he would have tasted and said, "I have returned and taken from it." He said to him: You have spoken well. For Rabbi Yochanan said: If he tasted and said, "I have returned and taken it from him" — he is believed. Abaye said: This one who is accustomed to be a physician — is trusted, for he knows how to reverse in the merit of their father.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁהָלַךְ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וְאָבְדָה דֶּרֶךְ שָׂדֵהוּ. אַדְמוֹן אוֹמֵר: יֵלֵךְ לוֹ בִּקְצָרָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יִקְנֶה לוֹ דֶּרֶךְ בְּמֵאָה מָנֶה, אוֹ יִפְרַח בָּאֲוִיר.
human_translation: one who went overseas and the path to his field was lost, Admon says: Let him go by the shortest And the Rabbis say: Let him buy himself a path one hundred dinars [ maneh ], or let him fly through the air.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who went to the sea coast and his field was lost, Admon says: he should go and buy it back quickly. But the Sages say: he should acquire a path for himself with a hundred mana, or he should cultivate it in the air.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא דְרַבָּנַן, שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר אַדְמוֹן! אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִקִּיפוּהָ אַרְבָּעָה בְּנֵי אָדָם מֵאַרְבַּע רוּחוֹתֶיהָ — אִי הָכִי, מַאי טַעְמָא דְאַדְמוֹן?
human_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis Admon speaks well, Rav Yehuda said Rav said: where was surrounded on four sides by four different people. If so, what is the reason of Admon?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the reason of the Rabbis that they say, "It is fitting"? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: For example, when four people surrounded her from her four sides - if so, what is the reason for "fitting"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בְּאַרְבְּעָה דְּאָתוּ מִכֹּחַ אַרְבְּעָה, וְאַרְבְּעָה דְּאָתוּ מִכֹּחַ חַד — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּמָצֵי מְדַחֵי לֵיהּ. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּחַד דְּאָתֵי מִכֹּחַ אַרְבְּעָה.
human_translation: Rava said: where four who come by virtue of four and four who come by virtue of one everyone agrees that they put off When they disagree where one who comes by virtue of four
llm_translation: Rava said: With four who come from the strength of four, and four who come from the strength of one - all the people of the world do not argue that he can push them away. When they argue, it is with one who comes from the strength of four.

hebrew_text: אַדְמוֹן סָבַר: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם דַּרְכָּא אִית לִי גַּבָּךְ. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אִי שָׁתְקַתְּ — שָׁתְקַתְּ, וְאִי לָא — מַהְדַּרְנָא שְׁטָרָא לְמָרַיְיהוּ וְלָא מָצֵית לְאִשְׁתַּעוֹיֵי דִּינָא בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Admon holds In any case, I have a path through your And the Rabbis hold If you will stay silent, stay silent and if not, I will return the document to its owner and you will not be able to negotiate with them,
llm_translation: Admon holds: "In any case, I have your back." And the Rabbis hold: "If you remain silent - remain silent, but if not - we will return the document to their masters and not find fault in their judgment."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: דִּיקְלָא לִבְרַת. אֲזוּל יַתְמֵי פְּלוּג לְנִכְסֵי, לָא יְהַבוּ לַהּ דִּיקְלָא. סְבַר רַב יוֹסֵף לְמֵימַר: הַיְינוּ מַתְנִיתִין.
human_translation: a certain who said to a palm tree for my daughter. The orphans went divided up the property they did not give a palm tree Rav Yosef thought to say that this is the mishna,
llm_translation: That one who said to them: "A palm tree to a daughter." He went and divided the property, they did not give to him the palm tree. Rav Yosef thought to say: This is the Mishnah.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם כֹּל חַד וְחַד מָצֵי מְדַחֵי לֵיהּ, הָכָא דִּיקְלָא גַּבַּיְיהוּ הוּא. מַאי תַּקַּנְתַּיְיהוּ? לִיתְּבוּ לַהּ דִּיקְלָא וְלֶיהְדְּרוּ וְלִיפַּלְגוּ מֵרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Are comparable? There, each and every one can put him off, here, the palm tree is in their What is their remedy? Let them give her a palm tree and go back and divide from the outset.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Who is similar? There, each and every one finds a reason for it, here, it is palm trees that are the reason. What is their benefit? They should sit under the palm tree, study, and separate from the beginning.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: דִּיקְלָא לִבְרַת. שְׁכֵיב וּשְׁבַיק תְּרֵי פַּלְגֵי דְּדִיקְלָא.
human_translation: a certain who said to a palm tree for my daughter. He died and left behind two halves of palm trees,
llm_translation: That one who said to them: "A palm branch to a son." Lie down and leave two halves of a palm branch.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב אָשֵׁי וְקָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: מִי קָרוּ אִינָשֵׁי לִתְרֵי פַּלְגֵי דִּיקְלֵי דִּיקְלָא, אוֹ לָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרְדֳּכַי לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הָכִי אָמַר אֲבִימִי מֵהַגְרוֹנְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: קָרוּ אִינָשֵׁי לִתְרֵי פַּלְגֵי דִּיקְלֵי דִּיקְלָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi sat and posed a difficulty to Do people refer to two halves of a palm tree palm tree or not? Rav Mordekhai said to Rav Ashi: Avimi of Hagronya said as follows in the name of Rava: People do refer to two halves of a palm tree as palm tree.
llm_translation: Sitting Rav Ashi and difficult for him: Who read people to two halves of a palm tree, or not? Said to him Rav Mordechai to Rav Ashi: So said Avimi from Hagraonya in the name of Rava: People read to two halves of a palm tree.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוֹצִיא שְׁטַר חוֹב עַל חֲבֵרוֹ, וְהַלָּה הוֹצִיא שֶׁמָּכַר לוֹ אֶת הַשָּׂדֶה. אַדְמוֹן אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל הוּא שֶׁיֹּאמַר: אִילּוּ הָיִיתִי חַיָּיב לְךָ — הָיָה לְךָ לְהִפָּרַע אֶת שֶׁלְּךָ כְּשֶׁמָּכַרְתָּ לִי אֶת הַשָּׂדֶה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: זֶה הָיָה פִּקֵּחַ, שֶׁמָּכַר לוֹ אֶת הַקַּרְקַע מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא יָכוֹל לְמַשְׁכְּנוֹ.
human_translation: one who produces a promissory note against another, and this produced that sold him a field Admon says can say: Were I indebted to you, you should have collected your when you sold me the field, And the Rabbis say: this was perspicacious, as he sold the land because now he can take collateral from him
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who produces a promissory note of debt against his fellow, and the borrower produces a receipt that he sold him the field. Admon says: It is possible for him to say, "If I were indebted to you, you should have collected from what you sold me the field." But the sages say: This one was astute, for he sold him the land in order to secure his dwelling place.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן? שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר אַדְמוֹן! בְּאַתְרָא דְּיָהֲבִי זוּזֵי וַהֲדַר כָּתְבִי שְׁטָרָא — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּמָצֵי אָמַר לֵיהּ: הָיָה לְךָ לִפְרוֹעַ אֶת שֶׁלְּךָ כְּשֶׁמָּכַרְתָּ לִי אֶת הַשָּׂדֶה.
human_translation: What is the rationale of the Rabbis? Admon is saying well. In a place where give money and afterward they write the bill everyone agrees that can say to You should have collected your when you sold me the field,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the reason of the Rabbis? He is saying well, red! In a place where one gives money and then writes a document - everyone agrees that it is valid. He should have disclosed his own property when he sold me the field.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי, בְּאַתְרָא דְּכָתְבִי שְׁטָרָא וַהֲדַר יָהֲבִי זוּזֵי. אַדְמוֹן סָבַר: אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמִימְסַר מוֹדָעָא. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: חַבְרָךְ חַבְרָא אִית לֵיהּ וְחַבְרָא דְּחַבְרָךְ חַבְרָא אִית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: When they disagree is to a place where write out the bill and afterward they give money. Admon holds should have put out a declaration, And the Rabbis hold Your friend has a friend and your friend’s friend has a friend,
llm_translation: When they argued, in a case where one writes a document and then gives money. Admon thought: he wants to transfer ownership. And the Rabbis thought: your friend's friend has a friend, and your friend's friend's friend has a friend.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהוֹצִיאוּ שְׁטַר חוֹב זֶה עַל זֶה, אַדְמוֹן אוֹמֵר: אִילּוּ הָיִיתִי חַיָּיב לְךָ — כֵּיצַד אַתָּה לֹוֶה מִמֶּנִּי?! וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: זֶה גּוֹבֶה שְׁטַר חוֹבוֹ, וְזֶה גּוֹבֶה שְׁטַר חוֹבוֹ.
human_translation: two who produced a promissory note against the other, Admon says: If I owed you how you are borrowing from me? And the Rabbis say: This one collects his promissory note, and that one collects his promissory note.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Two individuals who produce a promissory note of debt against each other, Admon says: "If I owed you, how could you borrow from me?!" And the Sages say: "This one collects his debt through the promissory note, and that one collects his debt through the promissory note."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִתְּמַר: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהוֹצִיאוּ שְׁטַר חוֹב זֶה עַל זֶה. רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: זֶה גּוֹבֶה וְזֶה גּוֹבֶה. רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: הַפּוֹכֵי מַטְרָתָא לָמָּה לִי. אֶלָּא זֶה עוֹמֵד בְּשֶׁלּוֹ וְזֶה עוֹמֵד בְּשֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: It was stated two who produced a promissory note against the other Rav Naḥman said: This one collects and that one collects Rav Sheshet said: Why do I to shift packs [ matrata ] Rather, this one stand with his and that one stand with his
llm_translation: Gemara: It was stated: Two people who produce a promissory note of debt, this one against this one. Rav Nachman said: This one claims a debt, and this one claims a debt. Rav Sheshet said: Why do I need a broken staff? Rather, this one stands in his claim, and this one stands in his claim.

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא עִידִּית וְעִידִּית, בֵּינוֹנִית וּבֵינוֹנִית, זִיבּוּרִית וְזִיבּוּרִית — וַדַּאי הַפּוֹכֵי מַטְרָתָא הוּא.
human_translation: Everyone superior-quality land and superior-quality land, intermediate-quality land and intermediate-quality land, inferior-quality land and inferior-quality land, is certainly shifting packs,
llm_translation: The world is a wheel, and a wheel, intermediate and intermediate, weaving and weaving - surely it is the turning of the wheel.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי, דְּאִית לֵיהּ לְחַד בֵּינוֹנִית וּלְחַד זִיבּוּרִית — רַב נַחְמָן סָבַר: זֶה גּוֹבֶה וְזֶה גּוֹבֶה. קָסָבַר: בְּשֶׁלּוֹ הֵן שָׁמִין.
human_translation: When they disagree where one has intermediate-quality land and one inferior-quality land. Rav Naḥman holds this one collects and that one collects he holds one assesses on his own
llm_translation: When they argued, that there is one Binonit and one Ziborit - Rav Nachman holds: this is a height and this is a height. He holds: they are both heard in his own.

hebrew_text: אָתֵי בַּעַל זִיבּוּרִית וְגָבֵי לֵיהּ לְבֵינוֹנִית, דַּהֲוָה גַּבֵּיהּ עִידִּית, וַאֲתָא הָהוּא וְשָׁקֵיל זִיבּוּרִית.
human_translation: the owner of inferior-quality land, will come and collect intermediate-quality land is for him superior-quality land, And that comes and takes from inferior-quality land,
llm_translation: The owner of a Zibburit came and placed it in between the Leinunit, for it was leaning. And that one came and took the Zibburit.

hebrew_text: וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: הַפּוֹכֵי מַטְרָתָא לָמָּה לִי, קָסָבַר: בְּשֶׁל כׇּל אָדָם הֵן שָׁמִין, סוֹף סוֹף כִּי אָתֵי הָהוּא — בֵּינוֹנִית דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָשָׁקֵיל.
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet, said: Why do I to shift packs, holds one assesses on all people, ultimately, when that intermediate-quality land,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Why do I need a metal plate? He holds: In the end, everyone will be heard, ultimately when that one comes - he will weigh his own merits.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב נַחְמָן: מַאי חָזֵית דְּאָתֵי בַּעַל זִיבּוּרִית בְּרֵישָׁא, לֵיתֵי בַּעַל בֵּינוֹנִית בְּרֵישָׁא וְלִיגְבֵּי זִיבּוּרִית, וְלֶיהְדַּר וְלִיגְבֵּי נִיהֲלֵיהּ!
human_translation: And according to Rav Naḥman, what did you see that the owner of inferior-quality land come first, Let the owner of intermediate-quality land come first and collect inferior-quality land And let return and collect him.
llm_translation: To Rav Nachman: What do you see when a Baal Zibburit comes first, let a Baal Beinonit come first and precede the Zibburit, and let him return and precede his own affairs!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּקְדֵים תַּבְעֵיהּ. סוֹף סוֹף כִּי אֲתוֹ לְמִגְבֵּי, בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי קָאָתוּ!
human_translation: No, necessary where precede and claim Ultimately, when they come to collect they come together,
llm_translation: Not necessary, for he asked first. Eventually, when he came to collect, they came together with Hadadezer!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לָא צְרִיכָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ לְחַד עִידִּית וּבֵינוֹנִית, וְאִית לֵיהּ לְחַד זִיבּוּרִית — מָר סָבַר: בְּשֶׁלּוֹ הֵן שָׁמִין, וּמָר סָבַר: בְּשֶׁל כׇּל אָדָם הֵן שָׁמִין.
human_translation: Rather, No, necessary where one has superior-quality land and intermediate-quality land, and one has inferior-quality land. One Sage, holds one assesses on his own And one Sage, holds appraises on all people,
llm_translation: Rather, it is not necessary that there be one witness and two intermediaries, but that there be one clear witness and one supporting witness. One Master holds: They are believed on his own, and one Master holds: They are believed on behalf of any person.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: זֶה גּוֹבֶה וְזֶה גּוֹבֶה! תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַב נַחְמָן אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: כְּגוֹן שֶׁלָּוָה זֶה לְעֶשֶׂר וְזֶה לְחָמֵשׁ.
human_translation: We learned And the Rabbis say: This one collects and that one collects Rav Naḥman interpreted in accordance with Rav Sheshet: for example, where this one borrowed for ten and that one for five
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah, and the Sages say: "This is high and this is high!" Rav Nachman translated it in the name of Rav Sheshet: For example, if one borrowed this for ten and this for five.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא רִאשׁוֹן לְעֶשֶׂר וְשֵׁנִי לְחָמֵשׁ, בְּהָא לֵימָא אַדְמוֹן: אִילּוּ הָיִיתִי חַיָּיב לְךָ כֵּיצַד אַתָּה לֹוֶה מִמֶּנִּי? הָא לָא מְטָא זִמְנֵיהּ. אֶלָּא רִאשׁוֹן לְחָמֵשׁ, וְשֵׁנִי לְעֶשֶׂר.
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say first for ten and second for five, this Admon would say: If I owed you how you are borrowing from me? date has not yet arrived Rather, the first for five and the second for ten
llm_translation: "How are the payments made? If you say the first payment is for ten and the second for five, in this case one should say 'red': If I owed you, how would you collect from me? This does not come at its time. Rather, the first payment is for five, and the second for ten."

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דִּמְטָא זִמְנֵיהּ — מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן. וְאִי דְּלָא מְטָא זִמְנֵיהּ — הָא לָא מְטָא זִמְנֵיהּ, וּמַאי טַעְמָא דְּאַדְמוֹן?
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If where date had arrived what is the rationale for the Rabbis? And if date had not arrived, date had not yet arrived, And what is the rationale for Admon?
llm_translation: "How are the cases similar? If his time has arrived - what is the reason of the Rabbis. And if his time has not arrived - behold, his time has not arrived, so what is the reason of Adam?"

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא דַּאֲתָא בְּהָהוּא יוֹמָא דְּמִשְׁלַם חָמֵשׁ. מָר סָבַר: עֲבִיד אִינִישׁ דְּיָזֵיף לְיוֹמֵיהּ, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא עֲבִיד אִינִישׁ דְּיָזֵיף לְיוֹמֵיהּ.
human_translation: No, necessary where he came on that day when the five years were completed. One Sage, holds a person will take out a loan for one day, and Sage, holds a person will not take out a loan for one day,
llm_translation: Not necessary that he comes on that day of paying five. Master holds: a person should do that he should increase his days, and Master holds: not a person should do that he should increase his days.

hebrew_text: רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא אָמַר: הָכָא בְּיַתְמֵי עָסְקִינַן, דְּיַתְמֵי מִיגְבָּא גָּבֻי, אַגְבּוֹיֵי לָא מַגְבִּינַן מִינַּיְיהוּ. וְהָא ״זֶה גּוֹבֶה וְזֶה גּוֹבֶה״ קָתָנֵי! זֶה גּוֹבֶה, וְזֶה רָאוּי לִגְבּוֹת וְאֵין לוֹ.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama stated Here we are dealing with orphans, as orphans collect do not collect from them But teaches this one collects and that one collects this one collects, and that one potential to collect but he does not have
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: Here we are dealing with yatmei, for yatmei are above the roof, we do not measure from them. But it is taught: "This is a height and this is a height!" This is a height, and this is fit to be measured, but it is not.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁתֵּי תְּשׁוּבוֹת בַּדָּבָר, חֲדָא: דְּזֶה גּוֹבֶה וְזֶה גּוֹבֶה קָתָנֵי. וְעוֹד, לַגְבִּינְהוּ אַרְעָא לְיַתְמֵי וְלֶיהְדַּר וְלִיגְבִּינְהוּ מִינַּיְיהוּ, כִּדְרַב נַחְמָן. דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: יְתוֹמִים שֶׁגָּבוּ קַרְקַע בְּחוֹבַת אֲבִיהֶן — בַּעַל חוֹב חוֹזֵר וְגוֹבֶה אוֹתָהּ מֵהֶן. קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rava said: two responses to this One that teaches this one collects and that one collects And furthermore, let him give land to the orphans and return and collect it from them, in accordance with Rav Naḥman. As Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: orphans who collected land in payment of their father’s debt, a creditor may come back and collect it from them. difficulty
llm_translation: Rava said: Two responses on the matter, one: this one collects and this one collects less. And furthermore, to strengthen them, to honor them, and to strengthen them from their enemies, as Rav Nachman said. For Rav Nachman said, as Rabba bar Avuh said: Orphans who collected a debt owed to their father - if the debtor returns and collects it from them, it is difficult.

hebrew_text: וְלוֹקְמַהּ דְּאִית לְהוּ לְיַתְמֵי זִיבּוּרִית, וְאִית לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ עִידִּית וּבֵינוֹנִית, דְּאָזְלִי יַתְמֵי גָּבוּ בֵּינוֹנִית, וּמַגְבּוּ לֵיהּ זִיבּוּרִית. דְּאִי נָמֵי בְּשֶׁל כׇּל אָדָם הֵן שָׁמִין, הָא אֵין נִפְרָעִין מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִים אֶלָּא מִזִּיבּוּרִית!
human_translation: And let us establish the orphans have inferior-quality land, and he himself, has superior-quality land and intermediate-quality land. In the orphans go collect intermediate-quality land while they give inferior-quality land that even if one assesses on all people, one collects from the property of orphans only from inferior-quality land.
llm_translation: And the remedy that there is for one who has a Zavah discharge, and he has for himself an Iddit and a Beinonit, that he should immerse in a Beinonit, and he should sprinkle on himself Zivurit. For if it is said that with regard to all people they are believed, here they are not exacted from the property of orphans except for Zivurit!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָא תְּפַס, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דִּתְפַס — תְּפַס.
human_translation: This applies only where has not as yet seized However, where he has seized he has seized
llm_translation: These are the words: where it did not grasp, but where it did grasp - it grasped.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שָׁלֹשׁ אֲרָצוֹת לְנִשּׂוּאִין: יְהוּדָה וְעֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן וְהַגָּלִיל — אֵין מוֹצִיאִין מֵעִיר לָעִיר וּמִכְּרַךְ לִכְרַךְ. אֲבָל בְּאוֹתָהּ הָאָרֶץ — מוֹצִיאִין מֵעִיר לְעִיר וּמִכְּרַךְ לִכְרַךְ.
human_translation: three lands to marriage: Judea, Transjordan, and the Galilee. not remove from town to town from city to city, However, in the same land one may remove her from town to town from city to city.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Three lands for marriage contracts: Judea, Transjordan, and Galilee - one may not transport the contract from city to city or from region to region. But in that same land - one may transport the contract from city to city and from region to region.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לֹא מֵעִיר לִכְרַךְ, וְלֹא מִכְּרַךְ לְעִיר.
human_translation: However, not from a town to a city, nor from a city to a town.
llm_translation: But not from city to village, and not from village to city.

hebrew_text: מוֹצִיאִין מִנָּוֶה הָרַע(ה) לְנָוֶה הַיָּפֶה, אֲבָל לֹא מִנָּוֶה הַיָּפֶה לְנָוֶה הָרַע(ה). רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף לֹא מִנָּוֶה רַע(ה) לְנָוֶה יָפֶה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַנָּוֶה הַיָּפֶה בּוֹדֵק.
human_translation: One may remove from a noxious residence to a pleasant residence, However, not from a pleasant residence to a noxious residence. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: also not from a noxious residence to a pleasant residence, because a pleasant residence tests
llm_translation: We remove from an ugly dwelling to a beautiful dwelling, but not from a beautiful dwelling to an ugly dwelling. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Not even from an ugly dwelling to a beautiful dwelling, because one examines the beautiful dwelling.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא מִכְּרַךְ לָעִיר — דְּבִכְרַךְ שְׁכִיחִי כֹּל מִילֵּי, בְּעִיר לָא שְׁכִיחִי כֹּל מִילֵּי. אֶלָּא מֵעִיר לִכְרַךְ מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: Granted, from a city to a town, as all items are available in a city, in a town all items are not available, However, what is the reason from a town to the city?
llm_translation: Gemara: "Regarding 'from your city' - for in your city, all matters are common, but in a city, not all matters are common. Rather, from a city to your city, what is the reason?"

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: מִנַּיִן שֶׁיְּשִׁיבַת כְּרַכִּים קָשָׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְבָרְכוּ הָעָם לְכֹל הָאֲנָשִׁים הַמִּתְנַדְּבִים לָשֶׁבֶת בִּירוּשָׁלִָים״.
human_translation: This supports Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina, as Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: From where that dwelling in cities is difficult? As it is stated: “And the people blessed all the men who willingly offered themselves to dwell in Jerusalem”
llm_translation: Assisting him to Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina. For Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina said: From where do we derive that sitting on hard benches is difficult? As it is stated: "And the people blessed all the men who willingly offered themselves to dwell in Jerusalem."

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר כּוּ׳. מַאי ״בּוֹדֵק״? כְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שִׁינּוּי וֶסֶת תְּחִלַּת חוֹלִי מֵעַיִם. כָּתוּב בְּסֵפֶר בֶּן סִירָא: ״כׇּל יְמֵי עָנִי רָעִים״. וְהָאִיכָּא שַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים? כְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שִׁינּוּי וֶסֶת תְּחִלַּת חוֹלִי מֵעַיִם.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says What tests This is in accordance with Shmuel, as Shmuel said: A change in habits [ veset ] the start of intestinal disease. it is written in Sefer Ben Sira : All the days of the poor are terrible. And there are Shabbatot and Festivals, This is in accordance with Shmuel, as Shmuel said: A change in habits the start of intestinal disease,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: What is "bodek"? Like Shmuel, for Shmuel said: Inspection and a beginning of illness from the eyes. It is written in the book of Ben Sira: "All the days of the poor are evil." But are there not Sabbaths and festivals? Like Shmuel, for Shmuel said: Inspection and a beginning of illness from the eyes.

hebrew_text: בֶּן סִירָא אוֹמֵר: ״אַף לֵילוֹת, בִּשְׁפַל גַּגִּים גַּגּוֹ, וּבִמְרוֹם הָרִים כַּרְמוֹ, מִמְּטַר גַּגִּים לְגַגּוֹ, וּמֵעֲפַר כַּרְמוֹ לִכְרָמִים״.
human_translation: Ben Sira says: Even the nights His roof is at the low point of the roofs, and his vineyard is at the mountain peaks, the rain of roofs to his roof, and the soil of his vineyard to vineyards,
llm_translation: Son of Sirach says: "Even at night, in the lowliest of roofs is his roof, and in the heights of the mountains is his vineyard, from rain of roofs to his roof, and from dust of his vineyard to vineyards."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַכֹּל מַעֲלִין לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאֵין הַכֹּל מוֹצִיאִין. הַכֹּל מַעֲלִין לִירוּשָׁלַיִם, וְאֵין הַכֹּל מוֹצִיאִין. אֶחָד הָאֲנָשִׁים וְאֶחָד הַנָּשִׁים.
human_translation: All to ascend to Eretz Yisrael, but all may not remove all to ascend to Jerusalem, and all may not, remove Both men and women
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: All ascend to the Land of Israel, but not all may leave. All ascend to Jerusalem, but not all may leave. One is like the men, and one is like the women.

hebrew_text: נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגֵרְשָׁהּ בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל — נוֹתֵן לָהּ מִמְּעוֹת אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגֵרְשָׁהּ בְּקַפּוֹטְקְיָא — נוֹתֵן לָהּ מִמְּעוֹת אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה בְּקַפּוֹטְקְיָא וְגֵרְשָׁהּ בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל — נוֹתֵן לָהּ מִמְּעוֹת אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֵן לָהּ מִמְּעוֹת קַפּוֹטְקְיָא. נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה בְּקַפּוֹטְקְיָא וְגֵרְשָׁהּ בְּקַפּוֹטְקְיָא — נוֹתֵן לָהּ מִמְּעוֹת קַפּוֹטְקְיָא.
human_translation: married a woman in Eretz Yisrael and divorced her in Eretz Yisrael, he gives her in the currency of Eretz Yisrael. married a woman in Eretz Yisrael and divorced her in Cappadocia, he gives her the currency of Eretz Yisrael. married a woman in Cappadocia and divorced her in Eretz Yisrael, he gives her the currency of Eretz Yisrael. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He gives her the currency of Cappadocia. married a woman in Cappadocia and divorced her in Cappadocia, he gives her the currency of Cappadocia.
llm_translation: He married a woman in the land of Israel and divorced her in the land of Israel - he gives her from the coins of the land of Israel. He married a woman in the land of Israel and divorced her in Capotkia - he gives her from the coins of the land of Israel. He married a woman in Capotkia and divorced her in the land of Israel - he gives her from the coins of the land of Israel. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: he gives her from the coins of Capotkia. He married a woman in Capotkia and divorced her in Capotkia - he gives her from the coins of Capotkia.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ ״הַכֹּל מַעֲלִין״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי עֲבָדִים.
human_translation: All to ascend. to include what to include slaves,
llm_translation: Gemara: "HaKol Maalin" le'etoyei mai? Le'etoyei avadim. Translation: The Gemara asks: "All ascend" - for what purpose? To ascend slaves.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּתָנֵי עֲבָדִים בְּהֶדְיָא, לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי מִנָּוֶה הַיָּפֶה לְנָוֶה הָרַע(ה).
human_translation: And according to the one expressly teaches slaves, to include what to include from a pleasant residence to a noxious residence,
llm_translation: "And for the one who teaches about slaves with a hand, to come to what? To come to the comparison of a beautiful estate to an undesirable estate."

hebrew_text: ״וְאֵין הַכֹּל מוֹצִיאִין״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי עֶבֶד שֶׁבָּרַח מֵחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ לָאָרֶץ, דְּאָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: זַבְּנֵיהּ הָכָא וְזִיל, מִשּׁוּם יְשִׁיבַת אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: But all may not remove to include what to include a slave who ran away from outside Eretz to Eretz as we say to Sell here, and go due to settling Eretz Yisrael.
llm_translation: "And not all are exempt" to include what? To include a slave who fled from outside the land to the land, as we say to him: 'Sell yourself here and go, because of settling the Land of Israel.'

hebrew_text: ״הַכֹּל מַעֲלִין לִירוּשָׁלַיִם״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי מִנָּוֶה הַיָּפֶה לְנָוֶה הָרַע(ה).
human_translation: All to ascend to Jerusalem. to include what to include from a pleasant residence to a noxious residence
llm_translation: "The statement 'All ascend to Jerusalem' - what does it come to include? It comes to include ascending from a beautiful dwelling to an inferior one."

hebrew_text: ״וְאֵין הַכֹּל מוֹצִיאִין״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי אֲפִילּוּ מִנָּוֶה הָרַע(ה) לְנָוֶה הַיָּפֶה. וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא ״אֵין מוֹצִיאִין״, תְּנָא סֵיפָא נָמֵי ״אֵין מוֹצִיאִין״.
human_translation: And all may not remove to include what to include even from a noxious residence to a pleasant residence. And since taught: But one may not remove, in the first clause, he also taught: But one may not remove, in the latter clause,
llm_translation: "And not all are brought out" for what? To include what? To include even from an ugly dwelling to a beautiful dwelling. And since the first Tanna taught "they do not bring out," the latter Tanna also states "they do not bring out."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הוּא אוֹמֵר לַעֲלוֹת, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת שֶׁלֹּא לַעֲלוֹת — כּוֹפִין אוֹתָהּ לַעֲלוֹת, וְאִם לָאו — תֵּצֵא בְּלֹא כְּתוּבָּה. הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת לַעֲלוֹת, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר שֶׁלֹּא לַעֲלוֹת — כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ לַעֲלוֹת, וְאִם לָאו — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: says to ascend, and says that not to ascend, one forces her to ascend. And if not she is divorced without marriage contract, she says to ascend and he says that not to ascend, one forces him to ascend. And if not he must divorce and give the marriage contract.
llm_translation: The sages taught: If he says to ascend, and she says not to ascend - they force her to ascend, and if not - she leaves without a marriage contract. If she says to ascend, and he says not to ascend - they force him to ascend, and if not - he must divorce her and give her a marriage contract.

hebrew_text: הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת לָצֵאת, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר שֶׁלֹּא לָצֵאת — כּוֹפִין אוֹתָהּ שֶׁלֹּא לָצֵאת, וְאִם לָאו — תֵּצֵא בְּלֹא כְּתוּבָּה. הוּא אוֹמֵר לָצֵאת, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת שֶׁלֹּא לָצֵאת — כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁלֹּא לָצֵאת, וְאִם לָאו — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: she says to leave and he says that not to leave, one forces her not to leave. And if not she is divorced without marriage contract. he says to leave and she says that not to leave, one forces him not to leave. And if not he must divorce and give the marriage contract.
llm_translation: She says "to go out," and he says "not to go out" - we force her not to go out, and if not - she shall go out without a document. He says "to go out," and she says "not to go out" - we force him not to go out, and if not - he shall take her out and give her a document.

hebrew_text: נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה כּוּ׳. הָא גּוּפַהּ קַשְׁיָא:
human_translation: one married a woman This matter itself is difficult,
llm_translation: He married a woman. Behold, her body is hard.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי: נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגֵרְשָׁהּ בְּקַפּוֹטְקְיָא, נוֹתֵן לָהּ מִמְּעוֹת אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל — אַלְמָא בָּתַר שִׁיעְבּוּדָא אָזְלִינַן. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה בְּקַפּוֹטְקְיָא וְגֵרְשָׁהּ בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, נוֹתֵן לָהּ מִמְּעוֹת אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל — אַלְמָא בָּתַר גּוּבְיָינָא אָזְלִינַן!
human_translation: teaches married a woman in Eretz Yisrael and divorced her in Cappadocia, he gives her the currency of Eretz Yisrael. Apparently, one follows lien, say the latter clause married a woman in Cappadocia and divorced her in Eretz Yisrael, he gives her currency of Eretz Yisrael. Apparently, one follows the collection
llm_translation: The text states: If one marries a woman in the land of Israel and divorces her in Kapotkia, and gives her money from the land of Israel - it is evident that we follow the place of the betrothal. Say the latter part: If one marries a woman in Kapotkia and divorces her in the land of Israel, and gives her money from the land of Israel - it is evident that we follow the place of the divorce!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: מִקּוּלֵּי כְתוּבָּה שָׁנוּ כָּאן. קָסָבַר כְּתוּבָּה דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rabba said: taught here of the leniencies a marriage contract. holds a marriage contract by rabbinic
llm_translation: Rabba said: They taught leniencies of Scripture here. He holds like the leniency of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֵן לָהּ מִמְּעוֹת קַפּוֹטְקְיָא. קָסָבַר כְּתוּבָּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says he in the currency of Cappadocia. holds a marriage contract by Torah
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One gives to her from the coins of Kapotkeiya. He holds that it is a biblical obligation.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמּוֹצִיא שְׁטַר חוֹב עַל חֲבֵירוֹ, כָּתוּב בּוֹ בָּבֶל — מַגְבֵּהוּ מִמְּעוֹת בָּבֶל, כָּתוּב בּוֹ אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל — מַגְבֵּהוּ מִמְּעוֹת אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. כָּתוּב בּוֹ סְתָם, הוֹצִיאוֹ בְּבָבֶל — מַגְבֵּהוּ מִמְּעוֹת בָּבֶל, הוֹצִיאוֹ בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל — מַגְבֵּהוּ מִמְּעוֹת אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. כָּתוּב בּוֹ כֶּסֶף סְתָם — מַה שֶּׁיִּרְצֶה לֹוֶה מַגְבֵּהוּ. מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בִּכְתוּבָּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one who produces a promissory note against another, Babylonia is written in it, he pays it with the currency of Babylonia; Eretz Yisrael is written in it, he pays it with currency of Eretz Yisrael. written without specification he produced it in Babylonia he pays it with the currency of Babylonia he produced it in Eretz Yisrael he pays it with currency of Eretz Yisrael. mentions money without specification the borrower may pay it with any he likes, this is not to a marriage contract.
llm_translation: The sages taught: One who produces a promissory note for a debt against his fellow, if it is written in it "Bavel," he raises it in Babylonian currency; if it is written in it "Eretz Yisrael," he raises it in the currency of Eretz Yisrael. If it is written in it without specification, if he produced it in Bavel, he raises it in Babylonian currency; if he produced it in Eretz Yisrael, he raises it in the currency of Eretz Yisrael. If it is written in it "silver" without specification, he raises it according to what the lender desires. This is not the case with a written document.

hebrew_text: אַהֵיָיא? אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: אַרֵישָׁא, לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּאָמַר כְּתוּבָּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: To which Rav Mesharshiyya said: the first clause, to exclude of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said a marriage contract by Torah
llm_translation: אַהֵיָיא? - Ahaiya? אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: - Rav Mesharshya said: אַרֵישָׁא, - First, לְאַפּוֹקֵי - to go out מִדְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, - from Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, דְּאָמַר - who said: כְּתוּבָּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. - it is a written law from the Torah.

hebrew_text: כָּתוּב בּוֹ כֶּסֶף סְתָם — מַה שֶּׁיִּרְצֶה לֹוֶה מַגְבֵּהוּ. וְאֵימָא נְסָכָא? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ מַטְבֵּעַ. וְאֵימָא פְּרִיטֵי? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: פְּרִיטֵי דְכַסְפָּא לָא עָבְדִי אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: mentions money [ kesef ] without specification, the borrower may pay it with any he likes. But say strips? Rabbi Elazar said: which it is written in Coins, And say perutot , Rav Pappa said: People do not mint perutot of silver,
llm_translation: It is written in it, "a plain silver" — whatever the lender desires from him. And why not "a libation"? Rabbi Elazar said: Because it is written in it "a coin." And why not "pieces of silver"? Rav Papa said: Pieces of silver that are not made of silver, people do not use.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לְעוֹלָם יָדוּר אָדָם בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲפִילּוּ בְּעִיר שֶׁרוּבָּהּ גּוֹיִם, וְאַל יָדוּר בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּעִיר שֶׁרוּבָּהּ יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁכׇּל הַדָּר בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל דּוֹמֶה כְּמִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אֱלוֹהַּ, וְכׇל הַדָּר בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ דּוֹמֶה כְּמִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אֱלוֹהַּ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָתֵת לָכֶם אֶת אֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן לִהְיוֹת לָכֶם לֵאלֹהִים״.
human_translation: the Sages taught: A person should always reside in Eretz Yisrael, even in a city that is mostly gentiles, and he should not reside outside Eretz even in a city that is mostly Jews. that anyone who resides in Eretz Yisrael is considered as one who has a God, and anyone who resides outside Eretz is considered as one who does not have a God. As it is stated: “To give to you the land of Canaan, to be your God”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A person should always reside in the Land of Israel, even in a city where the majority of its inhabitants are non-Jews, and should not reside outside the Land of Israel, even in a city where the majority of its inhabitants are Jews, for anyone who resides in the Land of Israel is considered as if he has a God, and anyone who resides outside the Land of Israel is considered as if he has no God. As it is stated: "To give you the land of Canaan, to be your God."

hebrew_text: וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ דָּר בָּאָרֶץ אֵין לוֹ אֱלוֹהַּ? אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לָךְ: כׇּל הַדָּר בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ כְּאִילּוּ עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. וְכֵן בְּדָוִד הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״כִּי גֵרְשׁוּנִי הַיּוֹם מֵהִסְתַּפֵּחַ בְּנַחֲלַת ה׳ לֵאמֹר לֵךְ עֲבוֹד אֱלֹהִים אֲחֵרִים״, וְכִי מִי אָמַר לוֹ לְדָוִד לֵךְ עֲבוֹד אֱלֹהִים אֲחֵרִים? אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לָךְ: כׇּל הַדָּר בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ — כְּאִילּוּ עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: And anyone who resides outside Eretz has no God? Rather, to tell you that anyone who resides outside Eretz is as though he is engaged in idol worship. And so it says with regard to David: “For they have driven me out this day that I should not cleave to the inheritance of the Lord, saying: Go, serve other gods” But who said to David: Go, serve other gods? Rather, to tell you that anyone who resides outside Eretz is as though he is engaged in idol worship.
llm_translation: "And all who does not reside in the land, does not have a God? Rather to say to you: Anyone who resides outside the land is as if he worships foreign worship. And so too, in David it says: 'For they have driven me out this day from abiding in the inheritance of the Lord, saying: Go, serve other gods,' and who said to David to go serve other gods? Rather to say to you: Anyone who resides outside the land - is as if he worships foreign worship."
