hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא הֲוָה קָמִשְׁתְּמִיט מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה דִּבְעָא לְמִיסַּק לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כׇּל הָעוֹלֶה מִבָּבֶל לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל עוֹבֵר בַּעֲשֵׂה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר:
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira was avoiding by Rav Yehuda, sought to ascend to Eretz Yisrael As Rav Yehuda said: Anyone who ascends from Babylonia to Eretz Yisrael transgresses a positive mitzva, as it is stated:
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira was questioning from him of Rav Yehudah who wanted to go to the Land of Israel, as Rav Yehudah said: Anyone who ascends from Babylon to the Land of Israel transgresses a positive commandment, as it is stated:

hebrew_text: ״בָּבֶלָה יוּבָאוּ וְשָׁמָּה יִהְיוּ עַד יוֹם פׇּקְדִי אוֹתָם נְאֻם ה׳״. וְרַבִּי זֵירָא — הָהוּא בִּכְלֵי שָׁרֵת כְּתִיב.
human_translation: “They shall be taken to Babylonia and there they shall remain until the day that I recall them, said the Lord” And Rabbi Zeira that is written about service vessels,
llm_translation: "Bavelah yuva'u v'shamah yihyu ad yom pokdei otam ne'um Hashem." V'Rabbi Zeira - hahu bichlei sharet ktiv.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יְהוּדָה? כְּתִיב קְרָא אַחֲרִינָא: ״הִשְׁבַּעְתִּי אֶתְכֶם בְּנוֹת יְרוּשָׁלִַים בִּצְבָאוֹת אוֹ בְּאַיְלוֹת הַשָּׂדֶה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda another verse is written: “I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem, by the gazelles and by the hinds of the field,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah? It is written in another verse: "I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem, by the gazelles or by the hinds of the field."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי זֵירָא — הָהוּא שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּחוֹמָה. וְרַב יְהוּדָה? ״הִשְׁבַּעְתִּי״ אַחֲרִינָא כְּתִיב.
human_translation: And Rabbi Zeira that that the Jews should not ascend as a wall, And Rav Yehuda another “I adjure you” written
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira - that one that Israel did not ascend with a wall. And Rav Yehuda? "I have sworn" is written elsewhere.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי זֵירָא — הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, דְּאָמַר: שָׁלֹשׁ שְׁבוּעוֹת הַלָּלוּ לָמָּה? אַחַת שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּחוֹמָה, וְאַחַת שֶׁהִשְׁבִּיעַ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלֹּא יִמְרְדוּ בְּאוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם, וְאַחַת שֶׁהִשְׁבִּיעַ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֶת הַגּוֹיִם שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁתַּעְבְּדוּ בָּהֶן בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹתֵר מִדַּאי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Zeira That is necessary for that Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, who said: Why these three oaths One, that the Jews should not ascend as a wall, And one, that the Holy One, Blessed be He, adjured the Jews that they should not rebel against the nations of the world. And one that the Holy One, Blessed be He, adjured the nations that they should not subjugate the Jews excessively.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira - that one asked him according to Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina, who said: "For what are these three weeks? One, that the Israelites should not ascend the wall, and one that the Holy One, blessed be He, made Israel swear not to rebel against the nations of the world, and one that the Holy One, blessed be He, made the nations swear that they should not subjugate Israel excessively."

hebrew_text: וְרַב יְהוּדָה — ״אִם תָּעִירוּ וְאִם תְּעוֹרְרוּ״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda written: “That you not awaken or stir up
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said: "If you awaken and arouse," it is written.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי זֵירָא — מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי לֵוִי, דְּאָמַר: שֵׁשׁ שְׁבוּעוֹת הַלָּלוּ לָמָּה? תְּלָתָא — הָנֵי דַּאֲמַרַן, אִינָךְ: שֶׁלֹּא יְגַלּוּ אֶת הַקֵּץ, וְשֶׁלֹּא יְרַחֲקוּ אֶת הַקֵּץ, וְשֶׁלֹּא יְגַלּוּ הַסּוֹד לַגּוֹיִם.
human_translation: And Rabbi Zeira He needs for that Rabbi Levi, who said: These six oaths, why Three are those that we said The other That should not reveal the end and that they should not distance the end and that they should not reveal the secret to the nations.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira - from the house of Rabbi Levi, as he said: "For what are these six weeks?" - those that we said, "You are not to reveal the end, nor are you to delay the end, nor are you to reveal the secret to the nations."

hebrew_text: ״בִּצְבָאוֹת אוֹ בְּאַיְלוֹת הַשָּׂדֶה״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָמַר לָהֶם הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, אִם אַתֶּם מְקַיְּימִין אֶת הַשְּׁבוּעָה — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו — אֲנִי מַתִּיר אֶת בְּשַׂרְכֶם כִּצְבָאוֹת וּכְאַיְלוֹת הַשָּׂדֶה.
human_translation: by the gazelles and by the hinds of the field” Rabbi Elazar said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to the Jewish people: If you fulfill the oath, it is good, and if not, I will abandon your flesh like the gazelles and like the hinds of the field.
llm_translation: "In troops or in the gazelles of the field," Rabbi Elazar said: The Holy One, blessed be He, said to the Israelites, 'If you fulfill the oath - good, but if not, I permit your flesh like the troops and like the gazelles of the field.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל הַדָּר בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל שָׁרוּי בְּלֹא עָוֹן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבַל יֹאמַר שָׁכֵן חָלִיתִי הָעָם הַיּוֹשֵׁב בָּהּ נְשׂוּא עָוֹן״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אֲנַן בְּסוֹבְלֵי חֳלָאִים מַתְנֵינַן לַהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Anyone who resides in Eretz Yisrael dwells without transgression, as it is stated: “And the inhabitant shall not say: I am sick; the people that dwell there shall be forgiven their iniquity” Rava said to Rav Ashi: We learned this with regard to those who suffer from sickness.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Anyone who lives in the land of Israel is free from sin, as it is stated: "And one shall not say, 'I am sick,' for the people who dwell in it have been forgiven." Rava said to Rav Ashi: We, who suffer from illnesses, recite this about it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עָנָן: כׇּל הַקָּבוּר בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל כְּאִילּוּ קָבוּר תַּחַת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״מִזְבַּח אֲדָמָה תַּעֲשֶׂה לִּי״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וְכִפֵּר אַדְמָתוֹ עַמּוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Anan said: Anyone who is buried in Eretz Yisrael as though buried beneath the altar. It is stated here: “An altar of earth [ adama ] you shall make for Me” and it is stated there: and atones for the land of [ admato ] His people”
llm_translation: Rav Anan said: Anyone buried in the land of Israel is as if buried beneath the altar. It is written here: "You shall make for Me an earthen altar," and it is written there: "And he shall atone for his land."

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא הֲוָה רְגִיל דַּהֲוָה סָלֵיק לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ. אֲתוֹ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. אָמַר: אַנְתְּ עוּלָּא, ״עַל אֲדָמָה טְמֵאָה תָּמוּת״. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֲרוֹנוֹ בָּא. אָמַר לָהֶם: אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה קוֹלַטְתּוֹ מֵחַיִּים לְקוֹלַטְתּוֹ לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: Ulla was accustomed to ascend to Eretz Yisrael he died outside Eretz They came and said to Rabbi Elazar He said: you Ulla, “You shall die in an unclean land” They said to him: But his coffin is coming He said to them: one who was absorbed while alive is not similar to one who was absorbed after death.
llm_translation: Ulla was accustomed that he would ascend to the Land of Israel, his soul would find rest outside of the Land. They came and said to Rabbi Elazar. He said: "You, Ulla, 'On impure soil you shall die.'" They said to him: His coffin is coming. He said to them: His reception is not like that of the living, but like that of the dead.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּנְפַלָה לֵיהּ יְבָמָה בֵּי חוֹזָאָה, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַהוּ לְמֵיחַת וּלְיַבֹּמַהּ?
human_translation: a certain man that a yevama , happened Bei Ḥoza’a, came before Rabbi Ḥanina said to him: What is descend to enter into levirate marriage
llm_translation: That man who fell to him a yevamah in the house of Chozah, came before Rabbi Chanina, he said to him: What about to divorce and to perform yibum?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָחִיו נָשָׂא כּוּתִית וָמֵת — בָּרוּךְ הַמָּקוֹם שֶׁהֲרָגוֹ. וְהוּא יֵרֵד אַחֲרָיו?!
human_translation: said to him: His brother married a Samaritan woman [ kutit ] and died. Blessed be the Omnipresent who killed him. And to descend after him?
llm_translation: He said to him: "His brother married a Kutite woman and died - blessed is the Omnipresent for killing him. And he should follow after him?!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאָסוּר לָצֵאת מֵאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְבָבֶל כָּךְ אָסוּר לָצֵאת מִבָּבֶל לִשְׁאָר אֲרָצוֹת. רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: אֲפִילּוּ מִפּוּמְבְּדִיתָא לְבֵי כוּבֵּי. הָהוּא דִּנְפַק מִפּוּמְבְּדִיתָא לְבֵי כוּבֵּי, שַׁמְתֵּיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף. הָהוּא דִּנְפַק מִפּוּמְבְּדִיתָא לְאַסְתּוֹנְיָא, שְׁכֵיב. אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִי בָּעֵי הַאי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן, הֲוָה חָיֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Just as it is prohibited to leave Eretz Yisrael to Babylonia, so too, is it prohibited to leave Babylonia for the other lands. Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: Even from Pumbedita to Bei Kuvei, A certain left Pumbedita to Bei Kuvei, Rav Yosef excommunicated him. A certain left Pumbedita to Astonia, died. Abaye said: Had this Torah scholar wanted, he would be alive,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Just as it is forbidden to leave the land of Israel for Babylon, so too it is forbidden to leave Babylon for other lands. Rabbah and Rav Yosef both said: Even from Pumbedita to Bei Kubbei. When he went out from Pumbedita to Bei Kubbei, Rav Yosef placed him under a ban. When he went out from Pumbedita to Astunia, he died. Abbaye said: If this person had wanted to become a leader among the scholars, he would have lived.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: כְּשֵׁרִין שֶׁבְּבָבֶל אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל קוֹלַטְתָּן, כְּשֵׁרִין שֶׁבִּשְׁאָר אֲרָצוֹת בָּבֶל קוֹלַטְתָּן. לְמַאי? אִילֵימָא לְיוּחֲסִין, וְהָאָמַר מָר: כׇּל הָאֲרָצוֹת עִיסָּה לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל עִיסָּה לְבָבֶל! אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן קְבוּרָה.
human_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: the worthy of Babylonia, Eretz Yisrael absorbs them; the worthy of other lands, Babylonia absorbs them. to what If we say to lineage, didn’t the Master say: all lands muddled to Eretz Yisrael, and Eretz Yisrael is muddled to Babylonia. Rather, to matters of burial,
llm_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both said: The dead who are buried in Babylonia, the Land of Israel receives them; the dead who are buried in other lands, Babylonia receives them. For what reason? If you say it is for lineage, but didn't the Master say: "All lands are dough compared to the Land of Israel, and the Land of Israel is dough compared to Babylonia!" Rather, it is regarding burial matters.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כׇּל הַדָּר בְּבָבֶל כְּאִילּוּ דָּר בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הוֹי צִיּוֹן הִמָּלְטִי יוֹשֶׁבֶת בַּת בָּבֶל״. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, נָקְטִינַן: בָּבֶל לָא חָזְיָא חַבְלֵי דְמָשִׁיחַ. תַּרְגְּמַהּ אַהוּצָל דְּבִנְיָמִין, וְקָרוּ לֵיהּ קַרְנָא דְשֵׁיזָבְתָּא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: anyone who resides in Babylon, as though he is residing in Eretz Yisrael, as it is stated: “Ho Zion, escape, you who dwells with the daughter of Babylon” Abaye said: We have a tradition Babylonia will not see the pangs of the Messiah, interpreted to Hutzal deVinyamin and call it Karna deShizavta,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Anyone who resides in Babylon is as though he dwells in the Land of Israel, as it is stated: "Ho, Zion, escape, you who dwell with the daughter of Babylon." Abaye said: We have learned: Babylon will not see the birth pangs of the Messiah. Ahutzal of Benjamin translated it, and they called him the Horn of Salvation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מֵתִים שֶׁבְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ אֵינָם חַיִּים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנָתַתִּי צְבִי בְּאֶרֶץ חַיִּים״ — אֶרֶץ שֶׁצִּבְיוֹנִי בָּהּ מֵתֶיהָ חַיִּים, שֶׁאֵין צִבְיוֹנִי בָּהּ — אֵין מֵתֶיהָ חַיִּים.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: The dead of outside Eretz not alive as it is stated: “And I will set glory [ tzvi ] in the land of the living” a land which contains My desire [ tzivyoni ], its dead alive; which does not contain My desire, its dead not alive.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: The dead who are outside the land are not considered alive, as it is stated: "And I will give beauty in the land of the living" - a land in which its beauty is in it, its dead are considered alive; a land in which its beauty is not in it, its dead are not considered alive.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל: ״יִחְיוּ מֵתֶיךָ נְבֵלָתִי יְקוּמוּן״, מַאי לָאו: ״יִחְיוּ מֵתֶיךָ״ — מֵתִים שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. ״נְבֵלָתִי יְקוּמוּן״ — מֵתִים שֶׁבְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ. וּמַאי ״וְנָתַתִּי צְבִי בְּאֶרֶץ חַיִּים״ — אַנְּבוּכַד נֶצַּר הוּא דִּכְתִיב, דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: מַיְיתֵינָא עֲלַיְיהוּ מַלְכָּא דְּקַלִּיל כִּי טַבְיָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Memel raised an objection “Your dead shall live; my dead bodies shall arise” What, is it not “Your dead shall live” the dead of Eretz Yisrael, “My dead bodies shall arise” the dead of outside Eretz And what “And I will set glory [ tzvi ] in the land of the living”? is written to Nebuchadnezzar, as the Merciful One states: I will bring upon you a king who is as swift as a deer [ tzvi ].
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "Let your dead live, let my corpses rise" (Isaiah 26:19). What is the reason that it does not say, "Let your dead live"? — It refers to the dead in the Land of Israel. "Let my corpses rise" — It refers to the dead outside the Land. And what is the meaning of "And I will give splendor in the land of the living"? — It is Nebuchadnezzar, as it is written, for the Merciful One said: "I will bring the king of Babylon upon them, who is swift and skillful" (Jeremiah 51:12).

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבִּי, מִקְרָא אַחֵר אֲנִי דּוֹרֵשׁ: ״נוֹתֵן נְשָׁמָה לָעָם עָלֶיהָ וְרוּחַ לַהוֹלְכִים בָּהּ״. וְאֶלָּא הָכְתִיב ״נְבֵלָתִי יְקוּמוּן״! הָהוּא בִּנְפָלִים הוּא דִּכְתִיב.
human_translation: said to My teacher, I teach a different verse, “He gives breath to the people upon it, and spirit to they who walk there” But isn’t it written: “My dead bodies shall arise”? That it is written stillborns,
llm_translation: He said to him: Rabbi, I interpret a different verse: "He gives breath to the people upon it, and spirit to those who walk in it." But isn't it written "My corpse will rise"! That verse is referring to the fallen ones.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל, הַאי ״נוֹתֵן נְשָׁמָה לָעָם עָלֶיהָ״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אֲפִילּוּ שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל מוּבְטָח לָהּ שֶׁהִיא בַּת הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״לָעָם עָלֶיהָ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״שְׁבוּ לָכֶם פֹּה עִם הַחֲמוֹר״ — עַם הַדּוֹמֶה לַחֲמוֹר.
human_translation: And what does Rabbi Abba bar Memel do with this “He gives breath to the people upon it”? He requires for that Rabbi Abbahu. As Rabbi Abbahu said: Even a Canaanite maidservant in Eretz Yisrael is assured the World-to-Come. It is written here: “To the people [ la’am ] upon it,” and it is written there: “Abide you here with [ im ] the donkey” A people [ am ] that is similar to a donkey,
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Memel said, "Regarding the statement, 'He gives a soul to the people upon it,' what does he do with it?" He asks according to Rabbi Abahu. For Rabbi Abahu said: Even a Canaanite maidservant in the land of Israel can be trusted that she is a daughter of the world to come. It is written here: 'to the people upon it,' and it is written there: 'Stay here with the donkey' — a people similar to a donkey.

hebrew_text: ״וְרוּחַ לַהוֹלְכִים בָּהּ״, אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַמְהַלֵּךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל מוּבְטָח לוֹ שֶׁהוּא בֶּן הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: “And spirit to they who walk there” Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Anyone who walks four cubits in Eretz Yisrael is assured of the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: "And 'a spirit for those who walk in it,'" said Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: Anyone who walks four cubits in the Land of Israel is assured that he is a son of the World to Come."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, צַדִּיקִים שֶׁבְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ אֵינָם חַיִּים?! אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא: עַל יְדֵי גִּלְגּוּל. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא סַלָּא רַבָּא: גִּלְגּוּל לְצַדִּיקִים צַעַר הוּא! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְחִילּוֹת נַעֲשׂוֹת לָהֶם בַּקַּרְקַע.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Elazar, the righteous outside Eretz not alive Rabbi Ile’a said: by means of rolling, Rabbi Abba Salla Rava strongly objects to this: Rolling is suffering for the righteous. Abaye said: Tunnels are prepared for them in the ground,
llm_translation: To Rabbi Elazar, the righteous who are outside the Land are not alive?! Rabbi Ilai said: Through reincarnation. Rabbi Abba Sala Rava objected to him: Reincarnation is distressing for the righteous! Abaye said: Tunnels are made for them in the ground.

hebrew_text: ״וּנְשָׂאתַנִי מִמִּצְרַיִם וּקְבַרְתַּנִי בִּקְבוּרָתָם״, אָמַר קַרְנָא, דְּבָרִים בְּגוֹ: יוֹדֵעַ הָיָה יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ שֶׁצַּדִּיק גָּמוּר הָיָה, וְאִם מֵתִים שֶׁבְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ חַיִּים, לָמָה הִטְרִיחַ אֶת בָּנָיו? שֶׁמָּא לֹא יִזְכֶּה לִמְחִילּוֹת.
human_translation: “You shall carry me out of Egypt and bury me in their burying-place” Karna said: inner matters Our Patriarch Jacob knew that he was completely righteous, and if the dead of outside Eretz alive, why did he trouble his sons lest he not merit the tunnels.
llm_translation: "And you shall carry me up from Egypt and bury me in their burial place," said the horn, as it is written: "Jacob our father knew that he was a complete righteous person. And if the dead who are outside the land are alive, why did he trouble his sons? Perhaps he will not merit forgiveness."

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: ״וַיַּשְׁבַּע יוֹסֵף אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא, דְּבָרִים בְּגוֹ: יוֹדֵעַ הָיָה יוֹסֵף בְּעַצְמוֹ שֶׁצַּדִּיק גָּמוּר הָיָה, וְאִם מֵתִים שֶׁבַּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ חַיִּים, לָמָה הִטְרִיחַ אֶת אֶחָיו אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת פַּרְסָה? שֶׁמָּא לֹא יִזְכֶּה לִמְחִילּוֹת.
human_translation: On a similar note, you say: “And Joseph took an oath of the children of Israel, Rabbi Ḥanina said: inner matters Joseph knew concerning himself that he was completely righteous, and if the dead of outside Eretz alive, why did he trouble his brothers four hundreds parasangs lest he not merit the tunnels.
llm_translation: As an example in the matter, you say: "And Joseph made the sons of Israel swear, etc." Rabbi Chanina said: Joseph knew by himself that he was a completely righteous person, and if the dead outside the land of Israel are alive, why did he trouble his brothers with four hundred paras? Perhaps he will not merit forgiveness.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ אֲחוֹהִי לְרַבָּה: יוֹדֵעַ הָיָה יַעֲקֹב שֶׁצַּדִּיק גָּמוּר הָיָה וְכוּ׳. אִילְפָא מוֹסִיף בָּהּ דְּבָרִים: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה מִצְטַעֵר עַל אִשָּׁה אַחַת, וּבִיקֵּשׁ לֵירֵד, כֵּיוָן שֶׁשָּׁמַע כָּזֹאת, גִּלְגֵּל בְּעַצְמוֹ עַד יוֹם מוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabba’s brothers sent him Jacob knew that he was completely righteous, Ilfa adds matters to An incident involving one who was suffering for a certain woman and he sought to descend When he heard this he suffered until the day he died.
llm_translation: They sent to his brother to Rabbah: Jacob knew that he was a complete righteous person, etc. Elfa added in it words: There was an incident with one who was distressed over a certain woman, and he sought to descend, but once he heard such, he rolled himself until the day of his death.

hebrew_text: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁחָכָם גָּדוֹל אַתָּה, אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה לוֹמֵד מֵעַצְמוֹ לַלּוֹמֵד מֵרַבּוֹ. וְאִם תֹּאמַר אֵין לְךָ רַב — יֵשׁ לְךָ רַב, וּמַנּוּ — רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: And although you are a great Sage, one who studies by himself is not similar to one who studies from his teacher, And if you say you do not have a teacher you do have a teacher. And who is he? Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: Even though you are a great sage, you are not comparable to one who learns from his teacher. And if you say you have no teacher - you do have a teacher, and his name is Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אֵין אַתָּה עוֹלֶה — הִזָּהֵר בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים: אַל תַּרְבֶּה בִּישִׁיבָה — שֶׁיְּשִׁיבָה קָשָׁה לְתַחְתּוֹנִיּוֹת, וְאַל תַּרְבֶּה בַּעֲמִידָה — שֶׁעֲמִידָה קָשָׁה לַלֵּב, וְאַל תַּרְבֶּה בַּהֲלִיכָה — שֶׁהֲלִיכָה קָשָׁה לָעֵינַיִם. אֶלָּא שְׁלִישׁ בִּישִׁיבָה, שְׁלִישׁ בַּעֲמִידָה, שְׁלִישׁ בְּהִילּוּךְ.
human_translation: And if you do not ascend be careful in three matters: Do not sit excessively, as sitting is harmful with regard to hemorrhoids; do not stand excessively, as standing is harmful with regard to heart and do not walk excessively, as walking is harmful with regard to eye Rather, One-third for sitting, one-third for standing, and one-third for walking.
llm_translation: And if you are not able to go up — be cautious in three matters: Do not increase sitting — for sitting is hard for the intestines, and do not increase standing — for standing is hard for the heart, and do not increase walking — for walking is hard for the eyes. Rather, one third in sitting, one third in standing, one third in walking.

hebrew_text: כׇּל יְשִׁיבָה שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהּ סְמִיכָה — עֲמִידָה נוֹחָה הֵימֶנָּה. עֲמִידָה סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? וְהָאָמְרַתְּ עֲמִידָה קָשָׁה לַלֵּב! אֶלָּא: יְשִׁיבָה
human_translation: any sitting that is without support, standing is more comfortable than that enter your mind standing Didn’t you say that standing is harmful with regard to heart Rather, sitting
llm_translation: Every yeshiva that does not have semicha - standing is easy from it. Standing is your opinion? But you said standing is difficult for the heart! Rather: yeshiva.

hebrew_text: שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ סְמִיכָה — עֲמִידָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ סְמִיכָה נוֹחָה הֵימֶנָּה.
human_translation: without support, standing with a support, is better than it.
llm_translation: That it does not have leaning - standing that has leaning resting from it.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמְרוּ: יִצְחָק וְשִׁמְעוֹן וְאוֹשַׁעְיָא אָמְרוּ דָּבָר אֶחָד: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בִּפְרָדוֹת. דְּתַנְיָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: פִּרְדָּה שֶׁתָּבְעָה — אֵין מַרְבִּיעִין עָלֶיהָ לֹא סוּס וְלֹא חֲמוֹר, אֶלָּא מִינָהּ.
human_translation: And so too, said Yitzḥak, Shimon, and Oshaya said the same statement: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda with regard to female mules. As it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: a female mule in heat, one not mate a horse or a donkey with her, Rather, one of her kind,
llm_translation: And so they said: Yitzchak, Shimon, and Oshaya said one thing: the halacha is according to Rabbi Yehuda in matters of separation. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: A cow that has been claimed - one does not mate with her neither a horse nor a donkey, but only her own kind.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: יִצְחָק — זֶה רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא, שִׁמְעוֹן — זֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, אוֹשַׁעְיָא — זֶה רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא בְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said, Yitzḥak is Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa; Shimon is Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi. And some say Reish Lakish, Oshaya is Rabbi Oshaya the Distinguished
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Yitzchak - this is Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha, Shimon - this is Rabbi Shimon ben Pazzi, and some say: Reish Lakish, Oshaya - this is Rabbi Oshaya bar Rabbi.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: עַמֵּי הָאֲרָצוֹת אֵינָן חַיִּים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מֵתִים בַּל יִחְיוּ וְגוֹ׳״, תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״מֵתִים בַּל יִחְיוּ״, יָכוֹל לַכֹּל — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״רְפָאִים בַּל יָקוּמוּ״, בִּמְרַפֶּה עַצְמוֹ מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: The common, uneducated people not alive as it is stated: “The dead live not” This is also taught “The dead live not”; might to everyone, the verse states: “The shades [ refa’im ] rise not” the verse is speaking of one who weakens [ merapeh ] himself from matters of Torah.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: The common people are not considered alive, as it is stated: "The dead will not live" (Isaiah 26:14). It was taught similarly: "The dead will not live." One might think this applies to everyone—therefore the verse states: "The Rephaim will not rise" (Isaiah 26:14), indicating that one who neglects Torah study is as if dead.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָא נִיחָא לְמָרַיְיהוּ דְּאָמְרַתְּ לְהוּ הָכִי, הָהוּא בִּמְרַפֶּה עַצְמוֹ לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הוּא דִּכְתִיב. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִקְרָא אַחֵר אֲנִי דּוֹרֵשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי טַל אוֹרוֹת טַלֶּיךָ וָאָרֶץ רְפָאִים תַּפִּיל״, כׇּל הַמִּשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּאוֹר תּוֹרָה — אוֹר תּוֹרָה מְחַיֵּיהוּ, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּאוֹר תּוֹרָה — אֵין אוֹר תּוֹרָה מְחַיֵּיהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to Their master, is not pleased that you say this of that is written about one who weakens himself to idol worship. said to him: I teach a different verse, as it is written: “For Your dew is as the dew of light, and the earth shall bring to life the shades” Anyone who uses the light of Torah, the light of Torah revive him; and anyone who does not use the light of Torah, the light of Torah not revive him.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yochanan: It is not pleasing to their Master that you said thus, for that one who weakens himself for idol worship, as it is written. He said to him: I interpret another verse, as it is written: "For a commandment is a lamp and the Torah is light, and reproofs of discipline are the way of life." Whoever engages in the light of Torah, the light of Torah will give him life, and whoever does not engage in the light of Torah, the light of Torah will not give him life.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּחַזְיֵיהּ דְּקָמִצְטַעַר, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבִּי, מָצָאתִי לָהֶן תַּקָּנָה מִן הַתּוֹרָה: ״וְאַתֶּם הַדְּבֵקִים בַּה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם חַיִּים כּוּלְּכֶם הַיּוֹם״, וְכִי אֶפְשָׁר לִדַּבּוֹקֵי בַּשְּׁכִינָה? וְהָכְתִיב: ״כִּי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ אֵשׁ אוֹכְלָה״?
human_translation: Since saw that was grieved he said to him: My teacher, I have found for them a remedy from the Torah “But You who cleave to the Lord your God, are alive every one of you this day” But is it possible to cleave to the Divine Presence? Isn’t it written: For the Lord your God is a devouring fire”
llm_translation: As soon as he saw that he was distressed, he said to him: Rabbi, I found for them a remedy from the Torah: "But you who are clinging to the Lord your God are all alive today." Is it possible for those who cling to the Divine Presence? But it is written: "For the Lord your God is a consuming fire."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: כׇּל הַמַּשִּׂיא בִּתּוֹ לְתַלְמִיד חָכָם, וְהָעוֹשֶׂה פְּרַקְמַטְיָא לְתַלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, וְהַמְהַנֶּה תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מִנְּכָסָיו — מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ מִדַּבֵּק בַּשְּׁכִינָה.
human_translation: Rather, anyone who marries his daughter to a Torah scholar, and one who conducts business [ perakmatya ] on behalf of Torah scholars, and one who to benefit Torah scholars with his property the verse ascribes him as though he is cleaving to the Divine Presence.
llm_translation: Rather: anyone who marries off his daughter to a Torah scholar, and one who provides food for the students of Torah scholars, and one who supports Torah scholars from his own resources - the Scripture considers it as if he cleaves to the Divine Presence.

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: ״לְאַהֲבָה אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ וּלְדׇבְקָה בוֹ״, וְכִי אֶפְשָׁר לָאָדָם לִידַּבֵּק בַּשְּׁכִינָה? אֶלָּא: כׇּל הַמַּשִּׂיא בִּתּוֹ לְתַלְמִיד חָכָם, וְהָעוֹשֶׂה פְּרַקְמַטְיָא לְתַלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, וְהַמְהַנֶּה תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מִנְּכָסָיו — מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ מִדַּבֵּק בַּשְּׁכִינָה.
human_translation: On a similar note, you say: “To love the Lord your God, and to cleave to Him” But is it possible for a person to cleave to the Divine Presence? Rather, anyone who marries his daughter to a Torah scholar, and one who conducts business on behalf of Torah scholars, and one who to benefit Torah scholars with his property, the verse ascribes him as though he is cleaving to the Divine Presence.
llm_translation: "As an example in this matter, you say: 'To love the Lord your God and to cleave to Him.' Is it possible for a person to cleave to the Divine Presence? Rather, anyone who gives his daughter to a Torah scholar, and one who provides funds for the students of Torah scholars, and one who benefits Torah scholars from his possessions - the Scripture considers it as if he cleaves to the Divine Presence."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף: עֲתִידִין צַדִּיקִים שֶׁמְּבַצְבְּצִין וְעוֹלִין בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיָצִיצוּ מֵעִיר כְּעֵשֶׂב הָאָרֶץ״, וְאֵין ״עִיר״ אֶלָּא יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְגַנּוֹתִי אֶל הָעִיר הַזֹּאת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef said: In the future, the righteous will burst forth and arise in Jerusalem, as it is stated: “And may they blossom out of the city like the grass of the earth” and “city” nothing other Jerusalem, as it is stated: “For I will defend this city”
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef said: Righteous individuals are destined to sprout forth and ascend in Jerusalem, as it is stated: "And they shall sprout forth from the city like grass of the earth," and "city" refers only to Jerusalem, as it is stated: "And I will turn My attention to this city."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף: עֲתִידִים צַדִּיקִים שֶׁיַּעַמְדוּ בְּמַלְבּוּשֵׁיהֶן, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מֵחִטָּה: מָה חִטָּה שֶׁנִּקְבְּרָה עֲרוּמָּה — יוֹצְאָה בְּכַמָּה לְבוּשִׁין, צַדִּיקִים שֶׁנִּקְבְּרוּ בִּלְבוּשֵׁיהֶן — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef said: In the future the righteous will stand in their clothes. a fortiori from wheat: Just as wheat, which is buried naked, emerges with several layers of garb, the righteous, who are buried clothed, all the more so
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef said: Righteous individuals in the future will stand in their garments, a fortiori from wheat: Just as wheat, when buried naked, emerges with how many coverings, righteous individuals who are buried in their garments - all the more so.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף: עֲתִידָה אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁתּוֹצִיא גְּלוּסְקָאוֹת וּכְלֵי מֵילָת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יְהִי פִסַּת בַּר בָּאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef said: In the future Eretz Yisrael will produce cakes [ geluskaot ] and wool clothing [ meilat ] as it is stated: “Let abundant [ pissat ] grain [ bar ] be in the land”
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef: The land of Israel is destined to produce glass vessels and fine garments, as it is stated: "Let there be a piece of land in the field."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״יְהִי פִסַּת בַּר בָּאָרֶץ בְּרֹאשׁ הָרִים״, אָמְרוּ: עֲתִידָה חִטָּה שֶׁתִּתַּמֵּר כְּדֶקֶל, וְעוֹלָה בְּרֹאשׁ הָרִים. וְשֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר: יֵשׁ צַעַר לְקוֹצְרָהּ! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יִרְעַשׁ כַּלְּבָנוֹן פִּרְיוֹ״ — הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מֵבִיא רוּחַ מִבֵּית גְּנָזָיו וּמְנַשְּׁבָהּ עָלֶיהָ וּמַשִּׁרָה אֶת סׇלְתָּהּ, וְאָדָם יוֹצֵא לַשָּׂדֶה וּמֵבִיא מְלֹא פִּיסַּת יָדוֹ, וּמִמֶּנָּה פַּרְנָסָתוֹ וּפַרְנָסַת אַנְשֵׁי בֵיתוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught “Let abundant [ pissat ] grain be in the land upon the top of the mountains” They said: In the future, wheat will rise up, and grow like a palm tree, and ascend to the top of the mountains. And lest you say its reaper discomfort, the verse states: “May his fruit rustle like Lebanon.” The Holy One, Blessed be He, bring a wind from His treasury and blow across, and induce the flour and a person will go out to the field and bring back a palmful [ pissat ] from which he will his livelihood and the livelihood of the members of his household.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Let there be wheat in the land on the tops of the mountains," they said: In the future, wheat will grow as tall as palm trees and ascend to the tops of the mountains. And lest you say, there is pain for the reaper! The Scripture teaches: "His produce shall shake like the Lebanon." — The Holy One, blessed be He, brings a wind from His treasuries, and it blows upon it and ripens its wheat, and a person goes out to the field and brings back the measure of his hand, and from it he sustains himself and sustains the people of his household.

hebrew_text: ״עִם חֵלֶב כִּלְיוֹת חִטָּה״, אָמְרוּ: עֲתִידָה חִטָּה שֶׁתְּהֵא כִּשְׁתֵּי כְלָיוֹת שֶׁל שׁוֹר הַגָּדוֹל. וְאַל תִּתְמַהּ, שֶׁהֲרֵי שׁוּעָל קִינֵּן בְּלֶפֶת, וּשְׁקָלוּהוּ, וּמָצְאוּ בּוֹ שִׁשִּׁים לִיטְרִין, בְּלִיטְרָא שֶׁל צִפּוֹרִי.
human_translation: “With the kidney-fat of wheat” said: In the future, wheat will be as the two kidneys of the large ox. And do not be surprised as there was a fox that nested inside a turnip, and they weighed and they discovered it sixty litra , by the litra of Tzippori.
llm_translation: "With the fat of kidneys of wheat," they said: Wheat is destined to be like the two kidneys of a large ox. And do not wonder, for a fox acquired a vineyard, and they weighed it, and found in it sixty liters, in the measure of a bird's crop."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּשִׁיחִין בְּאֶחָד שֶׁהִנִּיחַ לוֹ אָבִיו שְׁלֹשָׁה בַּדֵּי חַרְדָּל וְנִפְשַׁח אֶחָד מֵהֶן וְנִמְצְאוּ בּוֹ תִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין חַרְדָּל. וְעֵצָיו, סִיכְּכוּ בּוֹ סוּכַּת יוֹצְרִין. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן תַּחְלִיפָא: קֶלַח שֶׁל כְּרוּב הִנִּיחַ לָנוּ אַבָּא, וְהָיִינוּ עוֹלִים וְיוֹרְדִים בּוֹ בְּסוּלָּם.
human_translation: it is taught Rav Yosef said: an incident in Shiḥin, involving one whose father had left him three branches of mustard, one of which broke. And they discovered on nine kav of mustard. And wood of its they roofed a booth for artisans. Rabbi Shimon ben Taḥlifa said: Father left us a cabbage stalk and we would go up and down on it with a ladder,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rav Yosei said: There was an incident with a certain person who left his father three barrels of mustard, and one of them burst, and within it were found nine kav of mustard. And its branches, they formed for him a sukkah of artisans. Rabbi Shimon ben Tachlifa said: Our father left us a cherub's leaf, and we would ascend and descend upon it by a ladder.

hebrew_text: ״וְדַם עֵנָב תִּשְׁתֶּה חָמֶר״, אָמְרוּ: לֹא כָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה יֵשׁ בּוֹ צַעַר לִבְצוֹר וְלִדְרוֹךְ, הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא מֵבִיא עֲנָוָה אַחַת בַּקָּרוֹן אוֹ בִּסְפִינָה, וּמַנִּיחָהּ בְּזָוִית בֵּיתוֹ, וּמְסַפֵּק הֵימֶנָּה כְּפִטוֹס גָּדוֹל. וְעֵצָיו, מַסִּיקִין תַּחַת הַתַּבְשִׁיל. וְאֵין לְךָ כׇּל עֲנָבָה וַעֲנָבָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ שְׁלֹשִׁים גַּרְבֵי יַיִן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְדַם עֵנָב תִּשְׁתֶּה חָמֶר״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״חָמֶר״ אֶלָּא ״חוֹמֶר״.
human_translation: “And from the blood of the grape you drank foaming wine” said: The World-to-Come is not like this world. this world there is suffering in picking and pressing World-to-Come bring one grape in a wagon or on a boat and set it down in a corner of his house and supply from it enough about a large jug [ pitus ], and with its wood one will kindle under a cooked dish. And every grape you have will produce no less thirty full jugs of wine, As it is stated: “And from the blood of the grape you drank foaming wine [ ḥamer ].” Do not read ḥamer ; rather, ḥomer ,
llm_translation: "And the blood of grapes you shall drink as wine," they said: Not like this world is the world to come. In this world, there is distress in harvesting and treading grapes, but the world to come brings one cluster of grapes in a basket or in a ship, and places it in the corner of his house, and squeezes it and it fills a large jug. And its branches, they are placed beneath the cooking pot. And you do not have any grape that does not contain thirty measures of wine, as it is stated: "And the blood of grapes you shall drink as wine," do not read "wine" but "measure."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״אוֹסְרִי לַגֶּפֶן עִירֹה״ — אֵין לְךָ כׇּל גֶּפֶן וָגֶפֶן שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁאֵין צָרִיךְ עַיִר אַחַת לִבְצוֹר. ״וְלַשּׂוֹרֵקָה בְּנִי אֲתוֹנוֹ״ — אֵין לָךְ כׇּל אִילַן סְרָק שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא מַשּׂוֹי שְׁתֵּי אֲתוֹנוֹת. וְשֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר אֵין בּוֹ יַיִן, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּבֵּס בְּיַיִן לְבוּשׁוֹ״. וְשֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר אֵינוֹ אָדוֹם, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְדַם עֵנָב תִּשְׁתֶּה חָמֶר״.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: What is which is written: “Binding his foal to the vine” every grapevine you have in Eretz Yisrael requires a foal to harvest. “And his donkey’s colt to the choice vine [ soreka ].” Every barren [ serak ] tree you have in Eretz Yisrael will produce to load two donkeys. And lest you say do not contain wine, the verse states: “He washes his garments in wine.” And lest you say is not red, the verse states: “And from the blood of the grape you drank foaming wine”
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: What is the meaning of the verse "I will bind it up as a cluster for the vineyard"? You have no vineyard in the land of Israel that does not require one watchman to guard it. "And to the colt of my she-donkey, you have tied it" - you have no sycamore tree in the land of Israel that does not yield enough to feed two donkeys. And lest you say it does not produce wine, the Scripture teaches: "He washed his garment in wine." And lest you say it is not red, the Scripture teaches: "And the blood of grapes you shall drink as wine."

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר אֵינוֹ מַרְוֶה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״סוּתֹה״. וְשֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר אֵין בּוֹ טַעַם — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״חַכְלִילִי עֵינַיִם מִיָּיִן״. כׇּל חֵיךְ שֶׁטּוֹעֲמוֹ, אוֹמֵר: ״לִי לִי״. וְשֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר לִנְעָרִים יָפֶה וְלִזְקֵנִים אֵינוֹ יָפֶה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּלְבֶן שִׁנַּיִם מֵחָלָב״, אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״לְבֶן שִׁינַּיִם״ אֶלָּא ״לְבֶן שָׁנִים״.
human_translation: And lest you say does not inebriate the verse states: “And his vesture [ suto ] And lest you say has no flavor, the verse states: “His eyes shall be red [ ḥakhlili ] with wine” Each palate [ ḥeikh ] that tastes it says: for me, for me [ li li ]. And lest you say is good for the young but it is not good for the old, the verse states: “And his teeth white [ leven shinayim ] with milk” Do not read leven shinayim ; rather, leven shanim ,
llm_translation: And perhaps you will say it is not pleasing - the Talmud teaches: "Sutoh." And perhaps you will say it has no taste - the Talmud teaches: "Chaklili einayim miyayin." Every palate that tastes it, says: "For me, for me." And perhaps you will say to the youth it is beautiful and to the elderly it is not beautiful - the Talmud teaches: "U'levan shinayim mechalav," do not read "levan shinayim" but "levan shanim."

hebrew_text: פְּשָׁטֵיהּ דִּקְרָא בְּמַאי כְּתִיב? כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: אָמְרָה כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, רְמוֹז [לִי] בְּעֵינָיךְ דִּבְסִים מֵחַמְרָא, וְאַחְוִי לִי שִׁינָּיךְ דִּבְסִים מֵחֲלָבָא.
human_translation: To what does the plain meaning of verse refer? When Rav Dimi came he said: The congregation of Israel said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe: Hint with Your eyes that is sweeter than wine, and show me Your teeth that is sweeter than milk.
llm_translation: The simple meaning of the verse, with what is it written? When Rav Dimi came, he said: The congregation of Israel said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, hint to me with Your eyes that are like wine, and draw me after You with Your teeth that are like milk.

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: טוֹב הַמַּלְבִּין שִׁינַּיִם לַחֲבֵירוֹ יוֹתֵר מִמַּשְׁקֵהוּ חָלָב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּלְבֶן שִׁנַּיִם מֵחָלָב״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״לְבֶן שִׁינַּיִם״ אֶלָּא ״לִבּוּן שִׁינַּיִם״.
human_translation: supports of Rabbi Yoḥanan. As Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One who whitens his teeth to his friend is better than one who gives him milk to drink, as it is stated: “And his teeth white [ leven shinayim ] with milk” Do not read leven shinayim ; rather, libbun shinayim ,
llm_translation: Assisting him to Rabbi Yochanan, as Rabbi Yochanan said: Good is one who whitens his teeth for his friend more than giving him milk, as it is stated: "And white teeth from milk," do not read "white teeth" but rather "whitening of teeth."

hebrew_text: רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אַדָּא מַקְרֵי דַרְדְּקֵי דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ הֲוָה. אִיפַּגַּר תְּלָתָא יוֹמֵי וְלָא אֲתָא. כִּי אֲתָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי אִיפַּגַּרְתְּ?
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Adda was a school teacher of Reish Lakish. was delayed for three days and did not come When he came, said to him: Why were you delayed?
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Adda was reading the book of Dardakei, Reish Lakish was there. He studied for three days and did not come. When he came, he said to him: Why did you study for three days?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דָּלִית אַחַת הִנִּיחַ לִי אַבָּא וּבָצַרְתִּי מִמֶּנָּה יוֹם רִאשׁוֹן שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת אֶשְׁכּוֹלוֹת אֶשְׁכּוֹל לְגָרָב, יוֹם שֵׁנִי בָּצַרְתִּי שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת אֶשְׁכּוֹלוֹת שְׁתֵּי אֶשְׁכּוֹלוֹת לְגָרָב, יוֹם שְׁלִישִׁי בָּצַרְתִּי מִמֶּנָּה שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת אֶשְׁכּוֹלוֹת שָׁלֹשׁ אֶשְׁכּוֹלוֹת לְגָרָב, וְהִפְקַרְתִּי יוֹתֵר מֵחֶצְיָהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי לָאו דְּאִיפַּגַּרְתְּ הֲוָה עָבְדָא טְפֵי.
human_translation: said to him: Father left me one branch and I harvested from it first day three hundred grape clusters, cluster to a jug. second day I harvested three hundred grape clusters, two clusters to a jug. the third day I harvested three hundred grape clusters, three clusters to a jug, and I declared ownerless more than half of it. said to him: Had you not delayed would have produced more
llm_translation: He said to him: "If you had left me one cluster, Abba, I would have made from it on the first day three hundred bunches, a bunch for a grove. On the second day, I would have made from it two bunches for a grove. On the third day, I would have made from it three hundred bunches, three bunches for a grove, and I would have left over more than half of it." He said to him: "If you had not been so stingy, there would have been much more produce."

hebrew_text: רָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל אִיקְּלַע לִבְנֵי בְרַק, חֲזַנְהוּ לְהָנְהוּ עִיזֵּי דְּקָאָכְלָן תּוּתֵי תְּאֵינֵי וְקָנָטֵיף דּוּבְשָׁא מִתְּאֵינֵי וַחֲלָבָא טָיֵיף מִנַּיְיהוּ וּמִיעָרַב בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. אֲמַר: הַיְינוּ: ״זָבַת חָלָב וּדְבָשׁ״.
human_translation: Rami bar Yeḥezkel happened to Benei Berak. saw those goats that were grazing beneath a fig and there was honey oozing from the figs and milk dripping from and were mixing together. He said: This is flowing with milk and honey”
llm_translation: Ramei bar Yehezkel encountered the people of Barak, he saw them feeding their goats with mulberry leaves and honeycomb from the fig tree, and the milk was stronger than the honey and mixed together in a pot. He said: This is what is meant by "a land flowing with milk and honey."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בֶּן דּוֹסְתַּאי: מִלּוֹד לְאוֹנוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה מִילִין, פַּעַם אַחַת קִדַּמְתִּי בַּנֶּשֶׁף וְהָלַכְתִּי עַד קַרְסוּלַּיי בִּדְבַשׁ שֶׁל תְּאֵינִים. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי ״זָבַת חָלָב וּדְבָשׁ״ שֶׁל צִפּוֹרִי, וְהָוֵי שִׁיתְּסַר מִילִין אַשִּׁיתְּסַר מִילִין. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי ״זָבַת חָלָב וּדְבָשׁ״ שֶׁל כׇּל אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל,
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov ben Dostai said: There are three mil from Lud to Ono. Once I rose early in the morning and I walked in ankle-deep honey from fig trees. Reish Lakish said: I myself saw flowing with milk and honey by Tzippori, and it was sixteen by sixteen mil , Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: I myself saw flowing with milk and honey of all Eretz Yisrael,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov ben Dostai said: "The load of his donkey is three mil, once I preceded at dawn and walked until my ankles in fig honey." Reish Lakish said: "For me, see 'a flow of milk and honey' of birds, and if I refrain from words, I will refrain from words." Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said: "For me, see 'a flow of milk and honey' of the entire land of Israel."

hebrew_text: וְהָוְיָא כְּמִבֵּי מִיכְסֵי עַד אַקְרָא דְתוּלְבַּנְקֵי, עֶשְׂרִין וְתַרְתֵּין פַּרְסֵי אוּרְכָּא וּפוּתְיָא שִׁיתָּא פַּרְסֵי.
human_translation: and it was as from Bei Mikhsei until the fortress of Tulbanki: Its length twenty-two parasangs and its width six parasangs,
llm_translation: "And it shall be like from the entrance of Michsei until the vineyard of Tulbankei, twenty-two Parsaot in length and six Parsaot in width."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ וְרַבִּי עַוִּירָא וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא אִיקְּלַעוּ לְהָהוּא אַתְרָא. אַיְיתוֹ קַמַּיְיהוּ אֲפַרְסְקָא דַּהֲוָה כְּאִילְפַּס כְּפַר הִינוֹ. וְאִילְפַּס כְּפַר הִינוֹ כַּמָּה הָוֵי — חָמֵשׁ סְאִין. אָכְלוּ שְׁלִישׁ, וְהִפְקִירוּ שְׁלִישׁ, וְנָתְנוּ לִפְנֵי בְּהֶמְתָּן שְׁלִישׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥelbo, Rabbi Avira, and Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina happened to a certain place. brought before a peach [ afarseka ] that was as a stewpot [ ilpas ] of Kefar Hino. And how big is a stewpot of Kefar Hino? five se’a . They ate one-third they declared ownerless one-third and they placed before their animals one-third
llm_translation: Rabbi Helbo, Rabbi Avira, and Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina happened upon that place. They brought before them a peach tree that was like a palm tree in size. And how much is a palm tree in size? Five se'ahs. They ate one-third, abandoned one-third, and placed one-third before their animal.

hebrew_text: לְשָׁנָה אִיקְּלַע רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְהָתָם וְאַיְיתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ (נְקַטוּ) [נַקְטֵיהּ] בִּידֵיהּ, וְאָמַר: ״אֶרֶץ פְּרִי לִמְלֵחָה מֵרָעַת יוֹשְׁבֵי בָהּ״.
human_translation: In year, Rabbi Elazar happened to that and they brought before him. He held it in his hand, and he said, “A fruitful land into a salt waste, from the wickedness of they who dwell there”
llm_translation: In the year, Rabbi Elazar happened to come there, and they brought him before him, and he said: "A land of produce for salt, because of the evil of its inhabitants."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אִיקְּלַע לְגַבְלָא, חֲזַנְהוּ לְהָנְהוּ קִטּוּפֵי דַּהֲווֹ קָיְימִי כִּי עִיגְלֵי, אָמַר: עֲגָלִים בֵּין הַגְּפָנִים? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: קִטּוּפֵי נִינְהוּ. אָמַר: אֶרֶץ אֶרֶץ, הַכְנִיסִי פֵּירוֹתַיִיךְ, לְמִי אַתְּ מוֹצִיאָה פֵּירוֹתַיִיךְ, לְגוֹיִם הַלָּלוּ שֶׁעָמְדוּ עָלֵינוּ בְּחַטֹּאתֵינוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi happened to Gavla, he saw those clusters that were standing as calves. He said Calves are between the grapevines They said to him: They are clusters. said: O earth, O earth! Gather in your fruit. For whom do you produce your fruit? For these gentiles who stand over us in our sins?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi encountered a border, he saw the vines being pruned while still standing like calves. He said: Calves among the vines? They said to him: These are the pruned branches. He said: "Land, land, bring forth your fruits, for whom are you producing your fruits, for these nations who stand over us due to our sins?"

hebrew_text: לְשָׁנָה אִיקְּלַע רַבִּי חִיָּיא לְהָתָם, חֲזַנְהוּ דַּהֲווֹ קָיְימִי כְּעִיזֵּי, אָמַר: עִזִּים בֵּין הַגְּפָנִים? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: זִיל, לָא תַּעֲבֵיד לַן כִּי חַבְרָךְ.
human_translation: year, Rabbi Ḥiyya happened to that he saw clusters that were standing as goats. He said: Goats are between the grapevines. They said to him: Go do not do to us what your colleague
llm_translation: In the year, Rabbi Chiya happened to arrive there. They saw that they were standing like goats. He said, "Goats among the vines?" They said to him, "Go, do not trouble us, for you are our companion."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּבִרְכוֹתֶיהָ שֶׁל אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל — בֵּית סְאָה עוֹשָׂה חֲמֵשֶׁת רִיבּוֹא כּוֹרִין, בִּישִׁיבָתָהּ שֶׁל צוֹעַן — בֵּית סְאָה עוֹשָׂה שִׁבְעִים כּוֹרִין. דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אֲנִי רָאִיתִי בְּבִקְעַת בֵּית שְׁאָן בֵּית סְאָה עוֹשָׂה שִׁבְעִים כּוֹרִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught: In blessings of Eretz Yisrael, one beit se’a produces fifty thousand kor . when Zoan, was settled, one beit se’a would produce seventy kor . As it is taught Rabbi Meir said: I saw in the valley of Beit She’an beit se’a produced seventy kor ,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: In the blessings of the land of Israel - a Beit Se'ah (measure) produces five Ribbo (quarter) of Kor, in its fertile area of Tzoan - a Beit Se'ah produces seventy Kor. As it was taught, Rabbi Meir said: I have seen in the valley of Beit Shean a Beit Se'ah producing seventy Kor.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לְךָ מְעוּלָּה בְּכׇל אֲרָצוֹת יוֹתֵר מֵאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כְּגַן ה׳ כְּאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם״. וְאֵין לְךָ מְעוּלָּה בְּכׇל אֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם יוֹתֵר מִצּוֹעַן — דַּהֲווֹ מְרַבּוּ בַּהּ מְלָכִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי הָיוּ בְצוֹעַן שָׂרָיו״. וְאֵין לְךָ טְרָשִׁים בְּכׇל אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹתֵר מֵחֶבְרוֹן, דַּהֲווֹ קָבְרִי בָּהּ שָׁיכְבֵי.
human_translation: And you have no more outstanding among all the lands than the land of Egypt, as it is stated: “Like the garden of the Lord, like the land of Egypt” And you have no more outstanding in all of the land of Egypt than Zoan. that they would raise kings there, as it is written: “For his princes are at Zoan” And you have no rockier in all of Eretz Yisrael than Hebron, as would bury dead there,
llm_translation: "And you have no excellence in all lands more than the land of Egypt, as it is stated: 'Like the garden of the Lord, like the land of Egypt.' And you have no excellence in all the land of Egypt more than Zoan - for kings were multiplied in it, as it is written: 'For its princes were at Zoan.' And you have no treasures in all the land of Israel more than Hebron, for the Patriarchs are buried there."

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, חֶבְרוֹן מְבוּנָּה עַל אַחַת מִשִּׁבְעָה בְּצוֹעַן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְחֶבְרוֹן שֶׁבַע שָׁנִים נִבְנְתָה לִפְנֵי צוֹעַן מִצְרָיִם״, מַאי ״נִבְנְתָה״? אִילֵימָא נִבְנְתָה מַמָּשׁ, אֶפְשָׁר אָדָם בּוֹנֶה בַּיִת לִבְנוֹ קָטָן קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּבְנֶה לִבְנוֹ גָּדוֹל? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְנֵי חָם כּוּשׁ וּמִצְרַיִם וּפוּט וּכְנָעַן״!
human_translation: And even so, Hebron was more developed, than Zoan sevenfold, as it is written: “Now Hebron was built [ nivneta ] seven years before Zoan in Egypt” What Nivneta , If we say literally was built would a person build a house for his younger son before building for his older son? As it is stated: “And the sons of Ham: Cush, and Mizraim, and Put, and Canaan”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And even so, Hebron was built on one of the seven hills of Zion, as it is written: "And Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt." What does "was built" mean? If you say it was actually built, is it possible for a person to build a small house for his son before he builds a large one for himself? As it is said: "And the sons of Ham were Cush and Mizraim and Put and Canaan!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שֶׁמְּבוּנָּה עַל אַחַת מִשִּׁבְעָה בְּצוֹעֵן. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי בִּטְרָשִׁים, אֲבָל שֶׁלֹּא בִּטְרָשִׁים — חֲמֵשׁ מְאָה.
human_translation: Rather, was more developed than Zoan sevenfold, And this applies only to the rocky whereas not rocky five hundred
llm_translation: Rather, that it is built on one of seven in Tzoin. And these matters are in Tarshish, but not in Tarshish - five hundred.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי שֶׁלֹּא בְּבִרְכוֹתֶיהָ, אֲבָל בְּבִרְכוֹתֶיהָ, כְּתִיב: ״וַיִּזְרַע יִצְחָק בָּאָרֶץ הַהִיא וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And this applies to not blessed. However, when it was blessed, it is written: “And Isaac sowed in that land,
llm_translation: These are the matters that are not in its blessings, but in its blessings, as it is written: "And Isaac sowed in that land, and so on."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: סְאָה בִּיהוּדָה הָיְתָה עוֹשָׂה חָמֵשׁ סְאִין: סְאָה קֶמַח, סְאָה סֹלֶת, סְאָה סוּבִּין, סְאָה מוּרְסִין, וּסְאָה קִיבּוֹרְיָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא צַדּוּקִי לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: יָאֵה מְשַׁבְּחִיתוּ בַּהּ בְּאַרְעֲכוֹן. בֵּית סְאָה אַחַת הִנִּיחַ לִי אַבָּא, מִמֶּנָּה מְשַׁח, מִמֶּנָּה חֲמַר, מִמֶּנָּה עִיבוּר, מִמֶּנָּה קִיטְנִיּוֹת, מִמֶּנָּה רוֹעוֹת מִקְנָתִי.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yosei said: A se’a in Judea would produce five se’a . a se’a of flour; a se’a of fine flour; a se’a of bran a se’a of coarse bran, and a se’a of cibarium [ kiburaya ], A certain Sadducee said to Rabbi Ḥanina: You have done well in praising your land; father left me one beit se’a and from it oil, from it wine, from it produce, from it legumes, my sheep graze.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei said, in Judea a se'ah used to contain five se'ahs: a se'ah of wheat, a se'ah of barley, a se'ah of beans, a se'ah of lentils, and a se'ah of carobs. That Sadducee said to Rabbi Chanina: "You have praised it in your land." My father left me one se'ah, from it I anointed, from it I made vinegar, from it I made beer, from it I made porridge, from it I fed my cattle.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא בַּר אֱמוֹרָאָה לְבַר אַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל: הַאי [תָּאלְתָּא] דְּקָיְימָא אַגּוּדָּא דְיַרְדְּנָא כַּמָּה גָּדְרִיתוּ מִינַּהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שִׁיתִּין כּוֹרֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַכַּתִּי לָא עָיְילִיתוּ בָּהּ אַחְרֵיבְתּוּהָ, אֲנַן מְאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים כּוֹרֵי הֲוָה גָּזְרִינַן מִינַּהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא נָמֵי מֵחַד גִּיסָא קָאָמֵינָא לָךְ.
human_translation: A certain Amorite said to of Eretz Yisrael: That palm tree which stands on the banks of the Jordan, how many are you able to pick from it? He said to him: Sixty kor . said to him: You have not yet entered you have destroying it. We would pick off that 120 kor . said to him: I too am speaking to you one side
llm_translation: He said to him, that son of the teacher, to the son of the land of Israel: This question that is asked about the fence of the Jordan, how much did they fence from it? He said to him: Sixty cubits. He said to him: But did you not go after it and destroy it? We had decreed one hundred and twenty cubits from it. He said to him: I also am standing from one side for you.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶתֶּן לָךְ אֶרֶץ חֶמְדָּה נַחֲלַת צְבִי״, לָמָּה אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל נִמְשְׁלָה לִצְבִי? לוֹמַר לְךָ: מָה צְבִי זֶה אֵין עוֹרוֹ מַחֲזִיק בְּשָׂרוֹ, אַף אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵינָהּ מַחְזֶקֶת פֵּירוֹתֶיהָ. דָּבָר אַחֵר: מָה צְבִי זֶה קַל מִכׇּל הַחַיּוֹת, אַף אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל קַלָּה מִכׇּל הָאֲרָצוֹת לְבַשֵּׁל אֶת פֵּירוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: What is which is written: “And give you a pleasant land, the goodliest [ tzvi ] heritage” Why is Eretz Yisrael likened to a deer [ tzvi ]? to tell you just as this deer, its skin cannot contain its meat so too, Eretz Yisrael cannot contain its fruit Alternatively, just as this deer is swifter than all the beasts, so too Eretz Yisrael is swifter to ripen its fruit than all countries.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said, what is the meaning of what is written: "And I will give you a land flowing with milk and honey"? Why is the land of Israel compared to a deer? To tell you: Just as this deer, its skin does not hold its flesh, so too the land of Israel does not hold its fruits. Another explanation: Just as this deer is lighter than all the animals, so too the land of Israel is lighter than all the lands in ripening its fruits.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה צְבִי זֶה קַל וְאֵין בְּשָׂרוֹ שָׁמֵן — אַף אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל קַלָּה לְבַשֵּׁל וְאֵין פֵּירוֹתֶיהָ שְׁמֵנִים, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״זָבַת חָלָב וּדְבָשׁ״, שְׁמֵנִים מֵחָלָב וּמְתוּקִים מִדְּבַשׁ.
human_translation: If Just as this deer is swift and its meat is not fatty, so too, Eretz Yisrael is swift to ripen but its fruit is not fat the verse states: “Flowing with milk and honey” fat than milk and sweeter than honey.
llm_translation: "If what is a deer this light and no fat its — also land Israel light to cook and no fruits its fatty, scripture to say: 'flowing with milk and honey,' fatty from milk and sweet from honey."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כִּי הֲוָה סָלֵיק לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, אָמַר: פְּלַטִי לִי מֵחֲדָא. כִּי סַמְכוּהוּ, אֲמַר: פְּלַטִי לִי מִתַּרְתֵּי. כִּי אוֹתְבוּהוּ בְּסוֹד הָעִיבּוּר, אֲמַר: פְּלַטִי לִי מִתְּלָת,
human_translation: when Rabbi Elazar ascended to Eretz Yisrael he said: I have been spared one When they ordained him he said: I have been spared two. When they appointed him to sit in the council intercalation of the calendar, he said: I have been spared three.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, when he ascended to the Land of Israel, said: "Deliver me from this one." When they supported him, he said: "Deliver me from the two." When they seated him in the council of the sages, he said: "Deliver me from the three."

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיְתָה יָדִי אֶל הַנְּבִיאִים הַחוֹזִים שָׁוְא וְגוֹ׳״. ״בְּסוֹד עַמִּי לֹא יִהְיוּ״ — זֶה סוֹד עִיבּוּר. ״וּבִכְתָב בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא יִכָּתֵבוּ״ — זֶה סְמִיכָה. ״וְאֶל אַדְמַת יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא יָבוֹאוּ״ — כְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ.
human_translation: As it is stated: “And My hand shall be against the prophets that see vanity, “They shall not be in the council of My people,” this the council intercalation of the calendar; “neither shall they be written in the register of the house of Israel,” this ordination; “neither shall they enter into the land of Israel,” as per its plain meaning.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "And My hand shall be against the prophets that see vanity, etc." "In the secret of My people they shall not be" — this is the secret of interpretation. "And in the writing of the house of Israel they shall not be written" — this is juxtaposition. "And they shall not come to the land of Israel" — as it sounds.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא כִּי הֲוָה סָלֵיק לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לָא אַשְׁכַּח מַבָּרָא לְמֶעְבַּר, נְקַט בְּמִצְרָא וְקָעָבַר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא צַדּוּקִי: עַמָּא פְּזִיזָא, דְּקַדְּמִיתוּ פּוּמַּיְיכוּ לְאוּדְנַיְיכוּ, אַכַּתִּי בִּפְזִיזוּתַיְיכוּ קָיְימִיתוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דּוּכְתָּא דְּמֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן לָא זְכוֹ לַהּ, אֲנָא מִי יֵימַר דְּזָכֵינָא לַהּ.
human_translation: When Rabbi Zeira ascended to Eretz Yisrael he could not find a ferry to cross He took hold of a rope and crossed A certain Sadducee said to him: Hasty people who put your mouths before your ears, you remain hasty said to him: a place where Moses and Aaron did not merit who is to say that I will merit
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira, when he ascended to the Land of Israel, did not find a boat to cross over. He took hold of a reed and crossed over. That Sadducee said to him: You impulsive people, you who put your fingers in your eyes, do you think you are standing in your impulsive ways? He said to him: The merit of Moses and Aaron did not help them, can I then say that my merit will help me?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַבָּא מְנַשֵּׁק כֵּיפֵי דְעַכּוֹ. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא מְתַקֵּן מַתְקָלַיָּה. רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי
human_translation: Rabbi Abba would kiss the rocks of Akko, Rabbi Ḥanina would repair its stumbling blocks, Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Asi
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba kisses the hands of his father-in-law. Rabbi Chanina fixes a matkalaya. Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi.

hebrew_text: קָיְימִי מִשִּׁמְשָׁא לְטוּלָּא וּמִטּוּלָּא לְשִׁמְשָׁא. רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר גַּמָּדָא מִיגַּנְדַּר בְּעַפְרַהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי רָצוּ עֲבָדֶיךָ אֶת אֲבָנֶיהָ וְאֶת עֲפָרָהּ יְחוֹנֵנוּ״.
human_translation: would stand from sunny to shady and from shady to sunny Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Gamda would roll in the dust of as it is stated: “For Your servants take pleasure in her stones, and love her dust”
llm_translation: The text reads: "One may establish a ritual object from its designated purpose to a non-designated purpose, and from a non-designated purpose to its designated purpose. Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Gamda from Gindara in Afra expounded this law, as it is stated: 'For Your servants take pleasure in her stones, and cherish her dust.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא: דּוֹר שֶׁבֶּן דָּוִד בָּא — קָטֵיגוֹרְיָא בְּתַלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים. כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אֲמַר צֵירוּף אַחַר צֵירוּף, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעוֹד בָּהּ עֲשִׂירִיָּה וְשָׁבָה וְהָיְתָה לְבָעֵר״. תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: בָּזוֹזֵי, וּבָזוֹזֵי דְבָזוֹזִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: the generation in which the son of David come indictments [ kateigorya ], against Torah scholars. When I said this before Shmuel he said: refinement after refinement, as it is stated: “And if there be a tenth in it, it shall again be eaten up” Rav Yosef taught Despoilers and despoilers of despoilers
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: The generation of the son of David will come — a generation that scoffs at the scholars. For when Shmuel said it before him, he said one refinement after another, as it is stated: "Yet after all this, she will return to her lover" (Hosea 2:9). Rav Yosef taught: with coins, and with coins of coins.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: עֲתִידִין כׇּל אִילָנֵי סְרָק שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁיִּטְעֲנוּ פֵּירוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי עֵץ נָשָׂא פִרְיוֹ תְּאֵנָה וָגֶפֶן נָתְנוּ חֵילָם״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Rav said: In the future all barren trees in Eretz Yisrael will bear fruit, as it is stated: “For the tree bears its fruit, the fig tree and the vine yield their strength”
llm_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashe said in the name of Rav: All the barren trees in the land of Israel will bear fruit, as it is stated: "For a tree bears its fruit, a fig tree and a vine give their strength."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ שְׁנֵי דַּיָּינֵי גְזֵירוֹת וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת כְּתוּבּוֹת
llm_translation: We will return to you two wine judges and bring before you the tractate of written laws.
